start of thi project gutenberg ebook the king jame bibl 














the old testament of the king jame version of the bibl 




the first book of mose call genesi 


1 1 in the begin god creat the heaven and the earth 

1 2 and the earth wa without form and void and dark wa upon 
the face of the deep and the spirit of god move upon the face of the 
water 

1 3 and god said let there be light and there wa light 

1 4 and god saw the light that it wa good and god divid the light 
from the dark 

1 5 and god call the light day and the dark he call night 
and the even and the morn were the first day 

1 6 and god said let there be a firmament in the midst of the water 
and let it divid the water from the water 

1 7 and god made the firmament and divid the water which were 
under the firmament from the water which were abov the firmament 
and it wa so 

1 8 and god call the firmament heaven and the even and the 
morn were the second day 

1 9 and god said let the water under the heaven be gather togeth 
unto one place and let the dri land appear and it wa so 

1 10 and god call the dri land earth and the gather togeth of 
the water call he sea and god saw that it wa good 

1 11 and god said let the earth bring forth grass the herb yield 
seed and the fruit tree yield fruit after hi kind whose seed is 
in itself upon the earth and it wa so 

1 12 and the earth brought forth grass and herb yield seed after 
hi kind and the tree yield fruit whose seed wa in itself after 
hi kind and god saw that it wa good 

1 13 and the even and the morn were the third day 

1 14 and god said let there be light in the firmament of the heaven 
to divid the day from the night and let them be for sign and for 
season and for day and year 1 15 and let them be for light in 
the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth and it wa 
so 

1 16 and god made two great light the greater light to rule the day 
and the lesser light to rule the night he made the star also 

1 17 and god set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light 
upon the earth 1 18 and to rule over the day and over the night and 
to divid the light from the dark and god saw that it wa good 

1 19 and the even and the morn were the fourth day 

1 20 and god said let the water bring forth abundantli the move 
creatur that hath life and fowl that may fli abov the earth in the 
open firmament of heaven 

1 21 and god creat great whale and everi live creatur that 
moveth which the water brought forth abundantli after their kind 
and everi wing fowl after hi kind and god saw that it wa good 

1 22 and god bless them say be fruit and multipli and fill 
the water in the sea and let fowl multipli in the earth 

1 23 and the even and the morn were the fifth day 

1 24 and god said let the earth bring forth the live creatur after 
hi kind cattl and creep thing and beast of the earth after hi 
kind and it wa so 

1 25 and god made the beast of the earth after hi kind and cattl 
after their kind and everi thing that creepeth upon the earth after 
hi kind and god saw that it wa good 

1 26 and god said let u make man in our imag after our like 
and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the fowl 
of the air and over the cattl and over all the earth and over 
everi creep thing that creepeth upon the earth 

1 27 so god creat man in hi own imag in the imag of god creat 
he him male and femal creat he them 

1 28 and god bless them and god said unto them be fruit and 
multipli and replenish the earth and subdu it and have dominion 
over the fish of the sea and over the fowl of the air and over everi 
live thing that moveth upon the earth 

1 29 and god said behold i have given you everi herb bear seed 
which is upon the face of all the earth and everi tree in the which 
is the fruit of a tree yield seed to you it shall be for meat 

1 30 and to everi beast of the earth and to everi fowl of the air 
and to everi thing that creepeth upon the earth wherein there is 
life i have given everi green herb for meat and it wa so 

1 31 and god saw everi thing that he had made and behold it wa 
veri good and the even and the morn were the sixth day 

2 1 thu the heaven and the earth were finish and all the host of 
them 

2 2 and on the seventh day god end hi work which he had made and 
he rest on the seventh day from all hi work which he had made 

2 3 and god bless the seventh day and sanctifi it becau that 
in it he had rest from all hi work which god creat and made 

2 4 these are the gener of the heaven and of the earth when 
they were creat in the day that the lord god made the earth and the 
heaven 2 5 and everi plant of the field befor it wa in the earth 
and everi herb of the field befor it grew for the lord god had not 
cau it to rain upon the earth and there wa not a man to till the 
ground 

2 6 but there went up a mist from the earth and water the whole 
face of the ground 

2 7 and the lord god form man of the dust of the ground and 
breath into hi nostril the breath of life and man becam a live 
soul 

2 8 and the lord god plant a garden eastward in eden and there he 
put the man whom he had form 

2 9 and out of the ground made the lord god to grow everi tree that is 
pleasant to the sight and good for food the tree of life also in the 
midst of the garden and the tree of knowledg of good and evil 

2 10 and a river went out of eden to water the garden and from thenc 
it wa part and becam into four head 

2 11 the name of the first is pison that is it which compasseth the 
whole land of havilah where there is gold 2 12 and the gold of that 
land is good there is bdellium and the onyx stone 

2 13 and the name of the second river is gihon the same is it that 
compasseth the whole land of ethiopia 

2 14 and the name of the third river is hiddekel that is it which 
goeth toward the east of assyria and the fourth river is euphrat 

2 15 and the lord god took the man and put him into the garden of 
eden to dress it and to keep it 

2 16 and the lord god command the man say of everi tree of the 
garden thou mayest freeli eat 2 17 but of the tree of the knowledg 
of good and evil thou shalt not eat of it for in the day that thou 
eatest thereof thou shalt sure die 

2 18 and the lord god said it is not good that the man should be 
alon i will make him an help meet for him 

2 19 and out of the ground the lord god form everi beast of the 
field and everi fowl of the air and brought them unto adam to see 
what he would call them and whatsoev adam call everi live 
creatur that wa the name thereof 

2 20 and adam gave name to all cattl and to the fowl of the air 
and to everi beast of the field but for adam there wa not found an 
help meet for him 

2 21 and the lord god cau a deep sleep to fall upon adam and he 
slept and he took one of hi rib and close up the flesh instead 
thereof 2 22 and the rib which the lord god had taken from man made 
he a woman and brought her unto the man 

2 23 and adam said thi is now bone of my bone and flesh of my 
flesh she shall be call woman becau she wa taken out of man 

2 24 therefor shall a man leav hi father and hi mother and shall 
cleav unto hi wife and they shall be one flesh 

2 25 and they were both nake the man and hi wife and were not 
asham 

3 1 now the serpent wa more subtil than ani beast of the field which 
the lord god had made and he said unto the woman yea hath god said 
ye shall not eat of everi tree of the garden 3 2 and the woman said 
unto the serpent we may eat of the fruit of the tree of the garden 
3 3 but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden 
god hath said ye shall not eat of it neither shall ye touch it lest 
ye die 

3 4 and the serpent said unto the woman ye shall not sure die 3 5 
for god doth know that in the day ye eat thereof then your eye shall 
be open and ye shall be a god know good and evil 

3 6 and when the woman saw that the tree wa good for food and that 
it wa pleasant to the eye and a tree to be desir to make one 
wise she took of the fruit thereof and did eat and gave also unto 
her husband with her and he did eat 

3 7 and the eye of them both were open and they knew that they 
were nake and they sew fig leaf togeth and made themselv 
apron 

3 8 and they heard the voic of the lord god walk in the garden in 
the cool of the day and adam and hi wife hid themselv from the 
presenc of the lord god amongst the tree of the garden 

3 9 and the lord god call unto adam and said unto him where art 
thou 3 10 and he said i heard thi voic in the garden and i wa 
afraid becau i wa nake and i hid myself 

3 11 and he said who told thee that thou wast nake hast thou eaten 
of the tree whereof i command thee that thou shouldest not eat 
3 12 and the man said the woman whom thou gavest to be with me she 
gave me of the tree and i did eat 

3 13 and the lord god said unto the woman what is thi that thou hast 
done and the woman said the serpent beguil me and i did eat 

3 14 and the lord god said unto the serpent becau thou hast done 
thi thou art cur abov all cattl and abov everi beast of the 
field upon thi belli shalt thou go and dust shalt thou eat all the 
day of thi life 3 15 and i will put enmiti between thee and the 
woman and between thi seed and her seed it shall brui thi head 
and thou shalt brui hi heel 

3 16 unto the woman he said i will greatli multipli thi sorrow and 
thi concept in sorrow thou shalt bring forth child and thi 
desir shall be to thi husband and he shall rule over thee 

3 17 and unto adam he said becau thou hast hearken unto the voic 
of thi wife and hast eaten of the tree of which i command thee 
say thou shalt not eat of it cur is the ground for thi sake 
in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the day of thi life 3 18 thorn 
also and thistl shall it bring forth to thee and thou shalt eat the 
herb of the field 3 19 in the sweat of thi face shalt thou eat bread 
till thou return unto the ground for out of it wast thou taken for 
dust thou art and unto dust shalt thou return 

3 20 and adam call hi wife s name eve becau she wa the mother 
of all live 

3 21 unto adam also and to hi wife did the lord god make coat of 
skin and cloth them 

3 22 and the lord god said behold the man is becom a one of u to 
know good and evil and now lest he put forth hi hand and take also 
of the tree of life and eat and live for ever 3 23 therefor the 
lord god sent him forth from the garden of eden to till the ground 
from whenc he wa taken 

3 24 so he drove out the man and he place at the east of the garden 
of eden cherub and a flame sword which turn everi way to keep 
the way of the tree of life 

4 1 and adam knew eve hi wife and she conceiv and bare cain and 
said i have gotten a man from the lord 

4 2 and she again bare hi brother abel and abel wa a keeper of 
sheep but cain wa a tiller of the ground 

4 3 and in process of time it came to pa that cain brought of the 
fruit of the ground an offer unto the lord 

4 4 and abel he also brought of the firstl of hi flock and of 
the fat thereof and the lord had respect unto abel and to hi 
offer 4 5 but unto cain and to hi offer he had not respect 
and cain wa veri wroth and hi counten fell 

4 6 and the lord said unto cain whi art thou wroth and whi is thi 
counten fallen 4 7 if thou doest well shalt thou not be 
accept and if thou doest not well sin lieth at the door and unto 
thee shall be hi desir and thou shalt rule over him 

4 8 and cain talk with abel hi brother and it came to pa when 
they were in the field that cain rose up against abel hi brother 
and slew him 

4 9 and the lord said unto cain where is abel thi brother and he 
said i know not am i my brother s keeper 4 10 and he said what 
hast thou done the voic of thi brother s blood crieth unto me from 
the ground 

4 11 and now art thou cur from the earth which hath open her 
mouth to receiv thi brother s blood from thi hand 4 12 when thou 
tillest the ground it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her 
strength a fugit and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth 

4 13 and cain said unto the lord my punish is greater than i can 
bear 

4 14 behold thou hast driven me out thi day from the face of the 
earth and from thi face shall i be hid and i shall be a fugit and 
a vagabond in the earth and it shall come to pa that everi one 
that findeth me shall slay me 

4 15 and the lord said unto him therefor whosoev slayeth cain 
vengeanc shall be taken on him sevenfold and the lord set a mark 
upon cain lest ani find him should kill him 

4 16 and cain went out from the presenc of the lord and dwelt in the 
land of nod on the east of eden 

4 17 and cain knew hi wife and she conceiv and bare enoch and he 
build a citi and call the name of the citi after the name of hi 
son enoch 

4 18 and unto enoch wa born irad and irad begat mehujael and 
mehujael begat methusael and methusael begat lamech 

4 19 and lamech took unto him two wife the name of the one wa adah 
and the name of the other zillah 

4 20 and adah bare jabal he wa the father of such a dwell in tent 
and of such a have cattl 

4 21 and hi brother s name wa jubal he wa the father of all such 
a handl the harp and organ 

4 22 and zillah she also bare tubalcain an instruct of everi 
artif in brass and iron and the sister of tubalcain wa naamah 

4 23 and lamech said unto hi wife adah and zillah hear my voic 
ye wife of lamech hearken unto my speech for i have slain a man to 
my wound and a young man to my hurt 

4 24 if cain shall be aveng sevenfold truli lamech seventi and 
sevenfold 

4 25 and adam knew hi wife again and she bare a son and call hi 
name seth for god said she hath appoint me anoth seed instead 
of abel whom cain slew 

4 26 and to seth to him also there wa born a son and he call hi 
name eno then began men to call upon the name of the lord 

5 1 thi is the book of the gener of adam in the day that god 
creat man in the like of god made he him 5 2 male and femal 
creat he them and bless them and call their name adam in the 
day when they were creat 

5 3 and adam live an hundr and thirti year and begat a son in hi 
own like and after hi imag and call hi name seth 5 4 and 
the day of adam after he had begotten seth were eight hundr year 
and he begat son and daughter 5 5 and all the day that adam live 
were nine hundr and thirti year and he die 

5 6 and seth live an hundr and five year and begat eno 5 7 and 
seth live after he begat eno eight hundr and seven year and 
begat son and daughter 5 8 and all the day of seth were nine 
hundr and twelv year and he die 

5 9 and eno live nineti year and begat cainan 5 10 and eno live 
after he begat cainan eight hundr and fifteen year and begat son 
and daughter 5 11 and all the day of eno were nine hundr and 
five year and he die 

5 12 and cainan live seventi year and begat mahalaleel 5 13 and 
cainan live after he begat mahalaleel eight hundr and forti year 
and begat son and daughter 5 14 and all the day of cainan were 
nine hundr and ten year and he die 

5 15 and mahalaleel live sixti and five year and begat jare 5 16 
and mahalaleel live after he begat jare eight hundr and thirti 
year and begat son and daughter 5 17 and all the day of 
mahalaleel were eight hundr nineti and five year and he die 

5 18 and jare live an hundr sixti and two year and he begat 
enoch 5 19 and jare live after he begat enoch eight hundr year 
and begat son and daughter 5 20 and all the day of jare were nine 
hundr sixti and two year and he die 

5 21 and enoch live sixti and five year and begat methuselah 5 22 
and enoch walk with god after he begat methuselah three hundr 
year and begat son and daughter 5 23 and all the day of enoch 
were three hundr sixti and five year 5 24 and enoch walk with 
god and he wa not for god took him 

5 25 and methuselah live an hundr eighti and seven year and begat 
lamech 

5 26 and methuselah live after he begat lamech seven hundr eighti 
and two year and begat son and daughter 5 27 and all the day of 
methuselah were nine hundr sixti and nine year and he die 

5 28 and lamech live an hundr eighti and two year and begat a 
son 5 29 and he call hi name noah say thi same shall comfort 
u concern our work and toil of our hand becau of the ground 
which the lord hath cur 

5 30 and lamech live after he begat noah five hundr nineti and five 
year and begat son and daughter 5 31 and all the day of lamech 
were seven hundr seventi and seven year and he die 

5 32 and noah wa five hundr year old and noah begat shem ham 
and japheth 

6 1 and it came to pa when men began to multipli on the face of the 
earth and daughter were born unto them 6 2 that the son of god saw 
the daughter of men that they were fair and they took them wife of 
all which they chose 

6 3 and the lord said my spirit shall not alway strive with man for 
that he also is flesh yet hi day shall be an hundr and twenti 
year 

6 4 there were giant in the earth in those day and also after that 
when the son of god came in unto the daughter of men and they bare 
child to them the same becam mighti men which were of old men of 
renown 

6 5 and god saw that the wick of man wa great in the earth and 
that everi imagin of the thought of hi heart wa onli evil 
continu 

6 6 and it repent the lord that he had made man on the earth and it 
griev him at hi heart 

6 7 and the lord said i will destroy man whom i have creat from the 
face of the earth both man and beast and the creep thing and 
the fowl of the air for it repenteth me that i have made them 

6 8 but noah found grace in the eye of the lord 

6 9 these are the gener of noah noah wa a just man and perfect 
in hi gener and noah walk with god 

6 10 and noah begat three son shem ham and japheth 

6 11 the earth also wa corrupt befor god and the earth wa fill 
with violenc 

6 12 and god look upon the earth and behold it wa corrupt for 
all flesh had corrupt hi way upon the earth 

6 13 and god said unto noah the end of all flesh is come befor me 
for the earth is fill with violenc through them and behold i 
will destroy them with the earth 

6 14 make thee an ark of gopher wood room shalt thou make in the 
ark and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch 

6 15 and thi is the fashion which thou shalt make it of the length 
of the ark shall be three hundr cubit the breadth of it fifti 
cubit and the height of it thirti cubit 

6 16 a window shalt thou make to the ark and in a cubit shalt thou 
finish it abov and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side 
thereof with lower second and third stori shalt thou make it 

6 17 and behold i even i do bring a flood of water upon the 
earth to destroy all flesh wherein is the breath of life from under 
heaven and everi thing that is in the earth shall die 

6 18 but with thee will i establish my coven and thou shalt come 
into the ark thou and thi son and thi wife and thi son wife 
with thee 

6 19 and of everi live thing of all flesh two of everi sort shalt 
thou bring into the ark to keep them aliv with thee they shall be 
male and femal 

6 20 of fowl after their kind and of cattl after their kind of 
everi creep thing of the earth after hi kind two of everi sort 
shall come unto thee to keep them aliv 

6 21 and take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten and thou shalt 
gather it to thee and it shall be for food for thee and for them 

6 22 thu did noah accord to all that god command him so did 
he 

7 1 and the lord said unto noah come thou and all thi hou into the 
ark for thee have i seen righteou befor me in thi gener 

7 2 of everi clean beast thou shalt take to thee by seven the male 
and hi femal and of beast that are not clean by two the male and 
hi femal 

7 3 of fowl also of the air by seven the male and the femal to 
keep seed aliv upon the face of all the earth 

7 4 for yet seven day and i will cau it to rain upon the earth 
forti day and forti night and everi live substanc that i have 
made will i destroy from off the face of the earth 

7 5 and noah did accord unto all that the lord command him 

7 6 and noah wa six hundr year old when the flood of water wa 
upon the earth 

7 7 and noah went in and hi son and hi wife and hi son wife 
with him into the ark becau of the water of the flood 

7 8 of clean beast and of beast that are not clean and of fowl 
and of everi thing that creepeth upon the earth 7 9 there went in two 
and two unto noah into the ark the male and the femal a god had 
command noah 

7 10 and it came to pa after seven day that the water of the 
flood were upon the earth 

7 11 in the six hundredth year of noah s life in the second month 
the seventeenth day of the month the same day were all the fountain 
of the great deep broken up and the window of heaven were open 

7 12 and the rain wa upon the earth forti day and forti night 

7 13 in the selfsam day enter noah and shem and ham and japheth 
the son of noah and noah s wife and the three wife of hi son 
with them into the ark 7 14 they and everi beast after hi kind 
and all the cattl after their kind and everi creep thing that 
creepeth upon the earth after hi kind and everi fowl after hi kind 
everi bird of everi sort 

7 15 and they went in unto noah into the ark two and two of all 
flesh wherein is the breath of life 

7 16 and they that went in went in male and femal of all flesh a 
god had command him and the lord shut him in 

7 17 and the flood wa forti day upon the earth and the water 
increa and bare up the ark and it wa lift up abov the earth 

7 18 and the water prevail and were increa greatli upon the 
earth and the ark went upon the face of the water 

7 19 and the water prevail exceedingli upon the earth and all the 
high hill that were under the whole heaven were cover 

7 20 fifteen cubit upward did the water prevail and the mountain 
were cover 

7 21 and all flesh die that move upon the earth both of fowl and 
of cattl and of beast and of everi creep thing that creepeth 
upon the earth and everi man 7 22 all in whose nostril wa the 
breath of life of all that wa in the dri land die 

7 23 and everi live substanc wa destroy which wa upon the face 
of the ground both man and cattl and the creep thing and the 
fowl of the heaven and they were destroy from the earth and noah 
onli remain aliv and they that were with him in the ark 

7 24 and the water prevail upon the earth an hundr and fifti 
day 

8 1 and god rememb noah and everi live thing and all the 
cattl that wa with him in the ark and god made a wind to pa over 
the earth and the water asswag 8 2 the fountain also of the deep 
and the window of heaven were stop and the rain from heaven wa 
restrain 8 3 and the water return from off the earth 
continu and after the end of the hundr and fifti day the 
water were abat 

8 4 and the ark rest in the seventh month on the seventeenth day of 
the month upon the mountain of ararat 

8 5 and the water decrea continu until the tenth month in the 
tenth month on the first day of the month were the top of the 
mountain seen 

8 6 and it came to pa at the end of forti day that noah open the 
window of the ark which he had made 8 7 and he sent forth a raven 
which went forth to and fro until the water were dri up from off 
the earth 

8 8 also he sent forth a dove from him to see if the water were 
abat from off the face of the ground 8 9 but the dove found no rest 
for the sole of her foot and she return unto him into the ark for 
the water were on the face of the whole earth then he put forth hi 
hand and took her and pull her in unto him into the ark 

8 10 and he stay yet other seven day and again he sent forth the 
dove out of the ark 8 11 and the dove came in to him in the even 
and lo in her mouth wa an oliv leaf pluckt off so noah knew that 
the water were abat from off the earth 

8 12 and he stay yet other seven day and sent forth the dove 
which return not again unto him ani more 

8 13 and it came to pa in the six hundredth and first year in the 
first month the first day of the month the water were dri up from 
off the earth and noah remov the cover of the ark and look 
and behold the face of the ground wa dri 

8 14 and in the second month on the seven and twentieth day of the 
month wa the earth dri 

8 15 and god spake unto noah say 8 16 go forth of the ark thou 
and thi wife and thi son and thi son wife with thee 

8 17 bring forth with thee everi live thing that is with thee of 
all flesh both of fowl and of cattl and of everi creep thing 
that creepeth upon the earth that they may breed abundantli in the 
earth and be fruit and multipli upon the earth 

8 18 and noah went forth and hi son and hi wife and hi son 
wife with him 8 19 everi beast everi creep thing and everi 
fowl and whatsoev creepeth upon the earth after their kind went 
forth out of the ark 

8 20 and noah build an altar unto the lord and took of everi clean 
beast and of everi clean fowl and offer burnt offer on the 
altar 

8 21 and the lord smell a sweet savour and the lord said in hi 
heart i will not again cur the ground ani more for man s sake for 
the imagin of man s heart is evil from hi youth neither will i 
again smite ani more everi thing live a i have done 

8 22 while the earth remaineth seedtim and harvest and cold and 
heat and summer and winter and day and night shall not cea 

9 1 and god bless noah and hi son and said unto them be 
fruit and multipli and replenish the earth 

9 2 and the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon everi beast 
of the earth and upon everi fowl of the air upon all that moveth 
upon the earth and upon all the fish of the sea into your hand are 
they deliv 

9 3 everi move thing that liveth shall be meat for you even a the 
green herb have i given you all thing 

9 4 but flesh with the life thereof which is the blood thereof shall 
ye not eat 

9 5 and sure your blood of your life will i requir at the hand of 
everi beast will i requir it and at the hand of man at the hand of 
everi man s brother will i requir the life of man 

9 6 whoso sheddeth man s blood by man shall hi blood be shed for in 
the imag of god made he man 

9 7 and you be ye fruit and multipli bring forth abundantli in 
the earth and multipli therein 

9 8 and god spake unto noah and to hi son with him say 9 9 and 
i behold i establish my coven with you and with your seed after 
you 9 10 and with everi live creatur that is with you of the 
fowl of the cattl and of everi beast of the earth with you from 
all that go out of the ark to everi beast of the earth 

9 11 and i will establish my coven with you neither shall all 
flesh be cut off ani more by the water of a flood neither shall 
there ani more be a flood to destroy the earth 

9 12 and god said thi is the token of the coven which i make 
between me and you and everi live creatur that is with you for 
perpetu gener 9 13 i do set my bow in the cloud and it shall 
be for a token of a coven between me and the earth 

9 14 and it shall come to pa when i bring a cloud over the earth 
that the bow shall be seen in the cloud 9 15 and i will rememb my 
coven which is between me and you and everi live creatur of all 
flesh and the water shall no more becom a flood to destroy all 
flesh 

9 16 and the bow shall be in the cloud and i will look upon it that 
i may rememb the everlast coven between god and everi live 
creatur of all flesh that is upon the earth 

9 17 and god said unto noah thi is the token of the coven which 
i have establish between me and all flesh that is upon the earth 

9 18 and the son of noah that went forth of the ark were shem and 
ham and japheth and ham is the father of canaan 

9 19 these are the three son of noah and of them wa the whole earth 
overspread 

9 20 and noah began to be an husbandman and he plant a vineyard 
9 21 and he drank of the wine and wa drunken and he wa uncov 
within hi tent 

9 22 and ham the father of canaan saw the nake of hi father 
and told hi two brother without 

9 23 and shem and japheth took a garment and laid it upon both their 
shoulder and went backward and cover the nake of their 
father and their face were backward and they saw not their father s 
nake 

9 24 and noah awok from hi wine and knew what hi younger son had 
done unto him 

9 25 and he said cur be canaan a servant of servant shall he be 
unto hi brother 

9 26 and he said bless be the lord god of shem and canaan shall be 
hi servant 

9 27 god shall enlarg japheth and he shall dwell in the tent of 
shem and canaan shall be hi servant 

9 28 and noah live after the flood three hundr and fifti year 

9 29 and all the day of noah were nine hundr and fifti year and 
he die 

10 1 now these are the gener of the son of noah shem ham and 
japheth and unto them were son born after the flood 

10 2 the son of japheth gomer and magog and madai and javan and 
tubal and meshech and tira 

10 3 and the son of gomer ashkenaz and riphath and togarmah 

10 4 and the son of javan elishah and tarshish kittim and 
dodanim 

10 5 by these were the isl of the gentil divid in their land 
everi one after hi tongu after their famili in their nation 

10 6 and the son of ham cush and mizraim and phut and canaan 

10 7 and the son of cush seba and havilah and sabtah and raamah 
and sabtechah and the son of raamah sheba and dedan 

10 8 and cush begat nimrod he began to be a mighti one in the earth 

10 9 he wa a mighti hunter befor the lord wherefor it is said 
even a nimrod the mighti hunter befor the lord 

10 10 and the begin of hi kingdom wa babel and erech and 
accad and calneh in the land of shinar 

10 11 out of that land went forth asshur and build nineveh and the 
citi rehoboth and calah 10 12 and resen between nineveh and calah 
the same is a great citi 

10 13 and mizraim begat ludim and anamim and lehabim and naphtuhim 
10 14 and pathrusim and casluhim out of whom came philistim and 
caphtorim 

10 15 and canaan begat sidon hi first born and heth 10 16 and the 
jebusit and the amorit and the girgasit 10 17 and the hivit 
and the arkit and the sinit 10 18 and the arvadit and the 
zemarit and the hamathit and afterward were the famili of the 
canaanit spread abroad 

10 19 and the border of the canaanit wa from sidon a thou comest 
to gerar unto gaza a thou goest unto sodom and gomorrah and 
admah and zeboim even unto lasha 

10 20 these are the son of ham after their famili after their 
tongu in their countri and in their nation 

10 21 unto shem also the father of all the child of eber the 
brother of japheth the elder even to him were child born 

10 22 the child of shem elam and asshur and arphaxad and lud 
and aram 

10 23 and the child of aram uz and hul and gether and mash 

10 24 and arphaxad begat salah and salah begat eber 

10 25 and unto eber were born two son the name of one wa peleg for 
in hi day wa the earth divid and hi brother s name wa joktan 

10 26 and joktan begat almodad and sheleph and hazarmaveth and 
jerah 10 27 and hadoram and uzal and diklah 10 28 and obal and 
abimael and sheba 10 29 and ophir and havilah and jobab all these 
were the son of joktan 

10 30 and their dwell wa from mesha a thou goest unto sephar a 
mount of the east 

10 31 these are the son of shem after their famili after their 
tongu in their land after their nation 

10 32 these are the famili of the son of noah after their 
gener in their nation and by these were the nation divid 
in the earth after the flood 

11 1 and the whole earth wa of one languag and of one speech 

11 2 and it came to pa a they journey from the east that they 
found a plain in the land of shinar and they dwelt there 

11 3 and they said one to anoth go to let u make brick and burn 
them thoroughli and they had brick for stone and slime had they for 
morter 

11 4 and they said go to let u build u a citi and a tower whose 
top may reach unto heaven and let u make u a name lest we be 
scatter abroad upon the face of the whole earth 

11 5 and the lord came down to see the citi and the tower which the 
child of men build 

11 6 and the lord said behold the peopl is one and they have all 
one languag and thi they begin to do and now noth will be 
restrain from them which they have imagin to do 

11 7 go to let u go down and there confound their languag that 
they may not understand one anoth s speech 

11 8 so the lord scatter them abroad from thenc upon the face of 
all the earth and they left off to build the citi 

11 9 therefor is the name of it call babel becau the lord did 
there confound the languag of all the earth and from thenc did the 
lord scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth 

11 10 these are the gener of shem shem wa an hundr year 
old and begat arphaxad two year after the flood 11 11 and shem 
live after he begat arphaxad five hundr year and begat son and 
daughter 

11 12 and arphaxad live five and thirti year and begat salah 11 13 
and arphaxad live after he begat salah four hundr and three year 
and begat son and daughter 

11 14 and salah live thirti year and begat eber 11 15 and salah 
live after he begat eber four hundr and three year and begat son 
and daughter 

11 16 and eber live four and thirti year and begat peleg 11 17 and 
eber live after he begat peleg four hundr and thirti year and 
begat son and daughter 

11 18 and peleg live thirti year and begat reu 11 19 and peleg 
live after he begat reu two hundr and nine year and begat son 
and daughter 

11 20 and reu live two and thirti year and begat serug 11 21 and 
reu live after he begat serug two hundr and seven year and begat 
son and daughter 

11 22 and serug live thirti year and begat nahor 11 23 and serug 
live after he begat nahor two hundr year and begat son and 
daughter 

11 24 and nahor live nine and twenti year and begat terah 11 25 
and nahor live after he begat terah an hundr and nineteen year 
and begat son and daughter 

11 26 and terah live seventi year and begat abram nahor and 
haran 

11 27 now these are the gener of terah terah begat abram 
nahor and haran and haran begat lot 

11 28 and haran die befor hi father terah in the land of hi 
nativ in ur of the chald 

11 29 and abram and nahor took them wife the name of abram s wife 
wa sarai and the name of nahor s wife milcah the daughter of 
haran the father of milcah and the father of iscah 

11 30 but sarai wa barren she had no child 

11 31 and terah took abram hi son and lot the son of haran hi son s 
son and sarai hi daughter in law hi son abram s wife and they 
went forth with them from ur of the chald to go into the land of 
canaan and they came unto haran and dwelt there 

11 32 and the day of terah were two hundr and five year and terah 
die in haran 

12 1 now the lord had said unto abram get thee out of thi countri 
and from thi kindr and from thi father s hou unto a land that i 
will shew thee 12 2 and i will make of thee a great nation and i 
will bless thee and make thi name great and thou shalt be a 
bless 12 3 and i will bless them that bless thee and cur him 
that curseth thee and in thee shall all famili of the earth be 
bless 

12 4 so abram depart a the lord had spoken unto him and lot went 
with him and abram wa seventi and five year old when he depart 
out of haran 

12 5 and abram took sarai hi wife and lot hi brother s son and all 
their substanc that they had gather and the soul that they had 
gotten in haran and they went forth to go into the land of canaan 
and into the land of canaan they came 

12 6 and abram pa through the land unto the place of sichem unto 
the plain of moreh and the canaanit wa then in the land 

12 7 and the lord appear unto abram and said unto thi seed will i 
give thi land and there build he an altar unto the lord who 
appear unto him 

12 8 and he remov from thenc unto a mountain on the east of bethel 
and pitch hi tent have bethel on the west and hai on the east 
and there he build an altar unto the lord and call upon the name 
of the lord 

12 9 and abram journey go on still toward the south 

12 10 and there wa a famin in the land and abram went down into 
egypt to sojourn there for the famin wa grievou in the land 

12 11 and it came to pa when he wa come near to enter into egypt 
that he said unto sarai hi wife behold now i know that thou art a 
fair woman to look upon 12 12 therefor it shall come to pa when 
the egyptian shall see thee that they shall say thi is hi wife 
and they will kill me but they will save thee aliv 

12 13 say i pray thee thou art my sister that it may be well with 
me for thi sake and my soul shall live becau of thee 

12 14 and it came to pa that when abram wa come into egypt the 
egyptian beheld the woman that she wa veri fair 

12 15 the princ also of pharaoh saw her and commend her befor 
pharaoh and the woman wa taken into pharaoh s hou 

12 16 and he entreat abram well for her sake and he had sheep and 
ox and he as and manserv and maidserv and she as 
and camel 

12 17 and the lord plagu pharaoh and hi hou with great plagu 
becau of sarai abram s wife 

12 18 and pharaoh call abram and said what is thi that thou hast 
done unto me whi didst thou not tell me that she wa thi wife 12 19 
whi saidst thou she is my sister so i might have taken her to me to 
wife now therefor behold thi wife take her and go thi way 

12 20 and pharaoh command hi men concern him and they sent him 
away and hi wife and all that he had 

13 1 and abram went up out of egypt he and hi wife and all that he 
had and lot with him into the south 

13 2 and abram wa veri rich in cattl in silver and in gold 

13 3 and he went on hi journey from the south even to bethel unto 
the place where hi tent had been at the begin between bethel and 
hai 13 4 unto the place of the altar which he had make there at the 
first and there abram call on the name of the lord 

13 5 and lot also which went with abram had flock and herd and 
tent 

13 6 and the land wa not abl to bear them that they might dwell 
togeth for their substanc wa great so that they could not dwell 
togeth 

13 7 and there wa a strife between the herdmen of abram s cattl and 
the herdmen of lot s cattl and the canaanit and the perizzit 
dwell then in the land 

13 8 and abram said unto lot let there be no strife i pray thee 
between me and thee and between my herdmen and thi herdmen for we be 
brother 

13 9 is not the whole land befor thee separ thyself i pray thee 
from me if thou wilt take the left hand then i will go to the right 
or if thou depart to the right hand then i will go to the left 

13 10 and lot lift up hi eye and beheld all the plain of jordan 
that it wa well water everi where befor the lord destroy sodom 
and gomorrah even a the garden of the lord like the land of egypt 
a thou comest unto zoar 

13 11 then lot chose him all the plain of jordan and lot journey 
east and they separ themselv the one from the other 

13 12 abram dwell in the land of canaan and lot dwell in the 
citi of the plain and pitch hi tent toward sodom 

13 13 but the men of sodom were wick and sinner befor the lord 
exceedingli 

13 14 and the lord said unto abram after that lot wa separ from 
him lift up now thine eye and look from the place where thou art 
northward and southward and eastward and westward 13 15 for all 
the land which thou seest to thee will i give it and to thi seed for 
ever 

13 16 and i will make thi seed a the dust of the earth so that if a 
man can number the dust of the earth then shall thi seed also be 
number 

13 17 ari walk through the land in the length of it and in the 
breadth of it for i will give it unto thee 

13 18 then abram remov hi tent and came and dwelt in the plain of 
mamr which is in hebron and built there an altar unto the lord 

14 1 and it came to pa in the day of amraphel king of shinar 
arioch king of ellasar chedorlaom king of elam and tidal king of 
nation 14 2 that these made war with bera king of sodom and with 
birsha king of gomorrah shinab king of admah and shemeb king of 
zeboiim and the king of bela which is zoar 

14 3 all these were join togeth in the vale of siddim which is 
the salt sea 

14 4 twelv year they serv chedorlaom and in the thirteenth year 
they rebel 

14 5 and in the fourteenth year came chedorlaom and the king that 
were with him and smote the rephaim in ashteroth karnaim and the 
zuzim in ham and the emin in shaveh kiriathaim 14 6 and the 
horit in their mount seir unto elparan which is by the wilder 

14 7 and they return and came to enmishpat which is kadesh and 
smote all the countri of the amalekit and also the amorit that 
dwelt in hazezontamar 

14 8 and there went out the king of sodom and the king of gomorrah 
and the king of admah and the king of zeboiim and the king of bela 
the same is zoar and they join battl with them in the vale of 
siddim 14 9 with chedorlaom the king of elam and with tidal king 
of nation and amraphel king of shinar and arioch king of ellasar 
four king with five 

14 10 and the vale of siddim wa full of slimepit and the king of 
sodom and gomorrah fled and fell there and they that remain fled 
to the mountain 

14 11 and they took all the good of sodom and gomorrah and all their 
victual and went their way 

14 12 and they took lot abram s brother s son who dwelt in sodom 
and hi good and depart 

14 13 and there came one that had escap and told abram the hebrew 
for he dwelt in the plain of mamr the amorit brother of eshcol and 
brother of aner and these were confed with abram 

14 14 and when abram heard that hi brother wa taken captiv he 
arm hi train servant born in hi own hou three hundr and 
eighteen and pursu them unto dan 

14 15 and he divid himself against them he and hi servant by 
night and smote them and pursu them unto hobah which is on the 
left hand of damascu 

14 16 and he brought back all the good and also brought again hi 
brother lot and hi good and the woman also and the peopl 

14 17 and the king of sodom went out to meet him after hi return from 
the slaughter of chedorlaom and of the king that were with him at 
the valley of shaveh which is the king s dale 

14 18 and melchizedek king of salem brought forth bread and wine and 
he wa the priest of the most high god 

14 19 and he bless him and said bless be abram of the most high 
god possessor of heaven and earth 14 20 and bless be the most high 
god which hath deliv thine enemi into thi hand and he gave him 
tith of all 

14 21 and the king of sodom said unto abram give me the person and 
take the good to thyself 

14 22 and abram said to the king of sodom i have lift up mine hand 
unto the lord the most high god the possessor of heaven and earth 
14 23 that i will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet and 
that i will not take ani thing that is thine lest thou shouldest say 
i have made abram rich 14 24 save onli that which the young men have 
eaten and the portion of the men which went with me aner eshcol 
and mamr let them take their portion 

15 1 after these thing the word of the lord came unto abram in a 
vision say fear not abram i am thi shield and thi exceed 
great reward 

15 2 and abram said lord god what wilt thou give me see i go 
childless and the steward of my hou is thi eliez of damascu 
15 3 and abram said behold to me thou hast given no seed and lo 
one born in my hou is mine heir 

15 4 and behold the word of the lord came unto him say thi 
shall not be thine heir but he that shall come forth out of thine own 
bowel shall be thine heir 

15 5 and he brought him forth abroad and said look now toward 
heaven and tell the star if thou be abl to number them and he 
said unto him so shall thi seed be 

15 6 and he believ in the lord and he count it to him for 
righteou 

15 7 and he said unto him i am the lord that brought thee out of ur 
of the chald to give thee thi land to inherit it 

15 8 and he said lord god wherebi shall i know that i shall inherit 
it 15 9 and he said unto him take me an heifer of three year old 
and a she goat of three year old and a ram of three year old and a 
turtledov and a young pigeon 

15 10 and he took unto him all these and divid them in the midst 
and laid each piec one against anoth but the bird divid he not 

15 11 and when the fowl came down upon the carca abram drove them 
away 

15 12 and when the sun wa go down a deep sleep fell upon abram 
and lo an horror of great dark fell upon him 

15 13 and he said unto abram know of a sureti that thi seed shall be 
a stranger in a land that is not their s and shall serv them and 
they shall afflict them four hundr year 15 14 and also that 
nation whom they shall serv will i judg and afterward shall they 
come out with great substanc 

15 15 and thou shalt go to thi father in peac thou shalt be buri 
in a good old age 

15 16 but in the fourth gener they shall come hither again for 
the iniqu of the amorit is not yet full 

15 17 and it came to pa that when the sun went down and it wa 
dark behold a smoke furnac and a burn lamp that pa between 
those piec 

15 18 in the same day the lord made a coven with abram say 
unto thi seed have i given thi land from the river of egypt unto the 
great river the river euphrat 15 19 the kenit and the 
kenizzit and the kadmonit 15 20 and the hittit and the 
perizzit and the rephaim 15 21 and the amorit and the 
canaanit and the girgashit and the jebusit 

16 1 now sarai abram s wife bare him no child and she had an 
handmaid an egyptian whose name wa hagar 

16 2 and sarai said unto abram behold now the lord hath restrain 
me from bear i pray thee go in unto my maid it may be that i may 
obtain child by her and abram hearken to the voic of sarai 

16 3 and sarai abram s wife took hagar her maid the egyptian after 
abram had dwelt ten year in the land of canaan and gave her to her 
husband abram to be hi wife 

16 4 and he went in unto hagar and she conceiv and when she saw 
that she had conceiv her mistress wa despi in her eye 

16 5 and sarai said unto abram my wrong be upon thee i have given my 
maid into thi bosom and when she saw that she had conceiv i wa 
despi in her eye the lord judg between me and thee 

16 6 but abram said unto sarai behold thi maid is in thine hand do 
to her a it pleaseth thee and when sarai dealt hardli with her she 
fled from her face 

16 7 and the angel of the lord found her by a fountain of water in the 
wilder by the fountain in the way to shur 

16 8 and he said hagar sarai s maid whenc camest thou and whither 
wilt thou go and she said i flee from the face of my mistress sarai 

16 9 and the angel of the lord said unto her return to thi mistress 
and submit thyself under her hand 

16 10 and the angel of the lord said unto her i will multipli thi 
seed exceedingli that it shall not be number for multitud 

16 11 and the angel of the lord said unto her behold thou art with 
child and shalt bear a son and shalt call hi name ishmael becau 
the lord hath heard thi afflict 

16 12 and he will be a wild man hi hand will be against everi man 
and everi man s hand against him and he shall dwell in the presenc 
of all hi brother 

16 13 and she call the name of the lord that spake unto her thou 
god seest me for she said have i also here look after him that 
seeth me 16 14 wherefor the well wa call beerlahairoi behold 
it is between kadesh and bere 

16 15 and hagar bare abram a son and abram call hi son s name 
which hagar bare ishmael 

16 16 and abram wa fourscor and six year old when hagar bare 
ishmael to abram 

17 1 and when abram wa nineti year old and nine the lord appear 
to abram and said unto him i am the almighti god walk befor me 
and be thou perfect 

17 2 and i will make my coven between me and thee and will 
multipli thee exceedingli 

17 3 and abram fell on hi face and god talk with him say 17 4 
a for me behold my coven is with thee and thou shalt be a 
father of mani nation 

17 5 neither shall thi name ani more be call abram but thi name 
shall be abraham for a father of mani nation have i made thee 

17 6 and i will make thee exceed fruit and i will make nation 
of thee and king shall come out of thee 

17 7 and i will establish my coven between me and thee and thi seed 
after thee in their gener for an everlast coven to be a 
god unto thee and to thi seed after thee 

17 8 and i will give unto thee and to thi seed after thee the land 
wherein thou art a stranger all the land of canaan for an 
everlast poss and i will be their god 

17 9 and god said unto abraham thou shalt keep my coven therefor 
thou and thi seed after thee in their gener 

17 10 thi is my coven which ye shall keep between me and you and 
thi seed after thee everi man child among you shall be circumci 

17 11 and ye shall circumci the flesh of your foreskin and it shall 
be a token of the coven betwixt me and you 

17 12 and he that is eight day old shall be circumci among you 
everi man child in your gener he that is born in the hou or 
bought with money of ani stranger which is not of thi seed 

17 13 he that is born in thi hou and he that is bought with thi 
money must need be circumci and my coven shall be in your 
flesh for an everlast coven 

17 14 and the uncircumci man child whose flesh of hi foreskin is 
not circumci that soul shall be cut off from hi peopl he hath 
broken my coven 

17 15 and god said unto abraham a for sarai thi wife thou shalt not 
call her name sarai but sarah shall her name be 

17 16 and i will bless her and give thee a son also of her yea i 
will bless her and she shall be a mother of nation king of peopl 
shall be of her 

17 17 then abraham fell upon hi face and laugh and said in hi 
heart shall a child be born unto him that is an hundr year old 
and shall sarah that is nineti year old bear 17 18 and abraham 
said unto god o that ishmael might live befor thee 17 19 and god 
said sarah thi wife shall bear thee a son ind and thou shalt call 
hi name isaac and i will establish my coven with him for an 
everlast coven and with hi seed after him 

17 20 and a for ishmael i have heard thee behold i have bless 
him and will make him fruit and will multipli him exceedingli 
twelv princ shall he beget and i will make him a great nation 

17 21 but my coven will i establish with isaac which sarah shall 
bear unto thee at thi set time in the next year 

17 22 and he left off talk with him and god went up from abraham 

17 23 and abraham took ishmael hi son and all that were born in hi 
hou and all that were bought with hi money everi male among the 
men of abraham s hou and circumci the flesh of their foreskin in 
the selfsam day a god had said unto him 

17 24 and abraham wa nineti year old and nine when he wa 
circumci in the flesh of hi foreskin 

17 25 and ishmael hi son wa thirteen year old when he wa 
circumci in the flesh of hi foreskin 

17 26 in the selfsam day wa abraham circumci and ishmael hi 
son 

17 27 and all the men of hi hou born in the hou and bought with 
money of the stranger were circumci with him 

18 1 and the lord appear unto him in the plain of mamr and he sat 
in the tent door in the heat of the day 18 2 and he lift up hi eye 
and look and lo three men stood by him and when he saw them he 
ran to meet them from the tent door and bow himself toward the 
ground 18 3 and said my lord if now i have found favour in thi 
sight pa not away i pray thee from thi servant 18 4 let a littl 
water i pray you be fetch and wash your foot and rest yourselv 
under the tree 18 5 and i will fetch a morsel of bread and comfort 
ye your heart after that ye shall pa on for therefor are ye come 
to your servant and they said so do a thou hast said 

18 6 and abraham hasten into the tent unto sarah and said make 
readi quickli three measur of fine meal knead it and make cake 
upon the hearth 

18 7 and abraham ran unto the herd and fetcht a calf tender and good 
and gave it unto a young man and he hast to dress it 

18 8 and he took butter and milk and the calf which he had dress 
and set it befor them and he stood by them under the tree and they 
did eat 

18 9 and they said unto him where is sarah thi wife and he said 
behold in the tent 

18 10 and he said i will certainli return unto thee accord to the 
time of life and lo sarah thi wife shall have a son and sarah 
heard it in the tent door which wa behind him 

18 11 now abraham and sarah were old and well stricken in age and it 
cea to be with sarah after the manner of woman 

18 12 therefor sarah laugh within herself say after i am wax 
old shall i have pleasur my lord be old also 18 13 and the lord 
said unto abraham wherefor did sarah laugh say shall i of a 
sureti bear a child which am old 18 14 is ani thing too hard for 
the lord at the time appoint i will return unto thee accord to 
the time of life and sarah shall have a son 

18 15 then sarah deni say i laugh not for she wa afraid 
and he said nay but thou didst laugh 

18 16 and the men rose up from thenc and look toward sodom and 
abraham went with them to bring them on the way 

18 17 and the lord said shall i hide from abraham that thing which i 
do 18 18 see that abraham shall sure becom a great and mighti 
nation and all the nation of the earth shall be bless in him 
18 19 for i know him that he will command hi child and hi 
household after him and they shall keep the way of the lord to do 
justic and judgment that the lord may bring upon abraham that which 
he hath spoken of him 

18 20 and the lord said becau the cri of sodom and gomorrah is 
great and becau their sin is veri grievou 18 21 i will go down 
now and see whether they have done altogeth accord to the cri of 
it which is come unto me and if not i will know 

18 22 and the men turn their face from thenc and went toward 
sodom but abraham stood yet befor the lord 

18 23 and abraham drew near and said wilt thou also destroy the 
righteou with the wick 18 24 peradventur there be fifti 
righteou within the citi wilt thou also destroy and not spare the 
place for the fifti righteou that are therein 18 25 that be far 
from thee to do after thi manner to slay the righteou with the 
wick and that the righteou should be a the wick that be far 
from thee shall not the judg of all the earth do right 18 26 and 
the lord said if i find in sodom fifti righteou within the citi 
then i will spare all the place for their sake 

18 27 and abraham answer and said behold now i have taken upon me 
to speak unto the lord which am but dust and ash 18 28 
peradventur there shall lack five of the fifti righteou wilt thou 
destroy all the citi for lack of five and he said if i find there 
forti and five i will not destroy it 

18 29 and he spake unto him yet again and said peradventur there 
shall be forti found there and he said i will not do it for forti s 
sake 

18 30 and he said unto him oh let not the lord be angri and i will 
speak peradventur there shall thirti be found there and he said i 
will not do it if i find thirti there 

18 31 and he said behold now i have taken upon me to speak unto the 
lord peradventur there shall be twenti found there and he said i 
will not destroy it for twenti s sake 

18 32 and he said oh let not the lord be angri and i will speak yet 
but thi onc peradventur ten shall be found there and he said i 
will not destroy it for ten s sake 

18 33 and the lord went hi way a soon a he had left commun with 
abraham and abraham return unto hi place 

19 1 and there came two angel to sodom at even and lot sat in the 
gate of sodom and lot see them rose up to meet them and he bow 
himself with hi face toward the ground 19 2 and he said behold now 
my lord turn in i pray you into your servant s hou and tarri 
all night and wash your foot and ye shall rise up earli and go on 
your way and they said nay but we will abid in the street all 
night 

19 3 and he press upon them greatli and they turn in unto him 
and enter into hi hou and he made them a feast and did bake 
unleaven bread and they did eat 

19 4 but befor they lay down the men of the citi even the men of 
sodom compass the hou round both old and young all the peopl 
from everi quarter 19 5 and they call unto lot and said unto him 
where are the men which came in to thee thi night bring them out 
unto u that we may know them 

19 6 and lot went out at the door unto them and shut the door after 
him 19 7 and said i pray you brother do not so wickedli 

19 8 behold now i have two daughter which have not known man let 
me i pray you bring them out unto you and do ye to them a is good 
in your eye onli unto these men do noth for therefor came they 
under the shadow of my roof 

19 9 and they said stand back and they said again thi one fellow 
came in to sojourn and he will need be a judg now will we deal 
wor with thee than with them and they press sore upon the man 
even lot and came near to break the door 

19 10 but the men put forth their hand and pull lot into the hou 
to them and shut to the door 

19 11 and they smote the men that were at the door of the hou with 
blind both small and great so that they weari themselv to 
find the door 

19 12 and the men said unto lot hast thou here ani besid son in 
law and thi son and thi daughter and whatsoev thou hast in the 
citi bring them out of thi place 19 13 for we will destroy thi 
place becau the cri of them is waxen great befor the face of the 
lord and the lord hath sent u to destroy it 

19 14 and lot went out and spake unto hi son in law which marri 
hi daughter and said up get you out of thi place for the lord 
will destroy thi citi but he seem a one that mock unto hi son 
in law 

19 15 and when the morn aro then the angel hasten lot 
say ari take thi wife and thi two daughter which are here 
lest thou be consum in the iniqu of the citi 

19 16 and while he linger the men laid hold upon hi hand and upon 
the hand of hi wife and upon the hand of hi two daughter the lord 
be merci unto him and they brought him forth and set him 
without the citi 

19 17 and it came to pa when they had brought them forth abroad 
that he said escap for thi life look not behind thee neither stay 
thou in all the plain escap to the mountain lest thou be consum 

19 18 and lot said unto them oh not so my lord 19 19 behold now 
thi servant hath found grace in thi sight and thou hast magnifi thi 
merci which thou hast shew unto me in save my life and i cannot 
escap to the mountain lest some evil take me and i die 19 20 
behold now thi citi is near to flee unto and it is a littl one 
oh let me escap thither is it not a littl one and my soul shall 
live 

19 21 and he said unto him see i have accept thee concern thi 
thing also that i will not overthrow thi citi for the which thou 
hast spoken 

19 22 hast thee escap thither for i cannot do anyth till thou 
be come thither therefor the name of the citi wa call zoar 

19 23 the sun wa risen upon the earth when lot enter into zoar 

19 24 then the lord rain upon sodom and upon gomorrah brimston and 
fire from the lord out of heaven 19 25 and he overthrew those citi 
and all the plain and all the inhabit of the citi and that 
which grew upon the ground 

19 26 but hi wife look back from behind him and she becam a 
pillar of salt 

19 27 and abraham gat up earli in the morn to the place where he 
stood befor the lord 19 28 and he look toward sodom and gomorrah 
and toward all the land of the plain and beheld and lo the smoke 
of the countri went up a the smoke of a furnac 

19 29 and it came to pa when god destroy the citi of the plain 
that god rememb abraham and sent lot out of the midst of the 
overthrow when he overthrew the citi in the which lot dwelt 

19 30 and lot went up out of zoar and dwelt in the mountain and hi 
two daughter with him for he fear to dwell in zoar and he dwelt 
in a cave he and hi two daughter 

19 31 and the firstborn said unto the younger our father is old and 
there is not a man in the earth to come in unto u after the manner of 
all the earth 19 32 come let u make our father drink wine and we 
will lie with him that we may preserv seed of our father 

19 33 and they made their father drink wine that night and the 
firstborn went in and lay with her father and he perceiv not when 
she lay down nor when she aro 

19 34 and it came to pa on the morrow that the firstborn said unto 
the younger behold i lay yesternight with my father let u make him 
drink wine thi night also and go thou in and lie with him that we 
may preserv seed of our father 

19 35 and they made their father drink wine that night also and the 
younger aro and lay with him and he perceiv not when she lay 
down nor when she aro 

19 36 thu were both the daughter of lot with child by their father 

19 37 and the first born bare a son and call hi name moab the 
same is the father of the moabit unto thi day 

19 38 and the younger she also bare a son and call hi name 
benammi the same is the father of the child of ammon unto thi 
day 

20 1 and abraham journey from thenc toward the south countri and 
dwell between kadesh and shur and sojourn in gerar 

20 2 and abraham said of sarah hi wife she is my sister and 
abimelech king of gerar sent and took sarah 

20 3 but god came to abimelech in a dream by night and said to him 
behold thou art but a dead man for the woman which thou hast taken 
for she is a man s wife 

20 4 but abimelech had not come near her and he said lord wilt thou 
slay also a righteou nation 20 5 said he not unto me she is my 
sister and she even she herself said he is my brother in the 
integr of my heart and innoc of my hand have i done thi 

20 6 and god said unto him in a dream yea i know that thou didst 
thi in the integr of thi heart for i also withheld thee from 
sin against me therefor suffer i thee not to touch her 

20 7 now therefor restor the man hi wife for he is a prophet and 
he shall pray for thee and thou shalt live and if thou restor her 
not know thou that thou shalt sure die thou and all that are 
thine 

20 8 therefor abimelech rose earli in the morn and call all hi 
servant and told all these thing in their ear and the men were 
sore afraid 

20 9 then abimelech call abraham and said unto him what hast thou 
done unto u and what have i offend thee that thou hast brought on 
me and on my kingdom a great sin thou hast done deed unto me that 
ought not to be done 

20 10 and abimelech said unto abraham what sawest thou that thou 
hast done thi thing 20 11 and abraham said becau i thought 
sure the fear of god is not in thi place and they will slay me for 
my wife s sake 

20 12 and yet ind she is my sister she is the daughter of my 
father but not the daughter of my mother and she becam my wife 

20 13 and it came to pa when god cau me to wander from my 
father s hou that i said unto her thi is thi kind which thou 
shalt shew unto me at everi place whither we shall come say of me 
he is my brother 

20 14 and abimelech took sheep and ox and manserv and 
womenserv and gave them unto abraham and restor him sarah hi 
wife 

20 15 and abimelech said behold my land is befor thee dwell where 
it pleaseth thee 

20 16 and unto sarah he said behold i have given thi brother a 
thousand piec of silver behold he is to thee a cover of the 
eye unto all that are with thee and with all other thu she wa 
reprov 

20 17 so abraham pray unto god and god heal abimelech and hi 
wife and hi maidserv and they bare child 

20 18 for the lord had fast close up all the womb of the hou of 
abimelech becau of sarah abraham s wife 

21 1 and the lord visit sarah a he had said and the lord did unto 
sarah a he had spoken 

21 2 for sarah conceiv and bare abraham a son in hi old age at 
the set time of which god had spoken to him 

21 3 and abraham call the name of hi son that wa born unto him 
whom sarah bare to him isaac 

21 4 and abraham circumci hi son isaac be eight day old a 
god had command him 

21 5 and abraham wa an hundr year old when hi son isaac wa born 
unto him 

21 6 and sarah said god hath made me to laugh so that all that hear 
will laugh with me 

21 7 and she said who would have said unto abraham that sarah should 
have given child suck for i have born him a son in hi old age 

21 8 and the child grew and wa wean and abraham made a great 
feast the same day that isaac wa wean 

21 9 and sarah saw the son of hagar the egyptian which she had born 
unto abraham mock 

21 10 wherefor she said unto abraham cast out thi bondwoman and her 
son for the son of thi bondwoman shall not be heir with my son even 
with isaac 

21 11 and the thing wa veri grievou in abraham s sight becau of 
hi son 

21 12 and god said unto abraham let it not be grievou in thi sight 
becau of the lad and becau of thi bondwoman in all that sarah 
hath said unto thee hearken unto her voic for in isaac shall thi 
seed be call 

21 13 and also of the son of the bondwoman will i make a nation 
becau he is thi seed 

21 14 and abraham rose up earli in the morn and took bread and a 
bottl of water and gave it unto hagar put it on her shoulder 
and the child and sent her away and she depart and wander in 
the wilder of beersheba 

21 15 and the water wa spent in the bottl and she cast the child 
under one of the shrub 

21 16 and she went and sat her down over against him a good way off 
a it were a bow shot for she said let me not see the death of the 
child and she sat over against him and lift up her voic and wept 

21 17 and god heard the voic of the lad and the angel of god call 
to hagar out of heaven and said unto her what aileth thee hagar 
fear not for god hath heard the voic of the lad where he is 

21 18 ari lift up the lad and hold him in thine hand for i will 
make him a great nation 

21 19 and god open her eye and she saw a well of water and she 
went and fill the bottl with water and gave the lad drink 

21 20 and god wa with the lad and he grew and dwelt in the 
wilder and becam an archer 

21 21 and he dwelt in the wilder of paran and hi mother took him 
a wife out of the land of egypt 

21 22 and it came to pa at that time that abimelech and phichol the 
chief captain of hi host spake unto abraham say god is with thee 
in all that thou doest 21 23 now therefor swear unto me here by god 
that thou wilt not deal fal with me nor with my son nor with my 
son s son but accord to the kind that i have done unto thee 
thou shalt do unto me and to the land wherein thou hast sojourn 

21 24 and abraham said i will swear 

21 25 and abraham reprov abimelech becau of a well of water which 
abimelech s servant had violent taken away 

21 26 and abimelech said i wot not who hath done thi thing neither 
didst thou tell me neither yet heard i of it but to day 

21 27 and abraham took sheep and ox and gave them unto abimelech 
and both of them made a coven 

21 28 and abraham set seven ewe lamb of the flock by themselv 

21 29 and abimelech said unto abraham what mean these seven ewe lamb 
which thou hast set by themselv 21 30 and he said for these seven 
ewe lamb shalt thou take of my hand that they may be a wit unto 
me that i have dig thi well 

21 31 wherefor he call that place beersheba becau there they 
sware both of them 

21 32 thu they made a coven at beersheba then abimelech rose up 
and phichol the chief captain of hi host and they return into the 
land of the philistin 

21 33 and abraham plant a grove in beersheba and call there on 
the name of the lord the everlast god 

21 34 and abraham sojourn in the philistin land mani day 

22 1 and it came to pa after these thing that god did tempt 
abraham and said unto him abraham and he said behold here i am 

22 2 and he said take now thi son thine onli son isaac whom thou 
lovest and get thee into the land of moriah and offer him there for 
a burnt offer upon one of the mountain which i will tell thee of 

22 3 and abraham rose up earli in the morn and saddl hi a 
and took two of hi young men with him and isaac hi son and clave 
the wood for the burnt offer and rose up and went unto the place 
of which god had told him 

22 4 then on the third day abraham lift up hi eye and saw the 
place afar off 

22 5 and abraham said unto hi young men abid ye here with the a 
and i and the lad will go yonder and worship and come again to you 

22 6 and abraham took the wood of the burnt offer and laid it upon 
isaac hi son and he took the fire in hi hand and a knife and they 
went both of them togeth 

22 7 and isaac spake unto abraham hi father and said my father and 
he said here am i my son and he said behold the fire and the wood 
but where is the lamb for a burnt offer 22 8 and abraham said my 
son god will provid himself a lamb for a burnt offer so they 
went both of them togeth 

22 9 and they came to the place which god had told him of and abraham 
built an altar there and laid the wood in order and bound isaac hi 
son and laid him on the altar upon the wood 

22 10 and abraham stretch forth hi hand and took the knife to slay 
hi son 

22 11 and the angel of the lord call unto him out of heaven and 
said abraham abraham and he said here am i 

22 12 and he said lay not thine hand upon the lad neither do thou 
ani thing unto him for now i know that thou fearest god see thou 
hast not withheld thi son thine onli son from me 

22 13 and abraham lift up hi eye and look and behold behind 
him a ram caught in a thicket by hi horn and abraham went and took 
the ram and offer him up for a burnt offer in the stead of hi 
son 

22 14 and abraham call the name of that place jehovahjireh a it is 
said to thi day in the mount of the lord it shall be seen 

22 15 and the angel of the lord call unto abraham out of heaven the 
second time 22 16 and said by myself have i sworn saith the lord 
for becau thou hast done thi thing and hast not withheld thi son 
thine onli son 22 17 that in bless i will bless thee and in 
multipli i will multipli thi seed a the star of the heaven and 
a the sand which is upon the sea shore and thi seed shall po 
the gate of hi enemi 22 18 and in thi seed shall all the nation 
of the earth be bless becau thou hast obey my voic 

22 19 so abraham return unto hi young men and they rose up and 
went togeth to beersheba and abraham dwelt at beersheba 

22 20 and it came to pa after these thing that it wa told 
abraham say behold milcah she hath also born child unto thi 
brother nahor 22 21 huz hi firstborn and buz hi brother and 
kemuel the father of aram 22 22 and chese and hazo and pildash 
and jidlaph and bethuel 

22 23 and bethuel begat rebekah these eight milcah did bear to nahor 
abraham s brother 

22 24 and hi concubin whose name wa reumah she bare also tebah 
and gaham and thahash and maachah 

23 1 and sarah wa an hundr and seven and twenti year old these 
were the year of the life of sarah 

23 2 and sarah die in kirjatharba the same is hebron in the land of 
canaan and abraham came to mourn for sarah and to weep for her 

23 3 and abraham stood up from befor hi dead and spake unto the 
son of heth say 23 4 i am a stranger and a sojourn with you 
give me a poss of a buryingplac with you that i may buri my 
dead out of my sight 

23 5 and the child of heth answer abraham say unto him 23 6 
hear u my lord thou art a mighti princ among u in the choic of 
our sepulchr buri thi dead none of u shall withhold from thee hi 
sepulchr but that thou mayest buri thi dead 

23 7 and abraham stood up and bow himself to the peopl of the 
land even to the child of heth 

23 8 and he commun with them say if it be your mind that i 
should buri my dead out of my sight hear me and intreat for me to 
ephron the son of zohar 23 9 that he may give me the cave of 
machpelah which he hath which is in the end of hi field for a 
much money a it is worth he shall give it me for a poss of a 
buryingplac amongst you 

23 10 and ephron dwelt among the child of heth and ephron the 
hittit answer abraham in the audienc of the child of heth even 
of all that went in at the gate of hi citi say 23 11 nay my 
lord hear me the field give i thee and the cave that is therein i 
give it thee in the presenc of the son of my peopl give i it thee 
buri thi dead 

23 12 and abraham bow down himself befor the peopl of the land 

23 13 and he spake unto ephron in the audienc of the peopl of the 
land say but if thou wilt give it i pray thee hear me i will 
give thee money for the field take it of me and i will buri my dead 
there 

23 14 and ephron answer abraham say unto him 23 15 my lord 
hearken unto me the land is worth four hundr shekel of silver 
what is that betwixt me and thee buri therefor thi dead 

23 16 and abraham hearken unto ephron and abraham weigh to ephron 
the silver which he had name in the audienc of the son of heth 
four hundr shekel of silver current money with the merchant 

23 17 and the field of ephron which wa in machpelah which wa befor 
mamr the field and the cave which wa therein and all the tree 
that were in the field that were in all the border round about were 
made sure 23 18 unto abraham for a poss in the presenc of the 
child of heth befor all that went in at the gate of hi citi 

23 19 and after thi abraham buri sarah hi wife in the cave of the 
field of machpelah befor mamr the same is hebron in the land of 
canaan 

23 20 and the field and the cave that is therein were made sure unto 
abraham for a poss of a buryingplac by the son of heth 

24 1 and abraham wa old and well stricken in age and the lord had 
bless abraham in all thing 

24 2 and abraham said unto hi eldest servant of hi hou that rule 
over all that he had put i pray thee thi hand under my thigh 24 3 
and i will make thee swear by the lord the god of heaven and the god 
of the earth that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the 
daughter of the canaanit among whom i dwell 24 4 but thou shalt 
go unto my countri and to my kindr and take a wife unto my son 
isaac 

24 5 and the servant said unto him peradventur the woman will not be 
will to follow me unto thi land must i need bring thi son again 
unto the land from whenc thou camest 24 6 and abraham said unto 
him bewar thou that thou bring not my son thither again 

24 7 the lord god of heaven which took me from my father s hou and 
from the land of my kindr and which spake unto me and that sware 
unto me say unto thi seed will i give thi land he shall send 
hi angel befor thee and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from 
thenc 

24 8 and if the woman will not be will to follow thee then thou 
shalt be clear from thi my oath onli bring not my son thither again 

24 9 and the servant put hi hand under the thigh of abraham hi 
master and sware to him concern that matter 

24 10 and the servant took ten camel of the camel of hi master and 
depart for all the good of hi master were in hi hand and he 
aro and went to mesopotamia unto the citi of nahor 

24 11 and he made hi camel to kneel down without the citi by a well 
of water at the time of the even even the time that woman go out 
to draw water 

24 12 and he said o lord god of my master abraham i pray thee send 
me good speed thi day and shew kind unto my master abraham 

24 13 behold i stand here by the well of water and the daughter of 
the men of the citi come out to draw water 24 14 and let it come to 
pa that the damsel to whom i shall say let down thi pitcher i 
pray thee that i may drink and she shall say drink and i will give 
thi camel drink also let the same be she that thou hast appoint 
for thi servant isaac and therebi shall i know that thou hast shew 
kind unto my master 

24 15 and it came to pa befor he had done speak that behold 
rebekah came out who wa born to bethuel son of milcah the wife of 
nahor abraham s brother with her pitcher upon her shoulder 

24 16 and the damsel wa veri fair to look upon a virgin neither had 
ani man known her and she went down to the well and fill her 
pitcher and came up 

24 17 and the servant ran to meet her and said let me i pray thee 
drink a littl water of thi pitcher 

24 18 and she said drink my lord and she hast and let down her 
pitcher upon her hand and gave him drink 

24 19 and when she had done give him drink she said i will draw 
water for thi camel also until they have done drink 

24 20 and she hast and empti her pitcher into the trough and ran 
again unto the well to draw water and drew for all hi camel 

24 21 and the man wonder at her held hi peac to wit whether the 
lord had made hi journey prosper or not 

24 22 and it came to pa a the camel had done drink that the 
man took a golden ear of half a shekel weight and two bracelet 
for her hand of ten shekel weight of gold 24 23 and said whose 
daughter art thou tell me i pray thee is there room in thi father s 
hou for u to lodg in 24 24 and she said unto him i am the 
daughter of bethuel the son of milcah which she bare unto nahor 

24 25 she said moreov unto him we have both straw and provend 
enough and room to lodg in 

24 26 and the man bow down hi head and worship the lord 

24 27 and he said bless be the lord god of my master abraham who 
hath not left destitut my master of hi merci and hi truth i be 
in the way the lord led me to the hou of my master s brother 

24 28 and the damsel ran and told them of her mother s hou these 
thing 

24 29 and rebekah had a brother and hi name wa laban and laban ran 
out unto the man unto the well 

24 30 and it came to pa when he saw the ear and bracelet upon 
hi sister s hand and when he heard the word of rebekah hi sister 
say thu spake the man unto me that he came unto the man and 
behold he stood by the camel at the well 

24 31 and he said come in thou bless of the lord wherefor 
standest thou without for i have prepar the hou and room for the 
camel 

24 32 and the man came into the hou and he ungird hi camel and 
gave straw and provend for the camel and water to wash hi foot 
and the men s foot that were with him 

24 33 and there wa set meat befor him to eat but he said i will 
not eat until i have told mine errand and he said speak on 

24 34 and he said i am abraham s servant 

24 35 and the lord hath bless my master greatli and he is becom 
great and he hath given him flock and herd and silver and gold 
and manserv and maidserv and camel and as 

24 36 and sarah my master s wife bare a son to my master when she wa 
old and unto him hath he given all that he hath 

24 37 and my master made me swear say thou shalt not take a wife 
to my son of the daughter of the canaanit in whose land i dwell 
24 38 but thou shalt go unto my father s hou and to my kindr and 
take a wife unto my son 

24 39 and i said unto my master peradventur the woman will not 
follow me 

24 40 and he said unto me the lord befor whom i walk will send hi 
angel with thee and prosper thi way and thou shalt take a wife for 
my son of my kindr and of my father s hou 24 41 then shalt thou 
be clear from thi my oath when thou comest to my kindr and if 
they give not thee one thou shalt be clear from my oath 

24 42 and i came thi day unto the well and said o lord god of my 
master abraham if now thou do prosper my way which i go 24 43 
behold i stand by the well of water and it shall come to pa that 
when the virgin cometh forth to draw water and i say to her give me 
i pray thee a littl water of thi pitcher to drink 24 44 and she say 
to me both drink thou and i will also draw for thi camel let the 
same be the woman whom the lord hath appoint out for my master s 
son 

24 45 and befor i had done speak in mine heart behold rebekah 
came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder and she went down unto 
the well and drew water and i said unto her let me drink i pray 
thee 

24 46 and she made hast and let down her pitcher from her shoulder 
and said drink and i will give thi camel drink also so i drank 
and she made the camel drink also 

24 47 and i ask her and said whose daughter art thou and she 
said the daughter of bethuel nahor s son whom milcah bare unto him 
and i put the ear upon her face and the bracelet upon her hand 

24 48 and i bow down my head and worship the lord and bless 
the lord god of my master abraham which had led me in the right way
