to take my master s brother s daughter unto hi son 

24 49 and now if ye will deal kindli and truli with my master tell 
me and if not tell me that i may turn to the right hand or to the 
left 

24 50 then laban and bethuel answer and said the thing proceedeth 
from the lord we cannot speak unto thee bad or good 

24 51 behold rebekah is befor thee take her and go and let her be 
thi master s son s wife a the lord hath spoken 

24 52 and it came to pa that when abraham s servant heard their 
word he worship the lord bow himself to the earth 

24 53 and the servant brought forth jewel of silver and jewel of 
gold and raiment and gave them to rebekah he gave also to her 
brother and to her mother preciou thing 

24 54 and they did eat and drink he and the men that were with him 
and tarri all night and they rose up in the morn and he said 
send me away unto my master 

24 55 and her brother and her mother said let the damsel abid with 
u a few day at the least ten after that she shall go 

24 56 and he said unto them hinder me not see the lord hath 
prosper my way send me away that i may go to my master 

24 57 and they said we will call the damsel and enquir at her 
mouth 

24 58 and they call rebekah and said unto her wilt thou go with 
thi man and she said i will go 

24 59 and they sent away rebekah their sister and her nur and 
abraham s servant and hi men 

24 60 and they bless rebekah and said unto her thou art our 
sister be thou the mother of thousand of million and let thi seed 
po the gate of those which hate them 

24 61 and rebekah aro and her damsel and they rode upon the 
camel and follow the man and the servant took rebekah and went 
hi way 

24 62 and isaac came from the way of the well lahairoi for he dwelt 
in the south countri 

24 63 and isaac went out to medit in the field at the eventid and 
he lift up hi eye and saw and behold the camel were come 

24 64 and rebekah lift up her eye and when she saw isaac she 
light off the camel 

24 65 for she had said unto the servant what man is thi that walketh 
in the field to meet u and the servant had said it is my master 
therefor she took a vail and cover herself 

24 66 and the servant told isaac all thing that he had done 

24 67 and isaac brought her into hi mother sarah s tent and took 
rebekah and she becam hi wife and he love her and isaac wa 
comfort after hi mother s death 

25 1 then again abraham took a wife and her name wa keturah 

25 2 and she bare him zimran and jokshan and medan and midian and 
ishbak and shuah 

25 3 and jokshan begat sheba and dedan and the son of dedan were 
asshurim and letushim and leummim 

25 4 and the son of midian ephah and epher and hanoch and abidah 
and eldaah all these were the child of keturah 

25 5 and abraham gave all that he had unto isaac 

25 6 but unto the son of the concubin which abraham had abraham 
gave gift and sent them away from isaac hi son while he yet live 
eastward unto the east countri 

25 7 and these are the day of the year of abraham s life which he 
live an hundr threescor and fifteen year 

25 8 then abraham gave up the ghost and die in a good old age an 
old man and full of year and wa gather to hi peopl 

25 9 and hi son isaac and ishmael buri him in the cave of 
machpelah in the field of ephron the son of zohar the hittit which 
is befor mamr 25 10 the field which abraham purcha of the son 
of heth there wa abraham buri and sarah hi wife 

25 11 and it came to pa after the death of abraham that god bless 
hi son isaac and isaac dwelt by the well lahairoi 

25 12 now these are the gener of ishmael abraham s son whom 
hagar the egyptian sarah s handmaid bare unto abraham 25 13 and 
these are the name of the son of ishmael by their name accord 
to their gener the firstborn of ishmael nebajoth and kedar 
and adbeel and mibsam 25 14 and mishma and dumah and massa 25 15 
hadar and tema jetur naphish and kedemah 25 16 these are the son 
of ishmael and these are their name by their town and by their 
castl twelv princ accord to their nation 

25 17 and these are the year of the life of ishmael an hundr and 
thirti and seven year and he gave up the ghost and die and wa 
gather unto hi peopl 

25 18 and they dwelt from havilah unto shur that is befor egypt a 
thou goest toward assyria and he die in the presenc of all hi 
brother 

25 19 and these are the gener of isaac abraham s son abraham 
begat isaac 25 20 and isaac wa forti year old when he took rebekah 
to wife the daughter of bethuel the syrian of padanaram the sister 
to laban the syrian 

25 21 and isaac intreat the lord for hi wife becau she wa 
barren and the lord wa intreat of him and rebekah hi wife 
conceiv 

25 22 and the child struggl togeth within her and she said if 
it be so whi am i thu and she went to enquir of the lord 

25 23 and the lord said unto her two nation are in thi womb and two 
manner of peopl shall be separ from thi bowel and the one 
peopl shall be stronger than the other peopl and the elder shall 
serv the younger 

25 24 and when her day to be deliv were fulfil behold there 
were twin in her womb 

25 25 and the first came out red all over like an hairi garment and 
they call hi name esau 

25 26 and after that came hi brother out and hi hand took hold on 
esau s heel and hi name wa call jacob and isaac wa threescor 
year old when she bare them 

25 27 and the boy grew and esau wa a cun hunter a man of the 
field and jacob wa a plain man dwell in tent 

25 28 and isaac love esau becau he did eat of hi venison but 
rebekah love jacob 

25 29 and jacob sod pottag and esau came from the field and he wa 
faint 25 30 and esau said to jacob feed me i pray thee with that 
same red pottag for i am faint therefor wa hi name call edom 

25 31 and jacob said sell me thi day thi birthright 

25 32 and esau said behold i am at the point to die and what profit 
shall thi birthright do to me 25 33 and jacob said swear to me 
thi day and he sware unto him and he sold hi birthright unto 
jacob 

25 34 then jacob gave esau bread and pottag of lentil and he did 
eat and drink and rose up and went hi way thu esau despi hi 
birthright 

26 1 and there wa a famin in the land besid the first famin that 
wa in the day of abraham and isaac went unto abimelech king of the 
philistin unto gerar 

26 2 and the lord appear unto him and said go not down into egypt 
dwell in the land which i shall tell thee of 26 3 sojourn in thi 
land and i will be with thee and will bless thee for unto thee and 
unto thi seed i will give all these countri and i will perform the 
oath which i sware unto abraham thi father 26 4 and i will make thi 
seed to multipli a the star of heaven and will give unto thi seed 
all these countri and in thi seed shall all the nation of the 
earth be bless 26 5 becau that abraham obey my voic and kept 
my charg my command my statut and my law 

26 6 and isaac dwelt in gerar 26 7 and the men of the place ask him 
of hi wife and he said she is my sister for he fear to say she 
is my wife lest said he the men of the place should kill me for 
rebekah becau she wa fair to look upon 

26 8 and it came to pa when he had been there a long time that 
abimelech king of the philistin look out at a window and saw 
and behold isaac wa sport with rebekah hi wife 

26 9 and abimelech call isaac and said behold of a sureti she is 
thi wife and how saidst thou she is my sister and isaac said unto 
him becau i said lest i die for her 

26 10 and abimelech said what is thi thou hast done unto u one of 
the peopl might lightli have lien with thi wife and thou shouldest 
have brought guilti upon u 

26 11 and abimelech charg all hi peopl say he that toucheth 
thi man or hi wife shall sure be put to death 

26 12 then isaac sow in that land and receiv in the same year an 
hundredfold and the lord bless him 

26 13 and the man wax great and went forward and grew until he 
becam veri great 26 14 for he had poss of flock and 
poss of herd and great store of servant and the philistin 
envi him 

26 15 for all the well which hi father s servant had dig in the 
day of abraham hi father the philistin had stop them and 
fill them with earth 

26 16 and abimelech said unto isaac go from u for thou art much 
mightier than we 

26 17 and isaac depart thenc and pitch hi tent in the valley of 
gerar and dwelt there 

26 18 and isaac dig again the well of water which they had dig 
in the day of abraham hi father for the philistin had stop 
them after the death of abraham and he call their name after the 
name by which hi father had call them 

26 19 and isaac s servant dig in the valley and found there a 
well of spring water 

26 20 and the herdmen of gerar did strive with isaac s herdmen 
say the water is our and he call the name of the well esek 
becau they strove with him 

26 21 and they dig anoth well and strove for that also and he 
call the name of it sitnah 

26 22 and he remov from thenc and dig anoth well and for 
that they strove not and he call the name of it rehoboth and he 
said for now the lord hath made room for u and we shall be fruit 
in the land 

26 23 and he went up from thenc to beersheba 

26 24 and the lord appear unto him the same night and said i am 
the god of abraham thi father fear not for i am with thee and will 
bless thee and multipli thi seed for my servant abraham s sake 

26 25 and he build an altar there and call upon the name of the 
lord and pitch hi tent there and there isaac s servant dig a 
well 

26 26 then abimelech went to him from gerar and ahuzzath one of hi 
friend and phichol the chief captain of hi armi 

26 27 and isaac said unto them wherefor come ye to me see ye 
hate me and have sent me away from you 26 28 and they said we saw 
certainli that the lord wa with thee and we said let there be now 
an oath betwixt u even betwixt u and thee and let u make a 
coven with thee 26 29 that thou wilt do u no hurt a we have not 
touch thee and a we have done unto thee noth but good and have 
sent thee away in peac thou art now the bless of the lord 

26 30 and he made them a feast and they did eat and drink 

26 31 and they rose up betim in the morn and sware one to 
anoth and isaac sent them away and they depart from him in 
peac 

26 32 and it came to pa the same day that isaac s servant came 
and told him concern the well which they had dig and said unto 
him we have found water 

26 33 and he call it shebah therefor the name of the citi is 
beersheba unto thi day 

26 34 and esau wa forti year old when he took to wife judith the 
daughter of beeri the hittit and bashemath the daughter of elon the 
hittit 26 35 which were a grief of mind unto isaac and to rebekah 

27 1 and it came to pa that when isaac wa old and hi eye were 
dim so that he could not see he call esau hi eldest son and said 
unto him my son and he said unto him behold here am i 

27 2 and he said behold now i am old i know not the day of my 
death 27 3 now therefor take i pray thee thi weapon thi quiver 
and thi bow and go out to the field and take me some venison 27 4 
and make me savouri meat such a i love and bring it to me that i 
may eat that my soul may bless thee befor i die 

27 5 and rebekah heard when isaac spake to esau hi son and esau went 
to the field to hunt for venison and to bring it 

27 6 and rebekah spake unto jacob her son say behold i heard thi 
father speak unto esau thi brother say 27 7 bring me venison and 
make me savouri meat that i may eat and bless thee befor the lord 
befor my death 

27 8 now therefor my son obey my voic accord to that which i 
command thee 

27 9 go now to the flock and fetch me from thenc two good kid of 
the goat and i will make them savouri meat for thi father such a 
he loveth 27 10 and thou shalt bring it to thi father that he may 
eat and that he may bless thee befor hi death 

27 11 and jacob said to rebekah hi mother behold esau my brother is 
a hairi man and i am a smooth man 27 12 my father peradventur will 
feel me and i shall seem to him a a deceiv and i shall bring a 
cur upon me and not a bless 

27 13 and hi mother said unto him upon me be thi cur my son onli 
obey my voic and go fetch me them 

27 14 and he went and fetch and brought them to hi mother and 
hi mother made savouri meat such a hi father love 

27 15 and rebekah took goodli raiment of her eldest son esau which 
were with her in the hou and put them upon jacob her younger son 
27 16 and she put the skin of the kid of the goat upon hi hand 
and upon the smooth of hi neck 27 17 and she gave the savouri meat 
and the bread which she had prepar into the hand of her son jacob 

27 18 and he came unto hi father and said my father and he said 
here am i who art thou my son 27 19 and jacob said unto hi 
father i am esau thi first born i have done accord a thou badest 
me ari i pray thee sit and eat of my venison that thi soul may 
bless me 

27 20 and isaac said unto hi son how is it that thou hast found it 
so quickli my son and he said becau the lord thi god brought it 
to me 

27 21 and isaac said unto jacob come near i pray thee that i may 
feel thee my son whether thou be my veri son esau or not 

27 22 and jacob went near unto isaac hi father and he felt him and 
said the voic is jacob s voic but the hand are the hand of esau 

27 23 and he discern him not becau hi hand were hairi a hi 
brother esau s hand so he bless him 

27 24 and he said art thou my veri son esau and he said i am 

27 25 and he said bring it near to me and i will eat of my son s 
venison that my soul may bless thee and he brought it near to him 
and he did eat and he brought him wine and he drank 

27 26 and hi father isaac said unto him come near now and kiss me 
my son 

27 27 and he came near and kiss him and he smell the smell of 
hi raiment and bless him and said see the smell of my son is a 
the smell of a field which the lord hath bless 27 28 therefor god 
give thee of the dew of heaven and the fat of the earth and 
plenti of corn and wine 27 29 let peopl serv thee and nation bow 
down to thee be lord over thi brother and let thi mother s son bow 
down to thee cur be everi one that curseth thee and bless be he 
that blesseth thee 

27 30 and it came to pa a soon a isaac had made an end of 
bless jacob and jacob wa yet scarc gone out from the presenc of 
isaac hi father that esau hi brother came in from hi hunt 

27 31 and he also had made savouri meat and brought it unto hi 
father and said unto hi father let my father ari and eat of hi 
son s venison that thi soul may bless me 

27 32 and isaac hi father said unto him who art thou and he said i 
am thi son thi firstborn esau 

27 33 and isaac trembl veri exceedingli and said who where is he 
that hath taken venison and brought it me and i have eaten of all 
befor thou camest and have bless him yea and he shall be 
bless 

27 34 and when esau heard the word of hi father he cri with a 
great and exceed bitter cri and said unto hi father bless me 
even me also o my father 

27 35 and he said thi brother came with subtilti and hath taken away 
thi bless 

27 36 and he said is not he rightli name jacob for he hath 
supplant me these two time he took away my birthright and 
behold now he hath taken away my bless and he said hast thou not 
reserv a bless for me 27 37 and isaac answer and said unto 
esau behold i have made him thi lord and all hi brother have i 
given to him for servant and with corn and wine have i sustain 
him and what shall i do now unto thee my son 27 38 and esau said 
unto hi father hast thou but one bless my father bless me even 
me also o my father and esau lift up hi voic and wept 

27 39 and isaac hi father answer and said unto him behold thi 
dwell shall be the fat of the earth and of the dew of heaven 
from abov 27 40 and by thi sword shalt thou live and shalt serv 
thi brother and it shall come to pa when thou shalt have the 
dominion that thou shalt break hi yoke from off thi neck 

27 41 and esau hate jacob becau of the bless wherewith hi 
father bless him and esau said in hi heart the day of mourn 
for my father are at hand then will i slay my brother jacob 

27 42 and these word of esau her elder son were told to rebekah and 
she sent and call jacob her younger son and said unto him behold 
thi brother esau a touch thee doth comfort himself purpo to 
kill thee 

27 43 now therefor my son obey my voic ari flee thou to laban 
my brother to haran 27 44 and tarri with him a few day until thi 
brother s furi turn away 27 45 until thi brother s anger turn away 
from thee and he forget that which thou hast done to him then i will 
send and fetch thee from thenc whi should i be depriv also of you 
both in one day 27 46 and rebekah said to isaac i am weari of my 
life becau of the daughter of heth if jacob take a wife of the 
daughter of heth such a these which are of the daughter of the 
land what good shall my life do me 28 1 and isaac call jacob and 
bless him and charg him and said unto him thou shalt not take a 
wife of the daughter of canaan 

28 2 ari go to padanaram to the hou of bethuel thi mother s 
father and take thee a wife from thenc of the daugher of laban thi 
mother s brother 

28 3 and god almighti bless thee and make thee fruit and multipli 
thee that thou mayest be a multitud of peopl 28 4 and give thee 
the bless of abraham to thee and to thi seed with thee that thou 
mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger which god gave 
unto abraham 

28 5 and isaac sent away jacob and he went to padanaram unto laban 
son of bethuel the syrian the brother of rebekah jacob s and esau s 
mother 

28 6 when esau saw that isaac had bless jacob and sent him away to 
padanaram to take him a wife from thenc and that a he bless him 
he gave him a charg say thou shalt not take a wife of the 
daugher of canaan 28 7 and that jacob obey hi father and hi 
mother and wa gone to padanaram 28 8 and esau see that the 
daughter of canaan plea not isaac hi father 28 9 then went esau 
unto ishmael and took unto the wife which he had mahalath the 
daughter of ishmael abraham s son the sister of nebajoth to be hi 
wife 

28 10 and jacob went out from beersheba and went toward haran 

28 11 and he light upon a certain place and tarri there all 
night becau the sun wa set and he took of the stone of that 
place and put them for hi pillow and lay down in that place to 
sleep 

28 12 and he dream and behold a ladder set up on the earth and the 
top of it reach to heaven and behold the angel of god ascend 
and descend on it 

28 13 and behold the lord stood abov it and said i am the lord 
god of abraham thi father and the god of isaac the land whereon thou 
liest to thee will i give it and to thi seed 28 14 and thi seed 
shall be a the dust of the earth and thou shalt spread abroad to the 
west and to the east and to the north and to the south and in thee 
and in thi seed shall all the famili of the earth be bless 

28 15 and behold i am with thee and will keep thee in all place 
whither thou goest and will bring thee again into thi land for i 
will not leav thee until i have done that which i have spoken to 
thee of 

28 16 and jacob awak out of hi sleep and he said sure the lord 
is in thi place and i knew it not 

28 17 and he wa afraid and said how dread is thi place thi is 
none other but the hou of god and thi is the gate of heaven 

28 18 and jacob rose up earli in the morn and took the stone that 
he had put for hi pillow and set it up for a pillar and pour oil 
upon the top of it 

28 19 and he call the name of that place bethel but the name of 
that citi wa call luz at the first 

28 20 and jacob vow a vow say if god will be with me and will 
keep me in thi way that i go and will give me bread to eat and 
raiment to put on 28 21 so that i come again to my father s hou in 
peac then shall the lord be my god 28 22 and thi stone which i 
have set for a pillar shall be god s hou and of all that thou 
shalt give me i will sure give the tenth unto thee 

29 1 then jacob went on hi journey and came into the land of the 
peopl of the east 

29 2 and he look and behold a well in the field and lo there 
were three flock of sheep lie by it for out of that well they 
water the flock and a great stone wa upon the well s mouth 

29 3 and thither were all the flock gather and they roll the 
stone from the well s mouth and water the sheep and put the stone 
again upon the well s mouth in hi place 

29 4 and jacob said unto them my brother whenc be ye and they 
said of haran are we 

29 5 and he said unto them know ye laban the son of nahor and they 
said we know him 

29 6 and he said unto them is he well and they said he is well 
and behold rachel hi daughter cometh with the sheep 

29 7 and he said lo it is yet high day neither is it time that the 
cattl should be gather togeth water ye the sheep and go and 
feed them 

29 8 and they said we cannot until all the flock be gather 
togeth and till they roll the stone from the well s mouth then we 
water the sheep 

29 9 and while he yet spake with them rachel came with her father s 
sheep for she kept them 

29 10 and it came to pa when jacob saw rachel the daughter of laban 
hi mother s brother and the sheep of laban hi mother s brother 
that jacob went near and roll the stone from the well s mouth and 
water the flock of laban hi mother s brother 

29 11 and jacob kiss rachel and lift up hi voic and wept 

29 12 and jacob told rachel that he wa her father s brother and that 
he wa rebekah s son and she ran and told her father 

29 13 and it came to pa when laban heard the tide of jacob hi 
sister s son that he ran to meet him and embrac him and kiss 
him and brought him to hi hou and he told laban all these thing 

29 14 and laban said to him sure thou art my bone and my flesh and 
he abod with him the space of a month 

29 15 and laban said unto jacob becau thou art my brother 
shouldest thou therefor serv me for nought tell me what shall thi 
wage be 29 16 and laban had two daughter the name of the elder 
wa leah and the name of the younger wa rachel 

29 17 leah wa tender eye but rachel wa beauti and well 
favour 

29 18 and jacob love rachel and said i will serv thee seven year 
for rachel thi younger daughter 

29 19 and laban said it is better that i give her to thee than that 
i should give her to anoth man abid with me 

29 20 and jacob serv seven year for rachel and they seem unto 
him but a few day for the love he had to her 

29 21 and jacob said unto laban give me my wife for my day are 
fulfil that i may go in unto her 

29 22 and laban gather togeth all the men of the place and made a 
feast 

29 23 and it came to pa in the even that he took leah hi 
daughter and brought her to him and he went in unto her 

29 24 and laban gave unto hi daughter leah zilpah hi maid for an 
handmaid 

29 25 and it came to pa that in the morn behold it wa leah 
and he said to laban what is thi thou hast done unto me did not i 
serv with thee for rachel wherefor then hast thou beguil me 
29 26 and laban said it must not be so done in our countri to give 
the younger befor the firstborn 

29 27 fulfil her week and we will give thee thi also for the servic 
which thou shalt serv with me yet seven other year 

29 28 and jacob did so and fulfil her week and he gave him rachel 
hi daughter to wife also 

29 29 and laban gave to rachel hi daughter bilhah hi handmaid to be 
her maid 

29 30 and he went in also unto rachel and he love also rachel more 
than leah and serv with him yet seven other year 

29 31 and when the lord saw that leah wa hate he open her womb 
but rachel wa barren 

29 32 and leah conceiv and bare a son and she call hi name 
reuben for she said sure the lord hath look upon my afflict 
now therefor my husband will love me 

29 33 and she conceiv again and bare a son and said becau the 
lord hath heard i wa hate he hath therefor given me thi son also 
and she call hi name simeon 

29 34 and she conceiv again and bare a son and said now thi time 
will my husband be join unto me becau i have born him three son 
therefor wa hi name call levi 

29 35 and she conceiv again and bare a son and she said now will 
i prai the lord therefor she call hi name judah and left 
bear 

30 1 and when rachel saw that she bare jacob no child rachel 
envi her sister and said unto jacob give me child or el i 
die 

30 2 and jacob s anger wa kindl against rachel and he said am i 
in god s stead who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb 
30 3 and she said behold my maid bilhah go in unto her and she 
shall bear upon my knee that i may also have child by her 

30 4 and she gave him bilhah her handmaid to wife and jacob went in 
unto her 

30 5 and bilhah conceiv and bare jacob a son 

30 6 and rachel said god hath judg me and hath also heard my 
voic and hath given me a son therefor call she hi name dan 

30 7 and bilhah rachel s maid conceiv again and bare jacob a second 
son 

30 8 and rachel said with great wrestl have i wrestl with my 
sister and i have prevail and she call hi name naphtali 

30 9 when leah saw that she had left bear she took zilpah her 
maid and gave her jacob to wife 

30 10 and zilpah leah s maid bare jacob a son 

30 11 and leah said a troop cometh and she call hi name gad 

30 12 and zilpah leah s maid bare jacob a second son 

30 13 and leah said happi am i for the daughter will call me 
bless and she call hi name asher 

30 14 and reuben went in the day of wheat harvest and found 
mandrak in the field and brought them unto hi mother leah then 
rachel said to leah give me i pray thee of thi son s mandrak 

30 15 and she said unto her is it a small matter that thou hast taken 
my husband and wouldest thou take away my son s mandrak also and 
rachel said therefor he shall lie with thee to night for thi son s 
mandrak 

30 16 and jacob came out of the field in the even and leah went 
out to meet him and said thou must come in unto me for sure i 
have hire thee with my son s mandrak and he lay with her that 
night 

30 17 and god hearken unto leah and she conceiv and bare jacob 
the fifth son 

30 18 and leah said god hath given me my hire becau i have given 
my maiden to my husband and she call hi name issachar 

30 19 and leah conceiv again and bare jacob the sixth son 

30 20 and leah said god hath endu me with a good dowri now will my 
husband dwell with me becau i have born him six son and she 
call hi name zebulun 

30 21 and afterward she bare a daughter and call her name dinah 

30 22 and god rememb rachel and god hearken to her and open 
her womb 

30 23 and she conceiv and bare a son and said god hath taken away 
my reproach 30 24 and she call hi name joseph and said the lord 
shall add to me anoth son 

30 25 and it came to pa when rachel had born joseph that jacob 
said unto laban send me away that i may go unto mine own place and 
to my countri 

30 26 give me my wife and my child for whom i have serv thee 
and let me go for thou knowest my servic which i have done thee 

30 27 and laban said unto him i pray thee if i have found favour in 
thine eye tarri for i have learn by experi that the lord hath 
bless me for thi sake 

30 28 and he said appoint me thi wage and i will give it 

30 29 and he said unto him thou knowest how i have serv thee and 
how thi cattl wa with me 

30 30 for it wa littl which thou hadst befor i came and it is now 
increa unto a multitud and the lord hath bless thee sinc my 
come and now when shall i provid for mine own hou also 30 31 
and he said what shall i give thee and jacob said thou shalt not 
give me ani thing if thou wilt do thi thing for me i will again 
feed and keep thi flock 

30 32 i will pa through all thi flock to day remov from thenc 
all the speckl and spot cattl and all the brown cattl among 
the sheep and the spot and speckl among the goat and of such 
shall be my hire 

30 33 so shall my righteou answer for me in time to come when it 
shall come for my hire befor thi face everi one that is not speckl 
and spot among the goat and brown among the sheep that shall be 
count stolen with me 

30 34 and laban said behold i would it might be accord to thi 
word 

30 35 and he remov that day the he goat that were ringstrak and 
spot and all the she goat that were speckl and spot and 
everi one that had some white in it and all the brown among the 
sheep and gave them into the hand of hi son 

30 36 and he set three day journey betwixt himself and jacob and 
jacob fed the rest of laban s flock 

30 37 and jacob took him rod of green poplar and of the hazel and 
chesnut tree and pill white strake in them and made the white 
appear which wa in the rod 

30 38 and he set the rod which he had pill befor the flock in the 
gutter in the water trough when the flock came to drink that 
they should conceiv when they came to drink 

30 39 and the flock conceiv befor the rod and brought forth 
cattl ringstrak speckl and spot 

30 40 and jacob did separ the lamb and set the face of the 
flock toward the ringstrak and all the brown in the flock of 
laban and he put hi own flock by themselv and put them not unto 
laban s cattl 

30 41 and it came to pa whensoev the stronger cattl did 
conceiv that jacob laid the rod befor the eye of the cattl in 
the gutter that they might conceiv among the rod 

30 42 but when the cattl were feebl he put them not in so the 
feebler were laban s and the stronger jacob s 

30 43 and the man increa exceedingli and had much cattl and 
maidserv and manserv and camel and as 

31 1 and he heard the word of laban s son say jacob hath taken 
away all that wa our father s and of that which wa our father s 
hath he gotten all thi glori 

31 2 and jacob beheld the counten of laban and behold it wa 
not toward him a befor 

31 3 and the lord said unto jacob return unto the land of thi 
father and to thi kindr and i will be with thee 

31 4 and jacob sent and call rachel and leah to the field unto hi 
flock 31 5 and said unto them i see your father s counten that 
it is not toward me a befor but the god of my father hath been with 
me 

31 6 and ye know that with all my power i have serv your father 

31 7 and your father hath deceiv me and chang my wage ten time 
but god suffer him not to hurt me 

31 8 if he said thu the speckl shall be thi wage then all the 
cattl bare speckl and if he said thu the ringstrak shall be 
thi hire then bare all the cattl ringstrak 

31 9 thu god hath taken away the cattl of your father and given 
them to me 

31 10 and it came to pa at the time that the cattl conceiv that 
i lift up mine eye and saw in a dream and behold the ram which 
leap upon the cattl were ringstrak speckl and grisl 

31 11 and the angel of god spake unto me in a dream say jacob 
and i said here am i 

31 12 and he said lift up now thine eye and see all the ram which 
leap upon the cattl are ringstrak speckl and grisl for i 
have seen all that laban doeth unto thee 

31 13 i am the god of bethel where thou anointedst the pillar and 
where thou vowedst a vow unto me now ari get thee out from thi 
land and return unto the land of thi kindr 

31 14 and rachel and leah answer and said unto him is there yet ani 
portion or inherit for u in our father s hou 31 15 are we not 
count of him stranger for he hath sold u and hath quit devour 
also our money 

31 16 for all the rich which god hath taken from our father that is 
our and our child s now then whatsoev god hath said unto 
thee do 

31 17 then jacob rose up and set hi son and hi wife upon camel 
31 18 and he carri away all hi cattl and all hi good which he 
had gotten the cattl of hi get which he had gotten in 
padanaram for to go to isaac hi father in the land of canaan 

31 19 and laban went to shear hi sheep and rachel had stolen the 
imag that were her father s 

31 20 and jacob stole away unawar to laban the syrian in that he 
told him not that he fled 

31 21 so he fled with all that he had and he rose up and pa over 
the river and set hi face toward the mount gilead 

31 22 and it wa told laban on the third day that jacob wa fled 

31 23 and he took hi brother with him and pursu after him seven 
day journey and they overtook him in the mount gilead 

31 24 and god came to laban the syrian in a dream by night and said 
unto him take heed that thou speak not to jacob either good or bad 

31 25 then laban overtook jacob now jacob had pitch hi tent in the 
mount and laban with hi brother pitch in the mount of gilead 

31 26 and laban said to jacob what hast thou done that thou hast 
stolen away unawar to me and carri away my daughter a captiv 
taken with the sword 31 27 wherefor didst thou flee away secretli 
and steal away from me and didst not tell me that i might have sent 
thee away with mirth and with song with tabret and with harp 
31 28 and hast not suffer me to kiss my son and my daughter thou 
hast now done foolishli in so do 

31 29 it is in the power of my hand to do you hurt but the god of 
your father spake unto me yesternight say take thou heed that 
thou speak not to jacob either good or bad 

31 30 and now though thou wouldest need be gone becau thou sore 
longedst after thi father s hou yet wherefor hast thou stolen my 
god 31 31 and jacob answer and said to laban becau i wa 
afraid for i said peradventur thou wouldest take by forc thi 
daughter from me 

31 32 with whomsoev thou findest thi god let him not live befor 
our brother discern thou what is thine with me and take it to thee 
for jacob knew not that rachel had stolen them 

31 33 and laban went into jacob s tent and into leah s tent and into 
the two maidserv tent but he found them not then went he out 
of leah s tent and enter into rachel s tent 

31 34 now rachel had taken the imag and put them in the camel s 
furnitur and sat upon them and laban search all the tent but 
found them not 

31 35 and she said to her father let it not displea my lord that i 
cannot rise up befor thee for the custom of woman is upon me and he 
search but found not the imag 

31 36 and jacob wa wroth and chode with laban and jacob answer 
and said to laban what is my trespass what is my sin that thou hast 
so hotli pursu after me 31 37 wherea thou hast search all my 
stuff what hast thou found of all thi household stuff set it here 
befor my brother and thi brother that they may judg betwixt u 
both 

31 38 thi twenti year have i been with thee thi ewe and thi she 
goat have not cast their young and the ram of thi flock have i not 
eaten 

31 39 that which wa torn of beast i brought not unto thee i bare 
the loss of it of my hand didst thou requir it whether stolen by 
day or stolen by night 

31 40 thu i wa in the day the drought consum me and the frost by 
night and my sleep depart from mine eye 

31 41 thu have i been twenti year in thi hou i serv thee 
fourteen year for thi two daughter and six year for thi cattl 
and thou hast chang my wage ten time 

31 42 except the god of my father the god of abraham and the fear of 
isaac had been with me sure thou hadst sent me away now empti god 
hath seen mine afflict and the labour of my hand and rebuk thee 
yesternight 

31 43 and laban answer and said unto jacob these daughter are my 
daughter and these child are my child and these cattl are my 
cattl and all that thou seest is mine and what can i do thi day 
unto these my daughter or unto their child which they have born 
31 44 now therefor come thou let u make a coven i and thou and 
let it be for a wit between me and thee 

31 45 and jacob took a stone and set it up for a pillar 

31 46 and jacob said unto hi brother gather stone and they took 
stone and made an heap and they did eat there upon the heap 

31 47 and laban call it jegarsahadutha but jacob call it gale 

31 48 and laban said thi heap is a wit between me and thee thi 
day 

therefor wa the name of it call gale 31 49 and mizpah for he 
said the lord watch between me and thee when we are absent one from 
anoth 

31 50 if thou shalt afflict my daughter or if thou shalt take other 
wife besid my daughter no man is with u see god is wit 
betwixt me and thee 

31 51 and laban said to jacob behold thi heap and behold thi 
pillar which i have cast betwixt me and thee 31 52 thi heap be 
wit and thi pillar be wit that i will not pa over thi 
heap to thee and that thou shalt not pa over thi heap and thi 
pillar unto me for harm 

31 53 the god of abraham and the god of nahor the god of their 
father judg betwixt u and jacob sware by the fear of hi father 
isaac 

31 54 then jacob offer sacrif upon the mount and call hi 
brother to eat bread and they did eat bread and tarri all night 
in the mount 

31 55 and earli in the morn laban rose up and kiss hi son and 
hi daughter and bless them and laban depart and return unto 
hi place 

32 1 and jacob went on hi way and the angel of god met him 

32 2 and when jacob saw them he said thi is god s host and he 
call the name of that place mahanaim 

32 3 and jacob sent messeng befor him to esau hi brother unto the 
land of seir the countri of edom 

32 4 and he command them say thu shall ye speak unto my lord 
esau thi servant jacob saith thu i have sojourn with laban and 
stay there until now 32 5 and i have ox and as flock and 
manserv and womenserv and i have sent to tell my lord that 
i may find grace in thi sight 

32 6 and the messeng return to jacob say we came to thi 
brother esau and also he cometh to meet thee and four hundr men 
with him 

32 7 then jacob wa greatli afraid and distress and he divid the 
peopl that wa with him and the flock and herd and the camel 
into two band 32 8 and said if esau come to the one compani and 
smite it then the other compani which is left shall escap 

32 9 and jacob said o god of my father abraham and god of my father 
isaac the lord which saidst unto me return unto thi countri and to 
thi kindr and i will deal well with thee 32 10 i am not worthi of 
the least of all the merci and of all the truth which thou hast 
shew unto thi servant for with my staff i pa over thi jordan 
and now i am becom two band 

32 11 deliv me i pray thee from the hand of my brother from the 
hand of esau for i fear him lest he will come and smite me and the 
mother with the child 

32 12 and thou saidst i will sure do thee good and make thi seed 
a the sand of the sea which cannot be number for multitud 

32 13 and he lodg there that same night and took of that which came 
to hi hand a present for esau hi brother 32 14 two hundr she 
goat and twenti he goat two hundr ewe and twenti ram 32 15 
thirti milch camel with their colt forti kine and ten bull 
twenti she as and ten foal 

32 16 and he deliv them into the hand of hi servant everi drove 
by themselv and said unto hi servant pa over befor me and 
put a space betwixt drove and drove 

32 17 and he command the foremost say when esau my brother 
meeteth thee and asketh thee say whose art thou and whither 
goest thou and whose are these befor thee 32 18 then thou shalt 
say they be thi servant jacob s it is a present sent unto my lord 
esau and behold also he is behind u 

32 19 and so command he the second and the third and all that 
follow the drove say on thi manner shall ye speak unto esau 
when ye find him 

32 20 and say ye moreov behold thi servant jacob is behind u for 
he said i will appea him with the present that goeth befor me and 
afterward i will see hi face peradventur he will accept of me 

32 21 so went the present over befor him and himself lodg that 
night in the compani 

32 22 and he rose up that night and took hi two wife and hi two 
womenserv and hi eleven son and pa over the ford jabbok 

32 23 and he took them and sent them over the brook and sent over 
that he had 

32 24 and jacob wa left alon and there wrestl a man with him 
until the break of the day 

32 25 and when he saw that he prevail not against him he touch 
the hollow of hi thigh and the hollow of jacob s thigh wa out of 
joint a he wrestl with him 

32 26 and he said let me go for the day breaketh and he said i 
will not let thee go except thou bless me 

32 27 and he said unto him what is thi name and he said jacob 

32 28 and he said thi name shall be call no more jacob but israel 
for a a princ hast thou power with god and with men and hast 
prevail 

32 29 and jacob ask him and said tell me i pray thee thi name 
and he said wherefor is it that thou dost ask after my name and he 
bless him there 

32 30 and jacob call the name of the place peniel for i have seen 
god face to face and my life is preserv 

32 31 and a he pa over penuel the sun rose upon him and he 
halt upon hi thigh 

32 32 therefor the child of israel eat not of the sinew which 
shrank which is upon the hollow of the thigh unto thi day becau 
he touch the hollow of jacob s thigh in the sinew that shrank 

33 1 and jacob lift up hi eye and look and behold esau came 
and with him four hundr men and he divid the child unto leah 
and unto rachel and unto the two handmaid 

33 2 and he put the handmaid and their child foremost and leah 
and her child after and rachel and joseph hindermost 

33 3 and he pa over befor them and bow himself to the ground 
seven time until he came near to hi brother 

33 4 and esau ran to meet him and embrac him and fell on hi neck 
and kiss him and they wept 

33 5 and he lift up hi eye and saw the woman and the child 
and said who are those with thee and he said the child which god 
hath graciou given thi servant 

33 6 then the handmaiden came near they and their child and they 
bow themselv 

33 7 and leah also with her child came near and bow themselv 
and after came joseph near and rachel and they bow themselv 

33 8 and he said what meanest thou by all thi drove which i met and 
he said these are to find grace in the sight of my lord 

33 9 and esau said i have enough my brother keep that thou hast 
unto thyself 

33 10 and jacob said nay i pray thee if now i have found grace in 
thi sight then receiv my present at my hand for therefor i have 
seen thi face a though i had seen the face of god and thou wast 
plea with me 

33 11 take i pray thee my bless that is brought to thee becau 
god hath dealt graciou with me and becau i have enough and he 
urg him and he took it 

33 12 and he said let u take our journey and let u go and i will 
go befor thee 

33 13 and he said unto him my lord knoweth that the child are 
tender and the flock and herd with young are with me and if men 
should overdr them one day all the flock will die 

33 14 let my lord i pray thee pa over befor hi servant and i 
will lead on softli accord a the cattl that goeth befor me and 
the child be abl to endur until i come unto my lord unto seir 

33 15 and esau said let me now leav with thee some of the folk that 
are with me and he said what needeth it let me find grace in the 
sight of my lord 

33 16 so esau return that day on hi way unto seir 

33 17 and jacob journey to succoth and built him an hou and made 
booth for hi cattl therefor the name of the place is call 
succoth 

33 18 and jacob came to shalem a citi of shechem which is in the 
land of canaan when he came from padanaram and pitch hi tent 
befor the citi 

33 19 and he bought a parcel of a field where he had spread hi tent 
at the hand of the child of hamor shechem s father for an hundr 
piec of money 

33 20 and he erect there an altar and call it eleloheisrael 

34 1 and dinah the daughter of leah which she bare unto jacob went 
out to see the daughter of the land 

34 2 and when shechem the son of hamor the hivit princ of the 
countri saw her he took her and lay with her and defil her 

34 3 and hi soul clave unto dinah the daughter of jacob and he love 
the damsel and spake kindli unto the damsel 

34 4 and shechem spake unto hi father hamor say get me thi 
damsel to wife 

34 5 and jacob heard that he had defil dinah hi daughter now hi 
son were with hi cattl in the field and jacob held hi peac until 
they were come 

34 6 and hamor the father of shechem went out unto jacob to commun 
with him 

34 7 and the son of jacob came out of the field when they heard it 
and the men were griev and they were veri wroth becau he had 
wrought folli in israel in lie with jacob s daughter which thing 
ought not to be done 

34 8 and hamor commun with them say the soul of my son shechem 
longeth for your daughter i pray you give her him to wife 

34 9 and make ye marriag with u and give your daughter unto u 
and take our daughter unto you 

34 10 and ye shall dwell with u and the land shall be befor you 
dwell and trade ye therein and get you poss therein 

34 11 and shechem said unto her father and unto her brother let me 
find grace in your eye and what ye shall say unto me i will give 

34 12 ask me never so much dowri and gift and i will give accord 
a ye shall say unto me but give me the damsel to wife 

34 13 and the son of jacob answer shechem and hamor hi father 
deceit and said becau he had defil dinah their sister 
34 14 and they said unto them we cannot do thi thing to give our 
sister to one that is uncircumci for that were a reproach unto u 
34 15 but in thi will we consent unto you if ye will be a we be 
that everi male of you be circumci 34 16 then will we give our 
daughter unto you and we will take your daughter to u and we will 
dwell with you and we will becom one peopl 

34 17 but if ye will not hearken unto u to be circumci then will 
we take our daughter and we will be gone 

34 18 and their word plea hamor and shechem hamor s son 

34 19 and the young man defer not to do the thing becau he had 
delight in jacob s daughter and he wa more honour than all the 
hou of hi father 

34 20 and hamor and shechem hi son came unto the gate of their citi 
and commun with the men of their citi say 34 21 these men are 
peaceabl with u therefor let them dwell in the land and trade 
therein for the land behold it is larg enough for them let u 
take their daughter to u for wife and let u give them our 
daughter 

34 22 onli herein will the men consent unto u for to dwell with u 
to be one peopl if everi male among u be circumci a they are 
circumci 

34 23 shall not their cattl and their substanc and everi beast of 
their s be our s onli let u consent unto them and they will dwell 
with u 

34 24 and unto hamor and unto shechem hi son hearken all that went 
out of the gate of hi citi and everi male wa circumci all that 
went out of the gate of hi citi 

34 25 and it came to pa on the third day when they were sore that 
two of the son of jacob simeon and levi dinah s brother took each 
man hi sword and came upon the citi boldli and slew all the male 

34 26 and they slew hamor and shechem hi son with the edg of the 
sword and took dinah out of shechem s hou and went out 

34 27 the son of jacob came upon the slain and spoil the citi 
becau they had defil their sister 

34 28 they took their sheep and their ox and their as and that 
which wa in the citi and that which wa in the field 34 29 and all 
their wealth and all their littl one and their wife took they 
captiv and spoil even all that wa in the hou 

34 30 and jacob said to simeon and levi ye have troubl me to make 
me to stink among the inhabit of the land among the canaanit 
and the perizzit and i be few in number they shall gather 
themselv togeth against me and slay me and i shall be destroy 
i and my hou 

34 31 and they said should he deal with our sister a with an harlot 
35 1 and god said unto jacob ari go up to bethel and dwell there 
and make there an altar unto god that appear unto thee when thou 
fleddest from the face of esau thi brother 

35 2 then jacob said unto hi household and to all that were with 
him put away the strang god that are among you and be clean and 
chang your garment 35 3 and let u ari and go up to bethel and 
i will make there an altar unto god who answer me in the day of my 
distress and wa with me in the way which i went 

35 4 and they gave unto jacob all the strang god which were in their 
hand and all their ear which were in their ear and jacob hid 
them under the oak which wa by shechem 

35 5 and they journey and the terror of god wa upon the citi 
that were round about them and they did not pursu after the son of 
jacob 

35 6 so jacob came to luz which is in the land of canaan that is 
bethel he and all the peopl that were with him 

35 7 and he built there an altar and call the place elbethel 
becau there god appear unto him when he fled from the face of hi 
brother 

35 8 but deborah rebekah s nur die and she wa buri beneath 
bethel under an oak and the name of it wa call allonbachuth 

35 9 and god appear unto jacob again when he came out of padanaram 
and bless him 

35 10 and god said unto him thi name is jacob thi name shall not be 
call ani more jacob but israel shall be thi name and he call hi 
name israel 

35 11 and god said unto him i am god almighti be fruit and 
multipli a nation and a compani of nation shall be of thee and 
king shall come out of thi loin 35 12 and the land which i gave 
abraham and isaac to thee i will give it and to thi seed after thee 
will i give the land 

35 13 and god went up from him in the place where he talk with him 

35 14 and jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talk with him 
even a pillar of stone and he pour a drink offer thereon and he 
pour oil thereon 

35 15 and jacob call the name of the place where god spake with him 
bethel 

35 16 and they journey from bethel and there wa but a littl way 
to come to ephrath and rachel travail and she had hard labour 

35 17 and it came to pa when she wa in hard labour that the 
midwif said unto her fear not thou shalt have thi son also 

35 18 and it came to pa a her soul wa in depart for she 
die that she call hi name benoni but hi father call him 
benjamin 

35 19 and rachel die and wa buri in the way to ephrath which is 
bethlehem 

35 20 and jacob set a pillar upon her grave that is the pillar of 
rachel s grave unto thi day 

35 21 and israel journey and spread hi tent beyond the tower of 
edar 

35 22 and it came to pa when israel dwelt in that land that reuben 
went and lay with bilhah hi father s concubin and israel heard it 
now the son of jacob were twelv 35 23 the son of leah reuben 
jacob s firstborn and simeon and levi and judah and issachar and 
zebulun 35 24 the son of rachel joseph and benjamin 35 25 and the 
son of bilhah rachel s handmaid dan and naphtali 35 26 and the 
son of zilpah leah s handmaid gad and asher these are the son of 
jacob which were born to him in padanaram 

35 27 and jacob came unto isaac hi father unto mamr unto the citi 
of arbah which is hebron where abraham and isaac sojourn 

35 28 and the day of isaac were an hundr and fourscor year 

35 29 and isaac gave up the ghost and die and wa gather unto hi 
peopl be old and full of day and hi son esau and jacob buri 
him 

36 1 now these are the gener of esau who is edom 

36 2 esau took hi wife of the daughter of canaan adah the daughter 
of elon the hittit and aholibamah the daughter of anah the daughter 
of zibeon the hivit 36 3 and bashemath ishmael s daughter sister of 
nebajoth 

36 4 and adah bare to esau eliphaz and bashemath bare reuel 36 5 and 
aholibamah bare jeush and jaalam and korah these are the son of 
esau which were born unto him in the land of canaan 

36 6 and esau took hi wife and hi son and hi daughter and all 
the person of hi hou and hi cattl and all hi beast and all 
hi substanc which he had got in the land of canaan and went into 
the countri from the face of hi brother jacob 

36 7 for their rich were more than that they might dwell togeth 
and the land wherein they were stranger could not bear them becau 
of their cattl 

36 8 thu dwelt esau in mount seir esau is edom 

36 9 and these are the gener of esau the father of the edomit 
in mount seir 36 10 these are the name of esau s son eliphaz the 
son of adah the wife of esau reuel the son of bashemath the wife of 
esau 

36 11 and the son of eliphaz were teman omar zepho and gatam and 
kenaz 

36 12 and timna wa concubin to eliphaz esau s son and she bare to 
eliphaz amalek these were the son of adah esau s wife 

36 13 and these are the son of reuel nahath and zerah shammah and 
mizzah these were the son of bashemath esau s wife 

36 14 and these were the son of aholibamah the daughter of anah the 
daughter of zibeon esau s wife and she bare to esau jeush and 
jaalam and korah 

36 15 these were duke of the son of esau the son of eliphaz the 
firstborn son of esau duke teman duke omar duke zepho duke kenaz 
36 16 duke korah duke gatam and duke amalek these are the duke 
that came of eliphaz in the land of edom these were the son of adah 

36 17 and these are the son of reuel esau s son duke nahath duke 
zerah duke shammah duke mizzah these are the duke that came of 
reuel in the land of edom these are the son of bashemath esau s 
wife 

36 18 and these are the son of aholibamah esau s wife duke jeush 
duke jaalam duke korah these were the duke that came of aholibamah 
the daughter of anah esau s wife 

36 19 these are the son of esau who is edom and these are their 
duke 

36 20 these are the son of seir the horit who inhabit the land 
lotan and shobal and zibeon and anah 36 21 and dishon and ezer 
and dishan these are the duke of the horit the child of seir 
in the land of edom 

36 22 and the child of lotan were hori and hemam and lotan s 
sister wa timna 

36 23 and the child of shobal were these alvan and manahath and 
ebal shepho and onam 

36 24 and these are the child of zibeon both ajah and anah thi 
wa that anah that found the mule in the wilder a he fed the 
as of zibeon hi father 

36 25 and the child of anah were these dishon and aholibamah the 
daughter of anah 

36 26 and these are the child of dishon hemdan and eshban and 
ithran and cheran 

36 27 the child of ezer are these bilhan and zaavan and akan 

36 28 the child of dishan are these uz and aran 

36 29 these are the duke that came of the horit duke lotan duke 
shobal duke zibeon duke anah 36 30 duke dishon duke ezer duke 
dishan these are the duke that came of hori among their duke in 
the land of seir 

36 31 and these are the king that reign in the land of edom befor 
there reign ani king over the child of israel 

36 32 and bela the son of beor reign in edom and the name of hi 
citi wa dinhabah 

36 33 and bela die and jobab the son of zerah of bozrah reign in 
hi stead 

36 34 and jobab die and husham of the land of temani reign in hi 
stead 

36 35 and husham die and hadad the son of bedad who smote midian in 
the field of moab reign in hi stead and the name of hi citi wa 
avith 

36 36 and hadad die and samlah of masrekah reign in hi stead 

36 37 and samlah die and saul of rehoboth by the river reign in 
hi stead 

36 38 and saul die and baalhanan the son of achbor reign in hi 
stead 

36 39 and baalhanan the son of achbor die and hadar reign in hi 
stead and the name of hi citi wa pau and hi wife s name wa 
mehetabel the daughter of matr the daughter of mezahab 

36 40 and these are the name of the duke that came of esau 
accord to their famili after their place by their name duke 
timnah duke alvah duke jetheth 36 41 duke aholibamah duke elah 
duke pinon 36 42 duke kenaz duke teman duke mibzar 36 43 duke 
magdiel duke iram these be the duke of edom accord to their 
habit in the land of their poss he is esau the father of 
the edomit 

37 1 and jacob dwelt in the land wherein hi father wa a stranger in 
the land of canaan 

37 2 these are the gener of jacob joseph be seventeen year 
old wa feed the flock with hi brother and the lad wa with the 
son of bilhah and with the son of zilpah hi father s wife and 
joseph brought unto hi father their evil report 

37 3 now israel love joseph more than all hi child becau he 
wa the son of hi old age and he made him a coat of mani colour 

37 4 and when hi brother saw that their father love him more than 
all hi brother they hate him and could not speak peaceabl unto 
him 

37 5 and joseph dream a dream and he told it hi brother and they 
hate him yet the more 

37 6 and he said unto them hear i pray you thi dream which i have 
dream 37 7 for behold we were bind sheaf in the field and 
lo my sheaf aro and also stood upright and behold your sheaf 
stood round about and made obei to my sheaf 

37 8 and hi brother said to him shalt thou ind reign over u or 
shalt thou ind have dominion over u and they hate him yet the 
more for hi dream and for hi word 

37 9 and he dream yet anoth dream and told it hi brother and 
said behold i have dream a dream more and behold the sun and 
the moon and the eleven star made obei to me 

37 10 and he told it to hi father and to hi brother and hi 
father rebuk him and said unto him what is thi dream that thou 
hast dream shall i and thi mother and thi brother ind come to 
bow down ourselv to thee to the earth 37 11 and hi brother 
envi him but hi father observ the say 

37 12 and hi brother went to feed their father s flock in shechem 

37 13 and israel said unto joseph do not thi brother feed the flock 
in shechem come and i will send thee unto them and he said to him 
here am i 

37 14 and he said to him go i pray thee see whether it be well with 
thi brother and well with the flock and bring me word again so he 
sent him out of the vale of hebron and he came to shechem 

37 15 and a certain man found him and behold he wa wander in 
the field and the man ask him say what seekest thou 37 16 
and he said i seek my brother tell me i pray thee where they feed 
their flock 

37 17 and the man said they are depart henc for i heard them say 
let u go to dothan and joseph went after hi brother and found 
them in dothan 

37 18 and when they saw him afar off even befor he came near unto 
them they conspir against him to slay him 

37 19 and they said one to anoth behold thi dreamer cometh 

37 20 come now therefor and let u slay him and cast him into some 
pit and we will say some evil beast hath devour him and we shall 
see what will becom of hi dream 

37 21 and reuben heard it and he deliv him out of their hand 
and said let u not kill him 

37 22 and reuben said unto them shed no blood but cast him into thi 
pit that is in the wilder and lay no hand upon him that he might 
rid him out of their hand to deliv him to hi father again 

37 23 and it came to pa when joseph wa come unto hi brother 
that they stript joseph out of hi coat hi coat of mani colour that 
wa on him 37 24 and they took him and cast him into a pit and the 
pit wa empti there wa no water in it 

37 25 and they sat down to eat bread and they lift up their eye 
and look and behold a compani of ishmeelit came from gilead 
with their camel bear spiceri and balm and myrrh go to carri 
it down to egypt 

37 26 and judah said unto hi brother what profit is it if we slay 
our brother and conceal hi blood 37 27 come and let u sell him 
to the ishmeelit and let not our hand be upon him for he is our 
brother and our flesh and hi brother were content 

37 28 then there pa by midianit merchantman and they drew and 
lift up joseph out of the pit and sold joseph to the ishmeelit 
for twenti piec of silver and they brought joseph into egypt 

37 29 and reuben return unto the pit and behold joseph wa not in 
the pit and he rent hi cloth 

37 30 and he return unto hi brother and said the child is not 
and i whither shall i go 37 31 and they took joseph s coat and 
kill a kid of the goat and dip the coat in the blood 37 32 and 
they sent the coat of mani colour and they brought it to their 
father and said thi have we found know now whether it be thi son s 
coat or no 

37 33 and he knew it and said it is my son s coat an evil beast 
hath devour him joseph is without doubt rent in piec 

37 34 and jacob rent hi cloth and put sackcloth upon hi loin 
and mourn for hi son mani day 

37 35 and all hi son and all hi daughter rose up to comfort him 
but he refu to be comfort and he said for i will go down into 
the grave unto my son mourn thu hi father wept for him 

37 36 and the midianit sold him into egypt unto potiphar an offic 
of pharaoh s and captain of the guard 

38 1 and it came to pa at that time that judah went down from hi 
brother and turn in to a certain adullamit whose name wa hirah 

38 2 and judah saw there a daughter of a certain canaanit whose name 
wa shuah and he took her and went in unto her 

38 3 and she conceiv and bare a son and he call hi name er 

38 4 and she conceiv again and bare a son and she call hi name 
onan 

38 5 and she yet again conceiv and bare a son and call hi name 
shelah and he wa at chezib when she bare him 

38 6 and judah took a wife for er hi firstborn whose name wa tamar 

38 7 and er judah s firstborn wa wick in the sight of the lord 
and the lord slew him 

38 8 and judah said unto onan go in unto thi brother s wife and 
marri her and rai up seed to thi brother 

38 9 and onan knew that the seed should not be hi and it came to 
pa when he went in unto hi brother s wife that he spill it on 
the ground lest that he should give seed to hi brother 

38 10 and the thing which he did displea the lord wherefor he 
slew him also 

38 11 then said judah to tamar hi daughter in law remain a widow at 
thi father s hou till shelah my son be grown for he said lest 
peradventur he die also a hi brother did and tamar went and 
dwelt in her father s hou 

38 12 and in process of time the daughter of shuah judah s wife die 
and judah wa comfort and went up unto hi sheepshear to 
timnath he and hi friend hirah the adullamit 

38 13 and it wa told tamar say behold thi father in law goeth up 
to timnath to shear hi sheep 

38 14 and she put her widow s garment off from her and cover her 
with a vail and wrap herself and sat in an open place which is 
by the way to timnath for she saw that shelah wa grown and she wa 
not given unto him to wife 

38 15 when judah saw her he thought her to be an harlot becau she 
had cover her face 

38 16 and he turn unto her by the way and said go to i pray thee 
let me come in unto thee for he knew not that she wa hi daughter 
in law and she said what wilt thou give me that thou mayest come 
in unto me 38 17 and he said i will send thee a kid from the flock 
and she said wilt thou give me a pledg till thou send it 38 18 
and he said what pledg shall i give thee and she said thi signet 
and thi bracelet and thi staff that is in thine hand and he gave it 
her and came in unto her and she conceiv by him 

38 19 and she aro and went away and laid by her vail from her and 
put on the garment of her widowhood 

38 20 and judah sent the kid by the hand of hi friend the adullamit 
to receiv hi pledg from the woman s hand but he found her not 

38 21 then he ask the men of that place say where is the 
harlot that wa openli by the way side and they said there wa no 
harlot in thi place 

38 22 and he return to judah and said i cannot find her and also 
the men of the place said that there wa no harlot in thi place 

38 23 and judah said let her take it to her lest we be shame 
behold i sent thi kid and thou hast not found her 

38 24 and it came to pa about three month after that it wa told 
judah say tamar thi daughter in law hath play the harlot and 
also behold she is with child by whoredom and judah said bring her 
forth and let her be burnt 

38 25 when she wa brought forth she sent to her father in law 
say by the man whose these are am i with child and she said 
discern i pray thee whose are these the signet and bracelet and 
staff 

38 26 and judah acknowledg them and said she hath been more 
righteou than i becau that i gave her not to shelah my son and he 
knew her again no more 

38 27 and it came to pa in the time of her travail that behold 
twin were in her womb 

38 28 and it came to pa when she travail that the one put out 
hi hand and the midwif took and bound upon hi hand a scarlet 
thread say thi came out first 

38 29 and it came to pa a he drew back hi hand that behold hi 
brother came out and she said how hast thou broken forth thi 
breach be upon thee therefor hi name wa call pharez 

38 30 and afterward came out hi brother that had the scarlet thread 
upon hi hand and hi name wa call zarah 

39 1 and joseph wa brought down to egypt and potiphar an offic of 
pharaoh captain of the guard an egyptian bought him of the hand of 
the ishmeelit which had brought him down thither 

39 2 and the lord wa with joseph and he wa a prosper man and he 
wa in the hou of hi master the egyptian 

39 3 and hi master saw that the lord wa with him and that the lord 
made all that he did to prosper in hi hand 

39 4 and joseph found grace in hi sight and he serv him and he 
made him over over hi hou and all that he had he put into hi 
hand 

39 5 and it came to pa from the time that he had made him over 
in hi hou and over all that he had that the lord bless the 
egyptian s hou for joseph s sake and the bless of the lord wa 
upon all that he had in the hou and in the field 

39 6 and he left all that he had in joseph s hand and he knew not 
ought he had save the bread which he did eat and joseph wa a goodli 
person and well favour 

39 7 and it came to pa after these thing that hi master s wife 
cast her eye upon joseph and she said lie with me 

39 8 but he refu and said unto hi master s wife behold my 
master wotteth not what is with me in the hou and he hath commit 
all that he hath to my hand 39 9 there is none greater in thi hou 
than i neither hath he kept back ani thing from me but thee becau 
thou art hi wife how then can i do thi great wick and sin 
against god 39 10 and it came to pa a she spake to joseph day by 
day that he hearken not unto her to lie by her or to be with her 

39 11 and it came to pa about thi time that joseph went into the 
hou to do hi busi and there wa none of the men of the hou 
there within 

39 12 and she caught him by hi garment say lie with me and he 
left hi garment in her hand and fled and got him out 

39 13 and it came to pa when she saw that he had left hi garment 
in her hand and wa fled forth 39 14 that she call unto the men of 
her hou and spake unto them say see he hath brought in an 
hebrew unto u to mock u he came in unto me to lie with me and i 
cri with a loud voic 39 15 and it came to pa when he heard that 
i lift up my voic and cri that he left hi garment with me and 
fled and got him out 

39 16 and she laid up hi garment by her until hi lord came home 

39 17 and she spake unto him accord to these word say the 
hebrew servant which thou hast brought unto u came in unto me to 
mock me 39 18 and it came to pa a i lift up my voic and cri 
that he left hi garment with me and fled out 

39 19 and it came to pa when hi master heard the word of hi 
wife which she spake unto him say after thi manner did thi 
servant to me that hi wrath wa kindl 

39 20 and joseph s master took him and put him into the prison a 
place where the king s prison were bound and he wa there in the 
prison 

39 21 but the lord wa with joseph and shew him merci and gave him 
favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison 

39 22 and the keeper of the prison commit to joseph s hand all the 
prison that were in the prison and whatsoev they did there he 
wa the doer of it 

39 23 the keeper of the prison look not to ani thing that wa under 
hi hand becau the lord wa with him and that which he did the 
lord made it to prosper 

40 1 and it came to pa after these thing that the butler of the 
king of egypt and hi baker had offend their lord the king of egypt 

40 2 and pharaoh wa wroth against two of hi offic against the 
chief of the butler and against the chief of the baker 

40 3 and he put them in ward in the hou of the captain of the guard 
into the prison the place where joseph wa bound 

40 4 and the captain of the guard charg joseph with them and he 
serv them and they continu a season in ward 

40 5 and they dream a dream both of them each man hi dream in one 
night each man accord to the interpret of hi dream the 
butler and the baker of the king of egypt which were bound in the 
prison 

40 6 and joseph came in unto them in the morn and look upon 
them and behold they were sad 

40 7 and he ask pharaoh s offic that were with him in the ward of 
hi lord s hou say wherefor look ye so sadli to day 40 8 and 
they said unto him we have dream a dream and there is no 
interpret of it and joseph said unto them do not interpret 
belong to god tell me them i pray you 

40 9 and the chief butler told hi dream to joseph and said to him 
in my dream behold a vine wa befor me 40 10 and in the vine were 
three branch and it wa a though it bud and her blossom shot 
forth and the cluster thereof brought forth ripe grape 40 11 and 
pharaoh s cup wa in my hand and i took the grape and press them 
into pharaoh s cup and i gave the cup into pharaoh s hand 

40 12 and joseph said unto him thi is the interpret of it the 
three branch are three day 40 13 yet within three day shall 
pharaoh lift up thine head and restor thee unto thi place and thou 
shalt deliv pharaoh s cup into hi hand after the former manner 
when thou wast hi butler 

40 14 but think on me when it shall be well with thee and shew 
kind i pray thee unto me and make mention of me unto pharaoh 
and bring me out of thi hou 40 15 for ind i wa stolen away out 
of the land of the hebrew and here also have i done noth that 
they should put me into the dungeon 

40 16 when the chief baker saw that the interpret wa good he 
said unto joseph i also wa in my dream and behold i had three 
white basket on my head 40 17 and in the uppermost basket there wa 
of all manner of bakemeat for pharaoh and the bird did eat them out 
of the basket upon my head 

40 18 and joseph answer and said thi is the interpret 
thereof the three basket are three day 40 19 yet within three day 
shall pharaoh lift up thi head from off thee and shall hang thee on a 
tree and the bird shall eat thi flesh from off thee 

40 20 and it came to pa the third day which wa pharaoh s birthday 
that he made a feast unto all hi servant and he lift up the head 
of the chief butler and of the chief baker among hi servant 

40 21 and he restor the chief butler unto hi butlership again and 
he gave the cup into pharaoh s hand 40 22 but he hang the chief 
baker a joseph had interpret to them 

40 23 yet did not the chief butler rememb joseph but forgat him 

41 1 and it came to pa at the end of two full year that pharaoh 
dream and behold he stood by the river 

41 2 and behold there came up out of the river seven well favour 
kine and fatflesh and they fed in a meadow 

41 3 and behold seven other kine came up after them out of the 
river ill favour and leanflesh and stood by the other kine upon 
the brink of the river 

41 4 and the ill favour and leanflesh kine did eat up the seven 
well favour and fat kine so pharaoh awok 

41 5 and he slept and dream the second time and behold seven ear 
of corn came up upon one stalk rank and good 

41 6 and behold seven thin ear and blast with the east wind 
sprung up after them 

41 7 and the seven thin ear devour the seven rank and full ear 
and pharaoh awok and behold it wa a dream 

41 8 and it came to pa in the morn that hi spirit wa troubl 
and he sent and call for all the magician of egypt and all the 
wise men thereof and pharaoh told them hi dream but there wa none 
that could interpret them unto pharaoh 

41 9 then spake the chief butler unto pharaoh say i do rememb 
my fault thi day 41 10 pharaoh wa wroth with hi servant and put 
me in ward in the captain of the guard s hou both me and the chief 
baker 41 11 and we dream a dream in one night i and he we dream 
each man accord to the interpret of hi dream 

41 12 and there wa there with u a young man an hebrew servant to 
the captain of the guard and we told him and he interpret to u 
our dream to each man accord to hi dream he did interpret 

41 13 and it came to pa a he interpret to u so it wa me he 
restor unto mine offic and him he hang 

41 14 then pharaoh sent and call joseph and they brought him 
hastili out of the dungeon and he shave himself and chang hi 
raiment and came in unto pharaoh 

41 15 and pharaoh said unto joseph i have dream a dream and there 
is none that can interpret it and i have heard say of thee that thou 
canst understand a dream to interpret it 

41 16 and joseph answer pharaoh say it is not in me god shall 
give pharaoh an answer of peac 

41 17 and pharaoh said unto joseph in my dream behold i stood upon 
the bank of the river 41 18 and behold there came up out of the 
river seven kine fatflesh and well favour and they fed in a 
meadow 41 19 and behold seven other kine came up after them poor 
and veri ill favour and leanflesh such a i never saw in all the 
land of egypt for bad 41 20 and the lean and the ill favour 
kine did eat up the first seven fat kine 41 21 and when they had 
eaten them up it could not be known that they had eaten them but 
they were still ill favour a at the begin so i awok 

41 22 and i saw in my dream and behold seven ear came up in one 
stalk full and good 41 23 and behold seven ear wither thin 
and blast with the east wind sprung up after them 41 24 and the 
thin ear devour the seven good ear and i told thi unto the 
magician but there wa none that could declar it to me 

41 25 and joseph said unto pharaoh the dream of pharaoh is one god 
hath shew pharaoh what he is about to do 

41 26 the seven good kine are seven year and the seven good ear are 
seven year the dream is one 

41 27 and the seven thin and ill favour kine that came up after them 
are seven year and the seven empti ear blast with the east wind 
shall be seven year of famin 

41 28 thi is the thing which i have spoken unto pharaoh what god is 
about to do he sheweth unto pharaoh 

41 29 behold there come seven year of great plenti throughout all 
the land of egypt 41 30 and there shall ari after them seven year 
of famin and all the plenti shall be forgotten in the land of egypt 
and the famin shall consum the land 41 31 and the plenti shall not 
be known in the land by reason of that famin follow for it shall 
be veri grievou 

41 32 and for that the dream wa doubl unto pharaoh twice it is 
becau the thing is establish by god and god will shortli bring it 
to pa 

41 33 now therefor let pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise and 
set him over the land of egypt 

41 34 let pharaoh do thi and let him appoint offic over the land 
and take up the fifth part of the land of egypt in the seven plenteou 
year 

41 35 and let them gather all the food of those good year that come 
and lay up corn under the hand of pharaoh and let them keep food in 
the citi 

41 36 and that food shall be for store to the land against the seven 
year of famin which shall be in the land of egypt that the land 
perish not through the famin 

41 37 and the thing wa good in the eye of pharaoh and in the eye 
of all hi servant 

41 38 and pharaoh said unto hi servant can we find such a one a 
thi is a man in whom the spirit of god is 41 39 and pharaoh said 
unto joseph forasmuch a god hath shew thee all thi there is none 
so discreet and wise a thou art 41 40 thou shalt be over my hou 
and accord unto thi word shall all my peopl be rule onli in the 
throne will i be greater than thou 

41 41 and pharaoh said unto joseph see i have set thee over all the 
land of egypt 

41 42 and pharaoh took off hi ring from hi hand and put it upon 
joseph s hand and array him in vestur of fine linen and put a 
gold chain about hi neck 41 43 and he made him to ride in the second 
chariot which he had and they cri befor him bow the knee and he 
made him ruler over all the land of egypt 

41 44 and pharaoh said unto joseph i am pharaoh and without thee 
shall no man lift up hi hand or foot in all the land of egypt 

41 45 and pharaoh call joseph s name zaphnathpaaneah and he gave 
him to wife asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on and 
joseph went out over all the land of egypt 

41 46 and joseph wa thirti year old when he stood befor pharaoh 
king of egypt and joseph went out from the presenc of pharaoh and 
went throughout all the land of egypt 

41 47 and in the seven plenteou year the earth brought forth by 
hand 

41 48 and he gather up all the food of the seven year which were 
in the land of egypt and laid up the food in the citi the food of 
the field which wa round about everi citi laid he up in the same 

41 49 and joseph gather corn a the sand of the sea veri much 
until he left number for it wa without number 

41 50 and unto joseph were born two son befor the year of famin 
came which asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on bare unto 
him 

41 51 and joseph call the name of the firstborn manasseh for god 
said he hath made me forget all my toil and all my father s hou 

41 52 and the name of the second call he ephraim for god hath 
cau me to be fruit in the land of my afflict 

41 53 and the seven year of plenteou that wa in the land of 
egypt were end 

41 54 and the seven year of dearth began to come accord a joseph 
had said and the dearth wa in all land but in all the land of 
egypt there wa bread 

41 55 and when all the land of egypt wa famish the peopl cri to 
pharaoh for bread and pharaoh said unto all the egyptian go unto 
joseph what he saith to you do 

41 56 and the famin wa over all the face of the earth and joseph 
open all the storeh and sold unto the egyptian and the 
famin wax sore in the land of egypt 

41 57 and all countri came into egypt to joseph for to buy corn 
becau that the famin wa so sore in all land 

42 1 now when jacob saw that there wa corn in egypt jacob said unto 
hi son whi do ye look one upon anoth 42 2 and he said behold 
i have heard that there is corn in egypt get you down thither and 
buy for u from thenc that we may live and not die 

42 3 and joseph s ten brother went down to buy corn in egypt 

42 4 but benjamin joseph s brother jacob sent not with hi brother 
for he said lest peradventur mischief befal him 

42 5 and the son of israel came to buy corn among those that came 
for the famin wa in the land of canaan 

42 6 and joseph wa the governor over the land and he it wa that 
sold to all the peopl of the land and joseph s brother came and 
bow down themselv befor him with their face to the earth 

42 7 and joseph saw hi brother and he knew them but made himself 
strang unto them and spake roughli unto them and he said unto them 
whenc come ye and they said from the land of canaan to buy food 

42 8 and joseph knew hi brother but they knew not him 

42 9 and joseph rememb the dream which he dream of them and 
said unto them ye are spi to see the nake of the land ye are 
come 

42 10 and they said unto him nay my lord but to buy food are thi 
servant come 

42 11 we are all one man s son we are true men thi servant are no 
spi 

42 12 and he said unto them nay but to see the nake of the land 
ye are come 

42 13 and they said thi servant are twelv brother the son of one 
man in the land of canaan and behold the youngest is thi day with 
our father and one is not 

42 14 and joseph said unto them that is it that i spake unto you 
say ye are spi 42 15 herebi ye shall be prove by the life of 
pharaoh ye shall not go forth henc except your youngest brother come 
hither 

42 16 send one of you and let him fetch your brother and ye shall be 
kept in prison that your word may be prove whether there be ani 
truth in you or el by the life of pharaoh sure ye are spi 

42 17 and he put them all togeth into ward three day 

42 18 and joseph said unto them the third day thi do and live for 
i fear god 42 19 if ye be true men let one of your brother be bound 
in the hou of your prison go ye carri corn for the famin of your 
hou 42 20 but bring your youngest brother unto me so shall your 
word be verifi and ye shall not die and they did so 

42 21 and they said one to anoth we are verili guilti concern
