not a hou where there wa not one dead 

12 31 and he call for mose and aaron by night and said rise up 
and get you forth from among my peopl both ye and the child of 
israel and go serv the lord a ye have said 

12 32 also take your flock and your herd a ye have said and be 
gone and bless me also 

12 33 and the egyptian were urgent upon the peopl that they might 
send them out of the land in hast for they said we be all dead men 

12 34 and the peopl took their dough befor it wa leaven their 
kneadingtrough be bound up in their cloth upon their shoulder 

12 35 and the child of israel did accord to the word of mose 
and they borrow of the egyptian jewel of silver and jewel of 
gold and raiment 12 36 and the lord gave the peopl favour in the 
sight of the egyptian so that they lent unto them such thing a 
they requir and they spoil the egyptian 

12 37 and the child of israel journey from rame to succoth 
about six hundr thousand on foot that were men besid child 

12 38 and a mix multitud went up also with them and flock and 
herd even veri much cattl 

12 39 and they bake unleaven cake of the dough which they brought 
forth out of egypt for it wa not leaven becau they were thrust 
out of egypt and could not tarri neither had they prepar for 
themselv ani victual 

12 40 now the sojourn of the child of israel who dwelt in 
egypt wa four hundr and thirti year 

12 41 and it came to pa at the end of the four hundr and thirti 
year even the selfsam day it came to pa that all the host of 
the lord went out from the land of egypt 

12 42 it is a night to be much observ unto the lord for bring 
them out from the land of egypt thi is that night of the lord to be 
observ of all the child of israel in their gener 

12 43 and the lord said unto mose and aaron thi is the ordin of 
the passov there shall no stranger eat thereof 12 44 but everi 
man s servant that is bought for money when thou hast circumci 
him then shall he eat thereof 

12 45 a foreign and an hire servant shall not eat thereof 

12 46 in one hou shall it be eaten thou shalt not carri forth ought 
of the flesh abroad out of the hou neither shall ye break a bone 
thereof 

12 47 all the congreg of israel shall keep it 

12 48 and when a stranger shall sojourn with thee and will keep the 
passov to the lord let all hi male be circumci and then let 
him come near and keep it and he shall be a one that is born in the 
land for no uncircumci person shall eat thereof 

12 49 one law shall be to him that is homeborn and unto the stranger 
that sojourneth among you 

12 50 thu did all the child of israel a the lord command mose 
and aaron so did they 

12 51 and it came to pa the selfsam day that the lord did bring 
the child of israel out of the land of egypt by their armi 

13 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 13 2 sanctifi unto me all 
the firstborn whatsoev openeth the womb among the child of 
israel both of man and of beast it is mine 

13 3 and mose said unto the peopl rememb thi day in which ye 
came out from egypt out of the hou of bondag for by strength of 
hand the lord brought you out from thi place there shall no leaven 
bread be eaten 

13 4 thi day came ye out in the month abib 

13 5 and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of 
the canaanit and the hittit and the amorit and the hivit 
and the jebusit which he sware unto thi father to give thee a 
land flow with milk and honey that thou shalt keep thi servic in 
thi month 

13 6 seven day thou shalt eat unleaven bread and in the seventh 
day shall be a feast to the lord 

13 7 unleaven bread shall be eaten seven day and there shall no 
leaven bread be seen with thee neither shall there be leaven seen 
with thee in all thi quarter 

13 8 and thou shalt shew thi son in that day say thi is done 
becau of that which the lord did unto me when i came forth out of 
egypt 

13 9 and it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand and for a 
memori between thine eye that the lord s law may be in thi mouth 
for with a strong hand hath the lord brought thee out of egypt 

13 10 thou shalt therefor keep thi ordin in hi season from year 
to year 

13 11 and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of 
the canaanit a he sware unto thee and to thi father and shall 
give it thee 13 12 that thou shalt set apart unto the lord all that 
openeth the matrix and everi firstl that cometh of a beast which 
thou hast the male shall be the lord s 

13 13 and everi firstl of an a thou shalt redeem with a lamb and 
if thou wilt not redeem it then thou shalt break hi neck and all 
the firstborn of man among thi child shalt thou redeem 

13 14 and it shall be when thi son asketh thee in time to come 
say what is thi that thou shalt say unto him by strength of 
hand the lord brought u out from egypt from the hou of bondag 
13 15 and it came to pa when pharaoh would hardli let u go that 
the lord slew all the firstborn in the land of egypt both the 
firstborn of man and the firstborn of beast therefor i sacrif to 
the lord all that openeth the matrix be male but all the 
firstborn of my child i redeem 

13 16 and it shall be for a token upon thine hand and for frontlet 
between thine eye for by strength of hand the lord brought u forth 
out of egypt 

13 17 and it came to pa when pharaoh had let the peopl go that 
god led them not through the way of the land of the philistin 
although that wa near for god said lest peradventur the peopl 
repent when they see war and they return to egypt 13 18 but god led 
the peopl about through the way of the wilder of the red sea 
and the child of israel went up har out of the land of egypt 

13 19 and mose took the bone of joseph with him for he had straitli 
sworn the child of israel say god will sure visit you and 
ye shall carri up my bone away henc with you 

13 20 and they took their journey from succoth and encamp in etham 
in the edg of the wilder 

13 21 and the lord went befor them by day in a pillar of a cloud to 
lead them the way and by night in a pillar of fire to give them 
light to go by day and night 13 22 he took not away the pillar of 
the cloud by day nor the pillar of fire by night from befor the 
peopl 

14 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 14 2 speak unto the 
child of israel that they turn and encamp befor pihahiroth 
between migdol and the sea over against baalzephon befor it shall 
ye encamp by the sea 

14 3 for pharaoh will say of the child of israel they are 
entangl in the land the wilder hath shut them in 

14 4 and i will harden pharaoh s heart that he shall follow after 
them and i will be honour upon pharaoh and upon all hi host that 
the egyptian may know that i am the lord and they did so 

14 5 and it wa told the king of egypt that the peopl fled and the 
heart of pharaoh and of hi servant wa turn against the peopl 
and they said whi have we done thi that we have let israel go from 
serv u 14 6 and he made readi hi chariot and took hi peopl 
with him 14 7 and he took six hundr chosen chariot and all the 
chariot of egypt and captain over everi one of them 

14 8 and the lord harden the heart of pharaoh king of egypt and he 
pursu after the child of israel and the child of israel went 
out with an high hand 

14 9 but the egyptian pursu after them all the hor and chariot 
of pharaoh and hi horseman and hi armi and overtook them 
encamp by the sea besid pihahiroth befor baalzephon 

14 10 and when pharaoh drew nigh the child of israel lift up 
their eye and behold the egyptian march after them and they 
were sore afraid and the child of israel cri out unto the lord 

14 11 and they said unto mose becau there were no graf in egypt 
hast thou taken u away to die in the wilder wherefor hast thou 
dealt thu with u to carri u forth out of egypt 14 12 is not thi 
the word that we did tell thee in egypt say let u alon that we 
may serv the egyptian for it had been better for u to serv the 
egyptian than that we should die in the wilder 

14 13 and mose said unto the peopl fear ye not stand still and 
see the salvat of the lord which he will shew to you to day for 
the egyptian whom ye have seen to day ye shall see them again no 
more for ever 

14 14 the lord shall fight for you and ye shall hold your peac 

14 15 and the lord said unto mose wherefor criest thou unto me 
speak unto the child of israel that they go forward 14 16 but 
lift thou up thi rod and stretch out thine hand over the sea and 
divid it and the child of israel shall go on dri ground through 
the midst of the sea 

14 17 and i behold i will harden the heart of the egyptian and 
they shall follow them and i will get me honour upon pharaoh and 
upon all hi host upon hi chariot and upon hi horseman 

14 18 and the egyptian shall know that i am the lord when i have 
gotten me honour upon pharaoh upon hi chariot and upon hi 
horseman 

14 19 and the angel of god which went befor the camp of israel 
remov and went behind them and the pillar of the cloud went from 
befor their face and stood behind them 14 20 and it came between 
the camp of the egyptian and the camp of israel and it wa a cloud 
and dark to them but it gave light by night to these so that the 
one came not near the other all the night 

14 21 and mose stretch out hi hand over the sea and the lord 
cau the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night and 
made the sea dri land and the water were divid 

14 22 and the child of israel went into the midst of the sea upon 
the dri ground and the water were a wall unto them on their right 
hand and on their left 

14 23 and the egyptian pursu and went in after them to the midst 
of the sea even all pharaoh s hor hi chariot and hi horseman 

14 24 and it came to pa that in the morn watch the lord look 
unto the host of the egyptian through the pillar of fire and of the 
cloud and troubl the host of the egyptian 14 25 and took off 
their chariot wheel that they drave them heavili so that the 
egyptian said let u flee from the face of israel for the lord 
fighteth for them against the egyptian 

14 26 and the lord said unto mose stretch out thine hand over the 
sea that the water may come again upon the egyptian upon their 
chariot and upon their horseman 

14 27 and mose stretch forth hi hand over the sea and the sea 
return to hi strength when the morn appear and the egyptian 
fled against it and the lord overthrew the egyptian in the midst of 
the sea 

14 28 and the water return and cover the chariot and the 
horseman and all the host of pharaoh that came into the sea after 
them there remain not so much a one of them 

14 29 but the child of israel walk upon dri land in the midst of 
the sea and the water were a wall unto them on their right hand and 
on their left 

14 30 thu the lord save israel that day out of the hand of the 
egyptian and israel saw the egyptian dead upon the sea shore 

14 31 and israel saw that great work which the lord did upon the 
egyptian and the peopl fear the lord and believ the lord and 
hi servant mose 

15 1 then sang mose and the child of israel thi song unto the 
lord and spake say i will sing unto the lord for he hath 
triumph gloriou the hor and hi rider hath he thrown into the 
sea 

15 2 the lord is my strength and song and he is becom my salvat 
he is my god and i will prepar him an habit my father s god 
and i will exalt him 

15 3 the lord is a man of war the lord is hi name 

15 4 pharaoh s chariot and hi host hath he cast into the sea hi 
chosen captain also are drown in the red sea 

15 5 the depth have cover them they sank into the bottom a a 
stone 

15 6 thi right hand o lord is becom gloriou in power thi right 
hand o lord hath dash in piec the enemi 

15 7 and in the great of thine excel thou hast overthrown 
them that rose up against thee thou sentest forth thi wrath which 
consum them a stubbl 

15 8 and with the blast of thi nostril the water were gather 
togeth the flood stood upright a an heap and the depth were 
congeal in the heart of the sea 

15 9 the enemi said i will pursu i will overtak i will divid the 
spoil my lust shall be satisfi upon them i will draw my sword my 
hand shall destroy them 

15 10 thou didst blow with thi wind the sea cover them they sank 
a lead in the mighti water 

15 11 who is like unto thee o lord among the god who is like thee 
gloriou in holi fear in prai do wonder 15 12 thou 
stretchedst out thi right hand the earth swallow them 

15 13 thou in thi merci hast led forth the peopl which thou hast 
redeem thou hast guid them in thi strength unto thi holi 
habit 

15 14 the peopl shall hear and be afraid sorrow shall take hold on 
the inhabit of palestina 

15 15 then the duke of edom shall be amaz the mighti men of moab 
trembl shall take hold upon them all the inhabit of canaan 
shall melt away 

15 16 fear and dread shall fall upon them by the great of thine 
arm they shall be a still a a stone till thi peopl pa over o 
lord till the peopl pa over which thou hast purcha 

15 17 thou shalt bring them in and plant them in the mountain of 
thine inherit in the place o lord which thou hast made for thee 
to dwell in in the sanctuari o lord which thi hand have 
establish 

15 18 the lord shall reign for ever and ever 

15 19 for the hor of pharaoh went in with hi chariot and with hi 
horseman into the sea and the lord brought again the water of the 
sea upon them but the child of israel went on dri land in the 
midst of the sea 

15 20 and miriam the prophetess the sister of aaron took a timbrel 
in her hand and all the woman went out after her with timbrel and 
with danc 

15 21 and miriam answer them sing ye to the lord for he hath 
triumph gloriou the hor and hi rider hath he thrown into the 
sea 

15 22 so mose brought israel from the red sea and they went out into 
the wilder of shur and they went three day in the wilder 
and found no water 

15 23 and when they came to marah they could not drink of the water 
of marah for they were bitter therefor the name of it wa call 
marah 

15 24 and the peopl murmur against mose say what shall we 
drink 15 25 and he cri unto the lord and the lord shew him a 
tree which when he had cast into the water the water were made 
sweet there he made for them a statut and an ordin and there he 
prove them 15 26 and said if thou wilt dilig hearken to the 
voic of the lord thi god and wilt do that which is right in hi 
sight and wilt give ear to hi command and keep all hi 
statut i will put none of these disea upon thee which i have 
brought upon the egyptian for i am the lord that healeth thee 

15 27 and they came to elim where were twelv well of water and 
threescor and ten palm tree and they encamp there by the water 

16 1 and they took their journey from elim and all the congreg 
of the child of israel came unto the wilder of sin which is 
between elim and sinai on the fifteenth day of the second month after 
their depart out of the land of egypt 

16 2 and the whole congreg of the child of israel murmur 
against mose and aaron in the wilder 16 3 and the child of 
israel said unto them would to god we had die by the hand of the 
lord in the land of egypt when we sat by the flesh pot and when we 
did eat bread to the full for ye have brought u forth into thi 
wilder to kill thi whole assembl with hunger 

16 4 then said the lord unto mose behold i will rain bread from 
heaven for you and the peopl shall go out and gather a certain rate 
everi day that i may prove them whether they will walk in my law or 
no 

16 5 and it shall come to pa that on the sixth day they shall 
prepar that which they bring in and it shall be twice a much a 
they gather daili 

16 6 and mose and aaron said unto all the child of israel at 
even then ye shall know that the lord hath brought you out from the 
land of egypt 16 7 and in the morn then ye shall see the glori of 
the lord for that he heareth your murmur against the lord and 
what are we that ye murmur against u 16 8 and mose said thi 
shall be when the lord shall give you in the even flesh to eat 
and in the morn bread to the full for that the lord heareth your 
murmur which ye murmur against him and what are we your 
murmur are not against u but against the lord 

16 9 and mose spake unto aaron say unto all the congreg of the 
child of israel come near befor the lord for he hath heard your 
murmur 

16 10 and it came to pa a aaron spake unto the whole congreg 
of the child of israel that they look toward the wilder 
and behold the glori of the lord appear in the cloud 

16 11 and the lord spake unto mose say 16 12 i have heard the 
murmur of the child of israel speak unto them say at even 
ye shall eat flesh and in the morn ye shall be fill with bread 
and ye shall know that i am the lord your god 

16 13 and it came to pa that at even the quail came up and 
cover the camp and in the morn the dew lay round about the host 

16 14 and when the dew that lay wa gone up behold upon the face of 
the wilder there lay a small round thing a small a the hoar 
frost on the ground 

16 15 and when the child of israel saw it they said one to 
anoth it is manna for they wist not what it wa and mose said 
unto them thi is the bread which the lord hath given you to eat 

16 16 thi is the thing which the lord hath command gather of it 
everi man accord to hi eat an omer for everi man accord to 
the number of your person take ye everi man for them which are in 
hi tent 

16 17 and the child of israel did so and gather some more some 
le 

16 18 and when they did mete it with an omer he that gather much 
had noth over and he that gather littl had no lack they 
gather everi man accord to hi eat 

16 19 and mose said let no man leav of it till the morn 

16 20 notwithstand they hearken not unto mose but some of them 
left of it until the morn and it bred worm and stank and mose 
wa wroth with them 

16 21 and they gather it everi morn everi man accord to hi 
eat and when the sun wax hot it melt 

16 22 and it came to pa that on the sixth day they gather twice 
a much bread two omer for one man and all the ruler of the 
congreg came and told mose 

16 23 and he said unto them thi is that which the lord hath said to 
morrow is the rest of the holi sabbath unto the lord bake that which 
ye will bake to day and seeth that ye will seeth and that which 
remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morn 

16 24 and they laid it up till the morn a mose bade and it did 
not stink neither wa there ani worm therein 

16 25 and mose said eat that to day for to day is a sabbath unto 
the lord to day ye shall not find it in the field 

16 26 six day ye shall gather it but on the seventh day which is 
the sabbath in it there shall be none 

16 27 and it came to pa that there went out some of the peopl on 
the seventh day for to gather and they found none 

16 28 and the lord said unto mose how long refu ye to keep my 
command and my law 16 29 see for that the lord hath given you 
the sabbath therefor he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two 
day abid ye everi man in hi place let no man go out of hi place 
on the seventh day 

16 30 so the peopl rest on the seventh day 

16 31 and the hou of israel call the name thereof manna and it 
wa like coriand seed white and the tast of it wa like wafer 
made with honey 

16 32 and mose said thi is the thing which the lord commandeth 
fill an omer of it to be kept for your gener that they may see 
the bread wherewith i have fed you in the wilder when i brought 
you forth from the land of egypt 

16 33 and mose said unto aaron take a pot and put an omer full of 
manna therein and lay it up befor the lord to be kept for your 
gener 

16 34 a the lord command mose so aaron laid it up befor the 
testimoni to be kept 

16 35 and the child of israel did eat manna forti year until they 
came to a land inhabit they did eat manna until they came unto the 
border of the land of canaan 

16 36 now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah 

17 1 and all the congreg of the child of israel journey from 
the wilder of sin after their journey accord to the 
command of the lord and pitch in rephidim and there wa no 
water for the peopl to drink 

17 2 wherefor the peopl did chide with mose and said give u 
water that we may drink and mose said unto them whi chide ye with 
me wherefor do ye tempt the lord 17 3 and the peopl thirst 
there for water and the peopl murmur against mose and said 
wherefor is thi that thou hast brought u up out of egypt to kill 
u and our child and our cattl with thirst 17 4 and mose cri 
unto the lord say what shall i do unto thi peopl they be 
almost readi to stone me 

17 5 and the lord said unto mose go on befor the peopl and take 
with thee of the elder of israel and thi rod wherewith thou smotest 
the river take in thine hand and go 

17 6 behold i will stand befor thee there upon the rock in horeb 
and thou shalt smite the rock and there shall come water out of it 
that the peopl may drink and mose did so in the sight of the elder 
of israel 

17 7 and he call the name of the place massah and meribah becau 
of the chide of the child of israel and becau they tempt the 
lord say is the lord among u or not 17 8 then came amalek 
and fought with israel in rephidim 

17 9 and mose said unto joshua choo u out men and go out fight 
with amalek to morrow i will stand on the top of the hill with the 
rod of god in mine hand 

17 10 so joshua did a mose had said to him and fought with amalek 
and mose aaron and hur went up to the top of the hill 

17 11 and it came to pa when mose held up hi hand that israel 
prevail and when he let down hi hand amalek prevail 

17 12 but mose hand were heavi and they took a stone and put it 
under him and he sat thereon and aaron and hur stay up hi hand 
the one on the one side and the other on the other side and hi 
hand were steadi until the go down of the sun 

17 13 and joshua discomfit amalek and hi peopl with the edg of 
the sword 

17 14 and the lord said unto mose write thi for a memori in a 
book and rehear it in the ear of joshua for i will utterli put 
out the remembr of amalek from under heaven 

17 15 and mose built an altar and call the name of it 
jehovahnissi 17 16 for he said becau the lord hath sworn that the 
lord will have war with amalek from gener to gener 

18 1 when jethro the priest of midian mose father in law heard of 
all that god had done for mose and for israel hi peopl and that 
the lord had brought israel out of egypt 18 2 then jethro mose 
father in law took zipporah mose wife after he had sent her back 
18 3 and her two son of which the name of the one wa gershom for 
he said i have been an alien in a strang land 18 4 and the name of 
the other wa eliez for the god of my father said he wa mine 
help and deliv me from the sword of pharaoh 18 5 and jethro 
mose father in law came with hi son and hi wife unto mose into 
the wilder where he encamp at the mount of god 18 6 and he 
said unto mose i thi father in law jethro am come unto thee and thi 
wife and her two son with her 

18 7 and mose went out to meet hi father in law and did obei 
and kiss him and they ask each other of their welfar and they 
came into the tent 

18 8 and mose told hi father in law all that the lord had done unto 
pharaoh and to the egyptian for israel s sake and all the travail 
that had come upon them by the way and how the lord deliv them 

18 9 and jethro rejoic for all the good which the lord had done 
to israel whom he had deliv out of the hand of the egyptian 

18 10 and jethro said bless be the lord who hath deliv you out 
of the hand of the egyptian and out of the hand of pharaoh who hath 
deliv the peopl from under the hand of the egyptian 

18 11 now i know that the lord is greater than all god for in the 
thing wherein they dealt proudli he wa abov them 

18 12 and jethro mose father in law took a burnt offer and 
sacrif for god and aaron came and all the elder of israel to 
eat bread with mose father in law befor god 

18 13 and it came to pa on the morrow that mose sat to judg the 
peopl and the peopl stood by mose from the morn unto the 
even 

18 14 and when mose father in law saw all that he did to the peopl 
he said what is thi thing that thou doest to the peopl whi sittest 
thou thyself alon and all the peopl stand by thee from morn unto 
even 18 15 and mose said unto hi father in law becau the peopl 
come unto me to enquir of god 18 16 when they have a matter they 
come unto me and i judg between one and anoth and i do make them 
know the statut of god and hi law 

18 17 and mose father in law said unto him the thing that thou 
doest is not good 

18 18 thou wilt sure wear away both thou and thi peopl that is 
with thee for thi thing is too heavi for thee thou art not abl to 
perform it thyself alon 

18 19 hearken now unto my voic i will give thee counsel and god 
shall be with thee be thou for the peopl to god ward that thou 
mayest bring the cau unto god 18 20 and thou shalt teach them 
ordin and law and shalt shew them the way wherein they must 
walk and the work that they must do 

18 21 moreov thou shalt provid out of all the peopl abl men such 
a fear god men of truth hate covet and place such over 
them to be ruler of thousand and ruler of hundr ruler of 
fifti and ruler of ten 18 22 and let them judg the peopl at 
all season and it shall be that everi great matter they shall bring 
unto thee but everi small matter they shall judg so shall it be 
easier for thyself and they shall bear the burden with thee 

18 23 if thou shalt do thi thing and god command thee so then thou 
shalt be abl to endur and all thi peopl shall also go to their 
place in peac 

18 24 so mose hearken to the voic of hi father in law and did 
all that he had said 

18 25 and mose chose abl men out of all israel and made them head 
over the peopl ruler of thousand ruler of hundr ruler of 
fifti and ruler of ten 

18 26 and they judg the peopl at all season the hard cau they 
brought unto mose but everi small matter they judg themselv 

18 27 and mose let hi father in law depart and he went hi way into 
hi own land 

19 1 in the third month when the child of israel were gone forth 
out of the land of egypt the same day came they into the wilder 
of sinai 

19 2 for they were depart from rephidim and were come to the desert 
of sinai and had pitch in the wilder and there israel camp 
befor the mount 

19 3 and mose went up unto god and the lord call unto him out of 
the mountain say thu shalt thou say to the hou of jacob and 
tell the child of israel 19 4 ye have seen what i did unto the 
egyptian and how i bare you on eagl wing and brought you unto 
myself 

19 5 now therefor if ye will obey my voic ind and keep my 
coven then ye shall be a peculiar treasur unto me abov all 
peopl for all the earth is mine 19 6 and ye shall be unto me a 
kingdom of priest and an holi nation 

these are the word which thou shalt speak unto the child of 
israel 

19 7 and mose came and call for the elder of the peopl and laid 
befor their face all these word which the lord command him 

19 8 and all the peopl answer togeth and said all that the lord 
hath spoken we will do and mose return the word of the peopl 
unto the lord 

19 9 and the lord said unto mose lo i come unto thee in a thick 
cloud that the peopl may hear when i speak with thee and believ 
thee for ever 

and mose told the word of the peopl unto the lord 

19 10 and the lord said unto mose go unto the peopl and sanctifi 
them to day and to morrow and let them wash their cloth 19 11 and 
be readi against the third day for the third day the lord will come 
down in the sight of all the peopl upon mount sinai 

19 12 and thou shalt set bound unto the peopl round about say 
take heed to yourselv that ye go not up into the mount or touch 
the border of it whosoev toucheth the mount shall be sure put to 
death 19 13 there shall not an hand touch it but he shall sure be 
stone or shot through whether it be beast or man it shall not 
live when the trumpet soundeth long they shall come up to the mount 

19 14 and mose went down from the mount unto the peopl and 
sanctifi the peopl and they wash their cloth 

19 15 and he said unto the peopl be readi against the third day 
come not at your wife 

19 16 and it came to pa on the third day in the morn that there 
were thunder and lightn and a thick cloud upon the mount and 
the voic of the trumpet exceed loud so that all the peopl that 
wa in the camp trembl 

19 17 and mose brought forth the peopl out of the camp to meet with 
god and they stood at the nether part of the mount 

19 18 and mount sinai wa altogeth on a smoke becau the lord 
descend upon it in fire and the smoke thereof ascend a the smoke 
of a furnac and the whole mount quak greatli 

19 19 and when the voic of the trumpet sound long and wax louder 
and louder mose spake and god answer him by a voic 

19 20 and the lord came down upon mount sinai on the top of the 
mount and the lord call mose up to the top of the mount and mose 
went up 

19 21 and the lord said unto mose go down charg the peopl lest 
they break through unto the lord to gaze and mani of them perish 

19 22 and let the priest also which come near to the lord sanctifi 
themselv lest the lord break forth upon them 

19 23 and mose said unto the lord the peopl cannot come up to mount 
sinai for thou chargedst u say set bound about the mount and 
sanctifi it 

19 24 and the lord said unto him away get thee down and thou shalt 
come up thou and aaron with thee but let not the priest and the 
peopl break through to come up unto the lord lest he break forth 
upon them 

19 25 so mose went down unto the peopl and spake unto them 

20 1 and god spake all these word say 20 2 i am the lord thi 
god which have brought thee out of the land of egypt out of the 
hou of bondag 

20 3 thou shalt have no other god befor me 

20 4 thou shalt not make unto thee ani graven imag or ani like 
of ani thing that is in heaven abov or that is in the earth beneath 
or that is in the water under the earth 

20 5 thou shalt not bow down thyself to them nor serv them for i 
the lord thi god am a jealou god visit the iniqu of the 
father upon the child unto the third and fourth gener of them 
that hate me 20 6 and shew merci unto thousand of them that love 
me and keep my command 

20 7 thou shalt not take the name of the lord thi god in vain for the 
lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh hi name in vain 

20 8 rememb the sabbath day to keep it holi 

20 9 six day shalt thou labour and do all thi work 20 10 but the 
seventh day is the sabbath of the lord thi god in it thou shalt not 
do ani work thou nor thi son nor thi daughter thi manserv nor 
thi maidserv nor thi cattl nor thi stranger that is within thi 
gate 20 11 for in six day the lord made heaven and earth the sea 
and all that in them is and rest the seventh day wherefor the 
lord bless the sabbath day and hallow it 

20 12 honour thi father and thi mother that thi day may be long upon 
the land which the lord thi god giveth thee 

20 13 thou shalt not kill 

20 14 thou shalt not commit adulteri 

20 15 thou shalt not steal 

20 16 thou shalt not bear fal wit against thi neighbour 

20 17 thou shalt not covet thi neighbour s hou thou shalt not covet 
thi neighbour s wife nor hi manserv nor hi maidserv nor hi 
ox nor hi a nor ani thing that is thi neighbour s 

20 18 and all the peopl saw the thunder and the lightn and 
the noi of the trumpet and the mountain smoke and when the 
peopl saw it they remov and stood afar off 

20 19 and they said unto mose speak thou with u and we will hear 
but let not god speak with u lest we die 

20 20 and mose said unto the peopl fear not for god is come to 
prove you and that hi fear may be befor your face that ye sin 
not 

20 21 and the peopl stood afar off and mose drew near unto the 
thick dark where god wa 

20 22 and the lord said unto mose thu thou shalt say unto the 
child of israel ye have seen that i have talk with you from 
heaven 

20 23 ye shall not make with me god of silver neither shall ye make 
unto you god of gold 

20 24 an altar of earth thou shalt make unto me and shalt sacrif 
thereon thi burnt offer and thi peac offer thi sheep and 
thine ox in all place where i record my name i will come unto 
thee and i will bless thee 

20 25 and if thou wilt make me an altar of stone thou shalt not build 
it of hewn stone for if thou lift up thi tool upon it thou hast 
pollut it 

20 26 neither shalt thou go up by step unto mine altar that thi 
nake be not discov thereon 

21 1 now these are the judgment which thou shalt set befor them 

21 2 if thou buy an hebrew servant six year he shall serv and in 
the seventh he shall go out free for noth 

21 3 if he came in by himself he shall go out by himself if he were 
marri then hi wife shall go out with him 

21 4 if hi master have given him a wife and she have born him son 
or daughter the wife and her child shall be her master s and he 
shall go out by himself 

21 5 and if the servant shall plainli say i love my master my wife 
and my child i will not go out free 21 6 then hi master shall 
bring him unto the judg he shall also bring him to the door or 
unto the door post and hi master shall bore hi ear through with an 
aul and he shall serv him for ever 

21 7 and if a man sell hi daughter to be a maidserv she shall not 
go out a the manserv do 

21 8 if she plea not her master who hath betroth her to himself 
then shall he let her be redeem to sell her unto a strang nation 
he shall have no power see he hath dealt deceit with her 

21 9 and if he have betroth her unto hi son he shall deal with her 
after the manner of daughter 

21 10 if he take him anoth wife her food her raiment and her duti 
of marriag shall he not diminish 

21 11 and if he do not these three unto her then shall she go out 
free without money 

21 12 he that smiteth a man so that he die shall be sure put to 
death 

21 13 and if a man lie not in wait but god deliv him into hi hand 
then i will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee 

21 14 but if a man come presumptu upon hi neighbour to slay him 
with guil thou shalt take him from mine altar that he may die 

21 15 and he that smiteth hi father or hi mother shall be sure 
put to death 

21 16 and he that stealeth a man and selleth him or if he be found 
in hi hand he shall sure be put to death 

21 17 and he that curseth hi father or hi mother shall sure be 
put to death 

21 18 and if men strive togeth and one smite anoth with a stone 
or with hi fist and he die not but keepeth hi bed 21 19 if he 
rise again and walk abroad upon hi staff then shall he that smote 
him be quit onli he shall pay for the loss of hi time and shall 
cau him to be thoroughli heal 

21 20 and if a man smite hi servant or hi maid with a rod and he 
die under hi hand he shall be sure punish 

21 21 notwithstand if he continu a day or two he shall not be 
punish for he is hi money 

21 22 if men strive and hurt a woman with child so that her fruit 
depart from her and yet no mischief follow he shall be sure 
punish accord a the woman s husband will lay upon him and he 
shall pay a the judg determin 

21 23 and if ani mischief follow then thou shalt give life for life 
21 24 eye for eye tooth for tooth hand for hand foot for foot 
21 25 burn for burn wound for wound stripe for stripe 

21 26 and if a man smite the eye of hi servant or the eye of hi 
maid that it perish he shall let him go free for hi eye s sake 

21 27 and if he smite out hi manserv s tooth or hi maidserv s 
tooth he shall let him go free for hi tooth s sake 

21 28 if an ox gore a man or a woman that they die then the ox shall 
be sure stone and hi flesh shall not be eaten but the owner of 
the ox shall be quit 

21 29 but if the ox were wont to push with hi horn in time past and 
it hath been testifi to hi owner and he hath not kept him in but 
that he hath kill a man or a woman the ox shall be stone and hi 
owner also shall be put to death 

21 30 if there be laid on him a sum of money then he shall give for 
the ransom of hi life whatsoev is laid upon him 

21 31 whether he have gore a son or have gore a daughter accord 
to thi judgment shall it be done unto him 

21 32 if the ox shall push a manserv or a maidserv he shall 
give unto their master thirti shekel of silver and the ox shall be 
stone 

21 33 and if a man shall open a pit or if a man shall dig a pit and 
not cover it and an ox or an a fall therein 21 34 the owner of the 
pit shall make it good and give money unto the owner of them and the 
dead beast shall be hi 

21 35 and if one man s ox hurt anoth s that he die then they shall 
sell the live ox and divid the money of it and the dead ox also 
they shall divid 

21 36 or if it be known that the ox hath use to push in time past 
and hi owner hath not kept him in he shall sure pay ox for ox and 
the dead shall be hi own 

22 1 if a man shall steal an ox or a sheep and kill it or sell it 
he shall restor five ox for an ox and four sheep for a sheep 

22 2 if a thief be found break up and be smitten that he die 
there shall no blood be shed for him 

22 3 if the sun be risen upon him there shall be blood shed for him 
for he should make full restitut if he have noth then he shall 
be sold for hi theft 

22 4 if the theft be certainli found in hi hand aliv whether it be 
ox or a or sheep he shall restor doubl 

22 5 if a man shall cau a field or vineyard to be eaten and shall 
put in hi beast and shall feed in anoth man s field of the best 
of hi own field and of the best of hi own vineyard shall he make 
restitut 

22 6 if fire break out and catch in thorn so that the stack of 
corn or the stand corn or the field be consum therewith he 
that kindl the fire shall sure make restitut 

22 7 if a man shall deliv unto hi neighbour money or stuff to keep 
and it be stolen out of the man s hou if the thief be found let 
him pay doubl 

22 8 if the thief be not found then the master of the hou shall be 
brought unto the judg to see whether he have put hi hand unto hi 
neighbour s good 

22 9 for all manner of trespass whether it be for ox for a for 
sheep for raiment or for ani manner of lost thing which anoth 
challengeth to be hi the cau of both parti shall come befor the 
judg and whom the judg shall condemn he shall pay doubl unto 
hi neighbour 

22 10 if a man deliv unto hi neighbour an a or an ox or a 
sheep or ani beast to keep and it die or be hurt or driven away 
no man see it 22 11 then shall an oath of the lord be between them 
both that he hath not put hi hand unto hi neighbour s good and 
the owner of it shall accept thereof and he shall not make it good 

22 12 and if it be stolen from him he shall make restitut unto the 
owner thereof 

22 13 if it be torn in piec then let him bring it for wit and 
he shall not make good that which wa torn 

22 14 and if a man borrow ought of hi neighbour and it be hurt or 
die the owner thereof be not with it he shall sure make it 
good 

22 15 but if the owner thereof be with it he shall not make it good 
if it be an hire thing it came for hi hire 

22 16 and if a man entic a maid that is not betroth and lie with 
her he shall sure endow her to be hi wife 

22 17 if her father utterli refu to give her unto him he shall pay 
money accord to the dowri of virgin 

22 18 thou shalt not suffer a witch to live 

22 19 whosoev lieth with a beast shall sure be put to death 

22 20 he that sacrificeth unto ani god save unto the lord onli he 
shall be utterli destroy 

22 21 thou shalt neither vex a stranger nor oppress him for ye were 
stranger in the land of egypt 

22 22 ye shall not afflict ani widow or fatherless child 

22 23 if thou afflict them in ani wise and they cri at all unto me i 
will sure hear their cri 22 24 and my wrath shall wax hot and i 
will kill you with the sword and your wife shall be widow and your 
child fatherless 

22 25 if thou lend money to ani of my peopl that is poor by thee 
thou shalt not be to him a an usur neither shalt thou lay upon him 
usuri 

22 26 if thou at all take thi neighbour s raiment to pledg thou 
shalt deliv it unto him by that the sun goeth down 22 27 for that 
is hi cover onli it is hi raiment for hi skin wherein shall he 
sleep and it shall come to pa when he crieth unto me that i will 
hear for i am graciou 

22 28 thou shalt not revil the god nor cur the ruler of thi 
peopl 

22 29 thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thi ripe fruit and 
of thi liquor the firstborn of thi son shalt thou give unto me 

22 30 likewi shalt thou do with thine ox and with thi sheep 
seven day it shall be with hi dam on the eighth day thou shalt give 
it me 

22 31 and ye shall be holi men unto me neither shall ye eat ani flesh 
that is torn of beast in the field ye shall cast it to the dog 

23 1 thou shalt not rai a fal report put not thine hand with the 
wick to be an unright wit 

23 2 thou shalt not follow a multitud to do evil neither shalt thou 
speak in a cau to declin after mani to wrest judgment 23 3 neither 
shalt thou counten a poor man in hi cau 

23 4 if thou meet thine enemi s ox or hi a go astray thou shalt 
sure bring it back to him again 

23 5 if thou see the a of him that hateth thee lie under hi 
burden and wouldest forbear to help him thou shalt sure help with 
him 

23 6 thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thi poor in hi cau 

23 7 keep thee far from a fal matter and the innoc and righteou 
slay thou not for i will not justifi the wick 

23 8 and thou shalt take no gift for the gift blindeth the wise and 
perverteth the word of the righteou 

23 9 also thou shalt not oppress a stranger for ye know the heart of 
a stranger see ye were stranger in the land of egypt 

23 10 and six year thou shalt sow thi land and shalt gather in the 
fruit thereof 23 11 but the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and 
lie still that the poor of thi peopl may eat and what they leav 
the beast of the field shall eat in like manner thou shalt deal with 
thi vineyard and with thi oliveyard 

23 12 six day thou shalt do thi work and on the seventh day thou 
shalt rest that thine ox and thine a may rest and the son of thi 
handmaid and the stranger may be refresh 

23 13 and in all thing that i have said unto you be circumspect and 
make no mention of the name of other god neither let it be heard out 
of thi mouth 

23 14 three time thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year 

23 15 thou shalt keep the feast of unleaven bread thou shalt eat 
unleaven bread seven day a i command thee in the time 
appoint of the month abib for in it thou camest out from egypt and 
none shall appear befor me empti 23 16 and the feast of harvest 
the firstfruit of thi labour which thou hast sown in the field and 
the feast of ingath which is in the end of the year when thou 
hast gather in thi labour out of the field 

23 17 three item in the year all thi male shall appear befor the 
lord god 

23 18 thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrif with leaven 
bread neither shall the fat of my sacrif remain until the morn 

23 19 the first of the firstfruit of thi land thou shalt bring into 
the hou of the lord thi god thou shalt not seeth a kid in hi 
mother s milk 

23 20 behold i send an angel befor thee to keep thee in the way 
and to bring thee into the place which i have prepar 

23 21 bewar of him and obey hi voic provok him not for he will 
not pardon your transgress for my name is in him 

23 22 but if thou shalt ind obey hi voic and do all that i 
speak then i will be an enemi unto thine enemi and an adversari 
unto thine adversari 

23 23 for mine angel shall go befor thee and bring thee in unto the 
amorit and the hittit and the perizzit and the canaanit 
the hivit and the jebusit and i will cut them off 

23 24 thou shalt not bow down to their god nor serv them nor do 
after their work but thou shalt utterli overthrow them and quit 
break down their imag 

23 25 and ye shall serv the lord your god and he shall bless thi 
bread and thi water and i will take sick away from the midst of 
thee 

23 26 there shall noth cast their young nor be barren in thi 
land the number of thi day i will fulfil 

23 27 i will send my fear befor thee and will destroy all the peopl 
to whom thou shalt come and i will make all thine enemi turn their 
back unto thee 

23 28 and i will send hornet befor thee which shall drive out the 
hivit the canaanit and the hittit from befor thee 

23 29 i will not drive them out from befor thee in one year lest the 
land becom desol and the beast of the field multipli against 
thee 

23 30 by littl and littl i will drive them out from befor thee 
until thou be increa and inherit the land 

23 31 and i will set thi bound from the red sea even unto the sea of 
the philistin and from the desert unto the river for i will 
deliv the inhabit of the land into your hand and thou shalt 
drive them out befor thee 

23 32 thou shalt make no coven with them nor with their god 

23 33 they shall not dwell in thi land lest they make thee sin 
against me for if thou serv their god it will sure be a snare 
unto thee 

24 1 and he said unto mose come up unto the lord thou and aaron 
nadab and abihu and seventi of the elder of israel and worship ye 
afar off 

24 2 and mose alon shall come near the lord but they shall not come 
nigh neither shall the peopl go up with him 

24 3 and mose came and told the peopl all the word of the lord and 
all the judgment and all the peopl answer with one voic and 
said all the word which the lord hath said will we do 

24 4 and mose wrote all the word of the lord and rose up earli in 
the morn and build an altar under the hill and twelv pillar 
accord to the twelv tribe of israel 

24 5 and he sent young men of the child of israel which offer 
burnt offer and sacrif peac offer of ox unto the lord 

24 6 and mose took half of the blood and put it in bason and half 
of the blood he sprinkl on the altar 

24 7 and he took the book of the coven and read in the audienc of 
the peopl and they said all that the lord hath said will we do and 
be obedi 

24 8 and mose took the blood and sprinkl it on the peopl and 
said behold the blood of the coven which the lord hath made with 
you concern all these word 

24 9 then went up mose and aaron nadab and abihu and seventi of 
the elder of israel 24 10 and they saw the god of israel and there 
wa under hi foot a it were a pave work of a sapphir stone and a 
it were the bodi of heaven in hi clear 

24 11 and upon the nobl of the child of israel he laid not hi 
hand also they saw god and did eat and drink 

24 12 and the lord said unto mose come up to me into the mount and 
be there and i will give thee tabl of stone and a law and 
command which i have written that thou mayest teach them 

24 13 and mose rose up and hi minist joshua and mose went up 
into the mount of god 

24 14 and he said unto the elder tarri ye here for u until we come 
again unto you and behold aaron and hur are with you if ani man 
have ani matter to do let him come unto them 

24 15 and mose went up into the mount and a cloud cover the mount 

24 16 and the glori of the lord abod upon mount sinai and the cloud 
cover it six day and the seventh day he call unto mose out of 
the midst of the cloud 

24 17 and the sight of the glori of the lord wa like devour fire 
on the top of the mount in the eye of the child of israel 

24 18 and mose went into the midst of the cloud and gat him up into 
the mount and mose wa in the mount forti day and forti night 

25 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 25 2 speak unto the 
child of israel that they bring me an offer of everi man that 
giveth it willingli with hi heart ye shall take my offer 

25 3 and thi is the offer which ye shall take of them gold and 
silver and brass 25 4 and blue and purpl and scarlet and fine 
linen and goat hair 25 5 and ram skin dy red and badger 
skin and shittim wood 25 6 oil for the light spice for anoint 
oil and for sweet incen 25 7 onyx stone and stone to be set in 
the ephod and in the breastplat 

25 8 and let them make me a sanctuari that i may dwell among them 

25 9 accord to all that i shew thee after the pattern of the 
tabernacl and the pattern of all the instrument thereof even so 
shall ye make it 

25 10 and they shall make an ark of shittim wood two cubit and a 
half shall be the length thereof and a cubit and a half the breadth 
thereof and a cubit and a half the height thereof 

25 11 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold within and without 
shalt thou overlay it and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round 
about 

25 12 and thou shalt cast four ring of gold for it and put them in 
the four corner thereof and two ring shall be in the one side of 
it and two ring in the other side of it 

25 13 and thou shalt make stave of shittim wood and overlay them 
with gold 

25 14 and thou shalt put the stave into the ring by the side of the 
ark that the ark may be born with them 

25 15 the stave shall be in the ring of the ark they shall not be 
taken from it 

25 16 and thou shalt put into the ark the testimoni which i shall give 
thee 

25 17 and thou shalt make a merci seat of pure gold two cubit and a 
half shall be the length thereof and a cubit and a half the breadth 
thereof 

25 18 and thou shalt make two cherub of gold of beaten work shalt 
thou make them in the two end of the merci seat 

25 19 and make one cherub on the one end and the other cherub on the 
other end even of the merci seat shall ye make the cherub on the 
two end thereof 

25 20 and the cherub shall stretch forth their wing on high 
cover the merci seat with their wing and their face shall look 
one to anoth toward the merci seat shall the face of the cherub 
be 

25 21 and thou shalt put the merci seat abov upon the ark and in the 
ark thou shalt put the testimoni that i shall give thee 

25 22 and there i will meet with thee and i will commun with thee 
from abov the merci seat from between the two cherub which are 
upon the ark of the testimoni of all thing which i will give thee in 
command unto the child of israel 

25 23 thou shalt also make a tabl of shittim wood two cubit shall 
be the length thereof and a cubit the breadth thereof and a cubit 
and a half the height thereof 

25 24 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold and make thereto a 
crown of gold round about 

25 25 and thou shalt make unto it a border of an hand breadth round 
about and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round 
about 

25 26 and thou shalt make for it four ring of gold and put the ring 
in the four corner that are on the four foot thereof 

25 27 over against the border shall the ring be for place of the 
stave to bear the tabl 

25 28 and thou shalt make the stave of shittim wood and overlay them 
with gold that the tabl may be born with them 

25 29 and thou shalt make the dish thereof and spoon thereof and 
cover thereof and bowl thereof to cover withal of pure gold shalt 
thou make them 

25 30 and thou shalt set upon the tabl shewbread befor me alway 

25 31 and thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold of beaten work 
shall the candlestick be made hi shaft and hi branch hi bowl 
hi knop and hi flower shall be of the same 

25 32 and six branch shall come out of the side of it three 
branch of the candlestick out of the one side and three branch of 
the candlestick out of the other side 25 33 three bowl made like 
unto almond with a knop and a flower in one branch and three bowl 
made like almond in the other branch with a knop and a flower so in 
the six branch that come out of the candlestick 

25 34 and in the candlestick shall be four bowl made like unto 
almond with their knop and their flower 

25 35 and there shall be a knop under two branch of the same and a 
knop under two branch of the same and a knop under two branch of 
the same accord to the six branch that proceed out of the 
candlestick 

25 36 their knop and their branch shall be of the same all it 
shall be one beaten work of pure gold 

25 37 and thou shalt make the seven lamp thereof and they shall 
light the lamp thereof that they may give light over against it 

25 38 and the tong thereof and the snuffdish thereof shall be of 
pure gold 

25 39 of a talent of pure gold shall he make it with all these 
vessel 

25 40 and look that thou make them after their pattern which wa 
shew thee in the mount 

26 1 moreov thou shalt make the tabernacl with ten curtain of fine 
twine linen and blue and purpl and scarlet with cherub of 
cun work shalt thou make them 

26 2 the length of one curtain shall be eight and twenti cubit and 
the breadth of one curtain four cubit and everi one of the curtain 
shall have one measur 

26 3 the five curtain shall be coupl togeth one to anoth and 
other five curtain shall be coupl one to anoth 

26 4 and thou shalt make loop of blue upon the edg of the one 
curtain from the selvedg in the coupl and likewi shalt thou 
make in the uttermost edg of anoth curtain in the coupl of the 
second 

26 5 fifti loop shalt thou make in the one curtain and fifti loop 
shalt thou make in the edg of the curtain that is in the coupl of 
the second that the loop may take hold one of anoth 

26 6 and thou shalt make fifti tach of gold and coupl the curtain 
togeth with the tach and it shall be one tabernacl 

26 7 and thou shalt make curtain of goat hair to be a cover upon 
the tabernacl eleven curtain shalt thou make 

26 8 the length of one curtain shall be thirti cubit and the breadth 
of one curtain four cubit and the eleven curtain shall be all of 
one measur 

26 9 and thou shalt coupl five curtain by themselv and six 
curtain by themselv and shalt doubl the sixth curtain in the 
forefront of the tabernacl 

26 10 and thou shalt make fifti loop on the edg of the one curtain 
that is outmost in the coupl and fifti loop in the edg of the 
curtain which coupleth the second 

26 11 and thou shalt make fifti tach of brass and put the tach 
into the loop and coupl the tent togeth that it may be one 

26 12 and the remnant that remaineth of the curtain of the tent the 
half curtain that remaineth shall hang over the backsid of the 
tabernacl 

26 13 and a cubit on the one side and a cubit on the other side of 
that which remaineth in the length of the curtain of the tent it 
shall hang over the side of the tabernacl on thi side and on that 
side to cover it 

26 14 and thou shalt make a cover for the tent of ram skin dy 
red and a cover abov of badger skin 

26 15 and thou shalt make board for the tabernacl of shittim wood 
stand up 

26 16 ten cubit shall be the length of a board and a cubit and a 
half shall be the breadth of one board 

26 17 two tenon shall there be in one board set in order one against 
anoth thu shalt thou make for all the board of the tabernacl 

26 18 and thou shalt make the board for the tabernacl twenti board 
on the south side southward 

26 19 and thou shalt make forti socket of silver under the twenti 
board two socket under one board for hi two tenon and two 
socket under anoth board for hi two tenon 

26 20 and for the second side of the tabernacl on the north side 
there shall be twenti board 26 21 and their forti socket of silver 
two socket under one board and two socket under anoth board 

26 22 and for the side of the tabernacl westward thou shalt make six 
board 

26 23 and two board shalt thou make for the corner of the tabernacl 
in the two side 

26 24 and they shall be coupl togeth beneath and they shall be 
coupl togeth abov the head of it unto one ring thu shall it be 
for them both they shall be for the two corner 

26 25 and they shall be eight board and their socket of silver 
sixteen socket two socket under one board and two socket under 
anoth board 

26 26 and thou shalt make bar of shittim wood five for the board of 
the one side of the tabernacl 26 27 and five bar for the board of 
the other side of the tabernacl and five bar for the board of the 
side of the tabernacl for the two side westward 

26 28 and the middl bar in the midst of the board shall reach from 
end to end 

26 29 and thou shalt overlay the board with gold and make their 
ring of gold for place for the bar and thou shalt overlay the bar 
with gold 

26 30 and thou shalt rear up the tabernacl accord to the fashion 
thereof which wa shew thee in the mount 

26 31 and thou shalt make a vail of blue and purpl and scarlet and 
fine twine linen of cun work with cherub shall it be made 
26 32 and thou shalt hang it upon four pillar of shittim wood 
overlaid with gold their hook shall be of gold upon the four 
socket of silver 

26 33 and thou shalt hang up the vail under the tach that thou 
mayest bring in thither within the vail the ark of the testimoni and 
the vail shall divid unto you between the holi place and the most 
holi 

26 34 and thou shalt put the merci seat upon the ark of the testimoni 
in the most holi place 

26 35 and thou shalt set the tabl without the vail and the 
candlestick over against the tabl on the side of the tabernacl 
toward the south and thou shalt put the tabl on the north side 

26 36 and thou shalt make an hang for the door of the tent of 
blue and purpl and scarlet and fine twine linen wrought with 
needlework 

26 37 and thou shalt make for the hang five pillar of shittim 
wood and overlay them with gold and their hook shall be of gold 
and thou shalt cast five socket of brass for them 

27 1 and thou shalt make an altar of shittim wood five cubit long 
and five cubit broad the altar shall be foursquar and the height 
thereof shall be three cubit 

27 2 and thou shalt make the horn of it upon the four corner 
thereof hi horn shall be of the same and thou shalt overlay it 
with brass 

27 3 and thou shalt make hi pan to receiv hi ash and hi 
shovel and hi bason and hi fleshhook and hi firepan all the 
vessel thereof thou shalt make of brass 

27 4 and thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass and upon 
the net shalt thou make four brasen ring in the four corner thereof 

27 5 and thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath 
that the net may be even to the midst of the altar 

27 6 and thou shalt make stave for the altar stave of shittim wood 
and overlay them with brass 

27 7 and the stave shall be put into the ring and the stave shall 
be upon the two side of the altar to bear it 

27 8 hollow with board shalt thou make it a it wa shew thee in 
the mount so shall they make it 

27 9 and thou shalt make the court of the tabernacl for the south 
side southward there shall be hang for the court of fine twine 
linen of an hundr cubit long for one side 27 10 and the twenti 
pillar thereof and their twenti socket shall be of brass the hook 
of the pillar and their fillet shall be of silver 

27 11 and likewi for the north side in length there shall be 
hang of an hundr cubit long and hi twenti pillar and their 
twenti socket of brass the hook of the pillar and their fillet of 
silver 

27 12 and for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be 
hang of fifti cubit their pillar ten and their socket ten 

27 13 and the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be 
fifti cubit 

27 14 the hang of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubit 
their pillar three and their socket three 

27 15 and on the other side shall be hang fifteen cubit their 
pillar three and their socket three 

27 16 and for the gate of the court shall be an hang of twenti 
cubit of blue and purpl and scarlet and fine twine linen 
wrought with needlework and their pillar shall be four and their 
socket four 

27 17 all the pillar round about the court shall be fillet with 
silver their hook shall be of silver and their socket of brass 

27 18 the length of the court shall be an hundr cubit and the 
breadth fifti everi where and the height five cubit of fine twine 
linen and their socket of brass 

27 19 all the vessel of the tabernacl in all the servic thereof 
and all the pin thereof and all the pin of the court shall be of 
brass 

27 20 and thou shalt command the child of israel that they bring 
thee pure oil oliv beaten for the light to cau the lamp to burn 
alway 

27 21 in the tabernacl of the congreg without the vail which is 
befor the testimoni aaron and hi son shall order it from even 
to morn befor the lord it shall be a statut for ever unto their 
gener on the behalf of the child of israel 

28 1 and take thou unto thee aaron thi brother and hi son with him 
from among the child of israel that he may minist unto me in the 
priest s offic even aaron nadab and abihu eleazar and ithamar 
aaron s son 

28 2 and thou shalt make holi garment for aaron thi brother for glori 
and for beauti 

28 3 and thou shalt speak unto all that are wise heart whom i have 
fill with the spirit of wisdom that they may make aaron s garment 
to consecr him that he may minist unto me in the priest s 
offic 

28 4 and these are the garment which they shall make a breastplat 
and an ephod and a robe and a broider coat a mitr and a girdl 
and they shall make holi garment for aaron thi brother and hi son 
that he may minist unto me in the priest s offic 

28 5 and they shall take gold and blue and purpl and scarlet and 
fine linen 

28 6 and they shall make the ephod of gold of blue and of purpl of 
scarlet and fine twine linen with cun work 

28 7 it shall have the two shoulderpiec thereof join at the two 
edg thereof and so it shall be join togeth 

28 8 and the curiou girdl of the ephod which is upon it shall be 
of the same accord to the work thereof even of gold of blue and 
purpl and scarlet and fine twine linen 

28 9 and thou shalt take two onyx stone and grave on them the name 
of the child of israel 28 10 six of their name on one stone and 
the other six name of the rest on the other stone accord to their 
birth 

28 11 with the work of an engrav in stone like the engrav of a 
signet shalt thou engrav the two stone with the name of the 
child of israel thou shalt make them to be set in ouch of gold 

28 12 and thou shalt put the two stone upon the shoulder of the 
ephod for stone of memori unto the child of israel and aaron 
shall bear their name befor the lord upon hi two shoulder for a 
memori 

28 13 and thou shalt make ouch of gold 28 14 and two chain of pure 
gold at the end of wreathen work shalt thou make them and fasten 
the wreathen chain to the ouch 

28 15 and thou shalt make the breastplat of judgment with cun 
work after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it of gold of 
blue and of purpl and of scarlet and of fine twine linen shalt 
thou make it 

28 16 foursquar it shall be be doubl a span shall be the length 
thereof and a span shall be the breadth thereof 

28 17 and thou shalt set in it set of stone even four row of 
stone the first row shall be a sardiu a topaz and a carbuncl 
thi shall be the first row 

28 18 and the second row shall be an emerald a sapphir and a 
diamond 

28 19 and the third row a ligur an agat and an amethyst 

28 20 and the fourth row a beryl and an onyx and a jasper they 
shall be set in gold in their inclo 

28 21 and the stone shall be with the name of the child of 
israel twelv accord to their name like the engrav of a 
signet everi one with hi name shall they be accord to the twelv 
tribe 

28 22 and thou shalt make upon the breastplat chain at the end of 
wreathen work of pure gold 

28 23 and thou shalt make upon the breastplat two ring of gold and 
shalt put the two ring on the two end of the breastplat 

28 24 and thou shalt put the two wreathen chain of gold in the two 
ring which are on the end of the breastplat 

28 25 and the other two end of the two wreathen chain thou shalt 
fasten in the two ouch and put them on the shoulderpiec of the 
ephod befor it 

28 26 and thou shalt make two ring of gold and thou shalt put them 
upon the two end of the breastplat in the border thereof which is 
in the side of the ephod inward 

28 27 and two other ring of gold thou shalt make and shalt put them 
on the two side of the ephod underneath toward the forepart thereof 
over against the other coupl thereof abov the curiou girdl of 
the ephod 

28 28 and they shall bind the breastplat by the ring thereof unto 
the ring of the ephod with a lace of blue that it may be abov the 
curiou girdl of the ephod and that the breastplat be not loo 
from the ephod 

28 29 and aaron shall bear the name of the child of israel in the 
breastplat of judgment upon hi heart when he goeth in unto the holi 
place for a memori befor the lord continu 

28 30 and thou shalt put in the breastplat of judgment the urim and 
the thummim and they shall be upon aaron s heart when he goeth in 
befor the lord and aaron shall bear the judgment of the child of 
israel upon hi heart befor the lord continu 

28 31 and thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue 

28 32 and there shall be an hole in the top of it in the midst 
thereof it shall have a bind of woven work round about the hole of 
it a it were the hole of an habergeon that it be not rent 

28 33 and beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegran of 
blue and of purpl and of scarlet round about the hem thereof and 
bell of gold between them round about 28 34 a golden bell and a 
pomegran a golden bell and a pomegran upon the hem of the robe 
round about 

28 35 and it shall be upon aaron to minist and hi sound shall be 
heard when he goeth in unto the holi place befor the lord and when 
he cometh out that he die not 

28 36 and thou shalt make a plate of pure gold and grave upon it 
like the engrav of a signet holi to the lord 

28 37 and thou shalt put it on a blue lace that it may be upon the 
mitr upon the forefront of the mitr it shall be 

28 38 and it shall be upon aaron s forehead that aaron may bear the 
iniqu of the holi thing which the child of israel shall hallow 
in all their holi gift and it shall be alway upon hi forehead 
that they may be accept befor the lord 

28 39 and thou shalt embroid the coat of fine linen and thou shalt 
make the mitr of fine linen and thou shalt make the girdl of 
needlework 

28 40 and for aaron s son thou shalt make coat and thou shalt make 
for them girdl and bonnet shalt thou make for them for glori and 
for beauti 

28 41 and thou shalt put them upon aaron thi brother and hi son 
with him and shalt anoint them and consecr them and sanctifi 
them that they may minist unto me in the priest s offic 

28 42 and thou shalt make them linen breech to cover their 
nake from the loin even unto the thigh they shall reach 28 43 
and they shall be upon aaron and upon hi son when they come in 
unto the tabernacl of the congreg or when they come near unto 
the altar to minist in the holi place that they bear not iniqu 
and die it shall be a statut for ever unto him and hi seed after 
him 

29 1 and thi is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow 
them to minist unto me in the priest s offic take one young 
bullock and two ram without blemish 29 2 and unleaven bread and 
cake unleaven temper with oil and wafer unleaven anoint 
with oil of wheaten flour shalt thou make them 

29 3 and thou shalt put them into one basket and bring them in the 
basket with the bullock and the two ram 

29 4 and aaron and hi son thou shalt bring unto the door of the 
tabernacl of the congreg and shalt wash them with water 

29 5 and thou shalt take the garment and put upon aaron the coat 
and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the breastplat and 
gird him with the curiou girdl of the ephod 29 6 and thou shalt put 
the mitr upon hi head and put the holi crown upon the mitr 

29 7 then shalt thou take the anoint oil and pour it upon hi 
head and anoint him 

29 8 and thou shalt bring hi son and put coat upon them 

29 9 and thou shalt gird them with girdl aaron and hi son and 
put the bonnet on them and the priest s offic shall be their for a 
perpetu statut and thou shalt consecr aaron and hi son 

29 10 and thou shalt cau a bullock to be brought befor the 
tabernacl of the congreg and aaron and hi son shall put their 
hand upon the head of the bullock 

29 11 and thou shalt kill the bullock befor the lord by the door of 
the tabernacl of the congreg 

29 12 and thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock and put it upon 
the horn of the altar with thi finger and pour all the blood besid 
the bottom of the altar 

29 13 and thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inward and 
the caul that is abov the liver and the two kidney and the fat 
that is upon them and burn them upon the altar 

29 14 but the flesh of the bullock and hi skin and hi dung shalt 
thou burn with fire without the camp it is a sin offer 

29 15 thou shalt also take one ram and aaron and hi son shall put 
their hand upon the head of the ram 

29 16 and thou shalt slay the ram and thou shalt take hi blood and 
sprinkl it round about upon the altar 

29 17 and thou shalt cut the ram in piec and wash the inward of 
him and hi leg and put them unto hi piec and unto hi head 

29 18 and thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar it is a burnt 
offer unto the lord it is a sweet savour an offer made by fire 
unto the lord 

29 19 and thou shalt take the other ram and aaron and hi son shall 
put their hand upon the head of the ram 

29 20 then shalt thou kill the ram and take of hi blood and put it 
upon the tip of the right ear of aaron and upon the tip of the right 
ear of hi son and upon the thumb of their right hand and upon the 
great toe of their right foot and sprinkl the blood upon the altar 
round about 

29 21 and thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar and of 
the anoint oil and sprinkl it upon aaron and upon hi garment 
and upon hi son and upon the garment of hi son with him and he 
shall be hallow and hi garment and hi son and hi son 
garment with him 

29 22 also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump and the 
fat that covereth the inward and the caul abov the liver and the 
two kidney and the fat that is upon them and the right shoulder 
for it is a ram of consecr 29 23 and one loaf of bread and one 
cake of oil bread and one wafer out of the basket of the unleaven 
bread that is befor the lord 29 24 and thou shalt put all in the 
hand of aaron and in the hand of hi son and shalt wave them for 
a wave offer befor the lord 

29 25 and thou shalt receiv them of their hand and burn them upon 
the altar for a burnt offer for a sweet savour befor the lord it 
is an offer made by fire unto the lord 

29 26 and thou shalt take the breast of the ram of aaron s 
consecr and wave it for a wave offer befor the lord and it 
shall be thi part 

29 27 and thou shalt sanctifi the breast of the wave offer and the 
shoulder of the heav offer which is wave and which is heav 
up of the ram of the consecr even of that which is for aaron 
and of that which is for hi son 29 28 and it shall be aaron s and 
hi son by a statut for ever from the child of israel for it is 
an heav offer and it shall be an heav offer from the child 
of israel of the sacrif of their peac offer even their heav 
offer unto the lord 

29 29 and the holi garment of aaron shall be hi son after him to 
be anoint therein and to be consecr in them 

29 30 and that son that is priest in hi stead shall put them on seven 
day when he cometh into the tabernacl of the congreg to 
minist in the holi place 

29 31 and thou shalt take the ram of the consecr and seeth hi 
flesh in the holi place 

29 32 and aaron and hi son shall eat the flesh of the ram and the 
bread that is in the basket by the door of the tabernacl of the 
congreg 

29 33 and they shall eat those thing wherewith the aton wa 
made to consecr and to sanctifi them but a stranger shall not eat 
thereof becau they are holi 

29 34 and if ought of the flesh of the consecr or of the bread 
remain unto the morn then thou shalt burn the remaind with fire 
it shall not be eaten becau it is holi 

29 35 and thu shalt thou do unto aaron and to hi son accord to 
all thing which i have command thee seven day shalt thou 
consecr them 

29 36 and thou shalt offer everi day a bullock for a sin offer for 
aton and thou shalt clean the altar when thou hast made an 
aton for it and thou shalt anoint it to sanctifi it 

29 37 seven day thou shalt make an aton for the altar and 
sanctifi it and it shall be an altar most holi whatsoev toucheth 
the altar shall be holi 

29 38 now thi is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar two 
lamb of the first year day by day continu 

29 39 the one lamb thou shalt offer in the morn and the other lamb 
thou shalt offer at even 29 40 and with the one lamb a tenth deal of 
flour mingl with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil and the 
fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offer 

29 41 and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even and shalt do 
thereto accord to the meat offer of the morn and accord 
to the drink offer thereof for a sweet savour an offer made by 
fire unto the lord 

29 42 thi shall be a continu burnt offer throughout your 
gener at the door of the tabernacl of the congreg befor 
the lord where i will meet you to speak there unto thee 

29 43 and there i will meet with the child of israel and the 
tabernacl shall be sanctifi by my glori 

29 44 and i will sanctifi the tabernacl of the congreg and the 
altar i will sanctifi also both aaron and hi son to minist to me 
in the priest s offic 

29 45 and i will dwell among the child of israel and will be their 
god 

29 46 and they shall know that i am the lord their god that brought 
them forth out of the land of egypt that i may dwell among them i am 
the lord their god 

30 1 and thou shalt make an altar to burn incen upon of shittim 
wood shalt thou make it 

30 2 a cubit shall be the length thereof and a cubit the breadth 
thereof foursquar shall it be and two cubit shall be the height 
thereof the horn thereof shall be of the same 

30 3 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold the top thereof and 
the side thereof round about and the horn thereof and thou shalt 
make unto it a crown of gold round about 

30 4 and two golden ring shalt thou make to it under the crown of it 
by the two corner thereof upon the two side of it shalt thou make 
it and they shall be for place for the stave to bear it withal 

30 5 and thou shalt make the stave of shittim wood and overlay them 
with gold 

30 6 and thou shalt put it befor the vail that is by the ark of the 
testimoni befor the merci seat that is over the testimoni where i 
will meet with thee 

30 7 and aaron shall burn thereon sweet incen everi morn when he 
dresseth the lamp he shall burn incen upon it 

30 8 and when aaron lighteth the lamp at even he shall burn incen 
upon it a perpetu incen befor the lord throughout your 
gener 

30 9 ye shall offer no strang incen thereon nor burnt sacrif 
nor meat offer neither shall ye pour drink offer thereon 

30 10 and aaron shall make an aton upon the horn of it onc in a 
year with the blood of the sin offer of aton onc in the 
year shall he make aton upon it throughout your gener it 
is most holi unto the lord 

30 11 and the lord spake unto mose say 30 12 when thou takest 
the sum of the child of israel after their number then shall they 
give everi man a ransom for hi soul unto the lord when thou 
numberest them that there be no plagu among them when thou 
numberest them 

30 13 thi they shall give everi one that passeth among them that are 
number half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuari a shekel 
is twenti gerah an half shekel shall be the offer of the lord 

30 14 everi one that passeth among them that are number from twenti 
year old and abov shall give an offer unto the lord 

30 15 the rich shall not give more and the poor shall not give le 
than half a shekel when they give an offer unto the lord to make 
an aton for your soul 

30 16 and thou shalt take the aton money of the child of 
israel and shalt appoint it for the servic of the tabernacl of the 
congreg that it may be a memori unto the child of israel 
befor the lord to make an aton for your soul 

30 17 and the lord spake unto mose say 30 18 thou shalt also 
make a laver of brass and hi foot also of brass to wash withal and 
thou shalt put it between the tabernacl of the congreg and the 
altar and thou shalt put water therein 

30 19 for aaron and hi son shall wash their hand and their foot 
thereat 30 20 when they go into the tabernacl of the congreg 
they shall wash with water that they die not or when they come near 
to the altar to minist to burn offer made by fire unto the lord 
30 21 so they shall wash their hand and their foot that they die 
not and it shall be a statut for ever to them even to him and to 
hi seed throughout their gener 

30 22 moreov the lord spake unto mose say 30 23 take thou also 
unto thee princip spice of pure myrrh five hundr shekel and of 
sweet cinnamon half so much even two hundr and fifti shekel and 
of sweet calamu two hundr and fifti shekel 30 24 and of cassia 
five hundr shekel after the shekel of the sanctuari and of oil 
oliv an hin 30 25 and thou shalt make it an oil of holi ointment an 
ointment compound after the art of the apothecari it shall be an holi 
anoint oil 

30 26 and thou shalt anoint the tabernacl of the congreg 
therewith and the ark of the testimoni 30 27 and the tabl and all 
hi vessel and the candlestick and hi vessel and the altar of 
incen 30 28 and the altar of burnt offer with all hi vessel 
and the laver and hi foot 

30 29 and thou shalt sanctifi them that they may be most holi 
whatsoev toucheth them shall be holi 

30 30 and thou shalt anoint aaron and hi son and consecr them 
that they may minist unto me in the priest s offic 

30 31 and thou shalt speak unto the child of israel say thi 
shall be an holi anoint oil unto me throughout your gener 

30 32 upon man s flesh shall it not be pour neither shall ye make 
ani other like it after the composit of it it is holi and it 
shall be holi unto you 

30 33 whosoev compoundeth ani like it or whosoev putteth ani of 
it upon a stranger shall even be cut off from hi peopl 

30 34 and the lord said unto mose take unto thee sweet spice 
stact and onycha and galbanum these sweet spice with pure 
frankincen of each shall there be a like weight 30 35 and thou 
shalt make it a perfum a confect after the art of the apothecari 
temper togeth pure and holi 30 36 and thou shalt beat some of it 
veri small and put of it befor the testimoni in the tabernacl of 
the congreg where i will meet with thee it shall be unto you 
most holi 

30 37 and a for the perfum which thou shalt make ye shall not make 
to yourselv accord to the composit thereof it shall be unto 
thee holi for the lord 

30 38 whosoev shall make like unto that to smell thereto shall 
even be cut off from hi peopl 

31 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 31 2 see i have call by 
name bezaleel the son of uri the son of hur of the tribe of judah 
31 3 and i have fill him with the spirit of god in wisdom and in 
understand and in knowledg and in all manner of workmanship 
31 4 to devi cun work to work in gold and in silver and in 
brass 31 5 and in cut of stone to set them and in carv of 
timber to work in all manner of workmanship 

31 6 and i behold i have given with him aholiab the son of 
ahisamach of the tribe of dan and in the heart of all that are wise 
heart i have put wisdom that they may make all that i have 
command thee 31 7 the tabernacl of the congreg and the ark 
of the testimoni and the merci seat that is thereupon and all the 
furnitur of the tabernacl 31 8 and the tabl and hi furnitur and 
the pure candlestick with all hi furnitur and the altar of incen 
31 9 and the altar of burnt offer with all hi furnitur and the 
laver and hi foot 31 10 and the cloth of servic and the holi 
garment for aaron the priest and the garment of hi son to 
minist in the priest s offic 31 11 and the anoint oil and
