the shekel of the sanctuari 7 86 the golden spoon were twelv full 
of incen weigh ten shekel apiec after the shekel of the 
sanctuari all the gold of the spoon wa an hundr and twenti 
shekel 

7 87 all the ox for the burnt offer were twelv bullock the 
ram twelv the lamb of the first year twelv with their meat 
offer and the kid of the goat for sin offer twelv 

7 88 and all the ox for the sacrif of the peac offer were 
twenti and four bullock the ram sixti the he goat sixti the 
lamb of the first year sixti thi wa the dedic of the altar 
after that it wa anoint 

7 89 and when mose wa gone into the tabernacl of the congreg 
to speak with him then he heard the voic of one speak unto him 
from off the merci seat that wa upon the ark of testimoni from 
between the two cherub and he spake unto him 

8 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 8 2 speak unto aaron and 
say unto him when thou lightest the lamp the seven lamp shall give 
light over against the candlestick 

8 3 and aaron did so he light the lamp thereof over against the 
candlestick a the lord command mose 

8 4 and thi work of the candlestick wa of beaten gold unto the 
shaft thereof unto the flower thereof wa beaten work accord 
unto the pattern which the lord had shew mose so he made the 
candlestick 

8 5 and the lord spake unto mose say 8 6 take the levit from 
among the child of israel and clean them 

8 7 and thu shalt thou do unto them to clean them sprinkl water 
of purifi upon them and let them shave all their flesh and let 
them wash their cloth and so make themselv clean 

8 8 then let them take a young bullock with hi meat offer even 
fine flour mingl with oil and anoth young bullock shalt thou take 
for a sin offer 

8 9 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the tabernacl of the 
congreg and thou shalt gather the whole assembl of the child 
of israel togeth 8 10 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the 
lord and the child of israel shall put their hand upon the 
levit 8 11 and aaron shall offer the levit befor the lord for an 
offer of the child of israel that they may execut the servic 
of the lord 

8 12 and the levit shall lay their hand upon the head of the 
bullock and thou shalt offer the one for a sin offer and the 
other for a burnt offer unto the lord to make an aton for 
the levit 

8 13 and thou shalt set the levit befor aaron and befor hi son 
and offer them for an offer unto the lord 

8 14 thu shalt thou separ the levit from among the child of 
israel and the levit shall be mine 

8 15 and after that shall the levit go in to do the servic of the 
tabernacl of the congreg and thou shalt clean them and offer 
them for an offer 

8 16 for they are wholli given unto me from among the child of 
israel instead of such a open everi womb even instead of the 
firstborn of all the child of israel have i taken them unto me 

8 17 for all the firstborn of the child of israel are mine both 
man and beast on the day that i smote everi firstborn in the land of 
egypt i sanctifi them for myself 

8 18 and i have taken the levit for all the firstborn of the 
child of israel 

8 19 and i have given the levit a a gift to aaron and to hi son 
from among the child of israel to do the servic of the child 
of israel in the tabernacl of the congreg and to make an 
aton for the child of israel that there be no plagu among 
the child of israel when the child of israel come nigh unto the 
sanctuari 

8 20 and mose and aaron and all the congreg of the child of 
israel did to the levit accord unto all that the lord command 
mose concern the levit so did the child of israel unto them 

8 21 and the levit were purifi and they wash their cloth and 
aaron offer them a an offer befor the lord and aaron made an 
aton for them to clean them 

8 22 and after that went the levit in to do their servic in the 
tabernacl of the congreg befor aaron and befor hi son a 
the lord had command mose concern the levit so did they unto 
them 

8 23 and the lord spake unto mose say 8 24 thi is it that 
belongeth unto the levit from twenti and five year old and upward 
they shall go in to wait upon the servic of the tabernacl of the 
congreg 8 25 and from the age of fifti year they shall cea 
wait upon the servic thereof and shall serv no more 8 26 but 
shall minist with their brother in the tabernacl of the 
congreg to keep the charg and shall do no servic thu shalt 
thou do unto the levit touch their charg 

9 1 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai in the 
first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of 
egypt say 9 2 let the child of israel also keep the passov 
at hi appoint season 

9 3 in the fourteenth day of thi month at even ye shall keep it in 
hi appoint season accord to all the rite of it and accord 
to all the ceremoni thereof shall ye keep it 

9 4 and mose spake unto the child of israel that they should keep 
the passov 

9 5 and they kept the passov on the fourteenth day of the first 
month at even in the wilder of sinai accord to all that the 
lord command mose so did the child of israel 

9 6 and there were certain men who were defil by the dead bodi of a 
man that they could not keep the passov on that day and they came 
befor mose and befor aaron on that day 9 7 and those men said unto 
him we are defil by the dead bodi of a man wherefor are we kept 
back that we may not offer an offer of the lord in hi appoint 
season among the child of israel 9 8 and mose said unto them 
stand still and i will hear what the lord will command concern 
you 

9 9 and the lord spake unto mose say 9 10 speak unto the 
child of israel say if ani man of you or of your poster 
shall be unclean by reason of a dead bodi or be in a journey afar 
off yet he shall keep the passov unto the lord 

9 11 the fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep 
it and eat it with unleaven bread and bitter herb 

9 12 they shall leav none of it unto the morn nor break ani bone 
of it accord to all the ordin of the passov they shall keep 
it 

9 13 but the man that is clean and is not in a journey and 
forbeareth to keep the passov even the same soul shall be cut off 
from among hi peopl becau he brought not the offer of the lord 
in hi appoint season that man shall bear hi sin 

9 14 and if a stranger shall sojourn among you and will keep the 
passov unto the lord accord to the ordin of the passov 
and accord to the manner thereof so shall he do ye shall have one 
ordin both for the stranger and for him that wa born in the 
land 

9 15 and on the day that the tabernacl wa rear up the cloud 
cover the tabernacl name the tent of the testimoni and at even 
there wa upon the tabernacl a it were the appear of fire until 
the morn 

9 16 so it wa alway the cloud cover it by day and the appear 
of fire by night 

9 17 and when the cloud wa taken up from the tabernacl then after 
that the child of israel journey and in the place where the 
cloud abod there the child of israel pitch their tent 

9 18 at the command of the lord the child of israel journey 
and at the command of the lord they pitch a long a the cloud 
abod upon the tabernacl they rest in their tent 

9 19 and when the cloud tarri long upon the tabernacl mani day 
then the child of israel kept the charg of the lord and journey 
not 

9 20 and so it wa when the cloud wa a few day upon the tabernacl 
accord to the command of the lord they abod in their tent 
and accord to the command of the lord they journey 

9 21 and so it wa when the cloud abod from even unto the morn 
and that the cloud wa taken up in the morn then they journey 
whether it wa by day or by night that the cloud wa taken up they 
journey 

9 22 or whether it were two day or a month or a year that the 
cloud tarri upon the tabernacl remain thereon the child of 
israel abod in their tent and journey not but when it wa taken 
up they journey 

9 23 at the command of the lord they rest in the tent and at 
the command of the lord they journey they kept the charg of 
the lord at the command of the lord by the hand of mose 

10 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 10 2 make thee two 
trumpet of silver of a whole piec shalt thou make them that thou 
mayest use them for the call of the assembl and for the 
journey of the camp 

10 3 and when they shall blow with them all the assembl shall 
assembl themselv to thee at the door of the tabernacl of the 
congreg 

10 4 and if they blow but with one trumpet then the princ which 
are head of the thousand of israel shall gather themselv unto 
thee 

10 5 when ye blow an alarm then the camp that lie on the east part 
shall go forward 

10 6 when ye blow an alarm the second time then the camp that lie on 
the south side shall take their journey they shall blow an alarm for 
their journey 

10 7 but when the congreg is to be gather togeth ye shall 
blow but ye shall not sound an alarm 

10 8 and the son of aaron the priest shall blow with the trumpet 
and they shall be to you for an ordin for ever throughout your 
gener 

10 9 and if ye go to war in your land against the enemi that 
oppresseth you then ye shall blow an alarm with the trumpet and ye 
shall be rememb befor the lord your god and ye shall be save 
from your enemi 

10 10 also in the day of your glad and in your solemn day and 
in the begin of your month ye shall blow with the trumpet over 
your burnt offer and over the sacrif of your peac offer 
that they may be to you for a memori befor your god i am the lord 
your god 

10 11 and it came to pa on the twentieth day of the second month in 
the second year that the cloud wa taken up from off the tabernacl 
of the testimoni 

10 12 and the child of israel took their journey out of the 
wilder of sinai and the cloud rest in the wilder of paran 

10 13 and they first took their journey accord to the command 
of the lord by the hand of mose 

10 14 in the first place went the standard of the camp of the child 
of judah accord to their armi and over hi host wa nahshon the 
son of amminadab 

10 15 and over the host of the tribe of the child of issachar wa 
nethaneel the son of zuar 

10 16 and over the host of the tribe of the child of zebulun wa 
eliab the son of helon 

10 17 and the tabernacl wa taken down and the son of gershon and 
the son of merari set forward bear the tabernacl 

10 18 and the standard of the camp of reuben set forward accord to 
their armi and over hi host wa elizur the son of shedeur 

10 19 and over the host of the tribe of the child of simeon wa 
shelumiel the son of zurishaddai 

10 20 and over the host of the tribe of the child of gad wa 
eliasaph the son of deuel 

10 21 and the kohathit set forward bear the sanctuari and the 
other did set up the tabernacl against they came 

10 22 and the standard of the camp of the child of ephraim set 
forward accord to their armi and over hi host wa elishama the 
son of ammihud 

10 23 and over the host of the tribe of the child of manasseh wa 
gamaliel the son of pedahzur 

10 24 and over the host of the tribe of the child of benjamin wa 
abidan the son of gideoni 

10 25 and the standard of the camp of the child of dan set forward 
which wa the rereward of all the camp throughout their host and 
over hi host wa ahiez the son of ammishaddai 

10 26 and over the host of the tribe of the child of asher wa 
pagiel the son of ocran 

10 27 and over the host of the tribe of the child of naphtali wa 
ahira the son of enan 

10 28 thu were the journey of the child of israel accord to 
their armi when they set forward 

10 29 and mose said unto hobab the son of raguel the midianit 
mose father in law we are journey unto the place of which the 
lord said i will give it you come thou with u and we will do thee 
good for the lord hath spoken good concern israel 

10 30 and he said unto him i will not go but i will depart to mine 
own land and to my kindr 

10 31 and he said leav u not i pray thee forasmuch a thou 
knowest how we are to encamp in the wilder and thou mayest be to 
u instead of eye 

10 32 and it shall be if thou go with u yea it shall be that what 
good the lord shall do unto u the same will we do unto thee 

10 33 and they depart from the mount of the lord three day 
journey and the ark of the coven of the lord went befor them in 
the three day journey to search out a rest place for them 

10 34 and the cloud of the lord wa upon them by day when they went 
out of the camp 

10 35 and it came to pa when the ark set forward that mose said 
rise up lord and let thine enemi be scatter and let them that 
hate thee flee befor thee 

10 36 and when it rest he said return o lord unto the mani 
thousand of israel 

11 1 and when the peopl complain it displea the lord and the 
lord heard it and hi anger wa kindl and the fire of the lord 
burnt among them and consum them that were in the uttermost part 
of the camp 

11 2 and the peopl cri unto mose and when mose pray unto the 
lord the fire wa quench 

11 3 and he call the name of the place taberah becau the fire of 
the lord burnt among them 

11 4 and the mixt multitud that wa among them fell a lust and 
the child of israel also wept again and said who shall give u 
flesh to eat 11 5 we rememb the fish which we did eat in egypt 
freeli the cucumb and the melon and the leek and the onion 
and the garlick 11 6 but now our soul is dri away there is noth 
at all besid thi manna befor our eye 

11 7 and the manna wa a coriand seed and the colour thereof a 
the colour of bdellium 

11 8 and the peopl went about and gather it and ground it in 
mill or beat it in a mortar and bake it in pan and made cake of 
it and the tast of it wa a the tast of fresh oil 

11 9 and when the dew fell upon the camp in the night the manna fell 
upon it 

11 10 then mose heard the peopl weep throughout their famili 
everi man in the door of hi tent and the anger of the lord wa 
kindl greatli mose also wa displea 

11 11 and mose said unto the lord wherefor hast thou afflict thi 
servant and wherefor have i not found favour in thi sight that thou 
layest the burden of all thi peopl upon me 11 12 have i conceiv 
all thi peopl have i begotten them that thou shouldest say unto 
me carri them in thi bosom a a nur father beareth the suck 
child unto the land which thou swarest unto their father 11 13 
whenc should i have flesh to give unto all thi peopl for they weep 
unto me say give u flesh that we may eat 

11 14 i am not abl to bear all thi peopl alon becau it is too 
heavi for me 

11 15 and if thou deal thu with me kill me i pray thee out of 
hand if i have found favour in thi sight and let me not see my 
wretch 

11 16 and the lord said unto mose gather unto me seventi men of the 
elder of israel whom thou knowest to be the elder of the peopl 
and offic over them and bring them unto the tabernacl of the 
congreg that they may stand there with thee 

11 17 and i will come down and talk with thee there and i will take 
of the spirit which is upon thee and will put it upon them and they 
shall bear the burden of the peopl with thee that thou bear it not 
thyself alon 

11 18 and say thou unto the peopl sanctifi yourselv against to 
morrow and ye shall eat flesh for ye have wept in the ear of the 
lord say who shall give u flesh to eat for it wa well with u 
in egypt therefor the lord will give you flesh and ye shall eat 

11 19 ye shall not eat one day nor two day nor five day neither 
ten day nor twenti day 11 20 but even a whole month until it come 
out at your nostril and it be loathsom unto you becau that ye 
have despi the lord which is among you and have wept befor him 
say whi came we forth out of egypt 11 21 and mose said the 
peopl among whom i am are six hundr thousand footman and thou 
hast said i will give them flesh that they may eat a whole month 

11 22 shall the flock and the herd be slain for them to suffic 
them or shall all the fish of the sea be gather togeth for them 
to suffic them 11 23 and the lord said unto mose is the lord s 
hand wax short thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to 
pa unto thee or not 

11 24 and mose went out and told the peopl the word of the lord 
and gather the seventi men of the elder of the peopl and set them 
round about the tabernacl 

11 25 and the lord came down in a cloud and spake unto him and took 
of the spirit that wa upon him and gave it unto the seventi elder 
and it came to pa that when the spirit rest upon them they 
prophesi and did not cea 

11 26 but there remain two of the men in the camp the name of the 
one wa eldad and the name of the other medad and the spirit rest 
upon them and they were of them that were written but went not out 
unto the tabernacl and they prophesi in the camp 

11 27 and there ran a young man and told mose and said eldad and 
medad do prophesi in the camp 

11 28 and joshua the son of nun the servant of mose one of hi 
young men answer and said my lord mose forbid them 

11 29 and mose said unto him enviest thou for my sake would god 
that all the lord s peopl were prophet and that the lord would put 
hi spirit upon them 11 30 and mose gat him into the camp he and 
the elder of israel 

11 31 and there went forth a wind from the lord and brought quail 
from the sea and let them fall by the camp a it were a day s 
journey on thi side and a it were a day s journey on the other 
side round about the camp and a it were two cubit high upon the 
face of the earth 

11 32 and the peopl stood up all that day and all that night and 
all the next day and they gather the quail he that gather least 
gather ten homer and they spread them all abroad for themselv 
round about the camp 

11 33 and while the flesh wa yet between their teeth ere it wa 
chew the wrath of the lord wa kindl against the peopl and the 
lord smote the peopl with a veri great plagu 

11 34 and he call the name of that place kibrothhattaavah becau 
there they buri the peopl that lust 

11 35 and the peopl journey from kibrothhattaavah unto hazeroth 
and abod at hazeroth 

12 1 and miriam and aaron spake against mose becau of the ethiopian 
woman whom he had marri for he had marri an ethiopian woman 

12 2 and they said hath the lord ind spoken onli by mose hath he 
not spoken also by u and the lord heard it 

12 3 now the man mose wa veri meek abov all the men which were 
upon the face of the earth 12 4 and the lord spake suddenli unto 
mose and unto aaron and unto miriam come out ye three unto the 
tabernacl of the congreg and they three came out 

12 5 and the lord came down in the pillar of the cloud and stood in 
the door of the tabernacl and call aaron and miriam and they both 
came forth 

12 6 and he said hear now my word if there be a prophet among you 
i the lord will make myself known unto him in a vision and will speak 
unto him in a dream 

12 7 my servant mose is not so who is faith in all mine hou 

12 8 with him will i speak mouth to mouth even appar and not in 
dark speech and the similitud of the lord shall he behold 
wherefor then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant mose 
12 9 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against them and he 
depart 

12 10 and the cloud depart from off the tabernacl and behold 
miriam becam leprou white a snow and aaron look upon miriam 
and behold she wa leprou 

12 11 and aaron said unto mose ala my lord i beseech thee lay 
not the sin upon u wherein we have done foolishli and wherein we 
have sin 

12 12 let her not be a one dead of whom the flesh is half consum 
when he cometh out of hi mother s womb 

12 13 and mose cri unto the lord say heal her now o god i 
beseech thee 

12 14 and the lord said unto mose if her father had but spit in her 
face should she not be asham seven day let her be shut out from 
the camp seven day and after that let her be receiv in again 

12 15 and miriam wa shut out from the camp seven day and the peopl 
journey not till miriam wa brought in again 

12 16 and afterward the peopl remov from hazeroth and pitch in 
the wilder of paran 

13 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 13 2 send thou men that 
they may search the land of canaan which i give unto the child of 
israel of everi tribe of their father shall ye send a man everi one 
a ruler among them 

13 3 and mose by the command of the lord sent them from the 
wilder of paran all those men were head of the child of 
israel 

13 4 and these were their name of the tribe of reuben shammua the 
son of zaccur 

13 5 of the tribe of simeon shaphat the son of hori 

13 6 of the tribe of judah caleb the son of jephunneh 

13 7 of the tribe of issachar igal the son of joseph 

13 8 of the tribe of ephraim oshea the son of nun 

13 9 of the tribe of benjamin palti the son of raphu 

13 10 of the tribe of zebulun gaddiel the son of sodi 

13 11 of the tribe of joseph name of the tribe of manasseh gaddi 
the son of susi 

13 12 of the tribe of dan ammiel the son of gemal 

13 13 of the tribe of asher sethur the son of michael 

13 14 of the tribe of naphtali nahbi the son of vophsi 

13 15 of the tribe of gad geuel the son of machi 

13 16 these are the name of the men which mose sent to spi out the 
land 

and mose call oshea the son of nun jehoshua 

13 17 and mose sent them to spi out the land of canaan and said unto 
them get you up thi way southward and go up into the mountain 
13 18 and see the land what it is and the peopl that dwelleth 
therein whether they be strong or weak few or mani 13 19 and what 
the land is that they dwell in whether it be good or bad and what 
citi they be that they dwell in whether in tent or in strong 
hold 13 20 and what the land is whether it be fat or lean whether 
there be wood therein or not and be ye of good courag and bring of 
the fruit of the land now the time wa the time of the firstrip 
grape 

13 21 so they went up and search the land from the wilder of 
zin unto rehob a men come to hamath 

13 22 and they ascend by the south and came unto hebron where 
ahiman sheshai and talmai the child of anak were now hebron 
wa built seven year befor zoan in egypt 13 23 and they came unto 
the brook of eshcol and cut down from thenc a branch with one 
cluster of grape and they bare it between two upon a staff and they 
brought of the pomegran and of the fig 

13 24 the place wa call the brook eshcol becau of the cluster of 
grape which the child of israel cut down from thenc 

13 25 and they return from search of the land after forti day 

13 26 and they went and came to mose and to aaron and to all the 
congreg of the child of israel unto the wilder of paran 
to kadesh and brought back word unto them and unto all the 
congreg and shew them the fruit of the land 

13 27 and they told him and said we came unto the land whither thou 
sentest u and sure it floweth with milk and honey and thi is the 
fruit of it 

13 28 nevertheless the peopl be strong that dwell in the land and 
the citi are wall and veri great and moreov we saw the 
child of anak there 

13 29 the amalekit dwell in the land of the south and the hittit 
and the jebusit and the amorit dwell in the mountain and the 
canaanit dwell by the sea and by the coast of jordan 

13 30 and caleb still the peopl befor mose and said let u go 
up at onc and po it for we are well abl to overcom it 

13 31 but the men that went up with him said we be not abl to go up 
against the peopl for they are stronger than we 

13 32 and they brought up an evil report of the land which they had 
search unto the child of israel say the land through which 
we have gone to search it is a land that eateth up the inhabit 
thereof and all the peopl that we saw in it are men of a great 
statur 

13 33 and there we saw the giant the son of anak which come of the 
giant and we were in our own sight a grasshopp and so we were 
in their sight 

14 1 and all the congreg lift up their voic and cri and 
the peopl wept that night 

14 2 and all the child of israel murmur against mose and against 
aaron and the whole congreg said unto them would god that we 
had die in the land of egypt or would god we had die in thi 
wilder 14 3 and wherefor hath the lord brought u unto thi 
land to fall by the sword that our wife and our child should be 
a prey were it not better for u to return into egypt 14 4 and they 
said one to anoth let u make a captain and let u return into 
egypt 

14 5 then mose and aaron fell on their face befor all the assembl 
of the congreg of the child of israel 

14 6 and joshua the son of nun and caleb the son of jephunneh which 
were of them that search the land rent their cloth 14 7 and they 
spake unto all the compani of the child of israel say the 
land which we pa through to search it is an exceed good land 

14 8 if the lord delight in u then he will bring u into thi land 
and give it u a land which floweth with milk and honey 

14 9 onli rebel not ye against the lord neither fear ye the peopl of 
the land for they are bread for u their defenc is depart from 
them and the lord is with u fear them not 

14 10 but all the congreg bade stone them with stone and the 
glori of the lord appear in the tabernacl of the congreg 
befor all the child of israel 

14 11 and the lord said unto mose how long will thi peopl provok 
me and how long will it be ere they believ me for all the sign 
which i have shew among them 14 12 i will smite them with the 
pestil and disinherit them and will make of thee a greater 
nation and mightier than they 

14 13 and mose said unto the lord then the egyptian shall hear it 
for thou broughtest up thi peopl in thi might from among them 
14 14 and they will tell it to the inhabit of thi land for they 
have heard that thou lord art among thi peopl that thou lord art 
seen face to face and that thi cloud standeth over them and that 
thou goest befor them by day time in a pillar of a cloud and in a 
pillar of fire by night 

14 15 now if thou shalt kill all thi peopl a one man then the 
nation which have heard the fame of thee will speak say 14 16 
becau the lord wa not abl to bring thi peopl into the land which 
he sware unto them therefor he hath slain them in the wilder 

14 17 and now i beseech thee let the power of my lord be great 
accord a thou hast spoken say 14 18 the lord is 
longsuff and of great merci forgiv iniqu and 
transgress and by no mean clear the guilti visit the 
iniqu of the father upon the child unto the third and fourth 
gener 

14 19 pardon i beseech thee the iniqu of thi peopl accord 
unto the great of thi merci and a thou hast forgiven thi 
peopl from egypt even until now 

14 20 and the lord said i have pardon accord to thi word 14 21 
but a truli a i live all the earth shall be fill with the glori 
of the lord 

14 22 becau all those men which have seen my glori and my miracl 
which i did in egypt and in the wilder and have tempt me now 
these ten time and have not hearken to my voic 14 23 sure they 
shall not see the land which i sware unto their father neither shall 
ani of them that provok me see it 14 24 but my servant caleb 
becau he had anoth spirit with him and hath follow me fulli 
him will i bring into the land whereinto he went and hi seed shall 
po it 

14 25 now the amalekit and the canaanit dwelt in the valley 
tomorrow turn you and get you into the wilder by the way of the 
red sea 

14 26 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 14 27 how 
long shall i bear with thi evil congreg which murmur against 
me i have heard the murmur of the child of israel which they 
murmur against me 

14 28 say unto them a truli a i live saith the lord a ye have 
spoken in mine ear so will i do to you 14 29 your carca shall 
fall in thi wilder and all that were number of you accord 
to your whole number from twenti year old and upward which have 
murmur against me 

14 30 doubtless ye shall not come into the land concern which i 
sware to make you dwell therein save caleb the son of jephunneh and 
joshua the son of nun 

14 31 but your littl one which ye said should be a prey them will 
i bring in and they shall know the land which ye have despi 

14 32 but a for you your carca they shall fall in thi 
wilder 

14 33 and your child shall wander in the wilder forti year 
and bear your whoredom until your carca be wast in the 
wilder 

14 34 after the number of the day in which ye search the land even 
forti day each day for a year shall ye bear your iniqu even 
forti year and ye shall know my breach of promi 

14 35 i the lord have said i will sure do it unto all thi evil 
congreg that are gather togeth against me in thi 
wilder they shall be consum and there they shall die 

14 36 and the men which mose sent to search the land who return 
and made all the congreg to murmur against him by bring up a 
slander upon the land 14 37 even those men that did bring up the evil 
report upon the land die by the plagu befor the lord 

14 38 but joshua the son of nun and caleb the son of jephunneh which 
were of the men that went to search the land live still 

14 39 and mose told these say unto all the child of israel 
and the peopl mourn greatli 

14 40 and they rose up earli in the morn and gat them up into the 
top of the mountain say lo we be here and will go up unto the 
place which the lord hath promi for we have sin 

14 41 and mose said wherefor now do ye transgress the command 
of the lord but it shall not prosper 

14 42 go not up for the lord is not among you that ye be not smitten 
befor your enemi 

14 43 for the amalekit and the canaanit are there befor you and 
ye shall fall by the sword becau ye are turn away from the lord 
therefor the lord will not be with you 

14 44 but they presum to go up unto the hill top nevertheless the 
ark of the coven of the lord and mose depart not out of the 
camp 

14 45 then the amalekit came down and the canaanit which dwelt in 
that hill and smote them and discomfit them even unto hormah 

15 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 15 2 speak unto the 
child of israel and say unto them when ye be come into the land 
of your habit which i give unto you 15 3 and will make an 
offer by fire unto the lord a burnt offer or a sacrif in 
perform a vow or in a freewil offer or in your solemn feast 
to make a sweet savour unto the lord of the herd or of the flock 
15 4 then shall he that offereth hi offer unto the lord bring a 
meat offer of a tenth deal of flour mingl with the fourth part of 
an hin of oil 

15 5 and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offer shalt 
thou prepar with the burnt offer or sacrif for one lamb 

15 6 or for a ram thou shalt prepar for a meat offer two tenth 
deal of flour mingl with the third part of an hin of oil 

15 7 and for a drink offer thou shalt offer the third part of an 
hin of wine for a sweet savour unto the lord 

15 8 and when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offer or for a 
sacrif in perform a vow or peac offer unto the lord 15 9 
then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offer of three tenth 
deal of flour mingl with half an hin of oil 

15 10 and thou shalt bring for a drink offer half an hin of wine 
for an offer made by fire of a sweet savour unto the lord 

15 11 thu shall it be done for one bullock or for one ram or for a 
lamb or a kid 

15 12 accord to the number that ye shall prepar so shall ye do to 
everi one accord to their number 

15 13 all that are born of the countri shall do these thing after 
thi manner in offer an offer made by fire of a sweet savour 
unto the lord 

15 14 and if a stranger sojourn with you or whosoev be among you in 
your gener and will offer an offer made by fire of a sweet 
savour unto the lord a ye do so he shall do 

15 15 one ordin shall be both for you of the congreg and 
also for the stranger that sojourneth with you an ordin for ever 
in your gener a ye are so shall the stranger be befor the 
lord 

15 16 one law and one manner shall be for you and for the stranger 
that sojourneth with you 

15 17 and the lord spake unto mose say 15 18 speak unto the 
child of israel and say unto them when ye come into the land 
whither i bring you 15 19 then it shall be that when ye eat of the 
bread of the land ye shall offer up an heav offer unto the lord 

15 20 ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heav 
offer a ye do the heav offer of the threshingfloor so shall 
ye heav it 

15 21 of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the lord an heav 
offer in your gener 

15 22 and if ye have er and not observ all these command 
which the lord hath spoken unto mose 15 23 even all that the lord 
hath command you by the hand of mose from the day that the lord 
command mose and henceforward among your gener 15 24 then 
it shall be if ought be commit by ignor without the knowledg 
of the congreg that all the congreg shall offer one young 
bullock for a burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the lord with 
hi meat offer and hi drink offer accord to the manner 
and one kid of the goat for a sin offer 

15 25 and the priest shall make an aton for all the congreg 
of the child of israel and it shall be forgiven them for it is 
ignor and they shall bring their offer a sacrif made by 
fire unto the lord and their sin offer befor the lord for their 
ignor 15 26 and it shall be forgiven all the congreg of the 
child of israel and the stranger that sojourneth among them 
see all the peopl were in ignor 

15 27 and if ani soul sin through ignor then he shall bring a she 
goat of the first year for a sin offer 

15 28 and the priest shall make an aton for the soul that sinneth 
ignorantli when he sinneth by ignor befor the lord to make an 
aton for him and it shall be forgiven him 

15 29 ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignor 
both for him that is born among the child of israel and for the 
stranger that sojourneth among them 

15 30 but the soul that doeth ought presumptu whether he be born 
in the land or a stranger the same reproacheth the lord and that 
soul shall be cut off from among hi peopl 

15 31 becau he hath despi the word of the lord and hath broken 
hi command that soul shall utterli be cut off hi iniqu 
shall be upon him 

15 32 and while the child of israel were in the wilder they 
found a man that gather stick upon the sabbath day 

15 33 and they that found him gather stick brought him unto mose 
and aaron and unto all the congreg 

15 34 and they put him in ward becau it wa not declar what 
should be done to him 

15 35 and the lord said unto mose the man shall be sure put to 
death all the congreg shall stone him with stone without the 
camp 

15 36 and all the congreg brought him without the camp and 
stone him with stone and he die a the lord command mose 

15 37 and the lord spake unto mose say 15 38 speak unto the 
child of israel and bid them that they make them fring in the 
border of their garment throughout their gener and that they 
put upon the fring of the border a ribband of blue 15 39 and it 
shall be unto you for a fring that ye may look upon it and rememb 
all the command of the lord and do them and that ye seek not 
after your own heart and your own eye after which ye use to go a 
whore 15 40 that ye may rememb and do all my command and 
be holi unto your god 

15 41 i am the lord your god which brought you out of the land of 
egypt to be your god i am the lord your god 

16 1 now korah the son of izhar the son of kohath the son of levi 
and dathan and abiram the son of eliab and on the son of peleth 
son of reuben took men 16 2 and they rose up befor mose with 
certain of the child of israel two hundr and fifti princ of 
the assembl famou in the congreg men of renown 16 3 and they 
gather themselv togeth against mose and against aaron and said 
unto them ye take too much upon you see all the congreg are 
holi everi one of them and the lord is among them wherefor then 
lift ye up yourselv abov the congreg of the lord 16 4 and 
when mose heard it he fell upon hi face 16 5 and he spake unto 
korah and unto all hi compani say even to morrow the lord will 
shew who are hi and who is holi and will cau him to come near 
unto him even him whom he hath chosen will he cau to come near unto 
him 

16 6 thi do take you censer korah and all hi compani 16 7 and 
put fire therein and put incen in them befor the lord to morrow 
and it shall be that the man whom the lord doth choo he shall be 
holi ye take too much upon you ye son of levi 

16 8 and mose said unto korah hear i pray you ye son of levi 
16 9 seemeth it but a small thing unto you that the god of israel 
hath separ you from the congreg of israel to bring you near 
to himself to do the servic of the tabernacl of the lord and to 
stand befor the congreg to minist unto them 16 10 and he 
hath brought thee near to him and all thi brother the son of levi 
with thee and seek ye the priesthood also 16 11 for which cau 
both thou and all thi compani are gather togeth against the lord 
and what is aaron that ye murmur against him 16 12 and mose sent 
to call dathan and abiram the son of eliab which said we will not 
come up 16 13 is it a small thing that thou hast brought u up out of 
a land that floweth with milk and honey to kill u in the wilder 
except thou make thyself altogeth a princ over u 16 14 moreov 
thou hast not brought u into a land that floweth with milk and honey 
or given u inherit of field and vineyard wilt thou put out the 
eye of these men we will not come up 

16 15 and mose wa veri wroth and said unto the lord respect not 
thou their offer i have not taken one a from them neither have 
i hurt one of them 

16 16 and mose said unto korah be thou and all thi compani befor 
the lord thou and they and aaron to morrow 16 17 and take everi 
man hi censer and put incen in them and bring ye befor the lord 
everi man hi censer two hundr and fifti censer thou also and 
aaron each of you hi censer 

16 18 and they took everi man hi censer and put fire in them and 
laid incen thereon and stood in the door of the tabernacl of the 
congreg with mose and aaron 

16 19 and korah gather all the congreg against them unto the 
door of the tabernacl of the congreg and the glori of the lord 
appear unto all the congreg 

16 20 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 16 21 
separ yourselv from among thi congreg that i may consum 
them in a moment 

16 22 and they fell upon their face and said o god the god of the 
spirit of all flesh shall one man sin and wilt thou be wroth with 
all the congreg 16 23 and the lord spake unto mose say 
16 24 speak unto the congreg say get you up from about the 
tabernacl of korah dathan and abiram 

16 25 and mose rose up and went unto dathan and abiram and the 
elder of israel follow him 

16 26 and he spake unto the congreg say depart i pray you 
from the tent of these wick men and touch noth of their s lest 
ye be consum in all their sin 

16 27 so they gat up from the tabernacl of korah dathan and abiram 
on everi side and dathan and abiram came out and stood in the door 
of their tent and their wife and their son and their littl 
child 

16 28 and mose said herebi ye shall know that the lord hath sent me 
to do all these work for i have not done them of mine own mind 

16 29 if these men die the common death of all men or if they be 
visit after the visit of all men then the lord hath not sent 
me 

16 30 but if the lord make a new thing and the earth open her mouth 
and swallow them up with all that appertain unto them and they go 
down quick into the pit then ye shall understand that these men have 
provok the lord 

16 31 and it came to pa a he had made an end of speak all these 
word that the ground clave asund that wa under them 16 32 and 
the earth open her mouth and swallow them up and their hou 
and all the men that appertain unto korah and all their good 

16 33 they and all that appertain to them went down aliv into the 
pit and the earth close upon them and they perish from among the 
congreg 

16 34 and all israel that were round about them fled at the cri of 
them for they said lest the earth swallow u up also 

16 35 and there came out a fire from the lord and consum the two 
hundr and fifti men that offer incen 

16 36 and the lord spake unto mose say 16 37 speak unto eleazar 
the son of aaron the priest that he take up the censer out of the 
burn and scatter thou the fire yonder for they are hallow 

16 38 the censer of these sinner against their own soul let them 
make them broad plate for a cover of the altar for they offer 
them befor the lord therefor they are hallow and they shall be a 
sign unto the child of israel 

16 39 and eleazar the priest took the brasen censer wherewith they 
that were burnt had offer and they were made broad plate for a 
cover of the altar 16 40 to be a memori unto the child of 
israel that no stranger which is not of the seed of aaron come near 
to offer incen befor the lord that he be not a korah and a hi 
compani a the lord said to him by the hand of mose 

16 41 but on the morrow all the congreg of the child of israel 
murmur against mose and against aaron say ye have kill the 
peopl of the lord 

16 42 and it came to pa when the congreg wa gather against 
mose and against aaron that they look toward the tabernacl of the 
congreg and behold the cloud cover it and the glori of the 
lord appear 

16 43 and mose and aaron came befor the tabernacl of the 
congreg 

16 44 and the lord spake unto mose say 16 45 get you up from 
among thi congreg that i may consum them a in a moment and 
they fell upon their face 

16 46 and mose said unto aaron take a censer and put fire therein 
from off the altar and put on incen and go quickli unto the 
congreg and make an aton for them for there is wrath gone 
out from the lord the plagu is begun 

16 47 and aaron took a mose command and ran into the midst of the 
congreg and behold the plagu wa begun among the peopl and 
he put on incen and made an aton for the peopl 

16 48 and he stood between the dead and the live and the plagu wa 
stay 

16 49 now they that die in the plagu were fourteen thousand and 
seven hundr besid them that die about the matter of korah 

16 50 and aaron return unto mose unto the door of the tabernacl of 
the congreg and the plagu wa stay 

17 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 17 2 speak unto the 
child of israel and take of everi one of them a rod accord to 
the hou of their father of all their princ accord to the 
hou of their father twelv rod write thou everi man s name upon 
hi rod 

17 3 and thou shalt write aaron s name upon the rod of levi for one 
rod shall be for the head of the hou of their father 

17 4 and thou shalt lay them up in the tabernacl of the congreg 
befor the testimoni where i will meet with you 

17 5 and it shall come to pa that the man s rod whom i shall 
choo shall blossom and i will make to cea from me the murmur 
of the child of israel wherebi they murmur against you 

17 6 and mose spake unto the child of israel and everi one of 
their princ gave him a rod apiec for each princ one accord to 
their father hou even twelv rod and the rod of aaron wa 
among their rod 

17 7 and mose laid up the rod befor the lord in the tabernacl of 
wit 

17 8 and it came to pa that on the morrow mose went into the 
tabernacl of wit and behold the rod of aaron for the hou of 
levi wa bud and brought forth bud and bloom blossom and 
yield almond 

17 9 and mose brought out all the rod from befor the lord unto all 
the child of israel and they look and took everi man hi rod 

17 10 and the lord said unto mose bring aaron s rod again befor the 
testimoni to be kept for a token against the rebel and thou shalt 
quit take away their murmur from me that they die not 

17 11 and mose did so a the lord command him so did he 

17 12 and the child of israel spake unto mose say behold we 
die we perish we all perish 

17 13 whosoev cometh ani thing near unto the tabernacl of the lord 
shall die shall we be consum with die 18 1 and the lord said 
unto aaron thou and thi son and thi father s hou with thee shall 
bear the iniqu of the sanctuari and thou and thi son with thee 
shall bear the iniqu of your priesthood 

18 2 and thi brother also of the tribe of levi the tribe of thi 
father bring thou with thee that they may be join unto thee and 
minist unto thee but thou and thi son with thee shall minist 
befor the tabernacl of wit 

18 3 and they shall keep thi charg and the charg of all the 
tabernacl onli they shall not come nigh the vessel of the sanctuari 
and the altar that neither they nor ye also die 

18 4 and they shall be join unto thee and keep the charg of the 
tabernacl of the congreg for all the servic of the tabernacl 
and a stranger shall not come nigh unto you 

18 5 and ye shall keep the charg of the sanctuari and the charg of 
the altar that there be no wrath ani more upon the child of 
israel 

18 6 and i behold i have taken your brother the levit from among 
the child of israel to you they are given a a gift for the lord 
to do the servic of the tabernacl of the congreg 

18 7 therefor thou and thi son with thee shall keep your priest s 
offic for everyth of the altar and within the vail and ye shall 
serv i have given your priest s offic unto you a a servic of 
gift and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death 

18 8 and the lord spake unto aaron behold i also have given thee the 
charg of mine heav offer of all the hallow thing of the 
child of israel unto thee have i given them by reason of the 
anoint and to thi son by an ordin for ever 

18 9 thi shall be thine of the most holi thing reserv from the 
fire everi oblat of their everi meat offer of their and 
everi sin offer of their and everi trespass offer of their 
which they shall render unto me shall be most holi for thee and for 
thi son 

18 10 in the most holi place shalt thou eat it everi male shall eat 
it it shall be holi unto thee 

18 11 and thi is thine the heav offer of their gift with all 
the wave offer of the child of israel i have given them unto 
thee and to thi son and to thi daughter with thee by a statut for 
ever everi one that is clean in thi hou shall eat of it 

18 12 all the best of the oil and all the best of the wine and of 
the wheat the firstfruit of them which they shall offer unto the 
lord them have i given thee 

18 13 and whatsoev is first ripe in the land which they shall bring 
unto the lord shall be thine everi one that is clean in thine hou 
shall eat of it 

18 14 everi thing devot in israel shall be thine 

18 15 everi thing that openeth the matrix in all flesh which they 
bring unto the lord whether it be of men or beast shall be thine 
nevertheless the firstborn of man shalt thou sure redeem and the 
firstl of unclean beast shalt thou redeem 

18 16 and those that are to be redeem from a month old shalt thou 
redeem accord to thine estim for the money of five shekel 
after the shekel of the sanctuari which is twenti gerah 

18 17 but the firstl of a cow or the firstl of a sheep or the 
firstl of a goat thou shalt not redeem they are holi thou shalt 
sprinkl their blood upon the altar and shalt burn their fat for an 
offer made by fire for a sweet savour unto the lord 

18 18 and the flesh of them shall be thine a the wave breast and a 
the right shoulder are thine 

18 19 all the heav offer of the holi thing which the child 
of israel offer unto the lord have i given thee and thi son and thi 
daughter with thee by a statut for ever it is a coven of salt 
for ever befor the lord unto thee and to thi seed with thee 

18 20 and the lord spake unto aaron thou shalt have no inherit in 
their land neither shalt thou have ani part among them i am thi part 
and thine inherit among the child of israel 

18 21 and behold i have given the child of levi all the tenth in 
israel for an inherit for their servic which they serv even 
the servic of the tabernacl of the congreg 

18 22 neither must the child of israel henceforth come nigh the 
tabernacl of the congreg lest they bear sin and die 

18 23 but the levit shall do the servic of the tabernacl of the 
congreg and they shall bear their iniqu it shall be a 
statut for ever throughout your gener that among the child 
of israel they have no inherit 

18 24 but the tith of the child of israel which they offer a an 
heav offer unto the lord i have given to the levit to inherit 
therefor i have said unto them among the child of israel they 
shall have no inherit 

18 25 and the lord spake unto mose say 18 26 thu speak unto the 
levit and say unto them when ye take of the child of israel the 
tith which i have given you from them for your inherit then ye 
shall offer up an heav offer of it for the lord even a tenth part 
of the tith 

18 27 and thi your heav offer shall be reckon unto you a 
though it were the corn of the threshingfloor and a the ful of 
the winepress 

18 28 thu ye also shall offer an heav offer unto the lord of all 
your tith which ye receiv of the child of israel and ye shall 
give thereof the lord s heav offer to aaron the priest 

18 29 out of all your gift ye shall offer everi heav offer of the 
lord of all the best thereof even the hallow part thereof out of 
it 

18 30 therefor thou shalt say unto them when ye have heav the best 
thereof from it then it shall be count unto the levit a the 
increa of the threshingfloor and a the increa of the winepress 

18 31 and ye shall eat it in everi place ye and your household for 
it is your reward for your servic in the tabernacl of the 
congreg 

18 32 and ye shall bear no sin by reason of it when ye have heav 
from it the best of it neither shall ye pollut the holi thing of 
the child of israel lest ye die 

19 1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 19 2 thi 
is the ordin of the law which the lord hath command say 
speak unto the child of israel that they bring thee a red heifer 
without spot wherein is no blemish and upon which never came yoke 
19 3 and ye shall give her unto eleazar the priest that he may bring 
her forth without the camp and one shall slay her befor hi face 
19 4 and eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with hi finger 
and sprinkl of her blood directli befor the tabernacl of the 
congreg seven time 19 5 and one shall burn the heifer in hi 
sight her skin and her flesh and her blood with her dung shall he 
burn 19 6 and the priest shall take cedar wood and hyssop and 
scarlet and cast it into the midst of the burn of the heifer 

19 7 then the priest shall wash hi cloth and he shall bath hi 
flesh in water and afterward he shall come into the camp and the 
priest shall be unclean until the even 

19 8 and he that burneth her shall wash hi cloth in water and 
bath hi flesh in water and shall be unclean until the even 

19 9 and a man that is clean shall gather up the ash of the heifer 
and lay them up without the camp in a clean place and it shall be 
kept for the congreg of the child of israel for a water of 
separ it is a purif for sin 

19 10 and he that gathereth the ash of the heifer shall wash hi 
cloth and be unclean until the even and it shall be unto the 
child of israel and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them 
for a statut for ever 

19 11 he that toucheth the dead bodi of ani man shall be unclean seven 
day 

19 12 he shall purifi himself with it on the third day and on the 
seventh day he shall be clean but if he purifi not himself the third 
day then the seventh day he shall not be clean 

19 13 whosoev toucheth the dead bodi of ani man that is dead and 
purifieth not himself defileth the tabernacl of the lord and that 
soul shall be cut off from israel becau the water of separ wa 
not sprinkl upon him he shall be unclean hi unclean is yet 
upon him 

19 14 thi is the law when a man dieth in a tent all that come into 
the tent and all that is in the tent shall be unclean seven day 

19 15 and everi open vessel which hath no cover bound upon it is 
unclean 

19 16 and whosoev toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the 
open field or a dead bodi or a bone of a man or a grave shall be 
unclean seven day 

19 17 and for an unclean person they shall take of the ash of the 
burnt heifer of purif for sin and run water shall be put 
thereto in a vessel 19 18 and a clean person shall take hyssop and 
dip it in the water and sprinkl it upon the tent and upon all the 
vessel and upon the person that were there and upon him that 
touch a bone or one slain or one dead or a grave 19 19 and the 
clean person shall sprinkl upon the unclean on the third day and on 
the seventh day and on the seventh day he shall purifi himself and 
wash hi cloth and bath himself in water and shall be clean at 
even 

19 20 but the man that shall be unclean and shall not purifi himself 
that soul shall be cut off from among the congreg becau he 
hath defil the sanctuari of the lord the water of separ hath 
not been sprinkl upon him he is unclean 

19 21 and it shall be a perpetu statut unto them that he that 
sprinkleth the water of separ shall wash hi cloth and he that 
toucheth the water of separ shall be unclean until even 

19 22 and whatsoev the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean and 
the soul that toucheth it shall be unclean until even 

20 1 then came the child of israel even the whole congreg 
into the desert of zin in the first month and the peopl abod in 
kadesh and miriam die there and wa buri there 

20 2 and there wa no water for the congreg and they gather 
themselv togeth against mose and against aaron 

20 3 and the peopl chode with mose and spake say would god 
that we had die when our brother die befor the lord 20 4 and whi 
have ye brought up the congreg of the lord into thi wilder 
that we and our cattl should die there 20 5 and wherefor have ye 
made u to come up out of egypt to bring u in unto thi evil place 
it is no place of seed or of fig or of vine or of pomegran 
neither is there ani water to drink 

20 6 and mose and aaron went from the presenc of the assembl unto 
the door of the tabernacl of the congreg and they fell upon 
their face and the glori of the lord appear unto them 

20 7 and the lord spake unto mose say 20 8 take the rod and 
gather thou the assembl togeth thou and aaron thi brother and 
speak ye unto the rock befor their eye and it shall give forth hi 
water and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock so 
thou shalt give the congreg and their beast drink 

20 9 and mose took the rod from befor the lord a he command him 

20 10 and mose and aaron gather the congreg togeth befor 
the rock and he said unto them hear now ye rebel must we fetch 
you water out of thi rock 20 11 and mose lift up hi hand and 
with hi rod he smote the rock twice and the water came out 
abundantli and the congreg drank and their beast also 

20 12 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron becau ye believ me 
not to sanctifi me in the eye of the child of israel therefor 
ye shall not bring thi congreg into the land which i have given 
them 

20 13 thi is the water of meribah becau the child of israel 
strove with the lord and he wa sanctifi in them 

20 14 and mose sent messeng from kadesh unto the king of edom 
thu saith thi brother israel thou knowest all the travail that hath 
befallen u 20 15 how our father went down into egypt and we have 
dwelt in egypt a long time and the egyptian vex u and our 
father 20 16 and when we cri unto the lord he heard our voic 
and sent an angel and hath brought u forth out of egypt and 
behold we are in kadesh a citi in the uttermost of thi border 20 17 
let u pa i pray thee through thi countri we will not pa 
through the field or through the vineyard neither will we drink of 
the water of the well we will go by the king s high way we will not 
turn to the right hand nor to the left until we have pa thi 
border 

20 18 and edom said unto him thou shalt not pa by me lest i come 
out against thee with the sword 

20 19 and the child of israel said unto him we will go by the high 
way and if i and my cattl drink of thi water then i will pay for 
it i will onli without do anyth el go through on my foot 

20 20 and he said thou shalt not go through and edom came out 
against him with much peopl and with a strong hand 

20 21 thu edom refu to give israel passag through hi border 
wherefor israel turn away from him 

20 22 and the child of israel even the whole congreg 
journey from kadesh and came unto mount hor 

20 23 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron in mount hor by the 
coast of the land of edom say 20 24 aaron shall be gather unto 
hi peopl for he shall not enter into the land which i have given 
unto the child of israel becau ye rebel against my word at 
the water of meribah 

20 25 take aaron and eleazar hi son and bring them up unto mount 
hor 20 26 and strip aaron of hi garment and put them upon eleazar 
hi son and aaron shall be gather unto hi peopl and shall die 
there 

20 27 and mose did a the lord command and they went up into mount 
hor in the sight of all the congreg 

20 28 and mose strip aaron of hi garment and put them upon 
eleazar hi son and aaron die there in the top of the mount and 
mose and eleazar came down from the mount 

20 29 and when all the congreg saw that aaron wa dead they 
mourn for aaron thirti day even all the hou of israel 

21 1 and when king arad the canaanit which dwelt in the south heard 
tell that israel came by the way of the spi then he fought against 
israel and took some of them prison 

21 2 and israel vow a vow unto the lord and said if thou wilt 
ind deliv thi peopl into my hand then i will utterli destroy 
their citi 

21 3 and the lord hearken to the voic of israel and deliv up 
the canaanit and they utterli destroy them and their citi and 
he call the name of the place hormah 

21 4 and they journey from mount hor by the way of the red sea to 
compass the land of edom and the soul of the peopl wa much 
discourag becau of the way 

21 5 and the peopl spake against god and against mose wherefor 
have ye brought u up out of egypt to die in the wilder for there 
is no bread neither is there ani water and our soul loatheth thi 
light bread 

21 6 and the lord sent fieri serpent among the peopl and they bit 
the peopl and much peopl of israel die 

21 7 therefor the peopl came to mose and said we have sin for 
we have spoken against the lord and against thee pray unto the lord 
that he take away the serpent from u and mose pray for the 
peopl 

21 8 and the lord said unto mose make thee a fieri serpent and set 
it upon a pole and it shall come to pa that everi one that is 
bitten when he looketh upon it shall live 

21 9 and mose made a serpent of brass and put it upon a pole and it 
came to pa that if a serpent had bitten ani man when he beheld the 
serpent of brass he live 

21 10 and the child of israel set forward and pitch in oboth 

21 11 and they journey from oboth and pitch at ijeabarim in the 
wilder which is befor moab toward the sunri 

21 12 from thenc they remov and pitch in the valley of zare 

21 13 from thenc they remov and pitch on the other side of 
arnon which is in the wilder that cometh out of the coast of the 
amorit for arnon is the border of moab between moab and the 
amorit 

21 14 wherefor it is said in the book of the war of the lord what 
he did in the red sea and in the brook of arnon 21 15 and at the 
stream of the brook that goeth down to the dwell of ar and lieth 
upon the border of moab 

21 16 and from thenc they went to beer that is the well whereof the 
lord spake unto mose gather the peopl togeth and i will give 
them water 

21 17 then israel sang thi song spring up o well sing ye unto it 
21 18 the princ dig the well the nobl of the peopl dig it 
by the direct of the lawgiv with their stave and from the 
wilder they went to mattanah 21 19 and from mattanah to nahaliel 
and from nahaliel to bamoth 21 20 and from bamoth in the valley that 
is in the countri of moab to the top of pisgah which looketh toward 
jeshimon 

21 21 and israel sent messeng unto sihon king of the amorit 
say 21 22 let me pa through thi land we will not turn into the 
field or into the vineyard we will not drink of the water of the 
well but we will go along by the king s high way until we be past 
thi border 

21 23 and sihon would not suffer israel to pa through hi border 
but sihon gather all hi peopl togeth and went out against 
israel into the wilder and he came to jahaz and fought against 
israel 

21 24 and israel smote him with the edg of the sword and poss 
hi land from arnon unto jabbok even unto the child of ammon for 
the border of the child of ammon wa strong 

21 25 and israel took all these citi and israel dwelt in all the 
citi of the amorit in heshbon and in all the villag thereof 

21 26 for heshbon wa the citi of sihon the king of the amorit who 
had fought against the former king of moab and taken all hi land out 
of hi hand even unto arnon 

21 27 wherefor they that speak in proverb say come into heshbon 
let the citi of sihon be built and prepar 21 28 for there is a fire 
gone out of heshbon a flame from the citi of sihon it hath consum 
ar of moab and the lord of the high place of arnon 

21 29 woe to thee moab thou art undon o peopl of chemosh he hath 
given hi son that escap and hi daughter into captiv unto 
sihon king of the amorit 

21 30 we have shot at them heshbon is perish even unto dibon and 
we have laid them wast even unto nophah which reacheth unto medeba 

21 31 thu israel dwelt in the land of the amorit 

21 32 and mose sent to spi out jaazer and they took the villag 
thereof and drove out the amorit that were there 

21 33 and they turn and went up by the way of bashan and og the 
king of bashan went out against them he and all hi peopl to the 
battl at edrei 

21 34 and the lord said unto mose fear him not for i have deliv 
him into thi hand and all hi peopl and hi land and thou shalt do 
to him a thou didst unto sihon king of the amorit which dwelt at 
heshbon 

21 35 so they smote him and hi son and all hi peopl until there 
wa none left him aliv and they poss hi land 

22 1 and the child of israel set forward and pitch in the plain 
of moab on thi side jordan by jericho 

22 2 and balak the son of zippor saw all that israel had done to the 
amorit 

22 3 and moab wa sore afraid of the peopl becau they were mani 
and moab wa distress becau of the child of israel 

22 4 and moab said unto the elder of midian now shall thi compani 
lick up all that are round about u a the ox licketh up the grass of 
the field 

and balak the son of zippor wa king of the moabit at that time 

22 5 he sent messeng therefor unto balaam the son of beor to 
pethor which is by the river of the land of the child of hi 
peopl to call him say behold there is a peopl come out from 
egypt behold they cover the face of the earth and they abid over 
against me 22 6 come now therefor i pray thee cur me thi 
peopl for they are too mighti for me peradventur i shall prevail 
that we may smite them and that i may drive them out of the land for 
i wot that he whom thou blessest is bless and he whom thou cursest 
is cur 

22 7 and the elder of moab and the elder of midian depart with the 
reward of divin in their hand and they came unto balaam and 
spake unto him the word of balak 

22 8 and he said unto them lodg here thi night and i will bring 
you word again a the lord shall speak unto me and the princ of 
moab abod with balaam 

22 9 and god came unto balaam and said what men are these with thee 
22 10 and balaam said unto god balak the son of zippor king of moab 
hath sent unto me say 22 11 behold there is a peopl come out of 
egypt which covereth the face of the earth come now cur me them 
peradventur i shall be abl to overcom them and drive them out 

22 12 and god said unto balaam thou shalt not go with them thou 
shalt not cur the peopl for they are bless 

22 13 and balaam rose up in the morn and said unto the princ of 
balak get you into your land for the lord refuseth to give me leav 
to go with you 

22 14 and the princ of moab rose up and they went unto balak and 
said balaam refuseth to come with u 

22 15 and balak sent yet again princ more and more honour than 
they 

22 16 and they came to balaam and said to him thu saith balak the 
son of zippor let noth i pray thee hinder thee from come unto 
me 22 17 for i will promot thee unto veri great honour and i will 
do whatsoev thou sayest unto me come therefor i pray thee cur 
me thi peopl 

22 18 and balaam answer and said unto the servant of balak if 
balak would give me hi hou full of silver and gold i cannot go 
beyond the word of the lord my god to do le or more 

22 19 now therefor i pray you tarri ye also here thi night that i 
may know what the lord will say unto me more 

22 20 and god came unto balaam at night and said unto him if the men 
come to call thee rise up and go with them but yet the word which i 
shall say unto thee that shalt thou do 

22 21 and balaam rose up in the morn and saddl hi a and went 
with the princ of moab 

22 22 and god s anger wa kindl becau he went and the angel of 
the lord stood in the way for an adversari against him now he wa 
ride upon hi a and hi two servant were with him 

22 23 and the a saw the angel of the lord stand in the way and 
hi sword drawn in hi hand and the a turn asid out of the way 
and went into the field and balaam smote the a to turn her into 
the way 

22 24 but the angel of the lord stood in a path of the vineyard a 
wall be on thi side and a wall on that side 

22 25 and when the a saw the angel of the lord she thrust herself 
unto the wall and crush balaam s foot against the wall and he 
smote her again 

22 26 and the angel of the lord went further and stood in a narrow 
place where wa no way to turn either to the right hand or to the 
left 

22 27 and when the a saw the angel of the lord she fell down under 
balaam and balaam s anger wa kindl and he smote the a with a 
staff 

22 28 and the lord open the mouth of the a and she said unto 
balaam what have i done unto thee that thou hast smitten me these 
three time 22 29 and balaam said unto the a becau thou hast 
mock me i would there were a sword in mine hand for now would i 
kill thee 

22 30 and the a said unto balaam am not i thine a upon which 
thou hast ridden ever sinc i wa thine unto thi day wa i ever wont 
to do so unto thee and he said nay 

22 31 then the lord open the eye of balaam and he saw the angel of 
the lord stand in the way and hi sword drawn in hi hand and he 
bow down hi head and fell flat on hi face 

22 32 and the angel of the lord said unto him wherefor hast thou 
smitten thine a these three time behold i went out to withstand 
thee becau thi way is perver befor me 22 33 and the a saw me 
and turn from me these three time unless she had turn from me 
sure now also i had slain thee and save her aliv 

22 34 and balaam said unto the angel of the lord i have sin for i 
knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me now therefor if 
it displea thee i will get me back again 

22 35 and the angel of the lord said unto balaam go with the men but 
onli the word that i shall speak unto thee that thou shalt speak so 
balaam went with the princ of balak 

22 36 and when balak heard that balaam wa come he went out to meet 
him unto a citi of moab which is in the border of arnon which is in 
the utmost coast 

22 37 and balak said unto balaam did i not earnestli send unto thee 
to call thee wherefor camest thou not unto me am i not abl ind 
to promot thee to honour 22 38 and balaam said unto balak lo i am 
come unto thee have i now ani power at all to say ani thing the word 
that god putteth in my mouth that shall i speak 

22 39 and balaam went with balak and they came unto kirjathhuzoth 

22 40 and balak offer ox and sheep and sent to balaam and to the 
princ that were with him 

22 41 and it came to pa on the morrow that balak took balaam and 
brought him up into the high place of baal that thenc he might see 
the utmost part of the peopl 

23 1 and balaam said unto balak build me here seven altar and 
prepar me here seven ox and seven ram 

23 2 and balak did a balaam had spoken and balak and balaam offer 
on everi altar a bullock and a ram 

23 3 and balaam said unto balak stand by thi burnt offer and i 
will go peradventur the lord will come to meet me and whatsoev he 
sheweth me i will tell thee and he went to an high place 

23 4 and god met balaam and he said unto him i have prepar seven 
altar and i have offer upon everi altar a bullock and a ram 

23 5 and the lord put a word in balaam s mouth and said return unto 
balak and thu thou shalt speak 

23 6 and he return unto him and lo he stood by hi burnt 
sacrif he and all the princ of moab 

23 7 and he took up hi parabl and said balak the king of moab hath 
brought me from aram out of the mountain of the east say come 
cur me jacob and come defi israel 

23 8 how shall i cur whom god hath not cur or how shall i defi 
whom the lord hath not defi 23 9 for from the top of the rock i 
see him and from the hill i behold him lo the peopl shall dwell 
alon and shall not be reckon among the nation 

23 10 who can count the dust of jacob and the number of the fourth 
part of israel let me die the death of the righteou and let my last 
end be like hi 23 11 and balak said unto balaam what hast thou 
done unto me i took thee to cur mine enemi and behold thou 
hast bless them altogeth 

23 12 and he answer and said must i not take heed to speak that 
which the lord hath put in my mouth 23 13 and balak said unto him 
come i pray thee with me unto anoth place from whenc thou mayest 
see them thou shalt see but the utmost part of them and shalt not 
see them all and cur me them from thenc 

23 14 and he brought him into the field of zophim to the top of 
pisgah and built seven altar and offer a bullock and a ram on 
everi altar 

23 15 and he said unto balak stand here by thi burnt offer while 
i meet the lord yonder 

23 16 and the lord met balaam and put a word in hi mouth and said 
go again unto balak and say thu 

23 17 and when he came to him behold he stood by hi burnt offer 
and the princ of moab with him and balak said unto him what hath 
the lord spoken 23 18 and he took up hi parabl and said rise up 
balak and hear hearken unto me thou son of zippor 23 19 god is not 
a man that he should lie neither the son of man that he should 
repent hath he said and shall he not do it or hath he spoken and 
shall he not make it good 23 20 behold i have receiv command 
to bless and he hath bless and i cannot rever it 

23 21 he hath not beheld iniqu in jacob neither hath he seen 
perver in israel the lord hi god is with him and the shout of 
a king is among them 

23 22 god brought them out of egypt he hath a it were the strength 
of an unicorn 

23 23 sure there is no enchant against jacob neither is there 
ani divin against israel accord to thi time it shall be said 
of jacob and of israel what hath god wrought 23 24 behold the 
peopl shall rise up a a great lion and lift up himself a a young 
lion he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey and drink the 
blood of the slain 

23 25 and balak said unto balaam neither cur them at all nor bless 
them at all 

23 26 but balaam answer and said unto balak told not i thee 
say all that the lord speaketh that i must do 23 27 and balak 
said unto balaam come i pray thee i will bring thee unto anoth 
place peradventur it will plea god that thou mayest cur me them 
from thenc 

23 28 and balak brought balaam unto the top of peor that looketh 
toward jeshimon 

23 29 and balaam said unto balak build me here seven altar and 
prepar me here seven bullock and seven ram 

23 30 and balak did a balaam had said and offer a bullock and a 
ram on everi altar 

24 1 and when balaam saw that it plea the lord to bless israel he 
went not a at other time to seek for enchant but he set hi 
face toward the wilder 

24 2 and balaam lift up hi eye and he saw israel abid in hi 
tent accord to their tribe and the spirit of god came upon him 

24 3 and he took up hi parabl and said balaam the son of beor hath 
said and the man whose eye are open hath said 24 4 he hath said 
which heard the word of god which saw the vision of the almighti 
fall into a tranc but have hi eye open 24 5 how goodli are 
thi tent o jacob and thi tabernacl o israel 24 6 a the 
valley are they spread forth a garden by the river s side a the 
tree of lign alo which the lord hath plant and a cedar tree 
besid the water 

24 7 he shall pour the water out of hi bucket and hi seed shall be 
in mani water and hi king shall be higher than agag and hi 
kingdom shall be exalt 

24 8 god brought him forth out of egypt he hath a it were the 
strength of an unicorn he shall eat up the nation hi enemi and 
shall break their bone and pierc them through with hi arrow 

24 9 he couch he lay down a a lion and a a great lion who shall 
stir him up bless is he that blesseth thee and cur is he that 
curseth thee 

24 10 and balak s anger wa kindl against balaam and he smote hi 
hand togeth and balak said unto balaam i call thee to cur 
mine enemi and behold thou hast altogeth bless them these 
three time 

24 11 therefor now flee thou to thi place i thought to promot thee 
unto great honour but lo the lord hath kept thee back from honour 

24 12 and balaam said unto balak spake i not also to thi messeng 
which thou sentest unto me say 24 13 if balak would give me hi 
hou full of silver and gold i cannot go beyond the command of 
the lord to do either good or bad of mine own mind but what the lord 
saith that will i speak 24 14 and now behold i go unto my peopl 
come therefor and i will adverti thee what thi peopl shall do to 
thi peopl in the latter day 

24 15 and he took up hi parabl and said balaam the son of beor 
hath said and the man whose eye are open hath said 24 16 he hath 
said which heard the word of god and knew the knowledg of the most 
high which saw the vision of the almighti fall into a tranc but 
have hi eye open 24 17 i shall see him but not now i shall 
behold him but not nigh there shall come a star out of jacob and a 
sceptr shall rise out of israel and shall smite the corner of moab 
and destroy all the child of sheth 

24 18 and edom shall be a poss seir also shall be a poss 
for hi enemi and israel shall do valiantli 

24 19 out of jacob shall come he that shall have dominion and shall 
destroy him that remaineth of the citi 

24 20 and when he look on amalek he took up hi parabl and said 
amalek wa the first of the nation but hi latter end shall be that 
he perish for ever 

24 21 and he look on the kenit and took up hi parabl and said 
strong is thi dwellingplac and thou puttest thi nest in a rock 

24 22 nevertheless the kenit shall be wast until asshur shall 
carri thee away captiv 

24 23 and he took up hi parabl and said ala who shall live when 
god doeth thi 24 24 and ship shall come from the coast of chittim 
and shall afflict asshur and shall afflict eber and he also shall 
perish for ever 

24 25 and balaam rose up and went and return to hi place and 
balak also went hi way 

25 1 and israel abod in shittim and the peopl began to commit 
whoredom with the daughter of moab 

25 2 and they call the peopl unto the sacrif of their god and 
the peopl did eat and bow down to their god 

25 3 and israel join himself unto baalpeor and the anger of the 
lord wa kindl against israel 

25 4 and the lord said unto mose take all the head of the peopl 
and hang them up befor the lord against the sun that the fierc 
anger of the lord may be turn away from israel 

25 5 and mose said unto the judg of israel slay ye everi one hi 
men that were join unto baalpeor 

25 6 and behold one of the child of israel came and brought unto 
hi brother a midianitish woman in the sight of mose and in the 
sight of all the congreg of the child of israel who were 
weep befor the door of the tabernacl of the congreg 

25 7 and when phineha the son of eleazar the son of aaron the 
priest saw it he rose up from among the congreg and took a 
javelin in hi hand 25 8 and he went after the man of israel into the 
tent and thrust both of them through the man of israel and the 
woman through her belli so the plagu wa stay from the child of 
israel 

25 9 and those that die in the plagu were twenti and four thousand 

25 10 and the lord spake unto mose say 25 11 phineha the son 
of eleazar the son of aaron the priest hath turn my wrath away 
from the child of israel while he wa zealou for my sake among 
them that i consum not the child of israel in my jealousi 

25 12 wherefor say behold i give unto him my coven of peac 
25 13 and he shall have it and hi seed after him even the coven 
of an everlast priesthood becau he wa zealou for hi god and 
made an aton for the child of israel 

25 14 now the name of the israelit that wa slain even that wa 
slain with the midianitish woman wa zimri the son of salu a princ 
of a chief hou among the simeonit 

25 15 and the name of the midianitish woman that wa slain wa cozbi 
the daughter of zur he wa head over a peopl and of a chief hou 
in midian 

25 16 and the lord spake unto mose say 25 17 vex the midianit 
and smite them 25 18 for they vex you with their wile wherewith 
they have beguil you in the matter of peor and in the matter of 
cozbi the daughter of a princ of midian their sister which wa 
slain in the day of the plagu for peor s sake 

26 1 and it came to pa after the plagu that the lord spake unto 
mose and unto eleazar the son of aaron the priest say 26 2 take 
the sum of all the congreg of the child of israel from twenti 
year old and upward throughout their father hou all that are 
abl to go to war in israel 

26 3 and mose and eleazar the priest spake with them in the plain of 
moab by jordan near jericho say 26 4 take the sum of the peopl 
from twenti year old and upward a the lord command mose and the 
child of israel which went forth out of the land of egypt 

26 5 reuben the eldest son of israel the child of reuben hanoch 
of whom cometh the famili of the hanochit of pallu the famili of 
the palluit 26 6 of hezron the famili of the hezronit of carmi 
the famili of the carmit 

26 7 these are the famili of the reubenit and they that were 
number of them were forti and three thousand and seven hundr and 
thirti 

26 8 and the son of pallu eliab 

26 9 and the son of eliab nemuel and dathan and abiram thi is 
that dathan and abiram which were famou in the congreg who 
strove against mose and against aaron in the compani of korah when 
they strove against the lord 26 10 and the earth open her mouth 
and swallow them up togeth with korah when that compani die 
what time the fire devour two hundr and fifti men and they becam 
a sign 

26 11 notwithstand the child of korah die not 

26 12 the son of simeon after their famili of nemuel the famili 
of the nemuelit of jamin the famili of the jaminit of jachin

zarhit of shaul the famili of the shaulit

thousand and two hundr

arodit of are the famili of the arelit

that were number of them forti thousand and five hundr 

26 19 the son of judah were er and onan and er and onan die in the 
land of canaan 

26 20 and the son of judah after their famili were of shelah the

that were number of them threescor thousand and five hundr

ephraim 

26 29 of the son of manasseh of machir the famili of the

26 51 these were the number of the child of israel six hundr 
thousand and a thousand seven hundr and thirti 

26 52 and the lord spake unto mose say 26 53 unto these the land 
shall be divid for an inherit accord to the number of name 

26 54 to mani thou shalt give the more inherit and to few thou 
shalt give the le inherit to everi one shall hi inherit be 
given accord to those that were number of him 

26 55 notwithstand the land shall be divid by lot accord to 
the name of the tribe of their father they shall inherit 

26 56 accord to the lot shall the poss thereof be divid 
between mani and few 

26 57 and these are they that were number of the levit after their
