famili of gershon the famili of the gershonit of kohath the 
famili of the kohathit of merari the famili of the merarit 

26 58 these are the famili of the levit the famili of the 
libnit the famili of the hebronit the famili of the mahlit 
the famili of the mushit the famili of the korathit and kohath 
begat amram 

26 59 and the name of amram s wife wa jocheb the daughter of levi 
whom her mother bare to levi in egypt and she bare unto amram aaron 
and mose and miriam their sister 

26 60 and unto aaron wa born nadab and abihu eleazar and ithamar 

26 61 and nadab and abihu die when they offer strang fire befor 
the lord 

26 62 and those that were number of them were twenti and three 
thousand all male from a month old and upward for they were not 
number among the child of israel becau there wa no 
inherit given them among the child of israel 

26 63 these are they that were number by mose and eleazar the 
priest who number the child of israel in the plain of moab by 
jordan near jericho 

26 64 but among these there wa not a man of them whom mose and aaron 
the priest number when they number the child of israel in the 
wilder of sinai 

26 65 for the lord had said of them they shall sure die in the 
wilder and there wa not left a man of them save caleb the son 
of jephunneh and joshua the son of nun 

27 1 then came the daughter of zelophehad the son of hepher the son 
of gilead the son of machir the son of manasseh of the famili of 
manasseh the son of joseph and these are the name of hi daughter 
mahlah noah and hoglah and milcah and tirzah 

27 2 and they stood befor mose and befor eleazar the priest and 
befor the princ and all the congreg by the door of the 
tabernacl of the congreg say 27 3 our father die in the 
wilder and he wa not in the compani of them that gather 
themselv togeth against the lord in the compani of korah but die 
in hi own sin and had no son 

27 4 whi should the name of our father be done away from among hi 
famili becau he hath no son give unto u therefor a poss 
among the brother of our father 

27 5 and mose brought their cau befor the lord 

27 6 and the lord spake unto mose say 27 7 the daughter of 
zelophehad speak right thou shalt sure give them a poss of an 
inherit among their father s brother and thou shalt cau the 
inherit of their father to pa unto them 

27 8 and thou shalt speak unto the child of israel say if a 
man die and have no son then ye shall cau hi inherit to pa 
unto hi daughter 

27 9 and if he have no daughter then ye shall give hi inherit 
unto hi brother 

27 10 and if he have no brother then ye shall give hi inherit 
unto hi father s brother 

27 11 and if hi father have no brother then ye shall give hi 
inherit unto hi kinsman that is next to him of hi famili and he 
shall po it and it shall be unto the child of israel a 
statut of judgment a the lord command mose 

27 12 and the lord said unto mose get thee up into thi mount 
abarim and see the land which i have given unto the child of 
israel 

27 13 and when thou hast seen it thou also shalt be gather unto thi 
peopl a aaron thi brother wa gather 

27 14 for ye rebel against my command in the desert of zin in 
the strife of the congreg to sanctifi me at the water befor 
their eye that is the water of meribah in kadesh in the wilder 
of zin 

27 15 and mose spake unto the lord say 27 16 let the lord the 
god of the spirit of all flesh set a man over the congreg 
27 17 which may go out befor them and which may go in befor them 
and which may lead them out and which may bring them in that the 
congreg of the lord be not a sheep which have no shepherd 

27 18 and the lord said unto mose take thee joshua the son of nun a 
man in whom is the spirit and lay thine hand upon him 27 19 and set 
him befor eleazar the priest and befor all the congreg and 
give him a charg in their sight 

27 20 and thou shalt put some of thine honour upon him that all the 
congreg of the child of israel may be obedi 

27 21 and he shall stand befor eleazar the priest who shall ask 
counsel for him after the judgment of urim befor the lord at hi 
word shall they go out and at hi word they shall come in both he 
and all the child of israel with him even all the congreg 

27 22 and mose did a the lord command him and he took joshua and 
set him befor eleazar the priest and befor all the congreg 
27 23 and he laid hi hand upon him and gave him a charg a the 
lord command by the hand of mose 

28 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 28 2 command the child 
of israel and say unto them my offer and my bread for my 
sacrif made by fire for a sweet savour unto me shall ye observ 
to offer unto me in their due season 

28 3 and thou shalt say unto them thi is the offer made by fire 
which ye shall offer unto the lord two lamb of the first year 
without spot day by day for a continu burnt offer 

28 4 the one lamb shalt thou offer in the morn and the other lamb 
shalt thou offer at even 28 5 and a tenth part of an ephah of flour 
for a meat offer mingl with the fourth part of an hin of beaten 
oil 

28 6 it is a continu burnt offer which wa ordain in mount 
sinai for a sweet savour a sacrif made by fire unto the lord 

28 7 and the drink offer thereof shall be the fourth part of an hin 
for the one lamb in the holi place shalt thou cau the strong wine 
to be pour unto the lord for a drink offer 

28 8 and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even a the meat offer 
of the morn and a the drink offer thereof thou shalt offer 
it a sacrif made by fire of a sweet savour unto the lord 

28 9 and on the sabbath day two lamb of the first year without spot 
and two tenth deal of flour for a meat offer mingl with oil 
and the drink offer thereof 28 10 thi is the burnt offer of 
everi sabbath besid the continu burnt offer and hi drink 
offer 

28 11 and in the begin of your month ye shall offer a burnt 
offer unto the lord two young bullock and one ram seven lamb 
of the first year without spot 28 12 and three tenth deal of flour 
for a meat offer mingl with oil for one bullock and two tenth 
deal of flour for a meat offer mingl with oil for one ram 
28 13 and a sever tenth deal of flour mingl with oil for a meat 
offer unto one lamb for a burnt offer of a sweet savour a 
sacrif made by fire unto the lord 

28 14 and their drink offer shall be half an hin of wine unto a 
bullock and the third part of an hin unto a ram and a fourth part of 
an hin unto a lamb thi is the burnt offer of everi month 
throughout the month of the year 

28 15 and one kid of the goat for a sin offer unto the lord shall 
be offer besid the continu burnt offer and hi drink 
offer 

28 16 and in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passov of 
the lord 

28 17 and in the fifteenth day of thi month is the feast seven day 
shall unleaven bread be eaten 

28 18 in the first day shall be an holi convoc ye shall do no 
manner of servil work therein 28 19 but ye shall offer a sacrif 
made by fire for a burnt offer unto the lord two young bullock 
and one ram and seven lamb of the first year they shall be unto you 
without blemish 28 20 and their meat offer shall be of flour 
mingl with oil three tenth deal shall ye offer for a bullock and 
two tenth deal for a ram 28 21 a sever tenth deal shalt thou offer 
for everi lamb throughout the seven lamb 28 22 and one goat for a 
sin offer to make an aton for you 

28 23 ye shall offer these besid the burnt offer in the morn 
which is for a continu burnt offer 

28 24 after thi manner ye shall offer daili throughout the seven 
day the meat of the sacrif made by fire of a sweet savour unto 
the lord it shall be offer besid the continu burnt offer and 
hi drink offer 

28 25 and on the seventh day ye shall have an holi convoc ye 
shall do no servil work 

28 26 also in the day of the firstfruit when ye bring a new meat 
offer unto the lord after your week be out ye shall have an holi 
convoc ye shall do no servil work 28 27 but ye shall offer the 
burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the lord two young bullock 
one ram seven lamb of the first year 28 28 and their meat offer 
of flour mingl with oil three tenth deal unto one bullock two 
tenth deal unto one ram 28 29 a sever tenth deal unto one lamb 
throughout the seven lamb 28 30 and one kid of the goat to make an 
aton for you 

28 31 ye shall offer them besid the continu burnt offer and hi 
meat offer they shall be unto you without blemish and their 
drink offer 

29 1 and in the seventh month on the first day of the month ye shall 
have an holi convoc ye shall do no servil work it is a day of 
blow the trumpet unto you 

29 2 and ye shall offer a burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the 
lord one young bullock one ram and seven lamb of the first year 
without blemish 29 3 and their meat offer shall be of flour 
mingl with oil three tenth deal for a bullock and two tenth deal 
for a ram 29 4 and one tenth deal for one lamb throughout the seven 
lamb 29 5 and one kid of the goat for a sin offer to make an 
aton for you 29 6 besid the burnt offer of the month and 
hi meat offer and the daili burnt offer and hi meat 
offer and their drink offer accord unto their manner for 
a sweet savour a sacrif made by fire unto the lord 

29 7 and ye shall have on the tenth day of thi seventh month an holi 
convoc and ye shall afflict your soul ye shall not do ani work 
therein 29 8 but ye shall offer a burnt offer unto the lord for a 
sweet savour one young bullock one ram and seven lamb of the first 
year they shall be unto you without blemish 29 9 and their meat 
offer shall be of flour mingl with oil three tenth deal to a 
bullock and two tenth deal to one ram 29 10 a sever tenth deal 
for one lamb throughout the seven lamb 29 11 one kid of the goat 
for a sin offer besid the sin offer of aton and the 
continu burnt offer and the meat offer of it and their drink 
offer 

29 12 and on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an 
holi convoc ye shall do no servil work and ye shall keep a 
feast unto the lord seven day 29 13 and ye shall offer a burnt 
offer a sacrif made by fire of a sweet savour unto the lord 
thirteen young bullock two ram and fourteen lamb of the first 
year they shall be without blemish 29 14 and their meat offer 
shall be of flour mingl with oil three tenth deal unto everi 
bullock of the thirteen bullock two tenth deal to each ram of the 
two ram 29 15 and a sever tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen 
lamb 29 16 and one kid of the goat for a sin offer besid the 
continu burnt offer hi meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 17 and on the second day ye shall offer twelv young bullock two 
ram fourteen lamb of the first year without spot 29 18 and their 
meat offer and their drink offer for the bullock for the 
ram and for the lamb shall be accord to their number after the 
manner 29 19 and one kid of the goat for a sin offer besid the 
continu burnt offer and the meat offer thereof and their 
drink offer 

29 20 and on the third day eleven bullock two ram fourteen lamb 
of the first year without blemish 29 21 and their meat offer and 
their drink offer for the bullock for the ram and for the 
lamb shall be accord to their number after the manner 29 22 and 
one goat for a sin offer besid the continu burnt offer and 
hi meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 23 and on the fourth day ten bullock two ram and fourteen lamb 
of the first year without blemish 29 24 their meat offer and their 
drink offer for the bullock for the ram and for the lamb 
shall be accord to their number after the manner 29 25 and one 
kid of the goat for a sin offer besid the continu burnt 
offer hi meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 26 and on the fifth day nine bullock two ram and fourteen lamb 
of the first year without spot 29 27 and their meat offer and 
their drink offer for the bullock for the ram and for the 
lamb shall be accord to their number after the manner 29 28 and 
one goat for a sin offer besid the continu burnt offer and 
hi meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 29 and on the sixth day eight bullock two ram and fourteen 
lamb of the first year without blemish 29 30 and their meat offer 
and their drink offer for the bullock for the ram and for the 
lamb shall be accord to their number after the manner 29 31 and 
one goat for a sin offer besid the continu burnt offer hi 
meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 32 and on the seventh day seven bullock two ram and fourteen 
lamb of the first year without blemish 29 33 and their meat offer 
and their drink offer for the bullock for the ram and for the 
lamb shall be accord to their number after the manner 29 34 and 
one goat for a sin offer besid the continu burnt offer hi 
meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 35 on the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembl ye shall do 
no servil work therein 29 36 but ye shall offer a burnt offer a 
sacrif made by fire of a sweet savour unto the lord one bullock 
one ram seven lamb of the first year without blemish 29 37 their 
meat offer and their drink offer for the bullock for the ram 
and for the lamb shall be accord to their number after the 
manner 29 38 and one goat for a sin offer besid the continu 
burnt offer and hi meat offer and hi drink offer 

29 39 these thing ye shall do unto the lord in your set feast 
besid your vow and your freewil offer for your burnt 
offer and for your meat offer and for your drink offer 
and for your peac offer 

29 40 and mose told the child of israel accord to all that the 
lord command mose 

30 1 and mose spake unto the head of the tribe concern the 
child of israel say thi is the thing which the lord hath 
command 

30 2 if a man vow a vow unto the lord or swear an oath to bind hi 
soul with a bond he shall not break hi word he shall do accord 
to all that proceedeth out of hi mouth 

30 3 if a woman also vow a vow unto the lord and bind herself by a 
bond be in her father s hou in her youth 30 4 and her father 
hear her vow and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul and her 
father shall hold hi peac at her then all her vow shall stand and 
everi bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand 

30 5 but if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth not 
ani of her vow or of her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul 
shall stand and the lord shall forgiv her becau her father 
disallow her 

30 6 and if she had at all an husband when she vow or utter 
ought out of her lip wherewith she bound her soul 30 7 and her 
husband heard it and held hi peac at her in the day that he heard 
it then her vow shall stand and her bond wherewith she bound her 
soul shall stand 

30 8 but if her husband disallow her on the day that he heard it 
then he shall make her vow which she vow and that which she utter 
with her lip wherewith she bound her soul of none effect and the 
lord shall forgiv her 

30 9 but everi vow of a widow and of her that is divorc wherewith 
they have bound their soul shall stand against her 

30 10 and if she vow in her husband s hou or bound her soul by a 
bond with an oath 30 11 and her husband heard it and held hi peac 
at her and disallow her not then all her vow shall stand and 
everi bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand 

30 12 but if her husband hath utterli made them void on the day he 
heard them then whatsoev proceed out of her lip concern her 
vow or concern the bond of her soul shall not stand her husband 
hath made them void and the lord shall forgiv her 

30 13 everi vow and everi bind oath to afflict the soul her 
husband may establish it or her husband may make it void 

30 14 but if her husband altogeth hold hi peac at her from day to 
day then he establisheth all her vow or all her bond which are 
upon her he confirmeth them becau he held hi peac at her in the 
day that he heard them 

30 15 but if he shall ani way make them void after that he hath heard 
them then he shall bear her iniqu 

30 16 these are the statut which the lord command mose between 
a man and hi wife between the father and hi daughter be yet in 
her youth in her father s hou 

31 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 31 2 aveng the child 
of israel of the midianit afterward shalt thou be gather unto thi 
peopl 

31 3 and mose spake unto the peopl say arm some of yourselv 
unto the war and let them go against the midianit and aveng the 
lord of midian 

31 4 of everi tribe a thousand throughout all the tribe of israel 
shall ye send to the war 

31 5 so there were deliv out of the thousand of israel a 
thousand of everi tribe twelv thousand arm for war 

31 6 and mose sent them to the war a thousand of everi tribe them 
and phineha the son of eleazar the priest to the war with the holi 
instrument and the trumpet to blow in hi hand 

31 7 and they war against the midianit a the lord command 
mose and they slew all the male 

31 8 and they slew the king of midian besid the rest of them that 
were slain name evi and rekem and zur and hur and reba five 
king of midian balaam also the son of beor they slew with the sword 

31 9 and the child of israel took all the woman of midian captiv 
and their littl one and took the spoil of all their cattl and all 
their flock and all their good 

31 10 and they burnt all their citi wherein they dwelt and all 
their goodli castl with fire 

31 11 and they took all the spoil and all the prey both of men and 
of beast 

31 12 and they brought the captiv and the prey and the spoil unto 
mose and eleazar the priest and unto the congreg of the 
child of israel unto the camp at the plain of moab which are by 
jordan near jericho 

31 13 and mose and eleazar the priest and all the princ of the 
congreg went forth to meet them without the camp 

31 14 and mose wa wroth with the offic of the host with the 
captain over thousand and captain over hundr which came from 
the battl 

31 15 and mose said unto them have ye save all the woman aliv 
31 16 behold these cau the child of israel through the counsel 
of balaam to commit trespass against the lord in the matter of peor 
and there wa a plagu among the congreg of the lord 

31 17 now therefor kill everi male among the littl one and kill 
everi woman that hath known man by lie with him 

31 18 but all the woman child that have not known a man by lie 
with him keep aliv for yourselv 

31 19 and do ye abid without the camp seven day whosoev hath 
kill ani person and whosoev hath touch ani slain purifi both 
yourselv and your captiv on the third day and on the seventh day 

31 20 and purifi all your raiment and all that is made of skin and 
all work of goat hair and all thing made of wood 

31 21 and eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to 
the battl thi is the ordin of the law which the lord command 
mose 31 22 onli the gold and the silver the brass the iron the 
tin and the lead 31 23 everi thing that may abid the fire ye shall 
make it go through the fire and it shall be clean nevertheless it 
shall be purifi with the water of separ and all that abideth 
not the fire ye shall make go through the water 

31 24 and ye shall wash your cloth on the seventh day and ye shall 
be clean and afterward ye shall come into the camp 

31 25 and the lord spake unto mose say 31 26 take the sum of the 
prey that wa taken both of man and of beast thou and eleazar the 
priest and the chief father of the congreg 31 27 and divid 
the prey into two part between them that took the war upon them who 
went out to battl and between all the congreg 31 28 and levi a 
tribut unto the lord of the men of war which went out to battl one 
soul of five hundr both of the person and of the beef and of 
the as and of the sheep 31 29 take it of their half and give it 
unto eleazar the priest for an heav offer of the lord 

31 30 and of the child of israel s half thou shalt take one 
portion of fifti of the person of the beef of the as and of 
the flock of all manner of beast and give them unto the levit 
which keep the charg of the tabernacl of the lord 

31 31 and mose and eleazar the priest did a the lord command 
mose 

31 32 and the booti be the rest of the prey which the men of war 
had caught wa six hundr thousand and seventi thousand and five 
thousand sheep 31 33 and threescor and twelv thousand beef 31 34 
and threescor and one thousand as 31 35 and thirti and two 
thousand person in all of woman that had not known man by lie with 
him 

31 36 and the half which wa the portion of them that went out to 
war wa in number three hundr thousand and seven and thirti 
thousand and five hundr sheep 31 37 and the lord s tribut of the 
sheep wa six hundr and threescor and fifteen 

31 38 and the beef were thirti and six thousand of which the lord s 
tribut wa threescor and twelv 

31 39 and the as were thirti thousand and five hundr of which 
the lord s tribut wa threescor and one 

31 40 and the person were sixteen thousand of which the lord s 
tribut wa thirti and two person 

31 41 and mose gave the tribut which wa the lord s heav offer 
unto eleazar the priest a the lord command mose 

31 42 and of the child of israel s half which mose divid from 
the men that war 31 43 now the half that pertain unto the 
congreg wa three hundr thousand and thirti thousand and seven 
thousand and five hundr sheep 31 44 and thirti and six thousand 
beef 31 45 and thirti thousand as and five hundr 31 46 and 
sixteen thousand person 31 47 even of the child of israel s 
half mose took one portion of fifti both of man and of beast and 
gave them unto the levit which kept the charg of the tabernacl of 
the lord a the lord command mose 

31 48 and the offic which were over thousand of the host the 
captain of thousand and captain of hundr came near unto mose 
31 49 and they said unto mose thi servant have taken the sum of the 
men of war which are under our charg and there lacketh not one man 
of u 

31 50 we have therefor brought an oblat for the lord what everi 
man hath gotten of jewel of gold chain and bracelet ring 
ear and tablet to make an aton for our soul befor the 
lord 

31 51 and mose and eleazar the priest took the gold of them even all 
wrought jewel 

31 52 and all the gold of the offer that they offer up to the 
lord of the captain of thousand and of the captain of hundr 
wa sixteen thousand seven hundr and fifti shekel 

31 53 for the men of war had taken spoil everi man for himself 
31 54 and mose and eleazar the priest took the gold of the captain 
of thousand and of hundr and brought it into the tabernacl of 
the congreg for a memori for the child of israel befor the 
lord 

32 1 now the child of reuben and the child of gad had a veri 
great multitud of cattl and when they saw the land of jazer and 
the land of gilead that behold the place wa a place for cattl 
32 2 the child of gad and the child of reuben came and spake 
unto mose and to eleazar the priest and unto the princ of the 
congreg say 32 3 ataroth and dibon and jazer and nimrah 
and heshbon and elealeh and shebam and nebo and beon 32 4 even 
the countri which the lord smote befor the congreg of israel is 
a land for cattl and thi servant have cattl 32 5 wherefor said 
they if we have found grace in thi sight let thi land be given unto 
thi servant for a poss and bring u not over jordan 

32 6 and mose said unto the child of gad and to the child of 
reuben shall your brother go to war and shall ye sit here 32 7 
and wherefor discourag ye the heart of the child of israel from 
go over into the land which the lord hath given them 32 8 thu 
did your father when i sent them from kadeshbarnea to see the land 

32 9 for when they went up unto the valley of eshcol and saw the 
land they discourag the heart of the child of israel that they 
should not go into the land which the lord had given them 

32 10 and the lord s anger wa kindl the same time and he sware 
say 32 11 sure none of the men that came up out of egypt from 
twenti year old and upward shall see the land which i sware unto 
abraham unto isaac and unto jacob becau they have not wholli 
follow me 32 12 save caleb the son of jephunneh the kenezit and 
joshua the son of nun for they have wholli follow the lord 

32 13 and the lord s anger wa kindl against israel and he made 
them wander in the wilder forti year until all the gener 
that had done evil in the sight of the lord wa consum 

32 14 and behold ye are risen up in your father stead an increa 
of sin men to augment yet the fierc anger of the lord toward 
israel 

32 15 for if ye turn away from after him he will yet again leav them 
in the wilder and ye shall destroy all thi peopl 

32 16 and they came near unto him and said we will build sheepfold 
here for our cattl and citi for our littl one 32 17 but we 
ourselv will go readi arm befor the child of israel until we 
have brought them unto their place and our littl one shall dwell in 
the fenc citi becau of the inhabit of the land 

32 18 we will not return unto our hou until the child of israel 
have inherit everi man hi inherit 

32 19 for we will not inherit with them on yonder side jordan or 
forward becau our inherit is fallen to u on thi side jordan 
eastward 

32 20 and mose said unto them if ye will do thi thing if ye will 
go arm befor the lord to war 32 21 and will go all of you arm 
over jordan befor the lord until he hath driven out hi enemi from 
befor him 32 22 and the land be subdu befor the lord then 
afterward ye shall return and be guiltless befor the lord and 
befor israel and thi land shall be your poss befor the lord 

32 23 but if ye will not do so behold ye have sin against the 
lord and be sure your sin will find you out 

32 24 build you citi for your littl one and fold for your sheep 
and do that which hath proceed out of your mouth 

32 25 and the child of gad and the child of reuben spake unto 
mose say thi servant will do a my lord commandeth 

32 26 our littl one our wife our flock and all our cattl 
shall be there in the citi of gilead 32 27 but thi servant will 
pa over everi man arm for war befor the lord to battl a my 
lord saith 

32 28 so concern them mose command eleazar the priest and 
joshua the son of nun and the chief father of the tribe of the 
child of israel 32 29 and mose said unto them if the child of 
gad and the child of reuben will pa with you over jordan everi 
man arm to battl befor the lord and the land shall be subdu 
befor you then ye shall give them the land of gilead for a 
poss 32 30 but if they will not pa over with you arm they 
shall have poss among you in the land of canaan 

32 31 and the child of gad and the child of reuben answer 
say a the lord hath said unto thi servant so will we do 

32 32 we will pa over arm befor the lord into the land of canaan 
that the poss of our inherit on thi side jordan may be 
our 

32 33 and mose gave unto them even to the child of gad and to 
the child of reuben and unto half the tribe of manasseh the son of 
joseph the kingdom of sihon king of the amorit and the kingdom of 
og king of bashan the land with the citi thereof in the coast 
even the citi of the countri round about 

32 34 and the child of gad built dibon and ataroth and aroer 
32 35 and atroth shophan and jaazer and jogbehah 32 36 and 
bethnimrah and bethharan fenc citi and fold for sheep 

32 37 and the child of reuben built heshbon and elealeh and 
kirjathaim 32 38 and nebo and baalmeon their name be chang 
and shibmah and gave other name unto the citi which they build 

32 39 and the child of machir the son of manasseh went to gilead 
and took it and dispossess the amorit which wa in it 

32 40 and mose gave gilead unto machir the son of manasseh and he 
dwelt therein 

32 41 and jair the son of manasseh went and took the small town 
thereof and call them havothjair 

32 42 and nobah went and took kenath and the villag thereof and 
call it nobah after hi own name 

33 1 these are the journey of the child of israel which went 
forth out of the land of egypt with their armi under the hand of 
mose and aaron 

33 2 and mose wrote their go out accord to their journey by 
the command of the lord and these are their journey accord to 
their go out 

33 3 and they depart from rame in the first month on the 
fifteenth day of the first month on the morrow after the passov the 
child of israel went out with an high hand in the sight of all the 
egyptian 

33 4 for the egyptian buri all their firstborn which the lord had 
smitten among them upon their god also the lord execut judgment 

33 5 and the child of israel remov from rame and pitch in 
succoth 

33 6 and they depart from succoth and pitch in etham which is in 
the edg of the wilder 

33 7 and they remov from etham and turn again unto pihahiroth 
which is befor baalzephon and they pitch befor migdol 

33 8 and they depart from befor pihahiroth and pa through the 
midst of the sea into the wilder and went three day journey in 
the wilder of etham and pitch in marah 

33 9 and they remov from marah and came unto elim and in elim were 
twelv fountain of water and threescor and ten palm tree and they 
pitch there 

33 10 and they remov from elim and encamp by the red sea 

33 11 and they remov from the red sea and encamp in the 
wilder of sin 

33 12 and they took their journey out of the wilder of sin and 
encamp in dophkah 

33 13 and they depart from dophkah and encamp in alush 

33 14 and they remov from alush and encamp at rephidim where wa 
no water for the peopl to drink 

33 15 and they depart from rephidim and pitch in the wilder 
of sinai 

33 16 and they remov from the desert of sinai and pitch at 
kibrothhattaavah 

33 17 and they depart from kibrothhattaavah and encamp at 
hazeroth 

33 18 and they depart from hazeroth and pitch in rithmah 

33 19 and they depart from rithmah and pitch at rimmonparez 

33 20 and they depart from rimmonparez and pitch in libnah 

33 21 and they remov from libnah and pitch at rissah 

33 22 and they journey from rissah and pitch in kehelathah 

33 23 and they went from kehelathah and pitch in mount shapher 

33 24 and they remov from mount shapher and encamp in haradah 

33 25 and they remov from haradah and pitch in makheloth 

33 26 and they remov from makheloth and encamp at tahath 

33 27 and they depart from tahath and pitch at tarah 

33 28 and they remov from tarah and pitch in mithcah 

33 29 and they went from mithcah and pitch in hashmonah 

33 30 and they depart from hashmonah and encamp at moseroth 

33 31 and they depart from moseroth and pitch in benejaakan 

33 32 and they remov from benejaakan and encamp at horhagidgad 

33 33 and they went from horhagidgad and pitch in jotbathah 

33 34 and they remov from jotbathah and encamp at ebronah 

33 35 and they depart from ebronah and encamp at eziongab 

33 36 and they remov from eziongab and pitch in the wilder 
of zin which is kadesh 

33 37 and they remov from kadesh and pitch in mount hor in the 
edg of the land of edom 

33 38 and aaron the priest went up into mount hor at the command 
of the lord and die there in the fortieth year after the child 
of israel were come out of the land of egypt in the first day of the 
fifth month 

33 39 and aaron wa an hundr and twenti and three year old when he 
die in mount hor 

33 40 and king arad the canaanit which dwelt in the south in the 
land of canaan heard of the come of the child of israel 

33 41 and they depart from mount hor and pitch in zalmonah 

33 42 and they depart from zalmonah and pitch in punon 

33 43 and they depart from punon and pitch in oboth 

33 44 and they depart from oboth and pitch in ijeabarim in the 
border of moab 

33 45 and they depart from iim and pitch in dibongad 

33 46 and they remov from dibongad and encamp in almondiblathaim 

33 47 and they remov from almondiblathaim and pitch in the 
mountain of abarim befor nebo 

33 48 and they depart from the mountain of abarim and pitch in 
the plain of moab by jordan near jericho 

33 49 and they pitch by jordan from bethjesimoth even unto 
abelshittim in the plain of moab 

33 50 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan 
near jericho say 33 51 speak unto the child of israel and say 
unto them when ye are pa over jordan into the land of canaan 
33 52 then ye shall drive out all the inhabit of the land from 
befor you and destroy all their pictur and destroy all their 
molten imag and quit pluck down all their high place 33 53 and 
ye shall dispossess the inhabit of the land and dwell therein 
for i have given you the land to po it 

33 54 and ye shall divid the land by lot for an inherit among 
your famili and to the more ye shall give the more inherit and 
to the fewer ye shall give the le inherit everi man s 
inherit shall be in the place where hi lot falleth accord to 
the tribe of your father ye shall inherit 

33 55 but if ye will not drive out the inhabit of the land from 
befor you then it shall come to pa that those which ye let remain 
of them shall be prick in your eye and thorn in your side and 
shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell 

33 56 moreov it shall come to pa that i shall do unto you a i 
thought to do unto them 

34 1 and the lord spake unto mose say 34 2 command the child 
of israel and say unto them when ye come into the land of canaan 
thi is the land that shall fall unto you for an inherit even 
the land of canaan with the coast thereof 34 3 then your south 
quarter shall be from the wilder of zin along by the coast of 
edom and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea 
eastward 34 4 and your border shall turn from the south to the ascent 
of akrabbim and pa on to zin and the go forth thereof shall be 
from the south to kadeshbarnea and shall go on to hazaraddar and 
pa on to azmon 34 5 and the border shall fetch a compass from azmon 
unto the river of egypt and the go out of it shall be at the sea 

34 6 and a for the western border ye shall even have the great sea 
for a border thi shall be your west border 

34 7 and thi shall be your north border from the great sea ye shall 
point out for you mount hor 34 8 from mount hor ye shall point out 
your border unto the entranc of hamath and the go forth of the 
border shall be to zedad 34 9 and the border shall go on to ziphron 
and the go out of it shall be at hazarenan thi shall be your 
north border 

34 10 and ye shall point out your east border from hazarenan to 
shepham 34 11 and the coast shall go down from shepham to riblah on 
the east side of ain and the border shall descend and shall reach 
unto the side of the sea of chinnereth eastward 34 12 and the border 
shall go down to jordan and the go out of it shall be at the salt 
sea thi shall be your land with the coast thereof round about 

34 13 and mose command the child of israel say thi is the 
land which ye shall inherit by lot which the lord command to give 
unto the nine tribe and to the half tribe 34 14 for the tribe of 
the child of reuben accord to the hou of their father and 
the tribe of the child of gad accord to the hou of their 
father have receiv their inherit and half the tribe of 
manasseh have receiv their inherit 34 15 the two tribe and the 
half tribe have receiv their inherit on thi side jordan near 
jericho eastward toward the sunri 

34 16 and the lord spake unto mose say 34 17 these are the name 
of the men which shall divid the land unto you eleazar the priest 
and joshua the son of nun 

34 18 and ye shall take one princ of everi tribe to divid the land 
by inherit 

34 19 and the name of the men are these of the tribe of judah caleb 
the son of jephunneh 

34 20 and of the tribe of the child of simeon shemuel the son of 
ammihud 

34 21 of the tribe of benjamin elidad the son of chislon 

34 22 and the princ of the tribe of the child of dan bukki the 
son of jogli 

34 23 the princ of the child of joseph for the tribe of the 
child of manasseh hanniel the son of ephod 

34 24 and the princ of the tribe of the child of ephraim kemuel 
the son of shiphtan 

34 25 and the princ of the tribe of the child of zebulun 
elizaphan the son of parnach 

34 26 and the princ of the tribe of the child of issachar paltiel 
the son of azzan 

34 27 and the princ of the tribe of the child of asher ahihud the 
son of shelomi 

34 28 and the princ of the tribe of the child of naphtali pedahel 
the son of ammihud 

34 29 these are they whom the lord command to divid the inherit 
unto the child of israel in the land of canaan 

35 1 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan 
near jericho say 35 2 command the child of israel that they 
give unto the levit of the inherit of their poss citi to 
dwell in and ye shall give also unto the levit suburb for the 
citi round about them 

35 3 and the citi shall they have to dwell in and the suburb of 
them shall be for their cattl and for their good and for all their 
beast 

35 4 and the suburb of the citi which ye shall give unto the 
levit shall reach from the wall of the citi and outward a thousand 
cubit round about 

35 5 and ye shall measur from without the citi on the east side two 
thousand cubit and on the south side two thousand cubit and on the 
west side two thousand cubit and on the north side two thousand 
cubit and the citi shall be in the midst thi shall be to them the 
suburb of the citi 

35 6 and among the citi which ye shall give unto the levit there 
shall be six citi for refug which ye shall appoint for the 
manslay that he may flee thither and to them ye shall add forti 
and two citi 

35 7 so all the citi which ye shall give to the levit shall be 
forti and eight citi them shall ye give with their suburb 

35 8 and the citi which ye shall give shall be of the poss of 
the child of israel from them that have mani ye shall give mani 
but from them that have few ye shall give few everi one shall give of 
hi citi unto the levit accord to hi inherit which he 
inheriteth 

35 9 and the lord spake unto mose say 35 10 speak unto the 
child of israel and say unto them when ye be come over jordan 
into the land of canaan 35 11 then ye shall appoint you citi to be 
citi of refug for you that the slayer may flee thither which 
killeth ani person at unawar 

35 12 and they shall be unto you citi for refug from the aveng 
that the manslay die not until he stand befor the congreg in 
judgment 

35 13 and of these citi which ye shall give six citi shall ye have 
for refug 

35 14 ye shall give three citi on thi side jordan and three citi 
shall ye give in the land of canaan which shall be citi of refug 

35 15 these six citi shall be a refug both for the child of 
israel and for the stranger and for the sojourn among them that 
everi one that killeth ani person unawar may flee thither 

35 16 and if he smite him with an instrument of iron so that he die 
he is a murder the murder shall sure be put to death 

35 17 and if he smite him with throw a stone wherewith he may die 
and he die he is a murder the murder shall sure be put to 
death 

35 18 or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood wherewith he may 
die and he die he is a murder the murder shall sure be put to 
death 

35 19 the reveng of blood himself shall slay the murder when he 
meeteth him he shall slay him 

35 20 but if he thrust him of hatr or hurl at him by lay of 
wait that he die 35 21 or in enmiti smite him with hi hand that he 
die he that smote him shall sure be put to death for he is a 
murder the reveng of blood shall slay the murder when he 
meeteth him 

35 22 but if he thrust him suddenli without enmiti or have cast upon 
him ani thing without lay of wait 35 23 or with ani stone 
wherewith a man may die see him not and cast it upon him that he 
die and wa not hi enemi neither sought hi harm 35 24 then the 
congreg shall judg between the slayer and the reveng of blood 
accord to these judgment 35 25 and the congreg shall deliv 
the slayer out of the hand of the reveng of blood and the 
congreg shall restor him to the citi of hi refug whither he 
wa fled and he shall abid in it unto the death of the high priest 
which wa anoint with the holi oil 

35 26 but if the slayer shall at ani time come without the border of 
the citi of hi refug whither he wa fled 35 27 and the reveng of 
blood find him without the border of the citi of hi refug and the 
reveng of blood kill the slayer he shall not be guilti of blood 
35 28 becau he should have remain in the citi of hi refug until 
the death of the high priest but after the death of the high priest 
the slayer shall return into the land of hi poss 

35 29 so these thing shall be for a statut of judgment unto you 
throughout your gener in all your dwell 

35 30 whoso killeth ani person the murder shall be put to death by 
the mouth of wit but one wit shall not testifi against ani 
person to cau him to die 

35 31 moreov ye shall take no satisfact for the life of a 
murder which is guilti of death but he shall be sure put to 
death 

35 32 and ye shall take no satisfact for him that is fled to the 
citi of hi refug that he should come again to dwell in the land 
until the death of the priest 

35 33 so ye shall not pollut the land wherein ye are for blood it 
defileth the land and the land cannot be clean of the blood that 
is shed therein but by the blood of him that shed it 

35 34 defil not therefor the land which ye shall inhabit wherein i 
dwell for i the lord dwell among the child of israel 

36 1 and the chief father of the famili of the child of gilead 
the son of machir the son of manasseh of the famili of the son of 
joseph came near and spake befor mose and befor the princ the 
chief father of the child of israel 36 2 and they said the lord 
command my lord to give the land for an inherit by lot to the 
child of israel and my lord wa command by the lord to give the 
inherit of zelophehad our brother unto hi daughter 

36 3 and if they be marri to ani of the son of the other tribe of 
the child of israel then shall their inherit be taken from the 
inherit of our father and shall be put to the inherit of the 
tribe whereunto they are receiv so shall it be taken from the lot 
of our inherit 

36 4 and when the jubil of the child of israel shall be then 
shall their inherit be put unto the inherit of the tribe 
whereunto they are receiv so shall their inherit be taken away 
from the inherit of the tribe of our father 

36 5 and mose command the child of israel accord to the word 
of the lord say the tribe of the son of joseph hath said well 

36 6 thi is the thing which the lord doth command concern the 
daughter of zelophehad say let them marri to whom they think 
best onli to the famili of the tribe of their father shall they 
marri 

36 7 so shall not the inherit of the child of israel remov 
from tribe to tribe for everi one of the child of israel shall 
keep himself to the inherit of the tribe of hi father 

36 8 and everi daughter that possesseth an inherit in ani tribe 
of the child of israel shall be wife unto one of the famili of the 
tribe of her father that the child of israel may enjoy everi man 
the inherit of hi father 

36 9 neither shall the inherit remov from one tribe to anoth 
tribe but everi one of the tribe of the child of israel shall 
keep himself to hi own inherit 

36 10 even a the lord command mose so did the daughter of 
zelophehad 36 11 for mahlah tirzah and hoglah and milcah and 
noah the daughter of zelophehad were marri unto their father s 
brother son 36 12 and they were marri into the famili of the 
son of manasseh the son of joseph and their inherit remain in 
the tribe of the famili of their father 

36 13 these are the command and the judgment which the lord 
command by the hand of mose unto the child of israel in the 
plain of moab by jordan near jericho 




the fifth book of mose call deuteronomi 


1 1 these be the word which mose spake unto all israel on thi side 
jordan in the wilder in the plain over against the red sea 
between paran and tophel and laban and hazeroth and dizahab 

1 2 there are eleven day journey from horeb by the way of mount 
seir unto kadeshbarnea 1 3 and it came to pa in the fortieth 
year in the eleventh month on the first day of the month that mose 
spake unto the child of israel accord unto all that the lord 
had given him in command unto them 1 4 after he had slain sihon 
the king of the amorit which dwelt in heshbon and og the king of 
bashan which dwelt at astaroth in edrei 1 5 on thi side jordan in 
the land of moab began mose to declar thi law say 1 6 the 
lord our god spake unto u in horeb say ye have dwelt long enough 
in thi mount 1 7 turn you and take your journey and go to the 
mount of the amorit and unto all the place nigh thereunto in the 
plain in the hill and in the vale and in the south and by the sea 
side to the land of the canaanit and unto lebanon unto the great 
river the river euphrat 

1 8 behold i have set the land befor you go in and po the land 
which the lord sware unto your father abraham isaac and jacob to 
give unto them and to their seed after them 

1 9 and i spake unto you at that time say i am not abl to bear 
you myself alon 1 10 the lord your god hath multipli you and 
behold ye are thi day a the star of heaven for multitud 

1 11 the lord god of your father make you a thousand time so mani 
more a ye are and bless you a he hath promi you 1 12 how can 
i myself alon bear your cumbranc and your burden and your strife 
1 13 take you wise men and understand and known among your 
tribe and i will make them ruler over you 

1 14 and ye answer me and said the thing which thou hast spoken is 
good for u to do 

1 15 so i took the chief of your tribe wise men and known and made 
them head over you captain over thousand and captain over 
hundr and captain over fifti and captain over ten and 
offic among your tribe 

1 16 and i charg your judg at that time say hear the cau 
between your brother and judg righteou between everi man and hi 
brother and the stranger that is with him 

1 17 ye shall not respect person in judgment but ye shall hear the 
small a well a the great ye shall not be afraid of the face of man 
for the judgment is god s and the cau that is too hard for you 
bring it unto me and i will hear it 

1 18 and i command you at that time all the thing which ye should 
do 

1 19 and when we depart from horeb we went through all that great 
and terribl wilder which ye saw by the way of the mountain of 
the amorit a the lord our god command u and we came to 
kadeshbarnea 

1 20 and i said unto you ye are come unto the mountain of the 
amorit which the lord our god doth give unto u 

1 21 behold the lord thi god hath set the land befor thee go up and 
po it a the lord god of thi father hath said unto thee fear 
not neither be discourag 

1 22 and ye came near unto me everi one of you and said we will send 
men befor u and they shall search u out the land and bring u 
word again by what way we must go up and into what citi we shall 
come 

1 23 and the say plea me well and i took twelv men of you one 
of a tribe 1 24 and they turn and went up into the mountain and 
came unto the valley of eshcol and search it out 

1 25 and they took of the fruit of the land in their hand and 
brought it down unto u and brought u word again and said it is a 
good land which the lord our god doth give u 

1 26 notwithstand ye would not go up but rebel against the 
command of the lord your god 1 27 and ye murmur in your tent 
and said becau the lord hate u he hath brought u forth out of 
the land of egypt to deliv u into the hand of the amorit to 
destroy u 

1 28 whither shall we go up our brother have discourag our heart 
say the peopl is greater and taller than we the citi are great 
and wall up to heaven and moreov we have seen the son of the 
anakim there 

1 29 then i said unto you dread not neither be afraid of them 

1 30 the lord your god which goeth befor you he shall fight for you 
accord to all that he did for you in egypt befor your eye 1 31 
and in the wilder where thou hast seen how that the lord thi god 
bare thee a a man doth bear hi son in all the way that ye went 
until ye came into thi place 

1 32 yet in thi thing ye did not believ the lord your god 1 33 who 
went in the way befor you to search you out a place to pitch your 
tent in in fire by night to shew you by what way ye should go and 
in a cloud by day 

1 34 and the lord heard the voic of your word and wa wroth and 
sware say 1 35 sure there shall not one of these men of thi 
evil gener see that good land which i sware to give unto your 
father 

1 36 save caleb the son of jephunneh he shall see it and to him will 
i give the land that he hath trodden upon and to hi child 
becau he hath wholli follow the lord 

1 37 also the lord wa angri with me for your sake say thou also 
shalt not go in thither 

1 38 but joshua the son of nun which standeth befor thee he shall 
go in thither encourag him for he shall cau israel to inherit it 

1 39 moreov your littl one which ye said should be a prey and 
your child which in that day had no knowledg between good and 
evil they shall go in thither and unto them will i give it and they 
shall po it 

1 40 but a for you turn you and take your journey into the 
wilder by the way of the red sea 

1 41 then ye answer and said unto me we have sin against the 
lord we will go up and fight accord to all that the lord our god 
command u 

and when ye had gird on everi man hi weapon of war ye were readi 
to go up into the hill 

1 42 and the lord said unto me say unto them go not up neither 
fight for i am not among you lest ye be smitten befor your enemi 

1 43 so i spake unto you and ye would not hear but rebel against 
the command of the lord and went presumptu up into the hill 

1 44 and the amorit which dwelt in that mountain came out against 
you and chase you a bee do and destroy you in seir even unto 
hormah 

1 45 and ye return and wept befor the lord but the lord would not 
hearken to your voic nor give ear unto you 

1 46 so ye abod in kadesh mani day accord unto the day that ye 
abod there 

2 1 then we turn and took our journey into the wilder by the 
way of the red sea a the lord spake unto me and we compass mount 
seir mani day 

2 2 and the lord spake unto me say 2 3 ye have compass thi 
mountain long enough turn you northward 

2 4 and command thou the peopl say ye are to pa through the 
coast of your brother the child of esau which dwell in seir and 
they shall be afraid of you take ye good heed unto yourselv 
therefor 2 5 meddl not with them for i will not give you of their 
land no not so much a a foot breadth becau i have given mount 
seir unto esau for a poss 

2 6 ye shall buy meat of them for money that ye may eat and ye shall 
also buy water of them for money that ye may drink 

2 7 for the lord thi god hath bless thee in all the work of thi 
hand he knoweth thi walk through thi great wilder these 
forti year the lord thi god hath been with thee thou hast lack 
noth 

2 8 and when we pa by from our brother the child of esau 
which dwelt in seir through the way of the plain from elath and from 
eziongab we turn and pa by the way of the wilder of moab 

2 9 and the lord said unto me distress not the moabit neither 
contend with them in battl for i will not give thee of their land 
for a poss becau i have given ar unto the child of lot for 
a poss 

2 10 the emim dwelt therein in time past a peopl great and mani 
and tall a the anakim 2 11 which also were account giant a 
the anakim but the moabit call them emim 

2 12 the horim also dwelt in seir beforetim but the child of 
esau succeed them when they had destroy them from befor them 
and dwelt in their stead a israel did unto the land of hi 
poss which the lord gave unto them 

2 13 now rise up said i and get you over the brook zere and we 
went over the brook zere 

2 14 and the space in which we came from kadeshbarnea until we were 
come over the brook zere wa thirti and eight year until all the 
gener of the men of war were wast out from among the host a 
the lord sware unto them 

2 15 for ind the hand of the lord wa against them to destroy them 
from among the host until they were consum 

2 16 so it came to pa when all the men of war were consum and 
dead from among the peopl 2 17 that the lord spake unto me say 
2 18 thou art to pa over through ar the coast of moab thi day 
2 19 and when thou comest nigh over against the child of ammon 
distress them not nor meddl with them for i will not give thee of 
the land of the child of ammon ani poss becau i have given 
it unto the child of lot for a poss 

2 20 that also wa account a land of giant giant dwelt therein 
in old time and the ammonit call them zamzummim 2 21 a peopl 
great and mani and tall a the anakim but the lord destroy them 
befor them and they succeed them and dwelt in their stead 2 22 
a he did to the child of esau which dwelt in seir when he 
destroy the horim from befor them and they succeed them and 
dwelt in their stead even unto thi day 2 23 and the avim which 
dwelt in hazerim even unto azzah the caphtorim which came forth 
out of caphtor destroy them and dwelt in their stead 2 24 rise 
ye up take your journey and pa over the river arnon behold i 
have given into thine hand sihon the amorit king of heshbon and hi 
land begin to po it and contend with him in battl 

2 25 thi day will i begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of 
thee upon the nation that are under the whole heaven who shall hear 
report of thee and shall trembl and be in anguish becau of thee 

2 26 and i sent messeng out of the wilder of kedemoth unto 
sihon king of heshbon with word of peac say 2 27 let me pa 
through thi land i will go along by the high way i will neither turn 
unto the right hand nor to the left 

2 28 thou shalt sell me meat for money that i may eat and give me 
water for money that i may drink onli i will pa through on my 
foot 2 29 a the child of esau which dwell in seir and the 
moabit which dwell in ar did unto me until i shall pa over 
jordan into the land which the lord our god giveth u 

2 30 but sihon king of heshbon would not let u pa by him for the 
lord thi god harden hi spirit and made hi heart obstin that 
he might deliv him into thi hand a appeareth thi day 

2 31 and the lord said unto me behold i have begun to give sihon and 
hi land befor thee begin to po that thou mayest inherit hi 
land 

2 32 then sihon came out against u he and all hi peopl to fight 
at jahaz 

2 33 and the lord our god deliv him befor u and we smote him 
and hi son and all hi peopl 

2 34 and we took all hi citi at that time and utterli destroy 
the men and the woman and the littl one of everi citi we left 
none to remain 2 35 onli the cattl we took for a prey unto 
ourselv and the spoil of the citi which we took 

2 36 from aroer which is by the brink of the river of arnon and from 
the citi that is by the river even unto gilead there wa not one 
citi too strong for u the lord our god deliv all unto u 2 37 
onli unto the land of the child of ammon thou camest not nor unto 
ani place of the river jabbok nor unto the citi in the mountain 
nor unto whatsoev the lord our god forbad u 

3 1 then we turn and went up the way to bashan and og the king of 
bashan came out against u he and all hi peopl to battl at edrei 

3 2 and the lord said unto me fear him not for i will deliv him 
and all hi peopl and hi land into thi hand and thou shalt do 
unto him a thou didst unto sihon king of the amorit which dwelt at 
heshbon 

3 3 so the lord our god deliv into our hand og also the king of 
bashan and all hi peopl and we smote him until none wa left to 
him remain 

3 4 and we took all hi citi at that time there wa not a citi 
which we took not from them threescor citi all the region of 
argob the kingdom of og in bashan 

3 5 all these citi were fenc with high wall gate and bar 
besid unwal town a great mani 

3 6 and we utterli destroy them a we did unto sihon king of 
heshbon utterli destroy the men woman and child of everi 
citi 

3 7 but all the cattl and the spoil of the citi we took for a 
prey to ourselv 

3 8 and we took at that time out of the hand of the two king of the 
amorit the land that wa on thi side jordan from the river of 
arnon unto mount hermon 3 9 which hermon the sidonian call sirion 
and the amorit call it shenir 3 10 all the citi of the plain 
and all gilead and all bashan unto salchah and edrei citi of the 
kingdom of og in bashan 

3 11 for onli og king of bashan remain of the remnant of giant 
behold hi bedstead wa a bedstead of iron is it not in rabbath of 
the child of ammon nine cubit wa the length thereof and four 
cubit the breadth of it after the cubit of a man 

3 12 and thi land which we poss at that time from aroer which 
is by the river arnon and half mount gilead and the citi thereof 
gave i unto the reubenit and to the gadit 

3 13 and the rest of gilead and all bashan be the kingdom of og 
gave i unto the half tribe of manasseh all the region of argob with 
all bashan which wa call the land of giant 

3 14 jair the son of manasseh took all the countri of argob unto the 
coast of geshuri and maachathi and call them after hi own name 
bashanhavothjair unto thi day 

3 15 and i gave gilead unto machir 

3 16 and unto the reubenit and unto the gadit i gave from gilead 
even unto the river arnon half the valley and the border even unto 
the river jabbok which is the border of the child of ammon 3 17 
the plain also and jordan and the coast thereof from chinnereth 
even unto the sea of the plain even the salt sea under ashdothpisgah 
eastward 

3 18 and i command you at that time say the lord your god hath 
given you thi land to po it ye shall pa over arm befor 
your brother the child of israel all that are meet for the war 

3 19 but your wife and your littl one and your cattl for i 
know that ye have much cattl shall abid in your citi which i 
have given you 3 20 until the lord have given rest unto your 
brother a well a unto you and until they also po the land 
which the lord your god hath given them beyond jordan and then shall 
ye return everi man unto hi poss which i have given you 

3 21 and i command joshua at that time say thine eye have seen 
all that the lord your god hath done unto these two king so shall 
the lord do unto all the kingdom whither thou passest 

3 22 ye shall not fear them for the lord your god he shall fight for 
you 

3 23 and i besought the lord at that time say 3 24 o lord god 
thou hast begun to shew thi servant thi great and thi mighti 
hand for what god is there in heaven or in earth that can do 
accord to thi work and accord to thi might 3 25 i pray thee 
let me go over and see the good land that is beyond jordan that 
goodli mountain and lebanon 

3 26 but the lord wa wroth with me for your sake and would not hear 
me and the lord said unto me let it suffic thee speak no more unto 
me of thi matter 

3 27 get thee up into the top of pisgah and lift up thine eye 
westward and northward and southward and eastward and behold it 
with thine eye for thou shalt not go over thi jordan 

3 28 but charg joshua and encourag him and strengthen him for he 
shall go over befor thi peopl and he shall cau them to inherit 
the land which thou shalt see 

3 29 so we abod in the valley over against bethpeor 

4 1 now therefor hearken o israel unto the statut and unto the 
judgment which i teach you for to do them that ye may live and go 
in and po the land which the lord god of your father giveth you 

4 2 ye shall not add unto the word which i command you neither shall 
ye diminish ought from it that ye may keep the command of the 
lord your god which i command you 

4 3 your eye have seen what the lord did becau of baalpeor for all 
the men that follow baalpeor the lord thi god hath destroy them 
from among you 

4 4 but ye that did cleav unto the lord your god are aliv everi one 
of you thi day 

4 5 behold i have taught you statut and judgment even a the lord 
my god command me that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to 
po it 

4 6 keep therefor and do them for thi is your wisdom and your 
understand in the sight of the nation which shall hear all these 
statut and say sure thi great nation is a wise and 
understand peopl 

4 7 for what nation is there so great who hath god so nigh unto them 
a the lord our god is in all thing that we call upon him for 4 8 
and what nation is there so great that hath statut and judgment so 
righteou a all thi law which i set befor you thi day 4 9 onli 
take heed to thyself and keep thi soul dilig lest thou forget 
the thing which thine eye have seen and lest they depart from thi 
heart all the day of thi life but teach them thi son and thi son 
son 4 10 special the day that thou stoodest befor the lord thi 
god in horeb when the lord said unto me gather me the peopl 
togeth and i will make them hear my word that they may learn to 
fear me all the day that they shall live upon the earth and that 
they may teach their child 

4 11 and ye came near and stood under the mountain and the mountain 
burn with fire unto the midst of heaven with dark cloud and 
thick dark 

4 12 and the lord spake unto you out of the midst of the fire ye 
heard the voic of the word but saw no similitud onli ye heard a 
voic 

4 13 and he declar unto you hi coven which he command you to 
perform even ten command and he wrote them upon two tabl of 
stone 

4 14 and the lord command me at that time to teach you statut and 
judgment that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to 
po it 

4 15 take ye therefor good heed unto yourselv for ye saw no manner 
of similitud on the day that the lord spake unto you in horeb out of 
the midst of the fire 4 16 lest ye corrupt yourselv and make you a 
graven imag the similitud of ani figur the like of male or 
femal 4 17 the like of ani beast that is on the earth the 
like of ani wing fowl that flieth in the air 4 18 the like 
of ani thing that creepeth on the ground the like of ani fish 
that is in the water beneath the earth 4 19 and lest thou lift up 
thine eye unto heaven and when thou seest the sun and the moon and 
the star even all the host of heaven shouldest be driven to worship 
them and serv them which the lord thi god hath divid unto all 
nation under the whole heaven 

4 20 but the lord hath taken you and brought you forth out of the 
iron furnac even out of egypt to be unto him a peopl of 
inherit a ye are thi day 

4 21 furthermor the lord wa angri with me for your sake and sware 
that i should not go over jordan and that i should not go in unto 
that good land which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit 
4 22 but i must die in thi land i must not go over jordan but ye 
shall go over and po that good land 

4 23 take heed unto yourselv lest ye forget the coven of the 
lord your god which he made with you and make you a graven imag or 
the like of ani thing which the lord thi god hath forbidden thee 

4 24 for the lord thi god is a consum fire even a jealou god 

4 25 when thou shalt beget child and child s child and ye 
shall have remain long in the land and shall corrupt yourselv 
and make a graven imag or the like of ani thing and shall do 
evil in the sight of the lord thi god to provok him to anger 4 26 i 
call heaven and earth to wit against you thi day that ye shall 
soon utterli perish from off the land whereunto ye go over jordan to 
po it ye shall not prolong your day upon it but shall utterli 
be destroy 

4 27 and the lord shall scatter you among the nation and ye shall be 
left few in number among the heathen whither the lord shall lead you 

4 28 and there ye shall serv god the work of men s hand wood and 
stone which neither see nor hear nor eat nor smell 

4 29 but if from thenc thou shalt seek the lord thi god thou shalt 
find him if thou seek him with all thi heart and with all thi soul 

4 30 when thou art in tribul and all these thing are come upon 
thee even in the latter day if thou turn to the lord thi god and 
shalt be obedi unto hi voic 4 31 for the lord thi god is a 
merci god he will not forsak thee neither destroy thee nor 
forget the coven of thi father which he sware unto them 

4 32 for ask now of the day that are past which were befor thee 
sinc the day that god creat man upon the earth and ask from the 
one side of heaven unto the other whether there hath been ani such 
thing a thi great thing is or hath been heard like it 4 33 did 
ever peopl hear the voic of god speak out of the midst of the 
fire a thou hast heard and live 4 34 or hath god assay to go 
and take him a nation from the midst of anoth nation by 
temptat by sign and by wonder and by war and by a mighti 
hand and by a stretch out arm and by great terror accord to 
all that the lord your god did for you in egypt befor your eye 
4 35 unto thee it wa shew that thou mightest know that the lord he 
is god there is none el besid him 

4 36 out of heaven he made thee to hear hi voic that he might 
instruct thee and upon earth he shew thee hi great fire and thou 
heardest hi word out of the midst of the fire 

4 37 and becau he love thi father therefor he chose their seed 
after them and brought thee out in hi sight with hi mighti power 
out of egypt 4 38 to drive out nation from befor thee greater and 
mightier than thou art to bring thee in to give thee their land for 
an inherit a it is thi day 

4 39 know therefor thi day and consid it in thine heart that the 
lord he is god in heaven abov and upon the earth beneath there is 
none el 

4 40 thou shalt keep therefor hi statut and hi command 
which i command thee thi day that it may go well with thee and with 
thi child after thee and that thou mayest prolong thi day upon 
the earth which the lord thi god giveth thee for ever 

4 41 then mose sever three citi on thi side jordan toward the 
sunri 4 42 that the slayer might flee thither which should kill 
hi neighbour unawar and hate him not in time past and that 
flee unto one of these citi he might live 4 43 name bezer in 
the wilder in the plain countri of the reubenit and ramoth in 
gilead of the gadit and golan in bashan of the manassit 

4 44 and thi is the law which mose set befor the child of 
israel 4 45 these are the testimoni and the statut and the 
judgment which mose spake unto the child of israel after they 
came forth out of egypt 

4 46 on thi side jordan in the valley over against bethpeor in the 
land of sihon king of the amorit who dwelt at heshbon whom mose 
and the child of israel smote after they were come forth out of 
egypt 4 47 and they poss hi land and the land of og king of 
bashan two king of the amorit which were on thi side jordan 
toward the sunri 4 48 from aroer which is by the bank of the 
river arnon even unto mount sion which is hermon 4 49 and all the 
plain on thi side jordan eastward even unto the sea of the plain 
under the spring of pisgah 

5 1 and mose call all israel and said unto them hear o israel 
the statut and judgment which i speak in your ear thi day that 
ye may learn them and keep and do them 

5 2 the lord our god made a coven with u in horeb 

5 3 the lord made not thi coven with our father but with u 
even u who are all of u here aliv thi day 

5 4 the lord talk with you face to face in the mount out of the 
midst of the fire 5 5 i stood between the lord and you at that time 
to shew you the word of the lord for ye were afraid by reason of the 
fire and went not up into the mount say 5 6 i am the lord thi 
god which brought thee out of the land of egypt from the hou of 
bondag 

5 7 thou shalt have none other god befor me 

5 8 thou shalt not make thee ani graven imag or ani like of ani 
thing that is in heaven abov or that is in the earth beneath or 
that is in the water beneath the earth 5 9 thou shalt not bow down 
thyself unto them nor serv them for i the lord thi god am a jealou 
god visit the iniqu of the father upon the child unto the 
third and fourth gener of them that hate me 5 10 and shew 
merci unto thousand of them that love me and keep my command 

5 11 thou shalt not take the name of the lord thi god in vain for the 
lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh hi name in vain 

5 12 keep the sabbath day to sanctifi it a the lord thi god hath 
command thee 

5 13 six day thou shalt labour and do all thi work 5 14 but the 
seventh day is the sabbath of the lord thi god in it thou shalt not 
do ani work thou nor thi son nor thi daughter nor thi manserv 
nor thi maidserv nor thine ox nor thine a nor ani of thi 
cattl nor thi stranger that is within thi gate that thi manserv 
and thi maidserv may rest a well a thou 

5 15 and rememb that thou wast a servant in the land of egypt and 
that the lord thi god brought thee out thenc through a mighti hand 
and by a stretch out arm therefor the lord thi god command thee 
to keep the sabbath day 

5 16 honour thi father and thi mother a the lord thi god hath 
command thee that thi day may be prolong and that it may go 
well with thee in the land which the lord thi god giveth thee 

5 17 thou shalt not kill 

5 18 neither shalt thou commit adulteri 

5 19 neither shalt thou steal 

5 20 neither shalt thou bear fal wit against thi neighbour 

5 21 neither shalt thou desir thi neighbour s wife neither shalt 
thou covet thi neighbour s hou hi field or hi manserv or hi 
maidserv hi ox or hi a or ani thing that is thi neighbour s 

5 22 these word the lord spake unto all your assembl in the mount 
out of the midst of the fire of the cloud and of the thick dark 
with a great voic and he ad no more and he wrote them in two 
tabl of stone and deliv them unto me 

5 23 and it came to pa when ye heard the voic out of the midst of 
the dark for the mountain did burn with fire that ye came near 
unto me even all the head of your tribe and your elder 5 24 and 
ye said behold the lord our god hath shew u hi glori and hi 
great and we have heard hi voic out of the midst of the fire 
we have seen thi day that god doth talk with man and he liveth 

5 25 now therefor whi should we die for thi great fire will consum 
u if we hear the voic of the lord our god ani more then we shall 
die 

5 26 for who is there of all flesh that hath heard the voic of the 
live god speak out of the midst of the fire a we have and 
live 5 27 go thou near and hear all that the lord our god shall 
say and speak thou unto u all that the lord our god shall speak unto 
thee and we will hear it and do it 

5 28 and the lord heard the voic of your word when ye spake unto 
me and the lord said unto me i have heard the voic of the word of 
thi peopl which they have spoken unto thee they have well said all 
that they have spoken 

5 29 o that there were such an heart in them that they would fear me 
and keep all my command alway that it might be well with them 
and with their child for ever 5 30 go say to them get you into 
your tent again 

5 31 but a for thee stand thou here by me and i will speak unto 
thee all the command and the statut and the judgment which 
thou shalt teach them that they may do them in the land which i give 
them to po it 

5 32 ye shall observ to do therefor a the lord your god hath 
command you ye shall not turn asid to the right hand or to the 
left 

5 33 ye shall walk in all the way which the lord your god hath 
command you that ye may live and that it may be well with you and 
that ye may prolong your day in the land which ye shall po 

6 1 now these are the command the statut and the judgment 
which the lord your god command to teach you that ye might do them 
in the land whither ye go to po it 6 2 that thou mightest fear 
the lord thi god to keep all hi statut and hi command which 
i command thee thou and thi son and thi son s son all the day of 
thi life and that thi day may be prolong 

6 3 hear therefor o israel and observ to do it that it may be 
well with thee and that ye may increa mightili a the lord god of 
thi father hath promi thee in the land that floweth with milk and 
honey 

6 4 hear o israel the lord our god is one lord 6 5 and thou shalt 
love the lord thi god with all thine heart and with all thi soul and 
with all thi might 

6 6 and these word which i command thee thi day shall be in thine 
heart 6 7 and thou shalt teach them dilig unto thi child and 
shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine hou and when thou 
walkest by the way and when thou liest down and when thou risest up 

6 8 and thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand and they 
shall be a frontlet between thine eye 

6 9 and thou shalt write them upon the post of thi hou and on thi 
gate 

6 10 and it shall be when the lord thi god shall have brought thee 
into the land which he sware unto thi father to abraham to isaac 
and to jacob to give thee great and goodli citi which thou 
buildedst not 6 11 and hou full of all good thing which thou 
filledst not and well dig which thou diggedst not vineyard and 
oliv tree which thou plantedst not when thou shalt have eaten and 
be full 6 12 then bewar lest thou forget the lord which brought 
thee forth out of the land of egypt from the hou of bondag 

6 13 thou shalt fear the lord thi god and serv him and shalt swear 
by hi name 

6 14 ye shall not go after other god of the god of the peopl which 
are round about you 6 15 for the lord thi god is a jealou god among 
you lest the anger of the lord thi god be kindl against thee and 
destroy thee from off the face of the earth 

6 16 ye shall not tempt the lord your god a ye tempt him in 
massah 

6 17 ye shall dilig keep the command of the lord your god 
and hi testimoni and hi statut which he hath command thee 

6 18 and thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of 
the lord that it may be well with thee and that thou mayest go in 
and po the good land which the lord sware unto thi father 

6 19 to cast out all thine enemi from befor thee a the lord hath 
spoken 

6 20 and when thi son asketh thee in time to come say what mean 
the testimoni and the statut and the judgment which the lord 
our god hath command you 6 21 then thou shalt say unto thi son we 
were pharaoh s bondman in egypt and the lord brought u out of egypt 
with a mighti hand 6 22 and the lord shew sign and wonder great 
and sore upon egypt upon pharaoh and upon all hi household befor 
our eye 6 23 and he brought u out from thenc that he might bring 
u in to give u the land which he sware unto our father 

6 24 and the lord command u to do all these statut to fear the 
lord our god for our good alway that he might preserv u aliv a 
it is at thi day 

6 25 and it shall be our righteou if we observ to do all these 
command befor the lord our god a he hath command u 

7 1 when the lord thi god shall bring thee into the land whither thou 
goest to po it and hath cast out mani nation befor thee the 
hittit and the girgashit and the amorit and the canaanit 
and the perizzit and the hivit and the jebusit seven nation 
greater and mightier than thou 7 2 and when the lord thi god shall 
deliv them befor thee thou shalt smite them and utterli destroy 
them thou shalt make no coven with them nor shew merci unto them 
7 3 neither shalt thou make marriag with them thi daughter thou 
shalt not give unto hi son nor hi daughter shalt thou take unto thi 
son 

7 4 for they will turn away thi son from follow me that they may 
serv other god so will the anger of the lord be kindl against 
you and destroy thee suddenli 

7 5 but thu shall ye deal with them ye shall destroy their altar 
and break down their imag and cut down their grove and burn their 
graven imag with fire 

7 6 for thou art an holi peopl unto the lord thi god the lord thi 
god hath chosen thee to be a special peopl unto himself abov all 
peopl that are upon the face of the earth 

7 7 the lord did not set hi love upon you nor choo you becau ye 
were more in number than ani peopl for ye were the fewest of all 
peopl 7 8 but becau the lord love you and becau he would keep 
the oath which he had sworn unto your father hath the lord brought 
you out with a mighti hand and redeem you out of the hou of 
bondman from the hand of pharaoh king of egypt 

7 9 know therefor that the lord thi god he is god the faith god 
which keepeth coven and merci with them that love him and keep hi 
command to a thousand gener 7 10 and repayeth them that 
hate him to their face to destroy them he will not be slack to him 
that hateth him he will repay him to hi face 

7 11 thou shalt therefor keep the command and the statut and 
the judgment which i command thee thi day to do them 

7 12 wherefor it shall come to pa if ye hearken to these 
judgment and keep and do them that the lord thi god shall keep 
unto thee the coven and the merci which he sware unto thi father 
7 13 and he will love thee and bless thee and multipli thee he will 
also bless the fruit of thi womb and the fruit of thi land thi corn 
and thi wine and thine oil the increa of thi kine and the flock 
of thi sheep in the land which he sware unto thi father to give 
thee 

7 14 thou shalt be bless abov all peopl there shall not be male 
or femal barren among you or among your cattl 

7 15 and the lord will take away from thee all sick and will put 
none of the evil disea of egypt which thou knowest upon thee but 
will lay them upon all them that hate thee 

7 16 and thou shalt consum all the peopl which the lord thi god 
shall deliv thee thine eye shall have no piti upon them neither 
shalt thou serv their god for that will be a snare unto thee 

7 17 if thou shalt say in thine heart these nation are more than i 
how can i dispossess them 7 18 thou shalt not be afraid of them but 
shalt well rememb what the lord thi god did unto pharaoh and unto 
all egypt 7 19 the great temptat which thine eye saw and the 
sign and the wonder and the mighti hand and the stretch out 
arm wherebi the lord thi god brought thee out so shall the lord thi 
god do unto all the peopl of whom thou art afraid 

7 20 moreov the lord thi god will send the hornet among them until 
they that are left and hide themselv from thee be destroy 

7 21 thou shalt not be affright at them for the lord thi god is 
among you a mighti god and terribl 

7 22 and the lord thi god will put out those nation befor thee by 
littl and littl thou mayest not consum them at onc lest the 
beast of the field increa upon thee 

7 23 but the lord thi god shall deliv them unto thee and shall 
destroy them with a mighti destruct until they be destroy 

7 24 and he shall deliv their king into thine hand and thou shalt 
destroy their name from under heaven there shall no man be abl to 
stand befor thee until thou have destroy them 

7 25 the graven imag of their god shall ye burn with fire thou 
shalt not desir the silver or gold that is on them nor take it unto 
thee lest thou be snare therin for it is an abomin to the lord 
thi god 

7 26 neither shalt thou bring an abomin into thine hou lest 
thou be a cur thing like it but thou shalt utterli detest it and 
thou shalt utterli abhor it for it is a cur thing 

8 1 all the command which i command thee thi day shall ye 
observ to do that ye may live and multipli and go in and po 
the land which the lord sware unto your father 

8 2 and thou shalt rememb all the way which the lord thi god led 
thee these forti year in the wilder to humbl thee and to prove 
thee to know what wa in thine heart whether thou wouldest keep hi 
command or no 

8 3 and he humbl thee and suffer thee to hunger and fed thee 
with manna which thou knewest not neither did thi father know that 
he might make thee know that man doth not live by bread onli but by 
everi word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the lord doth man live 

8 4 thi raiment wax not old upon thee neither did thi foot swell 
these forti year 

8 5 thou shalt also consid in thine heart that a a man chasteneth 
hi son so the lord thi god chasteneth thee 

8 6 therefor thou shalt keep the command of the lord thi god to 
walk in hi way and to fear him
