distress thee in all thi gate 

28 56 the tender and delic woman among you which would not 
adventur to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delic 
and tender her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom 
and toward her son and toward her daughter 28 57 and toward her 
young one that cometh out from between her foot and toward her 
child which she shall bear for she shall eat them for want of all 
thing secretli in the sieg and strait wherewith thine enemi 
shall distress thee in thi gate 

28 58 if thou wilt not observ to do all the word of thi law that 
are written in thi book that thou mayest fear thi gloriou and 
fear name the lord thi god 28 59 then the lord will make thi 
plagu wonder and the plagu of thi seed even great plagu 
and of long continu and sore sick and of long continu 

28 60 moreov he will bring upon thee all the disea of egypt 
which thou wast afraid of and they shall cleav unto thee 

28 61 also everi sick and everi plagu which is not written in 
the book of thi law them will the lord bring upon thee until thou 
be destroy 

28 62 and ye shall be left few in number wherea ye were a the star 
of heaven for multitud becau thou wouldest not obey the voic of 
the lord thi god 

28 63 and it shall come to pa that a the lord rejoic over you to 
do you good and to multipli you so the lord will rejoic over you to 
destroy you and to bring you to nought and ye shall be pluck from 
off the land whither thou goest to po it 

28 64 and the lord shall scatter thee among all peopl from the one 
end of the earth even unto the other and there thou shalt serv other 
god which neither thou nor thi father have known even wood and 
stone 

28 65 and among these nation shalt thou find no ea neither shall 
the sole of thi foot have rest but the lord shall give thee there a 
trembl heart and fail of eye and sorrow of mind 28 66 and 
thi life shall hang in doubt befor thee and thou shalt fear day and 
night and shalt have none assur of thi life 28 67 in the morn 
thou shalt say would god it were even and at even thou shalt say 
would god it were morn for the fear of thine heart wherewith thou 
shalt fear and for the sight of thine eye which thou shalt see 

28 68 and the lord shall bring thee into egypt again with ship by 
the way whereof i spake unto thee thou shalt see it no more again 
and there ye shall be sold unto your enemi for bondman and 
bondwoman and no man shall buy you 

29 1 these are the word of the coven which the lord command 
mose to make with the child of israel in the land of moab besid 
the coven which he made with them in horeb 

29 2 and mose call unto all israel and said unto them ye have 
seen all that the lord did befor your eye in the land of egypt unto 
pharaoh and unto all hi servant and unto all hi land 29 3 the 
great temptat which thine eye have seen the sign and those 
great miracl 29 4 yet the lord hath not given you an heart to 
perceiv and eye to see and ear to hear unto thi day 

29 5 and i have led you forti year in the wilder your cloth 
are not waxen old upon you and thi shoe is not waxen old upon thi 
foot 

29 6 ye have not eaten bread neither have ye drunk wine or strong 
drink that ye might know that i am the lord your god 

29 7 and when ye came unto thi place sihon the king of heshbon and 
og the king of bashan came out against u unto battl and we smote 
them 29 8 and we took their land and gave it for an inherit unto 
the reubenit and to the gadit and to the half tribe of manasseh 

29 9 keep therefor the word of thi coven and do them that ye 
may prosper in all that ye do 

29 10 ye stand thi day all of you befor the lord your god your 
captain of your tribe your elder and your offic with all the 
men of israel 29 11 your littl one your wife and thi stranger 
that is in thi camp from the hewer of thi wood unto the drawer of thi 
water 29 12 that thou shouldest enter into coven with the lord thi 
god and into hi oath which the lord thi god maketh with thee thi 
day 29 13 that he may establish thee to day for a peopl unto 
himself and that he may be unto thee a god a he hath said unto 
thee and a he hath sworn unto thi father to abraham to isaac and 
to jacob 

29 14 neither with you onli do i make thi coven and thi oath 
29 15 but with him that standeth here with u thi day befor the lord 
our god and also with him that is not here with u thi day 29 16 
for ye know how we have dwelt in the land of egypt and how we came 
through the nation which ye pa by 29 17 and ye have seen their 
abomin and their idol wood and stone silver and gold which 
were among them 29 18 lest there should be among you man or woman 
or famili or tribe whose heart turneth away thi day from the lord 
our god to go and serv the god of these nation lest there should 
be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood 29 19 and it come 
to pa when he heareth the word of thi cur that he bless 
himself in hi heart say i shall have peac though i walk in the 
imagin of mine heart to add drunken to thirst 29 20 the 
lord will not spare him but then the anger of the lord and hi 
jealousi shall smoke against that man and all the cur that are 
written in thi book shall lie upon him and the lord shall blot out 
hi name from under heaven 

29 21 and the lord shall separ him unto evil out of all the tribe 
of israel accord to all the cur of the coven that are 
written in thi book of the law 29 22 so that the gener to come 
of your child that shall rise up after you and the stranger that 
shall come from a far land shall say when they see the plagu of 
that land and the sick which the lord hath laid upon it 29 23 
and that the whole land thereof is brimston and salt and burn 
that it is not sown nor beareth nor ani grass groweth therein like 
the overthrow of sodom and gomorrah admah and zeboim which the 
lord overthrew in hi anger and in hi wrath 29 24 even all nation 
shall say wherefor hath the lord done thu unto thi land what 
meaneth the heat of thi great anger 29 25 then men shall say 
becau they have forsaken the coven of the lord god of their 
father which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the 
land of egypt 29 26 for they went and serv other god and 
worship them god whom they knew not and whom he had not given 
unto them 29 27 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against thi 
land to bring upon it all the cur that are written in thi book 
29 28 and the lord root them out of their land in anger and in 
wrath and in great indign and cast them into anoth land a 
it is thi day 

29 29 the secret thing belong unto the lord our god but those thing 
which are reveal belong unto u and to our child for ever that 
we may do all the word of thi law 

30 1 and it shall come to pa when all these thing are come upon 
thee the bless and the cur which i have set befor thee and 
thou shalt call them to mind among all the nation whither the lord 
thi god hath driven thee 30 2 and shalt return unto the lord thi god 
and shalt obey hi voic accord to all that i command thee thi 
day thou and thi child with all thine heart and with all thi 
soul 30 3 that then the lord thi god will turn thi captiv and 
have compass upon thee and will return and gather thee from all 
the nation whither the lord thi god hath scatter thee 

30 4 if ani of thine be driven out unto the outmost part of heaven 
from thenc will the lord thi god gather thee and from thenc will he 
fetch thee 30 5 and the lord thi god will bring thee into the land 
which thi father poss and thou shalt po it and he will do 
thee good and multipli thee abov thi father 

30 6 and the lord thi god will circumci thine heart and the heart 
of thi seed to love the lord thi god with all thine heart and with 
all thi soul that thou mayest live 

30 7 and the lord thi god will put all these cur upon thine 
enemi and on them that hate thee which persecut thee 

30 8 and thou shalt return and obey the voic of the lord and do all 
hi command which i command thee thi day 

30 9 and the lord thi god will make thee plenteou in everi work of 
thine hand in the fruit of thi bodi and in the fruit of thi cattl 
and in the fruit of thi land for good for the lord will again 
rejoic over thee for good a he rejoic over thi father 30 10 if 
thou shalt hearken unto the voic of the lord thi god to keep hi 
command and hi statut which are written in thi book of the 
law and if thou turn unto the lord thi god with all thine heart and 
with all thi soul 

30 11 for thi command which i command thee thi day it is not 
hidden from thee neither is it far off 

30 12 it is not in heaven that thou shouldest say who shall go up 
for u to heaven and bring it unto u that we may hear it and do 
it 30 13 neither is it beyond the sea that thou shouldest say who 
shall go over the sea for u and bring it unto u that we may hear 
it and do it 30 14 but the word is veri nigh unto thee in thi 
mouth and in thi heart that thou mayest do it 

30 15 see i have set befor thee thi day life and good and death 
and evil 30 16 in that i command thee thi day to love the lord thi 
god to walk in hi way and to keep hi command and hi 
statut and hi judgment that thou mayest live and multipli and 
the lord thi god shall bless thee in the land whither thou goest to 
po it 

30 17 but if thine heart turn away so that thou wilt not hear but 
shalt be drawn away and worship other god and serv them 30 18 i 
denounc unto you thi day that ye shall sure perish and that ye 
shall not prolong your day upon the land whither thou passest over 
jordan to go to po it 

30 19 i call heaven and earth to record thi day against you that i 
have set befor you life and death bless and cur therefor 
choo life that both thou and thi seed may live 30 20 that thou 
mayest love the lord thi god and that thou mayest obey hi voic and 
that thou mayest cleav unto him for he is thi life and the length 
of thi day that thou mayest dwell in the land which the lord sware 
unto thi father to abraham to isaac and to jacob to give them 

31 1 and mose went and spake these word unto all israel 

31 2 and he said unto them i am an hundr and twenti year old thi 
day i can no more go out and come in also the lord hath said unto 
me thou shalt not go over thi jordan 

31 3 the lord thi god he will go over befor thee and he will 
destroy these nation from befor thee and thou shalt po them 
and joshua he shall go over befor thee a the lord hath said 

31 4 and the lord shall do unto them a he did to sihon and to og 
king of the amorit and unto the land of them whom he destroy 

31 5 and the lord shall give them up befor your face that ye may do 
unto them accord unto all the command which i have command 
you 

31 6 be strong and of a good courag fear not nor be afraid of them 
for the lord thi god he it is that doth go with thee he will not 
fail thee nor forsak thee 

31 7 and mose call unto joshua and said unto him in the sight of 
all israel be strong and of a good courag for thou must go with 
thi peopl unto the land which the lord hath sworn unto their father 
to give them and thou shalt cau them to inherit it 

31 8 and the lord he it is that doth go befor thee he will be with 
thee he will not fail thee neither forsak thee fear not neither 
be dismay 

31 9 and mose wrote thi law and deliv it unto the priest the 
son of levi which bare the ark of the coven of the lord and unto 
all the elder of israel 

31 10 and mose command them say at the end of everi seven 
year in the solemn of the year of relea in the feast of 
tabernacl 31 11 when all israel is come to appear befor the lord 
thi god in the place which he shall choo thou shalt read thi law 
befor all israel in their hear 

31 12 gather the peopl togeth men and woman and child and thi 
stranger that is within thi gate that they may hear and that they 
may learn and fear the lord your god and observ to do all the word 
of thi law 31 13 and that their child which have not known ani 
thing may hear and learn to fear the lord your god a long a ye 
live in the land whither ye go over jordan to po it 

31 14 and the lord said unto mose behold thi day approach that 
thou must die call joshua and present yourselv in the tabernacl 
of the congreg that i may give him a charg and mose and 
joshua went and present themselv in the tabernacl of the 
congreg 

31 15 and the lord appear in the tabernacl in a pillar of a cloud 
and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the tabernacl 

31 16 and the lord said unto mose behold thou shalt sleep with thi 
father and thi peopl will rise up and go a whore after the god 
of the stranger of the land whither they go to be among them and 
will forsak me and break my coven which i have made with them 

31 17 then my anger shall be kindl against them in that day and i 
will forsak them and i will hide my face from them and they shall 
be devour and mani evil and troubl shall befal them so that 
they will say in that day are not these evil come upon u becau 
our god is not among u 31 18 and i will sure hide my face in that 
day for all the evil which they shall have wrought in that they are 
turn unto other god 

31 19 now therefor write ye thi song for you and teach it the 
child of israel put it in their mouth that thi song may be a 
wit for me against the child of israel 

31 20 for when i shall have brought them into the land which i sware 
unto their father that floweth with milk and honey and they shall 
have eaten and fill themselv and waxen fat then will they turn 
unto other god and serv them and provok me and break my 
coven 

31 21 and it shall come to pa when mani evil and troubl are 
befallen them that thi song shall testifi against them a a wit 
for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouth of their seed for i 
know their imagin which they go about even now befor i have 
brought them into the land which i sware 

31 22 mose therefor wrote thi song the same day and taught it the 
child of israel 

31 23 and he gave joshua the son of nun a charg and said be strong 
and of a good courag for thou shalt bring the child of israel 
into the land which i sware unto them and i will be with thee 

31 24 and it came to pa when mose had made an end of write the 
word of thi law in a book until they were finish 31 25 that 
mose command the levit which bare the ark of the coven of the 
lord say 31 26 take thi book of the law and put it in the side 
of the ark of the coven of the lord your god that it may be there 
for a wit against thee 

31 27 for i know thi rebellion and thi stiff neck behold while i am 
yet aliv with you thi day ye have been rebelli against the lord 
and how much more after my death 31 28 gather unto me all the elder 
of your tribe and your offic that i may speak these word in 
their ear and call heaven and earth to record against them 

31 29 for i know that after my death ye will utterli corrupt 
yourselv and turn asid from the way which i have command you 
and evil will befal you in the latter day becau ye will do evil 
in the sight of the lord to provok him to anger through the work of 
your hand 

31 30 and mose spake in the ear of all the congreg of israel 
the word of thi song until they were end 

32 1 give ear o ye heaven and i will speak and hear o earth the 
word of my mouth 

32 2 my doctrin shall drop a the rain my speech shall distil a the 
dew a the small rain upon the tender herb and a the shower upon 
the grass 32 3 becau i will publish the name of the lord ascrib 
ye great unto our god 

32 4 he is the rock hi work is perfect for all hi way are 
judgment a god of truth and without iniqu just and right is he 

32 5 they have corrupt themselv their spot is not the spot of hi 
child they are a perver and crook gener 

32 6 do ye thu requit the lord o foolish peopl and unwi is not 
he thi father that hath bought thee hath he not made thee and 
establish thee 32 7 rememb the day of old consid the year 
of mani gener ask thi father and he will shew thee thi 
elder and they will tell thee 

32 8 when the most high divid to the nation their inherit when 
he separ the son of adam he set the bound of the peopl 
accord to the number of the child of israel 

32 9 for the lord s portion is hi peopl jacob is the lot of hi 
inherit 

32 10 he found him in a desert land and in the wast howl 
wilder he led him about he instruct him he kept him a the 
appl of hi eye 

32 11 a an eagl stirreth up her nest fluttereth over her young 
spreadeth abroad her wing taketh them beareth them on her wing 
32 12 so the lord alon did lead him and there wa no strang god 
with him 

32 13 he made him ride on the high place of the earth that he might 
eat the increa of the field and he made him to suck honey out of 
the rock and oil out of the flinti rock 32 14 butter of kine and 
milk of sheep with fat of lamb and ram of the breed of bashan and 
goat with the fat of kidney of wheat and thou didst drink the pure 
blood of the grape 

32 15 but jeshurun wax fat and kick thou art waxen fat thou art 
grown thick thou art cover with fat then he forsook god which 
made him and lightli esteem the rock of hi salvat 

32 16 they provok him to jealousi with strang god with 
abomin provok they him to anger 

32 17 they sacrif unto devil not to god to god whom they knew 
not to new god that came newli up whom your father fear not 

32 18 of the rock that begat thee thou art unmind and hast 
forgotten god that form thee 

32 19 and when the lord saw it he abhor them becau of the 
provok of hi son and of hi daughter 

32 20 and he said i will hide my face from them i will see what 
their end shall be for they are a veri froward gener child 
in whom is no faith 

32 21 they have move me to jealousi with that which is not god they 
have provok me to anger with their vaniti and i will move them to 
jealousi with those which are not a peopl i will provok them to 
anger with a foolish nation 

32 22 for a fire is kindl in mine anger and shall burn unto the 
lowest hell and shall consum the earth with her increa and set on 
fire the foundat of the mountain 

32 23 i will heap mischief upon them i will spend mine arrow upon 
them 

32 24 they shall be burnt with hunger and devour with burn heat 
and with bitter destruct i will also send the teeth of beast upon 
them with the poison of serpent of the dust 

32 25 the sword without and terror within shall destroy both the 
young man and the virgin the suckl also with the man of gray 
hair 

32 26 i said i would scatter them into corner i would make the 
remembr of them to cea from among men 32 27 were it not that i 
fear the wrath of the enemi lest their adversari should behav 
themselv strang and lest they should say our hand is high and 
the lord hath not done all thi 

32 28 for they are a nation void of counsel neither is there ani 
understand in them 

32 29 o that they were wise that they understood thi that they 
would consid their latter end 32 30 how should one chase a 
thousand and two put ten thousand to flight except their rock had 
sold them and the lord had shut them up 32 31 for their rock is not 
a our rock even our enemi themselv be judg 

32 32 for their vine is of the vine of sodom and of the field of 
gomorrah their grape are grape of gall their cluster are bitter 
32 33 their wine is the poison of dragon and the cruel venom of 
asp 

32 34 is not thi laid up in store with me and seal up among my 
treasur 32 35 to me belongeth vengeanc and recomp their foot 
shall slide in due time for the day of their calam is at hand and 
the thing that shall come upon them make hast 

32 36 for the lord shall judg hi peopl and repent himself for hi 
servant when he seeth that their power is gone and there is none 
shut up or left 

32 37 and he shall say where are their god their rock in whom they 
trust 32 38 which did eat the fat of their sacrif and drank 
the wine of their drink offer let them rise up and help you and 
be your protect 

32 39 see now that i even i am he and there is no god with me i 
kill and i make aliv i wound and i heal neither is there ani that 
can deliv out of my hand 

32 40 for i lift up my hand to heaven and say i live for ever 

32 41 if i whet my glitter sword and mine hand take hold on 
judgment i will render vengeanc to mine enemi and will reward 
them that hate me 

32 42 i will make mine arrow drunk with blood and my sword shall 
devour flesh and that with the blood of the slain and of the 
captiv from the begin of reveng upon the enemi 

32 43 rejoic o ye nation with hi peopl for he will aveng the 
blood of hi servant and will render vengeanc to hi adversari 
and will be merci unto hi land and to hi peopl 

32 44 and mose came and spake all the word of thi song in the ear 
of the peopl he and hoshea the son of nun 

32 45 and mose made an end of speak all these word to all israel 
32 46 and he said unto them set your heart unto all the word which 
i testifi among you thi day which ye shall command your child to 
observ to do all the word of thi law 

32 47 for it is not a vain thing for you becau it is your life and 
through thi thing ye shall prolong your day in the land whither ye 
go over jordan to po it 

32 48 and the lord spake unto mose that selfsam day say 32 49 
get thee up into thi mountain abarim unto mount nebo which is in 
the land of moab that is over against jericho and behold the land of 
canaan which i give unto the child of israel for a poss 
32 50 and die in the mount whither thou goest up and be gather unto 
thi peopl a aaron thi brother die in mount hor and wa gather 
unto hi peopl 32 51 becau ye trespass against me among the 
child of israel at the water of meribahkadesh in the wilder 
of zin becau ye sanctifi me not in the midst of the child of 
israel 

32 52 yet thou shalt see the land befor thee but thou shalt not go 
thither unto the land which i give the child of israel 

33 1 and thi is the bless wherewith mose the man of god bless 
the child of israel befor hi death 

33 2 and he said the lord came from sinai and rose up from seir unto 
them he shine forth from mount paran and he came with ten thousand 
of saint from hi right hand went a fieri law for them 

33 3 yea he love the peopl all hi saint are in thi hand and 
they sat down at thi foot everi one shall receiv of thi word 

33 4 mose command u a law even the inherit of the 
congreg of jacob 

33 5 and he wa king in jeshurun when the head of the peopl and the 
tribe of israel were gather togeth 

33 6 let reuben live and not die and let not hi men be few 

33 7 and thi is the bless of judah and he said hear lord the 
voic of judah and bring him unto hi peopl let hi hand be 
suffici for him and be thou an help to him from hi enemi 

33 8 and of levi he said let thi thummim and thi urim be with thi 
holi one whom thou didst prove at massah and with whom thou didst 
strive at the water of meribah 33 9 who said unto hi father and to 
hi mother i have not seen him neither did he acknowledg hi 
brother nor knew hi own child for they have observ thi word 
and kept thi coven 

33 10 they shall teach jacob thi judgment and israel thi law they 
shall put incen befor thee and whole burnt sacrif upon thine 
altar 

33 11 bless lord hi substanc and accept the work of hi hand 
smite through the loin of them that rise against him and of them 
that hate him that they rise not again 

33 12 and of benjamin he said the belov of the lord shall dwell in 
safeti by him and the lord shall cover him all the day long and he 
shall dwell between hi shoulder 

33 13 and of joseph he said bless of the lord be hi land for the 
preciou thing of heaven for the dew and for the deep that coucheth 
beneath 33 14 and for the preciou fruit brought forth by the sun 
and for the preciou thing put forth by the moon 33 15 and for the 
chief thing of the ancient mountain and for the preciou thing of 
the last hill 33 16 and for the preciou thing of the earth and 
ful thereof and for the good will of him that dwelt in the bush 
let the bless come upon the head of joseph and upon the top of the 
head of him that wa separ from hi brother 

33 17 hi glori is like the firstl of hi bullock and hi horn 
are like the horn of unicorn with them he shall push the peopl 
togeth to the end of the earth and they are the ten thousand of 
ephraim and they are the thousand of manasseh 

33 18 and of zebulun he said rejoic zebulun in thi go out and 
issachar in thi tent 

33 19 they shall call the peopl unto the mountain there they shall 
offer sacrif of righteou for they shall suck of the 
abund of the sea and of treasur hid in the sand 

33 20 and of gad he said bless be he that enlargeth gad he 
dwelleth a a lion and teareth the arm with the crown of the head 

33 21 and he provid the first part for himself becau there in a 
portion of the lawgiv wa he seat and he came with the head of 
the peopl he execut the justic of the lord and hi judgment 
with israel 

33 22 and of dan he said dan is a lion s whelp he shall leap from 
bashan 

33 23 and of naphtali he said o naphtali satisfi with favour and 
full with the bless of the lord po thou the west and the 
south 

33 24 and of asher he said let asher be bless with child let 
him be accept to hi brother and let him dip hi foot in oil 

33 25 thi shoe shall be iron and brass and a thi day so shall thi 
strength be 

33 26 there is none like unto the god of jeshurun who rideth upon the 
heaven in thi help and in hi excel on the sky 

33 27 the etern god is thi refug and underneath are the 
everlast arm and he shall thrust out the enemi from befor thee 
and shall say destroy them 

33 28 israel then shall dwell in safeti alon the fountain of jacob 
shall be upon a land of corn and wine also hi heaven shall drop 
down dew 

33 29 happi art thou o israel who is like unto thee o peopl save 
by the lord the shield of thi help and who is the sword of thi 
excel and thine enemi shall be found liar unto thee and thou 
shalt tread upon their high place 

34 1 and mose went up from the plain of moab unto the mountain of 
nebo to the top of pisgah that is over against jericho and the lord 
shew him all the land of gilead unto dan 34 2 and all naphtali 
and the land of ephraim and manasseh and all the land of judah unto 
the utmost sea 34 3 and the south and the plain of the valley of 
jericho the citi of palm tree unto zoar 

34 4 and the lord said unto him thi is the land which i sware unto 
abraham unto isaac and unto jacob say i will give it unto thi 
seed i have cau thee to see it with thine eye but thou shalt not 
go over thither 

34 5 so mose the servant of the lord die there in the land of moab 
accord to the word of the lord 

34 6 and he buri him in a valley in the land of moab over against 
bethpeor but no man knoweth of hi sepulchr unto thi day 

34 7 and mose wa an hundr and twenti year old when he die hi 
eye wa not dim nor hi natur forc abat 

34 8 and the child of israel wept for mose in the plain of moab 
thirti day so the day of weep and mourn for mose were end 

34 9 and joshua the son of nun wa full of the spirit of wisdom for 
mose had laid hi hand upon him and the child of israel 
hearken unto him and did a the lord command mose 

34 10 and there aro not a prophet sinc in israel like unto mose 
whom the lord knew face to face 34 11 in all the sign and the 
wonder which the lord sent him to do in the land of egypt to 
pharaoh and to all hi servant and to all hi land 34 12 and in 
all that mighti hand and in all the great terror which mose shew 
in the sight of all israel 




the book of joshua 


1 1 now after the death of mose the servant of the lord it came to 
pa that the lord spake unto joshua the son of nun mose minist 
say 1 2 mose my servant is dead now therefor ari go over 
thi jordan thou and all thi peopl unto the land which i do give 
to them even to the child of israel 

1 3 everi place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon that have 
i given unto you a i said unto mose 

1 4 from the wilder and thi lebanon even unto the great river 
the river euphrat all the land of the hittit and unto the great 
sea toward the go down of the sun shall be your coast 

1 5 there shall not ani man be abl to stand befor thee all the day 
of thi life a i wa with mose so i will be with thee i will not 
fail thee nor forsak thee 

1 6 be strong and of a good courag for unto thi peopl shalt thou 
divid for an inherit the land which i sware unto their father 
to give them 

1 7 onli be thou strong and veri courag that thou mayest observ 
to do accord to all the law which mose my servant command thee 
turn not from it to the right hand or to the left that thou mayest 
prosper withersoev thou goest 

1 8 thi book of the law shall not depart out of thi mouth but thou 
shalt medit therein day and night that thou mayest observ to do 
accord to all that is written therein for then thou shalt make thi 
way prosper and then thou shalt have good success 

1 9 have not i command thee be strong and of a good courag be not 
afraid neither be thou dismay for the lord thi god is with thee 
whithersoev thou goest 

1 10 then joshua command the offic of the peopl say 1 11 
pa through the host and command the peopl say prepar you 
victual for within three day ye shall pa over thi jordan to go 
in to po the land which the lord your god giveth you to po 
it 

1 12 and to the reubenit and to the gadit and to half the tribe 
of manasseh spake joshua say 1 13 rememb the word which mose 
the servant of the lord command you say the lord your god hath 
given you rest and hath given you thi land 

1 14 your wife your littl one and your cattl shall remain in 
the land which mose gave you on thi side jordan but ye shall pa 
befor your brother arm all the mighti men of valour and help 
them 1 15 until the lord have given your brother rest a he hath 
given you and they also have poss the land which the lord your 
god giveth them then ye shall return unto the land of your 
poss and enjoy it which mose the lord s servant gave you on 
thi side jordan toward the sunri 

1 16 and they answer joshua say all that thou commandest u we 
will do and whithersoev thou sendest u we will go 

1 17 accord a we hearken unto mose in all thing so will we 
hearken unto thee onli the lord thi god be with thee a he wa with 
mose 

1 18 whosoev he be that doth rebel against thi command and will 
not hearken unto thi word in all that thou commandest him he shall 
be put to death onli be strong and of a good courag 

2 1 and joshua the son of nun sent out of shittim two men to spi 
secretli say go view the land even jericho and they went and 
came into an harlot s hou name rahab and lodg there 

2 2 and it wa told the king of jericho say behold there came 
men in hither to night of the child of israel to search out the 
countri 

2 3 and the king of jericho sent unto rahab say bring forth the 
men that are come to thee which are enter into thine hou for 
they be come to search out all the countri 

2 4 and the woman took the two men and hid them and said thu there 
came men unto me but i wist not whenc they were 2 5 and it came to 
pa about the time of shut of the gate when it wa dark that 
the men went out whither the men went i wot not pursu after them 
quickli for ye shall overtak them 

2 6 but she had brought them up to the roof of the hou and hid them 
with the stalk of flax which she had laid in order upon the roof 

2 7 and the men pursu after them the way to jordan unto the ford 
and a soon a they which pursu after them were gone out they shut 
the gate 

2 8 and befor they were laid down she came up unto them upon the 
roof 2 9 and she said unto the men i know that the lord hath given 
you the land and that your terror is fallen upon u and that all the 
inhabit of the land faint becau of you 

2 10 for we have heard how the lord dri up the water of the red sea 
for you when ye came out of egypt and what ye did unto the two king 
of the amorit that were on the other side jordan sihon and og 
whom ye utterli destroy 

2 11 and a soon a we had heard these thing our heart did melt 
neither did there remain ani more courag in ani man becau of you 
for the lord your god he is god in heaven abov and in earth 
beneath 

2 12 now therefor i pray you swear unto me by the lord sinc i 
have shew you kind that ye will also shew kind unto my 
father s hou and give me a true token 2 13 and that ye will save 
aliv my father and my mother and my brother and my sister and 
all that they have and deliv our life from death 

2 14 and the men answer her our life for your if ye utter not 
thi our busi and it shall be when the lord hath given u the 
land that we will deal kindli and truli with thee 

2 15 then she let them down by a cord through the window for her 
hou wa upon the town wall and she dwelt upon the wall 

2 16 and she said unto them get you to the mountain lest the 
pursuer meet you and hide yourselv there three day until the 
pursuer be return and afterward may ye go your way 

2 17 and the men said unto her we will be blameless of thi thine 
oath which thou hast made u swear 

2 18 behold when we come into the land thou shalt bind thi line of 
scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let u down by and thou 
shalt bring thi father and thi mother and thi brother and all thi 
father s household home unto thee 

2 19 and it shall be that whosoev shall go out of the door of thi 
hou into the street hi blood shall be upon hi head and we will 
be guiltless and whosoev shall be with thee in the hou hi blood 
shall be on our head if ani hand be upon him 

2 20 and if thou utter thi our busi then we will be quit of 
thine oath which thou hast made u to swear 

2 21 and she said accord unto your word so be it and she sent 
them away and they depart and she bound the scarlet line in the 
window 

2 22 and they went and came unto the mountain and abod there three 
day until the pursuer were return and the pursuer sought them 
throughout all the way but found them not 

2 23 so the two men return and descend from the mountain and 
pa over and came to joshua the son of nun and told him all 
thing that befel them 2 24 and they said unto joshua truli the 
lord hath deliv into our hand all the land for even all the 
inhabit of the countri do faint becau of u 

3 1 and joshua rose earli in the morn and they remov from 
shittim and came to jordan he and all the child of israel and 
lodg there befor they pa over 

3 2 and it came to pa after three day that the offic went 
through the host 3 3 and they command the peopl say when ye 
see the ark of the coven of the lord your god and the priest the 
levit bear it then ye shall remov from your place and go after 
it 

3 4 yet there shall be a space between you and it about two thousand 
cubit by measur come not near unto it that ye may know the way by 
which ye must go for ye have not pa thi way heretofor 

3 5 and joshua said unto the peopl sanctifi yourselv for to 
morrow the lord will do wonder among you 

3 6 and joshua spake unto the priest say take up the ark of the 
coven and pa over befor the peopl and they took up the ark of 
the coven and went befor the peopl 

3 7 and the lord said unto joshua thi day will i begin to magnifi 
thee in the sight of all israel that they may know that a i wa 
with mose so i will be with thee 

3 8 and thou shalt command the priest that bear the ark of the 
coven say when ye are come to the brink of the water of 
jordan ye shall stand still in jordan 

3 9 and joshua said unto the child of israel come hither and hear 
the word of the lord your god 

3 10 and joshua said herebi ye shall know that the live god is 
among you and that he will without fail drive out from befor you the 
canaanit and the hittit and the hivit and the perizzit and 
the girgashit and the amorit and the jebusit 

3 11 behold the ark of the coven of the lord of all the earth 
passeth over befor you into jordan 

3 12 now therefor take you twelv men out of the tribe of israel 
out of everi tribe a man 

3 13 and it shall come to pa a soon a the sol of the foot of 
the priest that bear the ark of the lord the lord of all the earth 
shall rest in the water of jordan that the water of jordan shall be 
cut off from the water that come down from abov and they shall 
stand upon an heap 

3 14 and it came to pa when the peopl remov from their tent to 
pa over jordan and the priest bear the ark of the coven 
befor the peopl 3 15 and a they that bare the ark were come unto 
jordan and the foot of the priest that bare the ark were dip in 
the brim of the water for jordan overfloweth all hi bank all the 
time of harvest 3 16 that the water which came down from abov 
stood and rose up upon an heap veri far from the citi adam that is 
besid zaretan and those that came down toward the sea of the plain 
even the salt sea fail and were cut off and the peopl pa 
over right against jericho 

3 17 and the priest that bare the ark of the coven of the lord 
stood firm on dri ground in the midst of jordan and all the 
israelit pa over on dri ground until all the peopl were pa 
clean over jordan 

4 1 and it came to pa when all the peopl were clean pa over 
jordan that the lord spake unto joshua say 4 2 take you twelv 
men out of the peopl out of everi tribe a man 4 3 and command ye 
them say take you henc out of the midst of jordan out of the 
place where the priest foot stood firm twelv stone and ye shall 
carri them over with you and leav them in the lodg place where 
ye shall lodg thi night 

4 4 then joshua call the twelv men whom he had prepar of the 
child of israel out of everi tribe a man 4 5 and joshua said unto 
them pa over befor the ark of the lord your god into the midst of 
jordan and take you up everi man of you a stone upon hi shoulder 
accord unto the number of the tribe of the child of israel 4 6 
that thi may be a sign among you that when your child ask their 
father in time to come say what mean ye by these stone 4 7 
then ye shall answer them that the water of jordan were cut off 
befor the ark of the coven of the lord when it pa over 
jordan the water of jordan were cut off and these stone shall be 
for a memori unto the child of israel for ever 

4 8 and the child of israel did so a joshua command and took up 
twelv stone out of the midst of jordan a the lord spake unto 
joshua accord to the number of the tribe of the child of 
israel and carri them over with them unto the place where they 
lodg and laid them down there 

4 9 and joshua set up twelv stone in the midst of jordan in the 
place where the foot of the priest which bare the ark of the coven 
stood and they are there unto thi day 

4 10 for the priest which bare the ark stood in the midst of jordan 
until everyth wa finish that the lord command joshua to speak 
unto the peopl accord to all that mose command joshua and the 
peopl hast and pa over 

4 11 and it came to pa when all the peopl were clean pa over 
that the ark of the lord pa over and the priest in the presenc 
of the peopl 

4 12 and the child of reuben and the child of gad and half the 
tribe of manasseh pa over arm befor the child of israel a 
mose spake unto them 4 13 about forti thousand prepar for war 
pa over befor the lord unto battl to the plain of jericho 

4 14 on that day the lord magnifi joshua in the sight of all israel 
and they fear him a they fear mose all the day of hi life 

4 15 and the lord spake unto joshua say 4 16 command the priest 
that bear the ark of the testimoni that they come up out of jordan 

4 17 joshua therefor command the priest say come ye up out of 
jordan 

4 18 and it came to pa when the priest that bare the ark of the 
coven of the lord were come up out of the midst of jordan and the 
sol of the priest foot were lift up unto the dri land that the 
water of jordan return unto their place and flow over all hi 
bank a they did befor 

4 19 and the peopl came up out of jordan on the tenth day of the 
first month and encamp in gilgal in the east border of jericho 

4 20 and those twelv stone which they took out of jordan did 
joshua pitch in gilgal 

4 21 and he spake unto the child of israel say when your 
child shall ask their father in time to come say what mean 
these stone 4 22 then ye shall let your child know say 
israel came over thi jordan on dri land 

4 23 for the lord your god dri up the water of jordan from befor 
you until ye were pa over a the lord your god did to the red 
sea which he dri up from befor u until we were gone over 4 24 
that all the peopl of the earth might know the hand of the lord that 
it is mighti that ye might fear the lord your god for ever 

5 1 and it came to pa when all the king of the amorit which 
were on the side of jordan westward and all the king of the 
canaanit which were by the sea heard that the lord had dri up 
the water of jordan from befor the child of israel until we were 
pa over that their heart melt neither wa there spirit in them 
ani more becau of the child of israel 

5 2 at that time the lord said unto joshua make thee sharp knife 
and circumci again the child of israel the second time 

5 3 and joshua made him sharp knife and circumci the child of 
israel at the hill of the foreskin 

5 4 and thi is the cau whi joshua did circumci all the peopl 
that came out of egypt that were male even all the men of war die 
in the wilder by the way after they came out of egypt 

5 5 now all the peopl that came out were circumci but all the 
peopl that were born in the wilder by the way a they came forth 
out of egypt them they had not circumci 

5 6 for the child of israel walk forti year in the wilder 
till all the peopl that were men of war which came out of egypt 
were consum becau they obey not the voic of the lord unto 
whom the lord sware that he would not shew them the land which the 
lord sware unto their father that he would give u a land that 
floweth with milk and honey 

5 7 and their child whom he rai up in their stead them joshua 
circumci for they were uncircumci becau they had not 
circumci them by the way 

5 8 and it came to pa when they had done circumci all the 
peopl that they abod in their place in the camp till they were 
whole 

5 9 and the lord said unto joshua thi day have i roll away the 
reproach of egypt from off you wherefor the name of the place is 
call gilgal unto thi day 

5 10 and the child of israel encamp in gilgal and kept the 
passov on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plain of 
jericho 

5 11 and they did eat of the old corn of the land on the morrow after 
the passov unleaven cake and parch corn in the selfsam day 

5 12 and the manna cea on the morrow after they had eaten of the 
old corn of the land neither had the child of israel manna ani 
more but they did eat of the fruit of the land of canaan that year 

5 13 and it came to pa when joshua wa by jericho that he lift 
up hi eye and look and behold there stood a man over against 
him with hi sword drawn in hi hand and joshua went unto him and 
said unto him art thou for u or for our adversari 5 14 and he 
said nay but a captain of the host of the lord am i now come and 
joshua fell on hi face to the earth and did worship and said unto 
him what saith my lord unto hi servant 5 15 and the captain of the 
lord s host said unto joshua loo thi shoe from off thi foot for 
the place whereon thou standest is holi and joshua did so 

6 1 now jericho wa straitli shut up becau of the child of 
israel none went out and none came in 

6 2 and the lord said unto joshua see i have given into thine hand 
jericho and the king thereof and the mighti men of valour 

6 3 and ye shall compass the citi all ye men of war and go round 
about the citi onc thu shalt thou do six day 

6 4 and seven priest shall bear befor the ark seven trumpet of 
ram horn and the seventh day ye shall compass the citi seven 
time and the priest shall blow with the trumpet 

6 5 and it shall come to pa that when they make a long blast with 
the ram s horn and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet all the 
peopl shall shout with a great shout and the wall of the citi shall 
fall down flat and the peopl shall ascend up everi man straight 
befor him 

6 6 and joshua the son of nun call the priest and said unto them 
take up the ark of the coven and let seven priest bear seven 
trumpet of ram horn befor the ark of the lord 

6 7 and he said unto the peopl pa on and compass the citi and 
let him that is arm pa on befor the ark of the lord 

6 8 and it came to pa when joshua had spoken unto the peopl that 
the seven priest bear the seven trumpet of ram horn pa on 
befor the lord and blew with the trumpet and the ark of the 
coven of the lord follow them 

6 9 and the arm men went befor the priest that blew with the 
trumpet and the rereward came after the ark the priest go on 
and blow with the trumpet 

6 10 and joshua had command the peopl say ye shall not shout 
nor make ani noi with your voic neither shall ani word proceed out 
of your mouth until the day i bid you shout then shall ye shout 

6 11 so the ark of the lord compass the citi go about it onc 
and they came into the camp and lodg in the camp 

6 12 and joshua rose earli in the morn and the priest took up the 
ark of the lord 

6 13 and seven priest bear seven trumpet of ram horn befor 
the ark of the lord went on continu and blew with the trumpet 
and the arm men went befor them but the rereward came after the 
ark of the lord the priest go on and blow with the trumpet 

6 14 and the second day they compass the citi onc and return 
into the camp so they did six day 

6 15 and it came to pa on the seventh day that they rose earli 
about the dawn of the day and compass the citi after the same 
manner seven time onli on that day they compass the citi seven 
time 

6 16 and it came to pa at the seventh time when the priest blew 
with the trumpet joshua said unto the peopl shout for the lord 
hath given you the citi 

6 17 and the citi shall be accur even it and all that are 
therein to the lord onli rahab the harlot shall live she and all 
that are with her in the hou becau she hid the messeng that we 
sent 

6 18 and ye in ani wise keep yourselv from the accur thing lest 
ye make yourselv accur when ye take of the accur thing and 
make the camp of israel a cur and troubl it 

6 19 but all the silver and gold and vessel of brass and iron are 
consecr unto the lord they shall come into the treasuri of the 
lord 

6 20 so the peopl shout when the priest blew with the trumpet 
and it came to pa when the peopl heard the sound of the trumpet 
and the peopl shout with a great shout that the wall fell down 
flat so that the peopl went up into the citi everi man straight 
befor him and they took the citi 

6 21 and they utterli destroy all that wa in the citi both man and 
woman young and old and ox and sheep and a with the edg of the 
sword 

6 22 but joshua had said unto the two men that had spi out the 
countri go into the harlot s hou and bring out thenc the woman 
and all that she hath a ye sware unto her 

6 23 and the young men that were spi went in and brought out rahab 
and her father and her mother and her brother and all that she 
had and they brought out all her kindr and left them without the 
camp of israel 

6 24 and they burnt the citi with fire and all that wa therein onli 
the silver and the gold and the vessel of brass and of iron they 
put into the treasuri of the hou of the lord 

6 25 and joshua save rahab the harlot aliv and her father s 
household and all that she had and she dwelleth in israel even unto 
thi day becau she hid the messeng which joshua sent to spi out 
jericho 

6 26 and joshua adjur them at that time say cur be the man 
befor the lord that riseth up and buildeth thi citi jericho he 
shall lay the foundat thereof in hi firstborn and in hi youngest 
son shall he set up the gate of it 

6 27 so the lord wa with joshua and hi fame wa noi throughout 
all the countri 

7 1 but the child of israel commit a trespass in the accur 
thing for achan the son of carmi the son of zabdi the son of 
zerah of the tribe of judah took of the accur thing and the 
anger of the lord wa kindl against the child of israel 

7 2 and joshua sent men from jericho to ai which is besid bethaven 
on the east of bethel and spake unto them say go up and view the 
countri 

and the men went up and view ai 

7 3 and they return to joshua and said unto him let not all the 
peopl go up but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite 
ai and make not all the peopl to labour thither for they are but 
few 

7 4 so there went up thither of the peopl about three thousand men 
and they fled befor the men of ai 

7 5 and the men of ai smote of them about thirti and six men for they 
chase them from befor the gate even unto shebarim and smote them in 
the go down wherefor the heart of the peopl melt and becam 
a water 

7 6 and joshua rent hi cloth and fell to the earth upon hi face 
befor the ark of the lord until the eventid he and the elder of 
israel and put dust upon their head 

7 7 and joshua said ala o lord god wherefor hast thou at all 
brought thi peopl over jordan to deliv u into the hand of the 
amorit to destroy u would to god we had been content and dwelt 
on the other side jordan 7 8 o lord what shall i say when israel 
turneth their back befor their enemi 7 9 for the canaanit and 
all the inhabit of the land shall hear of it and shall environ u 
round and cut off our name from the earth and what wilt thou do unto 
thi great name 7 10 and the lord said unto joshua get thee up 
wherefor liest thou thu upon thi face 7 11 israel hath sin and 
they have also transgress my coven which i command them for 
they have even taken of the accur thing and have also stolen and 
dissembl also and they have put it even among their own stuff 

7 12 therefor the child of israel could not stand befor their 
enemi but turn their back befor their enemi becau they 
were accur neither will i be with you ani more except ye destroy 
the accur from among you 

7 13 up sanctifi the peopl and say sanctifi yourselv against to 
morrow for thu saith the lord god of israel there is an accur 
thing in the midst of thee o israel thou canst not stand befor 
thine enemi until ye take away the accur thing from among you 

7 14 in the morn therefor ye shall be brought accord to your 
tribe and it shall be that the tribe which the lord taketh shall 
come accord to the famili thereof and the famili which the lord 
shall take shall come by household and the household which the lord 
shall take shall come man by man 

7 15 and it shall be that he that is taken with the accur thing 
shall be burnt with fire he and all that he hath becau he hath 
transgress the coven of the lord and becau he hath wrought 
folli in israel 

7 16 so joshua rose up earli in the morn and brought israel by 
their tribe and the tribe of judah wa taken 7 17 and he brought 
the famili of judah and he took the famili of the zarhit and he 
brought the famili of the zarhit man by man and zabdi wa taken 
7 18 and he brought hi household man by man and achan the son of 
carmi the son of zabdi the son of zerah of the tribe of judah wa 
taken 

7 19 and joshua said unto achan my son give i pray thee glori to 
the lord god of israel and make confess unto him and tell me now 
what thou hast done hide it not from me 

7 20 and achan answer joshua and said ind i have sin against 
the lord god of israel and thu and thu have i done 7 21 when i saw 
among the spoil a goodli babylonish garment and two hundr shekel 
of silver and a wedg of gold of fifti shekel weight then i covet 
them and took them and behold they are hid in the earth in the 
midst of my tent and the silver under it 

7 22 so joshua sent messeng and they ran unto the tent and 
behold it wa hid in hi tent and the silver under it 

7 23 and they took them out of the midst of the tent and brought them 
unto joshua and unto all the child of israel and laid them out 
befor the lord 

7 24 and joshua and all israel with him took achan the son of zerah 
and the silver and the garment and the wedg of gold and hi son 
and hi daughter and hi ox and hi as and hi sheep and hi 
tent and all that he had and they brought them unto the valley of 
achor 

7 25 and joshua said whi hast thou troubl u the lord shall 
troubl thee thi day and all israel stone him with stone and 
burn them with fire after they had stone them with stone 

7 26 and they rai over him a great heap of stone unto thi day so 
the lord turn from the fierc of hi anger wherefor the name 
of that place wa call the valley of achor unto thi day 

8 1 and the lord said unto joshua fear not neither be thou dismay 
take all the peopl of war with thee and ari go up to ai see i 
have given into thi hand the king of ai and hi peopl and hi citi 
and hi land 8 2 and thou shalt do to ai and her king a thou didst 
unto jericho and her king onli the spoil thereof and the cattl 
thereof shall ye take for a prey unto yourselv lay thee an ambush 
for the citi behind it 

8 3 so joshua aro and all the peopl of war to go up against ai 
and joshua chose out thirti thousand mighti men of valour and sent 
them away by night 

8 4 and he command them say behold ye shall lie in wait 
against the citi even behind the citi go not veri far from the citi 
but be ye all readi 8 5 and i and all the peopl that are with me 
will approach unto the citi and it shall come to pa when they come 
out against u a at the first that we will flee befor them 8 6 
for they will come out after u till we have drawn them from the 
citi for they will say they flee befor u a at the first 
therefor we will flee befor them 

8 7 then ye shall rise up from the ambush and seiz upon the citi 
for the lord your god will deliv it into your hand 

8 8 and it shall be when ye have taken the citi that ye shall set 
the citi on fire accord to the command of the lord shall ye 
do see i have command you 

8 9 joshua therefor sent them forth and they went to lie in ambush 
and abod between bethel and ai on the west side of ai but joshua 
lodg that night among the peopl 

8 10 and joshua rose up earli in the morn and number the peopl 
and went up he and the elder of israel befor the peopl to ai 

8 11 and all the peopl even the peopl of war that were with him 
went up and drew nigh and came befor the citi and pitch on the 
north side of ai now there wa a valley between them and ai 

8 12 and he took about five thousand men and set them to lie in 
ambush between bethel and ai on the west side of the citi 

8 13 and when they had set the peopl even all the host that wa on 
the north of the citi and their lier in wait on the west of the 
citi joshua went that night into the midst of the valley 

8 14 and it came to pa when the king of ai saw it that they hast 
and rose up earli and the men of the citi went out against israel to 
battl he and all hi peopl at a time appoint befor the plain 
but he wist not that there were lier in ambush against him behind the 
citi 

8 15 and joshua and all israel made a if they were beaten befor 
them and fled by the way of the wilder 

8 16 and all the peopl that were in ai were call togeth to pursu 
after them and they pursu after joshua and were drawn away from 
the citi 

8 17 and there wa not a man left in ai or bethel that went not out 
after israel and they left the citi open and pursu after israel 

8 18 and the lord said unto joshua stretch out the spear that is in 
thi hand toward ai for i will give it into thine hand and joshua 
stretch out the spear that he had in hi hand toward the citi 

8 19 and the ambush aro quickli out of their place and they ran a 
soon a he had stretch out hi hand and they enter into the citi 
and took it and hast and set the citi on fire 

8 20 and when the men of ai look behind them they saw and behold 
the smoke of the citi ascend up to heaven and they had no power to 
flee thi way or that way and the peopl that fled to the wilder 
turn back upon the pursuer 

8 21 and when joshua and all israel saw that the ambush had taken the 
citi and that the smoke of the citi ascend then they turn again 
and slew the men of ai 

8 22 and the other issu out of the citi against them so they were 
in the midst of israel some on thi side and some on that side and 
they smote them so that they let none of them remain or escap 

8 23 and the king of ai they took aliv and brought him to joshua 

8 24 and it came to pa when israel had made an end of slay all 
the inhabit of ai in the field in the wilder wherein they 
chase them and when they were all fallen on the edg of the sword 
until they were consum that all the israelit return unto ai 
and smote it with the edg of the sword 

8 25 and so it wa that all that fell that day both of men and 
woman were twelv thousand even all the men of ai 

8 26 for joshua drew not hi hand back wherewith he stretch out the 
spear until he had utterli destroy all the inhabit of ai 

8 27 onli the cattl and the spoil of that citi israel took for a prey 
unto themselv accord unto the word of the lord which he 
command joshua 

8 28 and joshua burnt ai and made it an heap for ever even a 
desol unto thi day 

8 29 and the king of ai he hang on a tree until eventid and a 
soon a the sun wa down joshua command that they should take hi 
carca down from the tree and cast it at the enter of the gate of 
the citi and rai thereon a great heap of stone that remaineth 
unto thi day 

8 30 then joshua built an altar unto the lord god of israel in mount 
ebal 8 31 a mose the servant of the lord command the child of 
israel a it is written in the book of the law of mose an altar of 
whole stone over which no man hath lift up ani iron and they 
offer thereon burnt offer unto the lord and sacrif peac 
offer 

8 32 and he wrote there upon the stone a copi of the law of mose 
which he wrote in the presenc of the child of israel 

8 33 and all israel and their elder and offic and their judg 
stood on thi side the ark and on that side befor the priest the 
levit which bare the ark of the coven of the lord a well the 
stranger a he that wa born among them half of them over against 
mount gerizim and half of them over against mount ebal a mose the 
servant of the lord had command befor that they should bless the 
peopl of israel 

8 34 and afterward he read all the word of the law the bless and 
cur accord to all that is written in the book of the law 

8 35 there wa not a word of all that mose command which joshua 
read not befor all the congreg of israel with the woman and 
the littl one and the stranger that were conver among them 

9 1 and it came to pa when all the king which were on thi side 
jordan in the hill and in the valley and in all the coast of the 
great sea over against lebanon the hittit and the amorit the 
canaanit the perizzit the hivit and the jebusit heard thereof 
9 2 that they gather themselv togeth to fight with joshua and 
with israel with one accord 

9 3 and when the inhabit of gibeon heard what joshua had done unto 
jericho and to ai 9 4 they did work wilili and went and made a if 
they had been ambassador and took old sack upon their as and 
wine bottl old and rent and bound up 9 5 and old shoe and 
clout upon their foot and old garment upon them and all the bread 
of their provi wa dri and mouldi 

9 6 and they went to joshua unto the camp at gilgal and said unto 
him and to the men of israel we be come from a far countri now 
therefor make ye a leagu with u 

9 7 and the men of israel said unto the hivit peradventur ye dwell 
among u and how shall we make a leagu with you 9 8 and they said 
unto joshua we are thi servant and joshua said unto them who are 
ye and from whenc come ye 9 9 and they said unto him from a veri 
far countri thi servant are come becau of the name of the lord thi 
god for we have heard the fame of him and all that he did in egypt 
9 10 and all that he did to the two king of the amorit that were 
beyond jordan to sihon king of heshbon and to og king of bashan 
which wa at ashtaroth 

9 11 wherefor our elder and all the inhabit of our countri spake 
to u say take victual with you for the journey and go to meet 
them and say unto them we are your servant therefor now make ye a 
leagu with u 

9 12 thi our bread we took hot for our provi out of our hou on 
the day we came forth to go unto you but now behold it is dri and 
it is mouldi 9 13 and these bottl of wine which we fill were 
new and behold they be rent and these our garment and our shoe 
are becom old by reason of the veri long journey 

9 14 and the men took of their victual and ask not counsel at the 
mouth of the lord 

9 15 and joshua made peac with them and made a leagu with them to 
let them live and the princ of the congreg sware unto them 

9 16 and it came to pa at the end of three day after they had made 
a leagu with them that they heard that they were their neighbour 
and that they dwelt among them 

9 17 and the child of israel journey and came unto their citi 
on the third day now their citi were gibeon and chephirah and 
beeroth and kirjathjearim 

9 18 and the child of israel smote them not becau the princ of 
the congreg had sworn unto them by the lord god of israel and 
all the congreg murmur against the princ 

9 19 but all the princ said unto all the congreg we have sworn 
unto them by the lord god of israel now therefor we may not touch 
them 

9 20 thi we will do to them we will even let them live lest wrath 
be upon u becau of the oath which we sware unto them 

9 21 and the princ said unto them let them live but let them be 
hewer of wood and drawer of water unto all the congreg a the 
princ had promi them 

9 22 and joshua call for them and he spake unto them say 
wherefor have ye beguil u say we are veri far from you when 
ye dwell among u 9 23 now therefor ye are cur and there shall 
none of you be freed from be bondman and hewer of wood and 
drawer of water for the hou of my god 

9 24 and they answer joshua and said becau it wa certainli told 
thi servant how that the lord thi god command hi servant mose to 
give you all the land and to destroy all the inhabit of the land 
from befor you therefor we were sore afraid of our life becau of 
you and have done thi thing 

9 25 and now behold we are in thine hand a it seemeth good and 
right unto thee to do unto u do 

9 26 and so did he unto them and deliv them out of the hand of 
the child of israel that they slew them not 

9 27 and joshua made them that day hewer of wood and drawer of water 
for the congreg and for the altar of the lord even unto thi 
day in the place which he should choo 

10 1 now it came to pa when adonizedec king of jerusalem had heard 
how joshua had taken ai and had utterli destroy it a he had done 
to jericho and her king so he had done to ai and her king and how 
the inhabit of gibeon had made peac with israel and were among 
them 10 2 that they fear greatli becau gibeon wa a great citi 
a one of the royal citi and becau it wa greater than ai and 
all the men thereof were mighti 

10 3 wherefor adonizedec king of jerusalem sent unto hoham king of 
hebron and unto piram king of jarmuth and unto japhia king of 
lachish and unto debir king of eglon say 10 4 come up unto me 
and help me that we may smite gibeon for it hath made peac with 
joshua and with the child of israel 

10 5 therefor the five king of the amorit the king of jerusalem 
the king of hebron the king of jarmuth the king of lachish the king 
of eglon gather themselv togeth and went up they and all 
their host and encamp befor gibeon and made war against it 

10 6 and the men of gibeon sent unto joshua to the camp to gilgal 
say slack not thi hand from thi servant come up to u quickli 
and save u and help u for all the king of the amorit that dwell 
in the mountain are gather togeth against u 

10 7 so joshua ascend from gilgal he and all the peopl of war 
with him and all the mighti men of valour 

10 8 and the lord said unto joshua fear them not for i have 
deliv them into thine hand there shall not a man of them stand 
befor thee 

10 9 joshua therefor came unto them suddenli and went up from gilgal 
all night 

10 10 and the lord discomfit them befor israel and slew them with 
a great slaughter at gibeon and chase them along the way that goeth 
up to bethhoron and smote them to azekah and unto makkedah 

10 11 and it came to pa a they fled from befor israel and were 
in the go down to bethhoron that the lord cast down great stone 
from heaven upon them unto azekah and they die they were more which 
die with hailston than they whom the child of israel slew with 
the sword 

10 12 then spake joshua to the lord in the day when the lord deliv 
up the amorit befor the child of israel and he said in the 
sight of israel sun stand thou still upon gibeon and thou moon in 
the valley of ajalon 

10 13 and the sun stood still and the moon stay until the peopl 
had aveng themselv upon their enemi is not thi written in the 
book of jasher so the sun stood still in the midst of heaven and 
hast not to go down about a whole day 

10 14 and there wa no day like that befor it or after it that the 
lord hearken unto the voic of a man for the lord fought for 
israel 

10 15 and joshua return and all israel with him unto the camp to 
gilgal 

10 16 but these five king fled and hid themselv in a cave at 
makkedah 

10 17 and it wa told joshua say the five king are found hid in 
a cave at makkedah 

10 18 and joshua said roll great stone upon the mouth of the cave 
and set men by it for to keep them 10 19 and stay ye not but pursu 
after your enemi and smite the hindmost of them suffer them not to 
enter into their citi for the lord your god hath deliv them 
into your hand 

10 20 and it came to pa when joshua and the child of israel had 
made an end of slay them with a veri great slaughter till they 
were consum that the rest which remain of them enter into 
fenc citi 

10 21 and all the peopl return to the camp to joshua at makkedah in 
peac none move hi tongu against ani of the child of israel 

10 22 then said joshua open the mouth of the cave and bring out 
those five king unto me out of the cave 

10 23 and they did so and brought forth those five king unto him out 
of the cave the king of jerusalem the king of hebron the king of 
jarmuth the king of lachish and the king of eglon 

10 24 and it came to pa when they brought out those king unto 
joshua that joshua call for all the men of israel and said unto 
the captain of the men of war which went with him come near put 
your foot upon the neck of these king and they came near and put 
their foot upon the neck of them 

10 25 and joshua said unto them fear not nor be dismay be strong 
and of good courag for thu shall the lord do to all your enemi 
against whom ye fight 

10 26 and afterward joshua smote them and slew them and hang them 
on five tree and they were hang upon the tree until the even 

10 27 and it came to pa at the time of the go down of the sun 
that joshua command and they took them down off the tree and cast 
them into the cave wherein they had been hid and laid great stone in 
the cave s mouth which remain until thi veri day 

10 28 and that day joshua took makkedah and smote it with the edg of 
the sword and the king thereof he utterli destroy them and all 
the soul that were therein he let none remain and he did to the 
king of makkedah a he did unto the king of jericho 

10 29 then joshua pa from makkedah and all israel with him unto 
libnah and fought against libnah 10 30 and the lord deliv it 
also and the king thereof into the hand of israel and he smote it 
with the edg of the sword and all the soul that were therein he 
let none remain in it but did unto the king thereof a he did unto 
the king of jericho 

10 31 and joshua pa from libnah and all israel with him unto 
lachish and encamp against it and fought against it 10 32 and the 
lord deliv lachish into the hand of israel which took it on the 
second day and smote it with the edg of the sword and all the soul 
that were therein accord to all that he had done to libnah 

10 33 then horam king of gezer came up to help lachish and joshua 
smote him and hi peopl until he had left him none remain 

10 34 and from lachish joshua pa unto eglon and all israel with 
him and they encamp against it and fought against it 10 35 and 
they took it on that day and smote it with the edg of the sword and 
all the soul that were therein he utterli destroy that day 
accord to all that he had done to lachish 

10 36 and joshua went up from eglon and all israel with him unto 
hebron and they fought against it 10 37 and they took it and smote 
it with the edg of the sword and the king thereof and all the 
citi thereof and all the soul that were therein he left none 
remain accord to all that he had done to eglon but destroy 
it utterli and all the soul that were therein 

10 38 and joshua return and all israel with him to debir and 
fought against it 10 39 and he took it and the king thereof and all 
the citi thereof and they smote them with the edg of the sword 
and utterli destroy all the soul that were therein he left none 
remain a he had done to hebron so he did to debir and to the 
king thereof a he had done also to libnah and to her king 

10 40 so joshua smote all the countri of the hill and of the south 
and of the vale and of the spring and all their king he left none 
remain but utterli destroy all that breath a the lord god of 
israel command 

10 41 and joshua smote them from kadeshbarnea even unto gaza and all 
the countri of goshen even unto gibeon 

10 42 and all these king and their land did joshua take at one time 
becau the lord god of israel fought for israel 

10 43 and joshua return and all israel with him unto the camp to 
gilgal 

11 1 and it came to pa when jabin king of hazor had heard those 
thing that he sent to jobab king of madon and to the king of 
shimron and to the king of achshaph 11 2 and to the king that were 
on the north of the mountain and of the plain south of chinneroth 
and in the valley and in the border of dor on the west 11 3 and to 
the canaanit on the east and on the west and to the amorit and the 
hittit and the perizzit and the jebusit in the mountain and to 
the hivit under hermon in the land of mizpeh 

11 4 and they went out they and all their host with them much 
peopl even a the sand that is upon the sea shore in multitud with 
hor and chariot veri mani 

11 5 and when all these king were met togeth they came and pitch 
togeth at the water of merom to fight against israel 

11 6 and the lord said unto joshua be not afraid becau of them for 
to morrow about thi time will i deliv them up all slain befor 
israel thou shalt hough their hor and burn their chariot with 
fire 

11 7 so joshua came and all the peopl of war with him against them 
by the water of merom suddenli and they fell upon them 

11 8 and the lord deliv them into the hand of israel who smote 
them and chase them unto great zidon and unto misrephothmaim and 
unto the valley of mizpeh eastward and they smote them until they 
left them none remain 

11 9 and joshua did unto them a the lord bade him he hough their 
hor and burnt their chariot with fire 

11 10 and joshua at that time turn back and took hazor and smote 
the king thereof with the sword for hazor beforetim wa the head of 
all those kingdom 

11 11 and they smote all the soul that were therein with the edg of 
the sword utterli destroy them there wa not ani left to breath 
and he burnt hazor with fire 

11 12 and all the citi of those king and all the king of them 
did joshua take and smote them with the edg of the sword and he 
utterli destroy them a mose the servant of the lord command 

11 13 but a for the citi that stood still in their strength israel 
burn none of them save hazor onli that did joshua burn 

11 14 and all the spoil of these citi and the cattl the child 
of israel took for a prey unto themselv but everi man they smote 
with the edg of the sword until they had destroy them neither 
left they ani to breath 

11 15 a the lord command mose hi servant so did mose command 
joshua and so did joshua he left noth undon of all that the lord 
command mose 

11 16 so joshua took all that land the hill and all the south 
countri and all the land of goshen and the valley and the plain 
and the mountain of israel and the valley of the same 11 17 even 
from the mount halak that goeth up to seir even unto baalgad in the 
valley of lebanon under mount hermon and all their king he took and 
smote them and slew them 

11 18 joshua made war a long time with all those king 

11 19 there wa not a citi that made peac with the child of 
israel save the hivit the inhabit of gibeon all other they 
took in battl 

11 20 for it wa of the lord to harden their heart that they should 
come against israel in battl that he might destroy them utterli and 
that they might have no favour but that he might destroy them a the 
lord command mose 

11 21 and at that time came joshua and cut off the anakim from the 
mountain from hebron from debir from anab and from all the 
mountain of judah and from all the mountain of israel joshua 
destroy them utterli with their citi 

11 22 there wa none of the anakim left in the land of the child 
of israel onli in gaza in gath and in ashdod there remain 

11 23 so joshua took the whole land accord to all that the lord 
said unto mose and joshua gave it for an inherit unto israel 
accord to their divi by their tribe and the land rest from 
war 

12 1 now these are the king of the land which the child of israel 
smote and poss their land on the other side jordan toward the 
rise of the sun from the river arnon unto mount hermon and all the 
plain on the east 12 2 sihon king of the amorit who dwelt in 
heshbon and rule from aroer which is upon the bank of the river 
arnon and from the middl of the river and from half gilead even 
unto the river jabbok which is the border of the child of ammon 
12 3 and from the plain to the sea of chinneroth on the east and unto 
the sea of the plain even the salt sea on the east the way to 
bethjeshimoth and from the south under ashdothpisgah 12 4 and the 
coast of og king of bashan which wa of the remnant of the giant 
that dwelt at ashtaroth and at edrei 12 5 and reign in mount 
hermon and in salcah and in all bashan unto the border of the 
geshurit and the maachathit and half gilead the border of sihon 
king of heshbon 

12 6 them did mose the servant of the lord and the child of israel 
smite and mose the servant of the lord gave it for a poss unto 
the reubenit and the gadit and the half tribe of manasseh 

12 7 and these are the king of the countri which joshua and the 
child of israel smote on thi side jordan on the west from baalgad 
in the valley of lebanon even unto the mount halak that goeth up to 
seir which joshua gave unto the tribe of israel for a poss 
accord to their divi 12 8 in the mountain and in the 
valley and in the plain and in the spring and in the wilder 
and in the south countri the hittit the amorit and the 
canaanit the perizzit the hivit and the jebusit 12 9 the 
king of jericho one the king of ai which is besid bethel one 
12 10 the king of jerusalem one the king of hebron one 12 11 the 
king of jarmuth one the king of lachish one 12 12 the king of 
eglon one the king of gezer one 12 13 the king of debir one the 
king of geder one 12 14 the king of hormah one the king of arad 
one 12 15 the king of libnah one the king of adullam one 12 16 
the king of makkedah one the king of bethel one 12 17 the king of 
tappuah one the king of hepher one 12 18 the king of aphek one 
the king of lasharon one 12 19 the king of madon one the king of 
hazor one 12 20 the king of shimronmeron one the king of achshaph 
one 12 21 the king of taanach one the king of megiddo one 12 22 
the king of kedesh one the king of jokneam of carmel one 12 23 the 
king of dor in the coast of dor one the king of the nation of 
gilgal one 12 24 the king of tirzah one all the king thirti and 
one 

13 1 now joshua wa old and stricken in year and the lord said unto 
him thou art old and stricken in year and there remaineth yet veri 
much land to be poss 

13 2 thi is the land that yet remaineth all the border of the 
philistin and all geshuri 13 3 from sihor which is befor egypt 
even unto the border of ekron northward which is count to the 
canaanit five lord of the philistin the gazathit and the 
ashdothit the eshkalonit the gittit and the ekronit also 
the avit 13 4 from the south all the land of the canaanit and 
mearah that is besid the sidonian unto aphek to the border of the 
amorit 13 5 and the land of the giblit and all lebanon toward 
the sunri from baalgad under mount hermon unto the enter into 
hamath 

13 6 all the inhabit of the hill countri from lebanon unto 
misrephothmaim and all the sidonian them will i drive out from 
befor the child of israel onli divid thou it by lot unto the 
israelit for an inherit a i have command thee 

13 7 now therefor divid thi land for an inherit unto the nine 
tribe and the half tribe of manasseh 13 8 with whom the reubenit 
and the gadit have receiv their inherit which mose gave 
them beyond jordan eastward even a mose the servant of the lord 
gave them 13 9 from aroer that is upon the bank of the river arnon 
and the citi that is in the midst of the river and all the plain of 
medeba unto dibon 13 10 and all the citi of sihon king of the 
amorit which reign in heshbon unto the border of the child of 
ammon 13 11 and gilead and the border of the geshurit and 
maachathit and all mount hermon and all bashan unto salcah 13 12 
all the kingdom of og in bashan which reign in ashtaroth and in 
edrei who remain of the remnant of the giant for these did mose 
smite and cast them out 

13 13 nevertheless the child of israel expel not the geshurit 
nor the maachathit but the geshurit and the maachathit dwell 
among the israelit until thi day 

13 14 onli unto the tribe of levi he gave none inherit the 
sacrif of the lord god of israel made by fire are their 
inherit a he said unto them 

13 15 and mose gave unto the tribe of the child of reuben 
inherit accord to their famili 

13 16 and their coast wa from aroer that is on the bank of the river 
arnon and the citi that is in the midst of the river and all the 
plain by medeba 13 17 heshbon and all her citi that are in the 
plain dibon and bamothba and bethbaalmeon 13 18 and jahaza and 
kedemoth and mephaath 13 19 and kirjathaim and sibmah and 
zarethshahar in the mount of the valley 13 20 and bethpeor and 
ashdothpisgah and bethjeshimoth 13 21 and all the citi of the 
plain and all the kingdom of sihon king of the amorit which 
reign in heshbon whom mose smote with the princ of midian evi 
and rekem and zur and hur and reba which were duke of sihon 
dwell in the countri 

13 22 balaam also the son of beor the soothsay did the child of 
israel slay with the sword among them that were slain by them 

13 23 and the border of the child of reuben wa jordan and the 
border thereof thi wa the inherit of the child of reuben 
after their famili the citi and the villag thereof 

13 24 and mose gave inherit unto the tribe of gad even unto the 
child of gad accord to their famili 

13 25 and their coast wa jazer and all the citi of gilead and 
half the land of the child of ammon unto aroer that is befor 
rabbah 13 26 and from heshbon unto ramathmizpeh and betonim and 
from mahanaim unto the border of debir 13 27 and in the valley 
betharam and bethnimrah and succoth and zaphon the rest of the 
kingdom of sihon king of heshbon jordan and hi border even unto the 
edg of the sea of chinnereth on the other side jordan eastward 

13 28 thi is the inherit of the child of gad after their 
famili the citi and their villag 

13 29 and mose gave inherit unto the half tribe of manasseh and
