thi wa the poss of the half tribe of the child of manasseh 
by their famili 

13 30 and their coast wa from mahanaim all bashan all the kingdom 
of og king of bashan and all the town of jair which are in bashan 
threescor citi 13 31 and half gilead and ashtaroth and edrei 
citi of the kingdom of og in bashan were pertain unto the 
child of machir the son of manasseh even to the one half of the 
child of machir by their famili 

13 32 these are the countri which mose did distribut for 
inherit in the plain of moab on the other side jordan by 
jericho eastward 

13 33 but unto the tribe of levi mose gave not ani inherit the 
lord god of israel wa their inherit a he said unto them 

14 1 and these are the countri which the child of israel 
inherit in the land of canaan which eleazar the priest and joshua 
the son of nun and the head of the father of the tribe of the 
child of israel distribut for inherit to them 

14 2 by lot wa their inherit a the lord command by the hand 
of mose for the nine tribe and for the half tribe 

14 3 for mose had given the inherit of two tribe and an half 
tribe on the other side jordan but unto the levit he gave none 
inherit among them 

14 4 for the child of joseph were two tribe manasseh and ephraim 
therefor they gave no part unto the levit in the land save citi 
to dwell in with their suburb for their cattl and for their 
substanc 

14 5 a the lord command mose so the child of israel did and 
they divid the land 

14 6 then the child of judah came unto joshua in gilgal and caleb 
the son of jephunneh the kenezit said unto him thou knowest the 
thing that the lord said unto mose the man of god concern me and 
thee in kadeshbarnea 

14 7 forti year old wa i when mose the servant of the lord sent me 
from kadeshbarnea to espi out the land and i brought him word again 
a it wa in mine heart 

14 8 nevertheless my brother that went up with me made the heart of 
the peopl melt but i wholli follow the lord my god 

14 9 and mose sware on that day say sure the land whereon thi 
foot have trodden shall be thine inherit and thi child s for 
ever becau thou hast wholli follow the lord my god 

14 10 and now behold the lord hath kept me aliv a he said these 
forti and five year even sinc the lord spake thi word unto mose 
while the child of israel wander in the wilder and now lo 
i am thi day fourscor and five year old 

14 11 a yet i am a strong thi day a i wa in the day that mose 
sent me a my strength wa then even so is my strength now for war 
both to go out and to come in 

14 12 now therefor give me thi mountain whereof the lord spake in 
that day for thou heardest in that day how the anakim were there 
and that the citi were great and fenc if so be the lord will be 
with me then i shall be abl to drive them out a the lord said 

14 13 and joshua bless him and gave unto caleb the son of jephunneh 
hebron for an inherit 

14 14 hebron therefor becam the inherit of caleb the son of 
jephunneh the kenezit unto thi day becau that he wholli follow 
the lord god of israel 

14 15 and the name of hebron befor wa kirjatharba which arba wa a 
great man among the anakim and the land had rest from war 

15 1 thi then wa the lot of the tribe of the child of judah by 
their famili even to the border of edom the wilder of zin 
southward wa the uttermost part of the south coast 

15 2 and their south border wa from the shore of the salt sea from 
the bay that looketh southward 15 3 and it went out to the south side 
to maalehacrabbim and pa along to zin and ascend up on the 
south side unto kadeshbarnea and pa along to hezron and went up 
to adar and fetch a compass to karkaa 15 4 from thenc it pa 
toward azmon and went out unto the river of egypt and the go out 
of that coast were at the sea thi shall be your south coast 

15 5 and the east border wa the salt sea even unto the end of 
jordan 

and their border in the north quarter wa from the bay of the sea at 
the uttermost part of jordan 15 6 and the border went up to 
bethhogla and pa along by the north of betharabah and the border 
went up to the stone of bohan the son of reuben 15 7 and the border 
went up toward debir from the valley of achor and so northward 
look toward gilgal that is befor the go up to adummim which 
is on the south side of the river and the border pa toward the 
water of enshemesh and the go out thereof were at enrogel 15 8 
and the border went up by the valley of the son of hinnom unto the 
south side of the jebusit the same is jerusalem and the border went 
up to the top of the mountain that lieth befor the valley of hinnom 
westward which is at the end of the valley of the giant northward 
15 9 and the border wa drawn from the top of the hill unto the 
fountain of the water of nephtoah and went out to the citi of mount 
ephron and the border wa drawn to baalah which is kirjathjearim 
15 10 and the border compass from baalah westward unto mount seir 
and pa along unto the side of mount jearim which is chesalon on 
the north side and went down to bethshemesh and pa on to timnah 
15 11 and the border went out unto the side of ekron northward and 
the border wa drawn to shicron and pa along to mount baalah and 
went out unto jabneel and the go out of the border were at the 
sea 

15 12 and the west border wa to the great sea and the coast thereof 

thi is the coast of the child of judah round about accord to 
their famili 

15 13 and unto caleb the son of jephunneh he gave a part among the 
child of judah accord to the command of the lord to joshua 
even the citi of arba the father of anak which citi is hebron 

15 14 and caleb drove thenc the three son of anak sheshai and 
ahiman and talmai the child of anak 

15 15 and he went up thenc to the inhabit of debir and the name 
of debir befor wa kirjathseph 

15 16 and caleb said he that smiteth kirjathseph and taketh it to 
him will i give achsah my daughter to wife 

15 17 and othniel the son of kenaz the brother of caleb took it and 
he gave him achsah hi daughter to wife 

15 18 and it came to pa a she came unto him that she move him to 
ask of her father a field and she light off her a and caleb said 
unto her what wouldest thou 15 19 who answer give me a bless 
for thou hast given me a south land give me also spring of water 
and he gave her the upper spring and the nether spring 

15 20 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the child of judah 
accord to their famili 

15 21 and the uttermost citi of the tribe of the child of judah 
toward the coast of edom southward were kabzeel and eder and jagur 
15 22 and kinah and dimonah and adadah 15 23 and kedesh and hazor 
and ithnan 15 24 ziph and telem and bealoth 15 25 and hazor 
hadattah and kerioth and hezron which is hazor 15 26 amam and 
shema and moladah 15 27 and hazargaddah and heshmon and bethpalet 
15 28 and hazarshu and beersheba and bizjothjah 15 29 baalah and 
iim and azem 15 30 and eltolad and chesil and hormah 15 31 and 
ziklag and madmannah and sansannah 15 32 and lebaoth and shilhim 
and ain and rimmon all the citi are twenti and nine with their 
villag 15 33 and in the valley eshtaol and zoreah and ashnah 
15 34 and zanoah and engannim tappuah and enam 15 35 jarmuth and 
adullam socoh and azekah 15 36 and sharaim and adithaim and 
gederah and gederothaim fourteen citi with their villag 15 37 
zenan and hadashah and migdalgad 15 38 and dilean and mizpeh and 
joktheel 15 39 lachish and bozkath and eglon 15 40 and cabbon and 
lahmam and kithlish 15 41 and gederoth bethdagon and naamah and 
makkedah sixteen citi with their villag 15 42 libnah and ether 
and ashan 15 43 and jiphtah and ashnah and nezib 15 44 and keilah 
and achzib and mareshah nine citi with their villag 15 45 
ekron with her town and her villag 15 46 from ekron even unto the 
sea all that lay near ashdod with their villag 15 47 ashdod with 
her town and her villag gaza with her town and her villag unto 
the river of egypt and the great sea and the border thereof 15 48 
and in the mountain shamir and jattir and socoh 15 49 and dannah 
and kirjathsannah which is debir 15 50 and anab and eshtemoh and 
anim 15 51 and goshen and holon and giloh eleven citi with their 
villag 15 52 arab and dumah and eshean 15 53 and janum and 
bethtappuah and aphekah 15 54 and humtah and kirjatharba which is 
hebron and zior nine citi with their villag 15 55 maon carmel 
and ziph and juttah 15 56 and jezreel and jokdeam and zanoah 
15 57 cain gibeah and timnah ten citi with their villag 15 58 
halhul bethzur and gedor 15 59 and maarath and bethanoth and 
eltekon six citi with their villag 15 60 kirjathba which is 
kirjathjearim and rabbah two citi with their villag 15 61 in 
the wilder betharabah middin and secacah 15 62 and nibshan 
and the citi of salt and engedi six citi with their villag 

15 63 a for the jebusit the inhabit of jerusalem the child 
of judah could not drive them out but the jebusit dwell with the 
child of judah at jerusalem unto thi day 

16 1 and the lot of the child of joseph fell from jordan by 
jericho unto the water of jericho on the east to the wilder that 
goeth up from jericho throughout mount bethel 16 2 and goeth out from 
bethel to luz and passeth along unto the border of archi to ataroth 
16 3 and goeth down westward to the coast of japhleti unto the coast 
of bethhoron the nether and to gezer and the go out thereof are 
at the sea 

16 4 so the child of joseph manasseh and ephraim took their 
inherit 

16 5 and the border of the child of ephraim accord to their 
famili wa thu even the border of their inherit on the east 
side wa atarothaddar unto bethhoron the upper 16 6 and the border 
went out toward the sea to michmethah on the north side and the 
border went about eastward unto taanathshiloh and pa by it on the 
east to janohah 16 7 and it went down from janohah to ataroth and to 
naarath and came to jericho and went out at jordan 

16 8 the border went out from tappuah westward unto the river kanah 
and the go out thereof were at the sea thi is the inherit of 
the tribe of the child of ephraim by their famili 

16 9 and the separ citi for the child of ephraim were among 
the inherit of the child of manasseh all the citi with their 
villag 

16 10 and they drave not out the canaanit that dwelt in gezer but 
the canaanit dwell among the ephraimit unto thi day and serv 
under tribut 

17 1 there wa also a lot for the tribe of manasseh for he wa the 
firstborn of joseph to wit for machir the firstborn of manasseh the 
father of gilead becau he wa a man of war therefor he had gilead 
and bashan 

17 2 there wa also a lot for the rest of the child of manasseh by 
their famili for the child of abiez and for the child of 
helek and for the child of asriel and for the child of 
shechem and for the child of hepher and for the child of 
shemida these were the male child of manasseh the son of joseph by 
their famili 

17 3 but zelophehad the son of hepher the son of gilead the son of 
machir the son of manasseh had no son but daughter and these are 
the name of hi daughter mahlah and noah hoglah milcah and 
tirzah 

17 4 and they came near befor eleazar the priest and befor joshua 
the son of nun and befor the princ say the lord command 
mose to give u an inherit among our brother therefor 
accord to the command of the lord he gave them an inherit 
among the brother of their father 

17 5 and there fell ten portion to manasseh besid the land of 
gilead and bashan which were on the other side jordan 17 6 becau 
the daughter of manasseh had an inherit among hi son and the 
rest of manasseh s son had the land of gilead 

17 7 and the coast of manasseh wa from asher to michmethah that 
lieth befor shechem and the border went along on the right hand unto 
the inhabit of entappuah 

17 8 now manasseh had the land of tappuah but tappuah on the border 
of manasseh belong to the child of ephraim 17 9 and the coast 
descend unto the river kanah southward of the river these citi 
of ephraim are among the citi of manasseh the coast of manasseh 
also wa on the north side of the river and the outgo of it were 
at the sea 17 10 southward it wa ephraim s and northward it wa 
manasseh s and the sea is hi border and they met togeth in asher 
on the north and in issachar on the east 

17 11 and manasseh had in issachar and in asher bethshean and her 
town and ibleam and her town and the inhabit of dor and her 
town and the inhabit of endor and her town and the inhabit 
of taanach and her town and the inhabit of megiddo and her 
town even three countri 

17 12 yet the child of manasseh could not drive out the inhabit 
of those citi but the canaanit would dwell in that land 

17 13 yet it came to pa when the child of israel were waxen 
strong that they put the canaanit to tribut but did not utterli 
drive them out 

17 14 and the child of joseph spake unto joshua say whi hast 
thou given me but one lot and one portion to inherit see i am a 
great peopl forasmuch a the lord hath bless me hitherto 17 15 
and joshua answer them if thou be a great peopl then get thee up 
to the wood countri and cut down for thyself there in the land of the 
perizzit and of the giant if mount ephraim be too narrow for thee 

17 16 and the child of joseph said the hill is not enough for u 
and all the canaanit that dwell in the land of the valley have 
chariot of iron both they who are of bethshean and her town and 
they who are of the valley of jezreel 

17 17 and joshua spake unto the hou of joseph even to ephraim and 
to manasseh say thou art a great peopl and hast great power 
thou shalt not have one lot onli 17 18 but the mountain shall be 
thine for it is a wood and thou shalt cut it down and the outgo 
of it shall be thine for thou shalt drive out the canaanit though 
they have iron chariot and though they be strong 

18 1 and the whole congreg of the child of israel assembl 
togeth at shiloh and set up the tabernacl of the congreg 
there and the land wa subdu befor them 

18 2 and there remain among the child of israel seven tribe 
which had not yet receiv their inherit 

18 3 and joshua said unto the child of israel how long are ye 
slack to go to po the land which the lord god of your father 
hath given you 18 4 give out from among you three men for each 
tribe and i will send them and they shall rise and go through the 
land and describ it accord to the inherit of them and they 
shall come again to me 

18 5 and they shall divid it into seven part judah shall abid in 
their coast on the south and the hou of joseph shall abid in their 
coast on the north 

18 6 ye shall therefor describ the land into seven part and bring 
the descript hither to me that i may cast lot for you here befor 
the lord our god 

18 7 but the levit have no part among you for the priesthood of the 
lord is their inherit and gad and reuben and half the tribe of 
manasseh have receiv their inherit beyond jordan on the east 
which mose the servant of the lord gave them 

18 8 and the men aro and went away and joshua charg them that 
went to describ the land say go and walk through the land and 
describ it and come again to me that i may here cast lot for you 
befor the lord in shiloh 

18 9 and the men went and pa through the land and describ it by 
citi into seven part in a book and came again to joshua to the 
host at shiloh 

18 10 and joshua cast lot for them in shiloh befor the lord and 
there joshua divid the land unto the child of israel accord to 
their divi 

18 11 and the lot of the tribe of the child of benjamin came up 
accord to their famili and the coast of their lot came forth 
between the child of judah and the child of joseph 

18 12 and their border on the north side wa from jordan and the 
border went up to the side of jericho on the north side and went up 
through the mountain westward and the go out thereof were at the 
wilder of bethaven 

18 13 and the border went over from thenc toward luz to the side of 
luz which is bethel southward and the border descend to 
atarothadar near the hill that lieth on the south side of the nether 
bethhoron 

18 14 and the border wa drawn thenc and compass the corner of the 
sea southward from the hill that lieth befor bethhoron southward 
and the go out thereof were at kirjathba which is 
kirjathjearim a citi of the child of judah thi wa the west 
quarter 

18 15 and the south quarter wa from the end of kirjathjearim and the 
border went out on the west and went out to the well of water of 
nephtoah 18 16 and the border came down to the end of the mountain 
that lieth befor the valley of the son of hinnom and which is in the 
valley of the giant on the north and descend to the valley of 
hinnom to the side of jebusi on the south and descend to enrogel 
18 17 and wa drawn from the north and went forth to enshemesh and 
went forth toward geliloth which is over against the go up of 
adummim and descend to the stone of bohan the son of reuben 18 18 
and pa along toward the side over against arabah northward and 
went down unto arabah 18 19 and the border pa along to the side 
of bethhoglah northward and the outgo of the border were at the 
north bay of the salt sea at the south end of jordan thi wa the 
south coast 

18 20 and jordan wa the border of it on the east side thi wa the 
inherit of the child of benjamin by the coast thereof round 
about accord to their famili 

18 21 now the citi of the tribe of the child of benjamin 
accord to their famili were jericho and bethhoglah and the 
valley of keziz 18 22 and betharabah and zemaraim and bethel 18 23 
and avim and pharah and ophrah 18 24 and chepharhaammonai and 
ophni and gaba twelv citi with their villag 18 25 gibeon and 
ramah and beeroth 18 26 and mizpeh and chephirah and mozah 18 27 
and rekem and irpeel and taralah 18 28 and zelah eleph and 
jebusi which is jerusalem gibeath and kirjath fourteen citi with 
their villag thi is the inherit of the child of benjamin 
accord to their famili 

19 1 and the second lot came forth to simeon even for the tribe of 
the child of simeon accord to their famili and their 
inherit wa within the inherit of the child of judah 

19 2 and they had in their inherit beersheba and sheba and 
moladah 19 3 and hazarshu and balah and azem 19 4 and eltolad 
and bethul and hormah 19 5 and ziklag and bethmarcaboth and 
hazarsusah 19 6 and bethlebaoth and sharuhen thirteen citi and 
their villag 19 7 ain remmon and ether and ashan four citi 
and their villag 19 8 and all the villag that were round about 
these citi to baalathb ramath of the south thi is the 
inherit of the tribe of the child of simeon accord to their 
famili 

19 9 out of the portion of the child of judah wa the inherit 
of the child of simeon for the part of the child of judah wa 
too much for them therefor the child of simeon had their 
inherit within the inherit of them 

19 10 and the third lot came up for the child of zebulun accord 
to their famili and the border of their inherit wa unto sarid 
19 11 and their border went up toward the sea and maralah and 
reach to dabbasheth and reach to the river that is befor 
jokneam 19 12 and turn from sarid eastward toward the sunri 
unto the border of chislothtabor and then goeth out to daberath and 
goeth up to japhia 19 13 and from thenc passeth on along on the east 
to gittahheph to ittahkazin and goeth out to remmonmethoar to 
neah 19 14 and the border compasseth it on the north side to 
hannathon and the outgo thereof are in the valley of jiphthahel 
19 15 and kattath and nahal and shimron and idalah and 
bethlehem twelv citi with their villag 

19 16 thi is the inherit of the child of zebulun accord to 
their famili these citi with their villag 

19 17 and the fourth lot came out to issachar for the child of 
issachar accord to their famili 

19 18 and their border wa toward jezreel and chesulloth and shunem 
19 19 and haphraim and shihon and anaharath 19 20 and rabbith and 
kishion and abez 19 21 and remeth and engannim and enhaddah and 
bethpazzez 19 22 and the coast reacheth to tabor and shahazimah and 
bethshemesh and the outgo of their border were at jordan sixteen 
citi with their villag 

19 23 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the child of issachar 
accord to their famili the citi and their villag 

19 24 and the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the child of 
asher accord to their famili 

19 25 and their border wa helkath and hali and beten and achshaph 
19 26 and alammelech and amad and misheal and reacheth to carmel 
westward and to shihorlibnath 19 27 and turneth toward the sunri 
to bethdagon and reacheth to zebulun and to the valley of jiphthahel 
toward the north side of bethemek and neiel and goeth out to cabul 
on the left hand 19 28 and hebron and rehob and hammon and kanah 
even unto great zidon 19 29 and then the coast turneth to ramah and 
to the strong citi tyre and the coast turneth to hosah and the 
outgo thereof are at the sea from the coast to achzib 19 30 ummah 
also and aphek and rehob twenti and two citi with their villag 

19 31 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the child of asher 
accord to their famili these citi with their villag 

19 32 the sixth lot came out to the child of naphtali even for the 
child of naphtali accord to their famili 

19 33 and their coast wa from heleph from allon to zaanannim and 
adami nekeb and jabneel unto lakum and the outgo thereof were 
at jordan 19 34 and then the coast turneth westward to aznothtabor 
and goeth out from thenc to hukkok and reacheth to zebulun on the 
south side and reacheth to asher on the west side and to judah upon 
jordan toward the sunri 

19 35 and the fenc citi are ziddim zer and hammath rakkath and 
chinnereth 19 36 and adamah and ramah and hazor 19 37 and kedesh 
and edrei and enhazor 19 38 and iron and migdalel horem and 
bethanath and bethshemesh nineteen citi with their villag 

19 39 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the child of naphtali 
accord to their famili the citi and their villag 

19 40 and the seventh lot came out for the tribe of the child of 
dan accord to their famili 

19 41 and the coast of their inherit wa zorah and eshtaol and 
irshemesh 19 42 and shaalabbin and ajalon and jethlah 19 43 and 
elon and thimnathah and ekron 19 44 and eltekeh and gibbethon and 
baalath 19 45 and jehud and beneberak and gathrimmon 19 46 and 
mejarkon and rakkon with the border befor japho 

19 47 and the coast of the child of dan went out too littl for 
them therefor the child of dan went up to fight against leshem 
and took it and smote it with the edg of the sword and poss 
it and dwelt therein and call leshem dan after the name of dan 
their father 

19 48 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the child of dan 
accord to their famili these citi with their villag 

19 49 when they had made an end of divid the land for inherit 
by their coast the child of israel gave an inherit to joshua 
the son of nun among them 19 50 accord to the word of the lord 
they gave him the citi which he ask even timnathserah in mount 
ephraim and he built the citi and dwelt therein 

19 51 these are the inherit which eleazar the priest and joshua 
the son of nun and the head of the father of the tribe of the 
child of israel divid for an inherit by lot in shiloh befor 
the lord at the door of the tabernacl of the congreg so they 
made an end of divid the countri 

20 1 the lord also spake unto joshua say 20 2 speak to the 
child of israel say appoint out for you citi of refug 
whereof i spake unto you by the hand of mose 20 3 that the slayer 
that killeth ani person unawar and unwittingli may flee thither and 
they shall be your refug from the aveng of blood 

20 4 and when he that doth flee unto one of those citi shall stand 
at the enter of the gate of the citi and shall declar hi cau 
in the ear of the elder of that citi they shall take him into the 
citi unto them and give him a place that he may dwell among them 

20 5 and if the aveng of blood pursu after him then they shall not 
deliv the slayer up into hi hand becau he smote hi neighbour 
unwittingli and hate him not beforetim 

20 6 and he shall dwell in that citi until he stand befor the 
congreg for judgment and until the death of the high priest that 
shall be in those day then shall the slayer return and come unto 
hi own citi and unto hi own hou unto the citi from whenc he 
fled 

20 7 and they appoint kedesh in galil in mount naphtali and 
shechem in mount ephraim and kirjatharba which is hebron in the 
mountain of judah 

20 8 and on the other side jordan by jericho eastward they assign 
bezer in the wilder upon the plain out of the tribe of reuben and 
ramoth in gilead out of the tribe of gad and golan in bashan out of 
the tribe of manasseh 

20 9 these were the citi appoint for all the child of israel 
and for the stranger that sojourneth among them that whosoev 
killeth ani person at unawar might flee thither and not die by the 
hand of the aveng of blood until he stood befor the congreg 

21 1 then came near the head of the father of the levit unto 
eleazar the priest and unto joshua the son of nun and unto the head 
of the father of the tribe of the child of israel 21 2 and they 
spake unto them at shiloh in the land of canaan say the lord 
command by the hand of mose to give u citi to dwell in with the 
suburb thereof for our cattl 

21 3 and the child of israel gave unto the levit out of their 
inherit at the command of the lord these citi and their 
suburb 

21 4 and the lot came out for the famili of the kohathit and the 
child of aaron the priest which were of the levit had by lot 
out of the tribe of judah and out of the tribe of simeon and out of 
the tribe of benjamin thirteen citi 

21 5 and the rest of the child of kohath had by lot out of the 
famili of the tribe of ephraim and out of the tribe of dan and out 
of the half tribe of manasseh ten citi 

21 6 and the child of gershon had by lot out of the famili of the 
tribe of issachar and out of the tribe of asher and out of the tribe 
of naphtali and out of the half tribe of manasseh in bashan thirteen 
citi 

21 7 the child of merari by their famili had out of the tribe of 
reuben and out of the tribe of gad and out of the tribe of zebulun 
twelv citi 

21 8 and the child of israel gave by lot unto the levit these 
citi with their suburb a the lord command by the hand of mose 

21 9 and they gave out of the tribe of the child of judah and out 
of the tribe of the child of simeon these citi which are here 
mention by name 

21 10 which the child of aaron be of the famili of the 
kohathit who were of the child of levi had for their wa the 
first lot 

21 11 and they gave them the citi of arba the father of anak which 
citi is hebron in the hill countri of judah with the suburb thereof 
round about it 

21 12 but the field of the citi and the villag thereof gave they 
to caleb the son of jephunneh for hi poss 

21 13 thu they gave to the child of aaron the priest hebron with 
her suburb to be a citi of refug for the slayer and libnah with 
her suburb 21 14 and jattir with her suburb and eshtemoa with her 
suburb 21 15 and holon with her suburb and debir with her suburb 
21 16 and ain with her suburb and juttah with her suburb and 
bethshemesh with her suburb nine citi out of those two tribe 

21 17 and out of the tribe of benjamin gibeon with her suburb geba 
with her suburb 21 18 anathoth with her suburb and almon with her 
suburb four citi 

21 19 all the citi of the child of aaron the priest were 
thirteen citi with their suburb 

21 20 and the famili of the child of kohath the levit which 
remain of the child of kohath even they had the citi of their 
lot out of the tribe of ephraim 

21 21 for they gave them shechem with her suburb in mount ephraim to 
be a citi of refug for the slayer and gezer with her suburb 21 22 
and kibzaim with her suburb and bethhoron with her suburb four 
citi 

21 23 and out of the tribe of dan eltekeh with her suburb gibbethon 
with her suburb 21 24 aijalon with her suburb gathrimmon with her 
suburb four citi 

21 25 and out of the half tribe of manasseh tanach with her suburb 
and gathrimmon with her suburb two citi 

21 26 all the citi were ten with their suburb for the famili of 
the child of kohath that remain 

21 27 and unto the child of gershon of the famili of the 
levit out of the other half tribe of manasseh they gave golan in 
bashan with her suburb to be a citi of refug for the slayer and 
beeshterah with her suburb two citi 

21 28 and out of the tribe of issachar kishon with her suburb 
dabareh with her suburb 21 29 jarmuth with her suburb engannim 
with her suburb four citi 

21 30 and out of the tribe of asher mishal with her suburb abdon 
with her suburb 21 31 helkath with her suburb and rehob with her 
suburb four citi 

21 32 and out of the tribe of naphtali kedesh in galil with her 
suburb to be a citi of refug for the slayer and hammothdor with 
her suburb and kartan with her suburb three citi 

21 33 all the citi of the gershonit accord to their famili 
were thirteen citi with their suburb 

21 34 and unto the famili of the child of merari the rest of the 
levit out of the tribe of zebulun jokneam with her suburb and 
kartah with her suburb 21 35 dimnah with her suburb nahal with 
her suburb four citi 

21 36 and out of the tribe of reuben bezer with her suburb and 
jahazah with her suburb 21 37 kedemoth with her suburb and 
mephaath with her suburb four citi 

21 38 and out of the tribe of gad ramoth in gilead with her suburb 
to be a citi of refug for the slayer and mahanaim with her suburb 
21 39 heshbon with her suburb jazer with her suburb four citi in 
all 

21 40 so all the citi for the child of merari by their famili 
which were remain of the famili of the levit were by their lot 
twelv citi 

21 41 all the citi of the levit within the poss of the 
child of israel were forti and eight citi with their suburb 

21 42 these citi were everi one with their suburb round about them 
thu were all these citi 

21 43 and the lord gave unto israel all the land which he sware to 
give unto their father and they poss it and dwelt therein 

21 44 and the lord gave them rest round about accord to all that 
he sware unto their father and there stood not a man of all their 
enemi befor them the lord deliv all their enemi into their 
hand 

21 45 there fail not ought of ani good thing which the lord had 
spoken unto the hou of israel all came to pa 

22 1 then joshua call the reubenit and the gadit and the half 
tribe of manasseh 22 2 and said unto them ye have kept all that 
mose the servant of the lord command you and have obey my voic 
in all that i command you 22 3 ye have not left your brother these 
mani day unto thi day but have kept the charg of the command 
of the lord your god 

22 4 and now the lord your god hath given rest unto your brother a 
he promi them therefor now return ye and get you unto your 
tent and unto the land of your poss which mose the servant 
of the lord gave you on the other side jordan 

22 5 but take dilig heed to do the command and the law which 
mose the servant of the lord charg you to love the lord your god 
and to walk in all hi way and to keep hi command and to 
cleav unto him and to serv him with all your heart and with all 
your soul 

22 6 so joshua bless them and sent them away and they went unto 
their tent 

22 7 now to the one half of the tribe of manasseh mose had given 
poss in bashan but unto the other half thereof gave joshua 
among their brother on thi side jordan westward and when joshua 
sent them away also unto their tent then he bless them 22 8 and 
he spake unto them say return with much rich unto your tent 
and with veri much cattl with silver and with gold and with brass 
and with iron and with veri much raiment divid the spoil of your 
enemi with your brother 

22 9 and the child of reuben and the child of gad and the half 
tribe of manasseh return and depart from the child of israel 
out of shiloh which is in the land of canaan to go unto the countri 
of gilead to the land of their poss whereof they were 
poss accord to the word of the lord by the hand of mose 

22 10 and when they came unto the border of jordan that are in the 
land of canaan the child of reuben and the child of gad and the 
half tribe of manasseh built there an altar by jordan a great altar 
to see to 

22 11 and the child of israel heard say behold the child of 
reuben and the child of gad and the half tribe of manasseh have 
built an altar over against the land of canaan in the border of 
jordan at the passag of the child of israel 

22 12 and when the child of israel heard of it the whole 
congreg of the child of israel gather themselv togeth at 
shiloh to go up to war against them 

22 13 and the child of israel sent unto the child of reuben and 
to the child of gad and to the half tribe of manasseh into the 
land of gilead phineha the son of eleazar the priest 22 14 and with 
him ten princ of each chief hou a princ throughout all the 
tribe of israel and each one wa an head of the hou of their 
father among the thousand of israel 

22 15 and they came unto the child of reuben and to the child 
of gad and to the half tribe of manasseh unto the land of gilead 
and they spake with them say 22 16 thu saith the whole 
congreg of the lord what trespass is thi that ye have commit 
against the god of israel to turn away thi day from follow the 
lord in that ye have build you an altar that ye might rebel thi 
day against the lord 22 17 is the iniqu of peor too littl for 
u from which we are not clean until thi day although there wa 
a plagu in the congreg of the lord 22 18 but that ye must turn 
away thi day from follow the lord and it will be see ye rebel 
to day against the lord that to morrow he will be wroth with the 
whole congreg of israel 

22 19 notwithstand if the land of your poss be unclean then 
pa ye over unto the land of the poss of the lord wherein the 
lord s tabernacl dwelleth and take poss among u but rebel 
not against the lord nor rebel against u in build you an altar 
besid the altar of the lord our god 

22 20 did not achan the son of zerah commit a trespass in the accur 
thing and wrath fell on all the congreg of israel and that man 
perish not alon in hi iniqu 

22 21 then the child of reuben and the child of gad and the half 
tribe of manasseh answer and said unto the head of the thousand 
of israel 22 22 the lord god of god the lord god of god he 
knoweth and israel he shall know if it be in rebellion or if in 
transgress against the lord save u not thi day 22 23 that we 
have built u an altar to turn from follow the lord or if to offer 
thereon burnt offer or meat offer or if to offer peac 
offer thereon let the lord himself requir it 22 24 and if we 
have not rather done it for fear of thi thing say in time to 
come your child might speak unto our child say what have ye 
to do with the lord god of israel 22 25 for the lord hath made 
jordan a border between u and you ye child of reuben and child 
of gad ye have no part in the lord so shall your child make our 
child cea from fear the lord 

22 26 therefor we said let u now prepar to build u an altar not 
for burnt offer nor for sacrif 22 27 but that it may be a 
wit between u and you and our gener after u that we 
might do the servic of the lord befor him with our burnt offer 
and with our sacrif and with our peac offer that your 
child may not say to our child in time to come ye have no part 
in the lord 

22 28 therefor said we that it shall be when they should so say to 
u or to our gener in time to come that we may say again 
behold the pattern of the altar of the lord which our father made 
not for burnt offer nor for sacrif but it is a wit 
between u and you 

22 29 god forbid that we should rebel against the lord and turn thi 
day from follow the lord to build an altar for burnt offer 
for meat offer or for sacrif besid the altar of the lord 
our god that is befor hi tabernacl 

22 30 and when phineha the priest and the princ of the 
congreg and head of the thousand of israel which were with him 
heard the word that the child of reuben and the child of gad 
and the child of manasseh spake it plea them 

22 31 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest said unto the 
child of reuben and to the child of gad and to the child of 
manasseh thi day we perceiv that the lord is among u becau ye 
have not commit thi trespass against the lord now ye have 
deliv the child of israel out of the hand of the lord 

22 32 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest and the princ 
return from the child of reuben and from the child of gad 
out of the land of gilead unto the land of canaan to the child of 
israel and brought them word again 

22 33 and the thing plea the child of israel and the child 
of israel bless god and did not intend to go up against them in 
battl to destroy the land wherein the child of reuben and gad 
dwelt 

22 34 and the child of reuben and the child of gad call the 
altar ed for it shall be a wit between u that the lord is god 

23 1 and it came to pa a long time after that the lord had given 
rest unto israel from all their enemi round about that joshua wax 
old and stricken in age 

23 2 and joshua call for all israel and for their elder and for 
their head and for their judg and for their offic and said 
unto them i am old and stricken in age 23 3 and ye have seen all 
that the lord your god hath done unto all these nation becau of 
you for the lord your god is he that hath fought for you 

23 4 behold i have divid unto you by lot these nation that remain 
to be an inherit for your tribe from jordan with all the 
nation that i have cut off even unto the great sea westward 

23 5 and the lord your god he shall expel them from befor you and 
drive them from out of your sight and ye shall po their land a 
the lord your god hath promi unto you 

23 6 be ye therefor veri courag to keep and to do all that is 
written in the book of the law of mose that ye turn not asid 
therefrom to the right hand or to the left 23 7 that ye come not 
among these nation these that remain among you neither make mention 
of the name of their god nor cau to swear by them neither serv 
them nor bow yourselv unto them 23 8 but cleav unto the lord your 
god a ye have done unto thi day 

23 9 for the lord hath driven out from befor you great nation and 
strong but a for you no man hath been abl to stand befor you unto 
thi day 

23 10 one man of you shall chase a thousand for the lord your god he 
it is that fighteth for you a he hath promi you 

23 11 take good heed therefor unto yourselv that ye love the lord 
your god 

23 12 el if ye do in ani wise go back and cleav unto the remnant 
of these nation even these that remain among you and shall make 
marriag with them and go in unto them and they to you 23 13 know 
for a certainti that the lord your god will no more drive out ani of 
these nation from befor you but they shall be snare and trap unto 
you and scourg in your side and thorn in your eye until ye 
perish from off thi good land which the lord your god hath given you 

23 14 and behold thi day i am go the way of all the earth and 
ye know in all your heart and in all your soul that not one thing 
hath fail of all the good thing which the lord your god spake 
concern you all are come to pa unto you and not one thing hath 
fail thereof 

23 15 therefor it shall come to pa that a all good thing are 
come upon you which the lord your god promi you so shall the lord 
bring upon you all evil thing until he have destroy you from off 
thi good land which the lord your god hath given you 

23 16 when ye have transgress the coven of the lord your god 
which he command you and have gone and serv other god and bow 
yourselv to them then shall the anger of the lord be kindl 
against you and ye shall perish quickli from off the good land which 
he hath given unto you 

24 1 and joshua gather all the tribe of israel to shechem and 
call for the elder of israel and for their head and for their 
judg and for their offic and they present themselv befor 
god 

24 2 and joshua said unto all the peopl thu saith the lord god of 
israel your father dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time 
even terah the father of abraham and the father of nachor and they 
serv other god 

24 3 and i took your father abraham from the other side of the flood 
and led him throughout all the land of canaan and multipli hi 
seed and gave him isaac 

24 4 and i gave unto isaac jacob and esau and i gave unto esau mount 
seir to po it but jacob and hi child went down into egypt 

24 5 i sent mose also and aaron and i plagu egypt accord to 
that which i did among them and afterward i brought you out 

24 6 and i brought your father out of egypt and ye came unto the 
sea and the egyptian pursu after your father with chariot and 
horseman unto the red sea 

24 7 and when they cri unto the lord he put dark between you 
and the egyptian and brought the sea upon them and cover them 
and your eye have seen what i have done in egypt and ye dwelt in the 
wilder a long season 

24 8 and i brought you into the land of the amorit which dwelt on 
the other side jordan and they fought with you and i gave them into 
your hand that ye might po their land and i destroy them from 
befor you 

24 9 then balak the son of zippor king of moab aro and war 
against israel and sent and call balaam the son of beor to cur 
you 24 10 but i would not hearken unto balaam therefor he bless 
you still so i deliv you out of hi hand 

24 11 and you went over jordan and came unto jericho and the men of 
jericho fought against you the amorit and the perizzit and the 
canaanit and the hittit and the girgashit the hivit and 
the jebusit and i deliv them into your hand 

24 12 and i sent the hornet befor you which drave them out from 
befor you even the two king of the amorit but not with thi 
sword nor with thi bow 

24 13 and i have given you a land for which ye did not labour and 
citi which ye built not and ye dwell in them of the vineyard and 
oliveyard which ye plant not do ye eat 

24 14 now therefor fear the lord and serv him in sincer and in 
truth and put away the god which your father serv on the other 
side of the flood and in egypt and serv ye the lord 

24 15 and if it seem evil unto you to serv the lord choo you thi 
day whom ye will serv whether the god which your father serv 
that were on the other side of the flood or the god of the amorit 
in whose land ye dwell but a for me and my hou we will serv the 
lord 

24 16 and the peopl answer and said god forbid that we should 
forsak the lord to serv other god 24 17 for the lord our god he 
it is that brought u up and our father out of the land of egypt 
from the hou of bondag and which did those great sign in our 
sight and preserv u in all the way wherein we went and among all 
the peopl through whom we pa 24 18 and the lord drave out from 
befor u all the peopl even the amorit which dwelt in the land 
therefor will we also serv the lord for he is our god 

24 19 and joshua said unto the peopl ye cannot serv the lord for 
he is an holi god he is a jealou god he will not forgiv your 
transgress nor your sin 

24 20 if ye forsak the lord and serv strang god then he will 
turn and do you hurt and consum you after that he hath done you 
good 

24 21 and the peopl said unto joshua nay but we will serv the 
lord 

24 22 and joshua said unto the peopl ye are wit against 
yourselv that ye have chosen you the lord to serv him and they 
said we are wit 

24 23 now therefor put away said he the strang god which are 
among you and inclin your heart unto the lord god of israel 

24 24 and the peopl said unto joshua the lord our god will we serv 
and hi voic will we obey 

24 25 so joshua made a coven with the peopl that day and set them 
a statut and an ordin in shechem 

24 26 and joshua wrote these word in the book of the law of god and 
took a great stone and set it up there under an oak that wa by the 
sanctuari of the lord 

24 27 and joshua said unto all the peopl behold thi stone shall be 
a wit unto u for it hath heard all the word of the lord which 
he spake unto u it shall be therefor a wit unto you lest ye 
deni your god 

24 28 so joshua let the peopl depart everi man unto hi inherit 

24 29 and it came to pa after these thing that joshua the son of 
nun the servant of the lord die be an hundr and ten year 
old 

24 30 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in 
timnathserah which is in mount ephraim on the north side of the hill 
of gaash 

24 31 and israel serv the lord all the day of joshua and all the 
day of the elder that overliv joshua and which had known all the 
work of the lord that he had done for israel 

24 32 and the bone of joseph which the child of israel brought up 
out of egypt buri they in shechem in a parcel of ground which 
jacob bought of the son of hamor the father of shechem for an hundr 
piec of silver and it becam the inherit of the child of 
joseph 

24 33 and eleazar the son of aaron die and they buri him in a hill 
that pertain to phineha hi son which wa given him in mount 
ephraim 




the book of judg 


1 1 now after the death of joshua it came to pa that the child 
of israel ask the lord say who shall go up for u against the 
canaanit first to fight against them 1 2 and the lord said judah 
shall go up behold i have deliv the land into hi hand 

1 3 and judah said unto simeon hi brother come up with me into my 
lot that we may fight against the canaanit and i likewi will go 
with thee into thi lot so simeon went with him 

1 4 and judah went up and the lord deliv the canaanit and the 
perizzit into their hand and they slew of them in bezek ten 
thousand men 

1 5 and they found adonibezek in bezek and they fought against him 
and they slew the canaanit and the perizzit 

1 6 but adonibezek fled and they pursu after him and caught him 
and cut off hi thumb and hi great toe 

1 7 and adonibezek said threescor and ten king have their thumb 
and their great toe cut off gather their meat under my tabl a i 
have done so god hath requit me and they brought him to jerusalem 
and there he die 

1 8 now the child of judah had fought against jerusalem and had 
taken it and smitten it with the edg of the sword and set the citi 
on fire 

1 9 and afterward the child of judah went down to fight against the 
canaanit that dwelt in the mountain and in the south and in the 
valley 

1 10 and judah went against the canaanit that dwelt in hebron now 
the name of hebron befor wa kirjatharba and they slew sheshai and 
ahiman and talmai 

1 11 and from thenc he went against the inhabit of debir and the 
name of debir befor wa kirjathseph 1 12 and caleb said he that 
smiteth kirjathseph and taketh it to him will i give achsah my 
daughter to wife 

1 13 and othniel the son of kenaz caleb s younger brother took it 
and he gave him achsah hi daughter to wife 

1 14 and it came to pa when she came to him that she move him to 
ask of her father a field and she light from off her a and caleb 
said unto her what wilt thou 1 15 and she said unto him give me a 
bless for thou hast given me a south land give me also spring of 
water and caleb gave her the upper spring and the nether spring 

1 16 and the child of the kenit mose father in law went up out 
of the citi of palm tree with the child of judah into the 
wilder of judah which lieth in the south of arad and they went 
and dwelt among the peopl 

1 17 and judah went with simeon hi brother and they slew the 
canaanit that inhabit zephath and utterli destroy it and the 
name of the citi wa call hormah 

1 18 also judah took gaza with the coast thereof and askelon with the 
coast thereof and ekron with the coast thereof 

1 19 and the lord wa with judah and he drave out the inhabit of 
the mountain but could not drive out the inhabit of the valley 
becau they had chariot of iron 

1 20 and they gave hebron unto caleb a mose said and he expel 
thenc the three son of anak 

1 21 and the child of benjamin did not drive out the jebusit that 
inhabit jerusalem but the jebusit dwell with the child of 
benjamin in jerusalem unto thi day 

1 22 and the hou of joseph they also went up against bethel and 
the lord wa with them 

1 23 and the hou of joseph sent to descri bethel now the name of 
the citi befor wa luz 1 24 and the spi saw a man come forth out 
of the citi and they said unto him shew u we pray thee the 
entranc into the citi and we will shew thee merci 

1 25 and when he shew them the entranc into the citi they smote 
the citi with the edg of the sword but they let go the man and all 
hi famili 

1 26 and the man went into the land of the hittit and built a citi 
and call the name thereof luz which is the name thereof unto thi 
day 

1 27 neither did manasseh drive out the inhabit of bethshean and 
her town nor taanach and her town nor the inhabit of dor and 
her town nor the inhabit of ibleam and her town nor the 
inhabit of megiddo and her town but the canaanit would dwell 
in that land 

1 28 and it came to pa when israel wa strong that they put the 
canaanit to tribut and did not utterli drive them out 

1 29 neither did ephraim drive out the canaanit that dwelt in gezer 
but the canaanit dwelt in gezer among them 

1 30 neither did zebulun drive out the inhabit of kitron nor the 
inhabit of nahalol but the canaanit dwelt among them and 
becam tributari 

1 31 neither did asher drive out the inhabit of accho nor the 
inhabit of zidon nor of ahlab nor of achzib nor of helbah nor 
of aphik nor of rehob 1 32 but the asherit dwelt among the 
canaanit the inhabit of the land for they did not drive them 
out 

1 33 neither did naphtali drive out the inhabit of bethshemesh 
nor the inhabit of bethanath but he dwelt among the canaanit 
the inhabit of the land nevertheless the inhabit of 
bethshemesh and of bethanath becam tributari unto them 

1 34 and the amorit forc the child of dan into the mountain 
for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley 1 35 but 
the amorit would dwell in mount here in aijalon and in shaalbim 
yet the hand of the hou of joseph prevail so that they becam 
tributari 

1 36 and the coast of the amorit wa from the go up to akrabbim 
from the rock and upward 

2 1 and an angel of the lord came up from gilgal to bochim and said 
i made you to go up out of egypt and have brought you unto the land 
which i sware unto your father and i said i will never break my 
coven with you 

2 2 and ye shall make no leagu with the inhabit of thi land ye 
shall throw down their altar but ye have not obey my voic whi 
have ye done thi 2 3 wherefor i also said i will not drive them 
out from befor you but they shall be a thorn in your side and 
their god shall be a snare unto you 

2 4 and it came to pa when the angel of the lord spake these word 
unto all the child of israel that the peopl lift up their 
voic and wept 

2 5 and they call the name of that place bochim and they sacrif 
there unto the lord 

2 6 and when joshua had let the peopl go the child of israel went 
everi man unto hi inherit to po the land 

2 7 and the peopl serv the lord all the day of joshua and all the 
day of the elder that outliv joshua who had seen all the great 
work of the lord that he did for israel 

2 8 and joshua the son of nun the servant of the lord die be an 
hundr and ten year old 

2 9 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in 
timnathh in the mount of ephraim on the north side of the hill 
gaash 

2 10 and also all that gener were gather unto their father 
and there aro anoth gener after them which knew not the 
lord nor yet the work which he had done for israel 

2 11 and the child of israel did evil in the sight of the lord and 
serv baalim 2 12 and they forsook the lord god of their father 
which brought them out of the land of egypt and follow other god 
of the god of the peopl that were round about them and bow 
themselv unto them and provok the lord to anger 

2 13 and they forsook the lord and serv baal and ashtaroth 

2 14 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he 
deliv them into the hand of spoiler that spoil them and he 
sold them into the hand of their enemi round about so that they 
could not ani longer stand befor their enemi 

2 15 whithersoev they went out the hand of the lord wa against 
them for evil a the lord had said and a the lord had sworn unto 
them and they were greatli distress 

2 16 nevertheless the lord rai up judg which deliv them out 
of the hand of those that spoil them 

2 17 and yet they would not hearken unto their judg but they went a 
whore after other god and bow themselv unto them they turn 
quickli out of the way which their father walk in obey the 
command of the lord but they did not so 

2 18 and when the lord rai them up judg then the lord wa with 
the judg and deliv them out of the hand of their enemi all the 
day of the judg for it repent the lord becau of their groan 
by reason of them that oppress them and vex them 

2 19 and it came to pa when the judg wa dead that they return 
and corrupt themselv more than their father in follow other 
god to serv them and to bow down unto them they cea not from 
their own do nor from their stubborn way 

2 20 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he said 
becau that thi peopl hath transgress my coven which i 
command their father and have not hearken unto my voic 2 21 i 
also will not henceforth drive out ani from befor them of the nation 
which joshua left when he die 2 22 that through them i may prove 
israel whether they will keep the way of the lord to walk therein a 
their father did keep it or not 

2 23 therefor the lord left those nation without drive them out 
hastili neither deliv he them into the hand of joshua 

3 1 now these are the nation which the lord left to prove israel by 
them even a mani of israel a had not known all the war of canaan 
3 2 onli that the gener of the child of israel might know to 
teach them war at the least such a befor knew noth thereof 3 3 
name five lord of the philistin and all the canaanit and the 
sidonian and the hivit that dwelt in mount lebanon from mount 
baalhermon unto the enter in of hamath 

3 4 and they were to prove israel by them to know whether they would 
hearken unto the command of the lord which he command their 
father by the hand of mose 

3 5 and the child of israel dwelt among the canaanit hittit 
and amorit and perizzit and hivit and jebusit 3 6 and they 
took their daughter to be their wife and gave their daughter to 
their son and serv their god 

3 7 and the child of israel did evil in the sight of the lord and 
forgat the lord their god and serv baalim and the grove 

3 8 therefor the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he 
sold them into the hand of chushanrishathaim king of mesopotamia and 
the child of israel serv chushanrishathaim eight year 

3 9 and when the child of israel cri unto the lord the lord 
rai up a deliv to the child of israel who deliv them 
even othniel the son of kenaz caleb s younger brother 

3 10 and the spirit of the lord came upon him and he judg israel 
and went out to war and the lord deliv chushanrishathaim king of 
mesopotamia into hi hand and hi hand prevail against 
chushanrishathaim 

3 11 and the land had rest forti year and othniel the son of kenaz 
die 

3 12 and the child of israel did evil again in the sight of the 
lord and the lord strengthen eglon the king of moab against israel 
becau they had done evil in the sight of the lord 

3 13 and he gather unto him the child of ammon and amalek and 
went and smote israel and poss the citi of palm tree 

3 14 so the child of israel serv eglon the king of moab eighteen 
year 

3 15 but when the child of israel cri unto the lord the lord 
rai them up a deliv ehud the son of gera a benjamit a man 
lefthand and by him the child of israel sent a present unto 
eglon the king of moab 

3 16 but ehud made him a dagger which had two edg of a cubit 
length and he did gird it under hi raiment upon hi right thigh 

3 17 and he brought the present unto eglon king of moab and eglon wa 
a veri fat man 

3 18 and when he had made an end to offer the present he sent away 
the peopl that bare the present 

3 19 but he himself turn again from the quarri that were by 
gilgal and said i have a secret errand unto thee o king who said 
keep silenc and all that stood by him went out from him 

3 20 and ehud came unto him and he wa sit in a summer parlour 
which he had for himself alon and ehud said i have a messag from 
god unto thee 

and he aro out of hi seat 

3 21 and ehud put forth hi left hand and took the dagger from hi 
right thigh and thrust it into hi belli 3 22 and the haft also went 
in after the blade and the fat close upon the blade so that he 
could not draw the dagger out of hi belli and the dirt came out 

3 23 then ehud went forth through the porch and shut the door of the 
parlour upon him and lock them 

3 24 when he wa gone out hi servant came and when they saw that 
behold the door of the parlour were lock they said sure he 
covereth hi foot in hi summer chamber 

3 25 and they tarri till they were asham and behold he open 
not the door of the parlour therefor they took a key and open 
them and behold their lord wa fallen down dead on the earth 

3 26 and ehud escap while they tarri and pa beyond the 
quarri and escap unto seirath 

3 27 and it came to pa when he wa come that he blew a trumpet in 
the mountain of ephraim and the child of israel went down with him 
from the mount and he befor them 

3 28 and he said unto them follow after me for the lord hath 
deliv your enemi the moabit into your hand and they went down 
after him and took the ford of jordan toward moab and suffer not 
a man to pa over 

3 29 and they slew of moab at that time about ten thousand men all 
lusti and all men of valour and there escap not a man 

3 30 so moab wa subdu that day under the hand of israel and the 
land had rest fourscor year 

3 31 and after him wa shamgar the son of anath which slew of the 
philistin six hundr men with an ox goad and he also deliv 
israel 

4 1 and the child of israel again did evil in the sight of the 
lord when ehud wa dead 

4 2 and the lord sold them into the hand of jabin king of canaan that 
reign in hazor the captain of whose host wa sisera which dwelt in 
harosheth of the gentil 

4 3 and the child of israel cri unto the lord for he had nine 
hundr chariot of iron and twenti year he mightili oppress the 
child of israel 

4 4 and deborah a prophetess the wife of lapidoth she judg israel 
at that time 

4 5 and she dwelt under the palm tree of deborah between ramah and 
bethel in mount ephraim and the child of israel came up to her for 
judgment 

4 6 and she sent and call barak the son of abinoam out of 
kedeshnaphtali and said unto him hath not the lord god of israel 
command say go and draw toward mount tabor and take with thee 
ten thousand men of the child of naphtali and of the child of 
zebulun 4 7 and i will draw unto thee to the river kishon sisera 
the captain of jabin s armi with hi chariot and hi multitud and 
i will deliv him into thine hand 

4 8 and barak said unto her if thou wilt go with me then i will go 
but if thou wilt not go with me then i will not go 

4 9 and she said i will sure go with thee notwithstand the 
journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour for the lord 
shall sell sisera into the hand of a woman and deborah aro and 
went with barak to kedesh 

4 10 and barak call zebulun and naphtali to kedesh and he went up 
with ten thousand men at hi foot and deborah went up with him 

4 11 now heber the kenit which wa of the child of hobab the 
father in law of mose had sever himself from the kenit and 
pitch hi tent unto the plain of zaanaim which is by kedesh 

4 12 and they shew sisera that barak the son of abinoam wa gone up 
to mount tabor 

4 13 and sisera gather togeth all hi chariot even nine hundr 
chariot of iron and all the peopl that were with him from 
harosheth of the gentil unto the river of kishon 

4 14 and deborah said unto barak up for thi is the day in which the 
lord hath deliv sisera into thine hand is not the lord gone out 
befor thee so barak went down from mount tabor and ten thousand men 
after him 

4 15 and the lord discomfit sisera and all hi chariot and all 
hi host with the edg of the sword befor barak so that sisera 
light down off hi chariot and fled away on hi foot 

4 16 but barak pursu after the chariot and after the host unto 
harosheth of the gentil and all the host of sisera fell upon the 
edg of the sword and there wa not a man left 

4 17 howbeit sisera fled away on hi foot to the tent of jael the wife 
of heber the kenit for there wa peac between jabin the king of 
hazor and the hou of heber the kenit 

4 18 and jael went out to meet sisera and said unto him turn in my 
lord turn in to me fear not and when he had turn in unto her into 
the tent she cover him with a mantl 

4 19 and he said unto her give me i pray thee a littl water to 
drink for i am thirsti and she open a bottl of milk and gave him 
drink and cover him 

4 20 again he said unto her stand in the door of the tent and it 
shall be when ani man doth come and enquir of thee and say is 
there ani man here that thou shalt say no 

4 21 then jael heber s wife took a nail of the tent and took an 
hammer in her hand and went softli unto him and smote the nail into 
hi templ and fasten it into the ground for he wa fast asleep 
and weari so he die 

4 22 and behold a barak pursu sisera jael came out to meet him 
and said unto him come and i will shew thee the man whom thou 
seekest and when he came into her tent behold sisera lay dead and 
the nail wa in hi templ 

4 23 so god subdu on that day jabin the king of canaan befor the 
child of israel 

4 24 and the hand of the child of israel prosper and prevail 
against jabin the king of canaan until they had destroy jabin king 
of canaan 

5 1 then sang deborah and barak the son of abinoam on that day 
say 5 2 prai ye the lord for the aveng of israel when the 
peopl willingli offer themselv 

5 3 hear o ye king give ear o ye princ i even i will sing 
unto the lord i will sing prai to the lord god of israel 

5 4 lord when thou wentest out of seir when thou marchedst out of 
the field of edom the earth trembl and the heaven drop the 
cloud also drop water 

5 5 the mountain melt from befor the lord even that sinai from 
befor the lord god of israel 

5 6 in the day of shamgar the son of anath in the day of jael the 
highway were unoccupi and the travel walk through byway 

5 7 the inhabit of the villag cea they cea in israel 
until that i deborah aro that i aro a mother in israel 

5 8 they chose new god then wa war in the gate wa there a shield 
or spear seen among forti thousand in israel 5 9 my heart is toward 
the governor of israel that offer themselv willingli among the 
peopl bless ye the lord 

5 10 speak ye that ride on white as ye that sit in judgment and 
walk by the way 

5 11 they that are deliv from the noi of archer in the place 
of draw water there shall they rehear the righteou act of the 
lord even the righteou act toward the inhabit of hi villag 
in israel then shall the peopl of the lord go down to the gate 

5 12 awak awak deborah awak awak utter a song ari barak 
and lead thi captiv captiv thou son of abinoam 

5 13 then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobl 
among the peopl the lord made me have dominion over the mighti 

5 14 out of ephraim wa there a root of them against amalek after 
thee benjamin among thi peopl out of machir came down governor 
and out of zebulun they that handl the pen of the writer 

5 15 and the princ of issachar were with deborah even issachar and 
also barak he wa sent on foot into the valley for the divi of 
reuben there were great thought of heart 

5 16 whi abodest thou among the sheepfold to hear the bleat of 
the flock for the divi of reuben there were great search of 
heart 

5 17 gilead abod beyond jordan and whi did dan remain in ship 
asher continu on the sea shore and abod in hi breach 

5 18 zebulun and naphtali were a peopl that jeopard their life 
unto the death in the high place of the field 

5 19 the king came and fought then fought the king of canaan in 
taanach by the water of megiddo they took no gain of money 

5 20 they fought from heaven the star in their cour fought 
against sisera 

5 21 the river of kishon swept them away that ancient river the 
river kishon o my soul thou hast trodden down strength 

5 22 then were the horsehoof broken by the mean of the pran 
the pran of their mighti one 

5 23 cur ye meroz said the angel of the lord cur ye bitterli the 
inhabit thereof becau they came not to the help of the lord to 
the help of the lord against the mighti 

5 24 bless abov woman shall jael the wife of heber the kenit be 
bless shall she be abov woman in the tent 

5 25 he ask water and she gave him milk she brought forth butter 
in a lordli dish 

5 26 she put her hand to the nail and her right hand to the workman s 
hammer and with the hammer she smote sisera she smote off hi head 
when she had pierc and stricken through hi templ 

5 27 at her foot he bow he fell he lay down at her foot he bow 
he fell where he bow there he fell down dead 

5 28 the mother of sisera look out at a window and cri through 
the lattic whi is hi chariot so long in come whi tarri the 
wheel of hi chariot 5 29 her wise ladi answer her yea she 
return answer to herself 5 30 have they not sped have they not 
divid the prey to everi man a damsel or two to sisera a prey of 
diver colour a prey of diver colour of needlework of diver 
colour of needlework on both side meet for the neck of them that 
take the spoil 5 31 so let all thine enemi perish o lord but let 
them that love him be a the sun when he goeth forth in hi might and 
the land had rest forti year 

6 1 and the child of israel did evil in the sight of the lord and 
the lord deliv them into the hand of midian seven year 

6 2 and the hand of midian prevail against israel and becau of 
the midianit the child of israel made them the den which are in 
the mountain and cave and strong hold 

6 3 and so it wa when israel had sown that the midianit came up 
and the amalekit and the child of the east even they came up 
against them 6 4 and they encamp against them and destroy the 
increa of the earth till thou come unto gaza and left no 
susten for israel neither sheep nor ox nor a 

6 5 for they came up with their cattl and their tent and they came 
a grasshopp for multitud for both they and their camel were 
without number and they enter into the land to destroy it 

6 6 and israel wa greatli impoverish becau of the midianit and 
the child of israel cri unto the lord 

6 7 and it came to pa when the child of israel cri unto the 
lord becau of the midianit 6 8 that the lord sent a prophet unto 
the child of israel which said unto them thu saith the lord god 
of israel i brought you up from egypt and brought you forth out of 
the hou of bondag 6 9 and i deliv you out of the hand of the 
egyptian and out of the hand of all that oppress you and drave 
them out from befor you and gave you their land 6 10 and i said 
unto you i am the lord your god fear not the god of the amorit 
in whose land ye dwell but ye have not obey my voic 

6 11 and there came an angel of the lord and sat under an oak which 
wa in ophrah that pertain unto joash the abiezrit and hi son 
gideon thresh wheat by the winepress to hide it from the 
midianit 

6 12 and the angel of the lord appear unto him and said unto him 
the lord is with thee thou mighti man of valour 

6 13 and gideon said unto him oh my lord if the lord be with u whi 
then is all thi befallen u and where be all hi miracl which our 
father told u of say did not the lord bring u up from egypt 
but now the lord hath forsaken u and deliv u into the hand of 
the midianit 

6 14 and the lord look upon him and said go in thi thi might and 
thou shalt save israel from the hand of the midianit have not i 
sent thee 6 15 and he said unto him oh my lord wherewith shall i 
save israel behold my famili is poor in manasseh and i am the 
least in my father s hou 

6 16 and the lord said unto him sure i will be with thee and thou 
shalt smite the midianit a one man 

6 17 and he said unto him if now i have found grace in thi sight 
then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me 

6 18 depart not henc i pray thee until i come unto thee and bring 
forth my present and set it befor thee and he said i will tarri 
until thou come again 

6 19 and gideon went in and made readi a kid and unleaven cake of 
an ephah of flour the flesh he put in a basket and he put the broth 
in a pot and brought it out unto him under the oak and present it 

6 20 and the angel of god said unto him take the flesh and the 
unleaven cake and lay them upon thi rock and pour out the broth 
and he did so 

6 21 then the angel of the lord put forth the end of the staff that 
wa in hi hand and touch the flesh and the unleaven cake and 
there rose up fire out of the rock and consum the flesh and the 
unleaven cake then the angel of the lord depart out of hi 
sight 

6 22 and when gideon perceiv that he wa an angel of the lord 
gideon said ala o lord god for becau i have seen an angel of the 
lord face to face 

6 23 and the lord said unto him peac be unto thee fear not thou 
shalt not die 

6 24 then gideon built an altar there unto the lord and call it 
jehovahshalom unto thi day it is yet in ophrah of the abiezrit 

6 25 and it came to pa the same night that the lord said unto him 
take thi father s young bullock even the second bullock of seven 
year old and throw down the altar of baal that thi father hath and 
cut down the grove that is by it 6 26 and build an altar unto the 
lord thi god upon the top of thi rock in the order place and take 
the second bullock and offer a burnt sacrif with the wood of the 
grove which thou shalt cut down 

6 27 then gideon took ten men of hi servant and did a the lord had 
said unto him and so it wa becau he fear hi father s 
household and the men of the citi that he could not do it by day 
that he did it by night 

6 28 and when the men of the citi aro earli in the morn behold 
the altar of baal wa cast down and the grove wa cut down that wa 
by it and the second bullock wa offer upon the altar that wa 
built 

6 29 and they said one to anoth who hath done thi thing and when 
they enquir and ask they said gideon the son of joash hath done 
thi thing 

6 30 then the men of the citi said unto joash bring out thi son that 
he may die becau he hath cast down the altar of baal and becau 
he hath cut down the grove that wa by it 

6 31 and joash said unto all that stood against him will ye plead for 
baal will ye save him he that will plead for him let him be put to 
death whilst it is yet morn if he be a god let him plead for 
himself becau one hath cast down hi altar 

6 32 therefor on that day he call him jerubba say let baal 
plead against him becau he hath thrown down hi altar 

6 33 then all the midianit and the amalekit and the child of 
the east were gather togeth and went over and pitch in the 
valley of jezreel 

6 34 but the spirit of the lord came upon gideon and he blew a 
trumpet and abiez wa gather after him 

6 35 and he sent messeng throughout all manasseh who also wa 
gather after him and he sent messeng unto asher and unto 
zebulun and unto naphtali and they came up to meet them 

6 36 and gideon said unto god if thou wilt save israel by mine hand 
a thou hast said 6 37 behold i will put a fleec of wool in the 
floor and if the dew be on the fleec onli and it be dri upon all 
the earth besid then shall i know that thou wilt save israel by mine 
hand a thou hast said 

6 38 and it wa so for he rose up earli on the morrow and thrust the 
fleec togeth and wring the dew out of the fleec a bowl full of 
water 

6 39 and gideon said unto god let not thine anger be hot against me 
and i will speak but thi onc let me prove i pray thee but thi 
onc with the fleec let it now be dri onli upon the fleec and upon 
all the ground let there be dew 

6 40 and god did so that night for it wa dri upon the fleec onli 
and there wa dew on all the ground 

7 1 then jerubba who is gideon and all the peopl that were with 
him rose up earli and pitch besid the well of harod so that the 
host of the midianit were on the north side of them by the hill of 
moreh in the valley 

7 2 and the lord said unto gideon the peopl that are with thee are 
too mani for me to give the midianit into their hand lest israel 
vaunt themselv against me say mine own hand hath save me 

7 3 now therefor go to proclaim in the ear of the peopl say 
whosoev is fear and afraid let him return and depart earli from 
mount gilead and there return of the peopl twenti and two 
thousand and there remain ten thousand 

7 4 and the lord said unto gideon the peopl are yet too mani bring 
them down unto the water and i will tri them for thee there and it 
shall be that of whom i say unto thee thi shall go with thee the 
same shall go with thee and of whomsoev i say unto thee thi shall 
not go with thee the same shall not go 

7 5 so he brought down the peopl unto the water and the lord said 
unto gideon everi one that lappeth of the water with hi tongu a a 
dog lappeth him shalt thou set by himself likewi everi one that 
boweth down upon hi knee to drink 

7 6 and the number of them that lap put their hand to their 
mouth were three hundr men but all the rest of the peopl bow 
down upon their knee to drink water 

7 7 and the lord said unto gideon by the three hundr men that 
lap will i save you and deliv the midianit into thine hand 
and let all the other peopl go everi man unto hi place 

7 8 so the peopl took victual in their hand and their trumpet and 
he sent all the rest of israel everi man unto hi tent and retain 
those three hundr men and the host of midian wa beneath him in the 
valley 

7 9 and it came to pa the same night that the lord said unto him 
ari get thee down unto the host for i have deliv it into thine 
hand 

7 10 but if thou fear to go down go thou with phurah thi servant down 
to the host 7 11 and thou shalt hear what they say and afterward 
shall thine hand be strengthen to go down unto the host then went 
he down with phurah hi servant unto the outsid of the arm men that 
were in the host 

7 12 and the midianit and the amalekit and all the child of the 
east lay along in the valley like grasshopp for multitud and 
their camel were without number a the sand by the sea side for 
multitud 

7 13 and when gideon wa come behold there wa a man that told a 
dream unto hi fellow and said behold i dream a dream and lo a 
cake of barley bread tumbl into the host of midian and came unto a 
tent and smote it that it fell and overturn it that the tent lay 
along 

7 14 and hi fellow answer and said thi is noth el save the 
sword of gideon the son of joash a man of israel for into hi hand 
hath god deliv midian and all the host 

7 15 and it wa so when gideon heard the tell of the dream and 
the interpret thereof that he worship and return into the 
host of israel and said ari for the lord hath deliv into your 
hand the host of midian 

7 16 and he divid the three hundr men into three compani and he 
put a trumpet in everi man s hand with empti pitcher and lamp 
within the pitcher 

7 17 and he said unto them look on me and do likewi and behold 
when i come to the outsid of the camp it shall be that a i do so 
shall ye do 

7 18 when i blow with a trumpet i and all that are with me then blow 
ye the trumpet also on everi side of all the camp and say the sword 
of the lord and of gideon 

7 19 so gideon and the hundr men that were with him came unto the 
outsid of the camp in the begin of the middl watch and they had 
but newli set the watch and they blew the trumpet and brake the 
pitcher that were in their hand 

7 20 and the three compani blew the trumpet and brake the 
pitcher and held the lamp in their left hand and the trumpet in 
their right hand to blow withal and they cri the sword of the 
lord and of gideon 

7 21 and they stood everi man in hi place round about the camp and 
all the host ran and cri and fled 

7 22 and the three hundr blew the trumpet and the lord set everi 
man s sword against hi fellow even throughout all the host and the 
host fled to bethshittah in zererath and to the border of 
abelmeholah unto tabbath 

7 23 and the men of israel gather themselv togeth out of 
naphtali and out of asher and out of all manasseh and pursu after 
the midianit 

7 24 and gideon sent messeng throughout all mount ephraim say 
come down against the midianit and take befor them the water unto 
bethbarah and jordan then all the men of ephraim gather themselv 
togeth and took the water unto bethbarah and jordan 

7 25 and they took two princ of the midianit oreb and zeeb and 
they slew oreb upon the rock oreb and zeeb they slew at the winepress 
of zeeb and pursu midian and brought the head of oreb and zeeb to 
gideon on the other side jordan 

8 1 and the men of ephraim said unto him whi hast thou serv u 
thu that thou calledst u not when thou wentest to fight with the 
midianit and they did chide with him sharpli 

8 2 and he said unto them what have i done now in comparison of you 
is not the glean of the grape of ephraim better than the vintag 
of abiez 8 3 god hath deliv into your hand the princ of 
midian oreb and zeeb and what wa i abl to do in comparison of you 
then their anger wa abat toward him when he had said that 

8 4 and gideon came to jordan and pa over he and the three 
hundr men that were with him faint yet pursu them 

8 5 and he said unto the men of succoth give i pray you loaf of 
bread unto the peopl that follow me for they be faint and i am 
pursu after zebah and zalmunna king of midian 

8 6 and the princ of succoth said are the hand of zebah and 
zalmunna now in thine hand that we should give bread unto thine armi 
8 7 and gideon said therefor when the lord hath deliv zebah and 
zalmunna into mine hand then i will tear your flesh with the thorn 
of the wilder and with brier 

8 8 and he went up thenc to penuel and spake unto them likewi and 
the men of penuel answer him a the men of succoth had answer him 

8 9 and he spake also unto the men of penuel say when i come 
again in peac i will break down thi tower 

8 10 now zebah and zalmunna were in karkor and their host with them 
about fifteen thousand men all that were left of all the host of the 
child of the east for there fell an hundr and twenti thousand 
men that drew sword 

8 11 and gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tent on the 
east of nobah and jogbehah and smote the host for the host wa 
secur 

8 12 and when zebah and zalmunna fled he pursu after them and took 
the two king of midian zebah and zalmunna and discomfit all the 
host 

8 13 and gideon the son of joash return from battl befor the sun 
wa up 8 14 and caught a young man of the men of succoth and 
enquir of him and he describ unto him the princ of succoth and 
the elder thereof even threescor and seventeen men 

8 15 and he came unto the men of succoth and said behold zebah and 
zalmunna with whom ye did upbraid me say are the hand of zebah 
and zalmunna now in thine hand that we should give bread unto thi men 
that are weari 8 16 and he took the elder of the citi and thorn 
of the wilder and brier and with them he taught the men of 
succoth 

8 17 and he beat down the tower of penuel and slew the men of the 
citi 

8 18 then said he unto zebah and zalmunna what manner of men were 
they whom ye slew at tabor and they answer a thou art so were 
they each one resembl the child of a king
