8 19 and he said they were my brother even the son of my mother 
a the lord liveth if ye had save them aliv i would not slay you 

8 20 and he said unto jether hi firstborn up and slay them but the 
youth drew not hi sword for he fear becau he wa yet a youth 

8 21 then zebah and zalmunna said rise thou and fall upon u for a 
the man is so is hi strength and gideon aro and slew zebah and 
zalmunna and took away the ornament that were on their camel 
neck 

8 22 then the men of israel said unto gideon rule thou over u both 
thou and thi son and thi son s son also for thou hast deliv u 
from the hand of midian 

8 23 and gideon said unto them i will not rule over you neither 
shall my son rule over you the lord shall rule over you 

8 24 and gideon said unto them i would desir a request of you that 
ye would give me everi man the ear of hi prey for they had 
golden ear becau they were ishmaelit 8 25 and they 
answer we will willingli give them and they spread a garment and 
did cast therein everi man the ear of hi prey 

8 26 and the weight of the golden ear that he request wa a 
thousand and seven hundr shekel of gold besid ornament and 
collar and purpl raiment that wa on the king of midian and 
besid the chain that were about their camel neck 

8 27 and gideon made an ephod thereof and put it in hi citi even in 
ophrah and all israel went thither a whore after it which thing 
becam a snare unto gideon and to hi hou 

8 28 thu wa midian subdu befor the child of israel so that 
they lift up their head no more and the countri wa in quiet 
forti year in the day of gideon 

8 29 and jerubba the son of joash went and dwelt in hi own hou 

8 30 and gideon had threescor and ten son of hi bodi begotten for 
he had mani wife 

8 31 and hi concubin that wa in shechem she also bare him a son 
whose name he call abimelech 

8 32 and gideon the son of joash die in a good old age and wa 
buri in the sepulchr of joash hi father in ophrah of the 
abiezrit 

8 33 and it came to pa a soon a gideon wa dead that the 
child of israel turn again and went a whore after baalim and 
made baalberith their god 

8 34 and the child of israel rememb not the lord their god who 
had deliv them out of the hand of all their enemi on everi 
side 8 35 neither shew they kind to the hou of jerubba 
name gideon accord to all the good which he had shew unto 
israel 

9 1 and abimelech the son of jerubba went to shechem unto hi 
mother s brother and commun with them and with all the famili of 
the hou of hi mother s father say 9 2 speak i pray you in 
the ear of all the men of shechem whether is better for you either 
that all the son of jerubba which are threescor and ten person 
reign over you or that one reign over you rememb also that i am 
your bone and your flesh 

9 3 and hi mother s brother spake of him in the ear of all the men 
of shechem all these word and their heart inclin to follow 
abimelech for they said he is our brother 

9 4 and they gave him threescor and ten piec of silver out of the 
hou of baalberith wherewith abimelech hire vain and light person 
which follow him 

9 5 and he went unto hi father s hou at ophrah and slew hi 
brother the son of jerubba be threescor and ten person upon 
one stone notwithstand yet jotham the youngest son of jerubba 
wa left for he hid himself 

9 6 and all the men of shechem gather togeth and all the hou of 
millo and went and made abimelech king by the plain of the pillar 
that wa in shechem 

9 7 and when they told it to jotham he went and stood in the top of 
mount gerizim and lift up hi voic and cri and said unto them 
hearken unto me ye men of shechem that god may hearken unto you 

9 8 the tree went forth on a time to anoint a king over them and 
they said unto the oliv tree reign thou over u 

9 9 but the oliv tree said unto them should i leav my fat 
wherewith by me they honour god and man and go to be promot over 
the tree 9 10 and the tree said to the fig tree come thou and 
reign over u 

9 11 but the fig tree said unto them should i forsak my sweet 
and my good fruit and go to be promot over the tree 9 12 then 
said the tree unto the vine come thou and reign over u 

9 13 and the vine said unto them should i leav my wine which 
cheereth god and man and go to be promot over the tree 9 14 then 
said all the tree unto the brambl come thou and reign over u 

9 15 and the brambl said unto the tree if in truth ye anoint me 
king over you then come and put your trust in my shadow and if not 
let fire come out of the brambl and devour the cedar of lebanon 

9 16 now therefor if ye have done truli and sincer in that ye 
have made abimelech king and if ye have dealt well with jerubba and 
hi hou and have done unto him accord to the deserv of hi 
hand 9 17 for my father fought for you and adventur hi life 
far and deliv you out of the hand of midian 9 18 and ye are 
risen up against my father s hou thi day and have slain hi son 
threescor and ten person upon one stone and have made abimelech 
the son of hi maidserv king over the men of shechem becau he 
is your brother 9 19 if ye then have dealt truli and sincer with 
jerubba and with hi hou thi day then rejoic ye in abimelech 
and let him also rejoic in you 9 20 but if not let fire come out 
from abimelech and devour the men of shechem and the hou of millo 
and let fire come out from the men of shechem and from the hou of 
millo and devour abimelech 

9 21 and jotham ran away and fled and went to beer and dwelt there 
for fear of abimelech hi brother 

9 22 when abimelech had reign three year over israel 9 23 then god 
sent an evil spirit between abimelech and the men of shechem and the 
men of shechem dealt treacher with abimelech 9 24 that the 
cruelti done to the threescor and ten son of jerubba might come 
and their blood be laid upon abimelech their brother which slew them 
and upon the men of shechem which aid him in the kill of hi 
brother 

9 25 and the men of shechem set lier in wait for him in the top of 
the mountain and they rob all that came along that way by them 
and it wa told abimelech 

9 26 and gaal the son of ebe came with hi brother and went over to 
shechem and the men of shechem put their confid in him 

9 27 and they went out into the field and gather their vineyard 
and trode the grape and made merri and went into the hou of their 
god and did eat and drink and cur abimelech 

9 28 and gaal the son of ebe said who is abimelech and who is 
shechem that we should serv him is not he the son of jerubba and 
zebul hi offic serv the men of hamor the father of shechem for 
whi should we serv him 9 29 and would to god thi peopl were under 
my hand then would i remov abimelech and he said to abimelech 
increa thine armi and come out 

9 30 and when zebul the ruler of the citi heard the word of gaal the 
son of ebe hi anger wa kindl 

9 31 and he sent messeng unto abimelech privili say behold 
gaal the son of ebe and hi brother be come to shechem and behold 
they fortifi the citi against thee 

9 32 now therefor up by night thou and the peopl that is with thee 
and lie in wait in the field 9 33 and it shall be that in the 
morn a soon a the sun is up thou shalt rise earli and set upon 
the citi and behold when he and the peopl that is with him come 
out against thee then mayest thou do to them a thou shalt find 
occa 

9 34 and abimelech rose up and all the peopl that were with him by 
night and they laid wait against shechem in four compani 

9 35 and gaal the son of ebe went out and stood in the enter of 
the gate of the citi and abimelech rose up and the peopl that were 
with him from lie in wait 

9 36 and when gaal saw the peopl he said to zebul behold there 
come peopl down from the top of the mountain and zebul said unto 
him thou seest the shadow of the mountain a if they were men 

9 37 and gaal spake again and said see there come peopl down by the 
middl of the land and anoth compani come along by the plain of 
meonenim 

9 38 then said zebul unto him where is now thi mouth wherewith thou 
saidst who is abimelech that we should serv him is not thi the 
peopl that thou hast despi go out i pray now and fight with 
them 

9 39 and gaal went out befor the men of shechem and fought with 
abimelech 

9 40 and abimelech chase him and he fled befor him and mani were 
overthrown and wound even unto the enter of the gate 

9 41 and abimelech dwelt at arumah and zebul thrust out gaal and hi 
brother that they should not dwell in shechem 

9 42 and it came to pa on the morrow that the peopl went out into 
the field and they told abimelech 

9 43 and he took the peopl and divid them into three compani 
and laid wait in the field and look and behold the peopl were 
come forth out of the citi and he rose up against them and smote 
them 

9 44 and abimelech and the compani that wa with him rush forward 
and stood in the enter of the gate of the citi and the two other 
compani ran upon all the peopl that were in the field and slew 
them 

9 45 and abimelech fought against the citi all that day and he took 
the citi and slew the peopl that wa therein and beat down the 
citi and sow it with salt 

9 46 and when all the men of the tower of shechem heard that they 
enter into an hold of the hou of the god berith 

9 47 and it wa told abimelech that all the men of the tower of 
shechem were gather togeth 

9 48 and abimelech gat him up to mount zalmon he and all the peopl 
that were with him and abimelech took an axe in hi hand and cut 
down a bough from the tree and took it and laid it on hi shoulder 
and said unto the peopl that were with him what ye have seen me do 
make hast and do a i have done 

9 49 and all the peopl likewi cut down everi man hi bough and 
follow abimelech and put them to the hold and set the hold on fire 
upon them so that all the men of the tower of shechem die also 
about a thousand men and woman 

9 50 then went abimelech to thebez and encamp against thebez and 
took it 

9 51 but there wa a strong tower within the citi and thither fled 
all the men and woman and all they of the citi and shut it to them 
and gat them up to the top of the tower 

9 52 and abimelech came unto the tower and fought against it and 
went hard unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire 

9 53 and a certain woman cast a piec of a millston upon abimelech s 
head and all to brake hi skull 

9 54 then he call hastili unto the young man hi armourbear and 
said unto him draw thi sword and slay me that men say not of me a 
woman slew him and hi young man thrust him through and he die 

9 55 and when the men of israel saw that abimelech wa dead they 
depart everi man unto hi place 

9 56 thu god render the wick of abimelech which he did unto 
hi father in slay hi seventi brother 9 57 and all the evil of 
the men of shechem did god render upon their head and upon them came 
the cur of jotham the son of jerubba 

10 1 and after abimelech there aro to defend israel tola the son of 
puah the son of dodo a man of issachar and he dwelt in shamir in 
mount ephraim 

10 2 and he judg israel twenti and three year and die and wa 
buri in shamir 

10 3 and after him aro jair a gileadit and judg israel twenti 
and two year 

10 4 and he had thirti son that rode on thirti a colt and they 
had thirti citi which are call havothjair unto thi day which 
are in the land of gilead 

10 5 and jair die and wa buri in camon 

10 6 and the child of israel did evil again in the sight of the 
lord and serv baalim and ashtaroth and the god of syria and the 
god of zidon and the god of moab and the god of the child of 
ammon and the god of the philistin and forsook the lord and 
serv not him 

10 7 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he sold 
them into the hand of the philistin and into the hand of the 
child of ammon 

10 8 and that year they vex and oppress the child of israel 
eighteen year all the child of israel that were on the other side 
jordan in the land of the amorit which is in gilead 

10 9 moreov the child of ammon pa over jordan to fight also 
against judah and against benjamin and against the hou of ephraim 
so that israel wa sore distress 

10 10 and the child of israel cri unto the lord say we have 
sin against thee both becau we have forsaken our god and also 
serv baalim 

10 11 and the lord said unto the child of israel did not i deliv 
you from the egyptian and from the amorit from the child of 
ammon and from the philistin 10 12 the zidonian also and the 
amalekit and the maonit did oppress you and ye cri to me and 
i deliv you out of their hand 

10 13 yet ye have forsaken me and serv other god wherefor i will 
deliv you no more 

10 14 go and cri unto the god which ye have chosen let them deliv 
you in the time of your tribul 

10 15 and the child of israel said unto the lord we have sin 
do thou unto u whatsoev seemeth good unto thee deliv u onli we 
pray thee thi day 

10 16 and they put away the strang god from among them and serv 
the lord and hi soul wa griev for the miseri of israel 

10 17 then the child of ammon were gather togeth and encamp 
in gilead and the child of israel assembl themselv togeth 
and encamp in mizpeh 

10 18 and the peopl and princ of gilead said one to anoth what 
man is he that will begin to fight against the child of ammon he 
shall be head over all the inhabit of gilead 

11 1 now jephthah the gileadit wa a mighti man of valour and he wa 
the son of an harlot and gilead begat jephthah 

11 2 and gilead s wife bare him son and hi wife s son grew up and 
they thrust out jephthah and said unto him thou shalt not inherit in 
our father s hou for thou art the son of a strang woman 

11 3 then jephthah fled from hi brother and dwelt in the land of 
tob and there were gather vain men to jephthah and went out with 
him 

11 4 and it came to pa in process of time that the child of 
ammon made war against israel 

11 5 and it wa so that when the child of ammon made war against 
israel the elder of gilead went to fetch jephthah out of the land of 
tob 11 6 and they said unto jephthah come and be our captain that 
we may fight with the child of ammon 

11 7 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead did not ye hate me 
and expel me out of my father s hou and whi are ye come unto me now 
when ye are in distress 11 8 and the elder of gilead said unto 
jephthah therefor we turn again to thee now that thou mayest go 
with u and fight against the child of ammon and be our head over 
all the inhabit of gilead 

11 9 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead if ye bring me home 
again to fight against the child of ammon and the lord deliv 
them befor me shall i be your head 11 10 and the elder of gilead 
said unto jephthah the lord be wit between u if we do not so 
accord to thi word 

11 11 then jephthah went with the elder of gilead and the peopl 
made him head and captain over them and jephthah utter all hi 
word befor the lord in mizpeh 

11 12 and jephthah sent messeng unto the king of the child of 
ammon say what hast thou to do with me that thou art come 
against me to fight in my land 11 13 and the king of the child of 
ammon answer unto the messeng of jephthah becau israel took 
away my land when they came up out of egypt from arnon even unto 
jabbok and unto jordan now therefor restor those land again 
peaceabl 

11 14 and jephthah sent messeng again unto the king of the child 
of ammon 11 15 and said unto him thu saith jephthah israel took 
not away the land of moab nor the land of the child of ammon 
11 16 but when israel came up from egypt and walk through the 
wilder unto the red sea and came to kadesh 11 17 then israel 
sent messeng unto the king of edom say let me i pray thee 
pa through thi land but the king of edom would not hearken thereto 
and in like manner they sent unto the king of moab but he would not 
consent and israel abod in kadesh 

11 18 then they went along through the wilder and compass the 
land of edom and the land of moab and came by the east side of the 
land of moab and pitch on the other side of arnon but came not 
within the border of moab for arnon wa the border of moab 

11 19 and israel sent messeng unto sihon king of the amorit the 
king of heshbon and israel said unto him let u pa we pray thee 
through thi land into my place 

11 20 but sihon trust not israel to pa through hi coast but 
sihon gather all hi peopl togeth and pitch in jahaz and 
fought against israel 

11 21 and the lord god of israel deliv sihon and all hi peopl 
into the hand of israel and they smote them so israel poss all 
the land of the amorit the inhabit of that countri 

11 22 and they poss all the coast of the amorit from arnon 
even unto jabbok and from the wilder even unto jordan 

11 23 so now the lord god of israel hath dispossess the amorit 
from befor hi peopl israel and shouldest thou po it 11 24 
wilt not thou po that which chemosh thi god giveth thee to 
po so whomsoev the lord our god shall drive out from befor 
u them will we po 

11 25 and now art thou ani thing better than balak the son of zippor 
king of moab did he ever strive against israel or did he ever fight 
against them 11 26 while israel dwelt in heshbon and her town and 
in aroer and her town and in all the citi that be along by the 
coast of arnon three hundr year whi therefor did ye not recov 
them within that time 11 27 wherefor i have not sin against 
thee but thou doest me wrong to war against me the lord the judg be 
judg thi day between the child of israel and the child of 
ammon 

11 28 howbeit the king of the child of ammon hearken not unto the 
word of jephthah which he sent him 

11 29 then the spirit of the lord came upon jephthah and he pa 
over gilead and manasseh and pa over mizpeh of gilead and from 
mizpeh of gilead he pa over unto the child of ammon 

11 30 and jephthah vow a vow unto the lord and said if thou shalt 
without fail deliv the child of ammon into mine hand 11 31 then 
it shall be that whatsoev cometh forth of the door of my hou to 
meet me when i return in peac from the child of ammon shall 
sure be the lord s and i will offer it up for a burnt offer 

11 32 so jephthah pa over unto the child of ammon to fight 
against them and the lord deliv them into hi hand 

11 33 and he smote them from aroer even till thou come to minnith 
even twenti citi and unto the plain of the vineyard with a veri 
great slaughter thu the child of ammon were subdu befor the 
child of israel 

11 34 and jephthah came to mizpeh unto hi hou and behold hi 
daughter came out to meet him with timbrel and with danc and she 
wa hi onli child besid her he had neither son nor daughter 

11 35 and it came to pa when he saw her that he rent hi cloth 
and said ala my daughter thou hast brought me veri low and thou 
art one of them that troubl me for i have open my mouth unto the 
lord and i cannot go back 

11 36 and she said unto him my father if thou hast open thi mouth 
unto the lord do to me accord to that which hath proceed out of 
thi mouth forasmuch a the lord hath taken vengeanc for thee of 
thine enemi even of the child of ammon 

11 37 and she said unto her father let thi thing be done for me let 
me alon two month that i may go up and down upon the mountain and 
bewail my virgin i and my fellow 

11 38 and he said go and he sent her away for two month and she 
went with her companion and bewail her virgin upon the 
mountain 

11 39 and it came to pa at the end of two month that she return 
unto her father who did with her accord to hi vow which he had 
vow and she knew no man and it wa a custom in israel 11 40 that 
the daughter of israel went yearli to lament the daughter of jephthah 
the gileadit four day in a year 

12 1 and the men of ephraim gather themselv togeth and went 
northward and said unto jephthah wherefor passedst thou over to 
fight against the child of ammon and didst not call u to go with 
thee we will burn thine hou upon thee with fire 

12 2 and jephthah said unto them i and my peopl were at great strife 
with the child of ammon and when i call you ye deliv me not 
out of their hand 

12 3 and when i saw that ye deliv me not i put my life in my 
hand and pa over against the child of ammon and the lord 
deliv them into my hand wherefor then are ye come up unto me 
thi day to fight against me 12 4 then jephthah gather togeth 
all the men of gilead and fought with ephraim and the men of gilead 
smote ephraim becau they said ye gileadit are fugit of 
ephraim among the ephraimit and among the manassit 

12 5 and the gileadit took the passag of jordan befor the 
ephraimit and it wa so that when those ephraimit which were 
escap said let me go over that the men of gilead said unto him 
art thou an ephraimit if he said nay 12 6 then said they unto him 
say now shibboleth and he said sibboleth for he could not frame to 
pronounc it right then they took him and slew him at the passag 
of jordan and there fell at that time of the ephraimit forti and 
two thousand 

12 7 and jephthah judg israel six year then die jephthah the 
gileadit and wa buri in one of the citi of gilead 

12 8 and after him ibzan of bethlehem judg israel 

12 9 and he had thirti son and thirti daughter whom he sent 
abroad and took in thirti daughter from abroad for hi son and he 
judg israel seven year 

12 10 then die ibzan and wa buri at bethlehem 

12 11 and after him elon a zebulonit judg israel and he judg 
israel ten year 

12 12 and elon the zebulonit die and wa buri in aijalon in the 
countri of zebulun 

12 13 and after him abdon the son of hillel a pirathonit judg 
israel 

12 14 and he had forti son and thirti nephew that rode on 
threescor and ten a colt and he judg israel eight year 

12 15 and abdon the son of hillel the pirathonit die and wa buri 
in pirathon in the land of ephraim in the mount of the amalekit 

13 1 and the child of israel did evil again in the sight of the 
lord and the lord deliv them into the hand of the philistin 
forti year 

13 2 and there wa a certain man of zorah of the famili of the 
danit whose name wa manoah and hi wife wa barren and bare not 

13 3 and the angel of the lord appear unto the woman and said unto 
her behold now thou art barren and bearest not but thou shalt 
conceiv and bear a son 

13 4 now therefor bewar i pray thee and drink not wine nor strong 
drink and eat not ani unclean thing 13 5 for lo thou shalt 
conceiv and bear a son and no razor shall come on hi head for the 
child shall be a nazarit unto god from the womb and he shall begin 
to deliv israel out of the hand of the philistin 

13 6 then the woman came and told her husband say a man of god 
came unto me and hi counten wa like the counten of an angel 
of god veri terribl but i ask him not whenc he wa neither told 
he me hi name 13 7 but he said unto me behold thou shalt conceiv 
and bear a son and now drink no wine nor strong drink neither eat 
ani unclean thing for the child shall be a nazarit to god from the 
womb to the day of hi death 

13 8 then manoah intreat the lord and said o my lord let the man 
of god which thou didst send come again unto u and teach u what we 
shall do unto the child that shall be born 

13 9 and god hearken to the voic of manoah and the angel of god 
came again unto the woman a she sat in the field but manoah her 
husband wa not with her 

13 10 and the woman made hast and ran and shew her husband and 
said unto him behold the man hath appear unto me that came unto 
me the other day 

13 11 and manoah aro and went after hi wife and came to the man 
and said unto him art thou the man that spakest unto the woman and 
he said i am 

13 12 and manoah said now let thi word come to pa how shall we 
order the child and how shall we do unto him 13 13 and the angel of 
the lord said unto manoah of all that i said unto the woman let her 
bewar 

13 14 she may not eat of ani thing that cometh of the vine neither 
let her drink wine or strong drink nor eat ani unclean thing all 
that i command her let her observ 

13 15 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord i pray thee let u 
detain thee until we shall have made readi a kid for thee 

13 16 and the angel of the lord said unto manoah though thou detain 
me i will not eat of thi bread and if thou wilt offer a burnt 
offer thou must offer it unto the lord for manoah knew not that 
he wa an angel of the lord 

13 17 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord what is thi name 
that when thi say come to pa we may do thee honour 13 18 and 
the angel of the lord said unto him whi askest thou thu after my 
name see it is secret 13 19 so manoah took a kid with a meat 
offer and offer it upon a rock unto the lord and the angel did 
wonder and manoah and hi wife look on 

13 20 for it came to pa when the flame went up toward heaven from 
off the altar that the angel of the lord ascend in the flame of the 
altar and manoah and hi wife look on it and fell on their face 
to the ground 

13 21 but the angel of the lord did no more appear to manoah and to 
hi wife then manoah knew that he wa an angel of the lord 

13 22 and manoah said unto hi wife we shall sure die becau we 
have seen god 

13 23 but hi wife said unto him if the lord were plea to kill u 
he would not have receiv a burnt offer and a meat offer at our 
hand neither would he have shew u all these thing nor would a 
at thi time have told u such thing a these 

13 24 and the woman bare a son and call hi name samson and the 
child grew and the lord bless him 

13 25 and the spirit of the lord began to move him at time in the 
camp of dan between zorah and eshtaol 

14 1 and samson went down to timnath and saw a woman in timnath of 
the daughter of the philistin 

14 2 and he came up and told hi father and hi mother and said i 
have seen a woman in timnath of the daughter of the philistin now 
therefor get her for me to wife 

14 3 then hi father and hi mother said unto him is there never a 
woman among the daughter of thi brother or among all my peopl 
that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumci philistin and 
samson said unto hi father get her for me for she pleaseth me well 

14 4 but hi father and hi mother knew not that it wa of the lord 
that he sought an occa against the philistin for at that time 
the philistin had dominion over israel 

14 5 then went samson down and hi father and hi mother to timnath 
and came to the vineyard of timnath and behold a young lion roar 
against him 

14 6 and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him and he rent 
him a he would have rent a kid and he had noth in hi hand but 
he told not hi father or hi mother what he had done 

14 7 and he went down and talk with the woman and she plea 
samson well 

14 8 and after a time he return to take her and he turn asid to 
see the carca of the lion and behold there wa a swarm of bee 
and honey in the carca of the lion 

14 9 and he took thereof in hi hand and went on eat and came to 
hi father and mother and he gave them and they did eat but he told 
not them that he had taken the honey out of the carca of the lion 

14 10 so hi father went down unto the woman and samson made there a 
feast for so use the young men to do 

14 11 and it came to pa when they saw him that they brought thirti 
companion to be with him 

14 12 and samson said unto them i will now put forth a riddl unto 
you if ye can certainli declar it me within the seven day of the 
feast and find it out then i will give you thirti sheet and thirti 
chang of garment 14 13 but if ye cannot declar it me then shall 
ye give me thirti sheet and thirti chang of garment and they said 
unto him put forth thi riddl that we may hear it 

14 14 and he said unto them out of the eater came forth meat and out 
of the strong came forth sweet and they could not in three day 
expound the riddl 

14 15 and it came to pa on the seventh day that they said unto 
samson s wife entic thi husband that he may declar unto u the 
riddl lest we burn thee and thi father s hou with fire have ye 
call u to take that we have is it not so 14 16 and samson s wife 
wept befor him and said thou dost but hate me and lovest me not 
thou hast put forth a riddl unto the child of my peopl and hast 
not told it me and he said unto her behold i have not told it my 
father nor my mother and shall i tell it thee 14 17 and she wept 
befor him the seven day while their feast last and it came to 
pa on the seventh day that he told her becau she lay sore upon 
him and she told the riddl to the child of her peopl 

14 18 and the men of the citi said unto him on the seventh day befor 
the sun went down what is sweeter than honey and what is stronger 
than a lion and he said unto them if ye had not plow with my 
heifer ye had not found out my riddl 

14 19 and the spirit of the lord came upon him and he went down to 
ashkelon and slew thirti men of them and took their spoil and gave 
chang of garment unto them which expound the riddl and hi anger 
wa kindl and he went up to hi father s hou 

14 20 but samson s wife wa given to hi companion whom he had use 
a hi friend 

15 1 but it came to pa within a while after in the time of wheat 
harvest that samson visit hi wife with a kid and he said i will 
go in to my wife into the chamber but her father would not suffer him 
to go in 

15 2 and her father said i verili thought that thou hadst utterli 
hate her therefor i gave her to thi companion is not her younger 
sister fairer than she take her i pray thee instead of her 

15 3 and samson said concern them now shall i be more blameless 
than the philistin though i do them a displeasur 

15 4 and samson went and caught three hundr fox and took 
firebrand and turn tail to tail and put a firebrand in the midst 
between two tail 

15 5 and when he had set the brand on fire he let them go into the 
stand corn of the philistin and burnt up both the shock and 
also the stand corn with the vineyard and oliv 

15 6 then the philistin said who hath done thi and they answer 
samson the son in law of the timnit becau he had taken hi wife 
and given her to hi companion and the philistin came up and burnt 
her and her father with fire 

15 7 and samson said unto them though ye have done thi yet will i 
be aveng of you and after that i will cea 

15 8 and he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter and he 
went down and dwelt in the top of the rock etam 

15 9 then the philistin went up and pitch in judah and spread 
themselv in lehi 

15 10 and the men of judah said whi are ye come up against u and 
they answer to bind samson are we come up to do to him a he hath 
done to u 

15 11 then three thousand men of judah went to the top of the rock 
etam and said to samson knowest thou not that the philistin are 
ruler over u what is thi that thou hast done unto u and he said 
unto them a they did unto me so have i done unto them 

15 12 and they said unto him we are come down to bind thee that we 
may deliv thee into the hand of the philistin and samson said 
unto them swear unto me that ye will not fall upon me yourselv 

15 13 and they spake unto him say no but we will bind thee fast 
and deliv thee into their hand but sure we will not kill thee 
and they bound him with two new cord and brought him up from the 
rock 

15 14 and when he came unto lehi the philistin shout against him 
and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him and the cord that 
were upon hi arm becam a flax that wa burnt with fire and hi 
band loo from off hi hand 

15 15 and he found a new jawbon of an a and put forth hi hand 
and took it and slew a thousand men therewith 

15 16 and samson said with the jawbon of an a heap upon heap 
with the jaw of an a have i slain a thousand men 

15 17 and it came to pa when he had made an end of speak that 
he cast away the jawbon out of hi hand and call that place 
ramathlehi 

15 18 and he wa sore athirst and call on the lord and said thou 
hast given thi great deliv into the hand of thi servant and 
now shall i die for thirst and fall into the hand of the 
uncircumci 15 19 but god clave an hollow place that wa in the 
jaw and there came water thereout and when he had drunk hi spirit 
came again and he reviv wherefor he call the name thereof 
enhakkor which is in lehi unto thi day 

15 20 and he judg israel in the day of the philistin twenti 
year 

16 1 then went samson to gaza and saw there an harlot and went in 
unto her 

16 2 and it wa told the gazit say samson is come hither and 
they compass him in and laid wait for him all night in the gate of 
the citi and were quiet all the night say in the morn when 
it is day we shall kill him 

16 3 and samson lay till midnight and aro at midnight and took the 
door of the gate of the citi and the two post and went away with 
them bar and all and put them upon hi shoulder and carri them 
up to the top of an hill that is befor hebron 

16 4 and it came to pa afterward that he love a woman in the 
valley of sorek whose name wa delilah 

16 5 and the lord of the philistin came up unto her and said unto 
her entic him and see wherein hi great strength lieth and by what 
mean we may prevail against him that we may bind him to afflict him 
and we will give thee everi one of u eleven hundr piec of silver 

16 6 and delilah said to samson tell me i pray thee wherein thi 
great strength lieth and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict 
thee 

16 7 and samson said unto her if they bind me with seven green with 
that were never dri then shall i be weak and be a anoth man 

16 8 then the lord of the philistin brought up to her seven green 
with which had not been dri and she bound him with them 

16 9 now there were men lie in wait abid with her in the 
chamber 

and she said unto him the philistin be upon thee samson and he 
brake the with a a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the 
fire so hi strength wa not known 

16 10 and delilah said unto samson behold thou hast mock me and 
told me lie now tell me i pray thee wherewith thou mightest be 
bound 

16 11 and he said unto her if they bind me fast with new rope that 
never were occupi then shall i be weak and be a anoth man 

16 12 delilah therefor took new rope and bound him therewith and 
said unto him the philistin be upon thee samson and there were 
lier in wait abid in the chamber and he brake them from off hi 
arm like a thread 

16 13 and delilah said unto samson hitherto thou hast mock me and 
told me lie tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound and he said 
unto her if thou weavest the seven lock of my head with the web 

16 14 and she fasten it with the pin and said unto him the 
philistin be upon thee samson and he awak out of hi sleep and 
went away with the pin of the beam and with the web 

16 15 and she said unto him how canst thou say i love thee when 
thine heart is not with me thou hast mock me these three time and 
hast not told me wherein thi great strength lieth 

16 16 and it came to pa when she press him daili with her word 
and urg him so that hi soul wa vex unto death 16 17 that he 
told her all hi heart and said unto her there hath not come a razor 
upon mine head for i have been a nazarit unto god from my mother s 
womb if i be shaven then my strength will go from me and i shall 
becom weak and be like ani other man 

16 18 and when delilah saw that he had told her all hi heart she 
sent and call for the lord of the philistin say come up thi 
onc for he hath shew me all hi heart then the lord of the 
philistin came up unto her and brought money in their hand 

16 19 and she made him sleep upon her knee and she call for a man 
and she cau him to shave off the seven lock of hi head and she 
began to afflict him and hi strength went from him 

16 20 and she said the philistin be upon thee samson and he awok 
out of hi sleep and said i will go out a at other time befor 
and shake myself and he wist not that the lord wa depart from him 

16 21 but the philistin took him and put out hi eye and brought 
him down to gaza and bound him with fetter of brass and he did 
grind in the prison hou 

16 22 howbeit the hair of hi head began to grow again after he wa 
shaven 

16 23 then the lord of the philistin gather them togeth for to 
offer a great sacrif unto dagon their god and to rejoic for they 
said our god hath deliv samson our enemi into our hand 

16 24 and when the peopl saw him they prai their god for they 
said our god hath deliv into our hand our enemi and the 
destroy of our countri which slew mani of u 

16 25 and it came to pa when their heart were merri that they 
said call for samson that he may make u sport and they call for 
samson out of the prison hou and he made them sport and they set 
him between the pillar 

16 26 and samson said unto the lad that held him by the hand suffer 
me that i may feel the pillar whereupon the hou standeth that i 
may lean upon them 

16 27 now the hou wa full of men and woman and all the lord of 
the philistin were there and there were upon the roof about three 
thousand men and woman that beheld while samson made sport 

16 28 and samson call unto the lord and said o lord god rememb 
me i pray thee and strengthen me i pray thee onli thi onc o 
god that i may be at onc aveng of the philistin for my two eye 

16 29 and samson took hold of the two middl pillar upon which the 
hou stood and on which it wa born up of the one with hi right 
hand and of the other with hi left 

16 30 and samson said let me die with the philistin and he bow 
himself with all hi might and the hou fell upon the lord and 
upon all the peopl that were therein so the dead which he slew at 
hi death were more than they which he slew in hi life 

16 31 then hi brother and all the hou of hi father came down and 
took him and brought him up and buri him between zorah and eshtaol 
in the buryingplac of manoah hi father and he judg israel twenti 
year 

17 1 and there wa a man of mount ephraim whose name wa micah 

17 2 and he said unto hi mother the eleven hundr shekel of silver 
that were taken from thee about which thou cursedst and spakest of 
also in mine ear behold the silver is with me i took it and hi 
mother said bless be thou of the lord my son 

17 3 and when he had restor the eleven hundr shekel of silver to 
hi mother hi mother said i had wholli dedic the silver unto 
the lord from my hand for my son to make a graven imag and a molten 
imag now therefor i will restor it unto thee 

17 4 yet he restor the money unto hi mother and hi mother took 
two hundr shekel of silver and gave them to the founder who made 
thereof a graven imag and a molten imag and they were in the hou 
of micah 

17 5 and the man micah had an hou of god and made an ephod and 
teraphim and consecr one of hi son who becam hi priest 

17 6 in those day there wa no king in israel but everi man did that 
which wa right in hi own eye 

17 7 and there wa a young man out of bethlehemjudah of the famili of 
judah who wa a levit and he sojourn there 

17 8 and the man depart out of the citi from bethlehemjudah to 
sojourn where he could find a place and he came to mount ephraim to 
the hou of micah a he journey 

17 9 and micah said unto him whenc comest thou and he said unto 
him i am a levit of bethlehemjudah and i go to sojourn where i may 
find a place 

17 10 and micah said unto him dwell with me and be unto me a father 
and a priest and i will give thee ten shekel of silver by the year 
and a suit of apparel and thi victual so the levit went in 

17 11 and the levit wa content to dwell with the man and the young 
man wa unto him a one of hi son 

17 12 and micah consecr the levit and the young man becam hi 
priest and wa in the hou of micah 

17 13 then said micah now know i that the lord will do me good 
see i have a levit to my priest 

18 1 in those day there wa no king in israel and in those day the 
tribe of the danit sought them an inherit to dwell in for unto 
that day all their inherit had not fallen unto them among the 
tribe of israel 

18 2 and the child of dan sent of their famili five men from their 
coast men of valour from zorah and from eshtaol to spi out the 
land and to search it and they said unto them go search the land 
who when they came to mount ephraim to the hou of micah they 
lodg there 

18 3 when they were by the hou of micah they knew the voic of the 
young man the levit and they turn in thither and said unto him 
who brought thee hither and what makest thou in thi place and what 
hast thou here 18 4 and he said unto them thu and thu dealeth 
micah with me and hath hire me and i am hi priest 

18 5 and they said unto him ask counsel we pray thee of god that 
we may know whether our way which we go shall be prosper 

18 6 and the priest said unto them go in peac befor the lord is 
your way wherein ye go 

18 7 then the five men depart and came to laish and saw the peopl 
that were therein how they dwelt careless after the manner of the 
zidonian quiet and secur and there wa no magistr in the land 
that might put them to shame in ani thing and they were far from the 
zidonian and had no busi with ani man 

18 8 and they came unto their brother to zorah and eshtaol and their 
brother said unto them what say ye 18 9 and they said ari that 
we may go up against them for we have seen the land and behold it 
is veri good and are ye still be not sloth to go and to enter to 
po the land 

18 10 when ye go ye shall come unto a peopl secur and to a larg 
land for god hath given it into your hand a place where there is no 
want of ani thing that is in the earth 

18 11 and there went from thenc of the famili of the danit out of 
zorah and out of eshtaol six hundr men appoint with weapon of 
war 

18 12 and they went up and pitch in kirjathjearim in judah 
wherefor they call that place mahanehdan unto thi day behold it 
is behind kirjathjearim 

18 13 and they pa thenc unto mount ephraim and came unto the 
hou of micah 

18 14 then answer the five men that went to spi out the countri of 
laish and said unto their brother do ye know that there is in these 
hou an ephod and teraphim and a graven imag and a molten imag 
now therefor consid what ye have to do 

18 15 and they turn thitherward and came to the hou of the young 
man the levit even unto the hou of micah and salut him 

18 16 and the six hundr men appoint with their weapon of war 
which were of the child of dan stood by the enter of the gate 

18 17 and the five men that went to spi out the land went up and came 
in thither and took the graven imag and the ephod and the 
teraphim and the molten imag and the priest stood in the enter 
of the gate with the six hundr men that were appoint with weapon 
of war 

18 18 and these went into micah s hou and fetch the carv imag 
the ephod and the teraphim and the molten imag then said the 
priest unto them what do ye 18 19 and they said unto him hold thi 
peac lay thine hand upon thi mouth and go with u and be to u a 
father and a priest is it better for thee to be a priest unto the 
hou of one man or that thou be a priest unto a tribe and a famili 
in israel 18 20 and the priest s heart wa glad and he took the 
ephod and the teraphim and the graven imag and went in the midst 
of the peopl 

18 21 so they turn and depart and put the littl one and the 
cattl and the carriag befor them 

18 22 and when they were a good way from the hou of micah the men 
that were in the hou near to micah s hou were gather togeth 
and overtook the child of dan 

18 23 and they cri unto the child of dan and they turn their 
face and said unto micah what aileth thee that thou comest with 
such a compani 18 24 and he said ye have taken away my god which i 
made and the priest and ye are gone away and what have i more and 
what is thi that ye say unto me what aileth thee 18 25 and the 
child of dan said unto him let not thi voic be heard among u 
lest angri fellow run upon thee and thou lose thi life with the 
life of thi household 

18 26 and the child of dan went their way and when micah saw that 
they were too strong for him he turn and went back unto hi hou 

18 27 and they took the thing which micah had made and the priest 
which he had and came unto laish unto a peopl that were at quiet 
and secur and they smote them with the edg of the sword and burnt 
the citi with fire 

18 28 and there wa no deliv becau it wa far from zidon and 
they had no busi with ani man and it wa in the valley that lieth 
by bethrehob and they built a citi and dwelt therein 

18 29 and they call the name of the citi dan after the name of dan 
their father who wa born unto israel howbeit the name of the citi 
wa laish at the first 

18 30 and the child of dan set up the graven imag and jonathan 
the son of gershom the son of manasseh he and hi son were priest 
to the tribe of dan until the day of the captiv of the land 

18 31 and they set them up micah s graven imag which he made all 
the time that the hou of god wa in shiloh 

19 1 and it came to pa in those day when there wa no king in 
israel that there wa a certain levit sojourn on the side of 
mount ephraim who took to him a concubin out of bethlehemjudah 

19 2 and hi concubin play the whore against him and went away 
from him unto her father s hou to bethlehemjudah and wa there four 
whole month 

19 3 and her husband aro and went after her to speak friendli unto 
her and to bring her again have hi servant with him and a coupl 
of as and she brought him into her father s hou and when the 
father of the damsel saw him he rejoic to meet him 

19 4 and hi father in law the damsel s father retain him and he 
abod with him three day so they did eat and drink and lodg 
there 

19 5 and it came to pa on the fourth day when they aro earli in 
the morn that he rose up to depart and the damsel s father said 
unto hi son in law comfort thine heart with a morsel of bread and 
afterward go your way 

19 6 and they sat down and did eat and drink both of them togeth 
for the damsel s father had said unto the man be content i pray 
thee and tarri all night and let thine heart be merri 

19 7 and when the man rose up to depart hi father in law urg him 
therefor he lodg there again 

19 8 and he aro earli in the morn on the fifth day to depart and 
the damsel s father said comfort thine heart i pray thee and they 
tarri until afternoon and they did eat both of them 

19 9 and when the man rose up to depart he and hi concubin and 
hi servant hi father in law the damsel s father said unto him 
behold now the day draweth toward even i pray you tarri all 
night behold the day groweth to an end lodg here that thine heart 
may be merri and to morrow get you earli on your way that thou 
mayest go home 

19 10 but the man would not tarri that night but he rose up and 
depart and came over against jebu which is jerusalem and there 
were with him two as saddl hi concubin also wa with him 

19 11 and when they were by jebu the day wa far spent and the 
servant said unto hi master come i pray thee and let u turn in 
into thi citi of the jebusit and lodg in it 

19 12 and hi master said unto him we will not turn asid hither into 
the citi of a stranger that is not of the child of israel we will 
pa over to gibeah 

19 13 and he said unto hi servant come and let u draw near to one 
of these place to lodg all night in gibeah or in ramah 

19 14 and they pa on and went their way and the sun went down 
upon them when they were by gibeah which belongeth to benjamin 

19 15 and they turn asid thither to go in and to lodg in gibeah 
and when he went in he sat him down in a street of the citi for 
there wa no man that took them into hi hou to lodg 

19 16 and behold there came an old man from hi work out of the 
field at even which wa also of mount ephraim and he sojourn in 
gibeah but the men of the place were benjamit 

19 17 and when he had lift up hi eye he saw a wayfar man in 
the street of the citi and the old man said whither goest thou and 
whenc comest thou 19 18 and he said unto him we are pa from 
bethlehemjudah toward the side of mount ephraim from thenc am i and 
i went to bethlehemjudah but i am now go to the hou of the lord 
and there is no man that receiveth me to hou 

19 19 yet there is both straw and provend for our as and there 
is bread and wine also for me and for thi handmaid and for the young 
man which is with thi servant there is no want of ani thing 

19 20 and the old man said peac be with thee howsoev let all thi 
want lie upon me onli lodg not in the street 

19 21 so he brought him into hi hou and gave provend unto the 
as and they wash their foot and did eat and drink 

19 22 now a they were make their heart merri behold the men of 
the citi certain son of belial beset the hou round about and 
beat at the door and spake to the master of the hou the old man 
say bring forth the man that came into thine hou that we may 
know him 

19 23 and the man the master of the hou went out unto them and 
said unto them nay my brother nay i pray you do not so wickedli 
see that thi man is come into mine hou do not thi folli 

19 24 behold here is my daughter a maiden and hi concubin them i 
will bring out now and humbl ye them and do with them what seemeth 
good unto you but unto thi man do not so vile a thing 

19 25 but the men would not hearken to him so the man took hi 
concubin and brought her forth unto them and they knew her and 
abu her all the night until the morn and when the day began to 
spring they let her go 

19 26 then came the woman in the dawn of the day and fell down at 
the door of the man s hou where her lord wa till it wa light 

19 27 and her lord rose up in the morn and open the door of the 
hou and went out to go hi way and behold the woman hi 
concubin wa fallen down at the door of the hou and her hand were 
upon the threshold 

19 28 and he said unto her up and let u be go but none 
answer 

then the man took her up upon an a and the man rose up and gat him 
unto hi place 

19 29 and when he wa come into hi hou he took a knife and laid 
hold on hi concubin and divid her togeth with her bone into 
twelv piec and sent her into all the coast of israel 

19 30 and it wa so that all that saw it said there wa no such deed 
done nor seen from the day that the child of israel came up out of 
the land of egypt unto thi day consid of it take advic and 
speak your mind 

20 1 then all the child of israel went out and the congreg 
wa gather togeth a one man from dan even to beersheba with the 
land of gilead unto the lord in mizpeh 

20 2 and the chief of all the peopl even of all the tribe of 
israel present themselv in the assembl of the peopl of god 
four hundr thousand footman that drew sword 

20 3 now the child of benjamin heard that the child of israel 
were gone up to mizpeh then said the child of israel tell u 
how wa thi wick 20 4 and the levit the husband of the 
woman that wa slain answer and said i came into gibeah that 
belongeth to benjamin i and my concubin to lodg 

20 5 and the men of gibeah rose against me and beset the hou round 
about upon me by night and thought to have slain me and my concubin 
have they forc that she is dead 

20 6 and i took my concubin and cut her in piec and sent her 
throughout all the countri of the inherit of israel for they have 
commit lewd and folli in israel 

20 7 behold ye are all child of israel give here your advic and 
counsel 

20 8 and all the peopl aro a one man say we will not ani of 
u go to hi tent neither will we ani of u turn into hi hou 

20 9 but now thi shall be the thing which we will do to gibeah we 
will go up by lot against it 20 10 and we will take ten men of an 
hundr throughout all the tribe of israel and an hundr of a 
thousand and a thousand out of ten thousand to fetch victual for the 
peopl that they may do when they come to gibeah of benjamin 
accord to all the folli that they have wrought in israel 

20 11 so all the men of israel were gather against the citi knit 
togeth a one man 

20 12 and the tribe of israel sent men through all the tribe of 
benjamin say what wick is thi that is done among you 
20 13 now therefor deliv u the men the child of belial which 
are in gibeah that we may put them to death and put away evil from 
israel but the child of benjamin would not hearken to the voic of 
their brother the child of israel 

20 14 but the child of benjamin gather themselv togeth out of 
the citi unto gibeah to go out to battl against the child of 
israel 

20 15 and the child of benjamin were number at that time out of 
the citi twenti and six thousand men that drew sword besid the 
inhabit of gibeah which were number seven hundr chosen men 

20 16 among all thi peopl there were seven hundr chosen men 
lefthand everi one could sling stone at an hair breadth and not 
miss 

20 17 and the men of israel besid benjamin were number four 
hundr thousand men that drew sword all these were men of war 

20 18 and the child of israel aro and went up to the hou of 
god and ask counsel of god and said which of u shall go up first 
to the battl against the child of benjamin and the lord said 
judah shall go up first 

20 19 and the child of israel rose up in the morn and encamp 
against gibeah 

20 20 and the men of israel went out to battl against benjamin and 
the men of israel put themselv in array to fight against them at 
gibeah 

20 21 and the child of benjamin came forth out of gibeah and 
destroy down to the ground of the israelit that day twenti and two 
thousand men 

20 22 and the peopl the men of israel encourag themselv and set 
their battl again in array in the place where they put themselv in 
array the first day 

20 23 and the child of israel went up and wept befor the lord 
until even and ask counsel of the lord say shall i go up again 
to battl against the child of benjamin my brother and the lord 
said go up against him 20 24 and the child of israel came near 
against the child of benjamin the second day 

20 25 and benjamin went forth against them out of gibeah the second 
day and destroy down to the ground of the child of israel again 
eighteen thousand men all these drew the sword 

20 26 then all the child of israel and all the peopl went up 
and came unto the hou of god and wept and sat there befor the 
lord and fast that day until even and offer burnt offer and 
peac offer befor the lord 

20 27 and the child of israel enquir of the lord for the ark of 
the coven of god wa there in those day 20 28 and phineha the 
son of eleazar the son of aaron stood befor it in those day 
say shall i yet again go out to battl against the child of 
benjamin my brother or shall i cea and the lord said go up for 
to morrow i will deliv them into thine hand 

20 29 and israel set lier in wait round about gibeah 

20 30 and the child of israel went up against the child of 
benjamin on the third day and put themselv in array against gibeah 
a at other time 

20 31 and the child of benjamin went out against the peopl and 
were drawn away from the citi and they began to smite of the peopl 
and kill a at other time in the highway of which one goeth up to 
the hou of god and the other to gibeah in the field about thirti 
men of israel 

20 32 and the child of benjamin said they are smitten down befor 
u a at the first but the child of israel said let u flee and 
draw them from the citi unto the highway 

20 33 and all the men of israel rose up out of their place and put 
themselv in array at baaltamar and the lier in wait of israel came 
forth out of their place even out of the meadow of gibeah 

20 34 and there came against gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all 
israel and the battl wa sore but they knew not that evil wa near 
them 

20 35 and the lord smote benjamin befor israel and the child of 
israel destroy of the benjamit that day twenti and five thousand 
and an hundr men all these drew the sword 

20 36 so the child of benjamin saw that they were smitten for the 
men of israel gave place to the benjamit becau they trust unto 
the lier in wait which they had set besid gibeah 

20 37 and the lier in wait hast and rush upon gibeah and the 
lier in wait drew themselv along and smote all the citi with the 
edg of the sword 

20 38 now there wa an appoint sign between the men of israel and 
the lier in wait that they should make a great flame with smoke rise 
up out of the citi 

20 39 and when the men of israel retir in the battl benjamin began 
to smite and kill of the men of israel about thirti person for they 
said sure they are smitten down befor u a in the first battl 

20 40 but when the flame began to ari up out of the citi with a 
pillar of smoke the benjamit look behind them and behold the 
flame of the citi ascend up to heaven 

20 41 and when the men of israel turn again the men of benjamin 
were amaz for they saw that evil wa come upon them 

20 42 therefor they turn their back befor the men of israel unto 
the way of the wilder but the battl overtook them and them 
which came out of the citi they destroy in the midst of them 

20 43 thu they inclo the benjamit round about and chase them 
and trode them down with ea over against gibeah toward the 
sunri 

20 44 and there fell of benjamin eighteen thousand men all these were 
men of valour 

20 45 and they turn and fled toward the wilder unto the rock of 
rimmon and they glean of them in the highway five thousand men 
and pursu hard after them unto gidom and slew two thousand men of 
them 

20 46 so that all which fell that day of benjamin were twenti and five 
thousand men that drew the sword all these were men of valour 

20 47 but six hundr men turn and fled to the wilder unto the 
rock rimmon and abod in the rock rimmon four month 

20 48 and the men of israel turn again upon the child of 
benjamin and smote them with the edg of the sword a well the men 
of everi citi a the beast and all that came to hand also they set 
on fire all the citi that they came to 

21 1 now the men of israel had sworn in mizpeh say there shall 
not ani of u give hi daughter unto benjamin to wife 

21 2 and the peopl came to the hou of god and abod there till 
even befor god and lift up their voic and wept sore 21 3 and 
said o lord god of israel whi is thi come to pa in israel that 
there should be to day one tribe lack in israel 21 4 and it came 
to pa on the morrow that the peopl rose earli and built there an 
altar and offer burnt offer and peac offer 

21 5 and the child of israel said who is there among all the 
tribe of israel that came not up with the congreg unto the lord 
for they had made a great oath concern him that came not up to the 
lord to mizpeh say he shall sure be put to death 

21 6 and the child of israel repent them for benjamin their 
brother and said there is one tribe cut off from israel thi day 

21 7 how shall we do for wife for them that remain see we have 
sworn by the lord that we will not give them of our daughter to 
wife 21 8 and they said what one is there of the tribe of israel 
that came not up to mizpeh to the lord and behold there came none 
to the camp from jabeshgilead to the assembl 

21 9 for the peopl were number and behold there were none of the 
inhabit of jabeshgilead there 

21 10 and the congreg sent thither twelv thousand men of the 
valiantest and command them say go and smite the inhabit 
of jabeshgilead with the edg of the sword with the woman and the 
child 

21 11 and thi is the thing that ye shall do ye shall utterli destroy 
everi male and everi woman that hath lain by man 

21 12 and they found among the inhabit of jabeshgilead four 
hundr young virgin that had known no man by lie with ani male 
and they brought them unto the camp to shiloh which is in the land of 
canaan 

21 13 and the whole congreg sent some to speak to the child of 
benjamin that were in the rock rimmon and to call peaceabl unto 
them 

21 14 and benjamin came again at that time and they gave them wife 
which they had save aliv of the woman of jabeshgilead and yet so 
they suffic them not 

21 15 and the peopl repent them for benjamin becau that the lord 
had made a breach in the tribe of israel 

21 16 then the elder of the congreg said how shall we do for 
wife for them that remain see the woman are destroy out of 
benjamin 21 17 and they said there must be an inherit for them 
that be escap of benjamin that a tribe be not destroy out of 
israel 

21 18 howbeit we may not give them wife of our daughter for the 
child of israel have sworn say cur be he that giveth a wife 
to benjamin 

21 19 then they said behold there is a feast of the lord in shiloh 
yearli in a place which is on the north side of bethel on the east 
side of the highway that goeth up from bethel to shechem and on the 
south of lebonah 

21 20 therefor they command the child of benjamin say go 
and lie in wait in the vineyard 21 21 and see and behold if the 
daughter of shiloh come out to danc in danc then come ye out of 
the vineyard and catch you everi man hi wife of the daughter of 
shiloh and go to the land of benjamin 

21 22 and it shall be when their father or their brother come unto 
u to complain that we will say unto them be favour unto them 
for our sake becau we reserv not to each man hi wife in the 
war for ye did not give unto them at thi time that ye should be 
guilti 

21 23 and the child of benjamin did so and took them wife 
accord to their number of them that danc whom they caught and 
they went and return unto their inherit and repair the 
citi and dwelt in them 

21 24 and the child of israel depart thenc at that time everi 
man to hi tribe and to hi famili and they went out from thenc 
everi man to hi inherit 

21 25 in those day there wa no king in israel everi man did that 
which wa right in hi own eye 




the book of ruth 


1 1 now it came to pa in the day when the judg rule that there 
wa a famin in the land and a certain man of bethlehemjudah went to 
sojourn in the countri of moab he and hi wife and hi two son 

1 2 and the name of the man wa elimelech and the name of hi wife 
naomi and the name of hi two son mahlon and chilion ephrathit of 
bethlehemjudah and they came into the countri of moab and continu 
there 

1 3 and elimelech naomi s husband die and she wa left and her two 
son 

1 4 and they took them wife of the woman of moab the name of the one 
wa orpah and the name of the other ruth and they dwell there 
about ten year 

1 5 and mahlon and chilion die also both of them and the woman wa 
left of her two son and her husband 

1 6 then she aro with her daughter in law that she might return 
from the countri of moab for she had heard in the countri of moab how 
that the lord had visit hi peopl in give them bread 

1 7 wherefor she went forth out of the place where she wa and her 
two daughter in law with her and they went on the way to return unto 
the land of judah 

1 8 and naomi said unto her two daughter in law go return each to 
her mother s hou the lord deal kindli with you a ye have dealt 
with the dead and with me 

1 9 the lord grant you that ye may find rest each of you in the hou 
of her husband then she kiss them and they lift up their voic 
and wept 

1 10 and they said unto her sure we will return with thee unto thi 
peopl 

1 11 and naomi said turn again my daughter whi will ye go with me 
are there yet ani more son in my womb that they may be your 
husband 1 12 turn again my daughter go your way for i am too 
old to have an husband if i should say i have hope if i should have 
an husband also to night and should also bear son 1 13 would ye 
tarri for them till they were grown would ye stay for them from 
have husband nay my daughter for it grieveth me much for your 
sake that the hand of the lord is gone out against me 

1 14 and they lift up their voic and wept again and orpah kiss 
her mother in law but ruth clave unto her 

1 15 and she said behold thi sister in law is gone back unto her 
peopl and unto her god return thou after thi sister in law 

1 16 and ruth said intreat me not to leav thee or to return from 
follow after thee for whither thou goest i will go and where 
thou lodgest i will lodg thi peopl shall be my peopl and thi god 
my god 1 17 where thou diest will i die and there will i be buri 
the lord do so to me and more also if ought but death part thee and 
me 

1 18 when she saw that she wa stedfastli mind to go with her then 
she left speak unto her 

1 19 so they two went until they came to bethlehem and it came to 
pa when they were come to bethlehem that all the citi wa move 
about them and they said is thi naomi 1 20 and she said unto 
them call me not naomi call me mara for the almighti hath dealt 
veri bitterli with me 

1 21 i went out full and the lord hath brought me home again empti 
whi then call ye me naomi see the lord hath testifi against me 
and the almighti hath afflict me 1 22 so naomi return and ruth 
the moabitess her daughter in law with her which return out of 
the countri of moab and they came to bethlehem in the begin of 
barley harvest 

2 1 and naomi had a kinsman of her husband s a mighti man of wealth 
of the famili of elimelech and hi name wa boaz 

2 2 and ruth the moabitess said unto naomi let me now go to the 
field and glean ear of corn after him in whose sight i shall find 
grace 

and she said unto her go my daughter 

2 3 and she went and came and glean in the field after the 
reaper and her hap wa to light on a part of the field belong 
unto boaz who wa of the kindr of elimelech 

2 4 and behold boaz came from bethlehem and said unto the reaper 
the lord be with you and they answer him the lord bless thee 

2 5 then said boaz unto hi servant that wa set over the reaper 
whose damsel is thi 2 6 and the servant that wa set over the 
reaper answer and said it is the moabitish damsel that came back 
with naomi out of the countri of moab 2 7 and she said i pray you 
let me glean and gather after the reaper among the sheaf so she 
came and hath continu even from the morn until now that she 
tarri a littl in the hou 

2 8 then said boaz unto ruth hearest thou not my daughter go not to 
glean in anoth field neither go from henc but abid here fast by 
my maiden 2 9 let thine eye be on the field that they do reap and 
go thou after them have i not charg the young men that they shall 
not touch thee and when thou art athirst go unto the vessel and 
drink of that which the young men have drawn 

2 10 then she fell on her face and bow herself to the ground and 
said unto him whi have i found grace in thine eye that thou 
shouldest take knowledg of me see i am a stranger 2 11 and boaz 
answer and said unto her it hath fulli been shew me all that 
thou hast done unto thi mother in law sinc the death of thine 
husband and how thou hast left thi father and thi mother and the 
land of thi nativ and art come unto a peopl which thou knewest 
not heretofor 

2 12 the lord recompen thi work and a full reward be given thee of 
the lord god of israel under whose wing thou art come to trust 

2 13 then she said let me find favour in thi sight my lord for that 
thou hast comfort me and for that thou hast spoken friendli unto 
thine handmaid though i be not like unto one of thine handmaiden 

2 14 and boaz said unto her at mealtim come thou hither and eat of 
the bread and dip thi morsel in the vinegar and she sat besid the 
reaper and he reach her parch corn and she did eat and wa 
suffic and left 

2 15 and when she wa risen up to glean boaz command hi young men 
say let her glean even among the sheaf and reproach her not 
2 16 and let fall also some of the hand of purpo for her and 
leav them that she may glean them and rebuk her not 

2 17 so she glean in the field until even and beat out that she had 
glean and it wa about an ephah of barley 

2 18 and she took it up and went into the citi and her mother in law 
saw what she had glean and she brought forth and gave to her that 
she had reserv after she wa suffic 

2 19 and her mother in law said unto her where hast thou glean to 
day and where wroughtest thou bless be he that did take knowledg 
of thee and she shew her mother in law with whom she had wrought 
and said the man s name with whom i wrought to day is boaz 

2 20 and naomi said unto her daughter in law bless be he of the 
lord who hath not left off hi kind to the live and to the 
dead and naomi said unto her the man is near of kin unto u one of 
our next kinsman 

2 21 and ruth the moabitess said he said unto me also thou shalt 
keep fast by my young men until they have end all my harvest 

2 22 and naomi said unto ruth her daughter in law it is good my 
daughter that thou go out with hi maiden that they meet thee not 
in ani other field 

2 23 so she kept fast by the maiden of boaz to glean unto the end of 
barley harvest and of wheat harvest and dwelt with her mother in law 

3 1 then naomi her mother in law said unto her my daughter shall i 
not seek rest for thee that it may be well with thee 3 2 and now is 
not boaz of our kindr with whose maiden thou wast behold he 
winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor 

3 3 wash thyself therefor and anoint thee and put thi raiment upon 
thee and get thee down to the floor but make not thyself known unto 
the man until he shall have done eat and drink 

3 4 and it shall be when he lieth down that thou shalt mark the 
place where he shall lie and thou shalt go in and uncov hi foot 
and lay thee down and he will tell thee what thou shalt do 

3 5 and she said unto her all that thou sayest unto me i will do 

3 6 and she went down unto the floor and did accord to all that 
her mother in law bade her 

3 7 and when boaz had eaten and drunk and hi heart wa merri he 
went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn and she came softli 
and uncov hi foot and laid her down 

3 8 and it came to pa at midnight that the man wa afraid and 
turn himself and behold a woman lay at hi foot 

3 9 and he said who art thou and she answer i am ruth thine 
handmaid spread therefor thi skirt over thine handmaid for thou art 
a near kinsman 

3 10 and he said bless be thou of the lord my daughter for thou 
hast shew more kind in the latter end than at the begin 
inasmuch a thou followedst not young men whether poor or rich 

3 11 and now my daughter fear not i will do to thee all that thou 
requirest for all the citi of my peopl doth know that thou art a 
virtuou woman 

3 12 and now it is true that i am thi near kinsman howbeit there is a 
kinsman nearer than i 

3 13 tarri thi night and it shall be in the morn that if he will 
perform unto thee the part of a kinsman well let him do the 
kinsman s part but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee 
then will i do the part of a kinsman to thee a the lord liveth lie 
down until the morn 

3 14 and she lay at hi foot until the morn and she rose up befor 
one could know anoth and he said let it not be known that a woman 
came into the floor 

3 15 also he said bring the vail that thou hast upon thee and hold 
it 

and when she held it he measur six measur of barley and laid it 
on her and she went into the citi 

3 16 and when she came to her mother in law she said who art thou 
my daughter and she told her all that the man had done to her 

3 17 and she said these six measur of barley gave he me for he 
said to me go not empti unto thi mother in law 

3 18 then said she sit still my daughter until thou know how the 
matter will fall for the man will not be in rest until he have 
finish the thing thi day 

4 1 then went boaz up to the gate and sat him down there and 
behold the kinsman of whom boaz spake came by unto whom he said ho 
such a one turn asid sit down here and he turn asid and sat 
down 

4 2 and he took ten men of the elder of the citi and said sit ye 
down here and they sat down 

4 3 and he said unto the kinsman naomi that is come again out of the 
countri of moab selleth a parcel of land which wa our brother 
elimelech s 4 4 and i thought to adverti thee say buy it 
befor the inhabit and befor the elder of my peopl if thou 
wilt redeem it redeem it but if thou wilt not redeem it then tell 
me that i may know for there is none to redeem it besid thee and i 
am after thee and he said i will redeem it 

4 5 then said boaz what day thou buyest the field of the hand of 
naomi thou must buy it also of ruth the moabitess the wife of the 
dead to rai up the name of the dead upon hi inherit 

4 6 and the kinsman said i cannot redeem it for myself lest i mar 
mine own inherit redeem thou my right to thyself for i cannot 
redeem it 

4 7 now thi wa the manner in former time in israel concern 
redeem and concern chang for to confirm all thing a man 
pluck off hi shoe and gave it to hi neighbour and thi wa a 
testimoni in israel 

4 8 therefor the kinsman said unto boaz buy it for thee so he drew 
off hi shoe 

4 9 and boaz said unto the elder and unto all the peopl ye are 
wit thi day that i have bought all that wa elimelech s and 
all that wa chilion s and mahlon s of the hand of naomi 

4 10 moreov ruth the moabitess the wife of mahlon have i purcha 
to be my wife to rai up the name of the dead upon hi inherit 
that the name of the dead be not cut off from among hi brother and 
from the gate of hi place ye are wit thi day 

4 11 and all the peopl that were in the gate and the elder said 
we are wit the lord make the woman that is come into thine 
hou like rachel and like leah which two did build the hou of 
israel and do thou worthili in ephratah and be famou in bethlehem 
4 12 and let thi hou be like the hou of pharez whom tamar bare 
unto judah of the seed which the lord shall give thee of thi young 
woman 

4 13 so boaz took ruth and she wa hi wife and when he went in unto 
her the lord gave her concept and she bare a son 

4 14 and the woman said unto naomi bless be the lord which hath 
not left thee thi day without a kinsman that hi name may be famou 
in israel 

4 15 and he shall be unto thee a restor of thi life and a nourish 
of thine old age for thi daughter in law which loveth thee which is 
better to thee than seven son hath born him 

4 16 and naomi took the child and laid it in her bosom and becam 
nur unto it 

4 17 and the woman her neighbour gave it a name say there is a 
son born to naomi and they call hi name obe he is the father of 
jess the father of david 

4 18 now these are the gener of pharez pharez begat hezron 
4 19 and hezron begat ram and ram begat amminadab 4 20 and amminadab 
begat nahshon and nahshon begat salmon 4 21 and salmon begat boaz 
and boaz begat obe 4 22 and obe begat jess and jess begat david 




the first book of samuel 

otherwi call 

the first book of the king 


1 1 now there wa a certain man of ramathaimzophim of mount ephraim 
and hi name wa elkanah the son of jeroham the son of elihu the 
son of tohu the son of zuph an ephrathit 1 2 and he had two wife 
the name of the one wa hannah and the name of the other peninnah 
and peninnah had child but hannah had no child 

1 3 and thi man went up out of hi citi yearli to worship and to 
sacrif unto the lord of host in shiloh and the two son of eli 
hophni and phineha the priest of the lord were there 

1 4 and when the time wa that elkanah offer he gave to peninnah 
hi wife and to all her son and her daughter portion 1 5 but 
unto hannah he gave a worthi portion for he love hannah but the 
lord had shut up her womb 

1 6 and her adversari also provok her sore for to make her fret 
becau the lord had shut up her womb 

1 7 and a he did so year by year when she went up to the hou of 
the lord so she provok her therefor she wept and did not eat 

1 8 then said elkanah her husband to her hannah whi weepest thou 
and whi eatest thou not and whi is thi heart griev am not i better 
to thee than ten son 1 9 so hannah rose up after they had eaten in 
shiloh and after they had drunk now eli the priest sat upon a seat 
by a post of the templ of the lord 

1 10 and she wa in bitter of soul and pray unto the lord and 
wept sore 

1 11 and she vow a vow and said o lord of host if thou wilt 
ind look on the afflict of thine handmaid and rememb me and 
not forget thine handmaid but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man 
child then i will give him unto the lord all the day of hi life 
and there shall no razor come upon hi head 

1 12 and it came to pa a she continu pray befor the lord 
that eli mark her mouth 

1 13 now hannah she spake in her heart onli her lip move but her 
voic wa not heard therefor eli thought she had been drunken 

1 14 and eli said unto her how long wilt thou be drunken put away 
thi wine from thee 

1 15 and hannah answer and said no my lord i am a woman of a 
sorrow spirit i have drunk neither wine nor strong drink but have 
pour out my soul befor the lord 

1 16 count not thine handmaid for a daughter of belial for out of the 
abund of my complaint and grief have i spoken hitherto 

1 17 then eli answer and said go in peac and the god of israel 
grant thee thi petit that thou hast ask of him 

1 18 and she said let thine handmaid find grace in thi sight so the 
woman went her way and did eat and her counten wa no more sad 

1 19 and they rose up in the morn earli and worship befor the 
lord and return and came to their hou to ramah and elkanah knew 
hannah hi wife and the lord rememb her 

1 20 wherefor it came to pa when the time wa come about after 
hannah had conceiv that she bare a son and call hi name samuel 
say becau i have ask him of the lord 

1 21 and the man elkanah and all hi hou went up to offer unto the 
lord the yearli sacrif and hi vow 

1 22 but hannah went not up for she said unto her husband i will not 
go up until the child be wean and then i will bring him that he 
may appear befor the lord and there abid for ever 

1 23 and elkanah her husband said unto her do what seemeth thee good 
tarri until thou have wean him onli the lord establish hi word so 
the woman abod and gave her son suck until she wean him 

1 24 and when she had wean him she took him up with her with three 
bullock and one ephah of flour and a bottl of wine and brought 
him unto the hou of the lord in shiloh and the child wa young 

1 25 and they slew a bullock and brought the child to eli 

1 26 and she said oh my lord a thi soul liveth my lord i am the 
woman that stood by thee here pray unto the lord 

1 27 for thi child i pray and the lord hath given me my petit 
which i ask of him 1 28 therefor also i have lent him to the lord 
a long a he liveth he shall be lent to the lord and he worship 
the lord there 

2 1 and hannah pray and said my heart rejoiceth in the lord mine 
horn is exalt in the lord my mouth is enlarg over mine enemi 
becau i rejoic in thi salvat 

2 2 there is none holi a the lord for there is none besid thee 
neither is there ani rock like our god 

2 3 talk no more so exceed proudli let not arrog come out of 
your mouth for the lord is a god of knowledg and by him action are 
weigh 

2 4 the bow of the mighti men are broken and they that stumbl are 
gird with strength 

2 5 they that were full have hire out themselv for bread and they 
that were hungri cea so that the barren hath born seven and she 
that hath mani child is wax feebl 

2 6 the lord killeth and maketh aliv he bringeth down to the grave 
and bringeth up 

2 7 the lord maketh poor and maketh rich he bringeth low and 
lifteth up 

2 8 he raiseth up the poor out of the dust and lifteth up the beggar 
from the dunghil to set them among princ and to make them inherit 
the throne of glori for the pillar of the earth are the lord s and 
he hath set the world upon them 

2 9 he will keep the foot of hi saint and the wick shall be 
silent in dark for by strength shall no man prevail 

2 10 the adversari of the lord shall be broken to piec out of 
heaven shall he thunder upon them the lord shall judg the end of 
the earth and he shall give strength unto hi king and exalt the 
horn of hi anoint 

2 11 and elkanah went to ramah to hi hou and the child did 
minist unto the lord befor eli the priest
