2 12 now the son of eli were son of belial they knew not the lord 

2 13 and the priest s custom with the peopl wa that when ani man 
offer sacrif the priest s servant came while the flesh wa in 
seeth with a fleshhook of three teeth in hi hand 2 14 and he 
struck it into the pan or kettl or caldron or pot all that the 
fleshhook brought up the priest took for himself so they did in 
shiloh unto all the israelit that came thither 

2 15 also befor they burnt the fat the priest s servant came and 
said to the man that sacrif give flesh to roast for the priest 
for he will not have sodden flesh of thee but raw 

2 16 and if ani man said unto him let them not fail to burn the fat 
present and then take a much a thi soul desireth then he would 
answer him nay but thou shalt give it me now and if not i will 
take it by forc 

2 17 wherefor the sin of the young men wa veri great befor the 
lord for men abhor the offer of the lord 

2 18 but samuel minist befor the lord be a child gird with 
a linen ephod 

2 19 moreov hi mother made him a littl coat and brought it to him 
from year to year when she came up with her husband to offer the 
yearli sacrif 

2 20 and eli bless elkanah and hi wife and said the lord give 
thee seed of thi woman for the loan which is lent to the lord and 
they went unto their own home 

2 21 and the lord visit hannah so that she conceiv and bare 
three son and two daughter and the child samuel grew befor the 
lord 

2 22 now eli wa veri old and heard all that hi son did unto all 
israel and how they lay with the woman that assembl at the door of 
the tabernacl of the congreg 

2 23 and he said unto them whi do ye such thing for i hear of your 
evil deal by all thi peopl 

2 24 nay my son for it is no good report that i hear ye make the 
lord s peopl to transgress 

2 25 if one man sin against anoth the judg shall judg him but if 
a man sin against the lord who shall intreat for him notwithstand 
they hearken not unto the voic of their father becau the lord 
would slay them 

2 26 and the child samuel grew on and wa in favour both with the 
lord and also with men 

2 27 and there came a man of god unto eli and said unto him thu 
saith the lord did i plainli appear unto the hou of thi father 
when they were in egypt in pharaoh s hou 2 28 and did i choo him 
out of all the tribe of israel to be my priest to offer upon mine 
altar to burn incen to wear an ephod befor me and did i give 
unto the hou of thi father all the offer made by fire of the 
child of israel 2 29 wherefor kick ye at my sacrif and at 
mine offer which i have command in my habit and honourest 
thi son abov me to make yourselv fat with the chiefest of all the 
offer of israel my peopl 2 30 wherefor the lord god of israel 
saith i said ind that thi hou and the hou of thi father 
should walk befor me for ever but now the lord saith be it far from 
me for them that honour me i will honour and they that despi me 
shall be lightli esteem 

2 31 behold the day come that i will cut off thine arm and the arm 
of thi father s hou that there shall not be an old man in thine 
hou 

2 32 and thou shalt see an enemi in my habit in all the wealth 
which god shall give israel and there shall not be an old man in 
thine hou for ever 

2 33 and the man of thine whom i shall not cut off from mine altar 
shall be to consum thine eye and to griev thine heart and all the 
increa of thine hou shall die in the flower of their age 

2 34 and thi shall be a sign unto thee that shall come upon thi two 
son on hophni and phineha in one day they shall die both of them 

2 35 and i will rai me up a faith priest that shall do accord 
to that which is in mine heart and in my mind and i will build him a 
sure hou and he shall walk befor mine anoint for ever 

2 36 and it shall come to pa that everi one that is left in thine 
hou shall come and crouch to him for a piec of silver and a morsel 
of bread and shall say put me i pray thee into one of the priest 
offic that i may eat a piec of bread 

3 1 and the child samuel minist unto the lord befor eli and the 
word of the lord wa preciou in those day there wa no open vision 

3 2 and it came to pa at that time when eli wa laid down in hi 
place and hi eye began to wax dim that he could not see 3 3 and 
ere the lamp of god went out in the templ of the lord where the ark 
of god wa and samuel wa laid down to sleep 3 4 that the lord 
call samuel and he answer here am i 

3 5 and he ran unto eli and said here am i for thou calledst me 
and he said i call not lie down again and he went and lay down 

3 6 and the lord call yet again samuel and samuel aro and went 
to eli and said here am i for thou didst call me and he answer 
i call not my son lie down again 

3 7 now samuel did not yet know the lord neither wa the word of the 
lord yet reveal unto him 

3 8 and the lord call samuel again the third time and he aro and 
went to eli and said here am i for thou didst call me and eli 
perceiv that the lord had call the child 

3 9 therefor eli said unto samuel go lie down and it shall be if 
he call thee that thou shalt say speak lord for thi servant 
heareth so samuel went and lay down in hi place 

3 10 and the lord came and stood and call a at other time 
samuel samuel then samuel answer speak for thi servant heareth 

3 11 and the lord said to samuel behold i will do a thing in israel 
at which both the ear of everi one that heareth it shall tingl 

3 12 in that day i will perform against eli all thing which i have 
spoken concern hi hou when i begin i will also make an end 

3 13 for i have told him that i will judg hi hou for ever for the 
iniqu which he knoweth becau hi son made themselv vile and 
he restrain them not 

3 14 and therefor i have sworn unto the hou of eli that the 
iniqu of eli s hou shall not be purg with sacrif nor 
offer for ever 

3 15 and samuel lay until the morn and open the door of the 
hou of the lord and samuel fear to shew eli the vision 

3 16 then eli call samuel and said samuel my son and he 
answer here am i 

3 17 and he said what is the thing that the lord hath said unto thee 
i pray thee hide it not from me god do so to thee and more also if 
thou hide ani thing from me of all the thing that he said unto thee 

3 18 and samuel told him everi whit and hid noth from him and he 
said it is the lord let him do what seemeth him good 

3 19 and samuel grew and the lord wa with him and did let none of 
hi word fall to the ground 

3 20 and all israel from dan even to beersheba knew that samuel wa 
establish to be a prophet of the lord 

3 21 and the lord appear again in shiloh for the lord reveal 
himself to samuel in shiloh by the word of the lord 

4 1 and the word of samuel came to all israel now israel went out 
against the philistin to battl and pitch besid ebenez and 
the philistin pitch in aphek 

4 2 and the philistin put themselv in array against israel and 
when they join battl israel wa smitten befor the philistin 
and they slew of the armi in the field about four thousand men 

4 3 and when the peopl were come into the camp the elder of israel 
said wherefor hath the lord smitten u to day befor the 
philistin let u fetch the ark of the coven of the lord out of 
shiloh unto u that when it cometh among u it may save u out of 
the hand of our enemi 

4 4 so the peopl sent to shiloh that they might bring from thenc 
the ark of the coven of the lord of host which dwelleth between 
the cherub and the two son of eli hophni and phineha were 
there with the ark of the coven of god 

4 5 and when the ark of the coven of the lord came into the camp 
all israel shout with a great shout so that the earth rang again 

4 6 and when the philistin heard the noi of the shout they said 
what meaneth the noi of thi great shout in the camp of the hebrew 
and they understood that the ark of the lord wa come into the camp 

4 7 and the philistin were afraid for they said god is come into 
the camp and they said woe unto u for there hath not been such a 
thing heretofor 

4 8 woe unto u who shall deliv u out of the hand of these mighti 
god these are the god that smote the egyptian with all the plagu 
in the wilder 

4 9 be strong and quit yourselv like men o ye philistin that ye 
be not servant unto the hebrew a they have been to you quit 
yourselv like men and fight 

4 10 and the philistin fought and israel wa smitten and they fled 
everi man into hi tent and there wa a veri great slaughter for 
there fell of israel thirti thousand footman 

4 11 and the ark of god wa taken and the two son of eli hophni and 
phineha were slain 

4 12 and there ran a man of benjamin out of the armi and came to 
shiloh the same day with hi cloth rent and with earth upon hi 
head 

4 13 and when he came lo eli sat upon a seat by the waysid 
watch for hi heart trembl for the ark of god and when the man 
came into the citi and told it all the citi cri out 

4 14 and when eli heard the noi of the cri he said what meaneth 
the noi of thi tumult and the man came in hastili and told eli 

4 15 now eli wa nineti and eight year old and hi eye were dim 
that he could not see 

4 16 and the man said unto eli i am he that came out of the armi and 
i fled to day out of the armi and he said what is there done my 
son 4 17 and the messeng answer and said israel is fled befor 
the philistin and there hath been also a great slaughter among the 
peopl and thi two son also hophni and phineha are dead and the 
ark of god is taken 

4 18 and it came to pa when he made mention of the ark of god that 
he fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate and hi 
neck brake and he die for he wa an old man and heavi and he had 
judg israel forti year 

4 19 and hi daughter in law phineha wife wa with child near to 
be deliv and when she heard the tide that the ark of god wa 
taken and that her father in law and her husband were dead she bow 
herself and travail for her pain came upon her 

4 20 and about the time of her death the woman that stood by her said 
unto her fear not for thou hast born a son but she answer not 
neither did she regard it 

4 21 and she name the child ichabod say the glori is depart 
from israel becau the ark of god wa taken and becau of her 
father in law and her husband 

4 22 and she said the glori is depart from israel for the ark of 
god is taken 

5 1 and the philistin took the ark of god and brought it from 
ebenez unto ashdod 

5 2 when the philistin took the ark of god they brought it into the 
hou of dagon and set it by dagon 

5 3 and when they of ashdod aro earli on the morrow behold dagon 
wa fallen upon hi face to the earth befor the ark of the lord and 
they took dagon and set him in hi place again 

5 4 and when they aro earli on the morrow morn behold dagon wa 
fallen upon hi face to the ground befor the ark of the lord and the 
head of dagon and both the palm of hi hand were cut off upon the 
threshold onli the stump of dagon wa left to him 

5 5 therefor neither the priest of dagon nor ani that come into 
dagon s hou tread on the threshold of dagon in ashdod unto thi 
day 

5 6 but the hand of the lord wa heavi upon them of ashdod and he 
destroy them and smote them with emerod even ashdod and the 
coast thereof 

5 7 and when the men of ashdod saw that it wa so they said the ark 
of the god of israel shall not abid with u for hi hand is sore 
upon u and upon dagon our god 

5 8 they sent therefor and gather all the lord of the philistin 
unto them and said what shall we do with the ark of the god of 
israel and they answer let the ark of the god of israel be carri 
about unto gath and they carri the ark of the god of israel about 
thither 

5 9 and it wa so that after they had carri it about the hand of 
the lord wa against the citi with a veri great destruct and he 
smote the men of the citi both small and great and they had emerod 
in their secret part 

5 10 therefor they sent the ark of god to ekron and it came to pa 
a the ark of god came to ekron that the ekronit cri out say 
they have brought about the ark of the god of israel to u to slay u 
and our peopl 

5 11 so they sent and gather togeth all the lord of the 
philistin and said send away the ark of the god of israel and let 
it go again to hi own place that it slay u not and our peopl for 
there wa a deadli destruct throughout all the citi the hand of 
god wa veri heavi there 

5 12 and the men that die not were smitten with the emerod and the 
cri of the citi went up to heaven 

6 1 and the ark of the lord wa in the countri of the philistin 
seven month 

6 2 and the philistin call for the priest and the divin 
say what shall we do to the ark of the lord tell u wherewith we 
shall send it to hi place 

6 3 and they said if ye send away the ark of the god of israel send 
it not empti but in ani wise return him a trespass offer then ye 
shall be heal and it shall be known to you whi hi hand is not 
remov from you 

6 4 then said they what shall be the trespass offer which we shall 
return to him they answer five golden emerod and five golden 
mou accord to the number of the lord of the philistin for one 
plagu wa on you all and on your lord 

6 5 wherefor ye shall make imag of your emerod and imag of your 
mou that mar the land and ye shall give glori unto the god of 
israel peradventur he will lighten hi hand from off you and from 
off your god and from off your land 

6 6 wherefor then do ye harden your heart a the egyptian and 
pharaoh harden their heart when he had wrought wonder among 
them did they not let the peopl go and they depart 6 7 now 
therefor make a new cart and take two milch kine on which there 
hath come no yoke and tie the kine to the cart and bring their 
calf home from them 6 8 and take the ark of the lord and lay it 
upon the cart and put the jewel of gold which ye return him for a 
trespass offer in a coffer by the side thereof and send it away 
that it may go 

6 9 and see if it goeth up by the way of hi own coast to 
bethshemesh then he hath done u thi great evil but if not then we 
shall know that it is not hi hand that smote u it wa a chanc that 
happen to u 

6 10 and the men did so and took two milch kine and tie them to the 
cart and shut up their calf at home 6 11 and they laid the ark of 
the lord upon the cart and the coffer with the mou of gold and the 
imag of their emerod 

6 12 and the kine took the straight way to the way of bethshemesh and 
went along the highway low a they went and turn not asid to 
the right hand or to the left and the lord of the philistin went 
after them unto the border of bethshemesh 

6 13 and they of bethshemesh were reap their wheat harvest in the 
valley and they lift up their eye and saw the ark and rejoic 
to see it 

6 14 and the cart came into the field of joshua a bethshemit and 
stood there where there wa a great stone and they clave the wood of 
the cart and offer the kine a burnt offer unto the lord 

6 15 and the levit took down the ark of the lord and the coffer 
that wa with it wherein the jewel of gold were and put them on the 
great stone and the men of bethshemesh offer burnt offer and 
sacrif sacrif the same day unto the lord 

6 16 and when the five lord of the philistin had seen it they 
return to ekron the same day 

6 17 and these are the golden emerod which the philistin return 
for a trespass offer unto the lord for ashdod one for gaza one 
for askelon one for gath one for ekron one 6 18 and the golden 
mou accord to the number of all the citi of the philistin 
belong to the five lord both of fenc citi and of countri 
villag even unto the great stone of abel whereon they set down the 
ark of the lord which stone remaineth unto thi day in the field of 
joshua the bethshemit 

6 19 and he smote the men of bethshemesh becau they had look into 
the ark of the lord even he smote of the peopl fifti thousand and 
threescor and ten men and the peopl lament becau the lord had 
smitten mani of the peopl with a great slaughter 

6 20 and the men of bethshemesh said who is abl to stand befor thi 
holi lord god and to whom shall he go up from u 6 21 and they sent 
messeng to the inhabit of kirjathjearim say the 
philistin have brought again the ark of the lord come ye down and 
fetch it up to you 

7 1 and the men of kirjathjearim came and fetch up the ark of the 
lord and brought it into the hou of abinadab in the hill and 
sanctifi eleazar hi son to keep the ark of the lord 

7 2 and it came to pa while the ark abod in kirjathjearim that 
the time wa long for it wa twenti year and all the hou of 
israel lament after the lord 

7 3 and samuel spake unto all the hou of israel say if ye do 
return unto the lord with all your heart then put away the strang 
god and ashtaroth from among you and prepar your heart unto the 
lord and serv him onli and he will deliv you out of the hand of 
the philistin 

7 4 then the child of israel did put away baalim and ashtaroth and 
serv the lord onli 

7 5 and samuel said gather all israel to mizpeh and i will pray for 
you unto the lord 

7 6 and they gather togeth to mizpeh and drew water and pour 
it out befor the lord and fast on that day and said there we 
have sin against the lord and samuel judg the child of israel 
in mizpeh 

7 7 and when the philistin heard that the child of israel were 
gather togeth to mizpeh the lord of the philistin went up 
against israel and when the child of israel heard it they were 
afraid of the philistin 

7 8 and the child of israel said to samuel cea not to cri unto 
the lord our god for u that he will save u out of the hand of the 
philistin 

7 9 and samuel took a suck lamb and offer it for a burnt 
offer wholli unto the lord and samuel cri unto the lord for 
israel and the lord heard him 

7 10 and a samuel wa offer up the burnt offer the philistin 
drew near to battl against israel but the lord thunder with a 
great thunder on that day upon the philistin and discomfit them 
and they were smitten befor israel 

7 11 and the men of israel went out of mizpeh and pursu the 
philistin and smote them until they came under bethcar 

7 12 then samuel took a stone and set it between mizpeh and shen and 
call the name of it ebenez say hitherto hath the lord help 
u 

7 13 so the philistin were subdu and they came no more into the 
coast of israel and the hand of the lord wa against the philistin 
all the day of samuel 

7 14 and the citi which the philistin had taken from israel were 
restor to israel from ekron even unto gath and the coast thereof 
did israel deliv out of the hand of the philistin and there wa 
peac between israel and the amorit 

7 15 and samuel judg israel all the day of hi life 

7 16 and he went from year to year in circuit to bethel and gilgal 
and mizpeh and judg israel in all those place 

7 17 and hi return wa to ramah for there wa hi hou and there 
he judg israel and there he built an altar unto the lord 

8 1 and it came to pa when samuel wa old that he made hi son 
judg over israel 

8 2 now the name of hi firstborn wa joel and the name of hi 
second abiah they were judg in beersheba 

8 3 and hi son walk not in hi way but turn asid after lucr 
and took bribe and pervert judgment 

8 4 then all the elder of israel gather themselv togeth and 
came to samuel unto ramah 8 5 and said unto him behold thou art 
old and thi son walk not in thi way now make u a king to judg u 
like all the nation 

8 6 but the thing displea samuel when they said give u a king to 
judg u and samuel pray unto the lord 

8 7 and the lord said unto samuel hearken unto the voic of the 
peopl in all that they say unto thee for they have not reject 
thee but they have reject me that i should not reign over them 

8 8 accord to all the work which they have done sinc the day that 
i brought them up out of egypt even unto thi day wherewith they have 
forsaken me and serv other god so do they also unto thee 

8 9 now therefor hearken unto their voic howbeit yet protest 
solemnli unto them and shew them the manner of the king that shall 
reign over them 

8 10 and samuel told all the word of the lord unto the peopl that 
ask of him a king 

8 11 and he said thi will be the manner of the king that shall reign 
over you he will take your son and appoint them for himself for 
hi chariot and to be hi horseman and some shall run befor hi 
chariot 

8 12 and he will appoint him captain over thousand and captain 
over fifti and will set them to ear hi ground and to reap hi 
harvest and to make hi instrument of war and instrument of hi 
chariot 

8 13 and he will take your daughter to be confectionari and to be 
cook and to be baker 

8 14 and he will take your field and your vineyard and your 
oliveyard even the best of them and give them to hi servant 

8 15 and he will take the tenth of your seed and of your vineyard 
and give to hi offic and to hi servant 

8 16 and he will take your manserv and your maidserv and 
your goodliest young men and your as and put them to hi work 

8 17 he will take the tenth of your sheep and ye shall be hi 
servant 

8 18 and ye shall cri out in that day becau of your king which ye 
shall have chosen you and the lord will not hear you in that day 

8 19 nevertheless the peopl refu to obey the voic of samuel and 
they said nay but we will have a king over u 8 20 that we also may 
be like all the nation and that our king may judg u and go out 
befor u and fight our battl 

8 21 and samuel heard all the word of the peopl and he rehear 
them in the ear of the lord 

8 22 and the lord said to samuel hearken unto their voic and make 
them a king and samuel said unto the men of israel go ye everi man 
unto hi citi 

9 1 now there wa a man of benjamin whose name wa kish the son of 
abiel the son of zeror the son of bechorath the son of aphiah a 
benjamit a mighti man of power 

9 2 and he had a son whose name wa saul a choic young man and a 
goodli and there wa not among the child of israel a goodlier 
person than he from hi shoulder and upward he wa higher than ani 
of the peopl 

9 3 and the as of kish saul s father were lost and kish said to 
saul hi son take now one of the servant with thee and ari go 
seek the as 

9 4 and he pa through mount ephraim and pa through the land 
of shalisha but they found them not then they pa through the 
land of shalim and there they were not and he pa through the 
land of the benjamit but they found them not 

9 5 and when they were come to the land of zuph saul said to hi 
servant that wa with him come and let u return lest my father 
leav care for the as and take thought for u 

9 6 and he said unto him behold now there is in thi citi a man of 
god and he is an honour man all that he saith cometh sure to 
pa now let u go thither peradventur he can shew u our way that 
we should go 

9 7 then said saul to hi servant but behold if we go what shall 
we bring the man for the bread is spent in our vessel and there is 
not a present to bring to the man of god what have we 9 8 and the 
servant answer saul again and said behold i have here at hand the 
fourth part of a shekel of silver that will i give to the man of god 
to tell u our way 

9 9 beforetim in israel when a man went to enquir of god thu he 
spake come and let u go to the seer for he that is now call a 
prophet wa beforetim call a seer 9 10 then said saul to hi 
servant well said come let u go so they went unto the citi where 
the man of god wa 

9 11 and a they went up the hill to the citi they found young 
maiden go out to draw water and said unto them is the seer here 
9 12 and they answer them and said he is behold he is befor 
you make hast now for he came to day to the citi for there is a 
sacrif of the peopl to day in the high place 9 13 a soon a ye 
be come into the citi ye shall straightway find him befor he go up 
to the high place to eat for the peopl will not eat until he come 
becau he doth bless the sacrif and afterward they eat that be 
bidden now therefor get you up for about thi time ye shall find 
him 

9 14 and they went up into the citi and when they were come into the 
citi behold samuel came out against them for to go up to the high 
place 

9 15 now the lord had told samuel in hi ear a day befor saul came 
say 9 16 to morrow about thi time i will send thee a man out of 
the land of benjamin and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my 
peopl israel that he may save my peopl out of the hand of the 
philistin for i have look upon my peopl becau their cri is 
come unto me 

9 17 and when samuel saw saul the lord said unto him behold the man 
whom i spake to thee of thi same shall reign over my peopl 

9 18 then saul drew near to samuel in the gate and said tell me i 
pray thee where the seer s hou is 

9 19 and samuel answer saul and said i am the seer go up befor 
me unto the high place for ye shall eat with me to day and to morrow 
i will let thee go and will tell thee all that is in thine heart 

9 20 and a for thine as that were lost three day ago set not thi 
mind on them for they are found and on whom is all the desir of 
israel is it not on thee and on all thi father s hou 9 21 and 
saul answer and said am not i a benjamit of the smallest of the 
tribe of israel and my famili the least of all the famili of the 
tribe of benjamin wherefor then speakest thou so to me 9 22 and 
samuel took saul and hi servant and brought them into the parlour 
and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden 
which were about thirti person 

9 23 and samuel said unto the cook bring the portion which i gave 
thee of which i said unto thee set it by thee 

9 24 and the cook took up the shoulder and that which wa upon it 
and set it befor saul and samuel said behold that which is left 
set it befor thee and eat for unto thi time hath it been kept for 
thee sinc i said i have invit the peopl so saul did eat with 
samuel that day 

9 25 and when they were come down from the high place into the citi 
samuel commun with saul upon the top of the hou 

9 26 and they aro earli and it came to pa about the spring of the 
day that samuel call saul to the top of the hou say up that 
i may send thee away and saul aro and they went out both of them 
he and samuel abroad 

9 27 and a they were go down to the end of the citi samuel said 
to saul bid the servant pa on befor u and he pa on but 
stand thou still a while that i may shew thee the word of god 

10 1 then samuel took a vial of oil and pour it upon hi head and 
kiss him and said is it not becau the lord hath anoint thee to 
be captain over hi inherit 10 2 when thou art depart from me 
to day then thou shalt find two men by rachel s sepulchr in the 
border of benjamin at zelzah and they will say unto thee the as 
which thou wentest to seek are found and lo thi father hath left 
the care of the as and sorroweth for you say what shall i do 
for my son 10 3 then shalt thou go on forward from thenc and thou 
shalt come to the plain of tabor and there shall meet thee three men 
go up to god to bethel one carri three kid and anoth 
carri three loaf of bread and anoth carri a bottl of wine 
10 4 and they will salut thee and give thee two loaf of bread 
which thou shalt receiv of their hand 

10 5 after that thou shalt come to the hill of god where is the 
garrison of the philistin and it shall come to pa when thou art 
come thither to the citi that thou shalt meet a compani of prophet 
come down from the high place with a psalteri and a tabret and a 
pipe and a harp befor them and they shall prophesi 10 6 and the 
spirit of the lord will come upon thee and thou shalt prophesi with 
them and shalt be turn into anoth man 

10 7 and let it be when these sign are come unto thee that thou do 
a occa serv thee for god is with thee 

10 8 and thou shalt go down befor me to gilgal and behold i will 
come down unto thee to offer burnt offer and to sacrif 
sacrif of peac offer seven day shalt thou tarri till i 
come to thee and shew thee what thou shalt do 

10 9 and it wa so that when he had turn hi back to go from 
samuel god gave him anoth heart and all those sign came to pa 
that day 

10 10 and when they came thither to the hill behold a compani of 
prophet met him and the spirit of god came upon him and he 
prophesi among them 

10 11 and it came to pa when all that knew him beforetim saw that 
behold he prophesi among the prophet then the peopl said one to 
anoth what is thi that is come unto the son of kish is saul also 
among the prophet 10 12 and one of the same place answer and 
said but who is their father therefor it becam a proverb is saul 
also among the prophet 10 13 and when he had made an end of 
prophesi he came to the high place 

10 14 and saul s uncl said unto him and to hi servant whither went 
ye and he said to seek the as and when we saw that they were no 
where we came to samuel 

10 15 and saul s uncl said tell me i pray thee what samuel said 
unto you 

10 16 and saul said unto hi uncl he told u plainli that the as 
were found but of the matter of the kingdom whereof samuel spake he 
told him not 

10 17 and samuel call the peopl togeth unto the lord to mizpeh 
10 18 and said unto the child of israel thu saith the lord god of 
israel i brought up israel out of egypt and deliv you out of the 
hand of the egyptian and out of the hand of all kingdom and of 
them that oppress you 10 19 and ye have thi day reject your god 
who himself save you out of all your adver and your 
tribul and ye have said unto him nay but set a king over u 
now therefor present yourselv befor the lord by your tribe and 
by your thousand 

10 20 and when samuel had cau all the tribe of israel to come 
near the tribe of benjamin wa taken 

10 21 when he had cau the tribe of benjamin to come near by their 
famili the famili of matri wa taken and saul the son of kish wa 
taken and when they sought him he could not be found 

10 22 therefor they enquir of the lord further if the man should 
yet come thither and the lord answer behold he hath hid himself 
among the stuff 

10 23 and they ran and fetch him thenc and when he stood among the 
peopl he wa higher than ani of the peopl from hi shoulder and 
upward 

10 24 and samuel said to all the peopl see ye him whom the lord hath 
chosen that there is none like him among all the peopl and all the 
peopl shout and said god save the king 

10 25 then samuel told the peopl the manner of the kingdom and wrote 
it in a book and laid it up befor the lord and samuel sent all the 
peopl away everi man to hi hou 

10 26 and saul also went home to gibeah and there went with him a 
band of men whose heart god had touch 

10 27 but the child of belial said how shall thi man save u and 
they despi him and brought no present but he held hi peac 

11 1 then nahash the ammonit came up and encamp against 
jabeshgilead and all the men of jabesh said unto nahash make a 
coven with u and we will serv thee 

11 2 and nahash the ammonit answer them on thi condit will i 
make a coven with you that i may thrust out all your right eye 
and lay it for a reproach upon all israel 

11 3 and the elder of jabesh said unto him give u seven day 
respit that we may send messeng unto all the coast of israel 
and then if there be no man to save u we will come out to thee 

11 4 then came the messeng to gibeah of saul and told the tide 
in the ear of the peopl and all the peopl lift up their voic 
and wept 

11 5 and behold saul came after the herd out of the field and saul 
said what aileth the peopl that they weep and they told him the 
tide of the men of jabesh 

11 6 and the spirit of god came upon saul when he heard those tide 
and hi anger wa kindl greatli 

11 7 and he took a yoke of ox and hew them in piec and sent 
them throughout all the coast of israel by the hand of messeng 
say whosoev cometh not forth after saul and after samuel so 
shall it be done unto hi ox and the fear of the lord fell on the 
peopl and they came out with one consent 

11 8 and when he number them in bezek the child of israel were 
three hundr thousand and the men of judah thirti thousand 

11 9 and they said unto the messeng that came thu shall ye say 
unto the men of jabeshgilead to morrow by that time the sun be hot 
ye shall have help and the messeng came and shew it to the men 
of jabesh and they were glad 

11 10 therefor the men of jabesh said to morrow we will come out 
unto you and ye shall do with u all that seemeth good unto you 

11 11 and it wa so on the morrow that saul put the peopl in three 
compani and they came into the midst of the host in the morn 
watch and slew the ammonit until the heat of the day and it came 
to pa that they which remain were scatter so that two of them 
were not left togeth 

11 12 and the peopl said unto samuel who is he that said shall saul 
reign over u bring the men that we may put them to death 

11 13 and saul said there shall not a man be put to death thi day 
for to day the lord hath wrought salvat in israel 

11 14 then said samuel to the peopl come and let u go to gilgal 
and renew the kingdom there 

11 15 and all the peopl went to gilgal and there they made saul king 
befor the lord in gilgal and there they sacrif sacrif of 
peac offer befor the lord and there saul and all the men of 
israel rejoic greatli 

12 1 and samuel said unto all israel behold i have hearken unto 
your voic in all that ye said unto me and have made a king over you 

12 2 and now behold the king walketh befor you and i am old and 
grayhead and behold my son are with you and i have walk 
befor you from my childhood unto thi day 

12 3 behold here i am wit against me befor the lord and befor 
hi anoint whose ox have i taken or whose a have i taken or 
whom have i defraud whom have i oppress or of whose hand have i 
receiv ani bribe to blind mine eye therewith and i will restor it 
you 

12 4 and they said thou hast not defraud u nor oppress u 
neither hast thou taken ought of ani man s hand 

12 5 and he said unto them the lord is wit against you and hi 
anoint is wit thi day that ye have not found ought in my hand 
and they answer he is wit 

12 6 and samuel said unto the peopl it is the lord that advanc 
mose and aaron and that brought your father up out of the land of 
egypt 

12 7 now therefor stand still that i may reason with you befor the 
lord of all the righteou act of the lord which he did to you and to 
your father 

12 8 when jacob wa come into egypt and your father cri unto the 
lord then the lord sent mose and aaron which brought forth your 
father out of egypt and made them dwell in thi place 

12 9 and when they forgat the lord their god he sold them into the 
hand of sisera captain of the host of hazor and into the hand of the 
philistin and into the hand of the king of moab and they fought 
against them 

12 10 and they cri unto the lord and said we have sin becau 
we have forsaken the lord and have serv baalim and ashtaroth but 
now deliv u out of the hand of our enemi and we will serv thee 

12 11 and the lord sent jerubba and bedan and jephthah and 
samuel and deliv you out of the hand of your enemi on everi 
side and ye dwell safe 

12 12 and when ye saw that nahash the king of the child of ammon 
came against you ye said unto me nay but a king shall reign over 
u when the lord your god wa your king 

12 13 now therefor behold the king whom ye have chosen and whom ye 
have desir and behold the lord hath set a king over you 

12 14 if ye will fear the lord and serv him and obey hi voic and 
not rebel against the command of the lord then shall both ye and 
also the king that reigneth over you continu follow the lord your 
god 12 15 but if ye will not obey the voic of the lord but rebel 
against the command of the lord then shall the hand of the lord 
be against you a it wa against your father 

12 16 now therefor stand and see thi great thing which the lord 
will do befor your eye 

12 17 is it not wheat harvest to day i will call unto the lord and 
he shall send thunder and rain that ye may perceiv and see that your 
wick is great which ye have done in the sight of the lord in 
ask you a king 

12 18 so samuel call unto the lord and the lord sent thunder and 
rain that day and all the peopl greatli fear the lord and samuel 

12 19 and all the peopl said unto samuel pray for thi servant unto 
the lord thi god that we die not for we have ad unto all our sin 
thi evil to ask u a king 

12 20 and samuel said unto the peopl fear not ye have done all thi 
wick yet turn not asid from follow the lord but serv the 
lord with all your heart 12 21 and turn ye not asid for then should 
ye go after vain thing which cannot profit nor deliv for they are 
vain 

12 22 for the lord will not forsak hi peopl for hi great name s 
sake becau it hath plea the lord to make you hi peopl 

12 23 moreov a for me god forbid that i should sin against the 
lord in cea to pray for you but i will teach you the good and the 
right way 12 24 onli fear the lord and serv him in truth with all 
your heart for consid how great thing he hath done for you 

12 25 but if ye shall still do wickedli ye shall be consum both ye 
and your king 

13 1 saul reign one year and when he had reign two year over 
israel 13 2 saul chose him three thousand men of israel whereof two 
thousand were with saul in michmash and in mount bethel and a 
thousand were with jonathan in gibeah of benjamin and the rest of the 
peopl he sent everi man to hi tent 

13 3 and jonathan smote the garrison of the philistin that wa in 
geba and the philistin heard of it and saul blew the trumpet 
throughout all the land say let the hebrew hear 

13 4 and all israel heard say that saul had smitten a garrison of the 
philistin and that israel also wa had in abomin with the 
philistin and the peopl were call togeth after saul to gilgal 

13 5 and the philistin gather themselv togeth to fight with 
israel thirti thousand chariot and six thousand horseman and 
peopl a the sand which is on the sea shore in multitud and they 
came up and pitch in michmash eastward from bethaven 

13 6 when the men of israel saw that they were in a strait for the 
peopl were distress then the peopl did hide themselv in cave 
and in thicket and in rock and in high place and in pit 

13 7 and some of the hebrew went over jordan to the land of gad and 
gilead a for saul he wa yet in gilgal and all the peopl follow 
him trembl 

13 8 and he tarri seven day accord to the set time that samuel 
had appoint but samuel came not to gilgal and the peopl were 
scatter from him 

13 9 and saul said bring hither a burnt offer to me and peac 
offer and he offer the burnt offer 

13 10 and it came to pa that a soon a he had made an end of 
offer the burnt offer behold samuel came and saul went out to 
meet him that he might salut him 

13 11 and samuel said what hast thou done and saul said becau i 
saw that the peopl were scatter from me and that thou camest not 
within the day appoint and that the philistin gather 
themselv togeth at michmash 13 12 therefor said i the 
philistin will come down now upon me to gilgal and i have not made 
supplic unto the lord i forc myself therefor and offer a 
burnt offer 

13 13 and samuel said to saul thou hast done foolishli thou hast not 
kept the command of the lord thi god which he command thee for 
now would the lord have establish thi kingdom upon israel for ever 

13 14 but now thi kingdom shall not continu the lord hath sought him 
a man after hi own heart and the lord hath command him to be 
captain over hi peopl becau thou hast not kept that which the 
lord command thee 

13 15 and samuel aro and gat him up from gilgal unto gibeah of 
benjamin and saul number the peopl that were present with him 
about six hundr men 

13 16 and saul and jonathan hi son and the peopl that were present 
with them abod in gibeah of benjamin but the philistin encamp 
in michmash 

13 17 and the spoiler came out of the camp of the philistin in 
three compani one compani turn unto the way that leadeth to 
ophrah unto the land of shual 13 18 and anoth compani turn the 
way to bethhoron and anoth compani turn to the way of the border 
that looketh to the valley of zeboim toward the wilder 

13 19 now there wa no smith found throughout all the land of israel 
for the philistin said lest the hebrew make them sword or spear 
13 20 but all the israelit went down to the philistin to sharpen 
everi man hi share and hi coulter and hi axe and hi mattock 

13 21 yet they had a file for the mattock and for the coulter and 
for the fork and for the ax and to sharpen the goad 

13 22 so it came to pa in the day of battl that there wa neither 
sword nor spear found in the hand of ani of the peopl that were with 
saul and jonathan but with saul and with jonathan hi son wa there 
found 

13 23 and the garrison of the philistin went out to the passag of 
michmash 

14 1 now it came to pa upon a day that jonathan the son of saul 
said unto the young man that bare hi armour come and let u go over 
to the philistin garrison that is on the other side but he told 
not hi father 

14 2 and saul tarri in the uttermost part of gibeah under a 
pomegran tree which is in migron and the peopl that were with him 
were about six hundr men 14 3 and ahiah the son of ahitub 
ichabod s brother the son of phineha the son of eli the lord s 
priest in shiloh wear an ephod and the peopl knew not that 
jonathan wa gone 

14 4 and between the passag by which jonathan sought to go over 
unto the philistin garrison there wa a sharp rock on the one 
side and a sharp rock on the other side and the name of the one wa 
bozez and the name of the other seneh 

14 5 the forefront of the one wa situat northward over against 
michmash and the other southward over against gibeah 

14 6 and jonathan said to the young man that bare hi armour come 
and let u go over unto the garrison of these uncircumci it may be 
that the lord will work for u for there is no restraint to the lord 
to save by mani or by few 

14 7 and hi armourbear said unto him do all that is in thine 
heart turn thee behold i am with thee accord to thi heart 

14 8 then said jonathan behold we will pa over unto these men and 
we will discov ourselv unto them 

14 9 if they say thu unto u tarri until we come to you then we 
will stand still in our place and will not go up unto them 

14 10 but if they say thu come up unto u then we will go up for 
the lord hath deliv them into our hand and thi shall be a sign 
unto u 

14 11 and both of them discov themselv unto the garrison of the 
philistin and the philistin said behold the hebrew come forth 
out of the hole where they had hid themselv 

14 12 and the men of the garrison answer jonathan and hi 
armourbear and said come up to u and we will shew you a thing 
and jonathan said unto hi armourbear come up after me for the 
lord hath deliv them into the hand of israel 

14 13 and jonathan climb up upon hi hand and upon hi foot and 
hi armourbear after him and they fell befor jonathan and hi 
armourbear slew after him 

14 14 and that first slaughter which jonathan and hi armourbear 
made wa about twenti men within a it were an half acr of land 
which a yoke of ox might plow 

14 15 and there wa trembl in the host in the field and among all 
the peopl the garrison and the spoiler they also trembl and 
the earth quak so it wa a veri great trembl 

14 16 and the watchman of saul in gibeah of benjamin look and 
behold the multitud melt away and they went on beat down one 
anoth 

14 17 then said saul unto the peopl that were with him number now 
and see who is gone from u and when they had number behold 
jonathan and hi armourbear were not there 

14 18 and saul said unto ahiah bring hither the ark of god for the 
ark of god wa at that time with the child of israel 

14 19 and it came to pa while saul talk unto the priest that the 
noi that wa in the host of the philistin went on and increa 
and saul said unto the priest withdraw thine hand 

14 20 and saul and all the peopl that were with him assembl 
themselv and they came to the battl and behold everi man s 
sword wa against hi fellow and there wa a veri great discomfitur 

14 21 moreov the hebrew that were with the philistin befor that 
time which went up with them into the camp from the countri round 
about even they also turn to be with the israelit that were with 
saul and jonathan 

14 22 likewi all the men of israel which had hid themselv in mount 
ephraim when they heard that the philistin fled even they also 
follow hard after them in the battl 

14 23 so the lord save israel that day and the battl pa over 
unto bethaven 

14 24 and the men of israel were distress that day for saul had 
adjur the peopl say cur be the man that eateth ani food 
until even that i may be aveng on mine enemi so none of the 
peopl tast ani food 

14 25 and all they of the land came to a wood and there wa honey 
upon the ground 

14 26 and when the peopl were come into the wood behold the honey 
drop but no man put hi hand to hi mouth for the peopl fear 
the oath 

14 27 but jonathan heard not when hi father charg the peopl with 
the oath wherefor he put forth the end of the rod that wa in hi 
hand and dip it in an honeycomb and put hi hand to hi mouth 
and hi eye were enlighten 

14 28 then answer one of the peopl and said thi father straitli 
charg the peopl with an oath say cur be the man that eateth 
ani food thi day and the peopl were faint 

14 29 then said jonathan my father hath troubl the land see i 
pray you how mine eye have been enlighten becau i tast a 
littl of thi honey 

14 30 how much more if hapli the peopl had eaten freeli to day of 
the spoil of their enemi which they found for had there not been 
now a much greater slaughter among the philistin 14 31 and they 
smote the philistin that day from michmash to aijalon and the 
peopl were veri faint 

14 32 and the peopl flew upon the spoil and took sheep and ox 
and calf and slew them on the ground and the peopl did eat them 
with the blood 

14 33 then they told saul say behold the peopl sin against the 
lord in that they eat with the blood and he said ye have 
transgress roll a great stone unto me thi day 

14 34 and saul said disper yourselv among the peopl and say 
unto them bring me hither everi man hi ox and everi man hi sheep 
and slay them here and eat and sin not against the lord in eat 
with the blood 

and all the peopl brought everi man hi ox with him that night and 
slew them there 

14 35 and saul built an altar unto the lord the same wa the first 
altar that he built unto the lord 

14 36 and saul said let u go down after the philistin by night 
and spoil them until the morn light and let u not leav a man of 
them and they said do whatsoev seemeth good unto thee then said 
the priest let u draw near hither unto god 

14 37 and saul ask counsel of god shall i go down after the 
philistin wilt thou deliv them into the hand of israel but he 
answer him not that day 

14 38 and saul said draw ye near hither all the chief of the peopl 
and know and see wherein thi sin hath been thi day 

14 39 for a the lord liveth which saveth israel though it be in 
jonathan my son he shall sure die but there wa not a man among 
all the peopl that answer him 

14 40 then said he unto all israel be ye on one side and i and 
jonathan my son will be on the other side and the peopl said unto 
saul do what seemeth good unto thee 

14 41 therefor saul said unto the lord god of israel give a perfect 
lot 

and saul and jonathan were taken but the peopl escap 

14 42 and saul said cast lot between me and jonathan my son and 
jonathan wa taken 

14 43 then saul said to jonathan tell me what thou hast done and 
jonathan told him and said i did but tast a littl honey with the 
end of the rod that wa in mine hand and lo i must die 

14 44 and saul answer god do so and more also for thou shalt 
sure die jonathan 

14 45 and the peopl said unto saul shall jonathan die who hath 
wrought thi great salvat in israel god forbid a the lord 
liveth there shall not one hair of hi head fall to the ground for 
he hath wrought with god thi day so the peopl rescu jonathan 
that he die not 

14 46 then saul went up from follow the philistin and the 
philistin went to their own place 

14 47 so saul took the kingdom over israel and fought against all hi 
enemi on everi side against moab and against the child of 
ammon and against edom and against the king of zobah and against 
the philistin and whithersoev he turn himself he vex them 

14 48 and he gather an host and smote the amalekit and deliv 
israel out of the hand of them that spoil them 

14 49 now the son of saul were jonathan and ishui and melchishua 
and the name of hi two daughter were these the name of the 
firstborn merab and the name of the younger michal 14 50 and the 
name of saul s wife wa ahinoam the daughter of ahimaaz and the name 
of the captain of hi host wa abner the son of ner saul s uncl 

14 51 and kish wa the father of saul and ner the father of abner wa 
the son of abiel 

14 52 and there wa sore war against the philistin all the day of 
saul and when saul saw ani strong man or ani valiant man he took 
him unto him 

15 1 samuel also said unto saul the lord sent me to anoint thee to be 
king over hi peopl over israel now therefor hearken thou unto the 
voic of the word of the lord 

15 2 thu saith the lord of host i rememb that which amalek did to 
israel how he laid wait for him in the way when he came up from 
egypt 

15 3 now go and smite amalek and utterli destroy all that they have 
and spare them not but slay both man and woman infant and suckl 
ox and sheep camel and a 

15 4 and saul gather the peopl togeth and number them in 
telaim two hundr thousand footman and ten thousand men of judah 

15 5 and saul came to a citi of amalek and laid wait in the valley 

15 6 and saul said unto the kenit go depart get you down from 
among the amalekit lest i destroy you with them for ye shew 
kind to all the child of israel when they came up out of 
egypt so the kenit depart from among the amalekit 

15 7 and saul smote the amalekit from havilah until thou comest to 
shur that is over against egypt 

15 8 and he took agag the king of the amalekit aliv and utterli 
destroy all the peopl with the edg of the sword 

15 9 but saul and the peopl spare agag and the best of the sheep 
and of the ox and of the fatl and the lamb and all that wa 
good and would not utterli destroy them but everi thing that wa 
vile and refu that they destroy utterli 

15 10 then came the word of the lord unto samuel say 15 11 it 
repenteth me that i have set up saul to be king for he is turn back 
from follow me and hath not perform my command and it 
griev samuel and he cri unto the lord all night 

15 12 and when samuel rose earli to meet saul in the morn it wa 
told samuel say saul came to carmel and behold he set him up a 
place and is gone about and pa on and gone down to gilgal 

15 13 and samuel came to saul and saul said unto him bless be thou 
of the lord i have perform the command of the lord 

15 14 and samuel said what meaneth then thi bleat of the sheep in 
mine ear and the low of the ox which i hear 15 15 and saul 
said they have brought them from the amalekit for the peopl 
spare the best of the sheep and of the ox to sacrif unto the 
lord thi god and the rest we have utterli destroy 

15 16 then samuel said unto saul stay and i will tell thee what the 
lord hath said to me thi night and he said unto him say on 

15 17 and samuel said when thou wast littl in thine own sight wast 
thou not made the head of the tribe of israel and the lord anoint 
thee king over israel 15 18 and the lord sent thee on a journey and 
said go and utterli destroy the sinner the amalekit and fight 
against them until they be consum 

15 19 wherefor then didst thou not obey the voic of the lord but 
didst fli upon the spoil and didst evil in the sight of the lord 
15 20 and saul said unto samuel yea i have obey the voic of the 
lord and have gone the way which the lord sent me and have brought 
agag the king of amalek and have utterli destroy the amalekit 

15 21 but the peopl took of the spoil sheep and ox the chief of 
the thing which should have been utterli destroy to sacrif unto 
the lord thi god in gilgal 

15 22 and samuel said hath the lord a great delight in burnt 
offer and sacrif a in obey the voic of the lord behold 
to obey is better than sacrif and to hearken than the fat of ram 

15 23 for rebellion is a the sin of witchcraft and stubborn is 
a iniqu and idolatri becau thou hast reject the word of the 
lord he hath also reject thee from be king 

15 24 and saul said unto samuel i have sin for i have 
transgress the command of the lord and thi word becau i 
fear the peopl and obey their voic 

15 25 now therefor i pray thee pardon my sin and turn again with 
me that i may worship the lord 

15 26 and samuel said unto saul i will not return with thee for thou 
hast reject the word of the lord and the lord hath reject thee 
from be king over israel 

15 27 and a samuel turn about to go away he laid hold upon the 
skirt of hi mantl and it rent 

15 28 and samuel said unto him the lord hath rent the kingdom of 
israel from thee thi day and hath given it to a neighbour of thine 
that is better than thou 

15 29 and also the strength of israel will not lie nor repent for he 
is not a man that he should repent 

15 30 then he said i have sin yet honour me now i pray thee 
befor the elder of my peopl and befor israel and turn again with 
me that i may worship the lord thi god 

15 31 so samuel turn again after saul and saul worship the lord 

15 32 then said samuel bring ye hither to me agag the king of the 
amalekit and agag came unto him delic and agag said sure 
the bitter of death is past 

15 33 and samuel said a the sword hath made woman childless so 
shall thi mother be childless among woman and samuel hew agag in 
piec befor the lord in gilgal 

15 34 then samuel went to ramah and saul went up to hi hou to 
gibeah of saul 

15 35 and samuel came no more to see saul until the day of hi death 
nevertheless samuel mourn for saul and the lord repent that he 
had made saul king over israel 

16 1 and the lord said unto samuel how long wilt thou mourn for saul 
see i have reject him from reign over israel fill thine horn 
with oil and go i will send thee to jess the bethlehemit for i 
have provid me a king among hi son 

16 2 and samuel said how can i go if saul hear it he will kill me 
and the lord said take an heifer with thee and say i am come to 
sacrif to the lord 

16 3 and call jess to the sacrif and i will shew thee what thou 
shalt do and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom i name unto thee 

16 4 and samuel did that which the lord spake and came to bethlehem 
and the elder of the town trembl at hi come and said comest 
thou peaceabl 16 5 and he said peaceabl i am come to sacrif 
unto the lord sanctifi yourselv and come with me to the sacrif 
and he sanctifi jess and hi son and call them to the 
sacrif 

16 6 and it came to pa when they were come that he look on 
eliab and said sure the lord s anoint is befor him 

16 7 but the lord said unto samuel look not on hi counten or on 
the height of hi statur becau i have refu him for the lord 
seeth not a man seeth for man looketh on the outward appear but 
the lord looketh on the heart 

16 8 then jess call abinadab and made him pa befor samuel and 
he said neither hath the lord chosen thi 

16 9 then jess made shammah to pa by and he said neither hath the 
lord chosen thi 

16 10 again jess made seven of hi son to pa befor samuel and 
samuel said unto jess the lord hath not chosen these 

16 11 and samuel said unto jess are here all thi child and he 
said there remaineth yet the youngest and behold he keepeth the 
sheep and samuel said unto jess send and fetch him for we will not 
sit down till he come hither 

16 12 and he sent and brought him in now he wa ruddi and withal of 
a beauti counten and goodli to look to and the lord said 
ari anoint him for thi is he 

16 13 then samuel took the horn of oil and anoint him in the midst 
of hi brother and the spirit of the lord came upon david from that 
day forward so samuel rose up and went to ramah 

16 14 but the spirit of the lord depart from saul and an evil 
spirit from the lord troubl him 

16 15 and saul s servant said unto him behold now an evil spirit 
from god troubleth thee 

16 16 let our lord now command thi servant which are befor thee to 
seek out a man who is a cun player on an harp and it shall come 
to pa when the evil spirit from god is upon thee that he shall 
play with hi hand and thou shalt be well 

16 17 and saul said unto hi servant provid me now a man that can 
play well and bring him to me 

16 18 then answer one of the servant and said behold i have seen 
a son of jess the bethlehemit that is cun in play and a 
mighti valiant man and a man of war and prudent in matter and a 
come person and the lord is with him 

16 19 wherefor saul sent messeng unto jess and said send me 
david thi son which is with the sheep 

16 20 and jess took an a laden with bread and a bottl of wine 
and a kid and sent them by david hi son unto saul 

16 21 and david came to saul and stood befor him and he love him 
greatli and he becam hi armourbear 

16 22 and saul sent to jess say let david i pray thee stand 
befor me for he hath found favour in my sight 

16 23 and it came to pa when the evil spirit from god wa upon 
saul that david took an harp and play with hi hand so saul wa 
refresh and wa well and the evil spirit depart from him 

17 1 now the philistin gather togeth their armi to battl and 
were gather togeth at shochoh which belongeth to judah and 
pitch between shochoh and azekah in ephesdammim 

17 2 and saul and the men of israel were gather togeth and 
pitch by the valley of elah and set the battl in array against the 
philistin 

17 3 and the philistin stood on a mountain on the one side and 
israel stood on a mountain on the other side and there wa a valley 
between them 

17 4 and there went out a champion out of the camp of the philistin 
name goliath of gath whose height wa six cubit and a span 

17 5 and he had an helmet of brass upon hi head and he wa arm 
with a coat of mail and the weight of the coat wa five thousand 
shekel of brass 

17 6 and he had greav of brass upon hi leg and a target of brass 
between hi shoulder 

17 7 and the staff of hi spear wa like a weaver s beam and hi 
spear s head weigh six hundr shekel of iron and one bear a 
shield went befor him 

17 8 and he stood and cri unto the armi of israel and said unto 
them whi are ye come out to set your battl in array am not i a 
philistin and ye servant to saul choo you a man for you and let 
him come down to me 

17 9 if he be abl to fight with me and to kill me then will we be 
your servant but if i prevail against him and kill him then shall 
ye be our servant and serv u 

17 10 and the philistin said i defi the armi of israel thi day 
give me a man that we may fight togeth 

17 11 when saul and all israel heard those word of the philistin 
they were dismay and greatli afraid 

17 12 now david wa the son of that ephrathit of bethlehemjudah 
whose name wa jess and he had eight son and the man went among 
men for an old man in the day of saul 

17 13 and the three eldest son of jess went and follow saul to the 
battl and the name of hi three son that went to the battl were 
eliab the firstborn and next unto him abinadab and the third 
shammah 

17 14 and david wa the youngest and the three eldest follow saul 

17 15 but david went and return from saul to feed hi father s sheep 
at bethlehem 

17 16 and the philistin drew near morn and even and present 
himself forti day 

17 17 and jess said unto david hi son take now for thi brother an 
ephah of thi parch corn and these ten loaf and run to the camp 
of thi brother 17 18 and carri these ten chee unto the captain of 
their thousand and look how thi brother fare and take their pledg 

17 19 now saul and they and all the men of israel were in the 
valley of elah fight with the philistin 

17 20 and david rose up earli in the morn and left the sheep with 
a keeper and took and went a jess had command him and he came 
to the trench a the host wa go forth to the fight and shout 
for the battl 

17 21 for israel and the philistin had put the battl in array armi 
against armi 

17 22 and david left hi carriag in the hand of the keeper of the 
carriag and ran into the armi and came and salut hi brother 

17 23 and a he talk with them behold there came up the champion 
the philistin of gath goliath by name out of the armi of the 
philistin and spake accord to the same word and david heard 
them 

17 24 and all the men of israel when they saw the man fled from him 
and were sore afraid 

17 25 and the men of israel said have ye seen thi man that is come 
up sure to defi israel is he come up and it shall be that the 
man who killeth him the king will enrich him with great rich and 
will give him hi daughter and make hi father s hou free in 
israel 

17 26 and david spake to the men that stood by him say what shall 
be done to the man that killeth thi philistin and taketh away the 
reproach from israel for who is thi uncircumci philistin that 
he should defi the armi of the live god 17 27 and the peopl 
answer him after thi manner say so shall it be done to the man 
that killeth him 

17 28 and eliab hi eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men 
and eliab s anger wa kindl against david and he said whi camest 
thou down hither and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the 
wilder i know thi pride and the naughti of thine heart for 
thou art come down that thou mightest see the battl 

17 29 and david said what have i now done is there not a cau 
17 30 and he turn from him toward anoth and spake after the same 
manner and the peopl answer him again after the former manner 

17 31 and when the word were heard which david spake they rehear 
them befor saul and he sent for him 

17 32 and david said to saul let no man s heart fail becau of him 
thi servant will go and fight with thi philistin 

17 33 and saul said to david thou art not abl to go against thi 
philistin to fight with him for thou art but a youth and he a man 
of war from hi youth 

17 34 and david said unto saul thi servant kept hi father s sheep 
and there came a lion and a bear and took a lamb out of the flock 
17 35 and i went out after him and smote him and deliv it out of 
hi mouth and when he aro against me i caught him by hi beard 
and smote him and slew him 

17 36 thi servant slew both the lion and the bear and thi 
uncircumci philistin shall be a one of them see he hath 
defi the armi of the live god 

17 37 david said moreov the lord that deliv me out of the paw 
of the lion and out of the paw of the bear he will deliv me out of 
the hand of thi philistin and saul said unto david go and the 
lord be with thee 

17 38 and saul arm david with hi armour and he put an helmet of 
brass upon hi head also he arm him with a coat of mail 

17 39 and david gird hi sword upon hi armour and he assay to 
go for he had not prove it and david said unto saul i cannot go 
with these for i have not prove them and david put them off him 

17 40 and he took hi staff in hi hand and chose him five smooth 
stone out of the brook and put them in a shepherd s bag which he 
had even in a scrip and hi sling wa in hi hand and he drew near 
to the philistin 

17 41 and the philistin came on and drew near unto david and the man 
that bare the shield went befor him 

17 42 and when the philistin look about and saw david he 
disdain him for he wa but a youth and ruddi and of a fair 
counten 

17 43 and the philistin said unto david am i a dog that thou comest 
to me with stave and the philistin cur david by hi god 

17 44 and the philistin said to david come to me and i will give 
thi flesh unto the fowl of the air and to the beast of the field 

17 45 then said david to the philistin thou comest to me with a 
sword and with a spear and with a shield but i come to thee in the 
name of the lord of host the god of the armi of israel whom thou 
hast defi 

17 46 thi day will the lord deliv thee into mine hand and i will 
smite thee and take thine head from thee and i will give the 
carca of the host of the philistin thi day unto the fowl of the 
air and to the wild beast of the earth that all the earth may know 
that there is a god in israel 

17 47 and all thi assembl shall know that the lord saveth not with 
sword and spear for the battl is the lord s and he will give you 
into our hand 

17 48 and it came to pa when the philistin aro and came and 
drew nigh to meet david that david hasten and ran toward the armi 
to meet the philistin 

17 49 and david put hi hand in hi bag and took thenc a stone and 
slang it and smote the philistin in hi forehead that the stone 
sunk into hi forehead and he fell upon hi face to the earth 

17 50 so david prevail over the philistin with a sling and with a 
stone and smote the philistin and slew him but there wa no sword 
in the hand of david 

17 51 therefor david ran and stood upon the philistin and took hi 
sword and drew it out of the sheath thereof and slew him and cut 
off hi head therewith and when the philistin saw their champion 
wa dead they fled 

17 52 and the men of israel and of judah aro and shout and 
pursu the philistin until thou come to the valley and to the 
gate of ekron 

and the wound of the philistin fell down by the way to shaaraim 
even unto gath and unto ekron 

17 53 and the child of israel return from chase after the 
philistin and they spoil their tent 

17 54 and david took the head of the philistin and brought it to 
jerusalem but he put hi armour in hi tent 

17 55 and when saul saw david go forth against the philistin he said 
unto abner the captain of the host abner whose son is thi youth 
and abner said a thi soul liveth o king i cannot tell 

17 56 and the king said enquir thou whose son the stripl is 

17 57 and a david return from the slaughter of the philistin 
abner took him and brought him befor saul with the head of the 
philistin in hi hand 

17 58 and saul said to him whose son art thou thou young man and 
david answer i am the son of thi servant jess the bethlehemit 

18 1 and it came to pa when he had made an end of speak unto 
saul that the soul of jonathan wa knit with the soul of david and 
jonathan love him a hi own soul 

18 2 and saul took him that day and would let him go no more home to 
hi father s hou 

18 3 then jonathan and david made a coven becau he love him a 
hi own soul 

18 4 and jonathan strip himself of the robe that wa upon him and 
gave it to david and hi garment even to hi sword and to hi bow 
and to hi girdl 

18 5 and david went out whithersoev saul sent him and behav 
himself wise and saul set him over the men of war and he wa 
accept in the sight of all the peopl and also in the sight of 
saul s servant 

18 6 and it came to pa a they came when david wa return from 
the slaughter of the philistin that the woman came out of all citi 
of israel sing and danc to meet king saul with tabret with 
joy and with instrument of musick 

18 7 and the woman answer one anoth a they play and said saul 
hath slain hi thousand and david hi ten thousand 

18 8 and saul wa veri wroth and the say displea him and he 
said they have ascrib unto david ten thousand and to me they have 
ascrib but thousand and what can he have more but the kingdom 
18 9 and saul eye david from that day and forward 

18 10 and it came to pa on the morrow that the evil spirit from god 
came upon saul and he prophesi in the midst of the hou and david 
play with hi hand a at other time and there wa a javelin in 
saul s hand 

18 11 and saul cast the javelin for he said i will smite david even 
to the wall with it and david avoid out of hi presenc twice 

18 12 and saul wa afraid of david becau the lord wa with him and 
wa depart from saul 

18 13 therefor saul remov him from him and made him hi captain 
over a thousand and he went out and came in befor the peopl 

18 14 and david behav himself wise in all hi way and the lord 
wa with him 

18 15 wherefor when saul saw that he behav himself veri wise he 
wa afraid of him 

18 16 but all israel and judah love david becau he went out and 
came in befor them 

18 17 and saul said to david behold my elder daughter merab her will 
i give thee to wife onli be thou valiant for me and fight the lord s 
battl 

for saul said let not mine hand be upon him but let the hand of the 
philistin be upon him 

18 18 and david said unto saul who am i and what is my life or my 
father s famili in israel that i should be son in law to the king 
18 19 but it came to pa at the time when merab saul s daughter 
should have been given to david that she wa given unto adriel the 
meholathit to wife 

18 20 and michal saul s daughter love david and they told saul and 
the thing plea him 

18 21 and saul said i will give him her that she may be a snare to 
him and that the hand of the philistin may be against him 
wherefor saul said to david thou shalt thi day be my son in law in 
the one of the twain 

18 22 and saul command hi servant say commun with david 
secretli and say behold the king hath delight in thee and all hi 
servant love thee now therefor be the king s son in law 

18 23 and saul s servant spake those word in the ear of david and 
david said seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king s son in law 
see that i am a poor man and lightli esteem 18 24 and the 
servant of saul told him say on thi manner spake david 

18 25 and saul said thu shall ye say to david the king desireth not 
ani dowri but an hundr foreskin of the philistin to be aveng 
of the king s enemi but saul thought to make david fall by the hand 
of the philistin 

18 26 and when hi servant told david these word it plea david 
well to be the king s son in law and the day were not expir 

18 27 wherefor david aro and went he and hi men and slew of the 
philistin two hundr men and david brought their foreskin and 
they gave them in full tale to the king that he might be the king s 
son in law and saul gave him michal hi daughter to wife 

18 28 and saul saw and knew that the lord wa with david and that 
michal saul s daughter love him 

18 29 and saul wa yet the more afraid of david and saul becam 
david s enemi continu 

18 30 then the princ of the philistin went forth and it came to 
pa after they went forth that david behav himself more wise 
than all the servant of saul so that hi name wa much set by 

19 1 and saul spake to jonathan hi son and to all hi servant that 
they should kill david 

19 2 but jonathan saul s son delight much in david and jonathan 
told david say saul my father seeketh to kill thee now 
therefor i pray thee take heed to thyself until the morn and 
abid in a secret place and hide thyself 19 3 and i will go out and 
stand besid my father in the field where thou art and i will commun 
with my father of thee and what i see that i will tell thee 

19 4 and jonathan spake good of david unto saul hi father and said 
unto him let not the king sin against hi servant against david 
becau he hath not sin against thee and becau hi work have 
been to thee ward veri good 19 5 for he did put hi life in hi hand 
and slew the philistin and the lord wrought a great salvat for 
all israel thou sawest it and didst rejoic wherefor then wilt 
thou sin against innoc blood to slay david without a cau 19 6 
and saul hearken unto the voic of jonathan and saul sware a the 
lord liveth he shall not be slain 

19 7 and jonathan call david and jonathan shew him all those 
thing 

and jonathan brought david to saul and he wa in hi presenc a in 
time past 

19 8 and there wa war again and david went out and fought with the 
philistin and slew them with a great slaughter and they fled from 
him 

19 9 and the evil spirit from the lord wa upon saul a he sat in hi 
hou with hi javelin in hi hand and david play with hi hand 

19 10 and saul sought to smite david even to the wall with the 
javelin but he slip away out of saul s presenc and he smote the 
javelin into the wall and david fled and escap that night 

19 11 saul also sent messeng unto david s hou to watch him and 
to slay him in the morn and michal david s wife told him say 
if thou save not thi life to night to morrow thou shalt be slain 

19 12 so michal let david down through a window and he went and 
fled and escap 

19 13 and michal took an imag and laid it in the bed and put a 
pillow of goat hair for hi bolster and cover it with a cloth 

19 14 and when saul sent messeng to take david she said he is 
sick 

19 15 and saul sent the messeng again to see david say bring 
him up to me in the bed that i may slay him 

19 16 and when the messeng were come in behold there wa an imag 
in the bed with a pillow of goat hair for hi bolster 

19 17 and saul said unto michal whi hast thou deceiv me so and 
sent away mine enemi that he is escap and michal answer saul he 
said unto me let me go whi should i kill thee 19 18 so david fled 
and escap and came to samuel to ramah and told him all that saul 
had done to him and he and samuel went and dwelt in naioth 

19 19 and it wa told saul say behold david is at naioth in 
ramah 

19 20 and saul sent messeng to take david and when they saw the 
compani of the prophet prophesi and samuel stand a appoint 
over them the spirit of god wa upon the messeng of saul and they 
also prophesi 

19 21 and when it wa told saul he sent other messeng and they 
prophesi likewi and saul sent messeng again the third time 
and they prophesi also 

19 22 then went he also to ramah and came to a great well that is in 
sechu and he ask and said where are samuel and david and one 
said behold they be at naioth in ramah 

19 23 and he went thither to naioth in ramah and the spirit of god 
wa upon him also and he went on and prophesi until he came to 
naioth in ramah 

19 24 and he strip off hi cloth also and prophesi befor 
samuel in like manner and lay down nake all that day and all that 
night wherefor they say is saul also among the prophet 20 1 and 
david fled from naioth in ramah and came and said befor jonathan 
what have i done what is mine iniqu and what is my sin befor thi 
father that he seeketh my life 20 2 and he said unto him god 
forbid thou shalt not die behold my father will do noth either 
great or small but that he will shew it me and whi should my father 
hide thi thing from me it is not so 

20 3 and david sware moreov and said thi father certainli knoweth 
that i have found grace in thine eye and he saith let not jonathan 
know thi lest he be griev but truli a the lord liveth and a 
thi soul liveth there is but a step between me and death 

20 4 then said jonathan unto david whatsoev thi soul desireth i 
will even do it for thee 

20 5 and david said unto jonathan behold to morrow is the new moon 
and i should not fail to sit with the king at meat but let me go 
that i may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even 

20 6 if thi father at all miss me then say david earnestli ask 
leav of me that he might run to bethlehem hi citi for there is a 
yearli sacrif there for all the famili 

20 7 if he say thu it is well thi servant shall have peac but if 
he be veri wroth then be sure that evil is determin by him 

20 8 therefor thou shalt deal kindli with thi servant for thou hast 
brought thi servant into a coven of the lord with thee 
notwithstand if there be in me iniqu slay me thyself for whi 
shouldest thou bring me to thi father 20 9 and jonathan said far be 
it from thee for if i knew certainli that evil were determin by my 
father to come upon thee then would not i tell it thee 20 10 then 
said david to jonathan who shall tell me or what if thi father 
answer thee roughli 20 11 and jonathan said unto david come and 
let u go out into the field and they went out both of them into the 
field 

20 12 and jonathan said unto david o lord god of israel when i have 
sound my father about to morrow ani time or the third day and 
behold if there be good toward david and i then send not unto thee 
and shew it thee 20 13 the lord do so and much more to jonathan but 
if it plea my father to do thee evil then i will shew it thee and 
send thee away that thou mayest go in peac and the lord be with 
thee a he hath been with my father 

20 14 and thou shalt not onli while yet i live shew me the kind of 
the lord that i die not 20 15 but also thou shalt not cut off thi 
kind from my hou for ever no not when the lord hath cut off 
the enemi of david everi one from the face of the earth 

20 16 so jonathan made a coven with the hou of david say let 
the lord even requir it at the hand of david s enemi 

20 17 and jonathan cau david to swear again becau he love him 
for he love him a he love hi own soul 

20 18 then jonathan said to david to morrow is the new moon and thou 
shalt be miss becau thi seat will be empti 

20 19 and when thou hast stay three day then thou shalt go down 
quickli and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the 
busi wa in hand and shalt remain by the stone ezel 

20 20 and i will shoot three arrow on the side thereof a though i 
shot at a mark 

20 21 and behold i will send a lad say go find out the arrow 
if i expressli say unto the lad behold the arrow are on thi side 
of thee take them then come thou for there is peac to thee and no 
hurt a the lord liveth 

20 22 but if i say thu unto the young man behold the arrow are 
beyond thee go thi way for the lord hath sent thee away 

20 23 and a touch the matter which thou and i have spoken of 
behold the lord be between thee and me for ever 

20 24 so david hid himself in the field and when the new moon wa 
come the king sat him down to eat meat 

20 25 and the king sat upon hi seat a at other time even upon a 
seat by the wall and jonathan aro and abner sat by saul s side 
and david s place wa empti 

20 26 nevertheless saul spake not ani thing that day for he thought 
someth hath befallen him he is not clean sure he is not clean 

20 27 and it came to pa on the morrow which wa the second day of 
the month that david s place wa empti and saul said unto jonathan 
hi son wherefor cometh not the son of jess to meat neither 
yesterday nor to day 20 28 and jonathan answer saul david 
earnestli ask leav of me to go to bethlehem 20 29 and he said let 
me go i pray thee for our famili hath a sacrif in the citi and 
my brother he hath command me to be there and now if i have found 
favour in thine eye let me get away i pray thee and see my 
brother therefor he cometh not unto the king s tabl 

20 30 then saul s anger wa kindl against jonathan and he said unto 
him thou son of the perver rebelli woman do not i know that 
thou hast chosen the son of jess to thine own confu and unto the 
confu of thi mother s nake 20 31 for a long a the son of 
jess liveth upon the ground thou shalt not be establish nor thi 
kingdom wherefor now send and fetch him unto me for he shall sure 
die 

20 32 and jonathan answer saul hi father and said unto him 
wherefor shall he be slain what hath he done 20 33 and saul cast a 
javelin at him to smite him wherebi jonathan knew that it wa 
determin of hi father to slay david 

20 34 so jonathan aro from the tabl in fierc anger and did eat no 
meat the second day of the month for he wa griev for david 
becau hi father had done him shame 

20 35 and it came to pa in the morn that jonathan went out into 
the field at the time appoint with david and a littl lad with him 

20 36 and he said unto hi lad run find out now the arrow which i 
shoot and a the lad ran he shot an arrow beyond him 

20 37 and when the lad wa come to the place of the arrow which 
jonathan had shot jonathan cri after the lad and said is not the
