arrow beyond thee 20 38 and jonathan cri after the lad make 
speed hast stay not and jonathan s lad gather up the arrow and 
came to hi master 

20 39 but the lad knew not ani thing onli jonathan and david knew the 
matter 

20 40 and jonathan gave hi artilleri unto hi lad and said unto him 
go carri them to the citi 

20 41 and a soon a the lad wa gone david aro out of a place 
toward the south and fell on hi face to the ground and bow 
himself three time and they kiss one anoth and wept one with 
anoth until david exceed 

20 42 and jonathan said to david go in peac forasmuch a we have 
sworn both of u in the name of the lord say the lord be between 
me and thee and between my seed and thi seed for ever and he aro 
and depart and jonathan went into the citi 

21 1 then came david to nob to ahimelech the priest and ahimelech wa 
afraid at the meet of david and said unto him whi art thou alon 
and no man with thee 21 2 and david said unto ahimelech the priest 
the king hath command me a busi and hath said unto me let no 
man know ani thing of the busi whereabout i send thee and what i 
have command thee and i have appoint my servant to such and such 
a place 

21 3 now therefor what is under thine hand give me five loaf of 
bread in mine hand or what there is present 

21 4 and the priest answer david and said there is no common bread 
under mine hand but there is hallow bread if the young men have 
kept themselv at least from woman 

21 5 and david answer the priest and said unto him of a truth 
woman have been kept from u about these three day sinc i came out 
and the vessel of the young men are holi and the bread is in a 
manner common yea though it were sanctifi thi day in the vessel 

21 6 so the priest gave him hallow bread for there wa no bread 
there but the shewbread that wa taken from befor the lord to put 
hot bread in the day when it wa taken away 

21 7 now a certain man of the servant of saul wa there that day 
detain befor the lord and hi name wa doeg an edomit the 
chiefest of the herdmen that belong to saul 

21 8 and david said unto ahimelech and is there not here under thine 
hand spear or sword for i have neither brought my sword nor my 
weapon with me becau the king s busi requir hast 

21 9 and the priest said the sword of goliath the philistin whom 
thou slewest in the valley of elah behold it is here wrap in a 
cloth behind the ephod if thou wilt take that take it for there is 
no other save that here and david said there is none like that give 
it me 

21 10 and david aro and fled that day for fear of saul and went to 
achish the king of gath 

21 11 and the servant of achish said unto him is not thi david the 
king of the land did they not sing one to anoth of him in danc 
say saul hath slain hi thousand and david hi ten thousand 
21 12 and david laid up these word in hi heart and wa sore afraid 
of achish the king of gath 

21 13 and he chang hi behaviour befor them and feign himself 
mad in their hand and scrabbl on the door of the gate and let 
hi spittl fall down upon hi beard 

21 14 then said achish unto hi servant lo ye see the man is mad 
wherefor then have ye brought him to me 21 15 have i need of mad 
men that ye have brought thi fellow to play the mad man in my 
presenc shall thi fellow come into my hou 22 1 david therefor 
depart thenc and escap to the cave adullam and when hi 
brother and all hi father s hou heard it they went down thither 
to him 

22 2 and everi one that wa in distress and everi one that wa in 
debt and everi one that wa discont gather themselv unto 
him and he becam a captain over them and there were with him about 
four hundr men 

22 3 and david went thenc to mizpeh of moab and he said unto the 
king of moab let my father and my mother i pray thee come forth 
and be with you till i know what god will do for me 

22 4 and he brought them befor the king of moab and they dwelt with 
him all the while that david wa in the hold 

22 5 and the prophet gad said unto david abid not in the hold 
depart and get thee into the land of judah then david depart and 
came into the forest of hareth 

22 6 when saul heard that david wa discov and the men that were 
with him now saul abod in gibeah under a tree in ramah have hi 
spear in hi hand and all hi servant were stand about him 22 7 
then saul said unto hi servant that stood about him hear now ye 
benjamit will the son of jess give everi one of you field and 
vineyard and make you all captain of thousand and captain of 
hundr 22 8 that all of you have conspir against me and there is 
none that sheweth me that my son hath made a leagu with the son of 
jess and there is none of you that is sorri for me or sheweth unto 
me that my son hath stir up my servant against me to lie in wait 
a at thi day 22 9 then answer doeg the edomit which wa set 
over the servant of saul and said i saw the son of jess come to 
nob to ahimelech the son of ahitub 

22 10 and he enquir of the lord for him and gave him victual and 
gave him the sword of goliath the philistin 

22 11 then the king sent to call ahimelech the priest the son of 
ahitub and all hi father s hou the priest that were in nob and 
they came all of them to the king 

22 12 and saul said hear now thou son of ahitub and he answer 
here i am my lord 

22 13 and saul said unto him whi have ye conspir against me thou 
and the son of jess in that thou hast given him bread and a sword 
and hast enquir of god for him that he should rise against me to 
lie in wait a at thi day 22 14 then ahimelech answer the king 
and said and who is so faith among all thi servant a david 
which is the king s son in law and goeth at thi bid and is 
honour in thine hou 22 15 did i then begin to enquir of god 
for him be it far from me let not the king imput ani thing unto hi 
servant nor to all the hou of my father for thi servant knew 
noth of all thi le or more 

22 16 and the king said thou shalt sure die ahimelech thou and 
all thi father s hou 

22 17 and the king said unto the footman that stood about him turn 
and slay the priest of the lord becau their hand also is with 
david and becau they knew when he fled and did not shew it to me 
but the servant of the king would not put forth their hand to fall 
upon the priest of the lord 

22 18 and the king said to doeg turn thou and fall upon the priest 
and doeg the edomit turn and he fell upon the priest and slew on 
that day fourscor and five person that did wear a linen ephod 

22 19 and nob the citi of the priest smote he with the edg of the 
sword both men and woman child and suckl and ox and 
as and sheep with the edg of the sword 

22 20 and one of the son of ahimelech the son of ahitub name 
abiathar escap and fled after david 

22 21 and abiathar shew david that saul had slain the lord s 
priest 

22 22 and david said unto abiathar i knew it that day when doeg the 
edomit wa there that he would sure tell saul i have occa 
the death of all the person of thi father s hou 

22 23 abid thou with me fear not for he that seeketh my life 
seeketh thi life but with me thou shalt be in safeguard 

23 1 then they told david say behold the philistin fight 
against keilah and they rob the threshingfloor 

23 2 therefor david enquir of the lord say shall i go and 
smite these philistin and the lord said unto david go and smite 
the philistin and save keilah 

23 3 and david s men said unto him behold we be afraid here in 
judah how much more then if we come to keilah against the armi of 
the philistin 23 4 then david enquir of the lord yet again and 
the lord answer him and said ari go down to keilah for i will 
deliv the philistin into thine hand 

23 5 so david and hi men went to keilah and fought with the 
philistin and brought away their cattl and smote them with a 
great slaughter so david save the inhabit of keilah 

23 6 and it came to pa when abiathar the son of ahimelech fled to 
david to keilah that he came down with an ephod in hi hand 

23 7 and it wa told saul that david wa come to keilah and saul 
said god hath deliv him into mine hand for he is shut in by 
enter into a town that hath gate and bar 

23 8 and saul call all the peopl togeth to war to go down to 
keilah to besieg david and hi men 

23 9 and david knew that saul secretli practi mischief against him 
and he said to abiathar the priest bring hither the ephod 

23 10 then said david o lord god of israel thi servant hath 
certainli heard that saul seeketh to come to keilah to destroy the 
citi for my sake 

23 11 will the men of keilah deliv me up into hi hand will saul 
come down a thi servant hath heard o lord god of israel i beseech 
thee tell thi servant and the lord said he will come down 

23 12 then said david will the men of keilah deliv me and my men 
into the hand of saul and the lord said they will deliv thee up 

23 13 then david and hi men which were about six hundr aro and 
depart out of keilah and went whithersoev they could go and it 
wa told saul that david wa escap from keilah and he forbar to go 
forth 

23 14 and david abod in the wilder in strong hold and remain 
in a mountain in the wilder of ziph and saul sought him everi 
day but god deliv him not into hi hand 

23 15 and david saw that saul wa come out to seek hi life and david 
wa in the wilder of ziph in a wood 

23 16 and jonathan saul s son aro and went to david into the wood 
and strengthen hi hand in god 

23 17 and he said unto him fear not for the hand of saul my father 
shall not find thee and thou shalt be king over israel and i shall 
be next unto thee and that also saul my father knoweth 

23 18 and they two made a coven befor the lord and david abod in 
the wood and jonathan went to hi hou 

23 19 then came up the ziphit to saul to gibeah say doth not 
david hide himself with u in strong hold in the wood in the hill of 
hachilah which is on the south of jeshimon 23 20 now therefor o 
king come down accord to all the desir of thi soul to come down 
and our part shall be to deliv him into the king s hand 

23 21 and saul said bless be ye of the lord for ye have compass 
on me 

23 22 go i pray you prepar yet and know and see hi place where 
hi haunt is and who hath seen him there for it is told me that he 
dealeth veri subtilli 

23 23 see therefor and take knowledg of all the lurk place 
where he hideth himself and come ye again to me with the certainti 
and i will go with you and it shall come to pa if he be in the 
land that i will search him out throughout all the thousand of 
judah 

23 24 and they aro and went to ziph befor saul but david and hi 
men were in the wilder of maon in the plain on the south of 
jeshimon 

23 25 saul also and hi men went to seek him and they told david 
wherefor he came down into a rock and abod in the wilder of 
maon and when saul heard that he pursu after david in the 
wilder of maon 

23 26 and saul went on thi side of the mountain and david and hi 
men on that side of the mountain and david made hast to get away for 
fear of saul for saul and hi men compass david and hi men round 
about to take them 

23 27 but there came a messeng unto saul say hast thee and 
come for the philistin have invad the land 

23 28 wherefor saul return from pursu after david and went 
against the philistin therefor they call that place 
selahammahlekoth 

23 29 and david went up from thenc and dwelt in strong hold at 
engedi 

24 1 and it came to pa when saul wa return from follow the 
philistin that it wa told him say behold david is in the 
wilder of engedi 

24 2 then saul took three thousand chosen men out of all israel and 
went to seek david and hi men upon the rock of the wild goat 

24 3 and he came to the sheepcot by the way where wa a cave and 
saul went in to cover hi foot and david and hi men remain in the 
side of the cave 

24 4 and the men of david said unto him behold the day of which the 
lord said unto thee behold i will deliv thine enemi into thine 
hand that thou mayest do to him a it shall seem good unto thee then 
david aro and cut off the skirt of saul s robe privili 

24 5 and it came to pa afterward that david s heart smote him 
becau he had cut off saul s skirt 

24 6 and he said unto hi men the lord forbid that i should do thi 
thing unto my master the lord s anoint to stretch forth mine hand 
against him see he is the anoint of the lord 

24 7 so david stay hi servant with these word and suffer them 
not to rise against saul but saul rose up out of the cave and went 
on hi way 

24 8 david also aro afterward and went out of the cave and cri 
after saul say my lord the king and when saul look behind him 
david stoop with hi face to the earth and bow himself 

24 9 and david said to saul wherefor hearest thou men s word 
say behold david seeketh thi hurt 24 10 behold thi day thine 
eye have seen how that the lord had deliv thee to day into mine 
hand in the cave and some bade me kill thee but mine eye spare 
thee and i said i will not put forth mine hand against my lord for 
he is the lord s anoint 

24 11 moreov my father see yea see the skirt of thi robe in my 
hand for in that i cut off the skirt of thi robe and kill thee 
not know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgress in 
mine hand and i have not sin against thee yet thou huntest my 
soul to take it 

24 12 the lord judg between me and thee and the lord aveng me of 
thee but mine hand shall not be upon thee 

24 13 a saith the proverb of the ancient wick proceedeth from 
the wick but mine hand shall not be upon thee 

24 14 after whom is the king of israel come out after whom dost thou 
pursu after a dead dog after a flea 

24 15 the lord therefor be judg and judg between me and thee and 
see and plead my cau and deliv me out of thine hand 

24 16 and it came to pa when david had made an end of speak 
these word unto saul that saul said is thi thi voic my son 
david and saul lift up hi voic and wept 

24 17 and he said to david thou art more righteou than i for thou 
hast reward me good wherea i have reward thee evil 

24 18 and thou hast shew thi day how that thou hast dealt well with 
me forasmuch a when the lord had deliv me into thine hand thou 
killedst me not 

24 19 for if a man find hi enemi will he let him go well away 
wherefor the lord reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me 
thi day 

24 20 and now behold i know well that thou shalt sure be king and 
that the kingdom of israel shall be establish in thine hand 

24 21 swear now therefor unto me by the lord that thou wilt not cut 
off my seed after me and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my 
father s hou 

24 22 and david sware unto saul and saul went home but david and hi 
men gat them up unto the hold 

25 1 and samuel die and all the israelit were gather togeth 
and lament him and buri him in hi hou at ramah and david 
aro and went down to the wilder of paran 

25 2 and there wa a man in maon whose poss were in carmel 
and the man wa veri great and he had three thousand sheep and a 
thousand goat and he wa shear hi sheep in carmel 

25 3 now the name of the man wa nabal and the name of hi wife 
abigail and she wa a woman of good understand and of a beauti 
counten but the man wa churlish and evil in hi do and he 
wa of the hou of caleb 

25 4 and david heard in the wilder that nabal did shear hi sheep 

25 5 and david sent out ten young men and david said unto the young 
men get you up to carmel and go to nabal and greet him in my name 
25 6 and thu shall ye say to him that liveth in prosper peac be 
both to thee and peac be to thine hou and peac be unto all that 
thou hast 

25 7 and now i have heard that thou hast shearer now thi shepherd 
which were with u we hurt them not neither wa there ought miss 
unto them all the while they were in carmel 

25 8 ask thi young men and they will shew thee wherefor let the 
young men find favour in thine eye for we come in a good day give 
i pray thee whatsoev cometh to thine hand unto thi servant and to 
thi son david 

25 9 and when david s young men came they spake to nabal accord to 
all those word in the name of david and cea 

25 10 and nabal answer david s servant and said who is david and 
who is the son of jess there be mani servant now a day that break 
away everi man from hi master 

25 11 shall i then take my bread and my water and my flesh that i 
have kill for my shearer and give it unto men whom i know not 
whenc they be 25 12 so david s young men turn their way and went 
again and came and told him all those say 

25 13 and david said unto hi men gird ye on everi man hi sword and 
they gird on everi man hi sword and david also gird on hi 
sword and there went up after david about four hundr men and two 
hundr abod by the stuff 

25 14 but one of the young men told abigail nabal s wife say 
behold david sent messeng out of the wilder to salut our 
master and he rail on them 

25 15 but the men were veri good unto u and we were not hurt 
neither miss we ani thing a long a we were conver with them 
when we were in the field 25 16 they were a wall unto u both by 
night and day all the while we were with them keep the sheep 

25 17 now therefor know and consid what thou wilt do for evil is 
determin against our master and against all hi household for he 
is such a son of belial that a man cannot speak to him 

25 18 then abigail made hast and took two hundr loaf and two 
bottl of wine and five sheep readi dress and five measur of 
parch corn and an hundr cluster of raisin and two hundr 
cake of fig and laid them on as 

25 19 and she said unto her servant go on befor me behold i come 
after you but she told not her husband nabal 

25 20 and it wa so a she rode on the a that she came down by the 
covert on the hill and behold david and hi men came down against 
her and she met them 

25 21 now david had said sure in vain have i kept all that thi 
fellow hath in the wilder so that noth wa miss of all that 
pertain unto him and he hath requit me evil for good 

25 22 so and more also do god unto the enemi of david if i leav of 
all that pertain to him by the morn light ani that pisseth against 
the wall 

25 23 and when abigail saw david she hast and light off the a 
and fell befor david on her face and bow herself to the ground 
25 24 and fell at hi foot and said upon me my lord upon me let 
thi iniqu be and let thine handmaid i pray thee speak in thine 
audienc and hear the word of thine handmaid 

25 25 let not my lord i pray thee regard thi man of belial even 
nabal for a hi name is so is he nabal is hi name and folli is 
with him but i thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord whom 
thou didst send 

25 26 now therefor my lord a the lord liveth and a thi soul 
liveth see the lord hath withholden thee from come to shed 
blood and from aveng thyself with thine own hand now let thine 
enemi and they that seek evil to my lord be a nabal 

25 27 and now thi bless which thine handmaid hath brought unto my 
lord let it even be given unto the young men that follow my lord 

25 28 i pray thee forgiv the trespass of thine handmaid for the 
lord will certainli make my lord a sure hou becau my lord 
fighteth the battl of the lord and evil hath not been found in thee 
all thi day 

25 29 yet a man is risen to pursu thee and to seek thi soul but the 
soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundl of life with the lord thi 
god and the soul of thine enemi them shall he sling out a out 
of the middl of a sling 

25 30 and it shall come to pa when the lord shall have done to my 
lord accord to all the good that he hath spoken concern thee 
and shall have appoint thee ruler over israel 25 31 that thi shall 
be no grief unto thee nor offenc of heart unto my lord either that 
thou hast shed blood causeless or that my lord hath aveng himself 
but when the lord shall have dealt well with my lord then rememb 
thine handmaid 

25 32 and david said to abigail bless be the lord god of israel 
which sent thee thi day to meet me 25 33 and bless be thi advic 
and bless be thou which hast kept me thi day from come to shed 
blood and from aveng myself with mine own hand 

25 34 for in veri deed a the lord god of israel liveth which hath 
kept me back from hurt thee except thou hadst hast and come to 
meet me sure there had not been left unto nabal by the morn 
light ani that pisseth against the wall 

25 35 so david receiv of her hand that which she had brought him 
and said unto her go up in peac to thine hou see i have 
hearken to thi voic and have accept thi person 

25 36 and abigail came to nabal and behold he held a feast in hi 
hou like the feast of a king and nabal s heart wa merri within 
him for he wa veri drunken wherefor she told him noth le or 
more until the morn light 

25 37 but it came to pa in the morn when the wine wa gone out 
of nabal and hi wife had told him these thing that hi heart die 
within him and he becam a a stone 

25 38 and it came to pa about ten day after that the lord smote 
nabal that he die 

25 39 and when david heard that nabal wa dead he said bless be 
the lord that hath plead the cau of my reproach from the hand of 
nabal and hath kept hi servant from evil for the lord hath return 
the wick of nabal upon hi own head and david sent and commun 
with abigail to take her to him to wife 

25 40 and when the servant of david were come to abigail to carmel 
they spake unto her say david sent u unto thee to take thee to 
him to wife 

25 41 and she aro and bow herself on her face to the earth and 
said behold let thine handmaid be a servant to wash the foot of the 
servant of my lord 

25 42 and abigail hast and aro and rode upon an a with five 
damsel of her that went after her and she went after the messeng 
of david and becam hi wife 

25 43 david also took ahinoam of jezreel and they were also both of 
them hi wife 

25 44 but saul had given michal hi daughter david s wife to phalti 
the son of laish which wa of gallim 

26 1 and the ziphit came unto saul to gibeah say doth not david 
hide himself in the hill of hachilah which is befor jeshimon 26 2 
then saul aro and went down to the wilder of ziph have three 
thousand chosen men of israel with him to seek david in the 
wilder of ziph 

26 3 and saul pitch in the hill of hachilah which is befor 
jeshimon by the way but david abod in the wilder and he saw 
that saul came after him into the wilder 

26 4 david therefor sent out spi and understood that saul wa come 
in veri deed 

26 5 and david aro and came to the place where saul had pitch 
and david beheld the place where saul lay and abner the son of ner 
the captain of hi host and saul lay in the trench and the peopl 
pitch round about him 

26 6 then answer david and said to ahimelech the hittit and to 
abishai the son of zeruiah brother to joab say who will go down 
with me to saul to the camp and abishai said i will go down with 
thee 

26 7 so david and abishai came to the peopl by night and behold 
saul lay sleep within the trench and hi spear stuck in the ground 
at hi bolster but abner and the peopl lay round about him 

26 8 then said abishai to david god hath deliv thine enemi into 
thine hand thi day now therefor let me smite him i pray thee with 
the spear even to the earth at onc and i will not smite him the 
second time 

26 9 and david said to abishai destroy him not for who can stretch 
forth hi hand against the lord s anoint and be guiltless 26 10 
david said furthermor a the lord liveth the lord shall smite him 
or hi day shall come to die or he shall descend into battl and 
perish 

26 11 the lord forbid that i should stretch forth mine hand against 
the lord s anoint but i pray thee take thou now the spear that is 
at hi bolster and the cruse of water and let u go 

26 12 so david took the spear and the cruse of water from saul s 
bolster and they gat them away and no man saw it nor knew it 
neither awak for they were all asleep becau a deep sleep from 
the lord wa fallen upon them 

26 13 then david went over to the other side and stood on the top of 
an hill afar off a great space be between them 26 14 and david 
cri to the peopl and to abner the son of ner say answerest 
thou not abner then abner answer and said who art thou that 
criest to the king 26 15 and david said to abner art not thou a 
valiant man and who is like to thee in israel wherefor then hast 
thou not kept thi lord the king for there came one of the peopl in 
to destroy the king thi lord 

26 16 thi thing is not good that thou hast done a the lord liveth 
ye are worthi to die becau ye have not kept your master the lord s 
anoint 

and now see where the king s spear is and the cruse of water that wa 
at hi bolster 

26 17 and saul knew david s voic and said is thi thi voic my son 
david and david said it is my voic my lord o king 

26 18 and he said wherefor doth my lord thu pursu after hi 
servant for what have i done or what evil is in mine hand 26 19 
now therefor i pray thee let my lord the king hear the word of hi 
servant if the lord have stir thee up against me let him accept 
an offer but if they be the child of men cur be they befor 
the lord for they have driven me out thi day from abid in the 
inherit of the lord say go serv other god 

26 20 now therefor let not my blood fall to the earth befor the 
face of the lord for the king of israel is come out to seek a flea 
a when one doth hunt a partridg in the mountain 

26 21 then said saul i have sin return my son david for i will 
no more do thee harm becau my soul wa preciou in thine eye thi 
day behold i have play the fool and have er exceedingli 

26 22 and david answer and said behold the king s spear and let 
one of the young men come over and fetch it 

26 23 the lord render to everi man hi righteou and hi 
faith for the lord deliv thee into my hand to day but i 
would not stretch forth mine hand against the lord s anoint 

26 24 and behold a thi life wa much set by thi day in mine eye 
so let my life be much set by in the eye of the lord and let him 
deliv me out of all tribul 

26 25 then saul said to david bless be thou my son david thou 
shalt both do great thing and also shalt still prevail so david 
went on hi way and saul return to hi place 

27 1 and david said in hi heart i shall now perish one day by the 
hand of saul there is noth better for me than that i should 
speedili escap into the land of the philistin and saul shall 
despair of me to seek me ani more in ani coast of israel so shall i 
escap out of hi hand 

27 2 and david aro and he pa over with the six hundr men that 
were with him unto achish the son of maoch king of gath 

27 3 and david dwelt with achish at gath he and hi men everi man 
with hi household even david with hi two wife ahinoam the 
jezreelitess and abigail the carmelit nabal s wife 

27 4 and it wa told saul that david wa fled to gath and he sought 
no more again for him 

27 5 and david said unto achish if i have now found grace in thine 
eye let them give me a place in some town in the countri that i may 
dwell there for whi should thi servant dwell in the royal citi with 
thee 27 6 then achish gave him ziklag that day wherefor ziklag 
pertaineth unto the king of judah unto thi day 

27 7 and the time that david dwelt in the countri of the philistin 
wa a full year and four month 

27 8 and david and hi men went up and invad the geshurit and 
the gezrit and the amalekit for those nation were of old the 
inhabit of the land a thou goest to shur even unto the land of 
egypt 

27 9 and david smote the land and left neither man nor woman aliv 
and took away the sheep and the ox and the as and the camel 
and the apparel and return and came to achish 

27 10 and achish said whither have ye made a road to day and david 
said against the south of judah and against the south of the 
jerahmeelit and against the south of the kenit 

27 11 and david save neither man nor woman aliv to bring tide to 
gath say lest they should tell on u say so did david and 
so will be hi manner all the while he dwelleth in the countri of the 
philistin 

27 12 and achish believ david say he hath made hi peopl 
israel utterli to abhor him therefor he shall be my servant for 
ever 

28 1 and it came to pa in those day that the philistin gather 
their armi togeth for warfar to fight with israel and achish 
said unto david know thou assuredli that thou shalt go out with me 
to battl thou and thi men 

28 2 and david said to achish sure thou shalt know what thi servant 
can do and achish said to david therefor will i make thee keeper of 
mine head for ever 

28 3 now samuel wa dead and all israel had lament him and buri 
him in ramah even in hi own citi and saul had put away those that 
had familiar spirit and the wizard out of the land 

28 4 and the philistin gather themselv togeth and came and 
pitch in shunem and saul gather all israel togeth and they 
pitch in gilboa 

28 5 and when saul saw the host of the philistin he wa afraid and 
hi heart greatli trembl 

28 6 and when saul enquir of the lord the lord answer him not 
neither by dream nor by urim nor by prophet 

28 7 then said saul unto hi servant seek me a woman that hath a 
familiar spirit that i may go to her and enquir of her and hi 
servant said to him behold there is a woman that hath a familiar 
spirit at endor 

28 8 and saul disgui himself and put on other raiment and he 
went and two men with him and they came to the woman by night and 
he said i pray thee divin unto me by the familiar spirit and bring 
me him up whom i shall name unto thee 

28 9 and the woman said unto him behold thou knowest what saul hath 
done how he hath cut off those that have familiar spirit and the 
wizard out of the land wherefor then layest thou a snare for my 
life to cau me to die 28 10 and saul sware to her by the lord 
say a the lord liveth there shall no punish happen to thee 
for thi thing 

28 11 then said the woman whom shall i bring up unto thee and he 
said bring me up samuel 

28 12 and when the woman saw samuel she cri with a loud voic and 
the woman spake to saul say whi hast thou deceiv me for thou 
art saul 

28 13 and the king said unto her be not afraid for what sawest thou 
and the woman said unto saul i saw god ascend out of the earth 

28 14 and he said unto her what form is he of and she said an old 
man cometh up and he is cover with a mantl and saul perceiv 
that it wa samuel and he stoop with hi face to the ground and 
bow himself 

28 15 and samuel said to saul whi hast thou disquiet me to bring 
me up and saul answer i am sore distress for the philistin 
make war against me and god is depart from me and answereth me no 
more neither by prophet nor by dream therefor i have call 
thee that thou mayest make known unto me what i shall do 

28 16 then said samuel wherefor then dost thou ask of me see the 
lord is depart from thee and is becom thine enemi 28 17 and the 
lord hath done to him a he spake by me for the lord hath rent the 
kingdom out of thine hand and given it to thi neighbour even to 
david 28 18 becau thou obeyedst not the voic of the lord nor 
executedst hi fierc wrath upon amalek therefor hath the lord done 
thi thing unto thee thi day 

28 19 moreov the lord will also deliv israel with thee into the 
hand of the philistin and to morrow shalt thou and thi son be with 
me the lord also shall deliv the host of israel into the hand of 
the philistin 

28 20 then saul fell straightway all along on the earth and wa sore 
afraid becau of the word of samuel and there wa no strength in 
him for he had eaten no bread all the day nor all the night 

28 21 and the woman came unto saul and saw that he wa sore troubl 
and said unto him behold thine handmaid hath obey thi voic and i 
have put my life in my hand and have hearken unto thi word which 
thou spakest unto me 

28 22 now therefor i pray thee hearken thou also unto the voic of 
thine handmaid and let me set a morsel of bread befor thee and eat 
that thou mayest have strength when thou goest on thi way 

28 23 but he refu and said i will not eat but hi servant 
togeth with the woman compel him and he hearken unto their 
voic so he aro from the earth and sat upon the bed 

28 24 and the woman had a fat calf in the hou and she hast and 
kill it and took flour and knead it and did bake unleaven 
bread thereof 28 25 and she brought it befor saul and befor hi 
servant and they did eat then they rose up and went away that 
night 

29 1 now the philistin gather togeth all their armi to aphek 
and the israelit pitch by a fountain which is in jezreel 

29 2 and the lord of the philistin pa on by hundr and by 
thousand but david and hi men pa on in the rereward with 
achish 

29 3 then said the princ of the philistin what do these hebrew 
here and achish said unto the princ of the philistin is not 
thi david the servant of saul the king of israel which hath been 
with me these day or these year and i have found no fault in him 
sinc he fell unto me unto thi day 29 4 and the princ of the 
philistin were wroth with him and the princ of the philistin 
said unto him make thi fellow return that he may go again to hi 
place which thou hast appoint him and let him not go down with u 
to battl lest in the battl he be an adversari to u for wherewith 
should he reconcil himself unto hi master should it not be with the 
head of these men 29 5 is not thi david of whom they sang one to 
anoth in danc say saul slew hi thousand and david hi ten 
thousand 29 6 then achish call david and said unto him sure 
a the lord liveth thou hast been upright and thi go out and thi 
come in with me in the host is good in my sight for i have not 
found evil in thee sinc the day of thi come unto me unto thi day 
nevertheless the lord favour thee not 

29 7 wherefor now return and go in peac that thou displea not 
the lord of the philistin 

29 8 and david said unto achish but what have i done and what hast 
thou found in thi servant so long a i have been with thee unto thi 
day that i may not go fight against the enemi of my lord the king 
29 9 and achish answer and said to david i know that thou art good 
in my sight a an angel of god notwithstand the princ of the 
philistin have said he shall not go up with u to the battl 

29 10 wherefor now rise up earli in the morn with thi master s 
servant that are come with thee and a soon a ye be up earli in the 
morn and have light depart 

29 11 so david and hi men rose up earli to depart in the morn to 
return into the land of the philistin and the philistin went up 
to jezreel 

30 1 and it came to pa when david and hi men were come to ziklag 
on the third day that the amalekit had invad the south and 
ziklag and smitten ziklag and burn it with fire 30 2 and had 
taken the woman captiv that were therein they slew not ani either 
great or small but carri them away and went on their way 

30 3 so david and hi men came to the citi and behold it wa burn 
with fire and their wife and their son and their daughter were 
taken captiv 

30 4 then david and the peopl that were with him lift up their 
voic and wept until they had no more power to weep 

30 5 and david s two wife were taken captiv ahinoam the 
jezreelitess and abigail the wife of nabal the carmelit 

30 6 and david wa greatli distress for the peopl spake of stone 
him becau the soul of all the peopl wa griev everi man for hi 
son and for hi daughter but david encourag himself in the lord 
hi god 

30 7 and david said to abiathar the priest ahimelech s son i pray 
thee bring me hither the ephod and abiathar brought thither the 
ephod to david 

30 8 and david enquir at the lord say shall i pursu after thi 
troop shall i overtak them and he answer him pursu for thou 
shalt sure overtak them and without fail recov all 

30 9 so david went he and the six hundr men that were with him and 
came to the brook besor where those that were left behind stay 

30 10 but david pursu he and four hundr men for two hundr 
abod behind which were so faint that they could not go over the 
brook besor 

30 11 and they found an egyptian in the field and brought him to 
david and gave him bread and he did eat and they made him drink 
water 30 12 and they gave him a piec of a cake of fig and two 
cluster of raisin and when he had eaten hi spirit came again to 
him for he had eaten no bread nor drunk ani water three day and 
three night 

30 13 and david said unto him to whom belongest thou and whenc art 
thou and he said i am a young man of egypt servant to an amalekit 
and my master left me becau three day agon i fell sick 

30 14 we made an inva upon the south of the cherethit and upon 
the coast which belongeth to judah and upon the south of caleb and 
we burn ziklag with fire 

30 15 and david said to him canst thou bring me down to thi compani 
and he said swear unto me by god that thou wilt neither kill me nor 
deliv me into the hand of my master and i will bring thee down to 
thi compani 

30 16 and when he had brought him down behold they were spread 
abroad upon all the earth eat and drink and danc becau 
of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the 
philistin and out of the land of judah 

30 17 and david smote them from the twilight even unto the even of 
the next day and there escap not a man of them save four hundr 
young men which rode upon camel and fled 

30 18 and david recov all that the amalekit had carri away 
and david rescu hi two wife 

30 19 and there wa noth lack to them neither small nor great 
neither son nor daughter neither spoil nor ani thing that they had 
taken to them david recov all 

30 20 and david took all the flock and the herd which they drave 
befor those other cattl and said thi is david s spoil 

30 21 and david came to the two hundr men which were so faint that 
they could not follow david whom they had made also to abid at the 
brook besor and they went forth to meet david and to meet the peopl 
that were with him and when david came near to the peopl he salut 
them 

30 22 then answer all the wick men and men of belial of those 
that went with david and said becau they went not with u we will 
not give them ought of the spoil that we have recov save to everi 
man hi wife and hi child that they may lead them away and 
depart 

30 23 then said david ye shall not do so my brother with that 
which the lord hath given u who hath preserv u and deliv the 
compani that came against u into our hand 

30 24 for who will hearken unto you in thi matter but a hi part is 
that goeth down to the battl so shall hi part be that tarrieth by 
the stuff they shall part alik 

30 25 and it wa so from that day forward that he made it a statut 
and an ordin for israel unto thi day 

30 26 and when david came to ziklag he sent of the spoil unto the 
elder of judah even to hi friend say behold a present for you 
of the spoil of the enemi of the lord 30 27 to them which were in 
bethel and to them which were in south ramoth and to them which were 
in jattir 30 28 and to them which were in aroer and to them which 
were in siphmoth and to them which were in eshtemoa 30 29 and to 
them which were in rachal and to them which were in the citi of the 
jerahmeelit and to them which were in the citi of the kenit 
30 30 and to them which were in hormah and to them which were in 
chorashan and to them which were in athach 30 31 and to them which 
were in hebron and to all the place where david himself and hi men 
were wont to haunt 

31 1 now the philistin fought against israel and the men of israel 
fled from befor the philistin and fell down slain in mount gilboa 

31 2 and the philistin follow hard upon saul and upon hi son 
and the philistin slew jonathan and abinadab and melchishua 
saul s son 

31 3 and the battl went sore against saul and the archer hit him 
and he wa sore wound of the archer 

31 4 then said saul unto hi armourbear draw thi sword and thrust 
me through therewith lest these uncircumci come and thrust me 
through and abu me but hi armourbear would not for he wa sore 
afraid therefor saul took a sword and fell upon it 

31 5 and when hi armourbear saw that saul wa dead he fell 
likewi upon hi sword and die with him 

31 6 so saul die and hi three son and hi armourbear and all 
hi men that same day togeth 

31 7 and when the men of israel that were on the other side of the 
valley and they that were on the other side jordan saw that the men 
of israel fled and that saul and hi son were dead they forsook the 
citi and fled and the philistin came and dwelt in them 

31 8 and it came to pa on the morrow when the philistin came to 
strip the slain that they found saul and hi three son fallen in 
mount gilboa 

31 9 and they cut off hi head and strip off hi armour and sent 
into the land of the philistin round about to publish it in the 
hou of their idol and among the peopl 

31 10 and they put hi armour in the hou of ashtaroth and they 
fasten hi bodi to the wall of bethshan 

31 11 and when the inhabit of jabeshgilead heard of that which the 
philistin had done to saul 31 12 all the valiant men aro and 
went all night and took the bodi of saul and the bodi of hi son 
from the wall of bethshan and came to jabesh and burnt them there 

31 13 and they took their bone and buri them under a tree at 
jabesh and fast seven day 




the second book of samuel 

otherwi call 

the second book of the king 


1 1 now it came to pa after the death of saul when david wa 
return from the slaughter of the amalekit and david had abod two 
day in ziklag 1 2 it came even to pa on the third day that 
behold a man came out of the camp from saul with hi cloth rent 
and earth upon hi head and so it wa when he came to david that he 
fell to the earth and did obei 

1 3 and david said unto him from whenc comest thou and he said unto 
him out of the camp of israel am i escap 

1 4 and david said unto him how went the matter i pray thee tell 
me 

and he answer that the peopl are fled from the battl and mani of 
the peopl also are fallen and dead and saul and jonathan hi son are 
dead also 

1 5 and david said unto the young man that told him how knowest thou 
that saul and jonathan hi son be dead 1 6 and the young man that 
told him said a i happen by chanc upon mount gilboa behold saul 
lean upon hi spear and lo the chariot and horseman follow 
hard after him 

1 7 and when he look behind him he saw me and call unto me and 
i answer here am i 

1 8 and he said unto me who art thou and i answer him i am an 
amalekit 

1 9 he said unto me again stand i pray thee upon me and slay me 
for anguish is come upon me becau my life is yet whole in me 

1 10 so i stood upon him and slew him becau i wa sure that he 
could not live after that he wa fallen and i took the crown that wa 
upon hi head and the bracelet that wa on hi arm and have brought 
them hither unto my lord 

1 11 then david took hold on hi cloth and rent them and likewi 
all the men that were with him 1 12 and they mourn and wept and 
fast until even for saul and for jonathan hi son and for the 
peopl of the lord and for the hou of israel becau they were 
fallen by the sword 

1 13 and david said unto the young man that told him whenc art thou 
and he answer i am the son of a stranger an amalekit 

1 14 and david said unto him how wast thou not afraid to stretch 
forth thine hand to destroy the lord s anoint 1 15 and david 
call one of the young men and said go near and fall upon him and 
he smote him that he die 

1 16 and david said unto him thi blood be upon thi head for thi 
mouth hath testifi against thee say i have slain the lord s 
anoint 

1 17 and david lament with thi lament over saul and over 
jonathan hi son 1 18 also he bade them teach the child of judah 
the use of the bow behold it is written in the book of jasher 
1 19 the beauti of israel is slain upon thi high place how are the 
mighti fallen 1 20 tell it not in gath publish it not in the 
street of askelon lest the daughter of the philistin rejoic 
lest the daughter of the uncircumci triumph 

1 21 ye mountain of gilboa let there be no dew neither let there be 
rain upon you nor field of offer for there the shield of the 
mighti is vile cast away the shield of saul a though he had not 
been anoint with oil 

1 22 from the blood of the slain from the fat of the mighti the bow 
of jonathan turn not back and the sword of saul return not empti 

1 23 saul and jonathan were love and pleasant in their life and in 
their death they were not divid they were swifter than eagl they 
were stronger than lion 

1 24 ye daughter of israel weep over saul who cloth you in 
scarlet with other delight who put on ornament of gold upon your 
apparel 

1 25 how are the mighti fallen in the midst of the battl o jonathan 
thou wast slain in thine high place 

1 26 i am distress for thee my brother jonathan veri pleasant hast 
thou been unto me thi love to me wa wonder pa the love of 
woman 

1 27 how are the mighti fallen and the weapon of war perish 2 1 
and it came to pa after thi that david enquir of the lord 
say shall i go up into ani of the citi of judah and the lord 
said unto him go up and david said whither shall i go up and he 
said unto hebron 

2 2 so david went up thither and hi two wife also ahinoam the 
jezreelitess and abigail nabal s wife the carmelit 

2 3 and hi men that were with him did david bring up everi man with 
hi household and they dwelt in the citi of hebron 

2 4 and the men of judah came and there they anoint david king over 
the hou of judah and they told david say that the men of 
jabeshgilead were they that buri saul 

2 5 and david sent messeng unto the men of jabeshgilead and said 
unto them bless be ye of the lord that ye have shew thi 
kind unto your lord even unto saul and have buri him 

2 6 and now the lord shew kind and truth unto you and i also will 
requit you thi kind becau ye have done thi thing 

2 7 therefor now let your hand be strengthen and be ye valiant 
for your master saul is dead and also the hou of judah have 
anoint me king over them 

2 8 but abner the son of ner captain of saul s host took ishbosheth 
the son of saul and brought him over to mahanaim 2 9 and made him 
king over gilead and over the ashurit and over jezreel and over 
ephraim and over benjamin and over all israel 

2 10 ishbosheth saul s son wa forti year old when he began to reign 
over israel and reign two year but the hou of judah follow 
david 

2 11 and the time that david wa king in hebron over the hou of 
judah wa seven year and six month 

2 12 and abner the son of ner and the servant of ishbosheth the son 
of saul went out from mahanaim to gibeon 

2 13 and joab the son of zeruiah and the servant of david went out 
and met togeth by the pool of gibeon and they sat down the one on 
the one side of the pool and the other on the other side of the pool 

2 14 and abner said to joab let the young men now ari and play 
befor u and joab said let them ari 

2 15 then there aro and went over by number twelv of benjamin 
which pertain to ishbosheth the son of saul and twelv of the 
servant of david 

2 16 and they caught everi one hi fellow by the head and thrust hi 
sword in hi fellow s side so they fell down togeth wherefor that 
place wa call helkathhazzurim which is in gibeon 

2 17 and there wa a veri sore battl that day and abner wa beaten 
and the men of israel befor the servant of david 

2 18 and there were three son of zeruiah there joab and abishai 
and asahel and asahel wa a light of foot a a wild roe 

2 19 and asahel pursu after abner and in go he turn not to the 
right hand nor to the left from follow abner 

2 20 then abner look behind him and said art thou asahel and he 
answer i am 

2 21 and abner said to him turn thee asid to thi right hand or to 
thi left and lay thee hold on one of the young men and take thee hi 
armour 

but asahel would not turn asid from follow of him 

2 22 and abner said again to asahel turn thee asid from follow 
me wherefor should i smite thee to the ground how then should i 
hold up my face to joab thi brother 2 23 howbeit he refu to turn 
asid wherefor abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him 
under the fifth rib that the spear came out behind him and he fell 
down there and die in the same place and it came to pa that a 
mani a came to the place where asahel fell down and die stood still 

2 24 joab also and abishai pursu after abner and the sun went down 
when they were come to the hill of ammah that lieth befor giah by 
the way of the wilder of gibeon 

2 25 and the child of benjamin gather themselv togeth after 
abner and becam one troop and stood on the top of an hill 

2 26 then abner call to joab and said shall the sword devour for 
ever knowest thou not that it will be bitter in the latter end 
how long shall it be then ere thou bid the peopl return from 
follow their brother 2 27 and joab said a god liveth unless 
thou hadst spoken sure then in the morn the peopl had gone up 
everi one from follow hi brother 

2 28 so joab blew a trumpet and all the peopl stood still and 
pursu after israel no more neither fought they ani more 

2 29 and abner and hi men walk all that night through the plain 
and pa over jordan and went through all bithron and they came to 
mahanaim 

2 30 and joab return from follow abner and when he had gather 
all the peopl togeth there lack of david s servant nineteen men 
and asahel 

2 31 but the servant of david had smitten of benjamin and of abner s 
men so that three hundr and threescor men die 

2 32 and they took up asahel and buri him in the sepulchr of hi 
father which wa in bethlehem and joab and hi men went all night 
and they came to hebron at break of day 

3 1 now there wa long war between the hou of saul and the hou of 
david but david wax stronger and stronger and the hou of saul 
wax weaker and weaker 

3 2 and unto david were son born in hebron and hi firstborn wa 
amnon of ahinoam the jezreelitess 3 3 and hi second chileab of 
abigail the wife of nabal the carmelit and the third absalom the 
son of maacah the daughter of talmai king of geshur 3 4 and the 
fourth adonijah the son of haggith and the fifth shephatiah the son 
of abit 3 5 and the sixth ithream by eglah david s wife these 
were born to david in hebron 

3 6 and it came to pa while there wa war between the hou of saul 
and the hou of david that abner made himself strong for the hou 
of saul 

3 7 and saul had a concubin whose name wa rizpah the daughter of 
aiah and ishbosheth said to abner wherefor hast thou gone in unto 
my father s concubin 3 8 then wa abner veri wroth for the word of 
ishbosheth and said am i a dog s head which against judah do shew 
kind thi day unto the hou of saul thi father to hi brother 
and to hi friend and have not deliv thee into the hand of 
david that thou chargest me to day with a fault concern thi 
woman 3 9 so do god to abner and more also except a the lord 
hath sworn to david even so i do to him 3 10 to translat the 
kingdom from the hou of saul and to set up the throne of david over 
israel and over judah from dan even to beersheba 

3 11 and he could not answer abner a word again becau he fear 
him 

3 12 and abner sent messeng to david on hi behalf say whose 
is the land say also make thi leagu with me and behold my 
hand shall be with thee to bring about all israel unto thee 

3 13 and he said well i will make a leagu with thee but one thing 
i requir of thee that is thou shalt not see my face except thou 
first bring michal saul s daughter when thou comest to see my face 

3 14 and david sent messeng to ishbosheth saul s son say 
deliv me my wife michal which i espou to me for an hundr 
foreskin of the philistin 

3 15 and ishbosheth sent and took her from her husband even from 
phaltiel the son of laish 

3 16 and her husband went with her along weep behind her to 
bahurim 

then said abner unto him go return and he return 

3 17 and abner had commun with the elder of israel say ye 
sought for david in time past to be king over you 3 18 now then do 
it for the lord hath spoken of david say by the hand of my 
servant david i will save my peopl israel out of the hand of the 
philistin and out of the hand of all their enemi 

3 19 and abner also spake in the ear of benjamin and abner went also 
to speak in the ear of david in hebron all that seem good to 
israel and that seem good to the whole hou of benjamin 

3 20 so abner came to david to hebron and twenti men with him and 
david made abner and the men that were with him a feast 

3 21 and abner said unto david i will ari and go and will gather 
all israel unto my lord the king that they may make a leagu with 
thee and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth 
and david sent abner away and he went in peac 

3 22 and behold the servant of david and joab came from pursu a 
troop and brought in a great spoil with them but abner wa not with 
david in hebron for he had sent him away and he wa gone in peac 

3 23 when joab and all the host that wa with him were come they told 
joab say abner the son of ner came to the king and he hath sent 
him away and he is gone in peac 

3 24 then joab came to the king and said what hast thou done 
behold abner came unto thee whi is it that thou hast sent him away 
and he is quit gone 3 25 thou knowest abner the son of ner that he 
came to deceiv thee and to know thi go out and thi come in and 
to know all that thou doest 

3 26 and when joab wa come out from david he sent messeng after 
abner which brought him again from the well of sirah but david knew 
it not 

3 27 and when abner wa return to hebron joab took him asid in the 
gate to speak with him quietli and smote him there under the fifth 
rib that he die for the blood of asahel hi brother 

3 28 and afterward when david heard it he said i and my kingdom are 
guiltless befor the lord for ever from the blood of abner the son of 
ner 3 29 let it rest on the head of joab and on all hi father s 
hou and let there not fail from the hou of joab one that hath an 
issu or that is a leper or that leaneth on a staff or that falleth 
on the sword or that lacketh bread 

3 30 so joab and abishai hi brother slew abner becau he had slain 
their brother asahel at gibeon in the battl 

3 31 and david said to joab and to all the peopl that were with him 
rend your cloth and gird you with sackcloth and mourn befor 
abner and king david himself follow the bier 

3 32 and they buri abner in hebron and the king lift up hi 
voic and wept at the grave of abner and all the peopl wept 

3 33 and the king lament over abner and said die abner a a fool 
dieth 3 34 thi hand were not bound nor thi foot put into fetter 
a a man falleth befor wick men so fellest thou and all the 
peopl wept again over him 

3 35 and when all the peopl came to cau david to eat meat while it 
wa yet day david sware say so do god to me and more also if i 
tast bread or ought el till the sun be down 

3 36 and all the peopl took notic of it and it plea them a 
whatsoev the king did plea all the peopl 

3 37 for all the peopl and all israel understood that day that it wa 
not of the king to slay abner the son of ner 

3 38 and the king said unto hi servant know ye not that there is a 
princ and a great man fallen thi day in israel 3 39 and i am thi 
day weak though anoint king and these men the son of zeruiah be 
too hard for me the lord shall reward the doer of evil accord to 
hi wick 

4 1 and when saul s son heard that abner wa dead in hebron hi hand 
were feebl and all the israelit were troubl 

4 2 and saul s son had two men that were captain of band the name 
of the one wa baanah and the name of the other rechab the son of 
rimmon a beerothit of the child of benjamin for beeroth also 
wa reckon to benjamin 

4 3 and the beerothit fled to gittaim and were sojourn there 
until thi day 4 4 and jonathan saul s son had a son that wa 
lame of hi foot he wa five year old when the tide came of saul 
and jonathan out of jezreel and hi nur took him up and fled and 
it came to pa a she made hast to flee that he fell and becam 
lame and hi name wa mephibosheth 

4 5 and the son of rimmon the beerothit rechab and baanah went 
and came about the heat of the day to the hou of ishbosheth who lay 
on a bed at noon 

4 6 and they came thither into the midst of the hou a though they 
would have fetch wheat and they smote him under the fifth rib and 
rechab and baanah hi brother escap 

4 7 for when they came into the hou he lay on hi bed in hi 
bedchamb and they smote him and slew him and behead him and 
took hi head and gat them away through the plain all night 

4 8 and they brought the head of ishbosheth unto david to hebron and 
said to the king behold the head of ishbosheth the son of saul thine 
enemi which sought thi life and the lord hath aveng my lord the 
king thi day of saul and of hi seed 

4 9 and david answer rechab and baanah hi brother the son of 
rimmon the beerothit and said unto them a the lord liveth who 
hath redeem my soul out of all adver 4 10 when one told me 
say behold saul is dead think to have brought good tide i 
took hold of him and slew him in ziklag who thought that i would 
have given him a reward for hi tide 4 11 how much more when 
wick men have slain a righteou person in hi own hou upon hi 
bed shall i not therefor now requir hi blood of your hand and 
take you away from the earth 4 12 and david command hi young men 
and they slew them and cut off their hand and their foot and hang 
them up over the pool in hebron but they took the head of ishbosheth 
and buri it in the sepulchr of abner in hebron 

5 1 then came all the tribe of israel to david unto hebron and 
spake say behold we are thi bone and thi flesh 

5 2 also in time past when saul wa king over u thou wast he that 
leddest out and broughtest in israel and the lord said to thee thou 
shalt feed my peopl israel and thou shalt be a captain over israel 

5 3 so all the elder of israel came to the king to hebron and king 
david made a leagu with them in hebron befor the lord and they 
anoint david king over israel 

5 4 david wa thirti year old when he began to reign and he reign 
forti year 

5 5 in hebron he reign over judah seven year and six month and in 
jerusalem he reign thirti and three year over all israel and judah 

5 6 and the king and hi men went to jerusalem unto the jebusit the 
inhabit of the land which spake unto david say except thou 
take away the blind and the lame thou shalt not come in hither 
think david cannot come in hither 

5 7 nevertheless david took the strong hold of zion the same is the 
citi of david 

5 8 and david said on that day whosoev getteth up to the gutter 
and smiteth the jebusit and the lame and the blind that are hate 
of david s soul he shall be chief and captain wherefor they said 
the blind and the lame shall not come into the hou 

5 9 so david dwelt in the fort and call it the citi of david and 
david built round about from millo and inward 

5 10 and david went on and grew great and the lord god of host wa 
with him 

5 11 and hiram king of tyre sent messeng to david and cedar tree 
and carpent and mason and they built david an hou 

5 12 and david perceiv that the lord had establish him king over 
israel and that he had exalt hi kingdom for hi peopl israel s 
sake 

5 13 and david took him more concubin and wife out of jerusalem 
after he wa come from hebron and there were yet son and daughter 
born to david 

5 14 and these be the name of those that were born unto him in 
jerusalem shammuah and shobab and nathan and solomon 5 15 ibhar 
also and elishua and nepheg and japhia 5 16 and elishama and 
eliada and eliphalet 

5 17 but when the philistin heard that they had anoint david king 
over israel all the philistin came up to seek david and david 
heard of it and went down to the hold 

5 18 the philistin also came and spread themselv in the valley of 
rephaim 

5 19 and david enquir of the lord say shall i go up to the 
philistin wilt thou deliv them into mine hand and the lord said 
unto david go up for i will doubtless deliv the philistin into 
thine hand 

5 20 and david came to baalperazim and david smote them there and 
said the lord hath broken forth upon mine enemi befor me a the 
breach of water therefor he call the name of that place 
baalperazim 

5 21 and there they left their imag and david and hi men burn 
them 

5 22 and the philistin came up yet again and spread themselv in 
the valley of rephaim 

5 23 and when david enquir of the lord he said thou shalt not go 
up but fetch a compass behind them and come upon them over against 
the mulberri tree 

5 24 and let it be when thou hearest the sound of a go in the top 
of the mulberri tree that then thou shalt bestir thyself for then 
shall the lord go out befor thee to smite the host of the 
philistin 

5 25 and david did so a the lord had command him and smote the 
philistin from geba until thou come to gazer 

6 1 again david gather togeth all the chosen men of israel 
thirti thousand 

6 2 and david aro and went with all the peopl that were with him 
from baal of judah to bring up from thenc the ark of god whose 
name is call by the name of the lord of host that dwelleth between 
the cherub 

6 3 and they set the ark of god upon a new cart and brought it out of 
the hou of abinadab that wa in gibeah and uzzah and ahio the son 
of abinadab drave the new cart 

6 4 and they brought it out of the hou of abinadab which wa at 
gibeah accompani the ark of god and ahio went befor the ark 

6 5 and david and all the hou of israel play befor the lord on 
all manner of instrument made of fir wood even on harp and on 
psalteri and on timbrel and on cornet and on cymbal 

6 6 and when they came to nachon s threshingfloor uzzah put forth hi 
hand to the ark of god and took hold of it for the ox shook it 

6 7 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against uzzah and god smote 
him there for hi error and there he die by the ark of god 

6 8 and david wa displea becau the lord had made a breach upon 
uzzah and he call the name of the place perezuzzah to thi day 

6 9 and david wa afraid of the lord that day and said how shall the 
ark of the lord come to me 6 10 so david would not remov the ark of 
the lord unto him into the citi of david but david carri it asid 
into the hou of obededom the gittit 

6 11 and the ark of the lord continu in the hou of obededom the 
gittit three month and the lord bless obededom and all hi 
household 

6 12 and it wa told king david say the lord hath bless the 
hou of obededom and all that pertaineth unto him becau of the 
ark of god so david went and brought up the ark of god from the hou 
of obededom into the citi of david with glad 

6 13 and it wa so that when they that bare the ark of the lord had 
gone six pace he sacrif ox and fatl 

6 14 and david danc befor the lord with all hi might and david 
wa gird with a linen ephod 

6 15 so david and all the hou of israel brought up the ark of the 
lord with shout and with the sound of the trumpet 

6 16 and a the ark of the lord came into the citi of david michal 
saul s daughter look through a window and saw king david leap 
and danc befor the lord and she despi him in her heart 

6 17 and they brought in the ark of the lord and set it in hi place 
in the midst of the tabernacl that david had pitch for it and 
david offer burnt offer and peac offer befor the lord 

6 18 and a soon a david had made an end of offer burnt offer 
and peac offer he bless the peopl in the name of the lord of 
host 

6 19 and he dealt among all the peopl even among the whole multitud 
of israel a well to the woman a men to everi one a cake of bread 
and a good piec of flesh and a flagon of wine so all the peopl 
depart everi one to hi hou 

6 20 then david return to bless hi household and michal the 
daughter of saul came out to meet david and said how gloriou wa 
the king of israel to day who uncov himself to day in the eye of 
the handmaid of hi servant a one of the vain fellow shamelessli 
uncovereth himself 6 21 and david said unto michal it wa befor 
the lord which chose me befor thi father and befor all hi hou 
to appoint me ruler over the peopl of the lord over israel 
therefor will i play befor the lord 

6 22 and i will yet be more vile than thu and will be base in mine 
own sight and of the maidserv which thou hast spoken of of them 
shall i be had in honour 

6 23 therefor michal the daughter of saul had no child unto the day 
of her death 

7 1 and it came to pa when the king sat in hi hou and the lord 
had given him rest round about from all hi enemi 7 2 that the king 
said unto nathan the prophet see now i dwell in an hou of cedar 
but the ark of god dwelleth within curtain 

7 3 and nathan said to the king go do all that is in thine heart 
for the lord is with thee 

7 4 and it came to pa that night that the word of the lord came 
unto nathan say 7 5 go and tell my servant david thu saith the 
lord shalt thou build me an hou for me to dwell in 7 6 wherea i 
have not dwelt in ani hou sinc the time that i brought up the 
child of israel out of egypt even to thi day but have walk in 
a tent and in a tabernacl 

7 7 in all the place wherein i have walk with all the child of 
israel spake i a word with ani of the tribe of israel whom i 
command to feed my peopl israel say whi build ye not me an 
hou of cedar 7 8 now therefor so shalt thou say unto my servant 
david thu saith the lord of host i took thee from the sheepcot 
from follow the sheep to be ruler over my peopl over israel 7 9 
and i wa with thee whithersoev thou wentest and have cut off all 
thine enemi out of thi sight and have made thee a great name like 
unto the name of the great men that are in the earth 

7 10 moreov i will appoint a place for my peopl israel and will 
plant them that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no 
more neither shall the child of wick afflict them ani more 
a beforetim 7 11 and a sinc the time that i command judg to 
be over my peopl israel and have cau thee to rest from all thine 
enemi also the lord telleth thee that he will make thee an hou 

7 12 and when thi day be fulfil and thou shalt sleep with thi 
father i will set up thi seed after thee which shall proceed out of 
thi bowel and i will establish hi kingdom 

7 13 he shall build an hou for my name and i will stablish the 
throne of hi kingdom for ever 

7 14 i will be hi father and he shall be my son if he commit 
iniqu i will chasten him with the rod of men and with the stripe 
of the child of men 7 15 but my merci shall not depart away from 
him a i took it from saul whom i put away befor thee 

7 16 and thine hou and thi kingdom shall be establish for ever 
befor thee thi throne shall be establish for ever 

7 17 accord to all these word and accord to all thi vision 
so did nathan speak unto david 

7 18 then went king david in and sat befor the lord and he said 
who am i o lord god and what is my hou that thou hast brought me 
hitherto 7 19 and thi wa yet a small thing in thi sight o lord 
god but thou hast spoken also of thi servant s hou for a great 
while to come and is thi the manner of man o lord god 7 20 and 
what can david say more unto thee for thou lord god knowest thi 
servant 

7 21 for thi word s sake and accord to thine own heart hast thou 
done all these great thing to make thi servant know them 

7 22 wherefor thou art great o lord god for there is none like 
thee neither is there ani god besid thee accord to all that we 
have heard with our ear 

7 23 and what one nation in the earth is like thi peopl even like 
israel whom god went to redeem for a peopl to himself and to make 
him a name and to do for you great thing and terribl for thi land 
befor thi peopl which thou redeemedst to thee from egypt from the 
nation and their god 7 24 for thou hast confirm to thyself thi 
peopl israel to be a peopl unto thee for ever and thou lord art 
becom their god 

7 25 and now o lord god the word that thou hast spoken concern 
thi servant and concern hi hou establish it for ever and do 
a thou hast said 

7 26 and let thi name be magnifi for ever say the lord of host 
is the god over israel and let the hou of thi servant david be 
establish befor thee 

7 27 for thou o lord of host god of israel hast reveal to thi 
servant say i will build thee an hou therefor hath thi 
servant found in hi heart to pray thi prayer unto thee 

7 28 and now o lord god thou art that god and thi word be true 
and thou hast promi thi good unto thi servant 7 29 therefor 
now let it plea thee to bless the hou of thi servant that it may 
continu for ever befor thee for thou o lord god hast spoken it 
and with thi bless let the hou of thi servant be bless for 
ever 

8 1 and after thi it came to pa that david smote the philistin 
and subdu them and david took methegammah out of the hand of the 
philistin 

8 2 and he smote moab and measur them with a line cast them 
down to the ground even with two line measur he to put to death 
and with one full line to keep aliv and so the moabit becam 
david s servant and brought gift 

8 3 david smote also hadadez the son of rehob king of zobah a he 
went to recov hi border at the river euphrat 

8 4 and david took from him a thousand chariot and seven hundr 
horseman and twenti thousand footman and david hough all the 
chariot hor but reserv of them for an hundr chariot 

8 5 and when the syrian of damascu came to succour hadadez king of 
zobah david slew of the syrian two and twenti thousand men 

8 6 then david put garrison in syria of damascu and the syrian 
becam servant to david and brought gift and the lord preserv 
david whithersoev he went 

8 7 and david took the shield of gold that were on the servant of 
hadadez and brought them to jerusalem 

8 8 and from betah and from berothai citi of hadadez king david 
took exceed much brass 

8 9 when toi king of hamath heard that david had smitten all the host 
of hadadez 8 10 then toi sent joram hi son unto king david to 
salut him and to bless him becau he had fought against hadadez 
and smitten him for hadadez had war with toi and joram brought 
with him vessel of silver and vessel of gold and vessel of brass 
8 11 which also king david did dedic unto the lord with the silver 
and gold that he had dedic of all nation which he subdu 8 12 
of syria and of moab and of the child of ammon and of the 
philistin and of amalek and of the spoil of hadadez son of 
rehob king of zobah 

8 13 and david gat him a name when he return from smite of the 
syrian in the valley of salt be eighteen thousand men 

8 14 and he put garrison in edom throughout all edom put he 
garrison and all they of edom becam david s servant and the lord 
preserv david whithersoev he went 

8 15 and david reign over all israel and david execut judgment 
and justic unto all hi peopl 

8 16 and joab the son of zeruiah wa over the host and jehoshaphat 
the son of ahilud wa record 8 17 and zadok the son of ahitub and 
ahimelech the son of abiathar were the priest and seraiah wa the 
scribe 8 18 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over both the 
cherethit and the pelethit and david s son were chief ruler 

9 1 and david said is there yet ani that is left of the hou of 
saul that i may shew him kind for jonathan s sake 9 2 and there 
wa of the hou of saul a servant whose name wa ziba and when they 
had call him unto david the king said unto him art thou ziba and 
he said thi servant is he 

9 3 and the king said is there not yet ani of the hou of saul that 
i may shew the kind of god unto him and ziba said unto the king 
jonathan hath yet a son which is lame on hi foot 

9 4 and the king said unto him where is he and ziba said unto the 
king behold he is in the hou of machir the son of ammiel in 
lodebar 

9 5 then king david sent and fetch him out of the hou of machir 
the son of ammiel from lodebar 

9 6 now when mephibosheth the son of jonathan the son of saul wa 
come unto david he fell on hi face and did rever and david 
said mephibosheth and he answer behold thi servant 9 7 and 
david said unto him fear not for i will sure shew thee kind 
for jonathan thi father s sake and will restor thee all the land of 
saul thi father and thou shalt eat bread at my tabl continu 

9 8 and he bow himself and said what is thi servant that thou 
shouldest look upon such a dead dog a i am 9 9 then the king call 
to ziba saul s servant and said unto him i have given unto thi 
master s son all that pertain to saul and to all hi hou 

9 10 thou therefor and thi son and thi servant shall till the 
land for him and thou shalt bring in the fruit that thi master s 
son may have food to eat but mephibosheth thi master s son shall eat 
bread alway at my tabl now ziba had fifteen son and twenti 
servant 

9 11 then said ziba unto the king accord to all that my lord the 
king hath command hi servant so shall thi servant do a for 
mephibosheth said the king he shall eat at my tabl a one of the 
king s son 

9 12 and mephibosheth had a young son whose name wa micha and all 
that dwelt in the hou of ziba were servant unto mephibosheth 

9 13 so mephibosheth dwelt in jerusalem for he did eat continu at 
the king s tabl and wa lame on both hi foot 

10 1 and it came to pa after thi that the king of the child of 
ammon die and hanun hi son reign in hi stead 

10 2 then said david i will shew kind unto hanun the son of 
nahash a hi father shew kind unto me and david sent to 
comfort him by the hand of hi servant for hi father and david s 
servant came into the land of the child of ammon 

10 3 and the princ of the child of ammon said unto hanun their 
lord thinkest thou that david doth honour thi father that he hath 
sent comfort unto thee hath not david rather sent hi servant 
unto thee to search the citi and to spi it out and to overthrow it 
10 4 wherefor hanun took david s servant and shave off the one 
half of their beard and cut off their garment in the middl even 
to their buttock and sent them away 

10 5 when they told it unto david he sent to meet them becau the 
men were greatli asham and the king said tarri at jericho until 
your beard be grown and then return 

10 6 and when the child of ammon saw that they stank befor david 
the child of ammon sent and hire the syrian of bethrehob and the 
syrian of zoba twenti thousand footman and of king maacah a 
thousand men and of ishtob twelv thousand men 

10 7 and when david heard of it he sent joab and all the host of the 
mighti men 

10 8 and the child of ammon came out and put the battl in array 
at the enter in of the gate and the syrian of zoba and of rehob 
and ishtob and maacah were by themselv in the field 

10 9 when joab saw that the front of the battl wa against him befor 
and behind he chose of all the choic men of israel and put them in 
array against the syrian 10 10 and the rest of the peopl he 
deliv into the hand of abishai hi brother that he might put them 
in array against the child of ammon 

10 11 and he said if the syrian be too strong for me then thou 
shalt help me but if the child of ammon be too strong for thee 
then i will come and help thee 

10 12 be of good courag and let u play the men for our peopl and 
for the citi of our god and the lord do that which seemeth him 
good 

10 13 and joab drew nigh and the peopl that were with him unto the 
battl against the syrian and they fled befor him 

10 14 and when the child of ammon saw that the syrian were fled 
then fled they also befor abishai and enter into the citi so joab 
return from the child of ammon and came to jerusalem 

10 15 and when the syrian saw that they were smitten befor israel 
they gather themselv togeth 

10 16 and hadarez sent and brought out the syrian that were beyond 
the river and they came to helam and shobach the captain of the host 
of hadarez went befor them 

10 17 and when it wa told david he gather all israel togeth and 
pa over jordan and came to helam and the syrian set themselv 
in array against david and fought with him 

10 18 and the syrian fled befor israel and david slew the men of 
seven hundr chariot of the syrian and forti thousand horseman 
and smote shobach the captain of their host who die there 

10 19 and when all the king that were servant to hadarez saw that 
they were smitten befor israel they made peac with israel and 
serv them so the syrian fear to help the child of ammon ani 
more 

11 1 and it came to pa after the year wa expir at the time when 
king go forth to battl that david sent joab and hi servant with 
him and all israel and they destroy the child of ammon and 
besieg rabbah but david tarri still at jerusalem 

11 2 and it came to pa in an eveningtid that david aro from off 
hi bed and walk upon the roof of the king s hou and from the 
roof he saw a woman wash herself and the woman wa veri beauti 
to look upon 

11 3 and david sent and enquir after the woman and one said is not 
thi bathsheba the daughter of eliam the wife of uriah the hittit 
11 4 and david sent messeng and took her and she came in unto 
him and he lay with her for she wa purifi from her unclean 
and she return unto her hou 

11 5 and the woman conceiv and sent and told david and said i am 
with child 

11 6 and david sent to joab say send me uriah the hittit and 
joab sent uriah to david 

11 7 and when uriah wa come unto him david demand of him how joab 
did and how the peopl did and how the war prosper 

11 8 and david said to uriah go down to thi hou and wash thi foot 
and uriah depart out of the king s hou and there follow him a 
mess of meat from the king 

11 9 but uriah slept at the door of the king s hou with all the 
servant of hi lord and went not down to hi hou 

11 10 and when they had told david say uriah went not down unto 
hi hou david said unto uriah camest thou not from thi journey 
whi then didst thou not go down unto thine hou 11 11 and uriah 
said unto david the ark and israel and judah abid in tent and 
my lord joab and the servant of my lord are encamp in the open 
field shall i then go into mine hou to eat and to drink and to 
lie with my wife a thou livest and a thi soul liveth i will not 
do thi thing 

11 12 and david said to uriah tarri here to day also and to morrow i 
will let thee depart so uriah abod in jerusalem that day and the 
morrow 

11 13 and when david had call him he did eat and drink befor him 
and he made him drunk and at even he went out to lie on hi bed with 
the servant of hi lord but went not down to hi hou 

11 14 and it came to pa in the morn that david wrote a letter to 
joab and sent it by the hand of uriah 

11 15 and he wrote in the letter say set ye uriah in the 
forefront of the hottest battl and retir ye from him that he may 
be smitten and die 

11 16 and it came to pa when joab observ the citi that he 
assign uriah unto a place where he knew that valiant men were 

11 17 and the men of the citi went out and fought with joab and 
there fell some of the peopl of the servant of david and uriah the 
hittit die also 

11 18 then joab sent and told david all the thing concern the war 
11 19 and charg the messeng say when thou hast made an end of 
tell the matter of the war unto the king 11 20 and if so be that 
the king s wrath ari and he say unto thee wherefor approach ye 
so nigh unto the citi when ye did fight knew ye not that they would 
shoot from the wall 11 21 who smote abimelech the son of 
jerubbesheth did not a woman cast a piec of a millston upon him 
from the wall that he die in thebez whi went ye nigh the wall then 
say thou thi servant uriah the hittit is dead also 

11 22 so the messeng went and came and shew david all that joab 
had sent him for 

11 23 and the messeng said unto david sure the men prevail 
against u and came out unto u into the field and we were upon them 
even unto the enter of the gate 

11 24 and the shooter shot from off the wall upon thi servant and 
some of the king s servant be dead and thi servant uriah the hittit
