is dead also 

11 25 then david said unto the messeng thu shalt thou say unto 
joab let not thi thing displea thee for the sword devoureth one 
a well a anoth make thi battl more strong against the citi and 
overthrow it and encourag thou him 

11 26 and when the wife of uriah heard that uriah her husband wa 
dead she mourn for her husband 

11 27 and when the mourn wa past david sent and fetch her to 
hi hou and she becam hi wife and bare him a son but the thing 
that david had done displea the lord 

12 1 and the lord sent nathan unto david and he came unto him and 
said unto him there were two men in one citi the one rich and the 
other poor 

12 2 the rich man had exceed mani flock and herd 12 3 but the 
poor man had noth save one littl ewe lamb which he had bought 
and nourish up and it grew up togeth with him and with hi 
child it did eat of hi own meat and drank of hi own cup and 
lay in hi bosom and wa unto him a a daughter 

12 4 and there came a travel unto the rich man and he spare to 
take of hi own flock and of hi own herd to dress for the wayfar 
man that wa come unto him but took the poor man s lamb and dress 
it for the man that wa come to him 

12 5 and david s anger wa greatli kindl against the man and he 
said to nathan a the lord liveth the man that hath done thi thing 
shall sure die 12 6 and he shall restor the lamb fourfold becau 
he did thi thing and becau he had no piti 

12 7 and nathan said to david thou art the man thu saith the lord 
god of israel i anoint thee king over israel and i deliv thee 
out of the hand of saul 12 8 and i gave thee thi master s hou and 
thi master s wife into thi bosom and gave thee the hou of israel 
and of judah and if that had been too littl i would moreov have 
given unto thee such and such thing 

12 9 wherefor hast thou despi the command of the lord to do 
evil in hi sight thou hast kill uriah the hittit with the sword 
and hast taken hi wife to be thi wife and hast slain him with the 
sword of the child of ammon 

12 10 now therefor the sword shall never depart from thine hou 
becau thou hast despi me and hast taken the wife of uriah the 
hittit to be thi wife 

12 11 thu saith the lord behold i will rai up evil against thee 
out of thine own hou and i will take thi wife befor thine eye 
and give them unto thi neighbour and he shall lie with thi wife in 
the sight of thi sun 

12 12 for thou didst it secretli but i will do thi thing befor all 
israel and befor the sun 

12 13 and david said unto nathan i have sin against the lord and 
nathan said unto david the lord also hath put away thi sin thou 
shalt not die 

12 14 howbeit becau by thi deed thou hast given great occa to 
the enemi of the lord to blasphem the child also that is born unto 
thee shall sure die 

12 15 and nathan depart unto hi hou and the lord struck the 
child that uriah s wife bare unto david and it wa veri sick 

12 16 david therefor besought god for the child and david fast 
and went in and lay all night upon the earth 

12 17 and the elder of hi hou aro and went to him to rai him 
up from the earth but he would not neither did he eat bread with 
them 

12 18 and it came to pa on the seventh day that the child die and 
the servant of david fear to tell him that the child wa dead for 
they said behold while the child wa yet aliv we spake unto him 
and he would not hearken unto our voic how will he then vex himself 
if we tell him that the child is dead 12 19 but when david saw that 
hi servant whisper david perceiv that the child wa dead 
therefor david said unto hi servant is the child dead and they 
said he is dead 

12 20 then david aro from the earth and wash and anoint 
himself and chang hi apparel and came into the hou of the lord 
and worship then he came to hi own hou and when he requir 
they set bread befor him and he did eat 

12 21 then said hi servant unto him what thing is thi that thou 
hast done thou didst fast and weep for the child while it wa aliv 
but when the child wa dead thou didst rise and eat bread 

12 22 and he said while the child wa yet aliv i fast and wept 
for i said who can tell whether god will be graciou to me that the 
child may live 12 23 but now he is dead wherefor should i fast 
can i bring him back again i shall go to him but he shall not return 
to me 

12 24 and david comfort bathsheba hi wife and went in unto her 
and lay with her and she bare a son and he call hi name solomon 
and the lord love him 

12 25 and he sent by the hand of nathan the prophet and he call hi 
name jedidiah becau of the lord 

12 26 and joab fought against rabbah of the child of ammon and 
took the royal citi 

12 27 and joab sent messeng to david and said i have fought 
against rabbah and have taken the citi of water 

12 28 now therefor gather the rest of the peopl togeth and encamp 
against the citi and take it lest i take the citi and it be call 
after my name 

12 29 and david gather all the peopl togeth and went to rabbah 
and fought against it and took it 

12 30 and he took their king s crown from off hi head the weight 
whereof wa a talent of gold with the preciou stone and it wa set 
on david s head and he brought forth the spoil of the citi in great 
abund 

12 31 and he brought forth the peopl that were therein and put them 
under saw and under harrow of iron and under ax of iron and 
made them pa through the brick kiln and thu did he unto all the 
citi of the child of ammon so david and all the peopl return 
unto jerusalem 

13 1 and it came to pa after thi that absalom the son of david had 
a fair sister whose name wa tamar and amnon the son of david love 
her 

13 2 and amnon wa so vex that he fell sick for hi sister tamar 
for she wa a virgin and amnon thought it hard for him to do anyth 
to her 

13 3 but amnon had a friend whose name wa jonadab the son of 
shimeah david s brother and jonadab wa a veri subtil man 

13 4 and he said unto him whi art thou be the king s son lean 
from day to day wilt thou not tell me and amnon said unto him i 
love tamar my brother absalom s sister 

13 5 and jonadab said unto him lay thee down on thi bed and make 
thyself sick and when thi father cometh to see thee say unto him i 
pray thee let my sister tamar come and give me meat and dress the 
meat in my sight that i may see it and eat it at her hand 

13 6 so amnon lay down and made himself sick and when the king wa 
come to see him amnon said unto the king i pray thee let tamar my 
sister come and make me a coupl of cake in my sight that i may eat 
at her hand 

13 7 then david sent home to tamar say go now to thi brother 
amnon s hou and dress him meat 

13 8 so tamar went to her brother amnon s hou and he wa laid down 
and she took flour and knead it and made cake in hi sight and 
did bake the cake 

13 9 and she took a pan and pour them out befor him but he 
refu to eat and amnon said have out all men from me and they 
went out everi man from him 

13 10 and amnon said unto tamar bring the meat into the chamber that 
i may eat of thine hand and tamar took the cake which she had made 
and brought them into the chamber to amnon her brother 

13 11 and when she had brought them unto him to eat he took hold of 
her and said unto her come lie with me my sister 

13 12 and she answer him nay my brother do not forc me for no 
such thing ought to be done in israel do not thou thi folli 

13 13 and i whither shall i cau my shame to go and a for thee 
thou shalt be a one of the fool in israel now therefor i pray 
thee speak unto the king for he will not withhold me from thee 

13 14 howbeit he would not hearken unto her voic but be stronger 
than she forc her and lay with her 

13 15 then amnon hate her exceedingli so that the hatr wherewith 
he hate her wa greater than the love wherewith he had love her and 
amnon said unto her ari be gone 

13 16 and she said unto him there is no cau thi evil in send 
me away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me but he 
would not hearken unto her 

13 17 then he call hi servant that minist unto him and said 
put now thi woman out from me and bolt the door after her 

13 18 and she had a garment of diver colour upon her for with such 
robe were the king s daughter that were virgin apparel then hi 
servant brought her out and bolt the door after her 

13 19 and tamar put ash on her head and rent her garment of diver 
colour that wa on her and laid her hand on her head and went on 
cri 

13 20 and absalom her brother said unto her hath amnon thi brother 
been with thee but hold now thi peac my sister he is thi brother 
regard not thi thing so tamar remain desol in her brother 
absalom s hou 

13 21 but when king david heard of all these thing he wa veri 
wroth 

13 22 and absalom spake unto hi brother amnon neither good nor bad 
for absalom hate amnon becau he had forc hi sister tamar 

13 23 and it came to pa after two full year that absalom had 
sheepshear in baalhazor which is besid ephraim and absalom 
invit all the king s son 

13 24 and absalom came to the king and said behold now thi servant 
hath sheepshear let the king i beseech thee and hi servant go 
with thi servant 

13 25 and the king said to absalom nay my son let u not all now 
go lest we be chargeabl unto thee and he press him howbeit he 
would not go but bless him 

13 26 then said absalom if not i pray thee let my brother amnon go 
with u and the king said unto him whi should he go with thee 
13 27 but absalom press him that he let amnon and all the king s 
son go with him 

13 28 now absalom had command hi servant say mark ye now when 
amnon s heart is merri with wine and when i say unto you smite 
amnon then kill him fear not have not i command you be 
courag and be valiant 

13 29 and the servant of absalom did unto amnon a absalom had 
command 

then all the king s son aro and everi man gat him up upon hi 
mule and fled 

13 30 and it came to pa while they were in the way that tide 
came to david say absalom hath slain all the king s son and 
there is not one of them left 

13 31 then the king aro and tare hi garment and lay on the 
earth and all hi servant stood by with their cloth rent 

13 32 and jonadab the son of shimeah david s brother answer and 
said let not my lord suppo that they have slain all the young men 
the king s son for amnon onli is dead for by the appoint of 
absalom thi hath been determin from the day that he forc hi 
sister tamar 

13 33 now therefor let not my lord the king take the thing to hi 
heart to think that all the king s son are dead for amnon onli is 
dead 

13 34 but absalom fled and the young man that kept the watch lift 
up hi eye and look and behold there came much peopl by the 
way of the hill side behind him 

13 35 and jonadab said unto the king behold the king s son come a 
thi servant said so it is 

13 36 and it came to pa a soon a he had made an end of speak 
that behold the king s son came and lift up their voic and 
wept and the king also and all hi servant wept veri sore 

13 37 but absalom fled and went to talmai the son of ammihud king 
of geshur and david mourn for hi son everi day 

13 38 so absalom fled and went to geshur and wa there three year 

13 39 and the soul of king david long to go forth unto absalom for 
he wa comfort concern amnon see he wa dead 

14 1 now joab the son of zeruiah perceiv that the king s heart wa 
toward absalom 

14 2 and joab sent to tekoah and fetch thenc a wise woman and 
said unto her i pray thee feign thyself to be a mourner and put on 
now mourn apparel and anoint not thyself with oil but be a a 
woman that had a long time mourn for the dead 14 3 and come to the 
king and speak on thi manner unto him so joab put the word in her 
mouth 

14 4 and when the woman of tekoah spake to the king she fell on her 
face to the ground and did obei and said help o king 

14 5 and the king said unto her what aileth thee and she answer i 
am ind a widow woman and mine husband is dead 

14 6 and thi handmaid had two son and they two strove togeth in 
the field and there wa none to part them but the one smote the 
other and slew him 

14 7 and behold the whole famili is risen against thine handmaid 
and they said deliv him that smote hi brother that we may kill 
him for the life of hi brother whom he slew and we will destroy the 
heir also and so they shall quench my coal which is left and shall 
not leav to my husband neither name nor remaind upon the earth 

14 8 and the king said unto the woman go to thine hou and i will 
give charg concern thee 

14 9 and the woman of tekoah said unto the king my lord o king the 
iniqu be on me and on my father s hou and the king and hi 
throne be guiltless 

14 10 and the king said whoever saith ought unto thee bring him to 
me and he shall not touch thee ani more 

14 11 then said she i pray thee let the king rememb the lord thi 
god that thou wouldest not suffer the reveng of blood to destroy 
ani more lest they destroy my son and he said a the lord liveth 
there shall not one hair of thi son fall to the earth 

14 12 then the woman said let thine handmaid i pray thee speak one 
word unto my lord the king and he said say on 

14 13 and the woman said wherefor then hast thou thought such a 
thing against the peopl of god for the king doth speak thi thing a 
one which is faulti in that the king doth not fetch home again hi 
banish 

14 14 for we must need die and are a water spilt on the ground 
which cannot be gather up again neither doth god respect ani 
person yet doth he devi mean that hi banish be not expel 
from him 

14 15 now therefor that i am come to speak of thi thing unto my lord 
the king it is becau the peopl have made me afraid and thi 
handmaid said i will now speak unto the king it may be that the king 
will perform the request of hi handmaid 

14 16 for the king will hear to deliv hi handmaid out of the hand 
of the man that would destroy me and my son togeth out of the 
inherit of god 

14 17 then thine handmaid said the word of my lord the king shall now 
be comfort for a an angel of god so is my lord the king to 
discern good and bad therefor the lord thi god will be with thee 

14 18 then the king answer and said unto the woman hide not from 
me i pray thee the thing that i shall ask thee and the woman said 
let my lord the king now speak 

14 19 and the king said is not the hand of joab with thee in all 
thi and the woman answer and said a thi soul liveth my lord 
the king none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought 
that my lord the king hath spoken for thi servant joab he bade me 
and he put all these word in the mouth of thine handmaid 14 20 to 
fetch about thi form of speech hath thi servant joab done thi thing 
and my lord is wise accord to the wisdom of an angel of god to 
know all thing that are in the earth 

14 21 and the king said unto joab behold now i have done thi thing 
go therefor bring the young man absalom again 

14 22 and joab fell to the ground on hi face and bow himself and 
thank the king and joab said to day thi servant knoweth that i 
have found grace in thi sight my lord o king in that the king hath 
fulfil the request of hi servant 

14 23 so joab aro and went to geshur and brought absalom to 
jerusalem 

14 24 and the king said let him turn to hi own hou and let him 
not see my face so absalom return to hi own hou and saw not the 
king s face 

14 25 but in all israel there wa none to be so much prai a 
absalom for hi beauti from the sole of hi foot even to the crown of 
hi head there wa no blemish in him 

14 26 and when he poll hi head for it wa at everi year s end 
that he poll it becau the hair wa heavi on him therefor he 
poll it he weigh the hair of hi head at two hundr shekel 
after the king s weight 

14 27 and unto absalom there were born three son and one daughter 
whose name wa tamar she wa a woman of a fair counten 

14 28 so absalom dwelt two full year in jerusalem and saw not the 
king s face 

14 29 therefor absalom sent for joab to have sent him to the king 
but he would not come to him and when he sent again the second time 
he would not come 

14 30 therefor he said unto hi servant see joab s field is near 
mine and he hath barley there go and set it on fire and absalom s 
servant set the field on fire 

14 31 then joab aro and came to absalom unto hi hou and said 
unto him wherefor have thi servant set my field on fire 14 32 and 
absalom answer joab behold i sent unto thee say come hither 
that i may send thee to the king to say wherefor am i come from 
geshur it had been good for me to have been there still now 
therefor let me see the king s face and if there be ani iniqu in 
me let him kill me 

14 33 so joab came to the king and told him and when he had call 
for absalom he came to the king and bow himself on hi face to the 
ground befor the king and the king kiss absalom 

15 1 and it came to pa after thi that absalom prepar him 
chariot and hor and fifti men to run befor him 

15 2 and absalom rose up earli and stood besid the way of the gate 
and it wa so that when ani man that had a controversi came to the 
king for judgment then absalom call unto him and said of what 
citi art thou and he said thi servant is of one of the tribe of 
israel 

15 3 and absalom said unto him see thi matter are good and right 
but there is no man deput of the king to hear thee 

15 4 absalom said moreov oh that i were made judg in the land 
that everi man which hath ani suit or cau might come unto me and i 
would do him justic 15 5 and it wa so that when ani man came nigh 
to him to do him obei he put forth hi hand and took him and 
kiss him 

15 6 and on thi manner did absalom to all israel that came to the 
king for judgment so absalom stole the heart of the men of israel 

15 7 and it came to pa after forti year that absalom said unto the 
king i pray thee let me go and pay my vow which i have vow unto 
the lord in hebron 

15 8 for thi servant vow a vow while i abod at geshur in syria 
say if the lord shall bring me again ind to jerusalem then i 
will serv the lord 

15 9 and the king said unto him go in peac so he aro and went to 
hebron 

15 10 but absalom sent spi throughout all the tribe of israel 
say a soon a ye hear the sound of the trumpet then ye shall 
say absalom reigneth in hebron 

15 11 and with absalom went two hundr men out of jerusalem that 
were call and they went in their simplic and they knew not ani 
thing 

15 12 and absalom sent for ahithophel the gilonit david s 
counsellor from hi citi even from giloh while he offer 
sacrif and the conspiraci wa strong for the peopl increa 
continu with absalom 

15 13 and there came a messeng to david say the heart of the 
men of israel are after absalom 

15 14 and david said unto all hi servant that were with him at 
jerusalem ari and let u flee for we shall not el escap from 
absalom make speed to depart lest he overtak u suddenli and bring 
evil upon u and smite the citi with the edg of the sword 

15 15 and the king s servant said unto the king behold thi servant 
are readi to do whatsoev my lord the king shall appoint 

15 16 and the king went forth and all hi household after him and 
the king left ten woman which were concubin to keep the hou 

15 17 and the king went forth and all the peopl after him and 
tarri in a place that wa far off 

15 18 and all hi servant pa on besid him and all the 
cherethit and all the pelethit and all the gittit six hundr 
men which came after him from gath pa on befor the king 

15 19 then said the king to ittai the gittit wherefor goest thou 
also with u return to thi place and abid with the king for thou 
art a stranger and also an exil 

15 20 wherea thou camest but yesterday should i thi day make thee 
go up and down with u see i go whither i may return thou and 
take back thi brother merci and truth be with thee 

15 21 and ittai answer the king and said a the lord liveth and 
a my lord the king liveth sure in what place my lord the king 
shall be whether in death or life even there also will thi servant 
be 

15 22 and david said to ittai go and pa over and ittai the gittit 
pa over and all hi men and all the littl one that were with 
him 

15 23 and all the countri wept with a loud voic and all the peopl 
pa over the king also himself pa over the brook kidron and 
all the peopl pa over toward the way of the wilder 

15 24 and lo zadok also and all the levit were with him bear 
the ark of the coven of god and they set down the ark of god and 
abiathar went up until all the peopl had done pa out of the 
citi 

15 25 and the king said unto zadok carri back the ark of god into the 
citi if i shall find favour in the eye of the lord he will bring me 
again and shew me both it and hi habit 15 26 but if he thu 
say i have no delight in thee behold here am i let him do to me a 
seemeth good unto him 

15 27 the king said also unto zadok the priest art not thou a seer 
return into the citi in peac and your two son with you ahimaaz thi 
son and jonathan the son of abiathar 

15 28 see i will tarri in the plain of the wilder until there 
come word from you to certifi me 

15 29 zadok therefor and abiathar carri the ark of god again to 
jerusalem and they tarri there 

15 30 and david went up by the ascent of mount olivet and wept a he 
went up and had hi head cover and he went barefoot and all the 
peopl that wa with him cover everi man hi head and they went up 
weep a they went up 

15 31 and one told david say ahithophel is among the conspir 
with absalom and david said o lord i pray thee turn the counsel of 
ahithophel into foolish 

15 32 and it came to pa that when david wa come to the top of the 
mount where he worship god behold hushai the archit came to 
meet him with hi coat rent and earth upon hi head 15 33 unto whom 
david said if thou passest on with me then thou shalt be a burden 
unto me 15 34 but if thou return to the citi and say unto absalom i 
will be thi servant o king a i have been thi father s servant 
hitherto so will i now also be thi servant then mayest thou for me 
defeat the counsel of ahithophel 

15 35 and hast thou not there with thee zadok and abiathar the 
priest therefor it shall be that what thing soever thou shalt 
hear out of the king s hou thou shalt tell it to zadok and abiathar 
the priest 

15 36 behold they have there with them their two son ahimaaz 
zadok s son and jonathan abiathar s son and by them ye shall send 
unto me everi thing that ye can hear 

15 37 so hushai david s friend came into the citi and absalom came 
into jerusalem 

16 1 and when david wa a littl past the top of the hill behold 
ziba the servant of mephibosheth met him with a coupl of as 
saddl and upon them two hundr loaf of bread and an hundr 
bunch of raisin and an hundr of summer fruit and a bottl of 
wine 

16 2 and the king said unto ziba what meanest thou by these and ziba 
said the as be for the king s household to ride on and the bread 
and summer fruit for the young men to eat and the wine that such a 
be faint in the wilder may drink 

16 3 and the king said and where is thi master s son and ziba said 
unto the king behold he abideth at jerusalem for he said to day 
shall the hou of israel restor me the kingdom of my father 

16 4 then said the king to ziba behold thine are all that pertain 
unto mephibosheth and ziba said i humbl beseech thee that i may 
find grace in thi sight my lord o king 

16 5 and when king david came to bahurim behold thenc came out a 
man of the famili of the hou of saul whose name wa shimei the son 
of gera he came forth and cur still a he came 

16 6 and he cast stone at david and at all the servant of king 
david and all the peopl and all the mighti men were on hi right 
hand and on hi left 

16 7 and thu said shimei when he cur come out come out thou 
bloodi man and thou man of belial 16 8 the lord hath return upon 
thee all the blood of the hou of saul in whose stead thou hast 
reign and the lord hath deliv the kingdom into the hand of 
absalom thi son and behold thou art taken in thi mischief becau 
thou art a bloodi man 

16 9 then said abishai the son of zeruiah unto the king whi should 
thi dead dog cur my lord the king let me go over i pray thee and 
take off hi head 

16 10 and the king said what have i to do with you ye son of 
zeruiah so let him cur becau the lord hath said unto him cur 
david who shall then say wherefor hast thou done so 16 11 and 
david said to abishai and to all hi servant behold my son which 
came forth of my bowel seeketh my life how much more now may thi 
benjamit do it let him alon and let him cur for the lord hath 
bidden him 

16 12 it may be that the lord will look on mine afflict and that 
the lord will requit me good for hi cur thi day 

16 13 and a david and hi men went by the way shimei went along on 
the hill s side over against him and cur a he went and threw 
stone at him and cast dust 

16 14 and the king and all the peopl that were with him came weari 
and refresh themselv there 

16 15 and absalom and all the peopl the men of israel came to 
jerusalem and ahithophel with him 

16 16 and it came to pa when hushai the archit david s friend 
wa come unto absalom that hushai said unto absalom god save the 
king god save the king 

16 17 and absalom said to hushai is thi thi kind to thi friend 
whi wentest thou not with thi friend 16 18 and hushai said unto 
absalom nay but whom the lord and thi peopl and all the men of 
israel choo hi will i be and with him will i abid 

16 19 and again whom should i serv should i not serv in the 
presenc of hi son a i have serv in thi father s presenc so 
will i be in thi presenc 

16 20 then said absalom to ahithophel give counsel among you what we 
shall do 

16 21 and ahithophel said unto absalom go in unto thi father s 
concubin which he hath left to keep the hou and all israel shall 
hear that thou art abhor of thi father then shall the hand of all 
that are with thee be strong 

16 22 so they spread absalom a tent upon the top of the hou and 
absalom went in unto hi father s concubin in the sight of all 
israel 

16 23 and the counsel of ahithophel which he counsel in those 
day wa a if a man had enquir at the oracl of god so wa all 
the counsel of ahithophel both with david and with absalom 

17 1 moreov ahithophel said unto absalom let me now choo out 
twelv thousand men and i will ari and pursu after david thi 
night 17 2 and i will come upon him while he is weari and weak 
hand and will make him afraid and all the peopl that are with him 
shall flee and i will smite the king onli 17 3 and i will bring back 
all the peopl unto thee the man whom thou seekest is a if all 
return so all the peopl shall be in peac 

17 4 and the say plea absalom well and all the elder of 
israel 

17 5 then said absalom call now hushai the archit also and let u 
hear likewi what he saith 

17 6 and when hushai wa come to absalom absalom spake unto him 
say ahithophel hath spoken after thi manner shall we do after 
hi say if not speak thou 

17 7 and hushai said unto absalom the counsel that ahithophel hath 
given is not good at thi time 

17 8 for said hushai thou knowest thi father and hi men that they 
be mighti men and they be chafe in their mind a a bear rob of 
her whelp in the field and thi father is a man of war and will not 
lodg with the peopl 

17 9 behold he is hid now in some pit or in some other place and it 
will come to pa when some of them be overthrown at the first that 
whosoev heareth it will say there is a slaughter among the peopl 
that follow absalom 

17 10 and he also that is valiant whose heart is a the heart of a 
lion shall utterli melt for all israel knoweth that thi father is a 
mighti man and they which be with him are valiant men 

17 11 therefor i counsel that all israel be gener gather unto 
thee from dan even to beersheba a the sand that is by the sea for 
multitud and that thou go to battl in thine own person 

17 12 so shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found 
and we will light upon him a the dew falleth on the ground and of 
him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so 
much a one 

17 13 moreov if he be gotten into a citi then shall all israel 
bring rope to that citi and we will draw it into the river until 
there be not one small stone found there 

17 14 and absalom and all the men of israel said the counsel of 
hushai the archit is better than the counsel of ahithophel for the 
lord had appoint to defeat the good counsel of ahithophel to the 
intent that the lord might bring evil upon absalom 

17 15 then said hushai unto zadok and to abiathar the priest thu 
and thu did ahithophel counsel absalom and the elder of israel and 
thu and thu have i counsel 

17 16 now therefor send quickli and tell david say lodg not 
thi night in the plain of the wilder but speedili pa over 
lest the king be swallow up and all the peopl that are with him 

17 17 now jonathan and ahimaaz stay by enrogel for they might not 
be seen to come into the citi and a wench went and told them and 
they went and told king david 

17 18 nevertheless a lad saw them and told absalom but they went 
both of them away quickli and came to a man s hou in bahurim which 
had a well in hi court whither they went down 

17 19 and the woman took and spread a cover over the well s mouth 
and spread ground corn thereon and the thing wa not known 

17 20 and when absalom s servant came to the woman to the hou they 
said where is ahimaaz and jonathan and the woman said unto them 
they be gone over the brook of water and when they had sought and 
could not find them they return to jerusalem 

17 21 and it came to pa after they were depart that they came up 
out of the well and went and told king david and said unto david 
ari and pa quickli over the water for thu hath ahithophel 
counsel against you 

17 22 then david aro and all the peopl that were with him and 
they pa over jordan by the morn light there lack not one of 
them that wa not gone over jordan 

17 23 and when ahithophel saw that hi counsel wa not follow he 
saddl hi a and aro and gat him home to hi hou to hi 
citi and put hi household in order and hang himself and die 
and wa buri in the sepulchr of hi father 

17 24 then david came to mahanaim and absalom pa over jordan he 
and all the men of israel with him 

17 25 and absalom made amasa captain of the host instead of joab 
which amasa wa a man s son whose name wa ithra an israelit that 
went in to abigail the daughter of nahash sister to zeruiah joab s 
mother 

17 26 so israel and absalom pitch in the land of gilead 

17 27 and it came to pa when david wa come to mahanaim that shobi 
the son of nahash of rabbah of the child of ammon and machir the 
son of ammiel of lodebar and barzillai the gileadit of rogelim 
17 28 brought bed and bason and earthen vessel and wheat and 
barley and flour and parch corn and bean and lentil and 
parch pul 17 29 and honey and butter and sheep and chee of 
kine for david and for the peopl that were with him to eat for 
they said the peopl is hungri and weari and thirsti in the 
wilder 

18 1 and david number the peopl that were with him and set 
captain of thousand and captain of hundr over them 

18 2 and david sent forth a third part of the peopl under the hand of 
joab and a third part under the hand of abishai the son of zeruiah 
joab s brother and a third part under the hand of ittai the gittit 
and the king said unto the peopl i will sure go forth with you 
myself also 

18 3 but the peopl answer thou shalt not go forth for if we flee 
away they will not care for u neither if half of u die will they 
care for u but now thou art worth ten thousand of u therefor now 
it is better that thou succour u out of the citi 

18 4 and the king said unto them what seemeth you best i will do and 
the king stood by the gate side and all the peopl came out by 
hundr and by thousand 

18 5 and the king command joab and abishai and ittai say deal 
gentli for my sake with the young man even with absalom and all the 
peopl heard when the king gave all the captain charg concern 
absalom 

18 6 so the peopl went out into the field against israel and the 
battl wa in the wood of ephraim 18 7 where the peopl of israel 
were slain befor the servant of david and there wa there a great 
slaughter that day of twenti thousand men 

18 8 for the battl wa there scatter over the face of all the 
countri and the wood devour more peopl that day than the sword 
devour 

18 9 and absalom met the servant of david and absalom rode upon a 
mule and the mule went under the thick bough of a great oak and hi 
head caught hold of the oak and he wa taken up between the heaven 
and the earth and the mule that wa under him went away 

18 10 and a certain man saw it and told joab and said behold i saw 
absalom hang in an oak 

18 11 and joab said unto the man that told him and behold thou 
sawest him and whi didst thou not smite him there to the ground and 
i would have given thee ten shekel of silver and a girdl 

18 12 and the man said unto joab though i should receiv a thousand 
shekel of silver in mine hand yet would i not put forth mine hand 
against the king s son for in our hear the king charg thee and 
abishai and ittai say bewar that none touch the young man 
absalom 

18 13 otherwi i should have wrought falsehood against mine own life 
for there is no matter hid from the king and thou thyself wouldest 
have set thyself against me 

18 14 then said joab i may not tarri thu with thee and he took 
three dart in hi hand and thrust them through the heart of absalom 
while he wa yet aliv in the midst of the oak 

18 15 and ten young men that bare joab s armour compass about and 
smote absalom and slew him 

18 16 and joab blew the trumpet and the peopl return from pursu 
after israel for joab held back the peopl 

18 17 and they took absalom and cast him into a great pit in the 
wood and laid a veri great heap of stone upon him and all israel 
fled everi one to hi tent 

18 18 now absalom in hi lifetim had taken and rear up for himself 
a pillar which is in the king s dale for he said i have no son to 
keep my name in remembr and he call the pillar after hi own 
name and it is call unto thi day absalom s place 

18 19 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok let me now run and bear the 
king tide how that the lord hath aveng him of hi enemi 

18 20 and joab said unto him thou shalt not bear tide thi day 
but thou shalt bear tide anoth day but thi day thou shalt bear 
no tide becau the king s son is dead 

18 21 then said joab to cushi go tell the king what thou hast seen 
and cushi bow himself unto joab and ran 

18 22 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok yet again to joab but 
howsoev let me i pray thee also run after cushi and joab said 
wherefor wilt thou run my son see that thou hast no tide 
readi 18 23 but howsoev said he let me run and he said unto 
him run then ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain and overran cushi 

18 24 and david sat between the two gate and the watchman went up to 
the roof over the gate unto the wall and lift up hi eye and 
look and behold a man run alon 

18 25 and the watchman cri and told the king and the king said if 
he be alon there is tide in hi mouth and he came apac and 
drew near 

18 26 and the watchman saw anoth man run and the watchman 
call unto the porter and said behold anoth man run alon 
and the king said he also bringeth tide 

18 27 and the watchman said me thinketh the run of the foremost 
is like the run of ahimaaz the son of zadok and the king said he 
is a good man and cometh with good tide 

18 28 and ahimaaz call and said unto the king all is well and he 
fell down to the earth upon hi face befor the king and said 
bless be the lord thi god which hath deliv up the men that 
lift up their hand against my lord the king 

18 29 and the king said is the young man absalom safe and ahimaaz 
answer when joab sent the king s servant and me thi servant i saw 
a great tumult but i knew not what it wa 

18 30 and the king said unto him turn asid and stand here and he 
turn asid and stood still 

18 31 and behold cushi came and cushi said tide my lord the 
king for the lord hath aveng thee thi day of all them that rose up 
against thee 

18 32 and the king said unto cushi is the young man absalom safe and 
cushi answer the enemi of my lord the king and all that rise 
against thee to do thee hurt be a that young man is 

18 33 and the king wa much move and went up to the chamber over the 
gate and wept and a he went thu he said o my son absalom my 
son my son absalom would god i had die for thee o absalom my son 
my son 19 1 and it wa told joab behold the king weepeth and 
mourneth for absalom 

19 2 and the victori that day wa turn into mourn unto all the 
peopl for the peopl heard say that day how the king wa griev for 
hi son 

19 3 and the peopl gat them by stealth that day into the citi a 
peopl be asham steal away when they flee in battl 

19 4 but the king cover hi face and the king cri with a loud 
voic o my son absalom o absalom my son my son 19 5 and joab 
came into the hou to the king and said thou hast shame thi day 
the face of all thi servant which thi day have save thi life and 
the life of thi son and of thi daughter and the life of thi 
wife and the life of thi concubin 19 6 in that thou lovest thine 
enemi and hatest thi friend for thou hast declar thi day that 
thou regardest neither princ nor servant for thi day i perceiv 
that if absalom had live and all we had die thi day then it had 
plea thee well 

19 7 now therefor ari go forth and speak comfort unto thi 
servant for i swear by the lord if thou go not forth there will 
not tarri one with thee thi night and that will be wor unto thee 
than all the evil that befel thee from thi youth until now 

19 8 then the king aro and sat in the gate and they told unto all 
the peopl say behold the king doth sit in the gate and all the 
peopl came befor the king for israel had fled everi man to hi 
tent 

19 9 and all the peopl were at strife throughout all the tribe of 
israel say the king save u out of the hand of our enemi and 
he deliv u out of the hand of the philistin and now he is fled 
out of the land for absalom 

19 10 and absalom whom we anoint over u is dead in battl now 
therefor whi speak ye not a word of bring the king back 19 11 
and king david sent to zadok and to abiathar the priest say 
speak unto the elder of judah say whi are ye the last to bring 
the king back to hi hou see the speech of all israel is come to 
the king even to hi hou 

19 12 ye are my brother ye are my bone and my flesh wherefor then 
are ye the last to bring back the king 19 13 and say ye to amasa 
art thou not of my bone and of my flesh god do so to me and more 
also if thou be not captain of the host befor me continu in the 
room of joab 

19 14 and he bow the heart of all the men of judah even a the 
heart of one man so that they sent thi word unto the king return 
thou and all thi servant 

19 15 so the king return and came to jordan and judah came to 
gilgal to go to meet the king to conduct the king over jordan 

19 16 and shimei the son of gera a benjamit which wa of bahurim 
hast and came down with the men of judah to meet king david 

19 17 and there were a thousand men of benjamin with him and ziba the 
servant of the hou of saul and hi fifteen son and hi twenti 
servant with him and they went over jordan befor the king 

19 18 and there went over a ferri boat to carri over the king s 
household and to do what he thought good and shimei the son of gera 
fell down befor the king a he wa come over jordan 19 19 and said 
unto the king let not my lord imput iniqu unto me neither do 
thou rememb that which thi servant did perver the day that my 
lord the king went out of jerusalem that the king should take it to 
hi heart 

19 20 for thi servant doth know that i have sin therefor behold 
i am come the first thi day of all the hou of joseph to go down to 
meet my lord the king 

19 21 but abishai the son of zeruiah answer and said shall not 
shimei be put to death for thi becau he cur the lord s 
anoint 19 22 and david said what have i to do with you ye son 
of zeruiah that ye should thi day be adversari unto me shall 
there ani man be put to death thi day in israel for do not i know 
that i am thi day king over israel 19 23 therefor the king said 
unto shimei thou shalt not die and the king sware unto him 

19 24 and mephibosheth the son of saul came down to meet the king and 
had neither dress hi foot nor trim hi beard nor wash hi 
cloth from the day the king depart until the day he came again in 
peac 

19 25 and it came to pa when he wa come to jerusalem to meet the 
king that the king said unto him wherefor wentest not thou with me 
mephibosheth 19 26 and he answer my lord o king my servant 
deceiv me for thi servant said i will saddl me an a that i may 
ride thereon and go to the king becau thi servant is lame 

19 27 and he hath slander thi servant unto my lord the king but my 
lord the king is a an angel of god do therefor what is good in 
thine eye 

19 28 for all of my father s hou were but dead men befor my lord 
the king yet didst thou set thi servant among them that did eat at 
thine own tabl what right therefor have i yet to cri ani more unto 
the king 19 29 and the king said unto him whi speakest thou ani 
more of thi matter i have said thou and ziba divid the land 

19 30 and mephibosheth said unto the king yea let him take all 
forasmuch a my lord the king is come again in peac unto hi own 
hou 

19 31 and barzillai the gileadit came down from rogelim and went 
over jordan with the king to conduct him over jordan 

19 32 now barzillai wa a veri age man even fourscor year old and 
he had provid the king of susten while he lay at mahanaim for 
he wa a veri great man 

19 33 and the king said unto barzillai come thou over with me and i 
will feed thee with me in jerusalem 

19 34 and barzillai said unto the king how long have i to live that 
i should go up with the king unto jerusalem 19 35 i am thi day 
fourscor year old and can i discern between good and evil can thi 
servant tast what i eat or what i drink can i hear ani more the 
voic of sing men and sing woman wherefor then should thi 
servant be yet a burden unto my lord the king 19 36 thi servant will 
go a littl way over jordan with the king and whi should the king 
recompen it me with such a reward 19 37 let thi servant i pray 
thee turn back again that i may die in mine own citi and be buri 
by the grave of my father and of my mother but behold thi servant 
chimham let him go over with my lord the king and do to him what 
shall seem good unto thee 

19 38 and the king answer chimham shall go over with me and i will 
do to him that which shall seem good unto thee and whatsoev thou 
shalt requir of me that will i do for thee 

19 39 and all the peopl went over jordan and when the king wa come 
over the king kiss barzillai and bless him and he return unto 
hi own place 

19 40 then the king went on to gilgal and chimham went on with him 
and all the peopl of judah conduct the king and also half the 
peopl of israel 

19 41 and behold all the men of israel came to the king and said 
unto the king whi have our brother the men of judah stolen thee 
away and have brought the king and hi household and all david s 
men with him over jordan 19 42 and all the men of judah answer 
the men of israel becau the king is near of kin to u wherefor 
then be ye angri for thi matter have we eaten at all of the king s 
cost or hath he given u ani gift 19 43 and the men of israel 
answer the men of judah and said we have ten part in the king 
and we have also more right in david than ye whi then did ye despi 
u that our advic should not be first had in bring back our king 
and the word of the men of judah were fiercer than the word of the 
men of israel 

20 1 and there happen to be there a man of belial whose name wa 
sheba the son of bichri a benjamit and he blew a trumpet and 
said we have no part in david neither have we inherit in the son 
of jess everi man to hi tent o israel 

20 2 so everi man of israel went up from after david and follow 
sheba the son of bichri but the men of judah clave unto their king 
from jordan even to jerusalem 

20 3 and david came to hi hou at jerusalem and the king took the 
ten woman hi concubin whom he had left to keep the hou and put 
them in ward and fed them but went not in unto them so they were 
shut up unto the day of their death live in widowhood 

20 4 then said the king to amasa assembl me the men of judah within 
three day and be thou here present 

20 5 so amasa went to assembl the men of judah but he tarri longer 
than the set time which he had appoint him 

20 6 and david said to abishai now shall sheba the son of bichri do 
u more harm than did absalom take thou thi lord s servant and 
pursu after him lest he get him fenc citi and escap u 

20 7 and there went out after him joab s men and the cherethit and 
the pelethit and all the mighti men and they went out of 
jerusalem to pursu after sheba the son of bichri 

20 8 when they were at the great stone which is in gibeon amasa went 
befor them and joab s garment that he had put on wa gird unto 
him and upon it a girdl with a sword fasten upon hi loin in the 
sheath thereof and a he went forth it fell out 

20 9 and joab said to amasa art thou in health my brother and joab 
took amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him 

20 10 but amasa took no heed to the sword that wa in joab s hand so 
he smote him therewith in the fifth rib and shed out hi bowel to 
the ground and struck him not again and he die so joab and abishai 
hi brother pursu after sheba the son of bichri 

20 11 and one of joab s men stood by him and said he that favoureth 
joab and he that is for david let him go after joab 

20 12 and amasa wallow in blood in the midst of the highway and 
when the man saw that all the peopl stood still he remov amasa out 
of the highway into the field and cast a cloth upon him when he saw 
that everi one that came by him stood still 

20 13 when he wa remov out of the highway all the peopl went on 
after joab to pursu after sheba the son of bichri 

20 14 and he went through all the tribe of israel unto abel and to 
bethmaachah and all the berit and they were gather togeth and 
went also after him 

20 15 and they came and besieg him in abel of bethmaachah and they 
cast up a bank against the citi and it stood in the trench and all 
the peopl that were with joab batter the wall to throw it down 

20 16 then cri a wise woman out of the citi hear hear say i pray 
you unto joab come near hither that i may speak with thee 

20 17 and when he wa come near unto her the woman said art thou 
joab and he answer i am he then she said unto him hear the 
word of thine handmaid and he answer i do hear 

20 18 then she spake say they were wont to speak in old time 
say they shall sure ask counsel at abel and so they end the 
matter 

20 19 i am one of them that are peaceabl and faith in israel thou 
seekest to destroy a citi and a mother in israel whi wilt thou 
swallow up the inherit of the lord 20 20 and joab answer and 
said far be it far be it from me that i should swallow up or 
destroy 

20 21 the matter is not so but a man of mount ephraim sheba the son 
of bichri by name hath lift up hi hand against the king even 
against david deliv him onli and i will depart from the citi and 
the woman said unto joab behold hi head shall be thrown to thee 
over the wall 

20 22 then the woman went unto all the peopl in her wisdom and they 
cut off the head of sheba the son of bichri and cast it out to joab 
and he blew a trumpet and they retir from the citi everi man to 
hi tent and joab return to jerusalem unto the king 

20 23 now joab wa over all the host of israel and benaiah the son of 
jehoiada wa over the cherethit and over the pelethit 20 24 and 
adoram wa over the tribut and jehoshaphat the son of ahilud wa 
record 20 25 and sheva wa scribe and zadok and abiathar were the 
priest 20 26 and ira also the jairit wa a chief ruler about david 

21 1 then there wa a famin in the day of david three year year 
after year and david enquir of the lord and the lord answer it 
is for saul and for hi bloodi hou becau he slew the gibeonit 

21 2 and the king call the gibeonit and said unto them now the 
gibeonit were not of the child of israel but of the remnant of 
the amorit and the child of israel had sworn unto them and saul 
sought to slay them in hi zeal to the child of israel and judah 
21 3 wherefor david said unto the gibeonit what shall i do for 
you and wherewith shall i make the aton that ye may bless the 
inherit of the lord 21 4 and the gibeonit said unto him we 
will have no silver nor gold of saul nor of hi hou neither for u 
shalt thou kill ani man in israel and he said what ye shall say 
that will i do for you 

21 5 and they answer the king the man that consum u and that 
devi against u that we should be destroy from remain in ani 
of the coast of israel 21 6 let seven men of hi son be deliv 
unto u and we will hang them up unto the lord in gibeah of saul 
whom the lord did choo and the king said i will give them 

21 7 but the king spare mephibosheth the son of jonathan the son of 
saul becau of the lord s oath that wa between them between david 
and jonathan the son of saul 

21 8 but the king took the two son of rizpah the daughter of aiah 
whom she bare unto saul armoni and mephibosheth and the five son of 
michal the daughter of saul whom she brought up for adriel the son of 
barzillai the meholathit 21 9 and he deliv them into the hand 
of the gibeonit and they hang them in the hill befor the lord 
and they fell all seven togeth and were put to death in the day of 
harvest in the first day in the begin of barley harvest 

21 10 and rizpah the daughter of aiah took sackcloth and spread it 
for her upon the rock from the begin of harvest until water 
drop upon them out of heaven and suffer neither the bird of the 
air to rest on them by day nor the beast of the field by night 

21 11 and it wa told david what rizpah the daughter of aiah the 
concubin of saul had done 

21 12 and david went and took the bone of saul and the bone of 
jonathan hi son from the men of jabeshgilead which had stolen them 
from the street of bethshan where the philistin had hang them 
when the philistin had slain saul in gilboa 21 13 and he brought up 
from thenc the bone of saul and the bone of jonathan hi son and 
they gather the bone of them that were hang 

21 14 and the bone of saul and jonathan hi son buri they in the 
countri of benjamin in zelah in the sepulchr of kish hi father and 
they perform all that the king command and after that god wa 
intreat for the land 

21 15 moreov the philistin had yet war again with israel and 
david went down and hi servant with him and fought against the 
philistin and david wax faint 

21 16 and ishbibenob which wa of the son of the giant the weight 
of whose spear weigh three hundr shekel of brass in weight he 
be gird with a new sword thought to have slain david 

21 17 but abishai the son of zeruiah succour him and smote the 
philistin and kill him then the men of david sware unto him 
say thou shalt go no more out with u to battl that thou quench 
not the light of israel 

21 18 and it came to pa after thi that there wa again a battl 
with the philistin at gob then sibbechai the hushathit slew saph 
which wa of the son of the giant 

21 19 and there wa again a battl in gob with the philistin where 
elhanan the son of jaareoregim a bethlehemit slew the brother of 
goliath the gittit the staff of whose spear wa like a weaver s 
beam 

21 20 and there wa yet a battl in gath where wa a man of great 
statur that had on everi hand six finger and on everi foot six 
toe four and twenti in number and he also wa born to the giant 

21 21 and when he defi israel jonathan the son of shimeah the 
brother of david slew him 

21 22 these four were born to the giant in gath and fell by the hand 
of david and by the hand of hi servant 

22 1 and david spake unto the lord the word of thi song in the day 
that the lord had deliv him out of the hand of all hi enemi 
and out of the hand of saul 22 2 and he said the lord is my rock 
and my fortress and my deliv 22 3 the god of my rock in him 
will i trust he is my shield and the horn of my salvat my high 
tower and my refug my saviour thou savest me from violenc 

22 4 i will call on the lord who is worthi to be prai so shall i 
be save from mine enemi 

22 5 when the wave of death compass me the flood of ungodli men 
made me afraid 22 6 the sorrow of hell compass me about the 
snare of death prevent me 22 7 in my distress i call upon the 
lord and cri to my god and he did hear my voic out of hi templ 
and my cri did enter into hi ear 

22 8 then the earth shook and trembl the foundat of heaven 
move and shook becau he wa wroth 

22 9 there went up a smoke out of hi nostril and fire out of hi 
mouth devour coal were kindl by it 

22 10 he bow the heaven also and came down and dark wa under 
hi foot 

22 11 and he rode upon a cherub and did fli and he wa seen upon the 
wing of the wind 

22 12 and he made dark pavilion round about him dark water and 
thick cloud of the sky 

22 13 through the bright befor him were coal of fire kindl 

22 14 the lord thunder from heaven and the most high utter hi 
voic 

22 15 and he sent out arrow and scatter them lightn and 
discomfit them 

22 16 and the channel of the sea appear the foundat of the 
world were discov at the rebuk of the lord at the blast of 
the breath of hi nostril 

22 17 he sent from abov he took me he drew me out of mani water 
22 18 he deliv me from my strong enemi and from them that hate 
me for they were too strong for me 

22 19 they prevent me in the day of my calam but the lord wa my 
stay 

22 20 he brought me forth also into a larg place he deliv me 
becau he delight in me 

22 21 the lord reward me accord to my righteou accord to 
the clean of my hand hath he recompen me 

22 22 for i have kept the way of the lord and have not wickedli 
depart from my god 

22 23 for all hi judgment were befor me and a for hi statut i 
did not depart from them 

22 24 i wa also upright befor him and have kept myself from mine 
iniqu 

22 25 therefor the lord hath recompen me accord to my 
righteou accord to my clean in hi eye sight 

22 26 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merci and with the 
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright 

22 27 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure and with the froward 
thou wilt shew thyself unsavouri 

22 28 and the afflict peopl thou wilt save but thine eye are upon 
the haughti that thou mayest bring them down 

22 29 for thou art my lamp o lord and the lord will lighten my 
dark 

22 30 for by thee i have run through a troop by my god have i leap 
over a wall 

22 31 a for god hi way is perfect the word of the lord is tri 
he is a buckler to all them that trust in him 

22 32 for who is god save the lord and who is a rock save our god 
22 33 god is my strength and power and he maketh my way perfect 

22 34 he maketh my foot like hind foot and setteth me upon my high 
place 

22 35 he teacheth my hand to war so that a bow of steel is broken by 
mine arm 

22 36 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvat and thi 
gentl hath made me great 

22 37 thou hast enlarg my step under me so that my foot did not 
slip 

22 38 i have pursu mine enemi and destroy them and turn not 
again until i had consum them 

22 39 and i have consum them and wound them that they could not 
ari yea they are fallen under my foot 

22 40 for thou hast gird me with strength to battl them that rose 
up against me hast thou subdu under me 

22 41 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemi that i might 
destroy them that hate me 

22 42 they look but there wa none to save even unto the lord but 
he answer them not 

22 43 then did i beat them a small a the dust of the earth i did 
stamp them a the mire of the street and did spread them abroad 

22 44 thou also hast deliv me from the strive of my peopl 
thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen a peopl which i knew not 
shall serv me 

22 45 stranger shall submit themselv unto me a soon a they hear 
they shall be obedi unto me 

22 46 stranger shall fade away and they shall be afraid out of their 
close place 

22 47 the lord liveth and bless be my rock and exalt be the god 
of the rock of my salvat 

22 48 it is god that avengeth me and that bringeth down the peopl 
under me 

22 49 and that bringeth me forth from mine enemi thou also hast 
lift me up on high abov them that rose up against me thou hast 
deliv me from the violent man 

22 50 therefor i will give thank unto thee o lord among the 
heathen and i will sing prai unto thi name 

22 51 he is the tower of salvat for hi king and sheweth merci to 
hi anoint unto david and to hi seed for evermor 

23 1 now these be the last word of david david the son of jess 
said and the man who wa rai up on high the anoint of the god 
of jacob and the sweet psalmist of israel said 23 2 the spirit of 
the lord spake by me and hi word wa in my tongu 

23 3 the god of israel said the rock of israel spake to me he that 
ruleth over men must be just rule in the fear of god 

23 4 and he shall be a the light of the morn when the sun riseth 
even a morn without cloud a the tender grass spring out of 
the earth by clear shine after rain 

23 5 although my hou be not so with god yet he hath made with me an 
everlast coven order in all thing and sure for thi is all 
my salvat and all my desir although he make it not to grow 

23 6 but the son of belial shall be all of them a thorn thrust 
away becau they cannot be taken with hand 23 7 but the man that 
shall touch them must be fenc with iron and the staff of a spear 
and they shall be utterli burn with fire in the same place 

23 8 these be the name of the mighti men whom david had the 
tachmonit that sat in the seat chief among the captain the same 
wa adino the eznit he lift up hi spear against eight hundr whom 
he slew at one time 

23 9 and after him wa eleazar the son of dodo the ahohit one of the 
three mighti men with david when they defi the philistin that 
were there gather togeth to battl and the men of israel were 
gone away 23 10 he aro and smote the philistin until hi hand 
wa weari and hi hand clave unto the sword and the lord wrought a 
great victori that day and the peopl return after him onli to 
spoil 

23 11 and after him wa shammah the son of age the hararit and the 
philistin were gather togeth into a troop where wa a piec of 
ground full of lentil and the peopl fled from the philistin 

23 12 but he stood in the midst of the ground and defend it and 
slew the philistin and the lord wrought a great victori 

23 13 and three of the thirti chief went down and came to david in 
the harvest time unto the cave of adullam and the troop of the 
philistin pitch in the valley of rephaim 

23 14 and david wa then in an hold and the garrison of the 
philistin wa then in bethlehem 

23 15 and david long and said oh that one would give me drink of 
the water of the well of bethlehem which is by the gate 23 16 and 
the three mighti men brake through the host of the philistin and 
drew water out of the well of bethlehem that wa by the gate and 
took it and brought it to david nevertheless he would not drink 
thereof but pour it out unto the lord 

23 17 and he said be it far from me o lord that i should do thi 
is not thi the blood of the men that went in jeopardi of their life 
therefor he would not drink it these thing did these three mighti 
men 

23 18 and abishai the brother of joab the son of zeruiah wa chief 
among three and he lift up hi spear against three hundr and 
slew them and had the name among three 

23 19 wa he not most honour of three therefor he wa their 
captain howbeit he attain not unto the first three 

23 20 and benaiah the son of jehoiada the son of a valiant man of 
kabzeel who had done mani act he slew two lionlik men of moab he 
went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow 
23 21 and he slew an egyptian a goodli man and the egyptian had a 
spear in hi hand but he went down to him with a staff and pluck 
the spear out of the egyptian s hand and slew him with hi own spear 

23 22 these thing did benaiah the son of jehoiada and had the name 
among three mighti men 

23 23 he wa more honour than the thirti but he attain not to 
the first three and david set him over hi guard 

23 24 asahel the brother of joab wa one of the thirti elhanan the 
son of dodo of bethlehem 23 25 shammah the harodit elika the 
harodit 23 26 helez the paltit ira the son of ikkesh the tekoit 
23 27 abiez the anethothit mebunnai the hushathit 23 28 zalmon 
the ahohit maharai the netophathit 23 29 heleb the son of baanah 
a netophathit ittai the son of ribai out of gibeah of the child 
of benjamin 23 30 benaiah the pirathonit hiddai of the brook of 
gaash 23 31 abialbon the arbathit azmaveth the barhumit 23 32 
eliahba the shaalbonit of the son of jashen jonathan 23 33 
shammah the hararit ahiam the son of sharar the hararit 23 34 
eliphelet the son of ahasbai the son of the maachathit eliam the 
son of ahithophel the gilonit 23 35 hezrai the carmelit paarai the 
arbit 23 36 igal the son of nathan of zobah ban the gadit 23 37 
zelek the ammonit nahari the beerothit armourbear to joab the 
son of zeruiah 23 38 ira an ithrit gareb an ithrit 23 39 uriah 
the hittit thirti and seven in all 

24 1 and again the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel and 
he move david against them to say go number israel and judah 

24 2 for the king said to joab the captain of the host which wa with 
him go now through all the tribe of israel from dan even to 
beersheba and number ye the peopl that i may know the number of the 
peopl 

24 3 and joab said unto the king now the lord thi god add unto the 
peopl how mani soever they be an hundredfold and that the eye of 
my lord the king may see it but whi doth my lord the king delight in 
thi thing 24 4 notwithstand the king s word prevail against 
joab and against the captain of the host and joab and the captain 
of the host went out from the presenc of the king to number the 
peopl of israel 

24 5 and they pa over jordan and pitch in aroer on the right 
side of the citi that lieth in the midst of the river of gad and 
toward jazer 24 6 then they came to gilead and to the land of 
tahtimhodshi and they came to danjaan and about to zidon 24 7 and 
came to the strong hold of tyre and to all the citi of the hivit 
and of the canaanit and they went out to the south of judah even 
to beersheba 

24 8 so when they had gone through all the land they came to 
jerusalem at the end of nine month and twenti day 

24 9 and joab gave up the sum of the number of the peopl unto the 
king and there were in israel eight hundr thousand valiant men that 
drew the sword and the men of judah were five hundr thousand men 

24 10 and david s heart smote him after that he had number the 
peopl 

and david said unto the lord i have sin greatli in that i have 
done and now i beseech thee o lord take away the iniqu of thi 
servant for i have done veri foolishli 

24 11 for when david wa up in the morn the word of the lord came 
unto the prophet gad david s seer say 24 12 go and say unto 
david thu saith the lord i offer thee three thing choo thee one 
of them that i may do it unto thee 

24 13 so gad came to david and told him and said unto him shall 
seven year of famin come unto thee in thi land or wilt thou flee 
three month befor thine enemi while they pursu thee or that 
there be three day pestil in thi land now advi and see what 
answer i shall return to him that sent me 

24 14 and david said unto gad i am in a great strait let u fall now 
into the hand of the lord for hi merci are great and let me not 
fall into the hand of man 

24 15 so the lord sent a pestil upon israel from the morn even 
to the time appoint and there die of the peopl from dan even to 
beersheba seventi thousand men 

24 16 and when the angel stretch out hi hand upon jerusalem to 
destroy it the lord repent him of the evil and said to the angel 
that destroy the peopl it is enough stay now thine hand and the 
angel of the lord wa by the threshingplac of araunah the jebusit 

24 17 and david spake unto the lord when he saw the angel that smote 
the peopl and said lo i have sin and i have done wickedli but 
these sheep what have they done let thine hand i pray thee be 
against me and against my father s hou 

24 18 and gad came that day to david and said unto him go up rear 
an altar unto the lord in the threshingfloor of araunah the jebusit 

24 19 and david accord to the say of gad went up a the lord 
command 

24 20 and araunah look and saw the king and hi servant come on 
toward him and araunah went out and bow himself befor the king on 
hi face upon the ground 

24 21 and araunah said wherefor is my lord the king come to hi 
servant and david said to buy the threshingfloor of thee to build 
an altar unto the lord that the plagu may be stay from the peopl 

24 22 and araunah said unto david let my lord the king take and offer 
up what seemeth good unto him behold here be ox for burnt 
sacrif and thresh instrument and other instrument of the ox 
for wood 

24 23 all these thing did araunah a a king give unto the king and 
araunah said unto the king the lord thi god accept thee 

24 24 and the king said unto araunah nay but i will sure buy it of 
thee at a price neither will i offer burnt offer unto the lord my 
god of that which doth cost me noth so david bought the 
threshingfloor and the ox for fifti shekel of silver 

24 25 and david built there an altar unto the lord and offer burnt 
offer and peac offer so the lord wa intreat for the land 
and the plagu wa stay from israel 




the first book of the king 

commonli call 

the third book of the king 


1 1 now king david wa old and stricken in year and they cover 
him with cloth but he gat no heat 

1 2 wherefor hi servant said unto him let there be sought for my 
lord the king a young virgin and let her stand befor the king and 
let her cherish him and let her lie in thi bosom that my lord the 
king may get heat 

1 3 so they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coast of 
israel and found abishag a shunammit and brought her to the king 

1 4 and the damsel wa veri fair and cherish the king and 
minist to him but the king knew her not 

1 5 then adonijah the son of haggith exalt himself say i will 
be king and he prepar him chariot and horseman and fifti men to 
run befor him 

1 6 and hi father had not displea him at ani time in say whi 
hast thou done so and he also wa a veri goodli man and hi mother 
bare him after absalom 

1 7 and he confer with joab the son of zeruiah and with abiathar 
the priest and they follow adonijah help him 

1 8 but zadok the priest and benaiah the son of jehoiada and nathan 
the prophet and shimei and rei and the mighti men which belong to 
david were not with adonijah 

1 9 and adonijah slew sheep and ox and fat cattl by the stone of 
zoheleth which is by enrogel and call all hi brother the king s 
son and all the men of judah the king s servant 1 10 but nathan 
the prophet and benaiah and the mighti men and solomon hi brother 
he call not 

1 11 wherefor nathan spake unto bathsheba the mother of solomon 
say hast thou not heard that adonijah the son of haggith doth 
reign and david our lord knoweth it not 1 12 now therefor come 
let me i pray thee give thee counsel that thou mayest save thine 
own life and the life of thi son solomon 

1 13 go and get thee in unto king david and say unto him didst not 
thou my lord o king swear unto thine handmaid say assuredli 
solomon thi son shall reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne 
whi then doth adonijah reign 1 14 behold while thou yet talkest 
there with the king i also will come in after thee and confirm thi 
word 

1 15 and bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber and the 
king wa veri old and abishag the shunammit minist unto the 
king 

1 16 and bathsheba bow and did obei unto the king and the 
king said what wouldest thou 1 17 and she said unto him my lord 
thou swarest by the lord thi god unto thine handmaid say 
assuredli solomon thi son shall reign after me and he shall sit upon 
my throne 

1 18 and now behold adonijah reigneth and now my lord the king 
thou knowest it not 1 19 and he hath slain ox and fat cattl and 
sheep in abund and hath call all the son of the king and 
abiathar the priest and joab the captain of the host but solomon thi 
servant hath he not call 

1 20 and thou my lord o king the eye of all israel are upon thee 
that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord 
the king after him 

1 21 otherwi it shall come to pa when my lord the king shall 
sleep with hi father that i and my son solomon shall be count 
offend 

1 22 and lo while she yet talk with the king nathan the prophet 
also came in 

1 23 and they told the king say behold nathan the prophet and 
when he wa come in befor the king he bow himself befor the king 
with hi face to the ground 

1 24 and nathan said my lord o king hast thou said adonijah shall 
reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne 1 25 for he is gone 
down thi day and hath slain ox and fat cattl and sheep in 
abund and hath call all the king s son and the captain of 
the host and abiathar the priest and behold they eat and drink 
befor him and say god save king adonijah 

1 26 but me even me thi servant and zadok the priest and benaiah 
the son of jehoiada and thi servant solomon hath he not call 

1 27 is thi thing done by my lord the king and thou hast not shew 
it unto thi servant who should sit on the throne of my lord the king 
after him 1 28 then king david answer and said call me bathsheba 
and she came into the king s presenc and stood befor the king 

1 29 and the king sware and said a the lord liveth that hath 
redeem my soul out of all distress 1 30 even a i sware unto thee 
by the lord god of israel say assuredli solomon thi son shall 
reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead even so 
will i certainli do thi day 

1 31 then bathsheba bow with her face to the earth and did 
rever to the king and said let my lord king david live for ever 

1 32 and king david said call me zadok the priest and nathan the 
prophet and benaiah the son of jehoiada and they came befor the 
king 

1 33 the king also said unto them take with you the servant of your 
lord and cau solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule and bring 
him down to gihon 1 34 and let zadok the priest and nathan the 
prophet anoint him there king over israel and blow ye with the 
trumpet and say god save king solomon 

1 35 then ye shall come up after him that he may come and sit upon my 
throne for he shall be king in my stead and i have appoint him to 
be ruler over israel and over judah 

1 36 and benaiah the son of jehoiada answer the king and said 
amen the lord god of my lord the king say so too 

1 37 a the lord hath been with my lord the king even so be he with 
solomon and make hi throne greater than the throne of my lord king 
david 

1 38 so zadok the priest and nathan the prophet and benaiah the son 
of jehoiada and the cherethit and the pelethit went down and 
cau solomon to ride upon king david s mule and brought him to 
gihon 

1 39 and zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacl 
and anoint solomon and they blew the trumpet and all the peopl 
said god save king solomon 

1 40 and all the peopl came up after him and the peopl pipe with 
pipe and rejoic with great joy so that the earth rent with the 
sound of them 

1 41 and adonijah and all the guest that were with him heard it a 
they had made an end of eat and when joab heard the sound of the 
trumpet he said wherefor is thi noi of the citi be in an 
uproar 1 42 and while he yet spake behold jonathan the son of 
abiathar the priest came and adonijah said unto him come in for 
thou art a valiant man and bringest good tide 

1 43 and jonathan answer and said to adonijah verili our lord king 
david hath made solomon king 

1 44 and the king hath sent with him zadok the priest and nathan the 
prophet and benaiah the son of jehoiada and the cherethit and the 
pelethit and they have cau him to ride upon the king s mule 
1 45 and zadok the priest and nathan the prophet have anoint him 
king in gihon and they are come up from thenc rejoic so that the 
citi rang again thi is the noi that ye have heard 

1 46 and also solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom 

1 47 and moreov the king s servant came to bless our lord king 
david say god make the name of solomon better than thi name and 
make hi throne greater than thi throne and the king bow himself 
upon the bed 

1 48 and also thu said the king bless be the lord god of israel 
which hath given one to sit on my throne thi day mine eye even 
see it 

1 49 and all the guest that were with adonijah were afraid and rose 
up and went everi man hi way 

1 50 and adonijah fear becau of solomon and aro and went and 
caught hold on the horn of the altar 

1 51 and it wa told solomon say behold adonijah feareth king 
solomon for lo he hath caught hold on the horn of the altar 
say let king solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay hi 
servant with the sword 

1 52 and solomon said if he will shew himself a worthi man there 
shall not an hair of him fall to the earth but if wick shall be 
found in him he shall die 

1 53 so king solomon sent and they brought him down from the altar 
and he came and bow himself to king solomon and solomon said unto 
him go to thine hou 

2 1 now the day of david drew nigh that he should die and he charg 
solomon hi son say 2 2 i go the way of all the earth be thou 
strong therefor and shew thyself a man 2 3 and keep the charg of 
the lord thi god to walk in hi way to keep hi statut and hi 
command and hi judgment and hi testimoni a it is written 
in the law of mose that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest 
and whithersoev thou turnest thyself 2 4 that the lord may continu 
hi word which he spake concern me say if thi child take 
heed to their way to walk befor me in truth with all their heart and 
with all their soul there shall not fail thee said he a man on the 
throne of israel 

2 5 moreov thou knowest also what joab the son of zeruiah did to me 
and what he did to the two captain of the host of israel unto abner 
the son of ner and unto amasa the son of jether whom he slew and 
shed the blood of war in peac and put the blood of war upon hi 
girdl that wa about hi loin and in hi shoe that were on hi 
foot 

2 6 do therefor accord to thi wisdom and let not hi hoar head go 
down to the grave in peac 

2 7 but shew kind unto the son of barzillai the gileadit and 
let them be of those that eat at thi tabl for so they came to me 
when i fled becau of absalom thi brother 

2 8 and behold thou hast with thee shimei the son of gera a 
benjamit of bahurim which cur me with a grievou cur in the day 
when i went to mahanaim but he came down to meet me at jordan and i 
sware to him by the lord say i will not put thee to death with 
the sword 

2 9 now therefor hold him not guiltless for thou art a wise man and 
knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him but hi hoar head bring 
thou down to the grave with blood 

2 10 so david slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi of 
david 

2 11 and the day that david reign over israel were forti year 
seven year reign he in hebron and thirti and three year reign 
he in jerusalem 

2 12 then sat solomon upon the throne of david hi father and hi 
kingdom wa establish greatli 

2 13 and adonijah the son of haggith came to bathsheba the mother of 
solomon and she said comest thou peaceabl and he said peaceabl 

2 14 he said moreov i have somewhat to say unto thee and she said 
say on 

2 15 and he said thou knowest that the kingdom wa mine and that all 
israel set their face on me that i should reign howbeit the kingdom 
is turn about and is becom my brother s for it wa hi from the 
lord 

2 16 and now i ask one petit of thee deni me not and she said 
unto him say on 

2 17 and he said speak i pray thee unto solomon the king for he 
will not say thee nay that he give me abishag the shunammit to 
wife 

2 18 and bathsheba said well i will speak for thee unto the king 

2 19 bathsheba therefor went unto king solomon to speak unto him for 
adonijah and the king rose up to meet her and bow himself unto 
her and sat down on hi throne and cau a seat to be set for the 
king s mother and she sat on hi right hand 

2 20 then she said i desir one small petit of thee i pray thee 
say me not nay and the king said unto her ask on my mother for i 
will not say thee nay 

2 21 and she said let abishag the shunammit be given to adonijah thi 
brother to wife 

2 22 and king solomon answer and said unto hi mother and whi dost 
thou ask abishag the shunammit for adonijah ask for him the kingdom 
also for he is mine elder brother even for him and for abiathar the 
priest and for joab the son of zeruiah 

2 23 then king solomon sware by the lord say god do so to me and 
more also if adonijah have not spoken thi word against hi own life 

2 24 now therefor a the lord liveth which hath establish me and 
set me on the throne of david my father and who hath made me an 
hou a he promi adonijah shall be put to death thi day 

2 25 and king solomon sent by the hand of benaiah the son of jehoiada 
and he fell upon him that he die 

2 26 and unto abiathar the priest said the king get thee to anathoth 
unto thine own field for thou art worthi of death but i will not at 
thi time put thee to death becau thou barest the ark of the lord 
god befor david my father and becau thou hast been afflict in 
all wherein my father wa afflict 

2 27 so solomon thrust out abiathar from be priest unto the lord 
that he might fulfil the word of the lord which he spake concern 
the hou of eli in shiloh 

2 28 then tide came to joab for joab had turn after adonijah 
though he turn not after absalom and joab fled unto the tabernacl 
of the lord and caught hold on the horn of the altar 

2 29 and it wa told king solomon that joab wa fled unto the 
tabernacl of the lord and behold he is by the altar then solomon 
sent benaiah the son of jehoiada say go fall upon him 

2 30 and benaiah came to the tabernacl of the lord and said unto 
him thu saith the king come forth and he said nay but i will die 
here and benaiah brought the king word again say thu said joab 
and thu he answer me 

2 31 and the king said unto him do a he hath said and fall upon 
him and buri him that thou mayest take away the innoc blood 
which joab shed from me and from the hou of my father 

2 32 and the lord shall return hi blood upon hi own head who fell 
upon two men more righteou and better than he and slew them with the 
sword my father david not know thereof to wit abner the son of 
ner captain of the host of israel and amasa the son of jether 
captain of the host of judah 

2 33 their blood shall therefor return upon the head of joab and 
upon the head of hi seed for ever but upon david and upon hi seed 
and upon hi hou and upon hi throne shall there be peac for ever 
from the lord 

2 34 so benaiah the son of jehoiada went up and fell upon him and 
slew him and he wa buri in hi own hou in the wilder 

2 35 and the king put benaiah the son of jehoiada in hi room over the 
host and zadok the priest did the king put in the room of abiathar 

2 36 and the king sent and call for shimei and said unto him build 
thee an hou in jerusalem and dwell there and go not forth thenc 
ani whither
