2 37 for it shall be that on the day thou goest out and passest over 
the brook kidron thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt sure 
die thi blood shall be upon thine own head 

2 38 and shimei said unto the king the say is good a my lord the 
king hath said so will thi servant do and shimei dwelt in jerusalem 
mani day 

2 39 and it came to pa at the end of three year that two of the 
servant of shimei ran away unto achish son of maachah king of gath 
and they told shimei say behold thi servant be in gath 

2 40 and shimei aro and saddl hi a and went to gath to achish 
to seek hi servant and shimei went and brought hi servant from 
gath 

2 41 and it wa told solomon that shimei had gone from jerusalem to 
gath and wa come again 

2 42 and the king sent and call for shimei and said unto him did i 
not make thee to swear by the lord and protest unto thee say 
know for a certain on the day thou goest out and walkest abroad ani 
whither that thou shalt sure die and thou saidst unto me the word 
that i have heard is good 

2 43 whi then hast thou not kept the oath of the lord and the 
command that i have charg thee with 2 44 the king said 
moreov to shimei thou knowest all the wick which thine heart 
is privi to that thou didst to david my father therefor the lord 
shall return thi wick upon thine own head 2 45 and king solomon 
shall be bless and the throne of david shall be establish befor 
the lord for ever 

2 46 so the king command benaiah the son of jehoiada which went 
out and fell upon him that he die and the kingdom wa establish 
in the hand of solomon 

3 1 and solomon made affin with pharaoh king of egypt and took 
pharaoh s daughter and brought her into the citi of david until he 
had made an end of build hi own hou and the hou of the lord 
and the wall of jerusalem round about 

3 2 onli the peopl sacrif in high place becau there wa no 
hou built unto the name of the lord until those day 

3 3 and solomon love the lord walk in the statut of david hi 
father onli he sacrif and burnt incen in high place 

3 4 and the king went to gibeon to sacrif there for that wa the 
great high place a thousand burnt offer did solomon offer upon 
that altar 

3 5 in gibeon the lord appear to solomon in a dream by night and 
god said ask what i shall give thee 

3 6 and solomon said thou hast shew unto thi servant david my 
father great merci accord a he walk befor thee in truth and 
in righteou and in upright of heart with thee and thou hast 
kept for him thi great kind that thou hast given him a son to 
sit on hi throne a it is thi day 

3 7 and now o lord my god thou hast made thi servant king instead of 
david my father and i am but a littl child i know not how to go out 
or come in 

3 8 and thi servant is in the midst of thi peopl which thou hast 
chosen a great peopl that cannot be number nor count for 
multitud 

3 9 give therefor thi servant an understand heart to judg thi 
peopl that i may discern between good and bad for who is abl to 
judg thi thi so great a peopl 3 10 and the speech plea the 
lord that solomon had ask thi thing 

3 11 and god said unto him becau thou hast ask thi thing and 
hast not ask for thyself long life neither hast ask rich for 
thyself nor hast ask the life of thine enemi but hast ask for 
thyself understand to discern judgment 3 12 behold i have done 
accord to thi word lo i have given thee a wise and an 
understand heart so that there wa none like thee befor thee 
neither after thee shall ani ari like unto thee 

3 13 and i have also given thee that which thou hast not ask both 
rich and honour so that there shall not be ani among the king 
like unto thee all thi day 

3 14 and if thou wilt walk in my way to keep my statut and my 
command a thi father david did walk then i will lengthen thi 
day 

3 15 and solomon awok and behold it wa a dream and he came to 
jerusalem and stood befor the ark of the coven of the lord and 
offer up burnt offer and offer peac offer and made a 
feast to all hi servant 

3 16 then came there two woman that were harlot unto the king and 
stood befor him 

3 17 and the one woman said o my lord i and thi woman dwell in one 
hou and i wa deliv of a child with her in the hou 

3 18 and it came to pa the third day after that i wa deliv 
that thi woman wa deliv also and we were togeth there wa no 
stranger with u in the hou save we two in the hou 

3 19 and thi woman s child die in the night becau she overlaid 
it 

3 20 and she aro at midnight and took my son from besid me while 
thine handmaid slept and laid it in her bosom and laid her dead 
child in my bosom 

3 21 and when i rose in the morn to give my child suck behold it 
wa dead but when i had consid it in the morn behold it wa 
not my son which i did bear 

3 22 and the other woman said nay but the live is my son and the 
dead is thi son and thi said no but the dead is thi son and the 
live is my son thu they spake befor the king 

3 23 then said the king the one saith thi is my son that liveth 
and thi son is the dead and the other saith nay but thi son is the 
dead and my son is the live 

3 24 and the king said bring me a sword and they brought a sword 
befor the king 

3 25 and the king said divid the live child in two and give half 
to the one and half to the other 

3 26 then spake the woman whose the live child wa unto the king 
for her bowel yearn upon her son and she said o my lord give her 
the live child and in no wise slay it but the other said let it 
be neither mine nor thine but divid it 

3 27 then the king answer and said give her the live child and 
in no wise slay it she is the mother thereof 

3 28 and all israel heard of the judgment which the king had judg 
and they fear the king for they saw that the wisdom of god wa in 
him to do judgment 

4 1 so king solomon wa king over all israel 

4 2 and these were the princ which he had azariah the son of zadok 
the priest 4 3 elihoreph and ahiah the son of shisha scribe 
jehoshaphat the son of ahilud the record 

4 4 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over the host and zadok and 
abiathar were the priest 4 5 and azariah the son of nathan wa over 
the offic and zabud the son of nathan wa princip offic and 
the king s friend 4 6 and ahishar wa over the household and 
adoniram the son of abda wa over the tribut 

4 7 and solomon had twelv offic over all israel which provid 
victual for the king and hi household each man hi month in a year 
made provi 

4 8 and these are their name the son of hur in mount ephraim 4 9 
the son of dekar in makaz and in shaalbim and bethshemesh and 
elonbethhanan 4 10 the son of hese in aruboth to him pertain 
sochoh and all the land of hepher 4 11 the son of abinadab in all 
the region of dor which had taphath the daughter of solomon to wife 
4 12 baana the son of ahilud to him pertain taanach and megiddo 
and all bethshean which is by zartanah beneath jezreel from 
bethshean to abelmeholah even unto the place that is beyond jokneam 
4 13 the son of geber in ramothgilead to him pertain the town of 
jair the son of manasseh which are in gilead to him also pertain 
the region of argob which is in bashan threescor great citi with 
wall and brasen bar 4 14 ahinadab the son of iddo had mahanaim 
4 15 ahimaaz wa in naphtali he also took basmath the daughter of 
solomon to wife 4 16 baanah the son of hushai wa in asher and in 
aloth 4 17 jehoshaphat the son of paruah in issachar 4 18 shimei 
the son of elah in benjamin 4 19 geber the son of uri wa in the 
countri of gilead in the countri of sihon king of the amorit and 
of og king of bashan and he wa the onli offic which wa in the 
land 

4 20 judah and israel were mani a the sand which is by the sea in 
multitud eat and drink and make merri 

4 21 and solomon reign over all kingdom from the river unto the 
land of the philistin and unto the border of egypt they brought 
present and serv solomon all the day of hi life 

4 22 and solomon s provi for one day wa thirti measur of fine 
flour and threescor measur of meal 4 23 ten fat ox and twenti 
ox out of the pastur and an hundr sheep besid hart and 
roebuck and fallowd and fat fowl 

4 24 for he had dominion over all the region on thi side the river 
from tiphsah even to azzah over all the king on thi side the river 
and he had peac on all side round about him 

4 25 and judah and israel dwelt safe everi man under hi vine and 
under hi fig tree from dan even to beersheba all the day of 
solomon 

4 26 and solomon had forti thousand stall of hor for hi chariot 
and twelv thousand horseman 

4 27 and those offic provid victual for king solomon and for all 
that came unto king solomon s tabl everi man in hi month they 
lack noth 

4 28 barley also and straw for the hor and dromedari brought they 
unto the place where the offic were everi man accord to hi 
charg 

4 29 and god gave solomon wisdom and understand exceed much and 
larg of heart even a the sand that is on the sea shore 

4 30 and solomon s wisdom excel the wisdom of all the child of 
the east countri and all the wisdom of egypt 

4 31 for he wa wiser than all men than ethan the ezrahit and 
heman and chalcol and darda the son of mahol and hi fame wa in 
all nation round about 

4 32 and he spake three thousand proverb and hi song were a 
thousand and five 

4 33 and he spake of tree from the cedar tree that is in lebanon 
even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall he spake also of 
beast and of fowl and of creep thing and of fish 

4 34 and there came of all peopl to hear the wisdom of solomon from 
all king of the earth which had heard of hi wisdom 

5 1 and hiram king of tyre sent hi servant unto solomon for he had 
heard that they had anoint him king in the room of hi father for 
hiram wa ever a lover of david 

5 2 and solomon sent to hiram say 5 3 thou knowest how that david 
my father could not build an hou unto the name of the lord hi god 
for the war which were about him on everi side until the lord put 
them under the sol of hi foot 

5 4 but now the lord my god hath given me rest on everi side so that 
there is neither adversari nor evil occurr 

5 5 and behold i purpo to build an hou unto the name of the lord 
my god a the lord spake unto david my father say thi son whom 
i will set upon thi throne in thi room he shall build an hou unto 
my name 

5 6 now therefor command thou that they hew me cedar tree out of 
lebanon and my servant shall be with thi servant and unto thee 
will i give hire for thi servant accord to all that thou shalt 
appoint for thou knowest that there is not among u ani that can 
skill to hew timber like unto the sidonian 

5 7 and it came to pa when hiram heard the word of solomon that 
he rejoic greatli and said bless be the lord thi day which 
hath given unto david a wise son over thi great peopl 

5 8 and hiram sent to solomon say i have consid the thing 
which thou sentest to me for and i will do all thi desir concern 
timber of cedar and concern timber of fir 

5 9 my servant shall bring them down from lebanon unto the sea and i 
will convey them by sea in float unto the place that thou shalt 
appoint me and will cau them to be discharg there and thou shalt 
receiv them and thou shalt accomplish my desir in give food for 
my household 

5 10 so hiram gave solomon cedar tree and fir tree accord to all 
hi desir 

5 11 and solomon gave hiram twenti thousand measur of wheat for food 
to hi household and twenti measur of pure oil thu gave solomon 
to hiram year by year 

5 12 and the lord gave solomon wisdom a he promi him and there 
wa peac between hiram and solomon and they two made a leagu 
togeth 

5 13 and king solomon rai a levi out of all israel and the levi 
wa thirti thousand men 

5 14 and he sent them to lebanon ten thousand a month by cour a 
month they were in lebanon and two month at home and adoniram wa 
over the levi 

5 15 and solomon had threescor and ten thousand that bare burden 
and fourscor thousand hewer in the mountain 5 16 besid the chief 
of solomon s offic which were over the work three thousand and 
three hundr which rule over the peopl that wrought in the work 

5 17 and the king command and they brought great stone costli 
stone and hew stone to lay the foundat of the hou 

5 18 and solomon s builder and hiram s builder did hew them and the 
stonesquar so they prepar timber and stone to build the hou 

6 1 and it came to pa in the four hundr and eightieth year after 
the child of israel were come out of the land of egypt in the 
fourth year of solomon s reign over israel in the month zif which is 
the second month that he began to build the hou of the lord 

6 2 and the hou which king solomon built for the lord the length 
thereof wa threescor cubit and the breadth thereof twenti cubit 
and the height thereof thirti cubit 

6 3 and the porch befor the templ of the hou twenti cubit wa 
the length thereof accord to the breadth of the hou and ten 
cubit wa the breadth thereof befor the hou 

6 4 and for the hou he made window of narrow light 

6 5 and against the wall of the hou he built chamber round about 
against the wall of the hou round about both of the templ and of 
the oracl and he made chamber round about 6 6 the nethermost 
chamber wa five cubit broad and the middl wa six cubit broad 
and the third wa seven cubit broad for without in the wall of the 
hou he made narrow rest round about that the beam should not be 
fasten in the wall of the hou 

6 7 and the hou when it wa in build wa built of stone made 
readi befor it wa brought thither so that there wa neither hammer 
nor axe nor ani tool of iron heard in the hou while it wa in 
build 

6 8 the door for the middl chamber wa in the right side of the 
hou and they went up with wind stair into the middl chamber 
and out of the middl into the third 

6 9 so he built the hou and finish it and cover the hou with 
beam and board of cedar 

6 10 and then he built chamber against all the hou five cubit 
high and they rest on the hou with timber of cedar 

6 11 and the word of the lord came to solomon say 6 12 concern 
thi hou which thou art in build if thou wilt walk in my 
statut and execut my judgment and keep all my command to 
walk in them then will i perform my word with thee which i spake 
unto david thi father 6 13 and i will dwell among the child of 
israel and will not forsak my peopl israel 

6 14 so solomon built the hou and finish it 

6 15 and he built the wall of the hou within with board of cedar 
both the floor of the hou and the wall of the ceil and he 
cover them on the insid with wood and cover the floor of the 
hou with plank of fir 

6 16 and he built twenti cubit on the side of the hou both the 
floor and the wall with board of cedar he even built them for it 
within even for the oracl even for the most holi place 

6 17 and the hou that is the templ befor it wa forti cubit 
long 

6 18 and the cedar of the hou within wa carv with knop and open 
flower all wa cedar there wa no stone seen 

6 19 and the oracl he prepar in the hou within to set there the 
ark of the coven of the lord 

6 20 and the oracl in the forepart wa twenti cubit in length and 
twenti cubit in breadth and twenti cubit in the height thereof and 
he overlaid it with pure gold and so cover the altar which wa of 
cedar 

6 21 so solomon overlaid the hou within with pure gold and he made 
a partit by the chain of gold befor the oracl and he overlaid 
it with gold 

6 22 and the whole hou he overlaid with gold until he had finish 
all the hou also the whole altar that wa by the oracl he overlaid 
with gold 

6 23 and within the oracl he made two cherub of oliv tree each 
ten cubit high 

6 24 and five cubit wa the one wing of the cherub and five cubit 
the other wing of the cherub from the uttermost part of the one wing 
unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubit 

6 25 and the other cherub wa ten cubit both the cherub were of 
one measur and one size 

6 26 the height of the one cherub wa ten cubit and so wa it of the 
other cherub 

6 27 and he set the cherub within the inner hou and they 
stretch forth the wing of the cherub so that the wing of the 
one touch the one wall and the wing of the other cherub touch the 
other wall and their wing touch one anoth in the midst of the 
hou 

6 28 and he overlaid the cherub with gold 

6 29 and he carv all the wall of the hou round about with carv 
figur of cherub and palm tree and open flower within and 
without 

6 30 and the floor of the hou he overlaid with gold within and 
without 

6 31 and for the enter of the oracl he made door of oliv tree 
the lintel and side post were a fifth part of the wall 

6 32 the two door also were of oliv tree and he carv upon them 
carv of cherub and palm tree and open flower and overlaid 
them with gold and spread gold upon the cherub and upon the palm 
tree 

6 33 so also made he for the door of the templ post of oliv tree a 
fourth part of the wall 

6 34 and the two door were of fir tree the two leaf of the one 
door were fold and the two leaf of the other door were fold 

6 35 and he carv thereon cherub and palm tree and open flower 
and cover them with gold fit upon the carv work 

6 36 and he built the inner court with three row of hew stone and 
a row of cedar beam 

6 37 in the fourth year wa the foundat of the hou of the lord 
laid in the month zif 6 38 and in the eleventh year in the month 
bul which is the eighth month wa the hou finish throughout all 
the part thereof and accord to all the fashion of it so wa he 
seven year in build it 

7 1 but solomon wa build hi own hou thirteen year and he 
finish all hi hou 

7 2 he built also the hou of the forest of lebanon the length 
thereof wa an hundr cubit and the breadth thereof fifti cubit 
and the height thereof thirti cubit upon four row of cedar pillar 
with cedar beam upon the pillar 

7 3 and it wa cover with cedar abov upon the beam that lay on 
forti five pillar fifteen in a row 

7 4 and there were window in three row and light wa against light 
in three rank 

7 5 and all the door and post were squar with the window and 
light wa against light in three rank 

7 6 and he made a porch of pillar the length thereof wa fifti 
cubit and the breadth thereof thirti cubit and the porch wa 
befor them and the other pillar and the thick beam were befor 
them 

7 7 then he made a porch for the throne where he might judg even the 
porch of judgment and it wa cover with cedar from one side of the 
floor to the other 

7 8 and hi hou where he dwelt had anoth court within the porch 
which wa of the like work solomon made also an hou for pharaoh s 
daughter whom he had taken to wife like unto thi porch 

7 9 all these were of costli stone accord to the measur of 
hew stone saw with saw within and without even from the 
foundat unto the cope and so on the outsid toward the great 
court 

7 10 and the foundat wa of costli stone even great stone 
stone of ten cubit and stone of eight cubit 

7 11 and abov were costli stone after the measur of hew stone 
and cedar 

7 12 and the great court round about wa with three row of hew 
stone and a row of cedar beam both for the inner court of the 
hou of the lord and for the porch of the hou 

7 13 and king solomon sent and fetch hiram out of tyre 

7 14 he wa a widow s son of the tribe of naphtali and hi father wa 
a man of tyre a worker in brass and he wa fill with wisdom and 
understand and cun to work all work in brass and he came to 
king solomon and wrought all hi work 

7 15 for he cast two pillar of brass of eighteen cubit high apiec 
and a line of twelv cubit did compass either of them about 

7 16 and he made two chapit of molten brass to set upon the top 
of the pillar the height of the one chapit wa five cubit and 
the height of the other chapit wa five cubit 7 17 and net of 
checker work and wreath of chain work for the chapit which were 
upon the top of the pillar seven for the one chapit and seven for 
the other chapit 

7 18 and he made the pillar and two row round about upon the one 
network to cover the chapit that were upon the top with 
pomegran and so did he for the other chapit 

7 19 and the chapit that were upon the top of the pillar were of 
lili work in the porch four cubit 

7 20 and the chapit upon the two pillar had pomegran also 
abov over against the belli which wa by the network and the 
pomegran were two hundr in row round about upon the other 
chapit 

7 21 and he set up the pillar in the porch of the templ and he set 
up the right pillar and call the name thereof jachin and he set up 
the left pillar and call the name thereof boaz 

7 22 and upon the top of the pillar wa lili work so wa the work of 
the pillar finish 

7 23 and he made a molten sea ten cubit from the one brim to the 
other it wa round all about and hi height wa five cubit and a 
line of thirti cubit did compass it round about 

7 24 and under the brim of it round about there were knop compass 
it ten in a cubit compass the sea round about the knop were 
cast in two row when it wa cast 

7 25 it stood upon twelv ox three look toward the north and 
three look toward the west and three look toward the south and 
three look toward the east and the sea wa set abov upon them 
and all their hinder part were inward 

7 26 and it wa an hand breadth thick and the brim thereof wa 
wrought like the brim of a cup with flower of lili it contain 
two thousand bath 

7 27 and he made ten base of brass four cubit wa the length of one 
base and four cubit the breadth thereof and three cubit the height 
of it 

7 28 and the work of the base wa on thi manner they had border 
and the border were between the ledg 7 29 and on the border that 
were between the ledg were lion ox and cherub and upon the 
ledg there wa a base abov and beneath the lion and ox were 
certain addit made of thin work 

7 30 and everi base had four brasen wheel and plate of brass and 
the four corner thereof had undersett under the laver were 
undersett molten at the side of everi addit 

7 31 and the mouth of it within the chapit and abov wa a cubit 
but the mouth thereof wa round after the work of the base a cubit 
and an half and also upon the mouth of it were grave with their 
border foursquar not round 

7 32 and under the border were four wheel and the axletr of the 
wheel were join to the base and the height of a wheel wa a cubit 
and half a cubit 

7 33 and the work of the wheel wa like the work of a chariot wheel 
their axletr and their nave and their fello and their spoke 
were all molten 

7 34 and there were four undersett to the four corner of one base 
and the undersett were of the veri base itself 

7 35 and in the top of the base wa there a round compass of half a 
cubit high and on the top of the base the ledg thereof and the 
border thereof were of the same 

7 36 for on the plate of the ledg thereof and on the border 
thereof he grave cherub lion and palm tree accord to the 
proport of everi one and addit round about 

7 37 after thi manner he made the ten base all of them had one 
cast one measur and one size 

7 38 then made he ten laver of brass one laver contain forti 
bath and everi laver wa four cubit and upon everi one of the ten 
base one laver 

7 39 and he put five base on the right side of the hou and five on 
the left side of the hou and he set the sea on the right side of 
the hou eastward over against the south 

7 40 and hiram made the laver and the shovel and the bason so 
hiram made an end of do all the work that he made king solomon for 
the hou of the lord 7 41 the two pillar and the two bowl of the 
chapit that were on the top of the two pillar and the two 
network to cover the two bowl of the chapit which were upon the 
top of the pillar 7 42 and four hundr pomegran for the two 
network even two row of pomegran for one network to cover the 
two bowl of the chapit that were upon the pillar 7 43 and the 
ten base and ten laver on the base 7 44 and one sea and twelv 
ox under the sea 7 45 and the pot and the shovel and the 
bason and all these vessel which hiram made to king solomon for 
the hou of the lord were of bright brass 

7 46 in the plain of jordan did the king cast them in the clay ground 
between succoth and zarthan 

7 47 and solomon left all the vessel unweigh becau they were 
exceed mani neither wa the weight of the brass found out 

7 48 and solomon made all the vessel that pertain unto the hou of 
the lord the altar of gold and the tabl of gold whereupon the 
shewbread wa 7 49 and the candlestick of pure gold five on the 
right side and five on the left befor the oracl with the flower 
and the lamp and the tong of gold 7 50 and the bowl and the 
snuffer and the bason and the spoon and the censer of pure 
gold and the hing of gold both for the door of the inner hou 
the most holi place and for the door of the hou to wit of the 
templ 

7 51 so wa end all the work that king solomon made for the hou of 
the lord and solomon brought in the thing which david hi father had 
dedic even the silver and the gold and the vessel did he put 
among the treasur of the hou of the lord 

8 1 then solomon assembl the elder of israel and all the head of 
the tribe the chief of the father of the child of israel unto 
king solomon in jerusalem that they might bring up the ark of the 
coven of the lord out of the citi of david which is zion 

8 2 and all the men of israel assembl themselv unto king solomon 
at the feast in the month ethanim which is the seventh month 

8 3 and all the elder of israel came and the priest took up the 
ark 

8 4 and they brought up the ark of the lord and the tabernacl of the 
congreg and all the holi vessel that were in the tabernacl 
even those did the priest and the levit bring up 

8 5 and king solomon and all the congreg of israel that were 
assembl unto him were with him befor the ark sacrif sheep 
and ox that could not be told nor number for multitud 

8 6 and the priest brought in the ark of the coven of the lord 
unto hi place into the oracl of the hou to the most holi place 
even under the wing of the cherub 

8 7 for the cherub spread forth their two wing over the place of 
the ark and the cherub cover the ark and the stave thereof 
abov 

8 8 and they drew out the stave that the end of the stave were 
seen out in the holi place befor the oracl and they were not seen 
without and there they are unto thi day 

8 9 there wa noth in the ark save the two tabl of stone which 
mose put there at horeb when the lord made a coven with the 
child of israel when they came out of the land of egypt 

8 10 and it came to pa when the priest were come out of the holi 
place that the cloud fill the hou of the lord 8 11 so that the 
priest could not stand to minist becau of the cloud for the 
glori of the lord had fill the hou of the lord 

8 12 then spake solomon the lord said that he would dwell in the 
thick dark 

8 13 i have sure built thee an hou to dwell in a settl place 
for thee to abid in for ever 

8 14 and the king turn hi face about and bless all the 
congreg of israel and all the congreg of israel stood 
8 15 and he said bless be the lord god of israel which spake with 
hi mouth unto david my father and hath with hi hand fulfil it 
say 8 16 sinc the day that i brought forth my peopl israel out 
of egypt i chose no citi out of all the tribe of israel to build an 
hou that my name might be therein but i chose david to be over my 
peopl israel 

8 17 and it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hou for 
the name of the lord god of israel 

8 18 and the lord said unto david my father wherea it wa in thine 
heart to build an hou unto my name thou didst well that it wa in 
thine heart 

8 19 nevertheless thou shalt not build the hou but thi son that 
shall come forth out of thi loin he shall build the hou unto my 
name 

8 20 and the lord hath perform hi word that he spake and i am 
risen up in the room of david my father and sit on the throne of 
israel a the lord promi and have built an hou for the name of 
the lord god of israel 

8 21 and i have set there a place for the ark wherein is the coven 
of the lord which he made with our father when he brought them out 
of the land of egypt 

8 22 and solomon stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of 
all the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hand toward 
heaven 8 23 and he said lord god of israel there is no god like 
thee in heaven abov or on earth beneath who keepest coven and 
merci with thi servant that walk befor thee with all their heart 
8 24 who hast kept with thi servant david my father that thou 
promisedst him thou spakest also with thi mouth and hast fulfil 
it with thine hand a it is thi day 

8 25 therefor now lord god of israel keep with thi servant david my 
father that thou promisedst him say there shall not fail thee a 
man in my sight to sit on the throne of israel so that thi child 
take heed to their way that they walk befor me a thou hast walk 
befor me 

8 26 and now o god of israel let thi word i pray thee be verifi 
which thou spakest unto thi servant david my father 

8 27 but will god ind dwell on the earth behold the heaven and 
heaven of heaven cannot contain thee how much le thi hou that i 
have build 8 28 yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thi 
servant and to hi supplic o lord my god to hearken unto the 
cri and to the prayer which thi servant prayeth befor thee to day 
8 29 that thine eye may be open toward thi hou night and day even 
toward the place of which thou hast said my name shall be there that 
thou mayest hearken unto the prayer which thi servant shall make 
toward thi place 

8 30 and hearken thou to the supplic of thi servant and of thi 
peopl israel when they shall pray toward thi place and hear thou 
in heaven thi dwell place and when thou hearest forgiv 

8 31 if ani man trespass against hi neighbour and an oath be laid 
upon him to cau him to swear and the oath come befor thine altar 
in thi hou 8 32 then hear thou in heaven and do and judg thi 
servant condemn the wick to bring hi way upon hi head and 
justifi the righteou to give him accord to hi righteou 

8 33 when thi peopl israel be smitten down befor the enemi becau 
they have sin against thee and shall turn again to thee and 
confess thi name and pray and make supplic unto thee in thi 
hou 8 34 then hear thou in heaven and forgiv the sin of thi 
peopl israel and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest 
unto their father 

8 35 when heaven is shut up and there is no rain becau they have 
sin against thee if they pray toward thi place and confess thi 
name and turn from their sin when thou afflictest them 8 36 then 
hear thou in heaven and forgiv the sin of thi servant and of thi 
peopl israel that thou teach them the good way wherein they should 
walk and give rain upon thi land which thou hast given to thi peopl 
for an inherit 

8 37 if there be in the land famin if there be pestil blast 
mildew locust or if there be caterpil if their enemi besieg 
them in the land of their citi whatsoev plagu whatsoev 
sick there be 8 38 what prayer and supplic soever be made by 
ani man or by all thi peopl israel which shall know everi man the 
plagu of hi own heart and spread forth hi hand toward thi hou 
8 39 then hear thou in heaven thi dwell place and forgiv and do 
and give to everi man accord to hi way whose heart thou knowest 
for thou even thou onli knowest the heart of all the child of 
men 8 40 that they may fear thee all the day that they live in the 
land which thou gavest unto our father 

8 41 moreov concern a stranger that is not of thi peopl israel 
but cometh out of a far countri for thi name s sake 8 42 for they 
shall hear of thi great name and of thi strong hand and of thi 
stretch out arm when he shall come and pray toward thi hou 
8 43 hear thou in heaven thi dwell place and do accord to all 
that the stranger calleth to thee for that all peopl of the earth 
may know thi name to fear thee a do thi peopl israel and that 
they may know that thi hou which i have build is call by thi 
name 

8 44 if thi peopl go out to battl against their enemi whithersoev 
thou shalt send them and shall pray unto the lord toward the citi 
which thou hast chosen and toward the hou that i have built for thi 
name 8 45 then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their 
supplic and maintain their cau 

8 46 if they sin against thee for there is no man that sinneth not 
and thou be angri with them and deliv them to the enemi so that 
they carri them away captiv unto the land of the enemi far or near 
8 47 yet if they shall bethink themselv in the land whither they 
were carri captiv and repent and make supplic unto thee in 
the land of them that carri them captiv say we have sin 
and have done perver we have commit wick 8 48 and so 
return unto thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the 
land of their enemi which led them away captiv and pray unto thee 
toward their land which thou gavest unto their father the citi 
which thou hast chosen and the hou which i have built for thi name 
8 49 then hear thou their prayer and their supplic in heaven thi 
dwell place and maintain their cau 8 50 and forgiv thi peopl 
that have sin against thee and all their transgress wherein 
they have transgress against thee and give them compass befor 
them who carri them captiv that they may have compass on them 
8 51 for they be thi peopl and thine inherit which thou 
broughtest forth out of egypt from the midst of the furnac of iron 
8 52 that thine eye may be open unto the supplic of thi servant 
and unto the supplic of thi peopl israel to hearken unto them 
in all that they call for unto thee 

8 53 for thou didst separ them from among all the peopl of the 
earth to be thine inherit a thou spakest by the hand of mose 
thi servant when thou broughtest our father out of egypt o lord 
god 

8 54 and it wa so that when solomon had made an end of pray all 
thi prayer and supplic unto the lord he aro from befor the 
altar of the lord from kneel on hi knee with hi hand spread up 
to heaven 

8 55 and he stood and bless all the congreg of israel with a 
loud voic say 8 56 bless be the lord that hath given rest 
unto hi peopl israel accord to all that he promi there hath 
not fail one word of all hi good promi which he promi by the 
hand of mose hi servant 

8 57 the lord our god be with u a he wa with our father let him 
not leav u nor forsak u 8 58 that he may inclin our heart unto 
him to walk in all hi way and to keep hi command and hi 
statut and hi judgment which he command our father 

8 59 and let these my word wherewith i have made supplic befor 
the lord be nigh unto the lord our god day and night that he 
maintain the cau of hi servant and the cau of hi peopl israel 
at all time a the matter shall requir 8 60 that all the peopl of 
the earth may know that the lord is god and that there is none el 

8 61 let your heart therefor be perfect with the lord our god to 
walk in hi statut and to keep hi command a at thi day 

8 62 and the king and all israel with him offer sacrif befor 
the lord 

8 63 and solomon offer a sacrif of peac offer which he 
offer unto the lord two and twenti thousand ox and an hundr 
and twenti thousand sheep so the king and all the child of israel 
dedic the hou of the lord 

8 64 the same day did the king hallow the middl of the court that wa 
befor the hou of the lord for there he offer burnt offer 
and meat offer and the fat of the peac offer becau the 
brasen altar that wa befor the lord wa too littl to receiv the 
burnt offer and meat offer and the fat of the peac 
offer 

8 65 and at that time solomon held a feast and all israel with him a 
great congreg from the enter in of hamath unto the river of 
egypt befor the lord our god seven day and seven day even 
fourteen day 

8 66 on the eighth day he sent the peopl away and they bless the 
king and went unto their tent joy and glad of heart for all the 
good that the lord had done for david hi servant and for israel 
hi peopl 

9 1 and it came to pa when solomon had finish the build of the 
hou of the lord and the king s hou and all solomon s desir 
which he wa plea to do 9 2 that the lord appear to solomon the 
second time a he had appear unto him at gibeon 

9 3 and the lord said unto him i have heard thi prayer and thi 
supplic that thou hast made befor me i have hallow thi 
hou which thou hast built to put my name there for ever and mine 
eye and mine heart shall be there perpetu 

9 4 and if thou wilt walk befor me a david thi father walk in 
integr of heart and in upright to do accord to all that i 
have command thee and wilt keep my statut and my judgment 9 5 
then i will establish the throne of thi kingdom upon israel for ever 
a i promi to david thi father say there shall not fail thee a 
man upon the throne of israel 

9 6 but if ye shall at all turn from follow me ye or your 
child and will not keep my command and my statut which i 
have set befor you but go and serv other god and worship them 
9 7 then will i cut off israel out of the land which i have given 
them and thi hou which i have hallow for my name will i cast 
out of my sight and israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all 
peopl 9 8 and at thi hou which is high everi one that passeth 
by it shall be astonish and shall hiss and they shall say whi 
hath the lord done thu unto thi land and to thi hou 9 9 and 
they shall answer becau they forsook the lord their god who 
brought forth their father out of the land of egypt and have taken 
hold upon other god and have worship them and serv them 
therefor hath the lord brought upon them all thi evil 

9 10 and it came to pa at the end of twenti year when solomon had 
built the two hou the hou of the lord and the king s hou 
9 11 now hiram the king of tyre had furnish solomon with cedar 
tree and fir tree and with gold accord to all hi desir that 
then king solomon gave hiram twenti citi in the land of galil 

9 12 and hiram came out from tyre to see the citi which solomon had 
given him and they plea him not 

9 13 and he said what citi are these which thou hast given me my 
brother and he call them the land of cabul unto thi day 

9 14 and hiram sent to the king sixscor talent of gold 

9 15 and thi is the reason of the levi which king solomon rai for 
to build the hou of the lord and hi own hou and millo and the 
wall of jerusalem and hazor and megiddo and gezer 

9 16 for pharaoh king of egypt had gone up and taken gezer and burnt 
it with fire and slain the canaanit that dwelt in the citi and 
given it for a present unto hi daughter solomon s wife 

9 17 and solomon built gezer and bethhoron the nether 9 18 and 
baalath and tadmor in the wilder in the land 9 19 and all the 
citi of store that solomon had and citi for hi chariot and 
citi for hi horseman and that which solomon desir to build in 
jerusalem and in lebanon and in all the land of hi dominion 

9 20 and all the peopl that were left of the amorit hittit 
perizzit hivit and jebusit which were not of the child of 
israel 9 21 their child that were left after them in the land 
whom the child of israel also were not abl utterli to destroy 
upon those did solomon levi a tribut of bondserv unto thi day 

9 22 but of the child of israel did solomon make no bondman but 
they were men of war and hi servant and hi princ and hi 
captain and ruler of hi chariot and hi horseman 

9 23 these were the chief of the offic that were over solomon s 
work five hundr and fifti which bare rule over the peopl that 
wrought in the work 

9 24 but pharaoh s daughter came up out of the citi of david unto her 
hou which solomon had built for her then did he build millo 

9 25 and three time in a year did solomon offer burnt offer and 
peac offer upon the altar which he built unto the lord and he 
burnt incen upon the altar that wa befor the lord so he finish 
the hou 

9 26 and king solomon made a navi of ship in eziongeb which is 
besid eloth on the shore of the red sea in the land of edom 

9 27 and hiram sent in the navi hi servant shipmen that had 
knowledg of the sea with the servant of solomon 

9 28 and they came to ophir and fetch from thenc gold four 
hundr and twenti talent and brought it to king solomon 

10 1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon 
concern the name of the lord she came to prove him with hard 
question 

10 2 and she came to jerusalem with a veri great train with camel 
that bare spice and veri much gold and preciou stone and when 
she wa come to solomon she commun with him of all that wa in her 
heart 

10 3 and solomon told her all her question there wa not ani thing 
hid from the king which he told her not 

10 4 and when the queen of sheba had seen all solomon s wisdom and 
the hou that he had built 10 5 and the meat of hi tabl and the 
sit of hi servant and the attend of hi minist and 
their apparel and hi cupbear and hi ascent by which he went up 
unto the hou of the lord there wa no more spirit in her 

10 6 and she said to the king it wa a true report that i heard in 
mine own land of thi act and of thi wisdom 

10 7 howbeit i believ not the word until i came and mine eye had 
seen it and behold the half wa not told me thi wisdom and 
prosper exceedeth the fame which i heard 

10 8 happi are thi men happi are these thi servant which stand 
continu befor thee and that hear thi wisdom 

10 9 bless be the lord thi god which delight in thee to set thee 
on the throne of israel becau the lord love israel for ever 
therefor made he thee king to do judgment and justic 

10 10 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold and 
of spice veri great store and preciou stone there came no more 
such abund of spice a these which the queen of sheba gave to 
king solomon 

10 11 and the navi also of hiram that brought gold from ophir 
brought in from ophir great plenti of almug tree and preciou 
stone 

10 12 and the king made of the almug tree pillar for the hou of 
the lord and for the king s hou harp also and psalteri for 
singer there came no such almug tree nor were seen unto thi day 

10 13 and king solomon gave unto the queen of sheba all her desir 
whatsoev she ask besid that which solomon gave her of hi royal 
bounti 

so she turn and went to her own countri she and her servant 

10 14 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six 
hundr threescor and six talent of gold 10 15 besid that he had 
of the merchantman and of the traffick of the spice merchant and of 
all the king of arabia and of the governor of the countri 

10 16 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold six 
hundr shekel of gold went to one target 

10 17 and he made three hundr shield of beaten gold three pound of 
gold went to one shield and the king put them in the hou of the 
forest of lebanon 

10 18 moreov the king made a great throne of ivori and overlaid it 
with the best gold 

10 19 the throne had six step and the top of the throne wa round 
behind and there were stay on either side on the place of the seat 
and two lion stood besid the stay 

10 20 and twelv lion stood there on the one side and on the other 
upon the six step there wa not the like made in ani kingdom 

10 21 and all king solomon s drink vessel were of gold and all 
the vessel of the hou of the forest of lebanon were of pure gold 
none were of silver it wa noth account of in the day of 
solomon 

10 22 for the king had at sea a navi of tharshish with the navi of 
hiram onc in three year came the navi of tharshish bring gold 
and silver ivori and ape and peacock 

10 23 so king solomon exceed all the king of the earth for rich 
and for wisdom 

10 24 and all the earth sought to solomon to hear hi wisdom which 
god had put in hi heart 

10 25 and they brought everi man hi present vessel of silver and 
vessel of gold and garment and armour and spice hor and 
mule a rate year by year 

10 26 and solomon gather togeth chariot and horseman and he had 
a thousand and four hundr chariot and twelv thousand horseman 
whom he bestow in the citi for chariot and with the king at 
jerusalem 

10 27 and the king made silver to be in jerusalem a stone and 
cedar made he to be a the sycomor tree that are in the vale for 
abund 

10 28 and solomon had hor brought out of egypt and linen yarn the 
king s merchant receiv the linen yarn at a price 

10 29 and a chariot came up and went out of egypt for six hundr 
shekel of silver and an hor for an hundr and fifti and so for 
all the king of the hittit and for the king of syria did they 
bring them out by their mean 

11 1 but king solomon love mani strang woman togeth with the 
daughter of pharaoh woman of the moabit ammonit edomit 
zidonian and hittit 11 2 of the nation concern which the lord 
said unto the child of israel ye shall not go in to them neither 
shall they come in unto you for sure they will turn away your heart 
after their god solomon clave unto these in love 

11 3 and he had seven hundr wife princess and three hundr 
concubin and hi wife turn away hi heart 

11 4 for it came to pa when solomon wa old that hi wife turn 
away hi heart after other god and hi heart wa not perfect with 
the lord hi god a wa the heart of david hi father 

11 5 for solomon went after ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonian 
and after milcom the abomin of the ammonit 

11 6 and solomon did evil in the sight of the lord and went not fulli 
after the lord a did david hi father 

11 7 then did solomon build an high place for chemosh the abomin 
of moab in the hill that is befor jerusalem and for molech the 
abomin of the child of ammon 

11 8 and likewi did he for all hi strang wife which burnt 
incen and sacrif unto their god 

11 9 and the lord wa angri with solomon becau hi heart wa turn 
from the lord god of israel which had appear unto him twice 11 10 
and had command him concern thi thing that he should not go 
after other god but he kept not that which the lord command 

11 11 wherefor the lord said unto solomon forasmuch a thi is done 
of thee and thou hast not kept my coven and my statut which i 
have command thee i will sure rend the kingdom from thee and 
will give it to thi servant 

11 12 notwithstand in thi day i will not do it for david thi 
father s sake but i will rend it out of the hand of thi son 

11 13 howbeit i will not rend away all the kingdom but will give one 
tribe to thi son for david my servant s sake and for jerusalem s sake 
which i have chosen 

11 14 and the lord stir up an adversari unto solomon hadad the 
edomit he wa of the king s seed in edom 

11 15 for it came to pa when david wa in edom and joab the 
captain of the host wa gone up to buri the slain after he had 
smitten everi male in edom 11 16 for six month did joab remain 
there with all israel until he had cut off everi male in edom 11 17 
that hadad fled he and certain edomit of hi father s servant with 
him to go into egypt hadad be yet a littl child 

11 18 and they aro out of midian and came to paran and they took 
men with them out of paran and they came to egypt unto pharaoh king 
of egypt which gave him an hou and appoint him victual and 
gave him land 

11 19 and hadad found great favour in the sight of pharaoh so that he 
gave him to wife the sister of hi own wife the sister of tahpen 
the queen 

11 20 and the sister of tahpen bare him genubath hi son whom 
tahpen wean in pharaoh s hou and genubath wa in pharaoh s 
household among the son of pharaoh 

11 21 and when hadad heard in egypt that david slept with hi father 
and that joab the captain of the host wa dead hadad said to pharaoh 
let me depart that i may go to mine own countri 

11 22 then pharaoh said unto him but what hast thou lack with me 
that behold thou seekest to go to thine own countri and he 
answer noth howbeit let me go in ani wise 

11 23 and god stir him up anoth adversari rezon the son of 
eliadah which fled from hi lord hadadez king of zobah 11 24 and 
he gather men unto him and becam captain over a band when david 
slew them of zobah and they went to damascu and dwelt therein and 
reign in damascu 

11 25 and he wa an adversari to israel all the day of solomon 
besid the mischief that hadad did and he abhor israel and 
reign over syria 

11 26 and jeroboam the son of nebat an ephrathit of zereda 
solomon s servant whose mother s name wa zeruah a widow woman even 
he lift up hi hand against the king 

11 27 and thi wa the cau that he lift up hi hand against the 
king solomon built millo and repair the breach of the citi of 
david hi father 

11 28 and the man jeroboam wa a mighti man of valour and solomon 
see the young man that he wa industri he made him ruler over 
all the charg of the hou of joseph 

11 29 and it came to pa at that time when jeroboam went out of 
jerusalem that the prophet ahijah the shilonit found him in the way 
and he had clad himself with a new garment and they two were alon in 
the field 11 30 and ahijah caught the new garment that wa on him 
and rent it in twelv piec 11 31 and he said to jeroboam take thee 
ten piec for thu saith the lord the god of israel behold i will 
rend the kingdom out of the hand of solomon and will give ten tribe 
to thee 11 32 but he shall have one tribe for my servant david s 
sake and for jerusalem s sake the citi which i have chosen out of 
all the tribe of israel 11 33 becau that they have forsaken me 
and have worship ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonian chemosh 
the god of the moabit and milcom the god of the child of ammon 
and have not walk in my way to do that which is right in mine 
eye and to keep my statut and my judgment a did david hi 
father 

11 34 howbeit i will not take the whole kingdom out of hi hand but i 
will make him princ all the day of hi life for david my servant s 
sake whom i chose becau he kept my command and my statut 
11 35 but i will take the kingdom out of hi son s hand and will give 
it unto thee even ten tribe 

11 36 and unto hi son will i give one tribe that david my servant 
may have a light alway befor me in jerusalem the citi which i have 
chosen me to put my name there 

11 37 and i will take thee and thou shalt reign accord to all that 
thi soul desireth and shalt be king over israel 

11 38 and it shall be if thou wilt hearken unto all that i command 
thee and wilt walk in my way and do that is right in my sight to 
keep my statut and my command a david my servant did that i 
will be with thee and build thee a sure hou a i built for david 
and will give israel unto thee 

11 39 and i will for thi afflict the seed of david but not for ever 

11 40 solomon sought therefor to kill jeroboam and jeroboam aro 
and fled into egypt unto shishak king of egypt and wa in egypt 
until the death of solomon 

11 41 and the rest of the act of solomon and all that he did and 
hi wisdom are they not written in the book of the act of solomon 
11 42 and the time that solomon reign in jerusalem over all israel 
wa forti year 

11 43 and solomon slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi 
of david hi father and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead 

12 1 and rehoboam went to shechem for all israel were come to shechem 
to make him king 

12 2 and it came to pa when jeroboam the son of nebat who wa yet 
in egypt heard of it for he wa fled from the presenc of king 
solomon and jeroboam dwelt in egypt 12 3 that they sent and call 
him and jeroboam and all the congreg of israel came and spake 
unto rehoboam say 12 4 thi father made our yoke grievou now 
therefor make thou the grievou servic of thi father and hi heavi 
yoke which he put upon u lighter and we will serv thee 

12 5 and he said unto them depart yet for three day then come again 
to me and the peopl depart 

12 6 and king rehoboam consult with the old men that stood befor 
solomon hi father while he yet live and said how do ye advi that 
i may answer thi peopl 12 7 and they spake unto him say if 
thou wilt be a servant unto thi peopl thi day and wilt serv them 
and answer them and speak good word to them then they will be thi 
servant for ever 

12 8 but he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given 
him and consult with the young men that were grown up with him and 
which stood befor him 12 9 and he said unto them what counsel give 
ye that we may answer thi peopl who have spoken to me say make 
the yoke which thi father did put upon u lighter 12 10 and the 
young men that were grown up with him spake unto him say thu 
shalt thou speak unto thi peopl that spake unto thee say thi 
father made our yoke heavi but make thou it lighter unto u thu 
shalt thou say unto them my littl finger shall be thicker than my 
father s loin 

12 11 and now wherea my father did lade you with a heavi yoke i will 
add to your yoke my father hath chasti you with whip but i will 
chasti you with scorpion 

12 12 so jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam the third day 
a the king had appoint say come to me again the third day 

12 13 and the king answer the peopl roughli and forsook the old 
men s counsel that they gave him 12 14 and spake to them after the 
counsel of the young men say my father made your yoke heavi and 
i will add to your yoke my father also chasti you with whip but 
i will chasti you with scorpion 

12 15 wherefor the king hearken not unto the peopl for the cau 
wa from the lord that he might perform hi say which the lord 
spake by ahijah the shilonit unto jeroboam the son of nebat 

12 16 so when all israel saw that the king hearken not unto them 
the peopl answer the king say what portion have we in david 
neither have we inherit in the son of jess to your tent o 
israel now see to thine own hou david so israel depart unto 
their tent 

12 17 but a for the child of israel which dwelt in the citi of 
judah rehoboam reign over them 

12 18 then king rehoboam sent adoram who wa over the tribut and 
all israel stone him with stone that he die therefor king 
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot to flee to 
jerusalem 

12 19 so israel rebel against the hou of david unto thi day 

12 20 and it came to pa when all israel heard that jeroboam wa 
come again that they sent and call him unto the congreg and 
made him king over all israel there wa none that follow the hou 
of david but the tribe of judah onli 

12 21 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem he assembl all the 
hou of judah with the tribe of benjamin an hundr and fourscor 
thousand chosen men which were warrior to fight against the hou 
of israel to bring the kingdom again to rehoboam the son of solomon 

12 22 but the word of god came unto shemaiah the man of god say 
12 23 speak unto rehoboam the son of solomon king of judah and unto 
all the hou of judah and benjamin and to the remnant of the peopl 
say 12 24 thu saith the lord ye shall not go up nor fight 
against your brother the child of israel return everi man to hi 
hou for thi thing is from me they hearken therefor to the word 
of the lord and return to depart accord to the word of the 
lord 

12 25 then jeroboam built shechem in mount ephraim and dwelt therein 
and went out from thenc and built penuel 

12 26 and jeroboam said in hi heart now shall the kingdom return to 
the hou of david 12 27 if thi peopl go up to do sacrif in the 
hou of the lord at jerusalem then shall the heart of thi peopl 
turn again unto their lord even unto rehoboam king of judah and they 
shall kill me and go again to rehoboam king of judah 

12 28 whereupon the king took counsel and made two calf of gold 
and said unto them it is too much for you to go up to jerusalem 
behold thi god o israel which brought thee up out of the land of 
egypt 

12 29 and he set the one in bethel and the other put he in dan 

12 30 and thi thing becam a sin for the peopl went to worship 
befor the one even unto dan 

12 31 and he made an hou of high place and made priest of the 
lowest of the peopl which were not of the son of levi 

12 32 and jeroboam ordain a feast in the eighth month on the 
fifteenth day of the month like unto the feast that is in judah and 
he offer upon the altar so did he in bethel sacrif unto the 
calf that he had made and he place in bethel the priest of the 
high place which he had made 

12 33 so he offer upon the altar which he had made in bethel the 
fifteenth day of the eighth month even in the month which he had 
devi of hi own heart and ordain a feast unto the child of 
israel and he offer upon the altar and burnt incen 

13 1 and behold there came a man of god out of judah by the word of 
the lord unto bethel and jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incen 

13 2 and he cri against the altar in the word of the lord and said 
o altar altar thu saith the lord behold a child shall be born 
unto the hou of david josiah by name and upon thee shall he offer 
the priest of the high place that burn incen upon thee and men s 
bone shall be burnt upon thee 

13 3 and he gave a sign the same day say thi is the sign which 
the lord hath spoken behold the altar shall be rent and the ash 
that are upon it shall be pour out 

13 4 and it came to pa when king jeroboam heard the say of the 
man of god which had cri against the altar in bethel that he put 
forth hi hand from the altar say lay hold on him and hi hand 
which he put forth against him dri up so that he could not pull it 
in again to him 

13 5 the altar also wa rent and the ash pour out from the altar 
accord to the sign which the man of god had given by the word of 
the lord 

13 6 and the king answer and said unto the man of god intreat now 
the face of the lord thi god and pray for me that my hand may be 
restor me again and the man of god besought the lord and the 
king s hand wa restor him again and becam a it wa befor 

13 7 and the king said unto the man of god come home with me and 
refresh thyself and i will give thee a reward 

13 8 and the man of god said unto the king if thou wilt give me half 
thine hou i will not go in with thee neither will i eat bread nor 
drink water in thi place 13 9 for so wa it charg me by the word 
of the lord say eat no bread nor drink water nor turn again by 
the same way that thou camest 

13 10 so he went anoth way and return not by the way that he came 
to bethel 

13 11 now there dwelt an old prophet in bethel and hi son came and 
told him all the work that the man of god had done that day in 
bethel the word which he had spoken unto the king them they told 
also to their father 

13 12 and their father said unto them what way went he for hi son 
had seen what way the man of god went which came from judah 

13 13 and he said unto hi son saddl me the a so they saddl 
him the a and he rode thereon 13 14 and went after the man of god 
and found him sit under an oak and he said unto him art thou the 
man of god that camest from judah and he said i am 

13 15 then he said unto him come home with me and eat bread 

13 16 and he said i may not return with thee nor go in with thee 
neither will i eat bread nor drink water with thee in thi place 
13 17 for it wa said to me by the word of the lord thou shalt eat no 
bread nor drink water there nor turn again to go by the way that thou 
camest 

13 18 he said unto him i am a prophet also a thou art and an angel 
spake unto me by the word of the lord say bring him back with 
thee into thine hou that he may eat bread and drink water but he 
lie unto him 

13 19 so he went back with him and did eat bread in hi hou and 
drank water 

13 20 and it came to pa a they sat at the tabl that the word of 
the lord came unto the prophet that brought him back 13 21 and he 
cri unto the man of god that came from judah say thu saith the 
lord forasmuch a thou hast disobey the mouth of the lord and hast 
not kept the command which the lord thi god command thee 13 22 
but camest back and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place of 
the which the lord did say to thee eat no bread and drink no water 
thi carca shall not come unto the sepulchr of thi father 

13 23 and it came to pa after he had eaten bread and after he had 
drunk that he saddl for him the a to wit for the prophet whom 
he had brought back 

13 24 and when he wa gone a lion met him by the way and slew him 
and hi carca wa cast in the way and the a stood by it the lion 
also stood by the carca 

13 25 and behold men pa by and saw the carca cast in the way 
and the lion stand by the carca and they came and told it in the 
citi where the old prophet dwelt 

13 26 and when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard 
thereof he said it is the man of god who wa disobedi unto the 
word of the lord therefor the lord hath deliv him unto the lion 
which hath torn him and slain him accord to the word of the lord 
which he spake unto him 

13 27 and he spake to hi son say saddl me the a and they 
saddl him 

13 28 and he went and found hi carca cast in the way and the a 
and the lion stand by the carca the lion had not eaten the 
carca nor torn the a 

13 29 and the prophet took up the carca of the man of god and laid 
it upon the a and brought it back and the old prophet came to the 
citi to mourn and to buri him 

13 30 and he laid hi carca in hi own grave and they mourn over 
him say ala my brother 13 31 and it came to pa after he 
had buri him that he spake to hi son say when i am dead 
then buri me in the sepulchr wherein the man of god is buri lay my 
bone besid hi bone 13 32 for the say which he cri by the 
word of the lord against the altar in bethel and against all the 
hou of the high place which are in the citi of samaria shall 
sure come to pa 

13 33 after thi thing jeroboam return not from hi evil way but 
made again of the lowest of the peopl priest of the high place 
whosoev would he consecr him and he becam one of the priest 
of the high place 

13 34 and thi thing becam sin unto the hou of jeroboam even to 
cut it off and to destroy it from off the face of the earth 

14 1 at that time abijah the son of jeroboam fell sick 

14 2 and jeroboam said to hi wife ari i pray thee and disgui 
thyself that thou be not known to be the wife of jeroboam and get 
thee to shiloh behold there is ahijah the prophet which told me 
that i should be king over thi peopl 

14 3 and take with thee ten loaf and cracknel and a cruse of 
honey and go to him he shall tell thee what shall becom of the 
child 

14 4 and jeroboam s wife did so and aro and went to shiloh and 
came to the hou of ahijah but ahijah could not see for hi eye 
were set by reason of hi age 

14 5 and the lord said unto ahijah behold the wife of jeroboam 
cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son for he is sick thu and 
thu shalt thou say unto her for it shall be when she cometh in 
that she shall feign herself to be anoth woman 

14 6 and it wa so when ahijah heard the sound of her foot a she 
came in at the door that he said come in thou wife of jeroboam whi 
feignest thou thyself to be anoth for i am sent to thee with heavi 
tide 

14 7 go tell jeroboam thu saith the lord god of israel forasmuch 
a i exalt thee from among the peopl and made thee princ over my 
peopl israel 14 8 and rent the kingdom away from the hou of david 
and gave it thee and yet thou hast not been a my servant david who 
kept my command and who follow me with all hi heart to do 
that onli which wa right in mine eye 14 9 but hast done evil abov 
all that were befor thee for thou hast gone and made thee other 
god and molten imag to provok me to anger and hast cast me 
behind thi back 14 10 therefor behold i will bring evil upon the 
hou of jeroboam and will cut off from jeroboam him that pisseth 
against the wall and him that is shut up and left in israel and will 
take away the remnant of the hou of jeroboam a a man taketh away 
dung till it be all gone 

14 11 him that dieth of jeroboam in the citi shall the dog eat and 
him that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat for the 
lord hath spoken it 

14 12 ari thou therefor get thee to thine own hou and when thi 
foot enter into the citi the child shall die 

14 13 and all israel shall mourn for him and buri him for he onli of 
jeroboam shall come to the grave becau in him there is found some 
good thing toward the lord god of israel in the hou of jeroboam 

14 14 moreov the lord shall rai him up a king over israel who 
shall cut off the hou of jeroboam that day but what even now 

14 15 for the lord shall smite israel a a reed is shaken in the 
water and he shall root up israel out of thi good land which he 
gave to their father and shall scatter them beyond the river 
becau they have made their grove provok the lord to anger 

14 16 and he shall give israel up becau of the sin of jeroboam who 
did sin and who made israel to sin 

14 17 and jeroboam s wife aro and depart and came to tirzah and 
when she came to the threshold of the door the child die 14 18 and 
they buri him and all israel mourn for him accord to the word 
of the lord which he spake by the hand of hi servant ahijah the 
prophet 

14 19 and the rest of the act of jeroboam how he war and how he 
reign behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the 
king of israel 

14 20 and the day which jeroboam reign were two and twenti year 
and he slept with hi father and nadab hi son reign in hi stead 

14 21 and rehoboam the son of solomon reign in judah rehoboam wa 
forti and one year old when he began to reign and he reign 
seventeen year in jerusalem the citi which the lord did choo out 
of all the tribe of israel to put hi name there and hi mother s 
name wa naamah an ammonit 

14 22 and judah did evil in the sight of the lord and they provok 
him to jealousi with their sin which they had commit abov all 
that their father had done 

14 23 for they also built them high place and imag and grove on 
everi high hill and under everi green tree 

14 24 and there were also sodomit in the land and they did 
accord to all the abomin of the nation which the lord cast 
out befor the child of israel 

14 25 and it came to pa in the fifth year of king rehoboam that 
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem 14 26 and he took 
away the treasur of the hou of the lord and the treasur of the 
king s hou he even took away all and he took away all the shield 
of gold which solomon had made 

14 27 and king rehoboam made in their stead brasen shield and 
commit them unto the hand of the chief of the guard which kept 
the door of the king s hou 

14 28 and it wa so when the king went into the hou of the lord 
that the guard bare them and brought them back into the guard 
chamber 

14 29 now the rest of the act of rehoboam and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
14 30 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all their day 

14 31 and rehoboam slept with hi father and wa buri with hi 
father in the citi of david and hi mother s name wa naamah an 
ammonit and abijam hi son reign in hi stead 

15 1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam the son of nebat 
reign abijam over judah 

15 2 three year reign he in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
maachah the daughter of abishalom 

15 3 and he walk in all the sin of hi father which he had done 
befor him and hi heart wa not perfect with the lord hi god a 
the heart of david hi father 

15 4 nevertheless for david s sake did the lord hi god give him a 
lamp in jerusalem to set up hi son after him and to establish 
jerusalem 15 5 becau david did that which wa right in the eye of 
the lord and turn not asid from ani thing that he command him 
all the day of hi life save onli in the matter of uriah the 
hittit 

15 6 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all the day of 
hi life 

15 7 now the rest of the act of abijam and all that he did are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah and 
there wa war between abijam and jeroboam 

15 8 and abijam slept with hi father and they buri him in the 
citi of david and asa hi son reign in hi stead 

15 9 and in the twentieth year of jeroboam king of israel reign asa 
over judah 

15 10 and forti and one year reign he in jerusalem and hi 
mother s name wa maachah the daughter of abishalom 

15 11 and asa did that which wa right in the eye of the lord a did 
david hi father 

15 12 and he took away the sodomit out of the land and remov all 
the idol that hi father had made 

15 13 and also maachah hi mother even her he remov from be 
queen becau she had made an idol in a grove and asa destroy her 
idol and burnt it by the brook kidron 

15 14 but the high place were not remov nevertheless asa s heart 
wa perfect with the lord all hi day 

15 15 and he brought in the thing which hi father had dedic and 
the thing which himself had dedic into the hou of the lord 
silver and gold and vessel 

15 16 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all 
their day 

15 17 and baasha king of israel went up against judah and built 
ramah that he might not suffer ani to go out or come in to asa king 
of judah 

15 18 then asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the 
treasur of the hou of the lord and the treasur of the king s 
hou and deliv them into the hand of hi servant and king asa 
sent them to benhadad the son of tabrimon the son of hezion king of 
syria that dwelt at damascu say 15 19 there is a leagu between 
me and thee and between my father and thi father behold i have sent 
unto thee a present of silver and gold come and break thi leagu with 
baasha king of israel that he may depart from me 

15 20 so benhadad hearken unto king asa and sent the captain of 
the host which he had against the citi of israel and smote ijon 
and dan and abelbethmaachah and all cinneroth with all the land of 
naphtali 

15 21 and it came to pa when baasha heard thereof that he left off 
build of ramah and dwelt in tirzah 

15 22 then king asa made a proclam throughout all judah none wa 
exempt and they took away the stone of ramah and the timber 
thereof wherewith baasha had build and king asa built with them 
geba of benjamin and mizpah 

15 23 the rest of all the act of asa and all hi might and all that 
he did and the citi which he built are they not written in the 
book of the chronicl of the king of judah nevertheless in the time 
of hi old age he wa disea in hi foot 

15 24 and asa slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father 
in the citi of david hi father and jehoshaphat hi son reign in 
hi stead 

15 25 and nadab the son of jeroboam began to reign over israel in the 
second year of asa king of judah and reign over israel two year 

15 26 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way 
of hi father and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin 

15 27 and baasha the son of ahijah of the hou of issachar 
conspir against him and baasha smote him at gibbethon which 
belong to the philistin for nadab and all israel laid sieg to 
gibbethon 

15 28 even in the third year of asa king of judah did baasha slay him 
and reign in hi stead 

15 29 and it came to pa when he reign that he smote all the 
hou of jeroboam he left not to jeroboam ani that breath until he 
had destroy him accord unto the say of the lord which he 
spake by hi servant ahijah the shilonit 15 30 becau of the sin 
of jeroboam which he sin and which he made israel sin by hi 
provoc wherewith he provok the lord god of israel to anger 

15 31 now the rest of the act of nadab and all that he did are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 
15 32 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all 
their day 

15 33 in the third year of asa king of judah began baasha the son of 
ahijah to reign over all israel in tirzah twenti and four year 

15 34 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way 
of jeroboam and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin 

16 1 then the word of the lord came to jehu the son of hanani against 
baasha say 16 2 forasmuch a i exalt thee out of the dust and 
made thee princ over my peopl israel and thou hast walk in the 
way of jeroboam and hast made my peopl israel to sin to provok me 
to anger with their sin 16 3 behold i will take away the poster 
of baasha and the poster of hi hou and will make thi hou 
like the hou of jeroboam the son of nebat 

16 4 him that dieth of baasha in the citi shall the dog eat and him 
that dieth of hi in the field shall the fowl of the air eat 

16 5 now the rest of the act of baasha and what he did and hi 
might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king 
of israel 16 6 so baasha slept with hi father and wa buri in 
tirzah and elah hi son reign in hi stead 

16 7 and also by the hand of the prophet jehu the son of hanani came 
the word of the lord against baasha and against hi hou even for 
all the evil that he did in the sight of the lord in provok him to 
anger with the work of hi hand in be like the hou of jeroboam 
and becau he kill him 

16 8 in the twenti and sixth year of asa king of judah began elah the 
son of baasha to reign over israel in tirzah two year 

16 9 and hi servant zimri captain of half hi chariot conspir 
against him a he wa in tirzah drink himself drunk in the hou 
of arza steward of hi hou in tirzah 

16 10 and zimri went in and smote him and kill him in the twenti 
and seventh year of asa king of judah and reign in hi stead 

16 11 and it came to pa when he began to reign a soon a he sat 
on hi throne that he slew all the hou of baasha he left him not 
one that pisseth against a wall neither of hi kinsfolk nor of hi 
friend 

16 12 thu did zimri destroy all the hou of baasha accord to the 
word of the lord which he spake against baasha by jehu the prophet 

16 13 for all the sin of baasha and the sin of elah hi son by 
which they sin and by which they made israel to sin in provok 
the lord god of israel to anger with their vaniti 

16 14 now the rest of the act of elah and all that he did are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 
16 15 in the twenti and seventh year of asa king of judah did zimri 
reign seven day in tirzah and the peopl were encamp against 
gibbethon which belong to the philistin 

16 16 and the peopl that were encamp heard say zimri hath 
conspir and hath also slain the king wherefor all israel made 
omri the captain of the host king over israel that day in the camp 

16 17 and omri went up from gibbethon and all israel with him and 
they besieg tirzah 

16 18 and it came to pa when zimri saw that the citi wa taken 
that he went into the palac of the king s hou and burnt the king s 
hou over him with fire and die 

16 19 for hi sin which he sin in do evil in the sight of the 
lord in walk in the way of jeroboam and in hi sin which he did 
to make israel to sin 

16 20 now the rest of the act of zimri and hi treason that he 
wrought are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the 
king of israel 16 21 then were the peopl of israel divid into 
two part half of the peopl follow tibni the son of ginath to 
make him king and half follow omri 

16 22 but the peopl that follow omri prevail against the peopl 
that follow tibni the son of ginath so tibni die and omri 
reign 

16 23 in the thirti and first year of asa king of judah began omri to 
reign over israel twelv year six year reign he in tirzah 

16 24 and he bought the hill samaria of shemer for two talent of 
silver and built on the hill and call the name of the citi which 
he built after the name of shemer owner of the hill samaria 

16 25 but omri wrought evil in the eye of the lord and did wor 
than all that were befor him 

16 26 for he walk in all the way of jeroboam the son of nebat and 
in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin to provok the lord god of 
israel to anger with their vaniti 

16 27 now the rest of the act of omri which he did and hi might 
that he shew are they not written in the book of the chronicl of 
the king of israel 16 28 so omri slept with hi father and wa 
buri in samaria and ahab hi son reign in hi stead 

16 29 and in the thirti and eighth year of asa king of judah began 
ahab the son of omri to reign over israel and ahab the son of omri 
reign over israel in samaria twenti and two year 

16 30 and ahab the son of omri did evil in the sight of the lord abov 
all that were befor him 

16 31 and it came to pa a if it had been a light thing for him to 
walk in the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat that he took to wife 
jezebel the daughter of ethbaal king of the zidonian and went and 
serv baal and worship him 

16 32 and he rear up an altar for baal in the hou of baal which 
he had built in samaria 

16 33 and ahab made a grove and ahab did more to provok the lord god 
of israel to anger than all the king of israel that were befor him 

16 34 in hi day did hiel the bethelit build jericho he laid the 
foundat thereof in abiram hi firstborn and set up the gate 
thereof in hi youngest son segub accord to the word of the lord 
which he spake by joshua the son of nun 

17 1 and elijah the tishbit who wa of the inhabit of gilead 
said unto ahab a the lord god of israel liveth befor whom i stand 
there shall not be dew nor rain these year but accord to my word 

17 2 and the word of the lord came unto him say 17 3 get thee 
henc and turn thee eastward and hide thyself by the brook cherith 
that is befor jordan 

17 4 and it shall be that thou shalt drink of the brook and i have 
command the raven to feed thee there 

17 5 so he went and did accord unto the word of the lord for he 
went and dwelt by the brook cherith that is befor jordan 

17 6 and the raven brought him bread and flesh in the morn and 
bread and flesh in the even and he drank of the brook 

17 7 and it came to pa after a while that the brook dri up 
becau there had been no rain in the land 

17 8 and the word of the lord came unto him say 17 9 ari get 
thee to zarephath which belongeth to zidon and dwell there behold 
i have command a widow woman there to sustain thee 

17 10 so he aro and went to zarephath and when he came to the gate 
of the citi behold the widow woman wa there gather of stick 
and he call to her and said fetch me i pray thee a littl water 
in a vessel that i may drink 

17 11 and a she wa go to fetch it he call to her and said 
bring me i pray thee a morsel of bread in thine hand 

17 12 and she said a the lord thi god liveth i have not a cake but 
an hand of meal in a barrel and a littl oil in a cruse and 
behold i am gather two stick that i may go in and dress it for 
me and my son that we may eat it and die 

17 13 and elijah said unto her fear not go and do a thou hast said 
but make me thereof a littl cake first and bring it unto me and 
after make for thee and for thi son 

17 14 for thu saith the lord god of israel the barrel of meal shall 
not wast neither shall the cruse of oil fail until the day that the 
lord sendeth rain upon the earth 

17 15 and she went and did accord to the say of elijah and she 
and he and her hou did eat mani day 

17 16 and the barrel of meal wast not neither did the cruse of oil 
fail accord to the word of the lord which he spake by elijah 

17 17 and it came to pa after these thing that the son of the 
woman the mistress of the hou fell sick and hi sick wa so 
sore that there wa no breath left in him 

17 18 and she said unto elijah what have i to do with thee o thou 
man of god art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembr and 
to slay my son 17 19 and he said unto her give me thi son and he 
took him out of her bosom and carri him up into a loft where he 
abod and laid him upon hi own bed 

17 20 and he cri unto the lord and said o lord my god hast thou 
also brought evil upon the widow with whom i sojourn by slay her 
son 17 21 and he stretch himself upon the child three time and 
cri unto the lord and said o lord my god i pray thee let thi 
child s soul come into him again 

17 22 and the lord heard the voic of elijah and the soul of the 
child came into him again and he reviv
