17 23 and elijah took the child and brought him down out of the 
chamber into the hou and deliv him unto hi mother and elijah 
said see thi son liveth 

17 24 and the woman said to elijah now by thi i know that thou art a 
man of god and that the word of the lord in thi mouth is truth 

18 1 and it came to pa after mani day that the word of the lord 
came to elijah in the third year say go shew thyself unto ahab 
and i will send rain upon the earth 

18 2 and elijah went to shew himself unto ahab and there wa a sore 
famin in samaria 

18 3 and ahab call obadiah which wa the governor of hi hou 
now obadiah fear the lord greatli 18 4 for it wa so when jezebel 
cut off the prophet of the lord that obadiah took an hundr 
prophet and hid them by fifti in a cave and fed them with bread and 
water 18 5 and ahab said unto obadiah go into the land unto all 
fountain of water and unto all brook peradventur we may find 
grass to save the hor and mule aliv that we lose not all the 
beast 

18 6 so they divid the land between them to pa throughout it ahab 
went one way by himself and obadiah went anoth way by himself 

18 7 and a obadiah wa in the way behold elijah met him and he 
knew him and fell on hi face and said art thou that my lord 
elijah 18 8 and he answer him i am go tell thi lord behold 
elijah is here 

18 9 and he said what have i sin that thou wouldest deliv thi 
servant into the hand of ahab to slay me 18 10 a the lord thi god 
liveth there is no nation or kingdom whither my lord hath not sent 
to seek thee and when they said he is not there he took an oath of 
the kingdom and nation that they found thee not 

18 11 and now thou sayest go tell thi lord behold elijah is here 

18 12 and it shall come to pa a soon a i am gone from thee that 
the spirit of the lord shall carri thee whither i know not and so 
when i come and tell ahab and he cannot find thee he shall slay me 
but i thi servant fear the lord from my youth 

18 13 wa it not told my lord what i did when jezebel slew the 
prophet of the lord how i hid an hundr men of the lord s prophet 
by fifti in a cave and fed them with bread and water 18 14 and now 
thou sayest go tell thi lord behold elijah is here and he shall 
slay me 

18 15 and elijah said a the lord of host liveth befor whom i 
stand i will sure shew myself unto him to day 

18 16 so obadiah went to meet ahab and told him and ahab went to 
meet elijah 

18 17 and it came to pa when ahab saw elijah that ahab said unto 
him art thou he that troubleth israel 18 18 and he answer i have 
not troubl israel but thou and thi father s hou in that ye have 
forsaken the command of the lord and thou hast follow baalim 

18 19 now therefor send and gather to me all israel unto mount 
carmel and the prophet of baal four hundr and fifti and the 
prophet of the grove four hundr which eat at jezebel s tabl 

18 20 so ahab sent unto all the child of israel and gather the 
prophet togeth unto mount carmel 

18 21 and elijah came unto all the peopl and said how long halt ye 
between two opinion if the lord be god follow him but if baal 
then follow him and the peopl answer him not a word 

18 22 then said elijah unto the peopl i even i onli remain a 
prophet of the lord but baal s prophet are four hundr and fifti 
men 

18 23 let them therefor give u two bullock and let them choo one 
bullock for themselv and cut it in piec and lay it on wood and 
put no fire under and i will dress the other bullock and lay it on 
wood and put no fire under 18 24 and call ye on the name of your 
god and i will call on the name of the lord and the god that 
answereth by fire let him be god and all the peopl answer and 
said it is well spoken 

18 25 and elijah said unto the prophet of baal choo you one 
bullock for yourselv and dress it first for ye are mani and call 
on the name of your god but put no fire under 

18 26 and they took the bullock which wa given them and they dress 
it and call on the name of baal from morn even until noon 
say o baal hear u but there wa no voic nor ani that 
answer and they leap upon the altar which wa made 

18 27 and it came to pa at noon that elijah mock them and said 
cri aloud for he is a god either he is talk or he is pursu 
or he is in a journey or peradventur he sleepeth and must be 
awak 

18 28 and they cri aloud and cut themselv after their manner with 
knife and lancet till the blood gush out upon them 

18 29 and it came to pa when midday wa past and they prophesi 
until the time of the offer of the even sacrif that there 
wa neither voic nor ani to answer nor ani that regard 

18 30 and elijah said unto all the peopl come near unto me and all 
the peopl came near unto him and he repair the altar of the lord 
that wa broken down 

18 31 and elijah took twelv stone accord to the number of the 
tribe of the son of jacob unto whom the word of the lord came 
say israel shall be thi name 18 32 and with the stone he built 
an altar in the name of the lord and he made a trench about the 
altar a great a would contain two measur of seed 

18 33 and he put the wood in order and cut the bullock in piec and 
laid him on the wood and said fill four barrel with water and pour 
it on the burnt sacrif and on the wood 

18 34 and he said do it the second time and they did it the second 
time 

and he said do it the third time and they did it the third time 

18 35 and the water ran round about the altar and he fill the 
trench also with water 

18 36 and it came to pa at the time of the offer of the even 
sacrif that elijah the prophet came near and said lord god of 
abraham isaac and of israel let it be known thi day that thou art 
god in israel and that i am thi servant and that i have done all 
these thing at thi word 

18 37 hear me o lord hear me that thi peopl may know that thou 
art the lord god and that thou hast turn their heart back again 

18 38 then the fire of the lord fell and consum the burnt 
sacrif and the wood and the stone and the dust and lick up 
the water that wa in the trench 

18 39 and when all the peopl saw it they fell on their face and 
they said the lord he is the god the lord he is the god 

18 40 and elijah said unto them take the prophet of baal let not 
one of them escap and they took them and elijah brought them down 
to the brook kishon and slew them there 

18 41 and elijah said unto ahab get thee up eat and drink for there 
is a sound of abund of rain 

18 42 so ahab went up to eat and to drink and elijah went up to the 
top of carmel and he cast himself down upon the earth and put hi 
face between hi knee 18 43 and said to hi servant go up now look 
toward the sea and he went up and look and said there is 
noth and he said go again seven time 

18 44 and it came to pa at the seventh time that he said behold 
there ariseth a littl cloud out of the sea like a man s hand and he 
said go up say unto ahab prepar thi chariot and get thee down 
that the rain stop thee not 

18 45 and it came to pa in the mean while that the heaven wa black 
with cloud and wind and there wa a great rain and ahab rode and 
went to jezreel 

18 46 and the hand of the lord wa on elijah and he gird up hi 
loin and ran befor ahab to the entranc of jezreel 

19 1 and ahab told jezebel all that elijah had done and withal how he 
had slain all the prophet with the sword 

19 2 then jezebel sent a messeng unto elijah say so let the 
god do to me and more also if i make not thi life a the life of 
one of them by to morrow about thi time 

19 3 and when he saw that he aro and went for hi life and came 
to beersheba which belongeth to judah and left hi servant there 

19 4 but he himself went a day s journey into the wilder and came 
and sat down under a junip tree and he request for himself that 
he might die and said it is enough now o lord take away my life 
for i am not better than my father 

19 5 and a he lay and slept under a junip tree behold then an 
angel touch him and said unto him ari and eat 

19 6 and he look and behold there wa a cake baken on the coal 
and a cruse of water at hi head and he did eat and drink and laid 
him down again 

19 7 and the angel of the lord came again the second time and touch 
him and said ari and eat becau the journey is too great for 
thee 

19 8 and he aro and did eat and drink and went in the strength of 
that meat forti day and forti night unto horeb the mount of god 

19 9 and he came thither unto a cave and lodg there and behold 
the word of the lord came to him and he said unto him what doest 
thou here elijah 19 10 and he said i have been veri jealou for 
the lord god of host for the child of israel have forsaken thi 
coven thrown down thine altar and slain thi prophet with the 
sword and i even i onli am left and they seek my life to take it 
away 

19 11 and he said go forth and stand upon the mount befor the lord 

and behold the lord pa by and a great and strong wind rent the 
mountain and brake in piec the rock befor the lord but the lord 
wa not in the wind and after the wind an earthquak but the lord 
wa not in the earthquak 19 12 and after the earthquak a fire but 
the lord wa not in the fire and after the fire a still small voic 

19 13 and it wa so when elijah heard it that he wrap hi face in 
hi mantl and went out and stood in the enter in of the cave 
and behold there came a voic unto him and said what doest thou 
here elijah 19 14 and he said i have been veri jealou for the 
lord god of host becau the child of israel have forsaken thi 
coven thrown down thine altar and slain thi prophet with the 
sword and i even i onli am left and they seek my life to take it 
away 

19 15 and the lord said unto him go return on thi way to the 
wilder of damascu and when thou comest anoint hazael to be king 
over syria 19 16 and jehu the son of nimshi shalt thou anoint to be 
king over israel and elisha the son of shaphat of abelmeholah shalt 
thou anoint to be prophet in thi room 

19 17 and it shall come to pa that him that escapeth the sword of 
hazael shall jehu slay and him that escapeth from the sword of jehu 
shall elisha slay 

19 18 yet i have left me seven thousand in israel all the knee which 
have not bow unto baal and everi mouth which hath not kiss him 

19 19 so he depart thenc and found elisha the son of shaphat who 
wa plow with twelv yoke of ox befor him and he with the 
twelfth and elijah pa by him and cast hi mantl upon him 

19 20 and he left the ox and ran after elijah and said let me i 
pray thee kiss my father and my mother and then i will follow thee 
and he said unto him go back again for what have i done to thee 
19 21 and he return back from him and took a yoke of ox and slew 
them and boil their flesh with the instrument of the ox and 
gave unto the peopl and they did eat then he aro and went after 
elijah and minist unto him 

20 1 and benhadad the king of syria gather all hi host togeth 
and there were thirti and two king with him and hor and 
chariot and he went up and besieg samaria and war against it 

20 2 and he sent messeng to ahab king of israel into the citi and 
said unto him thu saith benhadad 20 3 thi silver and thi gold is 
mine thi wife also and thi child even the goodliest are mine 

20 4 and the king of israel answer and said my lord o king 
accord to thi say i am thine and all that i have 

20 5 and the messeng came again and said thu speaketh benhadad 
say although i have sent unto thee say thou shalt deliv me 
thi silver and thi gold and thi wife and thi child 20 6 yet i 
will send my servant unto thee to morrow about thi time and they 
shall search thine hou and the hou of thi servant and it shall 
be that whatsoev is pleasant in thine eye they shall put it in 
their hand and take it away 

20 7 then the king of israel call all the elder of the land and 
said mark i pray you and see how thi man seeketh mischief for he 
sent unto me for my wife and for my child and for my silver and 
for my gold and i deni him not 

20 8 and all the elder and all the peopl said unto him hearken not 
unto him nor consent 

20 9 wherefor he said unto the messeng of benhadad tell my lord 
the king all that thou didst send for to thi servant at the first i 
will do but thi thing i may not do and the messeng depart and 
brought him word again 

20 10 and benhadad sent unto him and said the god do so unto me 
and more also if the dust of samaria shall suffic for hand for 
all the peopl that follow me 

20 11 and the king of israel answer and said tell him let not him 
that girdeth on hi har boast himself a he that putteth it off 

20 12 and it came to pa when ben hadad heard thi messag a he 
wa drink he and the king in the pavilion that he said unto hi 
servant set yourselv in array and they set themselv in array 
against the citi 

20 13 and behold there came a prophet unto ahab king of israel 
say thu saith the lord hast thou seen all thi great multitud 
behold i will deliv it into thine hand thi day and thou shalt 
know that i am the lord 

20 14 and ahab said by whom and he said thu saith the lord even 
by the young men of the princ of the provinc then he said who 
shall order the battl and he answer thou 

20 15 then he number the young men of the princ of the provinc 
and they were two hundr and thirti two and after them he number 
all the peopl even all the child of israel be seven thousand 

20 16 and they went out at noon but benhadad wa drink himself 
drunk in the pavilion he and the king the thirti and two king 
that help him 

20 17 and the young men of the princ of the provinc went out 
first and benhadad sent out and they told him say there are men 
come out of samaria 

20 18 and he said whether they be come out for peac take them 
aliv or whether they be come out for war take them aliv 

20 19 so these young men of the princ of the provinc came out of 
the citi and the armi which follow them 

20 20 and they slew everi one hi man and the syrian fled and 
israel pursu them and benhadad the king of syria escap on an 
hor with the horseman 

20 21 and the king of israel went out and smote the hor and 
chariot and slew the syrian with a great slaughter 

20 22 and the prophet came to the king of israel and said unto him 
go strengthen thyself and mark and see what thou doest for at the 
return of the year the king of syria will come up against thee 

20 23 and the servant of the king of syria said unto him their god 
are god of the hill therefor they were stronger than we but let 
u fight against them in the plain and sure we shall be stronger 
than they 

20 24 and do thi thing take the king away everi man out of hi 
place and put captain in their room 20 25 and number thee an armi 
like the armi that thou hast lost hor for hor and chariot for 
chariot and we will fight against them in the plain and sure we 
shall be stronger than they and he hearken unto their voic and 
did so 

20 26 and it came to pa at the return of the year that benhadad 
number the syrian and went up to aphek to fight against israel 

20 27 and the child of israel were number and were all present 
and went against them and the child of israel pitch befor them 
like two littl flock of kid but the syrian fill the countri 

20 28 and there came a man of god and spake unto the king of israel 
and said thu saith the lord becau the syrian have said the lord 
is god of the hill but he is not god of the valley therefor will 
i deliv all thi great multitud into thine hand and ye shall know 
that i am the lord 

20 29 and they pitch one over against the other seven day and so 
it wa that in the seventh day the battl wa join and the 
child of israel slew of the syrian an hundr thousand footman in 
one day 

20 30 but the rest fled to aphek into the citi and there a wall fell 
upon twenti and seven thousand of the men that were left and benhadad 
fled and came into the citi into an inner chamber 

20 31 and hi servant said unto him behold now we have heard that 
the king of the hou of israel are merci king let u i pray 
thee put sackcloth on our loin and rope upon our head and go out 
to the king of israel peradventur he will save thi life 

20 32 so they gird sackcloth on their loin and put rope on their 
head and came to the king of israel and said thi servant benhadad 
saith i pray thee let me live and he said is he yet aliv he is 
my brother 

20 33 now the men did dilig observ whether ani thing would come 
from him and did hastili catch it and they said thi brother 
benhadad then he said go ye bring him then benhadad came forth to 
him and he cau him to come up into the chariot 

20 34 and ben hadad said unto him the citi which my father took 
from thi father i will restor and thou shalt make street for thee 
in damascu a my father made in samaria then said ahab i will send 
thee away with thi coven so he made a coven with him and sent 
him away 

20 35 and a certain man of the son of the prophet said unto hi 
neighbour in the word of the lord smite me i pray thee and the man 
refu to smite him 

20 36 then said he unto him becau thou hast not obey the voic of 
the lord behold a soon a thou art depart from me a lion shall 
slay thee 

and a soon a he wa depart from him a lion found him and slew 
him 

20 37 then he found anoth man and said smite me i pray thee and 
the man smote him so that in smite he wound him 

20 38 so the prophet depart and wait for the king by the way and 
disgui himself with ash upon hi face 

20 39 and a the king pa by he cri unto the king and he said 
thi servant went out into the midst of the battl and behold a man 
turn asid and brought a man unto me and said keep thi man if 
by ani mean he be miss then shall thi life be for hi life or 
el thou shalt pay a talent of silver 

20 40 and a thi servant wa busi here and there he wa gone and the 
king of israel said unto him so shall thi judgment be thyself hast 
decid it 

20 41 and he hast and took the ash away from hi face and the 
king of israel discern him that he wa of the prophet 

20 42 and he said unto him thu saith the lord becau thou hast let 
go out of thi hand a man whom i appoint to utter destruct 
therefor thi life shall go for hi life and thi peopl for hi 
peopl 

20 43 and the king of israel went to hi hou heavi and displea 
and came to samaria 

21 1 and it came to pa after these thing that naboth the 
jezreelit had a vineyard which wa in jezreel hard by the palac of 
ahab king of samaria 

21 2 and ahab spake unto naboth say give me thi vineyard that i 
may have it for a garden of herb becau it is near unto my hou 
and i will give thee for it a better vineyard than it or if it seem 
good to thee i will give thee the worth of it in money 

21 3 and naboth said to ahab the lord forbid it me that i should 
give the inherit of my father unto thee 

21 4 and ahab came into hi hou heavi and displea becau of the 
word which naboth the jezreelit had spoken to him for he had said i 
will not give thee the inherit of my father and he laid him down 
upon hi bed and turn away hi face and would eat no bread 

21 5 but jezebel hi wife came to him and said unto him whi is thi 
spirit so sad that thou eatest no bread 21 6 and he said unto her 
becau i spake unto naboth the jezreelit and said unto him give me 
thi vineyard for money or el if it plea thee i will give thee 
anoth vineyard for it and he answer i will not give thee my 
vineyard 

21 7 and jezebel hi wife said unto him dost thou now govern the 
kingdom of israel ari and eat bread and let thine heart be merri 
i will give thee the vineyard of naboth the jezreelit 

21 8 so she wrote letter in ahab s name and seal them with hi 
seal and sent the letter unto the elder and to the nobl that were 
in hi citi dwell with naboth 

21 9 and she wrote in the letter say proclaim a fast and set 
naboth on high among the peopl 21 10 and set two men son of 
belial befor him to bear wit against him say thou didst 
blasphem god and the king and then carri him out and stone him 
that he may die 

21 11 and the men of hi citi even the elder and the nobl who were 
the inhabit in hi citi did a jezebel had sent unto them and a 
it wa written in the letter which she had sent unto them 

21 12 they proclaim a fast and set naboth on high among the peopl 

21 13 and there came in two men child of belial and sat befor 
him and the men of belial wit against him even against naboth 
in the presenc of the peopl say naboth did blasphem god and 
the king then they carri him forth out of the citi and stone him 
with stone that he die 

21 14 then they sent to jezebel say naboth is stone and is 
dead 

21 15 and it came to pa when jezebel heard that naboth wa stone 
and wa dead that jezebel said to ahab ari take poss of the 
vineyard of naboth the jezreelit which he refu to give thee for 
money for naboth is not aliv but dead 

21 16 and it came to pa when ahab heard that naboth wa dead that 
ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of naboth the jezreelit to 
take poss of it 

21 17 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbit say 
21 18 ari go down to meet ahab king of israel which is in samaria 
behold he is in the vineyard of naboth whither he is gone down to 
po it 

21 19 and thou shalt speak unto him say thu saith the lord hast 
thou kill and also taken poss and thou shalt speak unto him 
say thu saith the lord in the place where dog lick the blood 
of naboth shall dog lick thi blood even thine 

21 20 and ahab said to elijah hast thou found me o mine enemi and 
he answer i have found thee becau thou hast sold thyself to work 
evil in the sight of the lord 

21 21 behold i will bring evil upon thee and will take away thi 
poster and will cut off from ahab him that pisseth against the 
wall and him that is shut up and left in israel 21 22 and will make 
thine hou like the hou of jeroboam the son of nebat and like the 
hou of baasha the son of ahijah for the provoc wherewith thou 
hast provok me to anger and made israel to sin 

21 23 and of jezebel also spake the lord say the dog shall eat 
jezebel by the wall of jezreel 

21 24 him that dieth of ahab in the citi the dog shall eat and him 
that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat 

21 25 but there wa none like unto ahab which did sell himself to 
work wick in the sight of the lord whom jezebel hi wife 
stir up 

21 26 and he did veri abomin in follow idol accord to all 
thing a did the amorit whom the lord cast out befor the child 
of israel 

21 27 and it came to pa when ahab heard those word that he rent 
hi cloth and put sackcloth upon hi flesh and fast and lay in 
sackcloth and went softli 

21 28 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbit say 
21 29 seest thou how ahab humbleth himself befor me becau he 
humbleth himself befor me i will not bring the evil in hi day but 
in hi son s day will i bring the evil upon hi hou 

22 1 and they continu three year without war between syria and 
israel 

22 2 and it came to pa in the third year that jehoshaphat the king 
of judah came down to the king of israel 

22 3 and the king of israel said unto hi servant know ye that 
ramoth in gilead is our and we be still and take it not out of the 
hand of the king of syria 22 4 and he said unto jehoshaphat wilt 
thou go with me to battl to ramothgilead and jehoshaphat said to the 
king of israel i am a thou art my peopl a thi peopl my hor 
a thi hor 

22 5 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel enquir i pray 
thee at the word of the lord to day 

22 6 then the king of israel gather the prophet togeth about 
four hundr men and said unto them shall i go against ramothgilead 
to battl or shall i forbear and they said go up for the lord 
shall deliv it into the hand of the king 

22 7 and jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord 
besid that we might enquir of him 22 8 and the king of israel 
said unto jehoshaphat there is yet one man micaiah the son of imlah 
by whom we may enquir of the lord but i hate him for he doth not 
prophesi good concern me but evil and jehoshaphat said let not 
the king say so 

22 9 then the king of israel call an offic and said hasten 
hither micaiah the son of imlah 

22 10 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah sat 
each on hi throne have put on their robe in a void place in the 
entranc of the gate of samaria and all the prophet prophesi 
befor them 

22 11 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah made him horn of iron and he 
said thu saith the lord with these shalt thou push the syrian 
until thou have consum them 

22 12 and all the prophet prophesi so say go up to 
ramothgilead and prosper for the lord shall deliv it into the 
king s hand 

22 13 and the messeng that wa gone to call micaiah spake unto him 
say behold now the word of the prophet declar good unto the 
king with one mouth let thi word i pray thee be like the word of 
one of them and speak that which is good 

22 14 and micaiah said a the lord liveth what the lord saith unto 
me that will i speak 

22 15 so he came to the king and the king said unto him micaiah 
shall we go against ramothgilead to battl or shall we forbear and 
he answer him go and prosper for the lord shall deliv it into 
the hand of the king 

22 16 and the king said unto him how mani time shall i adjur thee 
that thou tell me noth but that which is true in the name of the 
lord 22 17 and he said i saw all israel scatter upon the hill 
a sheep that have not a shepherd and the lord said these have no 
master let them return everi man to hi hou in peac 

22 18 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat did i not tell 
thee that he would prophesi no good concern me but evil 22 19 
and he said hear thou therefor the word of the lord i saw the lord 
sit on hi throne and all the host of heaven stand by him on 
hi right hand and on hi left 

22 20 and the lord said who shall persuad ahab that he may go up 
and fall at ramothgilead and one said on thi manner and anoth 
said on that manner 

22 21 and there came forth a spirit and stood befor the lord and 
said i will persuad him 

22 22 and the lord said unto him wherewith and he said i will go 
forth and i will be a lie spirit in the mouth of all hi prophet 
and he said thou shalt persud him and prevail also go forth and 
do so 

22 23 now therefor behold the lord hath put a lie spirit in the 
mouth of all these thi prophet and the lord hath spoken evil 
concern thee 

22 24 but zedekiah the son of chenaanah went near and smote micaiah 
on the cheek and said which way went the spirit of the lord from me 
to speak unto thee 22 25 and micaiah said behold thou shalt see in 
that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself 

22 26 and the king of israel said take micaiah and carri him back 
unto amon the governor of the citi and to joash the king s son 22 27 
and say thu saith the king put thi fellow in the prison and feed 
him with bread of afflict and with water of afflict until i 
come in peac 

22 28 and micaiah said if thou return at all in peac the lord hath 
not spoken by me and he said hearken o peopl everi one of you 

22 29 so the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up 
to ramothgilead 

22 30 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat i will disgui 
myself and enter into the battl but put thou on thi robe and the 
king of israel disgui himself and went into the battl 

22 31 but the king of syria command hi thirti and two captain that 
had rule over hi chariot say fight neither with small nor 
great save onli with the king of israel 

22 32 and it came to pa when the captain of the chariot saw 
jehoshaphat that they said sure it is the king of israel and they 
turn asid to fight against him and jehoshaphat cri out 

22 33 and it came to pa when the captain of the chariot perceiv 
that it wa not the king of israel that they turn back from 
pursu him 

22 34 and a certain man drew a bow at a ventur and smote the king of 
israel between the joint of the har wherefor he said unto the 
driver of hi chariot turn thine hand and carri me out of the host 
for i am wound 

22 35 and the battl increa that day and the king wa stay up in 
hi chariot against the syrian and die at even and the blood ran 
out of the wound into the midst of the chariot 

22 36 and there went a proclam throughout the host about the 
go down of the sun say everi man to hi citi and everi man to 
hi own countri 

22 37 so the king die and wa brought to samaria and they buri 
the king in samaria 

22 38 and one wash the chariot in the pool of samaria and the dog 
lick up hi blood and they wash hi armour accord unto the 
word of the lord which he spake 

22 39 now the rest of the act of ahab and all that he did and the 
ivori hou which he made and all the citi that he built are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 
22 40 so ahab slept with hi father and ahaziah hi son reign in 
hi stead 

22 41 and jehoshaphat the son of asa began to reign over judah in the 
fourth year of ahab king of israel 

22 42 jehoshaphat wa thirti and five year old when he began to 
reign and he reign twenti and five year in jerusalem and hi 
mother s name wa azubah the daughter of shilhi 

22 43 and he walk in all the way of asa hi father he turn not 
asid from it do that which wa right in the eye of the lord 
nevertheless the high place were not taken away for the peopl 
offer and burnt incen yet in the high place 

22 44 and jehoshaphat made peac with the king of israel 

22 45 now the rest of the act of jehoshaphat and hi might that he 
shew and how he war are they not written in the book of the 
chronicl of the king of judah 22 46 and the remnant of the 
sodomit which remain in the day of hi father asa he took out 
of the land 

22 47 there wa then no king in edom a deputi wa king 

22 48 jehoshaphat made ship of tharshish to go to ophir for gold but 
they went not for the ship were broken at eziongeb 

22 49 then said ahaziah the son of ahab unto jehoshaphat let my 
servant go with thi servant in the ship but jehoshaphat would not 

22 50 and jehoshaphat slept with hi father and wa buri with hi 
father in the citi of david hi father and jehoram hi son reign 
in hi stead 

22 51 ahaziah the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria 
the seventeenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah and reign two 
year over israel 

22 52 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way 
of hi father and in the way of hi mother and in the way of 
jeroboam the son of nebat who made israel to sin 22 53 for he serv 
baal and worship him and provok to anger the lord god of 
israel accord to all that hi father had done 




the second book of the king 

commonli call 

the fourth book of the king 


1 1 then moab rebel against israel after the death of ahab 

1 2 and ahaziah fell down through a lattic in hi upper chamber that 
wa in samaria and wa sick and he sent messeng and said unto 
them go enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron whether i shall 
recov of thi disea 

1 3 but the angel of the lord said to elijah the tishbit ari go 
up to meet the messeng of the king of samaria and say unto them 
is it not becau there is not a god in israel that ye go to enquir 
of baalzebub the god of ekron 1 4 now therefor thu saith the lord 
thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up but 
shalt sure die and elijah depart 

1 5 and when the messeng turn back unto him he said unto them 
whi are ye now turn back 1 6 and they said unto him there came a 
man up to meet u and said unto u go turn again unto the king that 
sent you and say unto him thu saith the lord is it not becau 
there is not a god in israel that thou sendest to enquir of 
baalzebub the god of ekron therefor thou shalt not come down from 
that bed on which thou art gone up but shalt sure die 

1 7 and he said unto them what manner of man wa he which came up to 
meet you and told you these word 1 8 and they answer him he wa 
an hairi man and girt with a girdl of leather about hi loin and 
he said it is elijah the tishbit 

1 9 then the king sent unto him a captain of fifti with hi fifti and 
he went up to him and behold he sat on the top of an hill and he 
spake unto him thou man of god the king hath said come down 

1 10 and elijah answer and said to the captain of fifti if i be a 
man of god then let fire come down from heaven and consum thee and 
thi fifti 

and there came down fire from heaven and consum him and hi fifti 

1 11 again also he sent unto him anoth captain of fifti with hi 
fifti 

and he answer and said unto him o man of god thu hath the king 
said come down quickli 

1 12 and elijah answer and said unto them if i be a man of god let 
fire come down from heaven and consum thee and thi fifti and the 
fire of god came down from heaven and consum him and hi fifti 

1 13 and he sent again a captain of the third fifti with hi fifti 
and the third captain of fifti went up and came and fell on hi knee 
befor elijah and besought him and said unto him o man of god i 
pray thee let my life and the life of these fifti thi servant be 
preciou in thi sight 

1 14 behold there came fire down from heaven and burnt up the two 
captain of the former fifti with their fifti therefor let my 
life now be preciou in thi sight 

1 15 and the angel of the lord said unto elijah go down with him be 
not afraid of him and he aro and went down with him unto the king 

1 16 and he said unto him thu saith the lord forasmuch a thou hast 
sent messeng to enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron is it not 
becau there is no god in israel to enquir of hi word therefor 
thou shalt not come down off that bed on which thou art gone up but 
shalt sure die 

1 17 so he die accord to the word of the lord which elijah had 
spoken 

and jehoram reign in hi stead in the second year of jehoram the son 
of jehoshaphat king of judah becau he had no son 

1 18 now the rest of the act of ahaziah which he did are they not 
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 2 1 and 
it came to pa when the lord would take up elijah into heaven by a 
whirlwind that elijah went with elisha from gilgal 

2 2 and elijah said unto elisha tarri here i pray thee for the lord 
hath sent me to bethel and elisha said unto him a the lord liveth 
and a thi soul liveth i will not leav thee so they went down to 
bethel 

2 3 and the son of the prophet that were at bethel came forth to 
elisha and said unto him knowest thou that the lord will take away 
thi master from thi head to day and he said yea i know it hold ye 
your peac 

2 4 and elijah said unto him elisha tarri here i pray thee for the 
lord hath sent me to jericho and he said a the lord liveth and a 
thi soul liveth i will not leav thee so they came to jericho 

2 5 and the son of the prophet that were at jericho came to elisha 
and said unto him knowest thou that the lord will take away thi 
master from thi head to day and he answer yea i know it hold ye 
your peac 

2 6 and elijah said unto him tarri i pray thee here for the lord 
hath sent me to jordan and he said a the lord liveth and a thi 
soul liveth i will not leav thee and they two went on 

2 7 and fifti men of the son of the prophet went and stood to view 
afar off and they two stood by jordan 

2 8 and elijah took hi mantl and wrap it togeth and smote the 
water and they were divid hither and thither so that they two 
went over on dri ground 

2 9 and it came to pa when they were gone over that elijah said 
unto elisha ask what i shall do for thee befor i be taken away from 
thee and elisha said i pray thee let a doubl portion of thi spirit 
be upon me 

2 10 and he said thou hast ask a hard thing nevertheless if thou 
see me when i am taken from thee it shall be so unto thee but if 
not it shall not be so 

2 11 and it came to pa a they still went on and talk that 
behold there appear a chariot of fire and hor of fire and 
part them both asund and elijah went up by a whirlwind into 
heaven 

2 12 and elisha saw it and he cri my father my father the 
chariot of israel and the horseman thereof and he saw him no more 
and he took hold of hi own cloth and rent them in two piec 

2 13 he took up also the mantl of elijah that fell from him and went 
back and stood by the bank of jordan 2 14 and he took the mantl of 
elijah that fell from him and smote the water and said where is 
the lord god of elijah and when he also had smitten the water they 
part hither and thither and elisha went over 

2 15 and when the son of the prophet which were to view at jericho 
saw him they said the spirit of elijah doth rest on elisha and they 
came to meet him and bow themselv to the ground befor him 

2 16 and they said unto him behold now there be with thi servant 
fifti strong men let them go we pray thee and seek thi master lest 
peradventur the spirit of the lord hath taken him up and cast him 
upon some mountain or into some valley and he said ye shall not 
send 

2 17 and when they urg him till he wa asham he said send they 
sent therefor fifti men and they sought three day but found him 
not 

2 18 and when they came again to him for he tarri at jericho he 
said unto them did i not say unto you go not 2 19 and the men of 
the citi said unto elisha behold i pray thee the situat of thi 
citi is pleasant a my lord seeth but the water is naught and the 
ground barren 

2 20 and he said bring me a new cruse and put salt therein and they 
brought it to him 

2 21 and he went forth unto the spring of the water and cast the 
salt in there and said thu saith the lord i have heal these 
water there shall not be from thenc ani more death or barren land 

2 22 so the water were heal unto thi day accord to the say 
of elisha which he spake 

2 23 and he went up from thenc unto bethel and a he wa go up by 
the way there came forth littl child out of the citi and mock 
him and said unto him go up thou bald head go up thou bald head 

2 24 and he turn back and look on them and cur them in the 
name of the lord and there came forth two she bear out of the wood 
and tare forti and two child of them 

2 25 and he went from thenc to mount carmel and from thenc he 
return to samaria 

3 1 now jehoram the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria 
the eighteenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah and reign twelv 
year 

3 2 and he wrought evil in the sight of the lord but not like hi 
father and like hi mother for he put away the imag of baal that 
hi father had made 

3 3 nevertheless he cleav unto the sin of jeroboam the son of 
nebat which made israel to sin he depart not therefrom 

3 4 and mesha king of moab wa a sheepmast and render unto the 
king of israel an hundr thousand lamb and an hundr thousand 
ram with the wool 

3 5 but it came to pa when ahab wa dead that the king of moab 
rebel against the king of israel 

3 6 and king jehoram went out of samaria the same time and number 
all israel 

3 7 and he went and sent to jehoshaphat the king of judah say the 
king of moab hath rebel against me wilt thou go with me against 
moab to battl and he said i will go up i am a thou art my peopl 
a thi peopl and my hor a thi hor 

3 8 and he said which way shall we go up and he answer the way 
through the wilder of edom 

3 9 so the king of israel went and the king of judah and the king of 
edom and they fetch a compass of seven day journey and there wa 
no water for the host and for the cattl that follow them 

3 10 and the king of israel said ala that the lord hath call 
these three king togeth to deliv them into the hand of moab 
3 11 but jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord 
that we may enquir of the lord by him and one of the king of 
israel s servant answer and said here is elisha the son of 
shaphat which pour water on the hand of elijah 

3 12 and jehoshaphat said the word of the lord is with him so the 
king of israel and jehoshaphat and the king of edom went down to him 

3 13 and elisha said unto the king of israel what have i to do with 
thee get thee to the prophet of thi father and to the prophet of 
thi mother 

and the king of israel said unto him nay for the lord hath call 
these three king togeth to deliv them into the hand of moab 

3 14 and elisha said a the lord of host liveth befor whom i 
stand sure were it not that i regard the presenc of jehoshaphat 
the king of judah i would not look toward thee nor see thee 

3 15 but now bring me a minstrel and it came to pa when the 
minstrel play that the hand of the lord came upon him 

3 16 and he said thu saith the lord make thi valley full of 
ditch 

3 17 for thu saith the lord ye shall not see wind neither shall ye 
see rain yet that valley shall be fill with water that ye may 
drink both ye and your cattl and your beast 

3 18 and thi is but a light thing in the sight of the lord he will 
deliv the moabit also into your hand 

3 19 and ye shall smite everi fenc citi and everi choic citi and 
shall fell everi good tree and stop all well of water and mar everi 
good piec of land with stone 

3 20 and it came to pa in the morn when the meat offer wa 
offer that behold there came water by the way of edom and the 
countri wa fill with water 

3 21 and when all the moabit heard that the king were come up to 
fight against them they gather all that were abl to put on armour 
and upward and stood in the border 

3 22 and they rose up earli in the morn and the sun shone upon the 
water and the moabit saw the water on the other side a red a 
blood 3 23 and they said thi is blood the king are sure slain 
and they have smitten one anoth now therefor moab to the spoil 

3 24 and when they came to the camp of israel the israelit rose up 
and smote the moabit so that they fled befor them but they went 
forward smite the moabit even in their countri 

3 25 and they beat down the citi and on everi good piec of land 
cast everi man hi stone and fill it and they stop all the 
well of water and fell all the good tree onli in kirharaseth 
left they the stone thereof howbeit the slinger went about it and 
smote it 

3 26 and when the king of moab saw that the battl wa too sore for 
him he took with him seven hundr men that drew sword to break 
through even unto the king of edom but they could not 

3 27 then he took hi eldest son that should have reign in hi 
stead and offer him for a burnt offer upon the wall and there 
wa great indign against israel and they depart from him and 
return to their own land 

4 1 now there cri a certain woman of the wife of the son of the 
prophet unto elisha say thi servant my husband is dead and thou 
knowest that thi servant did fear the lord and the creditor is come 
to take unto him my two son to be bondman 

4 2 and elisha said unto her what shall i do for thee tell me what 
hast thou in the hou and she said thine handmaid hath not ani 
thing in the hou save a pot of oil 

4 3 then he said go borrow thee vessel abroad of all thi 
neighbour even empti vessel borrow not a few 

4 4 and when thou art come in thou shalt shut the door upon thee and 
upon thi son and shalt pour out into all those vessel and thou 
shalt set asid that which is full 

4 5 so she went from him and shut the door upon her and upon her 
son who brought the vessel to her and she pour out 

4 6 and it came to pa when the vessel were full that she said 
unto her son bring me yet a vessel and he said unto her there is 
not a vessel more and the oil stay 

4 7 then she came and told the man of god and he said go sell the 
oil and pay thi debt and live thou and thi child of the rest 

4 8 and it fell on a day that elisha pa to shunem where wa a 
great woman and she constrain him to eat bread and so it wa that 
a oft a he pa by he turn in thither to eat bread 

4 9 and she said unto her husband behold now i perceiv that thi is 
an holi man of god which passeth by u continu 

4 10 let u make a littl chamber i pray thee on the wall and let 
u set for him there a bed and a tabl and a stool and a 
candlestick and it shall be when he cometh to u that he shall turn 
in thither 

4 11 and it fell on a day that he came thither and he turn into 
the chamber and lay there 

4 12 and he said to gehazi hi servant call thi shunammit and when 
he had call her she stood befor him 

4 13 and he said unto him say now unto her behold thou hast been 
care for u with all thi care what is to be done for thee 
wouldest thou be spoken for to the king or to the captain of the 
host and she answer i dwell among mine own peopl 

4 14 and he said what then is to be done for her and gehazi 
answer verili she hath no child and her husband is old 

4 15 and he said call her and when he had call her she stood in 
the door 

4 16 and he said about thi season accord to the time of life 
thou shalt embrac a son and she said nay my lord thou man of god 
do not lie unto thine handmaid 

4 17 and the woman conceiv and bare a son at that season that 
elisha had said unto her accord to the time of life 

4 18 and when the child wa grown it fell on a day that he went out 
to hi father to the reaper 

4 19 and he said unto hi father my head my head and he said to a 
lad carri him to hi mother 

4 20 and when he had taken him and brought him to hi mother he sat 
on her knee till noon and then die 

4 21 and she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of god and 
shut the door upon him and went out 

4 22 and she call unto her husband and said send me i pray thee 
one of the young men and one of the as that i may run to the man 
of god and come again 

4 23 and he said wherefor wilt thou go to him to day it is neither 
new moon nor sabbath and she said it shall be well 

4 24 then she saddl an a and said to her servant drive and go 
forward slack not thi ride for me except i bid thee 

4 25 so she went and came unto the man of god to mount carmel and it 
came to pa when the man of god saw her afar off that he said to 
gehazi hi servant behold yonder is that shunammit 4 26 run now i 
pray thee to meet her and say unto her is it well with thee is it 
well with thi husband is it well with the child and she answer it 
is well 4 27 and when she came to the man of god to the hill she 
caught him by the foot but gehazi came near to thrust her away and 
the man of god said let her alon for her soul is vex within her 
and the lord hath hid it from me and hath not told me 

4 28 then she said did i desir a son of my lord did i not say do 
not deceiv me 4 29 then he said to gehazi gird up thi loin and 
take my staff in thine hand and go thi way if thou meet ani man 
salut him not and if ani salut thee answer him not again and lay 
my staff upon the face of the child 

4 30 and the mother of the child said a the lord liveth and a thi 
soul liveth i will not leav thee and he aro and follow her 

4 31 and gehazi pa on befor them and laid the staff upon the 
face of the child but there wa neither voic nor hear wherefor 
he went again to meet him and told him say the child is not 
awak 

4 32 and when elisha wa come into the hou behold the child wa 
dead and laid upon hi bed 

4 33 he went in therefor and shut the door upon them twain and 
pray unto the lord 

4 34 and he went up and lay upon the child and put hi mouth upon 
hi mouth and hi eye upon hi eye and hi hand upon hi hand 
and stretch himself upon the child and the flesh of the child wax 
warm 

4 35 then he return and walk in the hou to and fro and went 
up and stretch himself upon him and the child sneez seven time 
and the child open hi eye 

4 36 and he call gehazi and said call thi shunammit so he 
call her and when she wa come in unto him he said take up thi 
son 

4 37 then she went in and fell at hi foot and bow herself to the 
ground and took up her son and went out 

4 38 and elisha came again to gilgal and there wa a dearth in the 
land and the son of the prophet were sit befor him and he 
said unto hi servant set on the great pot and seeth pottag for 
the son of the prophet 

4 39 and one went out into the field to gather herb and found a wild 
vine and gather thereof wild gourd hi lap full and came and 
shred them into the pot of pottag for they knew them not 

4 40 so they pour out for the men to eat and it came to pa a 
they were eat of the pottag that they cri out and said o thou 
man of god there is death in the pot and they could not eat thereof 

4 41 but he said then bring meal and he cast it into the pot and he 
said pour out for the peopl that they may eat and there wa no 
harm in the pot 

4 42 and there came a man from baalshalisha and brought the man of 
god bread of the firstfruit twenti loaf of barley and full ear 
of corn in the husk thereof and he said give unto the peopl that 
they may eat 

4 43 and hi servitor said what should i set thi befor an hundr 
men he said again give the peopl that they may eat for thu 
saith the lord they shall eat and shall leav thereof 

4 44 so he set it befor them and they did eat and left thereof 
accord to the word of the lord 

5 1 now naaman captain of the host of the king of syria wa a great 
man with hi master and honour becau by him the lord had given 
deliv unto syria he wa also a mighti man in valour but he wa 
a leper 

5 2 and the syrian had gone out by compani and had brought away 
captiv out of the land of israel a littl maid and she wait on 
naaman s wife 

5 3 and she said unto her mistress would god my lord were with the 
prophet that is in samaria for he would recov him of hi leprosi 

5 4 and one went in and told hi lord say thu and thu said the 
maid that is of the land of israel 

5 5 and the king of syria said go to go and i will send a letter 
unto the king of israel and he depart and took with him ten 
talent of silver and six thousand piec of gold and ten chang of 
raiment 

5 6 and he brought the letter to the king of israel say now when 
thi letter is come unto thee behold i have therewith sent naaman my 
servant to thee that thou mayest recov him of hi leprosi 

5 7 and it came to pa when the king of israel had read the letter 
that he rent hi cloth and said am i god to kill and to make 
aliv that thi man doth send unto me to recov a man of hi 
leprosi wherefor consid i pray you and see how he seeketh a 
quarrel against me 

5 8 and it wa so when elisha the man of god had heard that the king 
of israel had rent hi cloth that he sent to the king say 
wherefor hast thou rent thi cloth let him come now to me and he 
shall know that there is a prophet in israel 

5 9 so naaman came with hi hor and with hi chariot and stood at 
the door of the hou of elisha 

5 10 and elisha sent a messeng unto him say go and wash in 
jordan seven time and thi flesh shall come again to thee and thou 
shalt be clean 

5 11 but naaman wa wroth and went away and said behold i thought 
he will sure come out to me and stand and call on the name of the 
lord hi god and strike hi hand over the place and recov the 
leper 

5 12 are not abana and pharpar river of damascu better than all 
the water of israel may i not wash in them and be clean so he 
turn and went away in a rage 

5 13 and hi servant came near and spake unto him and said my 
father if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing wouldest thou 
not have done it how much rather then when he saith to thee wash 
and be clean 5 14 then went he down and dip himself seven time 
in jordan accord to the say of the man of god and hi flesh 
came again like unto the flesh of a littl child and he wa clean 

5 15 and he return to the man of god he and all hi compani and 
came and stood befor him and he said behold now i know that there 
is no god in all the earth but in israel now therefor i pray thee 
take a bless of thi servant 

5 16 but he said a the lord liveth befor whom i stand i will 
receiv none and he urg him to take it but he refu 

5 17 and naaman said shall there not then i pray thee be given to 
thi servant two mule burden of earth for thi servant will 
henceforth offer neither burnt offer nor sacrif unto other god 
but unto the lord 

5 18 in thi thing the lord pardon thi servant that when my master 
goeth into the hou of rimmon to worship there and he leaneth on my 
hand and i bow myself in the hou of rimmon when i bow down myself 
in the hou of rimmon the lord pardon thi servant in thi thing 

5 19 and he said unto him go in peac so he depart from him a 
littl way 

5 20 but gehazi the servant of elisha the man of god said behold 
my master hath spare naaman thi syrian in not receiv at hi 
hand that which he brought but a the lord liveth i will run after 
him and take somewhat of him 

5 21 so gehazi follow after naaman and when naaman saw him run 
after him he light down from the chariot to meet him and said is 
all well 5 22 and he said all is well my master hath sent me 
say behold even now there be come to me from mount ephraim two 
young men of the son of the prophet give them i pray thee a 
talent of silver and two chang of garment 

5 23 and naaman said be content take two talent and he urg him 
and bound two talent of silver in two bag with two chang of 
garment and laid them upon two of hi servant and they bare them 
befor him 

5 24 and when he came to the tower he took them from their hand and 
bestow them in the hou and he let the men go and they depart 

5 25 but he went in and stood befor hi master and elisha said unto 
him whenc comest thou gehazi and he said thi servant went no 
whither 

5 26 and he said unto him went not mine heart with thee when the man 
turn again from hi chariot to meet thee is it a time to receiv 
money and to receiv garment and oliveyard and vineyard and 
sheep and ox and manserv and maidserv 5 27 the leprosi 
therefor of naaman shall cleav unto thee and unto thi seed for 
ever and he went out from hi presenc a leper a white a snow 

6 1 and the son of the prophet said unto elisha behold now the 
place where we dwell with thee is too strait for u 

6 2 let u go we pray thee unto jordan and take thenc everi man a 
beam and let u make u a place there where we may dwell and he 
answer go ye 

6 3 and one said be content i pray thee and go with thi servant 
and he answer i will go 

6 4 so he went with them and when they came to jordan they cut down 
wood 

6 5 but a one wa fell a beam the axe head fell into the water 
and he cri and said ala master for it wa borrow 

6 6 and the man of god said where fell it and he shew him the 
place 

and he cut down a stick and cast it in thither and the iron did 
swim 

6 7 therefor said he take it up to thee and he put out hi hand 
and took it 

6 8 then the king of syria war against israel and took counsel 
with hi servant say in such and such a place shall be my camp 

6 9 and the man of god sent unto the king of israel say bewar 
that thou pa not such a place for thither the syrian are come 
down 

6 10 and the king of israel sent to the place which the man of god 
told him and warn him of and save himself there not onc nor 
twice 

6 11 therefor the heart of the king of syria wa sore troubl for 
thi thing and he call hi servant and said unto them will ye 
not shew me which of u is for the king of israel 6 12 and one of 
hi servant said none my lord o king but elisha the prophet that 
is in israel telleth the king of israel the word that thou speakest 
in thi bedchamb 

6 13 and he said go and spi where he is that i may send and fetch 
him 

and it wa told him say behold he is in dothan 

6 14 therefor sent he thither hor and chariot and a great host 
and they came by night and compass the citi about 

6 15 and when the servant of the man of god wa risen earli and gone 
forth behold an host compass the citi both with hor and 
chariot and hi servant said unto him ala my master how shall we 
do 6 16 and he answer fear not for they that be with u are more 
than they that be with them 

6 17 and elisha pray and said lord i pray thee open hi eye 
that he may see and the lord open the eye of the young man and he 
saw and behold the mountain wa full of hor and chariot of fire 
round about elisha 

6 18 and when they came down to him elisha pray unto the lord and 
said smite thi peopl i pray thee with blind and he smote 
them with blind accord to the word of elisha 

6 19 and elisha said unto them thi is not the way neither is thi 
the citi follow me and i will bring you to the man whom ye seek but 
he led them to samaria 

6 20 and it came to pa when they were come into samaria that 
elisha said lord open the eye of these men that they may see and 
the lord open their eye and they saw and behold they were in 
the midst of samaria 

6 21 and the king of israel said unto elisha when he saw them my 
father shall i smite them shall i smite them 6 22 and he answer 
thou shalt not smite them wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast 
taken captiv with thi sword and with thi bow set bread and water 
befor them that they may eat and drink and go to their master 

6 23 and he prepar great provi for them and when they had eaten 
and drunk he sent them away and they went to their master so the 
band of syria came no more into the land of israel 

6 24 and it came to pa after thi that benhadad king of syria 
gather all hi host and went up and besieg samaria 

6 25 and there wa a great famin in samaria and behold they 
besieg it until an a s head wa sold for fourscor piec of 
silver and the fourth part of a cab of dove s dung for five piec of 
silver 

6 26 and a the king of israel wa pa by upon the wall there 
cri a woman unto him say help my lord o king 

6 27 and he said if the lord do not help thee whenc shall i help 
thee out of the barnfloor or out of the winepress 6 28 and the 
king said unto her what aileth thee and she answer thi woman 
said unto me give thi son that we may eat him to day and we will 
eat my son to morrow 

6 29 so we boil my son and did eat him and i said unto her on the 
next day give thi son that we may eat him and she hath hid her son 

6 30 and it came to pa when the king heard the word of the woman 
that he rent hi cloth and he pa by upon the wall and the 
peopl look and behold he had sackcloth within upon hi flesh 

6 31 then he said god do so and more also to me if the head of 
elisha the son of shaphat shall stand on him thi day 

6 32 but elisha sat in hi hou and the elder sat with him and the 
king sent a man from befor him but ere the messeng came to him he 
said to the elder see ye how thi son of a murder hath sent to 
take away mine head look when the messeng cometh shut the door 
and hold him fast at the door is not the sound of hi master s foot 
behind him 6 33 and while he yet talk with them behold the 
messeng came down unto him and he said behold thi evil is of the 
lord what should i wait for the lord ani longer 7 1 then elisha 
said hear ye the word of the lord thu saith the lord to morrow 
about thi time shall a measur of fine flour be sold for a shekel 
and two measur of barley for a shekel in the gate of samaria 

7 2 then a lord on whose hand the king lean answer the man of god 
and said behold if the lord would make window in heaven might thi 
thing be and he said behold thou shalt see it with thine eye but 
shalt not eat thereof 

7 3 and there were four leprou men at the enter in of the gate 
and they said one to anoth whi sit we here until we die 7 4 if we 
say we will enter into the citi then the famin is in the citi and 
we shall die there and if we sit still here we die also now 
therefor come and let u fall unto the host of the syrian if they 
save u aliv we shall live and if they kill u we shall but die 

7 5 and they rose up in the twilight to go unto the camp of the 
syrian and when they were come to the uttermost part of the camp of 
syria behold there wa no man there 

7 6 for the lord had made the host of the syrian to hear a noi of 
chariot and a noi of hor even the noi of a great host and 
they said one to anoth lo the king of israel hath hire against u 
the king of the hittit and the king of the egyptian to come 
upon u 

7 7 wherefor they aro and fled in the twilight and left their 
tent and their hor and their as even the camp a it wa and 
fled for their life 

7 8 and when these leper came to the uttermost part of the camp they 
went into one tent and did eat and drink and carri thenc silver 
and gold and raiment and went and hid it and came again and 
enter into anoth tent and carri thenc also and went and hid 
it 

7 9 then they said one to anoth we do not well thi day is a day 
of good tide and we hold our peac if we tarri till the morn 
light some mischief will come upon u now therefor come that we 
may go and tell the king s household 

7 10 so they came and call unto the porter of the citi and they 
told them say we came to the camp of the syrian and behold 
there wa no man there neither voic of man but hor tie and 
as tie and the tent a they were 

7 11 and he call the porter and they told it to the king s hou 
within 

7 12 and the king aro in the night and said unto hi servant i 
will now shew you what the syrian have done to u they know that we 
be hungri therefor are they gone out of the camp to hide themselv 
in the field say when they come out of the citi we shall catch 
them aliv and get into the citi 

7 13 and one of hi servant answer and said let some take i pray 
thee five of the hor that remain which are left in the citi 
behold they are a all the multitud of israel that are left in it 
behold i say they are even a all the multitud of the israelit 
that are consum and let u send and see 

7 14 they took therefor two chariot hor and the king sent after 
the host of the syrian say go and see 

7 15 and they went after them unto jordan and lo all the way wa 
full of garment and vessel which the syrian had cast away in their 
hast and the messeng return and told the king 

7 16 and the peopl went out and spoil the tent of the syrian so 
a measur of fine flour wa sold for a shekel and two measur of 
barley for a shekel accord to the word of the lord 

7 17 and the king appoint the lord on whose hand he lean to have 
the charg of the gate and the peopl trode upon him in the gate and 
he die a the man of god had said who spake when the king came down 
to him 

7 18 and it came to pa a the man of god had spoken to the king 
say two measur of barley for a shekel and a measur of fine 
flour for a shekel shall be to morrow about thi time in the gate of 
samaria 7 19 and that lord answer the man of god and said now 
behold if the lord should make window in heaven might such a thing 
be and he said behold thou shalt see it with thine eye but shalt 
not eat thereof 

7 20 and so it fell out unto him for the peopl trode upon him in the 
gate and he die 

8 1 then spake elisha unto the woman whose son he had restor to 
life say ari and go thou and thine household and sojourn 
wheresoev thou canst sojourn for the lord hath call for a famin 
and it shall also come upon the land seven year 

8 2 and the woman aro and did after the say of the man of god 
and she went with her household and sojourn in the land of the 
philistin seven year 

8 3 and it came to pa at the seven year end that the woman 
return out of the land of the philistin and she went forth to cri 
unto the king for her hou and for her land 

8 4 and the king talk with gehazi the servant of the man of god 
say tell me i pray thee all the great thing that elisha hath 
done 

8 5 and it came to pa a he wa tell the king how he had 
restor a dead bodi to life that behold the woman whose son he 
had restor to life cri to the king for her hou and for her 
land and gehazi said my lord o king thi is the woman and thi is 
her son whom elisha restor to life 

8 6 and when the king ask the woman she told him so the king 
appoint unto her a certain offic say restor all that wa 
her and all the fruit of the field sinc the day that she left the 
land even until now 

8 7 and elisha came to damascu and benhadad the king of syria wa 
sick and it wa told him say the man of god is come hither 

8 8 and the king said unto hazael take a present in thine hand and 
go meet the man of god and enquir of the lord by him say shall 
i recov of thi disea 8 9 so hazael went to meet him and took a 
present with him even of everi good thing of damascu forti camel 
burden and came and stood befor him and said thi son benhadad king 
of syria hath sent me to thee say shall i recov of thi 
disea 8 10 and elisha said unto him go say unto him thou mayest 
certainli recov howbeit the lord hath shew me that he shall 
sure die 

8 11 and he settl hi counten stedfastli until he wa asham 
and the man of god wept 

8 12 and hazael said whi weepeth my lord and he answer becau i 
know the evil that thou wilt do unto the child of israel their 
strong hold wilt thou set on fire and their young men wilt thou slay 
with the sword and wilt dash their child and rip up their woman 
with child 

8 13 and hazael said but what is thi servant a dog that he should 
do thi great thing and elisha answer the lord hath shew me that 
thou shalt be king over syria 

8 14 so he depart from elisha and came to hi master who said to 
him what said elisha to thee and he answer he told me that thou 
shouldest sure recov 

8 15 and it came to pa on the morrow that he took a thick cloth 
and dip it in water and spread it on hi face so that he die 
and hazael reign in hi stead 

8 16 and in the fifth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel 
jehoshaphat be then king of judah jehoram the son of je hoshaphat 
king of judah began to reign 

8 17 thirti and two year old wa he when he began to reign and he 
reign eight year in jerusalem 

8 18 and he walk in the way of the king of israel a did the hou 
of ahab for the daughter of ahab wa hi wife and he did evil in the 
sight of the lord 

8 19 yet the lord would not destroy judah for david hi servant s 
sake a he promi him to give him alway a light and to hi 
child 

8 20 in hi day edom revolt from under the hand of judah and made 
a king over themselv 

8 21 so joram went over to zair and all the chariot with him and he 
rose by night and smote the edomit which compass him about and 
the captain of the chariot and the peopl fled into their tent 

8 22 yet edom revolt from under the hand of judah unto thi day 
then libnah revolt at the same time 

8 23 and the rest of the act of joram and all that he did are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 8 24 
and joram slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father in 
the citi of david and ahaziah hi son reign in hi stead 

8 25 in the twelfth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel did 
ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah begin to reign 

8 26 two and twenti year old wa ahaziah when he began to reign and 
he reign one year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa athaliah 
the daughter of omri king of israel 

8 27 and he walk in the way of the hou of ahab and did evil in 
the sight of the lord a did the hou of ahab for he wa the son in 
law of the hou of ahab 

8 28 and he went with joram the son of ahab to the war against hazael 
king of syria in ramothgilead and the syrian wound joram 

8 29 and king joram went back to be heal in jezreel of the wound 
which the syrian had given him at ramah when he fought against 
hazael king of syria and ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah 
went down to see joram the son of ahab in jezreel becau he wa 
sick 

9 1 and elisha the prophet call one of the child of the prophet 
and said unto him gird up thi loin and take thi box of oil in 
thine hand and go to ramothgilead 9 2 and when thou comest thither 
look out there jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi and go 
in and make him ari up from among hi brother and carri him to an 
inner chamber 9 3 then take the box of oil and pour it on hi head 
and say thu saith the lord i have anoint thee king over israel 
then open the door and flee and tarri not 

9 4 so the young man even the young man the prophet went to 
ramothgilead 

9 5 and when he came behold the captain of the host were sit 
and he said i have an errand to thee o captain and jehu said unto 
which of all u and he said to thee o captain 

9 6 and he aro and went into the hou and he pour the oil on 
hi head and said unto him thu saith the lord god of israel i have 
anoint thee king over the peopl of the lord even over israel 

9 7 and thou shalt smite the hou of ahab thi master that i may 
aveng the blood of my servant the prophet and the blood of all the 
servant of the lord at the hand of jezebel 

9 8 for the whole hou of ahab shall perish and i will cut off from 
ahab him that pisseth against the wall and him that is shut up and 
left in israel 9 9 and i will make the hou of ahab like the hou 
of jeroboam the son of nebat and like the hou of baasha the son of 
ahijah 9 10 and the dog shall eat jezebel in the portion of jezreel 
and there shall be none to buri her and he open the door and fled 

9 11 then jehu came forth to the servant of hi lord and one said 
unto him is all well wherefor came thi mad fellow to thee and he 
said unto them ye know the man and hi commun 

9 12 and they said it is fal tell u now and he said thu and 
thu spake he to me say thu saith the lord i have anoint thee 
king over israel 

9 13 then they hast and took everi man hi garment and put it 
under him on the top of the stair and blew with trumpet say 
jehu is king 

9 14 so jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi conspir 
against joram now joram had kept ramothgilead he and all israel 
becau of hazael king of syria 

9 15 but king joram wa return to be heal in jezreel of the wound 
which the syrian had given him when he fought with hazael king of 
syria and jehu said if it be your mind then let none go forth 
nor escap out of the citi to go to tell it in jezreel 

9 16 so jehu rode in a chariot and went to jezreel for joram lay 
there 

and ahaziah king of judah wa come down to see joram 

9 17 and there stood a watchman on the tower in jezreel and he spi 
the compani of jehu a he came and said i see a compani and joram 
said take an horseman and send to meet them and let him say is it 
peac 9 18 so there went one on horseback to meet him and said 
thu saith the king is it peac and jehu said what hast thou to do 
with peac turn thee behind me and the watchman told say the 
messeng came to them but he cometh not again 

9 19 then he sent out a second on horseback which came to them and 
said thu saith the king is it peac and jehu answer what hast 
thou to do with peac turn thee behind me 

9 20 and the watchman told say he came even unto them and cometh 
not again and the drive is like the drive of jehu the son of 
nimshi for he driveth furiou 

9 21 and joram said make readi and hi chariot wa made readi and 
joram king of israel and ahaziah king of judah went out each in hi 
chariot and they went out against jehu and met him in the portion of 
naboth the jezreelit 

9 22 and it came to pa when joram saw jehu that he said is it 
peac jehu and he answer what peac so long a the whoredom of 
thi mother jezebel and her witchcraft are so mani 9 23 and joram 
turn hi hand and fled and said to ahaziah there is treacheri o 
ahaziah 

9 24 and jehu drew a bow with hi full strength and smote jehoram 
between hi arm and the arrow went out at hi heart and he sunk 
down in hi chariot 

9 25 then said jehu to bidkar hi captain take up and cast him in 
the portion of the field of naboth the jezreelit for rememb how 
that when i and thou rode togeth after ahab hi father the lord 
laid thi burden upon him 9 26 sure i have seen yesterday the blood 
of naboth and the blood of hi son saith the lord and i will 
requit thee in thi plat saith the lord now therefor take and cast 
him into the plat of ground accord to the word of the lord 

9 27 but when ahaziah the king of judah saw thi he fled by the way 
of the garden hou and jehu follow after him and said smite him 
also in the chariot and they did so at the go up to gur which is 
by ibleam 

and he fled to megiddo and die there 

9 28 and hi servant carri him in a chariot to jerusalem and 
buri him in hi sepulchr with hi father in the citi of david 

9 29 and in the eleventh year of joram the son of ahab began ahaziah 
to reign over judah 

9 30 and when jehu wa come to jezreel jezebel heard of it and she 
paint her face and tire her head and look out at a window 

9 31 and a jehu enter in at the gate she said had zimri peac 
who slew hi master 9 32 and he lift up hi face to the window 
and said who is on my side who and there look out to him two or 
three eunuch 

9 33 and he said throw her down so they threw her down and some of 
her blood wa sprinkl on the wall and on the hor and he trode 
her under foot 

9 34 and when he wa come in he did eat and drink and said go see 
now thi cur woman and buri her for she is a king s daughter 

9 35 and they went to buri her but they found no more of her than the 
skull and the foot and the palm of her hand 

9 36 wherefor they came again and told him and he said thi is the 
word of the lord which he spake by hi servant elijah the tishbit 
say in the portion of jezreel shall dog eat the flesh of jezebel 
9 37 and the carca of jezebel shall be a dung upon the face of the 
field in the portion of jezreel so that they shall not say thi is 
jezebel 

10 1 and ahab had seventi son in samaria and jehu wrote letter and 
sent to samaria unto the ruler of jezreel to the elder and to 
them that brought up ahab s child say 10 2 now a soon a thi 
letter cometh to you see your master s son are with you and 
there are with you chariot and hor a fenc citi also and 
armour 10 3 look even out the best and meetest of your master s son 
and set him on hi father s throne and fight for your master s hou 

10 4 but they were exceedingli afraid and said behold two king 
stood not befor him how then shall we stand 10 5 and he that wa 
over the hou and he that wa over the citi the elder also and 
the bringer up of the child sent to jehu say we are thi 
servant and will do all that thou shalt bid u we will not make ani 
king do thou that which is good in thine eye 

10 6 then he wrote a letter the second time to them say if ye be 
mine and if ye will hearken unto my voic take ye the head of the 
men your master s son and come to me to jezreel by to morrow thi 
time now the king s son be seventi person were with the great 
men of the citi which brought them up 

10 7 and it came to pa when the letter came to them that they took 
the king s son and slew seventi person and put their head in 
basket and sent him them to jezreel 

10 8 and there came a messeng and told him say they have 
brought the head of the king s son and he said lay ye them in two 
heap at the enter in of the gate until the morn 

10 9 and it came to pa in the morn that he went out and stood 
and said to all the peopl ye be righteou behold i conspir 
against my master and slew him but who slew all these 10 10 know 
now that there shall fall unto the earth noth of the word of the 
lord which the lord spake concern the hou of ahab for the lord 
hath done that which he spake by hi servant elijah 

10 11 so jehu slew all that remain of the hou of ahab in jezreel 
and all hi great men and hi kinsfolk and hi priest until he 
left him none remain 

10 12 and he aro and depart and came to samaria and a he wa at 
the shear hou in the way 10 13 jehu met with the brother of 
ahaziah king of judah and said who are ye and they answer we are 
the brother of ahaziah and we go down to salut the child of the 
king and the child of the queen 

10 14 and he said take them aliv and they took them aliv and slew 
them at the pit of the shear hou even two and forti men neither 
left he ani of them 

10 15 and when he wa depart thenc he light on jehonadab the son 
of rechab come to meet him and he salut him and said to him is 
thine heart right a my heart is with thi heart and jehonadab 
answer it is if it be give me thine hand and he gave him hi 
hand and he took him up to him into the chariot 

10 16 and he said come with me and see my zeal for the lord so they 
made him ride in hi chariot 

10 17 and when he came to samaria he slew all that remain unto ahab 
in samaria till he had destroy him accord to the say of the 
lord which he spake to elijah 

10 18 and jehu gather all the peopl togeth and said unto them 
ahab serv baal a littl but jehu shall serv him much 

10 19 now therefor call unto me all the prophet of baal all hi 
servant and all hi priest let none be want for i have a great 
sacrif to do to baal whosoev shall be want he shall not 
live but jehu did it in subtilti to the intent that he might destroy 
the worshipp of baal 

10 20 and jehu said proclaim a solemn assembl for baal and they 
proclaim it 

10 21 and jehu sent through all israel and all the worshipp of 
baal came so that there wa not a man left that came not and they 
came into the hou of baal and the hou of baal wa full from one 
end to anoth 

10 22 and he said unto him that wa over the vestri bring forth 
vestment for all the worshipp of baal and he brought them forth 
vestment 

10 23 and jehu went and jehonadab the son of rechab into the hou 
of baal and said unto the worshipp of baal search and look that 
there be here with you none of the servant of the lord but the 
worshipp of baal onli 

10 24 and when they went in to offer sacrif and burnt offer 
jehu appoint fourscor men without and said if ani of the men whom 
i have brought into your hand escap he that letteth him go hi 
life shall be for the life of him 

10 25 and it came to pa a soon a he had made an end of offer 
the burnt offer that jehu said to the guard and to the captain 
go in and slay them let none come forth and they smote them with 
the edg of the sword and the guard and the captain cast them out 
and went to the citi of the hou of baal 

10 26 and they brought forth the imag out of the hou of baal and 
burn them 

10 27 and they brake down the imag of baal and brake down the hou 
of baal and made it a draught hou unto thi day 

10 28 thu jehu destroy baal out of israel 

10 29 howbeit from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made 
israel to sin jehu depart not from after them to wit the golden 
calf that were in bethel and that were in dan 

10 30 and the lord said unto jehu becau thou hast done well in 
execut that which is right in mine eye and hast done unto the 
hou of ahab accord to all that wa in mine heart thi child of 
the fourth gener shall sit on the throne of israel 

10 31 but jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the lord god of 
israel with all hi heart for he depart not from the sin of 
jeroboam which made israel to sin 

10 32 in those day the lord began to cut israel short and hazael 
smote them in all the coast of israel 10 33 from jordan eastward 
all the land of gilead the gadit and the reubenit and the 
manassit from aroer which is by the river arnon even gilead and 
bashan 

10 34 now the rest of the act of jehu and all that he did and all 
hi might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the 
king of israel 10 35 and jehu slept with hi father and they 
buri him in samaria and jehoahaz hi son reign in hi stead 

10 36 and the time that jehu reign over israel in samaria wa twenti 
and eight year 

11 1 and when athaliah the mother of ahaziah saw that her son wa 
dead she aro and destroy all the seed royal 

11 2 but jehosheba the daughter of king joram sister of ahaziah 
took joash the son of ahaziah and stole him from among the king s 
son which were slain and they hid him even him and hi nur in 
the bedchamb from athaliah so that he wa not slain 

11 3 and he wa with her hid in the hou of the lord six year and 
athaliah did reign over the land 

11 4 and the seventh year jehoiada sent and fetch the ruler over 
hundr with the captain and the guard and brought them to him 
into the hou of the lord and made a coven with them and took an 
oath of them in the hou of the lord and shew them the king s son
