11 5 and he command them say thi is the thing that ye shall 
do a third part of you that enter in on the sabbath shall even be 
keeper of the watch of the king s hou 11 6 and a third part shall 
be at the gate of sur and a third part at the gate behind the guard 
so shall ye keep the watch of the hou that it be not broken down 

11 7 and two part of all you that go forth on the sabbath even they 
shall keep the watch of the hou of the lord about the king 

11 8 and ye shall compass the king round about everi man with hi 
weapon in hi hand and he that cometh within the rang let him be 
slain and be ye with the king a he goeth out and a he cometh in 

11 9 and the captain over the hundr did accord to all thing 
that jehoiada the priest command and they took everi man hi men 
that were to come in on the sabbath with them that should go out on 
the sabbath and came to jehoiada the priest 

11 10 and to the captain over hundr did the priest give king 
david s spear and shield that were in the templ of the lord 

11 11 and the guard stood everi man with hi weapon in hi hand 
round about the king from the right corner of the templ to the left 
corner of the templ along by the altar and the templ 

11 12 and he brought forth the king s son and put the crown upon him 
and gave him the testimoni and they made him king and anoint him 
and they clap their hand and said god save the king 

11 13 and when athaliah heard the noi of the guard and of the 
peopl she came to the peopl into the templ of the lord 

11 14 and when she look behold the king stood by a pillar a the 
manner wa and the princ and the trumpet by the king and all 
the peopl of the land rejoic and blew with trumpet and athaliah 
rent her cloth and cri treason treason 

11 15 but jehoiada the priest command the captain of the hundr 
the offic of the host and said unto them have her forth without 
the rang and him that followeth her kill with the sword for the 
priest had said let her not be slain in the hou of the lord 

11 16 and they laid hand on her and she went by the way by the which 
the hor came into the king s hou and there wa she slain 

11 17 and jehoiada made a coven between the lord and the king and 
the peopl that they should be the lord s peopl between the king 
also and the peopl 

11 18 and all the peopl of the land went into the hou of baal and 
brake it down hi altar and hi imag brake they in piec 
thoroughli and slew mattan the priest of baal befor the altar and 
the priest appoint offic over the hou of the lord 

11 19 and he took the ruler over hundr and the captain and the 
guard and all the peopl of the land and they brought down the king 
from the hou of the lord and came by the way of the gate of the 
guard to the king s hou and he sat on the throne of the king 

11 20 and all the peopl of the land rejoic and the citi wa in 
quiet and they slew athaliah with the sword besid the king s hou 

11 21 seven year old wa jehoash when he began to reign 

12 1 in the seventh year of jehu jehoash began to reign and forti 
year reign he in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa zibiah of 
beersheba 

12 2 and jehoash did that which wa right in the sight of the lord all 
hi day wherein jehoiada the priest instruct him 

12 3 but the high place were not taken away the peopl still 
sacrif and burnt incen in the high place 

12 4 and jehoash said to the priest all the money of the dedic 
thing that is brought into the hou of the lord even the money of 
everi one that passeth the account the money that everi man is set 
at and all the money that cometh into ani man s heart to bring into 
the hou of the lord 12 5 let the priest take it to them everi man 
of hi acquaint and let them repair the breach of the hou 
wheresoev ani breach shall be found 

12 6 but it wa so that in the three and twentieth year of king 
jehoash the priest had not repair the breach of the hou 

12 7 then king jehoash call for jehoiada the priest and the other 
priest and said unto them whi repair ye not the breach of the 
hou now therefor receiv no more money of your acquaint but 
deliv it for the breach of the hou 

12 8 and the priest consent to receiv no more money of the peopl 
neither to repair the breach of the hou 

12 9 but jehoiada the priest took a chest and bore a hole in the lid 
of it and set it besid the altar on the right side a one cometh 
into the hou of the lord and the priest that kept the door put 
therein all the money that wa brought into the hou of the lord 

12 10 and it wa so when they saw that there wa much money in the 
chest that the king s scribe and the high priest came up and they 
put up in bag and told the money that wa found in the hou of the 
lord 

12 11 and they gave the money be told into the hand of them that 
did the work that had the oversight of the hou of the lord and 
they laid it out to the carpent and builder that wrought upon the 
hou of the lord 12 12 and to mason and hewer of stone and to 
buy timber and hew stone to repair the breach of the hou of the 
lord and for all that wa laid out for the hou to repair it 

12 13 howbeit there were not made for the hou of the lord bowl of 
silver snuffer bason trumpet ani vessel of gold or vessel of 
silver of the money that wa brought into the hou of the lord 
12 14 but they gave that to the workman and repair therewith the 
hou of the lord 

12 15 moreov they reckon not with the men into whose hand they 
deliv the money to be bestow on workman for they dealt 
faith 

12 16 the trespass money and sin money wa not brought into the hou 
of the lord it wa the priest 

12 17 then hazael king of syria went up and fought against gath and 
took it and hazael set hi face to go up to jerusalem 

12 18 and jehoash king of judah took all the hallow thing that 
jehoshaphat and jehoram and ahaziah hi father king of judah 
had dedic and hi own hallow thing and all the gold that wa 
found in the treasur of the hou of the lord and in the king s 
hou and sent it to hazael king of syria and he went away from 
jerusalem 

12 19 and the rest of the act of joash and all that he did are they 
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
12 20 and hi servant aro and made a conspiraci and slew joash in 
the hou of millo which goeth down to silla 

12 21 for jozachar the son of shimeath and jehozabad the son of 
shomer hi servant smote him and he die and they buri him with 
hi father in the citi of david and amaziah hi son reign in hi 
stead 

13 1 in the three and twentieth year of joash the son of ahaziah king 
of judah jehoahaz the son of jehu began to reign over israel in 
samaria and reign seventeen year 

13 2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord and 
follow the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat which made israel to 
sin he depart not therefrom 

13 3 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel and he 
deliv them into the hand of hazael king of syria and into the 
hand of benhadad the son of hazael all their day 

13 4 and jehoahaz besought the lord and the lord hearken unto him 
for he saw the oppress of israel becau the king of syria 
oppress them 

13 5 and the lord gave israel a saviour so that they went out from 
under the hand of the syrian and the child of israel dwelt in 
their tent a beforetim 

13 6 nevertheless they depart not from the sin of the hou of 
jeroboam who made israel sin but walk therein and there remain 
the grove also in samaria 13 7 neither did he leav of the peopl 
to jehoahaz but fifti horseman and ten chariot and ten thousand 
footman for the king of syria had destroy them and had made them 
like the dust by thresh 

13 8 now the rest of the act of jehoahaz and all that he did and 
hi might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the 
king of israel 13 9 and jehoahaz slept with hi father and they 
buri him in samaria and joash hi son reign in hi stead 

13 10 in the thirti and seventh year of joash king of judah began 
jehoash the son of jehoahaz to reign over israel in samaria and 
reign sixteen year 

13 11 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord he 
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made 
israel sin but he walk therein 

13 12 and the rest of the act of joash and all that he did and hi 
might wherewith he fought against amaziah king of judah are they not 
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 13 13 
and joash slept with hi father and jeroboam sat upon hi throne 
and joash wa buri in samaria with the king of israel 

13 14 now elisha wa fallen sick of hi sick whereof he die and 
joash the king of israel came down unto him and wept over hi face 
and said o my father my father the chariot of israel and the 
horseman thereof 

13 15 and elisha said unto him take bow and arrow and he took unto 
him bow and arrow 

13 16 and he said to the king of israel put thine hand upon the bow 
and he put hi hand upon it and elisha put hi hand upon the king s 
hand 

13 17 and he said open the window eastward and he open it then 
elisha said shoot and he shot and he said the arrow of the lord s 
deliv and the arrow of deliv from syria for thou shalt 
smite the syrian in aphek till thou have consum them 

13 18 and he said take the arrow and he took them and he said unto 
the king of israel smite upon the ground and he smote thrice and 
stay 

13 19 and the man of god wa wroth with him and said thou shouldest 
have smitten five or six time then hadst thou smitten syria till 
thou hadst consum it wherea now thou shalt smite syria but thrice 

13 20 and elisha die and they buri him and the band of the 
moabit invad the land at the come in of the year 

13 21 and it came to pa a they were buri a man that behold 
they spi a band of men and they cast the man into the sepulchr of 
elisha and when the man wa let down and touch the bone of 
elisha he reviv and stood up on hi foot 

13 22 but hazael king of syria oppress israel all the day of 
jehoahaz 

13 23 and the lord wa graciou unto them and had compass on them 
and had respect unto them becau of hi coven with abraham 
isaac and jacob and would not destroy them neither cast he them 
from hi presenc a yet 

13 24 so hazael king of syria die and benhadad hi son reign in 
hi stead 

13 25 and jehoash the son of jehoahaz took again out of the hand of 
benhadad the son of hazael the citi which he had taken out of the 
hand of jehoahaz hi father by war three time did joash beat him 
and recov the citi of israel 

14 1 in the second year of joash son of jehoahaz king of israel 
reign amaziah the son of joash king of judah 

14 2 he wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign and 
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
jehoaddan of jerusalem 

14 3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord yet not 
like david hi father he did accord to all thing a joash hi 
father did 

14 4 howbeit the high place were not taken away a yet the peopl 
did sacrif and burnt incen on the high place 

14 5 and it came to pa a soon a the kingdom wa confirm in hi 
hand that he slew hi servant which had slain the king hi father 

14 6 but the child of the murder he slew not accord unto 
that which is written in the book of the law of mose wherein the 
lord command say the father shall not be put to death for the 
child nor the child be put to death for the father but everi 
man shall be put to death for hi own sin 

14 7 he slew of edom in the valley of salt ten thousand and took 
selah by war and call the name of it joktheel unto thi day 

14 8 then amaziah sent messeng to jehoash the son of jehoahaz son 
of jehu king of israel say come let u look one anoth in the 
face 

14 9 and jehoash the king of israel sent to amaziah king of judah 
say the thistl that wa in lebanon sent to the cedar that wa in 
lebanon say give thi daughter to my son to wife and there pa 
by a wild beast that wa in lebanon and trode down the thistl 

14 10 thou hast ind smitten edom and thine heart hath lift thee 
up glori of thi and tarri at home for whi shouldest thou meddl to 
thi hurt that thou shouldest fall even thou and judah with thee 
14 11 but amaziah would not hear therefor jehoash king of israel 
went up and he and amaziah king of judah look one anoth in the 
face at bethshemesh which belongeth to judah 

14 12 and judah wa put to the wor befor israel and they fled 
everi man to their tent 

14 13 and jehoash king of israel took amaziah king of judah the son 
of jehoash the son of ahaziah at bethshemesh and came to jerusalem 
and brake down the wall of jerusalem from the gate of ephraim unto the 
corner gate four hundr cubit 

14 14 and he took all the gold and silver and all the vessel that 
were found in the hou of the lord and in the treasur of the 
king s hou and hostag and return to samaria 

14 15 now the rest of the act of jehoash which he did and hi might 
and how he fought with amaziah king of judah are they not written in 
the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 14 16 and jehoash 
slept with hi father and wa buri in samaria with the king of 
israel and jeroboam hi son reign in hi stead 

14 17 and amaziah the son of joash king of judah live after the death 
of jehoash son of jehoahaz king of israel fifteen year 

14 18 and the rest of the act of amaziah are they not written in the 
book of the chronicl of the king of judah 14 19 now they made a 
conspiraci against him in jerusalem and he fled to lachish but they 
sent after him to lachish and slew him there 

14 20 and they brought him on hor and he wa buri at jerusalem 
with hi father in the citi of david 

14 21 and all the peopl of judah took azariah which wa sixteen 
year old and made him king instead of hi father amaziah 

14 22 he built elath and restor it to judah after that the king 
slept with hi father 

14 23 in the fifteenth year of amaziah the son of joash king of judah 
jeroboam the son of joash king of israel began to reign in samaria 
and reign forti and one year 

14 24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord he 
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made 
israel to sin 

14 25 he restor the coast of israel from the enter of hamath unto 
the sea of the plain accord to the word of the lord god of israel 
which he spake by the hand of hi servant jonah the son of amittai 
the prophet which wa of gathheph 

14 26 for the lord saw the afflict of israel that it wa veri 
bitter for there wa not ani shut up nor ani left nor ani helper 
for israel 

14 27 and the lord said not that he would blot out the name of israel 
from under heaven but he save them by the hand of jeroboam the son 
of joash 

14 28 now the rest of the act of jeroboam and all that he did and 
hi might how he war and how he recov damascu and hamath 
which belong to judah for israel are they not written in the book 
of the chronicl of the king of israel 14 29 and jeroboam slept 
with hi father even with the king of israel and zachariah hi son 
reign in hi stead 

15 1 in the twenti and seventh year of jeroboam king of israel began 
azariah son of amaziah king of judah to reign 

15 2 sixteen year old wa he when he began to reign and he reign 
two and fifti year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa jecholiah 
of jerusalem 

15 3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that hi father amaziah had done 15 4 save that the 
high place were not remov the peopl sacrif and burnt incen 
still on the high place 

15 5 and the lord smote the king so that he wa a leper unto the day 
of hi death and dwelt in a sever hou and jotham the king s son 
wa over the hou judg the peopl of the land 

15 6 and the rest of the act of azariah and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
15 7 so azariah slept with hi father and they buri him with hi 
father in the citi of david and jotham hi son reign in hi stead 

15 8 in the thirti and eighth year of azariah king of judah did 
zachariah the son of jeroboam reign over israel in samaria six month 

15 9 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord a hi 
father had done he depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of 
nebat who made israel to sin 

15 10 and shallum the son of jabesh conspir against him and smote 
him befor the peopl and slew him and reign in hi stead 

15 11 and the rest of the act of zachariah behold they are written 
in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 

15 12 thi wa the word of the lord which he spake unto jehu say 
thi son shall sit on the throne of israel unto the fourth gener 
and so it came to pa 

15 13 shallum the son of jabesh began to reign in the nine and 
thirtieth year of uzziah king of judah and he reign a full month in 
samaria 

15 14 for menahem the son of gadi went up from tirzah and came to 
samaria and smote shallum the son of jabesh in samaria and slew him 
and reign in hi stead 

15 15 and the rest of the act of shallum and hi conspiraci which he 
made behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the 
king of israel 

15 16 then menahem smote tiphsah and all that were therein and the 
coast thereof from tirzah becau they open not to him therefor 
he smote it and all the woman therein that were with child he rip 
up 

15 17 in the nine and thirtieth year of azariah king of judah began 
menahem the son of gadi to reign over israel and reign ten year in 
samaria 

15 18 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord he 
depart not all hi day from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat 
who made israel to sin 

15 19 and pul the king of assyria came against the land and menahem 
gave pul a thousand talent of silver that hi hand might be with him 
to confirm the kingdom in hi hand 

15 20 and menahem exact the money of israel even of all the mighti 
men of wealth of each man fifti shekel of silver to give to the 
king of assyria so the king of assyria turn back and stay not 
there in the land 

15 21 and the rest of the act of menahem and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 
15 22 and menahem slept with hi father and pekahiah hi son reign 
in hi stead 

15 23 in the fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekahiah the son 
of menahem began to reign over israel in samaria and reign two 
year 

15 24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord he 
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made 
israel to sin 

15 25 but pekah the son of remaliah a captain of hi conspir 
against him and smote him in samaria in the palac of the king s 
hou with argob and arieh and with him fifti men of the gileadit 
and he kill him and reign in hi room 

15 26 and the rest of the act of pekahiah and all that he did 
behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of 
israel 

15 27 in the two and fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekah the 
son of remaliah began to reign over israel in samaria and reign 
twenti year 

15 28 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord he 
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made 
israel to sin 

15 29 in the day of pekah king of israel came tiglathpil king of 
assyria and took ijon and abelbethmaachah and janoah and kedesh 
and hazor and gilead and galil all the land of naphtali and 
carri them captiv to assyria 

15 30 and hoshea the son of elah made a conspiraci against pekah the 
son of remaliah and smote him and slew him and reign in hi 
stead in the twentieth year of jotham the son of uzziah 

15 31 and the rest of the act of pekah and all that he did behold 
they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel 

15 32 in the second year of pekah the son of remaliah king of israel 
began jotham the son of uzziah king of judah to reign 

15 33 five and twenti year old wa he when he began to reign and he 
reign sixteen year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa jerusha 
the daughter of zadok 

15 34 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord he did 
accord to all that hi father uzziah had done 

15 35 howbeit the high place were not remov the peopl sacrif 
and burn incen still in the high place he built the higher gate 
of the hou of the lord 

15 36 now the rest of the act of jotham and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
15 37 in those day the lord began to send against judah rezin the 
king of syria and pekah the son of remaliah 

15 38 and jotham slept with hi father and wa buri with hi 
father in the citi of david hi father and ahaz hi son reign in 
hi stead 

16 1 in the seventeenth year of pekah the son of remaliah ahaz the son 
of jotham king of judah began to reign 

16 2 twenti year old wa ahaz when he began to reign and reign 
sixteen year in jerusalem and did not that which wa right in the 
sight of the lord hi god like david hi father 

16 3 but he walk in the way of the king of israel yea and made 
hi son to pa through the fire accord to the abomin of the 
heathen whom the lord cast out from befor the child of israel 

16 4 and he sacrif and burnt incen in the high place and on 
the hill and under everi green tree 

16 5 then rezin king of syria and pekah son of remaliah king of israel 
came up to jerusalem to war and they besieg ahaz but could not 
overcom him 

16 6 at that time rezin king of syria recov elath to syria and 
drave the jew from elath and the syrian came to elath and dwelt 
there unto thi day 

16 7 so ahaz sent messeng to tiglathpil king of assyria 
say i am thi servant and thi son come up and save me out of the 
hand of the king of syria and out of the hand of the king of israel 
which rise up against me 

16 8 and ahaz took the silver and gold that wa found in the hou of 
the lord and in the treasur of the king s hou and sent it for a 
present to the king of assyria 

16 9 and the king of assyria hearken unto him for the king of 
assyria went up against damascu and took it and carri the peopl 
of it captiv to kir and slew rezin 

16 10 and king ahaz went to damascu to meet tiglathpil king of 
assyria and saw an altar that wa at damascu and king ahaz sent to 
urijah the priest the fashion of the altar and the pattern of it 
accord to all the workmanship thereof 

16 11 and urijah the priest built an altar accord to all that king 
ahaz had sent from damascu so urijah the priest made it against king 
ahaz came from damascu 

16 12 and when the king wa come from damascu the king saw the 
altar and the king approach to the altar and offer thereon 

16 13 and he burnt hi burnt offer and hi meat offer and 
pour hi drink offer and sprinkl the blood of hi peac 
offer upon the altar 

16 14 and he brought also the brasen altar which wa befor the lord 
from the forefront of the hou from between the altar and the hou 
of the lord and put it on the north side of the altar 

16 15 and king ahaz command urijah the priest say upon the 
great altar burn the morn burnt offer and the even meat 
offer and the king s burnt sacrif and hi meat offer with 
the burnt offer of all the peopl of the land and their meat 
offer and their drink offer and sprinkl upon it all the 
blood of the burnt offer and all the blood of the sacrif and 
the brasen altar shall be for me to enquir by 

16 16 thu did urijah the priest accord to all that king ahaz 
command 

16 17 and king ahaz cut off the border of the base and remov the 
laver from off them and took down the sea from off the brasen ox 
that were under it and put it upon the pavement of stone 

16 18 and the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the hou 
and the king s entri without turn he from the hou of the lord for 
the king of assyria 

16 19 now the rest of the act of ahaz which he did are they not 
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 16 20 
and ahaz slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father in 
the citi of david and hezekiah hi son reign in hi stead 

17 1 in the twelfth year of ahaz king of judah began hoshea the son of 
elah to reign in samaria over israel nine year 

17 2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord but not 
a the king of israel that were befor him 

17 3 against him came up shalman king of assyria and hoshea 
becam hi servant and gave him present 

17 4 and the king of assyria found conspiraci in hoshea for he had 
sent messeng to so king of egypt and brought no present to the 
king of assyria a he had done year by year therefor the king of 
assyria shut him up and bound him in prison 

17 5 then the king of assyria came up throughout all the land and 
went up to samaria and besieg it three year 

17 6 in the ninth year of hoshea the king of assyria took samaria and 
carri israel away into assyria and place them in halah and in 
habor by the river of gozan and in the citi of the mede 

17 7 for so it wa that the child of israel had sin against the 
lord their god which had brought them up out of the land of egypt 
from under the hand of pharaoh king of egypt and had fear other 
god 17 8 and walk in the statut of the heathen whom the lord 
cast out from befor the child of israel and of the king of 
israel which they had made 

17 9 and the child of israel did secretli those thing that were 
not right against the lord their god and they built them high place 
in all their citi from the tower of the watchman to the fenc 
citi 

17 10 and they set them up imag and grove in everi high hill and 
under everi green tree 17 11 and there they burnt incen in all the 
high place a did the heathen whom the lord carri away befor 
them and wrought wick thing to provok the lord to anger 17 12 
for they serv idol whereof the lord had said unto them ye shall 
not do thi thing 

17 13 yet the lord testifi against israel and against judah by all 
the prophet and by all the seer say turn ye from your evil 
way and keep my command and my statut accord to all the 
law which i command your father and which i sent to you by my 
servant the prophet 

17 14 notwithstand they would not hear but harden their neck 
like to the neck of their father that did not believ in the lord 
their god 

17 15 and they reject hi statut and hi coven that he made 
with their father and hi testimoni which he testifi against 
them and they follow vaniti and becam vain and went after the 
heathen that were round about them concern whom the lord had 
charg them that they should not do like them 

17 16 and they left all the command of the lord their god and 
made them molten imag even two calf and made a grove and 
worship all the host of heaven and serv baal 

17 17 and they cau their son and their daughter to pa through 
the fire and use divin and enchant and sold themselv to 
do evil in the sight of the lord to provok him to anger 

17 18 therefor the lord wa veri angri with israel and remov them 
out of hi sight there wa none left but the tribe of judah onli 

17 19 also judah kept not the command of the lord their god but 
walk in the statut of israel which they made 

17 20 and the lord reject all the seed of israel and afflict 
them and deliv them into the hand of spoiler until he had cast 
them out of hi sight 

17 21 for he rent israel from the hou of david and they made 
jeroboam the son of nebat king and jeroboam drave israel from 
follow the lord and made them sin a great sin 

17 22 for the child of israel walk in all the sin of jeroboam 
which he did they depart not from them 17 23 until the lord 
remov israel out of hi sight a he had said by all hi servant 
the prophet so wa israel carri away out of their own land to 
assyria unto thi day 

17 24 and the king of assyria brought men from babylon and from 
cuthah and from ava and from hamath and from sepharvaim and place 
them in the citi of samaria instead of the child of israel and 
they poss samaria and dwelt in the citi thereof 

17 25 and so it wa at the begin of their dwell there that 
they fear not the lord therefor the lord sent lion among them 
which slew some of them 

17 26 wherefor they spake to the king of assyria say the nation 
which thou hast remov and place in the citi of samaria know not 
the manner of the god of the land therefor he hath sent lion among 
them and behold they slay them becau they know not the manner of 
the god of the land 

17 27 then the king of assyria command say carri thither one of 
the priest whom ye brought from thenc and let them go and dwell 
there and let him teach them the manner of the god of the land 

17 28 then one of the priest whom they had carri away from samaria 
came and dwelt in bethel and taught them how they should fear the 
lord 

17 29 howbeit everi nation made god of their own and put them in the 
hou of the high place which the samaritan had made everi nation 
in their citi wherein they dwelt 

17 30 and the men of babylon made succothbenoth and the men of cuth 
made nergal and the men of hamath made ashima 17 31 and the avit 
made nibhaz and tartak and the sepharvit burnt their child in 
fire to adrammelech and anammelech the god of sepharvaim 

17 32 so they fear the lord and made unto themselv of the lowest 
of them priest of the high place which sacrif for them in the 
hou of the high place 

17 33 they fear the lord and serv their own god after the 
manner of the nation whom they carri away from thenc 

17 34 unto thi day they do after the former manner they fear not 
the lord neither do they after their statut or after their 
ordin or after the law and command which the lord command 
the child of jacob whom he name israel 17 35 with whom the lord 
had made a coven and charg them say ye shall not fear other 
god nor bow yourselv to them nor serv them nor sacrif to 
them 17 36 but the lord who brought you up out of the land of egypt 
with great power and a stretch out arm him shall ye fear and him 
shall ye worship and to him shall ye do sacrif 

17 37 and the statut and the ordin and the law and the 
command which he wrote for you ye shall observ to do for 
evermor and ye shall not fear other god 

17 38 and the coven that i have made with you ye shall not forget 
neither shall ye fear other god 

17 39 but the lord your god ye shall fear and he shall deliv you 
out of the hand of all your enemi 

17 40 howbeit they did not hearken but they did after their former 
manner 

17 41 so these nation fear the lord and serv their graven 
imag both their child and their child s child a did 
their father so do they unto thi day 

18 1 now it came to pa in the third year of hoshea son of elah king 
of israel that hezekiah the son of ahaz king of judah began to reign 

18 2 twenti and five year old wa he when he began to reign and he 
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem hi mother s name also wa 
abi the daughter of zachariah 

18 3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that david hi father did 

18 4 he remov the high place and brake the imag and cut down 
the grove and brake in piec the brasen serpent that mose had 
made for unto those day the child of israel did burn incen to 
it and he call it nehushtan 

18 5 he trust in the lord god of israel so that after him wa none 
like him among all the king of judah nor ani that were befor him 

18 6 for he clave to the lord and depart not from follow him 
but kept hi command which the lord command mose 

18 7 and the lord wa with him and he prosper whithersoev he went 
forth and he rebel against the king of assyria and serv him 
not 

18 8 he smote the philistin even unto gaza and the border 
thereof from the tower of the watchman to the fenc citi 

18 9 and it came to pa in the fourth year of king hezekiah which 
wa the seventh year of hoshea son of elah king of israel that 
shalman king of assyria came up against samaria and besieg it 

18 10 and at the end of three year they took it even in the sixth 
year of hezekiah that is in the ninth year of hoshea king of israel 
samaria wa taken 

18 11 and the king of assyria did carri away israel unto assyria and 
put them in halah and in habor by the river of gozan and in the 
citi of the mede 18 12 becau they obey not the voic of the 
lord their god but transgress hi coven and all that mose the 
servant of the lord command and would not hear them nor do them 

18 13 now in the fourteenth year of king hezekiah did sennacherib king 
of assyria come up against all the fenc citi of judah and took 
them 

18 14 and hezekiah king of judah sent to the king of assyria to 
lachish say i have offend return from me that which thou 
puttest on me will i bear and the king of assyria appoint unto 
hezekiah king of judah three hundr talent of silver and thirti 
talent of gold 

18 15 and hezekiah gave him all the silver that wa found in the hou 
of the lord and in the treasur of the king s hou 

18 16 at that time did hezekiah cut off the gold from the door of the 
templ of the lord and from the pillar which hezekiah king of judah 
had overlaid and gave it to the king of assyria 

18 17 and the king of assyria sent tartan and rabsari and rabshakeh 
from lachish to king hezekiah with a great host against jerusalem and 
they went up and came to jerusalem and when they were come up they 
came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool which is in the 
highway of the fuller s field 

18 18 and when they had call to the king there came out to them 
eliakim the son of hilkiah which wa over the household and shebna 
the scribe and joah the son of asaph the record 

18 19 and rabshakeh said unto them speak ye now to hezekiah thu 
saith the great king the king of assyria what confid is thi 
wherein thou trustest 18 20 thou sayest but they are but vain 
word i have counsel and strength for the war now on whom dost thou 
trust that thou rebellest against me 18 21 now behold thou 
trustest upon the staff of thi brui reed even upon egypt on 
which if a man lean it will go into hi hand and pierc it so is 
pharaoh king of egypt unto all that trust on him 

18 22 but if ye say unto me we trust in the lord our god is not that 
he whose high place and whose altar hezekiah hath taken away and 
hath said to judah and jerusalem ye shall worship befor thi altar 
in jerusalem 18 23 now therefor i pray thee give pledg to my 
lord the king of assyria and i will deliv thee two thousand hor 
if thou be abl on thi part to set rider upon them 

18 24 how then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the 
least of my master s servant and put thi trust on egypt for chariot 
and for horseman 18 25 am i now come up without the lord against 
thi place to destroy it the lord said to me go up against thi 
land and destroy it 

18 26 then said eliakim the son of hilkiah and shebna and joah unto 
rabshakeh speak i pray thee to thi servant in the syrian languag 
for we understand it and talk not with u in the jew languag in 
the ear of the peopl that are on the wall 

18 27 but rabshakeh said unto them hath my master sent me to thi 
master and to thee to speak these word hath he not sent me to the 
men which sit on the wall that they may eat their own dung and drink 
their own piss with you 18 28 then rabshakeh stood and cri with a 
loud voic in the jew languag and spake say hear the word of 
the great king the king of assyria 18 29 thu saith the king let 
not hezekiah deceiv you for he shall not be abl to deliv you out 
of hi hand 18 30 neither let hezekiah make you trust in the lord 
say the lord will sure deliv u and thi citi shall not be 
deliv into the hand of the king of assyria 

18 31 hearken not to hezekiah for thu saith the king of assyria 
make an agreement with me by a present and come out to me and then 
eat ye everi man of hi own vine and everi one of hi fig tree and 
drink ye everi one the water of hi cistern 18 32 until i come and 
take you away to a land like your own land a land of corn and wine a 
land of bread and vineyard a land of oil oliv and of honey that ye 
may live and not die and hearken not unto hezekiah when he 
persuadeth you say the lord will deliv u 

18 33 hath ani of the god of the nation deliv at all hi land 
out of the hand of the king of assyria 18 34 where are the god of 
hamath and of arpad where are the god of sepharvaim hena and 
ivah have they deliv samaria out of mine hand 18 35 who are 
they among all the god of the countri that have deliv their 
countri out of mine hand that the lord should deliv jerusalem out 
of mine hand 18 36 but the peopl held their peac and answer him 
not a word for the king s command wa say answer him not 

18 37 then came eliakim the son of hilkiah which wa over the 
household and shebna the scribe and joah the son of asaph the 
record to hezekiah with their cloth rent and told him the word 
of rabshakeh 

19 1 and it came to pa when king hezekiah heard it that he rent 
hi cloth and cover himself with sackcloth and went into the 
hou of the lord 

19 2 and he sent eliakim which wa over the household and shebna the 
scribe and the elder of the priest cover with sackcloth to 
isaiah the prophet the son of amoz 

19 3 and they said unto him thu saith hezekiah thi day is a day of 
troubl and of rebuk and blasphemi for the child are come to 
the birth and there is not strength to bring forth 

19 4 it may be the lord thi god will hear all the word of rabshakeh 
whom the king of assyria hi master hath sent to reproach the live 
god and will reprov the word which the lord thi god hath heard 
wherefor lift up thi prayer for the remnant that are left 

19 5 so the servant of king hezekiah came to isaiah 

19 6 and isaiah said unto them thu shall ye say to your master thu 
saith the lord be not afraid of the word which thou hast heard with 
which the servant of the king of assyria have blasphem me 

19 7 behold i will send a blast upon him and he shall hear a rumour 
and shall return to hi own land and i will cau him to fall by the 
sword in hi own land 

19 8 so rabshakeh return and found the king of assyria war 
against libnah for he had heard that he wa depart from lachish 

19 9 and when he heard say of tirhakah king of ethiopia behold he is 
come out to fight against thee he sent messeng again unto 
hezekiah say 19 10 thu shall ye speak to hezekiah king of judah 
say let not thi god in whom thou trustest deceiv thee say 
jerusalem shall not be deliv into the hand of the king of assyria 

19 11 behold thou hast heard what the king of assyria have done to 
all land by destroy them utterli and shalt thou be deliv 
19 12 have the god of the nation deliv them which my father 
have destroy a gozan and haran and rezeph and the child of 
eden which were in thelasar 19 13 where is the king of hamath and 
the king of arpad and the king of the citi of sepharvaim of hena 
and ivah 19 14 and hezekiah receiv the letter of the hand of the 
messeng and read it and hezekiah went up into the hou of the 
lord and spread it befor the lord 

19 15 and hezekiah pray befor the lord and said o lord god of 
israel which dwellest between the cherub thou art the god even 
thou alon of all the kingdom of the earth thou hast made heaven 
and earth 

19 16 lord bow down thine ear and hear open lord thine eye and 
see and hear the word of sennacherib which hath sent him to 
reproach the live god 

19 17 of a truth lord the king of assyria have destroy the 
nation and their land 19 18 and have cast their god into the fire 
for they were no god but the work of men s hand wood and stone 
therefor they have destroy them 

19 19 now therefor o lord our god i beseech thee save thou u out 
of hi hand that all the kingdom of the earth may know that thou art 
the lord god even thou onli 

19 20 then isaiah the son of amoz sent to hezekiah say thu saith 
the lord god of israel that which thou hast pray to me against 
sennacherib king of assyria i have heard 

19 21 thi is the word that the lord hath spoken concern him the 
virgin the daughter of zion hath despi thee and laugh thee to 
scorn the daughter of jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee 

19 22 whom hast thou reproach and blasphem and against whom hast 
thou exalt thi voic and lift up thine eye on high even against 
the holi one of israel 

19 23 by thi messeng thou hast reproach the lord and hast said 
with the multitud of my chariot i am come up to the height of the 
mountain to the side of lebanon and will cut down the tall cedar 
tree thereof and the choic fir tree thereof and i will enter into 
the lodg of hi border and into the forest of hi carmel 

19 24 i have dig and drunk strang water and with the sole of my 
foot have i dri up all the river of besieg place 

19 25 hast thou not heard long ago how i have done it and of ancient 
time that i have form it now have i brought it to pa that thou 
shouldest be to lay wast fenc citi into ruinou heap 

19 26 therefor their inhabit were of small power they were 
dismay and confound they were a the grass of the field and a 
the green herb a the grass on the hou top and a corn blast 
befor it be grown up 

19 27 but i know thi abod and thi go out and thi come in and 
thi rage against me 

19 28 becau thi rage against me and thi tumult is come up into mine 
ear therefor i will put my hook in thi nose and my bridl in thi 
lip and i will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest 

19 29 and thi shall be a sign unto thee ye shall eat thi year such 
thing a grow of themselv and in the second year that which 
springeth of the same and in the third year sow ye and reap and 
plant vineyard and eat the fruit thereof 

19 30 and the remnant that is escap of the hou of judah shall yet 
again take root downward and bear fruit upward 

19 31 for out of jerusalem shall go forth a remnant and they that 
escap out of mount zion the zeal of the lord of host shall do thi 

19 32 therefor thu saith the lord concern the king of assyria he 
shall not come into thi citi nor shoot an arrow there nor come 
befor it with shield nor cast a bank against it 

19 33 by the way that he came by the same shall he return and shall 
not come into thi citi saith the lord 

19 34 for i will defend thi citi to save it for mine own sake and 
for my servant david s sake 

19 35 and it came to pa that night that the angel of the lord went 
out and smote in the camp of the assyrian an hundr fourscor and 
five thousand and when they aro earli in the morn behold they 
were all dead corp 

19 36 so sennacherib king of assyria depart and went and return 
and dwelt at nineveh 

19 37 and it came to pa a he wa worship in the hou of 
nisroch hi god that adrammelech and sharez hi son smote him with 
the sword and they escap into the land of armenia and esarhaddon 
hi son reign in hi stead 

20 1 in those day wa hezekiah sick unto death and the prophet 
isaiah the son of amoz came to him and said unto him thu saith the 
lord set thine hou in order for thou shalt die and not live 

20 2 then he turn hi face to the wall and pray unto the lord 
say 20 3 i beseech thee o lord rememb now how i have walk 
befor thee in truth and with a perfect heart and have done that 
which is good in thi sight and hezekiah wept sore 

20 4 and it came to pa afor isaiah wa gone out into the middl 
court that the word of the lord came to him say 20 5 turn again 
and tell hezekiah the captain of my peopl thu saith the lord the 
god of david thi father i have heard thi prayer i have seen thi 
tear behold i will heal thee on the third day thou shalt go up 
unto the hou of the lord 

20 6 and i will add unto thi day fifteen year and i will deliv 
thee and thi citi out of the hand of the king of assyria and i will 
defend thi citi for mine own sake and for my servant david s sake 

20 7 and isaiah said take a lump of fig and they took and laid it 
on the boil and he recov 

20 8 and hezekiah said unto isaiah what shall be the sign that the 
lord will heal me and that i shall go up into the hou of the lord 
the third day 20 9 and isaiah said thi sign shalt thou have of the 
lord that the lord will do the thing that he hath spoken shall the 
shadow go forward ten degr or go back ten degr 20 10 and 
hezekiah answer it is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten 
degr nay but let the shadow return backward ten degr 

20 11 and isaiah the prophet cri unto the lord and he brought the 
shadow ten degr backward by which it had gone down in the dial of 
ahaz 

20 12 at that time berodachbaladan the son of baladan king of 
babylon sent letter and a present unto hezekiah for he had heard 
that hezekiah had been sick 

20 13 and hezekiah hearken unto them and shew them all the hou 
of hi preciou thing the silver and the gold and the spice and 
the preciou ointment and all the hou of hi armour and all that 
wa found in hi treasur there wa noth in hi hou nor in all 
hi dominion that hezekiah shew them not 

20 14 then came isaiah the prophet unto king hezekiah and said unto 
him what said these men and from whenc came they unto thee and 
hezekiah said they are come from a far countri even from babylon 

20 15 and he said what have they seen in thine hou and hezekiah 
answer all the thing that are in mine hou have they seen there 
is noth among my treasur that i have not shew them 

20 16 and isaiah said unto hezekiah hear the word of the lord 

20 17 behold the day come that all that is in thine hou and that 
which thi father have laid up in store unto thi day shall be 
carri into babylon noth shall be left saith the lord 

20 18 and of thi son that shall issu from thee which thou shalt 
beget shall they take away and they shall be eunuch in the palac 
of the king of babylon 

20 19 then said hezekiah unto isaiah good is the word of the lord 
which thou hast spoken and he said is it not good if peac and 
truth be in my day 20 20 and the rest of the act of hezekiah and 
all hi might and how he made a pool and a conduit and brought 
water into the citi are they not written in the book of the 
chronicl of the king of judah 20 21 and hezekiah slept with hi 
father and manasseh hi son reign in hi stead 

21 1 manasseh wa twelv year old when he began to reign and reign 
fifti and five year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
hephzibah 

21 2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord after 
the abomin of the heathen whom the lord cast out befor the 
child of israel 

21 3 for he built up again the high place which hezekiah hi father 
had destroy and he rear up altar for baal and made a grove a 
did ahab king of israel and worship all the host of heaven and 
serv them 

21 4 and he built altar in the hou of the lord of which the lord 
said in jerusalem will i put my name 

21 5 and he built altar for all the host of heaven in the two court 
of the hou of the lord 

21 6 and he made hi son pa through the fire and observ time 
and use enchant and dealt with familiar spirit and wizard he 
wrought much wick in the sight of the lord to provok him to 
anger 

21 7 and he set a graven imag of the grove that he had made in the 
hou of which the lord said to david and to solomon hi son in 
thi hou and in jerusalem which i have chosen out of all tribe of 
israel will i put my name for ever 21 8 neither will i make the foot 
of israel move ani more out of the land which i gave their father 
onli if they will observ to do accord to all that i have command 
them and accord to all the law that my servant mose command 
them 

21 9 but they hearken not and manasseh seduc them to do more evil 
than did the nation whom the lord destroy befor the child of 
israel 

21 10 and the lord spake by hi servant the prophet say 21 11 
becau manasseh king of judah hath done these abomin and hath 
done wickedli abov all that the amorit did which were befor him 
and hath made judah also to sin with hi idol 21 12 therefor thu 
saith the lord god of israel behold i am bring such evil upon 
jerusalem and judah that whosoev heareth of it both hi ear shall 
tingl 

21 13 and i will stretch over jerusalem the line of samaria and the 
plummet of the hou of ahab and i will wipe jerusalem a a man 
wipeth a dish wipe it and turn it upsid down 

21 14 and i will forsak the remnant of mine inherit and deliv 
them into the hand of their enemi and they shall becom a prey and 
a spoil to all their enemi 21 15 becau they have done that which 
wa evil in my sight and have provok me to anger sinc the day 
their father came forth out of egypt even unto thi day 

21 16 moreov manasseh shed innoc blood veri much till he had 
fill jerusalem from one end to anoth besid hi sin wherewith he 
made judah to sin in do that which wa evil in the sight of the 
lord 

21 17 now the rest of the act of manasseh and all that he did and 
hi sin that he sin are they not written in the book of the 
chronicl of the king of judah 21 18 and manasseh slept with hi 
father and wa buri in the garden of hi own hou in the garden 
of uzza and amon hi son reign in hi stead 

21 19 amon wa twenti and two year old when he began to reign and he 
reign two year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
meshullemeth the daughter of haruz of jotbah 

21 20 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord a hi 
father manasseh did 

21 21 and he walk in all the way that hi father walk in and 
serv the idol that hi father serv and worship them 21 22 
and he forsook the lord god of hi father and walk not in the way 
of the lord 

21 23 and the servant of amon conspir against him and slew the 
king in hi own hou 

21 24 and the peopl of the land slew all them that had conspir 
against king amon and the peopl of the land made josiah hi son king 
in hi stead 

21 25 now the rest of the act of amon which he did are they not 
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 21 26 
and he wa buri in hi sepulchr in the garden of uzza and josiah 
hi son reign in hi stead 

22 1 josiah wa eight year old when he began to reign and he reign 
thirti and one year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa jedidah 
the daughter of adaiah of boscath 

22 2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord and 
walk in all the way of david hi father and turn not asid to the 
right hand or to the left 

22 3 and it came to pa in the eighteenth year of king josiah that 
the king sent shaphan the son of azaliah the son of meshullam the 
scribe to the hou of the lord say 22 4 go up to hilkiah the 
high priest that he may sum the silver which is brought into the 
hou of the lord which the keeper of the door have gather of the 
peopl 22 5 and let them deliv it into the hand of the doer of the 
work that have the oversight of the hou of the lord and let them 
give it to the doer of the work which is in the hou of the lord to 
repair the breach of the hou 22 6 unto carpent and builder 
and mason and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the hou 

22 7 howbeit there wa no reckon made with them of the money that 
wa deliv into their hand becau they dealt faith 

22 8 and hilkiah the high priest said unto shaphan the scribe i have 
found the book of the law in the hou of the lord and hilkiah gave 
the book to shaphan and he read it 

22 9 and shaphan the scribe came to the king and brought the king 
word again and said thi servant have gather the money that wa 
found in the hou and have deliv it into the hand of them that 
do the work that have the oversight of the hou of the lord 

22 10 and shaphan the scribe shew the king say hilkiah the 
priest hath deliv me a book and shaphan read it befor the king 

22 11 and it came to pa when the king had heard the word of the 
book of the law that he rent hi cloth 

22 12 and the king command hilkiah the priest and ahikam the son of 
shaphan and achbor the son of michaiah and shaphan the scribe and 
asahiah a servant of the king s say 22 13 go ye enquir of the 
lord for me and for the peopl and for all judah concern the 
word of thi book that is found for great is the wrath of the lord 
that is kindl against u becau our father have not hearken 
unto the word of thi book to do accord unto all that which is 
written concern u 

22 14 so hilkiah the priest and ahikam and achbor and shaphan and 
asahiah went unto huldah the prophetess the wife of shallum the son 
of tikvah the son of harha keeper of the wardrob now she dwelt 
in jerusalem in the colleg and they commun with her 

22 15 and she said unto them thu saith the lord god of israel tell 
the man that sent you to me 22 16 thu saith the lord behold i will 
bring evil upon thi place and upon the inhabit thereof even all 
the word of the book which the king of judah hath read 22 17 becau 
they have forsaken me and have burn incen unto other god that 
they might provok me to anger with all the work of their hand 
therefor my wrath shall be kindl against thi place and shall not 
be quench 

22 18 but to the king of judah which sent you to enquir of the lord 
thu shall ye say to him thu saith the lord god of israel a 
touch the word which thou hast heard 22 19 becau thine heart 
wa tender and thou hast humbl thyself befor the lord when thou 
heardest what i spake against thi place and against the inhabit 
thereof that they should becom a desol and a cur and hast 
rent thi cloth and wept befor me i also have heard thee saith 
the lord 

22 20 behold therefor i will gather thee unto thi father and thou 
shalt be gather into thi grave in peac and thine eye shall not 
see all the evil which i will bring upon thi place and they brought 
the king word again 

23 1 and the king sent and they gather unto him all the elder of 
judah and of jerusalem 

23 2 and the king went up into the hou of the lord and all the men 
of judah and all the inhabit of jerusalem with him and the 
priest and the prophet and all the peopl both small and great 
and he read in their ear all the word of the book of the coven 
which wa found in the hou of the lord 

23 3 and the king stood by a pillar and made a coven befor the 
lord to walk after the lord and to keep hi command and hi 
testimoni and hi statut with all their heart and all their soul 
to perform the word of thi coven that were written in thi book 
and all the peopl stood to the coven 

23 4 and the king command hilkiah the high priest and the priest 
of the second order and the keeper of the door to bring forth out 
of the templ of the lord all the vessel that were made for baal and 
for the grove and for all the host of heaven and he burn them 
without jerusalem in the field of kidron and carri the ash of 
them unto bethel 

23 5 and he put down the idolatr priest whom the king of judah 
had ordain to burn incen in the high place in the citi of 
judah and in the place round about jerusalem them also that burn 
incen unto baal to the sun and to the moon and to the planet 
and to all the host of heaven 

23 6 and he brought out the grove from the hou of the lord without 
jerusalem unto the brook kidron and burn it at the brook kidron 
and stamp it small to powder and cast the powder thereof upon the 
graf of the child of the peopl 

23 7 and he brake down the hou of the sodomit that were by the 
hou of the lord where the woman wove hang for the grove 

23 8 and he brought all the priest out of the citi of judah and 
defil the high place where the priest had burn incen from 
geba to beersheba and brake down the high place of the gate that 
were in the enter in of the gate of joshua the governor of the 
citi which were on a man s left hand at the gate of the citi 

23 9 nevertheless the priest of the high place came not up to the 
altar of the lord in jerusalem but they did eat of the unleaven 
bread among their brother 

23 10 and he defil topheth which is in the valley of the child 
of hinnom that no man might make hi son or hi daughter to pa 
through the fire to molech 

23 11 and he took away the hor that the king of judah had given to 
the sun at the enter in of the hou of the lord by the chamber 
of nathanmelech the chamberlain which wa in the suburb and burn 
the chariot of the sun with fire 

23 12 and the altar that were on the top of the upper chamber of 
ahaz which the king of judah had made and the altar which manasseh 
had made in the two court of the hou of the lord did the king beat 
down and brake them down from thenc and cast the dust of them into 
the brook kidron 

23 13 and the high place that were befor jerusalem which were on 
the right hand of the mount of corrupt which solomon the king of 
israel had build for ashtoreth the abomin of the zidonian and 
for chemosh the abomin of the moabit and for milcom the 
abomin of the child of ammon did the king defil 

23 14 and he brake in piec the imag and cut down the grove and 
fill their place with the bone of men 

23 15 moreov the altar that wa at bethel and the high place which 
jeroboam the son of nebat who made israel to sin had made both that 
altar and the high place he brake down and burn the high place and 
stamp it small to powder and burn the grove 

23 16 and a josiah turn himself he spi the sepulchr that were 
there in the mount and sent and took the bone out of the 
sepulchr and burn them upon the altar and pollut it accord 
to the word of the lord which the man of god proclaim who 
proclaim these word 

23 17 then he said what titl is that that i see and the men of the 
citi told him it is the sepulchr of the man of god which came from 
judah and proclaim these thing that thou hast done against the 
altar of bethel 

23 18 and he said let him alon let no man move hi bone so they 
let hi bone alon with the bone of the prophet that came out of 
samaria 

23 19 and all the hou also of the high place that were in the 
citi of samaria which the king of israel had made to provok the 
lord to anger josiah took away and did to them accord to all the 
act that he had done in bethel 

23 20 and he slew all the priest of the high place that were there 
upon the altar and burn men s bone upon them and return to 
jerusalem 

23 21 and the king command all the peopl say keep the passov 
unto the lord your god a it is written in the book of thi coven 

23 22 sure there wa not holden such a passov from the day of the 
judg that judg israel nor in all the day of the king of israel 
nor of the king of judah 23 23 but in the eighteenth year of king 
josiah wherein thi passov wa holden to the lord in jerusalem 

23 24 moreov the worker with familiar spirit and the wizard and 
the imag and the idol and all the abomin that were spi in 
the land of judah and in jerusalem did josiah put away that he might 
perform the word of the law which were written in the book that 
hilkiah the priest found in the hou of the lord 

23 25 and like unto him wa there no king befor him that turn to 
the lord with all hi heart and with all hi soul and with all hi 
might accord to all the law of mose neither after him aro 
there ani like him 

23 26 notwithstand the lord turn not from the fierc of hi 
great wrath wherewith hi anger wa kindl against judah becau of 
all the provoc that manasseh had provok him withal 

23 27 and the lord said i will remov judah also out of my sight a 
i have remov israel and will cast off thi citi jerusalem which i 
have chosen and the hou of which i said my name shall be there 

23 28 now the rest of the act of josiah and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
23 29 in hi day pharaohnechoh king of egypt went up against the king 
of assyria to the river euphrat and king josiah went against him 
and he slew him at megiddo when he had seen him 

23 30 and hi servant carri him in a chariot dead from megiddo and 
brought him to jerusalem and buri him in hi own sepulchr and the 
peopl of the land took jehoahaz the son of josiah and anoint him 
and made him king in hi father s stead 

23 31 jehoahaz wa twenti and three year old when he began to reign 
and he reign three month in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
hamut the daughter of jeremiah of libnah 

23 32 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that hi father had done 

23 33 and pharaohnechoh put him in band at riblah in the land of 
hamath that he might not reign in jerusalem and put the land to a 
tribut of an hundr talent of silver and a talent of gold 

23 34 and pharaohnechoh made eliakim the son of josiah king in the 
room of josiah hi father and turn hi name to jehoiakim and took 
jehoahaz away and he came to egypt and die there 

23 35 and jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to pharaoh but he 
tax the land to give the money accord to the command of 
pharaoh he exact the silver and the gold of the peopl of the land 
of everi one accord to hi taxat to give it unto pharaohnechoh 

23 36 jehoiakim wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign 
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
zebudah the daughter of pedaiah of rumah 

23 37 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that hi father had done 

24 1 in hi day nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came up and jehoiakim 
becam hi servant three year then he turn and rebel against 
him 

24 2 and the lord sent against him band of the chald and band of 
the syrian and band of the moabit and band of the child of 
ammon and sent them against judah to destroy it accord to the 
word of the lord which he spake by hi servant the prophet 

24 3 sure at the command of the lord came thi upon judah to 
remov them out of hi sight for the sin of manasseh accord to 
all that he did 24 4 and also for the innoc blood that he shed 
for he fill jerusalem with innoc blood which the lord would not 
pardon 

24 5 now the rest of the act of jehoiakim and all that he did are 
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah 
24 6 so jehoiakim slept with hi father and jehoiachin hi son 
reign in hi stead 

24 7 and the king of egypt came not again ani more out of hi land 
for the king of babylon had taken from the river of egypt unto the 
river euphrat all that pertain to the king of egypt 

24 8 jehoiachin wa eighteen year old when he began to reign and he 
reign in jerusalem three month and hi mother s name wa nehushta 
the daughter of elnathan of jerusalem 

24 9 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that hi father had done 

24 10 at that time the servant of nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came 
up against jerusalem and the citi wa besieg 

24 11 and nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came against the citi and 
hi servant did besieg it 

24 12 and jehoiachin the king of judah went out to the king of 
babylon he and hi mother and hi servant and hi princ and 
hi offic and the king of babylon took him in the eighth year of 
hi reign 

24 13 and he carri out thenc all the treasur of the hou of the 
lord and the treasur of the king s hou and cut in piec all the 
vessel of gold which solomon king of israel had made in the templ of 
the lord a the lord had said 

24 14 and he carri away all jerusalem and all the princ and all 
the mighti men of valour even ten thousand captiv and all the 
craftsman and smith none remain save the poorest sort of the 
peopl of the land 

24 15 and he carri away jehoiachin to babylon and the king s 
mother and the king s wife and hi offic and the mighti of the 
land those carri he into captiv from jerusalem to babylon 

24 16 and all the men of might even seven thousand and craftsman and 
smith a thousand all that were strong and apt for war even them the 
king of babylon brought captiv to babylon 

24 17 and the king of babylon made mattaniah hi father s brother king 
in hi stead and chang hi name to zedekiah 

24 18 zedekiah wa twenti and one year old when he began to reign 
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem and hi mother s name wa 
hamut the daughter of jeremiah of libnah 

24 19 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord 
accord to all that jehoiakim had done 

24 20 for through the anger of the lord it came to pa in jerusalem 
and judah until he had cast them out from hi presenc that zedekiah 
rebel against the king of babylon 

25 1 and it came to pa in the ninth year of hi reign in the tenth 
month in the tenth day of the month that nebuchadnezzar king of 
babylon came he and all hi host against jerusalem and pitch 
against it and they built fort against it round about 

25 2 and the citi wa besieg unto the eleventh year of king 
zedekiah 

25 3 and on the ninth day of the fourth month the famin prevail in 
the citi and there wa no bread for the peopl of the land 

25 4 and the citi wa broken up and all the men of war fled by night 
by the way of the gate between two wall which is by the king s 
garden now the chald were against the citi round about and the 
king went the way toward the plain 

25 5 and the armi of the chald pursu after the king and overtook 
him in the plain of jericho and all hi armi were scatter from 
him 

25 6 so they took the king and brought him up to the king of babylon 
to riblah and they gave judgment upon him 

25 7 and they slew the son of zedekiah befor hi eye and put out 
the eye of zedekiah and bound him with fetter of brass and carri 
him to babylon 

25 8 and in the fifth month on the seventh day of the month which is 
the nineteenth year of king nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came 
nebuzaradan captain of the guard a servant of the king of babylon 
unto jerusalem 25 9 and he burnt the hou of the lord and the 
king s hou and all the hou of jerusalem and everi great man s 
hou burnt he with fire 

25 10 and all the armi of the chald that were with the captain of 
the guard brake down the wall of jerusalem round about 

25 11 now the rest of the peopl that were left in the citi and the 
fugit that fell away to the king of babylon with the remnant of 
the multitud did nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away 

25 12 but the captain of the guard left of the door of the poor of the 
land to be vinedress and husbandman 

25 13 and the pillar of brass that were in the hou of the lord and 
the base and the brasen sea that wa in the hou of the lord did 
the chald break in piec and carri the brass of them to 
babylon 

25 14 and the pot and the shovel and the snuffer and the spoon 
and all the vessel of brass wherewith they minist took they 
away 

25 15 and the firepan and the bowl and such thing a were of 
gold in gold and of silver in silver the captain of the guard took 
away 

25 16 the two pillar one sea and the base which solomon had made 
for the hou of the lord the brass of all these vessel wa without 
weight 

25 17 the height of the one pillar wa eighteen cubit and the 
chapit upon it wa brass and the height of the chapit three 
cubit and the wreathen work and pomegran upon the chapit 
round about all of brass and like unto these had the second pillar 
with wreathen work 

25 18 and the captain of the guard took seraiah the chief priest and 
zephaniah the second priest and the three keeper of the door 25 19 
and out of the citi he took an offic that wa set over the men of 
war and five men of them that were in the king s presenc which were 
found in the citi and the princip scribe of the host which 
muster the peopl of the land and threescor men of the peopl of 
the land that were found in the citi 25 20 and nebuzaradan captain of 
the guard took these and brought them to the king of babylon to 
riblah 25 21 and the king of babylon smote them and slew them at 
riblah in the land of hamath so judah wa carri away out of their 
land 

25 22 and a for the peopl that remain in the land of judah whom 
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon had left even over them he made 
gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan ruler 

25 23 and when all the captain of the armi they and their men 
heard that the king of babylon had made gedaliah governor there came 
to gedaliah to mizpah even ishmael the son of nethaniah and johanan 
the son of careah and seraiah the son of tanhumeth the netophathit 
and jaazaniah the son of a maachathit they and their men 

25 24 and gedaliah sware to them and to their men and said unto 
them fear not to be the servant of the chald dwell in the land 
and serv the king of babylon and it shall be well with you 

25 25 but it came to pa in the seventh month that ishmael the son 
of nethaniah the son of elishama of the seed royal came and ten 
men with him and smote gedaliah that he die and the jew and the 
chald that were with him at mizpah 

25 26 and all the peopl both small and great and the captain of 
the armi aro and came to egypt for they were afraid of the 
chald 

25 27 and it came to pa in the seven and thirtieth year of the 
captiv of jehoiachin king of judah in the twelfth month on the 
seven and twentieth day of the month that evilmerodach king of 
babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of 
jehoiachin king of judah out of prison 25 28 and he spake kindli to 
him and set hi throne abov the throne of the king that were with 
him in babylon 25 29 and chang hi prison garment and he did eat 
bread continu befor him all the day of hi life 

25 30 and hi allow wa a continu allow given him of the 
king a daili rate for everi day all the day of hi life 




the first book of the chronicl 


1 1 adam sheth enosh 1 2 kenan mahalaleel jere 1 3 henoch 
methuselah lamech 1 4 noah shem ham and japheth 

1 5 the son of japheth gomer and magog and madai and javan and 
tubal and meshech and tira 

1 6 and the son of gomer ashchenaz and riphath and togarmah 

1 7 and the son of javan elishah and tarshish kittim and dodanim 

1 8 the son of ham cush and mizraim put and canaan 

1 9 and the son of cush seba and havilah and sabta and raamah 
and sabtecha and the son of raamah sheba and dedan 

1 10 and cush begat nimrod he began to be mighti upon the earth 

1 11 and mizraim begat ludim and anamim and lehabim and naphtuhim 
1 12 and pathrusim and casluhim of whom came the philistin and 
caphthorim 

1 13 and canaan begat zidon hi firstborn and heth 1 14 the jebusit 
also and the amorit and the girgashit 1 15 and the hivit and 
the arkit and the sinit 1 16 and the arvadit and the zemarit 
and the hamathit 

1 17 the son of shem elam and asshur and arphaxad and lud and 
aram and uz and hul and gether and meshech 

1 18 and arphaxad begat shelah and shelah begat eber 

1 19 and unto eber were born two son the name of the one wa peleg 
becau in hi day the earth wa divid and hi brother s name wa 
joktan 

1 20 and joktan begat almodad and sheleph and hazarmaveth and 
jerah 1 21 hadoram also and uzal and diklah 1 22 and ebal and 
abimael and sheba 1 23 and ophir and havilah and jobab all these 
were the son of joktan 

1 24 shem arphaxad shelah 1 25 eber peleg reu 1 26 serug nahor 
terah 1 27 abram the same is abraham 

1 28 the son of abraham isaac and ishmael 

1 29 these are their gener the firstborn of ishmael nebaioth 
then kedar and adbeel and mibsam 1 30 mishma and dumah massa 
hadad and tema 1 31 jetur naphish and kedemah these are the son 
of ishmael 

1 32 now the son of keturah abraham s concubin she bare zimran 
and jokshan and medan and midian and ishbak and shuah and the 
son of jokshan sheba and dedan 

1 33 and the son of midian ephah and epher and henoch and abida 
and eldaah all these are the son of keturah 

1 34 and abraham begat isaac the son of isaac esau and israel 

1 35 the son of esau eliphaz reuel and jeush and jaalam and 
korah 

1 36 the son of eliphaz teman and omar zephi and gatam kenaz 
and timna and amalek 

1 37 the son of reuel nahath zerah shammah and mizzah 

1 38 and the son of seir lotan and shobal and zibeon and anah 
and dishon and ezar and dishan 

1 39 and the son of lotan hori and homam and timna wa lotan s 
sister 

1 40 the son of shobal alian and manahath and ebal shephi and 
onam 

and the son of zibeon aiah and anah 

1 41 the son of anah dishon and the son of dishon amram and 
eshban and ithran and cheran 

1 42 the son of ezer bilhan and zavan and jakan the son of 
dishan uz and aran 

1 43 now these are the king that reign in the land of edom befor 
ani king reign over the child of israel bela the son of beor 
and the name of hi citi wa dinhabah 

1 44 and when bela wa dead jobab the son of zerah of bozrah reign 
in hi stead 

1 45 and when jobab wa dead husham of the land of the temanit 
reign in hi stead 

1 46 and when husham wa dead hadad the son of bedad which smote 
midian in the field of moab reign in hi stead and the name of hi 
citi wa avith 

1 47 and when hadad wa dead samlah of masrekah reign in hi stead 

1 48 and when samlah wa dead shaul of rehoboth by the river reign 
in hi stead 

1 49 and when shaul wa dead baalhanan the son of achbor reign in 
hi stead 

1 50 and when baalhanan wa dead hadad reign in hi stead and the 
name of hi citi wa pai and hi wife s name wa mehetabel the 
daughter of matr the daughter of mezahab 

1 51 hadad die also and the duke of edom were duke timnah duke 
aliah duke jetheth 1 52 duke aholibamah duke elah duke pinon 1 53 
duke kenaz duke teman duke mibzar 1 54 duke magdiel duke iram 
these are the duke of edom 

2 1 these are the son of israel reuben simeon levi and judah 
issachar and zebulun 2 2 dan joseph and benjamin naphtali gad 
and asher 

2 3 the son of judah er and onan and shelah which three were born 
unto him of the daughter of shua the canaanit and er the 
firstborn of judah wa evil in the sight of the lord and he slew 
him 

2 4 and tamar hi daughter in law bore him pharez and zerah all the 
son of judah were five 

2 5 the son of pharez hezron and hamul 

2 6 and the son of zerah zimri and ethan and heman and calcol 
and dara five of them in all 

2 7 and the son of carmi achar the troubler of israel who 
transgress in the thing accur 

2 8 and the son of ethan azariah 

2 9 the son also of hezron that were born unto him jerahmeel and 
ram and chelubai 

2 10 and ram begat amminadab and amminadab begat nahshon princ of 
the child of judah 2 11 and nahshon begat salma and salma begat 
boaz 2 12 and boaz begat obe and obe begat jess 2 13 and jess 
begat hi firstborn eliab and abinadab the second and shimma the 
third 2 14 nethaneel the fourth raddai the fifth 2 15 ozem the 
sixth david the seventh 2 16 whose sister were zeruiah and 
abigail and the son of zeruiah abishai and joab and asahel 
three 

2 17 and abigail bare amasa and the father of amasa wa jether the 
ishmeelit 

2 18 and caleb the son of hezron begat child of azubah hi wife 
and of jerioth her son are these jesher and shobab and ardon 

2 19 and when azubah wa dead caleb took unto him ephrath which bare 
him hur 

2 20 and hur begat uri and uri begat bezaleel 

2 21 and afterward hezron went in to the daughter of machir the father 
of gilead whom he marri when he wa threescor year old and she 
bare him segub 

2 22 and segub begat jair who had three and twenti citi in the land 
of gilead 

2 23 and he took geshur and aram with the town of jair from them 
with kenath and the town thereof even threescor citi all these 
belong to the son of machir the father of gilead 

2 24 and after that hezron wa dead in calebephratah then abiah 
hezron s wife bare him ashur the father of tekoa 

2 25 and the son of jerahmeel the firstborn of hezron were ram the 
firstborn and bunah and oren and ozem and ahijah 

2 26 jerahmeel had also anoth wife whose name wa atarah she wa 
the mother of onam 

2 27 and the son of ram the firstborn of jerahmeel were maaz and 
jamin and eker 

2 28 and the son of onam were shammai and jada and the son of 
shammai nadab and abishur 

2 29 and the name of the wife of abishur wa abihail and she bare him 
ahban and molid 

2 30 and the son of nadab sele and appaim but sele die without 
child 

2 31 and the son of appaim ishi and the son of ishi sheshan and 
the child of sheshan ahlai 

2 32 and the son of jada the brother of shammai jether and 
jonathan and jether die without child 

2 33 and the son of jonathan peleth and zaza these were the son 
of jerahmeel 

2 34 now sheshan had no son but daughter and sheshan had a 
servant an egyptian whose name wa jarha 

2 35 and sheshan gave hi daughter to jarha hi servant to wife and 
she bare him attai 

2 36 and attai begat nathan and nathan begat zabad 2 37 and zabad 
begat ephlal and ephlal begat obe 2 38 and obe begat jehu and 
jehu begat azariah 2 39 and azariah begat helez and helez begat 
eleasah 2 40 and eleasah begat sisamai and sisamai begat shallum 
2 41 and shallum begat jekamiah and jekamiah begat elishama 

2 42 now the son of caleb the brother of jerahmeel were mesha hi 
firstborn which wa the father of ziph and the son of mareshah the 
father of hebron 

2 43 and the son of hebron korah and tappuah and rekem and shema 

2 44 and shema begat raham the father of jorkoam and rekem begat 
shammai 

2 45 and the son of shammai wa maon and maon wa the father of 
bethzur 

2 46 and ephah caleb s concubin bare haran and moza and gazez 
and haran begat gazez 

2 47 and the son of jahdai regem and jotham and gesham and pelet 
and ephah and shaaph 

2 48 maachah caleb s concubin bare sheber and tirhanah 

2 49 she bare also shaaph the father of madmannah sheva the father of 
machbenah and the father of gibea and the daughter of caleb wa 
achsa 

2 50 these were the son of caleb the son of hur the firstborn of 
ephratah shobal the father of kirjathjearim 

2 51 salma the father of bethlehem hareph the father of bethgad 

2 52 and shobal the father of kirjathjearim had son haroeh and half 
of the manahethit 

2 53 and the famili of kirjathjearim the ithrit and the puhit 
and the shumathit and the mishrait of them came the zareathit 
and the eshtaulit 2 54 the son of salma bethlehem and the 
netophathit ataroth the hou of joab and half of the 
manahethit the zorit 

2 55 and the famili of the scribe which dwelt at jabez the 
tirathit the shimeathit and suchathit these are the kenit 
that came of hemath the father of the hou of rechab 

3 1 now these were the son of david which were born unto him in 
hebron the firstborn amnon of ahinoam the jezreelitess the second 
daniel of abigail the carmelit 3 2 the third absalom the son of 
maachah the daughter of talmai king of geshur the fourth adonijah 
the son of haggith 3 3 the fifth shephatiah of abit the sixth 
ithream by eglah hi wife 

3 4 these six were born unto him in hebron and there he reign seven 
year and six month and in jerusalem he reign thirti and three 
year 

3 5 and these were born unto him in jerusalem shimea and shobab and 
nathan and solomon four of bathshua the daughter of ammiel 3 6 
ibhar also and elishama and eliphelet 3 7 and nogah and nepheg 
and japhia 3 8 and elishama and eliada and eliphelet nine 

3 9 these were all the son of david besid the son of the 
concubin and tamar their sister 

3 10 and solomon s son wa rehoboam abia hi son asa hi son 
jehoshaphat hi son 3 11 joram hi son ahaziah hi son joash hi 
son 3 12 amaziah hi son azariah hi son jotham hi son 3 13 ahaz 
hi son hezekiah hi son manasseh hi son 3 14 amon hi son josiah 
hi son

jehoiakim the third zedekiah the fourth shallum
