hundr chief father whom king david made ruler over the 
reubenit the gadit and the half tribe of manasseh for everi 
matter pertain to god and affair of the king 

27 1 now the child of israel after their number to wit the chief 
father and captain of thousand and hundr and their offic 
that serv the king in ani matter of the cour which came in and 
went out month by month throughout all the month of the year of 
everi cour were twenti and four thousand 

27 2 over the first cour for the first month wa jashobeam the son 
of zabdiel and in hi cour were twenti and four thousand 

27 3 of the child of perez wa the chief of all the captain of the 
host for the first month 

27 4 and over the cour of the second month wa dodai an ahohit and 
of hi cour wa mikloth also the ruler in hi cour likewi were 
twenti and four thousand 

27 5 the third captain of the host for the third month wa benaiah the 
son of jehoiada a chief priest and in hi cour were twenti and 
four thousand 

27 6 thi is that benaiah who wa mighti among the thirti and abov 
the thirti and in hi cour wa ammizabad hi son 

27 7 the fourth captain for the fourth month wa asahel the brother of 
joab and zebadiah hi son after him and in hi cour were twenti 
and four thousand 

27 8 the fifth captain for the fifth month wa shamhuth the izrahit 
and in hi cour were twenti and four thousand 

27 9 the sixth captain for the sixth month wa ira the son of ikkesh 
the tekoit and in hi cour were twenti and four thousand 

27 10 the seventh captain for the seventh month wa helez the 
pelonit of the child of ephraim and in hi cour were twenti 
and four thousand 

27 11 the eighth captain for the eighth month wa sibbecai the 
hushathit of the zarhit and in hi cour were twenti and four 
thousand 

27 12 the ninth captain for the ninth month wa abiez the 
anetothit of the benjamit and in hi cour were twenti and four 
thousand 

27 13 the tenth captain for the tenth month wa maharai the 
netophathit of the zarhit and in hi cour were twenti and four 
thousand 

27 14 the eleventh captain for the eleventh month wa benaiah the 
pirathonit of the child of ephraim and in hi cour were twenti 
and four thousand 

27 15 the twelfth captain for the twelfth month wa heldai the 
netophathit of othniel and in hi cour were twenti and four 
thousand 

27 16 furthermor over the tribe of israel the ruler of the 
reubenit wa eliez the son of zichri of the simeonit 
shephatiah the son of maachah 27 17 of the levit hashabiah the son 
of kemuel of the aaronit zadok 27 18 of judah elihu one of the 
brother of david of issachar omri the son of michael 27 19 of 
zebulun ishmaiah the son of obadiah of naphtali jerimoth the son of 
azriel 27 20 of the child of ephraim hoshea the son of azaziah 
of the half tribe of manasseh joel the son of pedaiah 27 21 of the 
half tribe of manasseh in gilead iddo the son of zechariah of 
benjamin jaasiel the son of abner 27 22 of dan azareel the son of 
jeroham these were the princ of the tribe of israel 

27 23 but david took not the number of them from twenti year old and 
under becau the lord had said he would increa israel like to the 
star of the heaven 

27 24 joab the son of zeruiah began to number but he finish not 
becau there fell wrath for it against israel neither wa the number 
put in the account of the chronicl of king david 

27 25 and over the king s treasur wa azmaveth the son of adiel and 
over the storeh in the field in the citi and in the 
villag and in the castl wa jehonathan the son of uzziah 27 26 
and over them that did the work of the field for tillag of the ground 
wa ezri the son of chelub 27 27 and over the vineyard wa shimei 
the ramathit over the increa of the vineyard for the wine cellar 
wa zabdi the shiphmit 27 28 and over the oliv tree and the 
sycomor tree that were in the low plain wa baalhanan the gederit 
and over the cellar of oil wa joash 27 29 and over the herd that 
fed in sharon wa shitrai the sharonit and over the herd that were 
in the valley wa shaphat the son of adlai 27 30 over the camel 
also wa obil the ishmaelit and over the as wa jehdeiah the 
meronothit 27 31 and over the flock wa jaziz the hagerit all 
these were the ruler of the substanc which wa king david s 

27 32 also jonathan david s uncl wa a counsellor a wise man and a 
scribe and jehiel the son of hachmoni wa with the king s son 27 33 
and ahithophel wa the king s counsellor and hushai the archit wa 
the king s companion 27 34 and after ahithophel wa jehoiada the son 
of benaiah and abiathar and the gener of the king s armi wa joab 

28 1 and david assembl all the princ of israel the princ of the 
tribe and the captain of the compani that minist to the king 
by cour and the captain over the thousand and captain over the 
hundr and the steward over all the substanc and poss of 
the king and of hi son with the offic and with the mighti men 
and with all the valiant men unto jerusalem 

28 2 then david the king stood up upon hi foot and said hear me my 
brother and my peopl a for me i had in mine heart to build an 
hou of rest for the ark of the coven of the lord and for the 
footstool of our god and had made readi for the build 28 3 but 
god said unto me thou shalt not build an hou for my name becau 
thou hast been a man of war and hast shed blood 

28 4 howbeit the lord god of israel chose me befor all the hou of 
my father to be king over israel for ever for he hath chosen judah to 
be the ruler and of the hou of judah the hou of my father and 
among the son of my father he like me to make me king over all 
israel 28 5 and of all my son for the lord hath given me mani 
son he hath chosen solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the 
kingdom of the lord over israel 

28 6 and he said unto me solomon thi son he shall build my hou and 
my court for i have chosen him to be my son and i will be hi 
father 

28 7 moreov i will establish hi kingdom for ever if he be constant 
to do my command and my judgment a at thi day 

28 8 now therefor in the sight of all israel the congreg of the 
lord and in the audienc of our god keep and seek for all the 
command of the lord your god that ye may po thi good land 
and leav it for an inherit for your child after you for ever 

28 9 and thou solomon my son know thou the god of thi father and 
serv him with a perfect heart and with a will mind for the lord 
searcheth all heart and understandeth all the imagin of the 
thought if thou seek him he will be found of thee but if thou 
forsak him he will cast thee off for ever 

28 10 take heed now for the lord hath chosen thee to build an hou 
for the sanctuari be strong and do it 

28 11 then david gave to solomon hi son the pattern of the porch and 
of the hou thereof and of the treasuri thereof and of the upper 
chamber thereof and of the inner parlour thereof and of the place 
of the merci seat 28 12 and the pattern of all that he had by the 
spirit of the court of the hou of the lord and of all the 
chamber round about of the treasuri of the hou of god and of 
the treasuri of the dedic thing 28 13 also for the cour of 
the priest and the levit and for all the work of the servic of 
the hou of the lord and for all the vessel of servic in the hou 
of the lord 

28 14 he gave of gold by weight for thing of gold for all 
instrument of all manner of servic silver also for all instrument 
of silver by weight for all instrument of everi kind of servic 
28 15 even the weight for the candlestick of gold and for their 
lamp of gold by weight for everi candlestick and for the lamp 
thereof and for the candlestick of silver by weight both for the 
candlestick and also for the lamp thereof accord to the use of 
everi candlestick 

28 16 and by weight he gave gold for the tabl of shewbread for 
everi tabl and likewi silver for the tabl of silver 28 17 also 
pure gold for the fleshhook and the bowl and the cup and for the 
golden bason he gave gold by weight for everi bason and likewi 
silver by weight for everi bason of silver 28 18 and for the altar of 
incen refin gold by weight and gold for the pattern of the 
chariot of the cherub that spread out their wing and cover the 
ark of the coven of the lord 

28 19 all thi said david the lord made me understand in write by 
hi hand upon me even all the work of thi pattern 

28 20 and david said to solomon hi son be strong and of good 
courag and do it fear not nor be dismay for the lord god even 
my god will be with thee he will not fail thee nor forsak thee 
until thou hast finish all the work for the servic of the hou of 
the lord 

28 21 and behold the cour of the priest and the levit even 
they shall be with thee for all the servic of the hou of god and 
there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship everi will 
skil man for ani manner of servic also the princ and all the 
peopl will be wholli at thi command 

29 1 furthermor david the king said unto all the congreg 
solomon my son whom alon god hath chosen is yet young and tender 
and the work is great for the palac is not for man but for the lord 
god 

29 2 now i have prepar with all my might for the hou of my god the 
gold for thing to be made of gold and the silver for thing of 
silver and the brass for thing of brass the iron for thing of 
iron and wood for thing of wood onyx stone and stone to be set 
glister stone and of diver colour and all manner of preciou 
stone and marbl stone in abund 

29 3 moreov becau i have set my affect to the hou of my god 
i have of mine own proper good of gold and silver which i have given 
to the hou of my god over and abov all that i have prepar for 
the holi hou 

29 4 even three thousand talent of gold of the gold of ophir and 
seven thousand talent of refin silver to overlay the wall of the 
hou withal 29 5 the gold for thing of gold and the silver for 
thing of silver and for all manner of work to be made by the hand 
of artif and who then is will to consecr hi servic thi 
day unto the lord 29 6 then the chief of the father and princ of 
the tribe of israel and the captain of thousand and of hundr 
with the ruler of the king s work offer willingli 29 7 and gave 
for the servic of the hou of god of gold five thousand talent and 
ten thousand dram and of silver ten thousand talent and of brass 
eighteen thousand talent and one hundr thousand talent of iron 

29 8 and they with whom preciou stone were found gave them to the 
treasur of the hou of the lord by the hand of jehiel the 
gershonit 

29 9 then the peopl rejoic for that they offer willingli 
becau with perfect heart they offer willingli to the lord and 
david the king also rejoic with great joy 

29 10 wherefor david bless the lord befor all the congreg 
and david said bless be thou lord god of israel our father for 
ever and ever 

29 11 thine o lord is the great and the power and the glori 
and the victori and the majesti for all that is in the heaven and in 
the earth is thine thine is the kingdom o lord and thou art exalt 
a head abov all 

29 12 both rich and honour come of thee and thou reignest over all 
and in thine hand is power and might and in thine hand it is to make 
great and to give strength unto all 

29 13 now therefor our god we thank thee and prai thi gloriou 
name 

29 14 but who am i and what is my peopl that we should be abl to 
offer so willingli after thi sort for all thing come of thee and 
of thine own have we given thee 

29 15 for we are stranger befor thee and sojourn a were all 
our father our day on the earth are a a shadow and there is none 
abid 

29 16 o lord our god all thi store that we have prepar to build 
thee an hou for thine holi name cometh of thine hand and is all 
thine own 

29 17 i know also my god that thou triest the heart and hast 
pleasur in upright a for me in the upright of mine heart i 
have willingli offer all these thing and now have i seen with joy 
thi peopl which are present here to offer willingli unto thee 

29 18 o lord god of abraham isaac and of israel our father keep 
thi for ever in the imagin of the thought of the heart of thi 
peopl and prepar their heart unto thee 29 19 and give unto solomon 
my son a perfect heart to keep thi command thi testimoni and 
thi statut and to do all these thing and to build the palac for 
the which i have made provi 

29 20 and david said to all the congreg now bless the lord your 
god 

and all the congreg bless the lord god of their father and 
bow down their head and worship the lord and the king 

29 21 and they sacrif sacrif unto the lord and offer burnt 
offer unto the lord on the morrow after that day even a thousand 
bullock a thousand ram and a thousand lamb with their drink 
offer and sacrif in abund for all israel 29 22 and did 
eat and drink befor the lord on that day with great glad and 
they made solomon the son of david king the second time and anoint 
him unto the lord to be the chief governor and zadok to be priest 

29 23 then solomon sat on the throne of the lord a king instead of 
david hi father and prosper and all israel obey him 

29 24 and all the princ and the mighti men and all the son 
likewi of king david submit themselv unto solomon the king 

29 25 and the lord magnifi solomon exceedingli in the sight of all 
israel and bestow upon him such royal majesti a had not been on 
ani king befor him in israel 

29 26 thu david the son of jess reign over all israel 

29 27 and the time that he reign over israel wa forti year seven 
year reign he in hebron and thirti and three year reign he in 
jerusalem 

29 28 and he die in a good old age full of day rich and honour 
and solomon hi son reign in hi stead 

29 29 now the act of david the king first and last behold they are 
written in the book of samuel the seer and in the book of nathan the 
prophet and in the book of gad the seer 29 30 with all hi reign and 
hi might and the time that went over him and over israel and over 
all the kingdom of the countri 




the second book of the chronicl 


1 1 and solomon the son of david wa strengthen in hi kingdom and 
the lord hi god wa with him and magnifi him exceedingli 

1 2 then solomon spake unto all israel to the captain of thousand 
and of hundr and to the judg and to everi governor in all 
israel the chief of the father 

1 3 so solomon and all the congreg with him went to the high 
place that wa at gibeon for there wa the tabernacl of the 
congreg of god which mose the servant of the lord had made in 
the wilder 

1 4 but the ark of god had david brought up from kirjathjearim to the 
place which david had prepar for it for he had pitch a tent for 
it at jerusalem 

1 5 moreov the brasen altar that bezaleel the son of uri the son 
of hur had made he put befor the tabernacl of the lord and 
solomon and the congreg sought unto it 

1 6 and solomon went up thither to the brasen altar befor the lord 
which wa at the tabernacl of the congreg and offer a 
thousand burnt offer upon it 

1 7 in that night did god appear unto solomon and said unto him ask 
what i shall give thee 

1 8 and solomon said unto god thou hast shew great merci unto david 
my father and hast made me to reign in hi stead 

1 9 now o lord god let thi promi unto david my father be 
establish for thou hast made me king over a peopl like the dust of 
the earth in multitud 

1 10 give me now wisdom and knowledg that i may go out and come in 
befor thi peopl for who can judg thi thi peopl that is so 
great 1 11 and god said to solomon becau thi wa in thine heart 
and thou hast not ask rich wealth or honour nor the life of 
thine enemi neither yet hast ask long life but hast ask wisdom 
and knowledg for thyself that thou mayest judg my peopl over whom 
i have made thee king 1 12 wisdom and knowledg is grant unto thee 
and i will give thee rich and wealth and honour such a none of 
the king have had that have been befor thee neither shall there ani 
after thee have the like 

1 13 then solomon came from hi journey to the high place that wa at 
gibeon to jerusalem from befor the tabernacl of the congreg 
and reign over israel 

1 14 and solomon gather chariot and horseman and he had a thousand 
and four hundr chariot and twelv thousand horseman which he 
place in the chariot citi and with the king at jerusalem 

1 15 and the king made silver and gold at jerusalem a plenteou a 
stone and cedar tree made he a the sycomor tree that are in the 
vale for abund 

1 16 and solomon had hor brought out of egypt and linen yarn the 
king s merchant receiv the linen yarn at a price 

1 17 and they fetch up and brought forth out of egypt a chariot for 
six hundr shekel of silver and an hor for an hundr and fifti 
and so brought they out hor for all the king of the hittit and 
for the king of syria by their mean 

2 1 and solomon determin to build an hou for the name of the lord 
and an hou for hi kingdom 

2 2 and solomon told out threescor and ten thousand men to bear 
burden and fourscor thousand to hew in the mountain and three 
thousand and six hundr to overs them 

2 3 and solomon sent to huram the king of tyre say a thou didst 
deal with david my father and didst send him cedar to build him an 
hou to dwell therein even so deal with me 

2 4 behold i build an hou to the name of the lord my god to 
dedic it to him and to burn befor him sweet incen and for the 
continu shewbread and for the burnt offer morn and even 
on the sabbath and on the new moon and on the solemn feast of the 
lord our god thi is an ordin for ever to israel 

2 5 and the hou which i build is great for great is our god abov 
all god 

2 6 but who is abl to build him an hou see the heaven and 
heaven of heaven cannot contain him who am i then that i should 
build him an hou save onli to burn sacrif befor him 2 7 send 
me now therefor a man cun to work in gold and in silver and in 
brass and in iron and in purpl and crimson and blue and that can 
skill to grave with the cun men that are with me in judah and in 
jerusalem whom david my father did provid 

2 8 send me also cedar tree fir tree and algum tree out of 
lebanon for i know that thi servant can skill to cut timber in 
lebanon and behold my servant shall be with thi servant 2 9 even 
to prepar me timber in abund for the hou which i am about to 
build shall be wonder great 

2 10 and behold i will give to thi servant the hewer that cut 
timber twenti thousand measur of beaten wheat and twenti thousand 
measur of barley and twenti thousand bath of wine and twenti 
thousand bath of oil 

2 11 then huram the king of tyre answer in write which he sent to 
solomon becau the lord hath love hi peopl he hath made thee 
king over them 

2 12 huram said moreov bless be the lord god of israel that made 
heaven and earth who hath given to david the king a wise son endu 
with prudenc and understand that might build an hou for the 
lord and an hou for hi kingdom 

2 13 and now i have sent a cun man endu with understand of 
huram my father s 2 14 the son of a woman of the daughter of dan 
and hi father wa a man of tyre skil to work in gold and in 
silver in brass in iron in stone and in timber in purpl in 
blue and in fine linen and in crimson also to grave ani manner of 
grave and to find out everi devic which shall be put to him with 
thi cun men and with the cun men of my lord david thi father 

2 15 now therefor the wheat and the barley the oil and the wine 
which my lord hath spoken of let him send unto hi servant 2 16 and 
we will cut wood out of lebanon a much a thou shalt need and we 
will bring it to thee in float by sea to joppa and thou shalt carri 
it up to jerusalem 

2 17 and solomon number all the stranger that were in the land of 
israel after the number wherewith david hi father had number 
them and they were found an hundr and fifti thousand and three 
thousand and six hundr 

2 18 and he set threescor and ten thousand of them to be bearer of 
burden and fourscor thousand to be hewer in the mountain and 
three thousand and six hundr over to set the peopl a work 

3 1 then solomon began to build the hou of the lord at jerusalem in 
mount moriah where the lord appear unto david hi father in the 
place that david had prepar in the threshingfloor of ornan the 
jebusit 

3 2 and he began to build in the second day of the second month in 
the fourth year of hi reign 

3 3 now these are the thing wherein solomon wa instruct for the 
build of the hou of god the length by cubit after the first 
measur wa threescor cubit and the breadth twenti cubit 

3 4 and the porch that wa in the front of the hou the length of it 
wa accord to the breadth of the hou twenti cubit and the 
height wa an hundr and twenti and he overlaid it within with pure 
gold 

3 5 and the greater hou he ciel with fir tree which he overlaid 
with fine gold and set thereon palm tree and chain 

3 6 and he garnish the hou with preciou stone for beauti and 
the gold wa gold of parvaim 

3 7 he overlaid also the hou the beam the post and the wall 
thereof and the door thereof with gold and grave cherub on the 
wall 

3 8 and he made the most holi hou the length whereof wa accord 
to the breadth of the hou twenti cubit and the breadth thereof 
twenti cubit and he overlaid it with fine gold amount to six 
hundr talent 

3 9 and the weight of the nail wa fifti shekel of gold and he 
overlaid the upper chamber with gold 

3 10 and in the most holi hou he made two cherub of imag work 
and overlaid them with gold 

3 11 and the wing of the cherub were twenti cubit long one wing 
of the one cherub wa five cubit reach to the wall of the hou 
and the other wing wa likewi five cubit reach to the wing of 
the other cherub 

3 12 and one wing of the other cherub wa five cubit reach to the 
wall of the hou and the other wing wa five cubit also join to 
the wing of the other cherub 

3 13 the wing of these cherub spread themselv forth twenti 
cubit and they stood on their foot and their face were inward 

3 14 and he made the vail of blue and purpl and crimson and fine 
linen and wrought cherub thereon 

3 15 also he made befor the hou two pillar of thirti and five 
cubit high and the chapit that wa on the top of each of them wa 
five cubit 

3 16 and he made chain a in the oracl and put them on the head 
of the pillar and made an hundr pomegran and put them on the 
chain 

3 17 and he rear up the pillar befor the templ one on the right 
hand and the other on the left and call the name of that on the 
right hand jachin and the name of that on the left boaz 

4 1 moreov he made an altar of brass twenti cubit the length 
thereof and twenti cubit the breadth thereof and ten cubit the 
height thereof 

4 2 also he made a molten sea of ten cubit from brim to brim round 
in compass and five cubit the height thereof and a line of thirti 
cubit did compass it round about 

4 3 and under it wa the similitud of ox which did compass it 
round about ten in a cubit compass the sea round about two row 
of ox were cast when it wa cast 

4 4 it stood upon twelv ox three look toward the north and 
three look toward the west and three look toward the south and 
three look toward the east and the sea wa set abov upon them 
and all their hinder part were inward 

4 5 and the thick of it wa an handbreadth and the brim of it 
like the work of the brim of a cup with flower of lili and it 
receiv and held three thousand bath 

4 6 he made also ten laver and put five on the right hand and five 
on the left to wash in them such thing a they offer for the 
burnt offer they wash in them but the sea wa for the priest to 
wash in 

4 7 and he made ten candlestick of gold accord to their form and 
set them in the templ five on the right hand and five on the left 

4 8 he made also ten tabl and place them in the templ five on 
the right side and five on the left and he made an hundr bason of 
gold 

4 9 furthermor he made the court of the priest and the great court 
and door for the court and overlaid the door of them with brass 

4 10 and he set the sea on the right side of the east end over 
against the south 

4 11 and huram made the pot and the shovel and the bason and 
huram finish the work that he wa to make for king solomon for the 
hou of god 4 12 to wit the two pillar and the pommel and the 
chapit which were on the top of the two pillar and the two 
wreath to cover the two pommel of the chapit which were on the 
top of the pillar 4 13 and four hundr pomegran on the two 
wreath two row of pomegran on each wreath to cover the two 
pommel of the chapit which were upon the pillar 

4 14 he made also base and laver made he upon the base 4 15 one 
sea and twelv ox under it 

4 16 the pot also and the shovel and the fleshhook and all their 
instrument did huram hi father make to king solomon for the hou 
of the lord of bright brass 

4 17 in the plain of jordan did the king cast them in the clay ground 
between succoth and zeredathah 

4 18 thu solomon made all these vessel in great abund for the 
weight of the brass could not be found out 

4 19 and solomon made all the vessel that were for the hou of god 
the golden altar also and the tabl whereon the shewbread wa set 
4 20 moreov the candlestick with their lamp that they should burn 
after the manner befor the oracl of pure gold 4 21 and the 
flower and the lamp and the tong made he of gold and that 
perfect gold 4 22 and the snuffer and the bason and the spoon 
and the censer of pure gold and the entri of the hou the inner 
door thereof for the most holi place and the door of the hou of 
the templ were of gold 

5 1 thu all the work that solomon made for the hou of the lord wa 
finish and solomon brought in all the thing that david hi father 
had dedic and the silver and the gold and all the instrument 
put he among the treasur of the hou of god 

5 2 then solomon assembl the elder of israel and all the head of 
the tribe the chief of the father of the child of israel unto 
jerusalem to bring up the ark of the coven of the lord out of the 
citi of david which is zion 

5 3 wherefor all the men of israel assembl themselv unto the king 
in the feast which wa in the seventh month 

5 4 and all the elder of israel came and the levit took up the 
ark 

5 5 and they brought up the ark and the tabernacl of the 
congreg and all the holi vessel that were in the tabernacl 
these did the priest and the levit bring up 

5 6 also king solomon and all the congreg of israel that were 
assembl unto him befor the ark sacrif sheep and ox which 
could not be told nor number for multitud 

5 7 and the priest brought in the ark of the coven of the lord 
unto hi place to the oracl of the hou into the most holi place 
even under the wing of the cherub 5 8 for the cherub spread 
forth their wing over the place of the ark and the cherub cover 
the ark and the stave thereof abov 

5 9 and they drew out the stave of the ark that the end of the 
stave were seen from the ark befor the oracl but they were not 
seen without and there it is unto thi day 

5 10 there wa noth in the ark save the two tabl which mose put 
therein at horeb when the lord made a coven with the child of 
israel when they came out of egypt 

5 11 and it came to pa when the priest were come out of the holi 
place for all the priest that were present were sanctifi and did 
not then wait by cour 5 12 also the levit which were the singer 
all of them of asaph of heman of jeduthun with their son and their 
brother be array in white linen have cymbal and psalteri 
and harp stood at the east end of the altar and with them an 
hundr and twenti priest sound with trumpet 5 13 it came even 
to pa a the trumpet and singer were a one to make one sound 
to be heard in prai and thank the lord and when they lift up 
their voic with the trumpet and cymbal and instrument of musick 
and prai the lord say for he is good for hi merci endureth 
for ever that then the hou wa fill with a cloud even the hou 
of the lord 5 14 so that the priest could not stand to minist by 
reason of the cloud for the glori of the lord had fill the hou of 
god 

6 1 then said solomon the lord hath said that he would dwell in the 
thick dark 

6 2 but i have built an hou of habit for thee and a place for 
thi dwell for ever 

6 3 and the king turn hi face and bless the whole congreg 
of israel and all the congreg of israel stood 

6 4 and he said bless be the lord god of israel who hath with hi 
hand fulfil that which he spake with hi mouth to my father david 
say 6 5 sinc the day that i brought forth my peopl out of the 
land of egypt i chose no citi among all the tribe of israel to build 
an hou in that my name might be there neither chose i ani man to 
be a ruler over my peopl israel 6 6 but i have chosen jerusalem 
that my name might be there and have chosen david to be over my 
peopl israel 

6 7 now it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hou for 
the name of the lord god of israel 

6 8 but the lord said to david my father forasmuch a it wa in thine 
heart to build an hou for my name thou didst well in that it wa in 
thine heart 6 9 notwithstand thou shalt not build the hou but 
thi son which shall come forth out of thi loin he shall build the 
hou for my name 

6 10 the lord therefor hath perform hi word that he hath spoken 
for i am risen up in the room of david my father and am set on the 
throne of israel a the lord promi and have built the hou for 
the name of the lord god of israel 

6 11 and in it have i put the ark wherein is the coven of the 
lord that he made with the child of israel 

6 12 and he stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of all 
the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hand 6 13 for 
solomon had made a brasen scaffold of five cubit long and five 
cubit broad and three cubit high and had set it in the midst of 
the court and upon it he stood and kneel down upon hi knee 
befor all the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hand 
toward heaven 

6 14 and said o lord god of israel there is no god like thee in the 
heaven nor in the earth which keepest coven and shewest merci 
unto thi servant that walk befor thee with all their heart 6 15 
thou which hast kept with thi servant david my father that which thou 
hast promi him and spakest with thi mouth and hast fulfil it 
with thine hand a it is thi day 

6 16 now therefor o lord god of israel keep with thi servant david 
my father that which thou hast promi him say there shall not 
fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of israel yet so 
that thi child take heed to their way to walk in my law a thou 
hast walk befor me 

6 17 now then o lord god of israel let thi word be verifi which 
thou hast spoken unto thi servant david 

6 18 but will god in veri deed dwell with men on the earth behold 
heaven and the heaven of heaven cannot contain thee how much le 
thi hou which i have built 6 19 have respect therefor to the 
prayer of thi servant and to hi supplic o lord my god to 
hearken unto the cri and the prayer which thi servant prayeth befor 
thee 6 20 that thine eye may be open upon thi hou day and night 
upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thi name 
there to hearken unto the prayer which thi servant prayeth toward 
thi place 

6 21 hearken therefor unto the supplic of thi servant and of 
thi peopl israel which they shall make toward thi place hear thou 
from thi dwell place even from heaven and when thou hearest 
forgiv 

6 22 if a man sin against hi neighbour and an oath be laid upon him 
to make him swear and the oath come befor thine altar in thi hou 
6 23 then hear thou from heaven and do and judg thi servant by 
requit the wick by recompen hi way upon hi own head and 
by justifi the righteou by give him accord to hi 
righteou 

6 24 and if thi peopl israel be put to the wor befor the enemi 
becau they have sin against thee and shall return and confess 
thi name and pray and make supplic befor thee in thi hou 
6 25 then hear thou from the heaven and forgiv the sin of thi 
peopl israel and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to 
them and to their father 

6 26 when the heaven is shut up and there is no rain becau they 
have sin against thee yet if they pray toward thi place and 
confess thi name and turn from their sin when thou dost afflict 
them 6 27 then hear thou from heaven and forgiv the sin of thi 
servant and of thi peopl israel when thou hast taught them the 
good way wherein they should walk and send rain upon thi land which 
thou hast given unto thi peopl for an inherit 

6 28 if there be dearth in the land if there be pestil if there 
be blast or mildew locust or caterpil if their enemi 
besieg them in the citi of their land whatsoev sore or 
whatsoev sick there be 6 29 then what prayer or what 
supplic soever shall be made of ani man or of all thi peopl 
israel when everi one shall know hi own sore and hi own grief and 
shall spread forth hi hand in thi hou 6 30 then hear thou from 
heaven thi dwell place and forgiv and render unto everi man 
accord unto all hi way whose heart thou knowest for thou onli 
knowest the heart of the child of men 6 31 that they may fear 
thee to walk in thi way so long a they live in the land which thou 
gavest unto our father 

6 32 moreov concern the stranger which is not of thi peopl 
israel but is come from a far countri for thi great name s sake and 
thi mighti hand and thi stretch out arm if they come and pray in 
thi hou 6 33 then hear thou from the heaven even from thi 
dwell place and do accord to all that the stranger calleth to 
thee for that all peopl of the earth may know thi name and fear 
thee a doth thi peopl israel and may know that thi hou which i 
have built is call by thi name 

6 34 if thi peopl go out to war against their enemi by the way that 
thou shalt send them and they pray unto thee toward thi citi which 
thou hast chosen and the hou which i have built for thi name 6 35 
then hear thou from the heaven their prayer and their supplic 
and maintain their cau 

6 36 if they sin against thee for there is no man which sinneth 
not and thou be angri with them and deliv them over befor their 
enemi and they carri them away captiv unto a land far off or 
near 6 37 yet if they bethink themselv in the land whither they are 
carri captiv and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their 
captiv say we have sin we have done amiss and have dealt 
wickedli 6 38 if they return to thee with all their heart and with 
all their soul in the land of their captiv whither they have 
carri them captiv and pray toward their land which thou gavest 
unto their father and toward the citi which thou hast chosen and 
toward the hou which i have built for thi name 6 39 then hear thou 
from the heaven even from thi dwell place their prayer and their 
supplic and maintain their cau and forgiv thi peopl which 
have sin against thee 

6 40 now my god let i beseech thee thine eye be open and let 
thine ear be attent unto the prayer that is made in thi place 

6 41 now therefor ari o lord god into thi rest place thou 
and the ark of thi strength let thi priest o lord god be cloth 
with salvat and let thi saint rejoic in good 

6 42 o lord god turn not away the face of thine anoint rememb 
the merci of david thi servant 

7 1 now when solomon had made an end of pray the fire came down 
from heaven and consum the burnt offer and the sacrif and 
the glori of the lord fill the hou 

7 2 and the priest could not enter into the hou of the lord 
becau the glori of the lord had fill the lord s hou 

7 3 and when all the child of israel saw how the fire came down 
and the glori of the lord upon the hou they bow themselv with 
their face to the ground upon the pavement and worship and 
prai the lord say for he is good for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

7 4 then the king and all the peopl offer sacrif befor the 
lord 

7 5 and king solomon offer a sacrif of twenti and two thousand 
ox and an hundr and twenti thousand sheep so the king and all 
the peopl dedic the hou of god 

7 6 and the priest wait on their offic the levit also with 
instrument of musick of the lord which david the king had made to 
prai the lord becau hi merci endureth for ever when david 
prai by their ministri and the priest sound trumpet befor 
them and all israel stood 

7 7 moreov solomon hallow the middl of the court that wa befor 
the hou of the lord for there he offer burnt offer and the 
fat of the peac offer becau the brasen altar which solomon had 
made wa not abl to receiv the burnt offer and the meat 
offer and the fat 

7 8 also at the same time solomon kept the feast seven day and all 
israel with him a veri great congreg from the enter in of 
hamath unto the river of egypt 

7 9 and in the eighth day they made a solemn assembl for they kept 
the dedic of the altar seven day and the feast seven day 

7 10 and on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent 
the peopl away into their tent glad and merri in heart for the 
good that the lord had shew unto david and to solomon and to 
israel hi peopl 

7 11 thu solomon finish the hou of the lord and the king s 
hou and all that came into solomon s heart to make in the hou of 
the lord and in hi own hou he prosper effect 

7 12 and the lord appear to solomon by night and said unto him i 
have heard thi prayer and have chosen thi place to myself for an 
hou of sacrif 

7 13 if i shut up heaven that there be no rain or if i command the 
locust to devour the land or if i send pestil among my peopl 
7 14 if my peopl which are call by my name shall humbl 
themselv and pray and seek my face and turn from their wick 
way then will i hear from heaven and will forgiv their sin and 
will heal their land 

7 15 now mine eye shall be open and mine ear attent unto the prayer 
that is made in thi place 

7 16 for now have i chosen and sanctifi thi hou that my name may 
be there for ever and mine eye and mine heart shall be there 
perpetu 

7 17 and a for thee if thou wilt walk befor me a david thi father 
walk and do accord to all that i have command thee and shalt 
observ my statut and my judgment 7 18 then will i stablish the 
throne of thi kingdom accord a i have coven with david thi 
father say there shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in israel 

7 19 but if ye turn away and forsak my statut and my command 
which i have set befor you and shall go and serv other god and 
worship them 7 20 then will i pluck them up by the root out of my 
land which i have given them and thi hou which i have sanctifi 
for my name will i cast out of my sight and will make it to be a 
proverb and a byword among all nation 

7 21 and thi hou which is high shall be an astonish to everi 
one that passeth by it so that he shall say whi hath the lord done 
thu unto thi land and unto thi hou 7 22 and it shall be 
answer becau they forsook the lord god of their father which 
brought them forth out of the land of egypt and laid hold on other 
god and worship them and serv them therefor hath he brought 
all thi evil upon them 

8 1 and it came to pa at the end of twenti year wherein solomon 
had built the hou of the lord and hi own hou 8 2 that the 
citi which huram had restor to solomon solomon built them and 
cau the child of israel to dwell there 

8 3 and solomon went to hamathzobah and prevail against it 

8 4 and he built tadmor in the wilder and all the store citi 
which he built in hamath 

8 5 also he built bethhoron the upper and bethhoron the nether 
fenc citi with wall gate and bar 8 6 and baalath and all 
the store citi that solomon had and all the chariot citi and the 
citi of the horseman and all that solomon desir to build in 
jerusalem and in lebanon and throughout all the land of hi 
dominion 

8 7 a for all the peopl that were left of the hittit and the 
amorit and the perizzit and the hivit and the jebusit 
which were not of israel 8 8 but of their child who were left 
after them in the land whom the child of israel consum not them 
did solomon make to pay tribut until thi day 

8 9 but of the child of israel did solomon make no servant for hi 
work but they were men of war and chief of hi captain and 
captain of hi chariot and horseman 

8 10 and these were the chief of king solomon s offic even two 
hundr and fifti that bare rule over the peopl 

8 11 and solomon brought up the daughter of pharaoh out of the citi of 
david unto the hou that he had built for her for he said my wife 
shall not dwell in the hou of david king of israel becau the 
place are holi whereunto the ark of the lord hath come 

8 12 then solomon offer burnt offer unto the lord on the altar 
of the lord which he had built befor the porch 8 13 even after a 
certain rate everi day offer accord to the command of 
mose on the sabbath and on the new moon and on the solemn 
feast three time in the year even in the feast of unleaven 
bread and in the feast of week and in the feast of tabernacl 

8 14 and he appoint accord to the order of david hi father the 
cour of the priest to their servic and the levit to their 
charg to prai and minist befor the priest a the duti of 
everi day requir the porter also by their cour at everi gate 
for so had david the man of god command 

8 15 and they depart not from the command of the king unto the 
priest and levit concern ani matter or concern the 
treasur 

8 16 now all the work of solomon wa prepar unto the day of the 
foundat of the hou of the lord and until it wa finish so the 
hou of the lord wa perfect 

8 17 then went solomon to eziongeb and to eloth at the sea side in 
the land of edom 

8 18 and huram sent him by the hand of hi servant ship and 
servant that had knowledg of the sea and they went with the 
servant of solomon to ophir and took thenc four hundr and fifti 
talent of gold and brought them to king solomon 

9 1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon she came 
to prove solomon with hard question at jerusalem with a veri great 
compani and camel that bare spice and gold in abund and 
preciou stone and when she wa come to solomon she commun with 
him of all that wa in her heart 

9 2 and solomon told her all her question and there wa noth hid 
from solomon which he told her not 

9 3 and when the queen of sheba had seen the wisdom of solomon and 
the hou that he had built 9 4 and the meat of hi tabl and the 
sit of hi servant and the attend of hi minist and 
their apparel hi cupbear also and their apparel and hi ascent 
by which he went up into the hou of the lord there wa no more 
spirit in her 

9 5 and she said to the king it wa a true report which i heard in 
mine own land of thine act and of thi wisdom 9 6 howbeit i believ 
not their word until i came and mine eye had seen it and behold 
the one half of the great of thi wisdom wa not told me for thou 
exceedest the fame that i heard 

9 7 happi are thi men and happi are these thi servant which stand 
continu befor thee and hear thi wisdom 

9 8 bless be the lord thi god which delight in thee to set thee 
on hi throne to be king for the lord thi god becau thi god love 
israel to establish them for ever therefor made he thee king over 
them to do judgment and justic 

9 9 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold and 
of spice great abund and preciou stone neither wa there ani 
such spice a the queen of sheba gave king solomon 

9 10 and the servant also of huram and the servant of solomon 
which brought gold from ophir brought algum tree and preciou 
stone 

9 11 and the king made of the algum tree terrac to the hou of the 
lord and to the king s palac and harp and psalteri for singer 
and there were none such seen befor in the land of judah 

9 12 and king solomon gave to the queen of sheba all her desir 
whatsoev she ask besid that which she had brought unto the king 
so she turn and went away to her own land she and her servant 

9 13 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six 
hundr and threescor and six talent of gold 9 14 besid that which 
chapman and merchant brought and all the king of arabia and 
governor of the countri brought gold and silver to solomon 

9 15 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold six 
hundr shekel of beaten gold went to one target 

9 16 and three hundr shield made he of beaten gold three hundr 
shekel of gold went to one shield and the king put them in the hou 
of the forest of lebanon 

9 17 moreov the king made a great throne of ivori and overlaid it 
with pure gold 

9 18 and there were six step to the throne with a footstool of gold 
which were fasten to the throne and stay on each side of the 
sit place and two lion stand by the stay 9 19 and twelv 
lion stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six step 
there wa not the like made in ani kingdom 

9 20 and all the drink vessel of king solomon were of gold and 
all the vessel of the hou of the forest of lebanon were of pure 
gold none were of silver it wa not ani thing account of in the 
day of solomon 

9 21 for the king s ship went to tarshish with the servant of huram 
everi three year onc came the ship of tarshish bring gold and 
silver ivori and ape and peacock 

9 22 and king solomon pa all the king of the earth in rich and 
wisdom 

9 23 and all the king of the earth sought the presenc of solomon to 
hear hi wisdom that god had put in hi heart 

9 24 and they brought everi man hi present vessel of silver and 
vessel of gold and raiment har and spice hor and mule 
a rate year by year 

9 25 and solomon had four thousand stall for hor and chariot and 
twelv thousand horseman whom he bestow in the chariot citi and 
with the king at jerusalem 

9 26 and he reign over all the king from the river even unto the 
land of the philistin and to the border of egypt 

9 27 and the king made silver in jerusalem a stone and cedar tree 
made he a the sycomor tree that are in the low plain in abund 

9 28 and they brought unto solomon hor out of egypt and out of all 
land 

9 29 now the rest of the act of solomon first and last are they not 
written in the book of nathan the prophet and in the propheci of 
ahijah the shilonit and in the vision of iddo the seer against 
jeroboam the son of nebat 9 30 and solomon reign in jerusalem over 
all israel forti year 

9 31 and solomon slept with hi father and he wa buri in the citi 
of david hi father and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead 

10 1 and rehoboam went to shechem for to shechem were all israel come 
to make him king 

10 2 and it came to pa when jeroboam the son of nebat who wa in 
egypt whither he fled from the presenc of solomon the king heard 
it that jeroboam return out of egypt 

10 3 and they sent and call him so jeroboam and all israel came and 
spake to rehoboam say 10 4 thi father made our yoke grievou now 
therefor ea thou somewhat the grievou servitud of thi father and 
hi heavi yoke that he put upon u and we will serv thee 

10 5 and he said unto them come again unto me after three day and 
the peopl depart 

10 6 and king rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood 
befor solomon hi father while he yet live say what counsel 
give ye me to return answer to thi peopl 10 7 and they spake unto 
him say if thou be kind to thi peopl and plea them and 
speak good word to them they will be thi servant for ever 

10 8 but he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him and took 
counsel with the young men that were brought up with him that stood 
befor him 

10 9 and he said unto them what advic give ye that we may return 
answer to thi peopl which have spoken to me say ea somewhat 
the yoke that thi father did put upon u 10 10 and the young men 
that were brought up with him spake unto him say thu shalt thou 
answer the peopl that spake unto thee say thi father made our 
yoke heavi but make thou it somewhat lighter for u thu shalt thou 
say unto them my littl finger shall be thicker than my father s 
loin 

10 11 for wherea my father put a heavi yoke upon you i will put more 
to your yoke my father chasti you with whip but i will chasti 
you with scorpion 

10 12 so jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam on the third 
day a the king bade say come again to me on the third day 

10 13 and the king answer them roughli and king rehoboam forsook 
the counsel of the old men 10 14 and answer them after the advic 
of the young men say my father made your yoke heavi but i will 
add thereto my father chasti you with whip but i will chasti 
you with scorpion 

10 15 so the king hearken not unto the peopl for the cau wa of 
god that the lord might perform hi word which he spake by the hand 
of ahijah the shilonit to jeroboam the son of nebat 

10 16 and when all israel saw that the king would not hearken unto 
them the peopl answer the king say what portion have we in 
david and we have none inherit in the son of jess everi man to 
your tent o israel and now david see to thine own hou so all 
israel went to their tent 

10 17 but a for the child of israel that dwelt in the citi of 
judah rehoboam reign over them 

10 18 then king rehoboam sent hadoram that wa over the tribut and 
the child of israel stone him with stone that he die but king 
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot to flee to 
jerusalem 

10 19 and israel rebel against the hou of david unto thi day 

11 1 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem he gather of the hou 
of judah and benjamin an hundr and fourscor thousand chosen men 
which were warrior to fight against israel that he might bring the 
kingdom again to rehoboam 

11 2 but the word of the lord came to shemaiah the man of god say 
11 3 speak unto rehoboam the son of solomon king of judah and to all 
israel in judah and benjamin say 11 4 thu saith the lord ye 
shall not go up nor fight against your brother return everi man to 
hi hou for thi thing is done of me and they obey the word of 
the lord and return from go against jeroboam 

11 5 and rehoboam dwelt in jerusalem and built citi for defenc in 
judah 

11 6 he built even bethlehem and etam and tekoa 11 7 and bethzur 
and shoco and adullam 11 8 and gath and mareshah and ziph 11 9 
and adoraim and lachish and azekah 11 10 and zorah and aijalon 
and hebron which are in judah and in benjamin fenc citi 

11 11 and he fortifi the strong hold and put captain in them and 
store of victual and of oil and wine 

11 12 and in everi sever citi he put shield and spear and made 
them exceed strong have judah and benjamin on hi side 

11 13 and the priest and the levit that were in all israel resort 
to him out of all their coast 

11 14 for the levit left their suburb and their poss and 
came to judah and jerusalem for jeroboam and hi son had cast them 
off from execut the priest s offic unto the lord 11 15 and he 
ordain him priest for the high place and for the devil and for 
the calf which he had made 

11 16 and after them out of all the tribe of israel such a set their 
heart to seek the lord god of israel came to jerusalem to sacrif 
unto the lord god of their father 

11 17 so they strengthen the kingdom of judah and made rehoboam the 
son of solomon strong three year for three year they walk in the 
way of david and solomon 

11 18 and rehoboam took him mahalath the daughter of jerimoth the son 
of david to wife and abihail the daughter of eliab the son of jess 
11 19 which bare him child jeush and shamariah and zaham 

11 20 and after her he took maachah the daughter of absalom which 
bare him abijah and attai and ziza and shelomith 

11 21 and rehoboam love maachah the daughter of absalom abov all hi 
wife and hi concubin for he took eighteen wife and threescor 
concubin and begat twenti and eight son and threescor 
daughter 11 22 and rehoboam made abijah the son of maachah the 
chief to be ruler among hi brother for he thought to make him 
king 

11 23 and he dealt wise and disper of all hi child 
throughout all the countri of judah and benjamin unto everi fenc 
citi and he gave them victual in abund and he desir mani 
wife 

12 1 and it came to pa when rehoboam had establish the kingdom 
and had strengthen himself he forsook the law of the lord and all 
israel with him 

12 2 and it came to pa that in the fifth year of king rehoboam 
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem becau they had 
transgress against the lord 12 3 with twelv hundr chariot and 
threescor thousand horseman and the peopl were without number that 
came with him out of egypt the lubim the sukkiim and the 
ethiopian 

12 4 and he took the fenc citi which pertain to judah and came 
to jerusalem 

12 5 then came shemaiah the prophet to rehoboam and to the princ of 
judah that were gather togeth to jerusalem becau of shishak 
and said unto them thu saith the lord ye have forsaken me and 
therefor have i also left you in the hand of shishak 

12 6 whereupon the princ of israel and the king humbl themselv 
and they said the lord is righteou 

12 7 and when the lord saw that they humbl themselv the word of 
the lord came to shemaiah say they have humbl themselv 
therefor i will not destroy them but i will grant them some 
deliv and my wrath shall not be pour out upon jerusalem by 
the hand of shishak 

12 8 nevertheless they shall be hi servant that they may know my 
servic and the servic of the kingdom of the countri 

12 9 so shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem and took away 
the treasur of the hou of the lord and the treasur of the 
king s hou he took all he carri away also the shield of gold 
which solomon had made 

12 10 instead of which king rehoboam made shield of brass and 
commit them to the hand of the chief of the guard that kept the 
entranc of the king s hou 

12 11 and when the king enter into the hou of the lord the guard 
came and fetch them and brought them again into the guard chamber 

12 12 and when he humbl himself the wrath of the lord turn from 
him that he would not destroy him altogeth and also in judah 
thing went well 

12 13 so king rehoboam strengthen himself in jerusalem and reign 
for rehoboam wa one and forti year old when he began to reign and 
he reign seventeen year in jerusalem the citi which the lord had 
chosen out of all the tribe of israel to put hi name there and hi 
mother s name wa naamah an ammonit 

12 14 and he did evil becau he prepar not hi heart to seek the 
lord 

12 15 now the act of rehoboam first and last are they not written 
in the book of shemaiah the prophet and of iddo the seer concern 
genealog and there were war between rehoboam and jeroboam 
continu 

12 16 and rehoboam slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi 
of david and abijah hi son reign in hi stead 

13 1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam began abijah to reign 
over judah 

13 2 he reign three year in jerusalem hi mother s name also wa 
michaiah the daughter of uriel of gibeah and there wa war between 
abijah and jeroboam 

13 3 and abijah set the battl in array with an armi of valiant men of 
war even four hundr thousand chosen men jeroboam also set the 
battl in array against him with eight hundr thousand chosen men 
be mighti men of valour 

13 4 and abijah stood up upon mount zemaraim which is in mount 
ephraim and said hear me thou jeroboam and all israel 13 5 ought 
ye not to know that the lord god of israel gave the kingdom over 
israel to david for ever even to him and to hi son by a coven of 
salt 13 6 yet jeroboam the son of nebat the servant of solomon the 
son of david is risen up and hath rebel against hi lord 

13 7 and there are gather unto him vain men the child of belial 
and have strengthen themselv against rehoboam the son of solomon 
when rehoboam wa young and tenderheart and could not withstand 
them 

13 8 and now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the lord in the hand 
of the son of david and ye be a great multitud and there are with 
your golden calf which jeroboam made you for god 

13 9 have ye not cast out the priest of the lord the son of aaron 
and the levit and have made you priest after the manner of the 
nation of other land so that whosoev cometh to consecr himself 
with a young bullock and seven ram the same may be a priest of them 
that are no god 

13 10 but a for u the lord is our god and we have not forsaken 
him and the priest which minist unto the lord are the son of 
aaron and the levit wait upon their busi 13 11 and they burn 
unto the lord everi morn and everi even burnt sacrif and 
sweet incen the shewbread also set they in order upon the pure 
tabl and the candlestick of gold with the lamp thereof to burn 
everi even for we keep the charg of the lord our god but ye have 
forsaken him 

13 12 and behold god himself is with u for our captain and hi 
priest with sound trumpet to cri alarm against you o child of 
israel fight ye not against the lord god of your father for ye 
shall not prosper 

13 13 but jeroboam cau an ambush to come about behind them so 
they were befor judah and the ambush wa behind them 

13 14 and when judah look back behold the battl wa befor and 
behind and they cri unto the lord and the priest sound with the 
trumpet 

13 15 then the men of judah gave a shout and a the men of judah 
shout it came to pa that god smote jeroboam and all israel 
befor abijah and judah 

13 16 and the child of israel fled befor judah and god deliv 
them into their hand 

13 17 and abijah and hi peopl slew them with a great slaughter so 
there fell down slain of israel five hundr thousand chosen men 

13 18 thu the child of israel were brought under at that time and 
the child of judah prevail becau they reli upon the lord god 
of their father 

13 19 and abijah pursu after jeroboam and took citi from him 
bethel with the town thereof and jeshanah with the town thereof 
and ephraim with the town thereof 

13 20 neither did jeroboam recov strength again in the day of 
abijah and the lord struck him and he die 

13 21 but abijah wax mighti and marri fourteen wife and begat 
twenti and two son and sixteen daughter 

13 22 and the rest of the act of abijah and hi way and hi 
say are written in the stori of the prophet iddo 

14 1 so abijah slept with hi father and they buri him in the citi 
of david and asa hi son reign in hi stead in hi day the land 
wa quiet ten year 

14 2 and asa did that which wa good and right in the eye of the lord 
hi god 14 3 for he took away the altar of the strang god and the 
high place and brake down the imag and cut down the grove 14 4 
and command judah to seek the lord god of their father and to do 
the law and the command 

14 5 also he took away out of all the citi of judah the high place 
and the imag and the kingdom wa quiet befor him 

14 6 and he built fenc citi in judah for the land had rest and 
he had no war in those year becau the lord had given him rest 

14 7 therefor he said unto judah let u build these citi and make 
about them wall and tower gate and bar while the land is yet 
befor u becau we have sought the lord our god we have sought 
him and he hath given u rest on everi side so they built and 
prosper 

14 8 and asa had an armi of men that bare target and spear out of 
judah three hundr thousand and out of benjamin that bare shield 
and drew bow two hundr and fourscor thousand all these were 
mighti men of valour 

14 9 and there came out against them zerah the ethiopian with an host 
of a thousand thousand and three hundr chariot and came unto 
mareshah 

14 10 then asa went out against him and they set the battl in array 
in the valley of zephathah at mareshah 

14 11 and asa cri unto the lord hi god and said lord it is 
noth with thee to help whether with mani or with them that have 
no power help u o lord our god for we rest on thee and in thi 
name we go against thi multitud o lord thou art our god let no 
man prevail against thee 

14 12 so the lord smote the ethiopian befor asa and befor judah 
and the ethiopian fled 

14 13 and asa and the peopl that were with him pursu them unto 
gerar and the ethiopian were overthrown that they could not recov 
themselv for they were destroy befor the lord and befor hi 
host and they carri away veri much spoil 

14 14 and they smote all the citi round about gerar for the fear of 
the lord came upon them and they spoil all the citi for there 
wa exceed much spoil in them 

14 15 they smote also the tent of cattl and carri away sheep and 
camel in abund and return to jerusalem 

15 1 and the spirit of god came upon azariah the son of ode 15 2 and 
he went out to meet asa and said unto him hear ye me asa and all 
judah and benjamin the lord is with you while ye be with him and if 
ye seek him he will be found of you but if ye forsak him he will 
forsak you 

15 3 now for a long season israel hath been without the true god and 
without a teach priest and without law 

15 4 but when they in their troubl did turn unto the lord god of 
israel and sought him he wa found of them 

15 5 and in those time there wa no peac to him that went out nor 
to him that came in but great vexat were upon all the inhabit 
of the countri 

15 6 and nation wa destroy of nation and citi of citi for god did 
vex them with all adver 

15 7 be ye strong therefor and let not your hand be weak for your 
work shall be reward 

15 8 and when asa heard these word and the propheci of ode the 
prophet he took courag and put away the abomin idol out of all 
the land of judah and benjamin and out of the citi which he had 
taken from mount ephraim and renew the altar of the lord that wa 
befor the porch of the lord 

15 9 and he gather all judah and benjamin and the stranger with 
them out of ephraim and manasseh and out of simeon for they fell to 
him out of israel in abund when they saw that the lord hi god 
wa with him 

15 10 so they gather themselv togeth at jerusalem in the third 
month in the fifteenth year of the reign of asa 

15 11 and they offer unto the lord the same time of the spoil which 
they had brought seven hundr ox and seven thousand sheep 

15 12 and they enter into a coven to seek the lord god of their 
father with all their heart and with all their soul 15 13 that 
whosoev would not seek the lord god of israel should be put to 
death whether small or great whether man or woman 

15 14 and they sware unto the lord with a loud voic and with 
shout and with trumpet and with cornet 

15 15 and all judah rejoic at the oath for they had sworn with all 
their heart and sought him with their whole desir and he wa found 
of them and the lord gave them rest round about 

15 16 and also concern maachah the mother of asa the king he 
remov her from be queen becau she had made an idol in a grove 
and asa cut down her idol and stamp it and burnt it at the brook 
kidron 

15 17 but the high place were not taken away out of israel 
nevertheless the heart of asa wa perfect all hi day 

15 18 and he brought into the hou of god the thing that hi father 
had dedic and that he himself had dedic silver and gold 
and vessel 

15 19 and there wa no more war unto the five and thirtieth year of 
the reign of asa 

16 1 in the six and thirtieth year of the reign of asa baasha king of 
israel came up against judah and built ramah to the intent that he 
might let none go out or come in to asa king of judah 

16 2 then asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasur of the 
hou of the lord and of the king s hou and sent to benhadad king 
of syria that dwelt at damascu say 16 3 there is a leagu 
between me and thee a there wa between my father and thi father 
behold i have sent thee silver and gold go break thi leagu with 
baasha king of israel that he may depart from me 

16 4 and benhadad hearken unto king asa and sent the captain of 
hi armi against the citi of israel and they smote ijon and dan 
and abelmaim and all the store citi of naphtali 

16 5 and it came to pa when baasha heard it that he left off 
build of ramah and let hi work cea 

16 6 then asa the king took all judah and they carri away the 
stone of ramah and the timber thereof wherewith baasha wa 
build and he built therewith geba and mizpah 

16 7 and at that time hanani the seer came to asa king of judah and 
said unto him becau thou hast reli on the king of syria and not 
reli on the lord thi god therefor is the host of the king of syria 
escap out of thine hand 

16 8 were not the ethiopian and the lubim a huge host with veri 
mani chariot and horseman yet becau thou didst reli on the lord 
he deliv them into thine hand 

16 9 for the eye of the lord run to and fro throughout the whole 
earth to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is 
perfect toward him herein thou hast done foolishli therefor from 
henceforth thou shalt have war 

16 10 then asa wa wroth with the seer and put him in a prison hou 
for he wa in a rage with him becau of thi thing and asa oppress 
some of the peopl the same time 

16 11 and behold the act of asa first and last lo they are 
written in the book of the king of judah and israel 

16 12 and asa in the thirti and ninth year of hi reign wa disea 
in hi foot until hi disea wa exceed great yet in hi disea 
he sought not to the lord but to the physician 

16 13 and asa slept with hi father and die in the one and fortieth 
year of hi reign 

16 14 and they buri him in hi own sepulchr which he had made for 
himself in the citi of david and laid him in the bed which wa fill 
with sweet odour and diver kind of spice prepar by the 
apothecari art and they made a veri great burn for him 

17 1 and jehoshaphat hi son reign in hi stead and strengthen 
himself against israel 

17 2 and he place forc in all the fenc citi of judah and set 
garrison in the land of judah and in the citi of ephraim which 
asa hi father had taken 

17 3 and the lord wa with jehoshaphat becau he walk in the first 
way of hi father david and sought not unto baalim 17 4 but sought 
to the lord god of hi father and walk in hi command and not 
after the do of israel 

17 5 therefor the lord stablish the kingdom in hi hand and all 
judah brought to jehoshaphat present and he had rich and honour in 
abund 

17 6 and hi heart wa lift up in the way of the lord moreov he 
took away the high place and grove out of judah 

17 7 also in the third year of hi reign he sent to hi princ even 
to benhail and to obadiah and to zechariah and to nethaneel and to 
michaiah to teach in the citi of judah 

17 8 and with them he sent levit even shemaiah and nethaniah and 
zebadiah and asahel and shemiramoth and jehonathan and adonijah 
and tobijah and tobadonijah levit and with them elishama and 
jehoram priest 

17 9 and they taught in judah and had the book of the law of the lord 
with them and went about throughout all the citi of judah and 
taught the peopl 

17 10 and the fear of the lord fell upon all the kingdom of the land 
that were round about judah so that they made no war against 
jehoshaphat 

17 11 also some of the philistin brought jehoshaphat present and 
tribut silver and the arabian brought him flock seven thousand 
and seven hundr ram and seven thousand and seven hundr he goat 

17 12 and jehoshaphat wax great exceedingli and he built in judah 
castl and citi of store 

17 13 and he had much busi in the citi of judah and the men of 
war mighti men of valour were in jerusalem 

17 14 and these are the number of them accord to the hou of 
their father of judah the captain of thousand adnah the chief 
and with him mighti men of valour three hundr thousand 

17 15 and next to him wa jehohanan the captain and with him two 
hundr and fourscor thousand 

17 16 and next him wa amasiah the son of zichri who willingli 
offer himself unto the lord and with him two hundr thousand 
mighti men of valour 

17 17 and of benjamin eliada a mighti man of valour and with him 
arm men with bow and shield two hundr thousand 

17 18 and next him wa jehozabad and with him an hundr and 
fourscor thousand readi prepar for the war 

17 19 these wait on the king besid those whom the king put in the 
fenc citi throughout all judah 

18 1 now jehoshaphat had rich and honour in abund and join 
affin with ahab 

18 2 and after certain year he went down to ahab to samaria and ahab 
kill sheep and ox for him in abund and for the peopl that he 
had with him and persuad him to go up with him to ramothgilead 

18 3 and ahab king of israel said unto jehoshaphat king of judah wilt 
thou go with me to ramothgilead and he answer him i am a thou 
art and my peopl a thi peopl and we will be with thee in the war 

18 4 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel enquir i pray 
thee at the word of the lord to day 

18 5 therefor the king of israel gather togeth of prophet four 
hundr men and said unto them shall we go to ramothgilead to 
battl or shall i forbear and they said go up for god will deliv 
it into the king s hand 

18 6 but jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord 
besid that we might enquir of him 18 7 and the king of israel 
said unto jehoshaphat there is yet one man by whom we may enquir of 
the lord but i hate him for he never prophesi good unto me but 
alway evil the same is micaiah the son of imla and jehoshaphat 
said let not the king say so 

18 8 and the king of israel call for one of hi offic and said 
fetch quickli micaiah the son of imla 

18 9 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat king of judah sat either 
of them on hi throne cloth in their robe and they sat in a void 
place at the enter in of the gate of samaria and all the prophet 
prophesi befor them 

18 10 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah had made him horn of iron 
and said thu saith the lord with these thou shalt push syria until 
they be consum 

18 11 and all the prophet prophesi so say go up to 
ramothgilead and prosper for the lord shall deliv it into the hand 
of the king 

18 12 and the messeng that went to call micaiah spake to him 
say behold the word of the prophet declar good to the king 
with one assent let thi word therefor i pray thee be like one of 
their s and speak thou good 

18 13 and micaiah said a the lord liveth even what my god saith 
that will i speak 

18 14 and when he wa come to the king the king said unto him 
micaiah shall we go to ramothgilead to battl or shall i forbear 
and he said go ye up and prosper and they shall be deliv into 
your hand 

18 15 and the king said to him how mani time shall i adjur thee 
that thou say noth but the truth to me in the name of the lord 
18 16 then he said i did see all israel scatter upon the mountain 
a sheep that have no shepherd and the lord said these have no 
master let them return therefor everi man to hi hou in peac 

18 17 and the king of israel said to jehoshaphat did i not tell thee 
that he would not prophesi good unto me but evil 18 18 again he 
said therefor hear the word of the lord i saw the lord sit upon 
hi throne and all the host of heaven stand on hi right hand and 
on hi left 

18 19 and the lord said who shall entic ahab king of israel that he 
may go up and fall at ramothgilead and one spake say after thi 
manner and anoth say after that manner 

18 20 then there came out a spirit and stood befor the lord and 
said i will entic him and the lord said unto him wherewith 18 21 
and he said i will go out and be a lie spirit in the mouth of all 
hi prophet and the lord said thou shalt entic him and thou shalt 
also prevail go out and do even so 

18 22 now therefor behold the lord hath put a lie spirit in the 
mouth of these thi prophet and the lord hath spoken evil against 
thee 

18 23 then zedekiah the son of chenaanah came near and smote micaiah 
upon the cheek and said which way went the spirit of the lord from 
me to speak unto thee 18 24 and micaiah said behold thou shalt see 
on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself 

18 25 then the king of israel said take ye micaiah and carri him 
back to amon the governor of the citi and to joash the king s son 
18 26 and say thu saith the king put thi fellow in the prison and 
feed him with bread of afflict and with water of afflict until 
i return in peac 

18 27 and micaiah said if thou certainli return in peac then hath 
not the lord spoken by me and he said hearken all ye peopl 

18 28 so the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up 
to ramothgilead 

18 29 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat i will disgui 
myself and i will go to the battl but put thou on thi robe so the 
king of israel disgui himself and they went to the battl 

18 30 now the king of syria had command the captain of the chariot 
that were with him say fight ye not with small or great save 
onli with the king of israel 

18 31 and it came to pa when the captain of the chariot saw 
jehoshaphat that they said it is the king of israel therefor they 
compass about him to fight but jehoshaphat cri out and the lord 
help him and god move them to depart from him 

18 32 for it came to pa that when the captain of the chariot 
perceiv that it wa not the king of israel they turn back again 
from pursu him 

18 33 and a certain man drew a bow at a ventur and smote the king of 
israel between the joint of the har therefor he said to hi 
chariot man turn thine hand that thou mayest carri me out of the 
host for i am wound 

18 34 and the battl increa that day howbeit the king of israel 
stay himself up in hi chariot against the syrian until the even 
and about the time of the sun go down he die 

19 1 and jehoshaphat the king of judah return to hi hou in peac 
to jerusalem 

19 2 and jehu the son of hanani the seer went out to meet him and 
said to king jehoshaphat shouldest thou help the ungodli and love 
them that hate the lord therefor is wrath upon thee from befor the 
lord 

19 3 nevertheless there are good thing found in thee in that thou 
hast taken away the grove out of the land and hast prepar thine 
heart to seek god 

19 4 and jehoshaphat dwelt at jerusalem and he went out again through 
the peopl from beersheba to mount ephraim and brought them back unto 
the lord god of their father 

19 5 and he set judg in the land throughout all the fenc citi of 
judah citi by citi 19 6 and said to the judg take heed what ye 
do for ye judg not for man but for the lord who is with you in the 
judgment 

19 7 wherefor now let the fear of the lord be upon you take heed and 
do it for there is no iniqu with the lord our god nor respect of 
person nor take of gift 

19 8 moreov in jerusalem did jehoshaphat set of the levit and of 
the priest and of the chief of the father of israel for the 
judgment of the lord and for controversi when they return to 
jerusalem 

19 9 and he charg them say thu shall ye do in the fear of the 
lord faith and with a perfect heart 

19 10 and what cau soever shall come to you of your brother that 
dwell in your citi between blood and blood between law and 
command statut and judgment ye shall even warn them that they 
trespass not against the lord and so wrath come upon you and upon 
your brother thi do and ye shall not trespass 

19 11 and behold amariah the chief priest is over you in all matter 
of the lord and zebadiah the son of ishmael the ruler of the hou 
of judah for all the king s matter also the levit shall be 
offic befor you deal courag and the lord shall be with the 
good 

20 1 it came to pa after thi also that the child of moab and 
the child of ammon and with them other besid the ammonit came 
against jehoshaphat to battl 

20 2 then there came some that told jehoshaphat say there cometh 
a great multitud against thee from beyond the sea on thi side syria 
and behold they be in hazazontamar which is engedi 

20 3 and jehoshaphat fear and set himself to seek the lord and 
proclaim a fast throughout all judah 

20 4 and judah gather themselv togeth to ask help of the lord 
even out of all the citi of judah they came to seek the lord 

20 5 and jehoshaphat stood in the congreg of judah and jerusalem 
in the hou of the lord befor the new court 20 6 and said o lord 
god of our father art not thou god in heaven and rulest not thou 
over all the kingdom of the heathen and in thine hand is there not 
power and might so that none is abl to withstand thee 20 7 art not 
thou our god who didst drive out the inhabit of thi land befor 
thi peopl israel and gavest it to the seed of abraham thi friend for 
ever 20 8 and they dwelt therein and have built thee a sanctuari 
therein for thi name say 20 9 if when evil cometh upon u a 
the sword judgment or pestil or famin we stand befor thi 
hou and in thi presenc for thi name is in thi hou and cri 
unto thee in our afflict then thou wilt hear and help 

20 10 and now behold the child of ammon and moab and mount seir 
whom thou wouldest not let israel invad when they came out of the 
land of egypt but they turn from them and destroy them not 
20 11 behold i say how they reward u to come to cast u out of thi 
poss which thou hast given u to inherit 

20 12 o our god wilt thou not judg them for we have no might 
against thi great compani that cometh against u neither know we 
what to do but our eye are upon thee 

20 13 and all judah stood befor the lord with their littl one 
their wife and their child 

20 14 then upon jahaziel the son of zechariah the son of benaiah the 
son of jeiel the son of mattaniah a levit of the son of asaph 
came the spirit of the lord in the midst of the congreg 20 15 
and he said hearken ye all judah and ye inhabit of jerusalem 
and thou king jehoshaphat thu saith the lord unto you be not afraid 
nor dismay by reason of thi great multitud for the battl is not 
your but god s 

20 16 to morrow go ye down against them behold they come up by the 
cliff of ziz and ye shall find them at the end of the brook befor 
the wilder of jeruel 

20 17 ye shall not need to fight in thi battl set yourselv stand 
ye still and see the salvat of the lord with you o judah and 
jerusalem fear not nor be dismay to morrow go out against them 
for the lord will be with you 

20 18 and jehoshaphat bow hi head with hi face to the ground and 
all judah and the inhabit of jerusalem fell befor the lord 
worship the lord 

20 19 and the levit of the child of the kohathit and of the 
child of the korhit stood up to prai the lord god of israel 
with a loud voic on high 

20 20 and they rose earli in the morn and went forth into the 
wilder of tekoa and a they went forth jehoshaphat stood and 
said hear me o judah and ye inhabit of jerusalem believ in 
the lord your god so shall ye be establish believ hi prophet 
so shall ye prosper 

20 21 and when he had consult with the peopl he appoint singer 
unto the lord and that should prai the beauti of holi a they 
went out befor the armi and to say prai the lord for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

20 22 and when they began to sing and to prai the lord set 
ambush against the child of ammon moab and mount seir which 
were come against judah and they were smitten 

20 23 for the child of ammon and moab stood up against the 
inhabit of mount seir utterli to slay and destroy them and when 
they had made an end of the inhabit of seir everi one help to 
destroy anoth 

20 24 and when judah came toward the watch tower in the wilder 
they look unto the multitud and behold they were dead bodi 
fallen to the earth and none escap 

20 25 and when jehoshaphat and hi peopl came to take away the spoil 
of them they found among them in abund both rich with the dead 
bodi and preciou jewel which they strip off for themselv 
more than they could carri away and they were three day in gather 
of the spoil it wa so much 

20 26 and on the fourth day they assembl themselv in the valley of 
berachah for there they bless the lord therefor the name of the 
same place wa call the valley of berachah unto thi day 

20 27 then they return everi man of judah and jerusalem and 
jehoshaphat in the forefront of them to go again to jerusalem with 
joy for the lord had made them to rejoic over their enemi 

20 28 and they came to jerusalem with psalteri and harp and 
trumpet unto the hou of the lord 

20 29 and the fear of god wa on all the kingdom of those countri 
when they had heard that the lord fought against the enemi of
