jaalah the child of darkon the child of giddel 2 57 the 
child of shephatiah the child of hattil the child of 
pochereth of zebaim the child of ami 

2 58 all the nethinim and the child of solomon s servant were 
three hundr nineti and two 

2 59 and these were they which went up from telmelah telharsa 
cherub addan and immer but they could not shew their father s 
hou and their seed whether they were of israel 2 60 the child 
of delaiah the child of tobiah the child of nekoda six 
hundr fifti and two 

2 61 and of the child of the priest the child of habaiah the 
child of koz the child of barzillai which took a wife of the 
daughter of barzillai the gileadit and wa call after their name 
2 62 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by 
genealog but they were not found therefor were they a pollut 
put from the priesthood 

2 63 and the tirshatha said unto them that they should not eat of the 
most holi thing till there stood up a priest with urim and with 
thummim 

2 64 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three 
hundr and threescor 2 65 besid their servant and their maid of 
whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirti and seven and 
there were among them two hundr sing men and sing woman 

2 66 their hor were seven hundr thirti and six their mule two 
hundr forti and five 2 67 their camel four hundr thirti and 
five their as six thousand seven hundr and twenti 

2 68 and some of the chief of the father when they came to the hou 
of the lord which is at jerusalem offer freeli for the hou of god 
to set it up in hi place 2 69 they gave after their abil unto the 
treasur of the work threescor and one thousand dram of gold and 
five thousand pound of silver and one hundr priest garment 

2 70 so the priest and the levit and some of the peopl and the 
singer and the porter and the nethinim dwelt in their citi 
and all israel in their citi 

3 1 and when the seventh month wa come and the child of israel 
were in the citi the peopl gather themselv togeth a one man 
to jerusalem 

3 2 then stood up jeshua the son of jozadak and hi brother the 
priest and zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and hi brother and 
build the altar of the god of israel to offer burnt offer 
thereon a it is written in the law of mose the man of god 

3 3 and they set the altar upon hi base for fear wa upon them 
becau of the peopl of those countri and they offer burnt 
offer thereon unto the lord even burnt offer morn and 
even 

3 4 they kept also the feast of tabernacl a it is written and 
offer the daili burnt offer by number accord to the custom 
a the duti of everi day requir 3 5 and afterward offer the 
continu burnt offer both of the new moon and of all the set 
feast of the lord that were consecr and of everi one that 
willingli offer a freewil offer unto the lord 

3 6 from the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt 
offer unto the lord but the foundat of the templ of the lord 
wa not yet laid 

3 7 they gave money also unto the mason and to the carpent and 
meat and drink and oil unto them of zidon and to them of tyre to 
bring cedar tree from lebanon to the sea of joppa accord to the 
grant that they had of cyru king of persia 

3 8 now in the second year of their come unto the hou of god at 
jerusalem in the second month began zerubbabel the son of shealtiel 
and jeshua the son of jozadak and the remnant of their brother the 
priest and the levit and all they that were come out of the 
captiv unto jerusalem and appoint the levit from twenti year 
old and upward to set forward the work of the hou of the lord 

3 9 then stood jeshua with hi son and hi brother kadmiel and hi 
son the son of judah togeth to set forward the workman in the 
hou of god the son of henadad with their son and their brother 
the levit 

3 10 and when the builder laid the foundat of the templ of the 
lord they set the priest in their apparel with trumpet and the 
levit the son of asaph with cymbal to prai the lord after the 
ordin of david king of israel 

3 11 and they sang togeth by cour in prai and give thank 
unto the lord becau he is good for hi merci endureth for ever 
toward israel 

and all the peopl shout with a great shout when they prai the 
lord becau the foundat of the hou of the lord wa laid 

3 12 but mani of the priest and levit and chief of the father who 
were ancient men that had seen the first hou when the foundat 
of thi hou wa laid befor their eye wept with a loud voic and 
mani shout aloud for joy 3 13 so that the peopl could not discern 
the noi of the shout of joy from the noi of the weep of the 
peopl for the peopl shout with a loud shout and the noi wa 
heard afar off 

4 1 now when the adversari of judah and benjamin heard that the 
child of the captiv build the templ unto the lord god of 
israel 4 2 then they came to zerubbabel and to the chief of the 
father and said unto them let u build with you for we seek your 
god a ye do and we do sacrif unto him sinc the day of 
esarhaddon king of assur which brought u up hither 

4 3 but zerubbabel and jeshua and the rest of the chief of the 
father of israel said unto them ye have noth to do with u to 
build an hou unto our god but we ourselv togeth will build unto 
the lord god of israel a king cyru the king of persia hath 
command u 

4 4 then the peopl of the land weaken the hand of the peopl of 
judah and troubl them in build 4 5 and hire counsellor 
against them to frustrat their purpo all the day of cyru king 
of persia even until the reign of dariu king of persia 

4 6 and in the reign of ahasueru in the begin of hi reign 
wrote they unto him an accu against the inhabit of judah and 
jerusalem 

4 7 and in the day of artaxerx wrote bishlam mithredath tabeel 
and the rest of their companion unto artaxerx king of persia and 
the write of the letter wa written in the syrian tongu and 
interpret in the syrian tongu 

4 8 rehum the chancellor and shimshai the scribe wrote a letter 
against jerusalem to artaxerx the king in thi sort 4 9 then wrote 
rehum the chancellor and shimshai the scribe and the rest of their 
companion the dinait the apharsathchit the tarpelit the 
apharsit the archevit the babylonian the susanchit the 
dehavit and the elamit 4 10 and the rest of the nation whom the 
great and nobl asnapp brought over and set in the citi of 
samaria and the rest that are on thi side the river and at such a 
time 

4 11 thi is the copi of the letter that they sent unto him even unto 
artaxerx the king thi servant the men on thi side the river and 
at such a time 

4 12 be it known unto the king that the jew which came up from thee 
to u are come unto jerusalem build the rebelli and the bad 
citi and have set up the wall thereof and join the foundat 

4 13 be it known now unto the king that if thi citi be build and 
the wall set up again then will they not pay toll tribut and 
custom and so thou shalt endamag the revenu of the king 

4 14 now becau we have mainten from the king s palac and it 
wa not meet for u to see the king s dishonour therefor have we 
sent and certifi the king 4 15 that search may be made in the book 
of the record of thi father so shalt thou find in the book of the 
record and know that thi citi is a rebelli citi and hurt 
unto king and provinc and that they have move sedit within the 
same of old time for which cau wa thi citi destroy 

4 16 we certifi the king that if thi citi be build again and the 
wall thereof set up by thi mean thou shalt have no portion on thi 
side the river 

4 17 then sent the king an answer unto rehum the chancellor and to 
shimshai the scribe and to the rest of their companion that dwell in 
samaria and unto the rest beyond the river peac and at such a 
time 

4 18 the letter which ye sent unto u hath been plainli read befor 
me 

4 19 and i command and search hath been made and it is found that 
thi citi of old time hath made insurrect against king and that 
rebellion and sedit have been made therein 

4 20 there have been mighti king also over jerusalem which have 
rule over all countri beyond the river and toll tribut and 
custom wa paid unto them 

4 21 give ye now command to cau these men to cea and that 
thi citi be not build until anoth command shall be given 
from me 

4 22 take heed now that ye fail not to do thi whi should damag grow 
to the hurt of the king 4 23 now when the copi of king artaxerx 
letter wa read befor rehum and shimshai the scribe and their 
companion they went up in hast to jerusalem unto the jew and made 
them to cea by forc and power 

4 24 then cea the work of the hou of god which is at jerusalem 
so it cea unto the second year of the reign of dariu king of 
persia 

5 1 then the prophet haggai the prophet and zechariah the son of 
iddo prophesi unto the jew that were in judah and jerusalem in the 
name of the god of israel even unto them 

5 2 then rose up zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and jeshua the son 
of jozadak and began to build the hou of god which is at jerusalem 
and with them were the prophet of god help them 

5 3 at the same time came to them tatnai governor on thi side the 
river and shetharboznai and their companion and said thu unto 
them who hath command you to build thi hou and to make up thi 
wall 5 4 then said we unto them after thi manner what are the 
name of the men that make thi build 5 5 but the eye of their 
god wa upon the elder of the jew that they could not cau them to 
cea till the matter came to dariu and then they return answer 
by letter concern thi matter 

5 6 the copi of the letter that tatnai governor on thi side the 
river and shetharboznai and hi companion the apharsachit which 
were on thi side the river sent unto dariu the king 5 7 they sent 
a letter unto him wherein wa written thu unto dariu the king all 
peac 

5 8 be it known unto the king that we went into the provinc of 
judea to the hou of the great god which is build with great 
stone and timber is laid in the wall and thi work goeth fast on 
and prospereth in their hand 

5 9 then ask we those elder and said unto them thu who command 
you to build thi hou and to make up these wall 5 10 we ask 
their name also to certifi thee that we might write the name of 
the men that were the chief of them 

5 11 and thu they return u answer say we are the servant of 
the god of heaven and earth and build the hou that wa build 
these mani year ago which a great king of israel build and set up 

5 12 but after that our father had provok the god of heaven unto 
wrath he gave them into the hand of nebuchadnezzar the king of 
babylon the chaldean who destroy thi hou and carri the 
peopl away into babylon 

5 13 but in the first year of cyru the king of babylon the same king 
cyru made a decr to build thi hou of god 

5 14 and the vessel also of gold and silver of the hou of god 
which nebuchadnezzar took out of the templ that wa in jerusalem and 
brought them into the templ of babylon those did cyru the king take 
out of the templ of babylon and they were deliv unto one whose 
name wa sheshbazzar whom he had made governor 5 15 and said unto 
him take these vessel go carri them into the templ that is in 
jerusalem and let the hou of god be build in hi place 

5 16 then came the same sheshbazzar and laid the foundat of the 
hou of god which is in jerusalem and sinc that time even until now 
hath it been in build and yet it is not finish 

5 17 now therefor if it seem good to the king let there be search 
made in the king s treasur hou which is there at babylon whether 
it be so that a decr wa made of cyru the king to build thi hou 
of god at jerusalem and let the king send hi pleasur to u 
concern thi matter 

6 1 then dariu the king made a decr and search wa made in the 
hou of the roll where the treasur were laid up in babylon 

6 2 and there wa found at achmetha in the palac that is in the 
provinc of the mede a roll and therein wa a record thu written 
6 3 in the first year of cyru the king the same cyru the king made a 
decr concern the hou of god at jerusalem let the hou be 
build the place where they offer sacrif and let the 
foundat thereof be strongli laid the height thereof threescor 
cubit and the breadth thereof threescor cubit 6 4 with three row 
of great stone and a row of new timber and let the expen be 
given out of the king s hou 6 5 and also let the golden and silver 
vessel of the hou of god which nebuchadnezzar took forth out of 
the templ which is at jerusalem and brought unto babylon be 
restor and brought again unto the templ which is at jerusalem 
everi one to hi place and place them in the hou of god 

6 6 now therefor tatnai governor beyond the river shetharboznai 
and your companion the apharsachit which are beyond the river be 
ye far from thenc 6 7 let the work of thi hou of god alon let 
the governor of the jew and the elder of the jew build thi hou 
of god in hi place 

6 8 moreov i make a decr what ye shall do to the elder of these 
jew for the build of thi hou of god that of the king s good 
even of the tribut beyond the river forthwith expen be given unto 
these men that they be not hinder 

6 9 and that which they have need of both young bullock and ram 
and lamb for the burnt offer of the god of heaven wheat salt 
wine and oil accord to the appoint of the priest which are 
at jerusalem let it be given them day by day without fail 6 10 that 
they may offer sacrif of sweet savour unto the god of heaven and 
pray for the life of the king and of hi son 

6 11 also i have made a decr that whosoev shall alter thi word 
let timber be pull down from hi hou and be set up let him be 
hang thereon and let hi hou be made a dunghil for thi 

6 12 and the god that hath cau hi name to dwell there destroy all 
king and peopl that shall put to their hand to alter and to destroy 
thi hou of god which is at jerusalem i dariu have made a decr 
let it be done with speed 

6 13 then tatnai governor on thi side the river shetharboznai and 
their companion accord to that which dariu the king had sent so 
they did speedili 

6 14 and the elder of the jew build and they prosper through 
the prophesi of haggai the prophet and zechariah the son of iddo 
and they build and finish it accord to the command of the 
god of israel and accord to the command of cyru and dariu 
and artaxerx king of persia 

6 15 and thi hou wa finish on the third day of the month adar 
which wa in the sixth year of the reign of dariu the king 

6 16 and the child of israel the priest and the levit and the 
rest of the child of the captiv kept the dedic of thi 
hou of god with joy 

6 17 and offer at the dedic of thi hou of god an hundr 
bullock two hundr ram four hundr lamb and for a sin offer 
for all israel twelv he goat accord to the number of the tribe 
of israel 

6 18 and they set the priest in their divi and the levit in 
their cour for the servic of god which is at jerusalem a it is 
written in the book of mose 

6 19 and the child of the captiv kept the passov upon the 
fourteenth day of the first month 

6 20 for the priest and the levit were purifi togeth all of 
them were pure and kill the passov for all the child of the 
captiv and for their brother the priest and for themselv 

6 21 and the child of israel which were come again out of 
captiv and all such a had separ themselv unto them from the 
filthi of the heathen of the land to seek the lord god of israel 
did eat 6 22 and kept the feast of unleaven bread seven day with 
joy for the lord had made them joy and turn the heart of the 
king of assyria unto them to strengthen their hand in the work of 
the hou of god the god of israel 

7 1 now after these thing in the reign of artaxerx king of persia 
ezra the son of seraiah the son of azariah the son of hilkiah 7 2 
the son of shallum the son of zadok the son of ahitub 7 3 the son 
of amariah the son of azariah the son of meraioth 7 4 the son of 
zerahiah the son of uzzi the son of bukki 7 5 the son of abishua 
the son of phineha the son of eleazar the son of aaron the chief 
priest 7 6 thi ezra went up from babylon and he wa a readi scribe 
in the law of mose which the lord god of israel had given and the 
king grant him all hi request accord to the hand of the lord 
hi god upon him 

7 7 and there went up some of the child of israel and of the 
priest and the levit and the singer and the porter and the 
nethinim unto jerusalem in the seventh year of artaxerx the king 

7 8 and he came to jerusalem in the fifth month which wa in the 
seventh year of the king 

7 9 for upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from 
babylon and on the first day of the fifth month came he to jerusalem 
accord to the good hand of hi god upon him 

7 10 for ezra had prepar hi heart to seek the law of the lord and 
to do it and to teach in israel statut and judgment 

7 11 now thi is the copi of the letter that the king artaxerx gave 
unto ezra the priest the scribe even a scribe of the word of the 
command of the lord and of hi statut to israel 

7 12 artaxerx king of king unto ezra the priest a scribe of the 
law of the god of heaven perfect peac and at such a time 

7 13 i make a decr that all they of the peopl of israel and of 
hi priest and levit in my realm which are mind of their own 
freewil to go up to jerusalem go with thee 

7 14 forasmuch a thou art sent of the king and of hi seven 
counsellor to enquir concern judah and jerusalem accord to 
the law of thi god which is in thine hand 7 15 and to carri the 
silver and gold which the king and hi counsellor have freeli 
offer unto the god of israel whose habit is in jerusalem 7 16 
and all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the provinc 
of babylon with the freewil offer of the peopl and of the 
priest offer willingli for the hou of their god which is in 
jerusalem 7 17 that thou mayest buy speedili with thi money 
bullock ram lamb with their meat offer and their drink 
offer and offer them upon the altar of the hou of your god 
which is in jerusalem 

7 18 and whatsoev shall seem good to thee and to thi brother to 
do with the rest of the silver and the gold that do after the will of 
your god 

7 19 the vessel also that are given thee for the servic of the hou 
of thi god those deliv thou befor the god of jerusalem 

7 20 and whatsoev more shall be need for the hou of thi god 
which thou shalt have occa to bestow bestow it out of the king s 
treasur hou 

7 21 and i even i artaxerx the king do make a decr to all the 
treasur which are beyond the river that whatsoev ezra the 
priest the scribe of the law of the god of heaven shall requir of 
you it be done speedili 7 22 unto an hundr talent of silver and 
to an hundr measur of wheat and to an hundr bath of wine and 
to an hundr bath of oil and salt without prescrib how much 

7 23 whatsoev is command by the god of heaven let it be 
dilig done for the hou of the god of heaven for whi should 
there be wrath against the realm of the king and hi son 7 24 also 
we certifi you that touch ani of the priest and levit singer 
porter nethinim or minist of thi hou of god it shall not be 
law to impo toll tribut or custom upon them 

7 25 and thou ezra after the wisdom of thi god that is in thine 
hand set magistr and judg which may judg all the peopl that 
are beyond the river all such a know the law of thi god and teach 
ye them that know them not 

7 26 and whosoev will not do the law of thi god and the law of the 
king let judgment be execut speedili upon him whether it be unto 
death or to banish or to confisc of good or to 
imprison 

7 27 bless be the lord god of our father which hath put such a 
thing a thi in the king s heart to beautifi the hou of the lord 
which is in jerusalem 7 28 and hath extend merci unto me befor the 
king and hi counsellor and befor all the king s mighti princ 
and i wa strengthen a the hand of the lord my god wa upon me and 
i gather togeth out of israel chief men to go up with me 

8 1 these are now the chief of their father and thi is the 
genealog of them that went up with me from babylon in the reign of 
artaxerx the king 

8 2 of the son of phineha gershom of the son of ithamar daniel 
of the son of david hattush 

8 3 of the son of shechaniah of the son of pharosh zechariah and 
with him were reckon by genealog of the male an hundr and fifti 

8 4 of the son of pahathmoab elihoenai the son of zerahiah and with 
him two hundr male 

8 5 of the son of shechaniah the son of jahaziel and with him three 
hundr male 

8 6 of the son also of adin ebe the son of jonathan and with him 
fifti male 

8 7 and of the son of elam jeshaiah the son of athaliah and with 
him seventi male 

8 8 and of the son of shephatiah zebadiah the son of michael and 
with him fourscor male 

8 9 of the son of joab obadiah the son of jehiel and with him two 
hundr and eighteen male 

8 10 and of the son of shelomith the son of josiphiah and with him 
an hundr and threescor male 

8 11 and of the son of bebai zechariah the son of bebai and with 
him twenti and eight male 

8 12 and of the son of azgad johanan the son of hakkatan and with 
him an hundr and ten male 

8 13 and of the last son of adonikam whose name are these 
eliphelet jeiel and shemaiah and with them threescor male 

8 14 of the son also of bigvai uthai and zabbud and with them 
seventi male 

8 15 and i gather them togeth to the river that runneth to ahava 
and there abod we in tent three day and i view the peopl and 
the priest and found there none of the son of levi 

8 16 then sent i for eliez for ariel for shemaiah and for 
elnathan and for jarib and for elnathan and for nathan and for 
zechariah and for meshullam chief men also for joiarib and for 
elnathan men of understand 

8 17 and i sent them with command unto iddo the chief at the place 
casiphia and i told them what they should say unto iddo and to hi 
brother the nethinim at the place casiphia that they should bring 
unto u minist for the hou of our god 

8 18 and by the good hand of our god upon u they brought u a man of 
understand of the son of mahli the son of levi the son of 
israel and sherebiah with hi son and hi brother eighteen 8 19 
and hashabiah and with him jeshaiah of the son of merari hi 
brother and their son twenti 8 20 also of the nethinim whom 
david and the princ had appoint for the servic of the levit 
two hundr and twenti nethinim all of them were express by name 

8 21 then i proclaim a fast there at the river of ahava that we 
might afflict ourselv befor our god to seek of him a right way for 
u and for our littl one and for all our substanc 

8 22 for i wa asham to requir of the king a band of soldier and 
horseman to help u against the enemi in the way becau we had 
spoken unto the king say the hand of our god is upon all them for 
good that seek him but hi power and hi wrath is against all them 
that forsak him 

8 23 so we fast and besought our god for thi and he wa intreat 
of u 

8 24 then i separ twelv of the chief of the priest sherebiah 
hashabiah and ten of their brother with them 8 25 and weigh unto 
them the silver and the gold and the vessel even the offer of 
the hou of our god which the king and hi counsellor and hi 
lord and all israel there present had offer 8 26 i even weigh 
unto their hand six hundr and fifti talent of silver and silver 
vessel an hundr talent and of gold an hundr talent 8 27 also 
twenti bason of gold of a thousand dram and two vessel of fine 
copper preciou a gold 

8 28 and i said unto them ye are holi unto the lord the vessel are 
holi also and the silver and the gold are a freewil offer unto 
the lord god of your father 

8 29 watch ye and keep them until ye weigh them befor the chief of 
the priest and the levit and chief of the father of israel at 
jerusalem in the chamber of the hou of the lord 

8 30 so took the priest and the levit the weight of the silver and 
the gold and the vessel to bring them to jerusalem unto the hou 
of our god 

8 31 then we depart from the river of ahava on the twelfth day of 
the first month to go unto jerusalem and the hand of our god wa 
upon u and he deliv u from the hand of the enemi and of such 
a lay in wait by the way 

8 32 and we came to jerusalem and abod there three day 

8 33 now on the fourth day wa the silver and the gold and the vessel 
weigh in the hou of our god by the hand of meremoth the son of 
uriah the priest and with him wa eleazar the son of phineha and 
with them wa jozabad the son of jeshua and noadiah the son of 
binnui levit 8 34 by number and by weight of everi one and all 
the weight wa written at that time 

8 35 also the child of those that had been carri away which were 
come out of the captiv offer burnt offer unto the god of 
israel twelv bullock for all israel nineti and six ram seventi 
and seven lamb twelv he goat for a sin offer all thi wa a 
burnt offer unto the lord 

8 36 and they deliv the king s commiss unto the king s 
lieuten and to the governor on thi side the river and they 
further the peopl and the hou of god 

9 1 now when these thing were done the princ came to me say 
the peopl of israel and the priest and the levit have not 
separ themselv from the peopl of the land do accord to 
their abomin even of the canaanit the hittit the 
perizzit the jebusit the ammonit the moabit the egyptian 
and the amorit 

9 2 for they have taken of their daughter for themselv and for 
their son so that the holi seed have mingl themselv with the 
peopl of those land yea the hand of the princ and ruler hath 
been chief in thi trespass 

9 3 and when i heard thi thing i rent my garment and my mantl and 
pluck off the hair of my head and of my beard and sat down 
astoni 

9 4 then were assembl unto me everi one that trembl at the word 
of the god of israel becau of the transgress of those that had 
been carri away and i sat astoni until the even sacrif 

9 5 and at the even sacrif i aro up from my heavi and 
have rent my garment and my mantl i fell upon my knee and spread 
out my hand unto the lord my god 9 6 and said o my god i am 
asham and blush to lift up my face to thee my god for our 
iniqu are increa over our head and our trespass is grown up 
unto the heaven 

9 7 sinc the day of our father have we been in a great trespass 
unto thi day and for our iniqu have we our king and our 
priest been deliv into the hand of the king of the land to 
the sword to captiv and to a spoil and to confu of face a 
it is thi day 

9 8 and now for a littl space grace hath been shew from the lord 
our god to leav u a remnant to escap and to give u a nail in hi 
holi place that our god may lighten our eye and give u a littl 
reviv in our bondag 

9 9 for we were bondman yet our god hath not forsaken u in our 
bondag but hath extend merci unto u in the sight of the king of 
persia to give u a reviv to set up the hou of our god and to 
repair the desol thereof and to give u a wall in judah and in 
jerusalem 

9 10 and now o our god what shall we say after thi for we have 
forsaken thi command 9 11 which thou hast command by thi 
servant the prophet say the land unto which ye go to po 
it is an unclean land with the filthi of the peopl of the land 
with their abomin which have fill it from one end to anoth 
with their unclean 

9 12 now therefor give not your daughter unto their son neither 
take their daughter unto your son nor seek their peac or their 
wealth for ever that ye may be strong and eat the good of the land 
and leav it for an inherit to your child for ever 

9 13 and after all that is come upon u for our evil deed and for 
our great trespass see that thou our god hast punish u le 
than our iniqu deserv and hast given u such deliv a 
thi 9 14 should we again break thi command and join in 
affin with the peopl of these abomin wouldest not thou be 
angri with u till thou hadst consum u so that there should be no 
remnant nor escap 9 15 o lord god of israel thou art righteou 
for we remain yet escap a it is thi day behold we are befor 
thee in our trespass for we cannot stand befor thee becau of 
thi 

10 1 now when ezra had pray and when he had confess weep and 
cast himself down befor the hou of god there assembl unto him 
out of israel a veri great congreg of men and woman and child 
for the peopl wept veri sore 

10 2 and shechaniah the son of jehiel one of the son of elam 
answer and said unto ezra we have trespass against our god and 
have taken strang wife of the peopl of the land yet now there is 
hope in israel concern thi thing 

10 3 now therefor let u make a coven with our god to put away all 
the wife and such a are born of them accord to the counsel of 
my lord and of those that trembl at the command of our god and 
let it be done accord to the law 

10 4 ari for thi matter belongeth unto thee we also will be with 
thee be of good courag and do it 

10 5 then aro ezra and made the chief priest the levit and all 
israel to swear that they should do accord to thi word and they 
sware 

10 6 then ezra rose up from befor the hou of god and went into the 
chamber of johanan the son of eliashib and when he came thither he 
did eat no bread nor drink water for he mourn becau of the 
transgress of them that had been carri away 

10 7 and they made proclam throughout judah and jerusalem unto 
all the child of the captiv that they should gather themselv 
togeth unto jerusalem 10 8 and that whosoev would not come within 
three day accord to the counsel of the princ and the elder 
all hi substanc should be forfeit and himself separ from the 
congreg of those that had been carri away 

10 9 then all the men of judah and benjamin gather themselv 
togeth unto jerusalem within three day it wa the ninth month on 
the twentieth day of the month and all the peopl sat in the street 
of the hou of god trembl becau of thi matter and for the 
great rain 

10 10 and ezra the priest stood up and said unto them ye have 
transgress and have taken strang wife to increa the trespass 
of israel 

10 11 now therefor make confess unto the lord god of your father 
and do hi pleasur and separ yourselv from the peopl of the 
land and from the strang wife 

10 12 then all the congreg answer and said with a loud voic 
a thou hast said so must we do 

10 13 but the peopl are mani and it is a time of much rain and we 
are not abl to stand without neither is thi a work of one day or 
two for we are mani that have transgress in thi thing 

10 14 let now our ruler of all the congreg stand and let all 
them which have taken strang wife in our citi come at appoint 
time and with them the elder of everi citi and the judg thereof 
until the fierc wrath of our god for thi matter be turn from u 

10 15 onli jonathan the son of asahel and jahaziah the son of tikvah 
were employ about thi matter and meshullam and shabbethai the 
levit help them 

10 16 and the child of the captiv did so and ezra the priest 
with certain chief of the father after the hou of their father 
and all of them by their name were separ and sat down in the 
first day of the tenth month to examin the matter 

10 17 and they made an end with all the men that had taken strang 
wife by the first day of the first month 

10 18 and among the son of the priest there were found that had 
taken strang wife name of the son of jeshua the son of jozadak 
and hi brother maaseiah and eliez and jarib and gedaliah 

10 19 and they gave their hand that they would put away their wife 
and be guilti they offer a ram of the flock for their trespass 

10 20 and of the son of immer hanani and zebadiah 

10 21 and of the son of harim maaseiah and elijah and shemaiah 
and jehiel and uzziah 

10 22 and of the son of pashur elioenai maaseiah ishmael 
nethaneel jozabad and elasah 

10 23 also of the levit jozabad and shimei and kelaiah the same 
is kelita pethahiah judah and eliez 

10 24 of the singer also eliashib and of the porter shallum and 
telem and uri 

10 25 moreov of israel of the son of parosh ramiah and jeziah 
and malchiah and miamin and eleazar and malchijah and benaiah 

10 26 and of the son of elam mattaniah zechariah and jehiel and 
abdi and jeremoth and eliah 

10 27 and of the son of zattu elioenai eliashib mattaniah and 
jeremoth and zabad and aziza 

10 28 of the son also of bebai jehohanan hananiah zabbai and 
athlai 

10 29 and of the son of ban meshullam malluch and adaiah jashub 
and sheal and ramoth 

10 30 and of the son of pahathmoab adna and chelal benaiah 
maaseiah mattaniah bezaleel and binnui and manasseh 

10 31 and of the son of harim eliez ishijah malchiah shemaiah 
shimeon 10 32 benjamin malluch and shemariah 

10 33 of the son of hashum mattenai mattathah zabad eliphelet 
jeremai manasseh and shimei 

10 34 of the son of ban maadai amram and uel 10 35 benaiah 
bedeiah chelluh 10 36 vaniah meremoth eliashib 10 37 mattaniah 
mattenai and jaasau 10 38 and ban and binnui shimei 10 39 and 
shelemiah and nathan and adaiah 10 40 machnadebai shashai sharai 
10 41 azareel and shelemiah shemariah 10 42 shallum amariah and 
joseph 

10 43 of the son of nebo jeiel mattithiah zabad zebina jadau 
and joel benaiah 

10 44 all these had taken strang wife and some of them had wife by 
whom they had child 




the book of nehemiah 


1 1 the word of nehemiah the son of hachaliah and it came to pa 
in the month chisleu in the twentieth year a i wa in shushan the 
palac 1 2 that hanani one of my brother came he and certain men 
of judah and i ask them concern the jew that had escap which 
were left of the captiv and concern jerusalem 

1 3 and they said unto me the remnant that are left of the captiv 
there in the provinc are in great afflict and reproach the wall 
of jerusalem also is broken down and the gate thereof are burn 
with fire 

1 4 and it came to pa when i heard these word that i sat down and 
wept and mourn certain day and fast and pray befor the god 
of heaven 1 5 and said i beseech thee o lord god of heaven the 
great and terribl god that keepeth coven and merci for them that 
love him and observ hi command 1 6 let thine ear now be 
attent and thine eye open that thou mayest hear the prayer of 
thi servant which i pray befor thee now day and night for the 
child of israel thi servant and confess the sin of the child 
of israel which we have sin against thee both i and my father s 
hou have sin 

1 7 we have dealt veri corruptli against thee and have not kept the 
command nor the statut nor the judgment which thou 
commandedst thi servant mose 

1 8 rememb i beseech thee the word that thou commandedst thi 
servant mose say if ye transgress i will scatter you abroad 
among the nation 1 9 but if ye turn unto me and keep my 
command and do them though there were of you cast out unto the 
uttermost part of the heaven yet will i gather them from thenc and 
will bring them unto the place that i have chosen to set my name 
there 

1 10 now these are thi servant and thi peopl whom thou hast 
redeem by thi great power and by thi strong hand 

1 11 o lord i beseech thee let now thine ear be attent to the 
prayer of thi servant and to the prayer of thi servant who desir 
to fear thi name and prosper i pray thee thi servant thi day and 
grant him merci in the sight of thi man for i wa the king s 
cupbear 

2 1 and it came to pa in the month nisan in the twentieth year of 
artaxerx the king that wine wa befor him and i took up the wine 
and gave it unto the king now i had not been beforetim sad in hi 
presenc 

2 2 wherefor the king said unto me whi is thi counten sad 
see thou art not sick thi is noth el but sorrow of heart 
then i wa veri sore afraid 2 3 and said unto the king let the king 
live for ever whi should not my counten be sad when the citi 
the place of my father sepulchr lieth wast and the gate 
thereof are consum with fire 2 4 then the king said unto me for 
what dost thou make request so i pray to the god of heaven 

2 5 and i said unto the king if it plea the king and if thi 
servant have found favour in thi sight that thou wouldest send me 
unto judah unto the citi of my father sepulchr that i may build 
it 

2 6 and the king said unto me the queen also sit by him for 
how long shall thi journey be and when wilt thou return so it 
plea the king to send me and i set him a time 

2 7 moreov i said unto the king if it plea the king let letter 
be given me to the governor beyond the river that they may convey me 
over till i come into judah 2 8 and a letter unto asaph the keeper of 
the king s forest that he may give me timber to make beam for the 
gate of the palac which appertain to the hou and for the wall 
of the citi and for the hou that i shall enter into and the king 
grant me accord to the good hand of my god upon me 

2 9 then i came to the governor beyond the river and gave them the 
king s letter now the king had sent captain of the armi and 
horseman with me 

2 10 when sanballat the horonit and tobiah the servant the 
ammonit heard of it it griev them exceedingli that there wa come 
a man to seek the welfar of the child of israel 

2 11 so i came to jerusalem and wa there three day 

2 12 and i aro in the night i and some few men with me neither 
told i ani man what my god had put in my heart to do at jerusalem 
neither wa there ani beast with me save the beast that i rode upon 

2 13 and i went out by night by the gate of the valley even befor 
the dragon well and to the dung port and view the wall of 
jerusalem which were broken down and the gate thereof were consum 
with fire 

2 14 then i went on to the gate of the fountain and to the king s 
pool but there wa no place for the beast that wa under me to pa 

2 15 then went i up in the night by the brook and view the wall 
and turn back and enter by the gate of the valley and so 
return 

2 16 and the ruler knew not whither i went or what i did neither 
had i a yet told it to the jew nor to the priest nor to the 
nobl nor to the ruler nor to the rest that did the work 

2 17 then said i unto them ye see the distress that we are in how 
jerusalem lieth wast and the gate thereof are burn with fire 
come and let u build up the wall of jerusalem that we be no more a 
reproach 

2 18 then i told them of the hand of my god which wa good upon me a 
also the king s word that he had spoken unto me and they said let 
u rise up and build so they strengthen their hand for thi good 
work 

2 19 but when sanballat the horonit and tobiah the servant the 
ammonit and geshem the arabian heard it they laugh u to scorn 
and despi u and said what is thi thing that ye do will ye 
rebel against the king 2 20 then answer i them and said unto 
them the god of heaven he will prosper u therefor we hi servant 
will ari and build but ye have no portion nor right nor memori 
in jerusalem 

3 1 then eliashib the high priest rose up with hi brother the 
priest and they build the sheep gate they sanctifi it and set 
up the door of it even unto the tower of meah they sanctifi it 
unto the tower of hananeel 

3 2 and next unto him build the men of jericho and next to them 
build zaccur the son of imri 

3 3 but the fish gate did the son of hassenaah build who also laid 
the beam thereof and set up the door thereof the lock thereof 
and the bar thereof 

3 4 and next unto them repair meremoth the son of urijah the son of 
koz and next unto them repair meshullam the son of berechiah the 
son of meshezabeel and next unto them repair zadok the son of 
baana 

3 5 and next unto them the tekoit repair but their nobl put not 
their neck to the work of their lord 

3 6 moreov the old gate repair jehoiada the son of paseah and 
meshullam the son of besodeiah they laid the beam thereof and set 
up the door thereof and the lock thereof and the bar thereof 

3 7 and next unto them repair melatiah the gibeonit and jadon the 
meronothit the men of gibeon and of mizpah unto the throne of the 
governor on thi side the river 

3 8 next unto him repair uzziel the son of harhaiah of the 
goldsmith 

next unto him also repair hananiah the son of one of the 
apothecari and they fortifi jerusalem unto the broad wall 

3 9 and next unto them repair rephaiah the son of hur the ruler of 
the half part of jerusalem 

3 10 and next unto them repair jedaiah the son of harumaph even 
over against hi hou and next unto him repair hattush the son of 
hashabniah 

3 11 malchijah the son of harim and hashub the son of pahathmoab 
repair the other piec and the tower of the furnac 

3 12 and next unto him repair shallum the son of halohesh the ruler 
of the half part of jerusalem he and hi daughter 

3 13 the valley gate repair hanun and the inhabit of zanoah 
they built it and set up the door thereof the lock thereof and 
the bar thereof and a thousand cubit on the wall unto the dung 
gate 

3 14 but the dung gate repair malchiah the son of rechab the ruler 
of part of bethhaccerem he built it and set up the door thereof 
the lock thereof and the bar thereof 

3 15 but the gate of the fountain repair shallun the son of 
colhozeh the ruler of part of mizpah he built it and cover it 
and set up the door thereof the lock thereof and the bar thereof 
and the wall of the pool of siloah by the king s garden and unto the 
stair that go down from the citi of david 

3 16 after him repair nehemiah the son of azbuk the ruler of the 
half part of bethzur unto the place over against the sepulchr of 
david and to the pool that wa made and unto the hou of the 
mighti 

3 17 after him repair the levit rehum the son of ban next unto 
him repair hashabiah the ruler of the half part of keilah in hi 
part 

3 18 after him repair their brother bavai the son of henadad the 
ruler of the half part of keilah 

3 19 and next to him repair ezer the son of jeshua the ruler of 
mizpah anoth piec over against the go up to the armouri at the 
turn of the wall 

3 20 after him baruch the son of zabbai earnestli repair the other 
piec from the turn of the wall unto the door of the hou of 
eliashib the high priest 

3 21 after him repair meremoth the son of urijah the son of koz 
anoth piec from the door of the hou of eliashib even to the end 
of the hou of eliashib 

3 22 and after him repair the priest the men of the plain 

3 23 after him repair benjamin and hashub over against their hou 

after him repair azariah the son of maaseiah the son of ananiah by 
hi hou 

3 24 after him repair binnui the son of henadad anoth piec from 
the hou of azariah unto the turn of the wall even unto the 
corner 

3 25 palal the son of uzai over against the turn of the wall and 
the tower which lieth out from the king s high hou that wa by the 
court of the prison after him pedaiah the son of parosh 

3 26 moreov the nethinim dwelt in ophel unto the place over 
against the water gate toward the east and the tower that lieth out 

3 27 after them the tekoit repair anoth piec over against the 
great tower that lieth out even unto the wall of ophel 

3 28 from abov the hor gate repair the priest everi one over 
against hi hou 

3 29 after them repair zadok the son of immer over against hi 
hou 

after him repair also shemaiah the son of shechaniah the keeper of 
the east gate 

3 30 after him repair hananiah the son of shelemiah and hanun the 
sixth son of zalaph anoth piec after him repair meshullam the 
son of berechiah over against hi chamber 

3 31 after him repair malchiah the goldsmith s son unto the place of 
the nethinim and of the merchant over against the gate miphkad 
and to the go up of the corner 

3 32 and between the go up of the corner unto the sheep gate 
repair the goldsmith and the merchant 

4 1 but it came to pa that when sanballat heard that we build the 
wall he wa wroth and took great indign and mock the jew 

4 2 and he spake befor hi brother and the armi of samaria and 
said what do these feebl jew will they fortifi themselv will 
they sacrif will they make an end in a day will they reviv the 
stone out of the heap of the rubbish which are burn 4 3 now 
tobiah the ammonit wa by him and he said even that which they 
build if a fox go up he shall even break down their stone wall 

4 4 hear o our god for we are despi and turn their reproach upon 
their own head and give them for a prey in the land of captiv 4 5 
and cover not their iniqu and let not their sin be blot out 
from befor thee for they have provok thee to anger befor the 
builder 

4 6 so built we the wall and all the wall wa join togeth unto 
the half thereof for the peopl had a mind to work 

4 7 but it came to pa that when sanballat and tobiah and the 
arabian and the ammonit and the ashdodit heard that the wall 
of jerusalem were made up and that the breach began to be stop 
then they were veri wroth 4 8 and conspir all of them togeth to 
come and to fight against jerusalem and to hinder it 

4 9 nevertheless we made our prayer unto our god and set a watch 
against them day and night becau of them 

4 10 and judah said the strength of the bearer of burden is 
decay and there is much rubbish so that we are not abl to build 
the wall 

4 11 and our adversari said they shall not know neither see till 
we come in the midst among them and slay them and cau the work to 
cea 

4 12 and it came to pa that when the jew which dwelt by them came 
they said unto u ten time from all place whenc ye shall return 
unto u they will be upon you 

4 13 therefor set i in the lower place behind the wall and on the 
higher place i even set the peopl after their famili with their 
sword their spear and their bow 

4 14 and i look and rose up and said unto the nobl and to the 
ruler and to the rest of the peopl be not ye afraid of them 
rememb the lord which is great and terribl and fight for your 
brother your son and your daughter your wife and your hou 

4 15 and it came to pa when our enemi heard that it wa known 
unto u and god had brought their counsel to nought that we return 
all of u to the wall everi one unto hi work 

4 16 and it came to pa from that time forth that the half of my 
servant wrought in the work and the other half of them held both the 
spear the shield and the bow and the habergeon and the ruler 
were behind all the hou of judah 

4 17 they which build on the wall and they that bare burden with 
those that lade everi one with one of hi hand wrought in the work 
and with the other hand held a weapon 

4 18 for the builder everi one had hi sword gird by hi side and 
so build and he that sound the trumpet wa by me 

4 19 and i said unto the nobl and to the ruler and to the rest of 
the peopl the work is great and larg and we are separ upon the 
wall one far from anoth 

4 20 in what place therefor ye hear the sound of the trumpet resort 
ye thither unto u our god shall fight for u 

4 21 so we labour in the work and half of them held the spear from 
the rise of the morn till the star appear 

4 22 likewi at the same time said i unto the peopl let everi one 
with hi servant lodg within jerusalem that in the night they may be 
a guard to u and labour on the day 

4 23 so neither i nor my brother nor my servant nor the men of 
the guard which follow me none of u put off our cloth save 
that everi one put them off for wash 

5 1 and there wa a great cri of the peopl and of their wife against 
their brother the jew 

5 2 for there were that said we our son and our daughter are 
mani therefor we take up corn for them that we may eat and live 

5 3 some also there were that said we have mortgag our land 
vineyard and hou that we might buy corn becau of the dearth 

5 4 there were also that said we have borrow money for the king s 
tribut and that upon our land and vineyard 

5 5 yet now our flesh is a the flesh of our brother our child a 
their child and lo we bring into bondag our son and our 
daughter to be servant and some of our daughter are brought unto 
bondag alreadi neither is it in our power to redeem them for other 
men have our land and vineyard 

5 6 and i wa veri angri when i heard their cri and these word 

5 7 then i consult with myself and i rebuk the nobl and the 
ruler and said unto them ye exact usuri everi one of hi brother 
and i set a great assembl against them 

5 8 and i said unto them we after our abil have redeem our 
brother the jew which were sold unto the heathen and will ye even 
sell your brother or shall they be sold unto u then held they 
their peac and found noth to answer 

5 9 also i said it is not good that ye do ought ye not to walk in 
the fear of our god becau of the reproach of the heathen our 
enemi 5 10 i likewi and my brother and my servant might 
exact of them money and corn i pray you let u leav off thi usuri 

5 11 restor i pray you to them even thi day their land their 
vineyard their oliveyard and their hou also the hundredth part 
of the money and of the corn the wine and the oil that ye exact of 
them 

5 12 then said they we will restor them and will requir noth of 
them so will we do a thou sayest then i call the priest and 
took an oath of them that they should do accord to thi promi 

5 13 also i shook my lap and said so god shake out everi man from 
hi hou and from hi labour that performeth not thi promi even 
thu be he shaken out and empti and all the congreg said 
amen and prai the lord and the peopl did accord to thi 
promi 

5 14 moreov from the time that i wa appoint to be their governor 
in the land of judah from the twentieth year even unto the two and 
thirtieth year of artaxerx the king that is twelv year i and my 
brother have not eaten the bread of the governor 

5 15 but the former governor that had been befor me were chargeabl 
unto the peopl and had taken of them bread and wine besid forti 
shekel of silver yea even their servant bare rule over the peopl 
but so did not i becau of the fear of god 

5 16 yea also i continu in the work of thi wall neither bought we 
ani land and all my servant were gather thither unto the work 

5 17 moreov there were at my tabl an hundr and fifti of the jew 
and ruler besid those that came unto u from among the heathen that 
are about u 

5 18 now that which wa prepar for me daili wa one ox and six 
choic sheep also fowl were prepar for me and onc in ten day 
store of all sort of wine yet for all thi requir not i the bread 
of the governor becau the bondag wa heavi upon thi peopl 

5 19 think upon me my god for good accord to all that i have 
done for thi peopl 

6 1 now it came to pa when sanballat and tobiah and geshem the 
arabian and the rest of our enemi heard that i had build the 
wall and that there wa no breach left therein though at that time 
i had not set up the door upon the gate 6 2 that sanballat and 
geshem sent unto me say come let u meet togeth in some one of 
the villag in the plain of ono but they thought to do me mischief 

6 3 and i sent messeng unto them say i am do a great work 
so that i cannot come down whi should the work cea whilst i leav 
it and come down to you 6 4 yet they sent unto me four time after 
thi sort and i answer them after the same manner 

6 5 then sent sanballat hi servant unto me in like manner the fifth 
time with an open letter in hi hand 6 6 wherein wa written it is 
report among the heathen and gashmu saith it that thou and the 
jew think to rebel for which cau thou buildest the wall that thou 
mayest be their king accord to these word 

6 7 and thou hast also appoint prophet to preach of thee at 
jerusalem say there is a king in judah and now shall it be 
report to the king accord to these word come now therefor and 
let u take counsel togeth 

6 8 then i sent unto him say there are no such thing done a 
thou sayest but thou feignest them out of thine own heart 

6 9 for they all made u afraid say their hand shall be weaken 
from the work that it be not done now therefor o god strengthen 
my hand 

6 10 afterward i came unto the hou of shemaiah the son of delaiah 
the son of mehetabeel who wa shut up and he said let u meet 
togeth in the hou of god within the templ and let u shut the 
door of the templ for they will come to slay thee yea in the 
night will they come to slay thee 

6 11 and i said should such a man a i flee and who is there that 
be a i am would go into the templ to save hi life i will not 
go in 

6 12 and lo i perceiv that god had not sent him but that he 
pronounc thi propheci against me for tobiah and sanballat had 
hire him 

6 13 therefor wa he hire that i should be afraid and do so and 
sin and that they might have matter for an evil report that they 
might reproach me 

6 14 my god think thou upon tobiah and sanballat accord to these 
their work and on the prophetess noadiah and the rest of the 
prophet that would have put me in fear 

6 15 so the wall wa finish in the twenti and fifth day of the month 
elul in fifti and two day 

6 16 and it came to pa that when all our enemi heard thereof and 
all the heathen that were about u saw these thing they were much 
cast down in their own eye for they perceiv that thi work wa 
wrought of our god 

6 17 moreov in those day the nobl of judah sent mani letter unto 
tobiah and the letter of tobiah came unto them 

6 18 for there were mani in judah sworn unto him becau he wa the 
son in law of shechaniah the son of arah and hi son johanan had 
taken the daughter of meshullam the son of berechiah 

6 19 also they report hi good deed befor me and utter my word 
to him and tobiah sent letter to put me in fear 

7 1 now it came to pa when the wall wa built and i had set up the 
door and the porter and the singer and the levit were appoint 
7 2 that i gave my brother hanani and hananiah the ruler of the 
palac charg over jerusalem for he wa a faith man and fear 
god abov mani 

7 3 and i said unto them let not the gate of jerusalem be open 
until the sun be hot and while they stand by let them shut the 
door and bar them and appoint watch of the inhabit of 
jerusalem everi one in hi watch and everi one to be over against 
hi hou 

7 4 now the citi wa larg and great but the peopl were few therein 
and the hou were not build 

7 5 and my god put into mine heart to gather togeth the nobl and 
the ruler and the peopl that they might be reckon by genealog 
and i found a regist of the genealog of them which came up at the 
first and found written therein 7 6 these are the child of the 
provinc that went up out of the captiv of those that had been 
carri away whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carri 
away and came again to jerusalem and to judah everi one unto hi 
citi 7 7 who came with zerubbabel jeshua nehemiah azariah 
raamiah nahamani mordecai bilshan mispereth bigvai nehum 
baanah the number i say of the men of the peopl of israel wa

two

7 60 all the nethinim and the child of solomon s servant were 
three hundr nineti and two 

7 61 and these were they which went up also from telmelah telharesha 
cherub addon and immer but they could not shew their father s 
hou nor their seed whether they were of israel 

7 62 the child of delaiah the child of tobiah the child of 
nekoda six hundr forti and two 

7 63 and of the priest the child of habaiah the child of koz 
the child of barzillai which took one of the daughter of 
barzillai the gileadit to wife and wa call after their name 

7 64 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by 
genealog but it wa not found therefor were they a pollut put 
from the priesthood 

7 65 and the tirshatha said unto them that they should not eat of the 
most holi thing till there stood up a priest with urim and thummim 

7 66 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three 
hundr and threescor 7 67 besid their manserv and their 
maidserv of whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirti 
and seven and they had two hundr forti and five sing men and 
sing woman 

7 68 their hor seven hundr thirti and six their mule two 
hundr forti and five 7 69 their camel four hundr thirti and 
five six thousand seven hundr and twenti as 

7 70 and some of the chief of the father gave unto the work the 
tirshatha gave to the treasur a thousand dram of gold fifti bason 
five hundr and thirti priest garment 

7 71 and some of the chief of the father gave to the treasur of the 
work twenti thousand dram of gold and two thousand and two hundr 
pound of silver 

7 72 and that which the rest of the peopl gave wa twenti thousand 
dram of gold and two thousand pound of silver and threescor and 
seven priest garment 

7 73 so the priest and the levit and the porter and the 
singer and some of the peopl and the nethinim and all israel 
dwelt in their citi and when the seventh month came the child 
of israel were in their citi 

8 1 and all the peopl gather themselv togeth a one man into 
the street that wa befor the water gate and they spake unto ezra 
the scribe to bring the book of the law of mose which the lord had 
command to israel 

8 2 and ezra the priest brought the law befor the congreg both 
of men and woman and all that could hear with understand upon the 
first day of the seventh month 

8 3 and he read therein befor the street that wa befor the water 
gate from the morn until midday befor the men and the woman and 
those that could understand and the ear of all the peopl were 
attent unto the book of the law 

8 4 and ezra the scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood which they had 
made for the purpo and besid him stood mattithiah and shema and 
anaiah and urijah and hilkiah and maaseiah on hi right hand and 
on hi left hand pedaiah and mishael and malchiah and hashum and 
hashbadana zechariah and meshullam 

8 5 and ezra open the book in the sight of all the peopl for he 
wa abov all the peopl and when he open it all the peopl stood 
up 8 6 and ezra bless the lord the great god and all the peopl 
answer amen amen with lift up their hand and they bow 
their head and worship the lord with their face to the ground 

8 7 also jeshua and ban and sherebiah jamin akkub shabbethai 
hodijah maaseiah kelita azariah jozabad hanan pelaiah and the 
levit cau the peopl to understand the law and the peopl stood 
in their place 

8 8 so they read in the book in the law of god distinctli and gave 
the sen and cau them to understand the read 

8 9 and nehemiah which is the tirshatha and ezra the priest the 
scribe and the levit that taught the peopl said unto all the 
peopl thi day is holi unto the lord your god mourn not nor weep 
for all the peopl wept when they heard the word of the law 

8 10 then he said unto them go your way eat the fat and drink the 
sweet and send portion unto them for whom noth is prepar for 
thi day is holi unto our lord neither be ye sorri for the joy of 
the lord is your strength 

8 11 so the levit still all the peopl say hold your peac 
for the day is holi neither be ye griev 

8 12 and all the peopl went their way to eat and to drink and to 
send portion and to make great mirth becau they had understood 
the word that were declar unto them 

8 13 and on the second day were gather togeth the chief of the 
father of all the peopl the priest and the levit unto ezra the 
scribe even to understand the word of the law 

8 14 and they found written in the law which the lord had command by 
mose that the child of israel should dwell in booth in the feast 
of the seventh month 8 15 and that they should publish and proclaim 
in all their citi and in jerusalem say go forth unto the 
mount and fetch oliv branch and pine branch and myrtl 
branch and palm branch and branch of thick tree to make 
booth a it is written 

8 16 so the peopl went forth and brought them and made themselv 
booth everi one upon the roof of hi hou and in their court and 
in the court of the hou of god and in the street of the water 
gate and in the street of the gate of ephraim 

8 17 and all the congreg of them that were come again out of the 
captiv made booth and sat under the booth for sinc the day of 
jeshua the son of nun unto that day had not the child of israel 
done so and there wa veri great glad 

8 18 also day by day from the first day unto the last day he read in 
the book of the law of god and they kept the feast seven day and on 
the eighth day wa a solemn assembl accord unto the manner 

9 1 now in the twenti and fourth day of thi month the child of 
israel were assembl with fast and with sackcloth and earth 
upon them 

9 2 and the seed of israel separ themselv from all stranger 
and stood and confess their sin and the iniqu of their 
father 

9 3 and they stood up in their place and read in the book of the law 
of the lord their god one fourth part of the day and anoth fourth 
part they confess and worship the lord their god 

9 4 then stood up upon the stair of the levit jeshua and ban 
kadmiel shebaniah bunni sherebiah ban and chenani and cri 
with a loud voic unto the lord their god 

9 5 then the levit jeshua and kadmiel ban hashabniah 
sherebiah hodijah shebaniah and pethahiah said stand up and bless 
the lord your god for ever and ever and bless be thi gloriou name 
which is exalt abov all bless and prai 

9 6 thou even thou art lord alon thou hast made heaven the heaven 
of heaven with all their host the earth and all thing that are 
therein the sea and all that is therein and thou preservest them 
all and the host of heaven worshippeth thee 

9 7 thou art the lord the god who didst choo abram and broughtest 
him forth out of ur of the chald and gavest him the name of 
abraham 9 8 and foundest hi heart faith befor thee and madest a 
coven with him to give the land of the canaanit the hittit 
the amorit and the perizzit and the jebusit and the 
girgashit to give it i say to hi seed and hast perform thi 
word for thou art righteou 9 9 and didst see the afflict of our 
father in egypt and heardest their cri by the red sea 9 10 and 
shewedst sign and wonder upon pharaoh and on all hi servant and 
on all the peopl of hi land for thou knewest that they dealt 
proudli against them so didst thou get thee a name a it is thi 
day 

9 11 and thou didst divid the sea befor them so that they went 
through the midst of the sea on the dri land and their persecutor 
thou threwest into the deep a a stone into the mighti water 

9 12 moreov thou leddest them in the day by a cloudi pillar and in 
the night by a pillar of fire to give them light in the way wherein 
they should go 

9 13 thou camest down also upon mount sinai and spakest with them 
from heaven and gavest them right judgment and true law good 
statut and command 9 14 and madest known unto them thi holi 
sabbath and commandedst them precept statut and law by the 
hand of mose thi servant 9 15 and gavest them bread from heaven for 
their hunger and broughtest forth water for them out of the rock for 
their thirst and promisedst them that they should go in to po 
the land which thou hadst sworn to give them 

9 16 but they and our father dealt proudli and harden their neck 
and hearken not to thi command 9 17 and refu to obey 
neither were mind of thi wonder that thou didst among them but 
harden their neck and in their rebellion appoint a captain to 
return to their bondag but thou art a god readi to pardon graciou 
and merci slow to anger and of great kind and forsookest 
them not 

9 18 yea when they had made them a molten calf and said thi is thi 
god that brought thee up out of egypt and had wrought great 
provoc 9 19 yet thou in thi manifold merci forsookest them 
not in the wilder the pillar of the cloud depart not from them 
by day to lead them in the way neither the pillar of fire by night 
to shew them light and the way wherein they should go 

9 20 thou gavest also thi good spirit to instruct them and 
withheldest not thi manna from their mouth and gavest them water for 
their thirst 

9 21 yea forti year didst thou sustain them in the wilder so 
that they lack noth their cloth wax not old and their foot 
swell not 

9 22 moreov thou gavest them kingdom and nation and didst divid 
them into corner so they poss the land of sihon and the land 
of the king of heshbon and the land of og king of bashan 

9 23 their child also multipliedst thou a the star of heaven and 
broughtest them into the land concern which thou hadst promi to 
their father that they should go in to po it 

9 24 so the child went in and poss the land and thou 
subduedst befor them the inhabit of the land the canaanit and 
gavest them into their hand with their king and the peopl of the 
land that they might do with them a they would 

9 25 and they took strong citi and a fat land and poss hou 
full of all good well dig vineyard and oliveyard and fruit 
tree in abund so they did eat and were fill and becam fat 
and delight themselv in thi great good 

9 26 nevertheless they were disobedi and rebel against thee 
and cast thi law behind their back and slew thi prophet which 
testifi against them to turn them to thee and they wrought great 
provoc 

9 27 therefor thou deliveredst them into the hand of their enemi 
who vex them and in the time of their troubl when they cri unto 
thee thou heardest them from heaven and accord to thi manifold 
merci thou gavest them saviour who save them out of the hand of 
their enemi 

9 28 but after they had rest they did evil again befor thee 
therefor leftest thou them in the land of their enemi so that they 
had the dominion over them yet when they return and cri unto 
thee thou heardest them from heaven and mani time didst thou 
deliv them accord to thi merci 9 29 and testifiedst against 
them that thou mightest bring them again unto thi law yet they dealt 
proudli and hearken not unto thi command but sin against 
thi judgment which if a man do he shall live in them and 
withdrew the shoulder and harden their neck and would not hear 

9 30 yet mani year didst thou forbear them and testifiedst against 
them by thi spirit in thi prophet yet would they not give ear 
therefor gavest thou them into the hand of the peopl of the land 

9 31 nevertheless for thi great merci sake thou didst not utterli 
consum them nor forsak them for thou art a graciou and merci 
god 

9 32 now therefor our god the great the mighti and the terribl 
god who keepest coven and merci let not all the troubl seem 
littl befor thee that hath come upon u on our king on our 
princ and on our priest and on our prophet and on our father 
and on all thi peopl sinc the time of the king of assyria unto 
thi day 

9 33 howbeit thou art just in all that is brought upon u for thou 
hast done right but we have done wickedli 9 34 neither have our 
king our princ our priest nor our father kept thi law nor 
hearken unto thi command and thi testimoni wherewith thou 
didst testifi against them 

9 35 for they have not serv thee in their kingdom and in thi great 
good that thou gavest them and in the larg and fat land which 
thou gavest befor them neither turn they from their wick work 

9 36 behold we are servant thi day and for the land that thou 
gavest unto our father to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof 
behold we are servant in it 9 37 and it yieldeth much increa unto 
the king whom thou hast set over u becau of our sin also they 
have dominion over our bodi and over our cattl at their pleasur 
and we are in great distress 

9 38 and becau of all thi we make a sure coven and write it 
and our princ levit and priest seal unto it 

10 1 now those that seal were nehemiah the tirshatha the son of 
hachaliah and zidkijah 10 2 seraiah azariah jeremiah 10 3 pashur 
amariah malchijah 10 4 hattush shebaniah malluch 10 5 harim 
meremoth obadiah 10 6 daniel ginnethon baruch 10 7 meshullam 
abijah mijamin 10 8 maaziah bilgai shemaiah these were the 
priest 

10 9 and the levit both jeshua the son of azaniah binnui of the 
son of henadad kadmiel 10 10 and their brother shebaniah 
hodijah kelita pelaiah hanan 10 11 micha rehob hashabiah 10 12 
zaccur sherebiah shebaniah 10 13 hodijah ban beninu 

10 14 the chief of the peopl parosh pahathmoab elam zatthu ban 
10 15 bunni azgad bebai 10 16 adonijah bigvai adin 10 17 ater 
hizkijah azzur 10 18 hodijah hashum bezai 10 19 hariph anathoth 
nebai 10 20 magpiash meshullam hezir 10 21 meshezabeel zadok 
jaddua 10 22 pelatiah hanan anaiah 10 23 hoshea hananiah hashub 
10 24 hallohesh pileha shobek 10 25 rehum hashabnah maaseiah 
10 26 and ahijah hanan anan 10 27 malluch harim baanah 

10 28 and the rest of the peopl the priest the levit the 
porter the singer the nethinim and all they that had separ 
themselv from the peopl of the land unto the law of god their 
wife their son and their daughter everi one have knowledg 
and have understand 10 29 they clave to their brother their 
nobl and enter into a cur and into an oath to walk in god s 
law which wa given by mose the servant of god and to observ and 
do all the command of the lord our lord and hi judgment and 
hi statut 10 30 and that we would not give our daughter unto the 
peopl of the land not take their daughter for our son 10 31 and 
if the peopl of the land bring ware or ani victual on the sabbath 
day to sell that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath or on 
the holi day and that we would leav the seventh year and the 
exact of everi debt 

10 32 also we made ordin for u to charg ourselv yearli with 
the third part of a shekel for the servic of the hou of our god 
10 33 for the shewbread and for the continu meat offer and for 
the continu burnt offer of the sabbath of the new moon for 
the set feast and for the holi thing and for the sin offer to 
make an aton for israel and for all the work of the hou of our 
god 

10 34 and we cast the lot among the priest the levit and the 
peopl for the wood offer to bring it into the hou of our god 
after the hou of our father at time appoint year by year to 
burn upon the altar of the lord our god a it is written in the law 
10 35 and to bring the firstfruit of our ground and the firstfruit 
of all fruit of all tree year by year unto the hou of the lord 
10 36 also the firstborn of our son and of our cattl a it is 
written in the law and the firstl of our herd and of our flock 
to bring to the hou of our god unto the priest that minist in 
the hou of our god 10 37 and that we should bring the firstfruit 
of our dough and our offer and the fruit of all manner of tree 
of wine and of oil unto the priest to the chamber of the hou of 
our god and the tith of our ground unto the levit that the same 
levit might have the tith in all the citi of our tillag 

10 38 and the priest the son of aaron shall be with the levit when 
the levit take tith and the levit shall bring up the tith of 
the tith unto the hou of our god to the chamber into the 
treasur hou 

10 39 for the child of israel and the child of levi shall bring 
the offer of the corn of the new wine and the oil unto the 
chamber where are the vessel of the sanctuari and the priest that 
minist and the porter and the singer and we will not forsak 
the hou of our god 

11 1 and the ruler of the peopl dwelt at jerusalem the rest of the 
peopl also cast lot to bring one of ten to dwell in jerusalem the 
holi citi and nine part to dwell in other citi 

11 2 and the peopl bless all the men that willingli offer 
themselv to dwell at jerusalem 

11 3 now these are the chief of the provinc that dwelt in jerusalem 
but in the citi of judah dwelt everi one in hi poss in their 
citi to wit israel the priest and the levit and the 
nethinim and the child of solomon s servant 

11 4 and at jerusalem dwelt certain of the child of judah and of 
the child of benjamin of the child of judah athaiah the son of 
uzziah the son of zechariah the son of amariah the son of 
shephatiah the son of mahalaleel of the child of perez 11 5 and 
maaseiah the son of baruch the son of colhozeh the son of hazaiah 
the son of adaiah the son of joiarib the son of zechariah the son 
of shiloni 

11 6 all the son of perez that dwelt at jerusalem were four hundr 
threescor and eight valiant men 

11 7 and these are the son of benjamin sallu the son of meshullam 
the son of jo the son of pedaiah the son of kolaiah the son of 
maaseiah the son of ithiel the son of jesaiah 

11 8 and after him gabbai sallai nine hundr twenti and eight 

11 9 and joel the son of zichri wa their over and judah the son 
of senuah wa second over the citi 

11 10 of the priest jedaiah the son of joiarib jachin 

11 11 seraiah the son of hilkiah the son of meshullam the son of 
zadok the son of meraioth the son of ahitub wa the ruler of the 
hou of god 

11 12 and their brother that did the work of the hou were eight 
hundr twenti and two and adaiah the son of jeroham the son of 
pelaliah the son of amzi the son of zechariah the son of pashur 
the son of malchiah 

11 13 and hi brother chief of the father two hundr forti and 
two and amashai the son of azareel the son of ahasai the son of 
meshillemoth the son of immer 11 14 and their brother mighti men 
of valour an hundr twenti and eight and their over wa 
zabdiel the son of one of the great men 

11 15 also of the levit shemaiah the son of hashub the son of 
azrikam the son of hashabiah the son of bunni 11 16 and shabbethai 
and jozabad of the chief of the levit had the oversight of the 
outward busi of the hou of god 

11 17 and mattaniah the son of micha the son of zabdi the son of 
asaph wa the princip to begin the thanksgiv in prayer and 
bakbukiah the second among hi brother and abda the son of shammua 
the son of galal the son of jeduthun 

11 18 all the levit in the holi citi were two hundr fourscor and 
four 

11 19 moreov the porter akkub talmon and their brother that 
kept the gate were an hundr seventi and two 

11 20 and the residu of israel of the priest and the levit were 
in all the citi of judah everi one in hi inherit 

11 21 but the nethinim dwelt in ophel and ziha and gispa were over 
the nethinim 

11 22 the over also of the levit at jerusalem wa uzzi the son 
of ban the son of hashabiah the son of mattaniah the son of micha 
of the son of asaph the singer were over the busi of the hou 
of god 

11 23 for it wa the king s command concern them that a 
certain portion should be for the singer due for everi day 

11 24 and pethahiah the son of meshezabeel of the child of zerah 
the son of judah wa at the king s hand in all matter concern the 
peopl 

11 25 and for the villag with their field some of the child of 
judah dwelt at kirjatharba and in the villag thereof and at dibon 
and in the villag thereof and at jekabzeel and in the villag 
thereof 11 26 and at jeshua and at moladah and at bethphelet 11 27 
and at hazarshu and at beersheba and in the villag thereof 
11 28 and at ziklag and at mekonah and in the villag thereof 
11 29 and at enrimmon and at zareah and at jarmuth 11 30 zanoah 
adullam and in their villag at lachish and the field thereof at 
azekah and in the villag thereof and they dwelt from beersheba 
unto the valley of hinnom 

11 31 the child also of benjamin from geba dwelt at michmash and 
aija and bethel and in their villag 

11 32 and at anathoth nob ananiah 11 33 hazor ramah gittaim 
11 34 hadid zeboim neballat 11 35 lod and ono the valley of 
craftsman 

11 36 and of the levit were divi in judah and in benjamin 

12 1 now these are the priest and the levit that went up with 
zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and jeshua seraiah jeremiah ezra 
12 2 amariah malluch hattush 12 3 shechaniah rehum meremoth 12 4 
iddo ginnetho abijah 12 5 miamin maadiah bilgah 12 6 shemaiah 
and joiarib jedaiah 12 7 sallu amok hilkiah jedaiah these were 
the chief of the priest and of their brother in the day of jeshua 

12 8 moreov the levit jeshua binnui kadmiel sherebiah judah 
and mattaniah which wa over the thanksgiv he and hi brother 

12 9 also bakbukiah and unni their brother were over against them 
in the watch 

12 10 and jeshua begat joiakim joiakim also begat eliashib and 
eliashib begat joiada 12 11 and joiada begat jonathan and jonathan 
begat jaddua 

12 12 and in the day of joiakim were priest the chief of the 
father of seraiah meraiah of jeremiah hananiah 12 13 of ezra 
meshullam of amariah jehohanan 12 14 of melicu jonathan of 
shebaniah joseph 12 15 of harim adna of meraioth helkai 12 16 of 
iddo zechariah of ginnethon meshullam 12 17 of abijah zichri of 
miniamin of moadiah piltai 12 18 of bilgah shammua of shemaiah 
jehonathan 12 19 and of joiarib mattenai of jedaiah uzzi 12 20 of 
sallai kallai of amok eber 12 21 of hilkiah hashabiah of 
jedaiah nethaneel 

12 22 the levit in the day of eliashib joiada and johanan and 
jaddua were record chief of the father also the priest to the 
reign of dariu the persian 

12 23 the son of levi the chief of the father were written in the 
book of the chronicl even until the day of johanan the son of 
eliashib 

12 24 and the chief of the levit hashabiah sherebiah and jeshua 
the son of kadmiel with their brother over against them to prai 
and to give thank accord to the command of david the man of 
god ward over against ward 

12 25 mattaniah and bakbukiah obadiah meshullam talmon akkub 
were porter keep the ward at the threshold of the gate 

12 26 these were in the day of joiakim the son of jeshua the son of 
jozadak and in the day of nehemiah the governor and of ezra the 
priest the scribe 

12 27 and at the dedic of the wall of jerusalem they sought the 
levit out of all their place to bring them to jerusalem to keep 
the dedic with glad both with thanksgiv and with 
sing with cymbal psalteri and with harp 

12 28 and the son of the singer gather themselv togeth both 
out of the plain countri round about jerusalem and from the villag 
of netophathi 12 29 also from the hou of gilgal and out of the 
field of geba and azmaveth for the singer had build them villag 
round about jerusalem 

12 30 and the priest and the levit purifi themselv and 
purifi the peopl and the gate and the wall 

12 31 then i brought up the princ of judah upon the wall and 
appoint two great compani of them that gave thank whereof one 
went on the right hand upon the wall toward the dung gate 12 32 and 
after them went hoshaiah and half of the princ of judah 12 33 and 
azariah ezra and meshullam 12 34 judah and benjamin and shemaiah 
and jeremiah 12 35 and certain of the priest son with trumpet 
name zechariah the son of jonathan the son of shemaiah the son of 
mattaniah the son of michaiah the son of zaccur the son of asaph 
12 36 and hi brother shemaiah and azarael milalai gilalai maai 
nethaneel and judah hanani with the music instrument of david 
the man of god and ezra the scribe befor them 

12 37 and at the fountain gate which wa over against them they went 
up by the stair of the citi of david at the go up of the wall 
abov the hou of david even unto the water gate eastward 

12 38 and the other compani of them that gave thank went over against 
them and i after them and the half of the peopl upon the wall from 
beyond the tower of the furnac even unto the broad wall 12 39 and 
from abov the gate of ephraim and abov the old gate and abov the 
fish gate and the tower of hananeel and the tower of meah even unto 
the sheep gate and they stood still in the prison gate 

12 40 so stood the two compani of them that gave thank in the hou 
of god and i and the half of the ruler with me 12 41 and the 
priest eliakim maaseiah miniamin michaiah elioenai zechariah 
and hananiah with trumpet 12 42 and maaseiah and shemaiah and 
eleazar and uzzi and jehohanan and malchijah and elam and ezer 
and the singer sang loud with jezrahiah their over 

12 43 also that day they offer great sacrif and rejoic for 
god had made them rejoic with great joy the wife also and the 
child rejoic so that the joy of jerusalem wa heard even afar 
off 

12 44 and at that time were some appoint over the chamber for the 
treasur for the offer for the firstfruit and for the tith 
to gather into them out of the field of the citi the portion of 
the law for the priest and levit for judah rejoic for the 
priest and for the levit that wait 

12 45 and both the singer and the porter kept the ward of their god 
and the ward of the purif accord to the command of 
david and of solomon hi son
