12 46 for in the day of david and asaph of old there were chief of 
the singer and song of prai and thanksgiv unto god 

12 47 and all israel in the day of zerubbabel and in the day of 
nehemiah gave the portion of the singer and the porter everi day 
hi portion and they sanctifi holi thing unto the levit and the 
levit sanctifi them unto the child of aaron 

13 1 on that day they read in the book of mose in the audienc of the 
peopl and therein wa found written that the ammonit and the 
moabit should not come into the congreg of god for ever 13 2 
becau they met not the child of israel with bread and with water 
but hire balaam against them that he should cur them howbeit our 
god turn the cur into a bless 

13 3 now it came to pa when they had heard the law that they 
separ from israel all the mix multitud 

13 4 and befor thi eliashib the priest have the oversight of the 
chamber of the hou of our god wa alli unto tobiah 13 5 and he 
had prepar for him a great chamber where aforetim they laid the 
meat offer the frankincen and the vessel and the tith of 
the corn the new wine and the oil which wa command to be given 
to the levit and the singer and the porter and the offer of 
the priest 

13 6 but in all thi time wa not i at jerusalem for in the two and 
thirtieth year of artaxerx king of babylon came i unto the king and 
after certain day obtain i leav of the king 13 7 and i came to 
jerusalem and understood of the evil that eliashib did for tobiah in 
prepar him a chamber in the court of the hou of god 

13 8 and it griev me sore therefor i cast forth all the household 
stuff to tobiah out of the chamber 

13 9 then i command and they clean the chamber and thither 
brought i again the vessel of the hou of god with the meat 
offer and the frankincen 

13 10 and i perceiv that the portion of the levit had not been 
given them for the levit and the singer that did the work were 
fled everi one to hi field 

13 11 then contend i with the ruler and said whi is the hou of 
god forsaken and i gather them togeth and set them in their 
place 

13 12 then brought all judah the tith of the corn and the new wine 
and the oil unto the treasuri 

13 13 and i made treasur over the treasuri shelemiah the priest 
and zadok the scribe and of the levit pedaiah and next to them 
wa hanan the son of zaccur the son of mattaniah for they were 
count faith and their offic wa to distribut unto their 
brother 

13 14 rememb me o my god concern thi and wipe not out my good 
deed that i have done for the hou of my god and for the offic 
thereof 

13 15 in those day saw i in judah some tread wine press on the 
sabbath and bring in sheaf and lade as a also wine 
grape and fig and all manner of burden which they brought into 
jerusalem on the sabbath day and i testifi against them in the day 
wherein they sold victual 

13 16 there dwelt men of tyre also therein which brought fish and 
all manner of ware and sold on the sabbath unto the child of 
judah and in jerusalem 

13 17 then i contend with the nobl of judah and said unto them 
what evil thing is thi that ye do and profan the sabbath day 
13 18 did not your father thu and did not our god bring all thi 
evil upon u and upon thi citi yet ye bring more wrath upon israel 
by profan the sabbath 

13 19 and it came to pa that when the gate of jerusalem began to 
be dark befor the sabbath i command that the gate should be shut 
and charg that they should not be open till after the sabbath and 
some of my servant set i at the gate that there should no burden be 
brought in on the sabbath day 

13 20 so the merchant and seller of all kind of ware lodg without 
jerusalem onc or twice 

13 21 then i testifi against them and said unto them whi lodg ye 
about the wall if ye do so again i will lay hand on you from that 
time forth came they no more on the sabbath 

13 22 and i command the levit that they should clean themselv 
and that they should come and keep the gate to sanctifi the sabbath 
day 

rememb me o my god concern thi also and spare me accord to 
the great of thi merci 

13 23 in those day also saw i jew that had marri wife of ashdod 
of ammon and of moab 13 24 and their child spake half in the 
speech of ashdod and could not speak in the jew languag but 
accord to the languag of each peopl 

13 25 and i contend with them and cur them and smote certain of 
them and pluck off their hair and made them swear by god say 
ye shall not give your daughter unto their son nor take their 
daughter unto your son or for yourselv 

13 26 did not solomon king of israel sin by these thing yet among 
mani nation wa there no king like him who wa belov of hi god 
and god made him king over all israel nevertheless even him did 
outlandish woman cau to sin 

13 27 shall we then hearken unto you to do all thi great evil to 
transgress against our god in marri strang wife 13 28 and one 
of the son of joiada the son of eliashib the high priest wa son in 
law to sanballat the horonit therefor i chase him from me 

13 29 rememb them o my god becau they have defil the 
priesthood and the coven of the priesthood and of the levit 

13 30 thu clean i them from all stranger and appoint the ward 
of the priest and the levit everi one in hi busi 13 31 and 
for the wood offer at time appoint and for the firstfruit 
rememb me o my god for good 




the book of esther 


1 1 now it came to pa in the day of ahasueru thi is ahasueru 
which reign from india even unto ethiopia over an hundr and 
seven and twenti provinc 1 2 that in those day when the king 
ahasueru sat on the throne of hi kingdom which wa in shushan the 
palac 1 3 in the third year of hi reign he made a feast unto all 
hi princ and hi servant the power of persia and medium the 
nobl and princ of the provinc be befor him 1 4 when he 
shew the rich of hi gloriou kingdom and the honour of hi 
excel majesti mani day even an hundr and fourscor day 

1 5 and when these day were expir the king made a feast unto all 
the peopl that were present in shushan the palac both unto great 
and small seven day in the court of the garden of the king s 
palac 1 6 where were white green and blue hang fasten with 
cord of fine linen and purpl to silver ring and pillar of marbl 
the bed were of gold and silver upon a pavement of red and blue 
and white and black marbl 

1 7 and they gave them drink in vessel of gold the vessel be 
diver one from anoth and royal wine in abund accord to 
the state of the king 

1 8 and the drink wa accord to the law none did compel for so 
the king had appoint to all the offic of hi hou that they 
should do accord to everi man s pleasur 

1 9 also vashti the queen made a feast for the woman in the royal 
hou which belong to king ahasueru 

1 10 on the seventh day when the heart of the king wa merri with 
wine he command mehuman biztha harbona bigtha and abagtha 
zethar and carca the seven chamberlain that serv in the presenc 
of ahasueru the king 1 11 to bring vashti the queen befor the king 
with the crown royal to shew the peopl and the princ her beauti 
for she wa fair to look on 

1 12 but the queen vashti refu to come at the king s command by 
hi chamberlain therefor wa the king veri wroth and hi anger 
burn in him 

1 13 then the king said to the wise men which knew the time for so 
wa the king s manner toward all that knew law and judgment 1 14 and 
the next unto him wa carshena shethar admatha tarshish mere 
marsena and memucan the seven princ of persia and medium which saw 
the king s face and which sat the first in the kingdom 1 15 what 
shall we do unto the queen vashti accord to law becau she hath 
not perform the command of the king ahasueru by the 
chamberlain 1 16 and memucan answer befor the king and the 
princ vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king onli but 
also to all the princ and to all the peopl that are in all the 
provinc of the king ahasueru 

1 17 for thi deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all woman so 
that they shall despi their husband in their eye when it shall be 
report the king ahasueru command vashti the queen to be brought 
in befor him but she came not 

1 18 likewi shall the ladi of persia and medium say thi day unto 
all the king s princ which have heard of the deed of the queen 
thu shall there ari too much contempt and wrath 

1 19 if it plea the king let there go a royal command from him 
and let it be written among the law of the persian and the mede 
that it be not alter that vashti come no more befor king 
ahasueru and let the king give her royal estat unto anoth that is 
better than she 

1 20 and when the king s decr which he shall make shall be publish 
throughout all hi empir for it is great all the wife shall give 
to their husband honour both to great and small 

1 21 and the say plea the king and the princ and the king did 
accord to the word of memucan 1 22 for he sent letter into all 
the king s provinc into everi provinc accord to the write 
thereof and to everi peopl after their languag that everi man 
should bear rule in hi own hou and that it should be publish 
accord to the languag of everi peopl 

2 1 after these thing when the wrath of king ahasueru wa appea 
he rememb vashti and what she had done and what wa decr 
against her 

2 2 then said the king s servant that minist unto him let there 
be fair young virgin sought for the king 2 3 and let the king 
appoint offic in all the provinc of hi kingdom that they may 
gather togeth all the fair young virgin unto shushan the palac to 
the hou of the woman unto the custodi of hege the king s 
chamberlain keeper of the woman and let their thing for 
purif be given them 2 4 and let the maiden which pleaseth the 
king be queen instead of vashti 

and the thing plea the king and he did so 

2 5 now in shushan the palac there wa a certain jew whose name wa 
mordecai the son of jair the son of shimei the son of kish a 
benjamit 2 6 who had been carri away from jerusalem with the 
captiv which had been carri away with jeconiah king of judah 
whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carri away 

2 7 and he brought up hadassah that is esther hi uncl s daughter 
for she had neither father nor mother and the maid wa fair and 
beauti whom mordecai when her father and mother were dead took 
for hi own daughter 

2 8 so it came to pa when the king s command and hi decr wa 
heard and when mani maiden were gather togeth unto shushan the 
palac to the custodi of hegai that esther wa brought also unto the 
king s hou to the custodi of hegai keeper of the woman 

2 9 and the maiden plea him and she obtain kind of him and 
he speedili gave her her thing for purif with such thing a 
belong to her and seven maiden which were meet to be given her 
out of the king s hou and he prefer her and her maid unto the 
best place of the hou of the woman 

2 10 esther had not shew her peopl nor her kindr for mordecai 
had charg her that she should not shew it 

2 11 and mordecai walk everi day befor the court of the woman s 
hou to know how esther did and what should becom of her 

2 12 now when everi maid s turn wa come to go in to king ahasueru 
after that she had been twelv month accord to the manner of the 
woman for so were the day of their purif accomplish to 
wit six month with oil of myrrh and six month with sweet odour 
and with other thing for the purifi of the woman 2 13 then thu 
came everi maiden unto the king whatsoev she desir wa given her 
to go with her out of the hou of the woman unto the king s hou 

2 14 in the even she went and on the morrow she return into the 
second hou of the woman to the custodi of shaashgaz the king s 
chamberlain which kept the concubin she came in unto the king no 
more except the king delight in her and that she were call by 
name 

2 15 now when the turn of esther the daughter of abihail the uncl of 
mordecai who had taken her for hi daughter wa come to go in unto 
the king she requir noth but what hegai the king s chamberlain 
the keeper of the woman appoint and esther obtain favour in the 
sight of all them that look upon her 

2 16 so esther wa taken unto king ahasueru into hi hou royal in 
the tenth month which is the month tebeth in the seventh year of hi 
reign 

2 17 and the king love esther abov all the woman and she obtain 
grace and favour in hi sight more than all the virgin so that he 
set the royal crown upon her head and made her queen instead of 
vashti 

2 18 then the king made a great feast unto all hi princ and hi 
servant even esther s feast and he made a relea to the provinc 
and gave gift accord to the state of the king 

2 19 and when the virgin were gather togeth the second time then 
mordecai sat in the king s gate 

2 20 esther had not yet shew her kindr nor her peopl a mordecai 
had charg her for esther did the command of mordecai like a 
when she wa brought up with him 

2 21 in those day while mordecai sat in the king s gate two of the 
king s chamberlain bigthan and teresh of those which kept the door 
were wroth and sought to lay hand on the king ahasueru 

2 22 and the thing wa known to mordecai who told it unto esther the 
queen and esther certifi the king thereof in mordecai s name 

2 23 and when inquisit wa made of the matter it wa found out 
therefor they were both hang on a tree and it wa written in the 
book of the chronicl befor the king 

3 1 after these thing did king ahasueru promot haman the son of 
hammedatha the agagit and advanc him and set hi seat abov all 
the princ that were with him 

3 2 and all the king s servant that were in the king s gate bow 
and reverenc haman for the king had so command concern him 
but mordecai bow not nor did him rever 

3 3 then the king s servant which were in the king s gate said unto 
mordecai whi transgressest thou the king s command 3 4 now it 
came to pa when they spake daili unto him and he hearken not 
unto them that they told haman to see whether mordecai s matter 
would stand for he had told them that he wa a jew 

3 5 and when haman saw that mordecai bow not nor did him rever 
then wa haman full of wrath 

3 6 and he thought scorn to lay hand on mordecai alon for they had 
shew him the peopl of mordecai wherefor haman sought to destroy 
all the jew that were throughout the whole kingdom of ahasueru even 
the peopl of mordecai 

3 7 in the first month that is the month nisan in the twelfth year 
of king ahasueru they cast pur that is the lot befor haman from 
day to day and from month to month to the twelfth month that is 
the month adar 

3 8 and haman said unto king ahasueru there is a certain peopl 
scatter abroad and disper among the peopl in all the provinc 
of thi kingdom and their law are diver from all peopl neither 
keep they the king s law therefor it is not for the king s profit 
to suffer them 

3 9 if it plea the king let it be written that they may be 
destroy and i will pay ten thousand talent of silver to the hand 
of those that have the charg of the busi to bring it into the 
king s treasuri 

3 10 and the king took hi ring from hi hand and gave it unto haman 
the son of hammedatha the agagit the jew enemi 

3 11 and the king said unto haman the silver is given to thee the 
peopl also to do with them a it seemeth good to thee 

3 12 then were the king s scribe call on the thirteenth day of the 
first month and there wa written accord to all that haman had 
command unto the king s lieuten and to the governor that were 
over everi provinc and to the ruler of everi peopl of everi 
provinc accord to the write thereof and to everi peopl after 
their languag in the name of king ahasueru wa it written and 
seal with the king s ring 

3 13 and the letter were sent by post into all the king s provinc 
to destroy to kill and to cau to perish all jew both young and 
old littl child and woman in one day even upon the thirteenth 
day of the twelfth month which is the month adar and to take the 
spoil of them for a prey 

3 14 the copi of the write for a command to be given in everi 
provinc wa publish unto all peopl that they should be readi 
against that day 

3 15 the post went out be hasten by the king s command and 
the decr wa given in shushan the palac and the king and haman sat 
down to drink but the citi shushan wa perplex 

4 1 when mordecai perceiv all that wa done mordecai rent hi 
cloth and put on sackcloth with ash and went out into the midst 
of the citi and cri with a loud and a bitter cri 4 2 and came even 
befor the king s gate for none might enter into the king s gate 
cloth with sackcloth 

4 3 and in everi provinc whithersoev the king s command and 
hi decr came there wa great mourn among the jew and fast 
and weep and wail and mani lay in sackcloth and ash 

4 4 so esther s maid and her chamberlain came and told it her then 
wa the queen exceedingli griev and she sent raiment to cloth 
mordecai and to take away hi sackcloth from him but he receiv it 
not 

4 5 then call esther for hatach one of the king s chamberlain 
whom he had appoint to attend upon her and gave him a command 
to mordecai to know what it wa and whi it wa 

4 6 so hatach went forth to mordecai unto the street of the citi 
which wa befor the king s gate 

4 7 and mordecai told him of all that had happen unto him and of 
the sum of the money that haman had promi to pay to the king s 
treasuri for the jew to destroy them 

4 8 also he gave him the copi of the write of the decr that wa 
given at shushan to destroy them to shew it unto esther and to 
declar it unto her and to charg her that she should go in unto the 
king to make supplic unto him and to make request befor him 
for her peopl 

4 9 and hatach came and told esther the word of mordecai 

4 10 again esther spake unto hatach and gave him command unto 
mordecai 4 11 all the king s servant and the peopl of the king s 
provinc do know that whosoev whether man or woman shall come 
unto the king into the inner court who is not call there is one 
law of hi to put him to death except such to whom the king shall 
hold out the golden sceptr that he may live but i have not been 
call to come in unto the king these thirti day 

4 12 and they told to mordecai esther s word 

4 13 then mordecai command to answer esther think not with thyself 
that thou shalt escap in the king s hou more than all the jew 

4 14 for if thou altogeth holdest thi peac at thi time then shall 
there enlarg and deliv ari to the jew from anoth 
place but thou and thi father s hou shall be destroy and who 
knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time a thi 
4 15 then esther bade them return mordecai thi answer 4 16 go 
gather togeth all the jew that are present in shushan and fast ye 
for me and neither eat nor drink three day night or day i also and 
my maiden will fast likewi and so will i go in unto the king 
which is not accord to the law and if i perish i perish 

4 17 so mordecai went hi way and did accord to all that esther 
had command him 

5 1 now it came to pa on the third day that esther put on her royal 
apparel and stood in the inner court of the king s hou over 
against the king s hou and the king sat upon hi royal throne in 
the royal hou over against the gate of the hou 

5 2 and it wa so when the king saw esther the queen stand in the 
court that she obtain favour in hi sight and the king held out to 
esther the golden sceptr that wa in hi hand so esther drew near 
and touch the top of the sceptr 

5 3 then said the king unto her what wilt thou queen esther and 
what is thi request it shall be even given thee to the half of the 
kingdom 

5 4 and esther answer if it seem good unto the king let the king 
and haman come thi day unto the banquet that i have prepar for him 

5 5 then the king said cau haman to make hast that he may do a 
esther hath said so the king and haman came to the banquet that 
esther had prepar 

5 6 and the king said unto esther at the banquet of wine what is thi 
petit and it shall be grant thee and what is thi request even 
to the half of the kingdom it shall be perform 

5 7 then answer esther and said my petit and my request is 5 8 
if i have found favour in the sight of the king and if it plea the 
king to grant my petit and to perform my request let the king and 
haman come to the banquet that i shall prepar for them and i will do 
to morrow a the king hath said 

5 9 then went haman forth that day joy and with a glad heart but 
when haman saw mordecai in the king s gate that he stood not up nor 
move for him he wa full of indign against mordecai 

5 10 nevertheless haman refrain himself and when he came home he 
sent and call for hi friend and zeresh hi wife 

5 11 and haman told them of the glori of hi rich and the multitud 
of hi child and all the thing wherein the king had promot him 
and how he had advanc him abov the princ and servant of the 
king 

5 12 haman said moreov yea esther the queen did let no man come in 
with the king unto the banquet that she had prepar but myself and 
to morrow am i invit unto her also with the king 

5 13 yet all thi availeth me noth so long a i see mordecai the 
jew sit at the king s gate 

5 14 then said zeresh hi wife and all hi friend unto him let a 
gallow be made of fifti cubit high and to morrow speak thou unto 
the king that mordecai may be hang thereon then go thou in merrili 
with the king unto the banquet and the thing plea haman and he 
cau the gallow to be made 

6 1 on that night could not the king sleep and he command to bring 
the book of record of the chronicl and they were read befor the 
king 

6 2 and it wa found written that mordecai had told of bigthana and 
teresh two of the king s chamberlain the keeper of the door who 
sought to lay hand on the king ahasueru 

6 3 and the king said what honour and digniti hath been done to 
mordecai for thi then said the king s servant that minist unto 
him there is noth done for him 

6 4 and the king said who is in the court now haman wa come into 
the outward court of the king s hou to speak unto the king to hang 
mordecai on the gallow that he had prepar for him 

6 5 and the king s servant said unto him behold haman standeth in 
the court and the king said let him come in 

6 6 so haman came in and the king said unto him what shall be done 
unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour now haman thought in 
hi heart to whom would the king delight to do honour more than to 
myself 6 7 and haman answer the king for the man whom the king 
delighteth to honour 6 8 let the royal apparel be brought which the 
king useth to wear and the hor that the king rideth upon and the 
crown royal which is set upon hi head 6 9 and let thi apparel and 
hor be deliv to the hand of one of the king s most nobl 
princ that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth 
to honour and bring him on horseback through the street of the citi 
and proclaim befor him thu shall it be done to the man whom the 
king delighteth to honour 

6 10 then the king said to haman make hast and take the apparel and 
the hor a thou hast said and do even so to mordecai the jew that 
sitteth at the king s gate let noth fail of all that thou hast 
spoken 

6 11 then took haman the apparel and the hor and array mordecai 
and brought him on horseback through the street of the citi and 
proclaim befor him thu shall it be done unto the man whom the 
king delighteth to honour 

6 12 and mordecai came again to the king s gate but haman hast to 
hi hou mourn and have hi head cover 

6 13 and haman told zeresh hi wife and all hi friend everi thing 
that had befallen him then said hi wise men and zeresh hi wife unto 
him if mordecai be of the seed of the jew befor whom thou hast 
begun to fall thou shalt not prevail against him but shalt sure 
fall befor him 

6 14 and while they were yet talk with him came the king s 
chamberlain and hast to bring haman unto the banquet that esther 
had prepar 

7 1 so the king and haman came to banquet with esther the queen 

7 2 and the king said again unto esther on the second day at the 
banquet of wine what is thi petit queen esther and it shall be 
grant thee and what is thi request and it shall be perform even 
to the half of the kingdom 

7 3 then esther the queen answer and said if i have found favour in 
thi sight o king and if it plea the king let my life be given me 
at my petit and my peopl at my request 7 4 for we are sold i 
and my peopl to be destroy to be slain and to perish but if we 
had been sold for bondman and bondwoman i had held my tongu 
although the enemi could not countervail the king s damag 

7 5 then the king ahasueru answer and said unto esther the queen 
who is he and where is he that durst presum in hi heart to do so 
7 6 and esther said the adversari and enemi is thi wick haman 
then haman wa afraid befor the king and the queen 

7 7 and the king ari from the banquet of wine in hi wrath went 
into the palac garden and haman stood up to make request for hi 
life to esther the queen for he saw that there wa evil determin 
against him by the king 

7 8 then the king return out of the palac garden into the place of 
the banquet of wine and haman wa fallen upon the bed whereon esther 
wa then said the king will he forc the queen also befor me in the 
hou a the word went out of king s mouth they cover haman s 
face 

7 9 and harbonah one of the chamberlain said befor the king 
behold also the gallow fifti cubit high which haman had made for 
mordecai who spoken good for the king standeth in the hou of 
haman then the king said hang him thereon 

7 10 so they hang haman on the gallow that he had prepar for 
mordecai then wa the king s wrath pacifi 

8 1 on that day did the king ahasueru give the hou of haman the 
jew enemi unto esther the queen and mordecai came befor the king 
for esther had told what he wa unto her 

8 2 and the king took off hi ring which he had taken from haman and 
gave it unto mordecai and esther set mordecai over the hou of 
haman 

8 3 and esther spake yet again befor the king and fell down at hi 
foot and besought him with tear to put away the mischief of haman 
the agagit and hi devic that he had devi against the jew 

8 4 then the king held out the golden sceptr toward esther so esther 
aro and stood befor the king 8 5 and said if it plea the king 
and if i have favour in hi sight and the thing seem right befor the 
king and i be plea in hi eye let it be written to rever the 
letter devi by haman the son of hammedatha the agagit which he 
wrote to destroy the jew which are in all the king s provinc 8 6 
for how can i endur to see the evil that shall come unto my peopl 
or how can i endur to see the destruct of my kindr 8 7 then 
the king ahasueru said unto esther the queen and to mordecai the jew 
behold i have given esther the hou of haman and him they have 
hang upon the gallow becau he laid hi hand upon the jew 

8 8 write ye also for the jew a it liketh you in the king s name 
and seal it with the king s ring for the write which is written in 
the king s name and seal with the king s ring may no man rever 

8 9 then were the king s scribe call at that time in the third 
month that is the month sivan on the three and twentieth day 
thereof and it wa written accord to all that mordecai command 
unto the jew and to the lieuten and the deputi and ruler of 
the provinc which are from india unto ethiopia an hundr twenti 
and seven provinc unto everi provinc accord to the write 
thereof and unto everi peopl after their languag and to the jew 
accord to their write and accord to their languag 

8 10 and he wrote in the king ahasueru name and seal it with the 
king s ring and sent letter by post on horseback and rider on 
mule camel and young dromedari 8 11 wherein the king grant 
the jew which were in everi citi to gather themselv togeth and 
to stand for their life to destroy to slay and to cau to perish 
all the power of the peopl and provinc that would assault them both 
littl one and woman and to take the spoil of them for a prey 8 12 
upon one day in all the provinc of king ahasueru name upon the 
thirteenth day of the twelfth month which is the month adar 

8 13 the copi of the write for a command to be given in everi 
provinc wa publish unto all peopl and that the jew should be 
readi against that day to aveng themselv on their enemi 

8 14 so the post that rode upon mule and camel went out be 
hasten and press on by the king s command and the decr wa 
given at shushan the palac 

8 15 and mordecai went out from the presenc of the king in royal 
apparel of blue and white and with a great crown of gold and with a 
garment of fine linen and purpl and the citi of shushan rejoic and 
wa glad 

8 16 the jew had light and glad and joy and honour 

8 17 and in everi provinc and in everi citi whithersoev the 
king s command and hi decr came the jew had joy and glad 
a feast and a good day and mani of the peopl of the land becam 
jew for the fear of the jew fell upon them 

9 1 now in the twelfth month that is the month adar on the 
thirteenth day of the same when the king s command and hi decr 
drew near to be put in execut in the day that the enemi of the 
jew hope to have power over them though it wa turn to the 
contrari that the jew had rule over them that hate them 9 2 the 
jew gather themselv togeth in their citi throughout all the 
provinc of the king ahasueru to lay hand on such a sought their 
hurt and no man could withstand them for the fear of them fell upon 
all peopl 

9 3 and all the ruler of the provinc and the lieuten and the 
deputi and offic of the king help the jew becau the fear 
of mordecai fell upon them 

9 4 for mordecai wa great in the king s hou and hi fame went out 
throughout all the provinc for thi man mordecai wax greater and 
greater 

9 5 thu the jew smote all their enemi with the stroke of the 
sword and slaughter and destruct and did what they would unto 
those that hate them 

9 6 and in shushan the palac the jew slew and destroy five hundr 
men 

9 7 and parshandatha and dalphon and aspatha 9 8 and poratha and 
adalia and aridatha 9 9 and parmashta and arisai and aridai and 
vajezatha 9 10 the ten son of haman the son of hammedatha the enemi 
of the jew slew they but on the spoil laid they not their hand 

9 11 on that day the number of those that were slain in shushan the 
palac wa brought befor the king 

9 12 and the king said unto esther the queen the jew have slain and 
destroy five hundr men in shushan the palac and the ten son of 
haman what have they done in the rest of the king s provinc now 
what is thi petit and it shall be grant thee or what is thi 
request further and it shall be done 

9 13 then said esther if it plea the king let it be grant to the 
jew which are in shushan to do to morrow also accord unto thi 
day s decr and let haman s ten son be hang upon the gallow 

9 14 and the king command it so to be done and the decr wa given 
at shushan and they hang haman s ten son 

9 15 for the jew that were in shushan gather themselv togeth on 
the fourteenth day also of the month adar and slew three hundr men 
at shushan but on the prey they laid not their hand 

9 16 but the other jew that were in the king s provinc gather 
themselv togeth and stood for their life and had rest from 
their enemi and slew of their foe seventi and five thousand but 
they laid not their hand on the prey 9 17 on the thirteenth day of 
the month adar and on the fourteenth day of the same rest they and 
made it a day of feast and glad 

9 18 but the jew that were at shushan assembl togeth on the 
thirteenth day thereof and on the fourteenth thereof and on the 
fifteenth day of the same they rest and made it a day of feast 
and glad 

9 19 therefor the jew of the villag that dwelt in the unwal 
town made the fourteenth day of the month adar a day of glad and 
feast and a good day and of send portion one to anoth 

9 20 and mordecai wrote these thing and sent letter unto all the 
jew that were in all the provinc of the king ahasueru both nigh 
and far 9 21 to stablish thi among them that they should keep the 
fourteenth day of the month adar and the fifteenth day of the same 
yearli 9 22 a the day wherein the jew rest from their enemi 
and the month which wa turn unto them from sorrow to joy and from 
mourn into a good day that they should make them day of feast 
and joy and of send portion one to anoth and gift to the 
poor 

9 23 and the jew undertook to do a they had begun and a mordecai 
had written unto them 9 24 becau haman the son of hammedatha the 
agagit the enemi of all the jew had devi against the jew to 
destroy them and had cast pur that is the lot to consum them and 
to destroy them 9 25 but when esther came befor the king he 
command by letter that hi wick devic which he devi against 
the jew should return upon hi own head and that he and hi son 
should be hang on the gallow 

9 26 wherefor they call these day purim after the name of pur 

therefor for all the word of thi letter and of that which they had 
seen concern thi matter and which had come unto them 9 27 the 
jew ordain and took upon them and upon their seed and upon all 
such a join themselv unto them so a it should not fail that 
they would keep these two day accord to their write and 
accord to their appoint time everi year 9 28 and that these day 
should be rememb and kept throughout everi gener everi 
famili everi provinc and everi citi and that these day of purim 
should not fail from among the jew nor the memori of them perish 
from their seed 

9 29 then esther the queen the daughter of abihail and mordecai the 
jew wrote with all author to confirm thi second letter of purim 

9 30 and he sent the letter unto all the jew to the hundr twenti 
and seven provinc of the kingdom of ahasueru with word of peac 
and truth 9 31 to confirm these day of purim in their time 
appoint accord a mordecai the jew and esther the queen had 
enjoin them and a they had decr for themselv and for their 
seed the matter of the fast and their cri 

9 32 and the decr of esther confirm these matter of purim and it 
wa written in the book 

10 1 and the king ahasueru laid a tribut upon the land and upon the 
isl of the sea 

10 2 and all the act of hi power and of hi might and the 
declar of the great of mordecai whereunto the king advanc 
him are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king 
of medium and persia 10 3 for mordecai the jew wa next unto king 
ahasueru and great among the jew and accept of the multitud of 
hi brother seek the wealth of hi peopl and speak peac to 
all hi seed 




the book of job 


1 1 there wa a man in the land of uz whose name wa job and that 
man wa perfect and upright and one that fear god and eschew evil 

1 2 and there were born unto him seven son and three daughter 

1 3 hi substanc also wa seven thousand sheep and three thousand 
camel and five hundr yoke of ox and five hundr she as and 
a veri great household so that thi man wa the greatest of all the 
men of the east 

1 4 and hi son went and feast in their hou everi one hi day 
and sent and call for their three sister to eat and to drink with 
them 

1 5 and it wa so when the day of their feast were gone about 
that job sent and sanctifi them and rose up earli in the morn 
and offer burnt offer accord to the number of them all for 
job said it may be that my son have sin and cur god in their 
heart thu did job continu 

1 6 now there wa a day when the son of god came to present 
themselv befor the lord and satan came also among them 

1 7 and the lord said unto satan whenc comest thou then satan 
answer the lord and said from go to and fro in the earth and 
from walk up and down in it 

1 8 and the lord said unto satan hast thou consid my servant job 
that there is none like him in the earth a perfect and an upright 
man one that feareth god and escheweth evil 1 9 then satan 
answer the lord and said doth job fear god for nought 1 10 hast 
not thou made an hedg about him and about hi hou and about all 
that he hath on everi side thou hast bless the work of hi hand 
and hi substanc is increa in the land 

1 11 but put forth thine hand now and touch all that he hath and he 
will cur thee to thi face 

1 12 and the lord said unto satan behold all that he hath is in thi 
power onli upon himself put not forth thine hand so satan went forth 
from the presenc of the lord 

1 13 and there wa a day when hi son and hi daughter were eat 
and drink wine in their eldest brother s hou 1 14 and there came 
a messeng unto job and said the ox were plow and the as 
feed besid them 1 15 and the sabean fell upon them and took 
them away yea they have slain the servant with the edg of the 
sword and i onli am escap alon to tell thee 

1 16 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said the 
fire of god is fallen from heaven and hath burn up the sheep and 
the servant and consum them and i onli am escap alon to tell 
thee 

1 17 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said the 
chaldean made out three band and fell upon the camel and have 
carri them away yea and slain the servant with the edg of the 
sword and i onli am escap alon to tell thee 

1 18 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said thi 
son and thi daughter were eat and drink wine in their eldest 
brother s hou 1 19 and behold there came a great wind from the 
wilder and smote the four corner of the hou and it fell upon 
the young men and they are dead and i onli am escap alon to tell 
thee 

1 20 then job aro and rent hi mantl and shave hi head and 
fell down upon the ground and worship 1 21 and said nake came i 
out of my mother s womb and nake shall i return thither the lord 
gave and the lord hath taken away bless be the name of the lord 

1 22 in all thi job sin not nor charg god foolishli 

2 1 again there wa a day when the son of god came to present 
themselv befor the lord and satan came also among them to present 
himself befor the lord 

2 2 and the lord said unto satan from whenc comest thou and satan 
answer the lord and said from go to and fro in the earth and 
from walk up and down in it 

2 3 and the lord said unto satan hast thou consid my servant job 
that there is none like him in the earth a perfect and an upright 
man one that feareth god and escheweth evil and still he holdeth 
fast hi integr although thou movedst me against him to destroy 
him without cau 

2 4 and satan answer the lord and said skin for skin yea all 
that a man hath will he give for hi life 

2 5 but put forth thine hand now and touch hi bone and hi flesh 
and he will cur thee to thi face 

2 6 and the lord said unto satan behold he is in thine hand but 
save hi life 

2 7 so went satan forth from the presenc of the lord and smote job 
with sore boil from the sole of hi foot unto hi crown 

2 8 and he took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal and he sat 
down among the ash 

2 9 then said hi wife unto him dost thou still retain thine 
integr cur god and die 

2 10 but he said unto her thou speakest a one of the foolish woman 
speaketh what shall we receiv good at the hand of god and shall we 
not receiv evil in all thi did not job sin with hi lip 

2 11 now when job s three friend heard of all thi evil that wa come 
upon him they came everi one from hi own place eliphaz the 
temanit and bildad the shuhit and zophar the naamathit for they 
had made an appoint togeth to come to mourn with him and to 
comfort him 

2 12 and when they lift up their eye afar off and knew him not 
they lift up their voic and wept and they rent everi one hi 
mantl and sprinkl dust upon their head toward heaven 

2 13 so they sat down with him upon the ground seven day and seven 
night and none spake a word unto him for they saw that hi grief 
wa veri great 

3 1 after thi open job hi mouth and cur hi day 

3 2 and job spake and said 3 3 let the day perish wherein i wa 
born and the night in which it wa said there is a man child 
conceiv 

3 4 let that day be dark let not god regard it from abov 
neither let the light shine upon it 

3 5 let dark and the shadow of death stain it let a cloud dwell 
upon it let the black of the day terrifi it 

3 6 a for that night let dark seiz upon it let it not be 
join unto the day of the year let it not come into the number of 
the month 

3 7 lo let that night be solitari let no joy voic come therein 

3 8 let them cur it that cur the day who are readi to rai up 
their mourn 

3 9 let the star of the twilight thereof be dark let it look for 
light but have none neither let it see the dawn of the day 3 10 
becau it shut not up the door of my mother s womb nor hid sorrow 
from mine eye 

3 11 whi die i not from the womb whi did i not give up the ghost 
when i came out of the belli 3 12 whi did the knee prevent me or 
whi the breast that i should suck 3 13 for now should i have lain 
still and been quiet i should have slept then had i been at rest 
3 14 with king and counsellor of the earth which build desol 
place for themselv 3 15 or with princ that had gold who fill 
their hou with silver 3 16 or a an hidden untim birth i had 
not been a infant which never saw light 

3 17 there the wick cea from troubl and there the weari be at 
rest 

3 18 there the prison rest togeth they hear not the voic of the 
oppressor 

3 19 the small and great are there and the servant is free from hi 
master 

3 20 wherefor is light given to him that is in miseri and life unto 
the bitter in soul 3 21 which long for death but it cometh not and 
dig for it more than for hid treasur 3 22 which rejoic 
exceedingli and are glad when they can find the grave 3 23 whi is 
light given to a man whose way is hid and whom god hath hedg in 
3 24 for my sigh cometh befor i eat and my roar are pour 
out like the water 

3 25 for the thing which i greatli fear is come upon me and that 
which i wa afraid of is come unto me 

3 26 i wa not in safeti neither had i rest neither wa i quiet yet 
troubl came 

4 1 then eliphaz the temanit answer and said 4 2 if we assay to 
commun with thee wilt thou be griev but who can withhold himself 
from speak 4 3 behold thou hast instruct mani and thou hast 
strengthen the weak hand 

4 4 thi word have upholden him that wa fall and thou hast 
strengthen the feebl knee 

4 5 but now it is come upon thee and thou faintest it toucheth thee 
and thou art troubl 

4 6 is not thi thi fear thi confid thi hope and the 
upright of thi way 4 7 rememb i pray thee who ever 
perish be innoc or where were the righteou cut off 4 8 
even a i have seen they that plow iniqu and sow wick reap 
the same 

4 9 by the blast of god they perish and by the breath of hi nostril 
are they consum 

4 10 the roar of the lion and the voic of the fierc lion and 
the teeth of the young lion are broken 

4 11 the old lion perisheth for lack of prey and the stout lion s 
whelp are scatter abroad 

4 12 now a thing wa secretli brought to me and mine ear receiv a 
littl thereof 

4 13 in thought from the vision of the night when deep sleep 
falleth on men 4 14 fear came upon me and trembl which made all 
my bone to shake 

4 15 then a spirit pa befor my face the hair of my flesh stood 
up 4 16 it stood still but i could not discern the form thereof an 
imag wa befor mine eye there wa silenc and i heard a voic 
say 4 17 shall mortal man be more just than god shall a man be 
more pure than hi maker 4 18 behold he put no trust in hi 
servant and hi angel he charg with folli 4 19 how much le in 
them that dwell in hou of clay whose foundat is in the dust 
which are crush befor the moth 4 20 they are destroy from 
morn to even they perish for ever without ani regard it 

4 21 doth not their excel which is in them go away they die 
even without wisdom 

5 1 call now if there be ani that will answer thee and to which of 
the saint wilt thou turn 5 2 for wrath killeth the foolish man and 
envi slayeth the silli one 

5 3 i have seen the foolish take root but suddenli i cur hi 
habit 

5 4 hi child are far from safeti and they are crush in the 
gate neither is there ani to deliv them 

5 5 whose harvest the hungri eateth up and taketh it even out of the 
thorn and the robber swalloweth up their substanc 

5 6 although afflict cometh not forth of the dust neither doth 
troubl spring out of the ground 5 7 yet man is born unto troubl a 
the spark fli upward 

5 8 i would seek unto god and unto god would i commit my cau 5 9 
which doeth great thing and unsearch marvel thing without 
number 5 10 who giveth rain upon the earth and sendeth water upon 
the field 5 11 to set up on high those that be low that those which 
mourn may be exalt to safeti 

5 12 he disappointeth the devic of the crafti so that their hand 
cannot perform their enterpri 

5 13 he taketh the wise in their own crafti and the counsel of 
the froward is carri headlong 

5 14 they meet with dark in the day time and grope in the noonday 
a in the night 

5 15 but he saveth the poor from the sword from their mouth and from 
the hand of the mighti 

5 16 so the poor hath hope and iniqu stoppeth her mouth 

5 17 behold happi is the man whom god correcteth therefor despi 
not thou the chasten of the almighti 5 18 for he maketh sore and 
bindeth up he woundeth and hi hand make whole 

5 19 he shall deliv thee in six troubl yea in seven there shall 
no evil touch thee 

5 20 in famin he shall redeem thee from death and in war from the 
power of the sword 

5 21 thou shalt be hid from the scourg of the tongu neither shalt 
thou be afraid of destruct when it cometh 

5 22 at destruct and famin thou shalt laugh neither shalt thou be 
afraid of the beast of the earth 

5 23 for thou shalt be in leagu with the stone of the field and the 
beast of the field shall be at peac with thee 

5 24 and thou shalt know that thi tabernacl shall be in peac and 
thou shalt visit thi habit and shalt not sin 

5 25 thou shalt know also that thi seed shall be great and thine 
offspr a the grass of the earth 

5 26 thou shalt come to thi grave in a full age like a a shock of 
corn cometh in in hi season 

5 27 lo thi we have search it so it is hear it and know thou it 
for thi good 

6 1 but job answer and said 6 2 oh that my grief were throughli 
weigh and my calam laid in the balanc togeth 6 3 for now 
it would be heavier than the sand of the sea therefor my word are 
swallow up 

6 4 for the arrow of the almighti are within me the poison whereof 
drinketh up my spirit the terror of god do set themselv in array 
against me 

6 5 doth the wild a bray when he hath grass or loweth the ox over 
hi fodder 6 6 can that which is unsavouri be eaten without salt or 
is there ani tast in the white of an egg 6 7 the thing that my 
soul refu to touch are a my sorrow meat 

6 8 oh that i might have my request and that god would grant me the 
thing that i long for 6 9 even that it would plea god to destroy 
me that he would let loo hi hand and cut me off 6 10 then 
should i yet have comfort yea i would harden myself in sorrow let 
him not spare for i have not conceal the word of the holi one 

6 11 what is my strength that i should hope and what is mine end 
that i should prolong my life 6 12 is my strength the strength of 
stone or is my flesh of brass 6 13 is not my help in me and is 
wisdom driven quit from me 6 14 to him that is afflict piti 
should be shew from hi friend but he forsaketh the fear of the 
almighti 

6 15 my brother have dealt deceit a a brook and a the stream 
of brook they pa away 6 16 which are blackish by reason of the 
ice and wherein the snow is hid 6 17 what time they wax warm they 
vanish when it is hot they are consum out of their place 

6 18 the path of their way are turn asid they go to noth and 
perish 

6 19 the troop of tema look the compani of sheba wait for 
them 

6 20 they were confound becau they had hope they came thither 
and were asham 

6 21 for now ye are noth ye see my cast down and are afraid 

6 22 did i say bring unto me or give a reward for me of your 
substanc 6 23 or deliv me from the enemi s hand or redeem me 
from the hand of the mighti 6 24 teach me and i will hold my 
tongu and cau me to understand wherein i have er 

6 25 how forcibl are right word but what doth your argu reprov 
6 26 do ye imagin to reprov word and the speech of one that is 
desper which are a wind 6 27 yea ye overwhelm the fatherless 
and ye dig a pit for your friend 

6 28 now therefor be content look upon me for it is evid unto 
you if i lie 

6 29 return i pray you let it not be iniqu yea return again my 
righteou is in it 

6 30 is there iniqu in my tongu cannot my tast discern perver 
thing 7 1 is there not an appoint time to man upon earth are not 
hi day also like the day of an hirel 7 2 a a servant 
earnestli desireth the shadow and a an hirel looketh for the 
reward of hi work 7 3 so am i made to po month of vaniti and 
wearisom night are appoint to me 

7 4 when i lie down i say when shall i ari and the night be gone 
and i am full of toss to and fro unto the dawn of the day 

7 5 my flesh is cloth with worm and clod of dust my skin is 
broken and becom loathsom 

7 6 my day are swifter than a weaver s shuttl and are spent without 
hope 

7 7 o rememb that my life is wind mine eye shall no more see good 

7 8 the eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more thine eye 
are upon me and i am not 

7 9 a the cloud is consum and vanisheth away so he that goeth down 
to the grave shall come up no more 

7 10 he shall return no more to hi hou neither shall hi place 
know him ani more 

7 11 therefor i will not refrain my mouth i will speak in the 
anguish of my spirit i will complain in the bitter of my soul 

7 12 am i a sea or a whale that thou settest a watch over me 7 13 
when i say my bed shall comfort me my couch shall ea my 
complaint 7 14 then thou scarest me with dream and terrifiest me 
through vision 7 15 so that my soul chooseth strangl and death 
rather than my life 

7 16 i loath it i would not live alway let me alon for my day 
are vaniti 

7 17 what is man that thou shouldest magnifi him and that thou 
shouldest set thine heart upon him 7 18 and that thou shouldest 
visit him everi morn and tri him everi moment 7 19 how long wilt 
thou not depart from me nor let me alon till i swallow down my 
spittl 7 20 i have sin what shall i do unto thee o thou 
preserv of men whi hast thou set me a a mark against thee so 
that i am a burden to myself 7 21 and whi dost thou not pardon my 
transgress and take away my iniqu for now shall i sleep in the 
dust and thou shalt seek me in the morn but i shall not be 

8 1 then answer bildad the shuhit and said 8 2 how long wilt thou 
speak these thing and how long shall the word of thi mouth be like 
a strong wind 8 3 doth god pervert judgment or doth the almighti 
pervert justic 8 4 if thi child have sin against him and he 
have cast them away for their transgress 8 5 if thou wouldest seek 
unto god betim and make thi supplic to the almighti 8 6 if 
thou wert pure and upright sure now he would awak for thee and 
make the habit of thi righteou prosper 

8 7 though thi begin wa small yet thi latter end should greatli 
increa 

8 8 for enquir i pray thee of the former age and prepar thyself 
to the search of their father 8 9 for we are but of yesterday and 
know noth becau our day upon earth are a shadow 8 10 shall 
not they teach thee and tell thee and utter word out of their 
heart 8 11 can the rush grow up without mire can the flag grow 
without water 8 12 whilst it is yet in hi green and not cut 
down it withereth befor ani other herb 

8 13 so are the path of all that forget god and the hypocrit s hope 
shall perish 8 14 whose hope shall be cut off and whose trust shall 
be a spider s web 

8 15 he shall lean upon hi hou but it shall not stand he shall 
hold it fast but it shall not endur 

8 16 he is green befor the sun and hi branch shooteth forth in hi 
garden 

8 17 hi root are wrap about the heap and seeth the place of 
stone 

8 18 if he destroy him from hi place then it shall deni him say 
i have not seen thee 

8 19 behold thi is the joy of hi way and out of the earth shall 
other grow 

8 20 behold god will not cast away a perfect man neither will he 
help the evil doer 8 21 till he fill thi mouth with laugh and 
thi lip with rejoic 

8 22 they that hate thee shall be cloth with shame and the dwell 
place of the wick shall come to nought 

9 1 then job answer and said 9 2 i know it is so of a truth but 
how should man be just with god 9 3 if he will contend with him he 
cannot answer him one of a thousand 

9 4 he is wise in heart and mighti in strength who hath harden 
himself against him and hath prosper 9 5 which removeth the 
mountain and they know not which overturneth them in hi anger 

9 6 which shaketh the earth out of her place and the pillar thereof 
trembl 

9 7 which commandeth the sun and it riseth not and sealeth up the 
star 

9 8 which alon spreadeth out the heaven and treadeth upon the wave 
of the sea 

9 9 which maketh arcturu orion and pleiad and the chamber of 
the south 

9 10 which doeth great thing past find out yea and wonder 
without number 

9 11 lo he goeth by me and i see him not he passeth on also but i 
perceiv him not 

9 12 behold he taketh away who can hinder him who will say unto 
him what doest thou 9 13 if god will not withdraw hi anger the 
proud helper do stoop under him 

9 14 how much le shall i answer him and choo out my word to 
reason with him 9 15 whom though i were righteou yet would i not 
answer but i would make supplic to my judg 

9 16 if i had call and he had answer me yet would i not believ 
that he had hearken unto my voic 

9 17 for he breaketh me with a tempest and multiplieth my wound 
without cau 

9 18 he will not suffer me to take my breath but filleth me with 
bitter 

9 19 if i speak of strength lo he is strong and if of judgment who 
shall set me a time to plead 9 20 if i justifi myself mine own 
mouth shall condemn me if i say i am perfect it shall also prove me 
perver 

9 21 though i were perfect yet would i not know my soul i would 
despi my life 

9 22 thi is one thing therefor i said it he destroyeth the perfect 
and the wick 

9 23 if the scourg slay suddenli he will laugh at the trial of the 
innoc 

9 24 the earth is given into the hand of the wick he covereth the 
face of the judg thereof if not where and who is he 9 25 now 
my day are swifter than a post they flee away they see no good 

9 26 they are pa away a the swift ship a the eagl that 
hasteth to the prey 

9 27 if i say i will forget my complaint i will leav off my 
heavi and comfort myself 9 28 i am afraid of all my sorrow i 
know that thou wilt not hold me innoc 

9 29 if i be wick whi then labour i in vain 9 30 if i wash myself 
with snow water and make my hand never so clean 9 31 yet shalt thou 
plung me in the ditch and mine own cloth shall abhor me 

9 32 for he is not a man a i am that i should answer him and we 
should come togeth in judgment 

9 33 neither is there ani daysman betwixt u that might lay hi hand 
upon u both 

9 34 let him take hi rod away from me and let not hi fear terrifi 
me 9 35 then would i speak and not fear him but it is not so with 
me 

10 1 my soul is weari of my life i will leav my complaint upon 
myself i will speak in the bitter of my soul 

10 2 i will say unto god do not condemn me shew me wherefor thou 
contendest with me 

10 3 is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress that thou 
shouldest despi the work of thine hand and shine upon the counsel 
of the wick 10 4 hast thou eye of flesh or seest thou a man 
seeth 10 5 are thi day a the day of man are thi year a man s 
day 10 6 that thou enquirest after mine iniqu and searchest 
after my sin 10 7 thou knowest that i am not wick and there is 
none that can deliv out of thine hand 

10 8 thine hand have made me and fashion me togeth round about 
yet thou dost destroy me 

10 9 rememb i beseech thee that thou hast made me a the clay and 
wilt thou bring me into dust again 10 10 hast thou not pour me out 
a milk and curdl me like chee 10 11 thou hast cloth me with 
skin and flesh and hast fenc me with bone and sinew 

10 12 thou hast grant me life and favour and thi visit hath 
preserv my spirit 

10 13 and these thing hast thou hid in thine heart i know that thi 
is with thee 

10 14 if i sin then thou markest me and thou wilt not acquit me from 
mine iniqu 

10 15 if i be wick woe unto me and if i be righteou yet will i 
not lift up my head i am full of confu therefor see thou mine 
afflict 10 16 for it increaseth thou huntest me a a fierc lion 
and again thou shewest thyself marvel upon me 

10 17 thou renewest thi wit against me and increasest thine 
indign upon me chang and war are against me 

10 18 wherefor then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb oh 
that i had given up the ghost and no eye had seen me 10 19 i should 
have been a though i had not been i should have been carri from 
the womb to the grave 

10 20 are not my day few cea then and let me alon that i may 
take comfort a littl 10 21 befor i go whenc i shall not return 
even to the land of dark and the shadow of death 10 22 a land of 
dark a dark itself and of the shadow of death without ani 
order and where the light is a dark 

11 1 then answer zophar the naamathit and said 11 2 should not 
the multitud of word be answer and should a man full of talk be 
justifi 11 3 should thi lie make men hold their peac and when 
thou mockest shall no man make thee asham 11 4 for thou hast 
said my doctrin is pure and i am clean in thine eye 

11 5 but oh that god would speak and open hi lip against thee 11 6 
and that he would shew thee the secret of wisdom that they are 
doubl to that which is know therefor that god exacteth of thee le 
than thine iniqu deserveth 

11 7 canst thou by search find out god canst thou find out the 
almighti unto perfect 11 8 it is a high a heaven what canst 
thou do deeper than hell what canst thou know 11 9 the measur 
thereof is longer than the earth and broader than the sea 

11 10 if he cut off and shut up or gather togeth then who can 
hinder him 11 11 for he knoweth vain men he seeth wick also 
will he not then consid it 11 12 for vain men would be wise 
though man be born like a wild a s colt 

11 13 if thou prepar thine heart and stretch out thine hand toward 
him 11 14 if iniqu be in thine hand put it far away and let not 
wick dwell in thi tabernacl 

11 15 for then shalt thou lift up thi face without spot yea thou 
shalt be stedfast and shalt not fear 11 16 becau thou shalt forget 
thi miseri and rememb it a water that pa away 11 17 and thine 
age shall be clearer than the noonday thou shalt shine forth thou 
shalt be a the morn

dig about thee and thou shalt take thi rest in safeti 

11 19 also thou shalt lie down and none shall make thee afraid yea 
mani shall make suit unto thee

escap and their hope shall be a the give up of the ghost 

12 1 and job answer and said 12 2 no doubt but ye are the peopl 
and wisdom shall die with you 

12 3 but i have understand a well a you i am not inferior to 
you yea who knoweth not such thing a these 12 4 i am a one 
mock of hi neighbour who calleth upon god and he answereth him 
the just upright man is laugh to scorn 

12 5 he that is readi to slip with hi foot is a a lamp despi in 
the thought of him that is at ea 

12 6 the tabernacl of robber prosper and they that provok god are 
secur into whose hand god bringeth abundantli 

12 7 but ask now the beast and they shall teach thee and the fowl 
of the air and they shall tell thee 12 8 or speak to the earth and 
it shall teach thee and the fish of the sea shall declar unto 
thee 

12 9 who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the lord hath 
wrought thi 12 10 in whose hand is the soul of everi live thing 
and the breath of all mankind 

12 11 doth not the ear tri word and the mouth tast hi meat 12 12 
with the ancient is wisdom and in length of day understand 

12 13 with him is wisdom and strength he hath counsel and 
understand 

12 14 behold he breaketh down and it cannot be built again he 
shutteth up a man and there can be no open 

12 15 behold he withholdeth the water and they dri up also he 
sendeth them out and they overturn the earth 

12 16 with him is strength and wisdom the deceiv and the deceiv 
are hi

fool 

12 18 he looseth the bond of king and girdeth their loin with a 
girdl 

12 19 he leadeth princ away spoil and overthroweth the mighti 

12 20 he removeth away the speech of the trusti and taketh away the 
understand of the age 

12 21 he poureth contempt upon princ and weakeneth the strength of 
the mighti 

12 22 he discovereth deep thing out of dark and bringeth out to 
light the shadow of death 

12 23 he increaseth the nation and destroyeth them he enlargeth the 
nation and straiteneth them again 

12 24 he taketh away the heart of the chief of the peopl of the 
earth and causeth them to wander in a wilder where there is no 
way 

12 25 they grope in the dark without light and he maketh them to 
stagger like a drunken man 

13 1 lo mine eye hath seen all thi mine ear hath heard and 
understood it 

13 2 what ye know the same do i know also i am not inferior unto 
you 

13 3 sure i would speak to the almighti and i desir to reason with 
god 

13 4 but ye are forger of lie ye are all physician of no valu 

13 5 o that ye would altogeth hold your peac and it should be your 
wisdom 

13 6 hear now my reason and hearken to the plead of my lip 

13 7 will ye speak wickedli for god and talk deceit for him 
13 8 will ye accept hi person will ye contend for god 13 9 is it 
good that he should search you out or a one man mocketh anoth do 
ye so mock him 13 10 he will sure reprov you if ye do secretli 
accept person 

13 11 shall not hi excel make you afraid and hi dread fall 
upon you 13 12 your remembr are like unto ash your bodi to 
bodi of clay 

13 13 hold your peac let me alon that i may speak and let come on 
me what will 

13 14 wherefor do i take my flesh in my teeth and put my life in 
mine hand 13 15 though he slay me yet will i trust in him but i 
will maintain mine own way befor him 

13 16 he also shall be my salvat for an hypocrit shall not come 
befor him 

13 17 hear dilig my speech and my declar with your ear 

13 18 behold now i have order my cau i know that i shall be 
justifi 

13 19 who is he that will plead with me for now if i hold my tongu 
i shall give up the ghost 

13 20 onli do not two thing unto me then will i not hide myself from 
thee 

13 21 withdraw thine hand far from me and let not thi dread make me 
afraid 

13 22 then call thou and i will answer or let me speak and answer 
thou me 

13 23 how mani are mine iniqu and sin make me to know my 
transgress and my sin 

13 24 wherefor hidest thou thi face and holdest me for thine enemi

the dri stubbl 13 26 for thou writest bitter thing against me and 
makest me to po the iniqu of my youth 

13 27 thou puttest my foot also in the stock and lookest narrowli 
unto all my path thou settest a print upon the heel of my foot

eaten 

14 1 man that is born of a woman is of few day and full of troubl 

14 2 he cometh forth like a flower and is cut down he fleeth also a 
a shadow and continueth not 

14 3 and doth thou open thine eye upon such an one and bringest me 
into judgment with thee 14 4 who can bring a clean thing out of an 
unclean not one 

14 5 see hi day are determin the number of hi month are with 
thee thou hast appoint hi bound that he cannot pa 14 6 turn 
from him that he may rest till he shall accomplish a an hirel 
hi day 

14 7 for there is hope of a tree if it be cut down that it will 
sprout again and that the tender branch thereof will not cea 

14 8 though the root thereof wax old in the earth and the stock 
thereof die in the ground 14 9 yet through the scent of water it will 
bud and bring forth bough like a plant 

14 10 but man dieth and wasteth away yea man giveth up the ghost 
and where is he 14 11 a the water fail from the sea and the flood 
decayeth and drieth up 14 12 so man lieth down and riseth not till 
the heaven be no more they shall not awak nor be rai out of 
their sleep 

14 13 o that thou wouldest hide me in the grave that thou wouldest 
keep me secret until thi wrath be past that thou wouldest appoint me 
a set time and rememb me 14 14 if a man die shall he live again 
all the day of my appoint time will i wait till my chang come 

14 15 thou shalt call and i will answer thee thou wilt have a desir 
to the work of thine hand 

14 16 for now thou numberest my step dost thou not watch over my 
sin 14 17 my transgress is seal up in a bag and thou sewest up 
mine iniqu 

14 18 and sure the mountain fall cometh to nought and the rock 
is remov out of hi place 

14 19 the water wear the stone thou washest away the thing which 
grow out of the dust of the earth and thou destroyest the hope of 
man 

14 20 thou prevailest for ever against him and he passeth thou 
changest hi counten and sendest him away 

14 21 hi son come to honour and he knoweth it not and they are 
brought low but he perceiveth it not of them 

14 22 but hi flesh upon him shall have pain and hi soul within him 
shall mourn 

15 1 then answer eliphaz the temanit and said 15 2 should a wise 
man utter vain knowledg and fill hi belli with the east wind 15 3 
should he reason with unprofit talk or with speech wherewith he 
can do no good 15 4 yea thou castest off fear and restrainest 
prayer befor god 

15 5 for thi mouth uttereth thine iniqu and thou choosest the 
tongu of the crafti 

15 6 thine own mouth condemneth thee and not i yea thine own lip 
testifi against thee 

15 7 art thou the first man that wa born or wast thou made befor 
the hill 15 8 hast thou heard the secret of god and dost thou 
restrain wisdom to thyself 15 9 what knowest thou that we know not 
what understandest thou which is not in u 15 10 with u are both 
the grayhead and veri age men much elder than thi father 

15 11 are the consol of god small with thee is there ani secret 
thing with thee 15 12 whi doth thine heart carri thee away and what 
do thi eye wink at 15 13 that thou turnest thi spirit against god 
and lettest such word go out of thi mouth 15 14 what is man that 
he should be clean and he which is born of a woman that he should be 
righteou 15 15 behold he putteth no trust in hi saint yea the 
heaven are not clean in hi sight 

15 16 how much more abomin and filthi is man which drinketh 
iniqu like water 15 17 i will shew thee hear me and that which 
i have seen i will declar 15 18 which wise men have told from their 
father and have not hid it 15 19 unto whom alon the earth wa 
given and no stranger pa among them 

15 20 the wick man travaileth with pain all hi day and the number 
of year is hidden to the oppressor 

15 21 a dread sound is in hi ear in prosper the destroy 
shall come upon him 

15 22 he believeth not that he shall return out of dark and he is 
wait for of the sword 

15 23 he wandereth abroad for bread say where is it he knoweth 
that the day of dark is readi at hi hand 

15 24 troubl and anguish shall make him afraid they shall prevail 
against him a a king readi to the battl 

15 25 for he stretcheth out hi hand against god and strengtheneth 
himself against the almighti 

15 26 he runneth upon him even on hi neck upon the thick bo of 
hi buckler 15 27 becau he covereth hi face with hi fat and 
maketh collop of fat on hi flank 

15 28 and he dwelleth in desol citi and in hou which no man 
inhabiteth which are readi to becom heap 

15 29 he shall not be rich neither shall hi substanc continu 
neither shall he prolong the perfect thereof upon the earth 

15 30 he shall not depart out of dark the flame shall dri up hi 
branch and by the breath of hi mouth shall he go away 

15 31 let not him that is deceiv trust in vaniti for vaniti shall 
be hi recomp 

15 32 it shall be accomplish befor hi time and hi branch shall 
not be green 

15 33 he shall shake off hi unrip grape a the vine and shall cast 
off hi flower a the oliv 

15 34 for the congreg of hypocrit shall be desol and fire 
shall consum the tabernacl of briberi 

15 35 they conceiv mischief and bring forth vaniti and their belli 
prepareth deceit 

16 1 then job answer and said 16 2 i have heard mani such thing 
miser comfort are ye all 

16 3 shall vain word have an end or what emboldeneth thee that thou 
answerest 16 4 i also could speak a ye do if your soul were in my 
soul s stead i could heap up word against you and shake mine head 
at you 

16 5 but i would strengthen you with my mouth and the move of my 
lip should asswag your grief 

16 6 though i speak my grief is not asswag and though i forbear 
what am i ea 16 7 but now he hath made me weari thou hast made 
desol all my compani 

16 8 and thou hast fill me with wrinkl which is a wit against 
me and my lean rise up in me beareth wit to my face 

16 9 he teareth me in hi wrath who hateth me he gnasheth upon me 
with hi teeth mine enemi sharpeneth hi eye upon me 

16 10 they have gape upon me with their mouth they have smitten me 
upon the cheek reproach they have gather themselv togeth 
against me 

16 11 god hath deliv me to the ungodli and turn me over into 
the hand of the wick 

16 12 i wa at ea but he hath broken me asund he hath also taken 
me by my neck and shaken me to piec and set me up for hi mark 

16 13 hi archer compass me round about he cleaveth my rein 
asund and doth not spare he poureth out my gall upon the ground 

16 14 he breaketh me with breach upon breach he runneth upon me like 
a giant 

16 15 i have sew sackcloth upon my skin and defil my horn in the 
dust 

16 16 my face is foul with weep and on my eyelid is the shadow of 
death 16 17 not for ani injust in mine hand also my prayer is 
pure 

16 18 o earth cover not thou my blood and let my cri have no place 

16 19 also now behold my wit is in heaven and my record is on 
high 

16 20 my friend scorn me but mine eye poureth out tear unto god 

16 21 o that one might plead for a man with god a a man pleadeth for 
hi neighbour 16 22 when a few year are come then i shall go the 
way whenc i shall not return 

17 1 my breath is corrupt my day are extinct the graf are readi 
for me 

17 2 are there not mocker with me and doth not mine eye continu in 
their provoc 17 3 lay down now put me in a sureti with thee 
who is he that will strike hand with me 17 4 for thou hast hid 
their heart from understand therefor shalt thou not exalt them 

17 5 he that speaketh flatteri to hi friend even the eye of hi 
child shall fail 

17 6 he hath made me also a byword of the peopl and aforetim i wa 
a a tabret 

17 7 mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow and all my member are 
a a shadow 

17 8 upright men shall be astoni at thi and the innoc shall 
stir up himself against the hypocrit 

17 9 the righteou also shall hold on hi way and he that hath clean 
hand shall be stronger and stronger 

17 10 but a for you all do ye return and come now for i cannot 
find one wise man among you 

17 11 my day are past my purpo are broken off even the thought 
of my heart 

17 12 they chang the night into day the light is short becau of 
dark 

17 13 if i wait the grave is mine hou i have made my bed in the 
dark 

17 14 i have said to corrupt thou art my father to the worm thou 
art my mother and my sister 

17 15 and where is now my hope a for my hope who shall see it 
17 16 they shall go down to the bar of the pit when our rest 
togeth is in the dust 

18 1 then answer bildad the shuhit and said 18 2 how long will it 
be ere ye make an end of word mark and afterward we will speak 

18 3 wherefor are we count a beast and reput vile in your 
sight 18 4 he teareth himself in hi anger shall the earth be 
forsaken for thee and shall the rock be remov out of hi place 
18 5 yea the light of the wick shall be put out and the spark of 
hi fire shall not shine 

18 6 the light shall be dark in hi tabernacl and hi candl shall 
be put out with him 

18 7 the step of hi strength shall be straiten and hi own 
counsel shall cast him down 

18 8 for he is cast into a net by hi own foot and he walketh upon a 
snare 

18 9 the gin shall take him by the heel and the robber shall prevail 
against him 

18 10 the snare is laid for him in the ground and a trap for him in 
the way 

18 11 terror shall make him afraid on everi side and shall drive him 
to hi foot 

18 12 hi strength shall be hungerbitten and destruct shall be 
readi at hi side 

18 13 it shall devour the strength of hi skin even the firstborn of 
death shall devour hi strength 

18 14 hi confid shall be root out of hi tabernacl and it 
shall bring him to the king of terror 

18 15 it shall dwell in hi tabernacl becau it is none of hi 
brimston shall be scatter upon hi habit 

18 16 hi root shall be dri up beneath and abov shall hi branch 
be cut off 

18 17 hi remembr shall perish from the earth and he shall have 
no name in the street 

18 18 he shall be driven from light into dark and chase out of 
the world 

18 19 he shall neither have son nor nephew among hi peopl nor ani 
remain in hi dwell 

18 20 they that come after him shall be astoni at hi day a they 
that went befor were affright 

18 21 sure such are the dwell of the wick and thi is the 
place of him that knoweth not god 

19 1 then job answer and said 19 2 how long will ye vex my soul 
and break me in piec with word 19 3 these ten time have ye 
reproach me ye are not asham that ye make yourselv strang to 
me 

19 4 and be it ind that i have er mine error remaineth with 
myself 

19 5 if ind ye will magnifi yourselv against me and plead 
against me my reproach 19 6 know now that god hath overthrown me and 
hath compass me with hi net 

19 7 behold i cri out of wrong but i am not heard i cri aloud but 
there is no judgment 

19 8 he hath fenc up my way that i cannot pa and he hath set 
dark in my path 

19 9 he hath strip me of my glori and taken the crown from my 
head 

19 10 he hath destroy me on everi side and i am gone and mine hope 
hath he remov like a tree 

19 11 he hath also kindl hi wrath against me and he counteth me 
unto him a one of hi enemi 

19 12 hi troop come togeth and rai up their way against me and 
encamp round about my tabernacl 

19 13 he hath put my brother far from me and mine acquaint are 
verili estrang from me 

19 14 my kinsfolk have fail and my familiar friend have forgotten 
me 

19 15 they that dwell in mine hou and my maid count me for a 
stranger i am an alien in their sight 

19 16 i call my servant and he gave me no answer i intreat him 
with my mouth 

19 17 my breath is strang to my wife though i intreat for the 
child s sake of mine own bodi 

19 18 yea young child despi me i aro and they spake against 
me 

19 19 all my inward friend abhor me and they whom i love are 
turn against me 

19 20 my bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh and i am escap 
with the skin of my teeth 

19 21 have piti upon me have piti upon me o ye my friend for the 
hand of god hath touch me 

19 22 whi do ye persecut me a god and are not satisfi with my 
flesh 19 23 oh that my word were now written oh that they were 
print in a book 19 24 that they were graven with an iron pen and 
lead in the rock for ever 19 25 for i know that my redeem liveth 
and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth 19 26 and 
though after my skin worm destroy thi bodi yet in my flesh shall i 
see god 19 27 whom i shall see for myself and mine eye shall 
behold and not anoth though my rein be consum within me 

19 28 but ye should say whi persecut we him see the root of the 
matter is found in me 19 29 be ye afraid of the sword for wrath 
bringeth the punish of the sword that ye may know there is a 
judgment 

20 1 then answer zophar the naamathit and said 20 2 therefor do 
my thought cau me to answer and for thi i make hast 

20 3 i have heard the check of my reproach and the spirit of my 
understand causeth me to answer 

20 4 knowest thou not thi of old sinc man wa place upon earth 
20 5 that the triumph of the wick is short and the joy of the 
hypocrit but for a moment 20 6 though hi excel mount up to 
the heaven and hi head reach unto the cloud 20 7 yet he shall 
perish for ever like hi own dung they which have seen him shall say 
where is he 20 8 he shall fli away a a dream and shall not be 
found yea he shall be chase away a a vision of the night 

20 9 the eye also which saw him shall see him no more neither shall 
hi place ani more behold him 

20 10 hi child shall seek to plea the poor and hi hand shall 
restor their good 

20 11 hi bone are full of the sin of hi youth which shall lie down 
with him in the dust 

20 12 though wick be sweet in hi mouth though he hide it under 
hi tongu 20 13 though he spare it and forsak it not but keep it 
still within hi mouth 20 14 yet hi meat in hi bowel is turn it 
is the gall of asp within him 

20 15 he hath swallow down rich and he shall vomit them up again 
god shall cast them out of hi belli 

20 16 he shall suck the poison of asp the viper s tongu shall slay 
him 

20 17 he shall not see the river the flood the brook of honey and 
butter 

20 18 that which he labour for shall he restor and shall not 
swallow it down accord to hi substanc shall the restitut be 
and he shall not rejoic therein 

20 19 becau he hath oppress and hath forsaken the poor becau he 
hath violent taken away an hou which he build not 20 20 sure 
he shall not feel quiet in hi belli he shall not save of that 
which he desir 

20 21 there shall none of hi meat be left therefor shall no man 
look for hi good 

20 22 in the ful of hi suffici he shall be in strait everi 
hand of the wick shall come upon him 

20 23 when he is about to fill hi belli god shall cast the furi of 
hi wrath upon him and shall rain it upon him while he is eat 

20 24 he shall flee from the iron weapon and the bow of steel shall 
strike him through 

20 25 it is drawn and cometh out of the bodi yea the glitter 
sword cometh out of hi gall terror are upon him 

20 26 all dark shall be hid in hi secret place a fire not blown 
shall consum him it shall go ill with him that is left in hi 
tabernacl 

20 27 the heaven shall reveal hi iniqu and the earth shall rise 
up against him 

20 28 the increa of hi hou shall depart and hi good shall flow 
away in the day of hi wrath 

20 29 thi is the portion of a wick man from god and the heritag 
appoint unto him by god 

21 1 but job answer and said 21 2 hear dilig my speech and 
let thi be your consol 

21 3 suffer me that i may speak and after that i have spoken mock 
on 

21 4 a for me is my complaint to man and if it were so whi should 
not my spirit be troubl 21 5 mark me and be astonish and lay 
your hand upon your mouth 

21 6 even when i rememb i am afraid and trembl taketh hold on my 
flesh 

21 7 wherefor do the wick live becom old yea are mighti in 
power 21 8 their seed is establish in their sight with them and 
their offspr befor their eye 

21 9 their hou are safe from fear neither is the rod of god upon 
them 

21 10 their bull gendereth and faileth not their cow calveth and 
casteth not her calf 

21 11 they send forth their littl one like a flock and their 
child danc 

21 12 they take the timbrel and harp and rejoic at the sound of the 
organ 

21 13 they spend their day in wealth and in a moment go down to the 
grave 

21 14 therefor they say unto god depart from u for we desir not 
the knowledg of thi way 

21 15 what is the almighti that we should serv him and what profit 
should we have if we pray unto him 21 16 lo their good is not in 
their hand the counsel of the wick is far from me 

21 17 how oft is the candl of the wick put out and how oft cometh 
their destruct upon them god distributeth sorrow in hi anger 

21 18 they are a stubbl befor the wind and a chaff that the storm 
carrieth away 

21 19 god layeth up hi iniqu for hi child he rewardeth him 
and he shall know it
