21 20 hi eye shall see hi destruct and he shall drink of the 
wrath of the almighti 

21 21 for what pleasur hath he in hi hou after him when the 
number of hi month is cut off in the midst 21 22 shall ani teach 
god knowledg see he judgeth those that are high 

21 23 one dieth in hi full strength be wholli at ea and quiet 

21 24 hi breast are full of milk and hi bone are moisten with 
marrow 

21 25 and anoth dieth in the bitter of hi soul and never 
eateth with pleasur 

21 26 they shall lie down alik in the dust and the worm shall cover 
them 

21 27 behold i know your thought and the devic which ye 
wrong imagin against me 

21 28 for ye say where is the hou of the princ and where are the 
dwell place of the wick 21 29 have ye not ask them that go 
by the way and do ye not know their token 21 30 that the wick is 
reserv to the day of destruct they shall be brought forth to the 
day of wrath 

21 31 who shall declar hi way to hi face and who shall repay him 
what he hath done 21 32 yet shall he be brought to the grave and 
shall remain in the tomb 

21 33 the clod of the valley shall be sweet unto him and everi man 
shall draw after him a there are innum befor him 

21 34 how then comfort ye me in vain see in your answer there 
remaineth falsehood 22 1 then eliphaz the temanit answer and 
said 22 2 can a man be profit unto god a he that is wise may be 
profit unto himself 22 3 is it ani pleasur to the almighti 
that thou art righteou or is it gain to him that thou makest thi 
way perfect 22 4 will he reprov thee for fear of thee will he 
enter with thee into judgment 22 5 is not thi wick great and 
thine iniqu infinit 22 6 for thou hast taken a pledg from thi 
brother for nought and strip the nake of their cloth 

22 7 thou hast not given water to the weari to drink and thou hast 
withholden bread from the hungri 

22 8 but a for the mighti man he had the earth and the honour 
man dwelt in it 

22 9 thou hast sent widow away empti and the arm of the fatherless 
have been broken 

22 10 therefor snare are round about thee and sudden fear troubleth 
thee 22 11 or dark that thou canst not see and abund of 
water cover thee 

22 12 is not god in the height of heaven and behold the height of the 
star how high they are 22 13 and thou sayest how doth god know 
can he judg through the dark cloud 22 14 thick cloud are a 
cover to him that he seeth not and he walketh in the circuit of 
heaven 

22 15 hast thou mark the old way which wick men have trodden 
22 16 which were cut down out of time whose foundat wa overflown 
with a flood 22 17 which said unto god depart from u and what can 
the almighti do for them 22 18 yet he fill their hou with good 
thing but the counsel of the wick is far from me 

22 19 the righteou see it and are glad and the innoc laugh them 
to scorn 

22 20 wherea our substanc is not cut down but the remnant of them 
the fire consumeth 

22 21 acquaint now thyself with him and be at peac therebi good 
shall come unto thee 

22 22 receiv i pray thee the law from hi mouth and lay up hi 
word in thine heart 

22 23 if thou return to the almighti thou shalt be built up thou 
shalt put away iniqu far from thi tabernacl 

22 24 then shalt thou lay up gold a dust and the gold of ophir a 
the stone of the brook 

22 25 yea the almighti shall be thi defenc and thou shalt have 
plenti of silver 

22 26 for then shalt thou have thi delight in the almighti and shalt 
lift up thi face unto god 

22 27 thou shalt make thi prayer unto him and he shall hear thee and 
thou shalt pay thi vow 

22 28 thou shalt also decr a thing and it shall be establish unto 
thee and the light shall shine upon thi way 

22 29 when men are cast down then thou shalt say there is lift 
up and he shall save the humbl person 

22 30 he shall deliv the island of the innoc and it is deliv 
by the pure of thine hand 

23 1 then job answer and said 23 2 even to day is my complaint 
bitter my stroke is heavier than my groan 

23 3 oh that i knew where i might find him that i might come even to 
hi seat 23 4 i would order my cau befor him and fill my mouth 
with argument 

23 5 i would know the word which he would answer me and understand 
what he would say unto me 

23 6 will he plead against me with hi great power no but he would 
put strength in me 

23 7 there the righteou might disput with him so should i be 
deliv for ever from my judg 

23 8 behold i go forward but he is not there and backward but i 
cannot perceiv him 23 9 on the left hand where he doth work but i 
cannot behold him he hideth himself on the right hand that i cannot 
see him 23 10 but he knoweth the way that i take when he hath tri 
me i shall come forth a gold 

23 11 my foot hath held hi step hi way have i kept and not 
declin 

23 12 neither have i gone back from the command of hi lip i 
have esteem the word of hi mouth more than my necessari food 

23 13 but he is in one mind and who can turn him and what hi soul 
desireth even that he doeth 

23 14 for he performeth the thing that is appoint for me and mani 
such thing are with him 

23 15 therefor am i troubl at hi presenc when i consid i am 
afraid of him 

23 16 for god maketh my heart soft and the almighti troubleth me 
23 17 becau i wa not cut off befor the dark neither hath he 
cover the dark from my face 

24 1 whi see time are not hidden from the almighti do they that 
know him not see hi day 24 2 some remov the landmark they 
violent take away flock and feed thereof 

24 3 they drive away the a of the fatherless they take the widow s 
ox for a pledg 

24 4 they turn the needi out of the way the poor of the earth hide 
themselv togeth 

24 5 behold a wild as in the desert go they forth to their work 
rise betim for a prey the wilder yieldeth food for them and 
for their child 

24 6 they reap everi one hi corn in the field and they gather the 
vintag of the wick 

24 7 they cau the nake to lodg without cloth that they have no 
cover in the cold 

24 8 they are wet with the shower of the mountain and embrac the 
rock for want of a shelter 

24 9 they pluck the fatherless from the breast and take a pledg of 
the poor 

24 10 they cau him to go nake without cloth and they take away 
the sheaf from the hungri 24 11 which make oil within their wall 
and tread their winepress and suffer thirst 

24 12 men groan from out of the citi and the soul of the wound 
crieth out yet god layeth not folli to them 

24 13 they are of those that rebel against the light they know not 
the way thereof nor abid in the path thereof 

24 14 the murder rise with the light killeth the poor and needi 
and in the night is a a thief 

24 15 the eye also of the adult waiteth for the twilight say 
no eye shall see me and disguiseth hi face 

24 16 in the dark they dig through hou which they had mark for 
themselv in the daytim they know not the light 

24 17 for the morn is to them even a the shadow of death if one 
know them they are in the terror of the shadow of death 

24 18 he is swift a the water their portion is cur in the earth 
he beholdeth not the way of the vineyard 

24 19 drought and heat consum the snow water so doth the grave 
those which have sin 

24 20 the womb shall forget him the worm shall feed sweetli on him 
he shall be no more rememb and wick shall be broken a a 
tree 

24 21 he evil entreateth the barren that beareth not and doeth not 
good to the widow 

24 22 he draweth also the mighti with hi power he riseth up and no 
man is sure of life 

24 23 though it be given him to be in safeti whereon he resteth yet 
hi eye are upon their way 

24 24 they are exalt for a littl while but are gone and brought 
low they are taken out of the way a all other and cut off a the 
top of the ear of corn 

24 25 and if it be not so now who will make me a liar and make my 
speech noth worth 25 1 then answer bildad the shuhit and 
said 25 2 dominion and fear are with him he maketh peac in hi high 
place 

25 3 is there ani number of hi armi and upon whom doth not hi 
light ari 25 4 how then can man be justifi with god or how can 
he be clean that is born of a woman 25 5 behold even to the moon 
and it shineth not yea the star are not pure in hi sight 

25 6 how much le man that is a worm and the son of man which is a 
worm 26 1 but job answer and said 26 2 how hast thou help him 
that is without power how savest thou the arm that hath no strength 
26 3 how hast thou counsel him that hath no wisdom and how hast 
thou plenti declar the thing a it is 26 4 to whom hast thou 
utter word and whose spirit came from thee 26 5 dead thing are 
form from under the water and the inhabit thereof 

26 6 hell is nake befor him and destruct hath no cover 

26 7 he stretcheth out the north over the empti place and hangeth the 
earth upon noth 

26 8 he bindeth up the water in hi thick cloud and the cloud is 
not rent under them 

26 9 he holdeth back the face of hi throne and spreadeth hi cloud 
upon it 

26 10 he hath compass the water with bound until the day and 
night come to an end 

26 11 the pillar of heaven trembl and are astonish at hi reproof 

26 12 he divideth the sea with hi power and by hi understand he 
smiteth through the proud 

26 13 by hi spirit he hath garnish the heaven hi hand hath 
form the crook serpent 

26 14 lo these are part of hi way but how littl a portion is 
heard of him but the thunder of hi power who can understand 27 1 
moreov job continu hi parabl and said 27 2 a god liveth who 
hath taken away my judgment and the almighti who hath vex my soul 
27 3 all the while my breath is in me and the spirit of god is in my 
nostril 27 4 my lip shall not speak wick nor my tongu utter 
deceit 

27 5 god forbid that i should justifi you till i die i will not 
remov mine integr from me 

27 6 my righteou i hold fast and will not let it go my heart 
shall not reproach me so long a i live 

27 7 let mine enemi be a the wick and he that riseth up against me 
a the unright 

27 8 for what is the hope of the hypocrit though he hath gain 
when god taketh away hi soul 27 9 will god hear hi cri when 
troubl cometh upon him 27 10 will he delight himself in the 
almighti will he alway call upon god 27 11 i will teach you by the 
hand of god that which is with the almighti will i not conceal 

27 12 behold all ye yourselv have seen it whi then are ye thu 
altogeth vain 27 13 thi is the portion of a wick man with god 
and the heritag of oppressor which they shall receiv of the 
almighti 

27 14 if hi child be multipli it is for the sword and hi 
offspr shall not be satisfi with bread 

27 15 those that remain of him shall be buri in death and hi 
widow shall not weep 

27 16 though he heap up silver a the dust and prepar raiment a the 
clay 27 17 he may prepar it but the just shall put it on and the 
innoc shall divid the silver 

27 18 he buildeth hi hou a a moth and a a booth that the keeper 
maketh 

27 19 the rich man shall lie down but he shall not be gather he 
openeth hi eye and he is not 

27 20 terror take hold on him a water a tempest stealeth him away 
in the night 

27 21 the east wind carrieth him away and he departeth and a a 
storm hurleth him out of hi place 

27 22 for god shall cast upon him and not spare he would fain flee 
out of hi hand 

27 23 men shall clap their hand at him and shall hiss him out of hi 
place 

28 1 sure there is a vein for the silver and a place for gold where 
they fine it 

28 2 iron is taken out of the earth and brass is molten out of the 
stone 

28 3 he setteth an end to dark and searcheth out all perfect 
the stone of dark and the shadow of death 

28 4 the flood breaketh out from the inhabit even the water 
forgotten of the foot they are dri up they are gone away from men 

28 5 a for the earth out of it cometh bread and under it is turn 
up a it were fire 

28 6 the stone of it are the place of sapphir and it hath dust of 
gold 

28 7 there is a path which no fowl knoweth and which the vultur s 
eye hath not seen 28 8 the lion s whelp have not trodden it nor the 
fierc lion pa by it 

28 9 he putteth forth hi hand upon the rock he overturneth the 
mountain by the root 

28 10 he cutteth out river among the rock and hi eye seeth everi 
preciou thing 

28 11 he bindeth the flood from overflow and the thing that is 
hid bringeth he forth to light 

28 12 but where shall wisdom be found and where is the place of 
understand 28 13 man knoweth not the price thereof neither is it 
found in the land of the live 

28 14 the depth saith it is not in me and the sea saith it is not 
with me 

28 15 it cannot be gotten for gold neither shall silver be weigh 
for the price thereof 

28 16 it cannot be valu with the gold of ophir with the preciou 
onyx or the sapphir 

28 17 the gold and the crystal cannot equal it and the exchang of it 
shall not be for jewel of fine gold 

28 18 no mention shall be made of coral or of pearl for the price 
of wisdom is abov rubi 

28 19 the topaz of ethiopia shall not equal it neither shall it be 
valu with pure gold 

28 20 whenc then cometh wisdom and where is the place of 
understand 28 21 see it is hid from the eye of all live 
and kept close from the fowl of the air 

28 22 destruct and death say we have heard the fame thereof with 
our ear 

28 23 god understandeth the way thereof and he knoweth the place 
thereof 

28 24 for he looketh to the end of the earth and seeth under the 
whole heaven 28 25 to make the weight for the wind and he weigheth 
the water by measur 

28 26 when he made a decr for the rain and a way for the lightn 
of the thunder 28 27 then did he see it and declar it he prepar 
it yea and search it out 

28 28 and unto man he said behold the fear of the lord that is 
wisdom and to depart from evil is understand 

29 1 moreov job continu hi parabl and said 29 2 oh that i were 
a in month past a in the day when god preserv me 29 3 when hi 
candl shine upon my head and when by hi light i walk through 
dark 29 4 a i wa in the day of my youth when the secret of 
god wa upon my tabernacl 29 5 when the almighti wa yet with me 
when my child were about me 29 6 when i wash my step with 
butter and the rock pour me out river of oil 29 7 when i went out 
to the gate through the citi when i prepar my seat in the street 
29 8 the young men saw me and hid themselv and the age aro and 
stood up 

29 9 the princ refrain talk and laid their hand on their 
mouth 

29 10 the nobl held their peac and their tongu cleav to the 
roof of their mouth 

29 11 when the ear heard me then it bless me and when the eye saw 
me it gave wit to me 29 12 becau i deliv the poor that 
cri and the fatherless and him that had none to help him 

29 13 the bless of him that wa readi to perish came upon me and i 
cau the widow s heart to sing for joy 

29 14 i put on righteou and it cloth me my judgment wa a a 
robe and a diadem 

29 15 i wa eye to the blind and foot wa i to the lame 

29 16 i wa a father to the poor and the cau which i knew not i 
search out 

29 17 and i brake the jaw of the wick and pluck the spoil out of 
hi teeth 

29 18 then i said i shall die in my nest and i shall multipli my 
day a the sand 

29 19 my root wa spread out by the water and the dew lay all night 
upon my branch 

29 20 my glori wa fresh in me and my bow wa renew in my hand 

29 21 unto me men gave ear and wait and kept silenc at my 
counsel 

29 22 after my word they spake not again and my speech drop upon 
them 

29 23 and they wait for me a for the rain and they open their 
mouth wide a for the latter rain 

29 24 if i laugh on them they believ it not and the light of my 
counten they cast not down 

29 25 i chose out their way and sat chief and dwelt a a king in the 
armi a one that comforteth the mourner 

30 1 but now they that are younger than i have me in deri whose 
father i would have disdain to have set with the dog of my flock 

30 2 yea whereto might the strength of their hand profit me in whom 
old age wa perish 30 3 for want and famin they were solitari 
flee into the wilder in former time desol and wast 

30 4 who cut up mallow by the bush and junip root for their 
meat 

30 5 they were driven forth from among men they cri after them a 
after a thief 30 6 to dwell in the cliff of the valley in cave 
of the earth and in the rock 

30 7 among the bush they bray under the nettl they were 
gather togeth 

30 8 they were child of fool yea child of base men they were 
viler than the earth 

30 9 and now am i their song yea i am their byword 

30 10 they abhor me they flee far from me and spare not to spit in 
my face 

30 11 becau he hath loo my cord and afflict me they have also 
let loo the bridl befor me 

30 12 upon my right hand rise the youth they push away my foot and 
they rai up against me the way of their destruct 

30 13 they mar my path they set forward my calam they have no 
helper 

30 14 they came upon me a a wide break in of water in the 
desol they roll themselv upon me 

30 15 terror are turn upon me they pursu my soul a the wind and 
my welfar passeth away a a cloud 

30 16 and now my soul is pour out upon me the day of afflict 
have taken hold upon me 

30 17 my bone are pierc in me in the night season and my sinew 
take no rest 

30 18 by the great forc of my disea is my garment chang it 
bindeth me about a the collar of my coat 

30 19 he hath cast me into the mire and i am becom like dust and 
ash 

30 20 i cri unto thee and thou dost not hear me i stand up and thou 
regardest me not 

30 21 thou art becom cruel to me with thi strong hand thou opposest 
thyself against me 

30 22 thou liftest me up to the wind thou causest me to ride upon it 
and dissolvest my substanc 

30 23 for i know that thou wilt bring me to death and to the hou 
appoint for all live 

30 24 howbeit he will not stretch out hi hand to the grave though 
they cri in hi destruct 

30 25 did not i weep for him that wa in troubl wa not my soul 
griev for the poor 30 26 when i look for good then evil came 
unto me and when i wait for light there came dark 

30 27 my bowel boil and rest not the day of afflict 
prevent me 

30 28 i went mourn without the sun i stood up and i cri in the 
congreg 

30 29 i am a brother to dragon and a companion to owl 

30 30 my skin is black upon me and my bone are burn with heat 

30 31 my harp also is turn to mourn and my organ into the voic 
of them that weep 

31 1 i made a coven with mine eye whi then should i think upon a 
maid 31 2 for what portion of god is there from abov and what 
inherit of the almighti from on high 31 3 is not destruct to 
the wick and a strang punish to the worker of iniqu 31 4 
doth not he see my way and count all my step 31 5 if i have 
walk with vaniti or if my foot hath hast to deceit 31 6 let me 
be weigh in an even balanc that god may know mine integr 

31 7 if my step hath turn out of the way and mine heart walk 
after mine eye and if ani blot hath cleav to mine hand 31 8 then 
let me sow and let anoth eat yea let my offspr be root out 

31 9 if mine heart have been deceiv by a woman or if i have laid 
wait at my neighbour s door 31 10 then let my wife grind unto 
anoth and let other bow down upon her 

31 11 for thi is an heinou crime yea it is an iniqu to be 
punish by the judg 

31 12 for it is a fire that consumeth to destruct and would root 
out all mine increa 

31 13 if i did despi the cau of my manserv or of my 
maidserv when they contend with me 31 14 what then shall i do 
when god riseth up and when he visiteth what shall i answer him 
31 15 did not he that made me in the womb make him and did not one 
fashion u in the womb 31 16 if i have withheld the poor from their 
desir or have cau the eye of the widow to fail 31 17 or have 
eaten my morsel myself alon and the fatherless hath not eaten 
thereof 31 18 for from my youth he wa brought up with me a with a 
father and i have guid her from my mother s womb 31 19 if i have 
seen ani perish for want of cloth or ani poor without cover 
31 20 if hi loin have not bless me and if he were not warm with 
the fleec of my sheep 31 21 if i have lift up my hand against the 
fatherless when i saw my help in the gate 31 22 then let mine arm 
fall from my shoulder blade and mine arm be broken from the bone 

31 23 for destruct from god wa a terror to me and by reason of 
hi high i could not endur 

31 24 if i have made gold my hope or have said to the fine gold thou 
art my confid 31 25 if i rejoic becau my wealth wa great and 
becau mine hand had gotten much 31 26 if i beheld the sun when it 
shine or the moon walk in bright 31 27 and my heart hath 
been secretli entic or my mouth hath kiss my hand 31 28 thi 
also were an iniqu to be punish by the judg for i should have 
deni the god that is abov 

31 29 if i rejoic at the destruct of him that hate me or lift 
up myself when evil found him 31 30 neither have i suffer my mouth 
to sin by wish a cur to hi soul 

31 31 if the men of my tabernacl said not oh that we had of hi 
flesh we cannot be satisfi 

31 32 the stranger did not lodg in the street but i open my door 
to the travel 

31 33 if i cover my transgress a adam by hide mine iniqu 
in my bosom 31 34 did i fear a great multitud or did the contempt 
of famili terrifi me that i kept silenc and went not out of the 
door 31 35 oh that one would hear me behold my desir is that the 
almighti would answer me and that mine adversari had written a book 

31 36 sure i would take it upon my shoulder and bind it a a crown 
to me 

31 37 i would declar unto him the number of my step a a princ 
would i go near unto him 

31 38 if my land cri against me or that the furrow likewi thereof 
complain 31 39 if i have eaten the fruit thereof without money or 
have cau the owner thereof to lose their life 31 40 let thistl 
grow instead of wheat and cockl instead of barley 

the word of job are end 

32 1 so these three men cea to answer job becau he wa righteou 
in hi own eye 

32 2 then wa kindl the wrath of elihu the son of barachel the 
buzit of the kindr of ram against job wa hi wrath kindl 
becau he justifi himself rather than god 

32 3 also against hi three friend wa hi wrath kindl becau 
they had found no answer and yet had condemn job 

32 4 now elihu had wait till job had spoken becau they were elder 
than he 

32 5 when elihu saw that there wa no answer in the mouth of these 
three men then hi wrath wa kindl 

32 6 and elihu the son of barachel the buzit answer and said i am 
young and ye are veri old wherefor i wa afraid and durst not shew 
you mine opinion 

32 7 i said day should speak and multitud of year should teach 
wisdom 

32 8 but there is a spirit in man and the inspir of the almighti 
giveth them understand 

32 9 great men are not alway wise neither do the age understand 
judgment 

32 10 therefor i said hearken to me i also will shew mine opinion 

32 11 behold i wait for your word i gave ear to your reason 
whilst ye search out what to say 

32 12 yea i attend unto you and behold there wa none of you 
that convinc job or that answer hi word 32 13 lest ye should 
say we have found out wisdom god thrusteth him down not man 

32 14 now he hath not direct hi word against me neither will i 
answer him with your speech 

32 15 they were amaz they answer no more they left off speak 

32 16 when i had wait for they spake not but stood still and 
answer no more 32 17 i said i will answer also my part i also 
will shew mine opinion 

32 18 for i am full of matter the spirit within me constraineth me 

32 19 behold my belli is a wine which hath no vent it is readi to 
burst like new bottl 

32 20 i will speak that i may be refresh i will open my lip and 
answer 

32 21 let me not i pray you accept ani man s person neither let me 
give flatter titl unto man 

32 22 for i know not to give flatter titl in so do my maker 
would soon take me away 

33 1 wherefor job i pray thee hear my speech and hearken to all 
my word 

33 2 behold now i have open my mouth my tongu hath spoken in my 
mouth 

33 3 my word shall be of the upright of my heart and my lip 
shall utter knowledg clearli 

33 4 the spirit of god hath made me and the breath of the almighti 
hath given me life 

33 5 if thou canst answer me set thi word in order befor me stand 
up 

33 6 behold i am accord to thi wish in god s stead i also am 
form out of the clay 

33 7 behold my terror shall not make thee afraid neither shall my 
hand be heavi upon thee 

33 8 sure thou hast spoken in mine hear and i have heard the 
voic of thi word say 33 9 i am clean without transgress i 
am innoc neither is there iniqu in me 

33 10 behold he findeth occa against me he counteth me for hi 
enemi 33 11 he putteth my foot in the stock he marketh all my 
path 

33 12 behold in thi thou art not just i will answer thee that god 
is greater than man 

33 13 whi dost thou strive against him for he giveth not account of 
ani of hi matter 

33 14 for god speaketh onc yea twice yet man perceiveth it not 

33 15 in a dream in a vision of the night when deep sleep falleth 
upon men in slumber upon the bed 33 16 then he openeth the ear 
of men and sealeth their instruct 33 17 that he may withdraw man 
from hi purpo and hide pride from man 

33 18 he keepeth back hi soul from the pit and hi life from 
perish by the sword 

33 19 he is chasten also with pain upon hi bed and the multitud 
of hi bone with strong pain 33 20 so that hi life abhorreth bread 
and hi soul dainti meat 

33 21 hi flesh is consum away that it cannot be seen and hi 
bone that were not seen stick out 

33 22 yea hi soul draweth near unto the grave and hi life to the 
destroy 

33 23 if there be a messeng with him an interpret one among a 
thousand to shew unto man hi upright 33 24 then he is graciou 
unto him and saith deliv him from go down to the pit i have 
found a ransom 

33 25 hi flesh shall be fresher than a child s he shall return to 
the day of hi youth 33 26 he shall pray unto god and he will be 
favour unto him and he shall see hi face with joy for he will 
render unto man hi righteou 

33 27 he looketh upon men and if ani say i have sin and 
pervert that which wa right and it profit me not 33 28 he will 
deliv hi soul from go into the pit and hi life shall see the 
light 

33 29 lo all these thing worketh god oftentim with man 33 30 to 
bring back hi soul from the pit to be enlighten with the light of 
the live 

33 31 mark well o job hearken unto me hold thi peac and i will 
speak 

33 32 if thou hast anyth to say answer me speak for i desir to 
justifi thee 

33 33 if not hearken unto me hold thi peac and i shall teach thee 
wisdom 

34 1 furthermor elihu answer and said 34 2 hear my word o ye 
wise men and give ear unto me ye that have knowledg 

34 3 for the ear trieth word a the mouth tasteth meat 

34 4 let u choo to u judgment let u know among ourselv what is 
good 

34 5 for job hath said i am righteou and god hath taken away my 
judgment 

34 6 should i lie against my right my wound is incur without 
transgress 

34 7 what man is like job who drinketh up scorn like water 34 8 
which goeth in compani with the worker of iniqu and walketh with 
wick men 

34 9 for he hath said it profiteth a man noth that he should 
delight himself with god 

34 10 therefor hearken unto me ye men of understand far be it 
from god that he should do wick and from the almighti that he 
should commit iniqu 

34 11 for the work of a man shall he render unto him and cau everi 
man to find accord to hi way 

34 12 yea sure god will not do wickedli neither will the almighti 
pervert judgment 

34 13 who hath given him a charg over the earth or who hath dispo 
the whole world 34 14 if he set hi heart upon man if he gather 
unto himself hi spirit and hi breath 34 15 all flesh shall perish 
togeth and man shall turn again unto dust 

34 16 if now thou hast understand hear thi hearken to the voic 
of my word 

34 17 shall even he that hateth right govern and wilt thou condemn 
him that is most just 34 18 is it fit to say to a king thou art 
wick and to princ ye are ungodli 34 19 how much le to him 
that accepteth not the person of princ nor regardeth the rich more 
than the poor for they all are the work of hi hand 

34 20 in a moment shall they die and the peopl shall be troubl at 
midnight and pa away and the mighti shall be taken away without 
hand 

34 21 for hi eye are upon the way of man and he seeth all hi 
go 

34 22 there is no dark nor shadow of death where the worker of 
iniqu may hide themselv 

34 23 for he will not lay upon man more than right that he should 
enter into judgment with god 

34 24 he shall break in piec mighti men without number and set 
other in their stead 

34 25 therefor he knoweth their work and he overturneth them in the 
night so that they are destroy 

34 26 he striketh them a wick men in the open sight of other 
34 27 becau they turn back from him and would not consid ani of 
hi way 34 28 so that they cau the cri of the poor to come unto 
him and he heareth the cri of the afflict 

34 29 when he giveth quiet who then can make troubl and when he 
hideth hi face who then can behold him whether it be done against a 
nation or against a man onli 34 30 that the hypocrit reign not 
lest the peopl be ensnar 

34 31 sure it is meet to be said unto god i have born 
chasti i will not offend ani more 34 32 that which i see not 
teach thou me if i have done iniqu i will do no more 

34 33 should it be accord to thi mind he will recompen it 
whether thou refu or whether thou choo and not i therefor 
speak what thou knowest 

34 34 let men of understand tell me and let a wise man hearken 
unto me 

34 35 job hath spoken without knowledg and hi word were without 
wisdom 

34 36 my desir is that job may be tri unto the end becau of hi 
answer for wick men 

34 37 for he addeth rebellion unto hi sin he clappeth hi hand 
among u and multiplieth hi word against god 

35 1 elihu spake moreov and said 35 2 thinkest thou thi to be 
right that thou saidst my righteou is more than god s 35 3 
for thou saidst what advantag will it be unto thee and what profit 
shall i have if i be clean from my sin 35 4 i will answer thee 
and thi companion with thee 

35 5 look unto the heaven and see and behold the cloud which are 
higher than thou 

35 6 if thou sinnest what doest thou against him or if thi 
transgress be multipli what doest thou unto him 35 7 if thou 
be righteou what givest thou him or what receiveth he of thine 
hand 35 8 thi wick may hurt a man a thou art and thi 
righteou may profit the son of man 

35 9 by reason of the multitud of oppress they make the oppress 
to cri they cri out by reason of the arm of the mighti 

35 10 but none saith where is god my maker who giveth song in the 
night 35 11 who teacheth u more than the beast of the earth and 
maketh u wiser than the fowl of heaven 35 12 there they cri but 
none giveth answer becau of the pride of evil men 

35 13 sure god will not hear vaniti neither will the almighti 
regard it 

35 14 although thou sayest thou shalt not see him yet judgment is 
befor him therefor trust thou in him 

35 15 but now becau it is not so he hath visit in hi anger yet 
he knoweth it not in great extrem 35 16 therefor doth job open 
hi mouth in vain he multiplieth word without knowledg 

36 1 elihu also proceed and said 36 2 suffer me a littl and i 
will shew thee that i have yet to speak on god s behalf 

36 3 i will fetch my knowledg from afar and will ascrib 
righteou to my maker 

36 4 for truli my word shall not be fal he that is perfect in 
knowledg is with thee 

36 5 behold god is mighti and despiseth not ani he is mighti in 
strength and wisdom 

36 6 he preserveth not the life of the wick but giveth right to the 
poor 

36 7 he withdraweth not hi eye from the righteou but with king 
are they on the throne yea he doth establish them for ever and they 
are exalt 

36 8 and if they be bound in fetter and be holden in cord of 
afflict 36 9 then he sheweth them their work and their 
transgress that they have exceed 

36 10 he openeth also their ear to disciplin and commandeth that 
they return from iniqu 

36 11 if they obey and serv him they shall spend their day in 
prosper and their year in pleasur 

36 12 but if they obey not they shall perish by the sword and they 
shall die without knowledg 

36 13 but the hypocrit in heart heap up wrath they cri not when he 
bindeth them 

36 14 they die in youth and their life is among the unclean 

36 15 he delivereth the poor in hi afflict and openeth their ear 
in oppress 

36 16 even so would he have remov thee out of the strait into a 
broad place where there is no strait and that which should be 
set on thi tabl should be full of fat 

36 17 but thou hast fulfil the judgment of the wick judgment and 
justic take hold on thee 

36 18 becau there is wrath bewar lest he take thee away with hi 
stroke then a great ransom cannot deliv thee 

36 19 will he esteem thi rich no not gold nor all the forc of 
strength 

36 20 desir not the night when peopl are cut off in their place 

36 21 take heed regard not iniqu for thi hast thou chosen rather 
than afflict 

36 22 behold god exalteth by hi power who teacheth like him 36 23 
who hath enjoin him hi way or who can say thou hast wrought 
iniqu 36 24 rememb that thou magnifi hi work which men 
behold 

36 25 everi man may see it man may behold it afar off 

36 26 behold god is great and we know him not neither can the 
number of hi year be search out 

36 27 for he maketh small the drop of water they pour down rain 
accord to the vapour thereof 36 28 which the cloud do drop and 
distil upon man abundantli 

36 29 also can ani understand the spread of the cloud or the 
noi of hi tabernacl 36 30 behold he spreadeth hi light upon 
it and covereth the bottom of the sea 

36 31 for by them judgeth he the peopl he giveth meat in abund 

36 32 with cloud he covereth the light and commandeth it not to 
shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt 

36 33 the noi thereof sheweth concern it the cattl also 
concern the vapour 

37 1 at thi also my heart trembleth and is move out of hi place 

37 2 hear attent the noi of hi voic and the sound that goeth 
out of hi mouth 

37 3 he directeth it under the whole heaven and hi lightn unto 
the end of the earth 

37 4 after it a voic roareth he thundereth with the voic of hi 
excel and he will not stay them when hi voic is heard 

37 5 god thundereth marvel with hi voic great thing doeth 
he which we cannot comprehend 

37 6 for he saith to the snow be thou on the earth likewi to the 
small rain and to the great rain of hi strength 

37 7 he sealeth up the hand of everi man that all men may know hi 
work 

37 8 then the beast go into den and remain in their place 

37 9 out of the south cometh the whirlwind and cold out of the north 

37 10 by the breath of god frost is given and the breadth of the 
water is straiten 

37 11 also by water he wearieth the thick cloud he scattereth hi 
bright cloud 37 12 and it is turn round about by hi counsel that 
they may do whatsoev he commandeth them upon the face of the world 
in the earth 

37 13 he causeth it to come whether for correct or for hi land 
or for merci 

37 14 hearken unto thi o job stand still and consid the wondrou 
work of god 

37 15 dost thou know when god dispo them and cau the light of 
hi cloud to shine 37 16 dost thou know the balanc of the 
cloud the wondrou work of him which is perfect in knowledg 
37 17 how thi garment are warm when he quieteth the earth by the 
south wind 37 18 hast thou with him spread out the sky which is 
strong and a a molten look glass 37 19 teach u what we shall 
say unto him for we cannot order our speech by reason of dark 

37 20 shall it be told him that i speak if a man speak sure he 
shall be swallow up 

37 21 and now men see not the bright light which is in the cloud but 
the wind passeth and cleanseth them 

37 22 fair weather cometh out of the north with god is terribl 
majesti 

37 23 touch the almighti we cannot find him out he is excel 
in power and in judgment and in plenti of justic he will not 
afflict 

37 24 men do therefor fear him he respecteth not ani that are wise 
of heart 

38 1 then the lord answer job out of the whirlwind and said 38 2 
who is thi that darkeneth counsel by word without knowledg 38 3 
gird up now thi loin like a man for i will demand of thee and 
answer thou me 

38 4 where wast thou when i laid the foundat of the earth 
declar if thou hast understand 

38 5 who hath laid the measur thereof if thou knowest or who hath 
stretch the line upon it 38 6 whereupon are the foundat 
thereof fasten or who laid the corner stone thereof 38 7 when the 
morn star sang togeth and all the son of god shout for joy 
38 8 or who shut up the sea with door when it brake forth a if it 
had issu out of the womb 38 9 when i made the cloud the garment 
thereof and thick dark a swaddlingband for it 38 10 and brake up 
for it my decr place and set bar and door 38 11 and said 
hitherto shalt thou come but no further and here shall thi proud 
wave be stay 38 12 hast thou command the morn sinc thi 
day and cau the dayspr to know hi place 38 13 that it might 
take hold of the end of the earth that the wick might be shaken 
out of it 38 14 it is turn a clay to the seal and they stand a 
a garment 

38 15 and from the wick their light is withholden and the high arm 
shall be broken 

38 16 hast thou enter into the spring of the sea or hast thou 
walk in the search of the depth 38 17 have the gate of death been 
open unto thee or hast thou seen the door of the shadow of death 
38 18 hast thou perceiv the breadth of the earth declar if thou 
knowest it all 

38 19 where is the way where light dwelleth and a for dark 
where is the place thereof 38 20 that thou shouldest take it to the 
bound thereof and that thou shouldest know the path to the hou 
thereof 38 21 knowest thou it becau thou wast then born or 
becau the number of thi day is great 38 22 hast thou enter into 
the treasur of the snow or hast thou seen the treasur of the 
hail 38 23 which i have reserv against the time of troubl against 
the day of battl and war 38 24 by what way is the light part 
which scattereth the east wind upon the earth 38 25 who hath divid 
a watercour for the overflow of water or a way for the 
lightn of thunder 38 26 to cau it to rain on the earth where no 
man is on the wilder wherein there is no man 38 27 to satisfi 
the desol and wast ground and to cau the bud of the tender herb 
to spring forth 38 28 hath the rain a father or who hath begotten 
the drop of dew 38 29 out of whose womb came the ice and the hoari 
frost of heaven who hath gender it 38 30 the water are hid a 
with a stone and the face of the deep is frozen 

38 31 canst thou bind the sweet influenc of pleiad or loo the 
band of orion 38 32 canst thou bring forth mazzaroth in hi season 
or canst thou guid arcturu with hi son 38 33 knowest thou the 
ordin of heaven canst thou set the dominion thereof in the 
earth 38 34 canst thou lift up thi voic to the cloud that 
abund of water may cover thee 38 35 canst thou send lightn 
that they may go and say unto thee here we are 38 36 who hath put 
wisdom in the inward part or who hath given understand to the 
heart 38 37 who can number the cloud in wisdom or who can stay the 
bottl of heaven 38 38 when the dust groweth into hard and the 
clod cleav fast togeth 38 39 wilt thou hunt the prey for the 
lion or fill the appetit of the young lion 38 40 when they couch 
in their den and abid in the covert to lie in wait 38 41 who 
provideth for the raven hi food when hi young one cri unto god 
they wander for lack of meat 

39 1 knowest thou the time when the wild goat of the rock bring 
forth or canst thou mark when the hind do calv 39 2 canst thou 
number the month that they fulfil or knowest thou the time when they 
bring forth 39 3 they bow themselv they bring forth their young 
one they cast out their sorrow 

39 4 their young one are in good like they grow up with corn they 
go forth and return not unto them 

39 5 who hath sent out the wild a free or who hath loo the band 
of the wild a 39 6 whose hou i have made the wilder and the 
barren land hi dwell 

39 7 he scorneth the multitud of the citi neither regardeth he the 
cri of the driver 

39 8 the rang of the mountain is hi pastur and he searcheth after 
everi green thing 

39 9 will the unicorn be will to serv thee or abid by thi crib 
39 10 canst thou bind the unicorn with hi band in the furrow or will 
he harrow the valley after thee 39 11 wilt thou trust him becau 
hi strength is great or wilt thou leav thi labour to him 39 12 
wilt thou believ him that he will bring home thi seed and gather it 
into thi barn 39 13 gavest thou the goodli wing unto the peacock 
or wing and feather unto the ostrich 39 14 which leaveth her egg 
in the earth and warmeth them in dust 39 15 and forgetteth that the 
foot may crush them or that the wild beast may break them 

39 16 she is harden against her young one a though they were not 
her s her labour is in vain without fear 39 17 becau god hath 
depriv her of wisdom neither hath he impart to her understand 

39 18 what time she lifteth up herself on high she scorneth the hor 
and hi rider 

39 19 hast thou given the hor strength hast thou cloth hi neck 
with thunder 39 20 canst thou make him afraid a a grasshopp the 
glori of hi nostril is terribl 

39 21 he paweth in the valley and rejoiceth in hi strength he goeth 
on to meet the arm men 

39 22 he mocketh at fear and is not affright neither turneth he 
back from the sword 

39 23 the quiver rattleth against him the glitter spear and the 
shield 

39 24 he swalloweth the ground with fierc and rage neither 
believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet 

39 25 he saith among the trumpet ha ha and he smelleth the battl 
afar off the thunder of the captain and the shout 

39 26 doth the hawk fli by thi wisdom and stretch her wing toward 
the south 39 27 doth the eagl mount up at thi command and make her 
nest on high 39 28 she dwelleth and abideth on the rock upon the 
crag of the rock and the strong place 

39 29 from thenc she seeketh the prey and her eye behold afar off 

39 30 her young one also suck up blood and where the slain are 
there is she 

40 1 moreov the lord answer job and said 40 2 shall he that 
contendeth with the almighti instruct him he that reproveth god let 
him answer it 

40 3 then job answer the lord and said 40 4 behold i am vile 
what shall i answer thee i will lay mine hand upon my mouth 

40 5 onc have i spoken but i will not answer yea twice but i will 
proceed no further 

40 6 then answer the lord unto job out of the whirlwind and said 
40 7 gird up thi loin now like a man i will demand of thee and 
declar thou unto me 

40 8 wilt thou also disannul my judgment wilt thou condemn me that 
thou mayest be righteou 40 9 hast thou an arm like god or canst 
thou thunder with a voic like him 40 10 deck thyself now with 
majesti and excel and array thyself with glori and beauti 

40 11 cast abroad the rage of thi wrath and behold everi one that is 
proud and aba him 

40 12 look on everi one that is proud and bring him low and tread 
down the wick in their place 

40 13 hide them in the dust togeth and bind their face in secret 

40 14 then will i also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can 
save thee 

40 15 behold now behemoth which i made with thee he eateth grass a 
an ox 

40 16 lo now hi strength is in hi loin and hi forc is in the 
navel of hi belli 

40 17 he moveth hi tail like a cedar the sinew of hi stone are 
wrap togeth 

40 18 hi bone are a strong piec of brass hi bone are like bar 
of iron 

40 19 he is the chief of the way of god he that made him can make 
hi sword to approach unto him 

40 20 sure the mountain bring him forth food where all the beast 
of the field play 

40 21 he lieth under the shadi tree in the covert of the reed and 
fen 

40 22 the shadi tree cover him with their shadow the willow of the 
brook compass him about 

40 23 behold he drinketh up a river and hasteth not he trusteth 
that he can draw up jordan into hi mouth 

40 24 he taketh it with hi eye hi nose pierceth through snare 

41 1 canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook or hi tongu with a 
cord which thou lettest down 41 2 canst thou put an hook into hi 
nose or bore hi jaw through with a thorn 41 3 will he make mani 
supplic unto thee will he speak soft word unto thee 41 4 
will he make a coven with thee wilt thou take him for a servant 
for ever 41 5 wilt thou play with him a with a bird or wilt thou 
bind him for thi maiden 41 6 shall the companion make a banquet of 
him shall they part him among the merchant 41 7 canst thou fill 
hi skin with barb iron or hi head with fish spear 41 8 lay 
thine hand upon him rememb the battl do no more 

41 9 behold the hope of him is in vain shall not one be cast down 
even at the sight of him 41 10 none is so fierc that dare stir him 
up who then is abl to stand befor me 41 11 who hath prevent me 
that i should repay him whatsoev is under the whole heaven is mine 

41 12 i will not conceal hi part nor hi power nor hi come 
proport 

41 13 who can discov the face of hi garment or who can come to him 
with hi doubl bridl 41 14 who can open the door of hi face hi 
teeth are terribl round about 

41 15 hi scale are hi pride shut up togeth a with a close seal 

41 16 one is so near to anoth that no air can come between them 

41 17 they are join one to anoth they stick togeth that they 
cannot be sunder 

41 18 by hi nee a light doth shine and hi eye are like the 
eyelid of the morn 

41 19 out of hi mouth go burn lamp and spark of fire leap out 

41 20 out of hi nostril goeth smoke a out of a seeth pot or 
caldron 

41 21 hi breath kindleth coal and a flame goeth out of hi mouth 

41 22 in hi neck remaineth strength and sorrow is turn into joy 
befor him 

41 23 the flake of hi flesh are join togeth they are firm in 
themselv they cannot be move 

41 24 hi heart is a firm a a stone yea a hard a a piec of the 
nether millston 

41 25 when he raiseth up himself the mighti are afraid by reason of 
break they purifi themselv 

41 26 the sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold the spear the 
dart nor the habergeon 

41 27 he esteemeth iron a straw and brass a rotten wood 

41 28 the arrow cannot make him flee slingston are turn with him 
into stubbl 

41 29 dart are count a stubbl he laugheth at the shake of a 
spear 

41 30 sharp stone are under him he spreadeth sharp point thing 
upon the mire 

41 31 he maketh the deep to boil like a pot he maketh the sea like a 
pot of ointment 

41 32 he maketh a path to shine after him one would think the deep to 
be hoari 

41 33 upon earth there is not hi like who is made without fear 

41 34 he beholdeth all high thing he is a king over all the child 
of pride 

42 1 then job answer the lord and said 42 2 i know that thou canst 
do everi thing and that no thought can be withholden from thee 

42 3 who is he that hideth counsel without knowledg therefor have i 
utter that i understood not thing too wonder for me which i 
knew not 

42 4 hear i beseech thee and i will speak i will demand of thee 
and declar thou unto me 

42 5 i have heard of thee by the hear of the ear but now mine eye 
seeth thee 

42 6 wherefor i abhor myself and repent in dust and ash 

42 7 and it wa so that after the lord had spoken these word unto 
job the lord said to eliphaz the temanit my wrath is kindl 
against thee and against thi two friend for ye have not spoken of 
me the thing that is right a my servant job hath 

42 8 therefor take unto you now seven bullock and seven ram and go 
to my servant job and offer up for yourselv a burnt offer and 
my servant job shall pray for you for him will i accept lest i deal 
with you after your folli in that ye have not spoken of me the thing 
which is right like my servant job 

42 9 so eliphaz the temanit and bildad the shuhit and zophar the 
naamathit went and did accord a the lord command them the 
lord also accept job 

42 10 and the lord turn the captiv of job when he pray for hi 
friend also the lord gave job twice a much a he had befor 

42 11 then came there unto him all hi brother and all hi sister 
and all they that had been of hi acquaint befor and did eat 
bread with him in hi hou and they bemoan him and comfort him 
over all the evil that the lord had brought upon him everi man also 
gave him a piec of money and everi one an ear of gold 

42 12 so the lord bless the latter end of job more than hi 
begin for he had fourteen thousand sheep and six thousand 
camel and a thousand yoke of ox and a thousand she as 

42 13 he had also seven son and three daughter 

42 14 and he call the name of the first jemima and the name of the 
second kezia and the name of the third kerenhappuch 

42 15 and in all the land were no woman found so fair a the daughter 
of job and their father gave them inherit among their brother 

42 16 after thi live job an hundr and forti year and saw hi 
son and hi son son even four gener 

42 17 so job die be old and full of day 




the book of psalm 


1 1 bless is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodli 
nor standeth in the way of sinner nor sitteth in the seat of the 
scorn 

1 2 but hi delight is in the law of the lord and in hi law doth he 
medit day and night 

1 3 and he shall be like a tree plant by the river of water that 
bringeth forth hi fruit in hi season hi leaf also shall not 
wither and whatsoev he doeth shall prosper 

1 4 the ungodli are not so but are like the chaff which the wind 
driveth away 

1 5 therefor the ungodli shall not stand in the judgment nor sinner 
in the congreg of the righteou 

1 6 for the lord knoweth the way of the righteou but the way of the 
ungodli shall perish 



2 1 whi do the heathen rage and the peopl imagin a vain thing 

2 2 the king of the earth set themselv and the ruler take counsel 
togeth against the lord and against hi anoint say 

2 3 let u break their band asund and cast away their cord from 
u 

2 4 he that sitteth in the heaven shall laugh the lord shall have 
them in deri 

2 5 then shall he speak unto them in hi wrath and vex them in hi 
sore displeasur 

2 6 yet have i set my king upon my holi hill of zion 

2 7 i will declar the decr the lord hath said unto me thou art my 
son thi day have i begotten thee 

2 8 ask of me and i shall give thee the heathen for thine 
inherit and the uttermost part of the earth for thi poss 

2 9 thou shalt break them with a rod of iron thou shalt dash them in 
piec like a potter s vessel 

2 10 be wise now therefor o ye king be instruct ye judg of 
the earth 

2 11 serv the lord with fear and rejoic with trembl 

2 12 kiss the son lest he be angri and ye perish from the way when 
hi wrath is kindl but a littl bless are all they that put their 
trust in him 



3 1 lord how are they increa that troubl me mani are they that 
rise up against me 

3 2 mani there be which say of my soul there is no help for him in 
god 

selah 

3 3 but thou o lord art a shield for me my glori and the lifter up 
of mine head 

3 4 i cri unto the lord with my voic and he heard me out of hi 
holi hill selah 

3 5 i laid me down and slept i awak for the lord sustain me 

3 6 i will not be afraid of ten thousand of peopl that have set 
themselv against me round about 

3 7 ari o lord save me o my god for thou hast smitten all mine 
enemi upon the cheek bone thou hast broken the teeth of the 
ungodli 

3 8 salvat belongeth unto the lord thi bless is upon thi 
peopl 

selah 



4 1 hear me when i call o god of my righteou thou hast enlarg 
me when i wa in distress have merci upon me and hear my prayer 

4 2 o ye son of men how long will ye turn my glori into shame how 
long will ye love vaniti and seek after lea selah 

4 3 but know that the lord hath set apart him that is godli for 
himself the lord will hear when i call unto him 

4 4 stand in awe and sin not commun with your own heart upon your 
bed and be still selah 

4 5 offer the sacrif of righteou and put your trust in the 
lord 

4 6 there be mani that say who will shew u ani good lord lift thou 
up the light of thi counten upon u 

4 7 thou hast put glad in my heart more than in the time that 
their corn and their wine increa 

4 8 i will both lay me down in peac and sleep for thou lord onli 
makest me dwell in safeti 



5 1 give ear to my word o lord consid my medit 

5 2 hearken unto the voic of my cri my king and my god for unto 
thee will i pray 

5 3 my voic shalt thou hear in the morn o lord in the morn 
will i direct my prayer unto thee and will look up 

5 4 for thou art not a god that hath pleasur in wick neither 
shall evil dwell with thee 

5 5 the foolish shall not stand in thi sight thou hatest all worker 
of iniqu 

5 6 thou shalt destroy them that speak lea the lord will abhor 
the bloodi and deceit man 

5 7 but a for me i will come into thi hou in the multitud of thi 
merci and in thi fear will i worship toward thi holi templ 

5 8 lead me o lord in thi righteou becau of mine enemi 
make thi way straight befor my face 

5 9 for there is no faith in their mouth their inward part is 
veri wick their throat is an open sepulchr they flatter with 
their tongu 

5 10 destroy thou them o god let them fall by their own counsel 
cast them out in the multitud of their transgress for they have 
rebel against thee 

5 11 but let all those that put their trust in thee rejoic let them 
ever shout for joy becau thou defendest them let them also that 
love thi name be joy in thee 

5 12 for thou lord wilt bless the righteou with favour wilt thou 
compass him a with a shield 



6 1 o lord rebuk me not in thine anger neither chasten me in thi 
hot displeasur 

6 2 have merci upon me o lord for i am weak o lord heal me for my 
bone are vex 

6 3 my soul is also sore vex but thou o lord how long 

6 4 return o lord deliv my soul oh save me for thi merci sake 

6 5 for in death there is no remembr of thee in the grave who 
shall give thee thank 

6 6 i am weari with my groan all the night make i my bed to swim 
i water my couch with my tear 

6 7 mine eye is consum becau of grief it waxeth old becau of 
all mine enemi 

6 8 depart from me all ye worker of iniqu for the lord hath 
heard the voic of my weep 

6 9 the lord hath heard my supplic the lord will receiv my 
prayer 

6 10 let all mine enemi be asham and sore vex let them return 
and be asham suddenli 



7 1 o lord my god in thee do i put my trust save me from all them 
that persecut me and deliv me 

7 2 lest he tear my soul like a lion rend it in piec while 
there is none to deliv 

7 3 o lord my god if i have done thi if there be iniqu in my 
hand 

7 4 if i have reward evil unto him that wa at peac with me yea 
i have deliv him that without cau is mine enemi 

7 5 let the enemi persecut my soul and take it yea let him tread 
down my life upon the earth and lay mine honour in the dust selah 

7 6 ari o lord in thine anger lift up thyself becau of the rage 
of mine enemi and awak for me to the judgment that thou hast 
command 

7 7 so shall the congreg of the peopl compass thee about for 
their sake therefor return thou on high 

7 8 the lord shall judg the peopl judg me o lord accord to my 
righteou and accord to mine integr that is in me 

7 9 oh let the wick of the wick come to an end but establish 
the just for the righteou god trieth the heart and rein 

7 10 my defenc is of god which saveth the upright in heart 

7 11 god judgeth the righteou and god is angri with the wick everi 
day 

7 12 if he turn not he will whet hi sword he hath bent hi bow and 
made it readi 

7 13 he hath also prepar for him the instrument of death he 
ordaineth hi arrow against the persecutor 

7 14 behold he travaileth with iniqu and hath conceiv mischief 
and brought forth falsehood 

7 15 he made a pit and dig it and is fallen into the ditch which 
he made 

7 16 hi mischief shall return upon hi own head and hi violent 
deal shall come down upon hi own pate 

7 17 i will prai the lord accord to hi righteou and will 
sing prai to the name of the lord most high 



8 1 o lord our lord how excel is thi name in all the earth who 
hast set thi glori abov the heaven 

8 2 out of the mouth of babe and suckl hast thou ordain 
strength becau of thine enemi that thou mightest still the enemi 
and the aveng 

8 3 when i consid thi heaven the work of thi finger the moon and 
the star which thou hast ordain 

8 4 what is man that thou art mind of him and the son of man 
that thou visitest him 

8 5 for thou hast made him a littl lower than the angel and hast 
crown him with glori and honour 

8 6 thou madest him to have dominion over the work of thi hand thou 
hast put all thing under hi foot 

8 7 all sheep and ox yea and the beast of the field 

8 8 the fowl of the air and the fish of the sea and whatsoev 
passeth through the path of the sea 

8 9 o lord our lord how excel is thi name in all the earth 


9 1 i will prai thee o lord with my whole heart i will shew forth 
all thi marvel work 

9 2 i will be glad and rejoic in thee i will sing prai to thi 
name o thou most high 

9 3 when mine enemi are turn back they shall fall and perish at 
thi presenc 

9 4 for thou hast maintain my right and my cau thou satest in the 
throne judg right 

9 5 thou hast rebuk the heathen thou hast destroy the wick 
thou hast put out their name for ever and ever 

9 6 o thou enemi destruct are come to a perpetu end and thou 
hast destroy citi their memori is perish with them 

9 7 but the lord shall endur for ever he hath prepar hi throne 
for judgment 

9 8 and he shall judg the world in righteou he shall minist 
judgment to the peopl in upright 

9 9 the lord also will be a refug for the oppress a refug in 
time of troubl 

9 10 and they that know thi name will put their trust in thee for 
thou lord hast not forsaken them that seek thee 

9 11 sing prai to the lord which dwelleth in zion declar among 
the peopl hi do 

9 12 when he maketh inquisit for blood he remembereth them he 
forgetteth not the cri of the humbl 

9 13 have merci upon me o lord consid my troubl which i suffer of 
them that hate me thou that liftest me up from the gate of death 

9 14 that i may shew forth all thi prai in the gate of the daughter 
of zion i will rejoic in thi salvat 

9 15 the heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made in the net 
which they hid is their own foot taken 

9 16 the lord is known by the judgment which he executeth the wick 
is snare in the work of hi own hand higgaion selah 

9 17 the wick shall be turn into hell and all the nation that 
forget god 

9 18 for the needi shall not alway be forgotten the expect of 
the poor shall not perish for ever 

9 19 ari o lord let not man prevail let the heathen be judg in 
thi sight 

9 20 put them in fear o lord that the nation may know themselv to 
be but men selah 



10 1 whi standest thou afar off o lord whi hidest thou thyself in 
time of troubl 

10 2 the wick in hi pride doth persecut the poor let them be 
taken in the devic that they have imagin 

10 3 for the wick boasteth of hi heart s desir and blesseth the 
covet whom the lord abhorreth 

10 4 the wick through the pride of hi counten will not seek 
after god god is not in all hi thought 

10 5 hi way are alway grievou thi judgment are far abov out of 
hi sight a for all hi enemi he puffeth at them 

10 6 he hath said in hi heart i shall not be move for i shall 
never be in adver 

10 7 hi mouth is full of cur and deceit and fraud under hi 
tongu is mischief and vaniti 

10 8 he sitteth in the lurk place of the villag in the secret 
place doth he murder the innoc hi eye are privili set against 
the poor 

10 9 he lieth in wait secretli a a lion in hi den he lieth in wait 
to catch the poor he doth catch the poor when he draweth him into 
hi net 

10 10 he croucheth and humbleth himself that the poor may fall by 
hi strong one 

10 11 he hath said in hi heart god hath forgotten he hideth hi 
face he will never see it 

10 12 ari o lord o god lift up thine hand forget not the humbl 

10 13 wherefor doth the wick contemn god he hath said in hi 
heart thou wilt not requir it 

10 14 thou hast seen it for thou beholdest mischief and spite to 
requit it with thi hand the poor committeth himself unto thee thou 
art the helper of the fatherless 

10 15 break thou the arm of the wick and the evil man seek out hi 
wick till thou find none 

10 16 the lord is king for ever and ever the heathen are perish out 
of hi land 

10 17 lord thou hast heard the desir of the humbl thou wilt 
prepar their heart thou wilt cau thine ear to hear 

10 18 to judg the fatherless and the oppress that the man of the 
earth may no more oppress 



11 1 in the lord put i my trust how say ye to my soul flee a a bird 
to your mountain 

11 2 for lo the wick bend their bow they make readi their arrow 
upon the string that they may privili shoot at the upright in heart 

11 3 if the foundat be destroy what can the righteou do 

11 4 the lord is in hi holi templ the lord s throne is in heaven 
hi eye behold hi eyelid tri the child of men 

11 5 the lord trieth the righteou but the wick and him that loveth 
violenc hi soul hateth 

11 6 upon the wick he shall rain snare fire and brimston and an 
horribl tempest thi shall be the portion of their cup 

11 7 for the righteou lord loveth righteou hi counten doth 
behold the upright 



12 1 help lord for the godli man ceaseth for the faith fail from 
among the child of men 

12 2 they speak vaniti everi one with hi neighbour with flatter 
lip and with a doubl heart do they speak 

12 3 the lord shall cut off all flatter lip and the tongu that 
speaketh proud thing 

12 4 who have said with our tongu will we prevail our lip are our 
own who is lord over u 

12 5 for the oppress of the poor for the sigh of the needi now 
will i ari saith the lord i will set him in safeti from him that 
puffeth at him 

12 6 the word of the lord are pure word a silver tri in a 
furnac of earth purifi seven time 

12 7 thou shalt keep them o lord thou shalt preserv them from thi 
gener for ever 

12 8 the wick walk on everi side when the vilest men are exalt 



13 1 how long wilt thou forget me o lord for ever how long wilt 
thou hide thi face from me 

13 2 how long shall i take counsel in my soul have sorrow in my 
heart daili how long shall mine enemi be exalt over me 

13 3 consid and hear me o lord my god lighten mine eye lest i 
sleep the sleep of death 

13 4 lest mine enemi say i have prevail against him and those that 
troubl me rejoic when i am move 

13 5 but i have trust in thi merci my heart shall rejoic in thi 
salvat 

13 6 i will sing unto the lord becau he hath dealt bounti with 
me 



14 1 the fool hath said in hi heart there is no god they are 
corrupt they have done abomin work there is none that doeth 
good 

14 2 the lord look down from heaven upon the child of men to see 
if there were ani that did understand and seek god 

14 3 they are all gone asid they are all togeth becom filthi 
there is none that doeth good no not one 

14 4 have all the worker of iniqu no knowledg who eat up my 
peopl a they eat bread and call not upon the lord 

14 5 there were they in great fear for god is in the gener of 
the righteou 

14 6 ye have shame the counsel of the poor becau the lord is hi 
refug 

14 7 oh that the salvat of israel were come out of zion when the 
lord bringeth back the captiv of hi peopl jacob shall rejoic 
and israel shall be glad 



15 1 lord who shall abid in thi tabernacl who shall dwell in thi 
holi hill 

15 2 he that walketh uprightli and worketh righteou and 
speaketh the truth in hi heart 

15 3 he that backbiteth not with hi tongu nor doeth evil to hi 
neighbour nor taketh up a reproach against hi neighbour 

15 4 in whose eye a vile person is contemn but he honoureth them 
that fear the lord he that sweareth to hi own hurt and changeth 
not 

15 5 he that putteth not out hi money to usuri nor taketh reward 
against the innoc he that doeth these thing shall never be move 



16 1 preserv me o god for in thee do i put my trust 

16 2 o my soul thou hast said unto the lord thou art my lord my 
good extendeth not to thee 

16 3 but to the saint that are in the earth and to the excel in 
whom is all my delight 

16 4 their sorrow shall be multipli that hasten after anoth god 
their drink offer of blood will i not offer nor take up their 
name into my lip 

16 5 the lord is the portion of mine inherit and of my cup thou 
maintainest my lot 

16 6 the line are fallen unto me in pleasant place yea i have a 
goodli heritag 

16 7 i will bless the lord who hath given me counsel my rein also 
instruct me in the night season 

16 8 i have set the lord alway befor me becau he is at my right 
hand i shall not be move 

16 9 therefor my heart is glad and my glori rejoiceth my flesh also 
shall rest in hope 

16 10 for thou wilt not leav my soul in hell neither wilt thou 
suffer thine holi one to see corrupt 

16 11 thou wilt shew me the path of life in thi presenc is ful 
of joy at thi right hand there are pleasur for evermor 



17 1 hear the right o lord attend unto my cri give ear unto my 
prayer that goeth not out of feign lip 

17 2 let my sentenc come forth from thi presenc let thine eye 
behold the thing that are equal 

17 3 thou hast prove mine heart thou hast visit me in the night 
thou hast tri me and shalt find noth i am purpo that my 
mouth shall not transgress 

17 4 concern the work of men by the word of thi lip i have kept 
me from the path of the destroy 

17 5 hold up my go in thi path that my footstep slip not 

17 6 i have call upon thee for thou wilt hear me o god inclin 
thine ear unto me and hear my speech 

17 7 shew thi marvel lovingkind o thou that savest by thi 
right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up 
against them 

17 8 keep me a the appl of the eye hide me under the shadow of thi 
wing 

17 9 from the wick that oppress me from my deadli enemi who 
compass me about 

17 10 they are inclo in their own fat with their mouth they speak 
proudli 

17 11 they have now compass u in our step they have set their 
eye bow down to the earth 

17 12 like a a lion that is greedi of hi prey and a it were a 
young lion lurk in secret place 

17 13 ari o lord disappoint him cast him down deliv my soul 
from the wick which is thi sword 

17 14 from men which are thi hand o lord from men of the world 
which have their portion in thi life and whose belli thou fillest 
with thi hid treasur they are full of child and leav the rest 
of their substanc to their babe 

17 15 a for me i will behold thi face in righteou i shall be 
satisfi when i awak with thi like 



18 1 i will love thee o lord my strength 

18 2 the lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliv my god 
my strength in whom i will trust my buckler and the horn of my 
salvat and my high tower 

18 3 i will call upon the lord who is worthi to be prai so shall 
i be save from mine enemi 

18 4 the sorrow of death compass me and the flood of ungodli men 
made me afraid 

18 5 the sorrow of hell compass me about the snare of death 
prevent me 

18 6 in my distress i call upon the lord and cri unto my god he 
heard my voic out of hi templ and my cri came befor him even 
into hi ear 

18 7 then the earth shook and trembl the foundat also of the 
hill move and were shaken becau he wa wroth 

18 8 there went up a smoke out of hi nostril and fire out of hi 
mouth devour coal were kindl by it 

18 9 he bow the heaven also and came down and dark wa under 
hi foot 

18 10 and he rode upon a cherub and did fli yea he did fli upon the 
wing of the wind 

18 11 he made dark hi secret place hi pavilion round about him 
were dark water and thick cloud of the sky 

18 12 at the bright that wa befor him hi thick cloud pa 
hail stone and coal of fire 

18 13 the lord also thunder in the heaven and the highest gave hi 
voic hail stone and coal of fire 

18 14 yea he sent out hi arrow and scatter them and he shot out 
lightn and discomfit them 

18 15 then the channel of water were seen and the foundat of 
the world were discov at thi rebuk o lord at the blast of the 
breath of thi nostril 

18 16 he sent from abov he took me he drew me out of mani water 

18 17 he deliv me from my strong enemi and from them which hate 
me for they were too strong for me 

18 18 they prevent me in the day of my calam but the lord wa my 
stay 

18 19 he brought me forth also into a larg place he deliv me 
becau he delight in me 

18 20 the lord reward me accord to my righteou accord to 
the clean of my hand hath he recompen me 

18 21 for i have kept the way of the lord and have not wickedli 
depart from my god 

18 22 for all hi judgment were befor me and i did not put away hi 
statut from me 

18 23 i wa also upright befor him and i kept myself from mine 
iniqu 

18 24 therefor hath the lord recompen me accord to my 
righteou accord to the clean of my hand in hi eyesight 

18 25 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merci with an 
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright 

18 26 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure and with the froward 
thou wilt shew thyself froward 

18 27 for thou wilt save the afflict peopl but wilt bring down 
high look 

18 28 for thou wilt light my candl the lord my god will enlighten my 
dark 

18 29 for by thee i have run through a troop and by my god have i 
leap over a wall 

18 30 a for god hi way is perfect the word of the lord is tri 
he is a buckler to all those that trust in him 

18 31 for who is god save the lord or who is a rock save our god 

18 32 it is god that girdeth me with strength and maketh my way 
perfect 

18 33 he maketh my foot like hind foot and setteth me upon my high 
place 

18 34 he teacheth my hand to war so that a bow of steel is broken by 
mine arm 

18 35 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvat and thi 
right hand hath holden me up and thi gentl hath made me great 

18 36 thou hast enlarg my step under me that my foot did not slip 

18 37 i have pursu mine enemi and overtaken them neither did i 
turn again till they were consum 

18 38 i have wound them that they were not abl to rise they are 
fallen under my foot 

18 39 for thou hast gird me with strength unto the battl thou hast 
subdu under me those that rose up against me 

18 40 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemi that i might 
destroy them that hate me 

18 41 they cri but there wa none to save them even unto the lord 
but he answer them not 

18 42 then did i beat them small a the dust befor the wind i did 
cast them out a the dirt in the street 

18 43 thou hast deliv me from the strive of the peopl and 
thou hast made me the head of the heathen a peopl whom i have not 
known shall serv me 

18 44 a soon a they hear of me they shall obey me the stranger 
shall submit themselv unto me 

18 45 the stranger shall fade away and be afraid out of their close 
place 

18 46 the lord liveth and bless be my rock and let the god of my 
salvat be exalt 

18 47 it is god that avengeth me and subdueth the peopl under me 

18 48 he delivereth me from mine enemi yea thou liftest me up 
abov those that rise up against me thou hast deliv me from the 
violent man 

18 49 therefor will i give thank unto thee o lord among the 
heathen and sing prai unto thi name 

18 50 great deliv giveth he to hi king and sheweth merci to 
hi anoint to david and to hi seed for evermor 



19 1 the heaven declar the glori of god and the firmament sheweth 
hi handywork 

19 2 day unto day uttereth speech and night unto night sheweth 
knowledg 

19 3 there is no speech nor languag where their voic is not heard 

19 4 their line is gone out through all the earth and their word to 
the end of the world in them hath he set a tabernacl for the sun 

19 5 which is a a bridegroom come out of hi chamber and rejoiceth 
a a strong man to run a race 

19 6 hi go forth is from the end of the heaven and hi circuit 
unto the end of it and there is noth hid from the heat thereof 

19 7 the law of the lord is perfect convert the soul the 
testimoni of the lord is sure make wise the simpl 

19 8 the statut of the lord are right rejoic the heart the 
command of the lord is pure enlighten the eye 

19 9 the fear of the lord is clean endur for ever the judgment 
of the lord are true and righteou altogeth 

19 10 more to be desir are they than gold yea than much fine gold 
sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb 

19 11 moreov by them is thi servant warn and in keep of them 
there is great reward 

19 12 who can understand hi error clean thou me from secret 
fault 

19 13 keep back thi servant also from presumptu sin let them not 
have dominion over me then shall i be upright and i shall be 
innoc from the great transgress 

19 14 let the word of my mouth and the medit of my heart be 
accept in thi sight o lord my strength and my redeem 



20 1 the lord hear thee in the day of troubl the name of the god of 
jacob defend thee 

20 2 send thee help from the sanctuari and strengthen thee out of 
zion 

20 3 rememb all thi offer and accept thi burnt sacrif 
selah 

20 4 grant thee accord to thine own heart and fulfil all thi 
counsel 

20 5 we will rejoic in thi salvat and in the name of our god we 
will set up our banner the lord fulfil all thi petit 

20 6 now know i that the lord saveth hi anoint he will hear him 
from hi holi heaven with the save strength of hi right hand 

20 7 some trust in chariot and some in hor but we will rememb 
the name of the lord our god 

20 8 they are brought down and fallen but we are risen and stand 
upright 

20 9 save lord let the king hear u when we call 



21 1 the king shall joy in thi strength o lord and in thi salvat 
how greatli shall he rejoic 

21 2 thou hast given him hi heart s desir and hast not withholden 
the request of hi lip selah 

21 3 for thou preventest him with the bless of good thou 
settest a crown of pure gold on hi head 

21 4 he ask life of thee and thou gavest it him even length of 
day for ever and ever 

21 5 hi glori is great in thi salvat honour and majesti hast thou 
laid upon him 

21 6 for thou hast made him most bless for ever thou hast made him 
exceed glad with thi counten 

21 7 for the king trusteth in the lord and through the merci of the 
most high he shall not be move 

21 8 thine hand shall find out all thine enemi thi right hand shall 
find out those that hate thee 

21 9 thou shalt make them a a fieri oven in the time of thine anger 
the lord shall swallow them up in hi wrath and the fire shall devour 
them 

21 10 their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth and their seed 
from among the child of men 

21 11 for they intend evil against thee they imagin a mischiev 
devic which they are not abl to perform 

21 12 therefor shalt thou make them turn their back when thou shalt 
make readi thine arrow upon thi string against the face of them 

21 13 be thou exalt lord in thine own strength so will we sing 
and prai thi power 



22 1 my god my god whi hast thou forsaken me whi art thou so far 
from help me and from the word of my roar 

22 2 o my god i cri in the day time but thou hearest not and in the 
night season and am not silent 

22 3 but thou art holi o thou that inhabitest the prai of israel 

22 4 our father trust in thee they trust and thou didst deliv 
them 

22 5 they cri unto thee and were deliv they trust in thee 
and were not confound 

22 6 but i am a worm and no man a reproach of men and despi of 
the peopl 

22 7 all they that see me laugh me to scorn they shoot out the lip 
they shake the head say 

22 8 he trust on the lord that he would deliv him let him deliv 
him see he delight in him 

22 9 but thou art he that took me out of the womb thou didst make me 
hope when i wa upon my mother s breast 

22 10 i wa cast upon thee from the womb thou art my god from my 
mother s belli 

22 11 be not far from me for troubl is near for there is none to 
help 

22 12 mani bull have compass me strong bull of bashan have beset 
me round 

22 13 they gape upon me with their mouth a a raven and a 
roar lion 

22 14 i am pour out like water and all my bone are out of joint 
my heart is like wax it is melt in the midst of my bowel 

22 15 my strength is dri up like a potsherd and my tongu cleaveth 
to my jaw and thou hast brought me into the dust of death 

22 16 for dog have compass me the assembl of the wick have 
inclo me they pierc my hand and my foot 

22 17 i may tell all my bone they look and stare upon me 

22 18 they part my garment among them and cast lot upon my vestur 

22 19 but be not thou far from me o lord o my strength hast thee 
to help me 

22 20 deliv my soul from the sword my darl from the power of the 
dog 

22 21 save me from the lion s mouth for thou hast heard me from the 
horn of the unicorn 

22 22 i will declar thi name unto my brother in the midst of the 
congreg will i prai thee 

22 23 ye that fear the lord prai him all ye the seed of jacob 
glorifi him and fear him all ye the seed of israel 

22 24 for he hath not despi nor abhor the afflict of the 
afflict neither hath he hid hi face from him but when he cri 
unto him he heard 

22 25 my prai shall be of thee in the great congreg i will pay 
my vow befor them that fear him 

22 26 the meek shall eat and be satisfi they shall prai the lord 
that seek him your heart shall live for ever 

22 27 all the end of the world shall rememb and turn unto the lord 
and all the kindr of the nation shall worship befor thee 

22 28 for the kingdom is the lord s and he is the governor among the 
nation 

22 29 all they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship all they 
that go down to the dust shall bow befor him and none can keep aliv 
hi own soul 

22 30 a seed shall serv him it shall be account to the lord for a 
gener 

22 31 they shall come and shall declar hi righteou unto a 
peopl that shall be born that he hath done thi 



23 1 the lord is my shepherd i shall not want 

23 2 he maketh me to lie down in green pastur he leadeth me besid 
the still water 

23 3 he restoreth my soul he leadeth me in the path of righteou 
for hi name s sake 

23 4 yea though i walk through the valley of the shadow of death i 
will fear no evil for thou art with me thi rod and thi staff they 
comfort me 

23 5 thou preparest a tabl befor me in the presenc of mine enemi 
thou anointest my head with oil my cup runneth over 

23 6 sure good and merci shall follow me all the day of my 
life and i will dwell in the hou of the lord for ever 



24 1 the earth is the lord s and the ful thereof the world and 
they that dwell therein 

24 2 for he hath found it upon the sea and establish it upon the 
flood 

24 3 who shall ascend into the hill of the lord or who shall stand in 
hi holi place 

24 4 he that hath clean hand and a pure heart who hath not lift 
up hi soul unto vaniti nor sworn deceit 

24 5 he shall receiv the bless from the lord and righteou 
from the god of hi salvat 

24 6 thi is the gener of them that seek him that seek thi face 
o jacob selah 

24 7 lift up your head o ye gate and be ye lift up ye everlast 
door and the king of glori shall come in 

24 8 who is thi king of glori the lord strong and mighti the lord 
mighti in battl 

24 9 lift up your head o ye gate even lift them up ye everlast 
door and the king of glori shall come in 

24 10 who is thi king of glori the lord of host he is the king of 
glori selah 



25 1 unto thee o lord do i lift up my soul 

25 2 o my god i trust in thee let me not be asham let not mine 
enemi triumph over me 

25 3 yea let none that wait on thee be asham let them be asham 
which transgress without cau 

25 4 shew me thi way o lord teach me thi path 

25 5 lead me in thi truth and teach me for thou art the god of my 
salvat on thee do i wait all the day
