25 6 rememb o lord thi tender merci and thi lovingkind 
for they have been ever of old 

25 7 rememb not the sin of my youth nor my transgress 
accord to thi merci rememb thou me for thi good sake o 
lord 

25 8 good and upright is the lord therefor will he teach sinner in 
the way 

25 9 the meek will he guid in judgment and the meek will he teach 
hi way 

25 10 all the path of the lord are merci and truth unto such a keep 
hi coven and hi testimoni 

25 11 for thi name s sake o lord pardon mine iniqu for it is 
great 

25 12 what man is he that feareth the lord him shall he teach in the 
way that he shall choo 

25 13 hi soul shall dwell at ea and hi seed shall inherit the 
earth 

25 14 the secret of the lord is with them that fear him and he will 
shew them hi coven 

25 15 mine eye are ever toward the lord for he shall pluck my foot 
out of the net 

25 16 turn thee unto me and have merci upon me for i am desol and 
afflict 

25 17 the troubl of my heart are enlarg o bring thou me out of my 
distress 

25 18 look upon mine afflict and my pain and forgiv all my sin 

25 19 consid mine enemi for they are mani and they hate me with 
cruel hatr 

25 20 o keep my soul and deliv me let me not be asham for i put 
my trust in thee 

25 21 let integr and upright preserv me for i wait on thee 

25 22 redeem israel o god out of all hi troubl 



26 1 judg me o lord for i have walk in mine integr i have 
trust also in the lord therefor i shall not slide 

26 2 examin me o lord and prove me tri my rein and my heart 

26 3 for thi lovingkind is befor mine eye and i have walk in 
thi truth 

26 4 i have not sat with vain person neither will i go in with 
dissembl 

26 5 i have hate the congreg of evil doer and will not sit 
with the wick 

26 6 i will wash mine hand in innoc so will i compass thine 
altar o lord 

26 7 that i may publish with the voic of thanksgiv and tell of 
all thi wondrou work 

26 8 lord i have love the habit of thi hou and the place 
where thine honour dwelleth 

26 9 gather not my soul with sinner nor my life with bloodi men 

26 10 in whose hand is mischief and their right hand is full of 
bribe 

26 11 but a for me i will walk in mine integr redeem me and be 
merci unto me 

26 12 my foot standeth in an even place in the congreg will i 
bless the lord 



27 1 the lord is my light and my salvat whom shall i fear the 
lord is the strength of my life of whom shall i be afraid 

27 2 when the wick even mine enemi and my foe came upon me to 
eat up my flesh they stumbl and fell 

27 3 though an host should encamp against me my heart shall not fear 
though war should rise against me in thi will i be confid 

27 4 one thing have i desir of the lord that will i seek after 
that i may dwell in the hou of the lord all the day of my life to 
behold the beauti of the lord and to enquir in hi templ 

27 5 for in the time of troubl he shall hide me in hi pavilion in 
the secret of hi tabernacl shall he hide me he shall set me up upon 
a rock 

27 6 and now shall mine head be lift up abov mine enemi round 
about me therefor will i offer in hi tabernacl sacrif of joy 
i will sing yea i will sing prai unto the lord 

27 7 hear o lord when i cri with my voic have merci also upon me 
and answer me 

27 8 when thou saidst seek ye my face my heart said unto thee thi 
face lord will i seek 

27 9 hide not thi face far from me put not thi servant away in anger 
thou hast been my help leav me not neither forsak me o god of my 
salvat 

27 10 when my father and my mother forsak me then the lord will take 
me up 

27 11 teach me thi way o lord and lead me in a plain path becau 
of mine enemi 

27 12 deliv me not over unto the will of mine enemi for fal 
wit are risen up against me and such a breath out cruelti 

27 13 i had faint unless i had believ to see the good of the 
lord in the land of the live 

27 14 wait on the lord be of good courag and he shall strengthen 
thine heart wait i say on the lord 



28 1 unto thee will i cri o lord my rock be not silent to me lest 
if thou be silent to me i becom like them that go down into the pit 

28 2 hear the voic of my supplic when i cri unto thee when i 
lift up my hand toward thi holi oracl 

28 3 draw me not away with the wick and with the worker of 
iniqu which speak peac to their neighbour but mischief is in 
their heart 

28 4 give them accord to their deed and accord to the 
wick of their endeavour give them after the work of their 
hand render to them their desert 

28 5 becau they regard not the work of the lord nor the oper 
of hi hand he shall destroy them and not build them up 

28 6 bless be the lord becau he hath heard the voic of my 
supplic 

28 7 the lord is my strength and my shield my heart trust in him 
and i am help therefor my heart greatli rejoiceth and with my 
song will i prai him 

28 8 the lord is their strength and he is the save strength of hi 
anoint 

28 9 save thi peopl and bless thine inherit feed them also and 
lift them up for ever 



29 1 give unto the lord o ye mighti give unto the lord glori and 
strength 

29 2 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name worship the lord 
in the beauti of holi 

29 3 the voic of the lord is upon the water the god of glori 
thundereth the lord is upon mani water 

29 4 the voic of the lord is power the voic of the lord is full 
of majesti 

29 5 the voic of the lord breaketh the cedar yea the lord breaketh 
the cedar of lebanon 

29 6 he maketh them also to skip like a calf lebanon and sirion like 
a young unicorn 

29 7 the voic of the lord divideth the flame of fire 

29 8 the voic of the lord shaketh the wilder the lord shaketh 
the wilder of kadesh 

29 9 the voic of the lord maketh the hind to calv and discovereth 
the forest and in hi templ doth everi one speak of hi glori 

29 10 the lord sitteth upon the flood yea the lord sitteth king for 
ever 

29 11 the lord will give strength unto hi peopl the lord will bless 
hi peopl with peac 



30 1 i will extol thee o lord for thou hast lift me up and hast 
not made my foe to rejoic over me 

30 2 o lord my god i cri unto thee and thou hast heal me 

30 3 o lord thou hast brought up my soul from the grave thou hast 
kept me aliv that i should not go down to the pit 

30 4 sing unto the lord o ye saint of hi and give thank at the 
remembr of hi holi 

30 5 for hi anger endureth but a moment in hi favour is life 
weep may endur for a night but joy cometh in the morn 

30 6 and in my prosper i said i shall never be move 

30 7 lord by thi favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong 
thou didst hide thi face and i wa troubl 

30 8 i cri to thee o lord and unto the lord i made supplic 

30 9 what profit is there in my blood when i go down to the pit 
shall the dust prai thee shall it declar thi truth 

30 10 hear o lord and have merci upon me lord be thou my helper 

30 11 thou hast turn for me my mourn into danc thou hast put 
off my sackcloth and gird me with glad 

30 12 to the end that my glori may sing prai to thee and not be 
silent 

o lord my god i will give thank unto thee for ever 



31 1 in thee o lord do i put my trust let me never be asham 
deliv me in thi righteou 

31 2 bow down thine ear to me deliv me speedili be thou my strong 
rock for an hou of defenc to save me 

31 3 for thou art my rock and my fortress therefor for thi name s 
sake lead me and guid me 

31 4 pull me out of the net that they have laid privili for me for 
thou art my strength 

31 5 into thine hand i commit my spirit thou hast redeem me o lord 
god of truth 

31 6 i have hate them that regard lie vaniti but i trust in the 
lord 

31 7 i will be glad and rejoic in thi merci for thou hast consid 
my troubl thou hast known my soul in adver 

31 8 and hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemi thou hast set 
my foot in a larg room 

31 9 have merci upon me o lord for i am in troubl mine eye is 
consum with grief yea my soul and my belli 

31 10 for my life is spent with grief and my year with sigh my 
strength faileth becau of mine iniqu and my bone are consum 

31 11 i wa a reproach among all mine enemi but especi among my 
neighbour and a fear to mine acquaint they that did see me 
without fled from me 

31 12 i am forgotten a a dead man out of mind i am like a broken 
vessel 

31 13 for i have heard the slander of mani fear wa on everi side 
while they took counsel togeth against me they devi to take away 
my life 

31 14 but i trust in thee o lord i said thou art my god 

31 15 my time are in thi hand deliv me from the hand of mine 
enemi and from them that persecut me 

31 16 make thi face to shine upon thi servant save me for thi 
merci sake 

31 17 let me not be asham o lord for i have call upon thee let 
the wick be asham and let them be silent in the grave 

31 18 let the lie lip be put to silenc which speak grievou 
thing proudli and contemptu against the righteou 

31 19 oh how great is thi good which thou hast laid up for them 
that fear thee which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee 
befor the son of men 

31 20 thou shalt hide them in the secret of thi presenc from the 
pride of man thou shalt keep them secretli in a pavilion from the 
strife of tongu 

31 21 bless be the lord for he hath shew me hi marvel 
kind in a strong citi 

31 22 for i said in my hast i am cut off from befor thine eye 
nevertheless thou heardest the voic of my supplic when i cri 
unto thee 

31 23 o love the lord all ye hi saint for the lord preserveth the 
faith and plenti rewardeth the proud doer 

31 24 be of good courag and he shall strengthen your heart all ye 
that hope in the lord 



32 1 bless is he whose transgress is forgiven whose sin is 
cover 

32 2 bless is the man unto whom the lord imputeth not iniqu and 
in whose spirit there is no guil 

32 3 when i kept silenc my bone wax old through my roar all 
the day long 

32 4 for day and night thi hand wa heavi upon me my moistur is 
turn into the drought of summer selah 

32 5 i acknowledg my sin unto thee and mine iniqu have i not hid 
i said i will confess my transgress unto the lord and thou 
forgavest the iniqu of my sin selah 

32 6 for thi shall everi one that is godli pray unto thee in a time 
when thou mayest be found sure in the flood of great water they 
shall not come nigh unto him 

32 7 thou art my hide place thou shalt preserv me from troubl 
thou shalt compass me about with song of deliv selah 

32 8 i will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt 
go i will guid thee with mine eye 

32 9 be ye not a the hor or a the mule which have no 
understand whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridl lest 
they come near unto thee 

32 10 mani sorrow shall be to the wick but he that trusteth in the 
lord merci shall compass him about 

32 11 be glad in the lord and rejoic ye righteou and shout for 
joy all ye that are upright in heart 



33 1 rejoic in the lord o ye righteou for prai is come for the 
upright 

33 2 prai the lord with harp sing unto him with the psalteri and an 
instrument of ten string 

33 3 sing unto him a new song play skil with a loud noi 

33 4 for the word of the lord is right and all hi work are done in 
truth 

33 5 he loveth righteou and judgment the earth is full of the 
good of the lord 

33 6 by the word of the lord were the heaven made and all the host 
of them by the breath of hi mouth 

33 7 he gathereth the water of the sea togeth a an heap he layeth 
up the depth in storeh 

33 8 let all the earth fear the lord let all the inhabit of the 
world stand in awe of him 

33 9 for he spake and it wa done he command and it stood fast 

33 10 the lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought he 
maketh the devic of the peopl of none effect 

33 11 the counsel of the lord standeth for ever the thought of hi 
heart to all gener 

33 12 bless is the nation whose god is the lord and the peopl whom 
he hath chosen for hi own inherit 

33 13 the lord looketh from heaven he beholdeth all the son of men 

33 14 from the place of hi habit he looketh upon all the 
inhabit of the earth 

33 15 he fashioneth their heart alik he considereth all their 
work 

33 16 there is no king save by the multitud of an host a mighti man 
is not deliv by much strength 

33 17 an hor is a vain thing for safeti neither shall he deliv 
ani by hi great strength 

33 18 behold the eye of the lord is upon them that fear him upon 
them that hope in hi merci 

33 19 to deliv their soul from death and to keep them aliv in 
famin 

33 20 our soul waiteth for the lord he is our help and our shield 

33 21 for our heart shall rejoic in him becau we have trust in 
hi holi name 

33 22 let thi merci o lord be upon u accord a we hope in thee 



34 1 i will bless the lord at all time hi prai shall continu 
be in my mouth 

34 2 my soul shall make her boast in the lord the humbl shall hear 
thereof and be glad 

34 3 o magnifi the lord with me and let u exalt hi name togeth 

34 4 i sought the lord and he heard me and deliv me from all my 
fear 

34 5 they look unto him and were lighten and their face were 
not asham 

34 6 thi poor man cri and the lord heard him and save him out of 
all hi troubl 

34 7 the angel of the lord encampeth round about them that fear him 
and delivereth them 

34 8 o tast and see that the lord is good bless is the man that 
trusteth in him 

34 9 o fear the lord ye hi saint for there is no want to them that 
fear him 

34 10 the young lion do lack and suffer hunger but they that seek 
the lord shall not want ani good thing 

34 11 come ye child hearken unto me i will teach you the fear of 
the lord 

34 12 what man is he that desireth life and loveth mani day that he 
may see good 

34 13 keep thi tongu from evil and thi lip from speak guil 

34 14 depart from evil and do good seek peac and pursu it 

34 15 the eye of the lord are upon the righteou and hi ear are 
open unto their cri 

34 16 the face of the lord is against them that do evil to cut off 
the remembr of them from the earth 

34 17 the righteou cri and the lord heareth and delivereth them out 
of all their troubl 

34 18 the lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart and 
saveth such a be of a contrit spirit 

34 19 mani are the afflict of the righteou but the lord 
delivereth him out of them all 

34 20 he keepeth all hi bone not one of them is broken 

34 21 evil shall slay the wick and they that hate the righteou 
shall be desol 

34 22 the lord redeemeth the soul of hi servant and none of them 
that trust in him shall be desol 



35 1 plead my cau o lord with them that strive with me fight 
against them that fight against me 

35 2 take hold of shield and buckler and stand up for mine help 

35 3 draw out also the spear and stop the way against them that 
persecut me say unto my soul i am thi salvat 

35 4 let them be confound and put to shame that seek after my soul 
let them be turn back and brought to confu that devi my hurt 

35 5 let them be a chaff befor the wind and let the angel of the 
lord chase them 

35 6 let their way be dark and slipperi and let the angel of the lord 
persecut them 

35 7 for without cau have they hid for me their net in a pit which 
without cau they have dig for my soul 

35 8 let destruct come upon him at unawar and let hi net that 
he hath hid catch himself into that veri destruct let him fall 

35 9 and my soul shall be joy in the lord it shall rejoic in hi 
salvat 

35 10 all my bone shall say lord who is like unto thee which 
deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him yea the poor 
and the needi from him that spoileth him 

35 11 fal wit did rise up they laid to my charg thing that 
i knew not 

35 12 they reward me evil for good to the spoil of my soul 

35 13 but a for me when they were sick my cloth wa sackcloth i 
humbl my soul with fast and my prayer return into mine own 
bosom 

35 14 i behav myself a though he had been my friend or brother i 
bow down heavili a one that mourneth for hi mother 

35 15 but in mine adver they rejoic and gather themselv 
togeth yea the abject gather themselv togeth against me 
and i knew it not they did tear me and cea not 

35 16 with hypocrit mocker in feast they gnash upon me with 
their teeth 

35 17 lord how long wilt thou look on rescu my soul from their 
destruct my darl from the lion 

35 18 i will give thee thank in the great congreg i will prai 
thee among much peopl 

35 19 let not them that are mine enemi wrong rejoic over me 
neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cau 

35 20 for they speak not peac but they devi deceit matter 
against them that are quiet in the land 

35 21 yea they open their mouth wide against me and said aha 
aha our eye hath seen it 

35 22 thi thou hast seen o lord keep not silenc o lord be not 
far from me 

35 23 stir up thyself and awak to my judgment even unto my cau 
my god and my lord 

35 24 judg me o lord my god accord to thi righteou and let 
them not rejoic over me 

35 25 let them not say in their heart ah so would we have it let 
them not say we have swallow him up 

35 26 let them be asham and brought to confu togeth that 
rejoic at mine hurt let them be cloth with shame and dishonour 
that magnifi themselv against me 

35 27 let them shout for joy and be glad that favour my righteou 
cau yea let them say continu let the lord be magnifi which 
hath pleasur in the prosper of hi servant 

35 28 and my tongu shall speak of thi righteou and of thi prai 
all the day long 



36 1 the transgress of the wick saith within my heart that there 
is no fear of god befor hi eye 

36 2 for he flattereth himself in hi own eye until hi iniqu be 
found to be hate 

36 3 the word of hi mouth are iniqu and deceit he hath left off 
to be wise and to do good 

36 4 he deviseth mischief upon hi bed he setteth himself in a way 
that is not good he abhorreth not evil 

36 5 thi merci o lord is in the heaven and thi faith 
reacheth unto the cloud 

36 6 thi righteou is like the great mountain thi judgment are 
a great deep o lord thou preservest man and beast 

36 7 how excel is thi lovingkind o god therefor the 
child of men put their trust under the shadow of thi wing 

36 8 they shall be abundantli satisfi with the fat of thi hou 
and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thi pleasur 

36 9 for with thee is the fountain of life in thi light shall we see 
light 

36 10 o continu thi lovingkind unto them that know thee and thi 
righteou to the upright in heart 

36 11 let not the foot of pride come against me and let not the hand 
of the wick remov me 

36 12 there are the worker of iniqu fallen they are cast down 
and shall not be abl to rise 



37 1 fret not thyself becau of evildo neither be thou enviou 
against the worker of iniqu 

37 2 for they shall soon be cut down like the grass and wither a the 
green herb 

37 3 trust in the lord and do good so shalt thou dwell in the land 
and verili thou shalt be fed 

37 4 delight thyself also in the lord and he shall give thee the 
desir of thine heart 

37 5 commit thi way unto the lord trust also in him and he shall 
bring it to pa 

37 6 and he shall bring forth thi righteou a the light and thi 
judgment a the noonday 

37 7 rest in the lord and wait patient for him fret not thyself 
becau of him who prospereth in hi way becau of the man who 
bringeth wick devic to pa 

37 8 cea from anger and forsak wrath fret not thyself in ani wise 
to do evil 

37 9 for evildo shall be cut off but those that wait upon the 
lord they shall inherit the earth 

37 10 for yet a littl while and the wick shall not be yea thou 
shalt dilig consid hi place and it shall not be 

37 11 but the meek shall inherit the earth and shall delight 
themselv in the abund of peac 

37 12 the wick plotteth against the just and gnasheth upon him with 
hi teeth 

37 13 the lord shall laugh at him for he seeth that hi day is 
come 

37 14 the wick have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow to 
cast down the poor and needi and to slay such a be of upright 
conver 

37 15 their sword shall enter into their own heart and their bow 
shall be broken 

37 16 a littl that a righteou man hath is better than the rich of 
mani wick 

37 17 for the arm of the wick shall be broken but the lord 
upholdeth the righteou 

37 18 the lord knoweth the day of the upright and their inherit 
shall be for ever 

37 19 they shall not be asham in the evil time and in the day of 
famin they shall be satisfi 

37 20 but the wick shall perish and the enemi of the lord shall 
be a the fat of lamb they shall consum into smoke shall they 
consum away 

37 21 the wick borroweth and payeth not again but the righteou 
sheweth merci and giveth 

37 22 for such a be bless of him shall inherit the earth and they 
that be cur of him shall be cut off 

37 23 the step of a good man are order by the lord and he 
delighteth in hi way 

37 24 though he fall he shall not be utterli cast down for the lord 
upholdeth him with hi hand 

37 25 i have been young and now am old yet have i not seen the 
righteou forsaken nor hi seed beg bread 

37 26 he is ever merci and lendeth and hi seed is bless 

37 27 depart from evil and do good and dwell for evermor 

37 28 for the lord loveth judgment and forsaketh not hi saint they 
are preserv for ever but the seed of the wick shall be cut off 

37 29 the righteou shall inherit the land and dwell therein for 
ever 

37 30 the mouth of the righteou speaketh wisdom and hi tongu 
talketh of judgment 

37 31 the law of hi god is in hi heart none of hi step shall 
slide 

37 32 the wick watcheth the righteou and seeketh to slay him 

37 33 the lord will not leav him in hi hand nor condemn him when he 
is judg 

37 34 wait on the lord and keep hi way and he shall exalt thee to 
inherit the land when the wick are cut off thou shalt see it 

37 35 i have seen the wick in great power and spread himself 
like a green bay tree 

37 36 yet he pa away and lo he wa not yea i sought him but 
he could not be found 

37 37 mark the perfect man and behold the upright for the end of 
that man is peac 

37 38 but the transgressor shall be destroy togeth the end of 
the wick shall be cut off 

37 39 but the salvat of the righteou is of the lord he is their 
strength in the time of troubl 

37 40 and the lord shall help them and deliv them he shall deliv 
them from the wick and save them becau they trust in him 



38 1 o lord rebuk me not in thi wrath neither chasten me in thi hot 
displeasur 

38 2 for thine arrow stick fast in me and thi hand presseth me sore 

38 3 there is no sound in my flesh becau of thine anger neither 
is there ani rest in my bone becau of my sin 

38 4 for mine iniqu are gone over mine head a an heavi burden 
they are too heavi for me 

38 5 my wound stink and are corrupt becau of my foolish 

38 6 i am troubl i am bow down greatli i go mourn all the day 
long 

38 7 for my loin are fill with a loathsom disea and there is no 
sound in my flesh 

38 8 i am feebl and sore broken i have roar by reason of the 
disquiet of my heart 

38 9 lord all my desir is befor thee and my groan is not hid 
from thee 

38 10 my heart panteth my strength faileth me a for the light of 
mine eye it also is gone from me 

38 11 my lover and my friend stand aloof from my sore and my 
kinsman stand afar off 

38 12 they also that seek after my life lay snare for me and they 
that seek my hurt speak mischiev thing and imagin deceit all 
the day long 

38 13 but i a a deaf man heard not and i wa a a dumb man that 
openeth not hi mouth 

38 14 thu i wa a a man that heareth not and in whose mouth are no 
reproof 

38 15 for in thee o lord do i hope thou wilt hear o lord my god 

38 16 for i said hear me lest otherwi they should rejoic over me 
when my foot slippeth they magnifi themselv against me 

38 17 for i am readi to halt and my sorrow is continu befor me 

38 18 for i will declar mine iniqu i will be sorri for my sin 

38 19 but mine enemi are live and they are strong and they that 
hate me wrong are multipli 

38 20 they also that render evil for good are mine adversari 
becau i follow the thing that good is 

38 21 forsak me not o lord o my god be not far from me 

38 22 make hast to help me o lord my salvat 



39 1 i said i will take heed to my way that i sin not with my 
tongu i will keep my mouth with a bridl while the wick is befor 
me 

39 2 i wa dumb with silenc i held my peac even from good and my 
sorrow wa stir 

39 3 my heart wa hot within me while i wa muse the fire burn 
then spake i with my tongu 

39 4 lord make me to know mine end and the measur of my day what 
it is that i may know how frail i am 

39 5 behold thou hast made my day a an handbreadth and mine age is 
a noth befor thee verili everi man at hi best state is 
altogeth vaniti 

selah 

39 6 sure everi man walketh in a vain shew sure they are 
disquiet in vain he heapeth up rich and knoweth not who shall 
gather them 

39 7 and now lord what wait i for my hope is in thee 

39 8 deliv me from all my transgress make me not the reproach 
of the foolish 

39 9 i wa dumb i open not my mouth becau thou didst it 

39 10 remov thi stroke away from me i am consum by the blow of 
thine hand 

39 11 when thou with rebuk dost correct man for iniqu thou 
makest hi beauti to consum away like a moth sure everi man is 
vaniti selah 

39 12 hear my prayer o lord and give ear unto my cri hold not thi 
peac at my tear for i am a stranger with thee and a sojourn a 
all my father were 

39 13 o spare me that i may recov strength befor i go henc and 
be no more 



40 1 i wait patient for the lord and he inclin unto me and 
heard my cri 

40 2 he brought me up also out of an horribl pit out of the miri 
clay and set my foot upon a rock and establish my go 

40 3 and he hath put a new song in my mouth even prai unto our god 
mani shall see it and fear and shall trust in the lord 

40 4 bless is that man that maketh the lord hi trust and 
respecteth not the proud nor such a turn asid to lie 

40 5 mani o lord my god are thi wonder work which thou hast 
done and thi thought which are to u ward they cannot be reckon 
up in order unto thee if i would declar and speak of them they are 
more than can be number 

40 6 sacrif and offer thou didst not desir mine ear hast thou 
open burnt offer and sin offer hast thou not requir 

40 7 then said i lo i come in the volum of the book it is written 
of me 

40 8 i delight to do thi will o my god yea thi law is within my 
heart 

40 9 i have preach righteou in the great congreg lo i 
have not refrain my lip o lord thou knowest 

40 10 i have not hid thi righteou within my heart i have 
declar thi faith and thi salvat i have not conceal thi 
lovingkind and thi truth from the great congreg 

40 11 withhold not thou thi tender merci from me o lord let thi 
lovingkind and thi truth continu preserv me 

40 12 for innum evil have compass me about mine iniqu 
have taken hold upon me so that i am not abl to look up they are 
more than the hair of mine head therefor my heart faileth me 

40 13 be plea o lord to deliv me o lord make hast to help 
me 

40 14 let them be asham and confound togeth that seek after my 
soul to destroy it let them be driven backward and put to shame that 
wish me evil 

40 15 let them be desol for a reward of their shame that say unto 
me aha aha 

40 16 let all those that seek thee rejoic and be glad in thee let 
such a love thi salvat say continu the lord be magnifi 

40 17 but i am poor and needi yet the lord thinketh upon me thou art 
my help and my deliv make no tarri o my god 



41 1 bless is he that considereth the poor the lord will deliv 
him in time of troubl 

41 2 the lord will preserv him and keep him aliv and he shall be 
bless upon the earth and thou wilt not deliv him unto the will of 
hi enemi 

41 3 the lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languish thou 
wilt make all hi bed in hi sick 

41 4 i said lord be merci unto me heal my soul for i have 
sin against thee 

41 5 mine enemi speak evil of me when shall he die and hi name 
perish 

41 6 and if he come to see me he speaketh vaniti hi heart gathereth 
iniqu to itself when he goeth abroad he telleth it 

41 7 all that hate me whisper togeth against me against me do they 
devi my hurt 

41 8 an evil disea say they cleaveth fast unto him and now that 
he lieth he shall rise up no more 

41 9 yea mine own familiar friend in whom i trust which did eat 
of my bread hath lift up hi heel against me 

41 10 but thou o lord be merci unto me and rai me up that i 
may requit them 

41 11 by thi i know that thou favourest me becau mine enemi doth 
not triumph over me 

41 12 and a for me thou upholdest me in mine integr and settest 
me befor thi face for ever 

41 13 bless be the lord god of israel from everlast and to 
everlast amen and amen 



42 1 a the hart panteth after the water brook so panteth my soul 
after thee o god 

42 2 my soul thirsteth for god for the live god when shall i come 
and appear befor god 

42 3 my tear have been my meat day and night while they continu 
say unto me where is thi god 

42 4 when i rememb these thing i pour out my soul in me for i had 
gone with the multitud i went with them to the hou of god with 
the voic of joy and prai with a multitud that kept holyday 

42 5 whi art thou cast down o my soul and whi art thou disquiet in 
me hope thou in god for i shall yet prai him for the help of hi 
counten 

42 6 o my god my soul is cast down within me therefor will i 
rememb thee from the land of jordan and of the hermonit from the 
hill mizar 

42 7 deep calleth unto deep at the noi of thi waterspout all thi 
wave and thi billow are gone over me 

42 8 yet the lord will command hi lovingkind in the day time and 
in the night hi song shall be with me and my prayer unto the god of 
my life 

42 9 i will say unto god my rock whi hast thou forgotten me whi go i 
mourn becau of the oppress of the enemi 

42 10 a with a sword in my bone mine enemi reproach me while 
they say daili unto me where is thi god 

42 11 whi art thou cast down o my soul and whi art thou disquiet 
within me hope thou in god for i shall yet prai him who is the 
health of my counten and my god 



43 1 judg me o god and plead my cau against an ungodli nation o 
deliv me from the deceit and unjust man 

43 2 for thou art the god of my strength whi dost thou cast me off 
whi go i mourn becau of the oppress of the enemi 

43 3 o send out thi light and thi truth let them lead me let them 
bring me unto thi holi hill and to thi tabernacl 

43 4 then will i go unto the altar of god unto god my exceed joy 
yea upon the harp will i prai thee o god my god 

43 5 whi art thou cast down o my soul and whi art thou disquiet 
within me hope in god for i shall yet prai him who is the health 
of my counten and my god 



44 1 we have heard with our ear o god our father have told u 
what work thou didst in their day in the time of old 

44 2 how thou didst drive out the heathen with thi hand and plantedst 
them how thou didst afflict the peopl and cast them out 

44 3 for they got not the land in poss by their own sword 
neither did their own arm save them but thi right hand and thine 
arm and the light of thi counten becau thou hadst a favour 
unto them 

44 4 thou art my king o god command deliv for jacob 

44 5 through thee will we push down our enemi through thi name will 
we tread them under that rise up against u 

44 6 for i will not trust in my bow neither shall my sword save me 

44 7 but thou hast save u from our enemi and hast put them to 
shame that hate u 

44 8 in god we boast all the day long and prai thi name for ever 

selah 

44 9 but thou hast cast off and put u to shame and goest not forth 
with our armi 

44 10 thou makest u to turn back from the enemi and they which hate 
u spoil for themselv 

44 11 thou hast given u like sheep appoint for meat and hast 
scatter u among the heathen 

44 12 thou sellest thi peopl for nought and dost not increa thi 
wealth by their price 

44 13 thou makest u a reproach to our neighbour a scorn and a 
deri to them that are round about u 

44 14 thou makest u a byword among the heathen a shake of the head 
among the peopl 

44 15 my confu is continu befor me and the shame of my face 
hath cover me 

44 16 for the voic of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth by reason 
of the enemi and aveng 

44 17 all thi is come upon u yet have we not forgotten thee 
neither have we dealt fal in thi coven 

44 18 our heart is not turn back neither have our step declin 
from thi way 

44 19 though thou hast sore broken u in the place of dragon and 
cover u with the shadow of death 

44 20 if we have forgotten the name of our god or stretch out our 
hand to a strang god 

44 21 shall not god search thi out for he knoweth the secret of the 
heart 

44 22 yea for thi sake are we kill all the day long we are count 
a sheep for the slaughter 

44 23 awak whi sleepest thou o lord ari cast u not off for 
ever 

44 24 wherefor hidest thou thi face and forgettest our afflict 
and our oppress 

44 25 for our soul is bow down to the dust our belli cleaveth unto 
the earth 

44 26 ari for our help and redeem u for thi merci sake 



45 1 my heart is indit a good matter i speak of the thing which i 
have made touch the king my tongu is the pen of a readi writer 

45 2 thou art fairer than the child of men grace is pour into 
thi lip therefor god hath bless thee for ever 

45 3 gird thi sword upon thi thigh o most mighti with thi glori and 
thi majesti 

45 4 and in thi majesti ride prosper becau of truth and 
meek and righteou and thi right hand shall teach thee 
terribl thing 

45 5 thine arrow are sharp in the heart of the king s enemi 
wherebi the peopl fall under thee 

45 6 thi throne o god is for ever and ever the sceptr of thi 
kingdom is a right sceptr 

45 7 thou lovest righteou and hatest wick therefor god 
thi god hath anoint thee with the oil of glad abov thi 
fellow 

45 8 all thi garment smell of myrrh and alo and cassia out of 
the ivori palac wherebi they have made thee glad 

45 9 king daughter were among thi honour woman upon thi right 
hand did stand the queen in gold of ophir 

45 10 hearken o daughter and consid and inclin thine ear forget 
also thine own peopl and thi father s hou 

45 11 so shall the king greatli desir thi beauti for he is thi lord 
and worship thou him 

45 12 and the daughter of tyre shall be there with a gift even the 
rich among the peopl shall intreat thi favour 

45 13 the king s daughter is all gloriou within her cloth is of 
wrought gold 

45 14 she shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework the 
virgin her companion that follow her shall be brought unto thee 

45 15 with glad and rejoic shall they be brought they shall 
enter into the king s palac 

45 16 instead of thi father shall be thi child whom thou mayest 
make princ in all the earth 

45 17 i will make thi name to be rememb in all gener 
therefor shall the peopl prai thee for ever and ever 



46 1 god is our refug and strength a veri present help in troubl 

46 2 therefor will not we fear though the earth be remov and 
though the mountain be carri into the midst of the sea 

46 3 though the water thereof roar and be troubl though the 
mountain shake with the swell thereof selah 

46 4 there is a river the stream whereof shall make glad the citi of 
god the holi place of the tabernacl of the most high 

46 5 god is in the midst of her she shall not be move god shall 
help her and that right earli 

46 6 the heathen rage the kingdom were move he utter hi voic 
the earth melt 

46 7 the lord of host is with u the god of jacob is our refug 
selah 

46 8 come behold the work of the lord what desol he hath made 
in the earth 

46 9 he maketh war to cea unto the end of the earth he breaketh 
the bow and cutteth the spear in sunder he burneth the chariot in 
the fire 

46 10 be still and know that i am god i will be exalt among the 
heathen i will be exalt in the earth 

46 11 the lord of host is with u the god of jacob is our refug 
selah 



47 1 o clap your hand all ye peopl shout unto god with the voic 
of triumph 

47 2 for the lord most high is terribl he is a great king over all 
the earth 

47 3 he shall subdu the peopl under u and the nation under our 
foot 

47 4 he shall choo our inherit for u the excel of jacob 
whom he love selah 

47 5 god is gone up with a shout the lord with the sound of a 
trumpet 

47 6 sing prai to god sing prai sing prai unto our king 
sing prai 

47 7 for god is the king of all the earth sing ye prai with 
understand 

47 8 god reigneth over the heathen god sitteth upon the throne of hi 
holi 

47 9 the princ of the peopl are gather togeth even the peopl 
of the god of abraham for the shield of the earth belong unto god 
he is greatli exalt 



48 1 great is the lord and greatli to be prai in the citi of our 
god in the mountain of hi holi 

48 2 beauti for situat the joy of the whole earth is mount 
zion on the side of the north the citi of the great king 

48 3 god is known in her palac for a refug 

48 4 for lo the king were assembl they pa by togeth 

48 5 they saw it and so they marvel they were troubl and 
hast away 

48 6 fear took hold upon them there and pain a of a woman in 
travail 

48 7 thou breakest the ship of tarshish with an east wind 

48 8 a we have heard so have we seen in the citi of the lord of 
host in the citi of our god god will establish it for ever selah 

48 9 we have thought of thi lovingkind o god in the midst of thi 
templ 

48 10 accord to thi name o god so is thi prai unto the end of 
the earth thi right hand is full of righteou 

48 11 let mount zion rejoic let the daughter of judah be glad 
becau of thi judgment 

48 12 walk about zion and go round about her tell the tower 
thereof 

48 13 mark ye well her bulwark consid her palac that ye may 
tell it to the gener follow 

48 14 for thi god is our god for ever and ever he will be our guid 
even unto death 



49 1 hear thi all ye peopl give ear all ye inhabit of the 
world 

49 2 both low and high rich and poor togeth 

49 3 my mouth shall speak of wisdom and the medit of my heart 
shall be of understand 

49 4 i will inclin mine ear to a parabl i will open my dark say 
upon the harp 

49 5 wherefor should i fear in the day of evil when the iniqu of 
my heel shall compass me about 

49 6 they that trust in their wealth and boast themselv in the 
multitud of their rich 

49 7 none of them can by ani mean redeem hi brother nor give to god 
a ransom for him 

49 8 for the redempt of their soul is preciou and it ceaseth for 
ever 

49 9 that he should still live for ever and not see corrupt 

49 10 for he seeth that wise men die likewi the fool and the 
brutish person perish and leav their wealth to other 

49 11 their inward thought is that their hou shall continu for 
ever and their dwell place to all gener they call their 
land after their own name 

49 12 nevertheless man be in honour abideth not he is like the 
beast that perish 

49 13 thi their way is their folli yet their poster approv their 
say selah 

49 14 like sheep they are laid in the grave death shall feed on them 
and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morn and 
their beauti shall consum in the grave from their dwell 

49 15 but god will redeem my soul from the power of the grave for he 
shall receiv me selah 

49 16 be not thou afraid when one is made rich when the glori of hi 
hou is increa 

49 17 for when he dieth he shall carri noth away hi glori shall 
not descend after him 

49 18 though while he live he bless hi soul and men will prai 
thee when thou doest well to thyself 

49 19 he shall go to the gener of hi father they shall never 
see light 

49 20 man that is in honour and understandeth not is like the beast 
that perish 



50 1 the mighti god even the lord hath spoken and call the earth 
from the rise of the sun unto the go down thereof 

50 2 out of zion the perfect of beauti god hath shine 

50 3 our god shall come and shall not keep silenc a fire shall 
devour befor him and it shall be veri tempestu round about him 

50 4 he shall call to the heaven from abov and to the earth that 
he may judg hi peopl 

50 5 gather my saint togeth unto me those that have made a 
coven with me by sacrif 

50 6 and the heaven shall declar hi righteou for god is judg 
himself selah 

50 7 hear o my peopl and i will speak o israel and i will testifi 
against thee i am god even thi god 

50 8 i will not reprov thee for thi sacrif or thi burnt 
offer to have been continu befor me 

50 9 i will take no bullock out of thi hou nor he goat out of thi 
fold 

50 10 for everi beast of the forest is mine and the cattl upon a 
thousand hill 

50 11 i know all the fowl of the mountain and the wild beast of 
the field are mine 

50 12 if i were hungri i would not tell thee for the world is mine 
and the ful thereof 

50 13 will i eat the flesh of bull or drink the blood of goat 

50 14 offer unto god thanksgiv and pay thi vow unto the most 
high 

50 15 and call upon me in the day of troubl i will deliv thee and 
thou shalt glorifi me 

50 16 but unto the wick god saith what hast thou to do to declar 
my statut or that thou shouldest take my coven in thi mouth 

50 17 see thou hatest instruct and casteth my word behind 
thee 

50 18 when thou sawest a thief then thou consentedst with him and 
hast been partak with adult 

50 19 thou givest thi mouth to evil and thi tongu frameth deceit 

50 20 thou sittest and speakest against thi brother thou slanderest 
thine own mother s son 

50 21 these thing hast thou done and i kept silenc thou thoughtest 
that i wa altogeth such an one a thyself but i will reprov thee 
and set them in order befor thine eye 

50 22 now consid thi ye that forget god lest i tear you in 
piec and there be none to deliv 

50 23 whoso offereth prai glorifieth me and to him that ordereth 
hi conver aright will i shew the salvat of god 



51 1 have merci upon me o god accord to thi lovingkind 
accord unto the multitud of thi tender merci blot out my 
transgress 

51 2 wash me throughli from mine iniqu and clean me from my sin 

51 3 for i acknowledg my transgress and my sin is ever befor 
me 

51 4 against thee thee onli have i sin and done thi evil in thi 
sight that thou mightest be justifi when thou speakest and be 
clear when thou judgest 

51 5 behold i wa shapen in iniqu and in sin did my mother 
conceiv me 

51 6 behold thou desirest truth in the inward part and in the 
hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom 

51 7 purg me with hyssop and i shall be clean wash me and i shall 
be whiter than snow 

51 8 make me to hear joy and glad that the bone which thou hast 
broken may rejoic 

51 9 hide thi face from my sin and blot out all mine iniqu 

51 10 creat in me a clean heart o god and renew a right spirit 
within me 

51 11 cast me not away from thi presenc and take not thi holi spirit 
from me 

51 12 restor unto me the joy of thi salvat and uphold me with thi 
free spirit 

51 13 then will i teach transgressor thi way and sinner shall be 
convert unto thee 

51 14 deliv me from bloodguilti o god thou god of my 
salvat and my tongu shall sing aloud of thi righteou 

51 15 o lord open thou my lip and my mouth shall shew forth thi 
prai 

51 16 for thou desirest not sacrif el would i give it thou 
delightest not in burnt offer 

51 17 the sacrif of god are a broken spirit a broken and a 
contrit heart o god thou wilt not despi 

51 18 do good in thi good pleasur unto zion build thou the wall of 
jerusalem 

51 19 then shalt thou be plea with the sacrif of righteou 
with burnt offer and whole burnt offer then shall they offer 
bullock upon thine altar 



52 1 whi boastest thou thyself in mischief o mighti man the good 
of god endureth continu 

52 2 the tongu deviseth mischief like a sharp razor work 
deceit 

52 3 thou lovest evil more than good and lie rather than to speak 
righteou selah 

52 4 thou lovest all devour word o thou deceit tongu 

52 5 god shall likewi destroy thee for ever he shall take thee 
away and pluck thee out of thi dwell place and root thee out of 
the land of the live selah 

52 6 the righteou also shall see and fear and shall laugh at him 

52 7 lo thi is the man that made not god hi strength but trust 
in the abund of hi rich and strengthen himself in hi 
wick 

52 8 but i am like a green oliv tree in the hou of god i trust in 
the merci of god for ever and ever 

52 9 i will prai thee for ever becau thou hast done it and i 
will wait on thi name for it is good befor thi saint 



53 1 the fool hath said in hi heart there is no god corrupt are 
they and have done abomin iniqu there is none that doeth 
good 

53 2 god look down from heaven upon the child of men to see if 
there were ani that did understand that did seek god 

53 3 everi one of them is gone back they are altogeth becom 
filthi there is none that doeth good no not one 

53 4 have the worker of iniqu no knowledg who eat up my peopl 
a they eat bread they have not call upon god 

53 5 there were they in great fear where no fear wa for god hath 
scatter the bone of him that encampeth against thee thou hast put 
them to shame becau god hath despi them 

53 6 oh that the salvat of israel were come out of zion when god 
bringeth back the captiv of hi peopl jacob shall rejoic and 
israel shall be glad 



54 1 save me o god by thi name and judg me by thi strength 

54 2 hear my prayer o god give ear to the word of my mouth 

54 3 for stranger are risen up against me and oppressor seek after 
my soul they have not set god befor them selah 

54 4 behold god is mine helper the lord is with them that uphold my 
soul 

54 5 he shall reward evil unto mine enemi cut them off in thi 
truth 

54 6 i will freeli sacrif unto thee i will prai thi name o 
lord for it is good 

54 7 for he hath deliv me out of all troubl and mine eye hath 
seen hi desir upon mine enemi 



55 1 give ear to my prayer o god and hide not thyself from my 
supplic 

55 2 attend unto me and hear me i mourn in my complaint and make a 
noi 

55 3 becau of the voic of the enemi becau of the oppress of 
the wick for they cast iniqu upon me and in wrath they hate me 

55 4 my heart is sore pain within me and the terror of death are 
fallen upon me 

55 5 fear and trembl are come upon me and horror hath 
overwhelm me 

55 6 and i said oh that i had wing like a dove for then would i fli 
away and be at rest 

55 7 lo then would i wander far off and remain in the wilder 
selah 

55 8 i would hasten my escap from the windi storm and tempest 

55 9 destroy o lord and divid their tongu for i have seen 
violenc and strife in the citi 

55 10 day and night they go about it upon the wall thereof mischief 
also and sorrow are in the midst of it 

55 11 wick is in the midst thereof deceit and guil depart not 
from her street 

55 12 for it wa not an enemi that reproach me then i could have 
born it neither wa it he that hate me that did magnifi himself 
against me then i would have hid myself from him 

55 13 but it wa thou a man mine equal my guid and mine 
acquaint 

55 14 we took sweet counsel togeth and walk unto the hou of god 
in compani 

55 15 let death seiz upon them and let them go down quick into hell 
for wick is in their dwell and among them 

55 16 a for me i will call upon god and the lord shall save me 

55 17 even and morn and at noon will i pray and cri aloud 
and he shall hear my voic 

55 18 he hath deliv my soul in peac from the battl that wa 
against me for there were mani with me 

55 19 god shall hear and afflict them even he that abideth of old 

selah becau they have no chang therefor they fear not god 

55 20 he hath put forth hi hand against such a be at peac with 
him he hath broken hi coven 

55 21 the word of hi mouth were smoother than butter but war wa in 
hi heart hi word were softer than oil yet were they drawn sword 

55 22 cast thi burden upon the lord and he shall sustain thee he 
shall never suffer the righteou to be move 

55 23 but thou o god shalt bring them down into the pit of 
destruct bloodi and deceit men shall not live out half their 
day but i will trust in thee 



56 1 be merci unto me o god for man would swallow me up he 
fight daili oppresseth me 

56 2 mine enemi would daili swallow me up for they be mani that 
fight against me o thou most high 

56 3 what time i am afraid i will trust in thee 

56 4 in god i will prai hi word in god i have put my trust i will 
not fear what flesh can do unto me 

56 5 everi day they wrest my word all their thought are against me 
for evil 

56 6 they gather themselv togeth they hide themselv they mark 
my step when they wait for my soul 

56 7 shall they escap by iniqu in thine anger cast down the 
peopl o god 

56 8 thou tellest my wander put thou my tear into thi bottl 
are they not in thi book 

56 9 when i cri unto thee then shall mine enemi turn back thi i 
know for god is for me 

56 10 in god will i prai hi word in the lord will i prai hi 
word 

56 11 in god have i put my trust i will not be afraid what man can do 
unto me 

56 12 thi vow are upon me o god i will render prai unto thee 

56 13 for thou hast deliv my soul from death wilt not thou 
deliv my foot from fall that i may walk befor god in the light 
of the live 



57 1 be merci unto me o god be merci unto me for my soul 
trusteth in thee yea in the shadow of thi wing will i make my 
refug until these calam be overpast 

57 2 i will cri unto god most high unto god that performeth all 
thing for me 

57 3 he shall send from heaven and save me from the reproach of him 
that would swallow me up selah god shall send forth hi merci and 
hi truth 

57 4 my soul is among lion and i lie even among them that are set on 
fire even the son of men whose teeth are spear and arrow and 
their tongu a sharp sword 

57 5 be thou exalt o god abov the heaven let thi glori be abov 
all the earth 

57 6 they have prepar a net for my step my soul is bow down 
they have dig a pit befor me into the midst whereof they are 
fallen themselv selah 

57 7 my heart is fix o god my heart is fix i will sing and give 
prai 

57 8 awak up my glori awak psalteri and harp i myself will awak 
earli 

57 9 i will prai thee o lord among the peopl i will sing unto 
thee among the nation 

57 10 for thi merci is great unto the heaven and thi truth unto the 
cloud 

57 11 be thou exalt o god abov the heaven let thi glori be 
abov all the earth 



58 1 do ye ind speak righteou o congreg do ye judg 
uprightli o ye son of men 

58 2 yea in heart ye work wick ye weigh the violenc of your 
hand in the earth 

58 3 the wick are estrang from the womb they go astray a soon a 
they be born speak lie 

58 4 their poison is like the poison of a serpent they are like the 
deaf adder that stoppeth her ear 

58 5 which will not hearken to the voic of charmer charm never 
so wise 

58 6 break their teeth o god in their mouth break out the great 
teeth of the young lion o lord 

58 7 let them melt away a water which run continu when he 
bendeth hi bow to shoot hi arrow let them be a cut in piec 

58 8 a a snail which melteth let everi one of them pa away like 
the untim birth of a woman that they may not see the sun 

58 9 befor your pot can feel the thorn he shall take them away a 
with a whirlwind both live and in hi wrath 

58 10 the righteou shall rejoic when he seeth the vengeanc he 
shall wash hi foot in the blood of the wick 

58 11 so that a man shall say verili there is a reward for the 
righteou verili he is a god that judgeth in the earth 



59 1 deliv me from mine enemi o my god defend me from them that 
rise up against me 

59 2 deliv me from the worker of iniqu and save me from bloodi 
men 

59 3 for lo they lie in wait for my soul the mighti are gather 
against me not for my transgress nor for my sin o lord 

59 4 they run and prepar themselv without my fault awak to help 
me and behold 

59 5 thou therefor o lord god of host the god of israel awak to 
visit all the heathen be not merci to ani wick transgressor 
selah 

59 6 they return at even they make a noi like a dog and go 
round about the citi 

59 7 behold they belch out with their mouth sword are in their 
lip for who say they doth hear 

59 8 but thou o lord shalt laugh at them thou shalt have all the 
heathen in deri 

59 9 becau of hi strength will i wait upon thee for god is my 
defenc 

59 10 the god of my merci shall prevent me god shall let me see my 
desir upon mine enemi 

59 11 slay them not lest my peopl forget scatter them by thi power 
and bring them down o lord our shield 

59 12 for the sin of their mouth and the word of their lip let them 
even be taken in their pride and for cur and lie which they 
speak 

59 13 consum them in wrath consum them that they may not be and 
let them know that god ruleth in jacob unto the end of the earth 
selah 

59 14 and at even let them return and let them make a noi like a 
dog and go round about the citi 

59 15 let them wander up and down for meat and grudg if they be not 
satisfi 

59 16 but i will sing of thi power yea i will sing aloud of thi 
merci in the morn for thou hast been my defenc and refug in the 
day of my troubl 

59 17 unto thee o my strength will i sing for god is my defenc 
and the god of my merci 



60 1 o god thou hast cast u off thou hast scatter u thou hast 
been displea o turn thyself to u again 

60 2 thou hast made the earth to trembl thou hast broken it heal 
the breach thereof for it shaketh 

60 3 thou hast shew thi peopl hard thing thou hast made u to 
drink the wine of astonish 

60 4 thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee that it may be 
display becau of the truth selah 

60 5 that thi belov may be deliv save with thi right hand and 
hear me 

60 6 god hath spoken in hi holi i will rejoic i will divid 
shechem and mete out the valley of succoth 

60 7 gilead is mine and manasseh is mine ephraim also is the 
strength of mine head judah is my lawgiv 

60 8 moab is my washpot over edom will i cast out my shoe philistia 
triumph thou becau of me 

60 9 who will bring me into the strong citi who will lead me into 
edom 

60 10 wilt not thou o god which hadst cast u off and thou o god 
which didst not go out with our armi 

60 11 give u help from troubl for vain is the help of man 

60 12 through god we shall do valiantli for he it is that shall tread 
down our enemi 



61 1 hear my cri o god attend unto my prayer 

61 2 from the end of the earth will i cri unto thee when my heart is 
overwhelm lead me to the rock that is higher than i 

61 3 for thou hast been a shelter for me and a strong tower from the 
enemi 

61 4 i will abid in thi tabernacl for ever i will trust in the 
covert of thi wing selah 

61 5 for thou o god hast heard my vow thou hast given me the 
heritag of those that fear thi name 

61 6 thou wilt prolong the king s life and hi year a mani 
gener 

61 7 he shall abid befor god for ever o prepar merci and truth 
which may preserv him 

61 8 so will i sing prai unto thi name for ever that i may daili 
perform my vow 



62 1 truli my soul waiteth upon god from him cometh my salvat 

62 2 he onli is my rock and my salvat he is my defenc i shall 
not be greatli move 

62 3 how long will ye imagin mischief against a man ye shall be 
slain all of you a a bow wall shall ye be and a a totter 
fenc 

62 4 they onli consult to cast him down from hi excel they 
delight in lie they bless with their mouth but they cur inwardli 
selah 

62 5 my soul wait thou onli upon god for my expect is from him 

62 6 he onli is my rock and my salvat he is my defenc i shall 
not be move 

62 7 in god is my salvat and my glori the rock of my strength and 
my refug is in god 

62 8 trust in him at all time ye peopl pour out your heart befor 
him god is a refug for u selah 

62 9 sure men of low degr are vaniti and men of high degr are a 
lie to be laid in the balanc they are altogeth lighter than 
vaniti 

62 10 trust not in oppress and becom not vain in robberi if 
rich increa set not your heart upon them 

62 11 god hath spoken onc twice have i heard thi that power 
belongeth unto god 

62 12 also unto thee o lord belongeth merci for thou renderest to 
everi man accord to hi work 



63 1 o god thou art my god earli will i seek thee my soul thirsteth 
for thee my flesh longeth for thee in a dri and thirsti land where 
no water is 

63 2 to see thi power and thi glori so a i have seen thee in the 
sanctuari 

63 3 becau thi lovingkind is better than life my lip shall 
prai thee 

63 4 thu will i bless thee while i live i will lift up my hand in 
thi name 

63 5 my soul shall be satisfi a with marrow and fat and my 
mouth shall prai thee with joy lip 

63 6 when i rememb thee upon my bed and medit on thee in the 
night watch 

63 7 becau thou hast been my help therefor in the shadow of thi 
wing will i rejoic 

63 8 my soul followeth hard after thee thi right hand upholdeth me 

63 9 but those that seek my soul to destroy it shall go into the 
lower part of the earth 

63 10 they shall fall by the sword they shall be a portion for fox 

63 11 but the king shall rejoic in god everi one that sweareth by 
him shall glori but the mouth of them that speak lie shall be 
stop 



64 1 hear my voic o god in my prayer preserv my life from fear of 
the enemi 

64 2 hide me from the secret counsel of the wick from the 
insurrect of the worker of iniqu 

64 3 who whet their tongu like a sword and bend their bow to shoot 
their arrow even bitter word 

64 4 that they may shoot in secret at the perfect suddenli do they 
shoot at him and fear not 

64 5 they encourag themselv in an evil matter they commun of 
lay snare privili they say who shall see them 

64 6 they search out iniqu they accomplish a dilig search 
both the inward thought of everi one of them and the heart is deep 

64 7 but god shall shoot at them with an arrow suddenli shall they be 
wound 

64 8 so they shall make their own tongu to fall upon themselv all 
that see them shall flee away 

64 9 and all men shall fear and shall declar the work of god for 
they shall wise consid of hi do 

64 10 the righteou shall be glad in the lord and shall trust in him 
and all the upright in heart shall glori 



65 1 prai waiteth for thee o god in sion and unto thee shall the 
vow be perform 

65 2 o thou that hearest prayer unto thee shall all flesh come 

65 3 iniqu prevail against me a for our transgress thou 
shalt purg them away 

65 4 bless is the man whom thou choosest and causest to approach 
unto thee that he may dwell in thi court we shall be satisfi with 
the good of thi hou even of thi holi templ 

65 5 by terribl thing in righteou wilt thou answer u o god of 
our salvat who art the confid of all the end of the earth 
and of them that are afar off upon the sea 

65 6 which by hi strength setteth fast the mountain be gird 
with power 

65 7 which stilleth the noi of the sea the noi of their wave 
and the tumult of the peopl 

65 8 they also that dwell in the uttermost part are afraid at thi 
token thou makest the outgo of the morn and even to 
rejoic 

65 9 thou visitest the earth and waterest it thou greatli enrichest 
it with the river of god which is full of water thou preparest them 
corn when thou hast so provid for it 

65 10 thou waterest the ridg thereof abundantli thou settlest the 
furrow thereof thou makest it soft with shower thou blessest the 
spring thereof 

65 11 thou crownest the year with thi good and thi path drop 
fat 

65 12 they drop upon the pastur of the wilder and the littl 
hill rejoic on everi side 

65 13 the pastur are cloth with flock the valley also are 
cover over with corn they shout for joy they also sing 



66 1 make a joy noi unto god all ye land 

66 2 sing forth the honour of hi name make hi prai gloriou 

66 3 say unto god how terribl art thou in thi work through the 
great of thi power shall thine enemi submit themselv unto 
thee 

66 4 all the earth shall worship thee and shall sing unto thee they 
shall sing to thi name selah 

66 5 come and see the work of god he is terribl in hi do toward 
the child of men 

66 6 he turn the sea into dri land they went through the flood on 
foot there did we rejoic in him 

66 7 he ruleth by hi power for ever hi eye behold the nation let 
not the rebelli exalt themselv selah 

66 8 o bless our god ye peopl and make the voic of hi prai to 
be heard 

66 9 which holdeth our soul in life and suffereth not our foot to be 
move 

66 10 for thou o god hast prove u thou hast tri u a silver 
is tri 

66 11 thou broughtest u into the net thou laidst afflict upon our 
loin 

66 12 thou hast cau men to ride over our head we went through 
fire and through water but thou broughtest u out into a wealthi 
place 

66 13 i will go into thi hou with burnt offer i will pay thee 
my vow 

66 14 which my lip have utter and my mouth hath spoken when i wa 
in troubl 

66 15 i will offer unto thee burnt sacrif of fatl with the 
incen of ram i will offer bullock with goat selah 

66 16 come and hear all ye that fear god and i will declar what he 
hath done for my soul

tongu 

66 18 if i regard iniqu in my heart the lord will not hear me 

66 19 but verili god hath heard me he hath attend to the voic of 
my prayer 

66 20 bless be god which hath not turn away my prayer nor hi 
merci from me 



67 1 god be merci unto u and bless u and cau hi face to

67 2 that thi way may be known upon earth thi save health among all 
nation

68 1 let god ari let hi enemi be scatter let them also that 
hate him flee befor him 

68 2 a smoke is driven away so drive them away a wax melteth 
befor the fire so let the wick perish at the presenc of god 

68 3 but let the righteou be glad let them rejoic befor god yea 
let them exceedingli rejoic 

68 4 sing unto god sing prai to hi name extol him that rideth 
upon the heaven by hi name jah and rejoic befor him 

68 5 a father of the fatherless and a judg of the widow is god in 
hi holi habit 

68 6 god setteth the solitari in famili he bringeth out those which 
are bound with chain but the rebelli dwell in a dri land 

68 7 o god when thou wentest forth befor thi peopl when thou didst 
march through the wilder selah 

68 8 the earth shook the heaven also drop at the presenc of god 
even sinai itself wa move at the presenc of god the god of israel 

68 9 thou o god didst send a plenti rain wherebi thou didst 
confirm thine inherit when it wa weari 

68 10 thi congreg hath dwelt therein thou o god hast prepar 
of thi good for the poor 

68 11 the lord gave the word great wa the compani of those that 
publish it 

68 12 king of armi did flee apac and she that tarri at home 
divid the spoil 

68 13 though ye have lien among the pot yet shall ye be a the wing 
of a dove cover with silver and her feather with yellow gold 

68 14 when the almighti scatter king in it it wa white a snow in 
salmon 

68 15 the hill of god is a the hill of bashan an high hill a the 
hill of bashan 

68 16 whi leap ye ye high hill thi is the hill which god desireth 
to dwell in yea the lord will dwell in it for ever 

68 17 the chariot of god are twenti thousand even thousand of 
angel the lord is among them a in sinai in the holi place 

68 18 thou hast ascend on high thou hast led captiv captiv 
thou hast receiv gift for men yea for the rebelli also that 
the lord god might dwell among them

the god of our salvat selah

lord belong the issu from death 

68 21 but god shall wound the head of hi enemi and the hairi scalp 
of such an one a goeth on still in hi trespass 

68 22 the lord said i will bring again from bashan i will bring my 
peopl again from the depth of the sea 

68 23 that thi foot may be dip in the blood of thine enemi and 
the tongu of thi dog in the same 

68 24 they have seen thi go o god even the go of my god my 
king in the sanctuari 

68 25 the singer went befor the player on instrument follow 
after among them were the damsel play with timbrel

fountain of israel

unto thee 

68 30 rebuk the compani of spearmen the multitud of the bull with

silver scatter thou the peopl that delight in war 

68 31 princ shall come out of egypt ethiopia shall soon stretch out 
her hand unto god 

68 32 sing unto god ye kingdom of the earth o sing prai unto the 
lord selah

old lo he doth send out hi voic and that a mighti voic
