hi strength is in the cloud 

68 35 o god thou art terribl out of thi holi place the god of 
israel is he that giveth strength and power unto hi peopl bless 
be god 



69 1 save me o god for the water are come in unto my soul 

69 2 i sink in deep mire where there is no stand i am come into 
deep water where the flood overflow me 

69 3 i am weari of my cri my throat is dri mine eye fail while 
i wait for my god 

69 4 they that hate me without a cau are more than the hair of mine 
head they that would destroy me be mine enemi wrong are 
mighti then i restor that which i took not away 

69 5 o god thou knowest my foolish and my sin are not hid from 
thee 

69 6 let not them that wait on thee o lord god of host be asham 
for my sake let not those that seek thee be confound for my sake o 
god of israel 

69 7 becau for thi sake i have born reproach shame hath cover my 
face 

69 8 i am becom a stranger unto my brother and an alien unto my 
mother s child 

69 9 for the zeal of thine hou hath eaten me up and the reproach 
of them that reproach thee are fallen upon me 

69 10 when i wept and chasten my soul with fast that wa to my 
reproach 

69 11 i made sackcloth also my garment and i becam a proverb to 
them 

69 12 they that sit in the gate speak against me and i wa the song 
of the drunkard 

69 13 but a for me my prayer is unto thee o lord in an accept 
time o god in the multitud of thi merci hear me in the truth of 
thi salvat 

69 14 deliv me out of the mire and let me not sink let me be 
deliv from them that hate me and out of the deep water 

69 15 let not the waterflood overflow me neither let the deep swallow 
me up and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me 

69 16 hear me o lord for thi lovingkind is good turn unto me 
accord to the multitud of thi tender merci 

69 17 and hide not thi face from thi servant for i am in troubl 
hear me speedili 

69 18 draw nigh unto my soul and redeem it deliv me becau of 
mine enemi 

69 19 thou hast known my reproach and my shame and my dishonour 
mine adversari are all befor thee 

69 20 reproach hath broken my heart and i am full of heavi and i 
look for some to take piti but there wa none and for comfort 
but i found none 

69 21 they gave me also gall for my meat and in my thirst they gave 
me vinegar to drink 

69 22 let their tabl becom a snare befor them and that which 
should have been for their welfar let it becom a trap 

69 23 let their eye be darken that they see not and make their 
loin continu to shake 

69 24 pour out thine indign upon them and let thi wrath anger 
take hold of them 

69 25 let their habit be desol and let none dwell in their 
tent 

69 26 for they persecut him whom thou hast smitten and they talk to 
the grief of those whom thou hast wound 

69 27 add iniqu unto their iniqu and let them not come into thi 
righteou 

69 28 let them be blot out of the book of the live and not be 
written with the righteou 

69 29 but i am poor and sorrow let thi salvat o god set me up 
on high 

69 30 i will prai the name of god with a song and will magnifi him 
with thanksgiv 

69 31 thi also shall plea the lord better than an ox or bullock 
that hath horn and hoof 

69 32 the humbl shall see thi and be glad and your heart shall 
live that seek god 

69 33 for the lord heareth the poor and despiseth not hi prison 

69 34 let the heaven and earth prai him the sea and everi thing 
that moveth therein 

69 35 for god will save zion and will build the citi of judah that 
they may dwell there and have it in poss 

69 36 the seed also of hi servant shall inherit it and they that 
love hi name shall dwell therein 



70 1 make hast o god to deliv me make hast to help me o lord 

70 2 let them be asham and confound that seek after my soul let 
them be turn backward and put to confu that desir my hurt 

70 3 let them be turn back for a reward of their shame that say 
aha aha 

70 4 let all those that seek thee rejoic and be glad in thee and let 
such a love thi salvat say continu let god be magnifi 

70 5 but i am poor and needi make hast unto me o god thou art my 
help and my deliv o lord make no tarri 



71 1 in thee o lord do i put my trust let me never be put to 
confu 

71 2 deliv me in thi righteou and cau me to escap inclin 
thine ear unto me and save me 

71 3 be thou my strong habit whereunto i may continu resort 
thou hast given command to save me for thou art my rock and my 
fortress 

71 4 deliv me o my god out of the hand of the wick out of the 
hand of the unright and cruel man 

71 5 for thou art my hope o lord god thou art my trust from my 
youth 

71 6 by thee have i been holden up from the womb thou art he that 
took me out of my mother s bowel my prai shall be continu of 
thee 

71 7 i am a a wonder unto mani but thou art my strong refug 

71 8 let my mouth be fill with thi prai and with thi honour all 
the day 

71 9 cast me not off in the time of old age forsak me not when my 
strength faileth 

71 10 for mine enemi speak against me and they that lay wait for my 
soul take counsel togeth 

71 11 say god hath forsaken him persecut and take him for there 
is none to deliv him 

71 12 o god be not far from me o my god make hast for my help 

71 13 let them be confound and consum that are adversari to my 
soul let them be cover with reproach and dishonour that seek my 
hurt 

71 14 but i will hope continu and will yet prai thee more and 
more 

71 15 my mouth shall shew forth thi righteou and thi salvat 
all the day for i know not the number thereof 

71 16 i will go in the strength of the lord god i will make mention 
of thi righteou even of thine onli 

71 17 o god thou hast taught me from my youth and hitherto have i 
declar thi wondrou work 

71 18 now also when i am old and greyhead o god forsak me not 
until i have shew thi strength unto thi gener and thi power 
to everi one that is to come 

71 19 thi righteou also o god is veri high who hast done great 
thing o god who is like unto thee 

71 20 thou which hast shew me great and sore troubl shalt 
quicken me again and shalt bring me up again from the depth of the 
earth 

71 21 thou shalt increa my great and comfort me on everi side 

71 22 i will also prai thee with the psalteri even thi truth o my 
god unto thee will i sing with the harp o thou holi one of israel 

71 23 my lip shall greatli rejoic when i sing unto thee and my 
soul which thou hast redeem 

71 24 my tongu also shall talk of thi righteou all the day long 
for they are confound for they are brought unto shame that seek my 
hurt 



72 1 give the king thi judgment o god and thi righteou unto 
the king s son 

72 2 he shall judg thi peopl with righteou and thi poor with 
judgment 

72 3 the mountain shall bring peac to the peopl and the littl 
hill by righteou 

72 4 he shall judg the poor of the peopl he shall save the child 
of the needi and shall break in piec the oppressor 

72 5 they shall fear thee a long a the sun and moon endur 
throughout all gener 

72 6 he shall come down like rain upon the mown grass a shower that 
water the earth 

72 7 in hi day shall the righteou flourish and abund of peac 
so long a the moon endureth 

72 8 he shall have dominion also from sea to sea and from the river 
unto the end of the earth 

72 9 they that dwell in the wilder shall bow befor him and hi 
enemi shall lick the dust 

72 10 the king of tarshish and of the isl shall bring present the 
king of sheba and seba shall offer gift 

72 11 yea all king shall fall down befor him all nation shall 
serv him 

72 12 for he shall deliv the needi when he crieth the poor also 
and him that hath no helper 

72 13 he shall spare the poor and needi and shall save the soul of 
the needi 

72 14 he shall redeem their soul from deceit and violenc and 
preciou shall their blood be in hi sight 

72 15 and he shall live and to him shall be given of the gold of 
sheba prayer also shall be made for him continu and daili shall 
he be prai 

72 16 there shall be an hand of corn in the earth upon the top of 
the mountain the fruit thereof shall shake like lebanon and they of 
the citi shall flourish like grass of the earth 

72 17 hi name shall endur for ever hi name shall be continu a 
long a the sun and men shall be bless in him all nation shall 
call him bless 

72 18 bless be the lord god the god of israel who onli doeth 
wondrou thing 

72 19 and bless be hi gloriou name for ever and let the whole 
earth be fill with hi glori amen and amen 

72 20 the prayer of david the son of jess are end 



73 1 truli god is good to israel even to such a are of a clean 
heart 

73 2 but a for me my foot were almost gone my step had well nigh 
slip 

73 3 for i wa enviou at the foolish when i saw the prosper of 
the wick 

73 4 for there are no band in their death but their strength is 
firm 

73 5 they are not in troubl a other men neither are they plagu 
like other men 

73 6 therefor pride compasseth them about a a chain violenc 
covereth them a a garment 

73 7 their eye stand out with fat they have more than heart 
could wish 

73 8 they are corrupt and speak wickedli concern oppress they 
speak loftili 

73 9 they set their mouth against the heaven and their tongu 
walketh through the earth 

73 10 therefor hi peopl return hither and water of a full cup are 
wrung out to them 

73 11 and they say how doth god know and is there knowledg in the 
most high 

73 12 behold these are the ungodli who prosper in the world they 
increa in rich 

73 13 verili i have clean my heart in vain and wash my hand in 
innoc 

73 14 for all the day long have i been plagu and chasten everi 
morn 

73 15 if i say i will speak thu behold i should offend against the 
gener of thi child 

73 16 when i thought to know thi it wa too pain for me 

73 17 until i went into the sanctuari of god then understood i their 
end 

73 18 sure thou didst set them in slipperi place thou castedst 
them down into destruct 

73 19 how are they brought into desol a in a moment they are 
utterli consum with terror 

73 20 a a dream when one awaketh so o lord when thou awakest thou 
shalt despi their imag 

73 21 thu my heart wa griev and i wa prick in my rein 

73 22 so foolish wa i and ignor i wa a a beast befor thee 

73 23 nevertheless i am continu with thee thou hast holden me by 
my right hand 

73 24 thou shalt guid me with thi counsel and afterward receiv me 
to glori 

73 25 whom have i in heaven but thee and there is none upon earth 
that i desir besid thee 

73 26 my flesh and my heart faileth but god is the strength of my 
heart and my portion for ever 

73 27 for lo they that are far from thee shall perish thou hast 
destroy all them that go a whore from thee 

73 28 but it is good for me to draw near to god i have put my trust 
in the lord god that i may declar all thi work 



74 1 o god whi hast thou cast u off for ever whi doth thine anger 
smoke against the sheep of thi pastur 

74 2 rememb thi congreg which thou hast purcha of old the 
rod of thine inherit which thou hast redeem thi mount zion 
wherein thou hast dwelt 

74 3 lift up thi foot unto the perpetu desol even all that 
the enemi hath done wickedli in the sanctuari 

74 4 thine enemi roar in the midst of thi congreg they set up 
their ensign for sign 

74 5 a man wa famou accord a he had lift up ax upon the 
thick tree 

74 6 but now they break down the carv work thereof at onc with ax 
and hammer 

74 7 they have cast fire into thi sanctuari they have defil by 
cast down the dwell place of thi name to the ground 

74 8 they said in their heart let u destroy them togeth they 
have burn up all the synagogu of god in the land 

74 9 we see not our sign there is no more ani prophet neither is 
there among u ani that knoweth how long 

74 10 o god how long shall the adversari reproach shall the enemi 
blasphem thi name for ever 

74 11 whi withdrawest thou thi hand even thi right hand pluck it out 
of thi bosom 

74 12 for god is my king of old work salvat in the midst of the 
earth 

74 13 thou didst divid the sea by thi strength thou brakest the 
head of the dragon in the water 

74 14 thou brakest the head of leviathan in piec and gavest him to 
be meat to the peopl inhabit the wilder 

74 15 thou didst cleav the fountain and the flood thou driedst up 
mighti river 

74 16 the day is thine the night also is thine thou hast prepar 
the light and the sun 

74 17 thou hast set all the border of the earth thou hast made 
summer and winter 

74 18 rememb thi that the enemi hath reproach o lord and that 
the foolish peopl have blasphem thi name 

74 19 o deliv not the soul of thi turtledov unto the multitud of 
the wick forget not the congreg of thi poor for ever 

74 20 have respect unto the coven for the dark place of the earth 
are full of the habit of cruelti 

74 21 o let not the oppress return asham let the poor and needi 
prai thi name 

74 22 ari o god plead thine own cau rememb how the foolish 
man reproacheth thee daili 

74 23 forget not the voic of thine enemi the tumult of those that 
rise up against thee increaseth continu 



75 1 unto thee o god do we give thank unto thee do we give thank 
for that thi name is near thi wondrou work declar 

75 2 when i shall receiv the congreg i will judg uprightli 

75 3 the earth and all the inhabit thereof are dissolv i bear 
up the pillar of it selah 

75 4 i said unto the fool deal not foolishli and to the wick 
lift not up the horn 

75 5 lift not up your horn on high speak not with a stiff neck 

75 6 for promot cometh neither from the east nor from the west 
nor from the south 

75 7 but god is the judg he putteth down one and setteth up 
anoth 

75 8 for in the hand of the lord there is a cup and the wine is red 
it is full of mixtur and he poureth out of the same but the dreg 
thereof all the wick of the earth shall wring them out and drink 
them 

75 9 but i will declar for ever i will sing prai to the god of 
jacob 

75 10 all the horn of the wick also will i cut off but the horn 
of the righteou shall be exalt 



76 1 in judah is god known hi name is great in israel 

76 2 in salem also is hi tabernacl and hi dwell place in zion 

76 3 there brake he the arrow of the bow the shield and the sword 
and the battl selah 

76 4 thou art more gloriou and excel than the mountain of prey 

76 5 the stoutheart are spoil they have slept their sleep and 
none of the men of might have found their hand 

76 6 at thi rebuk o god of jacob both the chariot and hor are 
cast into a dead sleep 

76 7 thou even thou art to be fear and who may stand in thi sight 
when onc thou art angri 

76 8 thou didst cau judgment to be heard from heaven the earth 
fear and wa still 

76 9 when god aro to judgment to save all the meek of the earth 
selah 

76 10 sure the wrath of man shall prai thee the remaind of 
wrath shalt thou restrain 

76 11 vow and pay unto the lord your god let all that be round about 
him bring present unto him that ought to be fear 

76 12 he shall cut off the spirit of princ he is terribl to the 
king of the earth 



77 1 i cri unto god with my voic even unto god with my voic and 
he gave ear unto me 

77 2 in the day of my troubl i sought the lord my sore ran in the 
night and cea not my soul refu to be comfort 

77 3 i rememb god and wa troubl i complain and my spirit 
wa overwhelm selah 

77 4 thou holdest mine eye wake i am so troubl that i cannot 
speak 

77 5 i have consid the day of old the year of ancient time 

77 6 i call to remembr my song in the night i commun with mine 
own heart and my spirit made dilig search 

77 7 will the lord cast off for ever and will he be favour no 
more 

77 8 is hi merci clean gone for ever doth hi promi fail for 
evermor 

77 9 hath god forgotten to be graciou hath he in anger shut up hi 
tender merci selah 

77 10 and i said thi is my infirm but i will rememb the year 
of the right hand of the most high 

77 11 i will rememb the work of the lord sure i will rememb 
thi wonder of old 

77 12 i will medit also of all thi work and talk of thi do 

77 13 thi way o god is in the sanctuari who is so great a god a 
our god 

77 14 thou art the god that doest wonder thou hast declar thi 
strength among the peopl 

77 15 thou hast with thine arm redeem thi peopl the son of jacob 
and joseph selah 

77 16 the water saw thee o god the water saw thee they were 
afraid the depth also were troubl 

77 17 the cloud pour out water the sky sent out a sound thine 
arrow also went abroad 

77 18 the voic of thi thunder wa in the heaven the lightn 
lighten the world the earth trembl and shook 

77 19 thi way is in the sea and thi path in the great water and thi 
footstep are not known 

77 20 thou leddest thi peopl like a flock by the hand of mose and 
aaron 



78 1 give ear o my peopl to my law inclin your ear to the word 
of my mouth 

78 2 i will open my mouth in a parabl i will utter dark say of 
old 

78 3 which we have heard and known and our father have told u 

78 4 we will not hide them from their child shew to the 
gener to come the prai of the lord and hi strength and hi 
wonder work that he hath done 

78 5 for he establish a testimoni in jacob and appoint a law in 
israel which he command our father that they should make them 
known to their child 

78 6 that the gener to come might know them even the child 
which should be born who should ari and declar them to their 
child 

78 7 that they might set their hope in god and not forget the work 
of god but keep hi command 

78 8 and might not be a their father a stubborn and rebelli 
gener a gener that set not their heart aright and whose 
spirit wa not stedfast with god 

78 9 the child of ephraim be arm and carri bow turn 
back in the day of battl 

78 10 they kept not the coven of god and refu to walk in hi 
law 

78 11 and forgat hi work and hi wonder that he had shew them 

78 12 marvel thing did he in the sight of their father in the 
land of egypt in the field of zoan 

78 13 he divid the sea and cau them to pa through and he made 
the water to stand a an heap 

78 14 in the daytim also he led them with a cloud and all the night 
with a light of fire 

78 15 he clave the rock in the wilder and gave them drink a out 
of the great depth 

78 16 he brought stream also out of the rock and cau water to 
run down like river 

78 17 and they sin yet more against him by provok the most high 
in the wilder 

78 18 and they tempt god in their heart by ask meat for their 
lust 

78 19 yea they spake against god they said can god furnish a tabl 
in the wilder 

78 20 behold he smote the rock that the water gush out and the 
stream overflow can he give bread also can he provid flesh for 
hi peopl 

78 21 therefor the lord heard thi and wa wroth so a fire wa 
kindl against jacob and anger also came up against israel 

78 22 becau they believ not in god and trust not in hi 
salvat 

78 23 though he had command the cloud from abov and open the 
door of heaven 

78 24 and had rain down manna upon them to eat and had given them 
of the corn of heaven 

78 25 man did eat angel food he sent them meat to the full 

78 26 he cau an east wind to blow in the heaven and by hi power 
he brought in the south wind 

78 27 he rain flesh also upon them a dust and feather fowl like 
a the sand of the sea 

78 28 and he let it fall in the midst of their camp round about their 
habit 

78 29 so they did eat and were well fill for he gave them their 
own desir 

78 30 they were not estrang from their lust but while their meat 
wa yet in their mouth 

78 31 the wrath of god came upon them and slew the fattest of them 
and smote down the chosen men of israel 

78 32 for all thi they sin still and believ not for hi 
wondrou work 

78 33 therefor their day did he consum in vaniti and their year 
in troubl 

78 34 when he slew them then they sought him and they return and 
enquir earli after god 

78 35 and they rememb that god wa their rock and the high god 
their redeem 

78 36 nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth and they 
lie unto him with their tongu 

78 37 for their heart wa not right with him neither were they 
stedfast in hi coven 

78 38 but he be full of compass forgav their iniqu and 
destroy them not yea mani a time turn he hi anger away and did 
not stir up all hi wrath 

78 39 for he rememb that they were but flesh a wind that passeth 
away and cometh not again 

78 40 how oft did they provok him in the wilder and griev him 
in the desert 

78 41 yea they turn back and tempt god and limit the holi one 
of israel 

78 42 they rememb not hi hand nor the day when he deliv them 
from the enemi 

78 43 how he had wrought hi sign in egypt and hi wonder in the 
field of zoan 

78 44 and had turn their river into blood and their flood that 
they could not drink 

78 45 he sent diver sort of fli among them which devour them 
and frog which destroy them 

78 46 he gave also their increa unto the caterpil and their 
labour unto the locust 

78 47 he destroy their vine with hail and their sycomor tree 
with frost 

78 48 he gave up their cattl also to the hail and their flock to 
hot thunderbolt 

78 49 he cast upon them the fierc of hi anger wrath and 
indign and troubl by send evil angel among them 

78 50 he made a way to hi anger he spare not their soul from death 
but gave their life over to the pestil 

78 51 and smote all the firstborn in egypt the chief of their 
strength in the tabernacl of ham 

78 52 but made hi own peopl to go forth like sheep and guid them 
in the wilder like a flock 

78 53 and he led them on safe so that they fear not but the sea 
overwhelm their enemi 

78 54 and he brought them to the border of hi sanctuari even to thi 
mountain which hi right hand had purcha 

78 55 he cast out the heathen also befor them and divid them an 
inherit by line and made the tribe of israel to dwell in their 
tent 

78 56 yet they tempt and provok the most high god and kept not 
hi testimoni 

78 57 but turn back and dealt unfaith like their father they 
were turn asid like a deceit bow 

78 58 for they provok him to anger with their high place and move 
him to jealousi with their graven imag 

78 59 when god heard thi he wa wroth and greatli abhor israel 

78 60 so that he forsook the tabernacl of shiloh the tent which he 
place among men 

78 61 and deliv hi strength into captiv and hi glori into 
the enemi s hand 

78 62 he gave hi peopl over also unto the sword and wa wroth with 
hi inherit 

78 63 the fire consum their young men and their maiden were not 
given to marriag 

78 64 their priest fell by the sword and their widow made no 
lament 

78 65 then the lord awak a one out of sleep and like a mighti man 
that shouteth by reason of wine 

78 66 and he smote hi enemi in the hinder part he put them to a 
perpetu reproach 

78 67 moreov he refu the tabernacl of joseph and chose not the 
tribe of ephraim 

78 68 but chose the tribe of judah the mount zion which he love 

78 69 and he built hi sanctuari like high palac like the earth 
which he hath establish for ever 

78 70 he chose david also hi servant and took him from the 
sheepfold 

78 71 from follow the ewe great with young he brought him to feed 
jacob hi peopl and israel hi inherit 

78 72 so he fed them accord to the integr of hi heart and 
guid them by the skil of hi hand 



79 1 o god the heathen are come into thine inherit thi holi 
templ have they defil they have laid jerusalem on heap 

79 2 the dead bodi of thi servant have they given to be meat unto 
the fowl of the heaven the flesh of thi saint unto the beast of 
the earth 

79 3 their blood have they shed like water round about jerusalem and 
there wa none to buri them 

79 4 we are becom a reproach to our neighbour a scorn and deri 
to them that are round about u 

79 5 how long lord wilt thou be angri for ever shall thi jealousi 
burn like fire 

79 6 pour out thi wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee and 
upon the kingdom that have not call upon thi name 

79 7 for they have devour jacob and laid wast hi dwell place 

79 8 o rememb not against u former iniqu let thi tender 
merci speedili prevent u for we are brought veri low 

79 9 help u o god of our salvat for the glori of thi name and 
deliv u and purg away our sin for thi name s sake 

79 10 wherefor should the heathen say where is their god let him be 
known among the heathen in our sight by the reveng of the blood of 
thi servant which is shed 

79 11 let the sigh of the prison come befor thee accord to 
the great of thi power preserv thou those that are appoint to 
die 

79 12 and render unto our neighbour sevenfold into their bosom their 
reproach wherewith they have reproach thee o lord 

79 13 so we thi peopl and sheep of thi pastur will give thee thank 
for ever we will shew forth thi prai to all gener 



80 1 give ear o shepherd of israel thou that leadest joseph like a 
flock thou that dwellest between the cherub shine forth 

80 2 befor ephraim and benjamin and manasseh stir up thi strength 
and come and save u 

80 3 turn u again o god and cau thi face to shine and we shall 
be save 

80 4 o lord god of host how long wilt thou be angri against the 
prayer of thi peopl 

80 5 thou feedest them with the bread of tear and givest them tear 
to drink in great measur 

80 6 thou makest u a strife unto our neighbour and our enemi 
laugh among themselv 

80 7 turn u again o god of host and cau thi face to shine and 
we shall be save 

80 8 thou hast brought a vine out of egypt thou hast cast out the 
heathen and plant it 

80 9 thou preparedst room befor it and didst cau it to take deep 
root and it fill the land 

80 10 the hill were cover with the shadow of it and the bough 
thereof were like the goodli cedar 

80 11 she sent out her bough unto the sea and her branch unto the 
river 

80 12 whi hast thou then broken down her hedg so that all they 
which pa by the way do pluck her 

80 13 the boar out of the wood doth wast it and the wild beast of 
the field doth devour it 

80 14 return we beseech thee o god of host look down from heaven 
and behold and visit thi vine 

80 15 and the vineyard which thi right hand hath plant and the 
branch that thou madest strong for thyself 

80 16 it is burn with fire it is cut down they perish at the 
rebuk of thi counten 

80 17 let thi hand be upon the man of thi right hand upon the son of 
man whom thou madest strong for thyself 

80 18 so will not we go back from thee quicken u and we will call 
upon thi name 

80 19 turn u again o lord god of host cau thi face to shine and 
we shall be save 



81 1 sing aloud unto god our strength make a joy noi unto the 
god of jacob 

81 2 take a psalm and bring hither the timbrel the pleasant harp 
with the psalteri 

81 3 blow up the trumpet in the new moon in the time appoint on 
our solemn feast day 

81 4 for thi wa a statut for israel and a law of the god of jacob 

81 5 thi he ordain in joseph for a testimoni when he went out 
through the land of egypt where i heard a languag that i understood 
not 

81 6 i remov hi shoulder from the burden hi hand were deliv 
from the pot 

81 7 thou calledst in troubl and i deliv thee i answer thee 
in the secret place of thunder i prove thee at the water of 
meribah 

selah 

81 8 hear o my peopl and i will testifi unto thee o israel if 
thou wilt hearken unto me 

81 9 there shall no strang god be in thee neither shalt thou worship 
ani strang god 

81 10 i am the lord thi god which brought thee out of the land of 
egypt open thi mouth wide and i will fill it 

81 11 but my peopl would not hearken to my voic and israel would 
none of me 

81 12 so i gave them up unto their own heart lust and they walk 
in their own counsel 

81 13 oh that my peopl had hearken unto me and israel had walk 
in my way 

81 14 i should soon have subdu their enemi and turn my hand 
against their adversari 

81 15 the hater of the lord should have submit themselv unto 
him but their time should have endur for ever 

81 16 he should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat and 
with honey out of the rock should i have satisfi thee 



82 1 god standeth in the congreg of the mighti he judgeth among 
the god 

82 2 how long will ye judg unjustli and accept the person of the 
wick selah 

82 3 defend the poor and fatherless do justic to the afflict and 
needi 

82 4 deliv the poor and needi rid them out of the hand of the 
wick 

82 5 they know not neither will they understand they walk on in 
dark all the foundat of the earth are out of cour 

82 6 i have said ye are god and all of you are child of the most 
high 

82 7 but ye shall die like men and fall like one of the princ 

82 8 ari o god judg the earth for thou shalt inherit all 
nation 



83 1 keep not thou silenc o god hold not thi peac and be not 
still o god 

83 2 for lo thine enemi make a tumult and they that hate thee 
have lift up the head 

83 3 they have taken crafti counsel against thi peopl and consult 
against thi hidden one 

83 4 they have said come and let u cut them off from be a 
nation that the name of israel may be no more in remembr 

83 5 for they have consult togeth with one consent they are 
confed against thee 

83 6 the tabernacl of edom and the ishmaelit of moab and the 
hagaren 

83 7 gebal and ammon and amalek the philistin with the 
inhabit of tyre 

83 8 assur also is join with them they have holpen the child of 
lot 

selah 

83 9 do unto them a unto the midianit a to sisera a to jabin 
at the brook of kison 

83 10 which perish at endor they becam a dung for the earth 

83 11 make their nobl like oreb and like zeeb yea all their 
princ a zebah and a zalmunna 

83 12 who said let u take to ourselv the hou of god in 
poss 

83 13 o my god make them like a wheel a the stubbl befor the 
wind 

83 14 a the fire burneth a wood and a the flame setteth the 
mountain on fire 

83 15 so persecut them with thi tempest and make them afraid with 
thi storm 

83 16 fill their face with shame that they may seek thi name o 
lord 

83 17 let them be confound and troubl for ever yea let them be 
put to shame and perish 

83 18 that men may know that thou whose name alon is jehovah art 
the most high over all the earth 



84 1 how amiabl are thi tabernacl o lord of host 

84 2 my soul longeth yea even fainteth for the court of the lord 
my heart and my flesh crieth out for the live god 

84 3 yea the sparrow hath found an hou and the swallow a nest for 
herself where she may lay her young even thine altar o lord of 
host my king and my god 

84 4 bless are they that dwell in thi hou they will be still 
prai thee selah 

84 5 bless is the man whose strength is in thee in whose heart are 
the way of them 

84 6 who pa through the valley of baca make it a well the rain 
also filleth the pool 

84 7 they go from strength to strength everi one of them in zion 
appeareth befor god 

84 8 o lord god of host hear my prayer give ear o god of jacob 
selah 

84 9 behold o god our shield and look upon the face of thine 
anoint 

84 10 for a day in thi court is better than a thousand i had rather 
be a doorkeep in the hou of my god than to dwell in the tent of 
wick 

84 11 for the lord god is a sun and shield the lord will give grace 
and glori no good thing will he withhold from them that walk 
uprightli 

84 12 o lord of host bless is the man that trusteth in thee 



85 1 lord thou hast been favour unto thi land thou hast brought 
back the captiv of jacob 

85 2 thou hast forgiven the iniqu of thi peopl thou hast cover 
all their sin selah 

85 3 thou hast taken away all thi wrath thou hast turn thyself from 
the fierc of thine anger 

85 4 turn u o god of our salvat and cau thine anger toward u 
to cea 

85 5 wilt thou be angri with u for ever wilt thou draw out thine 
anger to all gener 

85 6 wilt thou not reviv u again that thi peopl may rejoic in 
thee 

85 7 shew u thi merci o lord and grant u thi salvat 

85 8 i will hear what god the lord will speak for he will speak peac 
unto hi peopl and to hi saint but let them not turn again to 
folli 

85 9 sure hi salvat is nigh them that fear him that glori may 
dwell in our land 

85 10 merci and truth are met togeth righteou and peac have 
kiss each other 

85 11 truth shall spring out of the earth and righteou shall 
look down from heaven 

85 12 yea the lord shall give that which is good and our land shall 
yield her increa 

85 13 righteou shall go befor him and shall set u in the way 
of hi step 



86 1 bow down thine ear o lord hear me for i am poor and needi 

86 2 preserv my soul for i am holi o thou my god save thi servant 
that trusteth in thee 

86 3 be merci unto me o lord for i cri unto thee daili 

86 4 rejoic the soul of thi servant for unto thee o lord do i lift 
up my soul 

86 5 for thou lord art good and readi to forgiv and plenteou in 
merci unto all them that call upon thee 

86 6 give ear o lord unto my prayer and attend to the voic of my 
supplic 

86 7 in the day of my troubl i will call upon thee for thou wilt 
answer me 

86 8 among the god there is none like unto thee o lord neither are 
there ani work like unto thi work 

86 9 all nation whom thou hast made shall come and worship befor 
thee o lord and shall glorifi thi name 

86 10 for thou art great and doest wondrou thing thou art god 
alon 

86 11 teach me thi way o lord i will walk in thi truth unit my 
heart to fear thi name 

86 12 i will prai thee o lord my god with all my heart and i will 
glorifi thi name for evermor 

86 13 for great is thi merci toward me and thou hast deliv my 
soul from the lowest hell 

86 14 o god the proud are risen against me and the assembl of 
violent men have sought after my soul and have not set thee befor 
them 

86 15 but thou o lord art a god full of compass and graciou 
long suffer and plenteou in merci and truth 

86 16 o turn unto me and have merci upon me give thi strength unto 
thi servant and save the son of thine handmaid 

86 17 shew me a token for good that they which hate me may see it 
and be asham becau thou lord hast holpen me and comfort me 



87 1 hi foundat is in the holi mountain 

87 2 the lord loveth the gate of zion more than all the dwell of 
jacob 

87 3 gloriou thing are spoken of thee o citi of god selah 

87 4 i will make mention of rahab and babylon to them that know me 
behold philistia and tyre with ethiopia thi man wa born there 

87 5 and of zion it shall be said thi and that man wa born in her 
and the highest himself shall establish her 

87 6 the lord shall count when he writeth up the peopl that thi 
man wa born there selah 

87 7 a well the singer a the player on instrument shall be there 
all my spring are in thee 



88 1 o lord god of my salvat i have cri day and night befor 
thee 

88 2 let my prayer come befor thee inclin thine ear unto my cri 

88 3 for my soul is full of troubl and my life draweth nigh unto 
the grave 

88 4 i am count with them that go down into the pit i am a a man 
that hath no strength 

88 5 free among the dead like the slain that lie in the grave whom 
thou rememberest no more and they are cut off from thi hand 

88 6 thou hast laid me in the lowest pit in dark in the deep 

88 7 thi wrath lieth hard upon me and thou hast afflict me with all 
thi wave selah 

88 8 thou hast put away mine acquaint far from me thou hast made 
me an abomin unto them i am shut up and i cannot come forth 

88 9 mine eye mourneth by reason of afflict lord i have call 
daili upon thee i have stretch out my hand unto thee 

88 10 wilt thou shew wonder to the dead shall the dead ari and 
prai thee selah 

88 11 shall thi lovingkind be declar in the grave or thi 
faith in destruct 

88 12 shall thi wonder be known in the dark and thi righteou in 
the land of forget 

88 13 but unto thee have i cri o lord and in the morn shall my 
prayer prevent thee 

88 14 lord whi castest thou off my soul whi hidest thou thi face 
from me 

88 15 i am afflict and readi to die from my youth up while i suffer 
thi terror i am distract 

88 16 thi fierc wrath goeth over me thi terror have cut me off 

88 17 they came round about me daili like water they compass me 
about togeth 

88 18 lover and friend hast thou put far from me and mine 
acquaint into dark 



89 1 i will sing of the merci of the lord for ever with my mouth 
will i make known thi faith to all gener 

89 2 for i have said merci shall be built up for ever thi 
faith shalt thou establish in the veri heaven 

89 3 i have made a coven with my chosen i have sworn unto david my 
servant 

89 4 thi seed will i establish for ever and build up thi throne to 
all gener selah 

89 5 and the heaven shall prai thi wonder o lord thi 
faith also in the congreg of the saint 

89 6 for who in the heaven can be compar unto the lord who among 
the son of the mighti can be liken unto the lord 

89 7 god is greatli to be fear in the assembl of the saint and to 
be had in rever of all them that are about him 

89 8 o lord god of host who is a strong lord like unto thee or to 
thi faith round about thee 

89 9 thou rulest the rage of the sea when the wave thereof ari 
thou stillest them 

89 10 thou hast broken rahab in piec a one that is slain thou 
hast scatter thine enemi with thi strong arm 

89 11 the heaven are thine the earth also is thine a for the world 
and the ful thereof thou hast found them 

89 12 the north and the south thou hast creat them tabor and hermon 
shall rejoic in thi name 

89 13 thou hast a mighti arm strong is thi hand and high is thi 
right hand 

89 14 justic and judgment are the habit of thi throne merci and 
truth shall go befor thi face 

89 15 bless is the peopl that know the joy sound they shall 
walk o lord in the light of thi counten 

89 16 in thi name shall they rejoic all the day and in thi 
righteou shall they be exalt 

89 17 for thou art the glori of their strength and in thi favour our 
horn shall be exalt 

89 18 for the lord is our defenc and the holi one of israel is our 
king 

89 19 then thou spakest in vision to thi holi one and saidst i have 
laid help upon one that is mighti i have exalt one chosen out of 
the peopl 

89 20 i have found david my servant with my holi oil have i anoint 
him 

89 21 with whom my hand shall be establish mine arm also shall 
strengthen him 

89 22 the enemi shall not exact upon him nor the son of wick 
afflict him 

89 23 and i will beat down hi foe befor hi face and plagu them 
that hate him 

89 24 but my faith and my merci shall be with him and in my 
name shall hi horn be exalt 

89 25 i will set hi hand also in the sea and hi right hand in the 
river 

89 26 he shall cri unto me thou art my father my god and the rock 
of my salvat 

89 27 also i will make him my firstborn higher than the king of the 
earth 

89 28 my merci will i keep for him for evermor and my coven shall 
stand fast with him 

89 29 hi seed also will i make to endur for ever and hi throne a 
the day of heaven 

89 30 if hi child forsak my law and walk not in my judgment 

89 31 if they break my statut and keep not my command 

89 32 then will i visit their transgress with the rod and their 
iniqu with stripe 

89 33 nevertheless my lovingkind will i not utterli take from him 
nor suffer my faith to fail 

89 34 my coven will i not break nor alter the thing that is gone 
out of my lip 

89 35 onc have i sworn by my holi that i will not lie unto david 

89 36 hi seed shall endur for ever and hi throne a the sun befor 
me 

89 37 it shall be establish for ever a the moon and a a faith 
wit in heaven selah 

89 38 but thou hast cast off and abhor thou hast been wroth with 
thine anoint 

89 39 thou hast made void the coven of thi servant thou hast 
profan hi crown by cast it to the ground 

89 40 thou hast broken down all hi hedg thou hast brought hi 
strong hold to ruin 

89 41 all that pa by the way spoil him he is a reproach to hi 
neighbour 

89 42 thou hast set up the right hand of hi adversari thou hast 
made all hi enemi to rejoic 

89 43 thou hast also turn the edg of hi sword and hast not made 
him to stand in the battl 

89 44 thou hast made hi glori to cea and cast hi throne down to 
the ground 

89 45 the day of hi youth hast thou shorten thou hast cover him 
with shame selah 

89 46 how long lord wilt thou hide thyself for ever shall thi wrath 
burn like fire 

89 47 rememb how short my time is wherefor hast thou made all men 
in vain 

89 48 what man is he that liveth and shall not see death shall he 
deliv hi soul from the hand of the grave selah 

89 49 lord where are thi former lovingkind which thou swarest 
unto david in thi truth 

89 50 rememb lord the reproach of thi servant how i do bear in 
my bosom the reproach of all the mighti peopl 

89 51 wherewith thine enemi have reproach o lord wherewith they 
have reproach the footstep of thine anoint 

89 52 bless be the lord for evermor amen and amen 



90 1 lord thou hast been our dwell place in all gener 

90 2 befor the mountain were brought forth or ever thou hadst 
form the earth and the world even from everlast to everlast 
thou art god 

90 3 thou turnest man to destruct and sayest return ye child 
of men 

90 4 for a thousand year in thi sight are but a yesterday when it is 
past and a a watch in the night 

90 5 thou carriest them away a with a flood they are a a sleep in 
the morn they are like grass which groweth up 

90 6 in the morn it flourisheth and groweth up in the even it 
is cut down and withereth 

90 7 for we are consum by thine anger and by thi wrath are we 
troubl 

90 8 thou hast set our iniqu befor thee our secret sin in the 
light of thi counten 

90 9 for all our day are pa away in thi wrath we spend our year 
a a tale that is told 

90 10 the day of our year are threescor year and ten and if by 
reason of strength they be fourscor year yet is their strength 
labour and sorrow for it is soon cut off and we fli away 

90 11 who knoweth the power of thine anger even accord to thi 
fear so is thi wrath 

90 12 so teach u to number our day that we may appli our heart 
unto wisdom 

90 13 return o lord how long and let it repent thee concern thi 
servant 

90 14 o satisfi u earli with thi merci that we may rejoic and be 
glad all our day 

90 15 make u glad accord to the day wherein thou hast afflict 
u and the year wherein we have seen evil 

90 16 let thi work appear unto thi servant and thi glori unto their 
child 

90 17 and let the beauti of the lord our god be upon u and establish 
thou the work of our hand upon u yea the work of our hand 
establish thou it 



91 1 he that dwelleth in the secret place of the most high shall abid 
under the shadow of the almighti 

91 2 i will say of the lord he is my refug and my fortress my god 
in him will i trust 

91 3 sure he shall deliv thee from the snare of the fowler and 
from the noisom pestil 

91 4 he shall cover thee with hi feather and under hi wing shalt 
thou trust hi truth shall be thi shield and buckler 

91 5 thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night nor for the 
arrow that flieth by day 

91 6 nor for the pestil that walketh in dark nor for the 
destruct that wasteth at noonday 

91 7 a thousand shall fall at thi side and ten thousand at thi right 
hand but it shall not come nigh thee 

91 8 onli with thine eye shalt thou behold and see the reward of the 
wick 

91 9 becau thou hast made the lord which is my refug even the 
most high thi habit 

91 10 there shall no evil befal thee neither shall ani plagu come 
nigh thi dwell 

91 11 for he shall give hi angel charg over thee to keep thee in 
all thi way 

91 12 they shall bear thee up in their hand lest thou dash thi foot 
against a stone 

91 13 thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder the young lion and the 
dragon shalt thou trampl under foot 

91 14 becau he hath set hi love upon me therefor will i deliv 
him i will set him on high becau he hath known my name 

91 15 he shall call upon me and i will answer him i will be with him 
in troubl i will deliv him and honour him 

91 16 with long life will i satisfi him and shew him my salvat 



92 1 it is a good thing to give thank unto the lord and to sing 
prai unto thi name o most high 

92 2 to shew forth thi lovingkind in the morn and thi 
faith everi night 

92 3 upon an instrument of ten string and upon the psalteri upon 
the harp with a solemn sound 

92 4 for thou lord hast made me glad through thi work i will 
triumph in the work of thi hand 

92 5 o lord how great are thi work and thi thought are veri deep 

92 6 a brutish man knoweth not neither doth a fool understand thi 

92 7 when the wick spring a the grass and when all the worker of 
iniqu do flourish it is that they shall be destroy for ever 

92 8 but thou lord art most high for evermor 

92 9 for lo thine enemi o lord for lo thine enemi shall 
perish all the worker of iniqu shall be scatter 

92 10 but my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn i 
shall be anoint with fresh oil 

92 11 mine eye also shall see my desir on mine enemi and mine ear 
shall hear my desir of the wick that rise up against me 

92 12 the righteou shall flourish like the palm tree he shall grow 
like a cedar in lebanon 

92 13 those that be plant in the hou of the lord shall flourish in 
the court of our god 

92 14 they shall still bring forth fruit in old age they shall be fat 
and flourish 

92 15 to shew that the lord is upright he is my rock and there is no 
unright in him 



93 1 the lord reigneth he is cloth with majesti the lord is 
cloth with strength wherewith he hath gird himself the world 
also is stablish that it cannot be move 

93 2 thi throne is establish of old thou art from everlast 

93 3 the flood have lift up o lord the flood have lift up 
their voic the flood lift up their wave 

93 4 the lord on high is mightier than the noi of mani water yea 
than the mighti wave of the sea 

93 5 thi testimoni are veri sure holi becometh thine hou o 
lord for ever 



94 1 o lord god to whom vengeanc belongeth o god to whom vengeanc 
belongeth shew thyself 

94 2 lift up thyself thou judg of the earth render a reward to the 
proud 

94 3 lord how long shall the wick how long shall the wick 
triumph 

94 4 how long shall they utter and speak hard thing and all the 
worker of iniqu boast themselv 

94 5 they break in piec thi peopl o lord and afflict thine 
heritag 

94 6 they slay the widow and the stranger and murder the fatherless 

94 7 yet they say the lord shall not see neither shall the god of 
jacob regard it 

94 8 understand ye brutish among the peopl and ye fool when will 
ye be wise 

94 9 he that plant the ear shall he not hear he that form the 
eye shall he not see 

94 10 he that chastiseth the heathen shall not he correct he that 
teacheth man knowledg shall not he know 

94 11 the lord knoweth the thought of man that they are vaniti 

94 12 bless is the man whom thou chastenest o lord and teachest 
him out of thi law 

94 13 that thou mayest give him rest from the day of adver until 
the pit be dig for the wick 

94 14 for the lord will not cast off hi peopl neither will he 
forsak hi inherit 

94 15 but judgment shall return unto righteou and all the 
upright in heart shall follow it 

94 16 who will rise up for me against the evildo or who will stand 
up for me against the worker of iniqu 

94 17 unless the lord had been my help my soul had almost dwelt in 
silenc 

94 18 when i said my foot slippeth thi merci o lord held me up 

94 19 in the multitud of my thought within me thi comfort delight 
my soul 

94 20 shall the throne of iniqu have fellowship with thee which 
frameth mischief by a law 

94 21 they gather themselv togeth against the soul of the 
righteou and condemn the innoc blood 

94 22 but the lord is my defenc and my god is the rock of my refug 

94 23 and he shall bring upon them their own iniqu and shall cut 
them off in their own wick yea the lord our god shall cut them 
off 



95 1 o come let u sing unto the lord let u make a joy noi to 
the rock of our salvat 

95 2 let u come befor hi presenc with thanksgiv and make a 
joy noi unto him with psalm 

95 3 for the lord is a great god and a great king abov all god 

95 4 in hi hand are the deep place of the earth the strength of the 
hill is hi also 

95 5 the sea is hi and he made it and hi hand form the dri 
land 

95 6 o come let u worship and bow down let u kneel befor the lord 
our maker 

95 7 for he is our god and we are the peopl of hi pastur and the 
sheep of hi hand to day if ye will hear hi voic 

95 8 harden not your heart a in the provoc and a in the day 
of temptat in the wilder 

95 9 when your father tempt me prove me and saw my work 

95 10 forti year long wa i griev with thi gener and said 
it is a peopl that do err in their heart and they have not known my 
way 

95 11 unto whom i sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my 
rest 



96 1 o sing unto the lord a new song sing unto the lord all the 
earth 

96 2 sing unto the lord bless hi name shew forth hi salvat from 
day to day 

96 3 declar hi glori among the heathen hi wonder among all 
peopl 

96 4 for the lord is great and greatli to be prai he is to be 
fear abov all god 

96 5 for all the god of the nation are idol but the lord made the 
heaven 

96 6 honour and majesti are befor him strength and beauti are in hi 
sanctuari 

96 7 give unto the lord o ye kindr of the peopl give unto the 
lord glori and strength 

96 8 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name bring an 
offer and come into hi court 

96 9 o worship the lord in the beauti of holi fear befor him 
all the earth 

96 10 say among the heathen that the lord reigneth the world also 
shall be establish that it shall not be move he shall judg the 
peopl righteou 

96 11 let the heaven rejoic and let the earth be glad let the sea 
roar and the ful thereof 

96 12 let the field be joy and all that is therein then shall all 
the tree of the wood rejoic 

96 13 befor the lord for he cometh for he cometh to judg the 
earth he shall judg the world with righteou and the peopl 
with hi truth 



97 1 the lord reigneth let the earth rejoic let the multitud of 
isl be glad thereof 

97 2 cloud and dark are round about him righteou and 
judgment are the habit of hi throne 

97 3 a fire goeth befor him and burneth up hi enemi round about 

97 4 hi lightn enlighten the world the earth saw and 
trembl 

97 5 the hill melt like wax at the presenc of the lord at the 
presenc of the lord of the whole earth 

97 6 the heaven declar hi righteou and all the peopl see hi 
glori 

97 7 confound be all they that serv graven imag that boast 
themselv of idol worship him all ye god 

97 8 zion heard and wa glad and the daughter of judah rejoic 
becau of thi judgment o lord 

97 9 for thou lord art high abov all the earth thou art exalt 
far abov all god 

97 10 ye that love the lord hate evil he preserveth the soul of hi 
saint he delivereth them out of the hand of the wick 

97 11 light is sown for the righteou and glad for the upright in 
heart 

97 12 rejoic in the lord ye righteou and give thank at the 
remembr of hi holi 



98 1 o sing unto the lord a new song for he hath done marvel 
thing hi right hand and hi holi arm hath gotten him the victori 

98 2 the lord hath made known hi salvat hi righteou hath he 
openli shew in the sight of the heathen 

98 3 he hath rememb hi merci and hi truth toward the hou of 
israel all the end of the earth have seen the salvat of our god 

98 4 make a joy noi unto the lord all the earth make a loud 
noi and rejoic and sing prai 

98 5 sing unto the lord with the harp with the harp and the voic of 
a psalm

lord the king

that dwell therein 

98 8 let the flood clap their hand let the hill be joy togeth 

98 9 befor the lord for he cometh to judg the earth with 
righteou shall he judg the world and the peopl with equiti 



99 1 the lord reigneth let the peopl trembl he sitteth between the 
cherub let the earth be move 

99 2 the lord is great in zion and he is high abov all the peopl 

99 3 let them prai thi great and terribl name for it is holi 

99 4 the king s strength also loveth judgment thou dost establish 
equiti thou executest judgment and righteou in jacob 

99 5 exalt ye the lord our god and worship at hi footstool for he 
is holi 

99 6 mose and aaron among hi priest and samuel among them that 
call upon hi name they call upon the lord and he answer them 

99 7 he spake unto them in the cloudi pillar they kept hi 
testimoni and the ordin that he gave them 

99 8 thou answeredst them o lord our god thou wast a god that 
forgavest them though thou tookest vengeanc of their invent 

99 9 exalt the lord our god and worship at hi holi hill for the 
lord our god is holi 



100 1 make a joy noi unto the lord all ye land 

100 2 serv the lord with glad come befor hi presenc with 
sing 

100 3 know ye that the lord he is god it is he that hath made u and 
not we ourselv we are hi peopl and the sheep of hi pastur 

100 4 enter into hi gate with thanksgiv and into hi court with 
prai be thank unto him and bless hi name 

100 5 for the lord is good hi merci is everlast and hi truth 
endureth to all gener 



101 1 i will sing of merci and judgment unto thee o lord will i 
sing 

101 2 i will behav myself wise in a perfect way o when wilt thou 
come unto me i will walk within my hou with a perfect heart 

101 3 i will set no wick thing befor mine eye i hate the work of 
them that turn asid it shall not cleav to me 

101 4 a froward heart shall depart from me i will not know a wick 
person 

101 5 whoso privili slandereth hi neighbour him will i cut off him 
that hath an high look and a proud heart will not i suffer 

101 6 mine eye shall be upon the faith of the land that they may 
dwell with me he that walketh in a perfect way he shall serv me 

101 7 he that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my hou he that 
telleth lie shall not tarri in my sight 

101 8 i will earli destroy all the wick of the land that i may cut 
off all wick doer from the citi of the lord 



102 1 hear my prayer o lord and let my cri come unto thee 

102 2 hide not thi face from me in the day when i am in troubl 
inclin thine ear unto me in the day when i call answer me speedili 

102 3 for my day are consum like smoke and my bone are burn a 
an hearth 

102 4 my heart is smitten and wither like grass so that i forget 
to eat my bread 

102 5 by reason of the voic of my groan my bone cleav to my 
skin 

102 6 i am like a pelican of the wilder i am like an owl of the 
desert 

102 7 i watch and am a a sparrow alon upon the hou top 

102 8 mine enemi reproach me all the day and they that are mad 
against me are sworn against me 

102 9 for i have eaten ash like bread and mingl my drink with 
weep 

102 10 becau of thine indign and thi wrath for thou hast 
lift me up and cast me down 

102 11 my day are like a shadow that declineth and i am wither 
like grass 

102 12 but thou o lord shall endur for ever and thi remembr 
unto all gener 

102 13 thou shalt ari and have merci upon zion for the time to 
favour her yea the set time is come 

102 14 for thi servant take pleasur in her stone and favour the 
dust thereof 

102 15 so the heathen shall fear the name of the lord and all the 
king of the earth thi glori 

102 16 when the lord shall build up zion he shall appear in hi 
glori 

102 17 he will regard the prayer of the destitut and not despi 
their prayer 

102 18 thi shall be written for the gener to come and the 
peopl which shall be creat shall prai the lord 

102 19 for he hath look down from the height of hi sanctuari from 
heaven did the lord behold the earth 

102 20 to hear the groan of the prison to loo those that are 
appoint to death 

102 21 to declar the name of the lord in zion and hi prai in 
jerusalem 

102 22 when the peopl are gather togeth and the kingdom to 
serv the lord 

102 23 he weaken my strength in the way he shorten my day 

102 24 i said o my god take me not away in the midst of my day thi 
year are throughout all gener 

102 25 of old hast thou laid the foundat of the earth and the 
heaven are the work of thi hand 

102 26 they shall perish but thou shalt endur yea all of them 
shall wax old like a garment a a vestur shalt thou chang them and 
they shall be chang 

102 27 but thou art the same and thi year shall have no end 

102 28 the child of thi servant shall continu and their seed 
shall be establish befor thee 



103 1 bless the lord o my soul and all that is within me bless hi 
holi name 

103 2 bless the lord o my soul and forget not all hi benefit 

103 3 who forgiveth all thine iniqu who healeth all thi 
disea 

103 4 who redeemeth thi life from destruct who crowneth thee with 
lovingkind and tender merci 

103 5 who satisfieth thi mouth with good thing so that thi youth is 
renew like the eagl s 

103 6 the lord executeth righteou and judgment for all that are 
oppress 

103 7 he made known hi way unto mose hi act unto the child of 
israel 

103 8 the lord is merci and graciou slow to anger and plenteou 
in merci 

103 9 he will not alway chide neither will he keep hi anger for 
ever 

103 10 he hath not dealt with u after our sin nor reward u 
accord to our iniqu 

103 11 for a the heaven is high abov the earth so great is hi 
merci toward them that fear him 

103 12 a far a the east is from the west so far hath he remov our 
transgress from u 

103 13 like a a father pitieth hi child so the lord pitieth them 
that fear him 

103 14 for he knoweth our frame he remembereth that we are dust 

103 15 a for man hi day are a grass a a flower of the field so 
he flourisheth 

103 16 for the wind passeth over it and it is gone and the place 
thereof shall know it no more 

103 17 but the merci of the lord is from everlast to everlast 
upon them that fear him and hi righteou unto child s 
child 

103 18 to such a keep hi coven and to those that rememb hi 
command to do them 

103 19 the lord hath prepar hi throne in the heaven and hi 
kingdom ruleth over all 

103 20 bless the lord ye hi angel that excel in strength that do 
hi command hearken unto the voic of hi word 

103 21 bless ye the lord all ye hi host ye minist of hi that 
do hi pleasur 

103 22 bless the lord all hi work in all place of hi dominion 
bless the lord o my soul 



104 1 bless the lord o my soul o lord my god thou art veri great 
thou art cloth with honour and majesti 

104 2 who coverest thyself with light a with a garment who 
stretchest out the heaven like a curtain 

104 3 who layeth the beam of hi chamber in the water who maketh 
the cloud hi chariot who walketh upon the wing of the wind 

104 4 who maketh hi angel spirit hi minist a flame fire 

104 5 who laid the foundat of the earth that it should not be 
remov for ever 

104 6 thou coveredst it with the deep a with a garment the water 
stood abov the mountain 

104 7 at thi rebuk they fled at the voic of thi thunder they hast 
away 

104 8 they go up by the mountain they go down by the valley unto 
the place which thou hast found for them 

104 9 thou hast set a bound that they may not pa over that they 
turn not again to cover the earth 

104 10 he sendeth the spring into the valley which run among the 
hill 

104 11 they give drink to everi beast of the field the wild as 
quench their thirst 

104 12 by them shall the fowl of the heaven have their habit 
which sing among the branch 

104 13 he watereth the hill from hi chamber the earth is satisfi 
with the fruit of thi work 

104 14 he causeth the grass to grow for the cattl and herb for the 
servic of man that he may bring forth food out of the earth 

104 15 and wine that maketh glad the heart of man and oil to make hi 
face to shine and bread which strengtheneth man s heart 

104 16 the tree of the lord are full of sap the cedar of lebanon 
which he hath plant 

104 17 where the bird make their nest a for the stork the fir 
tree are her hou 

104 18 the high hill are a refug for the wild goat and the rock 
for the coni 

104 19 he appoint the moon for season the sun knoweth hi go 
down 

104 20 thou makest dark and it is night wherein all the beast 
of the forest do creep forth 

104 21 the young lion roar after their prey and seek their meat from 
god 

104 22 the sun ariseth they gather themselv togeth and lay them 
down in their den 

104 23 man goeth forth unto hi work and to hi labour until the 
even 

104 24 o lord how manifold are thi work in wisdom hast thou made 
them all the earth is full of thi rich 

104 25 so is thi great and wide sea wherein are thing creep 
innum both small and great beast 

104 26 there go the ship there is that leviathan whom thou hast 
made to play therein 

104 27 these wait all upon thee that thou mayest give them their meat 
in due season 

104 28 that thou givest them they gather thou openest thine hand 
they are fill with good 

104 29 thou hidest thi face they are troubl thou takest away their 
breath they die and return to their dust 

104 30 thou sendest forth thi spirit they are creat and thou 
renewest the face of the earth 

104 31 the glori of the lord shall endur for ever the lord shall 
rejoic in hi work 

104 32 he looketh on the earth and it trembleth he toucheth the 
hill and they smoke 

104 33 i will sing unto the lord a long a i live i will sing prai 
to my god while i have my be 

104 34 my medit of him shall be sweet i will be glad in the 
lord 

104 35 let the sinner be consum out of the earth and let the 
wick be no more bless thou the lord o my soul prai ye the lord 



105 1 o give thank unto the lord call upon hi name make known hi 
deed among the peopl 

105 2 sing unto him sing psalm unto him talk ye of all hi wondrou 
work 

105 3 glori ye in hi holi name let the heart of them rejoic that 
seek the lord 

105 4 seek the lord and hi strength seek hi face evermor 

105 5 rememb hi marvel work that he hath done hi wonder 
and the judgment of hi mouth 

105 6 o ye seed of abraham hi servant ye child of jacob hi 
chosen 

105 7 he is the lord our god hi judgment are in all the earth 

105 8 he hath rememb hi coven for ever the word which he 
command to a thousand gener 

105 9 which coven he made with abraham and hi oath unto isaac 

105 10 and confirm the same unto jacob for a law and to israel for 
an everlast coven 

105 11 say unto thee will i give the land of canaan the lot of 
your inherit 

105 12 when they were but a few men in number yea veri few and 
stranger in it 

105 13 when they went from one nation to anoth from one kingdom to 
anoth peopl 

105 14 he suffer no man to do them wrong yea he reprov king for 
their sake 

105 15 say touch not mine anoint and do my prophet no harm 

105 16 moreov he call for a famin upon the land he brake the 
whole staff of bread 

105 17 he sent a man befor them even joseph who wa sold for a 
servant 

105 18 whose foot they hurt with fetter he wa laid in iron 

105 19 until the time that hi word came the word of the lord tri 
him 

105 20 the king sent and loo him even the ruler of the peopl and 
let him go free 

105 21 he made him lord of hi hou and ruler of all hi substanc 

105 22 to bind hi princ at hi pleasur and teach hi senat 
wisdom 

105 23 israel also came into egypt and jacob sojourn in the land of 
ham 

105 24 and he increa hi peopl greatli and made them stronger 
than their enemi 

105 25 he turn their heart to hate hi peopl to deal subtilli with 
hi servant 

105 26 he sent mose hi servant and aaron whom he had chosen 

105 27 they shew hi sign among them and wonder in the land of 
ham 

105 28 he sent dark and made it dark and they rebel not 
against hi word 

105 29 he turn their water into blood and slew their fish 

105 30 their land brought forth frog in abund in the chamber of 
their king 

105 31 he spake and there came diver sort of fli and lou in all 
their coast 

105 32 he gave them hail for rain and flame fire in their land 

105 33 he smote their vine also and their fig tree and brake the 
tree of their coast 

105 34 he spake and the locust came and caterpil and that 
without number 

105 35 and did eat up all the herb in their land and devour the 
fruit of their ground 

105 36 he smote also all the firstborn in their land the chief of all 
their strength 

105 37 he brought them forth also with silver and gold and there wa 
not one feebl person among their tribe 

105 38 egypt wa glad when they depart for the fear of them fell 
upon them 

105 39 he spread a cloud for a cover and fire to give light in the 
night 

105 40 the peopl ask and he brought quail and satisfi them 
with the bread of heaven 

105 41 he open the rock and the water gush out they ran in the 
dri place like a river 

105 42 for he rememb hi holi promi and abraham hi servant 

105 43 and he brought forth hi peopl with joy and hi chosen with 
glad 

105 44 and gave them the land of the heathen and they inherit the 
labour of the peopl 

105 45 that they might observ hi statut and keep hi law prai 
ye the lord 



106 1 prai ye the lord o give thank unto the lord for he is good 
for hi merci endureth for ever 

106 2 who can utter the mighti act of the lord who can shew forth 
all hi prai 

106 3 bless are they that keep judgment and he that doeth 
righteou at all time 

106 4 rememb me o lord with the favour that thou bearest unto thi 
peopl o visit me with thi salvat 

106 5 that i may see the good of thi chosen that i may rejoic in the 
glad of thi nation that i may glori with thine inherit 

106 6 we have sin with our father we have commit iniqu we 
have done wickedli 

106 7 our father understood not thi wonder in egypt they rememb 
not the multitud of thi merci but provok him at the sea even at 
the red sea 

106 8 nevertheless he save them for hi name s sake that he might 
make hi mighti power to be known 

106 9 he rebuk the red sea also and it wa dri up so he led them 
through the depth a through the wilder 

106 10 and he save them from the hand of him that hate them and 
redeem them from the hand of the enemi 

106 11 and the water cover their enemi there wa not one of them 
left 

106 12 then believ they hi word they sang hi prai 

106 13 they soon forgat hi work they wait not for hi counsel 

106 14 but lust exceedingli in the wilder and tempt god in 
the desert 

106 15 and he gave them their request but sent lean into their 
soul 

106 16 they envi mose also in the camp and aaron the saint of the 
lord 

106 17 the earth open and swallow up dathan and cover the 
compani of abiram 

106 18 and a fire wa kindl in their compani the flame burn up 
the wick 

106 19 they made a calf in horeb and worship the molten imag 

106 20 thu they chang their glori into the similitud of an ox that 
eateth grass 

106 21 they forgat god their saviour which had done great thing in 
egypt 

106 22 wondrou work in the land of ham and terribl thing by the 
red sea 

106 23 therefor he said that he would destroy them had not mose hi 
chosen stood befor him in the breach to turn away hi wrath lest he 
should destroy them 

106 24 yea they despi the pleasant land they believ not hi 
word 

106 25 but murmur in their tent and hearken not unto the voic 
of the lord 

106 26 therefor he lift up hi hand against them to overthrow them 
in the wilder 

106 27 to overthrow their seed also among the nation and to scatter 
them in the land 

106 28 they join themselv also unto baalpeor and ate the 
sacrif of the dead 

106 29 thu they provok him to anger with their invent and the 
plagu brake in upon them 

106 30 then stood up phineha and execut judgment and so the 
plagu wa stay 

106 31 and that wa count unto him for righteou unto all 
gener for evermor 

106 32 they anger him also at the water of strife so that it went 
ill with mose for their sake 

106 33 becau they provok hi spirit so that he spake unadvisedli 
with hi lip 

106 34 they did not destroy the nation concern whom the lord 
command them 

106 35 but were mingl among the heathen and learn their work 

106 36 and they serv their idol which were a snare unto them 

106 37 yea they sacrif their son and their daughter unto 
devil 

106 38 and shed innoc blood even the blood of their son and of 
their daughter whom they sacrif unto the idol of canaan and 
the land wa pollut with blood 

106 39 thu were they defil with their own work and went a whore 
with their own invent 

106 40 therefor wa the wrath of the lord kindl against hi peopl 
insomuch that he abhor hi own inherit 

106 41 and he gave them into the hand of the heathen and they that 
hate them rule over them 

106 42 their enemi also oppress them and they were brought into 
subject under their hand 

106 43 mani time did he deliv them but they provok him with 
their counsel and were brought low for their iniqu 

106 44 nevertheless he regard their afflict when he heard their 
cri 

106 45 and he rememb for them hi coven and repent accord 
to the multitud of hi merci 

106 46 he made them also to be piti of all those that carri them 
captiv 

106 47 save u o lord our god and gather u from among the heathen 
to give thank unto thi holi name and to triumph in thi prai 

106 48 bless be the lord god of israel from everlast to 
everlast and let all the peopl say amen prai ye the lord 



107 1 o give thank unto the lord for he is good for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

107 2 let the redeem of the lord say so whom he hath redeem from 
the hand of the enemi 

107 3 and gather them out of the land from the east and from the 
west from the north and from the south 

107 4 they wander in the wilder in a solitari way they found no 
citi to dwell in 

107 5 hungri and thirsti their soul faint in them 

107 6 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he deliv 
them out of their distress 

107 7 and he led them forth by the right way that they might go to a 
citi of habit 

107 8 oh that men would prai the lord for hi good and for hi 
wonder work to the child of men 

107 9 for he satisfieth the long soul and filleth the hungri soul 
with good 

107 10 such a sit in dark and in the shadow of death be bound 
in afflict and iron 

107 11 becau they rebel against the word of god and contemn 
the counsel of the most high 

107 12 therefor he brought down their heart with labour they fell 
down and there wa none to help 

107 13 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he save 
them out of their distress 

107 14 he brought them out of dark and the shadow of death and 
brake their band in sunder 

107 15 oh that men would prai the lord for hi good and for hi 
wonder work to the child of men 

107 16 for he hath broken the gate of brass and cut the bar of iron 
in sunder 

107 17 fool becau of their transgress and becau of their 
iniqu are afflict 

107 18 their soul abhorreth all manner of meat and they draw near 
unto the gate of death 

107 19 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he saveth 
them out of their distress 

107 20 he sent hi word and heal them and deliv them from 
their destruct 

107 21 oh that men would prai the lord for hi good and for hi 
wonder work to the child of men 

107 22 and let them sacrif the sacrif of thanksgiv and 
declar hi work with rejoic 

107 23 they that go down to the sea in ship that do busi in 
great water 

107 24 these see the work of the lord and hi wonder in the deep 

107 25 for he commandeth and raiseth the stormi wind which lifteth 
up the wave thereof 

107 26 they mount up to the heaven they go down again to the depth 
their soul is melt becau of troubl 

107 27 they reel to and fro and stagger like a drunken man and are 
at their wit s end 

107 28 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he bringeth 
them out of their distress 

107 29 he maketh the storm a calm so that the wave thereof are 
still 

107 30 then are they glad becau they be quiet so he bringeth them 
unto their desir haven 

107 31 oh that men would prai the lord for hi good and for hi 
wonder work to the child of men 

107 32 let them exalt him also in the congreg of the peopl and 
prai him in the assembl of the elder 

107 33 he turneth river into a wilder and the waterspr into 
dri ground 

107 34 a fruit land into barren for the wick of them 
that dwell therein 

107 35 he turneth the wilder into a stand water and dri ground 
into waterspr 

107 36 and there he maketh the hungri to dwell that they may prepar 
a citi for habit 

107 37 and sow the field and plant vineyard which may yield fruit 
of increa 

107 38 he blesseth them also so that they are multipli greatli and 
suffereth not their cattl to decrea 

107 39 again they are minish and brought low through oppress 
afflict and sorrow 

107 40 he poureth contempt upon princ and causeth them to wander in 
the wilder where there is no way 

107 41 yet setteth he the poor on high from afflict and maketh him 
famili like a flock 

107 42 the righteou shall see it and rejoic and all iniqu shall 
stop her mouth 

107 43 whoso is wise and will observ these thing even they shall 
understand the lovingkind of the lord 



108 1 o god my heart is fix i will sing and give prai even with 
my glori 

108 2 awak psalteri and harp i myself will awak earli 

108 3 i will prai thee o lord among the peopl and i will sing 
prai unto thee among the nation 

108 4 for thi merci is great abov the heaven and thi truth reacheth 
unto the cloud 

108 5 be thou exalt o god abov the heaven and thi glori abov 
all the earth 

108 6 that thi belov may be deliv save with thi right hand and 
answer me 

108 7 god hath spoken in hi holi i will rejoic i will divid 
shechem and mete out the valley of succoth 

108 8 gilead is mine manasseh is mine ephraim also is the strength 
of mine head judah is my lawgiv 

108 9 moab is my washpot over edom will i cast out my shoe over 
philistia will i triumph

edom

o god go forth with our host 

108 12 give u help from troubl for vain is the help of man

tread down our enemi 



109 1 hold not thi peac o god of my prai 

109 2 for the mouth of the wick and the mouth of the deceit are 
open against me they have spoken against me with a lie tongu 

109 3 they compass me about also with word of hatr and fought 
against me without a cau 

109 4 for my love they are my adversari but i give myself unto 
prayer 

109 5 and they have reward me evil for good and hatr for my love 

109 6 set thou a wick man over him and let satan stand at hi right 
hand 

109 7 when he shall be judg let him be condemn and let hi 
prayer becom sin 

109 8 let hi day be few and let anoth take hi offic 

109 9 let hi child be fatherless and hi wife a widow 

109 10 let hi child be continu vagabond and beg let them 
seek their bread also out of their desol place 

109 11 let the extort catch all that he hath and let the 
stranger spoil hi labour 

109 12 let there be none to extend merci unto him neither let there 
be ani to favour hi fatherless child 

109 13 let hi poster be cut off and in the gener follow 
let their name be blot out 

109 14 let the iniqu of hi father be rememb with the lord 
and let not the sin of hi mother be blot out 

109 15 let them be befor the lord continu that he may cut off 
the memori of them from the earth 

109 16 becau that he rememb not to shew merci but persecut 
the poor and needi man that he might even slay the broken in heart 

109 17 a he love cur so let it come unto him a he delight 
not in bless so let it be far from him 

109 18 a he cloth himself with cur like a with hi garment so 
let it come into hi bowel like water and like oil into hi bone 

109 19 let it be unto him a the garment which covereth him and for a 
girdl wherewith he is gird continu 

109 20 let thi be the reward of mine adversari from the lord and 
of them that speak evil against my soul 

109 21 but do thou for me o god the lord for thi name s sake 
becau thi merci is good deliv thou me 

109 22 for i am poor and needi and my heart is wound within me 

109 23 i am gone like the shadow when it declineth i am toss up and 
down a the locust 

109 24 my knee are weak through fast and my flesh faileth of 
fat 

109 25 i becam also a reproach unto them when they look upon me 
they shake their head 

109 26 help me o lord my god o save me accord to thi merci 

109 27 that they may know that thi is thi hand that thou lord hast 
done it 

109 28 let them cur but bless thou when they ari let them be 
asham but let thi servant rejoic 

109 29 let mine adversari be cloth with shame and let them cover 
themselv with their own confu a with a mantl 

109 30 i will greatli prai the lord with my mouth yea i will 
prai him among the multitud 

109 31 for he shall stand at the right hand of the poor to save him 
from those that condemn hi soul 



110 1 the lord said unto my lord sit thou at my right hand until i 
make thine enemi thi footstool 

110 2 the lord shall send the rod of thi strength out of zion rule 
thou in the midst of thine enemi 

110 3 thi peopl shall be will in the day of thi power in the 
beauti of holi from the womb of the morn thou hast the dew 
of thi youth 

110 4 the lord hath sworn and will not repent thou art a priest for 
ever after the order of melchizedek 

110 5 the lord at thi right hand shall strike through king in the day 
of hi wrath 

110 6 he shall judg among the heathen he shall fill the place with 
the dead bodi he shall wound the head over mani countri 

110 7 he shall drink of the brook in the way therefor shall he lift 
up the head

command are sure 

111 8 they stand fast for ever and ever and are done in truth and

understand have all they that do hi command hi prai

supplic

upon him a long a i live

119 1 bless are the undefil in the way who walk in the law of the 
lord 

119 2 bless are they that keep hi testimoni and that seek him 
with the whole heart 

119 3 they also do no iniqu they walk in hi way 

119 4 thou hast command u to keep thi precept dilig 

119 5 o that my way were direct to keep thi statut 

119 6 then shall i not be asham when i have respect unto all thi 
command 

119 7 i will prai thee with upright of heart when i shall have 
learn thi righteou judgment

119 9 wherewith shall a young man clean hi way by take heed 
thereto accord to thi word

from thi command 

119 11 thi word have i hid in mine heart that i might not sin against 
thee

119 13 with my lip have i declar all the judgment of thi mouth

all rich

way

word

thi law

judgment at all time

119 24 thi testimoni also are my delight and my counsellor

observ it with my whole heart

delight
