119 165 great peac have they which love thi law and noth shall 
offend them 

119 166 lord i have hope for thi salvat and done thi 
command 

119 167 my soul hath kept thi testimoni and i love them 
exceedingli 

119 168 i have kept thi precept and thi testimoni for all my way 
are befor thee 

119 169 let my cri come near befor thee o lord give me 
understand accord to thi word 

119 170 let my supplic come befor thee deliv me accord to 
thi word 

119 171 my lip shall utter prai when thou hast taught me thi 
statut 

119 172 my tongu shall speak of thi word for all thi command 
are righteou 

119 173 let thine hand help me for i have chosen thi precept 

119 174 i have long for thi salvat o lord and thi law is my 
delight 

119 175 let my soul live and it shall prai thee and let thi 
judgment help me 

119 176 i have gone astray like a lost sheep seek thi servant for i 
do not forget thi command 



120 1 in my distress i cri unto the lord and he heard me 

120 2 deliv my soul o lord from lie lip and from a deceit 
tongu 

120 3 what shall be given unto thee or what shall be done unto thee 
thou fal tongu 

120 4 sharp arrow of the mighti with coal of junip 

120 5 woe is me that i sojourn in mesech that i dwell in the tent 
of kedar 

120 6 my soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peac 

120 7 i am for peac but when i speak they are for war 



121 1 i will lift up mine eye unto the hill from whenc cometh my 
help 

121 2 my help cometh from the lord which made heaven and earth 

121 3 he will not suffer thi foot to be move he that keepeth thee 
will not slumber 

121 4 behold he that keepeth israel shall neither slumber nor sleep 

121 5 the lord is thi keeper the lord is thi shade upon thi right 
hand 

121 6 the sun shall not smite thee by day nor the moon by night 

121 7 the lord shall preserv thee from all evil he shall preserv 
thi soul 

121 8 the lord shall preserv thi go out and thi come in from 
thi time forth and even for evermor 



122 1 i wa glad when they said unto me let u go into the hou of 
the lord 

122 2 our foot shall stand within thi gate o jerusalem 

122 3 jerusalem is build a a citi that is compact togeth 

122 4 whither the tribe go up the tribe of the lord unto the 
testimoni of israel to give thank unto the name of the lord 

122 5 for there are set throne of judgment the throne of the hou 
of david 

122 6 pray for the peac of jerusalem they shall prosper that love 
thee 

122 7 peac be within thi wall and prosper within thi palac 

122 8 for my brother and companion sake i will now say peac be 
within thee 

122 9 becau of the hou of the lord our god i will seek thi good 



123 1 unto thee lift i up mine eye o thou that dwellest in the 
heaven 

123 2 behold a the eye of servant look unto the hand of their 
master and a the eye of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress so 
our eye wait upon the lord our god until that he have merci upon u 

123 3 have merci upon u o lord have merci upon u for we are 
exceedingli fill with contempt 

123 4 our soul is exceedingli fill with the scorn of those that 
are at ea and with the contempt of the proud 



124 1 if it had not been the lord who wa on our side now may israel 
say 

124 2 if it had not been the lord who wa on our side when men rose 
up against u 

124 3 then they had swallow u up quick when their wrath wa 
kindl against u 

124 4 then the water had overwhelm u the stream had gone over our 
soul 

124 5 then the proud water had gone over our soul 

124 6 bless be the lord who hath not given u a a prey to their 
teeth 

124 7 our soul is escap a a bird out of the snare of the fowler 
the snare is broken and we are escap 

124 8 our help is in the name of the lord who made heaven and earth 



125 1 they that trust in the lord shall be a mount zion which cannot 
be remov but abideth for ever 

125 2 a the mountain are round about jerusalem so the lord is round 
about hi peopl from henceforth even for ever 

125 3 for the rod of the wick shall not rest upon the lot of the 
righteou lest the righteou put forth their hand unto iniqu 

125 4 do good o lord unto those that be good and to them that are 
upright in their heart 

125 5 a for such a turn asid unto their crook way the lord 
shall lead them forth with the worker of iniqu but peac shall be 
upon israel 



126 1 when the lord turn again the captiv of zion we were like 
them that dream 

126 2 then wa our mouth fill with laughter and our tongu with 
sing then said they among the heathen the lord hath done great 
thing for them 

126 3 the lord hath done great thing for u whereof we are glad 

126 4 turn again our captiv o lord a the stream in the south 

126 5 they that sow in tear shall reap in joy 

126 6 he that goeth forth and weepeth bear preciou seed shall 
doubtless come again with rejoic bring hi sheaf with him 



127 1 except the lord build the hou they labour in vain that build 
it except the lord keep the citi the watchman waketh but in vain 

127 2 it is vain for you to rise up earli to sit up late to eat the 
bread of sorrow for so he giveth hi belov sleep 

127 3 lo child are an heritag of the lord and the fruit of the 
womb is hi reward 

127 4 a arrow are in the hand of a mighti man so are child of 
the youth 

127 5 happi is the man that hath hi quiver full of them they shall 
not be asham but they shall speak with the enemi in the gate 



128 1 bless is everi one that feareth the lord that walketh in hi 
way 

128 2 for thou shalt eat the labour of thine hand happi shalt thou 
be and it shall be well with thee 

128 3 thi wife shall be a a fruit vine by the side of thine 
hou thi child like oliv plant round about thi tabl 

128 4 behold that thu shall the man be bless that feareth the 
lord 

128 5 the lord shall bless thee out of zion and thou shalt see the 
good of jerusalem all the day of thi life 

128 6 yea thou shalt see thi child s child and peac upon 
israel 



129 1 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth may israel now 
say 

129 2 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth yet they have 
not prevail against me 

129 3 the plower plow upon my back they made long their furrow 

129 4 the lord is righteou he hath cut asund the cord of the 
wick 

129 5 let them all be confound and turn back that hate zion 

129 6 let them be a the grass upon the housetop which withereth 
afor it groweth up 

129 7 wherewith the mower filleth not hi hand nor he that bindeth 
sheaf hi bosom 

129 8 neither do they which go by say the bless of the lord be 
upon you we bless you in the name of the lord 



130 1 out of the depth have i cri unto thee o lord 

130 2 lord hear my voic let thine ear be attent to the voic of 
my supplic 

130 3 if thou lord shouldest mark iniqu o lord who shall 
stand 

130 4 but there is forgiv with thee that thou mayest be fear 

130 5 i wait for the lord my soul doth wait and in hi word do i 
hope 

130 6 my soul waiteth for the lord more than they that watch for the 
morn i say more than they that watch for the morn 

130 7 let israel hope in the lord for with the lord there is merci 
and with him is plenteou redempt 

130 8 and he shall redeem israel from all hi iniqu 



131 1 lord my heart is not haughti nor mine eye lofti neither do i 
exerci myself in great matter or in thing too high for me 

131 2 sure i have behav and quiet myself a a child that is 
wean of hi mother my soul is even a a wean child 

131 3 let israel hope in the lord from henceforth and for ever 



132 1 lord rememb david and all hi afflict 

132 2 how he sware unto the lord and vow unto the mighti god of 
jacob 

132 3 sure i will not come into the tabernacl of my hou nor go 
up into my bed 

132 4 i will not give sleep to mine eye or slumber to mine eyelid 

132 5 until i find out a place for the lord an habit for the 
mighti god of jacob 

132 6 lo we heard of it at ephratah we found it in the field of the 
wood 

132 7 we will go into hi tabernacl we will worship at hi 
footstool 

132 8 ari o lord into thi rest thou and the ark of thi strength 

132 9 let thi priest be cloth with righteou and let thi 
saint shout for joy 

132 10 for thi servant david s sake turn not away the face of thine 
anoint 

132 11 the lord hath sworn in truth unto david he will not turn from 
it of the fruit of thi bodi will i set upon thi throne 

132 12 if thi child will keep my coven and my testimoni that i 
shall teach them their child shall also sit upon thi throne for 
evermor 

132 13 for the lord hath chosen zion he hath desir it for hi 
habit 

132 14 thi is my rest for ever here will i dwell for i have desir 
it 

132 15 i will abundantli bless her provi i will satisfi her poor 
with bread 

132 16 i will also cloth her priest with salvat and her saint 
shall shout aloud for joy 

132 17 there will i make the horn of david to bud i have ordain a 
lamp for mine anoint 

132 18 hi enemi will i cloth with shame but upon himself shall 
hi crown flourish 



133 1 behold how good and how pleasant it is for brother to dwell 
togeth in uniti 

133 2 it is like the preciou ointment upon the head that ran down 
upon the beard even aaron s beard that went down to the skirt of 
hi garment 

133 3 a the dew of hermon and a the dew that descend upon the 
mountain of zion for there the lord command the bless even 
life for evermor

135 1 prai ye the lord prai ye the name of the lord prai him 
o ye servant of the lord 

135 2 ye that stand in the hou of the lord in the court of the 
hou of our god 

135 3 prai the lord for the lord is good sing prai unto hi 
name for it is pleasant 

135 4 for the lord hath chosen jacob unto himself and israel for hi 
peculiar treasur 

135 5 for i know that the lord is great and that our lord is abov 
all god 

135 6 whatsoev the lord plea that did he in heaven and in 
earth in the sea and all deep place 

135 7 he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the earth he 
maketh lightn for the rain he bringeth the wind out of hi 
treasuri 

135 8 who smote the firstborn of egypt both of man and beast 

135 9 who sent token and wonder into the midst of thee o egypt 
upon pharaoh and upon all hi servant 

135 10 who smote great nation and slew mighti king

135 13 thi name o lord endureth for ever and thi memori o lord

135 14 for the lord will judg hi peopl and he will repent himself 
concern hi servant 

135 15 the idol of the heathen are silver and gold the work of men s 
hand 

135 16 they have mouth but they speak not eye have they but they 
see not 

135 17 they have ear but they hear not neither is there ani breath

135 20 bless the lord o hou of levi ye that fear the lord bless 
the lord 

135 21 bless be the lord out of zion which dwelleth at jerusalem 

prai ye the lord 



136 1 o give thank unto the lord for he is good for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 2 o give thank unto the god of god for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 3 o give thank to the lord of lord for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 4 to him who alon doeth great wonder for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 5 to him that by wisdom made the heaven for hi merci endureth 
for ever 

136 6 to him that stretch out the earth abov the water for hi 
merci endureth for ever 

136 7 to him that made great light for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 8 the sun to rule by day for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 9 the moon and star to rule by night for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 10 to him that smote egypt in their firstborn for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 11 and brought out israel from among them for hi merci endureth 
for ever 

136 12 with a strong hand and with a stretch out arm for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 13 to him which divid the red sea into part for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 14 and made israel to pa through the midst of it for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 15 but overthrew pharaoh and hi host in the red sea for hi 
merci endureth for ever 

136 16 to him which led hi peopl through the wilder for hi 
merci endureth for ever 

136 17 to him which smote great king for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 18 and slew famou king for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 19 sihon king of the amorit for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 20 and og the king of bashan for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 21 and gave their land for an heritag for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 22 even an heritag unto israel hi servant for hi merci 
endureth for ever 

136 23 who rememb u in our low estat for hi merci endureth for 
ever 

136 24 and hath redeem u from our enemi for hi merci endureth 
for ever 

136 25 who giveth food to all flesh for hi merci endureth for ever 

136 26 o give thank unto the god of heaven for hi merci endureth 
for ever 



137 1 by the river of babylon there we sat down yea we wept when 
we rememb zion 

137 2 we hang our harp upon the willow in the midst thereof 

137 3 for there they that carri u away captiv requir of u a 
song and they that wast u requir of u mirth say sing u 
one of the song of zion 

137 4 how shall we sing the lord s song in a strang land 

137 5 if i forget thee o jerusalem let my right hand forget her 
cun 

137 6 if i do not rememb thee let my tongu cleav to the roof of 
my mouth if i prefer not jerusalem abov my chief joy 

137 7 rememb o lord the child of edom in the day of jerusalem 
who said rase it rase it even to the foundat thereof 

137 8 o daughter of babylon who art to be destroy happi shall he 
be that rewardeth thee a thou hast serv u 

137 9 happi shall he be that taketh and dasheth thi littl one 
against the stone 



138 1 i will prai thee with my whole heart befor the god will i 
sing prai unto thee 

138 2 i will worship toward thi holi templ and prai thi name for 
thi lovingkind and for thi truth for thou hast magnifi thi word 
abov all thi name 

138 3 in the day when i cri thou answeredst me and strengthenedst 
me with strength in my soul 

138 4 all the king of the earth shall prai thee o lord when they 
hear the word of thi mouth 

138 5 yea they shall sing in the way of the lord for great is the 
glori of the lord 

138 6 though the lord be high yet hath he respect unto the lowli but 
the proud he knoweth afar off 

138 7 though i walk in the midst of troubl thou wilt reviv me thou 
shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemi and 
thi right hand shall save me 

138 8 the lord will perfect that which concerneth me thi merci o 
lord endureth for ever forsak not the work of thine own hand 



139 1 o lord thou hast search me and known me 

139 2 thou knowest my downsit and mine upri thou 
understandest my thought afar off 

139 3 thou compassest my path and my lie down and art acquaint 
with all my way 

139 4 for there is not a word in my tongu but lo o lord thou 
knowest it altogeth 

139 5 thou hast beset me behind and befor and laid thine hand upon 
me 

139 6 such knowledg is too wonder for me it is high i cannot 
attain unto it 

139 7 whither shall i go from thi spirit or whither shall i flee from 
thi presenc 

139 8 if i ascend up into heaven thou art there if i make my bed in 
hell behold thou art there 

139 9 if i take the wing of the morn and dwell in the uttermost 
part of the sea 

139 10 even there shall thi hand lead me and thi right hand shall 
hold me 

139 11 if i say sure the dark shall cover me even the night 
shall be light about me 

139 12 yea the dark hideth not from thee but the night shineth 
a the day the dark and the light are both alik to thee 

139 13 for thou hast poss my rein thou hast cover me in my 
mother s womb 

139 14 i will prai thee for i am fear and wonder made 
marvel are thi work and that my soul knoweth right well 

139 15 my substanc wa not hid from thee when i wa made in secret 
and curiou wrought in the lowest part of the earth 

139 16 thine eye did see my substanc yet be unperfect and in 
thi book all my member were written which in continu were 
fashion when a yet there wa none of them 

139 17 how preciou also are thi thought unto me o god how great is 
the sum of them 

139 18 if i should count them they are more in number than the sand 
when i awak i am still with thee 

139 19 sure thou wilt slay the wick o god depart from me 
therefor ye bloodi men 

139 20 for they speak against thee wickedli and thine enemi take 
thi name in vain 

139 21 do not i hate them o lord that hate thee and am not i 
griev with those that rise up against thee 

139 22 i hate them with perfect hatr i count them mine enemi 

139 23 search me o god and know my heart tri me and know my 
thought 

139 24 and see if there be ani wick way in me and lead me in the 
way everlast 



140 1 deliv me o lord from the evil man preserv me from the 
violent man 

140 2 which imagin mischief in their heart continu are they 
gather togeth for war 

140 3 they have sharpen their tongu like a serpent adder poison 
is under their lip selah 

140 4 keep me o lord from the hand of the wick preserv me from 
the violent man who have purpo to overthrow my go 

140 5 the proud have hid a snare for me and cord they have spread a 
net by the waysid they have set gin for me selah 

140 6 i said unto the lord thou art my god hear the voic of my 
supplic o lord 

140 7 o god the lord the strength of my salvat thou hast cover 
my head in the day of battl 

140 8 grant not o lord the desir of the wick further not hi 
wick devic lest they exalt themselv selah 

140 9 a for the head of those that compass me about let the mischief 
of their own lip cover them 

140 10 let burn coal fall upon them let them be cast into the 
fire into deep pit that they rise not up again 

140 11 let not an evil speaker be establish in the earth evil shall 
hunt the violent man to overthrow him 

140 12 i know that the lord will maintain the cau of the afflict 
and the right of the poor 

140 13 sure the righteou shall give thank unto thi name the 
upright shall dwell in thi presenc 



141 1 lord i cri unto thee make hast unto me give ear unto my 
voic when i cri unto thee 

141 2 let my prayer be set forth befor thee a incen and the 
lift up of my hand a the even sacrif 

141 3 set a watch o lord befor my mouth keep the door of my lip 

141 4 inclin not my heart to ani evil thing to practi wick work 
with men that work iniqu and let me not eat of their dainti 

141 5 let the righteou smite me it shall be a kind and let him 
reprov me it shall be an excel oil which shall not break my 
head for yet my prayer also shall be in their calam 

141 6 when their judg are overthrown in stoni place they shall 
hear my word for they are sweet 

141 7 our bone are scatter at the grave s mouth a when one 
cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth 

141 8 but mine eye are unto thee o god the lord in thee is my 
trust leav not my soul destitut 

141 9 keep me from the snare which they have laid for me and the 
gin of the worker of iniqu 

141 10 let the wick fall into their own net whilst that i withal 
escap 



142 1 i cri unto the lord with my voic with my voic unto the lord 
did i make my supplic 

142 2 i pour out my complaint befor him i shew befor him my 
troubl 

142 3 when my spirit wa overwhelm within me then thou knewest my 
path 

in the way wherein i walk have they privili laid a snare for me 

142 4 i look on my right hand and beheld but there wa no man that 
would know me refug fail me no man care for my soul 

142 5 i cri unto thee o lord i said thou art my refug and my 
portion in the land of the live 

142 6 attend unto my cri for i am brought veri low deliv me from 
my persecutor for they are stronger than i 

142 7 bring my soul out of prison that i may prai thi name the 
righteou shall compass me about for thou shalt deal bounti with 
me 



143 1 hear my prayer o lord give ear to my supplic in thi 
faith answer me and in thi righteou 

143 2 and enter not into judgment with thi servant for in thi sight 
shall no man live be justifi 

143 3 for the enemi hath persecut my soul he hath smitten my life 
down to the ground he hath made me to dwell in dark a those 
that have been long dead 

143 4 therefor is my spirit overwhelm within me my heart within me 
is desol 

143 5 i rememb the day of old i medit on all thi work i muse 
on the work of thi hand 

143 6 i stretch forth my hand unto thee my soul thirsteth after 
thee a a thirsti land selah 

143 7 hear me speedili o lord my spirit faileth hide not thi face 
from me lest i be like unto them that go down into the pit 

143 8 cau me to hear thi lovingkind in the morn for in thee 
do i trust cau me to know the way wherein i should walk for i lift 
up my soul unto thee 

143 9 deliv me o lord from mine enemi i flee unto thee to hide 
me 

143 10 teach me to do thi will for thou art my god thi spirit is 
good lead me into the land of upright 

143 11 quicken me o lord for thi name s sake for thi righteou 
sake bring my soul out of troubl 

143 12 and of thi merci cut off mine enemi and destroy all them 
that afflict my soul for i am thi servant 



144 1 bless be the lord my strength which teacheth my hand to war 
and my finger to fight 

144 2 my good and my fortress my high tower and my deliv 
my shield and he in whom i trust who subdueth my peopl under me 

144 3 lord what is man that thou takest knowledg of him or the son 
of man that thou makest account of him 

144 4 man is like to vaniti hi day are a a shadow that passeth 
away 

144 5 bow thi heaven o lord and come down touch the mountain and 
they shall smoke 

144 6 cast forth lightn and scatter them shoot out thine arrow 
and destroy them 

144 7 send thine hand from abov rid me and deliv me out of great 
water from the hand of strang child 

144 8 whose mouth speaketh vaniti and their right hand is a right 
hand of falsehood 

144 9 i will sing a new song unto thee o god upon a psalteri and an 
instrument of ten string will i sing prai unto thee 

144 10 it is he that giveth salvat unto king who delivereth david 
hi servant from the hurt sword 

144 11 rid me and deliv me from the hand of strang child whose 
mouth speaketh vaniti and their right hand is a right hand of 
falsehood 

144 12 that our son may be a plant grown up in their youth that 
our daughter may be a corner stone polish after the similitud 
of a palac 

144 13 that our garner may be full afford all manner of store 
that our sheep may bring forth thousand and ten thousand in our 
street 

144 14 that our ox may be strong to labour that there be no 
break in nor go out that there be no complain in our 
street 

144 15 happi is that peopl that is in such a case yea happi is 
that peopl whose god is the lord 



145 1 i will extol thee my god o king and i will bless thi name for 
ever and ever 

145 2 everi day will i bless thee and i will prai thi name for ever 
and ever 

145 3 great is the lord and greatli to be prai and hi great 
is unsearch 

145 4 one gener shall prai thi work to anoth and shall 
declar thi mighti act 

145 5 i will speak of the gloriou honour of thi majesti and of thi 
wondrou work 

145 6 and men shall speak of the might of thi terribl act and i 
will declar thi great 

145 7 they shall abundantli utter the memori of thi great good 
and shall sing of thi righteou 

145 8 the lord is graciou and full of compass slow to anger and 
of great merci 

145 9 the lord is good to all and hi tender merci are over all hi 
work 

145 10 all thi work shall prai thee o lord and thi saint shall 
bless thee 

145 11 they shall speak of the glori of thi kingdom and talk of thi 
power 

145 12 to make known to the son of men hi mighti act and the 
gloriou majesti of hi kingdom 

145 13 thi kingdom is an everlast kingdom and thi dominion 
endureth throughout all gener 

145 14 the lord upholdeth all that fall and raiseth up all those that 
be bow down 

145 15 the eye of all wait upon thee and thou givest them their meat 
in due season 

145 16 thou openest thine hand and satisfiest the desir of everi 
live thing 

145 17 the lord is righteou in all hi way and holi in all hi 
work 

145 18 the lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him to all that 
call upon him in truth 

145 19 he will fulfil the desir of them that fear him he also will 
hear their cri and will save them 

145 20 the lord preserveth all them that love him but all the wick 
will he destroy 

145 21 my mouth shall speak the prai of the lord and let all flesh 
bless hi holi name for ever and ever 



146 1 prai ye the lord prai the lord o my soul 

146 2 while i live will i prai the lord i will sing prai unto my 
god while i have ani be 

146 3 put not your trust in princ nor in the son of man in whom 
there is no help 

146 4 hi breath goeth forth he returneth to hi earth in that veri 
day hi thought perish 

146 5 happi is he that hath the god of jacob for hi help whose hope 
is in the lord hi god 

146 6 which made heaven and earth the sea and all that therein is 
which keepeth truth for ever 

146 7 which executeth judgment for the oppress which giveth food to 
the hungri the lord looseth the prison 

146 8 the lord openeth the eye of the blind the lord raiseth them 
that are bow down the lord loveth the righteou 

146 9 the lord preserveth the stranger he relieveth the fatherless 
and widow but the way of the wick he turneth upsid down 

146 10 the lord shall reign for ever even thi god o zion unto all 
gener prai ye the lord 



147 1 prai ye the lord for it is good to sing prai unto our god 
for it is pleasant and prai is come 

147 2 the lord doth build up jerusalem he gathereth togeth the 
outcast of israel 

147 3 he healeth the broken in heart and bindeth up their wound 

147 4 he telleth the number of the star he calleth them all by their 
name 

147 5 great is our lord and of great power hi understand is 
infinit 

147 6 the lord lifteth up the meek he casteth the wick down to the 
ground 

147 7 sing unto the lord with thanksgiv sing prai upon the harp 
unto our god 

147 8 who covereth the heaven with cloud who prepareth rain for the 
earth who maketh grass to grow upon the mountain 

147 9 he giveth to the beast hi food and to the young raven which 
cri 

147 10 he delighteth not in the strength of the hor he taketh not 
pleasur in the leg of a man 

147 11 the lord taketh pleasur in them that fear him in those that 
hope in hi merci 

147 12 prai the lord o jerusalem prai thi god o zion 

147 13 for he hath strengthen the bar of thi gate he hath bless 
thi child within thee 

147 14 he maketh peac in thi border and filleth thee with the 
finest of the wheat 

147 15 he sendeth forth hi command upon earth hi word runneth 
veri swiftli 

147 16 he giveth snow like wool he scattereth the hoarfrost like 
ash 

147 17 he casteth forth hi ice like morsel who can stand befor hi 
cold 

147 18 he sendeth out hi word and melteth them he causeth hi wind 
to blow and the water flow 

147 19 he sheweth hi word unto jacob hi statut and hi judgment 
unto israel 

147 20 he hath not dealt so with ani nation and a for hi judgment 
they have not known them prai ye the lord

him in the height

were creat 

148 6 he hath also stablish them for ever and ever he hath made a 
decr which shall not pa

148 8 fire and hail snow and vapour stormi wind fulfil hi

148 10 beast and all cattl creep thing and fli fowl

148 14 he also exalteth the horn of hi peopl the prai of all hi 
saint even of the child of israel a peopl near unto him prai 
ye the lord 



149 1 prai ye the lord sing unto the lord a new song and hi 
prai in the congreg of saint 

149 2 let israel rejoic in him that made him let the child of 
zion be joy in their king 

149 3 let them prai hi name in the danc let them sing prai 
unto him with the timbrel and harp 

149 4 for the lord taketh pleasur in hi peopl he will beautifi the 
meek with salvat 

149 5 let the saint be joy in glori let them sing aloud upon 
their bed 

149 6 let the high prai of god be in their mouth and a two edg 
sword in their hand 

149 7 to execut vengeanc upon the heathen and punish upon the 
peopl 

149 8 to bind their king with chain and their nobl with fetter 
of iron 

149 9 to execut upon them the judgment written thi honour have all 
hi saint prai ye the lord 



150 1 prai ye the lord prai god in hi sanctuari prai him in 
the firmament of hi power 

150 2 prai him for hi mighti act prai him accord to hi 
excel great 

150 3 prai him with the sound of the trumpet prai him with the 
psalteri and harp 

150 4 prai him with the timbrel and danc prai him with string 
instrument and organ 

150 5 prai him upon the loud cymbal prai him upon the high 
sound cymbal 

150 6 let everi thing that hath breath prai the lord prai ye the lord 




the proverb 


1 1 the proverb of solomon the son of david king of israel 1 2 to 
know wisdom and instruct to perceiv the word of understand 
1 3 to receiv the instruct of wisdom justic and judgment and 
equiti 1 4 to give subtilti to the simpl to the young man knowledg 
and discret 

1 5 a wise man will hear and will increa learn and a man of 
understand shall attain unto wise counsel 1 6 to understand a 
proverb and the interpret the word of the wise and their dark 
say 

1 7 the fear of the lord is the begin of knowledg but fool 
despi wisdom and instruct 

1 8 my son hear the instruct of thi father and forsak not the 
law of thi mother 1 9 for they shall be an ornament of grace unto thi 
head and chain about thi neck 

1 10 my son if sinner entic thee consent thou not 

1 11 if they say come with u let u lay wait for blood let u lurk 
privili for the innoc without cau 1 12 let u swallow them up 
aliv a the grave and whole a those that go down into the pit 
1 13 we shall find all preciou substanc we shall fill our hou 
with spoil 1 14 cast in thi lot among u let u all have one pur 
1 15 my son walk not thou in the way with them refrain thi foot from 
their path 1 16 for their foot run to evil and make hast to shed 
blood 

1 17 sure in vain the net is spread in the sight of ani bird 

1 18 and they lay wait for their own blood they lurk privili for 
their own life 

1 19 so are the way of everi one that is greedi of gain which taketh 
away the life of the owner thereof 

1 20 wisdom crieth without she uttereth her voic in the street 
1 21 she crieth in the chief place of concour in the open of 
the gate in the citi she uttereth her word say 1 22 how long 
ye simpl one will ye love simplic and the scorner delight in 
their scorn and fool hate knowledg 1 23 turn you at my 
reproof behold i will pour out my spirit unto you i will make known 
my word unto you 

1 24 becau i have call and ye refu i have stretch out my 
hand and no man regard 1 25 but ye have set at nought all my 
counsel and would none of my reproof 1 26 i also will laugh at your 
calam i will mock when your fear cometh 1 27 when your fear 
cometh a desol and your destruct cometh a a whirlwind when 
distress and anguish cometh upon you 

1 28 then shall they call upon me but i will not answer they shall 
seek me earli but they shall not find me 1 29 for that they hate 
knowledg and did not choo the fear of the lord 1 30 they would 
none of my counsel they despi all my reproof 

1 31 therefor shall they eat of the fruit of their own way and be 
fill with their own devic 

1 32 for the turn away of the simpl shall slay them and the 
prosper of fool shall destroy them 

1 33 but whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safe and shall be 
quiet from fear of evil 

2 1 my son if thou wilt receiv my word and hide my command 
with thee 2 2 so that thou inclin thine ear unto wisdom and appli 
thine heart to understand 2 3 yea if thou criest after knowledg 
and liftest up thi voic for understand 2 4 if thou seekest her a 
silver and searchest for her a for hid treasur 2 5 then shalt 
thou understand the fear of the lord and find the knowledg of god 

2 6 for the lord giveth wisdom out of hi mouth cometh knowledg and 
understand 

2 7 he layeth up sound wisdom for the righteou he is a buckler to 
them that walk uprightli 

2 8 he keepeth the path of judgment and preserveth the way of hi 
saint 

2 9 then shalt thou understand righteou and judgment and 
equiti yea everi good path 

2 10 when wisdom entereth into thine heart and knowledg is pleasant 
unto thi soul 2 11 discret shall preserv thee understand 
shall keep thee 2 12 to deliv thee from the way of the evil man 
from the man that speaketh froward thing 2 13 who leav the path of 
upright to walk in the way of dark 2 14 who rejoic to do 
evil and delight in the froward of the wick 2 15 whose way 
are crook and they froward in their path 2 16 to deliv thee 
from the strang woman even from the stranger which flattereth with 
her word 2 17 which forsaketh the guid of her youth and forgetteth 
the coven of her god 

2 18 for her hou inclineth unto death and her path unto the dead 

2 19 none that go unto her return again neither take they hold of the 
path of life 

2 20 that thou mayest walk in the way of good men and keep the path 
of the righteou 

2 21 for the upright shall dwell in the land and the perfect shall 
remain in it 

2 22 but the wick shall be cut off from the earth and the 
transgressor shall be root out of it 

3 1 my son forget not my law but let thine heart keep my 
command 3 2 for length of day and long life and peac shall 
they add to thee 

3 3 let not merci and truth forsak thee bind them about thi neck 
write them upon the tabl of thine heart 3 4 so shalt thou find 
favour and good understand in the sight of god and man 

3 5 trust in the lord with all thine heart and lean not unto thine 
own understand 

3 6 in all thi way acknowledg him and he shall direct thi path 

3 7 be not wise in thine own eye fear the lord and depart from 
evil 

3 8 it shall be health to thi navel and marrow to thi bone 

3 9 honour the lord with thi substanc and with the firstfruit of 
all thine increa 3 10 so shall thi barn be fill with plenti and 
thi press shall burst out with new wine 

3 11 my son despi not the chasten of the lord neither be weari 
of hi correct 3 12 for whom the lord loveth he correcteth even 
a a father the son in whom he delighteth 

3 13 happi is the man that findeth wisdom and the man that getteth 
understand 

3 14 for the merchandi of it is better than the merchandi of 
silver and the gain thereof than fine gold 

3 15 she is more preciou than rubi and all the thing thou canst 
desir are not to be compar unto her 

3 16 length of day is in her right hand and in her left hand rich 
and honour 

3 17 her way are way of pleasant and all her path are peac 

3 18 she is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her and happi 
is everi one that retaineth her 

3 19 the lord by wisdom hath found the earth by understand hath 
he establish the heaven 

3 20 by hi knowledg the depth are broken up and the cloud drop 
down the dew 

3 21 my son let not them depart from thine eye keep sound wisdom 
and discret 3 22 so shall they be life unto thi soul and grace to 
thi neck 

3 23 then shalt thou walk in thi way safe and thi foot shall not 
stumbl 

3 24 when thou liest down thou shalt not be afraid yea thou shalt 
lie down and thi sleep shall be sweet 

3 25 be not afraid of sudden fear neither of the desol of the 
wick when it cometh 

3 26 for the lord shall be thi confid and shall keep thi foot 
from be taken 

3 27 withhold not good from them to whom it is due when it is in the 
power of thine hand to do it 

3 28 say not unto thi neighbour go and come again and to morrow i 
will give when thou hast it by thee 

3 29 devi not evil against thi neighbour see he dwelleth 
secur by thee 

3 30 strive not with a man without cau if he have done thee no 
harm 

3 31 envi thou not the oppressor and choo none of hi way 

3 32 for the froward is abomin to the lord but hi secret is 
with the righteou 

3 33 the cur of the lord is in the hou of the wick but he 
blesseth the habit of the just 

3 34 sure he scorneth the scorner but he giveth grace unto the 
lowli 

3 35 the wise shall inherit glori but shame shall be the promot of 
fool 

4 1 hear ye child the instruct of a father and attend to know 
understand 

4 2 for i give you good doctrin forsak ye not my law 

4 3 for i wa my father s son tender and onli belov in the sight of 
my mother 

4 4 he taught me also and said unto me let thine heart retain my 
word keep my command and live 

4 5 get wisdom get understand forget it not neither declin from 
the word of my mouth 

4 6 forsak her not and she shall preserv thee love her and she 
shall keep thee 

4 7 wisdom is the princip thing therefor get wisdom and with all 
thi get get understand 

4 8 exalt her and she shall promot thee she shall bring thee to 
honour when thou dost embrac her 

4 9 she shall give to thine head an ornament of grace a crown of 
glori shall she deliv to thee 

4 10 hear o my son and receiv my say and the year of thi life 
shall be mani 

4 11 i have taught thee in the way of wisdom i have led thee in right 
path 

4 12 when thou goest thi step shall not be straiten and when thou 
runnest thou shalt not stumbl 

4 13 take fast hold of instruct let her not go keep her for she 
is thi life 

4 14 enter not into the path of the wick and go not in the way of 
evil men 

4 15 avoid it pa not by it turn from it and pa away 

4 16 for they sleep not except they have done mischief and their 
sleep is taken away unless they cau some to fall 

4 17 for they eat the bread of wick and drink the wine of 
violenc 

4 18 but the path of the just is a the shine light that shineth 
more and more unto the perfect day 

4 19 the way of the wick is a dark they know not at what they 
stumbl 

4 20 my son attend to my word inclin thine ear unto my say 

4 21 let them not depart from thine eye keep them in the midst of 
thine heart 

4 22 for they are life unto those that find them and health to all 
their flesh 

4 23 keep thi heart with all dilig for out of it are the issu 
of life 

4 24 put away from thee a froward mouth and perver lip put far 
from thee 

4 25 let thine eye look right on and let thine eyelid look straight 
befor thee 

4 26 ponder the path of thi foot and let all thi way be establish 

4 27 turn not to the right hand nor to the left remov thi foot from 
evil 

5 1 my son attend unto my wisdom and bow thine ear to my 
understand 5 2 that thou mayest regard discret and that thi 
lip may keep knowledg 

5 3 for the lip of a strang woman drop a an honeycomb and her 
mouth is smoother than oil 5 4 but her end is bitter a wormwood 
sharp a a two edg sword 

5 5 her foot go down to death her step take hold on hell 

5 6 lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life her way are 
moveabl that thou canst not know them 

5 7 hear me now therefor o ye child and depart not from the 
word of my mouth 

5 8 remov thi way far from her and come not nigh the door of her 
hou 5 9 lest thou give thine honour unto other and thi year unto 
the cruel 5 10 lest stranger be fill with thi wealth and thi 
labour be in the hou of a stranger 5 11 and thou mourn at the 
last when thi flesh and thi bodi are consum 5 12 and say how have 
i hate instruct and my heart despi reproof 5 13 and have not 
obey the voic of my teacher nor inclin mine ear to them that 
instruct me 5 14 i wa almost in all evil in the midst of the 
congreg and assembl 

5 15 drink water out of thine own cistern and run water out of 
thine own well 

5 16 let thi fountain be disper abroad and river of water in 
the street 

5 17 let them be onli thine own and not stranger with thee 

5 18 let thi fountain be bless and rejoic with the wife of thi 
youth 

5 19 let her be a the love hind and pleasant roe let her breast 
satisfi thee at all time and be thou ravish alway with her love 

5 20 and whi wilt thou my son be ravish with a strang woman and 
embrac the bosom of a stranger 5 21 for the way of man are befor 
the eye of the lord and he pondereth all hi go 

5 22 hi own iniqu shall take the wick himself and he shall be 
holden with the cord of hi sin 

5 23 he shall die without instruct and in the great of hi 
folli he shall go astray 

6 1 my son if thou be sureti for thi friend if thou hast stricken 
thi hand with a stranger 6 2 thou art snare with the word of thi 
mouth thou art taken with the word of thi mouth 

6 3 do thi now my son and deliv thyself when thou art come into 
the hand of thi friend go humbl thyself and make sure thi friend 

6 4 give not sleep to thine eye nor slumber to thine eyelid 

6 5 deliv thyself a a roe from the hand of the hunter and a a 
bird from the hand of the fowler 

6 6 go to the ant thou sluggard consid her way and be wise 6 7 
which have no guid over or ruler 6 8 provideth her meat in 
the summer and gathereth her food in the harvest 

6 9 how long wilt thou sleep o sluggard when wilt thou ari out of 
thi sleep 6 10 yet a littl sleep a littl slumber a littl 
fold of the hand to sleep 6 11 so shall thi poverti come a one 
that travelleth and thi want a an arm man 

6 12 a naughti person a wick man walketh with a froward mouth 

6 13 he winketh with hi eye he speaketh with hi foot he teacheth 
with hi finger 6 14 froward is in hi heart he deviseth 
mischief continu he soweth discord 

6 15 therefor shall hi calam come suddenli suddenli shall he be 
broken without remedi 

6 16 these six thing doth the lord hate yea seven are an 
abomin unto him 6 17 a proud look a lie tongu and hand 
that shed innoc blood 6 18 an heart that deviseth wick 
imagin foot that be swift in run to mischief 6 19 a fal 
wit that speaketh lie and he that soweth discord among brother 

6 20 my son keep thi father s command and forsak not the law of 
thi mother 6 21 bind them continu upon thine heart and tie them 
about thi neck 

6 22 when thou goest it shall lead thee when thou sleepest it shall 
keep thee and when thou awakest it shall talk with thee 

6 23 for the command is a lamp and the law is light and reproof 
of instruct are the way of life 6 24 to keep thee from the evil 
woman from the flatteri of the tongu of a strang woman 

6 25 lust not after her beauti in thine heart neither let her take 
thee with her eyelid 

6 26 for by mean of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piec of 
bread and the adultress will hunt for the preciou life 

6 27 can a man take fire in hi bosom and hi cloth not be burn 
6 28 can one go upon hot coal and hi foot not be burn 6 29 so 
he that goeth in to hi neighbour s wife whosoev toucheth her shall 
not be innoc 

6 30 men do not despi a thief if he steal to satisfi hi soul when 
he is hungri 6 31 but if he be found he shall restor sevenfold he 
shall give all the substanc of hi hou 

6 32 but whoso committeth adulteri with a woman lacketh understand 
he that doeth it destroyeth hi own soul 

6 33 a wound and dishonour shall he get and hi reproach shall not be 
wipe away 

6 34 for jealousi is the rage of a man therefor he will not spare in 
the day of vengeanc 

6 35 he will not regard ani ransom neither will he rest content 
though thou givest mani gift 

7 1 my son keep my word and lay up my command with thee 

7 2 keep my command and live and my law a the appl of thine 
eye 

7 3 bind them upon thi finger write them upon the tabl of thine 
heart 

7 4 say unto wisdom thou art my sister and call understand thi 
kinswoman 7 5 that they may keep thee from the strang woman from 
the stranger which flattereth with her word 

7 6 for at the window of my hou i look through my casement 7 7 
and beheld among the simpl one i discern among the youth a 
young man void of understand 7 8 pa through the street near 
her corner and he went the way to her hou 7 9 in the twilight in 
the even in the black and dark night 7 10 and behold there met 
him a woman with the attir of an harlot and subtil of heart 

7 11 she is loud and stubborn her foot abid not in her hou 7 12 
now is she without now in the street and lieth in wait at everi 
corner 7 13 so she caught him and kiss him and with an impud 
face said unto him 7 14 i have peac offer with me thi day have 
i pay my vow 

7 15 therefor came i forth to meet thee dilig to seek thi face 
and i have found thee 

7 16 i have deck my bed with cover of tapestri with carv 
work with fine linen of egypt 

7 17 i have perfum my bed with myrrh alo and cinnamon 

7 18 come let u take our fill of love until the morn let u 
solac ourselv with love 

7 19 for the goodman is not at home he is gone a long journey 7 20 
he hath taken a bag of money with him and will come home at the day 
appoint 

7 21 with her much fair speech she cau him to yield with the 
flatter of her lip she forc him 

7 22 he goeth after her straightway a an ox goeth to the slaughter 
or a a fool to the correct of the stock 7 23 till a dart strike 
through hi liver a a bird hasteth to the snare and knoweth not 
that it is for hi life 

7 24 hearken unto me now therefor o ye child and attend to the 
word of my mouth 

7 25 let not thine heart declin to her way go not astray in her 
path 

7 26 for she hath cast down mani wound yea mani strong men have 
been slain by her 

7 27 her hou is the way to hell go down to the chamber of 
death 

8 1 doth not wisdom cri and understand put forth her voic 8 2 
she standeth in the top of high place by the way in the place of 
the path 

8 3 she crieth at the gate at the entri of the citi at the come 
in at the door 

8 4 unto you o men i call and my voic is to the son of man 

8 5 o ye simpl understand wisdom and ye fool be ye of an 
understand heart 

8 6 hear for i will speak of excel thing and the open of my 
lip shall be right thing 

8 7 for my mouth shall speak truth and wick is an abomin 
to my lip 

8 8 all the word of my mouth are in righteou there is noth 
froward or perver in them 

8 9 they are all plain to him that understandeth and right to them 
that find knowledg 

8 10 receiv my instruct and not silver and knowledg rather than 
choic gold 

8 11 for wisdom is better than rubi and all the thing that may be 
desir are not to be compar to it 

8 12 i wisdom dwell with prudenc and find out knowledg of witti 
invent 

8 13 the fear of the lord is to hate evil pride and arrog and 
the evil way and the froward mouth do i hate 

8 14 counsel is mine and sound wisdom i am understand i have 
strength 

8 15 by me king reign and princ decr justic 

8 16 by me princ rule and nobl even all the judg of the earth 

8 17 i love them that love me and those that seek me earli shall find 
me 

8 18 rich and honour are with me yea durabl rich and 
righteou 

8 19 my fruit is better than gold yea than fine gold and my revenu 
than choic silver 

8 20 i lead in the way of righteou in the midst of the path of 
judgment 8 21 that i may cau those that love me to inherit 
substanc and i will fill their treasur 

8 22 the lord poss me in the begin of hi way befor hi 
work of old 

8 23 i wa set up from everlast from the begin or ever the 
earth wa 

8 24 when there were no depth i wa brought forth when there were 
no fountain abound with water 

8 25 befor the mountain were settl befor the hill wa i brought 
forth 8 26 while a yet he had not made the earth nor the field 
nor the highest part of the dust of the world 

8 27 when he prepar the heaven i wa there when he set a compass 
upon the face of the depth 8 28 when he establish the cloud abov 
when he strengthen the fountain of the deep 8 29 when he gave to 
the sea hi decr that the water should not pa hi command 
when he appoint the foundat of the earth 8 30 then i wa by 
him a one brought up with him and i wa daili hi delight 
rejoic alway befor him 8 31 rejoic in the habit part of 
hi earth and my delight were with the son of men 

8 32 now therefor hearken unto me o ye child for bless are 
they that keep my way 

8 33 hear instruct and be wise and refu it not 

8 34 bless is the man that heareth me watch daili at my gate 
wait at the post of my door 

8 35 for whoso findeth me findeth life and shall obtain favour of the 
lord 

8 36 but he that sinneth against me wrongeth hi own soul all they 
that hate me love death 

9 1 wisdom hath build her hou she hath hewn out her seven 
pillar 9 2 she hath kill her beast she hath mingl her wine 
she hath also furnish her tabl 

9 3 she hath sent forth her maiden she crieth upon the highest 
place of the citi 9 4 whoso is simpl let him turn in hither a 
for him that wanteth understand she saith to him 9 5 come eat of 
my bread and drink of the wine which i have mingl 

9 6 forsak the foolish and live and go in the way of understand 

9 7 he that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame and he that 
rebuketh a wick man getteth himself a blot 

9 8 reprov not a scorner lest he hate thee rebuk a wise man and 
he will love thee 

9 9 give instruct to a wise man and he will be yet wiser teach a 
just man and he will increa in learn 

9 10 the fear of the lord is the begin of wisdom and the 
knowledg of the holi is understand 

9 11 for by me thi day shall be multipli and the year of thi life 
shall be increa 

9 12 if thou be wise thou shalt be wise for thyself but if thou 
scornest thou alon shalt bear it 

9 13 a foolish woman is clamor she is simpl and knoweth noth 

9 14 for she sitteth at the door of her hou on a seat in the high 
place of the citi 9 15 to call passeng who go right on their 
way 9 16 whoso is simpl let him turn in hither and a for him 
that wanteth understand she saith to him 9 17 stolen water are 
sweet and bread eaten in secret is pleasant 

9 18 but he knoweth not that the dead are there and that her guest 
are in the depth of hell 

10 1 the proverb of solomon a wise son maketh a glad father but a 
foolish son is the heavi of hi mother 

10 2 treasur of wick profit noth but righteou 
delivereth from death 

10 3 the lord will not suffer the soul of the righteou to famish but 
he casteth away the substanc of the wick 

10 4 he becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand but the hand of 
the dilig maketh rich 

10 5 he that gathereth in summer is a wise son but he that sleepeth 
in harvest is a son that causeth shame 

10 6 bless are upon the head of the just but violenc covereth 
the mouth of the wick 

10 7 the memori of the just is bless but the name of the wick 
shall rot 

10 8 the wise in heart will receiv command but a prate fool 
shall fall 

10 9 he that walketh uprightli walketh sure but he that perverteth 
hi way shall be known 

10 10 he that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow but a prate fool 
shall fall 

10 11 the mouth of a righteou man is a well of life but violenc 
covereth the mouth of the wick 

10 12 hatr stirreth up strife but love covereth all sin 

10 13 in the lip of him that hath understand wisdom is found but 
a rod is for the back of him that is void of understand 

10 14 wise men lay up knowledg but the mouth of the foolish is near 
destruct 

10 15 the rich man s wealth is hi strong citi the destruct of the 
poor is their poverti 

10 16 the labour of the righteou tendeth to life the fruit of the 
wick to sin 

10 17 he is in the way of life that keepeth instruct but he that 
refuseth reproof erreth 

10 18 he that hideth hatr with lie lip and he that uttereth a 
slander is a fool 

10 19 in the multitud of word there wanteth not sin but he that 
refraineth hi lip is wise 

10 20 the tongu of the just is a choic silver the heart of the 
wick is littl worth 

10 21 the lip of the righteou feed mani but fool die for want of 
wisdom 

10 22 the bless of the lord it maketh rich and he addeth no 
sorrow with it 

10 23 it is a sport to a fool to do mischief but a man of 
understand hath wisdom 

10 24 the fear of the wick it shall come upon him but the desir 
of the righteou shall be grant 

10 25 a the whirlwind passeth so is the wick no more but the 
righteou is an everlast foundat 

10 26 a vinegar to the teeth and a smoke to the eye so is the 
sluggard to them that send him 

10 27 the fear of the lord prolongeth day but the year of the 
wick shall be shorten 

10 28 the hope of the righteou shall be glad but the expect 
of the wick shall perish 

10 29 the way of the lord is strength to the upright but destruct 
shall be to the worker of iniqu 

10 30 the righteou shall never be remov but the wick shall not 
inhabit the earth 

10 31 the mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom but the froward 
tongu shall be cut out 

10 32 the lip of the righteou know what is accept but the mouth 
of the wick speaketh froward 

11 1 a fal balanc is abomin to the lord but a just weight is 
hi delight 

11 2 when pride cometh then cometh shame but with the lowli is 
wisdom 

11 3 the integr of the upright shall guid them but the 
perver of transgressor shall destroy them 

11 4 rich profit not in the day of wrath but righteou 
delivereth from death 

11 5 the righteou of the perfect shall direct hi way but the 
wick shall fall by hi own wick 

11 6 the righteou of the upright shall deliv them but 
transgressor shall be taken in their own naughti 

11 7 when a wick man dieth hi expect shall perish and the 
hope of unjust men perisheth 

11 8 the righteou is deliv out of troubl and the wick cometh 
in hi stead 

11 9 an hypocrit with hi mouth destroyeth hi neighbour but through 
knowledg shall the just be deliv 

11 10 when it goeth well with the righteou the citi rejoiceth and 
when the wick perish there is shout 

11 11 by the bless of the upright the citi is exalt but it is 
overthrown by the mouth of the wick 

11 12 he that is void of wisdom despiseth hi neighbour but a man of 
understand holdeth hi peac 

11 13 a talebear revealeth secret but he that is of a faith 
spirit concealeth the matter 

11 14 where no counsel is the peopl fall but in the multitud of 
counsellor there is safeti 

11 15 he that is sureti for a stranger shall smart for it and he that 
hateth suretiship is sure 

11 16 a graciou woman retaineth honour and strong men retain rich 

11 17 the merci man doeth good to hi own soul but he that is 
cruel troubleth hi own flesh 

11 18 the wick worketh a deceit work but to him that soweth 
righteou shall be a sure reward 

11 19 a righteou tendeth to life so he that pursueth evil 
pursueth it to hi own death 

11 20 they that are of a froward heart are abomin to the lord 
but such a are upright in their way are hi delight 

11 21 though hand join in hand the wick shall not be unpunish 
but the seed of the righteou shall be deliv 

11 22 a a jewel of gold in a swine s snout so is a fair woman which 
is without discret 

11 23 the desir of the righteou is onli good but the expect of 
the wick is wrath 

11 24 there is that scattereth and yet increaseth and there is that 
withholdeth more than is meet but it tendeth to poverti 

11 25 the liber soul shall be made fat and he that watereth shall 
be water also himself 

11 26 he that withholdeth corn the peopl shall cur him but 
bless shall be upon the head of him that selleth it 

11 27 he that dilig seeketh good procureth favour but he that 
seeketh mischief it shall come unto him 

11 28 he that trusteth in hi rich shall fall but the righteou 
shall flourish a a branch 

11 29 he that troubleth hi own hou shall inherit the wind and the 
fool shall be servant to the wise of heart 

11 30 the fruit of the righteou is a tree of life and he that 
winneth soul is wise 

11 31 behold the righteou shall be recompen in the earth much 
more the wick and the sinner 

12 1 whoso loveth instruct loveth knowledg but he that hateth 
reproof is brutish 

12 2 a good man obtaineth favour of the lord but a man of wick 
devic will he condemn 

12 3 a man shall not be establish by wick but the root of the 
righteou shall not be move 

12 4 a virtuou woman is a crown to her husband but she that maketh 
asham is a rotten in hi bone 

12 5 the thought of the righteou are right but the counsel of the 
wick are deceit 

12 6 the word of the wick are to lie in wait for blood but the 
mouth of the upright shall deliv them 

12 7 the wick are overthrown and are not but the hou of the 
righteou shall stand 

12 8 a man shall be commend accord to hi wisdom but he that is 
of a perver heart shall be despi 

12 9 he that is despi and hath a servant is better than he that 
honoureth himself and lacketh bread 

12 10 a righteou man regardeth the life of hi beast but the tender 
merci of the wick are cruel 

12 11 he that tilleth hi land shall be satisfi with bread but he 
that followeth vain person is void of understand 

12 12 the wick desireth the net of evil men but the root of the 
righteou yieldeth fruit 

12 13 the wick is snare by the transgress of hi lip but the 
just shall come out of troubl 

12 14 a man shall be satisfi with good by the fruit of hi mouth 
and the recomp of a man s hand shall be render unto him 

12 15 the way of a fool is right in hi own eye but he that 
hearkeneth unto counsel is wise 

12 16 a fool s wrath is present known but a prudent man covereth 
shame 

12 17 he that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteou but a fal 
wit deceit 

12 18 there is that speaketh like the pierc of a sword but the 
tongu of the wise is health 

12 19 the lip of truth shall be establish for ever but a lie 
tongu is but for a moment 

12 20 deceit is in the heart of them that imagin evil but to the 
counsellor of peac is joy 

12 21 there shall no evil happen to the just but the wick shall be 
fill with mischief 

12 22 lie lip are abomin to the lord but they that deal truli 
are hi delight 

12 23 a prudent man concealeth knowledg but the heart of fool 
proclaimeth foolish 

12 24 the hand of the dilig shall bear rule but the sloth shall 
be under tribut 

12 25 heavi in the heart of man maketh it stoop but a good word 
maketh it glad 

12 26 the righteou is more excel than hi neighbour but the way 
of the wick seduceth them 

12 27 the sloth man roasteth not that which he took in hunt but 
the substanc of a dilig man is preciou 

12 28 in the way of righteou is life and in the pathway thereof 
there is no death 

13 1 a wise son heareth hi father s instruct but a scorner 
heareth not rebuk 

13 2 a man shall eat good by the fruit of hi mouth but the soul of 
the transgressor shall eat violenc 

13 3 he that keepeth hi mouth keepeth hi life but he that openeth 
wide hi lip shall have destruct 

13 4 the soul of the sluggard desireth and hath noth but the soul 
of the dilig shall be made fat 

13 5 a righteou man hateth lie but a wick man is loathsom and

13 6 righteou keepeth him that is upright in the way but 
wick overthroweth the sinner 

13 7 there is that maketh himself rich yet hath noth there is 
that maketh himself poor yet hath great rich

not rebuk 

13 9 the light of the righteou rejoiceth but the lamp of the wick

knowledg 22 21 that i might make thee know the certainti of the 
word of truth that thou mightest answer the word of truth to them 
that send unto thee 22 22 rob not the poor becau he is poor 
neither oppress the afflict in the gate 22 23 for the lord will 
plead their cau and spoil the soul of those that spoil them 

22 24 make no friendship with an angri man and with a furiou man 
thou shalt not go 22 25 lest thou learn hi way and get a snare to 
thi soul 

22 26 be not thou one of them that strike hand or of them that are 
sureti for debt 

22 27 if thou hast noth to pay whi should he take away thi bed 
from under thee 22 28 remov not the ancient landmark which thi 
father have set 

22 29 seest thou a man dilig in hi busi he shall stand befor 
king he shall not stand befor mean men 

23 1 when thou sittest to eat with a ruler consid dilig what 
is befor thee 23 2 and put a knife to thi throat if thou be a man 
given to appetit 

23 3 be not desir of hi dainti for they are deceit meat 

23 4 labour not to be rich cea from thine own wisdom 

23 5 wilt thou set thine eye upon that which is not for rich 
certainli make themselv wing they fli away a an eagl toward 
heaven 

23 6 eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye neither 
desir thou hi dainti meat 23 7 for a he thinketh in hi heart so 
is he eat and drink saith he to thee but hi heart is not with 
thee 

23 8 the morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up and lose 
thi sweet word 

23 9 speak not in the ear of a fool for he will despi the wisdom 
of thi word 

23 10 remov not the old landmark and enter not into the field of 
the fatherless 23 11 for their redeem is mighti he shall plead 
their cau with thee 

23 12 appli thine heart unto instruct and thine ear to the word 
of knowledg 

23 13 withhold not correct from the child for if thou beatest him 
with the rod he shall not die 

23 14 thou shalt beat him with the rod and shalt deliv hi soul 
from hell 

23 15 my son if thine heart be wise my heart shall rejoic even 
mine 

23 16 yea my rein shall rejoic when thi lip speak right thing 

23 17 let not thine heart envi sinner but be thou in the fear of the 
lord all the day long 

23 18 for sure there is an end and thine expect shall not be 
cut off 

23 19 hear thou my son and be wise and guid thine heart in the 
way 

23 20 be not among winebibb among riotou eater of flesh 23 21 
for the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverti and drowsi 
shall cloth a man with rag 

23 22 hearken unto thi father that begat thee and despi not thi 
mother when she is old 

23 23 buy the truth and sell it not also wisdom and instruct 
and understand 

23 24 the father of the righteou shall greatli rejoic and he that 
begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him 

23 25 thi father and thi mother shall be glad and she that bare thee 
shall rejoic 

23 26 my son give me thine heart and let thine eye observ my way 

23 27 for a whore is a deep ditch and a strang woman is a narrow 
pit 

23 28 she also lieth in wait a for a prey and increaseth the 
transgressor among men 

23 29 who hath woe who hath sorrow who hath content who hath 
babbl who hath wound without cau who hath red of eye 
23 30 they that tarri long at the wine they that go to seek mix 
wine 

23 31 look not thou upon the wine when it is red when it giveth hi 
colour in the cup when it moveth itself aright 

23 32 at the last it biteth like a serpent and stingeth like an 
adder 

23 33 thine eye shall behold strang woman and thine heart shall 
utter perver thing 

23 34 yea thou shalt be a he that lieth down in the midst of the 
sea or a he that lieth upon the top of a mast 

23 35 they have stricken me shalt thou say and i wa not sick they 
have beaten me and i felt it not when shall i awak i will seek it 
yet again 

24 1 be not thou enviou against evil men neither desir to be with 
them 

24 2 for their heart studieth destruct and their lip talk of 
mischief 

24 3 through wisdom is an hou build and by understand it is 
establish 24 4 and by knowledg shall the chamber be fill with 
all preciou and pleasant rich 

24 5 a wise man is strong yea a man of knowledg increaseth 
strength 

24 6 for by wise counsel thou shalt make thi war and in multitud of 
counsellor there is safeti 

24 7 wisdom is too high for a fool he openeth not hi mouth in the 
gate 

24 8 he that deviseth to do evil shall be call a mischiev person 

24 9 the thought of foolish is sin and the scorner is an 
abomin to men 

24 10 if thou faint in the day of adver thi strength is small 

24 11 if thou forbear to deliv them that are drawn unto death and 
those that are readi to be slain 24 12 if thou sayest behold we 
knew it not doth not he that pondereth the heart consid it and he 
that keepeth thi soul doth not he know it and shall not he render to 
everi man accord to hi work 24 13 my son eat thou honey 
becau it is good and the honeycomb which is sweet to thi tast 
24 14 so shall the knowledg of wisdom be unto thi soul when thou 
hast found it then there shall be a reward and thi expect shall 
not be cut off 

24 15 lay not wait o wick man against the dwell of the 
righteou spoil not hi rest place 24 16 for a just man falleth 
seven time and riseth up again but the wick shall fall into 
mischief 

24 17 rejoic not when thine enemi falleth and let not thine heart be 
glad when he stumbleth 24 18 lest the lord see it and it displea 
him and he turn away hi wrath from him 

24 19 fret not thyself becau of evil men neither be thou enviou at 
the wick 24 20 for there shall be no reward to the evil man the 
candl of the wick shall be put out 

24 21 my son fear thou the lord and the king and meddl not with 
them that are given to chang 24 22 for their calam shall rise 
suddenli and who knoweth the ruin of them both 24 23 these thing 
also belong to the wise it is not good to have respect of person in 
judgment 

24 24 he that saith unto the wick thou are righteou him shall the 
peopl cur nation shall abhor him 24 25 but to them that rebuk 
him shall be delight and a good bless shall come upon them 

24 26 everi man shall kiss hi lip that giveth a right answer 

24 27 prepar thi work without and make it fit for thyself in the 
field and afterward build thine hou 

24 28 be not a wit against thi neighbour without cau and 
deceiv not with thi lip 

24 29 say not i will do so to him a he hath done to me i will 
render to the man accord to hi work 

24 30 i went by the field of the sloth and by the vineyard of the 
man void of understand 24 31 and lo it wa all grown over with 
thorn and nettl had cover the face thereof and the stone wall 
thereof wa broken down 

24 32 then i saw and consid it well i look upon it and 
receiv instruct 

24 33 yet a littl sleep a littl slumber a littl fold of the 
hand to sleep 24 34 so shall thi poverti come a one that 
travelleth and thi want a an arm man 

25 1 these are also proverb of solomon which the men of hezekiah 
king of judah copi out 

25 2 it is the glori of god to conceal a thing but the honour of 
king is to search out a matter 

25 3 the heaven for height and the earth for depth and the heart of 
king is unsearch 

25 4 take away the dross from the silver and there shall come forth a 
vessel for the finer 

25 5 take away the wick from befor the king and hi throne shall 
be establish in righteou 

25 6 put not forth thyself in the presenc of the king and stand not 
in the place of great men 25 7 for better it is that it be said unto 
thee come up hither than that thou shouldest be put lower in the 
presenc of the princ whom thine eye have seen 

25 8 go not forth hastili to strive lest thou know not what to do in 
the end thereof when thi neighbour hath put thee to shame 

25 9 debat thi cau with thi neighbour himself and discov not a 
secret to anoth 25 10 lest he that heareth it put thee to shame 
and thine infami turn not away 

25 11 a word fitli spoken is like appl of gold in pictur of 
silver 

25 12 a an ear of gold and an ornament of fine gold so is a 
wise reprov upon an obedi ear 

25 13 a the cold of snow in the time of harvest so is a faith 
messeng to them that send him for he refresheth the soul of hi 
master 

25 14 whoso boasteth himself of a fal gift is like cloud and wind 
without rain 

25 15 by long forbear is a princ persuad and a soft tongu 
breaketh the bone 

25 16 hast thou found honey eat so much a is suffici for thee 
lest thou be fill therewith and vomit it 

25 17 withdraw thi foot from thi neighbour s hou lest he be weari 
of thee and so hate thee 

25 18 a man that beareth fal wit against hi neighbour is a 
maul and a sword and a sharp arrow 

25 19 confid in an unfaith man in time of troubl is like a 
broken tooth and a foot out of joint 

25 20 a he that taketh away a garment in cold weather and a vinegar 
upon nitr so is he that singeth song to an heavi heart 

25 21 if thine enemi be hungri give him bread to eat and if he be 
thirsti give him water to drink 25 22 for thou shalt heap coal of 
fire upon hi head and the lord shall reward thee 

25 23 the north wind driveth away rain so doth an angri counten a 
backbit tongu 

25 24 it is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop than with a 
brawl woman and in a wide hou 

25 25 a cold water to a thirsti soul so is good news from a far 
countri 

25 26 a righteou man fall down befor the wick is a a troubl 
fountain and a corrupt spring 

25 27 it is not good to eat much honey so for men to search their own 
glori is not glori 

25 28 he that hath no rule over hi own spirit is like a citi that is 
broken down and without wall 

26 1 a snow in summer and a rain in harvest so honour is not 
seemli for a fool 

26 2 a the bird by wander a the swallow by fli so the cur 
causeless shall not come 

26 3 a whip for the hor a bridl for the a and a rod for the 
fool s back 

26 4 answer not a fool accord to hi folli lest thou also be like 
unto him 

26 5 answer a fool accord to hi folli lest he be wise in hi own 
conceit 

26 6 he that sendeth a messag by the hand of a fool cutteth off the 
foot and drinketh damag 

26 7 the leg of the lame are not equal so is a parabl in the mouth 
of fool 

26 8 a he that bindeth a stone in a sling so is he that giveth 
honour to a fool 

26 9 a a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard so is a parabl 
in the mouth of fool 

26 10 the great god that form all thing both rewardeth the fool 
and rewardeth transgressor 

26 11 a a dog returneth to hi vomit so a fool returneth to hi 
folli 

26 12 seest thou a man wise in hi own conceit there is more hope of 
a fool than of him 

26 13 the sloth man saith there is a lion in the way a lion is in 
the street 

26 14 a the door turneth upon hi hing so doth the sloth upon 
hi bed 

26 15 the sloth hideth hi hand in hi bosom it grieveth him to 
bring it again to hi mouth 

26 16 the sluggard is wiser in hi own conceit than seven men that can 
render a reason 

26 17 he that passeth by and meddleth with strife belong not to 
him is like one that taketh a dog by the ear 

26 18 a a mad man who casteth firebrand arrow and death 26 19 so 
is the man that deceiveth hi neighbour and saith am not i in sport 
26 20 where no wood is there the fire goeth out so where there is no 
talebear the strife ceaseth 

26 21 a coal are to burn coal and wood to fire so is a 
contenti man to kindl strife 

26 22 the word of a talebear are a wound and they go down into 
the innermost part of the belli 

26 23 burn lip and a wick heart are like a potsherd cover with 
silver dross 

26 24 he that hateth dissembleth with hi lip and layeth up deceit 
within him 26 25 when he speaketh fair believ him not for there 
are seven abomin in hi heart 

26 26 whose hatr is cover by deceit hi wick shall be 
shew befor the whole congreg 

26 27 whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein and he that rolleth a 
stone it will return upon him 

26 28 a lie tongu hateth those that are afflict by it and a 
flatter mouth worketh ruin 

27 1 boast not thyself of to morrow for thou knowest not what a day 
may bring forth 

27 2 let anoth man prai thee and not thine own mouth a stranger 
and not thine own lip 

27 3 a stone is heavi and the sand weighti but a fool s wrath is 
heavier than them both 

27 4 wrath is cruel and anger is outrag but who is abl to stand 
befor envi 27 5 open rebuk is better than secret love 

27 6 faith are the wound of a friend but the kiss of an enemi 
are deceit 

27 7 the full soul loatheth an honeycomb but to the hungri soul everi 
bitter thing is sweet 

27 8 a a bird that wandereth from her nest so is a man that 
wandereth from hi place 

27 9 ointment and perfum rejoic the heart so doth the sweet of 
a man s friend by hearti counsel 

27 10 thine own friend and thi father s friend forsak not neither 
go into thi brother s hou in the day of thi calam for better is 
a neighbour that is near than a brother far off 

27 11 my son be wise and make my heart glad that i may answer him 
that reproacheth me 

27 12 a prudent man foreseeth the evil and hideth himself but the 
simpl pa on and are punish 

27 13 take hi garment that is sureti for a stranger and take a 
pledg of him for a strang woman 

27 14 he that blesseth hi friend with a loud voic rise earli in 
the morn it shall be count a cur to him 

27 15 a continu drop in a veri raini day and a contenti woman 
are alik 

27 16 whosoev hideth her hideth the wind and the ointment of hi 
right hand which bewrayeth itself 

27 17 iron sharpeneth iron so a man sharpeneth the counten of hi 
friend 

27 18 whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof so he 
that waiteth on hi master shall be honour 

27 19 a in water face answereth to face so the heart of man to man 

27 20 hell and destruct are never full so the eye of man are 
never satisfi 

27 21 a the fine pot for silver and the furnac for gold so is a 
man to hi prai 

27 22 though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a 
pestl yet will not hi foolish depart from him 

27 23 be thou dilig to know the state of thi flock and look well 
to thi herd 

27 24 for rich are not for ever and doth the crown endur to everi 
gener 27 25 the hay appeareth and the tender grass sheweth 
itself and herb of the mountain are gather 

27 26 the lamb are for thi cloth and the goat are the price of 
the field 

27 27 and thou shalt have goat milk enough for thi food for the 
food of thi household and for the mainten for thi maiden 

28 1 the wick flee when no man pursueth but the righteou are bold 
a a lion 

28 2 for the transgress of a land mani are the princ thereof but 
by a man of understand and knowledg the state thereof shall be 
prolong 

28 3 a poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweep rain which 
leaveth no food 

28 4 they that forsak the law prai the wick but such a keep the 
law contend with them 

28 5 evil men understand not judgment but they that seek the lord 
understand all thing 

28 6 better is the poor that walketh in hi upright than he that 
is perver in hi way though he be rich 

28 7 whoso keepeth the law is a wise son but he that is a companion 
of riotou men shameth hi father 

28 8 he that by usuri and unjust gain increaseth hi substanc he 
shall gather it for him that will piti the poor 

28 9 he that turneth away hi ear from hear the law even hi 
prayer shall be abomin 

28 10 whoso causeth the righteou to go astray in an evil way he 
shall fall himself into hi own pit but the upright shall have good 
thing in poss 

28 11 the rich man is wise in hi own conceit but the poor that hath 
understand searcheth him out 

28 12 when righteou men do rejoic there is great glori but when 
the wick rise a man is hidden 

28 13 he that covereth hi sin shall not prosper but whoso 
confesseth and forsaketh them shall have merci 

28 14 happi is the man that feareth alway but he that hardeneth hi 
heart shall fall into mischief 

28 15 a a roar lion and a rang bear so is a wick ruler over 
the poor peopl 

28 16 the princ that wanteth understand is also a great oppressor 
but he that hateth covet shall prolong hi day 

28 17 a man that doeth violenc to the blood of ani person shall flee 
to the pit let no man stay him 

28 18 whoso walketh uprightli shall be save but he that is perver 
in hi way shall fall at onc 

28 19 he that tilleth hi land shall have plenti of bread but he that 
followeth after vain person shall have poverti enough 

28 20 a faith man shall abound with bless but he that maketh 
hast to be rich shall not be innoc 

28 21 to have respect of person is not good for for a piec of bread 
that man will transgress 

28 22 he that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye and considereth not 
that poverti shall come upon him 

28 23 he that rebuketh a man afterward shall find more favour than he 
that flattereth with the tongu 

28 24 whoso robbeth hi father or hi mother and saith it is no 
transgress the same is the companion of a destroy 

28 25 he that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife but he that 
putteth hi trust in the lord shall be made fat 

28 26 he that trusteth in hi own heart is a fool but whoso walketh 
wise he shall be deliv 

28 27 he that giveth unto the poor shall not lack but he that hideth 
hi eye shall have mani a cur 

28 28 when the wick rise men hide themselv but when they perish 
the righteou increa 

29 1 he that be often reprov hardeneth hi neck shall suddenli 
be destroy and that without remedi 

29 2 when the righteou are in author the peopl rejoic but when 
the wick beareth rule the peopl mourn 

29 3 whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth hi father but he that keepeth 
compani with harlot spendeth hi substanc 

29 4 the king by judgment establisheth the land but he that receiveth 
gift overthroweth it 

29 5 a man that flattereth hi neighbour spreadeth a net for hi foot 

29 6 in the transgress of an evil man there is a snare but the 
righteou doth sing and rejoic 

29 7 the righteou considereth the cau of the poor but the wick 
regardeth not to know it 

29 8 scorn men bring a citi into a snare but wise men turn away 
wrath 

29 9 if a wise man contendeth with a foolish man whether he rage or 
laugh there is no rest 

29 10 the bloodthirsti hate the upright but the just seek hi soul 

29 11 a fool uttereth all hi mind but a wise man keepeth it in till 
afterward 

29 12 if a ruler hearken to lie all hi servant are wick 

29 13 the poor and the deceit man meet togeth the lord 
lighteneth both their eye 

29 14 the king that faith judgeth the poor hi throne shall be 
establish for ever 

29 15 the rod and reproof give wisdom but a child left to himself 
bringeth hi mother to shame 

29 16 when the wick are multipli transgress increaseth but 
the righteou shall see their fall 

29 17 correct thi son and he shall give thee rest yea he shall give 
delight unto thi soul 

29 18 where there is no vision the peopl perish but he that keepeth 
the law happi is he 

29 19 a servant will not be correct by word for though he 
understand he will not answer 

29 20 seest thou a man that is hasti in hi word there is more hope 
of a fool than of him 

29 21 he that delic bringeth up hi servant from a child shall 
have him becom hi son at the length 

29 22 an angri man stirreth up strife and a furiou man aboundeth in 
transgress 

29 23 a man s pride shall bring him low but honour shall uphold the 
humbl in spirit 

29 24 whoso is partner with a thief hateth hi own soul he heareth 
cur and bewrayeth it not 

29 25 the fear of man bringeth a snare but whoso putteth hi trust in 
the lord shall be safe 

29 26 mani seek the ruler s favour but everi man s judgment cometh 
from the lord 

29 27 an unjust man is an abomin to the just and he that is 
upright in the way is abomin to the wick 

30 1 the word of agur the son of jakeh even the propheci the man 
spake unto ithiel even unto ithiel and ucal 30 2 sure i am more 
brutish than ani man and have not the understand of a man 

30 3 i neither learn wisdom nor have the knowledg of the holi 

30 4 who hath ascend up into heaven or descend who hath gather 
the wind in hi fist who hath bound the water in a garment who 
hath establish all the end of the earth what is hi name and what 
is hi son s name if thou canst tell 30 5 everi word of god is 
pure he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him 

30 6 add thou not unto hi word lest he reprov thee and thou be 
found a liar 

30 7 two thing have i requir of thee deni me them not befor i 
die 30 8 remov far from me vaniti and lie give me neither poverti 
nor rich feed me with food conveni for me 30 9 lest i be full 
and deni thee and say who is the lord or lest i be poor and steal 
and take the name of my god in vain 

30 10 accu not a servant unto hi master lest he cur thee and 
thou be found guilti 

30 11 there is a gener that curseth their father and doth not 
bless their mother 

30 12 there is a gener that are pure in their own eye and yet 
is not wash from their filthi 

30 13 there is a gener o how lofti are their eye and their 
eyelid are lift up 

30 14 there is a gener whose teeth are a sword and their jaw 
teeth a knife to devour the poor from off the earth and the needi 
from among men
