one of israel in the midst of thee 

13 1 the burden of babylon which isaiah the son of amoz did see 

13 2 lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain exalt the voic unto 
them shake the hand that they may go into the gate of the nobl 

13 3 i have command my sanctifi one i have also call my mighti 
one for mine anger even them that rejoic in my high 

13 4 the noi of a multitud in the mountain like a of a great 
peopl a tumultu noi of the kingdom of nation gather 
togeth the lord of host mustereth the host of the battl 

13 5 they come from a far countri from the end of heaven even the 
lord and the weapon of hi indign to destroy the whole land 

13 6 howl ye for the day of the lord is at hand it shall come a a 
destruct from the almighti 

13 7 therefor shall all hand be faint and everi man s heart shall 
melt 13 8 and they shall be afraid pang and sorrow shall take hold 
of them they shall be in pain a a woman that travaileth they shall 
be amaz one at anoth their face shall be a flame 

13 9 behold the day of the lord cometh cruel both with wrath and 
fierc anger to lay the land desol and he shall destroy the 
sinner thereof out of it 

13 10 for the star of heaven and the constel thereof shall not 
give their light the sun shall be darken in hi go forth and 
the moon shall not cau her light to shine 

13 11 and i will punish the world for their evil and the wick for 
their iniqu and i will cau the arrog of the proud to cea 
and will lay low the haughti of the terribl 

13 12 i will make a man more preciou than fine gold even a man than 
the golden wedg of ophir 

13 13 therefor i will shake the heaven and the earth shall remov 
out of her place in the wrath of the lord of host and in the day of 
hi fierc anger 

13 14 and it shall be a the chase roe and a a sheep that no man 
taketh up they shall everi man turn to hi own peopl and flee everi 
one into hi own land 

13 15 everi one that is found shall be thrust through and everi one 
that is join unto them shall fall by the sword 

13 16 their child also shall be dash to piec befor their eye 
their hou shall be spoil and their wife ravish 

13 17 behold i will stir up the mede against them which shall not 
regard silver and a for gold they shall not delight in it 

13 18 their bow also shall dash the young men to piec and they 
shall have no piti on the fruit of the womb their eye shall not 
spare child 

13 19 and babylon the glori of kingdom the beauti of the chald 
excel shall be a when god overthrew sodom and gomorrah 

13 20 it shall never be inhabit neither shall it be dwelt in from 
gener to gener neither shall the arabian pitch tent there 
neither shall the shepherd make their fold there 

13 21 but wild beast of the desert shall lie there and their hou 
shall be full of dole creatur and owl shall dwell there and 
satyr shall danc there 

13 22 and the wild beast of the island shall cri in their desol 
hou and dragon in their pleasant palac and her time is near to 
come and her day shall not be prolong 

14 1 for the lord will have merci on jacob and will yet choo 
israel and set them in their own land and the stranger shall be 
join with them and they shall cleav to the hou of jacob 

14 2 and the peopl shall take them and bring them to their place 
and the hou of israel shall po them in the land of the lord for 
servant and handmaid and they shall take them captiv whose 
captiv they were and they shall rule over their oppressor 

14 3 and it shall come to pa in the day that the lord shall give 
thee rest from thi sorrow and from thi fear and from the hard 
bondag wherein thou wast made to serv 14 4 that thou shalt take up 
thi proverb against the king of babylon and say how hath the 
oppressor cea the golden citi cea 14 5 the lord hath broken 
the staff of the wick and the sceptr of the ruler 

14 6 he who smote the peopl in wrath with a continu stroke he that 
rule the nation in anger is persecut and none hindereth 

14 7 the whole earth is at rest and is quiet they break forth into 
sing 

14 8 yea the fir tree rejoic at thee and the cedar of lebanon 
say sinc thou art laid down no feller is come up against u 

14 9 hell from beneath is move for thee to meet thee at thi come 
it stirreth up the dead for thee even all the chief one of the 
earth it hath rai up from their throne all the king of the 
nation 

14 10 all they shall speak and say unto thee art thou also becom 
weak a we art thou becom like unto u 14 11 thi pomp is brought 
down to the grave and the noi of thi viol the worm is spread 
under thee and the worm cover thee 

14 12 how art thou fallen from heaven o lucif son of the morn 
how art thou cut down to the ground which didst weaken the nation 
14 13 for thou hast said in thine heart i will ascend into heaven i 
will exalt my throne abov the star of god i will sit also upon the 
mount of the congreg in the side of the north 14 14 i will 
ascend abov the height of the cloud i will be like the most high 

14 15 yet thou shalt be brought down to hell to the side of the pit 

14 16 they that see thee shall narrowli look upon thee and consid 
thee say is thi the man that made the earth to trembl that did 
shake kingdom 14 17 that made the world a a wilder and 
destroy the citi thereof that open not the hou of hi 
prison 14 18 all the king of the nation even all of them lie 
in glori everi one in hi own hou 

14 19 but thou art cast out of thi grave like an abomin branch 
and a the raiment of those that are slain thrust through with a 
sword that go down to the stone of the pit a a carca trodden 
under foot 

14 20 thou shalt not be join with them in burial becau thou hast 
destroy thi land and slain thi peopl the seed of evildo shall 
never be renown 

14 21 prepar slaughter for hi child for the iniqu of their 
father that they do not rise nor po the land nor fill the 
face of the world with citi 

14 22 for i will rise up against them saith the lord of host and 
cut off from babylon the name and remnant and son and nephew saith 
the lord 

14 23 i will also make it a poss for the bittern and pool of 
water and i will sweep it with the besom of destruct saith the 
lord of host 

14 24 the lord of host hath sworn say sure a i have thought 
so shall it come to pa and a i have purpo so shall it stand 
14 25 that i will break the assyrian in my land and upon my mountain 
tread him under foot then shall hi yoke depart from off them and 
hi burden depart from off their shoulder 

14 26 thi is the purpo that is purpo upon the whole earth and 
thi is the hand that is stretch out upon all the nation 

14 27 for the lord of host hath purpo and who shall disannul it 
and hi hand is stretch out and who shall turn it back 14 28 in 
the year that king ahaz die wa thi burden 

14 29 rejoic not thou whole palestina becau the rod of him that 
smote thee is broken for out of the serpent s root shall come forth a 
cockatr and hi fruit shall be a fieri fli serpent 

14 30 and the firstborn of the poor shall feed and the needi shall 
lie down in safeti and i will kill thi root with famin and he shall 
slay thi remnant 

14 31 howl o gate cri o citi thou whole palestina art dissolv

15 1 the burden of moab becau in the night ar of moab is laid 
wast and brought to silenc becau in the night kir of moab is 
laid wast and brought to silenc 15 2 he is gone up to bajith and 
to dibon the high place to weep moab shall howl over nebo and 
over medeba on all their head shall be bald and everi beard cut 
off 

15 3 in their street they shall gird themselv with sackcloth on 
the top of their hou and in their street everi one shall howl 
weep abundantli 

15 4 and heshbon shall cri and elealeh their voic shall be heard 
even unto jahaz therefor the arm soldier of moab shall cri out 
hi life shall be grievou unto him 

15 5 my heart shall cri out for moab hi fugit shall flee unto 
zoar an heifer of three year old for by the mount up of luhith 
with weep shall they go it up for in the way of horonaim they 
shall rai up a cri of destruct 

15 6 for the water of nimrim shall be desol for the hay is 
wither away the grass faileth there is no green thing 

15 7 therefor the abund they have gotten and that which they 
have laid up shall they carri away to the brook of the willow 

15 8 for the cri is gone round about the border of moab the howl 
thereof unto eglaim and the howl thereof unto beerelim 

15 9 for the water of dimon shall be full of blood for i will bring 
more upon dimon lion upon him that escapeth of moab and upon the 
remnant of the land 

16 1 send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from sela to the 
wilder unto the mount of the daughter of zion 

16 2 for it shall be that a a wander bird cast out of the nest 
so the daughter of moab shall be at the ford of arnon 

16 3 take counsel execut judgment make thi shadow a the night in

wandereth 

16 4 let mine outcast dwell with thee moab be thou a covert to them 
from the face of the spoiler for the extort is at an end the

upon it in truth in the tabernacl of david judg and seek 
judgment and hast righteou

haughti and hi pride and hi wrath but hi lie shall not be

16 7 therefor shall moab howl for moab everi one shall howl for the 
foundat of kirhareseth shall ye mourn sure they are stricken 

16 8 for the field of heshbon languish and the vine of sibmah the 
lord of the heathen have broken down the princip plant thereof 
they are come even unto jazer they wander through the wilder 
her branch are stretch out they are gone over the sea 

16 9 therefor i will bewail with the weep of jazer the vine of 
sibmah i will water thee with my tear o heshbon and elealeh for 
the shout for thi summer fruit and for thi harvest is fallen 

16 10 and glad is taken away and joy out of the plenti field 
and in the vineyard there shall be no sing neither shall there be 
shout the treader shall tread out no wine in their press i 
have made their vintag shout to cea 

16 11 wherefor my bowel shall sound like an harp for moab and mine 
inward part for kirharesh 

16 12 and it shall come to pa when it is seen that moab is weari on 
the high place that he shall come to hi sanctuari to pray but he 
shall not prevail 

16 13 thi is the word that the lord hath spoken concern moab sinc 
that time 

16 14 but now the lord hath spoken say within three year a the 
year of an hirel and the glori of moab shall be contemn with 
all that great multitud and the remnant shall be veri small and 
feebl 

17 1 the burden of damascu behold damascu is taken away from be 
a citi and it shall be a ruinou heap 

17 2 the citi of aroer are forsaken they shall be for flock which 
shall lie down and none shall make them afraid 

17 3 the fortress also shall cea from ephraim and the kingdom from 
damascu and the remnant of syria they shall be a the glori of the 
child of israel saith the lord of host 

17 4 and in that day it shall come to pa that the glori of jacob 
shall be made thin and the fat of hi flesh shall wax lean 

17 5 and it shall be a when the harvestman gathereth the corn and 
reapeth the ear with hi arm and it shall be a he that gathereth 
ear in the valley of rephaim 

17 6 yet glean grape shall be left in it a the shake of an 
oliv tree two or three berri in the top of the uppermost bough 
four or five in the outmost fruit branch thereof saith the lord 
god of israel 

17 7 at that day shall a man look to hi maker and hi eye shall 
have respect to the holi one of israel 

17 8 and he shall not look to the altar the work of hi hand 
neither shall respect that which hi finger have made either the 
grove or the imag 

17 9 in that day shall hi strong citi be a a forsaken bough and 
an uppermost branch which they left becau of the child of 
israel and there shall be desol 

17 10 becau thou hast forgotten the god of thi salvat and hast 
not been mind of the rock of thi strength therefor shalt thou 
plant pleasant plant and shalt set it with strang slip 17 11 in 
the day shalt thou make thi plant to grow and in the morn shalt 
thou make thi seed to flourish but the harvest shall be a heap in the 
day of grief and of desper sorrow 

17 12 woe to the multitud of mani peopl which make a noi like the 
noi of the sea and to the rush of nation that make a rush 
like the rush of mighti water 17 13 the nation shall rush like 
the rush of mani water but god shall rebuk them and they shall 
flee far off and shall be chase a the chaff of the mountain befor 
the wind and like a roll thing befor the whirlwind 

17 14 and behold at eveningtid troubl and befor the morn he is 
not 

thi is the portion of them that spoil u and the lot of them that 
rob u 

18 1 woe to the land shadow with wing which is beyond the river 
of ethiopia 18 2 that sendeth ambassador by the sea even in vessel 
of bulrush upon the water say go ye swift messeng to a 
nation scatter and peel to a peopl terribl from their begin 
hitherto a nation mete out and trodden down whose land the river 
have spoil 18 3 all ye inhabit of the world and dweller on 
the earth see ye when he lifteth up an ensign on the mountain and 
when he bloweth a trumpet hear ye 

18 4 for so the lord said unto me i will take my rest and i will 
consid in my dwell place like a clear heat upon herb and like a 
cloud of dew in the heat of harvest 

18 5 for afor the harvest when the bud is perfect and the sour 
grape is ripen in the flower he shall both cut off the sprig with 
prune hook and take away and cut down the branch 

18 6 they shall be left togeth unto the fowl of the mountain and 
to the beast of the earth and the fowl shall summer upon them and 
all the beast of the earth shall winter upon them 

18 7 in that time shall the present be brought unto the lord of host 
of a peopl scatter and peel and from a peopl terribl from 
their begin hitherto a nation mete out and trodden under foot 
whose land the river have spoil to the place of the name of the 
lord of host the mount zion 

19 1 the burden of egypt behold the lord rideth upon a swift cloud 
and shall come into egypt and the idol of egypt shall be move at 
hi presenc and the heart of egypt shall melt in the midst of it 

19 2 and i will set the egyptian against the egyptian and they 
shall fight everi one against hi brother and everi one against hi 
neighbour citi against citi and kingdom against kingdom 

19 3 and the spirit of egypt shall fail in the midst thereof and i 
will destroy the counsel thereof and they shall seek to the idol 
and to the charmer and to them that have familiar spirit and to 
the wizard 

19 4 and the egyptian will i give over into the hand of a cruel lord 
and a fierc king shall rule over them saith the lord the lord of 
host 

19 5 and the water shall fail from the sea and the river shall be 
wast and dri up 

19 6 and they shall turn the river far away and the brook of 
defenc shall be empti and dri up the reed and flag shall 
wither 

19 7 the paper reed by the brook by the mouth of the brook and 
everi thing sown by the brook shall wither be driven away and be 
no more 

19 8 the fisher also shall mourn and all they that cast angl into 
the brook shall lament and they that spread net upon the water 
shall languish 

19 9 moreov they that work in fine flax and they that weav 
network shall be confound 

19 10 and they shall be broken in the purpo thereof all that make 
sluic and pond for fish 

19 11 sure the princ of zoan are fool the counsel of the wise 
counsellor of pharaoh is becom brutish how say ye unto pharaoh i 
am the son of the wise the son of ancient king 19 12 where are 
they where are thi wise men and let them tell thee now and let them 
know what the lord of host hath purpo upon egypt 

19 13 the princ of zoan are becom fool the princ of noph are 
deceiv they have also seduc egypt even they that are the stay of 
the tribe thereof 

19 14 the lord hath mingl a perver spirit in the midst thereof 
and they have cau egypt to err in everi work thereof a a drunken 
man staggereth in hi vomit 

19 15 neither shall there be ani work for egypt which the head or 
tail branch or rush may do 

19 16 in that day shall egypt be like unto woman and it shall be 
afraid and fear becau of the shake of the hand of the lord of 
host which he shaketh over it 

19 17 and the land of judah shall be a terror unto egypt everi one 
that maketh mention thereof shall be afraid in himself becau of the 
counsel of the lord of host which he hath determin against it 

19 18 in that day shall five citi in the land of egypt speak the 
languag of canaan and swear to the lord of host one shall be 
call the citi of destruct 

19 19 in that day shall there be an altar to the lord in the midst of 
the land of egypt and a pillar at the border thereof to the lord 

19 20 and it shall be for a sign and for a wit unto the lord of 
host in the land of egypt for they shall cri unto the lord becau 
of the oppressor and he shall send them a saviour and a great one 
and he shall deliv them 

19 21 and the lord shall be known to egypt and the egyptian shall 
know the lord in that day and shall do sacrif and oblat yea 
they shall vow a vow unto the lord and perform it 

19 22 and the lord shall smite egypt he shall smite and heal it and 
they shall return even to the lord and he shall be intreat of them 
and shall heal them 

19 23 in that day shall there be a highway out of egypt to assyria 
and the assyrian shall come into egypt and the egyptian into assyria 
and the egyptian shall serv with the assyrian 

19 24 in that day shall israel be the third with egypt and with 
assyria even a bless in the midst of the land 19 25 whom the lord 
of host shall bless say bless be egypt my peopl and assyria 
the work of my hand and israel mine inherit 

20 1 in the year that tartan came unto ashdod when sargon the king 
of assyria sent him and fought against ashdod and took it 20 2 at 
the same time spake the lord by isaiah the son of amoz say go and 
loo the sackcloth from off thi loin and put off thi shoe from thi 
foot and he did so walk nake and barefoot 

20 3 and the lord said like a my servant isaiah hath walk nake 
and barefoot three year for a sign and wonder upon egypt and upon 
ethiopia 20 4 so shall the king of assyria lead away the egyptian 
prison and the ethiopian captiv young and old nake and 
barefoot even with their buttock uncov to the shame of egypt 

20 5 and they shall be afraid and asham of ethiopia their 
expect and of egypt their glori 

20 6 and the inhabit of thi isl shall say in that day behold 
such is our expect whither we flee for help to be deliv from 
the king of assyria and how shall we escap 21 1 the burden of the 
desert of the sea a whirlwind in the south pa through so it 
cometh from the desert from a terribl land 

21 2 a grievou vision is declar unto me the treacher dealer 
dealeth treacher and the spoiler spoileth go up o elam 
besieg o medium all the sigh thereof have i made to cea 

21 3 therefor are my loin fill with pain pang have taken hold 
upon me a the pang of a woman that travaileth i wa bow down at 
the hear of it i wa dismay at the see of it 

21 4 my heart pant fear affright me the night of my 
pleasur hath he turn into fear unto me 

21 5 prepar the tabl watch in the watchtow eat drink ari ye 
princ and anoint the shield 

21 6 for thu hath the lord said unto me go set a watchman let him 
declar what he seeth 

21 7 and he saw a chariot with a coupl of horseman a chariot of 
as and a chariot of camel and he hearken dilig with much 
heed 21 8 and he cri a lion my lord i stand continu upon the 
watchtow in the daytim and i am set in my ward whole night 21 9 
and behold here cometh a chariot of men with a coupl of horseman 

and he answer and said babylon is fallen is fallen and all the 
graven imag of her god he hath broken unto the ground 

21 10 o my thresh and the corn of my floor that which i have 
heard of the lord of host the god of israel have i declar unto 
you 

21 11 the burden of dumah he calleth to me out of seir watchman 
what of the night watchman what of the night 21 12 the watchman 
said the morn cometh and also the night if ye will enquir 
enquir ye return come 

21 13 the burden upon arabia in the forest in arabia shall ye lodg 
o ye travel compani of dedanim 

21 14 the inhabit of the land of tema brought water to him that 
wa thirsti they prevent with their bread him that fled 

21 15 for they fled from the sword from the drawn sword and from 
the bent bow and from the grievou of war 

21 16 for thu hath the lord said unto me within a year accord to 
the year of an hirel and all the glori of kedar shall fail 21 17 
and the residu of the number of archer the mighti men of the 
child of kedar shall be diminish for the lord god of israel 
hath spoken it 

22 1 the burden of the valley of vision what aileth thee now that 
thou art wholli gone up to the housetop 22 2 thou that art full of 
stir a tumultu citi joyou citi thi slain men are not slain 
with the sword nor dead in battl 

22 3 all thi ruler are fled togeth they are bound by the archer 
all that are found in thee are bound togeth which have fled from 
far 

22 4 therefor said i look away from me i will weep bitterli labour 
not to comfort me becau of the spoil of the daughter of my 
peopl 

22 5 for it is a day of troubl and of tread down and of 
perplex by the lord god of host in the valley of vision break 
down the wall and of cri to the mountain 

22 6 and elam bare the quiver with chariot of men and horseman and 
kir uncov the shield 

22 7 and it shall come to pa that thi choicest valley shall be 
full of chariot and the horseman shall set themselv in array at 
the gate 

22 8 and he discov the cover of judah and thou didst look in 
that day to the armour of the hou of the forest 

22 9 ye have seen also the breach of the citi of david that they 
are mani and ye gather togeth the water of the lower pool 

22 10 and ye have number the hou of jerusalem and the hou 
have ye broken down to fortifi the wall 

22 11 ye made also a ditch between the two wall for the water of the 
old pool but ye have not look unto the maker thereof neither had 
respect unto him that fashion it long ago 

22 12 and in that day did the lord god of host call to weep and 
to mourn and to bald and to gird with sackcloth 22 13 and 
behold joy and glad slay ox and kill sheep eat 
flesh and drink wine let u eat and drink for to morrow we shall 
die 

22 14 and it wa reveal in mine ear by the lord of host sure 
thi iniqu shall not be purg from you till ye die saith the lord 
god of host 

22 15 thu saith the lord god of host go get thee unto thi 
treasur even unto shebna which is over the hou and say 22 16 
what hast thou here and whom hast thou here that thou hast hew 
thee out a sepulchr here a he that heweth him out a sepulchr on 
high and that graveth an habit for himself in a rock 22 17 
behold the lord will carri thee away with a mighti captiv and 
will sure cover thee 

22 18 he will sure violent turn and toss thee like a ball into a 
larg countri there shalt thou die and there the chariot of thi 
glori shall be the shame of thi lord s hou 

22 19 and i will drive thee from thi station and from thi state shall 
he pull thee down 

22 20 and it shall come to pa in that day that i will call my 
servant eliakim the son of hilkiah 22 21 and i will cloth him with 
thi robe and strengthen him with thi girdl and i will commit thi 
govern into hi hand and he shall be a father to the inhabit 
of jerusalem and to the hou of judah 

22 22 and the key of the hou of david will i lay upon hi shoulder 
so he shall open and none shall shut and he shall shut and none 
shall open 

22 23 and i will fasten him a a nail in a sure place and he shall be 
for a gloriou throne to hi father s hou 

22 24 and they shall hang upon him all the glori of hi father s 
hou the offspr and the issu all vessel of small quantiti 
from the vessel of cup even to all the vessel of flagon 

22 25 in that day saith the lord of host shall the nail that is 
fasten in the sure place be remov and be cut down and fall and 
the burden that wa upon it shall be cut off for the lord hath spoken 
it 

23 1 the burden of tyre howl ye ship of tarshish for it is laid 
wast so that there is no hou no enter in from the land of 
chittim it is reveal to them 

23 2 be still ye inhabit of the isl thou whom the merchant of 
zidon that pa over the sea have replenish 

23 3 and by great water the seed of sihor the harvest of the river 
is her revenu and she is a mart of nation 

23 4 be thou asham o zidon for the sea hath spoken even the 
strength of the sea say i travail not nor bring forth child 
neither do i nourish up young men nor bring up virgin 

23 5 a at the report concern egypt so shall they be sore pain 
at the report of tyre 

23 6 pa ye over to tarshish howl ye inhabit of the isl 

23 7 is thi your joyou citi whose antiqu is of ancient day her 
own foot shall carri her afar off to sojourn 

23 8 who hath taken thi counsel against tyre the crown citi 
whose merchant are princ whose traffick are the honour of 
the earth 23 9 the lord of host hath purpo it to stain the 
pride of all glori and to bring into contempt all the honour of 
the earth 

23 10 pa through thi land a a river o daughter of tarshish there 
is no more strength 

23 11 he stretch out hi hand over the sea he shook the kingdom 
the lord hath given a command against the merchant citi to 
destroy the strong hold thereof 

23 12 and he said thou shalt no more rejoic o thou oppress 
virgin daughter of zidon ari pa over to chittim there also 
shalt thou have no rest 

23 13 behold the land of the chaldean thi peopl wa not till the 
assyrian found it for them that dwell in the wilder they set up 
the tower thereof they rai up the palac thereof and he brought 
it to ruin 

23 14 howl ye ship of tarshish for your strength is laid wast 

23 15 and it shall come to pa in that day that tyre shall be 
forgotten seventi year accord to the day of one king after the 
end of seventi year shall tyre sing a an harlot 

23 16 take an harp go about the citi thou harlot that hast been 
forgotten make sweet melodi sing mani song that thou mayest be 
rememb 

23 17 and it shall come to pa after the end of seventi year that 
the lord will visit tyre and she shall turn to her hire and shall 
commit fornic with all the kingdom of the world upon the face of 
the earth 

23 18 and her merchandi and her hire shall be holi to the lord 
it shall not be treasur nor laid up for her merchandi shall be 
for them that dwell befor the lord to eat suffici and for 
durabl cloth 

24 1 behold the lord maketh the earth empti and maketh it wast and 
turneth it upsid down and scattereth abroad the inhabit thereof 

24 2 and it shall be a with the peopl so with the priest a with 
the servant so with hi master a with the maid so with her 
mistress a with the buyer so with the seller a with the lender 
so with the borrow a with the taker of usuri so with the giver of 
usuri to him 

24 3 the land shall be utterli empti and utterli spoil for the 
lord hath spoken thi word 

24 4 the earth mourneth and fadeth away the world languisheth and 
fadeth away the haughti peopl of the earth do languish 

24 5 the earth also is defil under the inhabit thereof becau 
they have transgress the law chang the ordin broken the 
everlast coven 

24 6 therefor hath the cur devour the earth and they that dwell 
therein are desol therefor the inhabit of the earth are 
burn and few men left 

24 7 the new wine mourneth the vine languisheth all the merryheart 
do sigh 

24 8 the mirth of tabret ceaseth the noi of them that rejoic 
endeth the joy of the harp ceaseth 

24 9 they shall not drink wine with a song strong drink shall be 
bitter to them that drink it 

24 10 the citi of confu is broken down everi hou is shut up 
that no man may come in 

24 11 there is a cri for wine in the street all joy is darken 
the mirth of the land is gone 

24 12 in the citi is left desol and the gate is smitten with 
destruct 

24 13 when thu it shall be in the midst of the land among the peopl 
there shall be a the shake of an oliv tree and a the glean 
grape when the vintag is done 

24 14 they shall lift up their voic they shall sing for the majesti 
of the lord they shall cri aloud from the sea 

24 15 wherefor glorifi ye the lord in the fire even the name of the 
lord god of israel in the isl of the sea 

24 16 from the uttermost part of the earth have we heard song even 
glori to the righteou but i said my lean my lean woe unto 
me the treacher dealer have dealt treacher yea the 
treacher dealer have dealt veri treacher 

24 17 fear and the pit and the snare are upon thee o inhabit of 
the earth 

24 18 and it shall come to pa that he who fleeth from the noi of 
the fear shall fall into the pit and he that cometh up out of the 
midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare for the window from on 
high are open and the foundat of the earth do shake 

24 19 the earth is utterli broken down the earth is clean dissolv 
the earth is move exceedingli 

24 20 the earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard and shall be 
remov like a cottag and the transgress thereof shall be heavi 
upon it and it shall fall and not rise again 

24 21 and it shall come to pa in that day that the lord shall 
punish the host of the high one that are on high and the king of 
the earth upon the earth 

24 22 and they shall be gather togeth a prison are gather 
in the pit and shall be shut up in the prison and after mani day 
shall they be visit 

24 23 then the moon shall be confound and the sun asham when the 
lord of host shall reign in mount zion and in jerusalem and befor 
hi ancient gloriou 

25 1 o lord thou art my god i will exalt thee i will prai thi 
name for thou hast done wonder thing thi counsel of old are 
faith and truth 

25 2 for thou hast made of a citi an heap of a defenc citi a ruin 
a palac of stranger to be no citi it shall never be built 

25 3 therefor shall the strong peopl glorifi thee the citi of the 
terribl nation shall fear thee 

25 4 for thou hast been a strength to the poor a strength to the 
needi in hi distress a refug from the storm a shadow from the 
heat when the blast of the terribl one is a a storm against the 
wall 

25 5 thou shalt bring down the noi of stranger a the heat in a 
dri place even the heat with the shadow of a cloud the branch of the 
terribl one shall be brought low 

25 6 and in thi mountain shall the lord of host make unto all peopl 
a feast of fat thing a feast of wine on the lee of fat thing 
full of marrow of wine on the lee well refin 

25 7 and he will destroy in thi mountain the face of the cover 
cast over all peopl and the vail that is spread over all nation 

25 8 he will swallow up death in victori and the lord god will wipe 
away tear from off all face and the rebuk of hi peopl shall he 
take away from off all the earth for the lord hath spoken it 

25 9 and it shall be said in that day lo thi is our god we have 
wait for him and he will save u thi is the lord we have wait 
for him we will be glad and rejoic in hi salvat 

25 10 for in thi mountain shall the hand of the lord rest and moab 
shall be trodden down under him even a straw is trodden down for the 
dunghil 

25 11 and he shall spread forth hi hand in the midst of them a he 
that swimmeth spreadeth forth hi hand to swim and he shall bring 
down their pride togeth with the spoil of their hand 

25 12 and the fortress of the high fort of thi wall shall he bring 
down lay low and bring to the ground even to the dust 

26 1 in that day shall thi song be sung in the land of judah we have 
a strong citi salvat will god appoint for wall and bulwark 

26 2 open ye the gate that the righteou nation which keepeth the 
truth may enter in 

26 3 thou wilt keep him in perfect peac whose mind is stay on 
thee becau he trusteth in thee 

26 4 trust ye in the lord for ever for in the lord jehovah is 
everlast strength 26 5 for he bringeth down them that dwell on 
high the lofti citi he layeth it low he layeth it low even to the 
ground he bringeth it even to the dust 

26 6 the foot shall tread it down even the foot of the poor and the 
step of the needi 

26 7 the way of the just is upright thou most upright dost 
weigh the path of the just 

26 8 yea in the way of thi judgment o lord have we wait for 
thee the desir of our soul is to thi name and to the remembr of 
thee 

26 9 with my soul have i desir thee in the night yea with my 
spirit within me will i seek thee earli for when thi judgment are in 
the earth the inhabit of the world will learn righteou 

26 10 let favour be shew to the wick yet will he not learn 
righteou in the land of upright will he deal unjustli and 
will not behold the majesti of the lord 

26 11 lord when thi hand is lift up they will not see but they 
shall see and be asham for their envi at the peopl yea the fire 
of thine enemi shall devour them 

26 12 lord thou wilt ordain peac for u for thou also hast wrought 
all our work in u 

26 13 o lord our god other lord besid thee have had dominion over 
u but by thee onli will we make mention of thi name 

26 14 they are dead they shall not live they are decea they 
shall not rise therefor hast thou visit and destroy them and 
made all their memori to perish 

26 15 thou hast increa the nation o lord thou hast increa the 
nation thou art glorifi thou hadst remov it far unto all the 
end of the earth 

26 16 lord in troubl have they visit thee they pour out a 
prayer when thi chasten wa upon them 

26 17 like a a woman with child that draweth near the time of her 
deliveri is in pain and crieth out in her pang so have we been in 
thi sight o lord 

26 18 we have been with child we have been in pain we have a it 
were brought forth wind we have not wrought ani deliv in the 
earth neither have the inhabit of the world fallen 

26 19 thi dead men shall live togeth with my dead bodi shall they 
ari awak and sing ye that dwell in dust for thi dew is a the 
dew of herb and the earth shall cast out the dead 

26 20 come my peopl enter thou into thi chamber and shut thi 
door about thee hide thyself a it were for a littl moment until 
the indign be overpast 

26 21 for behold the lord cometh out of hi place to punish the 
inhabit of the earth for their iniqu the earth also shall 
disclo her blood and shall no more cover her slain 

27 1 in that day the lord with hi sore and great and strong sword 
shall punish leviathan the pierc serpent even leviathan that 
crook serpent and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea 

27 2 in that day sing ye unto her a vineyard of red wine 

27 3 i the lord do keep it i will water it everi moment lest ani 
hurt it i will keep it night and day 

27 4 furi is not in me who would set the brier and thorn against me 
in battl i would go through them i would burn them togeth 

27 5 or let him take hold of my strength that he may make peac with 
me and he shall make peac with me 

27 6 he shall cau them that come of jacob to take root israel shall 
blossom and bud and fill the face of the world with fruit 

27 7 hath he smitten him a he smote those that smote him or is he 
slain accord to the slaughter of them that are slain by him 27 8 
in measur when it shooteth forth thou wilt debat with it he 
stayeth hi rough wind in the day of the east wind 

27 9 by thi therefor shall the iniqu of jacob be purg and thi 
is all the fruit to take away hi sin when he maketh all the stone 
of the altar a chalkston that are beaten in sunder the grove and 
imag shall not stand up 

27 10 yet the defenc citi shall be desol and the habit 
forsaken and left like a wilder there shall the calf feed and 
there shall he lie down and consum the branch thereof 

27 11 when the bough thereof are wither they shall be broken off 
the woman come and set them on fire for it is a peopl of no 
understand therefor he that made them will not have merci on 
them and he that form them will shew them no favour 

27 12 and it shall come to pa in that day that the lord shall beat 
off from the channel of the river unto the stream of egypt and ye 
shall be gather one by one o ye child of israel 

27 13 and it shall come to pa in that day that the great trumpet 
shall be blown and they shall come which were readi to perish in the 
land of assyria and the outcast in the land of egypt and shall 
worship the lord in the holi mount at jerusalem 

28 1 woe to the crown of pride to the drunkard of ephraim whose 
gloriou beauti is a fade flower which are on the head of the fat 
valley of them that are overcom with wine 28 2 behold the lord 
hath a mighti and strong one which a a tempest of hail and a 
destroy storm a a flood of mighti water overflow shall cast 
down to the earth with the hand 

28 3 the crown of pride the drunkard of ephraim shall be trodden 
under foot 28 4 and the gloriou beauti which is on the head of the 
fat valley shall be a fade flower and a the hasti fruit befor 
the summer which when he that looketh upon it seeth while it is yet 
in hi hand he eateth it up 

28 5 in that day shall the lord of host be for a crown of glori and 
for a diadem of beauti unto the residu of hi peopl 28 6 and for a 
spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment and for strength 
to them that turn the battl to the gate 

28 7 but they also have er through wine and through strong drink 
are out of the way the priest and the prophet have er through 
strong drink they are swallow up of wine they are out of the way 
through strong drink they err in vision they stumbl in judgment 

28 8 for all tabl are full of vomit and filthi so that there is 
no place clean 

28 9 whom shall he teach knowledg and whom shall he make to 
understand doctrin them that are wean from the milk and drawn 
from the breast 

28 10 for precept must be upon precept precept upon precept line 
upon line line upon line here a littl and there a littl 28 11 
for with stammer lip and anoth tongu will he speak to thi 
peopl 

28 12 to whom he said thi is the rest wherewith ye may cau the 
weari to rest and thi is the refresh yet they would not hear 

28 13 but the word of the lord wa unto them precept upon precept 
precept upon precept line upon line line upon line here a littl 
and there a littl that they might go and fall backward and be 
broken and snare and taken 

28 14 wherefor hear the word of the lord ye scorn men that rule 
thi peopl which is in jerusalem 

28 15 becau ye have said we have made a coven with death and 
with hell are we at agreement when the overflow scourg shall pa 
through it shall not come unto u for we have made lie our refug 
and under falsehood have we hid ourselv 28 16 therefor thu saith 
the lord god behold i lay in zion for a foundat a stone a tri 
stone a preciou corner stone a sure foundat he that believeth 
shall not make hast 

28 17 judgment also will i lay to the line and righteou to the 
plummet and the hail shall sweep away the refug of lie and the 
water shall overflow the hide place 

28 18 and your coven with death shall be disannul and your 
agreement with hell shall not stand when the overflow scourg 
shall pa through then ye shall be trodden down by it 

28 19 from the time that it goeth forth it shall take you for morn 
by morn shall it pa over by day and by night and it shall be a 
vexat onli to understand the report 

28 20 for the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on 
it and the cover narrow than that he can wrap himself in it 

28 21 for the lord shall rise up a in mount perazim he shall be 
wroth a in the valley of gibeon that he may do hi work hi strang 
work and bring to pa hi act hi strang act 

28 22 now therefor be ye not mocker lest your band be made strong 
for i have heard from the lord god of host a consumpt even 
determin upon the whole earth 

28 23 give ye ear and hear my voic hearken and hear my speech 

28 24 doth the plowman plow all day to sow doth he open and break the 
clod of hi ground 28 25 when he hath made plain the face thereof 
doth he not cast abroad the fitch and scatter the cummin and cast 
in the princip wheat and the appoint barley and the rie in their 
place 28 26 for hi god doth instruct him to discret and doth 
teach him 

28 27 for the fitch are not thresh with a thresh instrument 
neither is a cart wheel turn about upon the cummin but the fitch 
are beaten out with a staff and the cummin with a rod 

28 28 bread corn is brui becau he will not ever be thresh it 
nor break it with the wheel of hi cart nor brui it with hi 
horseman 

28 29 thi also cometh forth from the lord of host which is 
wonder in counsel and excel in work 

29 1 woe to ariel to ariel the citi where david dwelt add ye year 
to year let them kill sacrif 

29 2 yet i will distress ariel and there shall be heavi and 
sorrow and it shall be unto me a ariel 

29 3 and i will camp against thee round about and will lay sieg 
against thee with a mount and i will rai fort against thee 

29 4 and thou shalt be brought down and shalt speak out of the 
ground and thi speech shall be low out of the dust and thi voic 
shall be a of one that hath a familiar spirit out of the ground 
and thi speech shall whisper out of the dust 

29 5 moreov the multitud of thi stranger shall be like small dust 
and the multitud of the terribl one shall be a chaff that passeth 
away yea it shall be at an instant suddenli 

29 6 thou shalt be visit of the lord of host with thunder and with 
earthquak and great noi with storm and tempest and the flame of 
devour fire 

29 7 and the multitud of all the nation that fight against ariel 
even all that fight against her and her munit and that distress 
her shall be a a dream of a night vision 

29 8 it shall even be a when an hungri man dreameth and behold he 
eateth but he awaketh and hi soul is empti or a when a thirsti 
man dreameth and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold 
he is faint and hi soul hath appetit so shall the multitud of all 
the nation be that fight against mount zion 

29 9 stay yourselv and wonder cri ye out and cri they are 
drunken but not with wine they stagger but not with strong drink 

29 10 for the lord hath pour out upon you the spirit of deep sleep 
and hath close your eye the prophet and your ruler the seer 
hath he cover 

29 11 and the vision of all is becom unto you a the word of a book 
that is seal which men deliv to one that is learn say read 
thi i pray thee and he saith i cannot for it is seal 29 12 and 
the book is deliv to him that is not learn say read thi i 
pray thee and he saith i am not learn 

29 13 wherefor the lord said forasmuch a thi peopl draw near me 
with their mouth and with their lip do honour me but have remov 
their heart far from me and their fear toward me is taught by the 
precept of men 29 14 therefor behold i will proceed to do a 
marvel work among thi peopl even a marvel work and a 
wonder for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish and the 
understand of their prudent men shall be hid 

29 15 woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the 
lord and their work are in the dark and they say who seeth u and 
who knoweth u 29 16 sure your turn of thing upsid down shall 
be esteem a the potter s clay for shall the work say of him that 
made it he made me not or shall the thing frame say of him that 
frame it he had no understand 29 17 is it not yet a veri littl 
while and lebanon shall be turn into a fruit field and the 
fruit field shall be esteem a a forest 29 18 and in that day 
shall the deaf hear the word of the book and the eye of the blind 
shall see out of obscur and out of dark 

29 19 the meek also shall increa their joy in the lord and the poor 
among men shall rejoic in the holi one of israel 

29 20 for the terribl one is brought to nought and the scorner is 
consum and all that watch for iniqu are cut off 29 21 that make 
a man an offend for a word and lay a snare for him that reproveth 
in the gate and turn asid the just for a thing of nought 

29 22 therefor thu saith the lord who redeem abraham concern 
the hou of jacob jacob shall not now be asham neither shall hi 
face now wax pale 

29 23 but when he seeth hi child the work of mine hand in the 
midst of him they shall sanctifi my name and sanctifi the holi one 
of jacob and shall fear the god of israel 

29 24 they also that er in spirit shall come to understand and 
they that murmur shall learn doctrin 

30 1 woe to the rebelli child saith the lord that take 
counsel but not of me and that cover with a cover but not of my 
spirit that they may add sin to sin 30 2 that walk to go down into 
egypt and have not ask at my mouth to strengthen themselv in the 
strength of pharaoh and to trust in the shadow of egypt 30 3 
therefor shall the strength of pharaoh be your shame and the trust 
in the shadow of egypt your confu 

30 4 for hi princ were at zoan and hi ambassador came to hane 

30 5 they were all asham of a peopl that could not profit them nor 
be an help nor profit but a shame and also a reproach 

30 6 the burden of the beast of the south into the land of troubl 
and anguish from whenc come the young and old lion the viper and 
fieri fli serpent they will carri their rich upon the shoulder 
of young as and their treasur upon the bunch of camel to a 
peopl that shall not profit them 

30 7 for the egyptian shall help in vain and to no purpo 
therefor have i cri concern thi their strength is to sit 
still 

30 8 now go write it befor them in a tabl and note it in a book 
that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever 30 9 that thi 
is a rebelli peopl lie child child that will not hear 
the law of the lord 30 10 which say to the seer see not and to the 
prophet prophesi not unto u right thing speak unto u smooth 
thing prophesi deceit 30 11 get you out of the way turn asid out 
of the path cau the holi one of israel to cea from befor u 

30 12 wherefor thu saith the holi one of israel becau ye despi 
thi word and trust in oppress and perver and stay thereon 
30 13 therefor thi iniqu shall be to you a a breach readi to 
fall swell out in a high wall whose break cometh suddenli at 
an instant 

30 14 and he shall break it a the break of the potter vessel 
that is broken in piec he shall not spare so that there shall not 
be found in the burst of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth 
or to take water withal out of the pit 

30 15 for thu saith the lord god the holi one of israel in 
return and rest shall ye be save in quiet and in confid 
shall be your strength and ye would not 

30 16 but ye said no for we will flee upon hor therefor shall 
ye flee and we will ride upon the swift therefor shall they that 
pursu you be swift 

30 17 one thousand shall flee at the rebuk of one at the rebuk of 
five shall ye flee till ye be left a a beacon upon the top of a 
mountain and a an ensign on an hill 

30 18 and therefor will the lord wait that he may be graciou unto 
you and therefor will he be exalt that he may have merci upon 
you for the lord is a god of judgment bless are all they that wait 
for him 

30 19 for the peopl shall dwell in zion at jerusalem thou shalt weep 
no more he will be veri graciou unto thee at the voic of thi cri 
when he shall hear it he will answer thee 

30 20 and though the lord give you the bread of adver and the 
water of afflict yet shall not thi teacher be remov into a 
corner ani more but thine eye shall see thi teacher 30 21 and 
thine ear shall hear a word behind thee say thi is the way 
walk ye in it when ye turn to the right hand and when ye turn to the 
left 

30 22 ye shall defil also the cover of thi graven imag of 
silver and the ornament of thi molten imag of gold thou shalt cast 
them away a a menstruou cloth thou shalt say unto it get thee 
henc 

30 23 then shall he give the rain of thi seed that thou shalt sow the 
ground withal and bread of the increa of the earth and it shall be 
fat and plenteou in that day shall thi cattl feed in larg 
pastur 

30 24 the ox likewi and the young as that ear the ground shall 
eat clean provend which hath been winnow with the shovel and with 
the fan 

30 25 and there shall be upon everi high mountain and upon everi high 
hill river and stream of water in the day of the great slaughter 
when the tower fall 

30 26 moreov the light of the moon shall be a the light of the sun 
and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold a the light of seven 
day in the day that the lord bindeth up the breach of hi peopl 
and healeth the stroke of their wound 

30 27 behold the name of the lord cometh from far burn with hi 
anger and the burden thereof is heavi hi lip are full of 
indign and hi tongu a a devour fire 30 28 and hi breath 
a an overflow stream shall reach to the midst of the neck to 
sift the nation with the siev of vaniti and there shall be a bridl 
in the jaw of the peopl cau them to err 

30 29 ye shall have a song a in the night when a holi solemn is 
kept and glad of heart a when one goeth with a pipe to come 
into the mountain of the lord to the mighti one of israel 

30 30 and the lord shall cau hi gloriou voic to be heard and 
shall shew the light down of hi arm with the indign of hi 
anger and with the flame of a devour fire with scatter and 
tempest and hailston 

30 31 for through the voic of the lord shall the assyrian be beaten 
down which smote with a rod 

30 32 and in everi place where the ground staff shall pa which 
the lord shall lay upon him it shall be with tabret and harp and 
in battl of shake will he fight with it 

30 33 for tophet is ordain of old yea for the king it is prepar 
he hath made it deep and larg the pile thereof is fire and much 
wood the breath of the lord like a stream of brimston doth kindl 
it 

31 1 woe to them that go down to egypt for help and stay on hor 
and trust in chariot becau they are mani and in horseman becau 
they are veri strong but they look not unto the holi one of israel 
neither seek the lord 31 2 yet he also is wise and will bring evil 
and will not call back hi word but will ari against the hou of 
the evildo and against the help of them that work iniqu 

31 3 now the egyptian are men and not god and their hor flesh 
and not spirit when the lord shall stretch out hi hand both he that 
helpeth shall fall and he that is holpen shall fall down and they 
all shall fail togeth 

31 4 for thu hath the lord spoken unto me like a the lion and the 
young lion roar on hi prey when a multitud of shepherd is 
call forth against him he will not be afraid of their voic nor 
aba himself for the noi of them so shall the lord of host come 
down to fight for mount zion and for the hill thereof 

31 5 a bird fli so will the lord of host defend jerusalem 
defend also he will deliv it and pa over he will preserv 
it 

31 6 turn ye unto him from whom the child of israel have deepli 
revolt 

31 7 for in that day everi man shall cast away hi idol of silver 
and hi idol of gold which your own hand have made unto you for a 
sin 

31 8 then shall the assyrian fall with the sword not of a mighti man 
and the sword not of a mean man shall devour him but he shall flee 
from the sword and hi young men shall be discomfit 

31 9 and he shall pa over to hi strong hold for fear and hi 
princ shall be afraid of the ensign saith the lord whose fire is 
in zion and hi furnac in jerusalem 

32 1 behold a king shall reign in righteou and princ shall 
rule in judgment 

32 2 and a man shall be a an hide place from the wind and a covert 
from the tempest a river of water in a dri place a the shadow of 
a great rock in a weari land 

32 3 and the eye of them that see shall not be dim and the ear of 
them that hear shall hearken 

32 4 the heart also of the rash shall understand knowledg and the 
tongu of the stammer shall be readi to speak plainli 

32 5 the vile person shall be no more call liber nor the churl 
said to be bounti 

32 6 for the vile person will speak villani and hi heart will work 
iniqu to practi hypocrisi and to utter error against the lord 
to make empti the soul of the hungri and he will cau the drink of 
the thirsti to fail 

32 7 the instrument also of the churl are evil he deviseth wick 
devic to destroy the poor with lie word even when the needi 
speaketh right 

32 8 but the liber deviseth liber thing and by liber thing 
shall he stand 

32 9 rise up ye woman that are at ea hear my voic ye careless 
daughter give ear unto my speech 

32 10 mani day and year shall ye be troubl ye careless woman for 
the vintag shall fail the gather shall not come 

32 11 trembl ye woman that are at ea be troubl ye careless 
one strip you and make you bare and gird sackcloth upon your 
loin 

32 12 they shall lament for the teat for the pleasant field for 
the fruit vine 

32 13 upon the land of my peopl shall come up thorn and brier yea 
upon all the hou of joy in the joyou citi 32 14 becau the 
palac shall be forsaken the multitud of the citi shall be left 
the fort and tower shall be for den for ever a joy of wild as 
a pastur of flock 32 15 until the spirit be pour upon u from on 
high and the wilder be a fruit field and the fruit field 
be count for a forest 

32 16 then judgment shall dwell in the wilder and righteou 
remain in the fruit field 

32 17 and the work of righteou shall be peac and the effect of 
righteou quiet and assur for ever 

32 18 and my peopl shall dwell in a peaceabl habit and in sure 
dwell and in quiet rest place 32 19 when it shall hail 
come down on the forest and the citi shall be low in a low place 

32 20 bless are ye that sow besid all water that send forth 
thither the foot of the ox and the a 

33 1 woe to thee that spoilest and thou wast not spoil and dealest 
treacher and they dealt not treacher with thee when thou 
shalt cea to spoil thou shalt be spoil and when thou shalt make 
an end to deal treacher they shall deal treacher with thee 

33 2 o lord be graciou unto u we have wait for thee be thou 
their arm everi morn our salvat also in the time of troubl 

33 3 at the noi of the tumult the peopl fled at the lift up of 
thyself the nation were scatter 

33 4 and your spoil shall be gather like the gather of the 
caterpil a the run to and fro of locust shall he run upon 
them 

33 5 the lord is exalt for he dwelleth on high he hath fill zion 
with judgment and righteou 

33 6 and wisdom and knowledg shall be the stabil of thi time and 
strength of salvat the fear of the lord is hi treasur 

33 7 behold their valiant one shall cri without the ambassador of 
peac shall weep bitterli 

33 8 the highway lie wast the wayfar man ceaseth he hath broken 
the coven he hath despi the citi he regardeth no man 

33 9 the earth mourneth and languisheth lebanon is asham and hewn 
down sharon is like a wilder and bashan and carmel shake off 
their fruit 

33 10 now will i rise saith the lord now will i be exalt now will 
i lift up myself 

33 11 ye shall conceiv chaff ye shall bring forth stubbl your 
breath a fire shall devour you 

33 12 and the peopl shall be a the burn of lime a thorn cut 
up shall they be burn in the fire 

33 13 hear ye that are far off what i have done and ye that are 
near acknowledg my might 

33 14 the sinner in zion are afraid fear hath surpri the 
hypocrit who among u shall dwell with the devour fire who 
among u shall dwell with everlast burn 33 15 he that walketh 
righteou and speaketh uprightli he that despiseth the gain of 
oppress that shaketh hi hand from hold of bribe that 
stoppeth hi ear from hear of blood and shutteth hi eye from 
see evil 33 16 he shall dwell on high hi place of defenc shall 
be the munit of rock bread shall be given him hi water shall 
be sure 

33 17 thine eye shall see the king in hi beauti they shall behold 
the land that is veri far off 

33 18 thine heart shall medit terror where is the scribe where is 
the receiv where is he that count the tower 33 19 thou shalt 
not see a fierc peopl a peopl of a deeper speech than thou canst 
perceiv of a stammer tongu that thou canst not understand 

33 20 look upon zion the citi of our solemn thine eye shall 
see jerusalem a quiet habit a tabernacl that shall not be taken 
down not one of the stake thereof shall ever be remov neither 
shall ani of the cord thereof be broken 

33 21 but there the gloriou lord will be unto u a place of broad 
river and stream wherein shall go no galley with oar neither 
shall gallant ship pa therebi 

33 22 for the lord is our judg the lord is our lawgiv the lord is 
our king he will save u 

33 23 thi tackl are loo they could not well strengthen their 
mast they could not spread the sail then is the prey of a great 
spoil divid the lame take the prey 

33 24 and the inhabit shall not say i am sick the peopl that 
dwell therein shall be forgiven their iniqu 

34 1 come near ye nation to hear and hearken ye peopl let the 
earth hear and all that is therein the world and all thing that 
come forth of it 

34 2 for the indign of the lord is upon all nation and hi furi 
upon all their armi he hath utterli destroy them he hath 
deliv them to the slaughter 

34 3 their slain also shall be cast out and their stink shall come up 
out of their carca and the mountain shall be melt with their 
blood 

34 4 and all the host of heaven shall be dissolv and the heaven 
shall be roll togeth a a scroll and all their host shall fall 
down a the leaf falleth off from the vine and a a fall fig from 
the fig tree 

34 5 for my sword shall be bath in heaven behold it shall come 
down upon idumea and upon the peopl of my cur to judgment 

34 6 the sword of the lord is fill with blood it is made fat with 
fat and with the blood of lamb and goat with the fat of the 
kidney of ram for the lord hath a sacrif in bozrah and a great 
slaughter in the land of idumea 

34 7 and the unicorn shall come down with them and the bullock with 
the bull and their land shall be soak with blood and their dust 
made fat with fat 

34 8 for it is the day of the lord s vengeanc and the year of 
recomp for the controversi of zion 

34 9 and the stream thereof shall be turn into pitch and the dust 
thereof into brimston and the land thereof shall becom burn 
pitch 

34 10 it shall not be quench night nor day the smoke thereof shall 
go up for ever from gener to gener it shall lie wast none 
shall pa through it for ever and ever 

34 11 but the cormor and the bittern shall po it the owl also 
and the raven shall dwell in it and he shall stretch out upon it the 
line of confu and the stone of empti 

34 12 they shall call the nobl thereof to the kingdom but none 
shall be there and all her princ shall be noth 

34 13 and thorn shall come up in her palac nettl and brambl in 
the fortress thereof and it shall be an habit of dragon and 
a court for owl 

34 14 the wild beast of the desert shall also meet with the wild 
beast of the island and the satyr shall cri to hi fellow the 
screech owl also shall rest there and find for herself a place of 
rest 

34 15 there shall the great owl make her nest and lay and hatch and 
gather under her shadow there shall the vultur also be gather 
everi one with her mate 

34 16 seek ye out of the book of the lord and read no one of these 
shall fail none shall want her mate for my mouth it hath command 
and hi spirit it hath gather them 

34 17 and he hath cast the lot for them and hi hand hath divid it 
unto them by line they shall po it for ever from gener to 
gener shall they dwell therein 

35 1 the wilder and the solitari place shall be glad for them and 
the desert shall rejoic and blossom a the rose 

35 2 it shall blossom abundantli and rejoic even with joy and 
sing the glori of lebanon shall be given unto it the excel 
of carmel and sharon they shall see the glori of the lord and the 
excel of our god 

35 3 strengthen ye the weak hand and confirm the feebl knee 

35 4 say to them that are of a fear heart be strong fear not 
behold your god will come with vengeanc even god with a recomp 
he will come and save you 

35 5 then the eye of the blind shall be open and the ear of the 
deaf shall be unstop 

35 6 then shall the lame man leap a an hart and the tongu of the 
dumb sing for in the wilder shall water break out and stream 
in the desert 

35 7 and the parch ground shall becom a pool and the thirsti land 
spring of water in the habit of dragon where each lay shall 
be grass with reed and rush 

35 8 and an highway shall be there and a way and it shall be call 
the way of holi the unclean shall not pa over it but it shall 
be for those the wayfar men though fool shall not err therein 

35 9 no lion shall be there nor ani raven beast shall go up 
thereon it shall not be found there but the redeem shall walk 
there 35 10 and the ransom of the lord shall return and come to 
zion with song and everlast joy upon their head they shall 
obtain joy and glad and sorrow and sigh shall flee away 

36 1 now it came to pa in the fourteenth year of king hezekiah that 
sennacherib king of assyria came up against all the defenc citi of 
judah and took them 

36 2 and the king of assyria sent rabshakeh from lachish to jerusalem 
unto king hezekiah with a great armi and he stood by the conduit of 
the upper pool in the highway of the fuller s field 

36 3 then came forth unto him eliakim hilkiah s son which wa over 
the hou and shebna the scribe and joah asaph s son the record 

36 4 and rabshakeh said unto them say ye now to hezekiah thu saith 
the great king the king of assyria what confid is thi wherein 
thou trustest 36 5 i say sayest thou but they are but vain word 
i have counsel and strength for war now on whom dost thou trust that 
thou rebellest against me 36 6 lo thou trustest in the staff of 
thi broken reed on egypt whereon if a man lean it will go into hi 
hand and pierc it so is pharaoh king of egypt to all that trust in 
him 

36 7 but if thou say to me we trust in the lord our god is it not 
he whose high place and whose altar hezekiah hath taken away and 
said to judah and to jerusalem ye shall worship befor thi altar 
36 8 now therefor give pledg i pray thee to my master the king of 
assyria and i will give thee two thousand hor if thou be abl on 
thi part to set rider upon them 

36 9 how then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least 
of my master s servant and put thi trust on egypt for chariot and 
for horseman 36 10 and am i now come up without the lord against 
thi land to destroy it the lord said unto me go up against thi 
land and destroy it 

36 11 then said eliakim and shebna and joah unto rabshakeh speak i 
pray thee unto thi servant in the syrian languag for we understand 
it and speak not to u in the jew languag in the ear of the 
peopl that are on the wall 

36 12 but rabshakeh said hath my master sent me to thi master and to 
thee to speak these word hath he not sent me to the men that sit 
upon the wall that they may eat their own dung and drink their own 
piss with you 36 13 then rabshakeh stood and cri with a loud 
voic in the jew languag and said hear ye the word of the great 
king the king of assyria 

36 14 thu saith the king let not hezekiah deceiv you for he shall 
not be abl to deliv you 

36 15 neither let hezekiah make you trust in the lord say the 
lord will sure deliv u thi citi shall not be deliv into the 
hand of the king of assyria 

36 16 hearken not to hezekiah for thu saith the king of assyria 
make an agreement with me by a present and come out to me and eat ye 
everi one of hi vine and everi one of hi fig tree and drink ye 
everi one the water of hi own cistern 36 17 until i come and take 
you away to a land like your own land a land of corn and wine a land 
of bread and vineyard 

36 18 bewar lest hezekiah persuad you say the lord will deliv 
u 

hath ani of the god of the nation deliv hi land out of the hand 
of the king of assyria 36 19 where are the god of hamath and 
arphad where are the god of sepharvaim and have they deliv 
samaria out of my hand 36 20 who are they among all the god of 
these land that have deliv their land out of my hand that the 
lord should deliv jerusalem out of my hand 36 21 but they held 
their peac and answer him not a word for the king s command 
wa say answer him not 

36 22 then came eliakim the son of hilkiah that wa over the 
household and shebna the scribe and joah the son of asaph the 
record to hezekiah with their cloth rent and told him the word 
of rabshakeh 

37 1 and it came to pa when king hezekiah heard it that he rent 
hi cloth and cover himself with sackcloth and went into the 
hou of the lord 

37 2 and he sent eliakim who wa over the household and shebna the 
scribe and the elder of the priest cover with sackcloth unto 
isaiah the prophet the son of amoz 

37 3 and they said unto him thu saith hezekiah thi day is a day of 
troubl and of rebuk and of blasphemi for the child are come to 
the birth and there is not strength to bring forth 

37 4 it may be the lord thi god will hear the word of rabshakeh whom 
the king of assyria hi master hath sent to reproach the live god 
and will reprov the word which the lord thi god hath heard 
wherefor lift up thi prayer for the remnant that is left 

37 5 so the servant of king hezekiah came to isaiah 

37 6 and isaiah said unto them thu shall ye say unto your master 
thu saith the lord be not afraid of the word that thou hast heard 
wherewith the servant of the king of assyria have blasphem me 

37 7 behold i will send a blast upon him and he shall hear a rumour 
and return to hi own land and i will cau him to fall by the sword 
in hi own land 

37 8 so rabshakeh return and found the king of assyria war 
against libnah for he had heard that he wa depart from lachish 

37 9 and he heard say concern tirhakah king of ethiopia he is come 
forth to make war with thee and when he heard it he sent messeng 
to hezekiah say 37 10 thu shall ye speak to hezekiah king of 
judah say let not thi god in whom thou trustest deceiv thee 
say jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of 
assyria 

37 11 behold thou hast heard what the king of assyria have done to 
all land by destroy them utterli and shalt thou be deliv 
37 12 have the god of the nation deliv them which my father 
have destroy a gozan and haran and rezeph and the child of 
eden which were in telassar 37 13 where is the king of hamath and 
the king of arphad and the king of the citi of sepharvaim hena and 
ivah 37 14 and hezekiah receiv the letter from the hand of the 
messeng and read it and hezekiah went up unto the hou of the 
lord and spread it befor the lord 

37 15 and hezekiah pray unto the lord say 37 16 o lord of 
host god of israel that dwellest between the cherub thou art 
the god even thou alon of all the kingdom of the earth thou hast 
made heaven and earth 

37 17 inclin thine ear o lord and hear open thine eye o lord 
and see and hear all the word of sennacherib which hath sent to 
reproach the live god 

37 18 of a truth lord the king of assyria have laid wast all the 
nation and their countri 37 19 and have cast their god into the 
fire for they were no god but the work of men s hand wood and 
stone therefor they have destroy them 

37 20 now therefor o lord our god save u from hi hand that all 
the kingdom of the earth may know that thou art the lord even thou 
onli 

37 21 then isaiah the son of amoz sent unto hezekiah say thu 
saith the lord god of israel wherea thou hast pray to me against 
sennacherib king of assyria 37 22 thi is the word which the lord 
hath spoken concern him the virgin the daughter of zion hath 
despi thee and laugh thee to scorn the daughter of jerusalem 
hath shaken her head at thee 

37 23 whom hast thou reproach and blasphem and against whom hast 
thou exalt thi voic and lift up thine eye on high even against 
the holi one of israel 

37 24 by thi servant hast thou reproach the lord and hast said by 
the multitud of my chariot am i come up to the height of the 
mountain to the side of lebanon and i will cut down the tall 
cedar thereof and the choic fir tree thereof and i will enter 
into the height of hi border and the forest of hi carmel 

37 25 i have dig and drunk water and with the sole of my foot 
have i dri up all the river of the besieg place 

37 26 hast thou not heard long ago how i have done it and of ancient 
time that i have form it now have i brought it to pa that thou 
shouldest be to lay wast defenc citi into ruinou heap 

37 27 therefor their inhabit were of small power they were 
dismay and confound they were a the grass of the field and a 
the green herb a the grass on the housetop and a corn blast 
befor it be grown up 

37 28 but i know thi abod and thi go out and thi come in and 
thi rage against me 

37 29 becau thi rage against me and thi tumult is come up into 
mine ear therefor will i put my hook in thi nose and my bridl in 
thi lip and i will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest 

37 30 and thi shall be a sign unto thee ye shall eat thi year such 
a groweth of itself and the second year that which springeth of the 
same and in the third year sow ye and reap and plant vineyard and 
eat the fruit thereof 

37 31 and the remnant that is escap of the hou of judah shall 
again take root downward and bear fruit upward 37 32 for out of 
jerusalem shall go forth a remnant and they that escap out of mount 
zion the zeal of the lord of host shall do thi 

37 33 therefor thu saith the lord concern the king of assyria he 
shall not come into thi citi nor shoot an arrow there nor come 
befor it with shield nor cast a bank against it 

37 34 by the way that he came by the same shall he return and shall 
not come into thi citi saith the lord 

37 35 for i will defend thi citi to save it for mine own sake and 
for my servant david s sake 

37 36 then the angel of the lord went forth and smote in the camp of 
the assyrian a hundr and fourscor and five thousand and when they 
aro earli in the morn behold they were all dead corp 

37 37 so sennacherib king of assyria depart and went and return 
and dwelt at nineveh 

37 38 and it came to pa a he wa worship in the hou of 
nisroch hi god that adrammelech and sharez hi son smote him with 
the sword and they escap into the land of armenia and esarhaddon 
hi son reign in hi stead 

38 1 in those day wa hezekiah sick unto death and isaiah the 
prophet the son of amoz came unto him and said unto him thu saith 
the lord set thine hou in order for thou shalt die and not live 

38 2 then hezekiah turn hi face toward the wall and pray unto 
the lord 38 3 and said rememb now o lord i beseech thee how i 
have walk befor thee in truth and with a perfect heart and have 
done that which is good in thi sight and hezekiah wept sore 

38 4 then came the word of the lord to isaiah say 38 5 go and 
say to hezekiah thu saith the lord the god of david thi father i 
have heard thi prayer i have seen thi tear behold i will add unto 
thi day fifteen year 

38 6 and i will deliv thee and thi citi out of the hand of the king 
of assyria and i will defend thi citi 

38 7 and thi shall be a sign unto thee from the lord that the lord 
will do thi thing that he hath spoken 38 8 behold i will bring 
again the shadow of the degr which is gone down in the sun dial of 
ahaz ten degr backward so the sun return ten degr by which 
degr it wa gone down 

38 9 the write of hezekiah king of judah when he had been sick and 
wa recov of hi sick 38 10 i said in the cut off of my 
day i shall go to the gate of the grave i am depriv of the 
residu of my year 

38 11 i said i shall not see the lord even the lord in the land of 
the live i shall behold man no more with the inhabit of the 
world 

38 12 mine age is depart and is remov from me a a shepherd s 
tent i have cut off like a weaver my life he will cut me off with 
pine sick from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me 

38 13 i reckon till morn that a a lion so will he break all 
my bone from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me 

38 14 like a crane or a swallow so did i chatter i did mourn a a 
dove mine eye fail with look upward o lord i am oppress 
undertak for me 

38 15 what shall i say he hath both spoken unto me and himself hath 
done it i shall go softli all my year in the bitter of my soul 

38 16 o lord by these thing men live and in all these thing is the 
life of my spirit so wilt thou recov me and make me to live 

38 17 behold for peac i had great bitter but thou hast in love 
to my soul deliv it from the pit of corrupt for thou hast cast 
all my sin behind thi back 

38 18 for the grave cannot prai thee death can not celebr thee 
they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thi truth 

38 19 the live the live he shall prai thee a i do thi day 
the father to the child shall make known thi truth 

38 20 the lord wa readi to save me therefor we will sing my song 
to the string instrument all the day of our life in the hou of 
the lord 

38 21 for isaiah had said let them take a lump of fig and lay it 
for a plaister upon the boil and he shall recov 

38 22 hezekiah also had said what is the sign that i shall go up to 
the hou of the lord 39 1 at that time merodachbaladan the son of 
baladan king of babylon sent letter and a present to hezekiah for 
he had heard that he had been sick and wa recov 

39 2 and hezekiah wa glad of them and shew them the hou of hi 
preciou thing the silver and the gold and the spice and the 
preciou ointment and all the hou of hi armour and all that wa 
found in hi treasur there wa noth in hi hou nor in all hi 
dominion that hezekiah shew them not 

39 3 then came isaiah the prophet unto king hezekiah and said unto 
him what said these men and from whenc came they unto thee and 
hezekiah said they are come from a far countri unto me even from 
babylon 

39 4 then said he what have they seen in thine hou and hezekiah 
answer all that is in mine hou have they seen there is noth 
among my treasur that i have not shew them 

39 5 then said isaiah to hezekiah hear the word of the lord of host 
39 6 behold the day come that all that is in thine hou and that 
which thi father have laid up in store until thi day shall be 
carri to babylon noth shall be left saith the lord 

39 7 and of thi son that shall issu from thee which thou shalt 
beget shall they take away and they shall be eunuch in the palac 
of the king of babylon 

39 8 then said hezekiah to isaiah good is the word of the lord which 
thou hast spoken he said moreov for there shall be peac and truth 
in my day 

40 1 comfort ye comfort ye my peopl saith your god 

40 2 speak ye comfort to jerusalem and cri unto her that her 
warfar is accomplish that her iniqu is pardon for she hath 
receiv of the lord s hand doubl for all her sin 

40 3 the voic of him that crieth in the wilder prepar ye the 
way of the lord make straight in the desert a highway for our god 

40 4 everi valley shall be exalt and everi mountain and hill shall 
be made low and the crook shall be made straight and the rough 
place plain 40 5 and the glori of the lord shall be reveal and 
all flesh shall see it togeth for the mouth of the lord hath spoken 
it 

40 6 the voic said cri and he said what shall i cri all flesh is 
grass and all the goodli thereof is a the flower of the field 
40 7 the grass withereth the flower fadeth becau the spirit of the 
lord bloweth upon it sure the peopl is grass 

40 8 the grass withereth the flower fadeth but the word of our god 
shall stand for ever 

40 9 o zion that bringest good tide get thee up into the high 
mountain o jerusalem that bringest good tide lift up thi voic 
with strength lift it up be not afraid say unto the citi of 
judah behold your god 40 10 behold the lord god will come with 
strong hand and hi arm shall rule for him behold hi reward is 
with him and hi work befor him 

40 11 he shall feed hi flock like a shepherd he shall gather the 
lamb with hi arm and carri them in hi bosom and shall gentli lead 
those that are with young 

40 12 who hath measur the water in the hollow of hi hand and 
mete out heaven with the span and comprehend the dust of the earth 
in a measur and weigh the mountain in scale and the hill in a 
balanc 40 13 who hath direct the spirit of the lord or be hi 
counsellor hath taught him 40 14 with whom took he counsel and who 
instruct him and taught him in the path of judgment and taught him 
knowledg and shew to him the way of understand 40 15 behold 
the nation are a a drop of a bucket and are count a the small 
dust of the balanc behold he taketh up the isl a a veri littl 
thing 

40 16 and lebanon is not suffici to burn nor the beast thereof 
suffici for a burnt offer 

40 17 all nation befor him are a noth and they are count to 
him le than noth and vaniti 

40 18 to whom then will ye liken god or what like will ye compar 
unto him 40 19 the workman melteth a graven imag and the goldsmith 
spreadeth it over with gold and casteth silver chain 

40 20 he that is so impoverish that he hath no oblat chooseth a 
tree that will not rot he seeketh unto him a cun workman to 
prepar a graven imag that shall not be move 

40 21 have ye not known have ye not heard hath it not been told you 
from the begin have ye not understood from the foundat of the 
earth 40 22 it is he that sitteth upon the circl of the earth and 
the inhabit thereof are a grasshopp that stretcheth out the 
heaven a a curtain and spreadeth them out a a tent to dwell in 
40 23 that bringeth the princ to noth he maketh the judg of 
the earth a vaniti 

40 24 yea they shall not be plant yea they shall not be sown 
yea their stock shall not take root in the earth and he shall also 
blow upon them and they shall wither and the whirlwind shall take 
them away a stubbl 

40 25 to whom then will ye liken me or shall i be equal saith the 
holi one 

40 26 lift up your eye on high and behold who hath creat these 
thing that bringeth out their host by number he calleth them all by 
name by the great of hi might for that he is strong in power 
not one faileth 

40 27 whi sayest thou o jacob and speakest o israel my way is hid 
from the lord and my judgment is pa over from my god 40 28 hast 
thou not known hast thou not heard that the everlast god the 
lord the creator of the end of the earth fainteth not neither is 
weari there is no search of hi understand 

40 29 he giveth power to the faint and to them that have no might he 
increaseth strength 

40 30 even the youth shall faint and be weari and the young men 
shall utterli fall 40 31 but they that wait upon the lord shall renew 
their strength they shall mount up with wing a eagl they shall 
run and not be weari and they shall walk and not faint 

41 1 keep silenc befor me o island and let the peopl renew their 
strength let them come near then let them speak let u come near 
togeth to judgment 

41 2 who rai up the righteou man from the east call him to hi 
foot gave the nation befor him and made him rule over king he 
gave them a the dust to hi sword and a driven stubbl to hi bow 

41 3 he pursu them and pa safe even by the way that he had 
not gone with hi foot 

41 4 who hath wrought and done it call the gener from the 
begin i the lord the first and with the last i am he 

41 5 the isl saw it and fear the end of the earth were afraid 
drew near and came 

41 6 they help everi one hi neighbour and everi one said to hi 
brother be of good courag 

41 7 so the carpent encourag the goldsmith and he that smootheth 
with the hammer him that smote the anvil say it is readi for the 
soder and he fasten it with nail that it should not be move 

41 8 but thou israel art my servant jacob whom i have chosen the 
seed of abraham my friend 

41 9 thou whom i have taken from the end of the earth and call 
thee from the chief men thereof and said unto thee thou art my 
servant i have chosen thee and not cast thee away 

41 10 fear thou not for i am with thee be not dismay for i am thi
