soap yet thine iniqu is mark befor me saith the lord god 

2 23 how canst thou say i am not pollut i have not gone after 
baalim see thi way in the valley know what thou hast done thou art 
a swift dromedari traver her way 2 24 a wild a use to the 
wilder that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasur in her occa 
who can turn her away all they that seek her will not weari 
themselv in her month they shall find her 

2 25 withhold thi foot from be unshod and thi throat from thirst 
but thou saidst there is no hope no for i have love stranger and 
after them will i go 

2 26 a the thief is asham when he is found so is the hou of 
israel asham they their king their princ and their priest 
and their prophet 

2 27 say to a stock thou art my father and to a stone thou hast 
brought me forth for they have turn their back unto me and not 
their face but in the time of their troubl they will say ari and 
save u 

2 28 but where are thi god that thou hast made thee let them ari 
if they can save thee in the time of thi troubl for accord to the 
number of thi citi are thi god o judah 

2 29 wherefor will ye plead with me ye all have transgress against 
me saith the lord 

2 30 in vain have i smitten your child they receiv no 
correct your own sword hath devour your prophet like a 
destroy lion 

2 31 o gener see ye the word of the lord have i been a 
wilder unto israel a land of dark wherefor say my peopl 
we are lord we will come no more unto thee 2 32 can a maid forget 
her ornament or a bride her attir yet my peopl have forgotten me 
day without number 

2 33 whi trimmest thou thi way to seek love therefor hast thou also 
taught the wick one thi way 

2 34 also in thi skirt is found the blood of the soul of the poor 
innoc i have not found it by secret search but upon all these 

2 35 yet thou sayest becau i am innoc sure hi anger shall 
turn from me behold i will plead with thee becau thou sayest i 
have not sin 

2 36 whi gaddest thou about so much to chang thi way thou also shalt 
be asham of egypt a thou wast asham of assyria 

2 37 yea thou shalt go forth from him and thine hand upon thine 
head for the lord hath reject thi confid and thou shalt not 
prosper in them 

3 1 they say if a man put away hi wife and she go from him and 
becom anoth man s shall he return unto her again shall not that 
land be greatli pollut but thou hast play the harlot with mani 
lover yet return again to me saith the lord 

3 2 lift up thine eye unto the high place and see where thou hast 
not been lien with in the way hast thou sat for them a the arabian 
in the wilder and thou hast pollut the land with thi whoredom 
and with thi wick 

3 3 therefor the shower have been withholden and there hath been no 
latter rain and thou hadst a whore s forehead thou refusedst to be 
asham 

3 4 wilt thou not from thi time cri unto me my father thou art the 
guid of my youth 3 5 will he reserv hi anger for ever will he 
keep it to the end behold thou hast spoken and done evil thing a 
thou couldest 

3 6 the lord said also unto me in the day of josiah the king hast 
thou seen that which backslid israel hath done she is gone up upon 
everi high mountain and under everi green tree and there hath play 
the harlot 

3 7 and i said after she had done all these thing turn thou unto me 
but she return not and her treacher sister judah saw it 

3 8 and i saw when for all the cau wherebi backslid israel 
commit adulteri i had put her away and given her a bill of 
divorc yet her treacher sister judah fear not but went and 
play the harlot also 

3 9 and it came to pa through the light of her whoredom that 
she defil the land and commit adulteri with stone and with 
stock 

3 10 and yet for all thi her treacher sister judah hath not turn 
unto me with her whole heart but feignedli saith the lord 

3 11 and the lord said unto me the backslid israel hath justifi 
herself more than treacher judah 

3 12 go and proclaim these word toward the north and say return 
thou backslid israel saith the lord and i will not cau mine 
anger to fall upon you for i am merci saith the lord and i will 
not keep anger for ever 

3 13 onli acknowledg thine iniqu that thou hast transgress 
against the lord thi god and hast scatter thi way to the stranger 
under everi green tree and ye have not obey my voic saith the 
lord 

3 14 turn o backslid child saith the lord for i am marri 
unto you and i will take you one of a citi and two of a famili and 
i will bring you to zion 3 15 and i will give you pastor accord 
to mine heart which shall feed you with knowledg and understand 

3 16 and it shall come to pa when ye be multipli and increa in 
the land in those day saith the lord they shall say no more the 
ark of the coven of the lord neither shall it come to mind 
neither shall they rememb it neither shall they visit it neither 
shall that be done ani more 

3 17 at that time they shall call jerusalem the throne of the lord 
and all the nation shall be gather unto it to the name of the 
lord to jerusalem neither shall they walk ani more after the 
imagin of their evil heart 

3 18 in those day the hou of judah shall walk with the hou of 
israel and they shall come togeth out of the land of the north to 
the land that i have given for an inherit unto your father 

3 19 but i said how shall i put thee among the child and give 
thee a pleasant land a goodli heritag of the host of nation and i 
said thou shalt call me my father and shalt not turn away from me 

3 20 sure a a wife treacher departeth from her husband so 
have ye dealt treacher with me o hou of israel saith the 
lord 

3 21 a voic wa heard upon the high place weep and supplic 
of the child of israel for they have pervert their way and they 
have forgotten the lord their god 

3 22 return ye backslid child and i will heal your 
backslid 

behold we come unto thee for thou art the lord our god 

3 23 truli in vain is salvat hope for from the hill and from the 
multitud of mountain truli in the lord our god is the salvat of 
israel 

3 24 for shame hath devour the labour of our father from our youth 
their flock and their herd their son and their daughter 

3 25 we lie down in our shame and our confu covereth u for we 
have sin against the lord our god we and our father from our 
youth even unto thi day and have not obey the voic of the lord 
our god 

4 1 if thou wilt return o israel saith the lord return unto me and 
if thou wilt put away thine abomin out of my sight then shalt 
thou not remov 

4 2 and thou shalt swear the lord liveth in truth in judgment and 
in righteou and the nation shall bless themselv in him and 
in him shall they glori 

4 3 for thu saith the lord to the men of judah and jerusalem break 
up your fallow ground and sow not among thorn 

4 4 circumci yourselv to the lord and take away the foreskin of 
your heart ye men of judah and inhabit of jerusalem lest my furi 
come forth like fire and burn that none can quench it becau of the 
evil of your do 

4 5 declar ye in judah and publish in jerusalem and say blow ye 
the trumpet in the land cri gather togeth and say assembl 
yourselv and let u go into the defenc citi 

4 6 set up the standard toward zion retir stay not for i will 
bring evil from the north and a great destruct 

4 7 the lion is come up from hi thicket and the destroy of the 
gentil is on hi way he is gone forth from hi place to make thi 
land desol and thi citi shall be laid wast without an 
inhabit 

4 8 for thi gird you with sackcloth lament and howl for the fierc 
anger of the lord is not turn back from u 

4 9 and it shall come to pa at that day saith the lord that the 
heart of the king shall perish and the heart of the princ and the 
priest shall be astonish and the prophet shall wonder 

4 10 then said i ah lord god sure thou hast greatli deceiv thi 
peopl and jerusalem say ye shall have peac wherea the sword 
reacheth unto the soul 

4 11 at that time shall it be said to thi peopl and to jerusalem a 
dri wind of the high place in the wilder toward the daughter of 
my peopl not to fan nor to clean 4 12 even a full wind from 
those place shall come unto me now also will i give sentenc against 
them 

4 13 behold he shall come up a cloud and hi chariot shall be a 
a whirlwind hi hor are swifter than eagl woe unto u for we 
are spoil 

4 14 o jerusalem wash thine heart from wick that thou mayest 
be save how long shall thi vain thought lodg within thee 4 15 
for a voic declareth from dan and publisheth afflict from mount 
ephraim 

4 16 make ye mention to the nation behold publish against 
jerusalem that watcher come from a far countri and give out their 
voic against the citi of judah 

4 17 a keeper of a field are they against her round about becau 
she hath been rebelli against me saith the lord 

4 18 thi way and thi do have procur these thing unto thee thi 
is thi wick becau it is bitter becau it reacheth unto 
thine heart 

4 19 my bowel my bowel i am pain at my veri heart my heart 
maketh a noi in me i cannot hold my peac becau thou hast heard 
o my soul the sound of the trumpet the alarm of war 

4 20 destruct upon destruct is cri for the whole land is 
spoil suddenli are my tent spoil and my curtain in a moment 

4 21 how long shall i see the standard and hear the sound of the 
trumpet 4 22 for my peopl is foolish they have not known me they 
are sottish child and they have none understand they are wise 
to do evil but to do good they have no knowledg 

4 23 i beheld the earth and lo it wa without form and void and 
the heaven and they had no light 

4 24 i beheld the mountain and lo they trembl and all the hill 
move lightli 

4 25 i beheld and lo there wa no man and all the bird of the 
heaven were fled 

4 26 i beheld and lo the fruit place wa a wilder and all 
the citi thereof were broken down at the presenc of the lord and 
by hi fierc anger 

4 27 for thu hath the lord said the whole land shall be desol 
yet will i not make a full end 

4 28 for thi shall the earth mourn and the heaven abov be black 
becau i have spoken it i have purpo it and will not repent 
neither will i turn back from it 

4 29 the whole citi shall flee for the noi of the horseman and 
bowman they shall go into thicket and climb up upon the rock 
everi citi shall be forsaken and not a man dwell therein 

4 30 and when thou art spoil what wilt thou do though thou 
clothest thyself with crimson though thou deckest thee with ornament 
of gold though thou rentest thi face with paint in vain shalt 
thou make thyself fair thi lover will despi thee they will seek 
thi life 

4 31 for i have heard a voic a of a woman in travail and the 
anguish a of her that bringeth forth her first child the voic of 
the daughter of zion that bewaileth herself that spreadeth her 
hand say woe is me now for my soul is weari becau of 
murder 

5 1 run ye to and fro through the street of jerusalem and see now 
and know and seek in the broad place thereof if ye can find a man 
if there be ani that executeth judgment that seeketh the truth and i 
will pardon it 

5 2 and though they say the lord liveth sure they swear fal 

5 3 o lord are not thine eye upon the truth thou hast stricken 
them but they have not griev thou hast consum them but they 
have refu to receiv correct they have made their face harder 
than a rock they have refu to return 

5 4 therefor i said sure these are poor they are foolish for 
they know not the way of the lord nor the judgment of their god 

5 5 i will get me unto the great men and will speak unto them for 
they have known the way of the lord and the judgment of their god 
but these have altogeth broken the yoke and burst the bond 

5 6 wherefor a lion out of the forest shall slay them and a wolf of 
the even shall spoil them a leopard shall watch over their 
citi everi one that goeth out thenc shall be torn in piec 
becau their transgress are mani and their backslid are 
increa 

5 7 how shall i pardon thee for thi thi child have forsaken me 
and sworn by them that are no god when i had fed them to the full 
they then commit adulteri and assembl themselv by troop in 
the harlot hou 

5 8 they were a fed hor in the morn everi one neigh after 
hi neighbour s wife 

5 9 shall i not visit for these thing saith the lord and shall not 
my soul be aveng on such a nation a thi 5 10 go ye up upon her 
wall and destroy but make not a full end take away her 
battlement for they are not the lord s 

5 11 for the hou of israel and the hou of judah have dealt veri 
treacher against me saith the lord 

5 12 they have beli the lord and said it is not he neither shall 
evil come upon u neither shall we see sword nor famin 5 13 and the 
prophet shall becom wind and the word is not in them thu shall it 
be done unto them 

5 14 wherefor thu saith the lord god of host becau ye speak thi 
word behold i will make my word in thi mouth fire and thi peopl 
wood and it shall devour them 

5 15 lo i will bring a nation upon you from far o hou of israel 
saith the lord it is a mighti nation it is an ancient nation a 
nation whose languag thou knowest not neither understandest what 
they say 

5 16 their quiver is a an open sepulchr they are all mighti men 

5 17 and they shall eat up thine harvest and thi bread which thi 
son and thi daughter should eat they shall eat up thi flock and 
thine herd they shall eat up thi vine and thi fig tree they shall 
impoverish thi fenc citi wherein thou trustedst with the sword 

5 18 nevertheless in those day saith the lord i will not make a 
full end with you 

5 19 and it shall come to pa when ye shall say wherefor doeth the 
lord our god all these thing unto u then shalt thou answer them 
like a ye have forsaken me and serv strang god in your land so 
shall ye serv stranger in a land that is not your s 

5 20 declar thi in the hou of jacob and publish it in judah 
say 5 21 hear now thi o foolish peopl and without 
understand which have eye and see not which have ear and hear 
not 5 22 fear ye not me saith the lord will ye not trembl at my 
presenc which have place the sand for the bound of the sea by a 
perpetu decr that it cannot pa it and though the wave thereof 
toss themselv yet can they not prevail though they roar yet can 
they not pa over it 5 23 but thi peopl hath a revolt and a 
rebelli heart they are revolt and gone 

5 24 neither say they in their heart let u now fear the lord our 
god that giveth rain both the former and the latter in hi season 
he reserveth unto u the appoint week of the harvest 

5 25 your iniqu have turn away these thing and your sin have 
withholden good thing from you 

5 26 for among my peopl are found wick men they lay wait a he 
that setteth snare they set a trap they catch men 

5 27 a a cage is full of bird so are their hou full of deceit 
therefor they are becom great and waxen rich 

5 28 they are waxen fat they shine yea they overpass the deed of 
the wick they judg not the cau the cau of the fatherless yet 
they prosper and the right of the needi do they not judg 

5 29 shall i not visit for these thing saith the lord shall not my 
soul be aveng on such a nation a thi 5 30 a wonder and 
horribl thing is commit in the land 5 31 the prophet prophesi 
fal and the priest bear rule by their mean and my peopl love 
to have it so and what will ye do in the end thereof 6 1 o ye 
child of benjamin gather yourselv to flee out of the midst of 
jerusalem and blow the trumpet in tekoa and set up a sign of fire in 
bethhaccerem for evil appeareth out of the north and great 
destruct 

6 2 i have liken the daughter of zion to a come and delic 
woman 

6 3 the shepherd with their flock shall come unto her they shall 
pitch their tent against her round about they shall feed everi one 
in hi place 

6 4 prepar ye war against her ari and let u go up at noon woe 
unto u for the day goeth away for the shadow of the even are 
stretch out 

6 5 ari and let u go by night and let u destroy her palac 

6 6 for thu hath the lord of host said hew ye down tree and cast 
a mount against jerusalem thi is the citi to be visit she is 
wholli oppress in the midst of her 

6 7 a a fountain casteth out her water so she casteth out her 
wick violenc and spoil is heard in her befor me continu 
is grief and wound 

6 8 be thou instruct o jerusalem lest my soul depart from thee 
lest i make thee desol a land not inhabit 

6 9 thu saith the lord of host they shall throughli glean the 
remnant of israel a a vine turn back thine hand a a grapegath 
into the basket 

6 10 to whom shall i speak and give warn that they may hear 
behold their ear is uncircumci and they cannot hearken behold 
the word of the lord is unto them a reproach they have no delight in 
it 

6 11 therefor i am full of the furi of the lord i am weari with 
hold in i will pour it out upon the child abroad and upon the 
assembl of young men togeth for even the husband with the wife 
shall be taken the age with him that is full of day 

6 12 and their hou shall be turn unto other with their field 
and wife togeth for i will stretch out my hand upon the 
inhabit of the land saith the lord 

6 13 for from the least of them even unto the greatest of them everi 
one is given to covet and from the prophet even unto the 
priest everi one dealeth fal 

6 14 they have heal also the hurt of the daughter of my peopl 
slightli say peac peac when there is no peac 

6 15 were they asham when they had commit abomin nay they 
were not at all asham neither could they blush therefor they 
shall fall among them that fall at the time that i visit them they 
shall be cast down saith the lord 

6 16 thu saith the lord stand ye in the way and see and ask for 
the old path where is the good way and walk therein and ye shall 
find rest for your soul but they said we will not walk therein 

6 17 also i set watchman over you say hearken to the sound of the 
trumpet but they said we will not hearken 

6 18 therefor hear ye nation and know o congreg what is 
among them 

6 19 hear o earth behold i will bring evil upon thi peopl even 
the fruit of their thought becau they have not hearken unto my 
word nor to my law but reject it 

6 20 to what purpo cometh there to me incen from sheba and the 
sweet cane from a far countri your burnt offer are not 
accept nor your sacrif sweet unto me 

6 21 therefor thu saith the lord behold i will lay stumblingblock 
befor thi peopl and the father and the son togeth shall fall 
upon them the neighbour and hi friend shall perish 

6 22 thu saith the lord behold a peopl cometh from the north 
countri and a great nation shall be rai from the side of the 
earth 

6 23 they shall lay hold on bow and spear they are cruel and have no 
merci their voic roareth like the sea and they ride upon hor 
set in array a men for war against thee o daughter of zion 

6 24 we have heard the fame thereof our hand wax feebl anguish 
hath taken hold of u and pain a of a woman in travail 

6 25 go not forth into the field nor walk by the way for the sword 
of the enemi and fear is on everi side 

6 26 o daughter of my peopl gird thee with sackcloth and wallow 
thyself in ash make thee mourn a for an onli son most bitter 
lament for the spoiler shall suddenli come upon u 

6 27 i have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my peopl that 
thou mayest know and tri their way 

6 28 they are all grievou revolt walk with slander they are 
brass and iron they are all corrupt 

6 29 the bellow are burn the lead is consum of the fire the 
founder melteth in vain for the wick are not pluck away 

6 30 reprob silver shall men call them becau the lord hath 
reject them 

7 1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord say 7 2 stand in 
the gate of the lord s hou and proclaim there thi word and say 
hear the word of the lord all ye of judah that enter in at these 
gate to worship the lord 

7 3 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel amend your way 
and your do and i will cau you to dwell in thi place 

7 4 trust ye not in lie word say the templ of the lord the 
templ of the lord the templ of the lord are these 

7 5 for if ye throughli amend your way and your do if ye 
throughli execut judgment between a man and hi neighbour 7 6 if ye 
oppress not the stranger the fatherless and the widow and shed not 
innoc blood in thi place neither walk after other god to your 
hurt 7 7 then will i cau you to dwell in thi place in the land 
that i gave to your father for ever and ever 

7 8 behold ye trust in lie word that cannot profit 

7 9 will ye steal murder and commit adulteri and swear fal and 
burn incen unto baal and walk after other god whom ye know not 
7 10 and come and stand befor me in thi hou which is call by my 
name and say we are deliv to do all these abomin 7 11 is 
thi hou which is call by my name becom a den of robber in 
your eye behold even i have seen it saith the lord 

7 12 but go ye now unto my place which wa in shiloh where i set my 
name at the first and see what i did to it for the wick of my 
peopl israel 

7 13 and now becau ye have done all these work saith the lord 
and i spake unto you rise up earli and speak but ye heard not 
and i call you but ye answer not 7 14 therefor will i do unto 
thi hou which is call by my name wherein ye trust and unto the 
place which i gave to you and to your father a i have done to 
shiloh 

7 15 and i will cast you out of my sight a i have cast out all your 
brother even the whole seed of ephraim 

7 16 therefor pray not thou for thi peopl neither lift up cri nor 
prayer for them neither make intercess to me for i will not hear 
thee 

7 17 seest thou not what they do in the citi of judah and in the 
street of jerusalem 7 18 the child gather wood and the father 
kindl the fire and the woman knead their dough to make cake to the 
queen of heaven and to pour out drink offer unto other god that 
they may provok me to anger 

7 19 do they provok me to anger saith the lord do they not provok 
themselv to the confu of their own face 7 20 therefor thu 
saith the lord god behold mine anger and my furi shall be pour out 
upon thi place upon man and upon beast and upon the tree of the 
field and upon the fruit of the ground and it shall burn and shall 
not be quench 

7 21 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel put your burnt 
offer unto your sacrif and eat flesh 

7 22 for i spake not unto your father nor command them in the day 
that i brought them out of the land of egypt concern burnt 
offer or sacrif 7 23 but thi thing command i them say 
obey my voic and i will be your god and ye shall be my peopl and 
walk ye in all the way that i have command you that it may be well 
unto you 

7 24 but they hearken not nor inclin their ear but walk in the 
counsel and in the imagin of their evil heart and went 
backward and not forward 

7 25 sinc the day that your father came forth out of the land of 
egypt unto thi day i have even sent unto you all my servant the 
prophet daili rise up earli and send them 7 26 yet they 
hearken not unto me nor inclin their ear but harden their 
neck they did wor than their father 

7 27 therefor thou shalt speak all these word unto them but they 
will not hearken to thee thou shalt also call unto them but they 
will not answer thee 

7 28 but thou shalt say unto them thi is a nation that obeyeth not 
the voic of the lord their god nor receiveth correct truth is 
perish and is cut off from their mouth 

7 29 cut off thine hair o jerusalem and cast it away and take up a 
lament on high place for the lord hath reject and forsaken 
the gener of hi wrath 

7 30 for the child of judah have done evil in my sight saith the 
lord they have set their abomin in the hou which is call by 
my name to pollut it 

7 31 and they have built the high place of tophet which is in the 
valley of the son of hinnom to burn their son and their daughter in 
the fire which i command them not neither came it into my heart 

7 32 therefor behold the day come saith the lord that it shall 
no more be call tophet nor the valley of the son of hinnom but the 
valley of slaughter for they shall buri in tophet till there be no 
place 

7 33 and the carca of thi peopl shall be meat for the fowl of 
the heaven and for the beast of the earth and none shall fray them 
away 

7 34 then will i cau to cea from the citi of judah and from the 
street of jerusalem the voic of mirth and the voic of glad 
the voic of the bridegroom and the voic of the bride for the land 
shall be desol 

8 1 at that time saith the lord they shall bring out the bone of 
the king of judah and the bone of hi princ and the bone of the 
priest and the bone of the prophet and the bone of the 
inhabit of jerusalem out of their graf 8 2 and they shall 
spread them befor the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven 
whom they have love and whom they have serv and after whom they 
have walk and whom they have sought and whom they have worship 
they shall not be gather nor be buri they shall be for dung upon 
the face of the earth 

8 3 and death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residu of 
them that remain of thi evil famili which remain in all the place 
whither i have driven them saith the lord of host 

8 4 moreov thou shalt say unto them thu saith the lord shall they 
fall and not ari shall he turn away and not return 8 5 whi then 
is thi peopl of jerusalem slidden back by a perpetu backslid 
they hold fast deceit they refu to return 

8 6 i hearken and heard but they spake not aright no man repent 
him of hi wick say what have i done everi one turn to 
hi cour a the hor rusheth into the battl 

8 7 yea the stork in the heaven knoweth her appoint time and the 
turtl and the crane and the swallow observ the time of their come 
but my peopl know not the judgment of the lord 

8 8 how do ye say we are wise and the law of the lord is with u 
lo certainli in vain made he it the pen of the scribe is in vain 

8 9 the wise men are asham they are dismay and taken lo they 
have reject the word of the lord and what wisdom is in them 8 10 
therefor will i give their wife unto other and their field to 
them that shall inherit them for everi one from the least even unto 
the greatest is given to covet from the prophet even unto the 
priest everi one dealeth fal 

8 11 for they have heal the hurt of the daughter of my peopl 
slightli say peac peac when there is no peac 

8 12 were they asham when they had commit abomin nay they 
were not at all asham neither could they blush therefor shall 
they fall among them that fall in the time of their visit they 
shall be cast down saith the lord 

8 13 i will sure consum them saith the lord there shall be no 
grape on the vine nor fig on the fig tree and the leaf shall fade 
and the thing that i have given them shall pa away from them 

8 14 whi do we sit still assembl yourselv and let u enter into 
the defenc citi and let u be silent there for the lord our god 
hath put u to silenc and given u water of gall to drink becau 
we have sin against the lord 

8 15 we look for peac but no good came and for a time of health 
and behold troubl 8 16 the snort of hi hor wa heard from 
dan the whole land trembl at the sound of the neigh of hi 
strong one for they are come and have devour the land and all 
that is in it the citi and those that dwell therein 

8 17 for behold i will send serpent cockatr among you which 
will not be charm and they shall bite you saith the lord 

8 18 when i would comfort myself against sorrow my heart is faint in 
me 

8 19 behold the voic of the cri of the daughter of my peopl becau 
of them that dwell in a far countri is not the lord in zion is not 
her king in her whi have they provok me to anger with their graven 
imag and with strang vaniti 8 20 the harvest is past the 
summer is end and we are not save 

8 21 for the hurt of the daughter of my peopl am i hurt i am black 
astonish hath taken hold on me 

8 22 is there no balm in gilead is there no physician there whi then 
is not the health of the daughter of my peopl recov 9 1 oh that 
my head were water and mine eye a fountain of tear that i might 
weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my peopl 9 2 oh 
that i had in the wilder a lodg place of wayfar men that i 
might leav my peopl and go from them for they be all adult 
an assembl of treacher men 

9 3 and they bend their tongu like their bow for lie but they are 
not valiant for the truth upon the earth for they proceed from evil 
to evil and they know not me saith the lord 

9 4 take ye heed everi one of hi neighbour and trust ye not in ani 
brother for everi brother will utterli supplant and everi neighbour 
will walk with slander 

9 5 and they will deceiv everi one hi neighbour and will not speak 
the truth they have taught their tongu to speak lie and weari 
themselv to commit iniqu 

9 6 thine habit is in the midst of deceit through deceit they 
refu to know me saith the lord 

9 7 therefor thu saith the lord of host behold i will melt them 
and tri them for how shall i do for the daughter of my peopl 9 8 
their tongu is a an arrow shot out it speaketh deceit one speaketh 
peaceabl to hi neighbour with hi mouth but in heart he layeth hi 
wait 

9 9 shall i not visit them for these thing saith the lord shall not 
my soul be aveng on such a nation a thi 9 10 for the mountain 
will i take up a weep and wail and for the habit of the 
wilder a lament becau they are burn up so that none can 
pa through them neither can men hear the voic of the cattl both 
the fowl of the heaven and the beast are fled they are gone 

9 11 and i will make jerusalem heap and a den of dragon and i will 
make the citi of judah desol without an inhabit 

9 12 who is the wise man that may understand thi and who is he to 
whom the mouth of the lord hath spoken that he may declar it for 
what the land perisheth and is burn up like a wilder that none 
passeth through 9 13 and the lord saith becau they have forsaken 
my law which i set befor them and have not obey my voic neither 
walk therein 9 14 but have walk after the imagin of their 
own heart and after baalim which their father taught them 9 15 
therefor thu saith the lord of host the god of israel behold i 
will feed them even thi peopl with wormwood and give them water 
of gall to drink 

9 16 i will scatter them also among the heathen whom neither they nor 
their father have known and i will send a sword after them till i 
have consum them 

9 17 thu saith the lord of host consid ye and call for the 
mourn woman that they may come and send for cun woman that 
they may come 9 18 and let them make hast and take up a wail for 
u that our eye may run down with tear and our eyelid gush out 
with water 

9 19 for a voic of wail is heard out of zion how are we spoil 
we are greatli confound becau we have forsaken the land becau 
our dwell have cast u out 

9 20 yet hear the word of the lord o ye woman and let your ear 
receiv the word of hi mouth and teach your daughter wail and 
everi one her neighbour lament 

9 21 for death is come up into our window and is enter into our 
palac to cut off the child from without and the young men from 
the street 

9 22 speak thu saith the lord even the carca of men shall fall 
a dung upon the open field and a the hand after the harvestman 
and none shall gather them 

9 23 thu saith the lord let not the wise man glori in hi wisdom 
neither let the mighti man glori in hi might let not the rich man 
glori in hi rich 9 24 but let him that glorieth glori in thi 
that he understandeth and knoweth me that i am the lord which 
exerci lovingkind judgment and righteou in the earth 
for in these thing i delight saith the lord 

9 25 behold the day come saith the lord that i will punish all 
them which are circumci with the uncircumci 9 26 egypt and 
judah and edom and the child of ammon and moab and all that are 
in the utmost corner that dwell in the wilder for all these 
nation are uncircumci and all the hou of israel are 
uncircumci in the heart 

10 1 hear ye the word which the lord speaketh unto you o hou of 
israel 10 2 thu saith the lord learn not the way of the heathen 
and be not dismay at the sign of heaven for the heathen are 
dismay at them 

10 3 for the custom of the peopl are vain for one cutteth a tree 
out of the forest the work of the hand of the workman with the axe 

10 4 they deck it with silver and with gold they fasten it with nail 
and with hammer that it move not 

10 5 they are upright a the palm tree but speak not they must need 
be born becau they cannot go be not afraid of them for they 
cannot do evil neither also is it in them to do good 

10 6 forasmuch a there is none like unto thee o lord thou art 
great and thi name is great in might 

10 7 who would not fear thee o king of nation for to thee doth it 
appertain forasmuch a among all the wise men of the nation and in 
all their kingdom there is none like unto thee 

10 8 but they are altogeth brutish and foolish the stock is a 
doctrin of vaniti 

10 9 silver spread into plate is brought from tarshish and gold from 
uphaz the work of the workman and of the hand of the founder blue 
and purpl is their cloth they are all the work of cun men 

10 10 but the lord is the true god he is the live god and an 
everlast king at hi wrath the earth shall trembl and the 
nation shall not be abl to abid hi indign 

10 11 thu shall ye say unto them the god that have not made the 
heaven and the earth even they shall perish from the earth and from 
under these heaven 

10 12 he hath made the earth by hi power he hath establish the 
world by hi wisdom and hath stretch out the heaven by hi 
discret 

10 13 when he uttereth hi voic there is a multitud of water in 
the heaven and he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the 
earth he maketh lightn with rain and bringeth forth the wind out 
of hi treasur 

10 14 everi man is brutish in hi knowledg everi founder is 
confound by the graven imag for hi molten imag is falsehood and 
there is no breath in them 

10 15 they are vaniti and the work of error in the time of their 
visit they shall perish 

10 16 the portion of jacob is not like them for he is the former of 
all thing and israel is the rod of hi inherit the lord of 
host is hi name 

10 17 gather up thi ware out of the land o inhabit of the 
fortress 

10 18 for thu saith the lord behold i will sling out the 
inhabit of the land at thi onc and will distress them that 
they may find it so 

10 19 woe is me for my hurt my wound is grievou but i said truli 
thi is a grief and i must bear it 

10 20 my tabernacl is spoil and all my cord are broken my 
child are gone forth of me and they are not there is none to 
stretch forth my tent ani more and to set up my curtain 

10 21 for the pastor are becom brutish and have not sought the 
lord therefor they shall not prosper and all their flock shall be 
scatter 

10 22 behold the noi of the bruit is come and a great commot 
out of the north countri to make the citi of judah desol and a 
den of dragon 

10 23 o lord i know that the way of man is not in himself it is not 
in man that walketh to direct hi step 

10 24 o lord correct me but with judgment not in thine anger lest 
thou bring me to noth 

10 25 pour out thi furi upon the heathen that know thee not and upon 
the famili that call not on thi name for they have eaten up jacob 
and devour him and consum him and have made hi habit 
desol 

11 1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord say 11 2 hear ye 
the word of thi coven and speak unto the men of judah and to 
the inhabit of jerusalem 11 3 and say thou unto them thu saith 
the lord god of israel cur be the man that obeyeth not the word 
of thi coven 11 4 which i command your father in the day that 
i brought them forth out of the land of egypt from the iron furnac 
say obey my voic and do them accord to all which i command 
you so shall ye be my peopl and i will be your god 11 5 that i may 
perform the oath which i have sworn unto your father to give them a 
land flow with milk and honey a it is thi day then answer i 
and said so be it o lord 

11 6 then the lord said unto me proclaim all these word in the 
citi of judah and in the street of jerusalem say hear ye the 
word of thi coven and do them 

11 7 for i earnestli protest unto your father in the day that i 
brought them up out of the land of egypt even unto thi day rise 
earli and protest say obey my voic 

11 8 yet they obey not nor inclin their ear but walk everi one 
in the imagin of their evil heart therefor i will bring upon 
them all the word of thi coven which i command them to do but 
they did them not 

11 9 and the lord said unto me a conspiraci is found among the men of 
judah and among the inhabit of jerusalem 

11 10 they are turn back to the iniqu of their forefath 
which refu to hear my word and they went after other god to 
serv them the hou of israel and the hou of judah have broken my 
coven which i made with their father 

11 11 therefor thu saith the lord behold i will bring evil upon 
them which they shall not be abl to escap and though they shall 
cri unto me i will not hearken unto them 

11 12 then shall the citi of judah and inhabit of jerusalem go 
and cri unto the god unto whom they offer incen but they shall not 
save them at all in the time of their troubl 

11 13 for accord to the number of thi citi were thi god o 
judah and accord to the number of the street of jerusalem have ye 
set up altar to that shame thing even altar to burn incen unto 
baal 

11 14 therefor pray not thou for thi peopl neither lift up a cri 
or prayer for them for i will not hear them in the time that they cri 
unto me for their troubl 

11 15 what hath my belov to do in mine hou see she hath 
wrought lewd with mani and the holi flesh is pa from thee 
when thou doest evil then thou rejoicest 

11 16 the lord call thi name a green oliv tree fair and of 
goodli fruit with the noi of a great tumult he hath kindl fire 
upon it and the branch of it are broken 

11 17 for the lord of host that plant thee hath pronounc evil 
against thee for the evil of the hou of israel and of the hou of 
judah which they have done against themselv to provok me to anger 
in offer incen unto baal 

11 18 and the lord hath given me knowledg of it and i know it then 
thou shewedst me their do 

11 19 but i wa like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter 
and i knew not that they had devi devic against me say let 
u destroy the tree with the fruit thereof and let u cut him off 
from the land of the live that hi name may be no more rememb 

11 20 but o lord of host that judgest righteou that triest the 
rein and the heart let me see thi vengeanc on them for unto thee 
have i reveal my cau 

11 21 therefor thu saith the lord of the men of anathoth that seek 
thi life say prophesi not in the name of the lord that thou die 
not by our hand 11 22 therefor thu saith the lord of host behold 
i will punish them the young men shall die by the sword their son 
and their daughter shall die by famin 11 23 and there shall be no 
remnant of them for i will bring evil upon the men of anathoth even 
the year of their visit 

12 1 righteou art thou o lord when i plead with thee yet let me 
talk with thee of thi judgment wherefor doth the way of the wick 
prosper wherefor are all they happi that deal veri treacher 
12 2 thou hast plant them yea they have taken root they grow 
yea they bring forth fruit thou art near in their mouth and far 
from their rein 

12 3 but thou o lord knowest me thou hast seen me and tri mine 
heart toward thee pull them out like sheep for the slaughter and 
prepar them for the day of slaughter 

12 4 how long shall the land mourn and the herb of everi field 
wither for the wick of them that dwell therein the beast are 
consum and the bird becau they said he shall not see our last 
end 

12 5 if thou hast run with the footman and they have weari thee 
then how canst thou contend with hor and if in the land of peac 
wherein thou trustedst they weari thee then how wilt thou do in 
the swell of jordan 12 6 for even thi brother and the hou of 
thi father even they have dealt treacher with thee yea they 
have call a multitud after thee believ them not though they 
speak fair word unto thee 

12 7 i have forsaken mine hou i have left mine heritag i have 
given the dearli belov of my soul into the hand of her enemi 

12 8 mine heritag is unto me a a lion in the forest it crieth out 
against me therefor have i hate it 

12 9 mine heritag is unto me a a speckl bird the bird round 
about are against her come ye assembl all the beast of the field 
come to devour 

12 10 mani pastor have destroy my vineyard they have trodden my 
portion under foot they have made my pleasant portion a desol 
wilder 

12 11 they have made it desol and be desol it mourneth unto 
me the whole land is made desol becau no man layeth it to 
heart 

12 12 the spoiler are come upon all high place through the 
wilder for the sword of the lord shall devour from the one end of 
the land even to the other end of the land no flesh shall have peac 

12 13 they have sown wheat but shall reap thorn they have put 
themselv to pain but shall not profit and they shall be asham of 
your revenu becau of the fierc anger of the lord 

12 14 thu saith the lord against all mine evil neighbour that touch 
the inherit which i have cau my peopl israel to inherit 
behold i will pluck them out of their land and pluck out the hou 
of judah from among them 

12 15 and it shall come to pa after that i have pluck them out i 
will return and have compass on them and will bring them again 
everi man to hi heritag and everi man to hi land 

12 16 and it shall come to pa if they will dilig learn the 
way of my peopl to swear by my name the lord liveth a they 
taught my peopl to swear by baal then shall they be built in the 
midst of my peopl 

12 17 but if they will not obey i will utterli pluck up and destroy 
that nation saith the lord 

13 1 thu saith the lord unto me go and get thee a linen girdl and 
put it upon thi loin and put it not in water 

13 2 so i got a girdl accord to the word of the lord and put it 
on my loin 

13 3 and the word of the lord came unto me the second time say 
13 4 take the girdl that thou hast got which is upon thi loin and 
ari go to euphrat and hide it there in a hole of the rock 

13 5 so i went and hid it by euphrat a the lord command me 

13 6 and it came to pa after mani day that the lord said unto me 
ari go to euphrat and take the girdl from thenc which i 
command thee to hide there 

13 7 then i went to euphrat and dig and took the girdl from 
the place where i had hid it and behold the girdl wa mar it 
wa profit for noth 

13 8 then the word of the lord came unto me say 13 9 thu saith 
the lord after thi manner will i mar the pride of judah and the 
great pride of jerusalem 

13 10 thi evil peopl which refu to hear my word which walk in 
the imagin of their heart and walk after other god to serv 
them and to worship them shall even be a thi girdl which is good 
for noth 

13 11 for a the girdl cleaveth to the loin of a man so have i 
cau to cleav unto me the whole hou of israel and the whole hou 
of judah saith the lord that they might be unto me for a peopl and 
for a name and for a prai and for a glori but they would not 
hear 

13 12 therefor thou shalt speak unto them thi word thu saith the 
lord god of israel everi bottl shall be fill with wine and they 
shall say unto thee do we not certainli know that everi bottl shall 
be fill with wine 13 13 then shalt thou say unto them thu saith 
the lord behold i will fill all the inhabit of thi land even 
the king that sit upon david s throne and the priest and the 
prophet and all the inhabit of jerusalem with drunken 

13 14 and i will dash them one against anoth even the father and 
the son togeth saith the lord i will not piti nor spare nor 
have merci but destroy them 

13 15 hear ye and give ear be not proud for the lord hath spoken 

13 16 give glori to the lord your god befor he cau dark and 
befor your foot stumbl upon the dark mountain and while ye look 
for light he turn it into the shadow of death and make it gross 
dark 

13 17 but if ye will not hear it my soul shall weep in secret place 
for your pride and mine eye shall weep sore and run down with tear 
becau the lord s flock is carri away captiv 

13 18 say unto the king and to the queen humbl yourselv sit down 
for your princip shall come down even the crown of your glori 

13 19 the citi of the south shall be shut up and none shall open 
them judah shall be carri away captiv all of it it shall be 
wholli carri away captiv 

13 20 lift up your eye and behold them that come from the north 
where is the flock that wa given thee thi beauti flock 13 21 
what wilt thou say when he shall punish thee for thou hast taught 
them to be captain and a chief over thee shall not sorrow take 
thee a a woman in travail 13 22 and if thou say in thine heart 
wherefor come these thing upon me for the great of thine 
iniqu are thi skirt discov and thi heel made bare 

13 23 can the ethiopian chang hi skin or the leopard hi spot 
then may ye also do good that are accustom to do evil 

13 24 therefor will i scatter them a the stubbl that passeth away 
by the wind of the wilder 

13 25 thi is thi lot the portion of thi measur from me saith the 
lord becau thou hast forgotten me and trust in falsehood 

13 26 therefor will i discov thi skirt upon thi face that thi 
shame may appear 

13 27 i have seen thine adulteri and thi neigh the lewd of 
thi whoredom and thine abomin on the hill in the field woe 
unto thee o jerusalem wilt thou not be made clean when shall it 
onc be 14 1 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah concern 
the dearth 

14 2 judah mourneth and the gate thereof languish they are black 
unto the ground and the cri of jerusalem is gone up 

14 3 and their nobl have sent their littl one to the water they 
came to the pit and found no water they return with their vessel 
empti they were asham and confound and cover their head 

14 4 becau the ground is chapt for there wa no rain in the earth 
the plowman were asham they cover their head 

14 5 yea the hind also calv in the field and forsook it becau 
there wa no grass 

14 6 and the wild as did stand in the high place they snuf up 
the wind like dragon their eye did fail becau there wa no 
grass 

14 7 o lord though our iniqu testifi against u do thou it for 
thi name s sake for our backslid are mani we have sin against 
thee 

14 8 o the hope of israel the saviour thereof in time of troubl whi 
shouldest thou be a a stranger in the land and a a wayfar man 
that turneth asid to tarri for a night 14 9 whi shouldest thou be 
a a man astoni a a mighti man that cannot save yet thou o lord 
art in the midst of u and we are call by thi name leav u not 

14 10 thu saith the lord unto thi peopl thu have they love to 
wander they have not refrain their foot therefor the lord doth 
not accept them he will now rememb their iniqu and visit their 
sin 

14 11 then said the lord unto me pray not for thi peopl for their 
good 

14 12 when they fast i will not hear their cri and when they offer 
burnt offer and an oblat i will not accept them but i will 
consum them by the sword and by the famin and by the pestil 

14 13 then said i ah lord god behold the prophet say unto them 
ye shall not see the sword neither shall ye have famin but i will 
give you assur peac in thi place 

14 14 then the lord said unto me the prophet prophesi lie in my 
name i sent them not neither have i command them neither spake 
unto them they prophesi unto you a fal vision and divin and a 
thing of nought and the deceit of their heart 

14 15 therefor thu saith the lord concern the prophet that 
prophesi in my name and i sent them not yet they say sword and 
famin shall not be in thi land by sword and famin shall those 
prophet be consum 

14 16 and the peopl to whom they prophesi shall be cast out in the 
street of jerusalem becau of the famin and the sword and they 
shall have none to buri them them their wife nor their son nor 
their daughter for i will pour their wick upon them 

14 17 therefor thou shalt say thi word unto them let mine eye run 
down with tear night and day and let them not cea for the virgin 
daughter of my peopl is broken with a great breach with a veri 
grievou blow 

14 18 if i go forth into the field then behold the slain with the 
sword and if i enter into the citi then behold them that are sick 
with famin yea both the prophet and the priest go about into a 
land that they know not 

14 19 hast thou utterli reject judah hath thi soul loth zion whi 
hast thou smitten u and there is no heal for u we look for 
peac and there is no good and for the time of heal and behold 
troubl 14 20 we acknowledg o lord our wick and the 
iniqu of our father for we have sin against thee 

14 21 do not abhor u for thi name s sake do not disgrac the throne 
of thi glori rememb break not thi coven with u 

14 22 are there ani among the vaniti of the gentil that can cau 
rain or can the heaven give shower art not thou he o lord our 
god therefor we will wait upon thee for thou hast made all these 
thing 

15 1 then said the lord unto me though mose and samuel stood befor 
me yet my mind could not be toward thi peopl cast them out of my 
sight and let them go forth 

15 2 and it shall come to pa if they say unto thee whither shall 
we go forth then thou shalt tell them thu saith the lord such a 
are for death to death and such a are for the sword to the sword 
and such a are for the famin to the famin and such a are for the 
captiv to the captiv 

15 3 and i will appoint over them four kind saith the lord the 
sword to slay and the dog to tear and the fowl of the heaven and 
the beast of the earth to devour and destroy 

15 4 and i will cau them to be remov into all kingdom of the 
earth becau of manasseh the son of hezekiah king of judah for that 
which he did in jerusalem 

15 5 for who shall have piti upon thee o jerusalem or who shall 
bemoan thee or who shall go asid to ask how thou doest 15 6 thou 
hast forsaken me saith the lord thou art gone backward therefor 
will i stretch out my hand against thee and destroy thee i am weari 
with repent 

15 7 and i will fan them with a fan in the gate of the land i will 
bereav them of child i will destroy my peopl sinc they return 
not from their way 

15 8 their widow are increa to me abov the sand of the sea i 
have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler 
at noonday i have cau him to fall upon it suddenli and terror 
upon the citi 

15 9 she that hath born seven languisheth she hath given up the 
ghost her sun is gone down while it wa yet day she hath been 
asham and confound and the residu of them will i deliv to the 
sword befor their enemi saith the lord 

15 10 woe is me my mother that thou hast born me a man of strife 
and a man of content to the whole earth i have neither lent on 
usuri nor men have lent to me on usuri yet everi one of them doth 
cur me 

15 11 the lord said verili it shall be well with thi remnant verili 
i will cau the enemi to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in 
the time of afflict 

15 12 shall iron break the northern iron and the steel 15 13 thi 
substanc and thi treasur will i give to the spoil without price 
and that for all thi sin even in all thi border 

15 14 and i will make thee to pa with thine enemi into a land 
which thou knowest not for a fire is kindl in mine anger which 
shall burn upon you 

15 15 o lord thou knowest rememb me and visit me and reveng me 
of my persecutor take me not away in thi longsuff know that 
for thi sake i have suffer rebuk 

15 16 thi word were found and i did eat them and thi word wa unto 
me the joy and rejoic of mine heart for i am call by thi name o 
lord god of host 

15 17 i sat not in the assembl of the mocker nor rejoic i sat 
alon becau of thi hand for thou hast fill me with indign 

15 18 whi is my pain perpetu and my wound incur which refuseth 
to be heal wilt thou be altogeth unto me a a liar and a water 
that fail 15 19 therefor thu saith the lord if thou return then 
will i bring thee again and thou shalt stand befor me and if thou 
take forth the preciou from the vile thou shalt be a my mouth let 
them return unto thee but return not thou unto them 

15 20 and i will make thee unto thi peopl a fenc brasen wall and 
they shall fight against thee but they shall not prevail against 
thee for i am with thee to save thee and to deliv thee saith the 
lord 

15 21 and i will deliv thee out of the hand of the wick and i 
will redeem thee out of the hand of the terribl 

16 1 the word of the lord came also unto me say 16 2 thou shalt 
not take thee a wife neither shalt thou have son or daughter in 
thi place 

16 3 for thu saith the lord concern the son and concern the 
daughter that are born in thi place and concern their mother 
that bare them and concern their father that begat them in thi 
land 16 4 they shall die of grievou death they shall not be 
lament neither shall they be buri but they shall be a dung upon 
the face of the earth and they shall be consum by the sword and by 
famin and their carca shall be meat for the fowl of heaven and 
for the beast of the earth 

16 5 for thu saith the lord enter not into the hou of mourn 
neither go to lament nor bemoan them for i have taken away my peac 
from thi peopl saith the lord even lovingkind and merci 

16 6 both the great and the small shall die in thi land they shall 
not be buri neither shall men lament for them nor cut themselv 
nor make themselv bald for them 16 7 neither shall men tear 
themselv for them in mourn to comfort them for the dead neither 
shall men give them the cup of consol to drink for their father 
or for their mother 

16 8 thou shalt not also go into the hou of feast to sit with 
them to eat and to drink 

16 9 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel behold i 
will cau to cea out of thi place in your eye and in your day 
the voic of mirth and the voic of glad the voic of the 
bridegroom and the voic of the bride 

16 10 and it shall come to pa when thou shalt shew thi peopl all 
these word and they shall say unto thee wherefor hath the lord 
pronounc all thi great evil against u or what is our iniqu or 
what is our sin that we have commit against the lord our god 
16 11 then shalt thou say unto them becau your father have 
forsaken me saith the lord and have walk after other god and 
have serv them and have worship them and have forsaken me and 
have not kept my law 16 12 and ye have done wor than your father 
for behold ye walk everi one after the imagin of hi evil 
heart that they may not hearken unto me 16 13 therefor will i cast 
you out of thi land into a land that ye know not neither ye nor your 
father and there shall ye serv other god day and night where i 
will not shew you favour 

16 14 therefor behold the day come saith the lord that it shall 
no more be said the lord liveth that brought up the child of 
israel out of the land of egypt 16 15 but the lord liveth that 
brought up the child of israel from the land of the north and from 
all the land whither he had driven them and i will bring them again 
into their land that i gave unto their father 

16 16 behold i will send for mani fisher saith the lord and they 
shall fish them and after will i send for mani hunter and they 
shall hunt them from everi mountain and from everi hill and out of 
the hole of the rock 

16 17 for mine eye are upon all their way they are not hid from my 
face neither is their iniqu hid from mine eye 

16 18 and first i will recompen their iniqu and their sin doubl 
becau they have defil my land they have fill mine inherit 
with the carca of their detest and abomin thing 

16 19 o lord my strength and my fortress and my refug in the day 
of afflict the gentil shall come unto thee from the end of the 
earth and shall say sure our father have inherit lie vaniti 
and thing wherein there is no profit 

16 20 shall a man make god unto himself and they are no god 16 21 
therefor behold i will thi onc cau them to know i will cau 
them to know mine hand and my might and they shall know that my name 
is the lord 

17 1 the sin of judah is written with a pen of iron and with the 
point of a diamond it is graven upon the tabl of their heart and 
upon the horn of your altar 17 2 whilst their child rememb 
their altar and their grove by the green tree upon the high hill 

17 3 o my mountain in the field i will give thi substanc and all thi 
treasur to the spoil and thi high place for sin throughout all 
thi border 

17 4 and thou even thyself shalt discontinu from thine heritag 
that i gave thee and i will cau thee to serv thine enemi in the 
land which thou knowest not for ye have kindl a fire in mine anger 
which shall burn for ever 

17 5 thu saith the lord cur be the man that trusteth in man and 
maketh flesh hi arm and whose heart departeth from the lord 

17 6 for he shall be like the heath in the desert and shall not see 
when good cometh but shall inhabit the parch place in the 
wilder in a salt land and not inhabit 

17 7 bless is the man that trusteth in the lord and whose hope the 
lord is 

17 8 for he shall be a a tree plant by the water and that 
spreadeth out her root by the river and shall not see when heat 
cometh but her leaf shall be green and shall not be care in the 
year of drought neither shall cea from yield fruit 

17 9 the heart is deceit abov all thing and desper wick 
who can know it 17 10 i the lord search the heart i tri the rein 
even to give everi man accord to hi way and accord to the 
fruit of hi do 

17 11 a the partridg sitteth on egg and hatcheth them not so he 
that getteth rich and not by right shall leav them in the midst 
of hi day and at hi end shall be a fool 

17 12 a gloriou high throne from the begin is the place of our 
sanctuari 

17 13 o lord the hope of israel all that forsak thee shall be 
asham and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth 
becau they have forsaken the lord the fountain of live water 

17 14 heal me o lord and i shall be heal save me and i shall be 
save for thou art my prai 

17 15 behold they say unto me where is the word of the lord let it 
come now 

17 16 a for me i have not hasten from be a pastor to follow 
thee neither have i desir the woeful day thou knowest that which 
came out of my lip wa right befor thee 

17 17 be not a terror unto me thou art my hope in the day of evil 

17 18 let them be confound that persecut me but let not me be 
confound let them be dismay but let not me be dismay bring 
upon them the day of evil and destroy them with doubl destruct 

17 19 thu said the lord unto me go and stand in the gate of the 
child of the peopl wherebi the king of judah come in and by the 
which they go out and in all the gate of jerusalem 17 20 and say 
unto them hear ye the word of the lord ye king of judah and all 
judah and all the inhabit of jerusalem that enter in by these 
gate 17 21 thu saith the lord take heed to yourselv and bear no 
burden on the sabbath day nor bring it in by the gate of jerusalem 
17 22 neither carri forth a burden out of your hou on the sabbath 
day neither do ye ani work but hallow ye the sabbath day a i 
command your father 

17 23 but they obey not neither inclin their ear but made their 
neck stiff that they might not hear nor receiv instruct 

17 24 and it shall come to pa if ye dilig hearken unto me 
saith the lord to bring in no burden through the gate of thi citi 
on the sabbath day but hallow the sabbath day to do no work therein 
17 25 then shall there enter into the gate of thi citi king and 
princ sit upon the throne of david ride in chariot and on 
hor they and their princ the men of judah and the inhabit 
of jerusalem and thi citi shall remain for ever 

17 26 and they shall come from the citi of judah and from the 
place about jerusalem and from the land of benjamin and from the 
plain and from the mountain and from the south bring burnt 
offer and sacrif and meat offer and incen and 
bring sacrif of prai unto the hou of the lord 

17 27 but if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day 
and not to bear a burden even enter in at the gate of jerusalem 
on the sabbath day then will i kindl a fire in the gate thereof 
and it shall devour the palac of jerusalem and it shall not be 
quench 

18 1 the word which came to jeremiah from the lord say 18 2 
ari and go down to the potter s hou and there i will cau thee 
to hear my word 

18 3 then i went down to the potter s hou and behold he wrought a 
work on the wheel 

18 4 and the vessel that he made of clay wa mar in the hand of the 
potter so he made it again anoth vessel a seem good to the 
potter to make it 

18 5 then the word of the lord came to me say 18 6 o hou of 
israel cannot i do with you a thi potter saith the lord behold 
a the clay is in the potter s hand so are ye in mine hand o hou 
of israel 

18 7 at what instant i shall speak concern a nation and concern 
a kingdom to pluck up and to pull down and to destroy it 18 8 if 
that nation against whom i have pronounc turn from their evil i 
will repent of the evil that i thought to do unto them 

18 9 and at what instant i shall speak concern a nation and 
concern a kingdom to build and to plant it 18 10 if it do evil in 
my sight that it obey not my voic then i will repent of the good 
wherewith i said i would benefit them 

18 11 now therefor go to speak to the men of judah and to the 
inhabit of jerusalem say thu saith the lord behold i frame 
evil against you and devi a devic against you return ye now everi 
one from hi evil way and make your way and your do good 

18 12 and they said there is no hope but we will walk after our own 
devic and we will everi one do the imagin of hi evil heart 

18 13 therefor thu saith the lord ask ye now among the heathen who 
hath heard such thing the virgin of israel hath done a veri horribl 
thing 

18 14 will a man leav the snow of lebanon which cometh from the rock 
of the field or shall the cold flow water that come from anoth 
place be forsaken 18 15 becau my peopl hath forgotten me they 
have burn incen to vaniti and they have cau them to stumbl in 
their way from the ancient path to walk in path in a way not cast 
up 18 16 to make their land desol and a perpetu hiss everi 
one that passeth therebi shall be astonish and wag hi head 

18 17 i will scatter them a with an east wind befor the enemi i 
will shew them the back and not the face in the day of their 
calam 

18 18 then said they come and let u devi devic against jeremiah 
for the law shall not perish from the priest nor counsel from the 
wise nor the word from the prophet come and let u smite him with 
the tongu and let u not give heed to ani of hi word 

18 19 give heed to me o lord and hearken to the voic of them that 
contend with me 

18 20 shall evil be recompen for good for they have dig a pit 
for my soul rememb that i stood befor thee to speak good for them 
and to turn away thi wrath from them 

18 21 therefor deliv up their child to the famin and pour out 
their blood by the forc of the sword and let their wife be bereav 
of their child and be widow and let their men be put to death 
let their young men be slain by the sword in battl 

18 22 let a cri be heard from their hou when thou shalt bring a 
troop suddenli upon them for they have dig a pit to take me and 
hid snare for my foot 

18 23 yet lord thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me 
forgiv not their iniqu neither blot out their sin from thi sight 
but let them be overthrown befor thee deal thu with them in the 
time of thine anger 

19 1 thu saith the lord go and get a potter s earthen bottl and 
take of the ancient of the peopl and of the ancient of the 
priest 19 2 and go forth unto the valley of the son of hinnom which 
is by the entri of the east gate and proclaim there the word that i 
shall tell thee 19 3 and say hear ye the word of the lord o king 
of judah and inhabit of jerusalem thu saith the lord of host 
the god of israel behold i will bring evil upon thi place the 
which whosoev heareth hi ear shall tingl 

19 4 becau they have forsaken me and have estrang thi place and 
have burn incen in it unto other god whom neither they nor their 
father have known nor the king of judah and have fill thi place 
with the blood of innoc 19 5 they have built also the high place 
of baal to burn their son with fire for burnt offer unto baal 
which i command not nor spake it neither came it into my mind 
19 6 therefor behold the day come saith the lord that thi place 
shall no more be call tophet nor the valley of the son of hinnom 
but the valley of slaughter 

19 7 and i will make void the counsel of judah and jerusalem in thi 
place and i will cau them to fall by the sword befor their 
enemi and by the hand of them that seek their life and their 
carca will i give to be meat for the fowl of the heaven and for 
the beast of the earth 

19 8 and i will make thi citi desol and an hiss everi one 
that passeth therebi shall be astonish and hiss becau of all the 
plagu thereof 

19 9 and i will cau them to eat the flesh of their son and the 
flesh of their daughter and they shall eat everi one the flesh of 
hi friend in the sieg and strait wherewith their enemi and 
they that seek their life shall straiten them 

19 10 then shalt thou break the bottl in the sight of the men that go 
with thee 19 11 and shalt say unto them thu saith the lord of 
host even so will i break thi peopl and thi citi a one breaketh 
a potter s vessel that cannot be made whole again and they shall 
buri them in tophet till there be no place to buri 

19 12 thu will i do unto thi place saith the lord and to the 
inhabit thereof and even make thi citi a tophet 19 13 and the 
hou of jerusalem and the hou of the king of judah shall be 
defil a the place of tophet becau of all the hou upon whose 
roof they have burn incen unto all the host of heaven and have 
pour out drink offer unto other god 

19 14 then came jeremiah from tophet whither the lord had sent him to 
prophesi and he stood in the court of the lord s hou and said to 
all the peopl 19 15 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel 
behold i will bring upon thi citi and upon all her town all the 
evil that i have pronounc against it becau they have harden 
their neck that they might not hear my word 

20 1 now pashur the son of immer the priest who wa also chief 
governor in the hou of the lord heard that jeremiah prophesi 
these thing 

20 2 then pashur smote jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stock 
that were in the high gate of benjamin which wa by the hou of the 
lord 

20 3 and it came to pa on the morrow that pashur brought forth 
jeremiah out of the stock then said jeremiah unto him the lord hath 
not call thi name pashur but magormissabib 

20 4 for thu saith the lord behold i will make thee a terror to 
thyself and to all thi friend and they shall fall by the sword of 
their enemi and thine eye shall behold it and i will give all 
judah into the hand of the king of babylon and he shall carri them 
captiv into babylon and shall slay them with the sword 

20 5 moreov i will deliv all the strength of thi citi and all 
the labour thereof and all the preciou thing thereof and all the 
treasur of the king of judah will i give into the hand of their 
enemi which shall spoil them and take them and carri them to 
babylon 

20 6 and thou pashur and all that dwell in thine hou shall go into 
captiv and thou shalt come to babylon and there thou shalt die 
and shalt be buri there thou and all thi friend to whom thou 
hast prophesi lie 

20 7 o lord thou hast deceiv me and i wa deceiv thou art 
stronger than i and hast prevail i am in deri daili everi one 
mocketh me 

20 8 for sinc i spake i cri out i cri violenc and spoil 
becau the word of the lord wa made a reproach unto me and a 
deri daili 

20 9 then i said i will not make mention of him nor speak ani more 
in hi name but hi word wa in mine heart a a burn fire shut up 
in my bone and i wa weari with forbear and i could not stay 

20 10 for i heard the defam of mani fear on everi side report 
say they and we will report it all my familiar watch for my 
halt say peradventur he will be entic and we shall prevail 
against him and we shall take our reveng on him 

20 11 but the lord is with me a a mighti terribl one therefor my 
persecutor shall stumbl and they shall not prevail they shall be 
greatli asham for they shall not prosper their everlast 
confu shall never be forgotten 

20 12 but o lord of host that triest the righteou and seest the 
rein and the heart let me see thi vengeanc on them for unto thee 
have i open my cau 

20 13 sing unto the lord prai ye the lord for he hath deliv 
the soul of the poor from the hand of evildo 

20 14 cur be the day wherein i wa born let not the day wherein my 
mother bare me be bless 

20 15 cur be the man who brought tide to my father say a 
man child is born unto thee make him veri glad 

20 16 and let that man be a the citi which the lord overthrew and 
repent not and let him hear the cri in the morn and the 
shout at noontid 20 17 becau he slew me not from the womb or 
that my mother might have been my grave and her womb to be alway 
great with me 

20 18 wherefor came i forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow 
that my day should be consum with shame 21 1 the word which came 
unto jeremiah from the lord when king zedekiah sent unto him pashur 
the son of melchiah and zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest 
say 21 2 enquir i pray thee of the lord for u for 
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon maketh war against u if so be that 
the lord will deal with u accord to all hi wondrou work that 
he may go up from u 

21 3 then said jeremiah unto them thu shall ye say to zedekiah 21 4 
thu saith the lord god of israel behold i will turn back the 
weapon of war that are in your hand wherewith ye fight against the 
king of babylon and against the chaldean which besieg you without 
the wall and i will assembl them into the midst of thi citi 

21 5 and i myself will fight against you with an outstretch hand and 
with a strong arm even in anger and in furi and in great wrath 

21 6 and i will smite the inhabit of thi citi both man and 
beast they shall die of a great pestil 

21 7 and afterward saith the lord i will deliv zedekiah king of 
judah and hi servant and the peopl and such a are left in thi 
citi from the pestil from the sword and from the famin into 
the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and into the hand of their 
enemi and into the hand of those that seek their life and he shall 
smite them with the edg of the sword he shall not spare them 
neither have piti nor have merci 

21 8 and unto thi peopl thou shalt say thu saith the lord behold 
i set befor you the way of life and the way of death 

21 9 he that abideth in thi citi shall die by the sword and by the 
famin and by the pestil but he that goeth out and falleth to 
the chaldean that besieg you he shall live and hi life shall be 
unto him for a prey 

21 10 for i have set my face against thi citi for evil and not for 
good saith the lord it shall be given into the hand of the king of 
babylon and he shall burn it with fire 

21 11 and touch the hou of the king of judah say hear ye the 
word of the lord 21 12 o hou of david thu saith the lord execut 
judgment in the morn and deliv him that is spoil out of the 
hand of the oppressor lest my furi go out like fire and burn that 
none can quench it becau of the evil of your do 

21 13 behold i am against thee o inhabit of the valley and rock 
of the plain saith the lord which say who shall come down against 
u or who shall enter into our habit 21 14 but i will punish 
you accord to the fruit of your do saith the lord and i will 
kindl a fire in the forest thereof and it shall devour all thing 
round about it 

22 1 thu saith the lord go down to the hou of the king of judah 
and speak there thi word 22 2 and say hear the word of the lord o 
king of judah that sittest upon the throne of david thou and thi 
servant and thi peopl that enter in by these gate 22 3 thu saith 
the lord execut ye judgment and righteou and deliv the 
spoil out of the hand of the oppressor and do no wrong do no 
violenc to the stranger the fatherless nor the widow neither shed 
innoc blood in thi place 

22 4 for if ye do thi thing ind then shall there enter in by the 
gate of thi hou king sit upon the throne of david ride in 
chariot and on hor he and hi servant and hi peopl 

22 5 but if ye will not hear these word i swear by myself saith the 
lord that thi hou shall becom a desol 

22 6 for thu saith the lord unto the king s hou of judah thou art 
gilead unto me and the head of lebanon yet sure i will make thee a 
wilder and citi which are not inhabit 

22 7 and i will prepar destroy against thee everi one with hi 
weapon and they shall cut down thi choic cedar and cast them into 
the fire 

22 8 and mani nation shall pa by thi citi and they shall say 
everi man to hi neighbour wherefor hath the lord done thu unto 
thi great citi 22 9 then they shall answer becau they have 
forsaken the coven of the lord their god and worship other 
god and serv them 

22 10 weep ye not for the dead neither bemoan him but weep sore for 
him that goeth away for he shall return no more nor see hi nativ 
countri 

22 11 for thu saith the lord touch shallum the son of josiah king 
of judah which reign instead of josiah hi father which went forth 
out of thi place he shall not return thither ani more 22 12 but he 
shall die in the place whither they have led him captiv and shall 
see thi land no more 

22 13 woe unto him that buildeth hi hou by unright and hi 
chamber by wrong that useth hi neighbour s servic without wage 
and giveth him not for hi work 22 14 that saith i will build me a 
wide hou and larg chamber and cutteth him out window and it is 
ciel with cedar and paint with vermilion 

22 15 shalt thou reign becau thou closest thyself in cedar did not 
thi father eat and drink and do judgment and justic and then it wa 
well with him 22 16 he judg the cau of the poor and needi then 
it wa well with him wa not thi to know me saith the lord 

22 17 but thine eye and thine heart are not but for thi covet 
and for to shed innoc blood and for oppress and for violenc 
to do it 

22 18 therefor thu saith the lord concern jehoiakim the son of 
josiah king of judah they shall not lament for him say ah my 
brother or ah sister they shall not lament for him say ah 
lord or ah hi glori 22 19 he shall be buri with the burial of 
an a drawn and cast forth beyond the gate of jerusalem 

22 20 go up to lebanon and cri and lift up thi voic in bashan and 
cri from the passag for all thi lover are destroy 

22 21 i spake unto thee in thi prosper but thou saidst i will not 
hear thi hath been thi manner from thi youth that thou obeyedst not 
my voic 

22 22 the wind shall eat up all thi pastor and thi lover shall go 
into captiv sure then shalt thou be asham and confound for 
all thi wick 

22 23 o inhabit of lebanon that makest thi nest in the cedar how 
graciou shalt thou be when pang come upon thee the pain a of a 
woman in travail 22 24 a i live saith the lord though coniah the 
son of jehoiakim king of judah were the signet upon my right hand yet 
would i pluck thee thenc 22 25 and i will give thee into the hand of 
them that seek thi life and into the hand of them whose face thou 
fearest even into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and 
into the hand of the chaldean 

22 26 and i will cast thee out and thi mother that bare thee into 
anoth countri where ye were not born and there shall ye die 

22 27 but to the land whereunto they desir to return thither shall 
they not return 

22 28 is thi man coniah a despi broken idol is he a vessel 
wherein is no pleasur wherefor are they cast out he and hi seed 
and are cast into a land which they know not 22 29 o earth earth 
earth hear the word of the lord 

22 30 thu saith the lord write ye thi man childless a man that 
shall not prosper in hi day for no man of hi seed shall prosper 
sit upon the throne of david and rule ani more in judah 

23 1 woe be unto the pastor that destroy and scatter the sheep of my 
pastur saith the lord 

23 2 therefor thu saith the lord god of israel against the pastor 
that feed my peopl ye have scatter my flock and driven them away 
and have not visit them behold i will visit upon you the evil of 
your do saith the lord 

23 3 and i will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countri 
whither i have driven them and will bring them again to their fold 
and they shall be fruit and increa 

23 4 and i will set up shepherd over them which shall feed them and 
they shall fear no more nor be dismay neither shall they be 
lack saith the lord 

23 5 behold the day come saith the lord that i will rai unto 
david a righteou branch and a king shall reign and prosper and 
shall execut judgment and justic in the earth 

23 6 in hi day judah shall be save and israel shall dwell safe 
and thi is hi name wherebi he shall be call the lord our 
righteou 

23 7 therefor behold the day come saith the lord that they shall 
no more say the lord liveth which brought up the child of israel 
out of the land of egypt 23 8 but the lord liveth which brought up 
and which led the seed of the hou of israel out of the north 
countri and from all countri whither i had driven them and they 
shall dwell in their own land 

23 9 mine heart within me is broken becau of the prophet all my 
bone shake i am like a drunken man and like a man whom wine hath 
overcom becau of the lord and becau of the word of hi 
holi 

23 10 for the land is full of adult for becau of swear the 
land mourneth the pleasant place of the wilder are dri up and 
their cour is evil and their forc is not right 

23 11 for both prophet and priest are profan yea in my hou have i 
found their wick saith the lord 

23 12 wherefor their way shall be unto them a slipperi way in the 
dark they shall be driven on and fall therein for i will bring 
evil upon them even the year of their visit saith the lord 

23 13 and i have seen folli in the prophet of samaria they 
prophesi in baal and cau my peopl israel to err 

23 14 i have seen also in the prophet of jerusalem an horribl thing 
they commit adulteri and walk in lie they strengthen also the hand 
of evildo that none doth return from hi wick they are all 
of them unto me a sodom and the inhabit thereof a gomorrah 

23 15 therefor thu saith the lord of host concern the prophet 
behold i will feed them with wormwood and make them drink the water 
of gall for from the prophet of jerusalem is profan gone forth 
into all the land 

23 16 thu saith the lord of host hearken not unto the word of the 
prophet that prophesi unto you they make you vain they speak a 
vision of their own heart and not out of the mouth of the lord 

23 17 they say still unto them that despi me the lord hath said ye 
shall have peac and they say unto everi one that walketh after the 
imagin of hi own heart no evil shall come upon you 

23 18 for who hath stood in the counsel of the lord and hath 
perceiv and heard hi word who hath mark hi word and heard it 
23 19 behold a whirlwind of the lord is gone forth in furi even a 
grievou whirlwind it shall fall grievou upon the head of the 
wick 

23 20 the anger of the lord shall not return until he have execut 
and till he have perform the thought of hi heart in the latter 
day ye shall consid it perfectli 

23 21 i have not sent these prophet yet they ran i have not spoken 
to them yet they prophesi 

23 22 but if they had stood in my counsel and had cau my peopl to 
hear my word then they should have turn them from their evil way
