and from the evil of their do 

23 23 am i a god at hand saith the lord and not a god afar off 
23 24 can ani hide himself in secret place that i shall not see him 
saith the lord do not i fill heaven and earth saith the lord 

23 25 i have heard what the prophet said that prophesi lie in my 
name say i have dream i have dream 

23 26 how long shall thi be in the heart of the prophet that 
prophesi lie yea they are prophet of the deceit of their own 
heart 23 27 which think to cau my peopl to forget my name by their 
dream which they tell everi man to hi neighbour a their father 
have forgotten my name for baal 

23 28 the prophet that hath a dream let him tell a dream and he that 
hath my word let him speak my word faith what is the chaff to 
the wheat saith the lord 

23 29 is not my word like a a fire saith the lord and like a hammer 
that breaketh the rock in piec 23 30 therefor behold i am 
against the prophet saith the lord that steal my word everi one 
from hi neighbour 

23 31 behold i am against the prophet saith the lord that use 
their tongu and say he saith 

23 32 behold i am against them that prophesi fal dream saith the 
lord and do tell them and cau my peopl to err by their lie and 
by their light yet i sent them not nor command them therefor 
they shall not profit thi peopl at all saith the lord 

23 33 and when thi peopl or the prophet or a priest shall ask 
thee say what is the burden of the lord thou shalt then say unto 
them what burden i will even forsak you saith the lord 

23 34 and a for the prophet and the priest and the peopl that 
shall say the burden of the lord i will even punish that man and hi 
hou 

23 35 thu shall ye say everi one to hi neighbour and everi one to 
hi brother what hath the lord answer and what hath the lord 
spoken 23 36 and the burden of the lord shall ye mention no more 
for everi man s word shall be hi burden for ye have pervert the 
word of the live god of the lord of host our god 

23 37 thu shalt thou say to the prophet what hath the lord answer 
thee and what hath the lord spoken 23 38 but sinc ye say the 
burden of the lord therefor thu saith the lord becau ye say thi 
word the burden of the lord and i have sent unto you say ye 
shall not say the burden of the lord 23 39 therefor behold i 
even i will utterli forget you and i will forsak you and the citi 
that i gave you and your father and cast you out of my presenc 
23 40 and i will bring an everlast reproach upon you and a 
perpetu shame which shall not be forgotten 

24 1 the lord shew me and behold two basket of fig were set 
befor the templ of the lord after that nebuchadrezzar king of 
babylon had carri away captiv jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of 
judah and the princ of judah with the carpent and smith from 
jerusalem and had brought them to babylon 

24 2 one basket had veri good fig even like the fig that are first 
ripe and the other basket had veri naughti fig which could not be 
eaten they were so bad 

24 3 then said the lord unto me what seest thou jeremiah and i 
said fig the good fig veri good and the evil veri evil that 
cannot be eaten they are so evil 

24 4 again the word of the lord came unto me say 24 5 thu saith 
the lord the god of israel like these good fig so will i 
acknowledg them that are carri away captiv of judah whom i have 
sent out of thi place into the land of the chaldean for their good 

24 6 for i will set mine eye upon them for good and i will bring 
them again to thi land and i will build them and not pull them 
down and i will plant them and not pluck them up 

24 7 and i will give them an heart to know me that i am the lord and 
they shall be my peopl and i will be their god for they shall 
return unto me with their whole heart 

24 8 and a the evil fig which cannot be eaten they are so evil 
sure thu saith the lord so will i give zedekiah the king of judah 
and hi princ and the residu of jerusalem that remain in thi 
land and them that dwell in the land of egypt 24 9 and i will 
deliv them to be remov into all the kingdom of the earth for 
their hurt to be a reproach and a proverb a taunt and a cur in 
all place whither i shall drive them 

24 10 and i will send the sword the famin and the pestil among 
them till they be consum from off the land that i gave unto them 
and to their father 

25 1 the word that came to jeremiah concern all the peopl of judah 
in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of judah that 
wa the first year of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon 25 2 the which 
jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the peopl of judah and to all 
the inhabit of jerusalem say 25 3 from the thirteenth year of 
josiah the son of amon king of judah even unto thi day that is the 
three and twentieth year the word of the lord hath come unto me and 
i have spoken unto you rise earli and speak but ye have not 
hearken 

25 4 and the lord hath sent unto you all hi servant the prophet 
rise earli and send them but ye have not hearken nor inclin 
your ear to hear 

25 5 they said turn ye again now everi one from hi evil way and 
from the evil of your do and dwell in the land that the lord hath 
given unto you and to your father for ever and ever 25 6 and go not 
after other god to serv them and to worship them and provok me 
not to anger with the work of your hand and i will do you no hurt 

25 7 yet ye have not hearken unto me saith the lord that ye might 
provok me to anger with the work of your hand to your own hurt 

25 8 therefor thu saith the lord of host becau ye have not heard 
my word 25 9 behold i will send and take all the famili of the 
north saith the lord and nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon my 
servant and will bring them against thi land and against the 
inhabit thereof and against all these nation round about and 
will utterli destroy them and make them an astonish and an 
hiss and perpetu desol 

25 10 moreov i will take from them the voic of mirth and the voic 
of glad the voic of the bridegroom and the voic of the bride 
the sound of the millston and the light of the candl 

25 11 and thi whole land shall be a desol and an astonish 
and these nation shall serv the king of babylon seventi year 

25 12 and it shall come to pa when seventi year are accomplish 
that i will punish the king of babylon and that nation saith the 
lord for their iniqu and the land of the chaldean and will make 
it perpetu desol 

25 13 and i will bring upon that land all my word which i have 
pronounc against it even all that is written in thi book which 
jeremiah hath prophesi against all the nation 

25 14 for mani nation and great king shall serv themselv of them 
also and i will recompen them accord to their deed and 
accord to the work of their own hand 

25 15 for thu saith the lord god of israel unto me take the wine cup 
of thi furi at my hand and cau all the nation to whom i send 
thee to drink it 

25 16 and they shall drink and be move and be mad becau of the 
sword that i will send among them 

25 17 then took i the cup at the lord s hand and made all the nation 
to drink unto whom the lord had sent me 25 18 to wit jerusalem and 
the citi of judah and the king thereof and the princ thereof 
to make them a desol an astonish an hiss and a cur 
a it is thi day 25 19 pharaoh king of egypt and hi servant and 
hi princ and all hi peopl 25 20 and all the mingl peopl and 
all the king of the land of uz and all the king of the land of the 
philistin and ashkelon and azzah and ekron and the remnant of 
ashdod 25 21 edom and moab and the child of ammon 25 22 and all 
the king of tyru and all the king of zidon and the king of the 
isl which are beyond the sea 25 23 dedan and tema and buz and 
all that are in the utmost corner 25 24 and all the king of arabia 
and all the king of the mingl peopl that dwell in the desert 
25 25 and all the king of zimri and all the king of elam and all 
the king of the mede 25 26 and all the king of the north far and 
near one with anoth and all the kingdom of the world which are 
upon the face of the earth and the king of sheshach shall drink after 
them 

25 27 therefor thou shalt say unto them thu saith the lord of 
host the god of israel drink ye and be drunken and spue and 
fall and rise no more becau of the sword which i will send among 
you 

25 28 and it shall be if they refu to take the cup at thine hand to 
drink then shalt thou say unto them thu saith the lord of host ye 
shall certainli drink 

25 29 for lo i begin to bring evil on the citi which is call by my 
name and should ye be utterli unpunish ye shall not be unpunish 
for i will call for a sword upon all the inhabit of the earth 
saith the lord of host 

25 30 therefor prophesi thou against them all these word and say 
unto them the lord shall roar from on high and utter hi voic from 
hi holi habit he shall mightili roar upon hi habit he 
shall give a shout a they that tread the grape against all the 
inhabit of the earth 

25 31 a noi shall come even to the end of the earth for the lord 
hath a controversi with the nation he will plead with all flesh he 
will give them that are wick to the sword saith the lord 

25 32 thu saith the lord of host behold evil shall go forth from 
nation to nation and a great whirlwind shall be rai up from the 
coast of the earth 

25 33 and the slain of the lord shall be at that day from one end of 
the earth even unto the other end of the earth they shall not be 
lament neither gather nor buri they shall be dung upon the 
ground 

25 34 howl ye shepherd and cri and wallow yourselv in the ash 
ye princip of the flock for the day of your slaughter and of your 
disper are accomplish and ye shall fall like a pleasant 
vessel 

25 35 and the shepherd shall have no way to flee nor the princip 
of the flock to escap 

25 36 a voic of the cri of the shepherd and an howl of the 
princip of the flock shall be heard for the lord hath spoil 
their pastur 

25 37 and the peaceabl habit are cut down becau of the fierc 
anger of the lord 

25 38 he hath forsaken hi covert a the lion for their land is 
desol becau of the fierc of the oppressor and becau of 
hi fierc anger 

26 1 in the begin of the reign of jehoiakim the son of josiah king 
of judah came thi word from the lord say 26 2 thu saith the 
lord stand in the court of the lord s hou and speak unto all the 
citi of judah which come to worship in the lord s hou all the 
word that i command thee to speak unto them diminish not a word 
26 3 if so be they will hearken and turn everi man from hi evil way 
that i may repent me of the evil which i purpo to do unto them 
becau of the evil of their do 

26 4 and thou shalt say unto them thu saith the lord if ye will not 
hearken to me to walk in my law which i have set befor you 26 5 to 
hearken to the word of my servant the prophet whom i sent unto 
you both rise up earli and send them but ye have not 
hearken 26 6 then will i make thi hou like shiloh and will make 
thi citi a cur to all the nation of the earth 

26 7 so the priest and the prophet and all the peopl heard jeremiah 
speak these word in the hou of the lord 

26 8 now it came to pa when jeremiah had made an end of speak 
all that the lord had command him to speak unto all the peopl that 
the priest and the prophet and all the peopl took him say thou 
shalt sure die 

26 9 whi hast thou prophesi in the name of the lord say thi 
hou shall be like shiloh and thi citi shall be desol without an 
inhabit and all the peopl were gather against jeremiah in the 
hou of the lord 

26 10 when the princ of judah heard these thing then they came up 
from the king s hou unto the hou of the lord and sat down in the 
entri of the new gate of the lord s hou 

26 11 then spake the priest and the prophet unto the princ and to 
all the peopl say thi man is worthi to die for he hath 
prophesi against thi citi a ye have heard with your ear 

26 12 then spake jeremiah unto all the princ and to all the peopl 
say the lord sent me to prophesi against thi hou and against 
thi citi all the word that ye have heard 

26 13 therefor now amend your way and your do and obey the 
voic of the lord your god and the lord will repent him of the evil 
that he hath pronounc against you 

26 14 a for me behold i am in your hand do with me a seemeth good 
and meet unto you 

26 15 but know ye for certain that if ye put me to death ye shall 
sure bring innoc blood upon yourselv and upon thi citi and 
upon the inhabit thereof for of a truth the lord hath sent me 
unto you to speak all these word in your ear 

26 16 then said the princ and all the peopl unto the priest and to 
the prophet thi man is not worthi to die for he hath spoken to u 
in the name of the lord our god 

26 17 then rose up certain of the elder of the land and spake to all 
the assembl of the peopl say 26 18 micah the morasthit 
prophesi in the day of hezekiah king of judah and spake to all the 
peopl of judah say thu saith the lord of host zion shall be 
plow like a field and jerusalem shall becom heap and the 
mountain of the hou a the high place of a forest 

26 19 did hezekiah king of judah and all judah put him at all to 
death did he not fear the lord and besought the lord and the lord 
repent him of the evil which he had pronounc against them thu 
might we procur great evil against our soul 

26 20 and there wa also a man that prophesi in the name of the 
lord urijah the son of shemaiah of kirjathjearim who prophesi 
against thi citi and against thi land accord to all the word of 
jeremiah 

26 21 and when jehoiakim the king with all hi mighti men and all 
the princ heard hi word the king sought to put him to death but 
when urijah heard it he wa afraid and fled and went into egypt 
26 22 and jehoiakim the king sent men into egypt name elnathan the 
son of achbor and certain men with him into egypt 

26 23 and they fetch forth urijah out of egypt and brought him unto 
jehoiakim the king who slew him with the sword and cast hi dead 
bodi into the graf of the common peopl 

26 24 nevertheless the hand of ahikam the son of shaphan wa with 
jeremiah that they should not give him into the hand of the peopl to 
put him to death 

27 1 in the begin of the reign of jehoiakim the son of josiah king 
of judah came thi word unto jeremiah from the lord say 27 2 thu 
saith the lord to me make thee bond and yoke and put them upon thi 
neck 27 3 and send them to the king of edom and to the king of moab 
and to the king of the ammonit and to the king of tyru and to the 
king of zidon by the hand of the messeng which come to jerusalem 
unto zedekiah king of judah 27 4 and command them to say unto their 
master thu saith the lord of host the god of israel thu shall 
ye say unto your master 27 5 i have made the earth the man and the 
beast that are upon the ground by my great power and by my 
outstretch arm and have given it unto whom it seem meet unto me 

27 6 and now have i given all these land into the hand of 
nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon my servant and the beast of the 
field have i given him also to serv him 

27 7 and all nation shall serv him and hi son and hi son s son 
until the veri time of hi land come and then mani nation and great 
king shall serv themselv of him 

27 8 and it shall come to pa that the nation and kingdom which will 
not serv the same nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon and that will 
not put their neck under the yoke of the king of babylon that nation 
will i punish saith the lord with the sword and with the famin 
and with the pestil until i have consum them by hi hand 

27 9 therefor hearken not ye to your prophet nor to your divin 
nor to your dreamer nor to your enchant nor to your sorcer 
which speak unto you say ye shall not serv the king of babylon 
27 10 for they prophesi a lie unto you to remov you far from your 
land and that i should drive you out and ye should perish 

27 11 but the nation that bring their neck under the yoke of the king 
of babylon and serv him those will i let remain still in their own 
land saith the lord and they shall till it and dwell therein 

27 12 i spake also to zedekiah king of judah accord to all these 
word say bring your neck under the yoke of the king of babylon 
and serv him and hi peopl and live 

27 13 whi will ye die thou and thi peopl by the sword by the 
famin and by the pestil a the lord hath spoken against the 
nation that will not serv the king of babylon 27 14 therefor 
hearken not unto the word of the prophet that speak unto you 
say ye shall not serv the king of babylon for they prophesi a 
lie unto you 

27 15 for i have not sent them saith the lord yet they prophesi a 
lie in my name that i might drive you out and that ye might perish 
ye and the prophet that prophesi unto you 

27 16 also i spake to the priest and to all thi peopl say thu 
saith the lord hearken not to the word of your prophet that 
prophesi unto you say behold the vessel of the lord s hou 
shall now shortli be brought again from babylon for they prophesi a 
lie unto you 

27 17 hearken not unto them serv the king of babylon and live 
wherefor should thi citi be laid wast 27 18 but if they be 
prophet and if the word of the lord be with them let them now make 
intercess to the lord of host that the vessel which are left in 
the hou of the lord and in the hou of the king of judah and at 
jerusalem go not to babylon 

27 19 for thu saith the lord of host concern the pillar and 
concern the sea and concern the base and concern the 
residu of the vessel that remain in thi citi 

27 20 which nebuchadnezzar king of babylon took not when he carri 
away captiv jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of judah from 
jerusalem to babylon and all the nobl of judah and jerusalem 27 21 
yea thu saith the lord of host the god of israel concern the 
vessel that remain in the hou of the lord and in the hou of the 
king of judah and of jerusalem 27 22 they shall be carri to 
babylon and there shall they be until the day that i visit them 
saith the lord then will i bring them up and restor them to thi 
place 

28 1 and it came to pa the same year in the begin of the reign 
of zedekiah king of judah in the fourth year and in the fifth month 
that hananiah the son of azur the prophet which wa of gibeon spake 
unto me in the hou of the lord in the presenc of the priest and 
of all the peopl say 28 2 thu speaketh the lord of host the 
god of israel say i have broken the yoke of the king of babylon 

28 3 within two full year will i bring again into thi place all the 
vessel of the lord s hou that nebuchadnezzar king of babylon took 
away from thi place and carri them to babylon 28 4 and i will 
bring again to thi place jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of judah 
with all the captiv of judah that went into babylon saith the 
lord for i will break the yoke of the king of babylon 

28 5 then the prophet jeremiah said unto the prophet hananiah in the 
presenc of the priest and in the presenc of all the peopl that 
stood in the hou of the lord 28 6 even the prophet jeremiah said 
amen the lord do so the lord perform thi word which thou hast 
prophesi to bring again the vessel of the lord s hou and all 
that is carri away captiv from babylon into thi place 

28 7 nevertheless hear thou now thi word that i speak in thine ear 
and in the ear of all the peopl 28 8 the prophet that have been 
befor me and befor thee of old prophesi both against mani 
countri and against great kingdom of war and of evil and of 
pestil 

28 9 the prophet which prophesieth of peac when the word of the 
prophet shall come to pa then shall the prophet be known that the 
lord hath truli sent him 

28 10 then hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet 
jeremiah s neck and brake it 

28 11 and hananiah spake in the presenc of all the peopl say 
thu saith the lord even so will i break the yoke of nebuchadnezzar 
king of babylon from the neck of all nation within the space of two 
full year and the prophet jeremiah went hi way 

28 12 then the word of the lord came unto jeremiah the prophet after 
that hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the 
prophet jeremiah say 28 13 go and tell hananiah say thu 
saith the lord thou hast broken the yoke of wood but thou shalt 
make for them yoke of iron 

28 14 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel i have put 
a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nation that they may serv 
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon and they shall serv him and i have 
given him the beast of the field also 

28 15 then said the prophet jeremiah unto hananiah the prophet hear 
now hananiah the lord hath not sent thee but thou makest thi 
peopl to trust in a lie 

28 16 therefor thu saith the lord behold i will cast thee from off 
the face of the earth thi year thou shalt die becau thou hast 
taught rebellion against the lord 

28 17 so hananiah the prophet die the same year in the seventh month 

29 1 now these are the word of the letter that jeremiah the prophet 
sent from jerusalem unto the residu of the elder which were carri 
away captiv and to the priest and to the prophet and to all the 
peopl whom nebuchadnezzar had carri away captiv from jerusalem to 
babylon 29 2 after that jeconiah the king and the queen and the 
eunuch the princ of judah and jerusalem and the carpent and 
the smith were depart from jerusalem 29 3 by the hand of elasah 
the son of shaphan and gemariah the son of hilkiah whom zedekiah 
king of judah sent unto babylon to nebuchadnezzar king of babylon 
say 29 4 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel unto all 
that are carri away captiv whom i have cau to be carri away 
from jerusalem unto babylon 29 5 build ye hou and dwell in them 
and plant garden and eat the fruit of them 29 6 take ye wife and 
beget son and daughter and take wife for your son and give your 
daughter to husband that they may bear son and daughter that ye 
may be increa there and not diminish 

29 7 and seek the peac of the citi whither i have cau you to be 
carri away captiv and pray unto the lord for it for in the peac 
thereof shall ye have peac 

29 8 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel let not your 
prophet and your divin that be in the midst of you deceiv you 
neither hearken to your dream which ye cau to be dream 

29 9 for they prophesi fal unto you in my name i have not sent 
them saith the lord 

29 10 for thu saith the lord that after seventi year be 
accomplish at babylon i will visit you and perform my good word 
toward you in cau you to return to thi place 

29 11 for i know the thought that i think toward you saith the lord 
thought of peac and not of evil to give you an expect end 

29 12 then shall ye call upon me and ye shall go and pray unto me 
and i will hearken unto you 

29 13 and ye shall seek me and find me when ye shall search for me 
with all your heart 

29 14 and i will be found of you saith the lord and i will turn away 
your captiv and i will gather you from all the nation and from 
all the place whither i have driven you saith the lord and i will 
bring you again into the place whenc i cau you to be carri away 
captiv 

29 15 becau ye have said the lord hath rai u up prophet in 
babylon 29 16 know that thu saith the lord of the king that sitteth 
upon the throne of david and of all the peopl that dwelleth in thi 
citi and of your brother that are not gone forth with you into 
captiv 29 17 thu saith the lord of host behold i will send 
upon them the sword the famin and the pestil and will make 
them like vile fig that cannot be eaten they are so evil 

29 18 and i will persecut them with the sword with the famin and 
with the pestil and will deliv them to be remov to all the 
kingdom of the earth to be a cur and an astonish and an 
hiss and a reproach among all the nation whither i have driven 
them 29 19 becau they have not hearken to my word saith the 
lord which i sent unto them by my servant the prophet rise up 
earli and send them but ye would not hear saith the lord 

29 20 hear ye therefor the word of the lord all ye of the captiv 
whom i have sent from jerusalem to babylon 29 21 thu saith the lord 
of host the god of israel of ahab the son of kolaiah and of 
zedekiah the son of maaseiah which prophesi a lie unto you in my 
name behold i will deliv them into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king 
of babylon and he shall slay them befor your eye 29 22 and of them 
shall be taken up a cur by all the captiv of judah which are in 
babylon say the lord make thee like zedekiah and like ahab whom 
the king of babylon roast in the fire 29 23 becau they have 
commit villani in israel and have commit adulteri with their 
neighbour wife and have spoken lie word in my name which i 
have not command them even i know and am a wit saith the 
lord 

29 24 thu shalt thou also speak to shemaiah the nehelamit say 
29 25 thu speaketh the lord of host the god of israel say 
becau thou hast sent letter in thi name unto all the peopl that 
are at jerusalem and to zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest and 
to all the priest say 29 26 the lord hath made thee priest in 
the stead of jehoiada the priest that ye should be offic in the 
hou of the lord for everi man that is mad and maketh himself a 
prophet that thou shouldest put him in prison and in the stock 

29 27 now therefor whi hast thou not reprov jeremiah of anathoth 
which maketh himself a prophet to you 29 28 for therefor he sent 
unto u in babylon say thi captiv is long build ye hou 
and dwell in them and plant garden and eat the fruit of them 

29 29 and zephaniah the priest read thi letter in the ear of 
jeremiah the prophet 

29 30 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah say 29 31 send 
to all them of the captiv say thu saith the lord concern 
shemaiah the nehelamit becau that shemaiah hath prophesi unto 
you and i sent him not and he cau you to trust in a lie 29 32 
therefor thu saith the lord behold i will punish shemaiah the 
nehelamit and hi seed he shall not have a man to dwell among thi 
peopl neither shall he behold the good that i will do for my peopl 
saith the lord becau he hath taught rebellion against the lord 

30 1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord say 30 2 thu 
speaketh the lord god of israel say write thee all the word that 
i have spoken unto thee in a book 

30 3 for lo the day come saith the lord that i will bring again 
the captiv of my peopl israel and judah saith the lord and i 
will cau them to return to the land that i gave to their father 
and they shall po it 

30 4 and these are the word that the lord spake concern israel and 
concern judah 

30 5 for thu saith the lord we have heard a voic of trembl of 
fear and not of peac 

30 6 ask ye now and see whether a man doth travail with child 
wherefor do i see everi man with hi hand on hi loin a a woman 
in travail and all face are turn into pale 30 7 ala for 
that day is great so that none is like it it is even the time of 
jacob s troubl but he shall be save out of it 

30 8 for it shall come to pa in that day saith the lord of host 
that i will break hi yoke from off thi neck and will burst thi 
bond and stranger shall no more serv themselv of him 30 9 but 
they shall serv the lord their god and david their king whom i will 
rai up unto them 

30 10 therefor fear thou not o my servant jacob saith the lord 
neither be dismay o israel for lo i will save thee from afar 
and thi seed from the land of their captiv and jacob shall return 
and shall be in rest and be quiet and none shall make him afraid 

30 11 for i am with thee saith the lord to save thee though i make 
a full end of all nation whither i have scatter thee yet i will 
not make a full end of thee but i will correct thee in measur and 
will not leav thee altogeth unpunish 

30 12 for thu saith the lord thi brui is incur and thi wound 
is grievou 

30 13 there is none to plead thi cau that thou mayest be bound up 
thou hast no heal medicin 

30 14 all thi lover have forgotten thee they seek thee not for i 
have wound thee with the wound of an enemi with the chasti of 
a cruel one for the multitud of thine iniqu becau thi sin 
were increa 

30 15 whi criest thou for thine afflict thi sorrow is incur 
for the multitud of thine iniqu becau thi sin were increa 
i have done these thing unto thee 

30 16 therefor all they that devour thee shall be devour and all 
thine adversari everi one of them shall go into captiv and 
they that spoil thee shall be a spoil and all that prey upon thee 
will i give for a prey 

30 17 for i will restor health unto thee and i will heal thee of thi 
wound saith the lord becau they call thee an outcast say 
thi is zion whom no man seeketh after 

30 18 thu saith the lord behold i will bring again the captiv of 
jacob s tent and have merci on hi dwellingplac and the citi 
shall be build upon her own heap and the palac shall remain after 
the manner thereof 

30 19 and out of them shall proceed thanksgiv and the voic of them 
that make merri and i will multipli them and they shall not be few 
i will also glorifi them and they shall not be small 

30 20 their child also shall be a aforetim and their 
congreg shall be establish befor me and i will punish all 
that oppress them 

30 21 and their nobl shall be of themselv and their governor 
shall proceed from the midst of them and i will cau him to draw 
near and he shall approach unto me for who is thi that engag hi 
heart to approach unto me saith the lord 

30 22 and ye shall be my peopl and i will be your god 

30 23 behold the whirlwind of the lord goeth forth with furi a 
continu whirlwind it shall fall with pain upon the head of the 
wick 

30 24 the fierc anger of the lord shall not return until he hath 
done it and until he have perform the intent of hi heart in the 
latter day ye shall consid it 

31 1 at the same time saith the lord will i be the god of all the 
famili of israel and they shall be my peopl 

31 2 thu saith the lord the peopl which were left of the sword 
found grace in the wilder even israel when i went to cau him 
to rest 

31 3 the lord hath appear of old unto me say yea i have love 
thee with an everlast love therefor with lovingkind have i 
drawn thee 

31 4 again i will build thee and thou shalt be built o virgin of 
israel thou shalt again be adorn with thi tabret and shalt go 
forth in the danc of them that make merri 

31 5 thou shalt yet plant vine upon the mountain of samaria the 
planter shall plant and shall eat them a common thing 

31 6 for there shall be a day that the watchman upon the mount 
ephraim shall cri ari ye and let u go up to zion unto the lord 
our god 

31 7 for thu saith the lord sing with glad for jacob and shout 
among the chief of the nation publish ye prai ye and say o 
lord save thi peopl the remnant of israel 

31 8 behold i will bring them from the north countri and gather them 
from the coast of the earth and with them the blind and the lame 
the woman with child and her that travaileth with child togeth a 
great compani shall return thither 

31 9 they shall come with weep and with supplic will i lead 
them i will cau them to walk by the river of water in a straight 
way wherein they shall not stumbl for i am a father to israel and 
ephraim is my firstborn 

31 10 hear the word of the lord o ye nation and declar it in the 
isl afar off and say he that scatter israel will gather him and 
keep him a a shepherd doth hi flock 

31 11 for the lord hath redeem jacob and ransom him from the hand 
of him that wa stronger than he 

31 12 therefor they shall come and sing in the height of zion and 
shall flow togeth to the good of the lord for wheat and for 
wine and for oil and for the young of the flock and of the herd and 
their soul shall be a a water garden and they shall not sorrow ani 
more at all 

31 13 then shall the virgin rejoic in the danc both young men and 
old togeth for i will turn their mourn into joy and will 
comfort them and make them rejoic from their sorrow 

31 14 and i will satiat the soul of the priest with fat and my 
peopl shall be satisfi with my good saith the lord 

31 15 thu saith the lord a voic wa heard in ramah lament 
and bitter weep rahel weep for her child refu to be 
comfort for her child becau they were not 

31 16 thu saith the lord refrain thi voic from weep and thine 
eye from tear for thi work shall be reward saith the lord and 
they shall come again from the land of the enemi 

31 17 and there is hope in thine end saith the lord that thi 
child shall come again to their own border 

31 18 i have sure heard ephraim bemoan himself thu thou hast 
chasti me and i wa chasti a a bullock unaccustom to the 
yoke turn thou me and i shall be turn for thou art the lord my 
god 

31 19 sure after that i wa turn i repent and after that i wa 
instruct i smote upon my thigh i wa asham yea even 
confound becau i did bear the reproach of my youth 

31 20 is ephraim my dear son is he a pleasant child for sinc i 
spake against him i do earnestli rememb him still therefor my 
bowel are troubl for him i will sure have merci upon him saith 
the lord 

31 21 set thee up waymark make thee high heap set thine heart 
toward the highway even the way which thou wentest turn again o 
virgin of israel turn again to these thi citi 

31 22 how long wilt thou go about o thou backslid daughter for 
the lord hath creat a new thing in the earth a woman shall compass 
a man 

31 23 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel a yet they 
shall use thi speech in the land of judah and in the citi thereof 
when i shall bring again their captiv the lord bless thee o 
habit of justic and mountain of holi 

31 24 and there shall dwell in judah itself and in all the citi 
thereof togeth husbandman and they that go forth with flock 

31 25 for i have satiat the weari soul and i have replenish everi 
sorrow soul 

31 26 upon thi i awak and beheld and my sleep wa sweet unto me 

31 27 behold the day come saith the lord that i will sow the hou 
of israel and the hou of judah with the seed of man and with the 
seed of beast 

31 28 and it shall come to pa that like a i have watch over 
them to pluck up and to break down and to throw down and to 
destroy and to afflict so will i watch over them to build and to 
plant saith the lord 

31 29 in those day they shall say no more the father have eaten a 
sour grape and the child s teeth are set on edg 

31 30 but everi one shall die for hi own iniqu everi man that 
eateth the sour grape hi teeth shall be set on edg 

31 31 behold the day come saith the lord that i will make a new 
coven with the hou of israel and with the hou of judah 31 32 
not accord to the coven that i made with their father in the 
day that i took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of 
egypt which my coven they brake although i wa an husband unto 
them saith the lord 31 33 but thi shall be the coven that i will 
make with the hou of israel after those day saith the lord i 
will put my law in their inward part and write it in their heart 
and will be their god and they shall be my peopl 

31 34 and they shall teach no more everi man hi neighbour and everi 
man hi brother say know the lord for they shall all know me 
from the least of them unto the greatest of them saith the lord for 
i will forgiv their iniqu and i will rememb their sin no more 

31 35 thu saith the lord which giveth the sun for a light by day 
and the ordin of the moon and of the star for a light by night 
which divideth the sea when the wave thereof roar the lord of host 
is hi name 31 36 if those ordin depart from befor me saith 
the lord then the seed of israel also shall cea from be a nation 
befor me for ever 

31 37 thu saith the lord if heaven abov can be measur and the 
foundat of the earth search out beneath i will also cast off 
all the seed of israel for all that they have done saith the lord 

31 38 behold the day come saith the lord that the citi shall be 
built to the lord from the tower of hananeel unto the gate of the 
corner 

31 39 and the measur line shall yet go forth over against it upon 
the hill gareb and shall compass about to goath 

31 40 and the whole valley of the dead bodi and of the ash and 
all the field unto the brook of kidron unto the corner of the hor 
gate toward the east shall be holi unto the lord it shall not be 
pluck up nor thrown down ani more for ever 

32 1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord in the tenth year of 
zedekiah king of judah which wa the eighteenth year of 
nebuchadrezzar 

32 2 for then the king of babylon s armi besieg jerusalem and 
jeremiah the prophet wa shut up in the court of the prison which wa 
in the king of judah s hou 

32 3 for zedekiah king of judah had shut him up say wherefor 
dost thou prophesi and say thu saith the lord behold i will give 
thi citi into the hand of the king of babylon and he shall take it 
32 4 and zedekiah king of judah shall not escap out of the hand of 
the chaldean but shall sure be deliv into the hand of the king 
of babylon and shall speak with him mouth to mouth and hi eye 
shall behold hi eye 32 5 and he shall lead zedekiah to babylon and 
there shall he be until i visit him saith the lord though ye fight 
with the chaldean ye shall not prosper 

32 6 and jeremiah said the word of the lord came unto me say 
32 7 behold hanameel the son of shallum thine uncl shall come unto 
thee say buy thee my field that is in anathoth for the right of 
redempt is thine to buy it 

32 8 so hanameel mine uncl s son came to me in the court of the 
prison accord to the word of the lord and said unto me buy my 
field i pray thee that is in anathoth which is in the countri of 
benjamin for the right of inherit is thine and the redempt is 
thine buy it for thyself 

then i knew that thi wa the word of the lord 

32 9 and i bought the field of hanameel my uncl s son that wa in 
anathoth and weigh him the money even seventeen shekel of silver 

32 10 and i subscrib the evid and seal it and took 
wit and weigh him the money in the balanc 

32 11 so i took the evid of the purcha both that which wa 
seal accord to the law and custom and that which wa open 32 12 
and i gave the evid of the purcha unto baruch the son of neriah 
the son of maaseiah in the sight of hanameel mine uncl s son and in 
the presenc of the wit that subscrib the book of the 
purcha befor all the jew that sat in the court of the prison 

32 13 and i charg baruch befor them say 32 14 thu saith the 
lord of host the god of israel take these evid thi evid 
of the purcha both which is seal and thi evid which is 
open and put them in an earthen vessel that they may continu mani 
day 

32 15 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel hou and 
field and vineyard shall be poss again in thi land 

32 16 now when i had deliv the evid of the purcha unto 
baruch the son of neriah i pray unto the lord say 32 17 ah 
lord god behold thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thi great 
power and stretch out arm and there is noth too hard for thee 
32 18 thou shewest lovingkind unto thousand and recompensest the 
iniqu of the father into the bosom of their child after them 
the great the mighti god the lord of host is hi name 32 19 great 
in counsel and mighti in work for thine eye are open upon all the 
way of the son of men to give everi one accord to hi way and 
accord to the fruit of hi do 32 20 which hast set sign and 
wonder in the land of egypt even unto thi day and in israel and 
among other men and hast made thee a name a at thi day 32 21 and 
hast brought forth thi peopl israel out of the land of egypt with 
sign and with wonder and with a strong hand and with a stretch 
out arm and with great terror 32 22 and hast given them thi land 
which thou didst swear to their father to give them a land flow 
with milk and honey 32 23 and they came in and poss it but 
they obey not thi voic neither walk in thi law they have done 
noth of all that thou commandedst them to do therefor thou hast 
cau all thi evil to come upon them 32 24 behold the mount they 
are come unto the citi to take it and the citi is given into the hand 
of the chaldean that fight against it becau of the sword and of 
the famin and of the pestil and what thou hast spoken is come 
to pa and behold thou seest it 

32 25 and thou hast said unto me o lord god buy thee the field for 
money and take wit for the citi is given into the hand of the 
chaldean 

32 26 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah say 32 27 
behold i am the lord the god of all flesh is there ani thing too 
hard for me 32 28 therefor thu saith the lord behold i will give 
thi citi into the hand of the chaldean and into the hand of 
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and he shall take it 32 29 and the 
chaldean that fight against thi citi shall come and set fire on 
thi citi and burn it with the hou upon whose roof they have 
offer incen unto baal and pour out drink offer unto other 
god to provok me to anger 

32 30 for the child of israel and the child of judah have onli 
done evil befor me from their youth for the child of israel have 
onli provok me to anger with the work of their hand saith the 
lord 

32 31 for thi citi hath been to me a a provoc of mine anger and 
of my furi from the day that they built it even unto thi day that i 
should remov it from befor my face 32 32 becau of all the evil of 
the child of israel and of the child of judah which they have 
done to provok me to anger they their king their princ their 
priest and their prophet and the men of judah and the inhabit 
of jerusalem 

32 33 and they have turn unto me the back and not the face though 
i taught them rise up earli and teach them yet they have not 
hearken to receiv instruct 

32 34 but they set their abomin in the hou which is call by 
my name to defil it 

32 35 and they built the high place of baal which are in the valley 
of the son of hinnom to cau their son and their daughter to pa 
through the fire unto molech which i command them not neither came 
it into my mind that they should do thi abomin to cau judah 
to sin 

32 36 and now therefor thu saith the lord the god of israel 
concern thi citi whereof ye say it shall be deliv into the 
hand of the king of babylon by the sword and by the famin and by 
the pestil 32 37 behold i will gather them out of all countri 
whither i have driven them in mine anger and in my furi and in great 
wrath and i will bring them again unto thi place and i will cau 
them to dwell safe 32 38 and they shall be my peopl and i will be 
their god 32 39 and i will give them one heart and one way that 
they may fear me for ever for the good of them and of their child 
after them 32 40 and i will make an everlast coven with them 
that i will not turn away from them to do them good but i will put 
my fear in their heart that they shall not depart from me 

32 41 yea i will rejoic over them to do them good and i will plant 
them in thi land assuredli with my whole heart and with my whole 
soul 

32 42 for thu saith the lord like a i have brought all thi great 
evil upon thi peopl so will i bring upon them all the good that i 
have promi them 

32 43 and field shall be bought in thi land whereof ye say it is 
desol without man or beast it is given into the hand of the 
chaldean 

32 44 men shall buy field for money and subscrib evid and 
seal them and take wit in the land of benjamin and in the 
place about jerusalem and in the citi of judah and in the citi 
of the mountain and in the citi of the valley and in the citi 
of the south for i will cau their captiv to return saith the 
lord 

33 1 moreov the word of the lord came unto jeremiah the second time 
while he wa yet shut up in the court of the prison say 33 2 thu 
saith the lord the maker thereof the lord that form it to 
establish it the lord is hi name 33 3 call unto me and i will 
answer thee and shew thee great and mighti thing which thou knowest 
not 

33 4 for thu saith the lord the god of israel concern the hou 
of thi citi and concern the hou of the king of judah which 
are thrown down by the mount and by the sword 33 5 they come to 
fight with the chaldean but it is to fill them with the dead bodi 
of men whom i have slain in mine anger and in my furi and for all 
whose wick i have hid my face from thi citi 

33 6 behold i will bring it health and cure and i will cure them 
and will reveal unto them the abund of peac and truth 

33 7 and i will cau the captiv of judah and the captiv of 
israel to return and will build them a at the first 

33 8 and i will clean them from all their iniqu wherebi they 
have sin against me and i will pardon all their iniqu 
wherebi they have sin and wherebi they have transgress against 
me 

33 9 and it shall be to me a name of joy a prai and an honour 
befor all the nation of the earth which shall hear all the good 
that i do unto them and they shall fear and trembl for all the 
good and for all the prosper that i procur unto it 

33 10 thu saith the lord again there shall be heard in thi place 
which ye say shall be desol without man and without beast even in 
the citi of judah and in the street of jerusalem that are 
desol without man and without inhabit and without beast 
33 11 the voic of joy and the voic of glad the voic of the 
bridegroom and the voic of the bride the voic of them that shall 
say prai the lord of host for the lord is good for hi merci 
endureth for ever and of them that shall bring the sacrif of 
prai into the hou of the lord for i will cau to return the 
captiv of the land a at the first saith the lord 

33 12 thu saith the lord of host again in thi place which is 
desol without man and without beast and in all the citi thereof 
shall be an habit of shepherd cau their flock to lie down 

33 13 in the citi of the mountain in the citi of the vale and 
in the citi of the south and in the land of benjamin and in the 
place about jerusalem and in the citi of judah shall the flock 
pa again under the hand of him that telleth them saith the lord 

33 14 behold the day come saith the lord that i will perform that 
good thing which i have promi unto the hou of israel and to the 
hou of judah 

33 15 in those day and at that time will i cau the branch of 
righteou to grow up unto david and he shall execut judgment and 
righteou in the land 

33 16 in those day shall judah be save and jerusalem shall dwell 
safe and thi is the name wherewith she shall be call the lord 
our righteou 

33 17 for thu saith the lord david shall never want a man to sit 
upon the throne of the hou of israel 33 18 neither shall the 
priest the levit want a man befor me to offer burnt offer and 
to kindl meat offer and to do sacrif continu 

33 19 and the word of the lord came unto jeremiah say 33 20 thu 
saith the lord if ye can break my coven of the day and my 
coven of the night and that there should not be day and night in 
their season 33 21 then may also my coven be broken with david my 
servant that he should not have a son to reign upon hi throne and 
with the levit the priest my minist 

33 22 a the host of heaven cannot be number neither the sand of 
the sea measur so will i multipli the seed of david my servant and 
the levit that minist unto me 

33 23 moreov the word of the lord came to jeremiah say 33 24 
considerest thou not what thi peopl have spoken say the two 
famili which the lord hath chosen he hath even cast them off thu 
they have despi my peopl that they should be no more a nation 
befor them 

33 25 thu saith the lord if my coven be not with day and night 
and if i have not appoint the ordin of heaven and earth 33 26 
then will i cast away the seed of jacob and david my servant so that 
i will not take ani of hi seed to be ruler over the seed of abraham 
isaac and jacob for i will cau their captiv to return and have 
merci on them 

34 1 the word which came unto jeremiah from the lord when 
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon and all hi armi and all the kingdom 
of the earth of hi dominion and all the peopl fought against 
jerusalem and against all the citi thereof say 34 2 thu saith 
the lord the god of israel go and speak to zedekiah king of judah 
and tell him thu saith the lord behold i will give thi citi into 
the hand of the king of babylon and he shall burn it with fire 34 3 
and thou shalt not escap out of hi hand but shalt sure be taken 
and deliv into hi hand and thine eye shall behold the eye of 
the king of babylon and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth and 
thou shalt go to babylon 

34 4 yet hear the word of the lord o zedekiah king of judah thu 
saith the lord of thee thou shalt not die by the sword 34 5 but thou 
shalt die in peac and with the burn of thi father the former 
king which were befor thee so shall they burn odour for thee and 
they will lament thee say ah lord for i have pronounc the 
word saith the lord 

34 6 then jeremiah the prophet spake all these word unto zedekiah 
king of judah in jerusalem 34 7 when the king of babylon s armi 
fought against jerusalem and against all the citi of judah that 
were left against lachish and against azekah for these defenc 
citi remain of the citi of judah 

34 8 thi is the word that came unto jeremiah from the lord after 
that the king zedekiah had made a coven with all the peopl which 
were at jerusalem to proclaim liberti unto them 34 9 that everi man 
should let hi manserv and everi man hi maidserv be an 
hebrew or an hebrewess go free that none should serv himself of 
them to wit of a jew hi brother 

34 10 now when all the princ and all the peopl which had enter 
into the coven heard that everi one should let hi manserv and 
everi one hi maidserv go free that none should serv themselv 
of them ani more then they obey and let them go 

34 11 but afterward they turn and cau the servant and the 
handmaid whom they had let go free to return and brought them into 
subject for servant and for handmaid 

34 12 therefor the word of the lord came to jeremiah from the lord 
say 34 13 thu saith the lord the god of israel i made a 
coven with your father in the day that i brought them forth out of 
the land of egypt out of the hou of bondman say 34 14 at the 
end of seven year let ye go everi man hi brother an hebrew which 
hath been sold unto thee and when he hath serv thee six year thou 
shalt let him go free from thee but your father hearken not unto 
me neither inclin their ear 

34 15 and ye were now turn and had done right in my sight in 
proclaim liberti everi man to hi neighbour and ye had made a 
coven befor me in the hou which is call by my name 34 16 but 
ye turn and pollut my name and cau everi man hi servant and 
everi man hi handmaid whom ye had set at liberti at their pleasur 
to return and brought them into subject to be unto you for 
servant and for handmaid 

34 17 therefor thu saith the lord ye have not hearken unto me in 
proclaim liberti everi one to hi brother and everi man to hi 
neighbour behold i proclaim a liberti for you saith the lord to 
the sword to the pestil and to the famin and i will make you 
to be remov into all the kingdom of the earth 

34 18 and i will give the men that have transgress my coven 
which have not perform the word of the coven which they had made 
befor me when they cut the calf in twain and pa between the 
part thereof 34 19 the princ of judah and the princ of 
jerusalem the eunuch and the priest and all the peopl of the 
land which pa between the part of the calf 34 20 i will even 
give them into the hand of their enemi and into the hand of them 
that seek their life and their dead bodi shall be for meat unto the 
fowl of the heaven and to the beast of the earth 

34 21 and zedekiah king of judah and hi princ will i give into the 
hand of their enemi and into the hand of them that seek their life 
and into the hand of the king of babylon s armi which are gone up 
from you 

34 22 behold i will command saith the lord and cau them to return 
to thi citi and they shall fight against it and take it and burn 
it with fire and i will make the citi of judah a desol without 
an inhabit 

35 1 the word which came unto jeremiah from the lord in the day of 
jehoiakim the son of josiah king of judah say 35 2 go unto the 
hou of the rechabit and speak unto them and bring them into the 
hou of the lord into one of the chamber and give them wine to 
drink 

35 3 then i took jaazaniah the son of jeremiah the son of habaziniah 
and hi brother and all hi son and the whole hou of the 
rechabit 35 4 and i brought them into the hou of the lord into 
the chamber of the son of hanan the son of igdaliah a man of god 
which wa by the chamber of the princ which wa abov the chamber 
of maaseiah the son of shallum the keeper of the door 35 5 and i set 
befor the son of the hou of the rechabit pot full of wine and 
cup and i said unto them drink ye wine 

35 6 but they said we will drink no wine for jonadab the son of 
rechab our father command u say ye shall drink no wine 
neither ye nor your son for ever 35 7 neither shall ye build hou 
nor sow seed nor plant vineyard nor have ani but all your day ye 
shall dwell in tent that ye may live mani day in the land where ye 
be stranger 

35 8 thu have we obey the voic of jonadab the son of rechab our 
father in all that he hath charg u to drink no wine all our day 
we our wife our son nor our daughter 35 9 nor to build hou 
for u to dwell in neither have we vineyard nor field nor seed 
35 10 but we have dwelt in tent and have obey and done accord 
to all that jonadab our father command u 

35 11 but it came to pa when nebuchadrezzar king of babylon came up 
into the land that we said come and let u go to jerusalem for fear 
of the armi of the chaldean and for fear of the armi of the syrian 
so we dwell at jerusalem 

35 12 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah say 35 13 thu 
saith the lord of host the god of israel go and tell the men of 
judah and the inhabit of jerusalem will ye not receiv 
instruct to hearken to my word saith the lord 

35 14 the word of jonadab the son of rechab that he command hi 
son not to drink wine are perform for unto thi day they drink 
none but obey their father s command notwithstand i have 
spoken unto you rise earli and speak but ye hearken not unto 
me 

35 15 i have sent also unto you all my servant the prophet rise 
up earli and send them say return ye now everi man from hi 
evil way and amend your do and go not after other god to serv 
them and ye shall dwell in the land which i have given to you and to 
your father but ye have not inclin your ear nor hearken unto 
me 

35 16 becau the son of jonadab the son of rechab have perform the 
command of their father which he command them but thi peopl 
hath not hearken unto me 35 17 therefor thu saith the lord god of 
host the god of israel behold i will bring upon judah and upon all 
the inhabit of jerusalem all the evil that i have pronounc 
against them becau i have spoken unto them but they have not 
heard and i have call unto them but they have not answer 

35 18 and jeremiah said unto the hou of the rechabit thu saith 
the lord of host the god of israel becau ye have obey the 
command of jonadab your father and kept all hi precept and 
done accord unto all that he hath command you 35 19 therefor 
thu saith the lord of host the god of israel jonadab the son of 
rechab shall not want a man to stand befor me for ever 

36 1 and it came to pa in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of 
josiah king of judah that thi word came unto jeremiah from the lord 
say 36 2 take thee a roll of a book and write therein all the 
word that i have spoken unto thee against israel and against judah 
and against all the nation from the day i spake unto thee from the 
day of josiah even unto thi day 

36 3 it may be that the hou of judah will hear all the evil which i 
purpo to do unto them that they may return everi man from hi evil 
way that i may forgiv their iniqu and their sin 

36 4 then jeremiah call baruch the son of neriah and baruch wrote 
from the mouth of jeremiah all the word of the lord which he had 
spoken unto him upon a roll of a book 

36 5 and jeremiah command baruch say i am shut up i cannot go 
into the hou of the lord 36 6 therefor go thou and read in the 
roll which thou hast written from my mouth the word of the lord in 
the ear of the peopl in the lord s hou upon the fast day and 
also thou shalt read them in the ear of all judah that come out of 
their citi 

36 7 it may be they will present their supplic befor the lord 
and will return everi one from hi evil way for great is the anger 
and the furi that the lord hath pronounc against thi peopl 

36 8 and baruch the son of neriah did accord to all that jeremiah 
the prophet command him read in the book the word of the lord 
in the lord s hou 

36 9 and it came to pa in the fifth year of jehoiakim the son of 
josiah king of judah in the ninth month that they proclaim a fast 
befor the lord to all the peopl in jerusalem and to all the peopl 
that came from the citi of judah unto jerusalem 

36 10 then read baruch in the book the word of jeremiah in the hou 
of the lord in the chamber of gemariah the son of shaphan the scribe 
in the higher court at the entri of the new gate of the lord s hou 
in the ear of all the peopl 

36 11 when michaiah the son of gemariah the son of shaphan had heard 
out of the book all the word of the lord 36 12 then he went down 
into the king s hou into the scribe s chamber and lo all the 
princ sat there even elishama the scribe and delaiah the son of 
shemaiah and elnathan the son of achbor and gemariah the son of 
shaphan and zedekiah the son of hananiah and all the princ 

36 13 then michaiah declar unto them all the word that he had 
heard when baruch read the book in the ear of the peopl 

36 14 therefor all the princ sent jehudi the son of nethaniah the 
son of shelemiah the son of cushi unto baruch say take in thine 
hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ear of the peopl and 
come so baruch the son of neriah took the roll in hi hand and came 
unto them 

36 15 and they said unto him sit down now and read it in our ear 
so baruch read it in their ear 

36 16 now it came to pa when they had heard all the word they 
were afraid both one and other and said unto baruch we will sure 
tell the king of all these word 

36 17 and they ask baruch say tell u now how didst thou write 
all these word at hi mouth 36 18 then baruch answer them he 
pronounc all these word unto me with hi mouth and i wrote them 
with ink in the book 

36 19 then said the princ unto baruch go hide thee thou and 
jeremiah and let no man know where ye be 

36 20 and they went in to the king into the court but they laid up 
the roll in the chamber of elishama the scribe and told all the word 
in the ear of the king 

36 21 so the king sent jehudi to fetch the roll and he took it out of 
elishama the scribe s chamber and jehudi read it in the ear of the 
king and in the ear of all the princ which stood besid the king 

36 22 now the king sat in the winterh in the ninth month and 
there wa a fire on the hearth burn befor him 

36 23 and it came to pa that when jehudi had read three or four 
leaf he cut it with the penknif and cast it into the fire that 
wa on the hearth until all the roll wa consum in the fire that 
wa on the hearth 

36 24 yet they were not afraid nor rent their garment neither the 
king nor ani of hi servant that heard all these word 

36 25 nevertheless elnathan and delaiah and gemariah had made 
intercess to the king that he would not burn the roll but he would 
not hear them 

36 26 but the king command jerahmeel the son of hammelech and 
seraiah the son of azriel and shelemiah the son of abdeel to take 
baruch the scribe and jeremiah the prophet but the lord hid them 

36 27 then the word of the lord came to jeremiah after that the king 
had burn the roll and the word which baruch wrote at the mouth of 
jeremiah say 36 28 take thee again anoth roll and write in it 
all the former word that were in the first roll which jehoiakim the 
king of judah hath burn 

36 29 and thou shalt say to jehoiakim king of judah thu saith the 
lord thou hast burn thi roll say whi hast thou written 
therein say the king of babylon shall certainli come and destroy 
thi land and shall cau to cea from thenc man and beast 36 30 
therefor thu saith the lord of jehoiakim king of judah he shall 
have none to sit upon the throne of david and hi dead bodi shall be 
cast out in the day to the heat and in the night to the frost 

36 31 and i will punish him and hi seed and hi servant for their 
iniqu and i will bring upon them and upon the inhabit of 
jerusalem and upon the men of judah all the evil that i have 
pronounc against them but they hearken not 

36 32 then took jeremiah anoth roll and gave it to baruch the 
scribe the son of neriah who wrote therein from the mouth of 
jeremiah all the word of the book which jehoiakim king of judah had 
burn in the fire and there were ad besid unto them mani like 
word 

37 1 and king zedekiah the son of josiah reign instead of coniah the 
son of jehoiakim whom nebuchadrezzar king of babylon made king in the 
land of judah 

37 2 but neither he nor hi servant nor the peopl of the land did 
hearken unto the word of the lord which he spake by the prophet 
jeremiah 

37 3 and zedekiah the king sent jehuc the son of shelemiah and 
zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest to the prophet jeremiah 
say pray now unto the lord our god for u 

37 4 now jeremiah came in and went out among the peopl for they had 
not put him into prison 

37 5 then pharaoh s armi wa come forth out of egypt and when the 
chaldean that besieg jerusalem heard tide of them they depart 
from jerusalem 

37 6 then came the word of the lord unto the prophet jeremiah say 
37 7 thu saith the lord the god of israel thu shall ye say to the 
king of judah that sent you unto me to enquir of me behold 
pharaoh s armi which is come forth to help you shall return to egypt 
into their own land 

37 8 and the chaldean shall come again and fight against thi citi 
and take it and burn it with fire 

37 9 thu saith the lord deceiv not yourselv say the 
chaldean shall sure depart from u for they shall not depart 

37 10 for though ye had smitten the whole armi of the chaldean that 
fight against you and there remain but wound men among them yet 
should they rise up everi man in hi tent and burn thi citi with 
fire 

37 11 and it came to pa that when the armi of the chaldean wa 
broken up from jerusalem for fear of pharaoh s armi 37 12 then 
jeremiah went forth out of jerusalem to go into the land of benjamin 
to separ himself thenc in the midst of the peopl 

37 13 and when he wa in the gate of benjamin a captain of the ward 
wa there whose name wa irijah the son of shelemiah the son of 
hananiah and he took jeremiah the prophet say thou fallest away 
to the chaldean 

37 14 then said jeremiah it is fal i fall not away to the 
chaldean 

but he hearken not to him so irijah took jeremiah and brought him 
to the princ 

37 15 wherefor the princ were wroth with jeremiah and smote him 
and put him in prison in the hou of jonathan the scribe for they 
had made that the prison 

37 16 when jeremiah wa enter into the dungeon and into the cabin 
and jeremiah had remain there mani day 37 17 then zedekiah the 
king sent and took him out and the king ask him secretli in hi 
hou and said is there ani word from the lord and jeremiah said 
there is for said he thou shalt be deliv into the hand of the 
king of babylon 

37 18 moreov jeremiah said unto king zedekiah what have i offend 
against thee or against thi servant or against thi peopl that ye 
have put me in prison 37 19 where are now your prophet which 
prophesi unto you say the king of babylon shall not come 
against you nor against thi land 37 20 therefor hear now i pray 
thee o my lord the king let my supplic i pray thee be 
accept befor thee that thou cau me not to return to the hou of 
jonathan the scribe lest i die there 

37 21 then zedekiah the king command that they should commit 
jeremiah into the court of the prison and that they should give him 
daili a piec of bread out of the baker street until all the bread 
in the citi were spent 

thu jeremiah remain in the court of the prison 

38 1 then shephatiah the son of mattan and gedaliah the son of 
pashur and jucal the son of shelemiah and pashur the son of 
malchiah heard the word that jeremiah had spoken unto all the 
peopl say 38 2 thu saith the lord he that remaineth in thi 
citi shall die by the sword by the famin and by the pestil but 
he that goeth forth to the chaldean shall live for he shall have hi 
life for a prey and shall live 

38 3 thu saith the lord thi citi shall sure be given into the 
hand of the king of babylon s armi which shall take it 

38 4 therefor the princ said unto the king we beseech thee let 
thi man be put to death for thu he weakeneth the hand of the men 
of war that remain in thi citi and the hand of all the peopl in 
speak such word unto them for thi man seeketh not the welfar of 
thi peopl but the hurt 

38 5 then zedekiah the king said behold he is in your hand for the 
king is not he that can do ani thing against you 

38 6 then took they jeremiah and cast him into the dungeon of 
malchiah the son of hammelech that wa in the court of the prison 
and they let down jeremiah with cord and in the dungeon there wa no 
water but mire so jeremiah sunk in the mire 

38 7 now when ebedmelech the ethiopian one of the eunuch which wa 
in the king s hou heard that they had put jeremiah in the dungeon 
the king then sit in the gate of benjamin 38 8 ebedmelech went 
forth out of the king s hou and spake to the king say 38 9 my 
lord the king these men have done evil in all that they have done to 
jeremiah the prophet whom they have cast into the dungeon and he is 
like to die for hunger in the place where he is for there is no more 
bread in the citi 

38 10 then the king command ebedmelech the ethiopian say take 
from henc thirti men with thee and take up jeremiah the prophet out 
of the dungeon befor he die 

38 11 so ebedmelech took the men with him and went into the hou of 
the king under the treasuri and took thenc old cast clout and old 
rotten rag and let them down by cord into the dungeon to jeremiah 

38 12 and ebedmelech the ethiopian said unto jeremiah put now these 
old cast clout and rotten rag under thine armhol under the cord 
and jeremiah did so 

38 13 so they drew up jeremiah with cord and took him up out of the 
dungeon and jeremiah remain in the court of the prison 

38 14 then zedekiah the king sent and took jeremiah the prophet unto 
him into the third entri that is in the hou of the lord and the 
king said unto jeremiah i will ask thee a thing hide noth from 
me 

38 15 then jeremiah said unto zedekiah if i declar it unto thee 
wilt thou not sure put me to death and if i give thee counsel wilt 
thou not hearken unto me 38 16 so zedekiah the king sware secretli 
unto jeremiah say a the lord liveth that made u thi soul i 
will not put thee to death neither will i give thee into the hand of 
these men that seek thi life 

38 17 then said jeremiah unto zedekiah thu saith the lord the god 
of host the god of israel if thou wilt assuredli go forth unto the 
king of babylon s princ then thi soul shall live and thi citi 
shall not be burn with fire and thou shalt live and thine hou 
38 18 but if thou wilt not go forth to the king of babylon s princ 
then shall thi citi be given into the hand of the chaldean and they 
shall burn it with fire and thou shalt not escap out of their hand 

38 19 and zedekiah the king said unto jeremiah i am afraid of the 
jew that are fallen to the chaldean lest they deliv me into their 
hand and they mock me 

38 20 but jeremiah said they shall not deliv thee obey i beseech 
thee the voic of the lord which i speak unto thee so it shall be 
well unto thee and thi soul shall live 

38 21 but if thou refu to go forth thi is the word that the lord 
hath shew me 38 22 and behold all the woman that are left in the 
king of judah s hou shall be brought forth to the king of babylon s 
princ and those woman shall say thi friend have set thee on and 
have prevail against thee thi foot are sunk in the mire and they 
are turn away back 

38 23 so they shall bring out all thi wife and thi child to the 
chaldean and thou shalt not escap out of their hand but shalt be 
taken by the hand of the king of babylon and thou shalt cau thi 
citi to be burn with fire 

38 24 then said zedekiah unto jeremiah let no man know of these 
word and thou shalt not die 

38 25 but if the princ hear that i have talk with thee and they 
come unto thee and say unto thee declar unto u now what thou hast 
said unto the king hide it not from u and we will not put thee to 
death also what the king said unto thee 38 26 then thou shalt say 
unto them i present my supplic befor the king that he would 
not cau me to return to jonathan s hou to die there 

38 27 then came all the princ unto jeremiah and ask him and he 
told them accord to all these word that the king had command so 
they left off speak with him for the matter wa not perceiv 

38 28 so jeremiah abod in the court of the prison until the day that 
jerusalem wa taken and he wa there when jerusalem wa taken 

39 1 in the ninth year of zedekiah king of judah in the tenth month 
came nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and all hi armi against 
jerusalem and they besieg it 

39 2 and in the eleventh year of zedekiah in the fourth month the 
ninth day of the month the citi wa broken up 

39 3 and all the princ of the king of babylon came in and sat in 
the middl gate even nergalsharez samgarnebo sarsechim rabsari 
nergalsharez rabmag with all the residu of the princ of the 
king of babylon 

39 4 and it came to pa that when zedekiah the king of judah saw 
them and all the men of war then they fled and went forth out of 
the citi by night by the way of the king s garden by the gate 
betwixt the two wall and he went out the way of the plain 

39 5 but the chaldean armi pursu after them and overtook zedekiah 
in the plain of jericho and when they had taken him they brought 
him up to nebuchadnezzar king of babylon to riblah in the land of 
hamath where he gave judgment upon him 

39 6 then the king of babylon slew the son of zedekiah in riblah 
befor hi eye also the king of babylon slew all the nobl of 
judah 

39 7 moreov he put out zedekiah s eye and bound him with chain 
to carri him to babylon 

39 8 and the chaldean burn the king s hou and the hou of the 
peopl with fire and brake down the wall of jerusalem 

39 9 then nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away captiv 
into babylon the remnant of the peopl that remain in the citi and 
those that fell away that fell to him with the rest of the peopl 
that remain 

39 10 but nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the 
peopl which had noth in the land of judah and gave them 
vineyard and field at the same time 

39 11 now nebuchadrezzar king of babylon gave charg concern 
jeremiah to nebuzaradan the captain of the guard say 39 12 take 
him and look well to him and do him no harm but do unto him even a 
he shall say unto thee 

39 13 so nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent and nebushasban 
rabsari and nergalsharez rabmag and all the king of babylon s 
princ 39 14 even they sent and took jeremiah out of the court of 
the prison and commit him unto gedaliah the son of ahikam the son 
of shaphan that he should carri him home so he dwelt among the 
peopl 

39 15 now the word of the lord came unto jeremiah while he wa shut 
up in the court of the prison say 39 16 go and speak to 
ebedmelech the ethiopian say thu saith the lord of host the 
god of israel behold i will bring my word upon thi citi for evil 
and not for good and they shall be accomplish in that day befor 
thee 

39 17 but i will deliv thee in that day saith the lord and thou 
shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid 

39 18 for i will sure deliv thee and thou shalt not fall by the 
sword but thi life shall be for a prey unto thee becau thou hast 
put thi trust in me saith the lord 

40 1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord after that 
nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from ramah when 
he had taken him be bound in chain among all that were carri 
away captiv of jerusalem and judah which were carri away captiv 
unto babylon 

40 2 and the captain of the guard took jeremiah and said unto him 
the lord thi god hath pronounc thi evil upon thi place 

40 3 now the lord hath brought it and done accord a he hath said 
becau ye have sin against the lord and have not obey hi 
voic therefor thi thing is come upon you 

40 4 and now behold i loo thee thi day from the chain which were 
upon thine hand if it seem good unto thee to come with me into 
babylon come and i will look well unto thee but if it seem ill unto 
thee to come with me into babylon forbear behold all the land is 
befor thee whither it seemeth good and conveni for thee to go 
thither go 

40 5 now while he wa not yet gone back he said go back also to 
gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan whom the king of 
babylon hath made governor over the citi of judah and dwell with 
him among the peopl or go wheresoev it seemeth conveni unto 
thee to go so the captain of the guard gave him victual and a 
reward and let him go 

40 6 then went jeremiah unto gedaliah the son of ahikam to mizpah and 
dwelt with him among the peopl that were left in the land 

40 7 now when all the captain of the forc which were in the field 
even they and their men heard that the king of babylon had made 
gedaliah the son of ahikam governor in the land and had commit 
unto him men and woman and child and of the poor of the land of 
them that were not carri away captiv to babylon 40 8 then they 
came to gedaliah to mizpah even ishmael the son of nethaniah and 
johanan and jonathan the son of kareah and seraiah the son of 
tanhumeth and the son of ephai the netophathit and jezaniah the 
son of a maachathit they and their men 

40 9 and gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan sware unto them 
and to their men say fear not to serv the chaldean dwell in 
the land and serv the king of babylon and it shall be well with 
you 

40 10 a for me behold i will dwell at mizpah to serv the 
chaldean which will come unto u but ye gather ye wine and summer 
fruit and oil and put them in your vessel and dwell in your 
citi that ye have taken 

40 11 likewi when all the jew that were in moab and among the 
ammonit and in edom and that were in all the countri heard that 
the king of babylon had left a remnant of judah and that he had set 
over them gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan 40 12 even 
all the jew return out of all place whither they were driven and 
came to the land of judah to gedaliah unto mizpah and gather wine 
and summer fruit veri much 

40 13 moreov johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the 
forc that were in the field came to gedaliah to mizpah 40 14 and 
said unto him dost thou certainli know that baali the king of the 
ammonit hath sent ishmael the son of nethaniah to slay thee but 
gedaliah the son of ahikam believ them not 

40 15 then johanan the son of kareah spake to gedaliah in mizpah 
secretli say let me go i pray thee and i will slay ishmael the 
son of nethaniah and no man shall know it wherefor should he slay 
thee that all the jew which are gather unto thee should be 
scatter and the remnant in judah perish 40 16 but gedaliah the 
son of ahikam said unto johanan the son of kareah thou shalt not do 
thi thing for thou speakest fal of ishmael 

41 1 now it came to pa in the seventh month that ishmael the son of 
nethaniah the son of elishama of the seed royal and the princ of 
the king even ten men with him came unto gedaliah the son of ahikam 
to mizpah and there they did eat bread togeth in mizpah 

41 2 then aro ishmael the son of nethaniah and the ten men that 
were with him and smote gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan 
with the sword and slew him whom the king of babylon had made 
governor over the land 

41 3 ishmael also slew all the jew that were with him even with 
gedaliah at mizpah and the chaldean that were found there and the 
men of war 

41 4 and it came to pa the second day after he had slain gedaliah 
and no man knew it 41 5 that there came certain from shechem from 
shiloh and from samaria even fourscor men have their beard 
shaven and their cloth rent and have cut themselv with 
offer and incen in their hand to bring them to the hou of the 
lord 

41 6 and ishmael the son of nethaniah went forth from mizpah to meet 
them weep all along a he went and it came to pa a he met 
them he said unto them come to gedaliah the son of ahikam 

41 7 and it wa so when they came into the midst of the citi that 
ishmael the son of nethaniah slew them and cast them into the midst 
of the pit he and the men that were with him 

41 8 but ten men were found among them that said unto ishmael slay u 
not for we have treasur in the field of wheat and of barley and 
of oil and of honey so he forbar and slew them not among their 
brother 

41 9 now the pit wherein ishmael had cast all the dead bodi of the 
men whom he had slain becau of gedaliah wa it which asa the king 
had made for fear of baasha king of israel and ishmael the son of 
nethaniah fill it with them that were slain 

41 10 then ishmael carri away captiv all the residu of the peopl 
that were in mizpah even the king s daughter and all the peopl 
that remain in mizpah whom nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had 
commit to gedaliah the son of ahikam and ishmael the son of 
nethaniah carri them away captiv and depart to go over to the 
ammonit 

41 11 but when johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the 
forc that were with him heard of all the evil that ishmael the son 
of nethaniah had done 41 12 then they took all the men and went to 
fight with ishmael the son of nethaniah and found him by the great 
water that are in gibeon 

41 13 now it came to pa that when all the peopl which were with 
ishmael saw johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the 
forc that were with him then they were glad 

41 14 so all the peopl that ishmael had carri away captiv from 
mizpah cast about and return and went unto johanan the son of 
kareah 

41 15 but ishmael the son of nethaniah escap from johanan with eight 
men and went to the ammonit 

41 16 then took johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the 
forc that were with him all the remnant of the peopl whom he had 
recov from ishmael the son of nethaniah from mizpah after that 
he had slain gedaliah the son of ahikam even mighti men of war and 
the woman and the child and the eunuch whom he had brought 
again from gibeon 41 17 and they depart and dwelt in the 
habit of chimham which is by bethlehem to go to enter into 
egypt 41 18 becau of the chaldean for they were afraid of them 
becau ishmael the son of nethaniah had slain gedaliah the son of 
ahikam whom the king of babylon made governor in the land 

42 1 then all the captain of the forc and johanan the son of 
kareah and jezaniah the son of hoshaiah and all the peopl from the 
least even unto the greatest came near 42 2 and said unto jeremiah 
the prophet let we beseech thee our supplic be accept befor 
thee and pray for u unto the lord thi god even for all thi 
remnant for we are left but a few of mani a thine eye do behold 
u 42 3 that the lord thi god may shew u the way wherein we may 
walk and the thing that we may do 

42 4 then jeremiah the prophet said unto them i have heard you 
behold i will pray unto the lord your god accord to your word 
and it shall come to pa that whatsoev thing the lord shall answer 
you i will declar it unto you i will keep noth back from you
