3 27 but when i speak with thee i will open thi mouth and thou shalt 
say unto them thu saith the lord god he that heareth let him hear 
and he that forbeareth let him forbear for they are a rebelli 
hou 

4 1 thou also son of man take thee a tile and lay it befor thee 
and pourtray upon it the citi even jerusalem 4 2 and lay sieg 
against it and build a fort against it and cast a mount against it 
set the camp also against it and set batter ram against it round 
about 

4 3 moreov take thou unto thee an iron pan and set it for a wall of 
iron between thee and the citi and set thi face against it and it 
shall be besieg and thou shalt lay sieg against it thi shall be 
a sign to the hou of israel 

4 4 lie thou also upon thi left side and lay the iniqu of the 
hou of israel upon it accord to the number of the day that thou 
shalt lie upon it thou shalt bear their iniqu 

4 5 for i have laid upon thee the year of their iniqu accord 
to the number of the day three hundr and nineti day so shalt 
thou bear the iniqu of the hou of israel 

4 6 and when thou hast accomplish them lie again on thi right side 
and thou shalt bear the iniqu of the hou of judah forti day i 
have appoint thee each day for a year 

4 7 therefor thou shalt set thi face toward the sieg of jerusalem 
and thine arm shall be uncov and thou shalt prophesi against it 

4 8 and behold i will lay band upon thee and thou shalt not turn 
thee from one side to anoth till thou hast end the day of thi 
sieg 

4 9 take thou also unto thee wheat and barley and bean and 
lentil and millet and fitch and put them in one vessel and 
make thee bread thereof accord to the number of the day that thou 
shalt lie upon thi side three hundr and nineti day shalt thou eat 
thereof 

4 10 and thi meat which thou shalt eat shall be by weight twenti 
shekel a day from time to time shalt thou eat it 

4 11 thou shalt drink also water by measur the sixth part of an hin 
from time to time shalt thou drink 

4 12 and thou shalt eat it a barley cake and thou shalt bake it 
with dung that cometh out of man in their sight 

4 13 and the lord said even thu shall the child of israel eat 
their defil bread among the gentil whither i will drive them 

4 14 then said i ah lord god behold my soul hath not been pollut 
for from my youth up even till now have i not eaten of that which 
dieth of itself or is torn in piec neither came there abomin 
flesh into my mouth 

4 15 then he said unto me lo i have given thee cow s dung for man s 
dung and thou shalt prepar thi bread therewith 

4 16 moreov he said unto me son of man behold i will break the 
staff of bread in jerusalem and they shall eat bread by weight and 
with care and they shall drink water by measur and with 
astonish 4 17 that they may want bread and water and be astoni 
one with anoth and consum away for their iniqu 

5 1 and thou son of man take thee a sharp knife take thee a 
barber s razor and cau it to pa upon thine head and upon thi 
beard then take thee balanc to weigh and divid the hair 

5 2 thou shalt burn with fire a third part in the midst of the citi 
when the day of the sieg are fulfil and thou shalt take a third 
part and smite about it with a knife and a third part thou shalt 
scatter in the wind and i will draw out a sword after them 

5 3 thou shalt also take thereof a few in number and bind them in thi 
skirt 

5 4 then take of them again and cast them into the midst of the fire 
and burn them in the fire for thereof shall a fire come forth into 
all the hou of israel 

5 5 thu saith the lord god thi is jerusalem i have set it in the 
midst of the nation and countri that are round about her 

5 6 and she hath chang my judgment into wick more than the 
nation and my statut more than the countri that are round about 
her for they have refu my judgment and my statut they have not 
walk in them 

5 7 therefor thu saith the lord god becau ye multipli more than 
the nation that are round about you and have not walk in my 
statut neither have kept my judgment neither have done accord 
to the judgment of the nation that are round about you 5 8 
therefor thu saith the lord god behold i even i am against thee 
and will execut judgment in the midst of thee in the sight of the 
nation 

5 9 and i will do in thee that which i have not done and whereunto i 
will not do ani more the like becau of all thine abomin 

5 10 therefor the father shall eat the son in the midst of thee 
and the son shall eat their father and i will execut judgment in 
thee and the whole remnant of thee will i scatter into all the wind 

5 11 wherefor a i live saith the lord god sure becau thou 
hast defil my sanctuari with all thi detest thing and with all 
thine abomin therefor will i also diminish thee neither shall 
mine eye spare neither will i have ani piti 

5 12 a third part of thee shall die with the pestil and with 
famin shall they be consum in the midst of thee and a third part 
shall fall by the sword round about thee and i will scatter a third 
part into all the wind and i will draw out a sword after them 

5 13 thu shall mine anger be accomplish and i will cau my furi 
to rest upon them and i will be comfort and they shall know that i 
the lord have spoken it in my zeal when i have accomplish my furi 
in them 

5 14 moreov i will make thee wast and a reproach among the nation 
that are round about thee in the sight of all that pa by 

5 15 so it shall be a reproach and a taunt an instruct and an 
astonish unto the nation that are round about thee when i shall 
execut judgment in thee in anger and in furi and in furiou rebuk 
i the lord have spoken it 

5 16 when i shall send upon them the evil arrow of famin which 
shall be for their destruct and which i will send to destroy you 
and i will increa the famin upon you and will break your staff of 
bread 5 17 so will i send upon you famin and evil beast and they 
shall bereav thee and pestil and blood shall pa through thee 
and i will bring the sword upon thee i the lord have spoken it 

6 1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 6 2 son of man set 
thi face toward the mountain of israel and prophesi against them 
6 3 and say ye mountain of israel hear the word of the lord god 
thu saith the lord god to the mountain and to the hill to the 
river and to the valley behold i even i will bring a sword upon 
you and i will destroy your high place 

6 4 and your altar shall be desol and your imag shall be 
broken and i will cast down your slain men befor your idol 

6 5 and i will lay the dead carca of the child of israel befor 
their idol and i will scatter your bone round about your altar 

6 6 in all your dwellingplac the citi shall be laid wast and the 
high place shall be desol that your altar may be laid wast and 
made desol and your idol may be broken and cea and your imag 
may be cut down and your work may be abolish 

6 7 and the slain shall fall in the midst of you and ye shall know 
that i am the lord 

6 8 yet will i leav a remnant that ye may have some that shall 
escap the sword among the nation when ye shall be scatter through 
the countri 

6 9 and they that escap of you shall rememb me among the nation 
whither they shall be carri captiv becau i am broken with their 
whorish heart which hath depart from me and with their eye which 
go a whore after their idol and they shall loth themselv for 
the evil which they have commit in all their abomin 

6 10 and they shall know that i am the lord and that i have not said 
in vain that i would do thi evil unto them 

6 11 thu saith the lord god smite with thine hand and stamp with 
thi foot and say ala for all the evil abomin of the hou of 
israel for they shall fall by the sword by the famin and by the 
pestil 

6 12 he that is far off shall die of the pestil and he that is 
near shall fall by the sword and he that remaineth and is besieg 
shall die by the famin thu will i accomplish my furi upon them 

6 13 then shall ye know that i am the lord when their slain men shall 
be among their idol round about their altar upon everi high hill 
in all the top of the mountain and under everi green tree and 
under everi thick oak the place where they did offer sweet savour to 
all their idol 

6 14 so will i stretch out my hand upon them and make the land 
desol yea more desol than the wilder toward diblath in 
all their habit and they shall know that i am the lord 

7 1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 7 2 also thou 
son of man thu saith the lord god unto the land of israel an end 
the end is come upon the four corner of the land 

7 3 now is the end come upon thee and i will send mine anger upon 
thee and will judg thee accord to thi way and will recompen 
upon thee all thine abomin 

7 4 and mine eye shall not spare thee neither will i have piti but i 
will recompen thi way upon thee and thine abomin shall be in 
the midst of thee and ye shall know that i am the lord 

7 5 thu saith the lord god an evil an onli evil behold is come 

7 6 an end is come the end is come it watcheth for thee behold it 
is come 

7 7 the morn is come unto thee o thou that dwellest in the land 
the time is come the day of troubl is near and not the sound 
again of the mountain 

7 8 now will i shortli pour out my furi upon thee and accomplish mine 
anger upon thee and i will judg thee accord to thi way and will 
recompen thee for all thine abomin 

7 9 and mine eye shall not spare neither will i have piti i will 
recompen thee accord to thi way and thine abomin that are 
in the midst of thee and ye shall know that i am the lord that 
smiteth 

7 10 behold the day behold it is come the morn is gone forth 
the rod hath blossom pride hath bud 

7 11 violenc is risen up into a rod of wick none of them shall 
remain nor of their multitud nor of ani of their s neither shall 
there be wail for them 

7 12 the time is come the day draweth near let not the buyer 
rejoic nor the seller mourn for wrath is upon all the multitud 
thereof 

7 13 for the seller shall not return to that which is sold although 
they were yet aliv for the vision is touch the whole multitud 
thereof which shall not return neither shall ani strengthen himself 
in the iniqu of hi life 

7 14 they have blown the trumpet even to make all readi but none 
goeth to the battl for my wrath is upon all the multitud thereof 

7 15 the sword is without and the pestil and the famin within 
he that is in the field shall die with the sword and he that is in 
the citi famin and pestil shall devour him 

7 16 but they that escap of them shall escap and shall be on the 
mountain like dove of the valley all of them mourn everi one 
for hi iniqu 

7 17 all hand shall be feebl and all knee shall be weak a water 

7 18 they shall also gird themselv with sackcloth and horror shall 
cover them and shame shall be upon all face and bald upon all 
their head 

7 19 they shall cast their silver in the street and their gold shall 
be remov their silver and their gold shall not be abl to deliv 
them in the day of the wrath of the lord they shall not satisfi their 
soul neither fill their bowel becau it is the stumblingblock of 
their iniqu 

7 20 a for the beauti of hi ornament he set it in majesti but they 
made the imag of their abomin and of their detest thing 
therein therefor have i set it far from them 

7 21 and i will give it into the hand of the stranger for a prey 
and to the wick of the earth for a spoil and they shall pollut it 

7 22 my face will i turn also from them and they shall pollut my 
secret place for the robber shall enter into it and defil it 

7 23 make a chain for the land is full of bloodi crime and the citi 
is full of violenc 

7 24 wherefor i will bring the worst of the heathen and they shall 
po their hou i will also make the pomp of the strong to 
cea and their holi place shall be defil 

7 25 destruct cometh and they shall seek peac and there shall be 
none 

7 26 mischief shall come upon mischief and rumour shall be upon 
rumour then shall they seek a vision of the prophet but the law 
shall perish from the priest and counsel from the ancient 

7 27 the king shall mourn and the princ shall be cloth with 
desol and the hand of the peopl of the land shall be troubl 
i will do unto them after their way and accord to their desert 
will i judg them and they shall know that i am the lord 

8 1 and it came to pa in the sixth year in the sixth month in the 
fifth day of the month a i sat in mine hou and the elder of 
judah sat befor me that the hand of the lord god fell there upon me 

8 2 then i beheld and lo a like a the appear of fire from 
the appear of hi loin even downward fire and from hi loin 
even upward a the appear of bright a the colour of amber 

8 3 and he put forth the form of an hand and took me by a lock of 
mine head and the spirit lift me up between the earth and the 
heaven and brought me in the vision of god to jerusalem to the door 
of the inner gate that looketh toward the north where wa the seat of 
the imag of jealousi which provoketh to jealousi 

8 4 and behold the glori of the god of israel wa there accord 
to the vision that i saw in the plain 

8 5 then said he unto me son of man lift up thine eye now the way 
toward the north so i lift up mine eye the way toward the north 
and behold northward at the gate of the altar thi imag of jealousi 
in the entri 

8 6 he said furthermor unto me son of man seest thou what they do 
even the great abomin that the hou of israel committeth here 
that i should go far off from my sanctuari but turn thee yet again 
and thou shalt see greater abomin 

8 7 and he brought me to the door of the court and when i look 
behold a hole in the wall 

8 8 then said he unto me son of man dig now in the wall and when i 
had dig in the wall behold a door 

8 9 and he said unto me go in and behold the wick abomin 
that they do here 

8 10 so i went in and saw and behold everi form of creep thing 
and abomin beast and all the idol of the hou of israel 
pourtray upon the wall round about 

8 11 and there stood befor them seventi men of the ancient of the 
hou of israel and in the midst of them stood jaazaniah the son of 
shaphan with everi man hi censer in hi hand and a thick cloud of 
incen went up 

8 12 then said he unto me son of man hast thou seen what the 
ancient of the hou of israel do in the dark everi man in the 
chamber of hi imageri for they say the lord seeth u not the lord 
hath forsaken the earth 

8 13 he said also unto me turn thee yet again and thou shalt see 
greater abomin that they do 

8 14 then he brought me to the door of the gate of the lord s hou 
which wa toward the north and behold there sat woman weep for 
tammuz 

8 15 then said he unto me hast thou seen thi o son of man turn 
thee yet again and thou shalt see greater abomin than these 

8 16 and he brought me into the inner court of the lord s hou and 
behold at the door of the templ of the lord between the porch and 
the altar were about five and twenti men with their back toward the 
templ of the lord and their face toward the east and they 
worship the sun toward the east 

8 17 then he said unto me hast thou seen thi o son of man is it a 
light thing to the hou of judah that they commit the abomin 
which they commit here for they have fill the land with violenc 
and have return to provok me to anger and lo they put the branch 
to their nose 

8 18 therefor will i also deal in furi mine eye shall not spare 
neither will i have piti and though they cri in mine ear with a loud 
voic yet will i not hear them 

9 1 he cri also in mine ear with a loud voic say cau them 
that have charg over the citi to draw near even everi man with hi 
destroy weapon in hi hand 

9 2 and behold six men came from the way of the higher gate which 
lieth toward the north and everi man a slaughter weapon in hi hand 
and one man among them wa cloth with linen with a writer s inkhorn 
by hi side and they went in and stood besid the brasen altar 

9 3 and the glori of the god of israel wa gone up from the cherub 
whereupon he wa to the threshold of the hou and he call to the 
man cloth with linen which had the writer s inkhorn by hi side 
9 4 and the lord said unto him go through the midst of the citi 
through the midst of jerusalem and set a mark upon the forehead of 
the men that sigh and that cri for all the abomin that be done 
in the midst thereof 

9 5 and to the other he said in mine hear go ye after him through 
the citi and smite let not your eye spare neither have ye piti 9 6 
slay utterli old and young both maid and littl child and 
woman but come not near ani man upon whom is the mark and begin at 
my sanctuari then they began at the ancient men which were befor the 
hou 

9 7 and he said unto them defil the hou and fill the court with 
the slain go ye forth and they went forth and slew in the citi 

9 8 and it came to pa while they were slay them and i wa left 
that i fell upon my face and cri and said ah lord god wilt thou 
destroy all the residu of israel in thi pour out of thi furi upon 
jerusalem 9 9 then said he unto me the iniqu of the hou of 
israel and judah is exceed great and the land is full of blood 
and the citi full of perver for they say the lord hath 
forsaken the earth and the lord seeth not 

9 10 and a for me also mine eye shall not spare neither will i have 
piti but i will recompen their way upon their head 

9 11 and behold the man cloth with linen which had the inkhorn by 
hi side report the matter say i have done a thou hast 
command me 

10 1 then i look and behold in the firmament that wa abov the 
head of the cherub there appear over them a it were a sapphir 
stone a the appear of the like of a throne 

10 2 and he spake unto the man cloth with linen and said go in 
between the wheel even under the cherub and fill thine hand with 
coal of fire from between the cherub and scatter them over the 
citi and he went in in my sight 

10 3 now the cherub stood on the right side of the hou when the 
man went in and the cloud fill the inner court 

10 4 then the glori of the lord went up from the cherub and stood 
over the threshold of the hou and the hou wa fill with the 
cloud and the court wa full of the bright of the lord s glori 

10 5 and the sound of the cherub wing wa heard even to the outer 
court a the voic of the almighti god when he speaketh 

10 6 and it came to pa that when he had command the man cloth 
with linen say take fire from between the wheel from between 
the cherub then he went in and stood besid the wheel 

10 7 and one cherub stretch forth hi hand from between the 
cherub unto the fire that wa between the cherub and took 
thereof and put it into the hand of him that wa cloth with linen 
who took it and went out 

10 8 and there appear in the cherub the form of a man s hand 
under their wing 

10 9 and when i look behold the four wheel by the cherub one 
wheel by one cherub and anoth wheel by anoth cherub and the 
appear of the wheel wa a the colour of a beryl stone 

10 10 and a for their appear they four had one like a if 
a wheel had been in the midst of a wheel 

10 11 when they went they went upon their four side they turn not 
a they went but to the place whither the head look they follow 
it they turn not a they went 

10 12 and their whole bodi and their back and their hand and 
their wing and the wheel were full of eye round about even the 
wheel that they four had 

10 13 a for the wheel it wa cri unto them in my hear o 
wheel 

10 14 and everi one had four face the first face wa the face of a 
cherub and the second face wa the face of a man and the third the 
face of a lion and the fourth the face of an eagl 

10 15 and the cherub were lift up thi is the live creatur 
that i saw by the river of chebar 

10 16 and when the cherub went the wheel went by them and when 
the cherub lift up their wing to mount up from the earth the 
same wheel also turn not from besid them 

10 17 when they stood these stood and when they were lift up 
these lift up themselv also for the spirit of the live creatur 
wa in them 

10 18 then the glori of the lord depart from off the threshold of 
the hou and stood over the cherub 

10 19 and the cherub lift up their wing and mount up from the 
earth in my sight when they went out the wheel also were besid 
them and everi one stood at the door of the east gate of the lord s 
hou and the glori of the god of israel wa over them abov 

10 20 thi is the live creatur that i saw under the god of israel 
by the river of chebar and i knew that they were the cherub 

10 21 everi one had four face apiec and everi one four wing and 
the like of the hand of a man wa under their wing 

10 22 and the like of their face wa the same face which i saw 
by the river of chebar their appear and themselv they went 
everi one straight forward 

11 1 moreov the spirit lift me up and brought me unto the east 
gate of the lord s hou which looketh eastward and behold at the 
door of the gate five and twenti men among whom i saw jaazaniah the 
son of azur and pelatiah the son of benaiah princ of the peopl 

11 2 then said he unto me son of man these are the men that devi 
mischief and give wick counsel in thi citi 11 3 which say it is 
not near let u build hou thi citi is the caldron and we be the 
flesh 

11 4 therefor prophesi against them prophesi o son of man 

11 5 and the spirit of the lord fell upon me and said unto me speak 
thu saith the lord thu have ye said o hou of israel for i know 
the thing that come into your mind everi one of them 

11 6 ye have multipli your slain in thi citi and ye have fill 
the street thereof with the slain 

11 7 therefor thu saith the lord god your slain whom ye have laid 
in the midst of it they are the flesh and thi citi is the caldron 
but i will bring you forth out of the midst of it 

11 8 ye have fear the sword and i will bring a sword upon you 
saith the lord god 

11 9 and i will bring you out of the midst thereof and deliv you 
into the hand of stranger and will execut judgment among you 

11 10 ye shall fall by the sword i will judg you in the border of 
israel and ye shall know that i am the lord 

11 11 thi citi shall not be your caldron neither shall ye be the 
flesh in the midst thereof but i will judg you in the border of 
israel 11 12 and ye shall know that i am the lord for ye have not 
walk in my statut neither execut my judgment but have done 
after the manner of the heathen that are round about you 

11 13 and it came to pa when i prophesi that pelatiah the son of 
benaiah die then fell i down upon my face and cri with a loud 
voic and said ah lord god wilt thou make a full end of the remnant 
of israel 11 14 again the word of the lord came unto me say 
11 15 son of man thi brother even thi brother the men of thi 
kindr and all the hou of israel wholli are they unto whom the 
inhabit of jerusalem have said get you far from the lord unto u 
is thi land given in poss 

11 16 therefor say thu saith the lord god although i have cast 
them far off among the heathen and although i have scatter them 
among the countri yet will i be to them a a littl sanctuari in 
the countri where they shall come 

11 17 therefor say thu saith the lord god i will even gather you 
from the peopl and assembl you out of the countri where ye have 
been scatter and i will give you the land of israel 

11 18 and they shall come thither and they shall take away all the 
detest thing thereof and all the abomin thereof from 
thenc 

11 19 and i will give them one heart and i will put a new spirit 
within you and i will take the stoni heart out of their flesh and 
will give them an heart of flesh 11 20 that they may walk in my 
statut and keep mine ordin and do them and they shall be my 
peopl and i will be their god 

11 21 but a for them whose heart walketh after the heart of their 
detest thing and their abomin i will recompen their way 
upon their own head saith the lord god 

11 22 then did the cherub lift up their wing and the wheel 
besid them and the glori of the god of israel wa over them abov 

11 23 and the glori of the lord went up from the midst of the citi 
and stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the citi 

11 24 afterward the spirit took me up and brought me in a vision by 
the spirit of god into chaldea to them of the captiv so the 
vision that i had seen went up from me 

11 25 then i spake unto them of the captiv all the thing that the 
lord had shew me 

12 1 the word of the lord also came unto me say 12 2 son of man 
thou dwellest in the midst of a rebelli hou which have eye to 
see and see not they have ear to hear and hear not for they are a 
rebelli hou 

12 3 therefor thou son of man prepar thee stuff for remov and 
remov by day in their sight and thou shalt remov from thi place to 
anoth place in their sight it may be they will consid though 
they be a rebelli hou 

12 4 then shalt thou bring forth thi stuff by day in their sight a 
stuff for remov and thou shalt go forth at even in their sight a 
they that go forth into captiv 

12 5 dig thou through the wall in their sight and carri out therebi 

12 6 in their sight shalt thou bear it upon thi shoulder and carri 
it forth in the twilight thou shalt cover thi face that thou see not 
the ground for i have set thee for a sign unto the hou of israel 

12 7 and i did so a i wa command i brought forth my stuff by day 
a stuff for captiv and in the even i dig through the wall with 
mine hand i brought it forth in the twilight and i bare it upon my 
shoulder in their sight 

12 8 and in the morn came the word of the lord unto me say 
12 9 son of man hath not the hou of israel the rebelli hou 
said unto thee what doest thou 12 10 say thou unto them thu saith 
the lord god thi burden concerneth the princ in jerusalem and all 
the hou of israel that are among them 

12 11 say i am your sign like a i have done so shall it be done 
unto them they shall remov and go into captiv 

12 12 and the princ that is among them shall bear upon hi shoulder 
in the twilight and shall go forth they shall dig through the wall 
to carri out therebi he shall cover hi face that he see not the 
ground with hi eye 

12 13 my net also will i spread upon him and he shall be taken in my 
snare and i will bring him to babylon to the land of the chaldean 
yet shall he not see it though he shall die there 

12 14 and i will scatter toward everi wind all that are about him to 
help him and all hi band and i will draw out the sword after them 

12 15 and they shall know that i am the lord when i shall scatter 
them among the nation and disper them in the countri 

12 16 but i will leav a few men of them from the sword from the 
famin and from the pestil that they may declar all their 
abomin among the heathen whither they come and they shall know 
that i am the lord 

12 17 moreov the word of the lord came to me say 12 18 son of 
man eat thi bread with quak and drink thi water with trembl 
and with care 12 19 and say unto the peopl of the land thu 
saith the lord god of the inhabit of jerusalem and of the land of 
israel they shall eat their bread with care and drink their 
water with astonish that her land may be desol from all that 
is therein becau of the violenc of all them that dwell therein 

12 20 and the citi that are inhabit shall be laid wast and the 
land shall be desol and ye shall know that i am the lord 

12 21 and the word of the lord came unto me say 12 22 son of man 
what is that proverb that ye have in the land of israel say the 
day are prolong and everi vision faileth 12 23 tell them 
therefor thu saith the lord god i will make thi proverb to cea 
and they shall no more use it a a proverb in israel but say unto 
them the day are at hand and the effect of everi vision 

12 24 for there shall be no more ani vain vision nor flatter 
divin within the hou of israel 

12 25 for i am the lord i will speak and the word that i shall speak 
shall come to pa it shall be no more prolong for in your day o 
rebelli hou will i say the word and will perform it saith the 
lord god 

12 26 again the word of the lord came to me say 

12 27 son of man behold they of the hou of israel say the vision 
that he seeth is for mani day to come and he prophesieth of the 
time that are far off 

12 28 therefor say unto them thu saith the lord god there shall 
none of my word be prolong ani more but the word which i have 
spoken shall be done saith the lord god 

13 1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 13 2 son of man 
prophesi against the prophet of israel that prophesi and say thou 
unto them that prophesi out of their own heart hear ye the word of 
the lord 13 3 thu saith the lord god woe unto the foolish prophet 
that follow their own spirit and have seen noth 13 4 o israel 
thi prophet are like the fox in the desert 

13 5 ye have not gone up into the gap neither made up the hedg for 
the hou of israel to stand in the battl in the day of the lord 

13 6 they have seen vaniti and lie divin say the lord 
saith and the lord hath not sent them and they have made other to 
hope that they would confirm the word 

13 7 have ye not seen a vain vision and have ye not spoken a lie 
divin wherea ye say the lord saith it albeit i have not 
spoken 13 8 therefor thu saith the lord god becau ye have 
spoken vaniti and seen lie therefor behold i am against you 
saith the lord god 

13 9 and mine hand shall be upon the prophet that see vaniti and 
that divin lie they shall not be in the assembl of my peopl 
neither shall they be written in the write of the hou of israel 
neither shall they enter into the land of israel and ye shall know 
that i am the lord god 

13 10 becau even becau they have seduc my peopl say 
peac and there wa no peac and one built up a wall and lo 
other daub it with untemp morter 13 11 say unto them which 
daub it with untemp morter that it shall fall there shall be an 
overflow shower and ye o great hailston shall fall and a 
stormi wind shall rend it 

13 12 lo when the wall is fallen shall it not be said unto you 
where is the daub wherewith ye have daub it 13 13 therefor 
thu saith the lord god i will even rend it with a stormi wind in my 
furi and there shall be an overflow shower in mine anger and 
great hailston in my furi to consum it 

13 14 so will i break down the wall that ye have daub with 
untemp morter and bring it down to the ground so that the 
foundat thereof shall be discov and it shall fall and ye 
shall be consum in the midst thereof and ye shall know that i am 
the lord 

13 15 thu will i accomplish my wrath upon the wall and upon them 
that have daub it with untemp morter and will say unto you the 
wall is no more neither they that daub it 13 16 to wit the 
prophet of israel which prophesi concern jerusalem and which see 
vision of peac for her and there is no peac saith the lord god 

13 17 likewi thou son of man set thi face against the daughter of 
thi peopl which prophesi out of their own heart and prophesi thou 
against them 13 18 and say thu saith the lord god woe to the woman 
that sew pillow to all armhol and make kerchief upon the head of 
everi statur to hunt soul will ye hunt the soul of my peopl and 
will ye save the soul aliv that come unto you 13 19 and will ye 
pollut me among my peopl for hand of barley and for piec of 
bread to slay the soul that should not die and to save the soul 
aliv that should not live by your lie to my peopl that hear your 
lie 13 20 wherefor thu saith the lord god behold i am against 
your pillow wherewith ye there hunt the soul to make them fli and 
i will tear them from your arm and will let the soul go even the 
soul that ye hunt to make them fli 

13 21 your kerchief also will i tear and deliv my peopl out of 
your hand and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunt and ye 
shall know that i am the lord 

13 22 becau with lie ye have made the heart of the righteou sad 
whom i have not made sad and strengthen the hand of the wick 
that he should not return from hi wick way by promi him life 
13 23 therefor ye shall see no more vaniti nor divin divin 
for i will deliv my peopl out of your hand and ye shall know that 
i am the lord 

14 1 then came certain of the elder of israel unto me and sat befor 
me 

14 2 and the word of the lord came unto me say 14 3 son of man 
these men have set up their idol in their heart and put the 
stumblingblock of their iniqu befor their face should i be 
enquir of at all by them 14 4 therefor speak unto them and say 
unto them thu saith the lord god everi man of the hou of israel 
that setteth up hi idol in hi heart and putteth the stumblingblock 
of hi iniqu befor hi face and cometh to the prophet i the lord 
will answer him that cometh accord to the multitud of hi idol 
14 5 that i may take the hou of israel in their own heart becau 
they are all estrang from me through their idol 

14 6 therefor say unto the hou of israel thu saith the lord god 
repent and turn yourselv from your idol and turn away your face 
from all your abomin 

14 7 for everi one of the hou of israel or of the stranger that 
sojourneth in israel which separateth himself from me and setteth up 
hi idol in hi heart and putteth the stumblingblock of hi iniqu 
befor hi face and cometh to a prophet to enquir of him concern 
me i the lord will answer him by myself 14 8 and i will set my face 
against that man and will make him a sign and a proverb and i will 
cut him off from the midst of my peopl and ye shall know that i am 
the lord 

14 9 and if the prophet be deceiv when he hath spoken a thing i the 
lord have deceiv that prophet and i will stretch out my hand upon 
him and will destroy him from the midst of my peopl israel 

14 10 and they shall bear the punish of their iniqu the 
punish of the prophet shall be even a the punish of him that 
seeketh unto him 14 11 that the hou of israel may go no more astray 
from me neither be pollut ani more with all their transgress 
but that they may be my peopl and i may be their god saith the lord 
god 

14 12 the word of the lord came again to me say 14 13 son of man 
when the land sinneth against me by trespass grievou then will 
i stretch out mine hand upon it and will break the staff of the bread 
thereof and will send famin upon it and will cut off man and beast 
from it 14 14 though these three men noah daniel and job were in 
it they should deliv but their own soul by their righteou 
saith the lord god 

14 15 if i cau noisom beast to pa through the land and they 
spoil it so that it be desol that no man may pa through becau 
of the beast 14 16 though these three men were in it a i live 
saith the lord god they shall deliv neither son nor daughter 
they onli shall be deliv but the land shall be desol 

14 17 or if i bring a sword upon that land and say sword go through 
the land so that i cut off man and beast from it 14 18 though these 
three men were in it a i live saith the lord god they shall 
deliv neither son nor daughter but they onli shall be deliv 
themselv 

14 19 or if i send a pestil into that land and pour out my furi 
upon it in blood to cut off from it man and beast 14 20 though noah 
daniel and job were in it a i live saith the lord god they shall 
deliv neither son nor daughter they shall but deliv their own 
soul by their righteou 

14 21 for thu saith the lord god how much more when i send my four 
sore judgment upon jerusalem the sword and the famin and the 
noisom beast and the pestil to cut off from it man and beast 
14 22 yet behold therein shall be left a remnant that shall be 
brought forth both son and daughter behold they shall come forth 
unto you and ye shall see their way and their do and ye shall be 
comfort concern the evil that i have brought upon jerusalem even 
concern all that i have brought upon it 

14 23 and they shall comfort you when ye see their way and their 
do and ye shall know that i have not done without cau all that 
i have done in it saith the lord god 

15 1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 15 2 son of man 
what is the vine tree more than ani tree or than a branch which is 
among the tree of the forest 15 3 shall wood be taken thereof to do 
ani work or will men take a pin of it to hang ani vessel thereon 
15 4 behold it is cast into the fire for fuel the fire devoureth 
both the end of it and the midst of it is burn is it meet for ani 
work 15 5 behold when it wa whole it wa meet for no work how 
much le shall it be meet yet for ani work when the fire hath 
devour it and it is burn 15 6 therefor thu saith the lord 
god a the vine tree among the tree of the forest which i have 
given to the fire for fuel so will i give the inhabit of 
jerusalem 

15 7 and i will set my face against them they shall go out from one 
fire and anoth fire shall devour them and ye shall know that i am 
the lord when i set my face against them 

15 8 and i will make the land desol becau they have commit a 
trespass saith the lord god 

16 1 again the word of the lord came unto me say 16 2 son of man 
cau jerusalem to know her abomin 16 3 and say thu saith the 
lord god unto jerusalem thi birth and thi nativ is of the land of 
canaan thi father wa an amorit and thi mother an hittit 

16 4 and a for thi nativ in the day thou wast born thi navel wa 
not cut neither wast thou wash in water to suppl thee thou wast 
not salt at all nor swaddl at all 

16 5 none eye piti thee to do ani of these unto thee to have 
compass upon thee but thou wast cast out in the open field to the 
loth of thi person in the day that thou wast born 

16 6 and when i pa by thee and saw thee pollut in thine own 
blood i said unto thee when thou wast in thi blood live yea i said 
unto thee when thou wast in thi blood live 

16 7 i have cau thee to multipli a the bud of the field and thou 
hast increa and waxen great and thou art come to excel 
ornament thi breast are fashion and thine hair is grown wherea 
thou wast nake and bare 

16 8 now when i pa by thee and look upon thee behold thi time 
wa the time of love and i spread my skirt over thee and cover thi 
nake yea i sware unto thee and enter into a coven with 
thee saith the lord god and thou becamest mine 

16 9 then wash i thee with water yea i throughli wash away thi 
blood from thee and i anoint thee with oil 

16 10 i cloth thee also with broider work and shod thee with 
badger skin and i gird thee about with fine linen and i cover 
thee with silk 

16 11 i deck thee also with ornament and i put bracelet upon thi 
hand and a chain on thi neck 

16 12 and i put a jewel on thi forehead and ear in thine ear 
and a beauti crown upon thine head 

16 13 thu wast thou deck with gold and silver and thi raiment wa 
of fine linen and silk and broider work thou didst eat fine 
flour and honey and oil and thou wast exceed beauti and thou 
didst prosper into a kingdom 

16 14 and thi renown went forth among the heathen for thi beauti for 
it wa perfect through my come which i had put upon thee saith 
the lord god 

16 15 but thou didst trust in thine own beauti and playedst the 
harlot becau of thi renown and pouredst out thi fornic on 
everi one that pa by hi it wa 

16 16 and of thi garment thou didst take and deckedst thi high 
place with diver colour and playedst the harlot thereupon the 
like thing shall not come neither shall it be so 

16 17 thou hast also taken thi fair jewel of my gold and of my 
silver which i had given thee and madest to thyself imag of men 
and didst commit whoredom with them 16 18 and tookest thi broider 
garment and coveredst them and thou hast set mine oil and mine 
incen befor them 

16 19 my meat also which i gave thee fine flour and oil and honey 
wherewith i fed thee thou hast even set it befor them for a sweet 
savour and thu it wa saith the lord god 

16 20 moreov thou hast taken thi son and thi daughter whom thou 
hast born unto me and these hast thou sacrif unto them to be 
devour is thi of thi whoredom a small matter 16 21 that thou 
hast slain my child and deliv them to cau them to pa 
through the fire for them 16 22 and in all thine abomin and 
thi whoredom thou hast not rememb the day of thi youth when 
thou wast nake and bare and wast pollut in thi blood 

16 23 and it came to pa after all thi wick woe woe unto 
thee saith the lord god 16 24 that thou hast also built unto thee 
an emin place and hast made thee an high place in everi street 

16 25 thou hast built thi high place at everi head of the way and 
hast made thi beauti to be abhor and hast open thi foot to everi 
one that pa by and multipli thi whoredom 

16 26 thou hast also commit fornic with the egyptian thi 
neighbour great of flesh and hast increa thi whoredom to 
provok me to anger 

16 27 behold therefor i have stretch out my hand over thee and 
have diminish thine ordinari food and deliv thee unto the will 
of them that hate thee the daughter of the philistin which are 
asham of thi lewd way 

16 28 thou hast play the whore also with the assyrian becau thou 
wast unsati yea thou hast play the harlot with them and yet 
couldest not be satisfi 

16 29 thou hast moreov multipli thi fornic in the land of 
canaan unto chaldea and yet thou wast not satisfi therewith 

16 30 how weak is thine heart saith the lord god see thou doest 
all these thing the work of an imperi whorish woman 16 31 in 
that thou buildest thine emin place in the head of everi way and 
makest thine high place in everi street and hast not been a an 
harlot in that thou scornest hire 16 32 but a a wife that 
committeth adulteri which taketh stranger instead of her husband 
16 33 they give gift to all whore but thou givest thi gift to all 
thi lover and hirest them that they may come unto thee on everi 
side for thi whoredom 

16 34 and the contrari is in thee from other woman in thi whoredom 
wherea none followeth thee to commit whoredom and in that thou 
givest a reward and no reward is given unto thee therefor thou art 
contrari 

16 35 wherefor o harlot hear the word of the lord 16 36 thu saith 
the lord god becau thi filthi wa pour out and thi nake 
discov through thi whoredom with thi lover and with all the 
idol of thi abomin and by the blood of thi child which 
thou didst give unto them 16 37 behold therefor i will gather all 
thi lover with whom thou hast taken pleasur and all them that thou 
hast love with all them that thou hast hate i will even gather 
them round about against thee and will discov thi nake unto 
them that they may see all thi nake 

16 38 and i will judg thee a woman that break wedlock and shed 
blood are judg and i will give thee blood in furi and jealousi 

16 39 and i will also give thee into their hand and they shall throw 
down thine emin place and shall break down thi high place they 
shall strip thee also of thi cloth and shall take thi fair jewel 
and leav thee nake and bare 

16 40 they shall also bring up a compani against thee and they shall 
stone thee with stone and thrust thee through with their sword 

16 41 and they shall burn thine hou with fire and execut 
judgment upon thee in the sight of mani woman and i will cau thee 
to cea from play the harlot and thou also shalt give no hire ani 
more 

16 42 so will i make my furi toward thee to rest and my jealousi 
shall depart from thee and i will be quiet and will be no more 
angri 

16 43 becau thou hast not rememb the day of thi youth but hast 
fret me in all these thing behold therefor i also will 
recompen thi way upon thine head saith the lord god and thou shalt 
not commit thi lewd abov all thine abomin 

16 44 behold everi one that useth proverb shall use thi proverb 
against thee say a is the mother so is her daughter 

16 45 thou art thi mother s daughter that lotheth her husband and her 
child and thou art the sister of thi sister which loth their 
husband and their child your mother wa an hittit and your 
father an amorit 

16 46 and thine elder sister is samaria she and her daughter that 
dwell at thi left hand and thi younger sister that dwelleth at thi 
right hand is sodom and her daughter 

16 47 yet hast thou not walk after their way nor done after their 
abomin but a if that were a veri littl thing thou wast 
corrupt more than they in all thi way 

16 48 a i live saith the lord god sodom thi sister hath not done 
she nor her daughter a thou hast done thou and thi daughter 

16 49 behold thi wa the iniqu of thi sister sodom pride 
ful of bread and abund of idl wa in her and in her 
daughter neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needi 

16 50 and they were haughti and commit abomin befor me 
therefor i took them away a i saw good 

16 51 neither hath samaria commit half of thi sin but thou hast 
multipli thine abomin more than they and hast justifi thi 
sister in all thine abomin which thou hast done 

16 52 thou also which hast judg thi sister bear thine own shame 
for thi sin that thou hast commit more abomin than they they 
are more righteou than thou yea be thou confound also and bear 
thi shame in that thou hast justifi thi sister 

16 53 when i shall bring again their captiv the captiv of sodom 
and her daughter and the captiv of samaria and her daughter 
then will i bring again the captiv of thi captiv in the midst of 
them 16 54 that thou mayest bear thine own shame and mayest be 
confound in all that thou hast done in that thou art a comfort unto 
them 

16 55 when thi sister sodom and her daughter shall return to their 
former estat and samaria and her daughter shall return to their 
former estat then thou and thi daughter shall return to your former 
estat 

16 56 for thi sister sodom wa not mention by thi mouth in the day 
of thi pride 16 57 befor thi wick wa discov a at the 
time of thi reproach of the daughter of syria and all that are round 
about her the daughter of the philistin which despi thee round 
about 

16 58 thou hast born thi lewd and thine abomin saith the 
lord 

16 59 for thu saith the lord god i will even deal with thee a thou 
hast done which hast despi the oath in break the coven 

16 60 nevertheless i will rememb my coven with thee in the day 
of thi youth and i will establish unto thee an everlast coven 

16 61 then thou shalt rememb thi way and be asham when thou 
shalt receiv thi sister thine elder and thi younger and i will 
give them unto thee for daughter but not by thi coven 

16 62 and i will establish my coven with thee and thou shalt know 
that i am the lord 16 63 that thou mayest rememb and be 
confound and never open thi mouth ani more becau of thi shame 
when i am pacifi toward thee for all that thou hast done saith the 
lord god 

17 1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 17 2 son of man 
put forth a riddl and speak a parabl unto the hou of israel 17 3 
and say thu saith the lord god a great eagl with great wing 
longw full of feather which had diver colour came unto 
lebanon and took the highest branch of the cedar 17 4 he crop off 
the top of hi young twig and carri it into a land of traffick he 
set it in a citi of merchant 

17 5 he took also of the seed of the land and plant it in a 
fruit field he place it by great water and set it a a willow 
tree 

17 6 and it grew and becam a spread vine of low statur whose 
branch turn toward him and the root thereof were under him so 
it becam a vine and brought forth branch and shot forth sprig 

17 7 there wa also anoth great eagl with great wing and mani 
feather and behold thi vine did bend her root toward him and 
shot forth her branch toward him that he might water it by the 
furrow of her plantat 

17 8 it wa plant in a good soil by great water that it might 
bring forth branch and that it might bear fruit that it might be a 
goodli vine 

17 9 say thou thu saith the lord god shall it prosper shall he not 
pull up the root thereof and cut off the fruit thereof that it 
wither it shall wither in all the leaf of her spring even without 
great power or mani peopl to pluck it up by the root thereof 

17 10 yea behold be plant shall it prosper shall it not 
utterli wither when the east wind toucheth it it shall wither in the 
furrow where it grew 

17 11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 17 12 say 
now to the rebelli hou know ye not what these thing mean tell 
them behold the king of babylon is come to jerusalem and hath taken 
the king thereof and the princ thereof and led them with him to 
babylon 17 13 and hath taken of the king s seed and made a coven 
with him and hath taken an oath of him he hath also taken the mighti 
of the land 17 14 that the kingdom might be base that it might not 
lift itself up but that by keep of hi coven it might stand 

17 15 but he rebel against him in send hi ambassador into 
egypt that they might give him hor and much peopl shall he 
prosper shall he escap that doeth such thing or shall he break the 
coven and be deliv 17 16 a i live saith the lord god 
sure in the place where the king dwelleth that made him king whose 
oath he despi and whose coven he brake even with him in the 
midst of babylon he shall die 

17 17 neither shall pharaoh with hi mighti armi and great compani 
make for him in the war by cast up mount and build fort to 
cut off mani person 17 18 see he despi the oath by break 
the coven when lo he had given hi hand and hath done all these 
thing he shall not escap 

17 19 therefor thu saith the lord god a i live sure mine oath 
that he hath despi and my coven that he hath broken even it 
will i recompen upon hi own head 

17 20 and i will spread my net upon him and he shall be taken in my 
snare and i will bring him to babylon and will plead with him there 
for hi trespass that he hath trespass against me 

17 21 and all hi fugit with all hi band shall fall by the 
sword and they that remain shall be scatter toward all wind and 
ye shall know that i the lord have spoken it 

17 22 thu saith the lord god i will also take of the highest branch 
of the high cedar and will set it i will crop off from the top of 
hi young twig a tender one and will plant it upon an high mountain 
and emin 17 23 in the mountain of the height of israel will i 
plant it and it shall bring forth bough and bear fruit and be a 
goodli cedar and under it shall dwell all fowl of everi wing in the 
shadow of the branch thereof shall they dwell 

17 24 and all the tree of the field shall know that i the lord have 
brought down the high tree have exalt the low tree have dri up 
the green tree and have made the dri tree to flourish i the lord 
have spoken and have done it 

18 1 the word of the lord came unto me again say 18 2 what mean 
ye that ye use thi proverb concern the land of israel say 
the father have eaten sour grape and the child s teeth are set 
on edg 18 3 a i live saith the lord god ye shall not have 
occa ani more to use thi proverb in israel 

18 4 behold all soul are mine a the soul of the father so also 
the soul of the son is mine the soul that sinneth it shall die 

18 5 but if a man be just and do that which is law and right 18 6 
and hath not eaten upon the mountain neither hath lift up hi eye 
to the idol of the hou of israel neither hath defil hi 
neighbour s wife neither hath come near to a menstruou woman 18 7 
and hath not oppress ani but hath restor to the debtor hi 
pledg hath spoil none by violenc hath given hi bread to the 
hungri and hath cover the nake with a garment 18 8 he that hath 
not given forth upon usuri neither hath taken ani increa that hath 
withdrawn hi hand from iniqu hath execut true judgment between 
man and man 18 9 hath walk in my statut and hath kept my 
judgment to deal truli he is just he shall sure live saith the 
lord god 

18 10 if he beget a son that is a robber a shedder of blood and that 
doeth the like to ani one of these thing 18 11 and that doeth not 
ani of those duti but even hath eaten upon the mountain and 
defil hi neighbour s wife 18 12 hath oppress the poor and needi 
hath spoil by violenc hath not restor the pledg and hath 
lift up hi eye to the idol hath commit abomin 18 13 
hath given forth upon usuri and hath taken increa shall he then 
live he shall not live he hath done all these abomin he shall 
sure die hi blood shall be upon him 

18 14 now lo if he beget a son that seeth all hi father s sin 
which he hath done and considereth and doeth not such like 18 15 
that hath not eaten upon the mountain neither hath lift up hi 
eye to the idol of the hou of israel hath not defil hi 
neighbour s wife 18 16 neither hath oppress ani hath not 
withholden the pledg neither hath spoil by violenc but hath 
given hi bread to the hungri and hath cover the nake with a 
garment 18 17 that hath taken off hi hand from the poor that hath 
not receiv usuri nor increa hath execut my judgment hath 
walk in my statut he shall not die for the iniqu of hi 
father he shall sure live 

18 18 a for hi father becau he cruelli oppress spoil hi 
brother by violenc and did that which is not good among hi peopl 
lo even he shall die in hi iniqu 

18 19 yet say ye whi doth not the son bear the iniqu of the 
father when the son hath done that which is law and right and 
hath kept all my statut and hath done them he shall sure live 

18 20 the soul that sinneth it shall die the son shall not bear the 
iniqu of the father neither shall the father bear the iniqu of 
the son the righteou of the righteou shall be upon him and the 
wick of the wick shall be upon him 

18 21 but if the wick will turn from all hi sin that he hath 
commit and keep all my statut and do that which is law and 
right he shall sure live he shall not die 

18 22 all hi transgress that he hath commit they shall not be 
mention unto him in hi righteou that he hath done he shall 
live 

18 23 have i ani pleasur at all that the wick should die saith the 
lord god and not that he should return from hi way and live 
18 24 but when the righteou turneth away from hi righteou and 
committeth iniqu and doeth accord to all the abomin that 
the wick man doeth shall he live all hi righteou that he 
hath done shall not be mention in hi trespass that he hath 
trespass and in hi sin that he hath sin in them shall he die 

18 25 yet ye say the way of the lord is not equal hear now o hou 
of israel is not my way equal are not your way unequ 18 26 when 
a righteou man turneth away from hi righteou and committeth 
iniqu and dieth in them for hi iniqu that he hath done shall 
he die 

18 27 again when the wick man turneth away from hi wick that 
he hath commit and doeth that which is law and right he shall 
save hi soul aliv 

18 28 becau he considereth and turneth away from all hi 
transgress that he hath commit he shall sure live he shall 
not die 

18 29 yet saith the hou of israel the way of the lord is not equal 
o hou of israel are not my way equal are not your way unequ 
18 30 therefor i will judg you o hou of israel everi one 
accord to hi way saith the lord god repent and turn yourselv 
from all your transgress so iniqu shall not be your ruin 

18 31 cast away from you all your transgress wherebi ye have 
transgress and make you a new heart and a new spirit for whi will 
ye die o hou of israel 18 32 for i have no pleasur in the death 
of him that dieth saith the lord god wherefor turn yourselv and 
live ye 

19 1 moreov take thou up a lament for the princ of israel 
19 2 and say what is thi mother a lioness she lay down among lion 
she nourish her whelp among young lion 

19 3 and she brought up one of her whelp it becam a young lion and 
it learn to catch the prey it devour men 

19 4 the nation also heard of him he wa taken in their pit and 
they brought him with chain unto the land of egypt 

19 5 now when she saw that she had wait and her hope wa lost then 
she took anoth of her whelp and made him a young lion 

19 6 and he went up and down among the lion he becam a young lion 
and learn to catch the prey and devour men 

19 7 and he knew their desol palac and he laid wast their 
citi and the land wa desol and the ful thereof by the 
noi of hi roar 

19 8 then the nation set against him on everi side from the 
provinc and spread their net over him he wa taken in their pit 

19 9 and they put him in ward in chain and brought him to the king 
of babylon they brought him into hold that hi voic should no more 
be heard upon the mountain of israel 

19 10 thi mother is like a vine in thi blood plant by the water 
she wa fruit and full of branch by reason of mani water 

19 11 and she had strong rod for the sceptr of them that bare rule 
and her statur wa exalt among the thick branch and she appear 
in her height with the multitud of her branch 

19 12 but she wa pluck up in furi she wa cast down to the ground 
and the east wind dri up her fruit her strong rod were broken and 
wither the fire consum them 

19 13 and now she is plant in the wilder in a dri and thirsti 
ground 

19 14 and fire is gone out of a rod of her branch which hath 
devour her fruit so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptr to 
rule thi is a lament and shall be for a lament 

20 1 and it came to pa in the seventh year in the fifth month the 
tenth day of the month that certain of the elder of israel came to 
enquir of the lord and sat befor me 

20 2 then came the word of the lord unto me say 20 3 son of man 
speak unto the elder of israel and say unto them thu saith the 
lord god are ye come to enquir of me a i live saith the lord god 
i will not be enquir of by you 

20 4 wilt thou judg them son of man wilt thou judg them cau 
them to know the abomin of their father 20 5 and say unto 
them thu saith the lord god in the day when i chose israel and 
lift up mine hand unto the seed of the hou of jacob and made 
myself known unto them in the land of egypt when i lift up mine 
hand unto them say i am the lord your god 20 6 in the day that i 
lift up mine hand unto them to bring them forth of the land of 
egypt into a land that i had espi for them flow with milk and 
honey which is the glori of all land 20 7 then said i unto them 
cast ye away everi man the abomin of hi eye and defil not 
yourselv with the idol of egypt i am the lord your god 

20 8 but they rebel against me and would not hearken unto me they 
did not everi man cast away the abomin of their eye neither 
did they forsak the idol of egypt then i said i will pour out my 
furi upon them to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of 
the land of egypt 

20 9 but i wrought for my name s sake that it should not be pollut 
befor the heathen among whom they were in whose sight i made myself 
known unto them in bring them forth out of the land of egypt 

20 10 wherefor i cau them to go forth out of the land of egypt 
and brought them into the wilder 

20 11 and i gave them my statut and shew them my judgment which 
if a man do he shall even live in them 

20 12 moreov also i gave them my sabbath to be a sign between me 
and them that they might know that i am the lord that sanctifi them 

20 13 but the hou of israel rebel against me in the wilder 
they walk not in my statut and they despi my judgment which 
if a man do he shall even live in them and my sabbath they greatli 
pollut then i said i would pour out my furi upon them in the 
wilder to consum them 

20 14 but i wrought for my name s sake that it should not be pollut 
befor the heathen in whose sight i brought them out 

20 15 yet also i lift up my hand unto them in the wilder that i 
would not bring them into the land which i had given them flow 
with milk and honey which is the glori of all land 20 16 becau 
they despi my judgment and walk not in my statut but 
pollut my sabbath for their heart went after their idol 

20 17 nevertheless mine eye spare them from destroy them neither 
did i make an end of them in the wilder 

20 18 but i said unto their child in the wilder walk ye not in 
the statut of your father neither observ their judgment nor 
defil yourselv with their idol 20 19 i am the lord your god walk 
in my statut and keep my judgment and do them 20 20 and hallow 
my sabbath and they shall be a sign between me and you that ye may 
know that i am the lord your god 

20 21 notwithstand the child rebel against me they walk 
not in my statut neither kept my judgment to do them which if a 
man do he shall even live in them they pollut my sabbath then i 
said i would pour out my furi upon them to accomplish my anger 
against them in the wilder 

20 22 nevertheless i withdrew mine hand and wrought for my name s 
sake that it should not be pollut in the sight of the heathen in 
whose sight i brought them forth 

20 23 i lift up mine hand unto them also in the wilder that i 
would scatter them among the heathen and disper them through the 
countri 20 24 becau they had not execut my judgment but had 
despi my statut and had pollut my sabbath and their eye 
were after their father idol 

20 25 wherefor i gave them also statut that were not good and 
judgment wherebi they should not live 20 26 and i pollut them in 
their own gift in that they cau to pa through the fire all that 
openeth the womb that i might make them desol to the end that 
they might know that i am the lord 

20 27 therefor son of man speak unto the hou of israel and say 
unto them thu saith the lord god yet in thi your father have 
blasphem me in that they have commit a trespass against me 

20 28 for when i had brought them into the land for the which i 
lift up mine hand to give it to them then they saw everi high hill 
and all the thick tree and they offer there their sacrif and 
there they present the provoc of their offer there also 
they made their sweet savour and pour out there their drink 
offer 

20 29 then i said unto them what is the high place whereunto ye go 
and the name whereof is call bamah unto thi day 

20 30 wherefor say unto the hou of israel thu saith the lord god 
are ye pollut after the manner of your father and commit ye 
whoredom after their abomin 20 31 for when ye offer your 
gift when ye make your son to pa through the fire ye pollut 
yourselv with all your idol even unto thi day and shall i be 
enquir of by you o hou of israel a i live saith the lord god 
i will not be enquir of by you 

20 32 and that which cometh into your mind shall not be at all that 
ye say we will be a the heathen a the famili of the countri 
to serv wood and stone 

20 33 a i live saith the lord god sure with a mighti hand and 
with a stretch out arm and with furi pour out will i rule over 
you 20 34 and i will bring you out from the peopl and will gather 
you out of the countri wherein ye are scatter with a mighti hand 
and with a stretch out arm and with furi pour out 

20 35 and i will bring you into the wilder of the peopl and 
there will i plead with you face to face 

20 36 like a i plead with your father in the wilder of the 
land of egypt so will i plead with you saith the lord god 

20 37 and i will cau you to pa under the rod and i will bring you 
into the bond of the coven 20 38 and i will purg out from among 
you the rebel and them that transgress against me i will bring them 
forth out of the countri where they sojourn and they shall not enter 
into the land of israel and ye shall know that i am the lord 

20 39 a for you o hou of israel thu saith the lord god go ye 
serv ye everi one hi idol and hereaft also if ye will not 
hearken unto me but pollut ye my holi name no more with your gift 
and with your idol 

20 40 for in mine holi mountain in the mountain of the height of 
israel saith the lord god there shall all the hou of israel all 
of them in the land serv me there will i accept them and there 
will i requir your offer and the firstfruit of your oblat 
with all your holi thing 

20 41 i will accept you with your sweet savour when i bring you out 
from the peopl and gather you out of the countri wherein ye have 
been scatter and i will be sanctifi in you befor the heathen 

20 42 and ye shall know that i am the lord when i shall bring you 
into the land of israel into the countri for the which i lift up 
mine hand to give it to your father 

20 43 and there shall ye rememb your way and all your do 
wherein ye have been defil and ye shall loth yourselv in your 
own sight for all your evil that ye have commit 

20 44 and ye shall know that i am the lord when i have wrought with 
you for my name s sake not accord to your wick way nor 
accord to your corrupt do o ye hou of israel saith the lord 
god 

20 45 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 20 46 son of 
man set thi face toward the south and drop thi word toward the 
south and prophesi against the forest of the south field 20 47 and 
say to the forest of the south hear the word of the lord thu saith 
the lord god behold i will kindl a fire in thee and it shall 
devour everi green tree in thee and everi dri tree the flame flame 
shall not be quench and all face from the south to the north shall 
be burn therein 

20 48 and all flesh shall see that i the lord have kindl it it 
shall not be quench 

20 49 then said i ah lord god they say of me doth he not speak 
parabl 21 1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 21 2 
son of man set thi face toward jerusalem and drop thi word toward 
the holi place and prophesi against the land of israel 21 3 and say 
to the land of israel thu saith the lord behold i am against thee 
and will draw forth my sword out of hi sheath and will cut off from 
thee the righteou and the wick 

21 4 see then that i will cut off from thee the righteou and the 
wick therefor shall my sword go forth out of hi sheath against 
all flesh from the south to the north 21 5 that all flesh may know 
that i the lord have drawn forth my sword out of hi sheath it shall 
not return ani more 

21 6 sigh therefor thou son of man with the break of thi loin 
and with bitter sigh befor their eye 

21 7 and it shall be when they say unto thee wherefor sighest thou 
that thou shalt answer for the tide becau it cometh and everi 
heart shall melt and all hand shall be feebl and everi spirit 
shall faint and all knee shall be weak a water behold it cometh 
and shall be brought to pa saith the lord god 

21 8 again the word of the lord came unto me say 21 9 son of man 
prophesi and say thu saith the lord say a sword a sword is 
sharpen and also furbish 21 10 it is sharpen to make a sore 
slaughter it is furbish that it may glitter should we then make 
mirth it contemneth the rod of my son a everi tree 

21 11 and he hath given it to be furbish that it may be handl 
thi sword is sharpen and it is furbish to give it into the hand 
of the slayer 

21 12 cri and howl son of man for it shall be upon my peopl it 
shall be upon all the princ of israel terror by reason of the 
sword shall be upon my peopl smite therefor upon thi thigh 

21 13 becau it is a trial and what if the sword contemn even the 
rod it shall be no more saith the lord god 

21 14 thou therefor son of man prophesi and smite thine hand 
togeth and let the sword be doubl the third time the sword of 
the slain it is the sword of the great men that are slain which 
entereth into their privi chamber 

21 15 i have set the point of the sword against all their gate that 
their heart may faint and their ruin be multipli ah it is made 
bright it is wrap up for the slaughter 

21 16 go thee one way or other either on the right hand or on the 
left whithersoev thi face is set 

21 17 i will also smite mine hand togeth and i will cau my furi 
to rest i the lord have said it 

21 18 the word of the lord came unto me again say 21 19 also 
thou son of man appoint thee two way that the sword of the king of 
babylon may come both twain shall come forth out of one land and 
choo thou a place choo it at the head of the way to the citi 

21 20 appoint a way that the sword may come to rabbath of the 
ammonit and to judah in jerusalem the defenc 

21 21 for the king of babylon stood at the part of the way at the 
head of the two way to use divin he made hi arrow bright he 
consult with imag he look in the liver 

21 22 at hi right hand wa the divin for jerusalem to appoint 
captain to open the mouth in the slaughter to lift up the voic 
with shout to appoint batter ram against the gate to cast a 
mount and to build a fort 

21 23 and it shall be unto them a a fal divin in their sight 
to them that have sworn oath but he will call to remembr the 
iniqu that they may be taken 

21 24 therefor thu saith the lord god becau ye have made your 
iniqu to be rememb in that your transgress are discov 
so that in all your do your sin do appear becau i say that 
ye are come to remembr ye shall be taken with the hand 

21 25 and thou profan wick princ of israel whose day is come 
when iniqu shall have an end 21 26 thu saith the lord god remov 
the diadem and take off the crown thi shall not be the same exalt 
him that is low and aba him that is high 

21 27 i will overturn overturn overturn it and it shall be no 
more until he come whose right it is and i will give it him 

21 28 and thou son of man prophesi and say thu saith the lord god 
concern the ammonit and concern their reproach even say 
thou the sword the sword is drawn for the slaughter it is 
furbish to consum becau of the glitter 21 29 while they see 
vaniti unto thee while they divin a lie unto thee to bring thee 
upon the neck of them that are slain of the wick whose day is 
come when their iniqu shall have an end 

21 30 shall i cau it to return into hi sheath i will judg thee in 
the place where thou wast creat in the land of thi nativ 

21 31 and i will pour out mine indign upon thee i will blow 
against thee in the fire of my wrath and deliv thee into the hand 
of brutish men and skil to destroy 

21 32 thou shalt be for fuel to the fire thi blood shall be in the 
midst of the land thou shalt be no more rememb for i the lord 
have spoken it 

22 1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 22 2 now 
thou son of man wilt thou judg wilt thou judg the bloodi citi 
yea thou shalt shew her all her abomin 

22 3 then say thou thu saith the lord god the citi sheddeth blood 
in the midst of it that her time may come and maketh idol against 
herself to defil herself 

22 4 thou art becom guilti in thi blood that thou hast shed and hast 
defil thyself in thine idol which thou hast made and thou hast 
cau thi day to draw near and art come even unto thi year 
therefor have i made thee a reproach unto the heathen and a mock 
to all countri 

22 5 those that be near and those that be far from thee shall mock 
thee which art infam and much vex 

22 6 behold the princ of israel everi one were in thee to their 
power to shed blood 

22 7 in thee have they set light by father and mother in the midst of 
thee have they dealt by oppress with the stranger in thee have 
they vex the fatherless and the widow 

22 8 thou hast despi mine holi thing and hast profan my 
sabbath 

22 9 in thee are men that carri tale to shed blood and in thee they 
eat upon the mountain in the midst of thee they commit lewd 

22 10 in thee have they discov their father nake in thee 
have they humbl her that wa set apart for pollut 

22 11 and one hath commit abomin with hi neighbour s wife 
and anoth hath lewdli defil hi daughter in law and anoth in 
thee hath humbl hi sister hi father s daughter 

22 12 in thee have they taken gift to shed blood thou hast taken 
usuri and increa and thou hast greedili gain of thi neighbour by 
extort and hast forgotten me saith the lord god 

22 13 behold therefor i have smitten mine hand at thi dishonest gain 
which thou hast made and at thi blood which hath been in the midst of 
thee 

22 14 can thine heart endur or can thine hand be strong in the 
day that i shall deal with thee i the lord have spoken it and will 
do it 

22 15 and i will scatter thee among the heathen and disper thee in 
the countri and will consum thi filthi out of thee 

22 16 and thou shalt take thine inherit in thyself in the sight of 
the heathen and thou shalt know that i am the lord 

22 17 and the word of the lord came unto me say 22 18 son of man 
the hou of israel is to me becom dross all they are brass and 
tin and iron and lead in the midst of the furnac they are even 
the dross of silver 

22 19 therefor thu saith the lord god becau ye are all becom 
dross behold therefor i will gather you into the midst of 
jerusalem 

22 20 a they gather silver and brass and iron and lead and tin 
into the midst of the furnac to blow the fire upon it to melt it 
so will i gather you in mine anger and in my furi and i will leav 
you there and melt you 

22 21 yea i will gather you and blow upon you in the fire of my 
wrath and ye shall be melt in the midst therof 

22 22 a silver is melt in the midst of the furnac so shall ye be 
melt in the midst thereof and ye shall know that i the lord have 
pour out my furi upon you 

22 23 and the word of the lord came unto me say 22 24 son of man 
say unto her thou art the land that is not clean nor rain upon 
in the day of indign 

22 25 there is a conspiraci of her prophet in the midst thereof like 
a roar lion raven the prey they have devour soul they have 
taken the treasur and preciou thing they have made her mani widow 
in the midst thereof 

22 26 her priest have violat my law and have profan mine holi 
thing they have put no differ between the holi and profan 
neither have they shew differ between the unclean and the clean 
and have hid their eye from my sabbath and i am profan among 
them 

22 27 her princ in the midst thereof are like wolf raven the 
prey to shed blood and to destroy soul to get dishonest gain 

22 28 and her prophet have daub them with untemp morter see 
vaniti and divin lie unto them say thu saith the lord god 
when the lord hath not spoken 

22 29 the peopl of the land have use oppress and exerci 
robberi and have vex the poor and needi yea they have oppress 
the stranger wrong 

22 30 and i sought for a man among them that should make up the 
hedg and stand in the gap befor me for the land that i should not 
destroy it but i found none 

22 31 therefor have i pour out mine indign upon them i have 
consum them with the fire of my wrath their own way have i 
recompen upon their head saith the lord god 

23 1 the word of the lord came again unto me say 23 2 son of man 
there were two woman the daughter of one mother 23 3 and they 
commit whoredom in egypt they commit whoredom in their youth 
there were their breast press and there they brui the teat of 
their virgin 

23 4 and the name of them were aholah the elder and aholibah her 
sister and they were mine and they bare son and daughter thu 
were their name samaria is aholah and jerusalem aholibah 

23 5 and aholah play the harlot when she wa mine and she dote on 
her lover on the assyrian her neighbour 23 6 which were cloth 
with blue captain and ruler all of them desir young men 
horseman ride upon hor 

23 7 thu she commit her whoredom with them with all them that 
were the chosen men of assyria and with all on whom she dote with 
all their idol she defil herself 

23 8 neither left she her whoredom brought from egypt for in her 
youth they lay with her and they brui the breast of her 
virgin and pour their whoredom upon her 

23 9 wherefor i have deliv her into the hand of her lover into 
the hand of the assyrian upon whom she dote 

23 10 these discov her nake they took her son and her 
daughter and slew her with the sword and she becam famou among 
woman for they had execut judgment upon her 

23 11 and when her sister aholibah saw thi she wa more corrupt in 
her inordin love than she and in her whoredom more than her 
sister in her whoredom 

23 12 she dote upon the assyrian her neighbour captain and ruler 
cloth most gorgeou horseman ride upon hor all of them 
desir young men 

23 13 then i saw that she wa defil that they took both one way 
23 14 and that she increa her whoredom for when she saw men 
pourtray upon the wall the imag of the chaldean pourtray with 
vermilion 23 15 gird with girdl upon their loin exceed in 
dy attir upon their head all of them princ to look to after 
the manner of the babylonian of chaldea the land of their nativ 
23 16 and a soon a she saw them with her eye she dote upon them 
and sent messeng unto them into chaldea 

23 17 and the babylonian came to her into the bed of love and they 
defil her with their whoredom and she wa pollut with them and 
her mind wa alien from them 

23 18 so she discov her whoredom and discov her nake 
then my mind wa alien from her like a my mind wa alien 
from her sister 

23 19 yet she multipli her whoredom in call to remembr the 
day of her youth wherein she had play the harlot in the land of 
egypt 

23 20 for she dote upon their paramour whose flesh is a the flesh 
of as and whose issu is like the issu of hor 

23 21 thu thou calledst to remembr the lewd of thi youth in 
brui thi teat by the egyptian for the pap of thi youth 

23 22 therefor o aholibah thu saith the lord god behold i will 
rai up thi lover against thee from whom thi mind is alien and 
i will bring them against thee on everi side 23 23 the babylonian 
and all the chaldean pekod and shoa and koa and all the assyrian 
with them all of them desir young men captain and ruler great 
lord and renown all of them ride upon hor 

23 24 and they shall come against thee with chariot wagon and 
wheel and with an assembl of peopl which shall set against thee 
buckler and shield and helmet round about and i will set judgment 
befor them and they shall judg thee accord to their judgment 

23 25 and i will set my jealousi against thee and they shall deal 
furiou with thee they shall take away thi nose and thine ear and 
thi remnant shall fall by the sword they shall take thi son and thi 
daughter and thi residu shall be devour by the fire 

23 26 they shall also strip thee out of thi cloth and take away thi 
fair jewel 

23 27 thu will i make thi lewd to cea from thee and thi 
whoredom brought from the land of egypt so that thou shalt not lift 
up thine eye unto them nor rememb egypt ani more 

23 28 for thu saith the lord god behold i will deliv thee into 
the hand of them whom thou hatest into the hand of them from whom thi 
mind is alien 23 29 and they shall deal with thee hate and 
shall take away all thi labour and shall leav thee nake and bare 
and the nake of thi whoredom shall be discov both thi 
lewd and thi whoredom 

23 30 i will do these thing unto thee becau thou hast gone a 
whore after the heathen and becau thou art pollut with their 
idol 

23 31 thou hast walk in the way of thi sister therefor will i give 
her cup into thine hand 

23 32 thu saith the lord god thou shalt drink of thi sister s cup 
deep and larg thou shalt be laugh to scorn and had in deri it 
containeth much 

23 33 thou shalt be fill with drunken and sorrow with the cup 
of astonish and desol with the cup of thi sister samaria 

23 34 thou shalt even drink it and suck it out and thou shalt break 
the sherd thereof and pluck off thine own breast for i have spoken 
it saith the lord god 

23 35 therefor thu saith the lord god becau thou hast forgotten 
me and cast me behind thi back therefor bear thou also thi lewd 
and thi whoredom 

23 36 the lord said moreov unto me son of man wilt thou judg 
aholah and aholibah yea declar unto them their abomin 23 37 
that they have commit adulteri and blood is in their hand and 
with their idol have they commit adulteri and have also cau 
their son whom they bare unto me to pa for them through the fire 
to devour them 

23 38 moreov thi they have done unto me they have defil my 
sanctuari in the same day and have profan my sabbath 

23 39 for when they had slain their child to their idol then they 
came the same day into my sanctuari to profan it and lo thu have 
they done in the midst of mine hou 

23 40 and furthermor that ye have sent for men to come from far 
unto whom a messeng wa sent and lo they came for whom thou 
didst wash thyself paintedst thi eye and deckedst thyself with
