thee and the wife of thi youth against whom thou hast dealt 
treacher yet is she thi companion and the wife of thi coven 

2 15 and did not he make one yet had he the residu of the spirit 
and wherefor one that he might seek a godli seed therefor take 
heed to your spirit and let none deal treacher against the wife 
of hi youth 

2 16 for the lord the god of israel saith that he hateth put 
away for one covereth violenc with hi garment saith the lord of 
host therefor take heed to your spirit that ye deal not 
treacher 

2 17 ye have weari the lord with your word yet ye say wherein 
have we weari him when ye say everi one that doeth evil is good in 
the sight of the lord and he delighteth in them or where is the god 
of judgment 3 1 behold i will send my messeng and he shall 
prepar the way befor me and the lord whom ye seek shall suddenli 
come to hi templ even the messeng of the coven whom ye 
delight in behold he shall come saith the lord of host 

3 2 but who may abid the day of hi come and who shall stand when 
he appeareth for he is like a refin s fire and like fuller soap 
3 3 and he shall sit a a refin and purifi of silver and he shall 
purifi the son of levi and purg them a gold and silver that they 
may offer unto the lord an offer in righteou 

3 4 then shall the offer of judah and jerusalem be pleasant unto 
the lord a in the day of old and a in former year 

3 5 and i will come near to you to judgment and i will be a swift 
wit against the sorcer and against the adult and against 
fal swearer and against those that oppress the hirel in hi 
wage the widow and the fatherless and that turn asid the stranger 
from hi right and fear not me saith the lord of host 

3 6 for i am the lord i chang not therefor ye son of jacob are 
not consum 

3 7 even from the day of your father ye are gone away from mine 
ordin and have not kept them return unto me and i will return 
unto you saith the lord of host but ye said wherein shall we 
return 3 8 will a man rob god yet ye have rob me but ye say 
wherein have we rob thee in tith and offer 

3 9 ye are cur with a cur for ye have rob me even thi whole 
nation 

3 10 bring ye all the tith into the storeh that there may be 
meat in mine hou and prove me now herewith saith the lord of 
host if i will not open you the window of heaven and pour you out 
a bless that there shall not be room enough to receiv it 

3 11 and i will rebuk the devour for your sake and he shall not 
destroy the fruit of your ground neither shall your vine cast her 
fruit befor the time in the field saith the lord of host 

3 12 and all nation shall call you bless for ye shall be a 
delightsom land saith the lord of host 

3 13 your word have been stout against me saith the lord yet ye 
say what have we spoken so much against thee 3 14 ye have said it 
is vain to serv god and what profit is it that we have kept hi 
ordin and that we have walk mourn befor the lord of 
host 3 15 and now we call the proud happi yea they that work 
wick are set up yea they that tempt god are even deliv 

3 16 then they that fear the lord spake often one to anoth and 
the lord hearken and heard it and a book of remembr wa 
written befor him for them that fear the lord and that thought 
upon hi name 

3 17 and they shall be mine saith the lord of host in that day when 
i make up my jewel and i will spare them a a man spareth hi own 
son that serveth him 

3 18 then shall ye return and discern between the righteou and the 
wick between him that serveth god and him that serveth him not 

4 1 for behold the day cometh that shall burn a an oven and all 
the proud yea and all that do wickedli shall be stubbl and the 
day that cometh shall burn them up saith the lord of host that it 
shall leav them neither root nor branch 

4 2 but unto you that fear my name shall the sun of righteou 
ari with heal in hi wing and ye shall go forth and grow up a 
calf of the stall 

4 3 and ye shall tread down the wick for they shall be ash under 
the sol of your foot in the day that i shall do thi saith the lord 
of host 

4 4 rememb ye the law of mose my servant which i command unto 
him in horeb for all israel with the statut and judgment 

4 5 behold i will send you elijah the prophet befor the come of 
the great and dread day of the lord 4 6 and he shall turn the 
heart of the father to the child and the heart of the child to 
their father lest i come and smite the earth with a cur 







the new testament of the king jame bibl 




the gospel accord to saint matthew 


1 1 the book of the gener of jesu christ the son of david the 
son of abraham 

1 2 abraham begat isaac and isaac begat jacob and jacob begat juda 
and hi brother 1 3 and juda begat phare and zara of thamar and 
phare begat esrom and esrom begat aram 1 4 and aram begat aminadab 
and aminadab begat naasson and naasson begat salmon 1 5 and salmon 
begat booz of rachab and booz begat obe of ruth and obe begat 
jess 1 6 and jess begat david the king and david the king begat 
solomon of her that had been the wife of uria 1 7 and solomon begat 
roboam and roboam begat abia and abia begat asa 1 8 and asa begat 
josaphat and josaphat begat joram and joram begat ozia 1 9 and 
ozia begat joatham and joatham begat achaz and achaz begat ezekia 
1 10 and ezekia begat manass and manass begat amon and amon 
begat josia 1 11 and josia begat jechonia and hi brother about 
the time they were carri away to babylon 1 12 and after they were 
brought to babylon jechonia begat salathiel and salathiel begat 
zorobabel 1 13 and zorobabel begat abiud and abiud begat eliakim 
and eliakim begat azor 1 14 and azor begat sadoc and sadoc begat 
achim and achim begat eliud 1 15 and eliud begat eleazar and 
eleazar begat matthan and matthan begat jacob 1 16 and jacob begat 
joseph the husband of mari of whom wa born jesu who is call 
christ 

1 17 so all the gener from abraham to david are fourteen 
gener and from david until the carri away into babylon are 
fourteen gener and from the carri away into babylon unto 
christ are fourteen gener 

1 18 now the birth of jesu christ wa on thi wise when a hi 
mother mari wa espou to joseph befor they came togeth she wa 
found with child of the holi ghost 

1 19 then joseph her husband be a just man and not will to 
make her a publick exampl wa mind to put her away privili 

1 20 but while he thought on these thing behold the angel of the 
lord appear unto him in a dream say joseph thou son of david 
fear not to take unto thee mari thi wife for that which is conceiv 
in her is of the holi ghost 

1 21 and she shall bring forth a son and thou shalt call hi name 
jesu for he shall save hi peopl from their sin 

1 22 now all thi wa done that it might be fulfil which wa 
spoken of the lord by the prophet say 1 23 behold a virgin shall 
be with child and shall bring forth a son and they shall call hi 
name emmanuel which be interpret is god with u 

1 24 then joseph be rai from sleep did a the angel of the lord 
had bidden him and took unto him hi wife 1 25 and knew her not till 
she had brought forth her firstborn son and he call hi name jesu 

2 1 now when jesu wa born in bethlehem of judaea in the day of 
herod the king behold there came wise men from the east to 
jerusalem 2 2 say where is he that is born king of the jew for 
we have seen hi star in the east and are come to worship him 

2 3 when herod the king had heard these thing he wa troubl and 
all jerusalem with him 

2 4 and when he had gather all the chief priest and scribe of the 
peopl togeth he demand of them where christ should be born 

2 5 and they said unto him in bethlehem of judaea for thu it is 
written by the prophet 2 6 and thou bethlehem in the land of juda 
art not the least among the princ of juda for out of thee shall 
come a governor that shall rule my peopl israel 

2 7 then herod when he had privili call the wise men enquir of 
them dilig what time the star appear 

2 8 and he sent them to bethlehem and said go and search dilig 
for the young child and when ye have found him bring me word again 
that i may come and worship him also 

2 9 when they had heard the king they depart and lo the star 
which they saw in the east went befor them till it came and stood 
over where the young child wa 

2 10 when they saw the star they rejoic with exceed great joy 

2 11 and when they were come into the hou they saw the young child 
with mari hi mother and fell down and worship him and when they 
had open their treasur they present unto him gift gold and 
frankincen and myrrh 

2 12 and be warn of god in a dream that they should not return to 
herod they depart into their own countri anoth way 

2 13 and when they were depart behold the angel of the lord 
appeareth to joseph in a dream say ari and take the young 
child and hi mother and flee into egypt and be thou there until i 
bring thee word for herod will seek the young child to destroy him 

2 14 when he aro he took the young child and hi mother by night 
and depart into egypt 2 15 and wa there until the death of herod 
that it might be fulfil which wa spoken of the lord by the 
prophet say out of egypt have i call my son 

2 16 then herod when he saw that he wa mock of the wise men wa 
exceed wroth and sent forth and slew all the child that were 
in bethlehem and in all the coast thereof from two year old and 
under accord to the time which he had dilig enquir of the 
wise men 

2 17 then wa fulfil that which wa spoken by jeremi the prophet 
say 2 18 in rama wa there a voic heard lament and 
weep and great mourn rachel weep for her child and 
would not be comfort becau they are not 

2 19 but when herod wa dead behold an angel of the lord appeareth 
in a dream to joseph in egypt 2 20 say ari and take the young 
child and hi mother and go into the land of israel for they are 
dead which sought the young child s life 

2 21 and he aro and took the young child and hi mother and came 
into the land of israel 

2 22 but when he heard that archelau did reign in judaea in the room 
of hi father herod he wa afraid to go thither notwithstand 
be warn of god in a dream he turn asid into the part of 
galil 2 23 and he came and dwelt in a citi call nazareth that it 
might be fulfil which wa spoken by the prophet he shall be 
call a nazaren 

3 1 in those day came john the baptist preach in the wilder 
of judaea 3 2 and say repent ye for the kingdom of heaven is at 
hand 

3 3 for thi is he that wa spoken of by the prophet esaia say 
the voic of one cri in the wilder prepar ye the way of the 
lord make hi path straight 

3 4 and the same john had hi raiment of camel s hair and a leathern 
girdl about hi loin and hi meat wa locust and wild honey 

3 5 then went out to him jerusalem and all judaea and all the region 
round about jordan 3 6 and were baptiz of him in jordan confess 
their sin 

3 7 but when he saw mani of the pharis and sadduc come to hi 
baptism he said unto them o gener of viper who hath warn 
you to flee from the wrath to come 3 8 bring forth therefor fruit 
meet for repent 3 9 and think not to say within yourselv we 
have abraham to our father for i say unto you that god is abl of 
these stone to rai up child unto abraham 

3 10 and now also the axe is laid unto the root of the tree 
therefor everi tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down 
and cast into the fire 

3 11 i ind baptiz you with water unto repent but he that 
cometh after me is mightier than i whose shoe i am not worthi to 
bear he shall baptiz you with the holi ghost and with fire 3 12 
whose fan is in hi hand and he will throughli purg hi floor and 
gather hi wheat into the garner but he will burn up the chaff with 
unquench fire 

3 13 then cometh jesu from galil to jordan unto john to be 
baptiz of him 

3 14 but john forbad him say i have need to be baptiz of thee 
and comest thou to me 3 15 and jesu answer said unto him suffer 
it to be so now for thu it becometh u to fulfil all righteou 
then he suffer him 

3 16 and jesu when he wa baptiz went up straightway out of the 
water and lo the heaven were open unto him and he saw the 
spirit of god descend like a dove and light upon him 3 17 and 
lo a voic from heaven say thi is my belov son in whom i am 
well plea 

4 1 then wa jesu led up of the spirit into the wilder to be 
tempt of the devil 

4 2 and when he had fast forti day and forti night he wa 
afterward an hungr 

4 3 and when the tempter came to him he said if thou be the son of 
god command that these stone be made bread 

4 4 but he answer and said it is written man shall not live by 
bread alon but by everi word that proceedeth out of the mouth of 
god 

4 5 then the devil taketh him up into the holi citi and setteth him 
on a pinnacl of the templ 4 6 and saith unto him if thou be the 
son of god cast thyself down for it is written he shall give hi 
angel charg concern thee and in their hand they shall bear thee 
up lest at ani time thou dash thi foot against a stone 

4 7 jesu said unto him it is written again thou shalt not tempt the 
lord thi god 

4 8 again the devil taketh him up into an exceed high mountain 
and sheweth him all the kingdom of the world and the glori of them 
4 9 and saith unto him all these thing will i give thee if thou 
wilt fall down and worship me 

4 10 then saith jesu unto him get thee henc satan for it is 
written thou shalt worship the lord thi god and him onli shalt thou 
serv 

4 11 then the devil leaveth him and behold angel came and 
minist unto him 

4 12 now when jesu had heard that john wa cast into prison he 
depart into galil 4 13 and leav nazareth he came and dwelt in 
capernaum which is upon the sea coast in the border of zabulon and 
nephthalim 4 14 that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by esaia 
the prophet say 4 15 the land of zabulon and the land of 
nephthalim by the way of the sea beyond jordan galil of the 
gentil 4 16 the peopl which sat in dark saw great light and 
to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung 
up 

4 17 from that time jesu began to preach and to say repent for the 
kingdom of heaven is at hand 

4 18 and jesu walk by the sea of galil saw two brother simon 
call peter and andrew hi brother cast a net into the sea for 
they were fisher 

4 19 and he saith unto them follow me and i will make you fisher of 
men 

4 20 and they straightway left their net and follow him 

4 21 and go on from thenc he saw other two brother jame the 
son of zebed and john hi brother in a ship with zebed their 
father mend their net and he call them 

4 22 and they immedi left the ship and their father and follow 
him 

4 23 and jesu went about all galil teach in their synagogu 
and preach the gospel of the kingdom and heal all manner of 
sick and all manner of disea among the peopl 

4 24 and hi fame went throughout all syria and they brought unto him 
all sick peopl that were taken with diver disea and torment and 
those which were poss with devil and those which were lunatick 
and those that had the palsi and he heal them 

4 25 and there follow him great multitud of peopl from galil 
and from decapoli and from jerusalem and from judaea and from 
beyond jordan 

5 1 and see the multitud he went up into a mountain and when he 
wa set hi discipl came unto him 5 2 and he open hi mouth and 
taught them say 5 3 bless are the poor in spirit for their is 
the kingdom of heaven 

5 4 bless are they that mourn for they shall be comfort 

5 5 bless are the meek for they shall inherit the earth 

5 6 bless are they which do hunger and thirst after righteou 
for they shall be fill 

5 7 bless are the merci for they shall obtain merci 

5 8 bless are the pure in heart for they shall see god 

5 9 bless are the peacemak for they shall be call the child 
of god 

5 10 bless are they which are persecut for righteou sake 
for their is the kingdom of heaven 

5 11 bless are ye when men shall revil you and persecut you and 
shall say all manner of evil against you fal for my sake 

5 12 rejoic and be exceed glad for great is your reward in 
heaven for so persecut they the prophet which were befor you 

5 13 ye are the salt of the earth but if the salt have lost hi 
savour wherewith shall it be salt it is thenceforth good for 
noth but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot of men 

5 14 ye are the light of the world a citi that is set on an hill 
cannot be hid 

5 15 neither do men light a candl and put it under a bushel but on 
a candlestick and it giveth light unto all that are in the hou 

5 16 let your light so shine befor men that they may see your good 
work and glorifi your father which is in heaven 

5 17 think not that i am come to destroy the law or the prophet i 
am not come to destroy but to fulfil 

5 18 for verili i say unto you till heaven and earth pa one jot or 
one tittl shall in no wise pa from the law till all be fulfil 

5 19 whosoev therefor shall break one of these least command 
and shall teach men so he shall be call the least in the kingdom of 
heaven but whosoev shall do and teach them the same shall be 
call great in the kingdom of heaven 

5 20 for i say unto you that except your righteou shall exceed 
the righteou of the scribe and pharis ye shall in no case 
enter into the kingdom of heaven 

5 21 ye have heard that it wa said by them of old time thou shalt 
not kill and whosoev shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment 
5 22 but i say unto you that whosoev is angri with hi brother 
without a cau shall be in danger of the judgment and whosoev 
shall say to hi brother raca shall be in danger of the council but 
whosoev shall say thou fool shall be in danger of hell fire 

5 23 therefor if thou bring thi gift to the altar and there 
rememberest that thi brother hath ought against thee 5 24 leav there 
thi gift befor the altar and go thi way first be reconcil to thi 
brother and then come and offer thi gift 

5 25 agr with thine adversari quickli while thou art in the way 
with him lest at ani time the adversari deliv thee to the judg 
and the judg deliv thee to the offic and thou be cast into 
prison 

5 26 verili i say unto thee thou shalt by no mean come out thenc 
till thou hast paid the uttermost farth 

5 27 ye have heard that it wa said by them of old time thou shalt 
not commit adulteri 5 28 but i say unto you that whosoev looketh 
on a woman to lust after her hath commit adulteri with her alreadi 
in hi heart 

5 29 and if thi right eye offend thee pluck it out and cast it from 
thee for it is profit for thee that one of thi member should 
perish and not that thi whole bodi should be cast into hell 

5 30 and if thi right hand offend thee cut it off and cast it from 
thee for it is profit for thee that one of thi member should 
perish and not that thi whole bodi should be cast into hell 

5 31 it hath been said whosoev shall put away hi wife let him 
give her a write of divorc 5 32 but i say unto you that 
whosoev shall put away hi wife save for the cau of 
fornic causeth her to commit adulteri and whosoev shall marri 
her that is divorc committeth adulteri 

5 33 again ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time 
thou shalt not forswear thyself but shalt perform unto the lord thine 
oath 5 34 but i say unto you swear not at all neither by heaven 
for it is god s throne 5 35 nor by the earth for it is hi 
footstool neither by jerusalem for it is the citi of the great king 

5 36 neither shalt thou swear by thi head becau thou canst not make 
one hair white or black 

5 37 but let your commun be yea yea nay nay for whatsoev 
is more than these cometh of evil 

5 38 ye have heard that it hath been said an eye for an eye and a 
tooth for a tooth 5 39 but i say unto you that ye resist not evil 
but whosoev shall smite thee on thi right cheek turn to him the 
other also 

5 40 and if ani man will sue thee at the law and take away thi coat 
let him have thi cloak also 

5 41 and whosoev shall compel thee to go a mile go with him twain 

5 42 give to him that asketh thee and from him that would borrow of 
thee turn not thou away 

5 43 ye have heard that it hath been said thou shalt love thi 
neighbour and hate thine enemi 

5 44 but i say unto you love your enemi bless them that cur you 
do good to them that hate you and pray for them which despit 
use you and persecut you 5 45 that ye may be the child of your 
father which is in heaven for he maketh hi sun to rise on the evil 
and on the good and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust 

5 46 for if ye love them which love you what reward have ye do not 
even the publican the same 5 47 and if ye salut your brother 
onli what do ye more than other do not even the publican so 5 48 
be ye therefor perfect even a your father which is in heaven is 
perfect 

6 1 take heed that ye do not your alm befor men to be seen of them 
otherwi ye have no reward of your father which is in heaven 

6 2 therefor when thou doest thine alm do not sound a trumpet 
befor thee a the hypocrit do in the synagogu and in the 
street that they may have glori of men verili i say unto you they 
have their reward 

6 3 but when thou doest alm let not thi left hand know what thi 
right hand doeth 6 4 that thine alm may be in secret and thi father 
which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openli 

6 5 and when thou prayest thou shalt not be a the hypocrit are 
for they love to pray stand in the synagogu and in the corner of 
the street that they may be seen of men verili i say unto you they 
have their reward 

6 6 but thou when thou prayest enter into thi closet and when thou 
hast shut thi door pray to thi father which is in secret and thi 
father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openli 

6 7 but when ye pray use not vain repetit a the heathen do for 
they think that they shall be heard for their much speak 

6 8 be not ye therefor like unto them for your father knoweth what 
thing ye have need of befor ye ask him 

6 9 after thi manner therefor pray ye our father which art in 
heaven hallow be thi name 

6 10 thi kingdom come thi will be done in earth a it is in heaven 

6 11 give u thi day our daili bread 

6 12 and forgiv u our debt a we forgiv our debtor 

6 13 and lead u not into temptat but deliv u from evil for 
thine is the kingdom and the power and the glori for ever amen 

6 14 for if ye forgiv men their trespass your heavenli father will 
also forgiv you 6 15 but if ye forgiv not men their trespass 
neither will your father forgiv your trespass 

6 16 moreov when ye fast be not a the hypocrit of a sad 
counten for they disfigur their face that they may appear unto 
men to fast verili i say unto you they have their reward 

6 17 but thou when thou fastest anoint thine head and wash thi 
face 6 18 that thou appear not unto men to fast but unto thi father 
which is in secret and thi father which seeth in secret shall 
reward thee openli 

6 19 lay not up for yourselv treasur upon earth where moth and 
rust doth corrupt and where thief break through and steal 6 20 but 
lay up for yourselv treasur in heaven where neither moth nor rust 
doth corrupt and where thief do not break through nor steal 6 21 
for where your treasur is there will your heart be also 

6 22 the light of the bodi is the eye if therefor thine eye be 
singl thi whole bodi shall be full of light 

6 23 but if thine eye be evil thi whole bodi shall be full of 
dark 

if therefor the light that is in thee be dark how great is that 
dark 6 24 no man can serv two master for either he will hate 
the one and love the other or el he will hold to the one and 
despi the other ye cannot serv god and mammon 

6 25 therefor i say unto you take no thought for your life what ye 
shall eat or what ye shall drink nor yet for your bodi what ye 
shall put on is not the life more than meat and the bodi than 
raiment 6 26 behold the fowl of the air for they sow not neither 
do they reap nor gather into barn yet your heavenli father feedeth 
them are ye not much better than they 6 27 which of you by take 
thought can add one cubit unto hi statur 6 28 and whi take ye 
thought for raiment consid the lili of the field how they grow 
they toil not neither do they spin 6 29 and yet i say unto you that 
even solomon in all hi glori wa not array like one of these 

6 30 wherefor if god so cloth the grass of the field which to day 
is and to morrow is cast into the oven shall he not much more cloth 
you o ye of littl faith 6 31 therefor take no thought say 
what shall we eat or what shall we drink or wherewith shall we 
be cloth 6 32 for after all these thing do the gentil seek 
for your heavenli father knoweth that ye have need of all these 
thing 

6 33 but seek ye first the kingdom of god and hi righteou and 
all these thing shall be ad unto you 

6 34 take therefor no thought for the morrow for the morrow shall 
take thought for the thing of itself suffici unto the day is the 
evil thereof 

7 1 judg not that ye be not judg 

7 2 for with what judgment ye judg ye shall be judg and with what 
measur ye mete it shall be measur to you again 

7 3 and whi beholdest thou the mote that is in thi brother s eye but 
considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye 7 4 or how wilt 
thou say to thi brother let me pull out the mote out of thine eye 
and behold a beam is in thine own eye 7 5 thou hypocrit first 
cast out the beam out of thine own eye and then shalt thou see 
clearli to cast out the mote out of thi brother s eye 

7 6 give not that which is holi unto the dog neither cast ye your 
pearl befor swine lest they trampl them under their foot and turn 
again and rend you 

7 7 ask and it shall be given you seek and ye shall find knock 
and it shall be open unto you 7 8 for everi one that asketh 
receiveth and he that seeketh findeth and to him that knocketh it 
shall be open 

7 9 or what man is there of you whom if hi son ask bread will he 
give him a stone 7 10 or if he ask a fish will he give him a 
serpent 7 11 if ye then be evil know how to give good gift 
unto your child how much more shall your father which is in heaven 
give good thing to them that ask him 7 12 therefor all thing 
whatsoev ye would that men should do to you do ye even so to them 
for thi is the law and the prophet 

7 13 enter ye in at the strait gate for wide is the gate and broad 
is the way that leadeth to destruct and mani there be which go in 
thereat 7 14 becau strait is the gate and narrow is the way which 
leadeth unto life and few there be that find it 

7 15 bewar of fal prophet which come to you in sheep s cloth 
but inwardli they are raven wolf 

7 16 ye shall know them by their fruit do men gather grape of 
thorn or fig of thistl 7 17 even so everi good tree bringeth 
forth good fruit but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit 

7 18 a good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit neither can a corrupt 
tree bring forth good fruit 

7 19 everi tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down and 
cast into the fire 

7 20 wherefor by their fruit ye shall know them 

7 21 not everi one that saith unto me lord lord shall enter into 
the kingdom of heaven but he that doeth the will of my father which 
is in heaven 

7 22 mani will say to me in that day lord lord have we not 
prophesi in thi name and in thi name have cast out devil and in 
thi name done mani wonder work 7 23 and then will i profess unto 
them i never knew you depart from me ye that work iniqu 

7 24 therefor whosoev heareth these say of mine and doeth 
them i will liken him unto a wise man which built hi hou upon a 
rock 7 25 and the rain descend and the flood came and the wind 
blew and beat upon that hou and it fell not for it wa found 
upon a rock 

7 26 and everi one that heareth these say of mine and doeth them 
not shall be liken unto a foolish man which built hi hou upon 
the sand 7 27 and the rain descend and the flood came and the 
wind blew and beat upon that hou and it fell and great wa the 
fall of it 

7 28 and it came to pa when jesu had end these say the 
peopl were astonish at hi doctrin 7 29 for he taught them a one 
have author and not a the scribe 

8 1 when he wa come down from the mountain great multitud follow 
him 

8 2 and behold there came a leper and worship him say lord 
if thou wilt thou canst make me clean 

8 3 and jesu put forth hi hand and touch him say i will be 
thou clean and immedi hi leprosi wa clean 

8 4 and jesu saith unto him see thou tell no man but go thi way 
shew thyself to the priest and offer the gift that mose command 
for a testimoni unto them 

8 5 and when jesu wa enter into capernaum there came unto him a 
centurion beseech him 8 6 and say lord my servant lieth at 
home sick of the palsi grievou torment 

8 7 and jesu saith unto him i will come and heal him 

8 8 the centurion answer and said lord i am not worthi that thou 
shouldest come under my roof but speak the word onli and my servant 
shall be heal 

8 9 for i am a man under author have soldier under me and i 
say to thi man go and he goeth and to anoth come and he 
cometh and to my servant do thi and he doeth it 

8 10 when jesu heard it he marvel and said to them that 
follow verili i say unto you i have not found so great faith no 
not in israel 

8 11 and i say unto you that mani shall come from the east and west 
and shall sit down with abraham and isaac and jacob in the kingdom 
of heaven 

8 12 but the child of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer 
dark there shall be weep and gnash of teeth 

8 13 and jesu said unto the centurion go thi way and a thou hast 
believ so be it done unto thee and hi servant wa heal in the 
selfsam hour 

8 14 and when jesu wa come into peter s hou he saw hi wife s 
mother laid and sick of a fever 

8 15 and he touch her hand and the fever left her and she aro 
and minist unto them 

8 16 when the even wa come they brought unto him mani that were 
poss with devil and he cast out the spirit with hi word and 
heal all that were sick 8 17 that it might be fulfil which wa 
spoken by esaia the prophet say himself took our infirm 
and bare our sick 

8 18 now when jesu saw great multitud about him he gave 
command to depart unto the other side 

8 19 and a certain scribe came and said unto him master i will 
follow thee whithersoev thou goest 

8 20 and jesu saith unto him the fox have hole and the bird of 
the air have nest but the son of man hath not where to lay hi head 

8 21 and anoth of hi discipl said unto him lord suffer me first 
to go and buri my father 

8 22 but jesu said unto him follow me and let the dead buri their 
dead 

8 23 and when he wa enter into a ship hi discipl follow him 

8 24 and behold there aro a great tempest in the sea insomuch 
that the ship wa cover with the wave but he wa asleep 

8 25 and hi discipl came to him and awok him say lord save 
u we perish 

8 26 and he saith unto them whi are ye fear o ye of littl faith 
then he aro and rebuk the wind and the sea and there wa a 
great calm 

8 27 but the men marvel say what manner of man is thi that 
even the wind and the sea obey him 8 28 and when he wa come to the 
other side into the countri of the gergesen there met him two 
poss with devil come out of the tomb exceed fierc so 
that no man might pa by that way 

8 29 and behold they cri out say what have we to do with 
thee jesu thou son of god art thou come hither to torment u 
befor the time 8 30 and there wa a good way off from them an herd 
of mani swine feed 

8 31 so the devil besought him say if thou cast u out suffer 
u to go away into the herd of swine 

8 32 and he said unto them go and when they were come out they went 
into the herd of swine and behold the whole herd of swine ran 
violent down a steep place into the sea and perish in the water 

8 33 and they that kept them fled and went their way into the citi 
and told everi thing and what wa befallen to the poss of the 
devil 

8 34 and behold the whole citi came out to meet jesu and when they 
saw him they besought him that he would depart out of their coast 

9 1 and he enter into a ship and pa over and came into hi own 
citi 

9 2 and behold they brought to him a man sick of the palsi lie on 
a bed and jesu see their faith said unto the sick of the palsi 
son be of good cheer thi sin be forgiven thee 

9 3 and behold certain of the scribe said within themselv thi 
man blasphemeth 

9 4 and jesu know their thought said wherefor think ye evil in 
your heart 9 5 for whether is easier to say thi sin be forgiven 
thee or to say ari and walk 9 6 but that ye may know that the 
son of man hath power on earth to forgiv sin then saith he to the 
sick of the palsi ari take up thi bed and go unto thine hou 

9 7 and he aro and depart to hi hou 

9 8 but when the multitud saw it they marvel and glorifi god 
which had given such power unto men 

9 9 and a jesu pa forth from thenc he saw a man name 
matthew sit at the receipt of custom and he saith unto him 
follow me and he aro and follow him 

9 10 and it came to pa a jesu sat at meat in the hou behold 
mani publican and sinner came and sat down with him and hi 
discipl 

9 11 and when the pharis saw it they said unto hi discipl whi 
eateth your master with publican and sinner 9 12 but when jesu 
heard that he said unto them they that be whole need not a 
physician but they that are sick 

9 13 but go ye and learn what that meaneth i will have merci and not 
sacrif for i am not come to call the righteou but sinner to 
repent 

9 14 then came to him the discipl of john say whi do we and the 
pharis fast oft but thi discipl fast not 9 15 and jesu said 
unto them can the child of the bridechamb mourn a long a the 
bridegroom is with them but the day will come when the bridegroom 
shall be taken from them and then shall they fast 

9 16 no man putteth a piec of new cloth unto an old garment for that 
which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment and the rent is 
made wor 

9 17 neither do men put new wine into old bottl el the bottl 
break and the wine runneth out and the bottl perish but they put 
new wine into new bottl and both are preserv 

9 18 while he spake these thing unto them behold there came a 
certain ruler and worship him say my daughter is even now 
dead but come and lay thi hand upon her and she shall live 

9 19 and jesu aro and follow him and so did hi discipl 

9 20 and behold a woman which wa disea with an issu of blood 
twelv year came behind him and touch the hem of hi garment 
9 21 for she said within herself if i may but touch hi garment i 
shall be whole 

9 22 but jesu turn him about and when he saw her he said 
daughter be of good comfort thi faith hath made thee whole and the 
woman wa made whole from that hour 

9 23 and when jesu came into the ruler s hou and saw the minstrel 
and the peopl make a noi 9 24 he said unto them give place for 
the maid is not dead but sleepeth and they laugh him to scorn 

9 25 but when the peopl were put forth he went in and took her by 
the hand and the maid aro 

9 26 and the fame hereof went abroad into all that land 

9 27 and when jesu depart thenc two blind men follow him 
cri and say thou son of david have merci on u 

9 28 and when he wa come into the hou the blind men came to him 
and jesu saith unto them believ ye that i am abl to do thi they 
said unto him yea lord 

9 29 then touch he their eye say accord to your faith be it 
unto you 

9 30 and their eye were open and jesu straitli charg them 
say see that no man know it 

9 31 but they when they were depart spread abroad hi fame in all 
that countri 

9 32 a they went out behold they brought to him a dumb man 
poss with a devil 

9 33 and when the devil wa cast out the dumb spake and the 
multitud marvel say it wa never so seen in israel 

9 34 but the pharis said he casteth out devil through the princ 
of the devil 

9 35 and jesu went about all the citi and villag teach in 
their synagogu and preach the gospel of the kingdom and heal 
everi sick and everi disea among the peopl 

9 36 but when he saw the multitud he wa move with compass on 
them becau they faint and were scatter abroad a sheep have 
no shepherd 

9 37 then saith he unto hi discipl the harvest truli is plenteou 
but the labour are few 9 38 pray ye therefor the lord of the 
harvest that he will send forth labour into hi harvest 

10 1 and when he had call unto him hi twelv discipl he gave 
them power against unclean spirit to cast them out and to heal all 
manner of sick and all manner of disea 

10 2 now the name of the twelv apostl are these the first simon 
who is call peter and andrew hi brother jame the son of zebed 
and john hi brother 10 3 philip and bartholomew thoma and 
matthew the publican jame the son of alphaeu and lebbaeu whose 
surnam wa thaddaeu 10 4 simon the canaanit and juda iscariot 
who also betray him 

10 5 these twelv jesu sent forth and command them say go not 
into the way of the gentil and into ani citi of the samaritan 
enter ye not 10 6 but go rather to the lost sheep of the hou of 
israel 

10 7 and a ye go preach say the kingdom of heaven is at hand 

10 8 heal the sick clean the leper rai the dead cast out 
devil freeli ye have receiv freeli give 

10 9 provid neither gold nor silver nor brass in your pur 10 10 
nor scrip for your journey neither two coat neither shoe nor yet 
stave for the workman is worthi of hi meat 

10 11 and into whatsoev citi or town ye shall enter enquir who in 
it is worthi and there abid till ye go thenc 

10 12 and when ye come into an hou salut it 

10 13 and if the hou be worthi let your peac come upon it but if 
it be not worthi let your peac return to you 

10 14 and whosoev shall not receiv you nor hear your word when 
ye depart out of that hou or citi shake off the dust of your foot 

10 15 verili i say unto you it shall be more toler for the land 
of sodom and gomorrha in the day of judgment than for that citi 

10 16 behold i send you forth a sheep in the midst of wolf be ye 
therefor wise a serpent and harmless a dove 

10 17 but bewar of men for they will deliv you up to the council 
and they will scourg you in their synagogu 10 18 and ye shall be 
brought befor governor and king for my sake for a testimoni 
against them and the gentil 

10 19 but when they deliv you up take no thought how or what ye 
shall speak for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall 
speak 

10 20 for it is not ye that speak but the spirit of your father which 
speaketh in you 

10 21 and the brother shall deliv up the brother to death and the 
father the child and the child shall rise up against their 
parent and cau them to be put to death 

10 22 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name s sake but he that 
endureth to the end shall be save 

10 23 but when they persecut you in thi citi flee ye into anoth 
for verili i say unto you ye shall not have gone over the citi of 
israel till the son of man be come 

10 24 the discipl is not abov hi master nor the servant abov hi 
lord 

10 25 it is enough for the discipl that he be a hi master and the 
servant a hi lord if they have call the master of the hou 
beelzebub how much more shall they call them of hi household 10 26 
fear them not therefor for there is noth cover that shall not 
be reveal and hid that shall not be known 

10 27 what i tell you in dark that speak ye in light and what ye 
hear in the ear that preach ye upon the housetop 

10 28 and fear not them which kill the bodi but are not abl to kill 
the soul but rather fear him which is abl to destroy both soul and 
bodi in hell 

10 29 are not two sparrow sold for a farth and one of them shall 
not fall on the ground without your father 

10 30 but the veri hair of your head are all number 

10 31 fear ye not therefor ye are of more valu than mani sparrow 

10 32 whosoev therefor shall confess me befor men him will i 
confess also befor my father which is in heaven 

10 33 but whosoev shall deni me befor men him will i also deni 
befor my father which is in heaven 

10 34 think not that i am come to send peac on earth i came not to 
send peac but a sword 

10 35 for i am come to set a man at varianc against hi father and 
the daughter against her mother and the daughter in law against her 
mother in law 

10 36 and a man s foe shall be they of hi own household 

10 37 he that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthi of 
me and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthi of 
me 

10 38 and he that taketh not hi cross and followeth after me is not 
worthi of me 

10 39 he that findeth hi life shall lose it and he that loseth hi 
life for my sake shall find it 

10 40 he that receiveth you receiveth me and he that receiveth me 
receiveth him that sent me 

10 41 he that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall 
receiv a prophet s reward and he that receiveth a righteou man in 
the name of a righteou man shall receiv a righteou man s reward 

10 42 and whosoev shall give to drink unto one of these littl one 
a cup of cold water onli in the name of a discipl verili i say unto 
you he shall in no wise lose hi reward 

11 1 and it came to pa when jesu had made an end of command hi 
twelv discipl he depart thenc to teach and to preach in their 
citi 

11 2 now when john had heard in the prison the work of christ he 
sent two of hi discipl 11 3 and said unto him art thou he that 
should come or do we look for anoth 11 4 jesu answer and said 
unto them go and shew john again those thing which ye do hear and 
see 11 5 the blind receiv their sight and the lame walk the leper 
are clean and the deaf hear the dead are rai up and the poor 
have the gospel preach to them 

11 6 and bless is he whosoev shall not be offend in me 

11 7 and a they depart jesu began to say unto the multitud 
concern john what went ye out into the wilder to see a reed 
shaken with the wind 11 8 but what went ye out for to see a man 
cloth in soft raiment behold they that wear soft cloth are in 
king hou 

11 9 but what went ye out for to see a prophet yea i say unto you 
and more than a prophet 

11 10 for thi is he of whom it is written behold i send my 
messeng befor thi face which shall prepar thi way befor thee 

11 11 verili i say unto you among them that are born of woman there 
hath not risen a greater than john the baptist notwithstand he 
that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he 

11 12 and from the day of john the baptist until now the kingdom of 
heaven suffereth violenc and the violent take it by forc 

11 13 for all the prophet and the law prophesi until john 

11 14 and if ye will receiv it thi is elia which wa for to come 

11 15 he that hath ear to hear let him hear 

11 16 but whereunto shall i liken thi gener it is like unto 
child sit in the market and call unto their fellow 11 17 
and say we have pipe unto you and ye have not danc we have 
mourn unto you and ye have not lament 

11 18 for john came neither eat nor drink and they say he hath 
a devil 

11 19 the son of man came eat and drink and they say behold a 
man glutton and a winebibb a friend of publican and sinner 
but wisdom is justifi of her child 

11 20 then began he to upbraid the citi wherein most of hi mighti 
work were done becau they repent not 11 21 woe unto thee 
chorazin woe unto thee bethsaida for if the mighti work which 
were done in you had been done in tyre and sidon they would have 
repent long ago in sackcloth and ash 

11 22 but i say unto you it shall be more toler for tyre and 
sidon at the day of judgment than for you 

11 23 and thou capernaum which art exalt unto heaven shalt be 
brought down to hell for if the mighti work which have been done in 
thee had been done in sodom it would have remain until thi day 

11 24 but i say unto you that it shall be more toler for the land 
of sodom in the day of judgment than for thee 

11 25 at that time jesu answer and said i thank thee o father 
lord of heaven and earth becau thou hast hid these thing from the 
wise and prudent and hast reveal them unto babe 

11 26 even so father for so it seem good in thi sight 

11 27 all thing are deliv unto me of my father and no man 
knoweth the son but the father neither knoweth ani man the father 
save the son and he to whomsoev the son will reveal him 

11 28 come unto me all ye that labour and are heavi laden and i will 
give you rest 

11 29 take my yoke upon you and learn of me for i am meek and lowli 
in heart and ye shall find rest unto your soul 

11 30 for my yoke is easi and my burden is light 

12 1 at that time jesu went on the sabbath day through the corn and 
hi discipl were an hungr and began to pluck the ear of corn and 
to eat 

12 2 but when the pharis saw it they said unto him behold thi 
discipl do that which is not law to do upon the sabbath day 

12 3 but he said unto them have ye not read what david did when he 
wa an hungr and they that were with him 12 4 how he enter into 
the hou of god and did eat the shewbread which wa not law for 
him to eat neither for them which were with him but onli for the 
priest 12 5 or have ye not read in the law how that on the sabbath 
day the priest in the templ profan the sabbath and are blameless 
12 6 but i say unto you that in thi place is one greater than the 
templ 

12 7 but if ye had known what thi meaneth i will have merci and not 
sacrif ye would not have condemn the guiltless 

12 8 for the son of man is lord even of the sabbath day 

12 9 and when he wa depart thenc he went into their synagogu 
12 10 and behold there wa a man which had hi hand wither and 
they ask him say is it law to heal on the sabbath day that 
they might accu him 

12 11 and he said unto them what man shall there be among you that 
shall have one sheep and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day 
will he not lay hold on it and lift it out 12 12 how much then is a 
man better than a sheep wherefor it is law to do well on the 
sabbath day 

12 13 then saith he to the man stretch forth thine hand and he 
stretch it forth and it wa restor whole like a the other 

12 14 then the pharis went out and held a council against him how 
they might destroy him 

12 15 but when jesu knew it he withdrew himself from thenc and 
great multitud follow him and he heal them all 12 16 and 
charg them that they should not make him known 12 17 that it might 
be fulfil which wa spoken by esaia the prophet say 12 18 
behold my servant whom i have chosen my belov in whom my soul is 
well plea i will put my spirit upon him and he shall shew 
judgment to the gentil 

12 19 he shall not strive nor cri neither shall ani man hear hi 
voic in the street 

12 20 a brui reed shall he not break and smoke flax shall he not 
quench till he send forth judgment unto victori 

12 21 and in hi name shall the gentil trust 

12 22 then wa brought unto him one poss with a devil blind and 
dumb and he heal him insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake 
and saw 

12 23 and all the peopl were amaz and said is not thi the son of 
david 12 24 but when the pharis heard it they said thi fellow 
doth not cast out devil but by beelzebub the princ of the devil 

12 25 and jesu knew their thought and said unto them everi kingdom 
divid against itself is brought to desol and everi citi or 
hou divid against itself shall not stand 12 26 and if satan cast 
out satan he is divid against himself how shall then hi kingdom 
stand 12 27 and if i by beelzebub cast out devil by whom do your 
child cast them out therefor they shall be your judg 

12 28 but if i cast out devil by the spirit of god then the kingdom 
of god is come unto you 

12 29 or el how can one enter into a strong man s hou and spoil 
hi good except he first bind the strong man and then he will spoil 
hi hou 

12 30 he that is not with me is against me and he that gathereth not 
with me scattereth abroad 

12 31 wherefor i say unto you all manner of sin and blasphemi shall 
be forgiven unto men but the blasphemi against the holi ghost shall 
not be forgiven unto men 

12 32 and whosoev speaketh a word against the son of man it shall 
be forgiven him but whosoev speaketh against the holi ghost it 
shall not be forgiven him neither in thi world neither in the world 
to come 

12 33 either make the tree good and hi fruit good or el make the 
tree corrupt and hi fruit corrupt for the tree is known by hi 
fruit 

12 34 o gener of viper how can ye be evil speak good 
thing for out of the abund of the heart the mouth speaketh 

12 35 a good man out of the good treasur of the heart bringeth forth 
good thing and an evil man out of the evil treasur bringeth forth 
evil thing 

12 36 but i say unto you that everi idl word that men shall speak 
they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment 

12 37 for by thi word thou shalt be justifi and by thi word thou 
shalt be condemn 

12 38 then certain of the scribe and of the pharis answer 
say master we would see a sign from thee 

12 39 but he answer and said unto them an evil and adult 
gener seeketh after a sign and there shall no sign be given to 
it but the sign of the prophet jona 12 40 for a jona wa three 
day and three night in the whale s belli so shall the son of man be 
three day and three night in the heart of the earth 

12 41 the men of nineveh shall rise in judgment with thi gener 
and shall condemn it becau they repent at the preach of jona 
and behold a greater than jona is here 

12 42 the queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with thi 
gener and shall condemn it for she came from the uttermost 
part of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon and behold a 
greater than solomon is here 

12 43 when the unclean spirit is gone out of a man he walketh through 
dri place seek rest and findeth none 

12 44 then he saith i will return into my hou from whenc i came 
out and when he is come he findeth it empti swept and garnish 

12 45 then goeth he and taketh with himself seven other spirit more 
wick than himself and they enter in and dwell there and the last 
state of that man is wor than the first even so shall it be also 
unto thi wick gener 

12 46 while he yet talk to the peopl behold hi mother and hi 
brother stood without desir to speak with him 

12 47 then one said unto him behold thi mother and thi brother 
stand without desir to speak with thee 

12 48 but he answer and said unto him that told him who is my 
mother and who are my brother 12 49 and he stretch forth hi 
hand toward hi discipl and said behold my mother and my brother 
12 50 for whosoev shall do the will of my father which is in heaven 
the same is my brother and sister and mother 

13 1 the same day went jesu out of the hou and sat by the sea 
side 

13 2 and great multitud were gather togeth unto him so that he 
went into a ship and sat and the whole multitud stood on the shore 

13 3 and he spake mani thing unto them in parabl say behold a 
sower went forth to sow 13 4 and when he sow some seed fell by 
the way side and the fowl came and devour them up 13 5 some fell 
upon stoni place where they had not much earth and forthwith they 
sprung up becau they had no deep of earth 13 6 and when the 
sun wa up they were scorch and becau they had no root they 
wither away 

13 7 and some fell among thorn and the thorn sprung up and choke 
them 13 8 but other fell into good ground and brought forth fruit 
some an hundredfold some sixtyfold some thirtyfold 

13 9 who hath ear to hear let him hear 

13 10 and the discipl came and said unto him whi speakest thou 
unto them in parabl 13 11 he answer and said unto them becau 
it is given unto you to know the mysteri of the kingdom of heaven 
but to them it is not given 

13 12 for whosoev hath to him shall be given and he shall have 
more abund but whosoev hath not from him shall be taken away 
even that he hath 

13 13 therefor speak i to them in parabl becau they see see 
not and hear they hear not neither do they understand 

13 14 and in them is fulfil the propheci of esaia which saith by 
hear ye shall hear and shall not understand and see ye shall 
see and shall not perceiv 13 15 for thi peopl s heart is wax 
gross and their ear are dull of hear and their eye they have 
close lest at ani time they should see with their eye and hear with 
their ear and should understand with their heart and should be 
convert and i should heal them 

13 16 but bless are your eye for they see and your ear for they 
hear 

13 17 for verili i say unto you that mani prophet and righteou men 
have desir to see those thing which ye see and have not seen them 
and to hear those thing which ye hear and have not heard them 

13 18 hear ye therefor the parabl of the sower 

13 19 when ani one heareth the word of the kingdom and understandeth 
it not then cometh the wick one and catcheth away that which wa 
sown in hi heart thi is he which receiv seed by the way side 

13 20 but he that receiv the seed into stoni place the same is he 
that heareth the word and anon with joy receiveth it 13 21 yet hath 
he not root in himself but dureth for a while for when tribul 
or persecut ariseth becau of the word by and by he is offend 

13 22 he also that receiv seed among the thorn is he that heareth 
the word and the care of thi world and the deceit of rich 
choke the word and he becometh unfruit 

13 23 but he that receiv seed into the good ground is he that 
heareth the word and understandeth it which also beareth fruit and 
bringeth forth some an hundredfold some sixti some thirti 

13 24 anoth parabl put he forth unto them say the kingdom of 
heaven is liken unto a man which sow good seed in hi field 13 25 
but while men slept hi enemi came and sow tare among the wheat 
and went hi way 

13 26 but when the blade wa sprung up and brought forth fruit then 
appear the tare also 

13 27 so the servant of the household came and said unto him sir 
didst not thou sow good seed in thi field from whenc then hath it 
tare 13 28 he said unto them an enemi hath done thi the servant 
said unto him wilt thou then that we go and gather them up 13 29 
but he said nay lest while ye gather up the tare ye root up also 
the wheat with them 

13 30 let both grow togeth until the harvest and in the time of 
harvest i will say to the reaper gather ye togeth first the tare 
and bind them in bundl to burn them but gather the wheat into my 
barn 

13 31 anoth parabl put he forth unto them say the kingdom of 
heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed which a man took and sow 
in hi field 13 32 which ind is the least of all seed but when 
it is grown it is the greatest among herb and becometh a tree so 
that the bird of the air come and lodg in the branch thereof 

13 33 anoth parabl spake he unto them the kingdom of heaven is 
like unto leaven which a woman took and hid in three measur of 
meal till the whole wa leaven 

13 34 all these thing spake jesu unto the multitud in parabl and 
without a parabl spake he not unto them 13 35 that it might be 
fulfil which wa spoken by the prophet say i will open my 
mouth in parabl i will utter thing which have been kept secret 
from the foundat of the world 

13 36 then jesu sent the multitud away and went into the hou and 
hi discipl came unto him say declar unto u the parabl of 
the tare of the field 

13 37 he answer and said unto them he that soweth the good seed is 
the son of man 13 38 the field is the world the good seed are the 
child of the kingdom but the tare are the child of the wick 
one 13 39 the enemi that sow them is the devil the harvest is the 
end of the world and the reaper are the angel 

13 40 a therefor the tare are gather and burn in the fire so 
shall it be in the end of thi world 

13 41 the son of man shall send forth hi angel and they shall 
gather out of hi kingdom all thing that offend and them which do 
iniqu 13 42 and shall cast them into a furnac of fire there 
shall be wail and gnash of teeth 

13 43 then shall the righteou shine forth a the sun in the kingdom 
of their father who hath ear to hear let him hear 

13 44 again the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasur hid in a 
field the which when a man hath found he hideth and for joy thereof 
goeth and selleth all that he hath and buyeth that field 

13 45 again the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man 
seek goodli pearl 13 46 who when he had found one pearl of great 
price went and sold all that he had and bought it 

13 47 again the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net that wa cast 
into the sea and gather of everi kind 13 48 which when it wa 
full they drew to shore and sat down and gather the good into 
vessel but cast the bad away 

13 49 so shall it be at the end of the world the angel shall come 
forth and sever the wick from among the just 13 50 and shall cast 
them into the furnac of fire there shall be wail and gnash of 
teeth 

13 51 jesu saith unto them have ye understood all these thing they 
say unto him yea lord 

13 52 then said he unto them therefor everi scribe which is 
instruct unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an 
household which bringeth forth out of hi treasur thing new and 
old 

13 53 and it came to pa that when jesu had finish these 
parabl he depart thenc 

13 54 and when he wa come into hi own countri he taught them in 
their synagogu insomuch that they were astonish and said whenc 
hath thi man thi wisdom and these mighti work 13 55 is not thi 
the carpent s son is not hi mother call mari and hi brother 
jame and jose and simon and juda 13 56 and hi sister are 
they not all with u whenc then hath thi man all these thing 
13 57 and they were offend in him but jesu said unto them a 
prophet is not without honour save in hi own countri and in hi own 
hou 

13 58 and he did not mani mighti work there becau of their 
unbelief 

14 1 at that time herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of jesu 14 2 
and said unto hi servant thi is john the baptist he is risen from 
the dead and therefor mighti work do shew forth themselv in him 

14 3 for herod had laid hold on john and bound him and put him in 
prison for herodia sake hi brother philip s wife 

14 4 for john said unto him it is not law for thee to have her 

14 5 and when he would have put him to death he fear the multitud 
becau they count him a a prophet 

14 6 but when herod s birthday wa kept the daughter of herodia 
danc befor them and plea herod 

14 7 whereupon he promi with an oath to give her whatsoev she 
would ask 

14 8 and she be befor instruct of her mother said give me 
here john baptist s head in a charger 

14 9 and the king wa sorri nevertheless for the oath s sake and 
them which sat with him at meat he command it to be given her 

14 10 and he sent and behead john in the prison 

14 11 and hi head wa brought in a charger and given to the damsel 
and she brought it to her mother 

14 12 and hi discipl came and took up the bodi and buri it and 
went and told jesu 

14 13 when jesu heard of it he depart thenc by ship into a desert 
place apart and when the peopl had heard thereof they follow him 
on foot out of the citi 

14 14 and jesu went forth and saw a great multitud and wa move 
with compass toward them and he heal their sick 

14 15 and when it wa even hi discipl came to him say thi 
is a desert place and the time is now past send the multitud away 
that they may go into the villag and buy themselv victual 

14 16 but jesu said unto them they need not depart give ye them to 
eat 

14 17 and they say unto him we have here but five loaf and two 
fish 

14 18 he said bring them hither to me 

14 19 and he command the multitud to sit down on the grass and 
took the five loaf and the two fish and look up to heaven he 
bless and brake and gave the loaf to hi discipl and the 
discipl to the multitud 

14 20 and they did all eat and were fill and they took up of the 
fragment that remain twelv basket full 

14 21 and they that had eaten were about five thousand men besid 
woman and child 

14 22 and straightway jesu constrain hi discipl to get into a 
ship and to go befor him unto the other side while he sent the 
multitud away 

14 23 and when he had sent the multitud away he went up into a 
mountain apart to pray and when the even wa come he wa there 
alon 

14 24 but the ship wa now in the midst of the sea toss with wave 
for the wind wa contrari 

14 25 and in the fourth watch of the night jesu went unto them 
walk on the sea 

14 26 and when the discipl saw him walk on the sea they were 
troubl say it is a spirit and they cri out for fear 

14 27 but straightway jesu spake unto them say be of good cheer 
it is i be not afraid 

14 28 and peter answer him and said lord if it be thou bid me 
come unto thee on the water 

14 29 and he said come and when peter wa come down out of the ship 
he walk on the water to go to jesu 

14 30 but when he saw the wind boister he wa afraid and 
begin to sink he cri say lord save me 

14 31 and immedi jesu stretch forth hi hand and caught him 
and said unto him o thou of littl faith wherefor didst thou doubt 
14 32 and when they were come into the ship the wind cea 

14 33 then they that were in the ship came and worship him say 
of a truth thou art the son of god 

14 34 and when they were gone over they came into the land of 
gennesaret 

14 35 and when the men of that place had knowledg of him they sent 
out into all that countri round about and brought unto him all that 
were disea 14 36 and besought him that they might onli touch the 
hem of hi garment and a mani a touch were made perfectli whole 

15 1 then came to jesu scribe and pharis which were of 
jerusalem say 15 2 whi do thi discipl transgress the tradit 
of the elder for they wash not their hand when they eat bread 

15 3 but he answer and said unto them whi do ye also transgress the 
command of god by your tradit 15 4 for god command say 
honour thi father and mother and he that curseth father or mother 
let him die the death 

15 5 but ye say whosoev shall say to hi father or hi mother it 
is a gift by whatsoev thou mightest be profit by me 15 6 and 
honour not hi father or hi mother he shall be free thu have ye 
made the command of god of none effect by your tradit 

15 7 ye hypocrit well did esaia prophesi of you say 15 8 thi 
peopl draweth nigh unto me with their mouth and honoureth me with 
their lip but their heart is far from me 

15 9 but in vain they do worship me teach for doctrin the 
command of men 

15 10 and he call the multitud and said unto them hear and 
understand 15 11 not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man 
but that which cometh out of the mouth thi defileth a man 

15 12 then came hi discipl and said unto him knowest thou that 
the pharis were offend after they heard thi say 15 13 but 
he answer and said everi plant which my heavenli father hath not 
plant shall be root up 

15 14 let them alon they be blind leader of the blind and if the 
blind lead the blind both shall fall into the ditch 

15 15 then answer peter and said unto him declar unto u thi 
parabl 

15 16 and jesu said are ye also yet without understand 15 17 do 
not ye yet understand that whatsoev entereth in at the mouth goeth 
into the belli and is cast out into the draught 15 18 but those 
thing which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart and 
they defil the man 

15 19 for out of the heart proceed evil thought murder adulteri 
fornic theft fal wit blasphemi 15 20 these are the 
thing which defil a man but to eat with unwashen hand defileth not 
a man 

15 21 then jesu went thenc and depart into the coast of tyre and 
sidon 

15 22 and behold a woman of canaan came out of the same coast and 
cri unto him say have merci on me o lord thou son of david 
my daughter is grievou vex with a devil 

15 23 but he answer her not a word and hi discipl came and 
besought him say send her away for she crieth after u 

15 24 but he answer and said i am not sent but unto the lost sheep 
of the hou of israel 

15 25 then came she and worship him say lord help me 

15 26 but he answer and said it is not meet to take the child s 
bread and to cast it to dog 

15 27 and she said truth lord yet the dog eat of the crumb which 
fall from their master tabl 

15 28 then jesu answer and said unto her o woman great is thi 
faith be it unto thee even a thou wilt and her daughter wa made 
whole from that veri hour 

15 29 and jesu depart from thenc and came nigh unto the sea of 
galil and went up into a mountain and sat down there 

15 30 and great multitud came unto him have with them those that 
were lame blind dumb maim and mani other and cast them down at 
jesu foot and he heal them 15 31 insomuch that the multitud 
wonder when they saw the dumb to speak the maim to be whole the 
lame to walk and the blind to see and they glorifi the god of 
israel 

15 32 then jesu call hi discipl unto him and said i have 
compass on the multitud becau they continu with me now three 
day and have noth to eat and i will not send them away fast 
lest they faint in the way 

15 33 and hi discipl say unto him whenc should we have so much 
bread in the wilder a to fill so great a multitud 15 34 and 
jesu saith unto them how mani loaf have ye and they said seven 
and a few littl fish 

15 35 and he command the multitud to sit down on the ground 

15 36 and he took the seven loaf and the fish and gave thank 
and brake them and gave to hi discipl and the discipl to the 
multitud 

15 37 and they did all eat and were fill and they took up of the 
broken meat that wa left seven basket full 

15 38 and they that did eat were four thousand men besid woman and 
child 

15 39 and he sent away the multitud and took ship and came into the 
coast of magdala 

16 1 the pharis also with the sadduc came and tempt desir 
him that he would shew them a sign from heaven 

16 2 he answer and said unto them when it is even ye say it 
will be fair weather for the sky is red 

16 3 and in the morn it will be foul weather to day for the sky 
is red and lower o ye hypocrit ye can discern the face of the 
sky but can ye not discern the sign of the time 16 4 a wick and 
adult gener seeketh after a sign and there shall no sign be 
given unto it but the sign of the prophet jona and he left them 
and depart 

16 5 and when hi discipl were come to the other side they had 
forgotten to take bread 

16 6 then jesu said unto them take heed and bewar of the leaven of 
the pharis and of the sadduc 

16 7 and they reason among themselv say it is becau we have 
taken no bread 

16 8 which when jesu perceiv he said unto them o ye of littl 
faith whi reason ye among yourselv becau ye have brought no 
bread 16 9 do ye not yet understand neither rememb the five 
loaf of the five thousand and how mani basket ye took up 16 10 
neither the seven loaf of the four thousand and how mani basket ye 
took up 16 11 how is it that ye do not understand that i spake it 
not to you concern bread that ye should bewar of the leaven of 
the pharis and of the sadduc 16 12 then understood they how 
that he bade them not bewar of the leaven of bread but of the 
doctrin of the pharis and of the sadduc 

16 13 when jesu came into the coast of caesarea philippi he ask 
hi discipl say whom do men say that i the son of man am 
16 14 and they said some say that thou art john the baptist some 
elia and other jeremia or one of the prophet 

16 15 he saith unto them but whom say ye that i am 16 16 and simon 
peter answer and said thou art the christ the son of the live 
god 

16 17 and jesu answer and said unto him bless art thou simon 
barjona for flesh and blood hath not reveal it unto thee but my 
father which is in heaven 

16 18 and i say also unto thee that thou art peter and upon thi 
rock i will build my church and the gate of hell shall not prevail 
against it 

16 19 and i will give unto thee the key of the kingdom of heaven and 
whatsoev thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven and 
whatsoev thou shalt loo on earth shall be loo in heaven 

16 20 then charg he hi discipl that they should tell no man that 
he wa jesu the christ 

16 21 from that time forth began jesu to shew unto hi discipl how 
that he must go unto jerusalem and suffer mani thing of the elder 
and chief priest and scribe and be kill and be rai again the 
third day 

16 22 then peter took him and began to rebuk him say be it far 
from thee lord thi shall not be unto thee 

16 23 but he turn and said unto peter get thee behind me satan 
thou art an offenc unto me for thou savourest not the thing that be 
of god but those that be of men 

16 24 then said jesu unto hi discipl if ani man will come after 
me let him deni himself and take up hi cross and follow me 

16 25 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it and whosoev 
will lose hi life for my sake shall find it 

16 26 for what is a man profit if he shall gain the whole world 
and lose hi own soul or what shall a man give in exchang for hi 
soul 16 27 for the son of man shall come in the glori of hi father 
with hi angel and then he shall reward everi man accord to hi 
work 

16 28 verili i say unto you there be some stand here which shall 
not tast of death till they see the son of man come in hi 
kingdom 

17 1 and after six day jesu taketh peter jame and john hi 
brother and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart 17 2 and 
wa transfigur befor them and hi face did shine a the sun and 
hi raiment wa white a the light 

17 3 and behold there appear unto them mose and elia talk 
with him 

17 4 then answer peter and said unto jesu lord it is good for u 
to be here if thou wilt let u make here three tabernacl one for 
thee and one for mose and one for elia 

17 5 while he yet spake behold a bright cloud overshadow them and 
behold a voic out of the cloud which said thi is my belov son 
in whom i am well plea hear ye him 

17 6 and when the discipl heard it they fell on their face and 
were sore afraid 

17 7 and jesu came and touch them and said ari and be not 
afraid 

17 8 and when they had lift up their eye they saw no man save 
jesu onli 

17 9 and a they came down from the mountain jesu charg them 
say tell the vision to no man until the son of man be risen again 
from the dead 

17 10 and hi discipl ask him say whi then say the scribe 
that elia must first come 17 11 and jesu answer and said unto 
them elia truli shall first come and restor all thing 

17 12 but i say unto you that elia is come alreadi and they knew 
him not but have done unto him whatsoev they list likewi shall 
also the son of man suffer of them 

17 13 then the discipl understood that he spake unto them of john 
the baptist 

17 14 and when they were come to the multitud there came to him a 
certain man kneel down to him and say 17 15 lord have merci 
on my son for he is lunatick and sore vex for ofttim he falleth 
into the fire and oft into the water 

17 16 and i brought him to thi discipl and they could not cure him 

17 17 then jesu answer and said o faithless and perver 
gener how long shall i be with you how long shall i suffer you 
bring him hither to me 

17 18 and jesu rebuk the devil and he depart out of him and the 
child wa cure from that veri hour 

17 19 then came the discipl to jesu apart and said whi could not 
we cast him out 17 20 and jesu said unto them becau of your 
unbelief for verili i say unto you if ye have faith a a grain of 
mustard seed ye shall say unto thi mountain remov henc to yonder 
place and it shall remov and noth shall be imposs unto you 

17 21 howbeit thi kind goeth not out but by prayer and fast 

17 22 and while they abod in galil jesu said unto them the son 
of man shall be betray into the hand of men 17 23 and they shall 
kill him and the third day he shall be rai again 

and they were exceed sorri 

17 24 and when they were come to capernaum they that receiv tribut 
money came to peter and said doth not your master pay tribut 
17 25 he saith ye and when he wa come into the hou jesu 
prevent him say what thinkest thou simon of whom do the king 
of the earth take custom or tribut of their own child or of 
stranger 17 26 peter saith unto him of stranger jesu saith unto 
him then are the child free 

17 27 notwithstand lest we should offend them go thou to the sea 
and cast an hook and take up the fish that first cometh up and when 
thou hast open hi mouth thou shalt find a piec of money that 
take and give unto them for me and thee 

18 1 at the same time came the discipl unto jesu say who is 
the greatest in the kingdom of heaven 18 2 and jesu call a littl 
child unto him and set him in the midst of them 18 3 and said 
verili i say unto you except ye be convert and becom a littl 
child ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven 

18 4 whosoev therefor shall humbl himself a thi littl child 
the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven 

18 5 and whoso shall receiv one such littl child in my name 
receiveth me 

18 6 but whoso shall offend one of these littl one which believ in 
me it were better for him that a millston were hang about hi 
neck and that he were drown in the depth of the sea 

18 7 woe unto the world becau of offenc for it must need be that 
offenc come but woe to that man by whom the offenc cometh 18 8 
wherefor if thi hand or thi foot offend thee cut them off and cast 
them from thee it is better for thee to enter into life halt or 
maim rather than have two hand or two foot to be cast into 
everlast fire 

18 9 and if thine eye offend thee pluck it out and cast it from 
thee it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye rather 
than have two eye to be cast into hell fire 

18 10 take heed that ye despi not one of these littl one for i 
say unto you that in heaven their angel do alway behold the face of 
my father which is in heaven 

18 11 for the son of man is come to save that which wa lost 

18 12 how think ye if a man have an hundr sheep and one of them be 
gone astray doth he not leav the nineti and nine and goeth into the 
mountain and seeketh that which is gone astray 18 13 and if so be 
that he find it verili i say unto you he rejoiceth more of that 
sheep than of the nineti and nine which went not astray 

18 14 even so it is not the will of your father which is in heaven 
that one of these littl one should perish 

18 15 moreov if thi brother shall trespass against thee go and tell 
him hi fault between thee and him alon if he shall hear thee thou 
hast gain thi brother 

18 16 but if he will not hear thee then take with thee one or two 
more that in the mouth of two or three wit everi word may be 
establish 

18 17 and if he shall neglect to hear them tell it unto the church 
but if he neglect to hear the church let him be unto thee a an 
heathen man and a publican 

18 18 verili i say unto you whatsoev ye shall bind on earth shall 
be bound in heaven and whatsoev ye shall loo on earth shall be 
loo in heaven 

18 19 again i say unto you that if two of you shall agr on earth a 
touch ani thing that they shall ask it shall be done for them of 
my father which is in heaven 

18 20 for where two or three are gather togeth in my name there 
am i in the midst of them 

18 21 then came peter to him and said lord how oft shall my brother 
sin against me and i forgiv him till seven time 18 22 jesu 
saith unto him i say not unto thee until seven time but until 
seventi time seven 

18 23 therefor is the kingdom of heaven liken unto a certain king 
which would take account of hi servant 

18 24 and when he had begun to reckon one wa brought unto him which 
owe him ten thousand talent 

18 25 but forasmuch a he had not to pay hi lord command him to be 
sold and hi wife and child and all that he had and payment to 
be made 

18 26 the servant therefor fell down and worship him say 
lord have patienc with me and i will pay thee all 

18 27 then the lord of that servant wa move with compass and 
loo him and forgav him the debt 

18 28 but the same servant went out and found one of hi 
fellowserv which owe him an hundr penni and he laid hand on 
him and took him by the throat say pay me that thou owest 

18 29 and hi fellowserv fell down at hi foot and besought him 
say have patienc with me and i will pay thee all 

18 30 and he would not but went and cast him into prison till he 
should pay the debt 

18 31 so when hi fellowserv saw what wa done they were veri 
sorri and came and told unto their lord all that wa done 

18 32 then hi lord after that he had call him said unto him o 
thou wick servant i forgav thee all that debt becau thou 
desiredst me 18 33 shouldest not thou also have had compass on thi 
fellowserv even a i had piti on thee 18 34 and hi lord wa 
wroth and deliv him to the tormentor till he should pay all 
that wa due unto him 

18 35 so likewi shall my heavenli father do also unto you if ye 
from your heart forgiv not everi one hi brother their trespass 

19 1 and it came to pa that when jesu had finish these say 
he depart from galil and came into the coast of judaea beyond 
jordan 19 2 and great multitud follow him and he heal them 
there 

19 3 the pharis also came unto him tempt him and say unto 
him is it law for a man to put away hi wife for everi cau 
19 4 and he answer and said unto them have ye not read that he 
which made them at the begin made them male and femal 19 5 and 
said for thi cau shall a man leav father and mother and shall 
cleav to hi wife and they twain shall be one flesh 19 6 wherefor 
they are no more twain but one flesh what therefor god hath join 
togeth let not man put asund 

19 7 they say unto him whi did mose then command to give a write 
of divorc and to put her away 19 8 he saith unto them mose 
becau of the hard of your heart suffer you to put away your 
wife but from the begin it wa not so 

19 9 and i say unto you whosoev shall put away hi wife except it 
be for fornic and shall marri anoth committeth adulteri and 
whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adulteri 

19 10 hi discipl say unto him if the case of the man be so with 
hi wife it is not good to marri 

19 11 but he said unto them all men cannot receiv thi say save 
they to whom it is given 

19 12 for there are some eunuch which were so born from their 
mother s womb and there are some eunuch which were made eunuch of 
men and there be eunuch which have made themselv eunuch for the 
kingdom of heaven s sake he that is abl to receiv it let him 
receiv it 

19 13 then were there brought unto him littl child that he should 
put hi hand on them and pray and the discipl rebuk them 

19 14 but jesu said suffer littl child and forbid them not to 
come unto me for of such is the kingdom of heaven 

19 15 and he laid hi hand on them and depart thenc 

19 16 and behold one came and said unto him good master what good 
thing shall i do that i may have etern life 19 17 and he said 
unto him whi callest thou me good there is none good but one that 
is god but if thou wilt enter into life keep the command 

19 18 he saith unto him which jesu said thou shalt do no murder 
thou shalt not commit adulteri thou shalt not steal thou shalt not 
bear fal wit 19 19 honour thi father and thi mother and thou 
shalt love thi neighbour a thyself 

19 20 the young man saith unto him all these thing have i kept from 
my youth up what lack i yet 19 21 jesu said unto him if thou wilt 
be perfect go and sell that thou hast and give to the poor and thou 
shalt have treasur in heaven and come and follow me 

19 22 but when the young man heard that say he went away 
sorrow for he had great poss 

19 23 then said jesu unto hi discipl verili i say unto you that 
a rich man shall hardli enter into the kingdom of heaven 

19 24 and again i say unto you it is easier for a camel to go through 
the eye of a needl than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of 
god 

19 25 when hi discipl heard it they were exceedingli amaz 
say who then can be save 19 26 but jesu beheld them and said 
unto them with men thi is imposs but with god all thing are 
possibl 

19 27 then answer peter and said unto him behold we have forsaken
