sick and readi to die 

7 3 and when he heard of jesu he sent unto him the elder of the 
jew beseech him that he would come and heal hi servant 

7 4 and when they came to jesu they besought him instantli say 
that he wa worthi for whom he should do thi 7 5 for he loveth our 
nation and he hath built u a synagogu 

7 6 then jesu went with them and when he wa now not far from the 
hou the centurion sent friend to him say unto him lord 
troubl not thyself for i am not worthi that thou shouldest enter 
under my roof 7 7 wherefor neither thought i myself worthi to come 
unto thee but say in a word and my servant shall be heal 

7 8 for i also am a man set under author have under me soldier 
and i say unto one go and he goeth and to anoth come and he 
cometh and to my servant do thi and he doeth it 

7 9 when jesu heard these thing he marvel at him and turn him 
about and said unto the peopl that follow him i say unto you i 
have not found so great faith no not in israel 

7 10 and they that were sent return to the hou found the 
servant whole that had been sick 

7 11 and it came to pa the day after that he went into a citi 
call nain and mani of hi discipl went with him and much peopl 

7 12 now when he came nigh to the gate of the citi behold there wa 
a dead man carri out the onli son of hi mother and she wa a 
widow and much peopl of the citi wa with her 

7 13 and when the lord saw her he had compass on her and said 
unto her weep not 

7 14 and he came and touch the bier and they that bare him stood 
still 

and he said young man i say unto thee ari 

7 15 and he that wa dead sat up and began to speak and he deliv 
him to hi mother 

7 16 and there came a fear on all and they glorifi god say 
that a great prophet is risen up among u and that god hath visit 
hi peopl 

7 17 and thi rumour of him went forth throughout all judaea and 
throughout all the region round about 

7 18 and the discipl of john shew him of all these thing 

7 19 and john call unto him two of hi discipl sent them to 
jesu say art thou he that should come or look we for anoth 
7 20 when the men were come unto him they said john baptist hath 
sent u unto thee say art thou he that should come or look we 
for anoth 7 21 and in that same hour he cure mani of their 
infirm and plagu and of evil spirit and unto mani that were 
blind he gave sight 

7 22 then jesu answer said unto them go your way and tell john 
what thing ye have seen and heard how that the blind see the lame 
walk the leper are clean the deaf hear the dead are rai to 
the poor the gospel is preach 

7 23 and bless is he whosoev shall not be offend in me 

7 24 and when the messeng of john were depart he began to speak 
unto the peopl concern john what went ye out into the wilder 
for to see a reed shaken with the wind 7 25 but what went ye out 
for to see a man cloth in soft raiment behold they which are 
gorgeou apparel and live delic are in king court 

7 26 but what went ye out for to see a prophet yea i say unto you 
and much more than a prophet 

7 27 thi is he of whom it is written behold i send my messeng 
befor thi face which shall prepar thi way befor thee 

7 28 for i say unto you among those that are born of woman there is 
not a greater prophet than john the baptist but he that is least in 
the kingdom of god is greater than he 

7 29 and all the peopl that heard him and the publican justifi 
god be baptiz with the baptism of john 

7 30 but the pharis and lawyer reject the counsel of god against 
themselv be not baptiz of him 

7 31 and the lord said whereunto then shall i liken the men of thi 
gener and to what are they like 7 32 they are like unto 
child sit in the marketplac and call one to anoth and 
say we have pipe unto you and ye have not danc we have 
mourn to you and ye have not wept 

7 33 for john the baptist came neither eat bread nor drink wine 
and ye say he hath a devil 

7 34 the son of man is come eat and drink and ye say behold a 
glutton man and a winebibb a friend of publican and sinner 
7 35 but wisdom is justifi of all her child 

7 36 and one of the pharis desir him that he would eat with him 
and he went into the pharis s hou and sat down to meat 

7 37 and behold a woman in the citi which wa a sinner when she 
knew that jesu sat at meat in the pharis s hou brought an 
alabast box of ointment 7 38 and stood at hi foot behind him 
weep and began to wash hi foot with tear and did wipe them with 
the hair of her head and kiss hi foot and anoint them with the 
ointment 

7 39 now when the pharis which had bidden him saw it he spake 
within himself say thi man if he were a prophet would have 
known who and what manner of woman thi is that toucheth him for she 
is a sinner 

7 40 and jesu answer said unto him simon i have somewhat to say 
unto thee and he saith master say on 

7 41 there wa a certain creditor which had two debtor the one owe 
five hundr penni and the other fifti 

7 42 and when they had noth to pay he frankli forgav them both 
tell me therefor which of them will love him most 7 43 simon 
answer and said i suppo that he to whom he forgav most 

and he said unto him thou hast rightli judg 

7 44 and he turn to the woman and said unto simon seest thou thi 
woman i enter into thine hou thou gavest me no water for my 
foot but she hath wash my foot with tear and wipe them with the 
hair of her head 

7 45 thou gavest me no kiss but thi woman sinc the time i came in 
hath not cea to kiss my foot 

7 46 my head with oil thou didst not anoint but thi woman hath 
anoint my foot with ointment 

7 47 wherefor i say unto thee her sin which are mani are 
forgiven for she love much but to whom littl is forgiven the same 
loveth littl 

7 48 and he said unto her thi sin are forgiven 

7 49 and they that sat at meat with him began to say within 
themselv who is thi that forgiveth sin also 7 50 and he said to 
the woman thi faith hath save thee go in peac 

8 1 and it came to pa afterward that he went throughout everi citi 
and villag preach and shew the glad tide of the kingdom of 
god and the twelv were with him 8 2 and certain woman which had 
been heal of evil spirit and infirm mari call magdalen 
out of whom went seven devil 8 3 and joanna the wife of chuza 
herod s steward and susanna and mani other which minist unto 
him of their substanc 

8 4 and when much peopl were gather togeth and were come to him 
out of everi citi he spake by a parabl 8 5 a sower went out to sow 
hi seed and a he sow some fell by the way side and it wa 
trodden down and the fowl of the air devour it 

8 6 and some fell upon a rock and a soon a it wa sprung up it 
wither away becau it lack moistur 

8 7 and some fell among thorn and the thorn sprang up with it and 
choke it 

8 8 and other fell on good ground and sprang up and bare fruit an 
hundredfold and when he had said these thing he cri he that hath 
ear to hear let him hear 

8 9 and hi discipl ask him say what might thi parabl be 
8 10 and he said unto you it is given to know the mysteri of the 
kingdom of god but to other in parabl that see they might not 
see and hear they might not understand 

8 11 now the parabl is thi the seed is the word of god 

8 12 those by the way side are they that hear then cometh the devil 
and taketh away the word out of their heart lest they should believ 
and be save 

8 13 they on the rock are they which when they hear receiv the 
word with joy and these have no root which for a while believ and 
in time of temptat fall away 

8 14 and that which fell among thorn are they which when they have 
heard go forth and are choke with care and rich and pleasur of 
thi life and bring no fruit to perfect 

8 15 but that on the good ground are they which in an honest and good 
heart have heard the word keep it and bring forth fruit with 
patienc 

8 16 no man when he hath light a candl covereth it with a vessel 
or putteth it under a bed but setteth it on a candlestick that they 
which enter in may see the light 

8 17 for noth is secret that shall not be made manifest neither 
ani thing hid that shall not be known and come abroad 

8 18 take heed therefor how ye hear for whosoev hath to him shall 
be given and whosoev hath not from him shall be taken even that 
which he seemeth to have 

8 19 then came to him hi mother and hi brother and could not come 
at him for the press 

8 20 and it wa told him by certain which said thi mother and thi 
brother stand without desir to see thee 

8 21 and he answer and said unto them my mother and my brother are 
these which hear the word of god and do it 

8 22 now it came to pa on a certain day that he went into a ship 
with hi discipl and he said unto them let u go over unto the 
other side of the lake and they launch forth 

8 23 but a they sail he fell asleep and there came down a storm of 
wind on the lake and they were fill with water and were in 
jeopardi 

8 24 and they came to him and awok him say master master we 
perish then he aro and rebuk the wind and the rage of the 
water and they cea and there wa a calm 

8 25 and he said unto them where is your faith and they be afraid 
wonder say one to anoth what manner of man is thi for he 
commandeth even the wind and water and they obey him 

8 26 and they arriv at the countri of the gadaren which is over 
against galil 

8 27 and when he went forth to land there met him out of the citi a 
certain man which had devil long time and ware no cloth neither 
abod in ani hou but in the tomb 

8 28 when he saw jesu he cri out and fell down befor him and 
with a loud voic said what have i to do with thee jesu thou son 
of god most high i beseech thee torment me not 

8 29 for he had command the unclean spirit to come out of the man 
for oftentim it had caught him and he wa kept bound with chain 
and in fetter and he brake the band and wa driven of the devil 
into the wilder 8 30 and jesu ask him say what is thi 
name and he said legion becau mani devil were enter into him 

8 31 and they besought him that he would not command them to go out 
into the deep 

8 32 and there wa there an herd of mani swine feed on the 
mountain and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter 
into them and he suffer them 

8 33 then went the devil out of the man and enter into the swine 
and the herd ran violent down a steep place into the lake and were 
choke 

8 34 when they that fed them saw what wa done they fled and went 
and told it in the citi and in the countri 

8 35 then they went out to see what wa done and came to jesu and 
found the man out of whom the devil were depart sit at the 
foot of jesu cloth and in hi right mind and they were afraid 

8 36 they also which saw it told them by what mean he that wa 
poss of the devil wa heal 

8 37 then the whole multitud of the countri of the gadaren round 
about besought him to depart from them for they were taken with great 
fear and he went up into the ship and return back again 

8 38 now the man out of whom the devil were depart besought him 
that he might be with him but jesu sent him away say 8 39 
return to thine own hou and shew how great thing god hath done 
unto thee and he went hi way and publish throughout the whole 
citi how great thing jesu had done unto him 

8 40 and it came to pa that when jesu wa return the peopl 
gladli receiv him for they were all wait for him 

8 41 and behold there came a man name jairu and he wa a ruler of 
the synagogu and he fell down at jesu foot and besought him that 
he would come into hi hou 8 42 for he had one onli daughter about 
twelv year of age and she lay a die but a he went the peopl 
throng him 

8 43 and a woman have an issu of blood twelv year which had 
spent all her live upon physician neither could be heal of ani 
8 44 came behind him and touch the border of hi garment and 
immedi her issu of blood stanch 

8 45 and jesu said who touch me when all deni peter and they 
that were with him said master the multitud throng thee and press 
thee and sayest thou who touch me 8 46 and jesu said somebodi 
hath touch me for i perceiv that virtu is gone out of me 

8 47 and when the woman saw that she wa not hid she came trembl 
and fall down befor him she declar unto him befor all the 
peopl for what cau she had touch him and how she wa heal 
immedi 

8 48 and he said unto her daughter be of good comfort thi faith 
hath made thee whole go in peac 

8 49 while he yet spake there cometh one from the ruler of the 
synagogu s hou say to him thi daughter is dead troubl not 
the master 

8 50 but when jesu heard it he answer him say fear not 
believ onli and she shall be made whole 

8 51 and when he came into the hou he suffer no man to go in 
save peter and jame and john and the father and the mother of the 
maiden 

8 52 and all wept and bewail her but he said weep not she is not 
dead but sleepeth 

8 53 and they laugh him to scorn know that she wa dead 

8 54 and he put them all out and took her by the hand and call 
say maid ari 

8 55 and her spirit came again and she aro straightway and he 
command to give her meat 

8 56 and her parent were astonish but he charg them that they 
should tell no man what wa done 

9 1 then he call hi twelv discipl togeth and gave them power 
and author over all devil and to cure disea 

9 2 and he sent them to preach the kingdom of god and to heal the 
sick 

9 3 and he said unto them take noth for your journey neither 
stave nor scrip neither bread neither money neither have two 
coat apiec 

9 4 and whatsoev hou ye enter into there abid and thenc 
depart 

9 5 and whosoev will not receiv you when ye go out of that citi 
shake off the veri dust from your foot for a testimoni against them 

9 6 and they depart and went through the town preach the 
gospel and heal everi where 

9 7 now herod the tetrarch heard of all that wa done by him and he 
wa perplex becau that it wa said of some that john wa risen 
from the dead 9 8 and of some that elia had appear and of 
other that one of the old prophet wa risen again 

9 9 and herod said john have i behead but who is thi of whom i 
hear such thing and he desir to see him 

9 10 and the apostl when they were return told him all that they 
had done and he took them and went asid privat into a desert 
place belong to the citi call bethsaida 

9 11 and the peopl when they knew it follow him and he receiv 
them and spake unto them of the kingdom of god and heal them that 
had need of heal 

9 12 and when the day began to wear away then came the twelv and 
said unto him send the multitud away that they may go into the 
town and countri round about and lodg and get victual for we are 
here in a desert place 

9 13 but he said unto them give ye them to eat and they said we 
have no more but five loaf and two fish except we should go and 
buy meat for all thi peopl 

9 14 for they were about five thousand men and he said to hi 
discipl make them sit down by fifti in a compani 

9 15 and they did so and made them all sit down 

9 16 then he took the five loaf and the two fish and look up 
to heaven he bless them and brake and gave to the discipl to 
set befor the multitud 

9 17 and they did eat and were all fill and there wa taken up of 
fragment that remain to them twelv basket 

9 18 and it came to pa a he wa alon pray hi discipl were 
with him and he ask them say whom say the peopl that i am 
9 19 they answer said john the baptist but some say elia and 
other say that one of the old prophet is risen again 

9 20 he said unto them but whom say ye that i am peter answer 
said the christ of god 

9 21 and he straitli charg them and command them to tell no man 
that thing 9 22 say the son of man must suffer mani thing and 
be reject of the elder and chief priest and scribe and be slain 
and be rai the third day 

9 23 and he said to them all if ani man will come after me let him 
deni himself and take up hi cross daili and follow me 

9 24 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it but whosoev 
will lose hi life for my sake the same shall save it 

9 25 for what is a man advantag if he gain the whole world and 
lose himself or be cast away 9 26 for whosoev shall be asham of 
me and of my word of him shall the son of man be asham when he 
shall come in hi own glori and in hi father s and of the holi 
angel 

9 27 but i tell you of a truth there be some stand here which 
shall not tast of death till they see the kingdom of god 

9 28 and it came to pa about an eight day after these say he 
took peter and john and jame and went up into a mountain to pray 

9 29 and a he pray the fashion of hi counten wa alter and 
hi raiment wa white and glister 

9 30 and behold there talk with him two men which were mose and 
elia 9 31 who appear in glori and spake of hi decea which he 
should accomplish at jerusalem 

9 32 but peter and they that were with him were heavi with sleep and 
when they were awak they saw hi glori and the two men that stood 
with him 

9 33 and it came to pa a they depart from him peter said unto 
jesu master it is good for u to be here and let u make three 
tabernacl one for thee and one for mose and one for elia not 
know what he said 

9 34 while he thu spake there came a cloud and overshadow them 
and they fear a they enter into the cloud 

9 35 and there came a voic out of the cloud say thi is my 
belov son hear him 

9 36 and when the voic wa past jesu wa found alon and they kept 
it close and told no man in those day ani of those thing which they 
had seen 

9 37 and it came to pa that on the next day when they were come 
down from the hill much peopl met him 

9 38 and behold a man of the compani cri out say master i 
beseech thee look upon my son for he is mine onli child 

9 39 and lo a spirit taketh him and he suddenli crieth out and it 
teareth him that he foameth again and brui him hardli departeth 
from him 

9 40 and i besought thi discipl to cast him out and they could not 

9 41 and jesu answer said o faithless and perver gener 
how long shall i be with you and suffer you bring thi son hither 

9 42 and a he wa yet a come the devil threw him down and tare 
him 

and jesu rebuk the unclean spirit and heal the child and 
deliv him again to hi father 

9 43 and they were all amaz at the mighti power of god but while 
they wonder everi one at all thing which jesu did he said unto 
hi discipl 9 44 let these say sink down into your ear for 
the son of man shall be deliv into the hand of men 

9 45 but they understood not thi say and it wa hid from them 
that they perceiv it not and they fear to ask him of that say 

9 46 then there aro a reason among them which of them should be 
greatest 

9 47 and jesu perceiv the thought of their heart took a child 
and set him by him 9 48 and said unto them whosoev shall receiv 
thi child in my name receiveth me and whosoev shall receiv me 
receiveth him that sent me for he that is least among you all the 
same shall be great 

9 49 and john answer and said master we saw one cast out devil 
in thi name and we forbad him becau he followeth not with u 

9 50 and jesu said unto him forbid him not for he that is not 
against u is for u 

9 51 and it came to pa when the time wa come that he should be 
receiv up he stedfastli set hi face to go to jerusalem 9 52 and 
sent messeng befor hi face and they went and enter into a 
villag of the samaritan to make readi for him 

9 53 and they did not receiv him becau hi face wa a though he 
would go to jerusalem 

9 54 and when hi discipl jame and john saw thi they said lord 
wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven and consum 
them even a elia did 9 55 but he turn and rebuk them and 
said ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of 

9 56 for the son of man is not come to destroy men s life but to 
save them and they went to anoth villag 

9 57 and it came to pa that a they went in the way a certain man 
said unto him lord i will follow thee whithersoev thou goest 

9 58 and jesu said unto him fox have hole and bird of the air 
have nest but the son of man hath not where to lay hi head 

9 59 and he said unto anoth follow me but he said lord suffer me 
first to go and buri my father 

9 60 jesu said unto him let the dead buri their dead but go thou 
and preach the kingdom of god 

9 61 and anoth also said lord i will follow thee but let me first 
go bid them farewel which are at home at my hou 

9 62 and jesu said unto him no man have put hi hand to the 
plough and look back is fit for the kingdom of god 

10 1 after these thing the lord appoint other seventi also and 
sent them two and two befor hi face into everi citi and place 
whither he himself would come 

10 2 therefor said he unto them the harvest truli is great but the 
labour are few pray ye therefor the lord of the harvest that he 
would send forth labour into hi harvest 

10 3 go your way behold i send you forth a lamb among wolf 

10 4 carri neither pur nor scrip nor shoe and salut no man by 
the way 

10 5 and into whatsoev hou ye enter first say peac be to thi 
hou 

10 6 and if the son of peac be there your peac shall rest upon it 
if not it shall turn to you again 

10 7 and in the same hou remain eat and drink such thing a 
they give for the labour is worthi of hi hire go not from hou 
to hou 

10 8 and into whatsoev citi ye enter and they receiv you eat such 
thing a are set befor you 10 9 and heal the sick that are therein 
and say unto them the kingdom of god is come nigh unto you 

10 10 but into whatsoev citi ye enter and they receiv you not go 
your way out into the street of the same and say 10 11 even the 
veri dust of your citi which cleaveth on u we do wipe off against 
you notwithstand be ye sure of thi that the kingdom of god is 
come nigh unto you 

10 12 but i say unto you that it shall be more toler in that day 
for sodom than for that citi 

10 13 woe unto thee chorazin woe unto thee bethsaida for if the 
mighti work had been done in tyre and sidon which have been done in 
you they had a great while ago repent sit in sackcloth and 
ash 

10 14 but it shall be more toler for tyre and sidon at the 
judgment than for you 

10 15 and thou capernaum which art exalt to heaven shalt be 
thrust down to hell 

10 16 he that heareth you heareth me and he that despiseth you 
despiseth me and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me 

10 17 and the seventi return again with joy say lord even the 
devil are subject unto u through thi name 

10 18 and he said unto them i beheld satan a lightn fall from 
heaven 

10 19 behold i give unto you power to tread on serpent and 
scorpion and over all the power of the enemi and noth shall by 
ani mean hurt you 

10 20 notwithstand in thi rejoic not that the spirit are 
subject unto you but rather rejoic becau your name are written 
in heaven 

10 21 in that hour jesu rejoic in spirit and said i thank thee o 
father lord of heaven and earth that thou hast hid these thing from 
the wise and prudent and hast reveal them unto babe even so 
father for so it seem good in thi sight 

10 22 all thing are deliv to me of my father and no man knoweth 
who the son is but the father and who the father is but the son 
and he to whom the son will reveal him 

10 23 and he turn him unto hi discipl and said privat 
bless are the eye which see the thing that ye see 10 24 for i 
tell you that mani prophet and king have desir to see those 
thing which ye see and have not seen them and to hear those thing 
which ye hear and have not heard them 

10 25 and behold a certain lawyer stood up and tempt him say 
master what shall i do to inherit etern life 10 26 he said unto 
him what is written in the law how readest thou 10 27 and he 
answer said thou shalt love the lord thi god with all thi heart 
and with all thi soul and with all thi strength and with all thi 
mind and thi neighbour a thyself 

10 28 and he said unto him thou hast answer right thi do and 
thou shalt live 

10 29 but he will to justifi himself said unto jesu and who is 
my neighbour 10 30 and jesu answer said a certain man went down 
from jerusalem to jericho and fell among thief which strip him 
of hi raiment and wound him and depart leav him half dead 

10 31 and by chanc there came down a certain priest that way and 
when he saw him he pa by on the other side 

10 32 and likewi a levit when he wa at the place came and look 
on him and pa by on the other side 

10 33 but a certain samaritan a he journey came where he wa and 
when he saw him he had compass on him 10 34 and went to him and 
bound up hi wound pour in oil and wine and set him on hi own 
beast and brought him to an inn and took care of him 

10 35 and on the morrow when he depart he took out two penni and 
gave them to the host and said unto him take care of him and 
whatsoev thou spendest more when i come again i will repay thee 

10 36 which now of these three thinkest thou wa neighbour unto him 
that fell among the thief 10 37 and he said he that shew merci 
on him then said jesu unto him go and do thou likewi 

10 38 now it came to pa a they went that he enter into a 
certain villag and a certain woman name martha receiv him into 
her hou 

10 39 and she had a sister call mari which also sat at jesu foot 
and heard hi word 

10 40 but martha wa cumber about much serv and came to him and 
said lord dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serv 
alon bid her therefor that she help me 

10 41 and jesu answer and said unto her martha martha thou art 
care and troubl about mani thing 10 42 but one thing is 
need and mari hath chosen that good part which shall not be taken 
away from her 

11 1 and it came to pa that a he wa pray in a certain place 
when he cea one of hi discipl said unto him lord teach u to 
pray a john also taught hi discipl 

11 2 and he said unto them when ye pray say our father which art in 
heaven hallow be thi name thi kingdom come thi will be done a 
in heaven so in earth 

11 3 give u day by day our daili bread 

11 4 and forgiv u our sin for we also forgiv everi one that is 
indebt to u and lead u not into temptat but deliv u from 
evil 

11 5 and he said unto them which of you shall have a friend and 
shall go unto him at midnight and say unto him friend lend me three 
loaf 11 6 for a friend of mine in hi journey is come to me and i 
have noth to set befor him 11 7 and he from within shall answer 
and say troubl me not the door is now shut and my child are 
with me in bed i cannot rise and give thee 

11 8 i say unto you though he will not rise and give him becau he 
is hi friend yet becau of hi importun he will rise and give 
him a mani a he needeth 

11 9 and i say unto you ask and it shall be given you seek and ye 
shall find knock and it shall be open unto you 

11 10 for everi one that asketh receiveth and he that seeketh 
findeth and to him that knocketh it shall be open 

11 11 if a son shall ask bread of ani of you that is a father will he 
give him a stone or if he ask a fish will he for a fish give him a 
serpent 11 12 or if he shall ask an egg will he offer him a 
scorpion 11 13 if ye then be evil know how to give good gift 
unto your child how much more shall your heavenli father give the 
holi spirit to them that ask him 11 14 and he wa cast out a 
devil and it wa dumb and it came to pa when the devil wa gone 
out the dumb spake and the peopl wonder 

11 15 but some of them said he casteth out devil through beelzebub 
the chief of the devil 

11 16 and other tempt him sought of him a sign from heaven 

11 17 but he know their thought said unto them everi kingdom 
divid against itself is brought to desol and a hou divid 
against a hou falleth 

11 18 if satan also be divid against himself how shall hi kingdom 
stand becau ye say that i cast out devil through beelzebub 

11 19 and if i by beelzebub cast out devil by whom do your son cast 
them out therefor shall they be your judg 

11 20 but if i with the finger of god cast out devil no doubt the 
kingdom of god is come upon you 

11 21 when a strong man arm keepeth hi palac hi good are in 
peac 11 22 but when a stronger than he shall come upon him and 
overcom him he taketh from him all hi armour wherein he trust 
and divideth hi spoil 

11 23 he that is not with me is against me and he that gathereth not 
with me scattereth 

11 24 when the unclean spirit is gone out of a man he walketh through 
dri place seek rest and find none he saith i will return 
unto my hou whenc i came out 

11 25 and when he cometh he findeth it swept and garnish 

11 26 then goeth he and taketh to him seven other spirit more wick 
than himself and they enter in and dwell there and the last state 
of that man is wor than the first 

11 27 and it came to pa a he spake these thing a certain woman 
of the compani lift up her voic and said unto him bless is the 
womb that bare thee and the pap which thou hast suck 

11 28 but he said yea rather bless are they that hear the word of 
god and keep it 

11 29 and when the peopl were gather thick togeth he began to 
say thi is an evil gener they seek a sign and there shall no 
sign be given it but the sign of jona the prophet 

11 30 for a jona wa a sign unto the ninevit so shall also the 
son of man be to thi gener 

11 31 the queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the 
men of thi gener and condemn them for she came from the utmost 
part of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon and behold a 
greater than solomon is here 

11 32 the men of ninev shall rise up in the judgment with thi 
gener and shall condemn it for they repent at the preach 
of jona and behold a greater than jona is here 

11 33 no man when he hath light a candl putteth it in a secret 
place neither under a bushel but on a candlestick that they which 
come in may see the light 

11 34 the light of the bodi is the eye therefor when thine eye is 
singl thi whole bodi also is full of light but when thine eye is 
evil thi bodi also is full of dark 

11 35 take heed therefor that the light which is in thee be not 
dark 

11 36 if thi whole bodi therefor be full of light have no part 
dark the whole shall be full of light a when the bright shine of 
a candl doth give thee light 

11 37 and a he spake a certain pharis besought him to dine with 
him and he went in and sat down to meat 

11 38 and when the pharis saw it he marvel that he had not first 
wash befor dinner 

11 39 and the lord said unto him now do ye pharis make clean the 
outsid of the cup and the platter but your inward part is full of 
raven and wick 

11 40 ye fool did not he that made that which is without make that 
which is within also 11 41 but rather give alm of such thing a ye 
have and behold all thing are clean unto you 

11 42 but woe unto you pharis for ye tith mint and rue and all 
manner of herb and pa over judgment and the love of god these 
ought ye to have done and not to leav the other undon 

11 43 woe unto you pharis for ye love the uppermost seat in the 
synagogu and greet in the market 

11 44 woe unto you scribe and pharis hypocrit for ye are a 
graf which appear not and the men that walk over them are not awar 
of them 

11 45 then answer one of the lawyer and said unto him master 
thu say thou reproachest u also 

11 46 and he said woe unto you also ye lawyer for ye lade men with 
burden grievou to be born and ye yourselv touch not the burden 
with one of your finger 

11 47 woe unto you for ye build the sepulchr of the prophet and 
your father kill them 

11 48 truli ye bear wit that ye allow the deed of your father 
for they ind kill them and ye build their sepulchr 

11 49 therefor also said the wisdom of god i will send them prophet 
and apostl and some of them they shall slay and persecut 11 50 
that the blood of all the prophet which wa shed from the foundat 
of the world may be requir of thi gener 11 51 from the blood 
of abel unto the blood of zacharia which perish between the altar 
and the templ verili i say unto you it shall be requir of thi 
gener 

11 52 woe unto you lawyer for ye have taken away the key of 
knowledg ye enter not in yourselv and them that were enter 
in ye hinder 

11 53 and a he said these thing unto them the scribe and the 
pharis began to urg him vehement and to provok him to speak of 
mani thing 11 54 lay wait for him and seek to catch someth 
out of hi mouth that they might accu him 

12 1 in the mean time when there were gather togeth an 
innum multitud of peopl insomuch that they trode one upon 
anoth he began to say unto hi discipl first of all bewar ye of 
the leaven of the pharis which is hypocrisi 

12 2 for there is noth cover that shall not be reveal neither 
hid that shall not be known 

12 3 therefor whatsoev ye have spoken in dark shall be heard in 
the light and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closet shall 
be proclaim upon the housetop 

12 4 and i say unto you my friend be not afraid of them that kill 
the bodi and after that have no more that they can do 

12 5 but i will forewarn you whom ye shall fear fear him which after 
he hath kill hath power to cast into hell yea i say unto you fear 
him 

12 6 are not five sparrow sold for two farth and not one of them 
is forgotten befor god 12 7 but even the veri hair of your head 
are all number fear not therefor ye are of more valu than mani 
sparrow 

12 8 also i say unto you whosoev shall confess me befor men him 
shall the son of man also confess befor the angel of god 12 9 but 
he that denieth me befor men shall be deni befor the angel of 
god 

12 10 and whosoev shall speak a word against the son of man it 
shall be forgiven him but unto him that blasphemeth against the holi 
ghost it shall not be forgiven 

12 11 and when they bring you unto the synagogu and unto 
magistr and power take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall 
answer or what ye shall say 12 12 for the holi ghost shall teach you 
in the same hour what ye ought to say 

12 13 and one of the compani said unto him master speak to my 
brother that he divid the inherit with me 

12 14 and he said unto him man who made me a judg or a divid over 
you 12 15 and he said unto them take heed and bewar of 
covet for a man s life consisteth not in the abund of the 
thing which he possesseth 

12 16 and he spake a parabl unto them say the ground of a 
certain rich man brought forth plenti 12 17 and he thought 
within himself say what shall i do becau i have no room where 
to bestow my fruit 12 18 and he said thi will i do i will pull 
down my barn and build greater and there will i bestow all my 
fruit and my good 

12 19 and i will say to my soul soul thou hast much good laid up 
for mani year take thine ea eat drink and be merri 

12 20 but god said unto him thou fool thi night thi soul shall be 
requir of thee then whose shall those thing be which thou hast 
provid 12 21 so is he that layeth up treasur for himself and is 
not rich toward god 

12 22 and he said unto hi discipl therefor i say unto you take 
no thought for your life what ye shall eat neither for the bodi 
what ye shall put on 

12 23 the life is more than meat and the bodi is more than raiment 

12 24 consid the raven for they neither sow nor reap which 
neither have storeh nor barn and god feedeth them how much more 
are ye better than the fowl 12 25 and which of you with take 
thought can add to hi statur one cubit 12 26 if ye then be not 
abl to do that thing which is least whi take ye thought for the 
rest 12 27 consid the lili how they grow they toil not they 
spin not and yet i say unto you that solomon in all hi glori wa 
not array like one of these 

12 28 if then god so cloth the grass which is to day in the field 
and to morrow is cast into the oven how much more will he cloth you 
o ye of littl faith 12 29 and seek not ye what ye shall eat or 
what ye shall drink neither be ye of doubt mind 

12 30 for all these thing do the nation of the world seek after and 
your father knoweth that ye have need of these thing 

12 31 but rather seek ye the kingdom of god and all these thing 
shall be ad unto you 

12 32 fear not littl flock for it is your father s good pleasur to 
give you the kingdom 

12 33 sell that ye have and give alm provid yourselv bag which 
wax not old a treasur in the heaven that faileth not where no 
thief approacheth neither moth corrupteth 

12 34 for where your treasur is there will your heart be also 

12 35 let your loin be gird about and your light burn 12 36 
and ye yourselv like unto men that wait for their lord when he will 
return from the wed that when he cometh and knocketh they may 
open unto him immedi 

12 37 bless are those servant whom the lord when he cometh shall 
find watch verili i say unto you that he shall gird himself and 
make them to sit down to meat and will come forth and serv them 

12 38 and if he shall come in the second watch or come in the third 
watch and find them so bless are those servant 

12 39 and thi know that if the goodman of the hou had known what 
hour the thief would come he would have watch and not have 
suffer hi hou to be broken through 

12 40 be ye therefor readi also for the son of man cometh at an hour 
when ye think not 

12 41 then peter said unto him lord speakest thou thi parabl unto 
u or even to all 12 42 and the lord said who then is that 
faith and wise steward whom hi lord shall make ruler over hi 
household to give them their portion of meat in due season 12 43 
bless is that servant whom hi lord when he cometh shall find so 
do 

12 44 of a truth i say unto you that he will make him ruler over all 
that he hath 

12 45 but and if that servant say in hi heart my lord delayeth hi 
come and shall begin to beat the manserv and maiden and to 
eat and drink and to be drunken 12 46 the lord of that servant will 
come in a day when he looketh not for him and at an hour when he is 
not awar and will cut him in sunder and will appoint him hi 
portion with the unbeliev 

12 47 and that servant which knew hi lord s will and prepar not 
himself neither did accord to hi will shall be beaten with mani 
stripe 

12 48 but he that knew not and did commit thing worthi of stripe 
shall be beaten with few stripe for unto whomsoev much is given 
of him shall be much requir and to whom men have commit much of 
him they will ask the more 

12 49 i am come to send fire on the earth and what will i if it be 
alreadi kindl 12 50 but i have a baptism to be baptiz with and 
how am i straiten till it be accomplish 12 51 suppo ye that i 
am come to give peac on earth i tell you nay but rather divi 
12 52 for from henceforth there shall be five in one hou divid 
three against two and two against three 

12 53 the father shall be divid against the son and the son against 
the father the mother against the daughter and the daughter against 
the mother the mother in law against her daughter in law and the 
daughter in law against her mother in law 

12 54 and he said also to the peopl when ye see a cloud rise out of 
the west straightway ye say there cometh a shower and so it is 

12 55 and when ye see the south wind blow ye say there will be heat 
and it cometh to pa 

12 56 ye hypocrit ye can discern the face of the sky and of the 
earth but how is it that ye do not discern thi time 12 57 yea and 
whi even of yourselv judg ye not what is right 12 58 when thou 
goest with thine adversari to the magistr a thou art in the way 
give dilig that thou mayest be deliv from him lest he hale 
thee to the judg and the judg deliv thee to the offic and the 
offic cast thee into prison 

12 59 i tell thee thou shalt not depart thenc till thou hast paid 
the veri last mite 

13 1 there were present at that season some that told him of the 
galilaean whose blood pilat had mingl with their sacrif 

13 2 and jesu answer said unto them suppo ye that these 
galilaean were sinner abov all the galilaean becau they 
suffer such thing 13 3 i tell you nay but except ye repent ye 
shall all likewi perish 

13 4 or those eighteen upon whom the tower in siloam fell and slew 
them think ye that they were sinner abov all men that dwelt in 
jerusalem 13 5 i tell you nay but except ye repent ye shall all 
likewi perish 

13 6 he spake also thi parabl a certain man had a fig tree plant 
in hi vineyard and he came and sought fruit thereon and found none 

13 7 then said he unto the dresser of hi vineyard behold these 
three year i come seek fruit on thi fig tree and find none cut 
it down whi cumbereth it the ground 13 8 and he answer said unto 
him lord let it alon thi year also till i shall dig about it and 
dung it 13 9 and if it bear fruit well and if not then after that 
thou shalt cut it down 

13 10 and he wa teach in one of the synagogu on the sabbath 

13 11 and behold there wa a woman which had a spirit of infirm 
eighteen year and wa bow togeth and could in no wise lift up 
herself 

13 12 and when jesu saw her he call her to him and said unto her 
woman thou art loo from thine infirm 

13 13 and he laid hi hand on her and immedi she wa made 
straight and glorifi god 

13 14 and the ruler of the synagogu answer with indign 
becau that jesu had heal on the sabbath day and said unto the 
peopl there are six day in which men ought to work in them 
therefor come and be heal and not on the sabbath day 

13 15 the lord then answer him and said thou hypocrit doth not 
each one of you on the sabbath loo hi ox or hi a from the stall 
and lead him away to water 13 16 and ought not thi woman be 
a daughter of abraham whom satan hath bound lo these eighteen 
year be loo from thi bond on the sabbath day 13 17 and when he 
had said these thing all hi adversari were asham and all the 
peopl rejoic for all the gloriou thing that were done by him 

13 18 then said he unto what is the kingdom of god like and 
whereunto shall i resembl it 13 19 it is like a grain of mustard 
seed which a man took and cast into hi garden and it grew and 
wax a great tree and the fowl of the air lodg in the branch of 
it 

13 20 and again he said whereunto shall i liken the kingdom of god 
13 21 it is like leaven which a woman took and hid in three measur 
of meal till the whole wa leaven 

13 22 and he went through the citi and villag teach and 
journey toward jerusalem 

13 23 then said one unto him lord are there few that be save and 
he said unto them 13 24 strive to enter in at the strait gate for 
mani i say unto you will seek to enter in and shall not be abl 

13 25 when onc the master of the hou is risen up and hath shut to 
the door and ye begin to stand without and to knock at the door 
say lord lord open unto u and he shall answer and say unto 
you i know you not whenc ye are 13 26 then shall ye begin to say 
we have eaten and drunk in thi presenc and thou hast taught in our 
street 

13 27 but he shall say i tell you i know you not whenc ye are 
depart from me all ye worker of iniqu 

13 28 there shall be weep and gnash of teeth when ye shall see 
abraham and isaac and jacob and all the prophet in the kingdom of 
god and you yourselv thrust out 

13 29 and they shall come from the east and from the west and from 
the north and from the south and shall sit down in the kingdom of 
god 

13 30 and behold there are last which shall be first and there are 
first which shall be last 

13 31 the same day there came certain of the pharis say unto 
him get thee out and depart henc for herod will kill thee 

13 32 and he said unto them go ye and tell that fox behold i cast 
out devil and i do cure to day and to morrow and the third day i 
shall be perfect 

13 33 nevertheless i must walk to day and to morrow and the day 
follow for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of jerusalem 

13 34 o jerusalem jerusalem which killest the prophet and stonest 
them that are sent unto thee how often would i have gather thi 
child togeth a a hen doth gather her brood under her wing and 
ye would not 13 35 behold your hou is left unto you desol and 
verili i say unto you ye shall not see me until the time come when 
ye shall say bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord 

14 1 and it came to pa a he went into the hou of one of the 
chief pharis to eat bread on the sabbath day that they watch 
him 

14 2 and behold there wa a certain man befor him which had the 
dropsi 

14 3 and jesu answer spake unto the lawyer and pharis say 
is it law to heal on the sabbath day 14 4 and they held their 
peac and he took him and heal him and let him go 14 5 and 
answer them say which of you shall have an a or an ox fallen 
into a pit and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day 
14 6 and they could not answer him again to these thing 

14 7 and he put forth a parabl to those which were bidden when he 
mark how they chose out the chief room say unto them 

14 8 when thou art bidden of ani man to a wed sit not down in the 
highest room lest a more honour man than thou be bidden of him 
14 9 and he that bade thee and him come and say to thee give thi man 
place and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room 

14 10 but when thou art bidden go and sit down in the lowest room 
that when he that bade thee cometh he may say unto thee friend go 
up higher then shalt thou have worship in the presenc of them that 
sit at meat with thee 

14 11 for whosoev exalteth himself shall be aba and he that 
humbleth himself shall be exalt 

14 12 then said he also to him that bade him when thou makest a 
dinner or a supper call not thi friend nor thi brother neither 
thi kinsman nor thi rich neighbour lest they also bid thee again 
and a recomp be made thee 

14 13 but when thou makest a feast call the poor the maim the 
lame the blind 14 14 and thou shalt be bless for they cannot 
recompen thee for thou shalt be recompen at the resurrect of 
the just 

14 15 and when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these 
thing he said unto him bless is he that shall eat bread in the 
kingdom of god 

14 16 then said he unto him a certain man made a great supper and 
bade mani 14 17 and sent hi servant at supper time to say to them 
that were bidden come for all thing are now readi 

14 18 and they all with one consent began to make excu the first 
said unto him i have bought a piec of ground and i must need go 
and see it i pray thee have me excu 

14 19 and anoth said i have bought five yoke of ox and i go to 
prove them i pray thee have me excu 

14 20 and anoth said i have marri a wife and therefor i cannot 
come 

14 21 so that servant came and shew hi lord these thing then the 
master of the hou be angri said to hi servant go out quickli 
into the street and lane of the citi and bring in hither the poor 
and the maim and the halt and the blind 

14 22 and the servant said lord it is done a thou hast command 
and yet there is room 

14 23 and the lord said unto the servant go out into the highway and 
hedg and compel them to come in that my hou may be fill 

14 24 for i say unto you that none of those men which were bidden 
shall tast of my supper 

14 25 and there went great multitud with him and he turn and 
said unto them 14 26 if ani man come to me and hate not hi father 
and mother and wife and child and brother and sister yea 
and hi own life also he cannot be my discipl 

14 27 and whosoev doth not bear hi cross and come after me cannot 
be my discipl 

14 28 for which of you intend to build a tower sitteth not down 
first and counteth the cost whether he have suffici to finish it 
14 29 lest hapli after he hath laid the foundat and is not abl 
to finish it all that behold it begin to mock him 14 30 say thi 
man began to build and wa not abl to finish 

14 31 or what king go to make war against anoth king sitteth 
not down first and consulteth whether he be abl with ten thousand to 
meet him that cometh against him with twenti thousand 14 32 or el 
while the other is yet a great way off he sendeth an ambassag and 
desireth condit of peac 

14 33 so likewi whosoev he be of you that forsaketh not all that 
he hath he cannot be my discipl 

14 34 salt is good but if the salt have lost hi savour wherewith 
shall it be season 14 35 it is neither fit for the land nor yet 
for the dunghil but men cast it out he that hath ear to hear let 
him hear 

15 1 then drew near unto him all the publican and sinner for to hear 
him 

15 2 and the pharis and scribe murmur say thi man 
receiveth sinner and eateth with them 

15 3 and he spake thi parabl unto them say 15 4 what man of 
you have an hundr sheep if he lose one of them doth not leav 
the nineti and nine in the wilder and go after that which is 
lost until he find it 15 5 and when he hath found it he layeth it 
on hi shoulder rejoic 

15 6 and when he cometh home he calleth togeth hi friend and 
neighbour say unto them rejoic with me for i have found my 
sheep which wa lost 

15 7 i say unto you that likewi joy shall be in heaven over one 
sinner that repenteth more than over nineti and nine just person 
which need no repent 

15 8 either what woman have ten piec of silver if she lose one 
piec doth not light a candl and sweep the hou and seek 
dilig till she find it 15 9 and when she hath found it she 
calleth her friend and her neighbour togeth say rejoic with 
me for i have found the piec which i had lost 

15 10 likewi i say unto you there is joy in the presenc of the 
angel of god over one sinner that repenteth 

15 11 and he said a certain man had two son 15 12 and the younger 
of them said to hi father father give me the portion of good that 
falleth to me and he divid unto them hi live 

15 13 and not mani day after the younger son gather all togeth 
and took hi journey into a far countri and there wast hi 
substanc with riotou live 

15 14 and when he had spent all there aro a mighti famin in that 
land and he began to be in want 

15 15 and he went and join himself to a citizen of that countri and 
he sent him into hi field to feed swine 

15 16 and he would fain have fill hi belli with the husk that the 
swine did eat and no man gave unto him 

15 17 and when he came to himself he said how mani hire servant of 
my father s have bread enough and to spare and i perish with hunger 
15 18 i will ari and go to my father and will say unto him father 
i have sin against heaven and befor thee 15 19 and am no more 
worthi to be call thi son make me a one of thi hire servant 

15 20 and he aro and came to hi father but when he wa yet a 
great way off hi father saw him and had compass and ran and 
fell on hi neck and kiss him 

15 21 and the son said unto him father i have sin against heaven 
and in thi sight and am no more worthi to be call thi son 

15 22 but the father said to hi servant bring forth the best robe 
and put it on him and put a ring on hi hand and shoe on hi foot 
15 23 and bring hither the fat calf and kill it and let u eat 
and be merri 15 24 for thi my son wa dead and is aliv again he 
wa lost and is found and they began to be merri 

15 25 now hi elder son wa in the field and a he came and drew nigh 
to the hou he heard musick and danc 

15 26 and he call one of the servant and ask what these thing 
meant 

15 27 and he said unto him thi brother is come and thi father hath 
kill the fat calf becau he hath receiv him safe and sound 

15 28 and he wa angri and would not go in therefor came hi father 
out and intreat him 

15 29 and he answer said to hi father lo these mani year do i 
serv thee neither transgress i at ani time thi command and 
yet thou never gavest me a kid that i might make merri with my 
friend 15 30 but a soon a thi thi son wa come which hath 
devour thi live with harlot thou hast kill for him the fat 
calf 

15 31 and he said unto him son thou art ever with me and all that i 
have is thine 

15 32 it wa meet that we should make merri and be glad for thi thi 
brother wa dead and is aliv again and wa lost and is found 

16 1 and he said also unto hi discipl there wa a certain rich 
man which had a steward and the same wa accu unto him that he 
had wast hi good 

16 2 and he call him and said unto him how is it that i hear thi 
of thee give an account of thi stewardship for thou mayest be no 
longer steward 

16 3 then the steward said within himself what shall i do for my 
lord taketh away from me the stewardship i cannot dig to beg i am 
asham 

16 4 i am resolv what to do that when i am put out of the 
stewardship they may receiv me into their hou 

16 5 so he call everi one of hi lord s debtor unto him and said 
unto the first how much owest thou unto my lord 16 6 and he said 
an hundr measur of oil and he said unto him take thi bill and 
sit down quickli and write fifti 

16 7 then said he to anoth and how much owest thou and he said an 
hundr measur of wheat and he said unto him take thi bill and 
write fourscor 

16 8 and the lord commend the unjust steward becau he had done 
wise for the child of thi world are in their gener wiser 
than the child of light 

16 9 and i say unto you make to yourselv friend of the mammon of 
unright that when ye fail they may receiv you into 
everlast habit 

16 10 he that is faith in that which is least is faith also in 
much and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much 

16 11 if therefor ye have not been faith in the unright 
mammon who will commit to your trust the true rich 16 12 and if 
ye have not been faith in that which is anoth man s who shall 
give you that which is your own 16 13 no servant can serv two 
master for either he will hate the one and love the other or el 
he will hold to the one and despi the other ye cannot serv god 
and mammon 

16 14 and the pharis also who were covet heard all these 
thing and they derid him 

16 15 and he said unto them ye are they which justifi yourselv 
befor men but god knoweth your heart for that which is highli 
esteem among men is abomin in the sight of god 

16 16 the law and the prophet were until john sinc that time the 
kingdom of god is preach and everi man presseth into it 

16 17 and it is easier for heaven and earth to pa than one tittl 
of the law to fail 

16 18 whosoev putteth away hi wife and marrieth anoth 
committeth adulteri and whosoev marrieth her that is put away from 
her husband committeth adulteri 

16 19 there wa a certain rich man which wa cloth in purpl and 
fine linen and fare sumptuou everi day 16 20 and there wa a 
certain beggar name lazaru which wa laid at hi gate full of 
sore 16 21 and desir to be fed with the crumb which fell from 
the rich man s tabl moreov the dog came and lick hi sore 

16 22 and it came to pa that the beggar die and wa carri by 
the angel into abraham s bosom the rich man also die and wa 
buri 16 23 and in hell he lift up hi eye be in torment and 
seeth abraham afar off and lazaru in hi bosom 

16 24 and he cri and said father abraham have merci on me and 
send lazaru that he may dip the tip of hi finger in water and cool 
my tongu for i am torment in thi flame 

16 25 but abraham said son rememb that thou in thi lifetim 
receivedst thi good thing and likewi lazaru evil thing but now 
he is comfort and thou art torment 

16 26 and besid all thi between u and you there is a great gulf 
fix so that they which would pa from henc to you cannot neither 
can they pa to u that would come from thenc 

16 27 then he said i pray thee therefor father that thou wouldest 
send him to my father s hou 16 28 for i have five brother that he 
may testifi unto them lest they also come into thi place of torment 

16 29 abraham saith unto him they have mose and the prophet let 
them hear them 

16 30 and he said nay father abraham but if one went unto them from 
the dead they will repent 

16 31 and he said unto him if they hear not mose and the prophet 
neither will they be persuad though one rose from the dead 

17 1 then said he unto the discipl it is imposs but that 
offenc will come but woe unto him through whom they come 17 2 it 
were better for him that a millston were hang about hi neck and 
he cast into the sea than that he should offend one of these littl 
one 

17 3 take heed to yourselv if thi brother trespass against thee 
rebuk him and if he repent forgiv him 

17 4 and if he trespass against thee seven time in a day and seven 
time in a day turn again to thee say i repent thou shalt 
forgiv him 

17 5 and the apostl said unto the lord increa our faith 

17 6 and the lord said if ye had faith a a grain of mustard seed ye 
might say unto thi sycamin tree be thou pluck up by the root and 
be thou plant in the sea and it should obey you 

17 7 but which of you have a servant plow or feed cattl 
will say unto him by and by when he is come from the field go and 
sit down to meat 17 8 and will not rather say unto him make readi 
wherewith i may sup and gird thyself and serv me till i have eaten 
and drunken and afterward thou shalt eat and drink 17 9 doth he 
thank that servant becau he did the thing that were command him 
i trow not 

17 10 so likewi ye when ye shall have done all those thing which 
are command you say we are unprofit servant we have done 
that which wa our duti to do 

17 11 and it came to pa a he went to jerusalem that he pa 
through the midst of samaria and galil 

17 12 and a he enter into a certain villag there met him ten men 
that were leper which stood afar off 17 13 and they lift up their 
voic and said jesu master have merci on u 

17 14 and when he saw them he said unto them go shew yourselv unto 
the priest and it came to pa that a they went they were 
clean 

17 15 and one of them when he saw that he wa heal turn back 
and with a loud voic glorifi god 17 16 and fell down on hi face 
at hi foot give him thank and he wa a samaritan 

17 17 and jesu answer said were there not ten clean but where 
are the nine 17 18 there are not found that return to give glori 
to god save thi stranger 

17 19 and he said unto him ari go thi way thi faith hath made 
thee whole 

17 20 and when he wa demand of the pharis when the kingdom of 
god should come he answer them and said the kingdom of god cometh 
not with observ 17 21 neither shall they say lo here or lo 
there for behold the kingdom of god is within you 

17 22 and he said unto the discipl the day will come when ye 
shall desir to see one of the day of the son of man and ye shall 
not see it 

17 23 and they shall say to you see here or see there go not after 
them nor follow them 

17 24 for a the lightn that lighteneth out of the one part under 
heaven shineth unto the other part under heaven so shall also the 
son of man be in hi day 

17 25 but first must he suffer mani thing and be reject of thi 
gener 

17 26 and a it wa in the day of noe so shall it be also in the 
day of the son of man 

17 27 they did eat they drank they marri wife they were given in 
marriag until the day that noe enter into the ark and the flood 
came and destroy them all 

17 28 likewi also a it wa in the day of lot they did eat they 
drank they bought they sold they plant they build 17 29 but 
the same day that lot went out of sodom it rain fire and brimston 
from heaven and destroy them all 

17 30 even thu shall it be in the day when the son of man is 
reveal 

17 31 in that day he which shall be upon the housetop and hi stuff 
in the hou let him not come down to take it away and he that is in 
the field let him likewi not return back 

17 32 rememb lot s wife 

17 33 whosoev shall seek to save hi life shall lose it and 
whosoev shall lose hi life shall preserv it 

17 34 i tell you in that night there shall be two men in one bed the 
one shall be taken and the other shall be left 

17 35 two woman shall be grind togeth the one shall be taken 
and the other left 

17 36 two men shall be in the field the one shall be taken and the 
other left 

17 37 and they answer and said unto him where lord and he said 
unto them wheresoev the bodi is thither will the eagl be 
gather togeth 

18 1 and he spake a parabl unto them to thi end that men ought 
alway to pray and not to faint 18 2 say there wa in a citi a 
judg which fear not god neither regard man 18 3 and there wa 
a widow in that citi and she came unto him say aveng me of mine 
adversari 

18 4 and he would not for a while but afterward he said within 
himself though i fear not god nor regard man 18 5 yet becau thi 
widow troubleth me i will aveng her lest by her continu come 
she weari me 

18 6 and the lord said hear what the unjust judg saith 

18 7 and shall not god aveng hi own elect which cri day and night 
unto him though he bear long with them 18 8 i tell you that he will 
aveng them speedili nevertheless when the son of man cometh shall 
he find faith on the earth 18 9 and he spake thi parabl unto 
certain which trust in themselv that they were righteou and 
despi other 18 10 two men went up into the templ to pray the 
one a pharis and the other a publican 

18 11 the pharis stood and pray thu with himself god i thank 
thee that i am not a other men are extort unjust 
adult or even a thi publican 

18 12 i fast twice in the week i give tith of all that i po 

18 13 and the publican stand afar off would not lift up so much 
a hi eye unto heaven but smote upon hi breast say god be 
merci to me a sinner 

18 14 i tell you thi man went down to hi hou justifi rather 
than the other for everi one that exalteth himself shall be aba 
and he that humbleth himself shall be exalt 

18 15 and they brought unto him also infant that he would touch 
them but when hi discipl saw it they rebuk them 

18 16 but jesu call them unto him and said suffer littl child 
to come unto me and forbid them not for of such is the kingdom of 
god 

18 17 verili i say unto you whosoev shall not receiv the kingdom 
of god a a littl child shall in no wise enter therein 

18 18 and a certain ruler ask him say good master what shall i 
do to inherit etern life 18 19 and jesu said unto him whi 
callest thou me good none is good save one that is god 

18 20 thou knowest the command do not commit adulteri do not 
kill do not steal do not bear fal wit honour thi father and 
thi mother 

18 21 and he said all these have i kept from my youth up 

18 22 now when jesu heard these thing he said unto him yet lackest 
thou one thing sell all that thou hast and distribut unto the poor 
and thou shalt have treasur in heaven and come follow me 

18 23 and when he heard thi he wa veri sorrow for he wa veri 
rich 

18 24 and when jesu saw that he wa veri sorrow he said how 
hardli shall they that have rich enter into the kingdom of god 
18 25 for it is easier for a camel to go through a needl s eye than 
for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of god 

18 26 and they that heard it said who then can be save 18 27 and 
he said the thing which are imposs with men are possibl with 
god 

18 28 then peter said lo we have left all and follow thee 

18 29 and he said unto them verili i say unto you there is no man 
that hath left hou or parent or brother or wife or child 
for the kingdom of god s sake 18 30 who shall not receiv manifold 
more in thi present time and in the world to come life everlast 

18 31 then he took unto him the twelv and said unto them behold we 
go up to jerusalem and all thing that are written by the prophet 
concern the son of man shall be accomplish 

18 32 for he shall be deliv unto the gentil and shall be 
mock and spite entreat and spit on 18 33 and they shall 
scourg him and put him to death and the third day he shall rise 
again 

18 34 and they understood none of these thing and thi say wa 
hid from them neither knew they the thing which were spoken 

18 35 and it came to pa that a he wa come nigh unto jericho a 
certain blind man sat by the way side beg 18 36 and hear the 
multitud pa by he ask what it meant 

18 37 and they told him that jesu of nazareth passeth by 

18 38 and he cri say jesu thou son of david have merci on 
me 

18 39 and they which went befor rebuk him that he should hold hi 
peac but he cri so much the more thou son of david have merci on 
me 

18 40 and jesu stood and command him to be brought unto him and 
when he wa come near he ask him 18 41 say what wilt thou that 
i shall do unto thee and he said lord that i may receiv my sight 

18 42 and jesu said unto him receiv thi sight thi faith hath save 
thee 

18 43 and immedi he receiv hi sight and follow him 
glorifi god and all the peopl when they saw it gave prai unto 
god 

19 1 and jesu enter and pa through jericho 

19 2 and behold there wa a man name zacchaeu which wa the chief 
among the publican and he wa rich 

19 3 and he sought to see jesu who he wa and could not for the 
press becau he wa littl of statur 

19 4 and he ran befor and climb up into a sycomor tree to see 
him for he wa to pa that way 

19 5 and when jesu came to the place he look up and saw him and 
said unto him zacchaeu make hast and come down for to day i must 
abid at thi hou 

19 6 and he made hast and came down and receiv him joy 

19 7 and when they saw it they all murmur say that he wa gone 
to be guest with a man that is a sinner 

19 8 and zacchaeu stood and said unto the lord behold lord the 
half of my good i give to the poor and if i have taken ani thing 
from ani man by fal accu i restor him fourfold 

19 9 and jesu said unto him thi day is salvat come to thi 
hou forsomuch a he also is a son of abraham 

19 10 for the son of man is come to seek and to save that which wa 
lost 

19 11 and a they heard these thing he ad and spake a parabl 
becau he wa nigh to jerusalem and becau they thought that the 
kingdom of god should immedi appear 

19 12 he said therefor a certain nobleman went into a far countri to 
receiv for himself a kingdom and to return 

19 13 and he call hi ten servant and deliv them ten pound 
and said unto them occupi till i come 

19 14 but hi citizen hate him and sent a messag after him 
say we will not have thi man to reign over u 

19 15 and it came to pa that when he wa return have receiv 
the kingdom then he command these servant to be call unto him 
to whom he had given the money that he might know how much everi man 
had gain by trade 

19 16 then came the first say lord thi pound hath gain ten 
pound 

19 17 and he said unto him well thou good servant becau thou hast 
been faith in a veri littl have thou author over ten citi 

19 18 and the second came say lord thi pound hath gain five 
pound 

19 19 and he said likewi to him be thou also over five citi 

19 20 and anoth came say lord behold here is thi pound which 
i have kept laid up in a napkin 19 21 for i fear thee becau thou 
art an auster man thou takest up that thou layedst not down and 
reapest that thou didst not sow 

19 22 and he saith unto him out of thine own mouth will i judg thee 
thou wick servant thou knewest that i wa an auster man take up 
that i laid not down and reap that i did not sow 19 23 wherefor 
then gavest not thou my money into the bank that at my come i might 
have requir mine own with usuri 19 24 and he said unto them that 
stood by take from him the pound and give it to him that hath ten 
pound 

19 25 and they said unto him lord he hath ten pound 19 26 for i 
say unto you that unto everi one which hath shall be given and from 
him that hath not even that he hath shall be taken away from him 

19 27 but those mine enemi which would not that i should reign over 
them bring hither and slay them befor me 

19 28 and when he had thu spoken he went befor ascend up to 
jerusalem 

19 29 and it came to pa when he wa come nigh to bethphag and 
bethani at the mount call the mount of oliv he sent two of hi 
discipl 19 30 say go ye into the villag over against you in 
the which at your enter ye shall find a colt tie whereon yet 
never man sat loo him and bring him hither 

19 31 and if ani man ask you whi do ye loo him thu shall ye say 
unto him becau the lord hath need of him 

19 32 and they that were sent went their way and found even a he had 
said unto them 

19 33 and a they were loo the colt the owner thereof said unto 
them whi loo ye the colt 19 34 and they said the lord hath need 
of him 

19 35 and they brought him to jesu and they cast their garment upon 
the colt and they set jesu thereon 

19 36 and a he went they spread their cloth in the way 

19 37 and when he wa come nigh even now at the descent of the mount 
of oliv the whole multitud of the discipl began to rejoic and 
prai god with a loud voic for all the mighti work that they had 
seen 19 38 say bless be the king that cometh in the name of the 
lord peac in heaven and glori in the highest 

19 39 and some of the pharis from among the multitud said unto 
him master rebuk thi discipl 

19 40 and he answer and said unto them i tell you that if these 
should hold their peac the stone would immedi cri out 

19 41 and when he wa come near he beheld the citi and wept over it 
19 42 say if thou hadst known even thou at least in thi thi 
day the thing which belong unto thi peac but now they are hid from 
thine eye 

19 43 for the day shall come upon thee that thine enemi shall cast 
a trench about thee and compass thee round and keep thee in on everi 
side 19 44 and shall lay thee even with the ground and thi child 
within thee and they shall not leav in thee one stone upon anoth 
becau thou knewest not the time of thi visit 

19 45 and he went into the templ and began to cast out them that 
sold therein and them that bought 19 46 say unto them it is 
written my hou is the hou of prayer but ye have made it a den of 
thief 

19 47 and he taught daili in the templ but the chief priest and the 
scribe and the chief of the peopl sought to destroy him 19 48 and 
could not find what they might do for all the peopl were veri 
attent to hear him 

20 1 and it came to pa that on one of those day a he taught the 
peopl in the templ and preach the gospel the chief priest and 
the scribe came upon him with the elder 20 2 and spake unto him 
say tell u by what author doest thou these thing or who is 
he that gave thee thi author 20 3 and he answer and said unto 
them i will also ask you one thing and answer me 20 4 the baptism 
of john wa it from heaven or of men 20 5 and they reason with 
themselv say if we shall say from heaven he will say whi 
then believ ye him not 20 6 but and if we say of men all the 
peopl will stone u for they be persuad that john wa a prophet 

20 7 and they answer that they could not tell whenc it wa 

20 8 and jesu said unto them neither tell i you by what author i 
do these thing 

20 9 then began he to speak to the peopl thi parabl a certain man 
plant a vineyard and let it forth to husbandman and went into a 
far countri for a long time 

20 10 and at the season he sent a servant to the husbandman that they 
should give him of the fruit of the vineyard but the husbandman beat 
him and sent him away empti 

20 11 and again he sent anoth servant and they beat him also and 
entreat him shame and sent him away empti 

20 12 and again he sent a third and they wound him also and cast 
him out 

20 13 then said the lord of the vineyard what shall i do i will send 
my belov son it may be they will rever him when they see him 

20 14 but when the husbandman saw him they reason among themselv 
say thi is the heir come let u kill him that the inherit 
may be our 

20 15 so they cast him out of the vineyard and kill him what 
therefor shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them 20 16 he shall 
come and destroy these husbandman and shall give the vineyard to 
other and when they heard it they said god forbid 

20 17 and he beheld them and said what is thi then that is written 
the stone which the builder reject the same is becom the head of 
the corner 20 18 whosoev shall fall upon that stone shall be 
broken but on whomsoev it shall fall it will grind him to powder 

20 19 and the chief priest and the scribe the same hour sought to 
lay hand on him and they fear the peopl for they perceiv that 
he had spoken thi parabl against them 

20 20 and they watch him and sent forth spi which should feign 
themselv just men that they might take hold of hi word that so 
they might deliv him unto the power and author of the governor 

20 21 and they ask him say master we know that thou sayest and 
teachest rightli neither acceptest thou the person of ani but 
teachest the way of god truli 20 22 is it law for u to give 
tribut unto caesar or no 20 23 but he perceiv their crafti 
and said unto them whi tempt ye me 20 24 shew me a penni whose 
imag and superscript hath it they answer and said caesar s 

20 25 and he said unto them render therefor unto caesar the thing 
which be caesar s and unto god the thing which be god s 

20 26 and they could not take hold of hi word befor the peopl and 
they marvel at hi answer and held their peac 

20 27 then came to him certain of the sadduc which deni that there 
is ani resurrect and they ask him 20 28 say master mose 
wrote unto u if ani man s brother die have a wife and he die 
without child that hi brother should take hi wife and rai up 
seed unto hi brother 

20 29 there were therefor seven brother and the first took a wife 
and die without child 

20 30 and the second took her to wife and he die childless 

20 31 and the third took her and in like manner the seven also and 
they left no child and die 

20 32 last of all the woman die also 

20 33 therefor in the resurrect whose wife of them is she for 
seven had her to wife 

20 34 and jesu answer said unto them the child of thi world 
marri and are given in marriag 20 35 but they which shall be 
account worthi to obtain that world and the resurrect from the 
dead neither marri nor are given in marriag 20 36 neither can they 
die ani more for they are equal unto the angel and are the child 
of god be the child of the resurrect 

20 37 now that the dead are rai even mose shew at the bush 
when he calleth the lord the god of abraham and the god of isaac and 
the god of jacob 

20 38 for he is not a god of the dead but of the live for all live 
unto him 

20 39 then certain of the scribe answer said master thou hast 
well said 

20 40 and after that they durst not ask him ani question at all 

20 41 and he said unto them how say they that christ is david s son 
20 42 and david himself saith in the book of psalm the lord said 
unto my lord sit thou on my right hand 20 43 till i make thine 
enemi thi footstool 

20 44 david therefor calleth him lord how is he then hi son 20 45 
then in the audienc of all the peopl he said unto hi discipl 
20 46 bewar of the scribe which desir to walk in long robe and 
love greet in the market and the highest seat in the 
synagogu and the chief room at feast 20 47 which devour widow 
hou and for a shew make long prayer the same shall receiv 
greater damnat 

21 1 and he look up and saw the rich men cast their gift into 
the treasuri 

21 2 and he saw also a certain poor widow cast in thither two 
mite 

21 3 and he said of a truth i say unto you that thi poor widow hath 
cast in more than they all 21 4 for all these have of their abund 
cast in unto the offer of god but she of her penuri hath cast in 
all the live that she had 

21 5 and a some spake of the templ how it wa adorn with goodli 
stone and gift he said 21 6 a for these thing which ye behold 
the day will come in the which there shall not be left one stone 
upon anoth that shall not be thrown down 

21 7 and they ask him say master but when shall these thing 
be and what sign will there be when these thing shall come to pa 
21 8 and he said take heed that ye be not deceiv for mani shall 
come in my name say i am christ and the time draweth near go ye 
not therefor after them 

21 9 but when ye shall hear of war and commot be not terrifi 
for these thing must first come to pa but the end is not by and 
by 

21 10 then said he unto them nation shall rise against nation and 
kingdom against kingdom 21 11 and great earthquak shall be in 
diver place and famin and pestil and fear sight and 
great sign shall there be from heaven 

21 12 but befor all these they shall lay their hand on you and 
persecut you deliv you up to the synagogu and into prison 
be brought befor king and ruler for my name s sake 

21 13 and it shall turn to you for a testimoni 

21 14 settl it therefor in your heart not to medit befor what 
ye shall answer 21 15 for i will give you a mouth and wisdom which 
all your adversari shall not be abl to gainsay nor resist 

21 16 and ye shall be betray both by parent and brother and 
kinsfolk and friend and some of you shall they cau to be put to 
death 

21 17 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name s sake 

21 18 but there shall not an hair of your head perish 

21 19 in your patienc po ye your soul 

21 20 and when ye shall see jerusalem compass with armi then know 
that the desol thereof is nigh 

21 21 then let them which are in judaea flee to the mountain and let 
them which are in the midst of it depart out and let not them that 
are in the countri enter thereinto 

21 22 for these be the day of vengeanc that all thing which are 
written may be fulfil 

21 23 but woe unto them that are with child and to them that give 
suck in those day for there shall be great distress in the land 
and wrath upon thi peopl 

21 24 and they shall fall by the edg of the sword and shall be led 
away captiv into all nation and jerusalem shall be trodden down of 
the gentil until the time of the gentil be fulfil 

21 25 and there shall be sign in the sun and in the moon and in the 
star and upon the earth distress of nation with perplex the 
sea and the wave roar 21 26 men s heart fail them for fear 
and for look after those thing which are come on the earth for 
the power of heaven shall be shaken 

21 27 and then shall they see the son of man come in a cloud with 
power and great glori 

21 28 and when these thing begin to come to pa then look up and 
lift up your head for your redempt draweth nigh 

21 29 and he spake to them a parabl behold the fig tree and all the 
tree 21 30 when they now shoot forth ye see and know of your own 
self that summer is now nigh at hand 

21 31 so likewi ye when ye see these thing come to pa know ye 
that the kingdom of god is nigh at hand 

21 32 verili i say unto you thi gener shall not pa away till 
all be fulfil 

21 33 heaven and earth shall pa away but my word shall not pa 
away 

21 34 and take heed to yourselv lest at ani time your heart be 
overcharg with surfeit and drunken and care of thi life 
and so that day come upon you unawar 

21 35 for a a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face 
of the whole earth 

21 36 watch ye therefor and pray alway that ye may be account 
worthi to escap all these thing that shall come to pa and to 
stand befor the son of man 

21 37 and in the day time he wa teach in the templ and at night 
he went out and abod in the mount that is call the mount of 
oliv 

21 38 and all the peopl came earli in the morn to him in the 
templ for to hear him 

22 1 now the feast of unleaven bread drew nigh which is call the 
passov 

22 2 and the chief priest and scribe sought how they might kill him 
for they fear the peopl 

22 3 then enter satan into juda surnam iscariot be of the 
number of the twelv 

22 4 and he went hi way and commun with the chief priest and 
captain how he might betray him unto them 

22 5 and they were glad and coven to give him money 

22 6 and he promi and sought opportun to betray him unto them 
in the absenc of the multitud 

22 7 then came the day of unleaven bread when the passov must be 
kill 

22 8 and he sent peter and john say go and prepar u the 
passov that we may eat 

22 9 and they said unto him where wilt thou that we prepar 22 10 
and he said unto them behold when ye are enter into the citi 
there shall a man meet you bear a pitcher of water follow him 
into the hou where he entereth in 

22 11 and ye shall say unto the goodman of the hou the master saith 
unto thee where is the guestchamb where i shall eat the passov 
with my discipl 22 12 and he shall shew you a larg upper room 
furnish there make readi
