galil after the baptism which john preach 10 38 how god anoint 
jesu of nazareth with the holi ghost and with power who went about 
do good and heal all that were oppress of the devil for god 
wa with him 

10 39 and we are wit of all thing which he did both in the land 
of the jew and in jerusalem whom they slew and hang on a tree 
10 40 him god rai up the third day and shew him openli 10 41 
not to all the peopl but unto wit chosen befor god even to 
u who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead 

10 42 and he command u to preach unto the peopl and to testifi 
that it is he which wa ordain of god to be the judg of quick and 
dead 

10 43 to him give all the prophet wit that through hi name 
whosoev believeth in him shall receiv remiss of sin 

10 44 while peter yet spake these word the holi ghost fell on all 
them which heard the word 

10 45 and they of the circumci which believ were astonish a 
mani a came with peter becau that on the gentil also wa pour 
out the gift of the holi ghost 

10 46 for they heard them speak with tongu and magnifi god then 
answer peter 10 47 can ani man forbid water that these should not 
be baptiz which have receiv the holi ghost a well a we 10 48 
and he command them to be baptiz in the name of the lord then 
pray they him to tarri certain day 

11 1 and the apostl and brother that were in judaea heard that the 
gentil had also receiv the word of god 

11 2 and when peter wa come up to jerusalem they that were of the 
circumci contend with him 11 3 say thou wentest in to men 
uncircumci and didst eat with them 

11 4 but peter rehear the matter from the begin and expound 
it by order unto them say 11 5 i wa in the citi of joppa 
pray and in a tranc i saw a vision a certain vessel descend a 
it had been a great sheet let down from heaven by four corner and 
it came even to me 11 6 upon the which when i had fasten mine eye 
i consid and saw fourfoot beast of the earth and wild beast 
and creep thing and fowl of the air 

11 7 and i heard a voic say unto me ari peter slay and eat 

11 8 but i said not so lord for noth common or unclean hath at 
ani time enter into my mouth 

11 9 but the voic answer me again from heaven what god hath 
clean that call not thou common 

11 10 and thi wa done three time and all were drawn up again into 
heaven 

11 11 and behold immedi there were three men alreadi come unto 
the hou where i wa sent from caesarea unto me 

11 12 and the spirit bade me go with them noth doubt moreov 
these six brother accompani me and we enter into the man s 
hou 11 13 and he shew u how he had seen an angel in hi hou 
which stood and said unto him send men to joppa and call for simon 
whose surnam is peter 11 14 who shall tell thee word wherebi thou 
and all thi hou shall be save 

11 15 and a i began to speak the holi ghost fell on them a on u 
at the begin 

11 16 then rememb i the word of the lord how that he said john 
ind baptiz with water but ye shall be baptiz with the holi 
ghost 

11 17 forasmuch then a god gave them the like gift a he did unto u 
who believ on the lord jesu christ what wa i that i could 
withstand god 11 18 when they heard these thing they held their 
peac and glorifi god say then hath god also to the gentil 
grant repent unto life 

11 19 now they which were scatter abroad upon the persecut that 
aro about stephen travel a far a phenic and cypru and 
antioch preach the word to none but unto the jew onli 

11 20 and some of them were men of cypru and cyren which when they 
were come to antioch spake unto the grecian preach the lord 
jesu 

11 21 and the hand of the lord wa with them and a great number 
believ and turn unto the lord 

11 22 then tide of these thing came unto the ear of the church 
which wa in jerusalem and they sent forth barnaba that he should 
go a far a antioch 

11 23 who when he came and had seen the grace of god wa glad and 
exhort them all that with purpo of heart they would cleav unto 
the lord 

11 24 for he wa a good man and full of the holi ghost and of faith 
and much peopl wa ad unto the lord 

11 25 then depart barnaba to tarsu for to seek saul 11 26 and 
when he had found him he brought him unto antioch and it came to 
pa that a whole year they assembl themselv with the church and 
taught much peopl and the discipl were call christian first in 
antioch 

11 27 and in these day came prophet from jerusalem unto antioch 

11 28 and there stood up one of them name agabu and signifi by 
the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world 
which came to pa in the day of claudiu caesar 

11 29 then the discipl everi man accord to hi abil 
determin to send relief unto the brother which dwelt in judaea 
11 30 which also they did and sent it to the elder by the hand of 
barnaba and saul 

12 1 now about that time herod the king stretch forth hi hand to 
vex certain of the church 

12 2 and he kill jame the brother of john with the sword 

12 3 and becau he saw it plea the jew he proceed further to 
take peter also then were the day of unleaven bread 12 4 and 
when he had apprehend him he put him in prison and deliv him 
to four quaternion of soldier to keep him intend after easter to 
bring him forth to the peopl 

12 5 peter therefor wa kept in prison but prayer wa made without 
cea of the church unto god for him 

12 6 and when herod would have brought him forth the same night peter 
wa sleep between two soldier bound with two chain and the 
keeper befor the door kept the prison 

12 7 and behold the angel of the lord came upon him and a light 
shine in the prison and he smote peter on the side and rai him 
up say ari up quickli and hi chain fell off from hi hand 

12 8 and the angel said unto him gird thyself and bind on thi 
sandal 

and so he did and he saith unto him cast thi garment about thee and 
follow me 

12 9 and he went out and follow him and wist not that it wa true 
which wa done by the angel but thought he saw a vision 

12 10 when they were past the first and the second ward they came 
unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the citi which open to them of 
hi own accord and they went out and pa on through one street 
and forthwith the angel depart from him 

12 11 and when peter wa come to himself he said now i know of a 
sureti that the lord hath sent hi angel and hath deliv me out 
of the hand of herod and from all the expect of the peopl of 
the jew 

12 12 and when he had consid the thing he came to the hou of 
mari the mother of john whose surnam wa mark where mani were 
gather togeth pray 

12 13 and a peter knock at the door of the gate a damsel came to 
hearken name rhoda 

12 14 and when she knew peter s voic she open not the gate for 
glad but ran in and told how peter stood befor the gate 

12 15 and they said unto her thou art mad but she constantli 
affirm that it wa even so then said they it is hi angel 

12 16 but peter continu knock and when they had open the door 
and saw him they were astonish 

12 17 but he beckon unto them with the hand to hold their peac 
declar unto them how the lord had brought him out of the prison and 
he said go shew these thing unto jame and to the brother and he 
depart and went into anoth place 

12 18 now a soon a it wa day there wa no small stir among the 
soldier what wa becom of peter 

12 19 and when herod had sought for him and found him not he 
examin the keeper and command that they should be put to death 
and he went down from judaea to caesarea and there abod 

12 20 and herod wa highli displea with them of tyre and sidon but 
they came with one accord to him and have made blastu the king s 
chamberlain their friend desir peac becau their countri wa 
nourish by the king s countri 

12 21 and upon a set day herod array in royal apparel sat upon hi 
throne and made an orat unto them 

12 22 and the peopl gave a shout say it is the voic of a god 
and not of a man 

12 23 and immedi the angel of the lord smote him becau he gave 
not god the glori and he wa eaten of worm and gave up the ghost 

12 24 but the word of god grew and multipli 

12 25 and barnaba and saul return from jerusalem when they had 
fulfil their ministri and took with them john whose surnam wa 
mark 

13 1 now there were in the church that wa at antioch certain prophet 
and teacher a barnaba and simeon that wa call niger and 
luciu of cyren and manaen which had been brought up with herod the 
tetrarch and saul 

13 2 a they minist to the lord and fast the holi ghost said 
separ me barnaba and saul for the work whereunto i have call 
them 

13 3 and when they had fast and pray and laid their hand on 
them they sent them away 

13 4 so they be sent forth by the holi ghost depart unto 
seleucia and from thenc they sail to cypru 

13 5 and when they were at salami they preach the word of god in 
the synagogu of the jew and they had also john to their minist 

13 6 and when they had gone through the isl unto papho they found a 
certain sorcer a fal prophet a jew whose name wa barjesu 
13 7 which wa with the deputi of the countri sergiu paulu a 
prudent man who call for barnaba and saul and desir to hear the 
word of god 

13 8 but elyma the sorcer for so is hi name by interpret 
withstood them seek to turn away the deputi from the faith 

13 9 then saul who also is call paul fill with the holi ghost 
set hi eye on him 

13 10 and said o full of all subtilti and all mischief thou child of 
the devil thou enemi of all righteou wilt thou not cea to 
pervert the right way of the lord 13 11 and now behold the hand 
of the lord is upon thee and thou shalt be blind not see the sun 
for a season and immedi there fell on him a mist and a dark 
and he went about seek some to lead him by the hand 

13 12 then the deputi when he saw what wa done believ be 
astonish at the doctrin of the lord 

13 13 now when paul and hi compani loo from papho they came to 
perga in pamphylia and john depart from them return to 
jerusalem 

13 14 but when they depart from perga they came to antioch in 
pisidia and went into the synagogu on the sabbath day and sat down 

13 15 and after the read of the law and the prophet the ruler of 
the synagogu sent unto them say ye men and brother if ye have 
ani word of exhort for the peopl say on 

13 16 then paul stood up and beckon with hi hand said men of 
israel and ye that fear god give audienc 

13 17 the god of thi peopl of israel chose our father and exalt 
the peopl when they dwelt a stranger in the land of egypt and with 
an high arm brought he them out of it 

13 18 and about the time of forti year suffer he their manner in 
the wilder 

13 19 and when he had destroy seven nation in the land of chanaan 
he divid their land to them by lot 

13 20 and after that he gave unto them judg about the space of four 
hundr and fifti year until samuel the prophet 

13 21 and afterward they desir a king and god gave unto them saul 
the son of ci a man of the tribe of benjamin by the space of forti 
year 

13 22 and when he had remov him he rai up unto them david to be 
their king to whom also he gave their testimoni and said i have 
found david the son of jess a man after mine own heart which shall 
fulfil all my will 

13 23 of thi man s seed hath god accord to hi promi rai unto 
israel a saviour jesu 13 24 when john had first preach befor hi 
come the baptism of repent to all the peopl of israel 

13 25 and a john fulfil hi cour he said whom think ye that i 
am i am not he but behold there cometh one after me whose shoe 
of hi foot i am not worthi to loo 

13 26 men and brother child of the stock of abraham and 
whosoev among you feareth god to you is the word of thi salvat 
sent 

13 27 for they that dwell at jerusalem and their ruler becau they 
knew him not nor yet the voic of the prophet which are read everi 
sabbath day they have fulfil them in condemn him 

13 28 and though they found no cau of death in him yet desir they 
pilat that he should be slain 

13 29 and when they had fulfil all that wa written of him they 
took him down from the tree and laid him in a sepulchr 

13 30 but god rai him from the dead 13 31 and he wa seen mani 
day of them which came up with him from galil to jerusalem who are 
hi wit unto the peopl 

13 32 and we declar unto you glad tide how that the promi which 
wa made unto the father 13 33 god hath fulfil the same unto u 
their child in that he hath rai up jesu again a it is also 
written in the second psalm thou art my son thi day have i begotten 
thee 

13 34 and a concern that he rai him up from the dead now no 
more to return to corrupt he said on thi wise i will give you 
the sure merci of david 

13 35 wherefor he saith also in anoth psalm thou shalt not suffer 
thine holi one to see corrupt 

13 36 for david after he had serv hi own gener by the will of 
god fell on sleep and wa laid unto hi father and saw corrupt 
13 37 but he whom god rai again saw no corrupt 

13 38 be it known unto you therefor men and brother that through 
thi man is preach unto you the forgiv of sin 13 39 and by 
him all that believ are justifi from all thing from which ye 
could not be justifi by the law of mose 

13 40 bewar therefor lest that come upon you which is spoken of in 
the prophet 13 41 behold ye despi and wonder and perish for 
i work a work in your day a work which ye shall in no wise believ 
though a man declar it unto you 

13 42 and when the jew were gone out of the synagogu the gentil 
besought that these word might be preach to them the next sabbath 

13 43 now when the congreg wa broken up mani of the jew and 
religi proselyt follow paul and barnaba who speak to 
them persuad them to continu in the grace of god 

13 44 and the next sabbath day came almost the whole citi togeth to 
hear the word of god 

13 45 but when the jew saw the multitud they were fill with 
envi and spake against those thing which were spoken by paul 
contradict and blasphem 

13 46 then paul and barnaba wax bold and said it wa necessari 
that the word of god should first have been spoken to you but see 
ye put it from you and judg yourselv unworthi of everlast life 
lo we turn to the gentil 

13 47 for so hath the lord command u say i have set thee to be 
a light of the gentil that thou shouldest be for salvat unto the 
end of the earth 

13 48 and when the gentil heard thi they were glad and glorifi 
the word of the lord and a mani a were ordain to etern life 
believ 

13 49 and the word of the lord wa publish throughout all the 
region 

13 50 but the jew stir up the devout and honour woman and the 
chief men of the citi and rai persecut against paul and 
barnaba and expel them out of their coast 

13 51 but they shook off the dust of their foot against them and came 
unto iconium 

13 52 and the discipl were fill with joy and with the holi ghost 

14 1 and it came to pa in iconium that they went both togeth into 
the synagogu of the jew and so spake that a great multitud both 
of the jew and also of the greek believ 

14 2 but the unbeliev jew stir up the gentil and made their 
mind evil affect against the brother 

14 3 long time therefor abod they speak boldli in the lord which 
gave testimoni unto the word of hi grace and grant sign and 
wonder to be done by their hand 

14 4 but the multitud of the citi wa divid and part held with the 
jew and part with the apostl 

14 5 and when there wa an assault made both of the gentil and also 
of the jew with their ruler to use them despit and to stone 
them 14 6 they were ware of it and fled unto lystra and derb 
citi of lycaonia and unto the region that lieth round about 14 7 
and there they preach the gospel 

14 8 and there sat a certain man at lystra impot in hi foot 
be a crippl from hi mother s womb who never had walk 14 9 the 
same heard paul speak who stedfastli behold him and perceiv 
that he had faith to be heal 14 10 said with a loud voic stand 
upright on thi foot and he leap and walk 

14 11 and when the peopl saw what paul had done they lift up their 
voic say in the speech of lycaonia the god are come down to u 
in the like of men 

14 12 and they call barnaba jupit and paul mercuriu becau 
he wa the chief speaker 

14 13 then the priest of jupit which wa befor their citi brought 
ox and garland unto the gate and would have done sacrif with 
the peopl 

14 14 which when the apostl barnaba and paul heard of they rent 
their cloth and ran in among the peopl cri out 14 15 and 
say sir whi do ye these thing we also are men of like passion 
with you and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vaniti 
unto the live god which made heaven and earth and the sea and 
all thing that are therein 14 16 who in time past suffer all 
nation to walk in their own way 

14 17 nevertheless he left not himself without wit in that he did 
good and gave u rain from heaven and fruit season fill our 
heart with food and glad 

14 18 and with these say scarc restrain they the peopl that 
they had not done sacrif unto them 

14 19 and there came thither certain jew from antioch and iconium 
who persuad the peopl and have stone paul drew him out of the 
citi suppo he had been dead 

14 20 howbeit a the discipl stood round about him he rose up and 
came into the citi and the next day he depart with barnaba to 
derb 

14 21 and when they had preach the gospel to that citi and had 
taught mani they return again to lystra and to iconium and 
antioch 14 22 confirm the soul of the discipl and exhort 
them to continu in the faith and that we must through much 
tribul enter into the kingdom of god 

14 23 and when they had ordain them elder in everi church and had 
pray with fast they commend them to the lord on whom they 
believ 

14 24 and after they had pa throughout pisidia they came to 
pamphylia 

14 25 and when they had preach the word in perga they went down 
into attalia 14 26 and thenc sail to antioch from whenc they had 
been recommend to the grace of god for the work which they 
fulfil 

14 27 and when they were come and had gather the church togeth 
they rehear all that god had done with them and how he had open 
the door of faith unto the gentil 

14 28 and there they abod long time with the discipl 

15 1 and certain men which came down from judaea taught the brother 
and said except ye be circumci after the manner of mose ye 
cannot be save 

15 2 when therefor paul and barnaba had no small dissen and 
disput with them they determin that paul and barnaba and 
certain other of them should go up to jerusalem unto the apostl and 
elder about thi question 

15 3 and be brought on their way by the church they pa through 
phenic and samaria declar the conver of the gentil and 
they cau great joy unto all the brother 

15 4 and when they were come to jerusalem they were receiv of the 
church and of the apostl and elder and they declar all thing 
that god had done with them 

15 5 but there rose up certain of the sect of the pharis which 
believ say that it wa need to circumci them and to 
command them to keep the law of mose 

15 6 and the apostl and elder came togeth for to consid of thi 
matter 

15 7 and when there had been much disput peter rose up and said 
unto them men and brother ye know how that a good while ago god 
made choic among u that the gentil by my mouth should hear the 
word of the gospel and believ 

15 8 and god which knoweth the heart bare them wit give them 
the holi ghost even a he did unto u 15 9 and put no differ 
between u and them purifi their heart by faith 

15 10 now therefor whi tempt ye god to put a yoke upon the neck of 
the discipl which neither our father nor we were abl to bear 
15 11 but we believ that through the grace of the lord jesu christ 
we shall be save even a they 

15 12 then all the multitud kept silenc and gave audienc to 
barnaba and paul declar what miracl and wonder god had wrought 
among the gentil by them 

15 13 and after they had held their peac jame answer say men 
and brother hearken unto me 15 14 simeon hath declar how god at 
the first did visit the gentil to take out of them a peopl for hi 
name 

15 15 and to thi agr the word of the prophet a it is written 
15 16 after thi i will return and will build again the tabernacl of 
david which is fallen down and i will build again the ruin thereof 
and i will set it up 15 17 that the residu of men might seek after 
the lord and all the gentil upon whom my name is call saith the 
lord who doeth all these thing 

15 18 known unto god are all hi work from the begin of the 
world 

15 19 wherefor my sentenc is that we troubl not them which from 
among the gentil are turn to god 15 20 but that we write unto 
them that they abstain from pollut of idol and from 
fornic and from thing strangl and from blood 

15 21 for mose of old time hath in everi citi them that preach him 
be read in the synagogu everi sabbath day 

15 22 then plea it the apostl and elder with the whole church 
to send chosen men of their own compani to antioch with paul and 
barnaba name juda surnam barsaba and sila chief men among 
the brother 15 23 and they wrote letter by them after thi manner 
the apostl and elder and brother send greet unto the brother 
which are of the gentil in antioch and syria and cilicia 

15 24 forasmuch a we have heard that certain which went out from u 
have troubl you with word subvert your soul say ye must 
be circumci and keep the law to whom we gave no such command 
15 25 it seem good unto u be assembl with one accord to send 
chosen men unto you with our belov barnaba and paul 15 26 men that 
have hazard their life for the name of our lord jesu christ 

15 27 we have sent therefor juda and sila who shall also tell you 
the same thing by mouth 

15 28 for it seem good to the holi ghost and to u to lay upon you 
no greater burden than these necessari thing 15 29 that ye abstain 
from meat offer to idol and from blood and from thing 
strangl and from fornic from which if ye keep yourselv ye 
shall do well fare ye well 

15 30 so when they were dismiss they came to antioch and when they 
had gather the multitud togeth they deliv the epistl 15 31 
which when they had read they rejoic for the consol 

15 32 and juda and sila be prophet also themselv exhort 
the brother with mani word and confirm them 

15 33 and after they had tarri there a space they were let go in 
peac from the brother unto the apostl 

15 34 notwithstand it plea sila to abid there still 

15 35 paul also and barnaba continu in antioch teach and 
preach the word of the lord with mani other also 

15 36 and some day after paul said unto barnaba let u go again and 
visit our brother in everi citi where we have preach the word of 
the lord and see how they do 

15 37 and barnaba determin to take with them john whose surnam 
wa mark 

15 38 but paul thought not good to take him with them who depart 
from them from pamphylia and went not with them to the work 

15 39 and the content wa so sharp between them that they depart 
asund one from the other and so barnaba took mark and sail unto 
cypru 15 40 and paul chose sila and depart be recommend by 
the brother unto the grace of god 

15 41 and he went through syria and cilicia confirm the church 

16 1 then came he to derb and lystra and behold a certain discipl 
wa there name timotheu the son of a certain woman which wa a 
jewess and believ but hi father wa a greek 16 2 which wa well 
report of by the brother that were at lystra and iconium 

16 3 him would paul have to go forth with him and took and 
circumci him becau of the jew which were in those quarter for 
they knew all that hi father wa a greek 

16 4 and a they went through the citi they deliv them the 
decr for to keep that were ordain of the apostl and elder 
which were at jerusalem 

16 5 and so were the church establish in the faith and increa 
in number daili 

16 6 now when they had gone throughout phrygia and the region of 
galatia and were forbidden of the holi ghost to preach the word in 
asia 16 7 after they were come to mysia they assay to go into 
bithynia but the spirit suffer them not 

16 8 and they pa by mysia came down to troa 

16 9 and a vision appear to paul in the night there stood a man of 
macedonia and pray him say come over into macedonia and help 
u 

16 10 and after he had seen the vision immedi we endeavour to 
go into macedonia assuredli gather that the lord had call u for 
to preach the gospel unto them 

16 11 therefor loo from troa we came with a straight cour to 
samothracia and the next day to neapoli 16 12 and from thenc to 
philippi which is the chief citi of that part of macedonia and a 
coloni and we were in that citi abid certain day 

16 13 and on the sabbath we went out of the citi by a river side 
where prayer wa wont to be made and we sat down and spake unto the 
woman which resort thither 

16 14 and a certain woman name lydia a seller of purpl of the citi 
of thyatira which worship god heard u whose heart the lord 
open that she attend unto the thing which were spoken of paul 

16 15 and when she wa baptiz and her household she besought u 
say if ye have judg me to be faith to the lord come into my 
hou and abid there and she constrain u 

16 16 and it came to pa a we went to prayer a certain damsel 
poss with a spirit of divin met u which brought her 
master much gain by soothsay 16 17 the same follow paul and u 
and cri say these men are the servant of the most high god 
which shew unto u the way of salvat 

16 18 and thi did she mani day but paul be griev turn and 
said to the spirit i command thee in the name of jesu christ to come 
out of her 

and he came out the same hour 

16 19 and when her master saw that the hope of their gain wa gone 
they caught paul and sila and drew them into the marketplac unto 
the ruler 16 20 and brought them to the magistr say these 
men be jew do exceedingli troubl our citi 16 21 and teach 
custom which are not law for u to receiv neither to observ 
be roman 

16 22 and the multitud rose up togeth against them and the 
magistr rent off their cloth and command to beat them 

16 23 and when they had laid mani stripe upon them they cast them 
into prison charg the jailor to keep them safe 16 24 who 
have receiv such a charg thrust them into the inner prison and 
made their foot fast in the stock 

16 25 and at midnight paul and sila pray and sang prai unto 
god and the prison heard them 

16 26 and suddenli there wa a great earthquak so that the 
foundat of the prison were shaken and immedi all the door 
were open and everi one s band were loo 

16 27 and the keeper of the prison awak out of hi sleep and 
see the prison door open he drew out hi sword and would have 
kill himself suppo that the prison had been fled 

16 28 but paul cri with a loud voic say do thyself no harm 
for we are all here 

16 29 then he call for a light and sprang in and came trembl 
and fell down befor paul and sila 16 30 and brought them out and 
said sir what must i do to be save 16 31 and they said believ 
on the lord jesu christ and thou shalt be save and thi hou 

16 32 and they spake unto him the word of the lord and to all that 
were in hi hou 

16 33 and he took them the same hour of the night and wash their 
stripe and wa baptiz he and all hi straightway 

16 34 and when he had brought them into hi hou he set meat befor 
them and rejoic believ in god with all hi hou 

16 35 and when it wa day the magistr sent the serjeant say 
let those men go 

16 36 and the keeper of the prison told thi say to paul the 
magistr have sent to let you go now therefor depart and go in 
peac 

16 37 but paul said unto them they have beaten u openli uncondemn 
be roman and have cast u into prison and now do they thrust u 
out privili nay verili but let them come themselv and fetch u 
out 

16 38 and the serjeant told these word unto the magistr and 
they fear when they heard that they were roman 

16 39 and they came and besought them and brought them out and 
desir them to depart out of the citi 

16 40 and they went out of the prison and enter into the hou of 
lydia and when they had seen the brother they comfort them and 
depart 

17 1 now when they had pa through amphipoli and apollonia they 
came to thessalonica where wa a synagogu of the jew 17 2 and 
paul a hi manner wa went in unto them and three sabbath day 
reason with them out of the scriptur 17 3 open and alleg 
that christ must need have suffer and risen again from the dead 
and that thi jesu whom i preach unto you is christ 

17 4 and some of them believ and consort with paul and sila and 
of the devout greek a great multitud and of the chief woman not a 
few 

17 5 but the jew which believ not move with envi took unto them 
certain lewd fellow of the baser sort and gather a compani and 
set all the citi on an uproar and assault the hou of jason and 
sought to bring them out to the peopl 

17 6 and when they found them not they drew jason and certain 
brother unto the ruler of the citi cri these that have turn 
the world upsid down are come hither also 17 7 whom jason hath 
receiv and these all do contrari to the decr of caesar say 
that there is anoth king one jesu 

17 8 and they troubl the peopl and the ruler of the citi when 
they heard these thing 

17 9 and when they had taken secur of jason and of the other they 
let them go 

17 10 and the brother immedi sent away paul and sila by night 
unto berea who come thither went into the synagogu of the jew 

17 11 these were more nobl than those in thessalonica in that they 
receiv the word with all readi of mind and search the 
scriptur daili whether those thing were so 

17 12 therefor mani of them believ also of honour woman which 
were greek and of men not a few 

17 13 but when the jew of thessalonica had knowledg that the word of 
god wa preach of paul at berea they came thither also and stir 
up the peopl 

17 14 and then immedi the brother sent away paul to go a it 
were to the sea but sila and timotheu abod there still 

17 15 and they that conduct paul brought him unto athen and 
receiv a command unto sila and timotheu for to come to him 
with all speed they depart 

17 16 now while paul wait for them at athen hi spirit wa stir 
in him when he saw the citi wholli given to idolatri 

17 17 therefor disput he in the synagogu with the jew and with 
the devout person and in the market daili with them that met with 
him 

17 18 then certain philosoph of the epicurean and of the stoick 
encount him and some said what will thi babbler say other 
some he seemeth to be a setter forth of strang god becau he 
preach unto them jesu and the resurrect 

17 19 and they took him and brought him unto areopagu say may 
we know what thi new doctrin whereof thou speakest is 17 20 for 
thou bringest certain strang thing to our ear we would know 
therefor what these thing mean 

17 21 for all the athenian and stranger which were there spent 
their time in noth el but either to tell or to hear some new 
thing 17 22 then paul stood in the midst of mar hill and said 
ye men of athen i perceiv that in all thing ye are too 
superst 

17 23 for a i pa by and beheld your devot i found an altar 
with thi inscript to the unknown god whom therefor ye 
ignorantli worship him declar i unto you 

17 24 god that made the world and all thing therein see that he 
is lord of heaven and earth dwelleth not in templ made with hand 
17 25 neither is worship with men s hand a though he need ani 
thing see he giveth to all life and breath and all thing 17 26 
and hath made of one blood all nation of men for to dwell on all the 
face of the earth and hath determin the time befor appoint and 
the bound of their habit 17 27 that they should seek the lord 
if hapli they might feel after him and find him though he be not far 
from everi one of u 17 28 for in him we live and move and have our 
be a certain also of your own poet have said for we are also 
hi offspr 

17 29 forasmuch then a we are the offspr of god we ought not to 
think that the godhead is like unto gold or silver or stone graven 
by art and man s devic 

17 30 and the time of thi ignor god wink at but now 
commandeth all men everi where to repent 17 31 becau he hath 
appoint a day in the which he will judg the world in righteou 
by that man whom he hath ordain whereof he hath given assur 
unto all men in that he hath rai him from the dead 

17 32 and when they heard of the resurrect of the dead some 
mock and other said we will hear thee again of thi matter 

17 33 so paul depart from among them 

17 34 howbeit certain men clave unto him and believ among the 
which wa dionysiu the areopagit and a woman name damari and 
other with them 

18 1 after these thing paul depart from athen and came to 
corinth 18 2 and found a certain jew name aquila born in pontu 
late come from itali with hi wife priscilla becau that 
claudiu had command all jew to depart from rome and came unto 
them 

18 3 and becau he wa of the same craft he abod with them and 
wrought for by their occup they were tentmak 

18 4 and he reason in the synagogu everi sabbath and persuad the 
jew and the greek 

18 5 and when sila and timotheu were come from macedonia paul wa 
press in the spirit and testifi to the jew that jesu wa 
christ 

18 6 and when they oppo themselv and blasphem he shook hi 
raiment and said unto them your blood be upon your own head i am 
clean from henceforth i will go unto the gentil 

18 7 and he depart thenc and enter into a certain man s hou 
name justu one that worship god whose hou join hard to the 
synagogu 

18 8 and crispu the chief ruler of the synagogu believ on the 
lord with all hi hou and mani of the corinthian hear believ 
and were baptiz 

18 9 then spake the lord to paul in the night by a vision be not 
afraid but speak and hold not thi peac 18 10 for i am with thee 
and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee for i have much peopl in 
thi citi 

18 11 and he continu there a year and six month teach the word 
of god among them 

18 12 and when gallio wa the deputi of achaia the jew made 
insurrect with one accord against paul and brought him to the 
judgment seat 18 13 say thi fellow persuadeth men to worship god 
contrari to the law 

18 14 and when paul wa now about to open hi mouth gallio said unto 
the jew if it were a matter of wrong or wick lewd o ye jew 
reason would that i should bear with you 18 15 but if it be a 
question of word and name and of your law look ye to it for i 
will be no judg of such matter 

18 16 and he drave them from the judgment seat 

18 17 then all the greek took sosthen the chief ruler of the 
synagogu and beat him befor the judgment seat and gallio care for 
none of those thing 

18 18 and paul after thi tarri there yet a good while and then 
took hi leav of the brother and sail thenc into syria and with 
him priscilla and aquila have shorn hi head in cenchrea for he 
had a vow 

18 19 and he came to ephesu and left them there but he himself 
enter into the synagogu and reason with the jew 

18 20 when they desir him to tarri longer time with them he 
consent not 18 21 but bade them farewel say i must by all 
mean keep thi feast that cometh in jerusalem but i will return 
again unto you if god will and he sail from ephesu 

18 22 and when he had land at caesarea and gone up and salut the 
church he went down to antioch 

18 23 and after he had spent some time there he depart and went 
over all the countri of galatia and phrygia in order strengthen 
all the discipl 

18 24 and a certain jew name apollo born at alexandria an eloqu 
man and mighti in the scriptur came to ephesu 

18 25 thi man wa instruct in the way of the lord and be 
fervent in the spirit he spake and taught dilig the thing of 
the lord know onli the baptism of john 

18 26 and he began to speak boldli in the synagogu whom when aquila 
and priscilla had heard they took him unto them and expound unto 
him the way of god more perfectli 

18 27 and when he wa dispo to pa into achaia the brother 
wrote exhort the discipl to receiv him who when he wa come 
help them much which had believ through grace 18 28 for he 
mightili convinc the jew and that publickli shew by the 
scriptur that jesu wa christ 

19 1 and it came to pa that while apollo wa at corinth paul 
have pa through the upper coast came to ephesu and find 
certain discipl 19 2 he said unto them have ye receiv the holi 
ghost sinc ye believ and they said unto him we have not so much 
a heard whether there be ani holi ghost 

19 3 and he said unto them unto what then were ye baptiz and they 
said unto john s baptism 

19 4 then said paul john verili baptiz with the baptism of 
repent say unto the peopl that they should believ on him 
which should come after him that is on christ jesu 

19 5 when they heard thi they were baptiz in the name of the lord 
jesu 

19 6 and when paul had laid hi hand upon them the holi ghost came 
on them and they spake with tongu and prophesi 

19 7 and all the men were about twelv 

19 8 and he went into the synagogu and spake boldli for the space of 
three month disput and persuad the thing concern the 
kingdom of god 

19 9 but when diver were harden and believ not but spake evil 
of that way befor the multitud he depart from them and separ 
the discipl disput daili in the school of one tyrannu 

19 10 and thi continu by the space of two year so that all they 
which dwelt in asia heard the word of the lord jesu both jew and 
greek 

19 11 and god wrought special miracl by the hand of paul 19 12 so 
that from hi bodi were brought unto the sick handkerchief or apron 
and the disea depart from them and the evil spirit went out of 
them 

19 13 then certain of the vagabond jew exorcist took upon them to 
call over them which had evil spirit the name of the lord jesu 
say we adjur you by jesu whom paul preacheth 

19 14 and there were seven son of one sceva a jew and chief of the 
priest which did so 

19 15 and the evil spirit answer and said jesu i know and paul i 
know but who are ye 19 16 and the man in whom the evil spirit wa 
leap on them and overcam them and prevail against them so that 
they fled out of that hou nake and wound 

19 17 and thi wa known to all the jew and greek also dwell at 
ephesu and fear fell on them all and the name of the lord jesu wa 
magnifi 

19 18 and mani that believ came and confess and shew their 
deed 

19 19 mani of them also which use curiou art brought their book 
togeth and burn them befor all men and they count the price 
of them and found it fifti thousand piec of silver 

19 20 so mightili grew the word of god and prevail 

19 21 after these thing were end paul purpo in the spirit when 
he had pa through macedonia and achaia to go to jerusalem 
say after i have been there i must also see rome 

19 22 so he sent into macedonia two of them that minist unto him 
timotheu and erastu but he himself stay in asia for a season 

19 23 and the same time there aro no small stir about that way 

19 24 for a certain man name demetriu a silversmith which made 
silver shrine for diana brought no small gain unto the craftsman 
19 25 whom he call togeth with the workman of like occup and 
said sir ye know that by thi craft we have our wealth 

19 26 moreov ye see and hear that not alon at ephesu but almost 
throughout all asia thi paul hath persuad and turn away much 
peopl say that they be no god which are made with hand 19 27 
so that not onli thi our craft is in danger to be set at nought but 
also that the templ of the great goddess diana should be despi 
and her magnif should be destroy whom all asia and the world 
worshippeth 

19 28 and when they heard these say they were full of wrath and 
cri out say great is diana of the ephesian 

19 29 and the whole citi wa fill with confu and have caught 
gaiu and aristarchu men of macedonia paul s companion in travel 
they rush with one accord into the theatr 

19 30 and when paul would have enter in unto the peopl the 
discipl suffer him not 

19 31 and certain of the chief of asia which were hi friend sent 
unto him desir him that he would not adventur himself into the 
theatr 

19 32 some therefor cri one thing and some anoth for the 
assembl wa confu and the more part knew not wherefor they were 
come togeth 

19 33 and they drew alexand out of the multitud the jew put 
him forward and alexand beckon with the hand and would have made 
hi defenc unto the peopl 

19 34 but when they knew that he wa a jew all with one voic about 
the space of two hour cri out great is diana of the ephesian 

19 35 and when the townclerk had appea the peopl he said ye men 
of ephesu what man is there that knoweth not how that the citi of 
the ephesian is a worshipp of the great goddess diana and of the 
imag which fell down from jupit 19 36 see then that these 
thing cannot be spoken against ye ought to be quiet and to do 
noth rashli 

19 37 for ye have brought hither these men which are neither robber 
of church nor yet blasphem of your goddess 

19 38 wherefor if demetriu and the craftsman which are with him 
have a matter against ani man the law is open and there are 
deputi let them implead one anoth 

19 39 but if ye enquir ani thing concern other matter it shall 
be determin in a law assembl 

19 40 for we are in danger to be call in question for thi day s 
uproar there be no cau wherebi we may give an account of thi 
concour 

19 41 and when he had thu spoken he dismiss the assembl 

20 1 and after the uproar wa cea paul call unto him the 
discipl and embrac them and depart for to go into macedonia 

20 2 and when he had gone over those part and had given them much 
exhort he came into greec 20 3 and there abod three month 
and when the jew laid wait for him a he wa about to sail into 
syria he purpo to return through macedonia 

20 4 and there accompani him into asia sopat of berea and of the 
thessalonian aristarchu and secundu and gaiu of derb and 
timotheu and of asia tychicu and trophimu 

20 5 these go befor tarri for u at troa 

20 6 and we sail away from philippi after the day of unleaven 
bread and came unto them to troa in five day where we abod seven 
day 

20 7 and upon the first day of the week when the discipl came 
togeth to break bread paul preach unto them readi to depart on 
the morrow and continu hi speech until midnight 

20 8 and there were mani light in the upper chamber where they were 
gather togeth 

20 9 and there sat in a window a certain young man name eutychu 
be fallen into a deep sleep and a paul wa long preach he 
sunk down with sleep and fell down from the third loft and wa taken 
up dead 

20 10 and paul went down and fell on him and embrac him said 
troubl not yourselv for hi life is in him 

20 11 when he therefor wa come up again and had broken bread and 
eaten and talk a long while even till break of day so he 
depart 

20 12 and they brought the young man aliv and were not a littl 
comfort 

20 13 and we went befor to ship and sail unto asso there 
intend to take in paul for so had he appoint mind himself to 
go afoot 

20 14 and when he met with u at asso we took him in and came to 
mitylen 

20 15 and we sail thenc and came the next day over against chio 
and the next day we arriv at samo and tarri at trogyllium and 
the next day we came to miletu 

20 16 for paul had determin to sail by ephesu becau he would not 
spend the time in asia for he hast if it were possibl for him to 
be at jerusalem the day of pentecost 

20 17 and from miletu he sent to ephesu and call the elder of 
the church 

20 18 and when they were come to him he said unto them ye know from 
the first day that i came into asia after what manner i have been 
with you at all season 20 19 serv the lord with all humil of 
mind and with mani tear and temptat which befel me by the 
lie in wait of the jew 20 20 and how i kept back noth that wa 
profit unto you but have shew you and have taught you 
publickli and from hou to hou 20 21 testifi both to the jew 
and also to the greek repent toward god and faith toward our 
lord jesu christ 

20 22 and now behold i go bound in the spirit unto jerusalem not 
know the thing that shall befal me there 20 23 save that the 
holi ghost witnesseth in everi citi say that bond and afflict 
abid me 

20 24 but none of these thing move me neither count i my life dear 
unto myself so that i might finish my cour with joy and the 
ministri which i have receiv of the lord jesu to testifi the 
gospel of the grace of god 

20 25 and now behold i know that ye all among whom i have gone 
preach the kingdom of god shall see my face no more 

20 26 wherefor i take you to record thi day that i am pure from the 
blood of all men 

20 27 for i have not shun to declar unto you all the counsel of 
god 

20 28 take heed therefor unto yourselv and to all the flock over 
the which the holi ghost hath made you over to feed the church 
of god which he hath purcha with hi own blood 

20 29 for i know thi that after my depart shall grievou wolf 
enter in among you not spare the flock 

20 30 also of your own self shall men ari speak perver 
thing to draw away discipl after them 

20 31 therefor watch and rememb that by the space of three year 
i cea not to warn everi one night and day with tear 

20 32 and now brother i commend you to god and to the word of hi 
grace which is abl to build you up and to give you an inherit 
among all them which are sanctifi 

20 33 i have covet no man s silver or gold or apparel 

20 34 yea ye yourselv know that these hand have minist unto 
my necess and to them that were with me 

20 35 i have shew you all thing how that so labour ye ought to 
support the weak and to rememb the word of the lord jesu how he 
said it is more bless to give than to receiv 

20 36 and when he had thu spoken he kneel down and pray with 
them all 

20 37 and they all wept sore and fell on paul s neck and kiss him 
20 38 sorrow most of all for the word which he spake that they 
should see hi face no more and they accompani him unto the ship 

21 1 and it came to pa that after we were gotten from them and had 
launch we came with a straight cour unto coo and the day 
follow unto rhode and from thenc unto patara 21 2 and find a 
ship sail over unto phenicia we went aboard and set forth 

21 3 now when we had discov cypru we left it on the left hand 
and sail into syria and land at tyre for there the ship wa to 
unlad her burden 

21 4 and find discipl we tarri there seven day who said to 
paul through the spirit that he should not go up to jerusalem 

21 5 and when we had accomplish those day we depart and went our 
way and they all brought u on our way with wife and child till 
we were out of the citi and we kneel down on the shore and pray 

21 6 and when we had taken our leav one of anoth we took ship and 
they return home again 

21 7 and when we had finish our cour from tyre we came to 
ptolemai and salut the brother and abod with them one day 

21 8 and the next day we that were of paul s compani depart and 
came unto caesarea and we enter into the hou of philip the 
evangelist which wa one of the seven and abod with him 

21 9 and the same man had four daughter virgin which did prophesi 

21 10 and a we tarri there mani day there came down from judaea a 
certain prophet name agabu 

21 11 and when he wa come unto u he took paul s girdl and bound 
hi own hand and foot and said thu saith the holi ghost so shall 
the jew at jerusalem bind the man that owneth thi girdl and shall 
deliv him into the hand of the gentil 

21 12 and when we heard these thing both we and they of that place 
besought him not to go up to jerusalem 

21 13 then paul answer what mean ye to weep and to break mine 
heart for i am readi not to be bound onli but also to die at 
jerusalem for the name of the lord jesu 

21 14 and when he would not be persuad we cea say the will 
of the lord be done 

21 15 and after those day we took up our carriag and went up to 
jerusalem 

21 16 there went with u also certain of the discipl of caesarea 
and brought with them one mnason of cypru an old discipl with whom 
we should lodg 

21 17 and when we were come to jerusalem the brother receiv u 
gladli 

21 18 and the day follow paul went in with u unto jame and all 
the elder were present 

21 19 and when he had salut them he declar particularli what 
thing god had wrought among the gentil by hi ministri 

21 20 and when they heard it they glorifi the lord and said unto 
him thou seest brother how mani thousand of jew there are which 
believ and they are all zealou of the law 21 21 and they are 
inform of thee that thou teachest all the jew which are among the 
gentil to forsak mose say that they ought not to circumci 
their child neither to walk after the custom 

21 22 what is it therefor the multitud must need come togeth 
for they will hear that thou art come 

21 23 do therefor thi that we say to thee we have four men which 
have a vow on them 21 24 them take and purifi thyself with them and 
be at charg with them that they may shave their head and all may 
know that those thing whereof they were inform concern thee 
are noth but that thou thyself also walkest orderli and keepest 
the law 

21 25 a touch the gentil which believ we have written and 
conclud that they observ no such thing save onli that they keep 
themselv from thing offer to idol and from blood and from 
strangl and from fornic 

21 26 then paul took the men and the next day purifi himself with 
them enter into the templ to signifi the accomplish of the 
day of purif until that an offer should be offer for 
everi one of them 

21 27 and when the seven day were almost end the jew which were 
of asia when they saw him in the templ stir up all the peopl 
and laid hand on him 21 28 cri out men of israel help thi is 
the man that teacheth all men everi where against the peopl and the 
law and thi place and further brought greek also into the templ 
and hath pollut thi holi place 

21 29 for they had seen befor with him in the citi trophimu an 
ephesian whom they suppo that paul had brought into the templ 
21 30 and all the citi wa move and the peopl ran togeth and 
they took paul and drew him out of the templ and forthwith the 
door were shut 

21 31 and a they went about to kill him tide came unto the chief 
captain of the band that all jerusalem wa in an uproar 

21 32 who immedi took soldier and centurion and ran down unto 
them and when they saw the chief captain and the soldier they left 
beat of paul 

21 33 then the chief captain came near and took him and command 
him to be bound with two chain and demand who he wa and what he 
had done 

21 34 and some cri one thing some anoth among the multitud and 
when he could not know the certainti for the tumult he command him 
to be carri into the castl 

21 35 and when he came upon the stair so it wa that he wa born 
of the soldier for the violenc of the peopl 

21 36 for the multitud of the peopl follow after cri away 
with him 

21 37 and a paul wa to be led into the castl he said unto the 
chief captain may i speak unto thee who said canst thou speak 
greek 21 38 art not thou that egyptian which befor these day 
madest an uproar and leddest out into the wilder four thousand 
men that were murder 21 39 but paul said i am a man which am a 
jew of tarsu a citi in cilicia a citizen of no mean citi and i 
beseech thee suffer me to speak unto the peopl 

21 40 and when he had given him licenc paul stood on the stair and 
beckon with the hand unto the peopl and when there wa made a 
great silenc he spake unto them in the hebrew tongu say 22 1 
men brother and father hear ye my defenc which i make now unto 
you 

22 2 and when they heard that he spake in the hebrew tongu to them 
they kept the more silenc and he saith 22 3 i am verili a man 
which am a jew born in tarsu a citi in cilicia yet brought up in 
thi citi at the foot of gamaliel and taught accord to the perfect 
manner of the law of the father and wa zealou toward god a ye 
all are thi day 

22 4 and i persecut thi way unto the death bind and deliv 
into prison both men and woman 

22 5 a also the high priest doth bear me wit and all the estat 
of the elder from whom also i receiv letter unto the brother 
and went to damascu to bring them which were there bound unto 
jerusalem for to be punish 

22 6 and it came to pa that a i made my journey and wa come 
nigh unto damascu about noon suddenli there shone from heaven a 
great light round about me 

22 7 and i fell unto the ground and heard a voic say unto me 
saul saul whi persecutest thou me 22 8 and i answer who art 
thou lord and he said unto me i am jesu of nazareth whom thou 
persecutest 

22 9 and they that were with me saw ind the light and were afraid 
but they heard not the voic of him that spake to me 

22 10 and i said what shall i do lord and the lord said unto me 
ari and go into damascu and there it shall be told thee of all 
thing which are appoint for thee to do 

22 11 and when i could not see for the glori of that light be led 
by the hand of them that were with me i came into damascu 

22 12 and one anania a devout man accord to the law have a 
good report of all the jew which dwelt there 22 13 came unto me and 
stood and said unto me brother saul receiv thi sight and the same 
hour i look up upon him 

22 14 and he said the god of our father hath chosen thee that thou 
shouldest know hi will and see that just one and shouldest hear the 
voic of hi mouth 

22 15 for thou shalt be hi wit unto all men of what thou hast 
seen and heard 

22 16 and now whi tarriest thou ari and be baptiz and wash away 
thi sin call on the name of the lord 

22 17 and it came to pa that when i wa come again to jerusalem 
even while i pray in the templ i wa in a tranc 22 18 and saw 
him say unto me make hast and get thee quickli out of jerusalem 
for they will not receiv thi testimoni concern me 

22 19 and i said lord they know that i imprison and beat in everi 
synagogu them that believ on thee 22 20 and when the blood of thi 
martyr stephen wa shed i also wa stand by and consent unto 
hi death and kept the raiment of them that slew him 

22 21 and he said unto me depart for i will send thee far henc unto 
the gentil 

22 22 and they gave him audienc unto thi word and then lift up 
their voic and said away with such a fellow from the earth for it 
is not fit that he should live 

22 23 and a they cri out and cast off their cloth and threw 
dust into the air 22 24 the chief captain command him to be brought 
into the castl and bade that he should be examin by scourg 
that he might know wherefor they cri so against him 

22 25 and a they bound him with thong paul said unto the centurion 
that stood by is it law for you to scourg a man that is a roman 
and uncondemn 22 26 when the centurion heard that he went and 
told the chief captain say take heed what thou doest for thi 
man is a roman 

22 27 then the chief captain came and said unto him tell me art 
thou a roman he said yea 

22 28 and the chief captain answer with a great sum obtain i thi 
freedom and paul said but i wa free born 

22 29 then straightway they depart from him which should have 
examin him and the chief captain also wa afraid after he knew 
that he wa a roman and becau he had bound him 

22 30 on the morrow becau he would have known the certainti 
wherefor he wa accu of the jew he loo him from hi band 
and command the chief priest and all their council to appear and 
brought paul down and set him befor them 

23 1 and paul earnestli behold the council said men and 
brother i have live in all good conscienc befor god until thi 
day 

23 2 and the high priest anania command them that stood by him to 
smite him on the mouth 

23 3 then said paul unto him god shall smite thee thou white wall 
for sittest thou to judg me after the law and commandest me to be 
smitten contrari to the law 23 4 and they that stood by said 
revilest thou god s high priest 23 5 then said paul i wist not 
brother that he wa the high priest for it is written thou shalt 
not speak evil of the ruler of thi peopl 

23 6 but when paul perceiv that the one part were sadduc and the 
other pharis he cri out in the council men and brother i am a 
pharis the son of a pharis of the hope and resurrect of the 
dead i am call in question 

23 7 and when he had so said there aro a dissen between the 
pharis and the sadduc and the multitud wa divid 

23 8 for the sadduc say that there is no resurrect neither 
angel nor spirit but the pharis confess both 

23 9 and there aro a great cri and the scribe that were of the 
pharis part aro and strove say we find no evil in thi 
man but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him let u not fight 
against god 

23 10 and when there aro a great dissen the chief captain 
fear lest paul should have been pull in piec of them command 
the soldier to go down and to take him by forc from among them and 
to bring him into the castl 

23 11 and the night follow the lord stood by him and said be of 
good cheer paul for a thou hast testifi of me in jerusalem so 
must thou bear wit also at rome 

23 12 and when it wa day certain of the jew band togeth and 
bound themselv under a cur say that they would neither eat nor 
drink till they had kill paul 

23 13 and they were more than forti which had made thi conspiraci 

23 14 and they came to the chief priest and elder and said we have 
bound ourselv under a great cur that we will eat noth until we 
have slain paul 

23 15 now therefor ye with the council signifi to the chief captain 
that he bring him down unto you to morrow a though ye would enquir 
someth more perfectli concern him and we or ever he come near 
are readi to kill him 

23 16 and when paul s sister s son heard of their lie in wait he 
went and enter into the castl and told paul 

23 17 then paul call one of the centurion unto him and said bring 
thi young man unto the chief captain for he hath a certain thing to 
tell him 

23 18 so he took him and brought him to the chief captain and said 
paul the prison call me unto him and pray me to bring thi 
young man unto thee who hath someth to say unto thee 

23 19 then the chief captain took him by the hand and went with him 
asid privat and ask him what is that thou hast to tell me 
23 20 and he said the jew have agr to desir thee that thou 
wouldest bring down paul to morrow into the council a though they 
would enquir somewhat of him more perfectli 

23 21 but do not thou yield unto them for there lie in wait for him 
of them more than forti men which have bound themselv with an oath 
that they will neither eat nor drink till they have kill him and 
now are they readi look for a promi from thee 

23 22 so the chief captain then let the young man depart and charg 
him see thou tell no man that thou hast shew these thing to me 

23 23 and he call unto him two centurion say make readi two 
hundr soldier to go to caesarea and horseman threescor and ten 
and spearmen two hundr at the third hour of the night 23 24 and 
provid them beast that they may set paul on and bring him safe 
unto felix the governor 

23 25 and he wrote a letter after thi manner 23 26 claudiu lysia 
unto the most excel governor felix sendeth greet 

23 27 thi man wa taken of the jew and should have been kill of 
them then came i with an armi and rescu him have understood 
that he wa a roman 

23 28 and when i would have known the cau wherefor they accu 
him i brought him forth into their council 23 29 whom i perceiv to 
be accu of question of their law but to have noth laid to hi 
charg worthi of death or of bond 

23 30 and when it wa told me how that the jew laid wait for the man 
i sent straightway to thee and gave command to hi accu also 
to say befor thee what they had against him farewel 

23 31 then the soldier a it wa command them took paul and 
brought him by night to antipatri 

23 32 on the morrow they left the horseman to go with him and 
return to the castl 23 33 who when they came to caesarea and 
deliv the epistl to the governor present paul also befor him 

23 34 and when the governor had read the letter he ask of what 
provinc he wa and when he understood that he wa of cilicia 23 35 
i will hear thee said he when thine accu are also come and he 
command him to be kept in herod s judgment hall 

24 1 and after five day anania the high priest descend with the 
elder and with a certain orat name tertullu who inform the 
governor against paul 

24 2 and when he wa call forth tertullu began to accu him 
say see that by thee we enjoy great quiet and that veri 
worthi deed are done unto thi nation by thi provid 24 3 we 
accept it alway and in all place most nobl felix with all 
thank 

24 4 notwithstand that i be not further tediou unto thee i pray 
thee that thou wouldest hear u of thi clemenc a few word 

24 5 for we have found thi man a pestil fellow and a mover of 
sedit among all the jew throughout the world and a ringlead of 
the sect of the nazaren 24 6 who also hath gone about to profan 
the templ whom we took and would have judg accord to our law 

24 7 but the chief captain lysia came upon u and with great 
violenc took him away out of our hand 24 8 command hi accu 
to come unto thee by examin of whom thyself mayest take knowledg 
of all these thing whereof we accu him 

24 9 and the jew also assent say that these thing were so 

24 10 then paul after that the governor had beckon unto him to 
speak answer forasmuch a i know that thou hast been of mani year 
a judg unto thi nation i do the more cheer answer for myself 
24 11 becau that thou mayest understand that there are yet but 
twelv day sinc i went up to jerusalem for to worship 

24 12 and they neither found me in the templ disput with ani man 
neither rai up the peopl neither in the synagogu nor in the 
citi 24 13 neither can they prove the thing whereof they now accu 
me 

24 14 but thi i confess unto thee that after the way which they call 
heresi so worship i the god of my father believ all thing which 
are written in the law and in the prophet 24 15 and have hope toward 
god which they themselv also allow that there shall be a 
resurrect of the dead both of the just and unjust 

24 16 and herein do i exerci myself to have alway a conscienc 
void to offenc toward god and toward men 

24 17 now after mani year i came to bring alm to my nation and 
offer 

24 18 whereupon certain jew from asia found me purifi in the 
templ neither with multitud nor with tumult 

24 19 who ought to have been here befor thee and object if they had 
ought against me 

24 20 or el let these same here say if they have found ani evil 
do in me while i stood befor the council 24 21 except it be for 
thi one voic that i cri stand among them touch the 
resurrect of the dead i am call in question by you thi day 

24 22 and when felix heard these thing have more perfect knowledg 
of that way he defer them and said when lysia the chief captain 
shall come down i will know the uttermost of your matter 

24 23 and he command a centurion to keep paul and to let him have 
liberti and that he should forbid none of hi acquaint to 
minist or come unto him 

24 24 and after certain day when felix came with hi wife drusilla 
which wa a jewess he sent for paul and heard him concern the 
faith in christ 

24 25 and a he reason of righteou temper and judgment to 
come felix trembl and answer go thi way for thi time when i 
have a conveni season i will call for thee 

24 26 he hope also that money should have been given him of paul 
that he might loo him wherefor he sent for him the often and 
commun with him 

24 27 but after two year porciu festu came into felix room and 
felix will to shew the jew a pleasur left paul bound 

25 1 now when festu wa come into the provinc after three day he 
ascend from caesarea to jerusalem 

25 2 then the high priest and the chief of the jew inform him 
against paul and besought him 25 3 and desir favour against him 
that he would send for him to jerusalem lay wait in the way to 
kill him 

25 4 but festu answer that paul should be kept at caesarea and 
that he himself would depart shortli thither 

25 5 let them therefor said he which among you are abl go down 
with me and accu thi man if there be ani wick in him 

25 6 and when he had tarri among them more than ten day he went 
down unto caesarea and the next day sit on the judgment seat 
command paul to be brought 

25 7 and when he wa come the jew which came down from jerusalem 
stood round about and laid mani and grievou complaint against paul 
which they could not prove 

25 8 while he answer for himself neither against the law of the 
jew neither against the templ nor yet against caesar have i 
offend ani thing at all 

25 9 but festu will to do the jew a pleasur answer paul and 
said wilt thou go up to jerusalem and there be judg of these 
thing befor me 25 10 then said paul i stand at caesar s judgment 
seat where i ought to be judg to the jew have i done no wrong a 
thou veri well knowest 

25 11 for if i be an offend or have commit ani thing worthi of 
death i refu not to die but if there be none of these thing 
whereof these accu me no man may deliv me unto them i appeal 
unto caesar 

25 12 then festu when he had confer with the council answer 
hast thou appeal unto caesar unto caesar shalt thou go 

25 13 and after certain day king agrippa and bernic came unto 
caesarea to salut festu 

25 14 and when they had been there mani day festu declar paul s 
cau unto the king say there is a certain man left in bond by 
felix 25 15 about whom when i wa at jerusalem the chief priest 
and the elder of the jew inform me desir to have judgment 
against him 

25 16 to whom i answer it is not the manner of the roman to 
deliv ani man to die befor that he which is accu have the 
accu face to face and have licenc to answer for himself 
concern the crime laid against him 

25 17 therefor when they were come hither without ani delay on the 
morrow i sat on the judgment seat and command the man to be brought 
forth 

25 18 against whom when the accu stood up they brought none 
accu of such thing a i suppo 25 19 but had certain 
question against him of their own superstit and of one jesu 
which wa dead whom paul affirm to be aliv 

25 20 and becau i doubt of such manner of question i ask him 
whether he would go to jerusalem and there be judg of these 
matter 

25 21 but when paul had appeal to be reserv unto the hear of 
augustu i command him to be kept till i might send him to caesar 

25 22 then agrippa said unto festu i would also hear the man myself 
to morrow said he thou shalt hear him 

25 23 and on the morrow when agrippa wa come and bernic with 
great pomp and wa enter into the place of hear with the chief 
captain and princip men of the citi at festu command paul 
wa brought forth 

25 24 and festu said king agrippa and all men which are here 
present with u ye see thi man about whom all the multitud of the 
jew have dealt with me both at jerusalem and also here cri that 
he ought not to live ani longer 

25 25 but when i found that he had commit noth worthi of death 
and that he himself hath appeal to augustu i have determin to 
send him 

25 26 of whom i have no certain thing to write unto my lord wherefor 
i have brought him forth befor you and special befor thee o king 
agrippa that after examin had i might have somewhat to write 

25 27 for it seemeth to me unreason to send a prison and not 
withal to signifi the crime laid against him 

26 1 then agrippa said unto paul thou art permit to speak for 
thyself 

then paul stretch forth the hand and answer for himself 26 2 i 
think myself happi king agrippa becau i shall answer for myself 
thi day befor thee touch all the thing whereof i am accu of 
the jew 26 3 especi becau i know thee to be expert in all 
custom and question which are among the jew wherefor i beseech 
thee to hear me patient 

26 4 my manner of life from my youth which wa at the first among 
mine own nation at jerusalem know all the jew 26 5 which knew me 
from the begin if they would testifi that after the most 
straitest sect of our religion i live a pharis 

26 6 and now i stand and am judg for the hope of the promi made of 
god unto our father 26 7 unto which promi our twelv tribe 
instantli serv god day and night hope to come for which hope s 
sake king agrippa i am accu of the jew 

26 8 whi should it be thought a thing incr with you that god 
should rai the dead 26 9 i verili thought with myself that i 
ought to do mani thing contrari to the name of jesu of nazareth 

26 10 which thing i also did in jerusalem and mani of the saint did 
i shut up in prison have receiv author from the chief priest 
and when they were put to death i gave my voic against them 

26 11 and i punish them oft in everi synagogu and compel them 
to blasphem and be exceedingli mad against them i persecut 
them even unto strang citi 

26 12 whereupon a i went to damascu with author and commiss 
from the chief priest 26 13 at midday o king i saw in the way a 
light from heaven abov the bright of the sun shine round 
about me and them which journey with me 

26 14 and when we were all fallen to the earth i heard a voic 
speak unto me and say in the hebrew tongu saul saul whi 
persecutest thou me it is hard for thee to kick against the prick 

26 15 and i said who art thou lord and he said i am jesu whom 
thou persecutest 

26 16 but rise and stand upon thi foot for i have appear unto thee 
for thi purpo to make thee a minist and a wit both of these 
thing which thou hast seen and of those thing in the which i will 
appear unto thee 26 17 deliv thee from the peopl and from the 
gentil unto whom now i send thee 26 18 to open their eye and to 
turn them from dark to light and from the power of satan unto 
god that they may receiv forgiv of sin and inherit among 
them which are sanctifi by faith that is in me 

26 19 whereupon o king agrippa i wa not disobedi unto the 
heavenli vision 26 20 but shew first unto them of damascu and at 
jerusalem and throughout all the coast of judaea and then to the 
gentil that they should repent and turn to god and do work meet 
for repent 

26 21 for these cau the jew caught me in the templ and went 
about to kill me 

26 22 have therefor obtain help of god i continu unto thi day 
wit both to small and great say none other thing than 
those which the prophet and mose did say should come 26 23 that 
christ should suffer and that he should be the first that should rise 
from the dead and should shew light unto the peopl and to the 
gentil 

26 24 and a he thu spake for himself festu said with a loud voic 
paul thou art besid thyself much learn doth make thee mad 

26 25 but he said i am not mad most nobl festu but speak forth 
the word of truth and sober 

26 26 for the king knoweth of these thing befor whom also i speak 
freeli for i am persuad that none of these thing are hidden from 
him for thi thing wa not done in a corner 

26 27 king agrippa believest thou the prophet i know that thou 
believest 

26 28 then agrippa said unto paul almost thou persuadest me to be a 
christian 

26 29 and paul said i would to god that not onli thou but also all 
that hear me thi day were both almost and altogeth such a i am 
except these bond 

26 30 and when he had thu spoken the king rose up and the governor 
and bernic and they that sat with them 26 31 and when they were 
gone asid they talk between themselv say thi man doeth 
noth worthi of death or of bond 

26 32 then said agrippa unto festu thi man might have been set at 
liberti if he had not appeal unto caesar 

27 1 and when it wa determin that we should sail into itali they 
deliv paul and certain other prison unto one name juliu a 
centurion of augustu band 

27 2 and enter into a ship of adramyttium we launch mean to 
sail by the coast of asia one aristarchu a macedonian of 
thessalonica be with u 

27 3 and the next day we touch at sidon and juliu courteou 
entreat paul and gave him liberti to go unto hi friend to refresh 
himself 

27 4 and when we had launch from thenc we sail under cypru 
becau the wind were contrari 

27 5 and when we had sail over the sea of cilicia and pamphylia we 
came to myra a citi of lycia 

27 6 and there the centurion found a ship of alexandria sail into 
itali and he put u therein 

27 7 and when we had sail slowli mani day and scarc were come 
over against cnidu the wind not suffer u we sail under crete 
over against salmon 27 8 and hardli pa it came unto a place 
which is call the fair haven nigh whereunto wa the citi of lasea 

27 9 now when much time wa spent and when sail wa now danger 
becau the fast wa now alreadi past paul admonish them 27 10 and 
said unto them sir i perceiv that thi voyag will be with hurt 
and much damag not onli of the lade and ship but also of our 
life 

27 11 nevertheless the centurion believ the master and the owner of 
the ship more than those thing which were spoken by paul 

27 12 and becau the haven wa not commodi to winter in the more 
part advi to depart thenc also if by ani mean they might attain 
to phenic and there to winter which is an haven of crete and lieth 
toward the south west and north west 

27 13 and when the south wind blew softli suppo that they had 
obtain their purpo loo thenc they sail close by crete 

27 14 but not long after there aro against it a tempestu wind 
call euroclydon 

27 15 and when the ship wa caught and could not bear up into the 
wind we let her drive 

27 16 and run under a certain island which is call clauda we 
had much work to come by the boat 27 17 which when they had taken up 
they use help undergird the ship and fear lest they should 
fall into the quicksand strake sail and so were driven 

27 18 and we be exceedingli toss with a tempest the next day 
they lighten the ship 27 19 and the third day we cast out with our 
own hand the tackl of the ship 

27 20 and when neither sun nor star in mani day appear and no 
small tempest lay on u all hope that we should be save wa then 
taken away 

27 21 but after long abstin paul stood forth in the midst of them 
and said sir ye should have hearken unto me and not have loo 
from crete and to have gain thi harm and loss 

27 22 and now i exhort you to be of good cheer for there shall be no 
loss of ani man s life among you but of the ship 

27 23 for there stood by me thi night the angel of god whose i am 
and whom i serv 27 24 say fear not paul thou must be brought 
befor caesar and lo god hath given thee all them that sail with 
thee 

27 25 wherefor sir be of good cheer for i believ god that it 
shall be even a it wa told me 

27 26 howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island 

27 27 but when the fourteenth night wa come a we were driven up and 
down in adria about midnight the shipmen deem that they drew near 
to some countri 27 28 and sound and found it twenti fathom and 
when they had gone a littl further they sound again and found it 
fifteen fathom 

27 29 then fear lest we should have fallen upon rock they cast 
four anchor out of the stern and wish for the day 

27 30 and a the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship when they 
had let down the boat into the sea under colour a though they would 
have cast anchor out of the foreship 27 31 paul said to the 
centurion and to the soldier except these abid in the ship ye 
cannot be save 

27 32 then the soldier cut off the rope of the boat and let her 
fall off 

27 33 and while the day wa come on paul besought them all to take 
meat say thi day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarri and 
continu fast have taken noth 

27 34 wherefor i pray you to take some meat for thi is for your 
health for there shall not an hair fall from the head of ani of you 

27 35 and when he had thu spoken he took bread and gave thank to 
god in presenc of them all and when he had broken it he began to 
eat 

27 36 then were they all of good cheer and they also took some meat 

27 37 and we were in all in the ship two hundr threescor and 
sixteen soul 

27 38 and when they had eaten enough they lighten the ship and 
cast out the wheat into the sea 

27 39 and when it wa day they knew not the land but they discov 
a certain creek with a shore into the which they were mind if it 
were possibl to thrust in the ship 

27 40 and when they had taken up the anchor they commit 
themselv unto the sea and loo the rudder band and hoi up 
the mainsail to the wind and made toward shore 

27 41 and fall into a place where two sea met they ran the ship 
aground and the forepart stuck fast and remain unmov but the 
hinder part wa broken with the violenc of the wave 

27 42 and the soldier counsel wa to kill the prison lest ani of 
them should swim out and escap 

27 43 but the centurion will to save paul kept them from their 
purpo and command that they which could swim should cast 
themselv first into the sea and get to land 27 44 and the rest 
some on board and some on broken piec of the ship 

and so it came to pa that they escap all safe to land 

28 1 and when they were escap then they knew that the island wa 
call melita 

28 2 and the barbar peopl shew u no littl kind for they 
kindl a fire and receiv u everi one becau of the present 
rain and becau of the cold 

28 3 and when paul had gather a bundl of stick and laid them on 
the fire there came a viper out of the heat and fasten on hi 
hand 

28 4 and when the barbarian saw the venom beast hang on hi hand 
they said among themselv no doubt thi man is a murder whom 
though he hath escap the sea yet vengeanc suffereth not to live 

28 5 and he shook off the beast into the fire and felt no harm 

28 6 howbeit they look when he should have swollen or fallen down 
dead suddenli but after they had look a great while and saw no 
harm come to him they chang their mind and said that he wa a 
god 

28 7 in the same quarter were poss of the chief man of the 
island whose name wa publiu who receiv u and lodg u three 
day courteou 

28 8 and it came to pa that the father of publiu lay sick of a 
fever and of a bloodi flux to whom paul enter in and pray and 
laid hi hand on him and heal him 

28 9 so when thi wa done other also which had disea in the 
island came and were heal 28 10 who also honour u with mani 
honour and when we depart they lade u with such thing a were 
necessari 

28 11 and after three month we depart in a ship of alexandria 
which had winter in the isl whose sign wa castor and pollux 

28 12 and land at syracu we tarri there three day 

28 13 and from thenc we fetch a compass and came to rhegium and 
after one day the south wind blew and we came the next day to 
puteoli 28 14 where we found brother and were desir to tarri with 
them seven day and so we went toward rome 

28 15 and from thenc when the brother heard of u they came to 
meet u a far a appii forum and the three tavern whom when paul 
saw he thank god and took courag 

28 16 and when we came to rome the centurion deliv the prison 
to the captain of the guard but paul wa suffer to dwell by himself 
with a soldier that kept him 

28 17 and it came to pa that after three day paul call the chief 
of the jew togeth and when they were come togeth he said unto 
them men and brother though i have commit noth against the 
peopl or custom of our father yet wa i deliv prison from 
jerusalem into the hand of the roman 

28 18 who when they had examin me would have let me go becau 
there wa no cau of death in me 

28 19 but when the jew spake against it i wa constrain to appeal 
unto caesar not that i had ought to accu my nation of 

28 20 for thi cau therefor have i call for you to see you and 
to speak with you becau that for the hope of israel i am bound with 
thi chain 

28 21 and they said unto him we neither receiv letter out of 
judaea concern thee neither ani of the brother that came shew 
or spake ani harm of thee 

28 22 but we desir to hear of thee what thou thinkest for a 
concern thi sect we know that everi where it is spoken against
