continueth ever hath an unchang priesthood 

7 25 wherefor he is abl also to save them to the uttermost that come 
unto god by him see he ever liveth to make intercess for them 

7 26 for such an high priest becam u who is holi harmless 
undefil separ from sinner and made higher than the heaven 
7 27 who needeth not daili a those high priest to offer up 
sacrif first for hi own sin and then for the peopl s for thi 
he did onc when he offer up himself 

7 28 for the law maketh men high priest which have infirm but the 
word of the oath which wa sinc the law maketh the son who is 
consecr for evermor 

8 1 now of the thing which we have spoken thi is the sum we have 
such an high priest who is set on the right hand of the throne of the 
majesti in the heaven 8 2 a minist of the sanctuari and of the 
true tabernacl which the lord pitch and not man 

8 3 for everi high priest is ordain to offer gift and sacrif 
wherefor it is of necess that thi man have somewhat also to 
offer 

8 4 for if he were on earth he should not be a priest see that 
there are priest that offer gift accord to the law 8 5 who serv 
unto the exampl and shadow of heavenli thing a mose wa 
admonish of god when he wa about to make the tabernacl for see 
saith he that thou make all thing accord to the pattern shew to 
thee in the mount 

8 6 but now hath he obtain a more excel ministri by how much 
also he is the mediat of a better coven which wa establish 
upon better promi 

8 7 for if that first coven had been faultless then should no 
place have been sought for the second 

8 8 for find fault with them he saith behold the day come 
saith the lord when i will make a new coven with the hou of 
israel and with the hou of judah 8 9 not accord to the coven 
that i made with their father in the day when i took them by the hand 
to lead them out of the land of egypt becau they continu not in 
my coven and i regard them not saith the lord 

8 10 for thi is the coven that i will make with the hou of 
israel after those day saith the lord i will put my law into their 
mind and write them in their heart and i will be to them a god and 
they shall be to me a peopl 8 11 and they shall not teach everi man 
hi neighbour and everi man hi brother say know the lord for 
all shall know me from the least to the greatest 

8 12 for i will be merci to their unright and their sin 
and their iniqu will i rememb no more 

8 13 in that he saith a new coven he hath made the first old now 
that which decayeth and waxeth old is readi to vanish away 

9 1 then verili the first coven had also ordin of divin 
servic and a worldli sanctuari 

9 2 for there wa a tabernacl made the first wherein wa the 
candlestick and the tabl and the shewbread which is call the 
sanctuari 

9 3 and after the second veil the tabernacl which is call the 
holiest of all 9 4 which had the golden censer and the ark of the 
coven overlaid round about with gold wherein wa the golden pot 
that had manna and aaron s rod that bud and the tabl of the 
coven 9 5 and over it the cherub of glori shadow the 
mercyseat of which we cannot now speak particularli 

9 6 now when these thing were thu ordain the priest went alway 
into the first tabernacl accomplish the servic of god 

9 7 but into the second went the high priest alon onc everi year 
not without blood which he offer for himself and for the error of 
the peopl 9 8 the holi ghost thi signifi that the way into the 
holiest of all wa not yet made manifest while a the first 
tabernacl wa yet stand 9 9 which wa a figur for the time then 
present in which were offer both gift and sacrif that could 
not make him that did the servic perfect a pertain to the 
conscienc 9 10 which stood onli in meat and drink and diver 
wash and carnal ordin impo on them until the time of 
reform 

9 11 but christ be come an high priest of good thing to come by a 
greater and more perfect tabernacl not made with hand that is to 
say not of thi build 9 12 neither by the blood of goat and 
calf but by hi own blood he enter in onc into the holi place 
have obtain etern redempt for u 

9 13 for if the blood of bull and of goat and the ash of an 
heifer sprinkl the unclean sanctifieth to the purifi of the 
flesh 9 14 how much more shall the blood of christ who through the 
etern spirit offer himself without spot to god purg your 
conscienc from dead work to serv the live god 9 15 and for thi 
cau he is the mediat of the new testament that by mean of death 
for the redempt of the transgress that were under the first 
testament they which are call might receiv the promi of etern 
inherit 

9 16 for where a testament is there must also of necess be the 
death of the testat 

9 17 for a testament is of forc after men are dead otherwi it is 
of no strength at all while the testat liveth 

9 18 whereupon neither the first testament wa dedic without 
blood 

9 19 for when mose had spoken everi precept to all the peopl 
accord to the law he took the blood of calf and of goat with 
water and scarlet wool and hyssop and sprinkl both the book and 
all the peopl 9 20 say thi is the blood of the testament which 
god hath enjoin unto you 

9 21 moreov he sprinkl with blood both the tabernacl and all the 
vessel of the ministri 

9 22 and almost all thing are by the law purg with blood and 
without shed of blood is no remiss 

9 23 it wa therefor necessari that the pattern of thing in the 
heaven should be purifi with these but the heavenli thing 
themselv with better sacrif than these 

9 24 for christ is not enter into the holi place made with hand 
which are the figur of the true but into heaven itself now to 
appear in the presenc of god for u 9 25 nor yet that he should 
offer himself often a the high priest entereth into the holi place 
everi year with blood of other 9 26 for then must he often have 
suffer sinc the foundat of the world but now onc in the end of 
the world hath he appear to put away sin by the sacrif of 
himself 

9 27 and a it is appoint unto men onc to die but after thi the 
judgment 9 28 so christ wa onc offer to bear the sin of mani 
and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time 
without sin unto salvat 

10 1 for the law have a shadow of good thing to come and not the 
veri imag of the thing can never with those sacrif which they 
offer year by year continu make the comer thereunto perfect 

10 2 for then would they not have cea to be offer becau that 
the worshipp onc purg should have had no more conscienc of 
sin 

10 3 but in those sacrif there is a remembr again made of sin 
everi year 

10 4 for it is not possibl that the blood of bull and of goat 
should take away sin 

10 5 wherefor when he cometh into the world he saith sacrif and 
offer thou wouldest not but a bodi hast thou prepar me 10 6 in 
burnt offer and sacrif for sin thou hast had no pleasur 

10 7 then said i lo i come in the volum of the book it is written 
of me to do thi will o god 

10 8 abov when he said sacrif and offer and burnt offer 
and offer for sin thou wouldest not neither hadst pleasur 
therein which are offer by the law 10 9 then said he lo i come 
to do thi will o god he taketh away the first that he may establish 
the second 

10 10 by the which will we are sanctifi through the offer of the 
bodi of jesu christ onc for all 

10 11 and everi priest standeth daili minist and offer 
oftentim the same sacrif which can never take away sin 10 12 
but thi man after he had offer one sacrif for sin for ever 
sat down on the right hand of god 10 13 from henceforth expect 
till hi enemi be made hi footstool 

10 14 for by one offer he hath perfect for ever them that are 
sanctifi 

10 15 whereof the holi ghost also is a wit to u for after that 
he had said befor 10 16 thi is the coven that i will make with 
them after those day saith the lord i will put my law into their 
heart and in their mind will i write them 10 17 and their sin and 
iniqu will i rememb no more 

10 18 now where remiss of these is there is no more offer for 
sin 

10 19 have therefor brother bold to enter into the holiest 
by the blood of jesu 10 20 by a new and live way which he hath 
consecr for u through the veil that is to say hi flesh 10 21 
and have an high priest over the hou of god 10 22 let u draw 
near with a true heart in full assur of faith have our heart 
sprinkl from an evil conscienc and our bodi wash with pure 
water 

10 23 let u hold fast the profess of our faith without waver 
for he is faith that promi 10 24 and let u consid one 
anoth to provok unto love and to good work 10 25 not forsak 
the assembl of ourselv togeth a the manner of some is but 
exhort one anoth and so much the more a ye see the day 
approach 

10 26 for if we sin wil after that we have receiv the knowledg 
of the truth there remaineth no more sacrif for sin 10 27 but a 
certain fear look for of judgment and fieri indign which 
shall devour the adversari 

10 28 he that despi mose law die without merci under two or 
three wit 10 29 of how much sorer punish suppo ye shall 
he be thought worthi who hath trodden under foot the son of god and 
hath count the blood of the coven wherewith he wa sanctifi 
an unholi thing and hath done despit unto the spirit of grace 
10 30 for we know him that hath said vengeanc belongeth unto me i 
will recompen saith the lord and again the lord shall judg hi 
peopl 

10 31 it is a fear thing to fall into the hand of the live god 

10 32 but call to remembr the former day in which after ye were 
illumin ye endur a great fight of afflict 10 33 partli 
whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproach and afflict 
and partli whilst ye becam companion of them that were so use 

10 34 for ye had compass of me in my bond and took joy the 
spoil of your good know in yourselv that ye have in heaven a 
better and an endur substanc 

10 35 cast not away therefor your confid which hath great 
recomp of reward 

10 36 for ye have need of patienc that after ye have done the will 
of god ye might receiv the promi 

10 37 for yet a littl while and he that shall come will come and 
will not tarri 

10 38 now the just shall live by faith but if ani man draw back my 
soul shall have no pleasur in him 

10 39 but we are not of them who draw back unto perdit but of them 
that believ to the save of the soul 

11 1 now faith is the substanc of thing hope for the evid of 
thing not seen 

11 2 for by it the elder obtain a good report 

11 3 through faith we understand that the world were frame by the 
word of god so that thing which are seen were not made of thing 
which do appear 

11 4 by faith abel offer unto god a more excel sacrif than 
cain by which he obtain wit that he wa righteou god 
testifi of hi gift and by it he be dead yet speaketh 

11 5 by faith enoch wa translat that he should not see death and 
wa not found becau god had translat him for befor hi 
translat he had thi testimoni that he plea god 

11 6 but without faith it is imposs to plea him for he that 
cometh to god must believ that he is and that he is a reward of 
them that dilig seek him 

11 7 by faith noah be warn of god of thing not seen a yet 
move with fear prepar an ark to the save of hi hou by the 
which he condemn the world and becam heir of the righteou 
which is by faith 

11 8 by faith abraham when he wa call to go out into a place which 
he should after receiv for an inherit obey and he went out 
not know whither he went 

11 9 by faith he sojourn in the land of promi a in a strang 
countri dwell in tabernacl with isaac and jacob the heir with 
him of the same promi 11 10 for he look for a citi which hath 
foundat whose builder and maker is god 

11 11 through faith also sara herself receiv strength to conceiv 
seed and wa deliv of a child when she wa past age becau she 
judg him faith who had promi 

11 12 therefor sprang there even of one and him a good a dead so 
mani a the star of the sky in multitud and a the sand which is by 
the sea shore innum 

11 13 these all die in faith not have receiv the promi but 
have seen them afar off and were persuad of them and embrac 
them and confess that they were stranger and pilgrim on the 
earth 

11 14 for they that say such thing declar plainli that they seek a 
countri 

11 15 and truli if they had been mind of that countri from whenc 
they came out they might have had opportun to have return 

11 16 but now they desir a better countri that is an heavenli 
wherefor god is not asham to be call their god for he hath 
prepar for them a citi 

11 17 by faith abraham when he wa tri offer up isaac and he 
that had receiv the promi offer up hi onli begotten son 11 18 
of whom it wa said that in isaac shall thi seed be call 11 19 
account that god wa abl to rai him up even from the dead from 
whenc also he receiv him in a figur 

11 20 by faith isaac bless jacob and esau concern thing to come 

11 21 by faith jacob when he wa a die bless both the son of 
joseph and worship lean upon the top of hi staff 

11 22 by faith joseph when he die made mention of the depart of 
the child of israel and gave command concern hi bone 

11 23 by faith mose when he wa born wa hid three month of hi 
parent becau they saw he wa a proper child and they were not 
afraid of the king s command 

11 24 by faith mose when he wa come to year refu to be call 
the son of pharaoh s daughter 11 25 choo rather to suffer 
afflict with the peopl of god than to enjoy the pleasur of sin 
for a season 11 26 esteem the reproach of christ greater rich 
than the treasur in egypt for he had respect unto the recomp of 
the reward 

11 27 by faith he forsook egypt not fear the wrath of the king 
for he endur a see him who is invi 

11 28 through faith he kept the passov and the sprinkl of blood 
lest he that destroy the firstborn should touch them 

11 29 by faith they pa through the red sea a by dri land which 
the egyptian assay to do were drown 

11 30 by faith the wall of jericho fell down after they were 
compass about seven day 

11 31 by faith the harlot rahab perish not with them that believ 
not when she had receiv the spi with peac 

11 32 and what shall i more say for the time would fail me to tell of 
gedeon and of barak and of samson and of jephtha of david also 
and samuel and of the prophet 11 33 who through faith subdu 
kingdom wrought righteou obtain promi stop the mouth 
of lion 

11 34 quench the violenc of fire escap the edg of the sword 
out of weak were made strong wax valiant in fight turn to 
flight the armi of the alien 

11 35 woman receiv their dead rai to life again and other were 
tortur not accept deliv that they might obtain a better 
resurrect 11 36 and other had trial of cruel mock and 
scourg yea moreov of bond and imprison 11 37 they were 
stone they were sawn asund were tempt were slain with the 
sword they wander about in sheepskin and goatskin be 
destitut afflict torment 11 38 of whom the world wa not 
worthi they wander in desert and in mountain and in den and 
cave of the earth 

11 39 and these all have obtain a good report through faith 
receiv not the promi 11 40 god have provid some better thing 
for u that they without u should not be made perfect 

12 1 wherefor see we also are compass about with so great a 
cloud of wit let u lay asid everi weight and the sin which 
doth so easili beset u and let u run with patienc the race that is 
set befor u 12 2 look unto jesu the author and finish of our 
faith who for the joy that wa set befor him endur the cross 
despi the shame and is set down at the right hand of the throne 
of god 

12 3 for consid him that endur such contradict of sinner 
against himself lest ye be weari and faint in your mind 

12 4 ye have not yet resist unto blood strive against sin 

12 5 and ye have forgotten the exhort which speaketh unto you a 
unto child my son despi not thou the chasten of the lord 
nor faint when thou art rebuk of him 12 6 for whom the lord loveth 
he chasteneth and scourgeth everi son whom he receiveth 

12 7 if ye endur chasten god dealeth with you a with son for 
what son is he whom the father chasteneth not 12 8 but if ye be 
without chasti whereof all are partak then are ye bastard 
and not son 

12 9 furthermor we have had father of our flesh which correct u 
and we gave them rever shall we not much rather be in subject 
unto the father of spirit and live 12 10 for they verili for a few 
day chasten u after their own pleasur but he for our profit 
that we might be partak of hi holi 

12 11 now no chasten for the present seemeth to be joyou but 
grievou nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceabl fruit of 
righteou unto them which are exerci therebi 

12 12 wherefor lift up the hand which hang down and the feebl 
knee 12 13 and make straight path for your foot lest that which is 
lame be turn out of the way but let it rather be heal 

12 14 follow peac with all men and holi without which no man 
shall see the lord 12 15 look dilig lest ani man fail of the 
grace of god lest ani root of bitter spring up troubl you 
and therebi mani be defil 12 16 lest there be ani fornic or 
profan person a esau who for one morsel of meat sold hi 
birthright 

12 17 for ye know how that afterward when he would have inherit the 
bless he wa reject for he found no place of repent though 
he sought it care with tear 

12 18 for ye are not come unto the mount that might be touch and 
that burn with fire nor unto black and dark and tempest 
12 19 and the sound of a trumpet and the voic of word which voic 
they that heard intreat that the word should not be spoken to them 
ani more 12 20 for they could not endur that which wa command 
and if so much a a beast touch the mountain it shall be stone or 
thrust through with a dart 12 21 and so terribl wa the sight that 
mose said i exceedingli fear and quak 12 22 but ye are come unto 
mount sion and unto the citi of the live god the heavenli 
jerusalem and to an innum compani of angel 12 23 to the 
gener assembl and church of the firstborn which are written in 
heaven and to god the judg of all and to the spirit of just men 
made perfect 12 24 and to jesu the mediat of the new coven and 
to the blood of sprinkl that speaketh better thing than that of 
abel 

12 25 see that ye refu not him that speaketh for if they escap 
not who refu him that spake on earth much more shall not we 
escap if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven 12 26 
whose voic then shook the earth but now he hath promi say 
yet onc more i shake not the earth onli but also heaven 

12 27 and thi word yet onc more signifieth the remov of those 
thing that are shaken a of thing that are made that those thing 
which cannot be shaken may remain 

12 28 wherefor we receiv a kingdom which cannot be move let u 
have grace wherebi we may serv god accept with rever and 
godli fear 12 29 for our god is a consum fire 

13 1 let brotherli love continu 

13 2 be not forget to entertain stranger for therebi some have 
entertain angel unawar 

13 3 rememb them that are in bond a bound with them and them 
which suffer adver a be yourselv also in the bodi 

13 4 marriag is honour in all and the bed undefil but 
whoremong and adult god will judg 

13 5 let your conver be without covet and be content 
with such thing a ye have for he hath said i will never leav 
thee nor forsak thee 

13 6 so that we may boldli say the lord is my helper and i will not 
fear what man shall do unto me 

13 7 rememb them which have the rule over you who have spoken unto 
you the word of god whose faith follow consid the end of their 
conver 

13 8 jesu christ the same yesterday and to day and for ever 

13 9 be not carri about with diver and strang doctrin for it is 
a good thing that the heart be establish with grace not with meat 
which have not profit them that have been occupi therein 

13 10 we have an altar whereof they have no right to eat which serv 
the tabernacl 

13 11 for the bodi of those beast whose blood is brought into the 
sanctuari by the high priest for sin are burn without the camp 

13 12 wherefor jesu also that he might sanctifi the peopl with hi 
own blood suffer without the gate 

13 13 let u go forth therefor unto him without the camp bear hi 
reproach 

13 14 for here have we no continu citi but we seek one to come 

13 15 by him therefor let u offer the sacrif of prai to god 
continu that is the fruit of our lip give thank to hi name 

13 16 but to do good and to commun forget not for with such 
sacrif god is well plea 

13 17 obey them that have the rule over you and submit yourselv 
for they watch for your soul a they that must give account that 
they may do it with joy and not with grief for that is unprofit 
for you 

13 18 pray for u for we trust we have a good conscienc in all 
thing will to live honestli 

13 19 but i beseech you the rather to do thi that i may be restor 
to you the sooner 

13 20 now the god of peac that brought again from the dead our lord 
jesu that great shepherd of the sheep through the blood of the 
everlast coven 13 21 make you perfect in everi good work to do 
hi will work in you that which is wellplea in hi sight 
through jesu christ to whom be glori for ever and ever amen 

13 22 and i beseech you brother suffer the word of exhort for 
i have written a letter unto you in few word 

13 23 know ye that our brother timothi is set at liberti with whom 
if he come shortli i will see you 

13 24 salut all them that have the rule over you and all the saint 

they of itali salut you 

13 25 grace be with you all amen 




the gener epistl of jame 


1 1 jame a servant of god and of the lord jesu christ 
to the twelv tribe which are scatter abroad greet 

1 2 my brother count it all joy when ye fall into diver 
temptat 1 3 know thi that the tri of your faith worketh 
patienc 

1 4 but let patienc have her perfect work that ye may be perfect and 
entir want noth 

1 5 if ani of you lack wisdom let him ask of god that giveth to all 
men liber and upbraideth not and it shall be given him 

1 6 but let him ask in faith noth waver for he that wavereth 
is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and toss 

1 7 for let not that man think that he shall receiv ani thing of the 
lord 

1 8 a doubl mind man is unstabl in all hi way 

1 9 let the brother of low degr rejoic in that he is exalt 1 10 
but the rich in that he is made low becau a the flower of the 
grass he shall pa away 

1 11 for the sun is no sooner risen with a burn heat but it 
withereth the grass and the flower thereof falleth and the grace of 
the fashion of it perisheth so also shall the rich man fade away in 
hi way 

1 12 bless is the man that endureth temptat for when he is 
tri he shall receiv the crown of life which the lord hath 
promi to them that love him 

1 13 let no man say when he is tempt i am tempt of god for god 
cannot be tempt with evil neither tempteth he ani man 1 14 but 
everi man is tempt when he is drawn away of hi own lust and 
entic 

1 15 then when lust hath conceiv it bringeth forth sin and sin 
when it is finish bringeth forth death 

1 16 do not err my belov brother 

1 17 everi good gift and everi perfect gift is from abov and cometh 
down from the father of light with whom is no variabl neither 
shadow of turn 

1 18 of hi own will begat he u with the word of truth that we 
should be a kind of firstfruit of hi creatur 

1 19 wherefor my belov brother let everi man be swift to hear 
slow to speak slow to wrath 1 20 for the wrath of man worketh not 
the righteou of god 

1 21 wherefor lay apart all filthi and superflu of 
naughti and receiv with meek the engraft word which is 
abl to save your soul 

1 22 but be ye doer of the word and not hearer onli deceiv your 
own self 

1 23 for if ani be a hearer of the word and not a doer he is like 
unto a man behold hi natur face in a glass 1 24 for he 
beholdeth himself and goeth hi way and straightway forgetteth what 
manner of man he wa 

1 25 but whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberti and continueth 
therein he be not a forget hearer but a doer of the work thi 
man shall be bless in hi deed 

1 26 if ani man among you seem to be religi and bridleth not hi 
tongu but deceiveth hi own heart thi man s religion is vain 

1 27 pure religion and undefil befor god and the father is thi to 
visit the fatherless and widow in their afflict and to keep 
himself unspot from the world 

2 1 my brother have not the faith of our lord jesu christ the lord 
of glori with respect of person 

2 2 for if there come unto your assembl a man with a gold ring in 
goodli apparel and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment 2 3 
and ye have respect to him that weareth the gay cloth and say unto 
him sit thou here in a good place and say to the poor stand thou 
there or sit here under my footstool 2 4 are ye not then partial in 
yourselv and are becom judg of evil thought 2 5 hearken my 
belov brother hath not god chosen the poor of thi world rich in 
faith and heir of the kingdom which he hath promi to them that 
love him 2 6 but ye have despi the poor do not rich men oppress 
you and draw you befor the judgment seat 2 7 do not they 
blasphem that worthi name by the which ye are call 2 8 if ye 
fulfil the royal law accord to the scriptur thou shalt love thi 
neighbour a thyself ye do well 2 9 but if ye have respect to 
person ye commit sin and are convinc of the law a transgressor 

2 10 for whosoev shall keep the whole law and yet offend in one 
point he is guilti of all 

2 11 for he that said do not commit adulteri said also do not kill 
now if thou commit no adulteri yet if thou kill thou art becom a 
transgressor of the law 

2 12 so speak ye and so do a they that shall be judg by the law 
of liberti 

2 13 for he shall have judgment without merci that hath shew no 
merci and merci rejoiceth against judgment 

2 14 what doth it profit my brother though a man say he hath faith 
and have not work can faith save him 2 15 if a brother or sister 
be nake and destitut of daili food 2 16 and one of you say unto 
them depart in peac be ye warm and fill notwithstand ye 
give them not those thing which are need to the bodi what doth it 
profit 2 17 even so faith if it hath not work is dead be 
alon 

2 18 yea a man may say thou hast faith and i have work shew me 
thi faith without thi work and i will shew thee my faith by my 
work 

2 19 thou believest that there is one god thou doest well the devil 
also believ and trembl 

2 20 but wilt thou know o vain man that faith without work is dead 
2 21 wa not abraham our father justifi by work when he had 
offer isaac hi son upon the altar 2 22 seest thou how faith 
wrought with hi work and by work wa faith made perfect 2 23 and 
the scriptur wa fulfil which saith abraham believ god and it 
wa imput unto him for righteou and he wa call the friend 
of god 

2 24 ye see then how that by work a man is justifi and not by 
faith onli 

2 25 likewi also wa not rahab the harlot justifi by work when 
she had receiv the messeng and had sent them out anoth way 
2 26 for a the bodi without the spirit is dead so faith without 
work is dead also 

3 1 my brother be not mani master know that we shall receiv 
the greater condemn 

3 2 for in mani thing we offend all if ani man offend not in word 
the same is a perfect man and abl also to bridl the whole bodi 

3 3 behold we put bit in the hor mouth that they may obey u 
and we turn about their whole bodi 

3 4 behold also the ship which though they be so great and are 
driven of fierc wind yet are they turn about with a veri small 
helm whithersoev the governor listeth 

3 5 even so the tongu is a littl member and boasteth great thing 

behold how great a matter a littl fire kindleth 3 6 and the tongu 
is a fire a world of iniqu so is the tongu among our member 
that it defileth the whole bodi and setteth on fire the cour of 
natur and it is set on fire of hell 

3 7 for everi kind of beast and of bird and of serpent and of 
thing in the sea is tame and hath been tame of mankind 3 8 but 
the tongu can no man tame it is an unruli evil full of deadli 
poison 

3 9 therewith bless we god even the father and therewith cur we 
men which are made after the similitud of god 

3 10 out of the same mouth proceedeth bless and cur my 
brother these thing ought not so to be 

3 11 doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and 
bitter 3 12 can the fig tree my brother bear oliv berri 
either a vine fig so can no fountain both yield salt water and 
fresh 

3 13 who is a wise man and endu with knowledg among you let him 
shew out of a good conver hi work with meek of wisdom 

3 14 but if ye have bitter envi and strife in your heart glori 
not and lie not against the truth 

3 15 thi wisdom descendeth not from abov but is earthli sensual 
devilish 

3 16 for where envi and strife is there is confu and everi 
evil work 

3 17 but the wisdom that is from abov is first pure then peaceabl 
gentl and easi to be intreat full of merci and good fruit 
without partial and without hypocrisi 

3 18 and the fruit of righteou is sown in peac of them that make 
peac 

4 1 from whenc come war and fight among you come they not 
henc even of your lust that war in your member 4 2 ye lust and 
have not ye kill and desir to have and cannot obtain ye fight and 
war yet ye have not becau ye ask not 

4 3 ye ask and receiv not becau ye ask amiss that ye may consum 
it upon your lust 

4 4 ye adult and adulteress know ye not that the friendship of 
the world is enmiti with god whosoev therefor will be a friend of 
the world is the enemi of god 

4 5 do ye think that the scriptur saith in vain the spirit that 
dwelleth in u lusteth to envi 4 6 but he giveth more grace 
wherefor he saith god resisteth the proud but giveth grace unto the 
humbl 

4 7 submit yourselv therefor to god resist the devil and he will 
flee from you 

4 8 draw nigh to god and he will draw nigh to you clean your 
hand ye sinner and purifi your heart ye doubl mind 

4 9 be afflict and mourn and weep let your laughter be turn to 
mourn and your joy to heavi 

4 10 humbl yourselv in the sight of the lord and he shall lift you 
up 

4 11 speak not evil one of anoth brother he that speaketh evil of 
hi brother and judgeth hi brother speaketh evil of the law and 
judgeth the law but if thou judg the law thou art not a doer of the 
law but a judg 

4 12 there is one lawgiv who is abl to save and to destroy who 
art thou that judgest anoth 4 13 go to now ye that say to day or 
to morrow we will go into such a citi and continu there a year and 
buy and sell and get gain 4 14 wherea ye know not what shall be on 
the morrow for what is your life it is even a vapour that appeareth 
for a littl time and then vanisheth away 

4 15 for that ye ought to say if the lord will we shall live and do 
thi or that 

4 16 but now ye rejoic in your boast all such rejoic is evil 

4 17 therefor to him that knoweth to do good and doeth it not to 
him it is sin 

5 1 go to now ye rich men weep and howl for your miseri that shall 
come upon you 

5 2 your rich are corrupt and your garment are motheaten 

5 3 your gold and silver is canker and the rust of them shall be a 
wit against you and shall eat your flesh a it were fire ye have 
heap treasur togeth for the last day 

5 4 behold the hire of the labour who have reap down your 
field which is of you kept back by fraud crieth and the cri of 
them which have reap are enter into the ear of the lord of 
sabaoth 

5 5 ye have live in pleasur on the earth and been wanton ye have 
nourish your heart a in a day of slaughter 

5 6 ye have condemn and kill the just and he doth not resist you 

5 7 be patient therefor brother unto the come of the lord 

behold the husbandman waiteth for the preciou fruit of the earth 
and hath long patienc for it until he receiv the earli and latter 
rain 

5 8 be ye also patient stablish your heart for the come of the 
lord draweth nigh 

5 9 grudg not one against anoth brother lest ye be condemn 
behold the judg standeth befor the door 

5 10 take my brother the prophet who have spoken in the name of 
the lord for an exampl of suffer afflict and of patienc 

5 11 behold we count them happi which endur ye have heard of the 
patienc of job and have seen the end of the lord that the lord is 
veri piti and of tender merci 

5 12 but abov all thing my brother swear not neither by heaven 
neither by the earth neither by ani other oath but let your yea be 
yea and your nay nay lest ye fall into condemn 

5 13 is ani among you afflict let him pray is ani merri let him 
sing psalm 

5 14 is ani sick among you let him call for the elder of the church 
and let them pray over him anoint him with oil in the name of the 
lord 5 15 and the prayer of faith shall save the sick and the lord 
shall rai him up and if he have commit sin they shall be 
forgiven him 

5 16 confess your fault one to anoth and pray one for anoth 
that ye may be heal the effectu fervent prayer of a righteou man 
availeth much 

5 17 elia wa a man subject to like passion a we are and he pray 
earnestli that it might not rain and it rain not on the earth by 
the space of three year and six month 

5 18 and he pray again and the heaven gave rain and the earth 
brought forth her fruit 

5 19 brother if ani of you do err from the truth and one convert 
him 5 20 let him know that he which converteth the sinner from the 
error of hi way shall save a soul from death and shall hide a 
multitud of sin 




the first epistl gener of peter 


1 1 peter an apostl of jesu christ to the stranger scatter 
throughout pontu galatia cappadocia asia and bithynia 1 2 elect 
accord to the foreknowledg of god the father through 
sanctif of the spirit unto obedi and sprinkl of the 
blood of jesu christ grace unto you and peac be multipli 

1 3 bless be the god and father of our lord jesu christ which 
accord to hi abund merci hath begotten u again unto a live 
hope by the resurrect of jesu christ from the dead 1 4 to an 
inherit incorrupt and undefil and that fadeth not away 
reserv in heaven for you 1 5 who are kept by the power of god 
through faith unto salvat readi to be reveal in the last time 

1 6 wherein ye greatli rejoic though now for a season if need be 
ye are in heavi through manifold temptat 1 7 that the trial 
of your faith be much more preciou than of gold that perisheth 
though it be tri with fire might be found unto prai and honour 
and glori at the appear of jesu christ 1 8 whom have not seen 
ye love in whom though now ye see him not yet believ ye rejoic 
with joy unspeak and full of glori 1 9 receiv the end of your 
faith even the salvat of your soul 

1 10 of which salvat the prophet have enquir and search 
dilig who prophesi of the grace that should come unto you 
1 11 search what or what manner of time the spirit of christ which 
wa in them did signifi when it testifi beforehand the suffer 
of christ and the glori that should follow 

1 12 unto whom it wa reveal that not unto themselv but unto u 
they did minist the thing which are now report unto you by them 
that have preach the gospel unto you with the holi ghost sent down 
from heaven which thing the angel desir to look into 

1 13 wherefor gird up the loin of your mind be sober and hope to 
the end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revel 
of jesu christ 1 14 a obedi child not fashion yourselv 
accord to the former lust in your ignor 1 15 but a he which 
hath call you is holi so be ye holi in all manner of conver 
1 16 becau it is written be ye holi for i am holi 

1 17 and if ye call on the father who without respect of person 
judgeth accord to everi man s work pa the time of your 
sojourn here in fear 1 18 forasmuch a ye know that ye were not 
redeem with corrupt thing a silver and gold from your vain 
conver receiv by tradit from your father 1 19 but with 
the preciou blood of christ a of a lamb without blemish and without 
spot 1 20 who verili wa foreordain befor the foundat of the 
world but wa manifest in these last time for you 1 21 who by him 
do believ in god that rai him up from the dead and gave him 
glori that your faith and hope might be in god 

1 22 see ye have purifi your soul in obey the truth through 
the spirit unto unfeign love of the brother see that ye love one 
anoth with a pure heart fervent 1 23 be born again not of 
corrupt seed but of incorrupt by the word of god which 
liveth and abideth for ever 

1 24 for all flesh is a grass and all the glori of man a the flower 
of grass the grass withereth and the flower thereof falleth away 
1 25 but the word of the lord endureth for ever and thi is the word 
which by the gospel is preach unto you 

2 1 wherefor lay asid all malic and all guil and hypocrisi 
and envi all evil speak 2 2 a newborn babe desir the 
sincer milk of the word that ye may grow therebi 2 3 if so be ye 
have tast that the lord is graciou 

2 4 to whom come a unto a live stone disallow ind of men 
but chosen of god and preciou 2 5 ye also a live stone are 
built up a spiritu hou an holi priesthood to offer up spiritu 
sacrif accept to god by jesu christ 

2 6 wherefor also it is contain in the scriptur behold i lay in 
sion a chief corner stone elect preciou and he that believeth on 
him shall not be confound 

2 7 unto you therefor which believ he is preciou but unto them 
which be disobedi the stone which the builder disallow the 
same is made the head of the corner 2 8 and a stone of stumbl and 
a rock of offenc even to them which stumbl at the word be 
disobedi whereunto also they were appoint 

2 9 but ye are a chosen gener a royal priesthood an holi 
nation a peculiar peopl that ye should shew forth the prai of 
him who hath call you out of dark into hi marvel light 
2 10 which in time past were not a peopl but are now the peopl of 
god which had not obtain merci but now have obtain merci 

2 11 dearli belov i beseech you a stranger and pilgrim abstain 
from fleshli lust which war against the soul 2 12 have your 
conver honest among the gentil that wherea they speak 
against you a evildo they may by your good work which they 
shall behold glorifi god in the day of visit 

2 13 submit yourselv to everi ordin of man for the lord s sake 
whether it be to the king a suprem 2 14 or unto governor a unto 
them that are sent by him for the punish of evildo and for the 
prai of them that do well 

2 15 for so is the will of god that with well do ye may put to 
silenc the ignor of foolish men 2 16 a free and not use your 
liberti for a cloke of malici but a the servant of god 

2 17 honour all men love the brotherhood fear god honour the king 

2 18 servant be subject to your master with all fear not onli to 
the good and gentl but also to the froward 

2 19 for thi is thankworthi if a man for conscienc toward god 
endur grief suffer wrong 

2 20 for what glori is it if when ye be buffet for your fault ye 
shall take it patient but if when ye do well and suffer for it 
ye take it patient thi is accept with god 

2 21 for even hereunto were ye call becau christ also suffer 
for u leav u an exampl that ye should follow hi step 2 22 
who did no sin neither wa guil found in hi mouth 2 23 who when 
he wa revil revil not again when he suffer he threaten 
not but commit himself to him that judgeth righteou 2 24 who 
hi own self bare our sin in hi own bodi on the tree that we be 
dead to sin should live unto righteou by whose stripe ye were 
heal 

2 25 for ye were a sheep go astray but are now return unto the 
shepherd and bishop of your soul 

3 1 likewi ye wife be in subject to your own husband that 
if ani obey not the word they also may without the word be won by the 
conver of the wife 3 2 while they behold your chast 
conver coupl with fear 

3 3 whose adorn let it not be that outward adorn of plait the 
hair and of wear of gold or of put on of apparel 3 4 but let 
it be the hidden man of the heart in that which is not corrupt 
even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit which is in the sight of 
god of great price 

3 5 for after thi manner in the old time the holi woman also who 
trust in god adorn themselv be in subject unto their own 
husband 3 6 even a sara obey abraham call him lord whose 
daughter ye are a long a ye do well and are not afraid with ani 
amaz 

3 7 likewi ye husband dwell with them accord to knowledg 
give honour unto the wife a unto the weaker vessel and a be 
heir togeth of the grace of life that your prayer be not 
hinder 

3 8 final be ye all of one mind have compass one of anoth 
love a brother be piti be courteou 3 9 not render evil for 
evil or rail for rail but contrariwi bless know that 
ye are thereunto call that ye should inherit a bless 

3 10 for he that will love life and see good day let him refrain 
hi tongu from evil and hi lip that they speak no guil 3 11 let 
him eschew evil and do good let him seek peac and ensu it 

3 12 for the eye of the lord are over the righteou and hi ear are 
open unto their prayer but the face of the lord is against them that 
do evil 

3 13 and who is he that will harm you if ye be follow of that 
which is good 3 14 but and if ye suffer for righteou sake 
happi are ye and be not afraid of their terror neither be troubl 
3 15 but sanctifi the lord god in your heart and be readi alway to 
give an answer to everi man that asketh you a reason of the hope that 
is in you with meek and fear 3 16 have a good conscienc that 
wherea they speak evil of you a of evildo they may be asham 
that fal accu your good conver in christ 

3 17 for it is better if the will of god be so that ye suffer for 
well do than for evil do 

3 18 for christ also hath onc suffer for sin the just for the 
unjust that he might bring u to god be put to death in the 
flesh but quicken by the spirit 3 19 by which also he went and 
preach unto the spirit in prison 3 20 which sometim were 
disobedi when onc the longsuff of god wait in the day of 
noah while the ark wa a prepar wherein few that is eight soul 
were save by water 

3 21 the like figur whereunto even baptism doth also now save u not 
the put away of the filth of the flesh but the answer of a good 
conscienc toward god by the resurrect of jesu christ 3 22 who 
is gone into heaven and is on the right hand of god angel and 
author and power be made subject unto him 

4 1 forasmuch then a christ hath suffer for u in the flesh arm 
yourselv likewi with the same mind for he that hath suffer in 
the flesh hath cea from sin 4 2 that he no longer should live the 
rest of hi time in the flesh to the lust of men but to the will of 
god 

4 3 for the time past of our life may suffic u to have wrought the 
will of the gentil when we walk in lascivi lust excess 
of wine revel banquet and abomin idolatri 4 4 
wherein they think it strang that ye run not with them to the same 
excess of riot speak evil of you 4 5 who shall give account to 
him that is readi to judg the quick and the dead 

4 6 for for thi cau wa the gospel preach also to them that are 
dead that they might be judg accord to men in the flesh but 
live accord to god in the spirit 

4 7 but the end of all thing is at hand be ye therefor sober and 
watch unto prayer 

4 8 and abov all thing have fervent chariti among yourselv for 
chariti shall cover the multitud of sin 

4 9 use hospit one to anoth without grudg 

4 10 a everi man hath receiv the gift even so minist the same 
one to anoth a good steward of the manifold grace of god 

4 11 if ani man speak let him speak a the oracl of god if ani man 
minist let him do it a of the abil which god giveth that god 
in all thing may be glorifi through jesu christ to whom be prai 
and dominion for ever and ever amen 

4 12 belov think it not strang concern the fieri trial which is 
to tri you a though some strang thing happen unto you 4 13 but 
rejoic inasmuch a ye are partak of christ s suffer that 
when hi glori shall be reveal ye may be glad also with exceed 
joy 

4 14 if ye be reproach for the name of christ happi are ye for the 
spirit of glori and of god resteth upon you on their part he is evil 
spoken of but on your part he is glorifi 

4 15 but let none of you suffer a a murder or a a thief or a an 
evildo or a a busybodi in other men s matter 

4 16 yet if ani man suffer a a christian let him not be asham but 
let him glorifi god on thi behalf 

4 17 for the time is come that judgment must begin at the hou of 
god and if it first begin at u what shall the end be of them that 
obey not the gospel of god 4 18 and if the righteou scarc be 
save where shall the ungodli and the sinner appear 4 19 wherefor 
let them that suffer accord to the will of god commit the keep 
of their soul to him in well do a unto a faith creator 

5 1 the elder which are among you i exhort who am also an elder and 
a wit of the suffer of christ and also a partak of the 
glori that shall be reveal 5 2 feed the flock of god which is among 
you take the oversight thereof not by constraint but willingli 
not for filthi lucr but of a readi mind 5 3 neither a be lord 
over god s heritag but be ensampl to the flock 

5 4 and when the chief shepherd shall appear ye shall receiv a crown 
of glori that fadeth not away 

5 5 likewi ye younger submit yourselv unto the elder yea all 
of you be subject one to anoth and be cloth with humil for 
god resisteth the proud and giveth grace to the humbl 

5 6 humbl yourselv therefor under the mighti hand of god that he 
may exalt you in due time 5 7 cast all your care upon him for he 
careth for you 

5 8 be sober be vigil becau your adversari the devil a a 
roar lion walketh about seek whom he may devour 5 9 whom 
resist stedfast in the faith know that the same afflict are 
accomplish in your brother that are in the world 

5 10 but the god of all grace who hath call u unto hi etern 
glori by christ jesu after that ye have suffer a while make you 
perfect stablish strengthen settl you 

5 11 to him be glori and dominion for ever and ever amen 

5 12 by silvanu a faith brother unto you a i suppo i have 
written briefli exhort and testifi that thi is the true grace 
of god wherein ye stand 

5 13 the church that is at babylon elect togeth with you 
saluteth you and so doth marcu my son 

5 14 greet ye one anoth with a kiss of chariti peac be with you 
all that are in christ jesu amen 




the second gener epistl of peter 


1 1 simon peter a servant and an apostl of jesu christ to them 
that have obtain like preciou faith with u through the 
righteou of god and our saviour jesu christ 1 2 grace and peac 
be multipli unto you through the knowledg of god and of jesu our 
lord 1 3 accord a hi divin power hath given unto u all thing 
that pertain unto life and godli through the knowledg of him 
that hath call u to glori and virtu 1 4 wherebi are given unto u 
exceed great and preciou promi that by these ye might be 
partak of the divin natur have escap the corrupt that is 
in the world through lust 

1 5 and besid thi give all dilig add to your faith virtu 
and to virtu knowledg 1 6 and to knowledg temper and to 
temper patienc and to patienc godli 1 7 and to godli 
brotherli kind and to brotherli kind chariti 

1 8 for if these thing be in you and abound they make you that ye 
shall neither be barren nor unfruit in the knowledg of our lord 
jesu christ 

1 9 but he that lacketh these thing is blind and cannot see afar 
off and hath forgotten that he wa purg from hi old sin 

1 10 wherefor the rather brother give dilig to make your 
call and elect sure for if ye do these thing ye shall never 
fall 1 11 for so an entranc shall be minist unto you abundantli 
into the everlast kingdom of our lord and saviour jesu christ 

1 12 wherefor i will not be neglig to put you alway in 
remembr of these thing though ye know them and be establish 
in the present truth 

1 13 yea i think it meet a long a i am in thi tabernacl to stir 
you up by put you in remembr 1 14 know that shortli i must 
put off thi my tabernacl even a our lord jesu christ hath shew 
me 

1 15 moreov i will endeavour that ye may be abl after my decea to 
have these thing alway in remembr 

1 16 for we have not follow cunningli devi fabl when we made 
known unto you the power and come of our lord jesu christ but were 
eyewit of hi majesti 

1 17 for he receiv from god the father honour and glori when there 
came such a voic to him from the excel glori thi is my belov 
son in whom i am well plea 

1 18 and thi voic which came from heaven we heard when we were with 
him in the holi mount 

1 19 we have also a more sure word of propheci whereunto ye do well 
that ye take heed a unto a light that shineth in a dark place until 
the day dawn and the day star ari in your heart 1 20 know thi 
first that no propheci of the scriptur is of ani privat 
interpret 

1 21 for the propheci came not in old time by the will of man but 
holi men of god spake a they were move by the holi ghost 

2 1 but there were fal prophet also among the peopl even a there 
shall be fal teacher among you who privili shall bring in damnabl 
heresi even deni the lord that bought them and bring upon 
themselv swift destruct 

2 2 and mani shall follow their pernici way by reason of whom the 
way of truth shall be evil spoken of 

2 3 and through covet shall they with feign word make 
merchandi of you whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not 
and their damnat slumbereth not 

2 4 for if god spare not the angel that sin but cast them down 
to hell and deliv them into chain of dark to be reserv 
unto judgment 2 5 and spare not the old world but save noah the 
eighth person a preacher of righteou bring in the flood upon 
the world of the ungodli 2 6 and turn the citi of sodom and 
gomorrha into ash condemn them with an overthrow make them an 
ensampl unto those that after should live ungodli 2 7 and deliv 
just lot vex with the filthi conver of the wick 2 8 for 
that righteou man dwell among them in see and hear vex 
hi righteou soul from day to day with their unlaw deed 2 9 the 
lord knoweth how to deliv the godli out of temptat and to 
reserv the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punish 2 10 but 
chiefli them that walk after the flesh in the lust of unclean and 
despi govern presumptu are they selfwil they are not 
afraid to speak evil of digniti 

2 11 wherea angel which are greater in power and might bring not 
rail accu against them befor the lord 

2 12 but these a natur brute beast made to be taken and 
destroy speak evil of the thing that they understand not and 
shall utterli perish in their own corrupt 2 13 and shall receiv 
the reward of unright a they that count it pleasur to riot 
in the day time spot they are and blemish sport themselv 
with their own deceiv while they feast with you 2 14 have eye 
full of adulteri and that cannot cea from sin beguil unstabl 
soul an heart they have exerci with covet practic cur 
child 2 15 which have forsaken the right way and are gone astray 
follow the way of balaam the son of bosor who love the wage of 
unright 2 16 but wa rebuk for hi iniqu the dumb a 
speak with man s voic forbad the mad of the prophet 

2 17 these are well without water cloud that are carri with a 
tempest to whom the mist of dark is reserv for ever 

2 18 for when they speak great swell word of vaniti they allur 
through the lust of the flesh through much wanton those that 
were clean escap from them who live in error 

2 19 while they promi them liberti they themselv are the servant 
of corrupt for of whom a man is overcom of the same is he 
brought in bondag 

2 20 for if after they have escap the pollut of the world 
through the knowledg of the lord and saviour jesu christ they are 
again entangl therein and overcom the latter end is wor with 
them than the begin 

2 21 for it had been better for them not to have known the way of 
righteou than after they have known it to turn from the holi 
command deliv unto them 

2 22 but it is happen unto them accord to the true proverb the 
dog is turn to hi own vomit again and the sow that wa wash to 
her wallow in the mire 

3 1 thi second epistl belov i now write unto you in both which 
i stir up your pure mind by way of remembr 3 2 that ye may be 
mind of the word which were spoken befor by the holi prophet 
and of the command of u the apostl of the lord and saviour 3 3 
know thi first that there shall come in the last day scoffer 
walk after their own lust 3 4 and say where is the promi of 
hi come for sinc the father fell asleep all thing continu a 
they were from the begin of the creation 

3 5 for thi they willingli are ignor of that by the word of god 
the heaven were of old and the earth stand out of the water and 
in the water 3 6 wherebi the world that then wa be overflow 
with water perish 3 7 but the heaven and the earth which are 
now by the same word are kept in store reserv unto fire against 
the day of judgment and perdit of ungodli men 

3 8 but belov be not ignor of thi one thing that one day is 
with the lord a a thousand year and a thousand year a one day 

3 9 the lord is not slack concern hi promi a some men count 
slack but is longsuff to u ward not will that ani 
should perish but that all should come to repent 

3 10 but the day of the lord will come a a thief in the night in the 
which the heaven shall pa away with a great noi and the element 
shall melt with fervent heat the earth also and the work that are 
therein shall be burn up 

3 11 see then that all these thing shall be dissolv what manner 
of person ought ye to be in all holi conver and godli 3 12 
look for and hast unto the come of the day of god wherein the 
heaven be on fire shall be dissolv and the element shall melt 
with fervent heat 3 13 nevertheless we accord to hi promi 
look for new heaven and a new earth wherein dwelleth righteou 

3 14 wherefor belov see that ye look for such thing be 
dilig that ye may be found of him in peac without spot and 
blameless 

3 15 and account that the longsuff of our lord is salvat even 
a our belov brother paul also accord to the wisdom given unto 
him hath written unto you 3 16 a also in all hi epistl speak 
in them of these thing in which are some thing hard to be 
understood which they that are unlearn and unstabl wrest a they 
do also the other scriptur unto their own destruct 

3 17 ye therefor belov see ye know these thing befor bewar 
lest ye also be led away with the error of the wick fall from 
your own stedfast 

3 18 but grow in grace and in the knowledg of our lord and saviour 
jesu christ to him be glori both now and for ever amen 




the first epistl gener of john 


1 1 that which wa from the begin which we have heard which we 
have seen with our eye which we have look upon and our hand have 
handl of the word of life 1 2 for the life wa manifest and we 
have seen it and bear wit and shew unto you that etern life 
which wa with the father and wa manifest unto u 1 3 that which 
we have seen and heard declar we unto you that ye also may have 
fellowship with u and truli our fellowship is with the father and 
with hi son jesu christ 

1 4 and these thing write we unto you that your joy may be full 

1 5 thi then is the messag which we have heard of him and declar 
unto you that god is light and in him is no dark at all 

1 6 if we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in dark 
we lie and do not the truth 1 7 but if we walk in the light a he 
is in the light we have fellowship one with anoth and the blood of 
jesu christ hi son cleanseth u from all sin 

1 8 if we say that we have no sin we deceiv ourselv and the truth 
is not in u 

1 9 if we confess our sin he is faith and just to forgiv u our 
sin and to clean u from all unright 

1 10 if we say that we have not sin we make him a liar and hi 
word is not in u 

2 1 my littl child these thing write i unto you that ye sin 
not 

and if ani man sin we have an advoc with the father jesu christ 
the righteou 2 2 and he is the propiti for our sin and not 
for our s onli but also for the sin of the whole world 

2 3 and herebi we do know that we know him if we keep hi 
command 

2 4 he that saith i know him and keepeth not hi command is a 
liar and the truth is not in him 

2 5 but whoso keepeth hi word in him verili is the love of god 
perfect herebi know we that we are in him 

2 6 he that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk 
even a he walk 

2 7 brother i write no new command unto you but an old 
command which ye had from the begin the old command is 
the word which ye have heard from the begin 

2 8 again a new command i write unto you which thing is true in 
him and in you becau the dark is past and the true light now 
shineth 

2 9 he that saith he is in the light and hateth hi brother is in 
dark even until now 

2 10 he that loveth hi brother abideth in the light and there is 
none occa of stumbl in him 

2 11 but he that hateth hi brother is in dark and walketh in 
dark and knoweth not whither he goeth becau that dark hath 
blind hi eye 

2 12 i write unto you littl child becau your sin are forgiven 
you for hi name s sake 

2 13 i write unto you father becau ye have known him that is from 
the begin i write unto you young men becau ye have overcom 
the wick one i write unto you littl child becau ye have 
known the father 

2 14 i have written unto you father becau ye have known him that 
is from the begin i have written unto you young men becau ye 
are strong and the word of god abideth in you and ye have overcom 
the wick one 

2 15 love not the world neither the thing that are in the world if 
ani man love the world the love of the father is not in him 

2 16 for all that is in the world the lust of the flesh and the lust 
of the eye and the pride of life is not of the father but is of 
the world 

2 17 and the world passeth away and the lust thereof but he that 
doeth the will of god abideth for ever 

2 18 littl child it is the last time and a ye have heard that 
antichrist shall come even now are there mani antichrist wherebi we 
know that it is the last time 

2 19 they went out from u but they were not of u for if they had 
been of u they would no doubt have continu with u but they went 
out that they might be made manifest that they were not all of u 

2 20 but ye have an unction from the holi one and ye know all thing 

2 21 i have not written unto you becau ye know not the truth but 
becau ye know it and that no lie is of the truth 

2 22 who is a liar but he that denieth that jesu is the christ he is 
antichrist that denieth the father and the son 

2 23 whosoev denieth the son the same hath not the father he that 
acknowledgeth the son hath the father also 

2 24 let that therefor abid in you which ye have heard from the 
begin if that which ye have heard from the begin shall remain 
in you ye also shall continu in the son and in the father 

2 25 and thi is the promi that he hath promi u even etern 
life 

2 26 these thing have i written unto you concern them that seduc 
you 

2 27 but the anoint which ye have receiv of him abideth in you 
and ye need not that ani man teach you but a the same anoint 
teacheth you of all thing and is truth and is no lie and even a 
it hath taught you ye shall abid in him 

2 28 and now littl child abid in him that when he shall 
appear we may have confid and not be asham befor him at hi 
come 

2 29 if ye know that he is righteou ye know that everi one that 
doeth righteou is born of him 

3 1 behold what manner of love the father hath bestow upon u that 
we should be call the son of god therefor the world knoweth u 
not becau it knew him not 

3 2 belov now are we the son of god and it doth not yet appear 
what we shall be but we know that when he shall appear we shall be 
like him for we shall see him a he is 

3 3 and everi man that hath thi hope in him purifieth himself even 
a he is pure 

3 4 whosoev committeth sin transgresseth also the law for sin is 
the transgress of the law 

3 5 and ye know that he wa manifest to take away our sin and in 
him is no sin 

3 6 whosoev abideth in him sinneth not whosoev sinneth hath not 
seen him neither known him 

3 7 littl child let no man deceiv you he that doeth 
righteou is righteou even a he is righteou 

3 8 he that committeth sin is of the devil for the devil sinneth from 
the begin for thi purpo the son of god wa manifest that he 
might destroy the work of the devil 

3 9 whosoev is born of god doth not commit sin for hi seed 
remaineth in him and he cannot sin becau he is born of god 

3 10 in thi the child of god are manifest and the child of the 
devil whosoev doeth not righteou is not of god neither he 
that loveth not hi brother 

3 11 for thi is the messag that ye heard from the begin that we 
should love one anoth 

3 12 not a cain who wa of that wick one and slew hi brother 
and wherefor slew he him becau hi own work were evil and hi 
brother s righteou 

3 13 marvel not my brother if the world hate you 

3 14 we know that we have pa from death unto life becau we love 
the brother he that loveth not hi brother abideth in death 

3 15 whosoev hateth hi brother is a murder and ye know that no 
murder hath etern life abid in him 

3 16 herebi perceiv we the love of god becau he laid down hi life 
for u and we ought to lay down our life for the brother 

3 17 but whoso hath thi world s good and seeth hi brother have 
need and shutteth up hi bowel of compass from him how dwelleth 
the love of god in him 3 18 my littl child let u not love in 
word neither in tongu but in deed and in truth 

3 19 and herebi we know that we are of the truth and shall assur our 
heart befor him 

3 20 for if our heart condemn u god is greater than our heart and 
knoweth all thing 

3 21 belov if our heart condemn u not then have we confid 
toward god 

3 22 and whatsoev we ask we receiv of him becau we keep hi 
command and do those thing that are plea in hi sight 

3 23 and thi is hi command that we should believ on the name 
of hi son jesu christ and love one anoth a he gave u 
command 

3 24 and he that keepeth hi command dwelleth in him and he in 
him 

and herebi we know that he abideth in u by the spirit which he hath 
given u 

4 1 belov believ not everi spirit but tri the spirit whether 
they are of god becau mani fal prophet are gone out into the 
world 

4 2 herebi know ye the spirit of god everi spirit that confesseth 
that jesu christ is come in the flesh is of god 4 3 and everi spirit 
that confesseth not that jesu christ is come in the flesh is not of 
god and thi is that spirit of antichrist whereof ye have heard that 
it should come and even now alreadi is it in the world 

4 4 ye are of god littl child and have overcom them becau 
greater is he that is in you than he that is in the world 

4 5 they are of the world therefor speak they of the world and the 
world heareth them 

4 6 we are of god he that knoweth god heareth u he that is not of 
god heareth not u herebi know we the spirit of truth and the spirit 
of error 

4 7 belov let u love one anoth for love is of god and everi 
one that loveth is born of god and knoweth god 

4 8 he that loveth not knoweth not god for god is love 

4 9 in thi wa manifest the love of god toward u becau that god 
sent hi onli begotten son into the world that we might live through 
him 

4 10 herein is love not that we love god but that he love u and 
sent hi son to be the propiti for our sin 

4 11 belov if god so love u we ought also to love one anoth 

4 12 no man hath seen god at ani time if we love one anoth god 
dwelleth in u and hi love is perfect in u 

4 13 herebi know we that we dwell in him and he in u becau he 
hath given u of hi spirit 

4 14 and we have seen and do testifi that the father sent the son to 
be the saviour of the world 

4 15 whosoev shall confess that jesu is the son of god god 
dwelleth in him and he in god 

4 16 and we have known and believ the love that god hath to u god 
is love and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in god and god in him 

4 17 herein is our love made perfect that we may have bold in the 
day of judgment becau a he is so are we in thi world 

4 18 there is no fear in love but perfect love casteth out fear 
becau fear hath torment he that feareth is not made perfect in 
love 

4 19 we love him becau he first love u 

4 20 if a man say i love god and hateth hi brother he is a liar 
for he that loveth not hi brother whom he hath seen how can he love 
god whom he hath not seen 4 21 and thi command have we from 
him that he who loveth god love hi brother also 

5 1 whosoev believeth that jesu is the christ is born of god and 
everi one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten 
of him 

5 2 by thi we know that we love the child of god when we love 
god and keep hi command 

5 3 for thi is the love of god that we keep hi command and 
hi command are not grievou 

5 4 for whatsoev is born of god overcometh the world and thi is 
the victori that overcometh the world even our faith 

5 5 who is he that overcometh the world but he that believeth that 
jesu is the son of god 5 6 thi is he that came by water and blood 
even jesu christ not by water onli but by water and blood and it 
is the spirit that beareth wit becau the spirit is truth 

5 7 for there are three that bear record in heaven the father the 
word and the holi ghost and these three are one 

5 8 and there are three that bear wit in earth the spirit and 
the water and the blood and these three agr in one 

5 9 if we receiv the wit of men the wit of god is greater 
for thi is the wit of god which he hath testifi of hi son 

5 10 he that believeth on the son of god hath the wit in himself 
he that believeth not god hath made him a liar becau he believeth 
not the record that god gave of hi son 

5 11 and thi is the record that god hath given to u etern life 
and thi life is in hi son 

5 12 he that hath the son hath life and he that hath not the son of 
god hath not life 

5 13 these thing have i written unto you that believ on the name of 
the son of god that ye may know that ye have etern life and that 
ye may believ on the name of the son of god 

5 14 and thi is the confid that we have in him that if we ask 
ani thing accord to hi will he heareth u 5 15 and if we know 
that he hear u whatsoev we ask we know that we have the petit 
that we desir of him 

5 16 if ani man see hi brother sin a sin which is not unto death he 
shall ask and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto 
death there is a sin unto death i do not say that he shall pray for 
it 

5 17 all unright is sin and there is a sin not unto death 

5 18 we know that whosoev is born of god sinneth not but he that is 
begotten of god keepeth himself and that wick one toucheth him not 

5 19 and we know that we are of god and the whole world lieth in 
wick 

5 20 and we know that the son of god is come and hath given u an 
understand that we may know him that is true and we are in him 
that is true even in hi son jesu christ thi is the true god and 
etern life 

5 21 littl child keep yourselv from idol amen 




the second epistl gener of john 


1 1 the elder unto the elect ladi and her child whom i love in 
the truth and not i onli but also all they that have known the 
truth 1 2 for the truth s sake which dwelleth in u and shall be 
with u for ever 

1 3 grace be with you merci and peac from god the father and from 
the lord jesu christ the son of the father in truth and love 

1 4 i rejoic greatli that i found of thi child walk in truth 
a we have receiv a command from the father 

1 5 and now i beseech thee ladi not a though i wrote a new 
command unto thee but that which we had from the begin that 
we love one anoth 

1 6 and thi is love that we walk after hi command thi is the 
command that a ye have heard from the begin ye should walk 
in it 

1 7 for mani deceiv are enter into the world who confess not 
that jesu christ is come in the flesh thi is a deceiv and an 
antichrist 

1 8 look to yourselv that we lose not those thing which we have 
wrought but that we receiv a full reward 

1 9 whosoev transgresseth and abideth not in the doctrin of 
christ hath not god he that abideth in the doctrin of christ he 
hath both the father and the son 

1 10 if there come ani unto you and bring not thi doctrin receiv 
him not into your hou neither bid him god speed 1 11 for he that 
biddeth him god speed is partak of hi evil deed 

1 12 have mani thing to write unto you i would not write with 
paper and ink but i trust to come unto you and speak face to face 
that our joy may be full 

1 13 the child of thi elect sister greet thee amen 




the third epistl gener of john 


1 1 the elder unto the wellbelov gaiu whom i love in the truth 

1 2 belov i wish abov all thing that thou mayest prosper and be 
in health even a thi soul prospereth 

1 3 for i rejoic greatli when the brother came and testifi of 
the truth that is in thee even a thou walkest in the truth 

1 4 i have no greater joy than to hear that my child walk in truth 

1 5 belov thou doest faith whatsoev thou doest to the 
brother and to stranger 1 6 which have born wit of thi 
chariti befor the church whom if thou bring forward on their journey 
after a godli sort thou shalt do well 1 7 becau that for hi 
name s sake they went forth take noth of the gentil 

1 8 we therefor ought to receiv such that we might be fellowhelp 
to the truth 

1 9 i wrote unto the church but diotreph who loveth to have the 
preemin among them receiveth u not 

1 10 wherefor if i come i will rememb hi deed which he doeth 
prate against u with malici word and not content therewith 
neither doth he himself receiv the brother and forbiddeth them that 
would and casteth them out of the church 

1 11 belov follow not that which is evil but that which is good 
he that doeth good is of god but he that doeth evil hath not seen 
god 

1 12 demetriu hath good report of all men and of the truth itself 
yea and we also bear record and ye know that our record is true 

1 13 i had mani thing to write but i will not with ink and pen write 
unto thee 1 14 but i trust i shall shortli see thee and we shall 
speak face to face peac be to thee our friend salut thee greet 
the friend by name 




the gener epistl of jude 


1 1 jude the servant of jesu christ and brother of jame to them 
that are sanctifi by god the father and preserv in jesu christ 
and call 1 2 merci unto you and peac and love be multipli 

1 3 belov when i gave all dilig to write unto you of the common 
salvat it wa need for me to write unto you and exhort you 
that ye should earnestli contend for the faith which wa onc 
deliv unto the saint 

1 4 for there are certain men crept in unawar who were befor of 
old ordain to thi condemn ungodli men turn the grace of 
our god into lascivi and deni the onli lord god and our 
lord jesu christ 

1 5 i will therefor put you in remembr though ye onc knew thi 
how that the lord have save the peopl out of the land of egypt 
afterward destroy them that believ not 

1 6 and the angel which kept not their first estat but left their 
own habit he hath reserv in everlast chain under dark 
unto the judgment of the great day 

1 7 even a sodom and gomorrha and the citi about them in like 
manner give themselv over to fornic and go after strang 
flesh are set forth for an exampl suffer the vengeanc of 
etern fire 

1 8 likewi also these filthi dreamer defil the flesh despi 
dominion and speak evil of digniti 

1 9 yet michael the archangel when contend with the devil he 
disput about the bodi of mose durst not bring against him a 
rail accu but said the lord rebuk thee 

1 10 but these speak evil of those thing which they know not but 
what they know natur a brute beast in those thing they 
corrupt themselv 

1 11 woe unto them for they have gone in the way of cain and ran 
greedili after the error of balaam for reward and perish in the 
gainsay of core 

1 12 these are spot in your feast of chariti when they feast with 
you feed themselv without fear cloud they are without water 
carri about of wind tree whose fruit withereth without fruit 
twice dead pluck up by the root 1 13 rage wave of the sea 
foam out their own shame wander star to whom is reserv the 
black of dark for ever 

1 14 and enoch also the seventh from adam prophesi of these 
say behold the lord cometh with ten thousand of hi saint 1 15 
to execut judgment upon all and to convinc all that are ungodli 
among them of all their ungodli deed which they have ungodli 
commit and of all their hard speech which ungodli sinner have 
spoken against him 

1 16 these are murmur complain walk after their own lust 
and their mouth speaketh great swell word have men s person in 
admir becau of advantag 

1 17 but belov rememb ye the word which were spoken befor of 
the apostl of our lord jesu christ 1 18 how that they told you 
there should be mocker in the last time who should walk after their 
own ungodli lust 

1 19 these be they who separ themselv sensual have not the 
spirit 

1 20 but ye belov build up yourselv on your most holi faith 
pray in the holi ghost 1 21 keep yourselv in the love of god 
look for the merci of our lord jesu christ unto etern life 

1 22 and of some have compass make a differ 1 23 and other 
save with fear pull them out of the fire hate even the garment 
spot by the flesh 

1 24 now unto him that is abl to keep you from fall and to 
present you faultless befor the presenc of hi glori with exceed 
joy 1 25 to the onli wise god our saviour be glori and majesti 
dominion and power both now and ever amen 




the revel of saint john the devin 


1 1 the revel of jesu christ which god gave unto him to shew 
unto hi servant thing which must shortli come to pa and he sent 
and signifi it by hi angel unto hi servant john 1 2 who bare 
record of the word of god and of the testimoni of jesu christ and 
of all thing that he saw 

1 3 bless is he that readeth and they that hear the word of thi 
propheci and keep those thing which are written therein for the 
time is at hand 

1 4 john to the seven church which are in asia grace be unto you 
and peac from him which is and which wa and which is to come and 
from the seven spirit which are befor hi throne 1 5 and from jesu 
christ who is the faith wit and the first begotten of the 
dead and the princ of the king of the earth unto him that love 
u and wash u from our sin in hi own blood 1 6 and hath made u 
king and priest unto god and hi father to him be glori and 
dominion for ever and ever amen 

1 7 behold he cometh with cloud and everi eye shall see him and 
they also which pierc him and all kindr of the earth shall wail 
becau of him even so amen 

1 8 i am alpha and omega the begin and the end saith the 
lord which is and which wa and which is to come the almighti 

1 9 i john who also am your brother and companion in tribul 
and in the kingdom and patienc of jesu christ wa in the isl that 
is call patmo for the word of god and for the testimoni of jesu 
christ 

1 10 i wa in the spirit on the lord s day and heard behind me a 
great voic a of a trumpet 1 11 say i am alpha and omega the 
first and the last and what thou seest write in a book and send it 
unto the seven church which are in asia unto ephesu and unto 
smyrna and unto pergamo and unto thyatira and unto sardi and 
unto philadelphia and unto laodicea 

1 12 and i turn to see the voic that spake with me and be 
turn i saw seven golden candlestick 1 13 and in the midst of the 
seven candlestick one like unto the son of man cloth with a 
garment down to the foot and girt about the pap with a golden 
girdl 

1 14 hi head and hi hair were white like wool a white a snow 
and hi eye were a a flame of fire 1 15 and hi foot like unto fine 
brass a if they burn in a furnac and hi voic a the sound of 
mani water 

1 16 and he had in hi right hand seven star and out of hi mouth 
went a sharp twoedg sword and hi counten wa a the sun 
shineth in hi strength 

1 17 and when i saw him i fell at hi foot a dead and he laid hi 
right hand upon me say unto me fear not i am the first and the 
last 1 18 i am he that liveth and wa dead and behold i am aliv 
for evermor amen and have the key of hell and of death 

1 19 write the thing which thou hast seen and the thing which are 
and the thing which shall be hereaft 1 20 the mysteri of the seven 
star which thou sawest in my right hand and the seven golden 
candlestick the seven star are the angel of the seven church 
and the seven candlestick which thou sawest are the seven church 

2 1 unto the angel of the church of ephesu write these thing saith 
he that holdeth the seven star in hi right hand who walketh in the 
midst of the seven golden candlestick 2 2 i know thi work and thi 
labour and thi patienc and how thou canst not bear them which are 
evil and thou hast tri them which say they are apostl and are 
not and hast found them liar 2 3 and hast born and hast patienc 
and for my name s sake hast labour and hast not faint 

2 4 nevertheless i have somewhat against thee becau thou hast left 
thi first love 

2 5 rememb therefor from whenc thou art fallen and repent and do 
the first work or el i will come unto thee quickli and will 
remov thi candlestick out of hi place except thou repent 

2 6 but thi thou hast that thou hatest the deed of the 
nicolaitan which i also hate 

2 7 he that hath an ear let him hear what the spirit saith unto the 
church to him that overcometh will i give to eat of the tree of 
life which is in the midst of the paradi of god 

2 8 and unto the angel of the church in smyrna write these thing 
saith the first and the last which wa dead and is aliv 2 9 i know 
thi work and tribul and poverti but thou art rich and i 
know the blasphemi of them which say they are jew and are not but 
are the synagogu of satan 

2 10 fear none of those thing which thou shalt suffer behold the 
devil shall cast some of you into prison that ye may be tri and ye 
shall have tribul ten day be thou faith unto death and i 
will give thee a crown of life 

2 11 he that hath an ear let him hear what the spirit saith unto the 
church he that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death 

2 12 and to the angel of the church in pergamo write these thing 
saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edg 2 13 i know thi 
work and where thou dwellest even where satan s seat is and thou 
holdest fast my name and hast not deni my faith even in those day 
wherein antipa wa my faith martyr who wa slain among you where 
satan dwelleth 

2 14 but i have a few thing against thee becau thou hast there 
them that hold the doctrin of balaam who taught balac to cast a 
stumblingblock befor the child of israel to eat thing sacrif 
unto idol and to commit fornic 

2 15 so hast thou also them that hold the doctrin of the 
nicolaitan which thing i hate 

2 16 repent or el i will come unto thee quickli and will fight 
against them with the sword of my mouth 

2 17 he that hath an ear let him hear what the spirit saith unto the 
church to him that overcometh will i give to eat of the hidden 
manna and will give him a white stone and in the stone a new name 
written which no man knoweth save he that receiveth it 

2 18 and unto the angel of the church in thyatira write these thing 
saith the son of god who hath hi eye like unto a flame of fire and 
hi foot are like fine brass 2 19 i know thi work and chariti and 
servic and faith and thi patienc and thi work and the last to 
be more than the first 

2 20 notwithstand i have a few thing against thee becau thou 
sufferest that woman jezebel which calleth herself a prophetess to 
teach and to seduc my servant to commit fornic and to eat 
thing sacrif unto idol 

2 21 and i gave her space to repent of her fornic and she 
repent not 

2 22 behold i will cast her into a bed and them that commit adulteri 
with her into great tribul except they repent of their deed
